B_6_C_1_0
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा हनुमतो वाक्यम् यथावद्भिभाषितम् |
रामः प्रीतिसमायुक्तो वाक्यमुत्तरमब्रवीत् || ६-१-१_END
BEGIN_
Touched with joy to hear the words rightly spoken by Hanuman, Rama replied as
follows: -_END

B_6_C_1_1
BEGIN_
कृतम् हनुमता कार्यम् सुमहद्भुवि दुर्लभम् |
मनसापि यदन्येन न शक्यम् धरणीतले || ६-१-२_END
BEGIN_
"A very outstanding work, the most arduous in the world has been done by Hanuman,
which could not be carried out even in thought by any other on the surface of this earth."_END

B_6_C_1_2
BEGIN_
न हि तम् परिपश्यामि यस्तरेत महोदधिम् |
अन्यत्र गुरुडाद्वायोरन्यत्र च हनूमतः || ६-१-३_END
BEGIN_
"Indeed, I cannot perceive as such anyone other than Garuda (chief of the feathered
race and vehicle of Lord Vishnu), wind- god and Hanuman, who can cross the mighty ocean."_END

B_6_C_1_3
BEGIN_
देवदानवयक्षाणाम् गन्धर्वोरगरक्षसाम् |
अप्रधृष्याम् पुरीम् लङ्काम् रावणेन सुरक्षिताम् || ६-१-४
प्रविष्टः सत्त्वमाश्रित्य जीवन्को नाम निष्क्रमेत् |_END
BEGIN_
"Who can return alive, having entered (once) taking refuge only in self- command,
the city of Lanka, which is unconquerable by gods demons and Yakshas and even by Gandharvas, Nagas
and ogres and well under the custody of Ravana?"_END

B_6_C_1_4
BEGIN_
को विशेत्सुदुराधर्षाम् राक्षसैश्च सुरक्षिताम् || ६-१-५
यो वीर्यबलसम्पन्नो न समः स्याद्धनूमतः |_END
BEGIN_
"Who is able to capture that citadel, by assault, that is exceedingly dangerous to
be attacked and which is powerfully guarded by ogres, but one whose courage and valour are equal to
Hanuman's?"_END

B_6_C_1_5
BEGIN_
भृत्यकार्यम् हनुमता सुग्रीवस्य कृतम् महत् || ६-१-६
एवम् विधाय स्वबलम् सदृशम् विक्रमस्य च |_END
BEGIN_
"A great act of service has been done by Hanuman to Sugriva thus by exhibiting his
strength corresponding to his pace."_END

B_6_C_2_0
BEGIN_
तम् तु शोकपरिद्यूनम् रामम् दशरथात्मजम् |
उवाच वचनम् श्रीमान् सुग्रीवह् शोकनाशनम् || ६-२-१_END
BEGIN_
The glorious Sugreeva made the following reply, which was intended to expel his
grief, to Rama the son of Dasaratha who felt miserable with anguish._END

B_6_C_1_6
BEGIN_
यो हि भृत्यो नियुक्तः सन् भर्त्रा कर्मणि दुष्करे || ६-१-७
कुर्यात्तदुनुरागेण तमहुः पुरुषोत्तमम् |_END
BEGIN_
"That servant to whom his master entrusts a difficult task and who performs it with
zeal is said to be a superior person."_END

B_6_C_2_1
BEGIN_
किम् त्वया तप्यते वीर यथान्यः प्राकृतस्तथा |
मैवम् भूस्त्यज सतापम् कृतघ्न इव सौहृदम् || ६-२-२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, hero! Why are you lamenting thus, as any other ordinary man? Do not be
sorrowful like this. Abandon your grief, as an ungrateful man abandons friendship."_END

B_6_C_1_7
BEGIN_
यो नियुक्तः परम् कार्यम् न कुर्यान्नऋपतेः प्रियम् || ६-१-८
भृत्यो युक्तः समर्थश्च तमाहुर्मध्यम् नरम् |_END
BEGIN_
"The one who is ready and capable but who yet does no more than his master extracts
from him is called a mediocre person."_END

B_6_C_2_2
BEGIN_
सम्तापस्य च ते स्थानम् न हि पश्यामि राघव |
प्रवृत्तामुपलब्धायाम् ज्ञाते च निलये रिपोः || ६-२-३_END
BEGIN_
"As the information about Seetha has since been gathered, I do not indeed see any
scope for your grief Oh, Rama!"_END

B_6_C_1_8
BEGIN_
नियुक्तो नृपतेः कार्यम् न कुर्याद्यः समाहितः || ६-१-९
भृत्यो युक्तः समर्थश्च तमाहुः पुरुष्धमम् |_END
BEGIN_
"The one who is well and able and yet does not carry out the instructions of his
master as directed is said to be the least of men ."_END

B_6_C_2_3
BEGIN_
मतिमान् शास्त्रवित्प्राज्ञः पण्डितश्चासि राघव |
त्यजेमाम् प्राकृताम् उद्धिं कृतात्मेवार्थदूषणीम् || ६-२-४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! You are a wise person, a knower of sacred works, an intellectual and a
learned man. Give up these ordinary apprehensions like a man whose spirit is disciplined gives up
ideas which spoil the purpose._END

B_6_C_1_9
BEGIN_
तन्नियोगे नियुक्तेन कृतम् हनूमता || ६-१-१०
न चात्मा लघताम् नीतः सुग्रीवश्चापि तोषितः |_END
BEGIN_
"Through the discovery of Sita's retreat by this faithful messenger, Hanuman has
fulfilled the task entrusted to him unfalteringly to the satisfaction of Sugriva and hence there
was no diminution to his self."_END

B_6_C_2_4
BEGIN_
संद्रम् लङ्घयित्वा तु महानक्रसमाकुलम् |
लङ्कामारोहयिष्यामो हनिष्यामश्च ते रिपुम् || ६-२-५_END
BEGIN_
"We shall make our way up to Lanka, by crossing the ocean filled with large
crocodiles. We shall destroy your enemy."_END

B_6_C_1_10
BEGIN_
अहम् च रघवंशश्च लक्ष्मणश्च महाबलः || ६-१-११
वैदेह्या दर्शनेनाद्य धर्मतः परिरक्षिताः |_END
BEGIN_
"By finding out Sita, the Raghu dynasty as well as myself and the valiant Lakshmana
too, have been rightly saved today."_END

B_6_C_2_5
BEGIN_
निरुत्साहस्य दीनस्य शोकपर्याकुलात्मनः |
सर्वार्था व्यवसीदन्ति व्यसनम् चाधिगच्छति || ६-२-६_END
BEGIN_
"All action get dissipated by a person who is non-enthusiastic, depressed and
disturbed with grief. Such a person gets into troubles too."_END

B_6_C_1_11
BEGIN_
इदम् तु मम दीनस्य मनो भूयः प्रकर्षति || ६-१-१२
यदिहास्य प्रियाक्ष्यातुर्न कुर्मि सदृशम् प्रियम् |_END
BEGIN_
"But it squeezes my conscience further, hopeless as I am, to think that I am not
able to do a pleasant act befittingly to the bearer of these good tidings."_END

B_6_C_2_6
BEGIN_
इमे शूराः समर्थाश्च सर्वतो हरियूथपाः |
त्वत्प्रियार्थम् कृतोत्साहाः प्रवेष्टुमपि पावकम् || ६-२-७
एषाम् हर्षेण जानामि तर्कश्चापि दृढो मम |_END
BEGIN_
"These leaders of monkey squads are gallant and efficient in all ways. They are
enthusiastic even to enter a fire for your sake. I understand this from their joy and my reasoning
too is sound."_END

B_6_C_1_12
BEGIN_
एष सर्वस्वभूतस्तु परिष्वङ्गो हनुमतः || ६-१-१३
मया कालमिमम् प्राप्य दत्तस्तस्य महात्मनः |_END
BEGIN_
"Let me at least embrace this magnanimous Hanuman since in the present
circumstances, this is all that is easily obtained from me."_END

B_6_C_2_7
BEGIN_
विक्रमेण समानेष्ये सीताम् हत्वा यथा रिपुम् || ६-२-८
रावनम् पापक्र्माणम् तथा त्वम् कर्तुमर्हसि |_END
BEGIN_
"You ought to act in every way that I may be able to get back Seetha, after
destroying by an attack the enemy Ravana of sinful deeds."_END

B_6_C_1_13
BEGIN_
इत्युक्त्वा प्रीतिहृष्टाङ्गो रामस्तम् परिष्स्वजे || ६-१-१४
हनुमन्तम् कृतात्मानम् क्ऱ्६इतवाक्यमुपागतम् |_END
BEGIN_
Thus saying, Rama vibrating with joy, clasped Hanuman in his arms who, master of
himself, his mission fulfilled, had returned._END

B_6_C_2_8
BEGIN_
सेतुरत्र यथा बद्ध्येथा पश्येम ताम् पुरीम् || ६-२-९
तस्य राक्षसराजस्य तथा त्वम् कुरु राघव |_END
BEGIN_
"You take steps in such a way that a bridge is constructed across the sea and we
reach that city of the king of ogres."_END

B_6_C_3_0
BEGIN_
सुग्रीवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा हेतुमत् परम अर्थवित् |
प्रतिजग्राह काकुत्स्थो हनूमन्तम् अथ अब्रवीत् || ६-३-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the well-founded and highly reasonable words of Sugreeva, Rama concurred
with him and spoke then to Hanuma as follows:_END

B_6_C_1_14
BEGIN_
ध्यात्वा पुनरुवाचेदम् वचनम् रघुसत्तमः || ६-१-१५
हरीनामीश्वरस्यापि सुग्रीवस्योपशृण्वतः |_END
BEGIN_
After reflecting a while, Rama the great scion of Raghus, again spoke as follows,
Sugriva the ruler of monkeys too listening attentively._END

B_6_C_2_9
BEGIN_
दृष्ट्वा ताम् हि पुरीम् लङ्काम् त्रिकूटशिखरे स्थिताम् || ६-२-१०
हतम् च रावणम् उद्धे दर्शनादवधारय |_END
BEGIN_
"Be certain that Ravana is killed, once he is seen in a battle and on our seeing
that city of Lanka standing on a peak of the Trikuta Mountain."_END

B_6_C_3_1
BEGIN_
तरसा सेतु बन्धेन सागर उच्चोषणेन वा |
सर्वथा सुसमर्थो अस्मि सागरस्य अस्य लन्घने || ६-३-२_END
BEGIN_
"I am competent of crossing this ocean by all means, either by way of austerity or
by forming a bridge or by drying up the ocean."_END

B_6_C_1_15
BEGIN_
सर्वथा सुकृतम् तावत्सीतायाः परिमार्गणम् || ६-१-१६
सागरम् तु समासाद्य पुनर्नष्टम् मनो मम |_END
BEGIN_
"The search for Sita has been performed so much well in all ways. But my mind gets
dejected once more, when I behold this vast ocean."_END

B_6_C_2_10
BEGIN_
अबद्ध्वा सागरे सेतुम् घोरे च वरुणालये || ६-२-११
लङ्का न मर्दितुम् शक्या सेन्द्रैरपि सुरासुरैः |_END
BEGIN_
"Without building a bridge across the sea, the dreadful abode of Varuna (the god of
water), Lanka cannot be defeated even by gods and demons including Indra."_END

B_6_C_3_2
BEGIN_
कति दुर्गाणि दुर्गाया लंकायास् तद् ब्रवीहि मे |
ज्ञातुम् इच्चामि तत् सर्वम् दर्शनाद् इव वानर || ६-३-३_END
BEGIN_
"Tell me how many citadels in Lanka are difficult of access, Oh, Hanuma! I desire to
know all that, as though viewed with an eye."_END

B_6_C_1_16
BEGIN_
कथम् नाम समुद्रस्य दुष्पारस्य महाम्भसः || ६-१-१७
हरयो दक्षिणम् पारम् गमिष्यन्ति समागताह् |_END
BEGIN_
How can these monkeys put together will reach the southern bank of the ocean, which
is so difficult to cross and which contains voluminous water?"_END

B_6_C_2_11
BEGIN_
सेतुर्बद्धः समुद्रे च यावल्लङ्कासमीपतः || ६-२-१२
सर्वम् तीर्णम् च मे सैन्यम् जितमित्युपधारय |
इमे हि समरे वीरा हरयः कामरूपिणः || ६-२-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Know that when the whole of my army crosses the sea as a bridge is built across it,
they will come out victorious, because these monkeys who are able to change their form at will are
indeed valiant in battle."_END

B_6_C_3_3
BEGIN_
बलस्य परिमाणम् च द्वार दुर्ग क्रियाम् अपि |
गुप्ति कर्म च लंकाया रक्षसाम् सदनानि च || ६-३-४
यथा सुखम् यथावच् च लंकायाम् असि दृष्टवान् |
सरम् आचक्ष्व तत्त्वेन सर्वथा कुशलो हि असि || ६-३-५_END
BEGIN_
"You had the opportunity to catch a glimpse of the size of the army, the
fortification-details of the gates and citadels, the way in which Lanka was guarded and the various
mansions of ogres. Describe everything in accordance with facts, for you are skilled in all
ways."_END

B_6_C_1_17
BEGIN_
यद्यप्येष तु वृत्तान्तो वैदेह्या गदितो मम || ६-१-१८
समुद्रपारगमने हरीणाम् किमिहोत्तरम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Having received the tidings of Sita, what can now be done to take the monkeys to
the farther side the sea?"_END

B_6_C_2_12
BEGIN_
तदलम् विक्लबाम् बुद्धिम् राजन् सर्वार्थनाशनीम् |
पुरुषस्य हि लोकेऽस्मिन् शोकः शौर्यापकर्षणः || ६-२-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Therefore, take away your apprehensive mind, which destroys any enterprise for
grief in this world diminishes the might of a man, Oh king!"_END

B_6_C_3_4
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा रामस्य वचनम् हनूमान् मारुत आत्मजः |
वाक्यम् वाक्यविदाम् श्रेष्ठो रामम् पुनर् अथ अब्रवीत् || ६-३-६_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Rama, Hanuma the son of wind-god, who was excellent in the art
of expression, forthwith spoke once more to Rama as follows:_END

B_6_C_1_18
BEGIN_
इत्युक्त्वा शोकसम्भ्रान्तो रामह् शत्रुनिबर्हणः || ६-१-१९
हनूमन्तम् महाबाहुस्ततो ध्यानमुपागमत् |_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking to Hanuman, Rama the destroyer of enemies and the mighty armed, was
filled with apprehension and then became absorbed in thought._END

B_6_C_2_13
BEGIN_
यत्तु कार्यम् मनुष्येण शौण्डीर्यमवलम्ब्यताम् |
तदलम्करणायैव कर्तुर्भवति सत्वरम् || ६-२-१५_END
BEGIN_
�Cling to the practice of boldness, ought to be resorted to by a man. It will
produce competence without doubt to the doer quickly."_END

B_6_C_3_5
BEGIN_
श्रूयताम् सर्वम् आख्यास्ये दुर्ग कर्म विधानतः |
गुप्ता पुरी यथा लंका रक्षिता च यथा बलैः || ६-३-७_END
BEGIN_
"Listen to me! I shall tell you everything-how the city of Lanka has been defended
by the various methods of fortification and how it has been guarded by the troops."_END

B_6_C_2_14
BEGIN_
अस्मिन् काले महाप्राज्ञ् सत्त्वमातिष्ठ ते जसा |
शूराणाम् हि मनुष्याणाम् त्वद्विधानाम् महात्मनाम् || ६-२-१६
विनष्टेवा रनस्स्टे वाशोकः सर्वार्थनाशनः |_END
BEGIN_
"Prevail upon the strength with alertness at this moment, Oh highly intelligent
prince! Grief for something lost or destroyed consumes all resources of even the strong and
magnanimous men like you."_END

B_6_C_3_6
BEGIN_
राक्षसाश्च यथा स्निग्धा रावणस्य च तेजसा |
पराम् समृद्धिम् लंकायाः सागरस्य च भीमताम् || ६-३-८
विभागम् च बल ओघस्य निर्देशम् वाहनस्य च |
एवमुक्त्वा कपिश्रेष्ठः कथयामास तत्ववित् || ६-३-९_END
BEGIN_
"I shall tell you the details of how the ogres are attached to their king, the
excellent prosperity of Lanka generated by the glory of Ravana, the awfulness of the ocean, the
division of the body of his forces and of animals like horses and elephants carrying his forces
other than the infantry." Saying so, Hanuma the foremost among monkeys, who knew the truth narrated
as follows._END

B_6_C_2_15
BEGIN_
तत्त्वम् बुद्धिमताम् श्रेष्ठह् सर्वशास्त्रर्थकोविदः || ६-२-१७
मद्विधैः सचिवैः सार्धमरिम् जेतुम् समर्हसि |_END
BEGIN_
"You are the foremost among the intelligent and the knower of all sacred texts.
Hence, you ought to defeat the enemy, with allies like me."_END

B_6_C_3_7
BEGIN_
प्रहृष्टा मुदिता लंका मत्त द्विप समाकुला |
महती रथ सम्पूर्णा रक्षो गण समाकुला || ६-३-१०_END
BEGIN_
"The great Lanka was rejoiced and gayful, full of elephants in rut, abounding in
chariots and inhabited by gangs of ogres."_END

B_6_C_2_16
BEGIN_
न हि पश्याम्यहम् कम् चित्त्रिषु लोकेषु राघव || ६-२-१८
गृहीतधनुषो यस्ते तिष्ठे दभिमुखो रणे |_END
BEGIN_
"I do not indeed see any one who can withstand you in a battle filed in the three
worlds, when you are armed with a bow, Oh Rama!"_END

B_6_C_3_8
BEGIN_
दृढ बद्ध कवाटानि महापरिघवन्ति च |
चत्वारि विपुलान्यस्या द्वाराणि सुमहान्ति || ६-३-११_END
BEGIN_
"Four fairly big and extensive gates are fitted with strong doors along with huge
beams for locking those gates."_END

B_6_C_2_17
BEGIN_
वानरेषु समासक्तम् न ते कार्यम् विपत्स्यते || ६-२-१९
अचिराद्द्रक्ष्यसे सीताम् तीर्त्वा सागरमक्षयम् |_END
BEGIN_
"You work duly entrusted to the monkeys will not be spoiled. You shall behold Seetha
era imperishable sea."_END

B_6_C_4_0
BEGIN_श्रुत्वा हनूमतो वाक्यम् यथावद् अनुपूर्वशः |
ततो अब्रवीन् महातेजा रामः सत्य पराक्रमः || ६-४-१_END
BEGIN_Rama, a very bright man and a true warrior, having duly heard the words of Hanuman from 
the beginning, thereafter spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_3_9
BEGIN_
तत्रेषूपयन्त्राणि बलवन्ति महान्ति च |
आगतम् पर सैन्यम् तैस् तत्र प्रतिनिवार्यते || ६-३-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Strong and mighty ballista capable of hurling darts and stones have been attached
to them. The enemy troops which arrive there are warded off by those catapults at the very
gates."_END

B_6_C_2_18
BEGIN_
तदलम् शोकमालम्ब्य क्रोधमालम्ब भूपते || ६-२-२०
निश्चेष्टाह् क्षत्रिया मन्दाः सर्वे चण्डस्य् बिभ्यति |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lord of the earth! Desist from this melancholy. Yield to your legitimate
indignation. Unadventurous Kshatriyas (members of warrior-tribe) never win honor but all fear the
wrathful."_END

B_6_C_4_1
BEGIN_याम् निवेदयसे लंकाम् पुरीम् भीमस्य रक्षसः |
क्षिप्रम् एनाम् वधिष्यामि सत्यम् एतद् ब्रवीमि ते || ६-४-२_END
BEGIN_"I shall destroy quickly Lanka, the city of that terrible ogre (Ravana), of which you 
just informed I am really telling this."_END

B_6_C_3_10
BEGIN_
द्वारेषु संस्कृता भीमाः काल आयस मयाः शिताः |
शतशो रोचिता वीरैः शतघ्न्यो रक्षसाम् गणैः || ६-३-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Dangerous and sharp edged Sataghnis made of iron, forged by hordes of ogres, have
been kept in readiness in hundreds at the gates._END

B_6_C_2_19
BEGIN_
लङ्घानार्थम् च घोरस्य समुद्रस्य नदीपतेः || ६-२-२१
सहास्माभिरिहोओपेतह् सूक्ष्मबुद्धिर्विचारय |_END
BEGIN_
"You with your resourceful mind, along with us together, ponder over now a design to
cross the sea, the terrible Lord of rivers."_END

B_6_C_4_2
BEGIN_अस्मिन् मुहूर्ते सुग्रीव प्रयाणम् अभिरोचये |
युक्तो मुहूर्तो विजयः प्राप्तो मध्यम् दिवा करः || ६-४-३_END
BEGIN_"Be pleased to approve our march at this moment, a suitable moment for success. The sun 
reached the mid-day._END

B_6_C_3_11
BEGIN_
सौवर्णः च महांस् तस्याः प्राकारो दुष्प्रधर्षणः |
मणि विद्रुम वैदूर्य मुक्ता विचरित अन्तरः || ६-३-१४_END
BEGIN_
"A great rampart made of gold, which is difficult to assail with violence and is
inlaid at intervals with gems, corals, cat's eyes and pearls, encircle that Lanka."_END

B_6_C_2_20
BEGIN_
लङ्घिते तत्र तैः सैन्यैर्जितमित्येव निश्चिनु || ६-२-२२
सर्वम् तीर्णम् च मे सैन्यम् जितमित्यवधार्यताम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Know victory to be certain, once the sea has been crossed by the army. Verily when
all my forces have passed over the sea our triumph is assured!"_END

B_6_C_4_3
BEGIN_सीताम् गृत्वा तु तद्यातु क्वासौ यास्यति जीवितः |
सीता श्रुत्वाभियानम् मे आशामेष्यति जीविते || ६-४-४
जीवितान्तेऽ मृतम् स्पृष्ट्वा पीत्वा विषमिवातुरः |_END
BEGIN_"Let that ogre go (to his abode) after kidnapping Seetha. Where will he go alive? Hearing 
of my march to Lanka, Seetha will get back her hope in life, like a sick man having drunk poison touches 
ambrosia at the end of his life."_END

B_6_C_3_12
BEGIN_
सर्वतः च महाभीमाः शीत तोया महाशुभाः |
अगाधा ग्राहवत्यः च परिखा मीन सेविताः || ६-३-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Most awe-inspiring and fathomless moats (deep trenches) of great splendor, filled
with cold water, infested with alligators and inhabited by fishes are there all round the
city."_END

B_6_C_2_21
BEGIN_
इमे हि हरयः शूराः समरे कामरूपिणः || ६-२-२३
तानरीन्विधमिष्यन्ति शिलापादपवृष्टिभिः |_END
BEGIN_
"These monkeys, the courageous soldiers who are able to change their form at their
volition, will crush their opponents with an avalanche of rocks and trees."_END

B_6_C_4_4
BEGIN_उत्तरा फल्गुनी हि अद्य श्वस् तु हस्तेन योक्ष्यते || ६-४-५
अभिप्रयाम सुग्रीव सर्व अनीक समावृताः |_END
BEGIN_"This northern planet of Phalguni will be in conjunction with the Hasta star tomorrow. 
Hence, let us depart today itself with all the troops accompanying us, Oh, Sugreeva!"_END

B_6_C_3_13
BEGIN_
द्वारेषु तासाम् चत्वारः सम्क्रमाः परम आयताः |
यन्त्रैर् उपेता बहुभिर् महद्भिर् दृढ संधिभिः || ६-३-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Anterior to the gateways, there are four very extensive draw-bridges, equipped with
numerous engines and furnished with many rows of buildings (built on the rampart and meant for
those entrusted with the duty of guarding the entrances)."_END

B_6_C_2_22
BEGIN_
कथम् चित्परिपश्यामि लङ्घितम् वरुणालयम् || ६-२-२४
हतमित्येव तम् मन्ये युद्धे शत्रुनिबर्हण |_END
BEGIN_
"Once we have crossed the sea (the abode of Varuna) by whatever the means employed,
Ravana is as definitely killed in my eyes, Oh exterminator of enemies!"_END

B_6_C_3_14
BEGIN_
त्रायन्ते सम्क्रमास् तत्र पर सैन्य आगमे सति |
यन्त्रैस् तैर् अवकीर्यन्ते परिखासु समन्ततः || ६-३-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Against the approach of the enemy forces there, the draw-bridges are protected by
the aforesaid engines and the enemy-battalions are flung into the moats on every side."_END

B_6_C_4_5
BEGIN_निमित्तानि च धन्यानि यानि प्रादुर् भवन्ति मे || ६-४-६
निहत्य रावणम् सीताम् आनयिष्यामि जानकीम् |_END
BEGIN_"By seeing the omens which are becoming visible, I deduce that I shall bring back Seetha 
the daughter of Janaka, by killing Ravana."_END

B_6_C_2_23
BEGIN_
किमुक्त्वा बहुधा चापि सर्वथा विजया भवान् || ६-२-२५
निमित्तानि च पश्यामि मनो मे सम्प्रहृष्यति |_END
BEGIN_
What is the use of all these words? By all means, you will be a victorious man. I
see good omens and my heard is over thrilled with joy."_END

B_6_C_3_15
BEGIN_
एकस् त्व् अकम्प्यो बलवान् सम्क्रमः सुमहादृढः |
काञ्चनैर् बहुभिः स्तम्भैर् वेदिकाभिः च शोभितः || ६-३-१८_END
BEGIN_
"The most important draw-bridge which is unshakable, firmly fastened very well and
strong, is dazzling with numerous gold pillars and pedestals."_END

B_6_C_4_6
BEGIN_उपरिष्टाद्द् हि नयनम् स्फुरमाणम् इदम् मम || ६-४-७
विजयम् समनुप्राप्तम् शंसति इव मनो रथम् |_END
BEGIN_"My eye which is twitching on the upper lid, is proclaiming as it were, my desire of 
victory coming nearer."_END

B_6_C_3_16
BEGIN_
स्वयम् प्रकृति सम्पन्नो युयुत्सू राम रावणः |
उत्थितः च अप्रमत्तः च बलानाम् अनुदर्शने || ६-३-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Ravana, inclined to war and endowed with powers of the state, himself remains alert
and in readiness to review the forces, Oh, Rama!"_END

B_6_C_4_7
BEGIN_ततो वाबरराहेब कज्श्मणेन सुपूजितः || ६-४-८
उवाच रामो धर्मात्मा पुनरप्यर्थकोविदः |_END
BEGIN_Then Rama the virtuous man versed in moral law, who was well-adored by Sugreeva the king 
of monkeys and Lakshmana, again spoke as follows:-_END

B_6_C_5_0
BEGIN_
सा तु नीलेन विधिवत् स्वारक्षा सुसमाहिता |
सागरस्य उत्तरे तीरे साधु सेना विनिएशिता || ६-५-१_END
BEGIN_
That famous army, well-protected by Neela, was kept stationed nicely at the northern
shore of the ocean._END

B_6_C_3_17
BEGIN_
लंका पुरी निरालम्बा देव दुर्गा भय आवहा |
न अदेयम् पार्वतम् वन्यम् कृत्रिमम् च चतुर् विधम् || ६-३-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Lanka therefore is impregnable, it is a celestial citadel, that inspires terror.
Surrounded by water and built on a mountain, it has four fold defenses including forest and
artificial fortification."_END

B_6_C_4_8
BEGIN_अग्रे यातु बलस्य अस्य नीलो मार्गम् अवेक्षितुम् || ६-४-९
वृतः शत सहस्रेण वानराणाम् तरस्विनाम् |_END
BEGIN_"Let general Nila accompanied by strength of hundred thousand warriors go before the 
army, to explore the way."_END

B_6_C_5_1
BEGIN_
मैन्दः च द्विविधः च उभौ तत्र वानर पुम्गवौ |
विचेरतुः च ताम् सेनाम् रक्षा अर्थम् सर्वतो दिशम् || ६-५-२_END
BEGIN_
Both Maina and Dvivida the distinguished monkeys there moved in all directions
through that army, for the purpose of vigilance._END

B_6_C_3_18
BEGIN_
स्थिता पारे समुद्रस्य दूर पारस्य राघव |
नौ पथः च अपि न अस्ति अत्र निरादेशः च सर्वतः || ६-३-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Lanka is situated on the other side of the ocean, which is difficult of access, Oh
Rama! It offers no passage for vehicles either and there is no proper communication from all
sides."_END

B_6_C_4_9
BEGIN_फल मूलवता नील शीत कानन वारिणा |
पथा मधुमता च आशु सेनाम् सेना पते नय || ६-४-१०_END
BEGIN_"Oh Nila the chief of Army! Steer the army speedily by the path, abound with fruits and 
roots, cool woods and fresh water and honey."_END

B_6_C_5_2
BEGIN_
निविष्टायाम् तु सेनायाम् तीरे नद नदी पतेः |
पार्श्वस्थम् लक्ष्मणम् दृष्ट्वा रामो वचनम् अब्रवीत् || ६-५-३_END
BEGIN_
After the army was settled at the sea-shore, Rama spoke to Lakshmana who was by his
side (as follows):_END

B_6_C_3_19
BEGIN_
शैल अग्रे रचिता दुर्गा सा पूर् देव पुर उपमा |
वाजि वारण सम्पूर्णा लंका परम दुर्जया || ६-३-२२_END
BEGIN_
"That city of Lanka, resembling the city of Gods, is built on a mountain peak and is
inaccessible. That Lanka is abound with horses and elephants and is extremely difficult to
conquer."_END

B_6_C_4_10
BEGIN_दूषयेयुर् दुरात्मानः पथि मूल फल उदकम् || ६-४-११
राक्षसाः परिरक्षेथास् तेभ्यस् त्वम् नित्यम् उद्यतः |_END
BEGIN_"The evil-minded demons may spoil the roots, fruits and water in the path-way. You always 
try to be on you guard."_END

B_6_C_5_3
BEGIN_
शोकः च किल कालेन गच्चता हि अपगच्चति |
मम च अपश्यतः कान्ताम् अहनि अहनि वर्धते || ६-५-४_END
BEGIN_
"It is so said that sorrow gets vanished at the passing of time. But my agony of not
seeing my beloved is getting increased every day."_END

B_6_C_3_20
BEGIN_
परिघाः च शतघ्न्यः च यन्त्राणि विविधानि च |
शोभयन्ति पुरीम् लंकाम् रावणस्य दुरात्मनः || ६-३-२३_END
BEGIN_
Deep trenches and Sataghnis too as well as engines of war of every kind adorn Lanka
the city of wicked Ravana."_END

B_6_C_4_11
BEGIN_निम्नेषु वन दुर्गेषु वनेषु च वन ओकसः || ६-४-१२
अभिप्लुत्य अभिपश्येयुः परेषाम् निहतम् बलम् |_END
BEGIN_"Let the monkeys jump into law grounds, into places made inaccessible by forest-grores 
and into thickets and notice whether any rival forces are stationed there."_END

B_6_C_5_4
BEGIN_
न मे दुह्खम् प्रिया दूरे न मे दुह्खम् हृता इति च |
तद् एव अनुशोचामि वयो अस्या हि अतिवर्तते || ६-५-५_END
BEGIN_
"There is no anguish for me that my beloved is at a distance, nor that she was taken
away. Her age is indeed passing away. Only about this, I am repenting."_END

B_6_C_3_21
BEGIN_
अयुतम् रक्षसाम् अत्र पश्चिम द्वारम् आश्रितम् |
शूल हस्ता दुराधर्षाः सर्वे खड्ग अग्र योधिनः || ६-३-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Ten thousand ogres all carrying darts in their hands and warriors contending with
swords, who are difficult to assail, are positioned at the eastern gate."_END

B_6_C_4_12
BEGIN_यत्तु फल्गु बलम् किंचित्तदत्रैवोपपद्यताम् || ६-४-१३
एतद्धि कृत्यम् घोरम् नो विक्रमेण प्रयुज्यताम् |_END
BEGIN_"Let whatever little of feeble forces stay back in Kishkindha, as our operation will 
indeed be dreadful. It has to be discharged daringly."_END

B_6_C_5_5
BEGIN_
वाहि वात यतः कन्या ताम् स्पृष्ट्वा माम् अपि स्पृश |
त्वयि मे गात्र संस्पर्शः चन्द्रे दृष्टि समागमः || ६-५-६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, wind! Flow from the side of my beloved. Touch her and touch me too. It is
through you that I get a contact of her limbs. It is through moon that I get a contact of her
eyes."_END

B_6_C_3_22
BEGIN_
नियुतम् रक्षसाम् अत्र दक्षिण द्वारम् आश्रितम् |
चतुर् अन्गेण सैन्येन योधास् तत्र अपि अनुत्तमाः || ६-३-२५_END
BEGIN_
"One hundred thousand of ogres, with an army of four limbs (viz. horses, foot
soldiers, elephants and chariots) are positioned at the southern gate of the city. Warriors
unsurpassed by others constitute that army."_END

B_6_C_4_13
BEGIN_सागर ओघ निभम् भीमम् अग्र अनीकम् महाबलाः || ६-४-१४
कपि सिम्हा प्रकर्षन्तु शतशो अथ सहस्रशः |_END
BEGIN_"Let the best of monkeys with great strength in hundreds and thousands lead the formidable 
of the army, which is akin to an oceanic stream."_END

B_6_C_6_0
BEGIN_
लंकायाम् तु कृतम् कर्म घोरम् दृष्ट्वा भव आवहम् |
राक्षस इन्द्रो हनुमता शक्रेण इव महात्मना || ६-६-१
अब्रवीद् राक्षसान् सर्वान् ह्रिया किंचिद् अवान् मुखः |_END
BEGIN_
Having seen the fearful and the terrible act in Lanka done by Hanuma, like Devendra
the powerful King of celestials, Ravana with his face descended a little with shame, spoke to the
demons as follows:_END

B_6_C_3_23
BEGIN_
प्रयुतम् रक्षसाम् अत्र पूर्व द्वारम् समाश्रितम् |
चर्म खड्ग धराः सर्वे तथा सर्व अस्त्र कोविदाः || ६-३-२६_END
BEGIN_
One million troops arrived with shields and swords as well as proficient in the use
of all mystic missiles, are positioned at the western gate."_END

B_6_C_4_14
BEGIN_गजः च गिरि सम्काशो गवयः च महाबलः || ६-४-१५
गव अक्षः च अग्रतो यान्तु गवाम् दृप्ता इव ऋषभाः |_END
BEGIN_"Let Gaja, equal to a mountain, Gavaya a very strong warrior and Gavaksha march in front, 
as a majestic bull marches in front of a cow-herd."_END

B_6_C_5_6
BEGIN_
तन् मे दहति गात्राणि विषम् पीतम् इव आशये |
हा नाथ इति प्रिया सा माम् ह्रियमाणा यद् अब्रवीत् || ६-५-७_END
BEGIN_
"That darling being carried away; might have cried "Oh, Lord!" Seeking for help.
That thought is like poison gulped by me, hovering in my stomach and scorching my limbs."_END

B_6_C_6_1
BEGIN_
धर्षिता च प्रविष्टा च लंका दुष्प्रसहा पुरी || ६-६-२
तेन वानर मात्रेण दृष्टा सीता च जानकी |_END
BEGIN_
"By him, who was only a monkey, the irresistible City of Lanka was entered into and
was over-powered. Seetha the daughter of Janaka was also discovered by him._END

B_6_C_3_24
BEGIN_
न्यर्बुदम् रक्षसाम् अत्र उत्तर द्वारम् आश्रितम् |
रथिनः च अश्व वाहाः च कुल पुत्राः सुपूजिताः || ६-३-२७_END
BEGIN_
"A hundred millions of ogres, who are mounted in chariots or who ride on hoses, sons
of distinguished families and greatly honored, are positioned there at the northern gate."_END

B_6_C_4_15
BEGIN_यातु वानर वाहिन्या वानरः प्लवताम् पतिः || ६-४-१६
पालयन् दक्षिणम् पार्श्वम् ऋषभो वानर ऋषभः |_END
BEGIN_"Let the monkey called Rishabha, Lord of the simians and the best of the primates march 
forward, duly guarding the right side of the army of the simians."_END

B_6_C_5_7
BEGIN_
तद् वियोग इन्धनवता तच् चिन्ता विपुल अर्चिषा |
रात्रिम् दिवम् शरीरम् मे दह्यते मदन अग्निना || ६-५-८_END
BEGIN_
"My body is scorching night and day, by the fire of passion, holding fuel of my
separation from her and my thoughts of her flaring into shimmering flames."_END

B_6_C_6_2
BEGIN_
प्रसादो धर्षितः चैत्यः प्रवरा राक्षसा हताः || ६-६-३
आविला च पुरी लंका सर्वा हनुमता कृता |_END
BEGIN_
The thousand-pillared building used as a sanctuary was assaulted by Hanuma. Our most
excellent demons were killed. The entire City of Lanka was made turbid._END

B_6_C_4_16
BEGIN_गन्ध हस्ती इव दुर्धर्षस् तरस्वी गन्ध मादनः || ६-४-१७
यातु वानर वाहिन्याः सव्यम् पार्श्वम् अधिष्ठितः |_END
BEGIN_"Let Gandhamadana, with a strength unconquerable like an elephant in rut, proceed duly 
guarding the left side of the army of monkeys."_END

B_6_C_3_25
BEGIN_
शतम् शत सहस्राणाम् मध्यमम् गुल्मम् आश्रितम् |
यातु धाना दुराधर्षाः साग्र कोटिः च रक्षसाम् || ६-३-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Moreover, ogres hundreds of thousands in number, difficult to attack, aggregating
to one and quarter of a crore of ogres are positioned at the central division."_END

B_6_C_5_8
BEGIN_
अवगाह्य अर्णवम् स्वप्स्ये सौमित्रे भवता विना |
कथंचित् प्रज्वलन् कामः समासुप्तम् जले दहेत् || ६-५-९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lakshmana! Diving deep into the sea without you, I shall fall asleep. This
flaming passion will not thus scorch me, lying down in water._END

B_6_C_6_3
BEGIN_
किम् करिष्यामि भद्रम् वः किम् वा युक्तम् अनन्तरम् || ६-६-४
उच्यताम् नः समर्थम् यत् कृतम् च सुकृतम् भवेत् |_END
BEGIN_
May prosperity befall on you! What shall I do? What appropriate thing is to be done
next? Please speak that which is well-answering and that, if attempted becomes well-done._END

B_6_C_3_26
BEGIN_
ते मया सम्क्रमा भग्नाः परिखाः च अवपूरिताः |
दग्धा च नगरी लंका प्राकाराः च अवसादिताः || ६-३-२९
बलैकदेशः क्षपितो राक्षसानाम् महात्मनाम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Those bridges were broken by me and the moats were filled up (with the wreckage).
The city of Lanka was burnt by me and the defensive walls were pulled down. A part of the army of
the gigantic ogres was destroyed."_END

B_6_C_4_17
BEGIN_यास्यामि बल मध्ये अहम् बल ओघम् अभिहर्षयन् || ६-४-१८
अधिरुह्य हनूमन्तम् ऐरावतम् इव ईश्वरः |_END
BEGIN_"I myself, mounted on the shoulders of Hanuman, like Indra on Airavata, will march in 
the centre of my troops, duly cheering the multitude of army."_END

B_6_C_5_9
BEGIN_
बह्व् एतत् कामयानस्य शक्यम् एतेन जीवितुम् |
यद् अहम् सा च वाम ऊरुर् एकाम् धरणिम् आश्रितौ || ६-५-१०_END
BEGIN_
"It is enough for me, who is passionate, that Seetha with charming thighs and myself
are resting on one the same earth and on this fact I am able to survive."_END

B_6_C_7_0
BEGIN_इति उक्ता राक्षस इन्द्रेण राक्षसास्ते महाबलाः |
ऊचुः प्रान्जलयः सर्वे रावणम् राक्षस ईश्वरम् || ६-७-१
द्विष्त्पक्ष्ह्मविज्ञाय नीतिबाह्यास्त्वबुद्धयः |_END
BEGIN_Hearing the words of Ravana, those demons who were strong, stupid and without moral conduct, 
all raising up their joined palms and spoke to Ravana the king of demons, without knowing the strengths 
of their enemy's side (as follows):_END

B_6_C_6_4
BEGIN_
मन्त्र मूलम् हि विजयम् प्राहुर् आर्या मनस्विनः || ६-६-५
तस्माद् वै रोचये मन्त्रम् रामम् प्रति महाबलाः |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, people of great strength! Wise-men say that victory is dependent on good
forethought. Verily for that reason, I desire a deliberation about Rama."_END

B_6_C_3_27
BEGIN_
येन केन तु मार्गेण तराम वरुण आलयम् || ६-३-३०
हता इति नगरी लंकाम् वानरैर् अवधार्यताम् |_END
BEGIN_
"By some way or other, let us cross the ocean. The city of Lanka should be assumed
then as destroyed by the monkeys."_END

B_6_C_4_18
BEGIN_अन्गदेन एष सम्यातु लक्ष्मणः च अन्तक उपमः || ६-४-१९
सार्वभौमेन भूत ईशो द्रविण अधिपतिस् यथा |_END
BEGIN_"Let this Lakshmana, resembling the lord of Death, march on the shoulders of Angada like 
Kubera the lord of riches and the sovereign of beings marches on an elephant called Sarvabhauma."_END

B_6_C_5_10
BEGIN_
केदारस्य इव केदारः स उदकस्य निरूदकः |
उपस्नेहेन जीवामि जीवन्तीम् यत् शृणोमि ताम् || ६-५-११_END
BEGIN_
"Even as a paddy-field without water survives, by getting wet from a neighboring
paddy-field under water, I also survive since I am hearing her as surviving._END

B_6_C_7_1
BEGIN_राजन् परिघ शक्ति ऋष्टि शूल पट्टस सम्कुलम् || ६-७-२
सुमहन् नो बलम् कस्माद् विषादम् भजते भवान् |_END
BEGIN_"Oh, king! Our army, equipped with iron bars, javelins, double-edged swords, darts and 
sharp-edged spears, is very great. Why are you getting worried?"_END

B_6_C_6_5
BEGIN_
त्रिविधाः पुरुषा लोके उत्तम अधम मध्यमाः || ६-६-६
तेषाम् तु समवेतानाम् गुण दोषम् वदामि अहम् |_END
BEGIN_
"There are three types of men in the world, namely the foremost the middle most and
the lowest. I am telling their inherent merits and defects."_END

B_6_C_3_28
BEGIN_
अङ्गदो द्विविदो मैन्दो जाम्बवान् पनसो नलः || ६-३-३१
नीलः सेना पतिः चैव बल शेषेण किम् तव |
प्लवमाना हि गत्वा ताम् रावणस्य महापुरीम् || ६-३-३२
सप्रकाराम् सभवनाम् आनयिष्यन्ति मैथिलीम् |
सप्राकाराम् सभवनामानयुष्यन्ति राघव || ६-३-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! What is the use for the rest of the forces to you? Angada, Divida,
Mainda, Jambavan, Panasa, Anala and Nila the commander-in-chief alone, by reaching that great city
of Ravana leaping and storming Lanka with its mountains and woods, moats and archways, protective
walls and buildings, will recover Seetha."_END

B_6_C_4_19
BEGIN_जाम्बवामः च सुषेणः च वेग दर्शी च वानरः || ६-४-२०
ऋक्ष राजो महासत्त्वः कुक्षिम् रक्षन्तु ते त्रयः |_END
BEGIN_Let the highly strong, Jambavan with Sushena and the monkey called Vegadarshi, all three, 
guard the middle part of the army."_END

B_6_C_5_11
BEGIN_
कदा तु खलु सुस्शोणीम् शत पत्र आयत ईक्षणाम् |
विजित्य शत्रून् द्रक्ष्यामि सीताम् स्फीताम् इव श्रियम् || ६-५-१२_END
BEGIN_
"When shall I behold Seetha with charming hips, having long lotus-like eyes
flourishing as prosperity, by conquering the enemies?"_END

B_6_C_7_2
BEGIN_त्वया भोगवतीम् गत्वा निर्जताः पन्नगा युधि || ६-७-३
कैलास शिखर आवासी यक्षैर् बहुभिर् आवृतः |
सुमहत् कदनम् कृत्वा वश्यस् ते धनदः कृतः || ६-७-४_END
BEGIN_"After proceeding to Bhogavati city (the abode of Nagas in Patala one of the seven regions 
under the earth), the serpents there were defeated by you. Kubera (the bestower of riches) who resides 
on the peak of Mount Kailasa, surrounded by many yakshas (a class of demi-gods) surrendered to you after 
doing a great battle."_END

B_6_C_6_6
BEGIN_
मन्त्रिभिर् हित सम्युक्तैः समर्थैर् मन्त्र निर्णये || ६-६-७
मित्रैर् वा अपि समान अर्थैर् बान्धवैर् अपि वा हितैः |
सहितो मन्त्रयित्वा यः कर्म आरम्भान् प्रवर्तयेत् || ६-६-८
दैवे च कुरुते यत्नम् तम् आहुः पुरुष उत्तमम् |_END
BEGIN_
"The wise call him as the foremost among men, who carries through the beginning of
any undertaking after consulting those who are wedded with welfare of others, or with ministers who
are efficient in conferring decisions or with friends having common interests or additionally with
relatives or who try to get a favour from Providence too."_END

B_6_C_3_29
BEGIN_
एवम् आज्ञापय क्षिप्रम् बलानाम् सर्व सम्ग्रहम् |
मुहूर्तेन तु युक्तेन प्रस्थानमभिरोचय || ६-३-३४_END
BEGIN_
"Order quickly to get all the forces accumulated accordingly. Let us set out at the
appropriate moment."_END

B_6_C_4_20
BEGIN_राघवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवो वाहिनी पतिः || ६-४-२१
व्यादिदेश महावीर्यान् वानरान् वानर ऱ्षभः |_END
BEGIN_"Hearing the words of Rama, Sugreeva with great valour, the commander of forces and the 
lion among monkeys gave orders to the monkeys accordingly."_END

B_6_C_5_12
BEGIN_
कदा नु चारु बिम्ब ओष्ठम् तस्याः पद्मम् इव आननम् |
ईषद् उन्नम्य पास्यामि रसायनम् इव आतुरः || ६-५-१३_END
BEGIN_
"When, gently raising her face looking like louts, with its beautiful teeth and
lips, shall I drink as a sick man the sovereign drink of remedy?"_END

B_6_C_7_3
BEGIN_स महाईश्वर सख्येन श्लाघमानस् त्वया विभो |
निर्जितः समरे रोषाल् लोक पालो महाबलः || ६-७-५_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Lord! By your rage, Kubera who was boasting himself for his friendship with Lord 
Shiva (the Supreme Lord) and said to be a guardian of the world possessing great strength, was defeated 
by you in battle."_END

B_6_C_6_7
BEGIN_
एको अर्थम् विम्ऱ्शेद् एको धर्मे प्रकुरुते मनः || ६-६-९
एकः कार्याणि कुरुते तम् आहुर् मध्यमम् नरम् |_END
BEGIN_
"The wise men call that man as mediocre, who deliberates about an activity
solitarily, applies his mind on law and justice all by himself and performs works singly."_END

B_6_C_4_21
BEGIN_ते वानर गणाः सर्वे समुत्पत्य युयुत्सवः || ६-४-२२
गुहाभ्यः शिखरेभ्यः च आशु पुप्लुविरे तदा |_END
BEGIN_Then, all those troops of monkeys with great speed together raised up and quickly bounced 
from caves and mountain-tops._END

B_6_C_5_13
BEGIN_
तौ तस्याः सम्हतौ पीनौ स्तनौ ताल फल उपमौ |
कदा नु खलु स उत्कम्पौ हसन्त्या माम् भजिष्यतः || ६-५-१४_END
BEGIN_
"When will those breasts which are delightful close, bulging and quivering, looking
like palmary fruits, indeed press me?"_END

B_6_C_7_4
BEGIN_विनिहत्य च यक्षौघान् विक्षोभ्य च विगृह्य च |
त्वया कैलास शिखराद् विमानम् इदम् आहृतम् || ६-७-६_END
BEGIN_"Throwing down a group of Yakshas, after causing a flutter among them and taking them 
in prison, this aerial car (Pushpak) was procured by you from Mount Kailasa."_END

B_6_C_6_8
BEGIN_
गुण दोषाव् अनिश्चित्य त्यक्त्वा दैव व्यपाश्रयम् || ६-६-१०
करिष्यामि इति यः कार्यम् उपेक्षेत् स नर अधमः |_END
BEGIN_
"He who does not determine the merits and demerits of an act clearly, having
recourse to Providence and neglects his duty by simply telling �I shall do it', he is the lowest
among men."_END

B_6_C_4_22
BEGIN_ततो वानर राजेन लक्ष्मणेन च पूजितः || ६-४-२३
जगाम रामो धर्म आत्मा ससैन्यो दक्षिणाम् दिशम् |_END
BEGIN_Thereafter Rama the virtuous man, treated respectfully by Sugreeva and Lakshmana, moved 
towards southern direction, along with the army._END

B_6_C_5_14
BEGIN_
सा नूनम् असित अपान्गी रक्षो मध्य गता सती |
मन् नाथा नाथ हीना इव त्रातारम् न अधिगच्चति || ६-५-१५_END
BEGIN_
"She, with dark-cornered eyes, who has fallen into the midst of demons, is surely
not getting any defender, she resembling an orphan, though I am her support."_END

B_6_C_7_5
BEGIN_मयेन दानव इन्द्रेण त्वद् भयात् सख्यम् इच्चता |
दुहिता तव भार्या अर्थे दत्ता राक्षस पुम्गव || ६-७-७_END
BEGIN_"Oh, the best of ogres! By Maya, the lord of demons, Mandodari his daughter was given 
to you in marriage, due to fear from you and duly desiring your friendship."_END

B_6_C_6_9
BEGIN_
यथा इमे पुरुषा नित्यम् उत्तम अधम मध्यमाः || ६-६-११
एवम् मन्त्रो अपि विज्ञेय उत्तम अधम मध्यमः |_END
BEGIN_
"In which manner these men are categorized always as good, bad or mediocre, so also
the resolution in thought is classified as good bad or mediocre."_END

B_6_C_4_23
BEGIN_शतैः शत सहस्रैः च कोटीभिर् अयुतैर् अपि || ६-४-२४
वारणाभिः च हरिभिर् ययौ परिव्ऱ्तस् तदा |_END
BEGIN_At that time, Rama went surrounded by monkeys, looking like elephants, numbering in hundreds, 
hundreds of thousands and crores._END

B_6_C_5_15
BEGIN_
कदा विक्षोभ्य रक्षांसि सा विधूय उत्पतिष्यति |
राक्षसीमध्यगा शेते स्नुषा दशरथस्य च || ६-५-१६_END
BEGIN_
"How Seetha the daughter of King Janaka, my darling and Dasaratha's daughter-in-law
is sleeping among ogresses?"_END

B_6_C_7_6
BEGIN_दानव इन्द्रो मधुर् नाम वीर्य उत्सिक्तो दुरासदः |
विगृह्य वशम् आनीतः कुम्भीनस्याः सुख आवहः || ६-७-८_END
BEGIN_Oh, mighty armed! Madhu Kumbhinasa's (your sister's) husband, another ruler of demons, 
who was proud of his valour and who was difficult to be defeated, was taken into your subjugation, your 
having won a battle against him."_END

B_6_C_6_10
BEGIN_
ऐकमत्यम् उपागम्य शास्त्र दृष्टेन चक्षुषा || ६-६-१२
मन्त्रिणो यत्र निरस्तास् तम् आहुर् मन्त्रम् उत्तमम् |_END
BEGIN_
"The wise say that resolution of thought is excellent, in which the thinkers, on a
view perceived by scriptures, obtain consensus and are satisfied with it."_END

B_6_C_4_24
BEGIN_तम् यान्तम् अनुयाति स्म महती हरि वाहिनी || ६-४-२५
हृष्टाः प्रमुदिताः सर्वे सुग्रीवेण अभिपालिताः |_END
BEGIN_That extensive army of monkeys followed Rama who was marching in the lead. All those 
monkeys maintained by Sugreeva were rejoicing with delight._END

B_6_C_5_16
BEGIN_
अविक्षोभ्याणि रक्षांसि सा विधूयोत्पतिष्यति |
विधूय जलदान् नीलान् शशि लेखा शरत्स्व् इव || ६-५-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha will come out, driving away (through my force) the unassailable demons, as
driving away black clouds by a digit of the moon, in autumn."_END

B_6_C_7_7
BEGIN_निर्जितास् ते महाबाहो नागा गत्वा रसा तलम् |
वासुकिस् तक्षकः शन्खो जटी च वशम् आहृताः || ६-७-९_END
BEGIN_"Oh, mighty armed! After moving down to rasatala (the penultimate subterranean region), 
the you conquered serpent-demons Vasukim Takshaka, Saukha and Jati were conquered by you and captivated 
as your subjects."_END

B_6_C_6_11
BEGIN_
बह्व्यो अपि मतयो गत्वा मन्त्रिणो हि अर्थ निर्णये || ६-६-१३
पुनर् यत्र एकताम् प्राप्तः स मन्त्रो मध्यमः स्मृतः |_END
BEGIN_
"Only after deliberating several kinds of opinions, that decision of a matter
obtained finally by a consensus of the counselors, is called mediocre."_END

B_6_C_4_25
BEGIN_आप्लवन्तः प्लवन्तः च गर्जन्तः च प्लवम् गमाः || ६-४-२६
क्ष्वेलन्तो निनदन्तः च जग्मुर् वै दक्षिणाम् दिशम् |_END
BEGIN_The monkeys, jumping overwhelmingly with roaring sound and jest fully playing musical 
instruments (like trumpets) marched towards southern direction._END

B_6_C_5_17
BEGIN_
स्वभाव तनुका नूनम् शोकेन अनशनेन च |
भूयस् तनुतरा सीता देश काल विपर्ययात् || ६-५-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha, who by nature is slender, will undoubtedly become leaner further because of
her anguish, her abstinence from food and her adverse position of time and place."_END

B_6_C_8_0
BEGIN_
ततो नील अम्बुद निभः प्रहस्तो नाम राक्षसः |
अब्रवीत् प्राञ्जलिर् वाक्यम् शूरः सेना पतिस्तदा || ६-८-१_END
BEGIN_
A valiant demon by name Prahasta, the commander-in-chief, appearing like a dark
cloud, joined his palms in salutation and spoke these words._END

B_6_C_7_8
BEGIN_अक्षया बलवन्तः च शूरा लब्ध वराः पुनः |
त्वया सम्वत्सरम् युद्ध्वा समरे दानवा विभो || ६-७-१०
स्व बलम् समुपाश्रित्य नीता वशम् अरिम् दम |
मायाः च अधिगतास् तत्र बहवो राक्षस अधिप || ६-७-११_END
BEGIN_"Oh, annihilator of enemies, Commander of demons and the Lord! You after performing a 
battle for a year by you mighty demons who were beyond destruction, who were valiant and who obtained 
boons (for immortality) were defeated using your own strength in combat. Several fascinating tricks 
also were learnt from them."_END

B_6_C_6_12
BEGIN_
अन्योन्य मतिम् आस्थाय यत्र सम्प्रतिभाष्यते || ६-६-१४
न च ऐकमत्ये श्रेयो अस्ति मन्त्रः सो अधम उच्यते |_END
BEGIN_
"That resolution is said to be worst in which several arguments are made, employing
one or the other divergent opinions and in which there is no advantage even after a consensus."_END

B_6_C_4_26
BEGIN_भक्षयन्तः सुगन्धीनि मधूनि च फलानि च || ६-४-२७
उद्वहन्तो महावृक्षान् मन्जरी पुन्ज धारिणः |_END
BEGIN_They marched on, eating good-smelling honeys and fruits and carrying large branches bearing 
clusters of blossoms in multitude._END

B_6_C_5_18
BEGIN_
कदा नु राक्षस इन्द्रस्य निधाय उरसि सायकान् |
सीताम् प्रत्याहरिष्यामि शोकम् उत्सृज्य मानसम् || ६-५-१९_END
BEGIN_
"When shall I bring back Seetha, having lodged arrows in Ravana's chest and having
abandoned this mental agony?"_END

B_6_C_8_1
BEGIN_
देव दानव गन्धर्वाः पिशाचपतगौरगाः |
न त्वाम् धर्षयितुम् शक्ताः किम् पुनर् वानरा रणे || ६-८-२_END
BEGIN_
"All gods, demons, gandharvas, devils, birds and serpents can be attacked by you in
battle. Why to talk about two human beings?"_END

B_6_C_7_9
BEGIN_शूराः च बलवन्तः च वरुणस्य सुता रणे |
निर्जितास् ते महाबाग चतुर् विध बल अनुगाः || ६-७-१२_END
BEGIN_"Oh, illustrious king! Varuna's sons, valiant strong and who were followed by an army 
having four limbs (viz. elephants, chariots, cavalry and infantry) were defeated by you in a battle."_END

B_6_C_6_13
BEGIN_
तस्मात् सुमन्त्रितम् साधु भवन्तो मन्त्रि सत्तमाः || ६-६-१५
कार्यम् सम्प्रतिपद्यन्ताम् एतत् कृत्यतमम् मम |_END
BEGIN_
"For that reason, you, having excellent intellect, arrive at a well-thought out
rightful action. To me, this is earnestly to be done."_END

B_6_C_4_27
BEGIN_अन्योन्यम् सहसा दृष्टा निर्वहन्ति क्षिपन्ति च || ६-४-२८
पतन्तः च उत्पतन्ति अन्ये पातयन्ति अपरे परान् |_END
BEGIN_Wild monkeys would lift up and throw one another all of a sudden. Some others were hanging 
down and flying upwards. Some other monkeys were throwing down others._END

B_6_C_5_19
BEGIN_
कदा नु खलु माम् साध्वी सीता अमर सुता उपमा |
स उत्कण्ठा कण्ठम् आलम्ब्य मोक्ष्यति आनन्दजम् जलम् || ६-५-२०_END
BEGIN_
"When indeed Seetha the virtuous lady similar to the child of a celestial, with an
excited longing, will embrace my neck and release tears of joy?"_END

B_6_C_8_2
BEGIN_
सर्वे प्रमत्ता विश्वस्ता वन्चिताः स्म हनूमता |
न हि मे जीवतो गच्चेज् जीवन् स वन गोचरः || ६-८-३_END
BEGIN_
"All of us, in good faith but with negligence, were cheated by Hanuma. That monkey
cannot go alive, while I am alive."_END

B_6_C_7_10
BEGIN_मृत्यु दण्ड महाग्राहम् शाल्मलि द्वीप मण्डितम् |
कालपाशमहाईचिम् यमकिम्करपन्नगम् || ६-७-१३
महाज्वरेण दुर्धर्षम् यमलोकमहार्णवम् |
अवगाह्य त्वया राजन् यमस्य बल सागरम् || ६-७-१४
जयः च विप्लुलः प्राप्तो मृत्युः च प्रतिषेधितः |
सुयुद्धेन च ते सर्वे लोकास् तत्र सुतोषिताः || ६-७-१५_END
BEGIN_Oh, king! After entering a great ocean in the shape of Yama's realm, with a huge alligator 
in the form of death's rod of punishment, adorned with silk-cotton trees (bristling with thorns to be 
used a weapons), turbulent with a huge wave in the shape of noose of Kala (Time Spirit), with serpents 
in the form of Yama's servants and difficult to be conquered on account of mighty Jvara (Spirit presiding 
over fevers), and churning the sea in the form of Yama's forces, a great victory was obtained and death 
warded off by you. All the people there were delighted to see your good battle."_END

B_6_C_6_14
BEGIN_
वानराणाम् हि वीराणाम् सहस्रैः परिवारितः || ६-६-१६
रामो अभ्येति पुरीम् लंकाम् अस्माकम् उपरोधकः |_END
BEGIN_
"Rama surrounded by thousands of courageous monkeys, is coming to the City of Lanka,
for the purpose of besieging us."_END

B_6_C_5_20
BEGIN_
कदा शोकम् इमम् घोरम् मैथिली विप्रयोगजम् |
सहसा विप्रमोक्ष्यामि वासः शुक्ल इतरम् यथा || ६-५-२१_END
BEGIN_
"When shall I thrillingly abandon this terrible anguish, born out of my separation
from Seetha so soon, as we abandon a soiled clothing?"_END

B_6_C_4_28
BEGIN_रावणो नो निहन्तव्यः सर्वे च रजनी चराः || ६-४-२९
इति गर्जन्ति हरयो राघवस्य समीपतः |_END
BEGIN_Monkeys close to Rama were thus shouting, "To us, Ravana is worthy of killing and also 
the entire demons."_END

B_6_C_8_3
BEGIN_
सर्वाम् सागर पर्यन्ताम् सशैल वन काननाम् |
करोमि अवानराम् भूमिम् आज्ञापयतु माम् भवान् || ६-८-४_END
BEGIN_
"I shall make the entire earth extending upto the ocean, along with mountains
forests and woods, bereft of monkeys. You command me."_END

B_6_C_7_11
BEGIN_क्षत्रियैर् बहुभिर् वीरैः शक्र तुल्य पराक्रमैः |
आसीद् वसुमती पूर्णा महद्भिर् इव पादपैः || ६-७-१६_END
BEGIN_"The earth was filled, like with big trees, with many warriors who were strong with a 
courage equal to that Devendra (Lord of celestials)._END

B_6_C_6_15
BEGIN_
तरिष्यति च सुव्यक्तम् राघवः सागरम् सुखम् || ६-६-१७
तरसा युक्त रूपेण सानुजः सबल अनुगः |_END
BEGIN_
"Rama, by his be-fitting strength, can certainly cross the ocean easily, with his
brother along with his army and his companions."_END

B_6_C_4_29
BEGIN_पुरस्ताद् ऋषभ्हो वीरो नीलः कुमुद एव च || ६-४-३०
पथानम् शोधयन्ति स्म वानरैर् बहुभिः सह |_END
BEGIN_Rishabha, Nila, and the courageous Kumuda along with many monkeys were clearing up the 
path ahead._END

B_6_C_5_21
BEGIN_
एवम् विलपतस् तस्य तत्र रामस्य धीमतः |
दिन क्षयान् मन्द वपुर् भास्करो अस्तम् उपागमत् || ६-५-२२_END
BEGIN_
While that sagacious Rama was lamenting thus there, the sun, the weak-rayed due to
day-decline, approached the dusk._END

B_6_C_8_4
BEGIN_
रक्षाम् चैव विधास्यामि वानराद् रजनी चर |
न आगमिष्यति ते दुह्खम् किंचिद् आत्म अपराधजम् || ६-८-५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Ravana! I shall arrange for your defence from that monkey. Not a little trouble
will come to you on account of your guilt (abduction of Seetha)."_END

B_6_C_7_12
BEGIN_तेषाम् वीर्य गुण उत्साहैर् न समो राघवो रणे |
प्रसह्य ते त्वया राजन् हताः परम दुर्जयाः || ६-७-१७_END
BEGIN_"Oh, King! Rama was not equal to them in combat, by their valour excellence and energy. 
Those warriors, who were difficult to be overcome in battle, were overpowered and killed by you."_END

B_6_C_6_16
BEGIN_
समुद्रमुच्छोषयति वीर्येणान्यत्करोति वा|| ६-६-१८
तस्मिन्न् एवम् गते कार्ये विरुद्धे वानरैः सह |
हितम् पुरे च सैन्ये च सर्वम् सम्मन्त्र्यताम् मम || ६-६-१९_END
BEGIN_
"He may even get the ocean dried up. He may do any other thing by his valour. The
aforesaid act of enmity with monkeys having commenced in this way, advise me everything that is
good for the city and my army."_END

B_6_C_4_30
BEGIN_मध्ये तु राजा सुग्रीवो रामो लक्ष्मण एव च || ६-४-३१
बहुभिर् बलिभिर् भीमैर् व्ऱ्ताः शत्रु निबर्हणः |_END
BEGIN_Sugreeva the king of monkeys, Rama and Lakshmana the destroyers of enemies were moving 
in the centre along with many robust and terrible monkeys._END

B_6_C_5_22
BEGIN_
आश्वासितो लक्ष्मणेन रामः संध्याम् उपासत |
स्मरन् कमल पत्र अक्षीम् सीताम् शोक आकुली कृतः || ६-५-२३_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana consoled Rama who was overwhelmed with anguish, duly recollecting the
lotus-eyed Seetha. Thereafter, Rama worshipped the evening-twilight._END

B_6_C_8_5
BEGIN_
अब्रवीत्तम् सुसम्क्रुद्धो दुर्मुखो नाम राक्षसः |
इदम् न क्षमणीयम् हि सर्वेषाम् नः प्रधर्षणम् || ६-८-६_END
BEGIN_
A demon by name Durmukha, being seriously enraged, spoke to him as follows: "This
humiliation meted out to us by that monkey is indeed not to be tolerated."_END

B_6_C_7_13
BEGIN_तिष्ठ वा किम् महाराज श्रमेण तव वानरान् |
अयमेको महारज इन्द्रजित् क्षपयिष्यति || ६-७-१८_END
BEGIN_Oh, emperor! Why exertion to you? You remain here. Oh, emperor! This Indrajit alone can 
destroy the monkeys."_END

B_6_C_4_31
BEGIN_हरिः शत बलिर् वीरः कोटीभिर् दशभिर् वृतः || ६-४-३२
सर्वाम् एको हि अवष्टभ्य ररक्ष हरि वाहिनीम् |_END
BEGIN_The heroic monkey satabali who was accompanied by ten crores of monkeys, standing alone 
firmly, guarded the whole army of monkeys._END

B_6_C_9_0
BEGIN_
ततो निकुम्भो रभसः सूर्य शत्रुर् महाबलः |
सुप्तघ्नो यज्ञ कोपः च महापार्श्वो महाउअरः || ६-९-१
अग्नि केतुः च दुर्धर्षो रश्मि केतुः च राक्षसः |
इन्द्रजिच् च महातेजा बलवान् रावण आत्मजः || ६-९-२
प्रहस्तो अथ विरूप अक्षो वज्र दम्ष्ट्रो महाबलः |
धूम्र अक्षः च अतिकायः च दुर्मुखः चैव राक्षसः || ६-९-३
परिघान् पट्टसान् प्रासान् शक्ति शूल परश्वधान् |
चापानि च सबाणानि खड्गामः च विपुलान् शितान् || ६-९-४
प्रगृह्य परम क्रुद्धाः समुत्पत्य च राक्षसाः |
अब्रुवन् रावणम् सर्वे प्रदीप्ता इव तेजसा || ६-९-५_END
BEGIN_
Then, Nikumbha, Rabhasa, the exceedingly strong Surya satru, Suptaghna, Yaj~akopa,
Mahaparsva and Mahodara, the unconquerable demons Agniketu and Rasmiketu, then the powerful son of
Ravana named Indrajit endowed with great energy, Prahasta and Virupaksha, Vajradamstra who was
extraordinarily strong, Dhumarksha and Atikaya and the demon by name Durmukha, carrying iron clubs,
sharp-edged spears, spikes, darts, javelins and axes, bows with excellent arrows and swords shining
like a vast expanse of water, and who were all extremely enraged, and flaming as it were with
glory, those demons rose up and spoke to Ravana (as follows)._END

B_6_C_8_6
BEGIN_
अयम् परिभवो भूयः पुरस्य अन्तः पुरस्य च |
श्रीमतो राक्षस इन्द्रस्य वानर इन्द्र प्रधर्षणम् || ६-८-७_END
BEGIN_
"This insult to the city of Lanka and the palaces together with attack by Sugreeva
on the glorious Ravana are still outrageous."_END

B_6_C_7_14
BEGIN_अनेन हि महाराज महेश्वरमनुत्तमम् |
इष्ट्वा यज्ञम् वरो लब्धो लोके परमदुर्लभः || ६-७-१९_END
BEGIN_"Oh, emperor! After performing an excellent sacrifice to propitiate Mahesvara (the great 
lord shiva), a boon very rare to be obtained in the world, was acquired by him."_END

B_6_C_4_32
BEGIN_कोटी शत परीवारः केसरी पनसो गजः || ६-४-३३
अर्कः च अतिबलः पार्श्वम् एकम् तस्य अभिरक्षति |_END
BEGIN_Kesari with a retinue of a hundred crore, Panasa, Gaja and Arka along with many monkeys 
were protecting one flank of that army._END

B_6_C_9_1
BEGIN_
अद्य रामम् वधिष्यामः सुग्रीवम् च सलक्ष्मणम् |
कृपणम् च हनूमन्तम् लंका येन प्रधर्षिता || ६-९-६_END
BEGIN_
"Now itself, we shall kill Rama along with Lakshmana and Sugreeva as well as the
pitiable Hanuma by whom Lanka was attacked."_END

B_6_C_8_7
BEGIN_
अस्मिन् मुहूर्ते हत्वा एको निवर्तिष्यामि वानरान् |
प्रविष्टान् सागरम् भीमम् अम्बरम् वा रसा तलम् || ६-८-८_END
BEGIN_
"Proceeding at this moment alone, I shall destroy those monkeys, whether they
entered the ocean or the subterranean region or the sky."_END

B_6_C_7_15
BEGIN_शक्तितोमरमीनम् च विनिकीर्णान्त्रशैवलम् |
गजकच्चपसम्बाधंश्वमण्डूकसम्कुलम् || ६-७-२०
रुद्रादित्यमहाग्राहम् मरुद्वसुमहोरगम् |
रथश्वगजतोयौघम् पदातिपुलिनम् महत् || ६-७-२१
अनेन हि समासाद्य देवानाम् बलसागम् |
गृहीतो दैवतपतिर्लङ्काम् चापि प्रवेशितः || ६-७-२२_END
BEGIN_"Approaching that huge ocean of army of celestials, whose fish are lanes and spheres, 
whose guts thrown asunder as duck-weeds, whose turtles are the elephants, whose frogs are the teeming 
horses, infested with alligators in the form of (eleven) Rudras (gods of destruction) and (twelve) Adityas 
(sons of Aditi), with huge serpents in the form of (forty nine) Maruts (wind gods) and (eight) Vasus, 
having chariots horses and elephants for its volume of waters and the sandy elephants for its volume 
of waters and the sandy banks its infantry, Devendra (Lord of celestials) was captured by him and was 
impelled to come to Lanka (as a detenu)._END

B_6_C_4_33
BEGIN_सुषेणो जाम्बवामः चैव ऋक्षैर् बहुभिर् आवृतः || ६-४-३४
सुग्रीवम् पुरतः कृत्वा जघनम् सम्ररक्षतुः |_END
BEGIN_Keeping Sugreeva in front, Sushena and Jambavanta surrounded by many bears, protected 
the hinder part of that army._END

B_6_C_9_2
BEGIN_
तान् गृहीत आयुधान् सर्वान् वारयित्वा विभीषणः |
अब्रवीत् प्रान्जलिर् वाक्यम् पुनः प्रत्युपवेश्य तान् || ६-९-७_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana (Ravana's youngest half-brother) restraining all those who were made to
seize weapons, were made to sit again by saluting them with joined palms and spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_8_8
BEGIN_
ततो अब्रवीत् सुसम्क्रुद्धो वज्र दम्ष्ट्रो महाबलः |
प्रगृह्य परिघम् घोरम् मांस शोणित रूपितम् || ६-८-९_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter the very strong Vajradamshtra, beset with great anger, took hold of a
terrific iron club smeared with flesh and blood and spoke (as follows):_END

B_6_C_7_16
BEGIN_पीतामहनियोगाच्च मुक्तः शम्बरवृत्रहा |
गतस्त्रिविष्टपम् राजन् सर्वदेवनमस्कृतः || ६-७-२३_END
BEGIN_"Oh, king! Having been released by the orders of your grand father Brahma, Devendra who 
killed demons called Shambara and Vrita and who was adored by all celestials, went back to heaven."_END

B_6_C_4_34
BEGIN_तेषाम् सेना पतिर् वीरो नीलो वानर पुम्गवः || ६-४-३५
सम्पतन् पतताम् श्रेष्ठस् तद् बलम् पर्यपालयत् |_END
BEGIN_Nila their chief of the army, the brave and the best among monkeys, the self controlled 
and the foremost among movable beings, was protecting atha army in every direction._END

B_6_C_9_3
BEGIN_
अपि उपायैस् त्रिभिस् तात यो अर्थः प्राप्तुम् न शक्यते |
तस्य विक्रम कालांस् तान् युक्तान् आहुर् मनीषिणः || ६-९-८_END
BEGIN_
"Dear brother! That act which cannot be accomplished by three well-known strategies
(viz . conciliation, gift and sowing dissention) , is only then to be accomplished by exhibiting
prowess, as stated by wise men."_END

B_6_C_8_9
BEGIN_
किम् नो हनुमता कार्यम् कृपणेन तपस्विना |
रामे तिष्ठति दुर्धर्षे सुग्रीवे सह लक्ष्मणे || ६-८-१०_END
BEGIN_
"What work for us with that pitiable and miserable Hanuma, when Rama along with
Lakshmana and Sugreeva who are difficult to be conquered exist?"_END

B_6_C_7_17
BEGIN_तमेव त्वम् महाराज विसृजेन्द्रजितम् सुतम् |
यावद्वानरसेनाम् ताम् परामाम् नयति क्ष्हयम् || ६-७-२४_END
BEGIN_"Oh, emperor! You send that Indrajit alone, so that the army of monkeys together with 
Rama will be brought to an end."_END

B_6_C_4_35
BEGIN_वलीमुखः प्रजङ्घश्च जम्भोऽथ रभसः कपिः || ६-४-३६
सर्वतः च ययुर् वीरास् त्वरयन्तः प्लवम् गमान् |_END
BEGIN_Valimukha, Prajangha, Jambha and Rabhasa the monkey were moving on all sides, urging 
the monkeys forward._END

B_6_C_9_4
BEGIN_
प्रमत्तेष्व् अभियुक्तेषु दैवेन प्रहतेषु च |
विक्रमास् तात सिध्यन्ति परीक्ष्य विधिना कृताः || ६-९-९_END
BEGIN_
"The gallantries performed according to the prescribed precept, after being tested,
O dear brother, only succeed against those who are indifferent, who have been already attacked by
an enemy or who stand struck down by fate."_END

B_6_C_8_10
BEGIN_
अद्य रामम् ससुग्रीवम् परिघेण सलक्ष्मणम् |
आगमिष्यामि हत्वा एको विक्षोभ्य हरि वाहिनीम् || ६-८-११_END
BEGIN_
"Now itself, with this iron club, killing Rama, Lakshmana and Sugreeva after
perturbing the army of monkeys, I shall come back."_END

B_6_C_7_18
BEGIN_राजन् न आपद् अयुक्ता इयम् आगता प्राकृताज् जनात् |
हृदि न एव त्वया कार्या त्वम् वधिष्यसि राघवम् || ६-७-२५_END
BEGIN_"Oh, king! This unbefitting danger has come froma a man who is ordinary. It is not to 
be kept by you in mind, you will kill Rama."_END

B_6_C_4_36
BEGIN_एवम् ते हरि शार्दूला गच्चन्तो बल दर्पिताः || ६-४-३७
अपश्यंस् ते गिरि श्रेष्ठम् सह्यम् द्रुम लता युतम् |
सागर ओघ निभम् भीमम् तद् वानर बलम् महत् || ६-४-३८_END
BEGIN_Those foremost among the monkeys, proud of their strength, thus marching with the army, 
saw the Sahya mountain the best of mountains joined with many small mountains, lakes fully abounding 
in flowers and eminent ponds._END

B_6_C_9_5
BEGIN_
अप्रमत्तम् कथम् तम् तु विजिगीषुम् बले स्थितम् |
जित रोषम् दुराधर्षम् प्रधर्षयितुम् इच्चथ || ६-९-१०_END
BEGIN_
"How do you wish to attack that famous Rama, who is always attentive, who has a will
to conquer, who is established in strength, who has subdued his anger and who is difficult to be
conquered."_END

B_6_C_8_11
BEGIN_
इदम् ममापरम् वाक्यम् शृणु राजन्यदीच्चसि |
उपायकुशलो ह्येव जयेच्चत्रुनतन्द्रितः || ६-८-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, king! If you are willing, hear my words further. One who is skilled din a
stratagem alone will be without lassitude and can indeed defeat the enemies."_END

B_6_C_10_0
BEGIN_
ततः प्रत्युषसि प्राप्ते प्राप्तधर्मार्थनिश्चयः |
राक्षसाधिपतेर्वेश्म भीमकर्मा विभीषणः || ६-१०-१_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana, who always arrived at a settlement in matters of virtue, pleasure and
wealth and who was terrible in his act, on arrival of the dawn, entered the palace of Ravana._END

B_6_C_4_37
BEGIN_रामस्य शासनम् ज्ञात्वा भीमकोपस्य भीतवत् |
वर्जयन्नगराभ्याशांस्तथा जनपदानपि || ६-४-३९
सागरौघनिभम् भीमम् तद्वानरबलम् महत् |
निह्ससर्प महाघोषम् भीम वेग इव अर्णवः || ६-४-४०_END
BEGIN_That large army of monkeys, terrific like an ocean-flood cognizing the command of Rama 
which is frightfully enraging, having terror-stricken, abandoning the vicinity of towns and even villages, 
marched like a highly dreadful ocean with a great hoaring sound._END

B_6_C_9_6
BEGIN_
समुद्रम् लन्घयित्वा तु घोरम् नद नदी पतिम् |
कृतम् हनुमता कर्म दुष्करम् तर्कयेत कः || ६-९-११_END
BEGIN_
"Who can conceive or even imagine in this world, that Hanuma's speed in crossing the
formidable ocean, which is the lord of streams and rivers?"_END

B_6_C_8_12
BEGIN_
कामरूपधराः शूराः सुभीमा भीमदर्शनाः |
राक्षसा वा सहस्राणि राक्षसाधिप निश्चिताः || ६-८-१३
काकुत्थ्समुपसम्गम्य बिभ्रतो मानुषम् वपुः |
सर्वे ह्यसम्भ्रमा भूत्वा ब्रुवन्तु रघुसत्तमम् || ६-८-१४_END
BEGIN_
O, king of demons! Thousands of demons able to change their form at will courageaous
appalling terrifying to look at and firm (in their purpose) can wear human body approach Rama
without embarrassment and all speak to Rama (as follows)._END

B_6_C_10_1
BEGIN_
शैलाग्रचयसम्काशम् शैलशृज्~गमिवोन्नतम् |
सुविभक्तमहाकक्षम् महाजनपरिग्रहम् || ६-१०-२_END
BEGIN_
Ravana's palace was looking like a mass of rocks, elevated like a mountain-peak,
well-divided into spacious apartments and occupied by eminent men._END

B_6_C_4_38
BEGIN_तस्य दाशरथेः पार्श्वे शूरास् ते कपि कुन्जराः |
तूर्णम् आपुप्लुवुः सर्वे सद् अश्वा इव चोदिताः || ६-४-४१_END
BEGIN_All those prominent and valiant monkeys were overwhelmingly jumping ahead, like fine 
horses being whipped, at the side of that Rama._END

B_6_C_8_13
BEGIN_
प्रेषिता भरतेनैव भ्रात्रा तव यवीयसा |
स हि सेनाम् समुत्थाप्य क्षिप्रमेवोपयास्यति || ६-८-१५_END
BEGIN_
"We have been despatched by Bharata, your younger brother. He is summoning his
forces and will surely come here soon."_END

B_6_C_9_7
BEGIN_
बलानि अपरिमेयानि वीर्याणि च निशा चराः |
परेषाम् सहसा अवज्ञा न कर्तव्या कथंचन || ६-९-१२_END
BEGIN_
"O, demons! The strength and the abilities of the enemies are difficult to be
measured. They cannot be treated with contempt hastily by any means."_END

B_6_C_10_2
BEGIN_
मतिमद्भिर्महामात्रैरनुरकैरधिष्ठितम् |
राक्षसैराप्तपर्याप्तैह् सर्वतः परिरक्षितम् || ६-१०-३_END
BEGIN_
It was inhabited by prime ministers, who were intelligent and beloved. It was
guarded on all sides by demons, who were trust worthy and efficient._END

B_6_C_4_39
BEGIN_कपिभ्याम् उह्यमानौ तौ शुशुभते नर ऋषभौ |
महद्भ्याम् इव संस्पृष्टौ ग्राहाभ्याम् चन्द्र भास्करौ || ६-४-४२_END
BEGIN_Rama and Lakshmana the best among men being carried on shoulders by Hanuman and Angada 
the two monkeys, were effulgent like the moon and the sun having come together in contact with two large 
planets (Jupiter and Venus)._END

B_6_C_8_14
BEGIN_
ततो वयमितस्तुर्णम् शूलशक्तिगदाधराः |
चापबाणासिहस्तश्च त्वरितास्तत्र यामहे || ६-८-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Carrying spikes, javelins and maces together with arrows and swords in hand, we
will quickly go there from here soon."_END

B_6_C_9_8
BEGIN_
किम् च राक्षस राजस्य रामेण अपकृतम् पुरा |
आजहार जन स्थानाद् यस्य भार्याम् यशस्विनः || ६-९-१३_END
BEGIN_
"What offence was done earlier to the king of demons by the illustrious Rama, whose
wife that he bore away from Janasthana?"_END

B_6_C_10_3
BEGIN_
मत्तमातज्~गनिःश्वासैर्व्याकुलीकृतमारुतम् |
शज्~खघोषमहाघोषम् तूर्यसम्बाधनादितम् || ६-१०-४_END
BEGIN_
The air was filled with the sighing breaths of elephants in rut, with tumultuous
noise produced by the blowing of conches and made to resound by an ensemble of musical
instruments._END

B_6_C_4_40
BEGIN_ततो वानरराजेन लक्ष्मणेन सुपूजितः |
जगाम रामो धर्मात्मा ससैन्यो दक्षिणाम् दिशम् || ६-४-४३
तम् अन्गद गतो रामम् लक्ष्मणः शुभया गिरा |
उवाच प्रतिपूर्ण अर्थः स्म्ऱ्तिमान् प्रतिभानवान् || ६-४-४४_END
BEGIN_Thereafter, Rama the virtuous man, treated respectfully by Sugreeva and Lakshmana, moved 
towards southern direction, along with the army. Lakshmana, with a fully meaningful presence of mind, 
sitting on Angada, spoke the following auspicious words which were fully meaningful, to Rama._END

B_6_C_8_15
BEGIN_
आकाशे गणशः स्थित्वा हत्वा ताम् हरिवाहिनीम् |
अश्मशस्त्रमहावृष्ट्वा प्रापयाम् यमक्षयम् || ६-८-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Standing as groups in the sky and beating that army of monkeys with a mighty hail
of stones and missiles, we should send them to the world of Death."_END

B_6_C_9_9
BEGIN_
खरो यदि अतिवृत्तस् तु रामेण निहतो रणे |
अवश्यम् प्राणिनाम् प्राणा रक्षितव्या यथा बलम् || ६-९-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Khara, who has gone beyond limits, was of course killed by Rama in an encounter.
Lives are certainly to be protected, according to one's own strength, by living beings."_END

B_6_C_10_4
BEGIN_
प्रमदाजनसम्बाधम् प्रजल्पितमहापथम् |
तप्तकाञ्चननिर्यूहम् भूषणोत्तमभूषितम् || ६-१०-५_END
BEGIN_
The palace was filled with a number of women-folk. It was having principal passages
in which spoken words were heard. It was having turrets made of pure gold and adorned with
excellent decors._END

B_6_C_4_41
BEGIN_हृताम् अवाप्य वैदेहीम् क्षिप्रम् हत्वा च रावणम् |
समृद्ध अर्थः समृद्ध अर्थाम् अयोध्याम् प्रतियास्यसि || ६-४-४५_END
BEGIN_"Killing Ravana fast and obtaining Seetha who was taken away, you will proceed to Ayodhya 
which is abundant by rich, having accomplished your purpose."_END

B_6_C_8_16
BEGIN_
एवम् चेदुपसर्पेतामनयम् रामलक्ष्मणौ |
अवश्यमपनीतेन जहतामेव जीवितम् || ६-८-१८_END
BEGIN_
"If Rama and Lakshmana thus approach softly into our trap they will surely abandon
their lives as they are taken away by the trap."_END

B_6_C_9_10
BEGIN_
एतन् निमित्तम् वैदेही भयम् नः सुमहद् भवेत् |
आहृता सा परित्याज्या कलह अर्थे क्ऱ्ते न किम् || ६-९-१५_END
BEGIN_
"For this reason, a very great danger because of Seetha will occur to us. She, who
was brought here, is to be given away. What is the use in doing anything, with an animosity as an
end?"_END

B_6_C_10_5
BEGIN_
गन्धर्वाणामिवावासमालयम् मरुतामिव |
रत्नसंचयसम्बाधम् भवनम् भोगिनामिव || ६-१०-६_END
BEGIN_
The palace was like an abode of Gandharvas (celestial musicians) and of Maruts
(strom-gods) filled with a collection of jewels resembling a house of Nagas (serpent-gods)._END

B_6_C_4_42
BEGIN_महान्ति च निमित्तानि दिवि भूमौ च राघव |
शुभान्ति तव पश्यामि सर्वाणि एव अर्थ सिद्धये || ६-४-४६
अनु वाति शुभो वायुः सेनाम् मृदु हितः सुखः |_END
BEGIN_"I am seeing all grand good omens in the sky and the earth self-evident of your fulfillment, 
Oh Rama! The wind which is favorable, gentle beneficial and comfortable to the army is blowing alongside."_END

B_6_C_8_17
BEGIN_
कौम्भकर्णिस् ततो वीरो निकुम्भो नाम वीर्यवान् |
अब्रवीत् परम कुर्द्धो रावणम् लोक रावणम् || ६-८-१९_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter Kumbhakarna's son, by name Nikumbha, strong and powerful, became very
angry and spoke (as follows) to Ravana, who made people cry._END

B_6_C_9_11
BEGIN_
न नः क्षमम् वीर्यवता तेन धर्म अनुवर्तिना |
वैरम् निरर्थकम् कर्तुम् दीयताम् अस्य मैथिली || ६-९-१६_END
BEGIN_
"It is not appropriate to make enmity uselessly with Rama, who is valiant and who
follows righteousness. Let Seetha be given away to him."_END

B_6_C_10_6
BEGIN_
तम् महाभ्रमिवादित्य स्तेजोविस्तृतरश्मिमान् |
अग्रजस्यालयम् वीरः प्रविवेश महाद्युतिः || ६-१०-७_END
BEGIN_
The valiant Vibhishana with great splendour entered that mansion of his elder
brother, Ravana, like the sun with rays outstretched with splendour entering a big cloud._END

B_6_C_9_12
BEGIN_
यावन् सगजाम् साश्वाम् बहु रत्न समाकुलाम् |
पुरीम् दारयते बाणैर् दीयताम् अस्य मैथिली || ६-९-१७_END
BEGIN_
Before the City of Lanka with its elephants, horses and many riches are shattered by
arrows, let Seetha be given away to him."_END

B_6_C_4_43
BEGIN_पूर्ण वल्गु स्वराः च इमे प्रवदन्ति मृग द्विजाः || ६-४-४७
प्रसन्नाः च दिशः सर्वा विमलः च दिवा करः |_END
BEGIN_"These beasts and birds are uttering sonorous and sweet sounds. All the quarters are 
looking bright. Even the sun is clear."_END

B_6_C_8_18
BEGIN_
सर्वे भवन्तस् तिष्ठन्तु महाराजेन सम्गताः |
अहम् एको हनिष्यामि राघवम् सह लक्ष्मणम् || ६-८-२०
सुग्रीवम् सहनूमन्तम् सर्वांश्चैवात्र वानरान् |_END
BEGIN_
All of you stay along with the king. I alone will kill there, Rama along with
Lakshman, Sugreeva along with Hanuma and all the monkeys also._END

B_6_C_10_7
BEGIN_
पुण्यान् पुण्याहघोषांश्च वेदिविद्भिरुदाहृतान् |
शुश्राव सुमहातेजा भ्रातुर्विजयसंश्रितान् || ६-१०-८_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana with great radiance, heard the auspicious sounds of felicitous recital of
prayers uttered by the knowers of Vedas (scriptural texts), wishing for the victory of his
brother._END

B_6_C_9_13
BEGIN_
यावत् सुघोरा महती दुर्धर्षा हरि वाहिनी |
न अवस्कन्दति नो लंकाम् तावत् सीता प्रदीयताम् || ६-९-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Not so long as the huge army of monkeys which is very dangerous and unconquerable
attacks our Lanka, let Seetha be given away."_END

B_6_C_8_19
BEGIN_
ततो वज्रहनुर्नाम राक्षसः पर्वतोपमः || ६-८-२१
क्रुद्धः परिलिहन् वक्त्रम् जिह्वया वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, a demon by name Vajrahanu who was resembling a mountain, becoming enraged and
licking the corners of his mouth with his tongue, spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_4_44
BEGIN_उशना च प्रसन्न अर्चिर् अनु त्वाम् भार्गवो गतः || ६-४-४८
ब्रह्म राशिर् विशुद्धः च शुद्धाः च परम ऋषयः |
अर्चिष्मन्तः प्रकाशन्ते ध्रुवम् सर्वे प्रदक्षिणम् || ६-४-४९_END
BEGIN_"The planet of Venus with its bright light, born from the sage Bhrigu (a mind-born son 
of Brahma the creator) is hanging behind you. Dhruva, the very bright pole-star (which is recognized 
by the contiguity of the stars presided over by the seven Brahmana sages) is becoming clear. All the 
pure great sages having bright light are shining are shining around Dhruva star._END

B_6_C_10_8
BEGIN_
पूजितान् दधिपात्रैश्च सर्पिर्भिः सुमनोक्षतैः |
मन्त्रवेदविदो विप्रान् ददर्श स महाबलः || ६-१०-९_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana of great strength, saw Brahmins who know Mantras (sacred texts) and
Brahmanas, respected and offered with pots filled of curd, clarified butter as well as with flowers
and unbroken rice._END

B_6_C_8_20
BEGIN_
स्वैरम् कुर्वन्तु कार्याणि भवन्तो विगत ज्वराः || ६-८-२२
एको अहम् भक्षयिष्यामि तान् सर्वान् हरि यूथपान् |
स्वस्थाः क्रीडन्तु निश्चिन्ताः पिबन्तु मधु वारुणीम् || ६-८-२३_END
BEGIN_
"You do your occupations freely redeemed of mental pain, play comfortably and drink
spirituous liquor without any worry. I alone will devour the entire army of monkeys."_END

B_6_C_4_45
BEGIN_त्रिशन्कुर् विमलो भाति राज ऋषिः सपुरोहितः || ६-४-५०
पितामह वरो अस्माकम् इष्क्वाकूणाम् महात्मनाम् |_END
BEGIN_"The royal sage Trishanku, our paternal grand father, born in the high-souled Ikshvaku 
dynasty, is purely shining (as a star) in front, along with his family-priest."_END

B_6_C_9_14
BEGIN_
विनश्येद्द् हि पुरी लंका शूराः सर्वे च आक्षसाः |
रामस्य दयिता पत्नी न स्वयम् यदि दीयते || ६-९-१९_END
BEGIN_
"If the beloved wife of Rama is not given away of your own accord, the city of Lanka
will indeed perish. All our valiant demons too will Perish."_END

B_6_C_10_9
BEGIN_
स पूज्यमानो रक्षोभिद्दीप्यमानम् स्वतेजसा |
असवस्थम् महाबाहुर्ववन्दे धनदानुजम् || ६-१०-१०_END
BEGIN_
The mighty armed Vibhishana, being adored by the deomons and shining by his own
splendour, offered salutation to Ravana the younger brother of Kubera (the lord of riches), who
occupied the throne._END

B_6_C_9_15
BEGIN_
प्रसादये त्वाम् बन्धुत्वात् कुरुष्व वचनम् मम |
हितम् पथ्यम् त्व् अहम् ब्रूमि दीयताम् अस्य मैथिली || ६-९-२०_END
BEGIN_
"I am propitiating you because of my relationship. Act on my words. I am telling you
beneficial as well as truthful word. Let Seetha be given away to him."_END

B_6_C_8_21
BEGIN_
अहम् एको हनिष्यामि सुग्रीवम् सह लक्ष्मणम् |
स अन्गदम् च हनूमन्तम् रामम् च रण कुन्जरम् || ६-८-२४_END
BEGIN_
At this time I alone will kill Sugreeva along with Lakshmana Hanuma along with
Angada and all monkeys._END

B_6_C_4_46
BEGIN_विमले च प्रकाशेते विशाखे निरुपद्रवे || ६-४-५१
नक्षत्रम् परम् अस्माकम् इक्ष्वाकूणाम् महात्मनाम् |_END
BEGIN_"Visakha stars are shining clearly without any evil influence. This supreme constellation 
is of our Ikshvakus, the high-souled."_END

B_6_C_10_10
BEGIN_
स राजदृष्टिसम्पन्नमासनम् हेमभूषितम् |
जगाम समुदाचारम् प्रयुज्याचारकोविदः || ६-१०-११_END
BEGIN_
Practicing customary formalities, Vibhishana who knew the code of conduct, obtained
a seat adorned with gold, as endowed to him by a glance of the king._END

B_6_C_9_16
BEGIN_
पुरा शरत् सूर्य मरीच्चि सम्निभान् |
नव अग्र पुन्खान् सुदृढान् नृप आत्मजः |
सृजति अमोघान् विशिखान् वधाय ते |
प्रदीयताम् दाशरथाय मैथिली || ६-९-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Before Rama the prince discharges for your destruction, very strong and unfailing
arrows equal to the rays of autumnal sun and provided with new heads and shafts, let Seetha be
given away to Rama."_END

B_6_C_4_47
BEGIN_नैरृतम् नैरृतानाम् च नक्षत्रम् अभिपीड्यते || ६-४-५२
मूलम् मूलवता स्प्ऱ्ष्टम् धूप्यते धूम केतुना |_END
BEGIN_"The Mula constellation of the titans is badly aspected, in that it is touched by a comet 
risen with a tail of light and tormented by it."_END

B_6_C_10_11
BEGIN_
स रावणम् महात्मानम् विजने मन्त्रिसम्निधौ |
उवाच हितमत्यर्थम् वचनम् हेतुनिश्चितम् || ६-१०-१२_END
BEGIN_
In the presence of ministers and in privation, Vibhishana spoke to powerful Ravana
the words convinced of reason and which were very much beneficial._END

B_6_C_9_17
BEGIN_
त्यजस्व कोपम् सुख धर्म नाशनम् |
भजस्व धर्मम् रति कीर्ति वर्धनम् |
प्रसीद जीवेम सपुत्र बान्धवाः |
प्रदीयताम् दाशरथाय मैथिली || ६-९-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Abandon soon your anger, which destroys happiness and piety. Resort to
righteousness, which augments joy and fame. Become placid so that we may live with our sons and
relatives. Let Seetha be given away to Rama."_END

B_6_C_4_48
BEGIN_सरम् च एतद् विनाशाय राक्षसानाम् उपस्थितम् || ६-४-५३
काले काल गृहीतानाम् नकत्रम् ग्रह पीडितम् |_END
BEGIN_"All this has come for the destruction of the titans, for, the star seized by death is 
oppressed by a planet in its last hour."_END

B_6_C_10_12
BEGIN_
प्रसाद्य भ्रातरम् ज्येष्ठम् सान्त्वेनोपस्थितक्रमः |
देशकालार्थसम्वादि दृष्टलोकपरावः || ६-१०-१३_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana, who could discriminate between good and evil things in the world, having
sought the favour from his eldest (half-) brother by means of soothing words arranged in an order,
spoke in consonance with place, time and purpose._END

B_6_C_4_49
BEGIN_प्रसन्नाः सुरसाः च आपो वनानि फलवन्ति च |
प्रवान्ति अभ्यधिकम् गन्धा यथा ऋतु कुसुमा द्रुमाः || ६-४-५४_END
BEGIN_"The waters are crystal-clear, with good taste. The woodlands are laden with fruit. The 
fragrant air is not blowing much. Trees are bearing seasonal flowers."_END

B_6_C_9_18
BEGIN_
विभीषणवचः श्रुत्वा रावणो राक्षसेश्वरः |
विसर्जयित्वा तान् सर्वान् प्रैवेश स्वकम् गृहम् || ६-९-२३_END
BEGIN_
After hearing Vibhishana's words, Ravana the king of demons left all of them and
entered his own palace._END

B_6_C_11_0
BEGIN_
स बभुव कृशो राजा मैथिलीकाममोहितः |
असन्मानाच्च सुहृदाम् पापः पापेन कर्मणाः || ६-११-१_END
BEGIN_
That sinful Ravana, infatuated by his desire for Seetha, became emaciated by his
sinful action and by his despising of well-disposed people like Vibhishana._END

B_6_C_10_13
BEGIN_
यदा प्रभृति वैदेही सम्प्राप्तेह परतप |
तदा प्रभृति दृश्यन्ते निमित्तान्यशुभानि नः || ६-१०-१४_END
BEGIN_
"O, annihilator of enemies! We are seeing inauspicious omens, since Seetha arrived
here."_END

B_6_C_4_50
BEGIN_व्यूढानि कपि सैन्यानि प्रकाशन्ते अधिकम् प्रभो |
देवानाम् इव सैन्यानि सम्ग्रामे तारकामये || ६-४-५५
एवम् आर्य समीक्ष्य एतान् प्रीतो भवितुम् अर्हसि |_END
BEGIN_"The armies of monkeys formed into different squadrons are looking highly splendid like 
the armies of celestials in the battle in which the demon Taraka was killed, Oh venerable one! Be pleased 
to see these good omens in this manner."_END

B_6_C_11_1
BEGIN_
अतीतसमये काले तस्मिन्वे युधि रावणः |
अमात्यैश्च सुहृद्भिश्च प्राप्तकालममन्यत || ६-११-२_END
BEGIN_
Though the occasion for war was lacking Ravana thought of consulting with his
ministers and well-wishers then to be a fit time._END

B_6_C_10_14
BEGIN_
सस्फुलिज्~गः सधूमार्चिह् सधूमकलुषोदयः |
मन्त्रसम्घहुतोऽप्यग्निर्न सम्यगभिवर्धते || ६-१०-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Even if the sacrificial fire is fed with oblations while uttering a proper set of
Mantras (Spiritual texts), the fire is not flaring up well, emitting sparks, its flames are
enveloped in smoke and are coming forth, polluted with soot."_END

B_6_C_4_51
BEGIN_इति भ्रातरम् आश्वास्य हृष्टः सौमित्रिर् अब्रवीत् || ६-४-५६
अथ आव्ऱ्त्य महीम् कृत्स्नाम् जगाम महती चमूः |
ऋक्ष वानर शार्दूलैर् नख दम्ष्ट्र आयुधैर् वृता || ६-४-५७_END
BEGIN_The delighted Lakshmana spoke thus, cheering up his brother. Then, the army of monkeys 
consisting of excellent bears and monkeys having their very nails and teeth as weapons, marched ahead, 
covering the entire earth._END

B_6_C_11_2
BEGIN_
स हेमजालविततम् मणिविद्रुमभूषितम् |
उपगम्य विनीताश्वमारुरोह महार्थम् || ६-११-३_END
BEGIN_
Approaching a great chariot, covered by a golden net, adorned with gems and corals
and yoked with trained horses, Ravana mounted on it._END

B_6_C_10_15
BEGIN_
अग्निष्ठेष्वग्निशालासु तथा ब्रह्मस्थलीषु च |
परीपृपाणि दृश्यन्ते हव्येषु च पिपीलिकाः || ६-१०-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Serpents are seen at the corner of the sacrificial post which is nearest the fire,
also in houses keeping sacrificial fire and in places where sacred studies are made. Ants are seen
in things to be offered as oblations."_END

B_6_C_4_52
BEGIN_कर अग्रैः चरण अग्रैः च वानरैर् उद्धतम् रजः |
भीमम् अन्तर् दधे लोकम् निवार्य सवितुः प्रभाम् || ६-४-५८
सा स्म याति दिवा रात्रम् महती हरि वाहिनी |
हृष्ट प्रमुदिता सेना सुग्रीवेण अभिरक्षिता || ६-४-५९_END
BEGIN_The aweful dust raised by nails and claws of monkeys obscured the splendor of the sun 
and also covered the earth comprising of mountains forests and the atmosphere. The colossal monkey-army 
advanced, encompassing the southern region like a mass of cloud enveloping the sky._END

B_6_C_11_3
BEGIN_
तमास्थाय रथश्रेष्ठो महामेघसमस्वनम् |
प्रययौ रक्षसाम् श्रेष्ठो दशग्रीवः सभाम् प्रति || ६-११-४_END
BEGIN_
Ravana the excellent among demons ascended that most beautiful chariot, with a
rattling sound resembling the rumbling of a large cloud and then proceeded towards the
assembly-hall._END

B_6_C_10_16
BEGIN_
गवाम् पयांसि स्कन्नानि विमदा वरकुञ्जराः |
दीनमश्वाः प्रहेषन्ते न च ग्रासाभिनन्दिनः || ६-१०-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Cow's milk is getting curdled. Excellent elephants are bereft of rut. Horses are
neighing miserably and are not rejoiced in eating grass."_END

B_6_C_4_53
BEGIN_उत्तरन्त्याश्च सेनायाः सततम् बहुयोजनम् |
नदीस्रोतांसि सर्वाणि सस्यन्दुर्विपरीतवत् || ६-४-६०_END
BEGIN_While the army was crossing the entire river-currents uninterruptedly, the currents flowed 
invertedly for a distance of many yojanas._END

B_6_C_11_4
BEGIN_
असिचर्मधरा योधाः सर्वायुधधरास्ततः |
राक्षसा राक्षसेन्द्रस्य पुरस्तात्सम्प्रतस्थिरे || ६-११-५_END
BEGIN_
Warriors holding swords and shield as well as demons wearing all types of weapons,
marched in front of Ravana._END

B_6_C_10_17
BEGIN_
खरोष्ट्राश्वतरा राजन्भिन्न्रोमाः स्रवन्ति च |
न स्वभावेऽवतिष्ठन्ते विधानैरपि चिन्तताः || ६-१०-१८_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! Donkeys, camels and mules shed tears, losing their hair and even if
treated asper medical procedures are not getting cured."_END

B_6_C_4_54
BEGIN_सरांसि विमलाम्भांसि द्रुमाकीर्णांश्च पर्वतान् |
समान् भूमिप्रदेशांश्च वनानि फलवन्ति च || ६-४-६१
मध्येन च समन्ताच्च वनानि फलवन्ति च |_END
BEGIN_The mighty army entered thoroughly into lakes containing clear water, mountains full 
of trees, plain-landed territories and forests laden with fruits from the middle, from the four sides, 
from across and from under._END

B_6_C_11_5
BEGIN_
नानाविकृतवेषाश्च नानाभूषणभूषिताः |
पार्श्वतः पृष्ठतश्चैनम् परिवार्य ययुस्तदा || ६-११-६_END
BEGIN_
Demons wearing all types of unusual dresses and adoring various kinds of jewellery
then marched, duly surrounding him from sides and even behind._END

B_6_C_10_18
BEGIN_
वायसाः सघशः क्रूरा व्याहरन्ति समन्ततः |
समवेताश्च दृश्यन्ते विमानाग्रेषु सम्घशः || ६-१०-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Crows in flocks are crying cruelly from all sides and are seen in crowds assembled
together on house-tops."_END

B_6_C_4_55
BEGIN_समावृत्य महीम् कृत्स्नाम् जगाम महती चमूः || ६-४-६२
ते हृष्टवदनाह् सर्वे जग्मुर्मारुतरम्हसः |_END
BEGIN_The gigantic army marched, thoroughly covering the land. All of them with a wind-like 
aped went on, manifesting a joy in their faces._END

B_6_C_11_6
BEGIN_
रथैश्चातिरथा शीघ्रम् मतैश्च वरवारणैः |
अमात्पेतुर्दशग्रीवमाक्रीडद्भिश्च वाजिभिः || ६-११-७_END
BEGIN_
Great chariot-warriors in chariots, on excellent elephants in rut and horses
supportively coming in different gaits, rushed after Ravana quickly._END

B_6_C_10_19
BEGIN_
गृध्राश्च परिलीयन्ते पुरीमुपरि पिण्डिताः |
उपपन्नाश्च संध्ये द्वे व्याहरन्त्यशिवम् शिवाः || ६-१०-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Vultures fly to and fro in circles over the city. Jackals are crying inauspiciously
at the approach of both dawn and the dusk."_END

B_6_C_4_56
BEGIN_हरयो राघवस्यार्थे समारोपितविक्रमाः || ६-४-६३
हर्षम् वीर्यम् बलोद्रेकाद्दर्शयन्तः परस्परम् |
यौवनोत्सेकजाद्दर्पाद्विविधांश्चक्रुरध्वनि || ६-४-६४_END
BEGIN_For the sake of Rama, the monkeys with fully elevated pace vied with each other in high 
spirits, vigor and prowess. Out of pride born of prime youth, some made various gestures on the way._END

B_6_C_11_7
BEGIN_
गदापरिघहस्ताश्च शक्तितोमरपाणयः |
परश्वथधराश्चान्ये तथान्ये शूलपाणयः || ६-११-८_END
BEGIN_
Some had maces and iron bars in their hands. Some had javelins and iron clubs. Some
were holding axes. Some others had darts in their hands._END

B_6_C_10_20
BEGIN_
क्रव्यादानाम् मृगाणाम् च पुरीद्वारेषु सज्~घशः |
श्रूयन्ते विपुला घोषाः सविस्फूर्जितनिःस्वनाः || ६-१०-२१_END
BEGIN_
"At city-gates are heard loud cries of carnivorous animals gathered in groups, with
thundering noise."_END

B_6_C_11_8
BEGIN_
ततस्तूर्यसहस्राणाम् सम्जज्ञे निःस्वनो महान् |
तुमुलः शङ्खशब्दश्च सभाम् गच्चति रवणे || ६-११-९_END
BEGIN_
As Ravana was proceeding to the assembly-hall, loud blare of thousands of trumpets
along with tumultuous noise of conches were produced._END

B_6_C_4_57
BEGIN_तत्र केचिद्द्रुतम् जग्मुरुत्पेतुश्च तथापरे |
केचित्किलकिलाम् चक्रुर्वानरा वनगोचराः || ६-४-६५_END
BEGIN_Some wild monkeys there walked very speedily. In that manner, some others hovered highly. 
Some made noises, sounding "kila! kila!"._END

B_6_C_12_0
BEGIN_
स ताम् परिषदम् कृत्स्नाम् समीक्ष्य समितिम्जयः |
प्रबोधयामास तदा प्रहस्तम् वाहिनीपतिम् || ६-१२-१_END
BEGIN_
Then, Ravana an eminent person in the assembly, having seen all that gathering,
instructed Prahasta the chief of his army (as follows):_END

B_6_C_10_21
BEGIN_
तदेवम् प्रस्तुते कार्ते प्रायश्चित्तमिदम् क्षमम् |
रोचये वीर वैदेही राघवाय प्रदीयताम् || ६-१०-२२_END
BEGIN_
"O, brave man! Hence, when the actions of evil forces are happening in this way,
this atonement is appropriate that Seetha be given away to Rama and I like it."_END

B_6_C_11_9
BEGIN_
स नेमिघोषेण महान्सहसाभिनिनादयन् |
राजमार्गम् श्रिया जुष्टम् प्रतिपेदे महारथः || ६-११-१०_END
BEGIN_
That excellently great chariot, making noise of the sound of its wheels, soon
entered the beautiful royal high-way._END

B_6_C_4_58
