BEGIN_प्रास्फोटयंश्च पुच्छानि सम्निजघ्नः पदान्यपि |
भुजान्विक्षिप्य शैलांश्च द्रुमानन्ये बभञ्जरे || ६-४-६६_END
BEGIN_Some monkeys lashed their tails. Some even stamped their feet. Some others, stretching 
their arms, broke off rocks and trees._END

B_6_C_12_1
BEGIN_
सेनापते यथा ते स्युः कृतविद्याश्चतुर्विधाः |
योधा नगररक्षायाम् तथा व्यादेष्टुमर्हसि || ६-१२-२_END
BEGIN_
"O, commander! You are allowed to issue an order to see that well-trained warriors
belonging to the four divisions of the army (viz.cavalry, infantry, chariots and elephants) are
entrusted with the defense of the city."_END

B_6_C_10_22
BEGIN_
इदम् च यदि वामोहाल्लोभाद्वा व्याहृतम् मया |
तत्राप् च महाराज न दोषम् कर्तुमर्हसि || ६-१०-२३_END
BEGIN_
"O, emperor! If I am speaking this because of infatuation or greed, in that case
also, you ought not to find fault with me."_END

B_6_C_11_10
BEGIN_
विमलम् चातपत्रम् च पगृहीतमशोभत |
पाण्डुरम् राक्षसेन्द्रस्य पूर्णस्तारधिपो यथा || ६-११-११_END
BEGIN_
The spotlessly white umbrella, held on Ravana's head, shone like a full-moon._END

B_6_C_4_59
BEGIN_आरोहन्तश्च शृङ्गाणि गिरीणाम् गिरिगोचराः |
महानादान् प्रमुञ्चन्ति क्ष्वेडामन्ये प्रचक्रिते || ६-४-६७_END
BEGIN_Some monkeys ascended mountain-peaks and uttered huge noises. Some others made lion's 
roars._END

B_6_C_12_2
BEGIN_
स प्रहस्तः प्रतीतात्मा चिकीर्षन् राजशासनम् |
विनिक्षिपद् बलम् सर्वम् बहिरन्तश्च मन्दिरे || ६-१२-३_END
BEGIN_
Prahasta, resolute in his mind to follow the king's orders stationed the whole army
both outside as well as inside the city._END

B_6_C_10_23
BEGIN_
अयम् हि दोषः सर्वस्य जनस्याप्योपलक्ष्यते |
रक्षसाम् राक्षसीनाम् च पुरस्यान्तः पुरस्य च || ६-१०-२४_END
BEGIN_
"These bad omens are being seen indeed by demons and lady-demons of the city and of
the gynaeceum as well as all these people here."_END

B_6_C_11_11
BEGIN_
हेमञ्जरिगर्भे च शुद्धस्फटिकविग्रहे |
चामरव्यजने तस्य रेजतुः सव्यदक्षिणे || ६-११-१२_END
BEGIN_
On his left and right sides, two fans of yak's tails with crystal handles and golden
fringes were shining._END

B_6_C_4_60
BEGIN_ऊरुवेगैश्च ममृदुर्लताजालान्यनेकशः |
जृम्भमाणाश्च विक्रान्ता विचिक्रीडुः शिलाद्रुमैः || ६-४-६८_END
BEGIN_Some monkeys were crushing many webs of creepers by the jerks of their thighs. The valiant 
monkeys also played with rocks and trees, by stretching their limbs._END

B_6_C_12_3
BEGIN_
ततो विनिक्षिप्य बलम् सर्वम् नगरगुप्तये |
प्रहस्तः प्रमुखे राज्ञो निषसाद जगाद च || ६-१२-४_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, Prahasta after keeping the whole army in defence of the city, sat in
front of the king and spoke (as follows):_END

B_6_C_10_24
BEGIN_
प्रापणे चास्य मन्त्रस्य निवृत्ताः सर्वमन्त्रिणः |
अवश्यम् च मया वाच्यम् यद्दृष्टमथवा श्रुतम् || ६-१०-२५
सम्विधाय यथान्यायम् तद्भवान् कर्तुमर्हति |_END
BEGIN_
"All your ministers have abstained to pass this counsel to you. Whatever is seen or
heard, it is to be told certainly by me. Hence, you ought to do according to a justification of
things for the occasion."_END

B_6_C_11_12
BEGIN_
ते कृताञ्जलयः सर्वे रथस्थम् पृथिवीस्थिताः |
राक्ष्सा राक्षसश्रेष्ठम् शिरोभिस्तम् ववन्दिरे || ६-११-१३_END
BEGIN_
All those demons standing on ground offered their salutation by bending their heads
and joining their palms to his the best of demons, mounted on the chariot._END

B_6_C_4_61
BEGIN_ततः शतसहस्रैश्च कोटिभिश्च सहस्रशः |
वानराणाम् सुघोराणाम् श्रीमत्परिवृता मही || ६-४-६९_END
BEGIN_In that place, the land was covered splendidly by hundreds of thousands, by thousands 
and crores of monkeys, who were looking very dreadful._END

B_6_C_12_4
BEGIN_
विहितम् बहिरन्तश्च बलम् बलवतस्तव |
कुरुष्वाविमनाः क्षिप्रम् यदभिप्रेतमस्ति ते || ६-१२-५_END
BEGIN_
Your army, as strong as you are, has been positioned both outside and inside the
city. Pray do quickly, with an undistracted mind, whatever is preferable to you."_END

B_6_C_10_25
BEGIN_
इति स्वमन्त्रिणाम् मध्ये भ्राता भ्रातरमूचिवान् || ६-१०-२६
रावणम् रक्षसाम् श्रेष्ठम् पथ्यमेतद्विभीषणः |_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana, the half- bother spoke these beneficial words to Ravana, the best among
demons in the midst of his half-brother's ministers._END

B_6_C_11_13
BEGIN_
राक्षनैः स्तूयमानः सन् जयाशीर्भिररिंदमः |
अससाद महातेजाः सभाम् विरचिताम् तदा || ६-११-१४_END
BEGIN_
Ravana the harasser of enemies, possessing great splendor, while being praised by
demons through cheers of victory, approached that organized assembly._END

B_6_C_4_62
BEGIN_सा स्म याति दिवारात्रम् महती हरिवाहिनी |
प्रहृष्टमुदिताः सर्वे सुग्रीवेणाभिपालिताः || ६-४-७०
वनरास् त्वरितम् यान्ति सर्वे युद्ध अभिनन्दनः |
मुमोक्षयिषवः सीताम् मुहूर्तम् क्व अपि न आसत || ६-४-७१_END
BEGIN_That extensive monkey-army was marching day and night. All the monkeys ruled by Sugreeva 
were exceedingly pleased and cheerful. All were marching quickly, rejoicing for war. Those monkeys desirous 
of Seetha's release, did not halt even for a moment anywhere._END

B_6_C_12_5
BEGIN_
प्रहस्तस्य वचः श्रुत्वा राजा राज्यहितैषिणः |
सुखेप्सुः सुहृदाम् मध्ये व्याजहार स रावणः || ६-६-१२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Prahasta, who wished the welfare of the kingdom, king Ravana,
with a desire to obtain happiness, spoke in the desire midst of his friends as follows:_END

B_6_C_10_26
BEGIN_
हितम् महार्थम् मऋदु हेतुसम्हितम् |
व्यतीतकालायतिसम्प्रतिक्षमम् |
निशम्य तद्वाक्यमुपस्थितज्वरः |
प्रसज्~गवानुत्तरमेत दब्रवीत् || ६-१०-२७_END
BEGIN_
Ravana, who had evil inclination, heard those words, which were beneficial very
well-meant, soft, conformable to reason and suitable for the past future and present times, got
enraged and uttered this reply._END

B_6_C_11_14
BEGIN_
सुवर्णरजतास्तीर्णाम् विशुद्धस्फटिकान्तराम् |
विराजमानो वपुषा रुक्मपट्टोत्तरच्चदाम् || ६-११-१५
ताम् पिशाचशतैः षड्भिरभिगुप्ताम् सदाप्रभाम् |
प्रविवेश महातेजाः सुकृताम् विश्वकर्मणा || ६-११-१६_END
BEGIN_
Ravana with great splendour, with his body shining brightly, entered that assembly
hall, which was paved with gold and silver, whose interior was wrought with pure crystal, carpeted
with skins of deer, guarded by six hundred evil spirits, ever shining and well-constructed by
Visvakarma._END

B_6_C_4_63
BEGIN_ततः पादप सम्बाधम् नाना मृग समाकुलम् |
सह्य पर्वतम् आसेदुर् मलयम् च मही धरम् || ६-४-७२_END
BEGIN_Then, those monkeys reached and climbed up a mountain called sahya with a full canopy 
of trees and filled with many kinds of beasts._END

B_6_C_12_6
BEGIN_
प्रियाप्रिये सुख दुःखम् लाभालाभे सिताहिते |
धर्मकामार्थकृच्च्रेषु यूयमार्हथ वेदितुम् || ६-१२-७_END
BEGIN_
When you are in difficult situations regarding virtue pleasure and wealth, you are
able to have a correct notion of pleasant and unpleasant things, happiness and sorrow, gain and
detriment as well as advantages and disadvantages."_END

B_6_C_10_27
BEGIN_
भयम् न पश्यामि कुतश्चिदप्यहम् |
न राघवः प्राप्स्यति जातु मैथिलीम् |
सुरैः सहेन्द्रैरपि सम्गरे कथम् |
ममाग्रतः स्थास्यति लक्ष्मणाग्रजः || ६-१०-२८_END
BEGIN_
"I do not see any fear from whom so ever. Rama cannot obtain Seetha by any means.
How Rama even along with Indra and the celestials can stand before me in battle?"_END

B_6_C_11_15
BEGIN_
तस्याम् स वैदूर्यमयम् प्रियाकाजिनसम्वृतम् |
महत्सोपाश्रयम् भेजे रावणः परमासनम् || ६-११-१७_END
BEGIN_
Ravana, that hall, occupied a big and excellent throne embedded with jewels (cat's
eye gems), covered with skin of deer called Priyaka and furnished with pillows._END

B_6_C_13_0
BEGIN_
रावणम् क्रुद्धमाज्ञाय महापार्श्वो महाबलः |
मुहूर्त मनुसंचिन्त्य प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्य मब्रवीत् || ६-१३-१_END
BEGIN_
Perceiving Ravana enraged, a very strong demon named Mahaparsva thought for a while
and with joined palms, spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_4_64
BEGIN_काननानि विचित्राणि नदी प्रस्रवणानि च |
पश्यन्न् अपि ययौ रामः सह्यस्य मलयस्य च || ६-४-७३_END
BEGIN_Rama too went along, seeing the wonderful woods, streams and cascades of Sahya and Malaya 
mountains._END

B_6_C_12_7
BEGIN_
सर्वकृत्यानि युष्माभिः समारब्धनि सर्वदा |
मन्त्रकर्मनियुक्तानि न जातु विफलानि मे || ६-१२-८_END
BEGIN_
"All of my works undertaken by you with an act of attention, were never in
vain."_END

B_6_C_10_28
BEGIN_
इत्येवमुक्र्वा सुरसैन्यनाशनो |
महाबलः सम्यति चण्डविक्रमः |
दशाननो भ्रातरमाप्तवादिनम् |
विसर्जयामास तदा विभीषणम् || ६-१०-२९_END
BEGIN_
Ravana, who annihilated the army of celestials and who was very powerful with an
impetuous valour, thus spoke and then sent away Vibhishana, who had spoken honestly._END

B_6_C_11_16
BEGIN_
ततः शशासेश्वरवद्दूतान् लघुपराक्रमान् |
समानयत मे क्षिप्रमिहैतान् राक्षसानिति || ६-११-१८
कृत्यमस्ति महाज्जाने कर्तव्यमिति शत्रुभिः |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter Ravana, as a king, ordered his messengers, who were moving fast as
follows: "There is a gigantic work before us. I know what the enemies are doing. Therefore, bring
all the demons here quickly."_END

B_6_C_13_1
BEGIN_
यः खल्वपि वनम् प्राप्य मृगव्यालनिषेवितम् |
न पिबेन्मधु सम्प्राप्य स नरो बालिशो ध्रुवम् || ६-१३-२_END
BEGIN_
"That man indeed is a fool, who after reaching a forest inhabited by wild beasts and
vicious elephants and having duly found honey, does not drink it."_END

B_6_C_4_65
BEGIN_चम्पकांस् तिलकामः चूतान् अशोकान् सिन्दु वारकान् |
तिनिशान् करवीरामः च तिमिशान् भन्जन्ति स्म प्लवम् गमाः || ६-४-७४_END
BEGIN_The monkeys enjoyed the fruits of Champaka, Tilaka, mango, Praseka, Sindnvaara Timisa 
and Karaveera trees._END

B_6_C_12_8
BEGIN_
ससोमग्रहनक्षत्रैर्मरुद्भिरिव वासवः |
भवद्भिरहमत्यर्थम् वृतः श्रियमवाप्नुयाम् || ६-१२-९_END
BEGIN_
"I will obtain maximum prosperity, while abiding with you, as Indra obtains
properity while abiding with moon, planets, stars and celestials."_END

B_6_C_11_17
BEGIN_
राक्षसास्तद्वचः श्रुत्वा लङ्कायाम् परिचक्रमुः || ६-११-१९
अनुगेहमवस्थय विहारशयनेषु च |
उद्यानेषु च रक्क्षंसि चोदयन्तो ह्यभीतवत् || ६-११-२०_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words, the messenger impelled the demons staying in entertainment
places, in bedrooms or in gardens and went without fear to every house in Lanka._END

B_6_C_4_66
BEGIN_अशोकांश्च करञ्जांश्च प्लक्षन्य्ग्रोधपादपान् |
जम्बूकामलकान्नागान् भजन्ति स्म प्लवङ्गमाः || ६-४-७५_END
BEGIN_The monkeys enjoyed Ashoka, Karanja, Plaksa, Nyagrodha, Jambu, myrobalan and Naga trees._END

B_6_C_13_2
BEGIN_
ईश्वरस्येश्वरः कोऽस्ति तव शत्रुनिबर्हण |
रमस्व सह वैदेह्या शत्रूनाक्रम्य मूर्धसु || ६-१३-३_END
BEGIN_
"O,annihilator of enemies! Who is a lord to you, who are a lord of all? Setting your
foot upon the heads of your enemies, take pleasure with Sita."_END

B_6_C_12_9
BEGIN_
अहम् तु खलु सर्वन्वः समर्थयुतुमुद्यतः |
कुमभकर्णस्य तु स्वप्नान्नेममर्थमचोदयम् || ६-१२-१०_END
BEGIN_
"I am intent on reminding all of you again. But I could not inform this matter
earlier to Kumbhakarna because of his sleep."_END

B_6_C_11_18
BEGIN_
ते रथान् रुचिरानेके दृप्तानेके दृढान् हयान् |
नागनेकेऽधिरुरुहुर्जग्मुश्चैके पदातयः || ६-११-२१_END
BEGIN_
Some of the demons mounted beautiful chariots; some mounted wild and strong horses
and some mounted on elephants. Some others went on foot._END

B_6_C_4_67
BEGIN_प्रस्तरेषु च रम्येषु विविधाः काननद्रुमाः |
वायुवेगप्रचलिताः पुष्पैरवकिरन्ति ताम् || ६-४-७६_END
BEGIN_Various kinds of forest-trees standing on enchanting plateaus, being shaken by gust of 
winds, poured out flowers on those monkeys._END

B_6_C_13_3
BEGIN_
बलात्कुक्कुटवृत्तेन प्रवर्तस्व महाबल |
अक्रम्याक्रम्य सीताम् वै ताम् भुङिक्स्व च रमस्व च || ६-१३-४_END
BEGIN_
"O, ruler endowed with a mighty prowess! Act in the mode of a cock, forcibly against
her. Enjoy that Sita, by charging on her again and again and revel with her."_END

B_6_C_12_10
BEGIN_
अयम् हि सुप्तः ष्ण्मासान् कुम्भकर्णो महाबलः |
सर्वशस्त्रभृतम् मुख्यः स इदानीम् समुत्थितः || ६-१२-११_END
BEGIN_
"This most powerful Kumbhakarna, the chief among all the wielders of weapons, was
indeed sleeping for the last six months and now, he woke up."_END

B_6_C_11_19
BEGIN_
सा पुरी परमाकीर्णा रथकुञ्जरवाजिभिः |
सम्पतद्भिर्विरुरुचे गरुत्मद्चिरिवामबरम् || ६-११-२२_END
BEGIN_
That city, extremely crowded with chariots elephants and horses rushing fast
together, appeared like birds rushing fast in the sky._END

B_6_C_4_68
BEGIN_मारुतः सुखसंस्पर्शोओ वाति चन्दनशीतलः |
षट्पदैरनुकूजद्भिर्वनेषु मधुगन्धिषु || ६-४-७७_END
BEGIN_A soft-touching breeze, refreshing as a sandal, blew while the bees hummed in the nectar-scented 
woods._END

B_6_C_13_4
BEGIN_
लब्धकामस्य ते पश्चादागमिष्यति किम् भयम् |
प्राप्तमप्राप्तकालम् वा सर्वम् प्रतिविधास्यते || ६-१३-५_END
BEGIN_
"What fear will be there to you, after fulfilling your lust? All that comes or yet
to come will be prevented (by us)."_END

B_6_C_12_11
BEGIN_
इयम् च दण्डकारण्य़ाद्रामस्य महिषी प्रिया |
रक्षोभिश्चरितोद्देशादानीता जनकात्मजा || ६-१२-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha the beloved wife of Rama was brought from the forest of Dandaka, the place
frequented by demons."_END

B_6_C_11_20
BEGIN_
ते वाहनान्यवस्थाप्य यानानि विविधानि च |
सभाम् पद्भिः प्रविविशुः सिम्हा गिरिगुहामिव || ६-११-२३_END
BEGIN_
Parking horses, elephants and various kinds vehicles like chariots, they entered by
foot the assembly-hall as a mountain-cave is entered by lions._END

B_6_C_4_69
BEGIN_अधिकम् शैलराजस्तु धातुभिस्तु विभूसितः |
धातुभ्यः प्रसृतो रेणुर्वायुवेगेन घुट्टितः || ६-४-७८
सुमहद्वानरानीकम् चादयामास सर्वतः |_END
BEGIN_That royal Sahya Mountain was highly adorned with red-coloured metal. The dust blown 
from that metal by the velocity of wind, coming forth from all sides, obscured the huge monkey-army._END

B_6_C_13_5
BEGIN_
कुम्भकर्णः सहास्माभिरिन्द्रजिच्च महाबलः |
प्रतिषेधयितुम् शक्तौ सवज्रमपि वज्रिणम् || ६-१३-६_END
BEGIN_
"Kumbhakarna and Indrajit of great might together with us are capable of keeping off
even Devendra (god of celestials), wielding the weapon of a thunderbolt."_END

B_6_C_12_12
BEGIN_
सा मे न शय्यामारोढुमिच्चत्यलसगामिनी |
त्रिषुलोकेषु चान्या मे न सीतासदृशी मता || ६-१२-१३_END
BEGIN_
Seetha of languid pace, does not like to reach my bed. I do not imagine any other
woman similar to Seetha existing in the three worlds."_END

B_6_C_11_21
BEGIN_
राज्ञः पादौ गृहीत्वा तु राज्ञा ते प्रतिपूजिताः |
पीठेष्वन्ये बृसीष्वन्ये भूमौ केचिदुपाविशन् || ६-११-२४_END
BEGIN_
Touching the feet of the king and greeted in turn by the king, some sat down on
seats, some others on mats (of Kusa grass) and others on the ground._END

B_6_C_4_70
BEGIN_गिरिप्रस्थेषु रम्येषु सर्वतः सम्प्रपुष्पिताः || ६-४-७९
केतक्यः सिन्दुवाराश्च वासन्त्यश्च मनोरमाः |
माधव्यो गन्धपूर्णाश्च कुन्दगुल्माश्च पुष्पिता || ६-४-८०
चिरबिल्वा मधूकाश्च वञ्जुला वकुलास्तथा |
रञ्जकास्तिलकाश्चैव नागवृक्षश्च पुष्पिता || ६-४-८१
चूताः पाटलिकाश्चैव कोविदाराश्च पुष्पिताः |
मुचुलिन्दार्जुनाश्चैव शिंशपाः कुटजास्तथा || ६-४-८२
हिन्तालास्तिनिशाश्चैव चूर्णका नीपकास्तथा || ६-४-८३
नीलाशोकाश्च सरला अङ्कोलाः पद्मकास्तथा |
प्रीयमाणैः प्लवम्गैस्तु सर्वे पर्याकुलीकृताः || ६-४-८४_END
BEGIN_On the lovely mountain slopes, in blossom on all sides, Ketaki and Sindhuvara trees, 
the charming Vasanti, Madhavi creepers with flowers full of scent, clumps of jasmine, Chiribila, Madhuka, 
Vanjula and Vakula, Ranjanka and Tilaka, Nyavriksha all in flower, Mango, Patalike, Kovidara in flower, 
Muchulinda, Arjuna, Simsapa and Kutaja, Hintala, Timisa, Chirna and Nipa, blue Ashoka, Sarala, Ankola 
and Padmaka all these trees were crawled in excitement by the monkeys who were delighted._END

B_6_C_13_6
BEGIN_
उपप्रदानम् सान्त्वम् वा भेदम् वा कुशलैः कृतम् |
समतिक्रम्य दण्डेन सिद्धिमर्थेषु रोचये || ६-१३-७_END
BEGIN_
"Overstepping the methods of giving away gifts or conciliation or even showing
dissention being followed by right men, I like accomplishment of actions through hostile
means."_END

B_6_C_12_13
BEGIN_
तनुमध्या पृथुश्रोणी शरदिन्दुनिभानना |
हेमबिम्बनिभा सौम्यामायेव मयनिर्मिता || ६-१२-१४_END
BEGIN_
"She has a slim waist, well-developed hips, and a face similar to an autumnal moon.
Looking like an idol of gold and being placid She appears like an illusory image created by
Maya._END

B_6_C_11_22
BEGIN_
ते समेत्य सभायाम् वै राक्षसा राजशासनात् |
यथार्हमुपतस्थुस्ते रावणम् राक्षसाधिपम् || ६-११-२५_END
BEGIN_
Congregating in the assembly hall at the king's command, those demons took their
position round Ravana the king of demons, each according to their rank._END

B_6_C_4_71
BEGIN_व्यास्तिस्मिन् गिरौ रम्याः पल्वलानि तथैव च |
चक्रवाकानुचरिताः कारण्डवनिषेविताः || ६-४-८५
प्लवैः क्रौञ्चे सम्कीर्णा वराहमृगसेविताः |
ऋक्षैस्तरक्षुभिः सिम्हैः शार्दूलैश्च भयावहैः || ६-४-८६
व्यालैश्च बहुभिर्भीमैः सेव्यमानाः समन्ततः |
पद्मेः सौगन्धिकैः पुल्लैः सेव्यमानाः समन्ततः || ६-४-८७
वारिजैर्विविधैः पुष्पै रम्यास्तत्र जलाशयाः |_END
BEGIN_There were delightful wells with stairs and ponds in that mountain, sought after by chakravaka 
birds, frequented by karandava birds, crowded with water-fowls and cranes, visited by boars and deer, 
haunted on all sides by bears, hyenas, lions and many dreadful tigers. There were beautiful reservoirs 
of water with blossoming blue lotuses, water lilies, white water lilies, black water lilies and various 
other kinds of aquatic flowers._END

B_6_C_12_14
BEGIN_
सुलोहिततलौ श्लक्क्षणौ चरणौ सुप्रतिष्ठतौ |
दृष्ट्वा ताम्रनखौ तस्या दीप्यते मे शरीरजः || ६-१२-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing Her feet with rose-coloured soles, smooth and evenly resting on ground with
the rosy soles, my lust is kindled."_END

B_6_C_13_7
BEGIN_
इह प्राप्तान्वयम् सर्वान् शत्रूंस्तव महाबल |
वशे शस्त्रप्रतापेन करिष्यामो न संशयः || ६-१३-८_END
BEGIN_
"O, ruler endowed with great might! We shall make all your enemies reaching here to
surrender, by the power of our weapons. There is no doubt about it."_END

B_6_C_11_23
BEGIN_
मन्त्रिणश्च यथामुख्या निश्चितार्थेषु पण्डिताः |
अमात्याश्च गुणोपेताः सर्वज्ञा बुद्धिदर्शनाः || ६-११-२६
समीयुस्तत्र शतशः शूराश्च बहवस्तथा |
सभायाम् हेमवर्णायाम् सर्वार्थस्य सुखाय वै || ६-११-२७_END
BEGIN_
Ministers who were scholars well versed in deciding action those endowed with good
qualities, those who were all-knowing, king's ministers who could perceive things by their power of
intellect and many warriors in hundreds, gathered according to their importance in that assembly
hall, wrapped with gold, for providing felicity in all actions._END

B_6_C_4_72
BEGIN_तस्य सानुषु कूजन्ति नानाद्विजगणास्तथा || ६-४-८८
स्नात्वा पीत्वोदकान्यत्र जले क्रीदन्ति वानराः |
अन्योन्यम् प्लावयन्ति स्म शैलमारुह्य वानराः || ६-४-८९_END
BEGIN_Various kinds of birds sang in those mountain-peaks. Monkeys bathed in water, drank those 
waters and played. They ascended the mountain and got drenched in water, by sprinkling water by one 
over the other among themselves._END

B_6_C_13_8
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तस्तदा राजा महापार्श्वएन रावणः |
तस्य सम्पूजयन्वाक्यमिदम् वचनमब्रवीत् || ६-१३-९_END
BEGIN_
Appreciating the words spoken thus by Mahaparsva, King Ravana spoke the following
words:_END

B_6_C_12_15
BEGIN_
हुताग्निरर्चिःसम्काशामेनाम् सौरीमिव प्रभाम् |
उन्नसम् विमलम् वल्गु वदनम् चारुलोचनम् || ६-१२-१६
पश्यंस्तदवशस्तस्याः कामस्य वशमेयिवान् |_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing her countenance similar to the flame of a sacrificial fire and looking like
the radiance of the sun, with her prominent nose and the pretty clear and handsome eyes, I became
unrestrained, having submitted to the will of my passion."_END

B_6_C_11_24
BEGIN_
ततो महात्मा विपुलम् सुयुग्यम् |
रथम् वरम् हेमविचित्रिताङ्गम् |
शुभम् समास्थाय ययौ यशस्वी |
विभीषणः संसदमग्रजस्य || ६-११-२८_END
BEGIN_
The high-souled and illustrious VibhiShana ascended an excellent auspicious and
spacious chariot yoked with good horses with its various parts decked in gold and drove towards the
assembly-hall of Ravana his elder brother._END

B_6_C_4_73
BEGIN_फलानि अमृत गन्धीनि मूलानि कुसुमानि च |
बुभुजुर् वानरास् तत्र पादपानाम् बल उत्कटाः || ६-४-९०_END
BEGIN_Monkeys in mad rut plucked sweet-smelling fruits, roots and flowers there._END

B_6_C_13_9
BEGIN_
महापार्श्व निबोध त्वम् रहस्यम् किंचिदात्मनः |
चिरवृत्तम् तदाख्यास्ये यदवाप्तम् पुरा मया || ६-१३-१०_END
BEGIN_
"O, Mahaparsva! Know a little secret about me. I shall tell you an incident, which
occurred to me long ago."_END

B_6_C_12_16
BEGIN_
क्रोधहर्षसमानेन दुर्वर्णकरणेन च || ६-१२-१७
शोकसम्तापनित्येन कामेन कलुषीकृतः |_END
BEGIN_
"I have been polluted by lust and equally by anger and pleasure thus making me pale
and I have been ever since in grief and anguish."_END

B_6_C_11_25
BEGIN_
स पूर्वजायावरजः शशंस |
ना माथ पश्चाच्चरणौ ववन्दे |
शुकः प्रहस्तश्च तथैव तेभ्यो |
ददौ यथार्हम् प्ऱ्^थगासनानि || ६-११-२९_END
BEGIN_
Then, that younger brother Vibhishana told Ravana his name and offered salutation to
the feet. Suka and Prahasta followed suit. Ravana gave them suitable seats separately._END

B_6_C_4_74
BEGIN_द्रोण मात्र प्रमाणानि लम्बमानानि वानराः |
ययुः पिबन्तो हृष्टास् ते मधूनि मधु पिन्गलाः || ६-४-९१_END
BEGIN_Those monkeys, in reddish brown colour like honey, drinking honey from honey-combs weighing 
about a maund each, went on cheerfully._END

B_6_C_13_10
BEGIN_
पितामहस्य भवनम् गच्चन्तीम् पुञ्जिकस्थलाम् |
चञ्चूर्यमाणामद्राक्षमाकाशेऽग्निशिखामिव || ६-१३-११_END
BEGIN_
"Once I saw a celestial nymph, Punjikasthala(by name) flashing like a flame,
concealing herself in the sky and proceeding towards the abode of Brahma."_END

B_6_C_12_17
BEGIN_
सा तु सम्वत्सरम् कालम् मामयाचत भामिनी || ६-१२-१८
प्रतीक्षमाणा भर्तारम् राममायतलोचना |
तन्मया चारुनेत्रायाः प्रतिज्ञातम् वचः शुभम् || ६-१२-१९
श्रान्तोऽहम् सततम् कामाद्यातो हय इवाध्वनि |_END
BEGIN_
"Looking forward Rama, her husband, that longish large eyed Seetha, requested me to
give time for one year. I accepted the auspicious words of the charmingly eyed Seetha. I am wearied
of this lust, like a horse galloping along a path continuously."_END

B_6_C_11_26
BEGIN_
सुवर्णनानामणिभुषणानाम् |
सुवाससाम् संसदि राक्षसानाम् |
तेषाम् परार्थ्यगुरुचन्दनानाम् |
स्रजाम् च गन्धाः प्रववुः समन्तात् || ६-११-३०_END
BEGIN_
The aroma of the best aloe and sandal paste painted on the persons as also of
garlands worn round the necks of those demons duly adorned with ornaments of gold and gems and
attired in excellent clothes diffused all round in the assembly-hall._END

B_6_C_4_75
BEGIN_पादपान् अवभन्जन्तो विकर्षन्तस् तथा लताः |
विधमन्तो गिरि वरान् प्रययुः प्लवग ऋषभाः || ६-४-९२_END
BEGIN_Those foremost among the monkeys marched, breaking off trees, pulling along creepers 
and throwing away excellent mountains._END

B_6_C_13_11
BEGIN_
सा प्रसह्य मया भुक्ता कृता विवसना ततः |
स्वयम्भूभवनम् प्राप्ता लोलिता नलिनी यथा || ६-१३-१२_END
BEGIN_
"She was made unclothed by me and was enjoyed forcibly. Thereafter, appearing like a
crumpled lotus, she went to the abode of Brahma."_END

B_6_C_12_18
BEGIN_
कथम् सागरमक्षोभ्यम् तरिष्यन्ति वनौकसः || ६-१२-२०
बहुसत्त्वसमाकीर्णम् तौ वा दशरथात्मजौ |_END
BEGIN_
How the monkeys or even Rama and Lakshmana can cross the unassailable ocean,
completely infested as it was with sea-animals?"_END

B_6_C_11_27
BEGIN_
न चुक्रुशुर्नानृतमाह कश्चि |
त्सभासदो नापि जजल्पुरुच्चैः |
संसिद्धार्थः सर्व एवोग्रवीर्या |
भर्तुः सर्वे ददृशुश्चाननम् ते || ६-११-३१_END
BEGIN_
The assembled persons there did not yell loudly. None uttered untruth or even talked
vociferously. All of them were ready for action and were endowed with terrible energy. All of them
sat, perceiving their lord's face._END

B_6_C_4_76
BEGIN_वृक्षेभ्यो अन्ये तु कपयो नर्दन्तो मधु दर्पिताः |
अन्ये वृक्षान् प्रपद्यन्ते प्रपतन्ति अपि च अपरे || ६-४-९३_END
BEGIN_Some other monkeys, well-pleased with honey got from trees, yelled loudly. Some others 
reached trees to get honey. Some others were drinking honey excessively._END

B_6_C_13_12
BEGIN_
तच्च तस्य तदा मन्ये ज्ञातमासीन्महात्मनः |
अथ सम्कुपितो वेधा मामिदम् वाक्यमब्रवी || ६-१३-१३_END
BEGIN_
"I think that the matter was made known to the high soled Brahama and then the
enraged Brahma spoke to me the following words:_END

B_6_C_12_19
BEGIN_
अथवा कपिनैकेन कृतम् नः कदनम् महत् || ६-१२-२१
दुर्ज्ञेयाः कार्यगतयो ब्रूत यस्य यथामति |_END
BEGIN_
"on the other hand, a huge destruction was done to us, by a single monkey. The
consequences of their acts are unpredictable. Tell me what is there in your mind, according to your
own understanding."_END

B_6_C_11_28
BEGIN_
स रावणः शस्त्रभृताम् मनस्विनाम् |
महाबलानाम् समितौ मनस्वी |
तप्याम् सभायाम् प्रभया चकाशे |
मध्ये वसूनामिव वज्रहस्तः || ६-११-३२_END
BEGIN_
In that assembly, that Ravana, full of mind, shone with brilliance among the
assemblage of those demons possessing great strength, like Devendra (the Lord of heaven) amidst
Vasus (a class of gods)_END

B_6_C_13_13
BEGIN_
अद्यप्रभृति यामन्याम् बलान्नारीम् गमिष्यसि |
तदा ते शतधा मुर्धा फलिष्यति न संशयः || ६-१३-१४_END
BEGIN_
"From today onwards, if you revel with any other woman forcibly, your head then
undoubtedly will break asunder into a hundred pieces."_END

B_6_C_4_77
BEGIN_बभूव वसुधा तैस् तु सम्पूर्णा हरि पुम्गवैः |
यथा कमल केदारैः पक्वैर् इव वसुम् धरा || ६-४-९४_END
BEGIN_The earth filled with those excellent monkeys, was like land filled with ripened fields 
of paddy._END

B_6_C_12_20
BEGIN_
मानुषान्नो भयम् नास्ति तथापि तु विमृश्यताम् || ६-१२-२२
तदा देवासुरे युद्दे युष्माभिः सहितोऽजयम् |
ते मे भवन्तश्च तथा सुग्रीवप्रमुखान् हरीन् || ६-१२-२३
परे पारे समुद्रस्य पुरस्कृत्य नृपात्मजौ |
सीतायाः पदवीम् प्राप्य सम्प्राप्तौ वरुणालयम् || ६-१२-२४_END
BEGIN_
"We have no fear with human beings. Even so, the matter can be discussed. Earlier,
together with you, I conquered the celestials in a battle between the celestials and demons. You
also conquered them. Knowing the whereabouts of Seetha, Rama and Lakshmana together with Sugreeva
and other monkeys reached the other shore of the ocean."_END

B_6_C_13_14
BEGIN_
इत्यहम् तस्य शापस्य भीतः प्रसभमेव ताम् |
नारोहये बलात्सीताम् वैदेहीम् शय्ने शुभे || ६-१३-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Fearing the curse given in this manner by Brahama, I am not violently making Sita
the daughter of Videha, to mount on my beautiful bed forcibly."_END

B_6_C_4_78
BEGIN_महाइन्द्रम् अथ सम्प्राप्य रामो राजीव लोचनः |
अध्यारोहन् महाबाहुः शिखरम् द्रुम भूषितम् || ६-४-९५_END
BEGIN_Then, the lotus-eyed and the mighty-armed Rama reached Mahendra mountain and ascended 
its top, adorned with trees._END

B_6_C_12_21
BEGIN_
अदेया च यथा सीता वध्यौ दशरथात्मजौ |
भवद्भिर्मन्त्य्रताम् मन्त्रः सुनीतम् चाभिधीयताम् || ६-१२-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Let a consultation be held by you and a judicious line of course suggested, so that
Seetha may not have to be handed -over to them back and Rama and Lakshmana may be killed."_END

B_6_C_4_79
BEGIN_ततः शिखरम् आरुह्य रामो दशरथ आत्मजः |
कूर्म मीन समाकीर्णम् अपश्यत् सलिल आशयम् || ६-४-९६_END
BEGIN_Then, Rama the son of Dasartha mounted the peak and saw an ocean ruffled with water and 
scattered well with turtles and fishes._END

B_6_C_13_15
BEGIN_
सागरस्येव मे वेगो मारुतस्येव मे गतिः |
नैतद्दाशरथिर्वेद ह्यापादयति तेन माम् || ६-१३-१६_END
BEGIN_
"My swiftness is like that of an ocean. My movement is like that of a wind. Rama
does not know this and hence he is indeed having an encounter with me."_END

B_6_C_12_22
BEGIN_
न हि शक्तिम् प्रपश्यामि जगत्यन्यस्य कस्यचित् |
सागरम् वानरैस्तीर्त्वा विश्चयेन जयो मम || ६-१२-२६_END
BEGIN_
"I do not see any other's capability to cross the ocean even so with the monkeys.
Victory is surely mine."_END

B_6_C_4_80
BEGIN_ते सह्यम् समतिक्रम्य मलयम् च महागिरिम् |
आसेदुर् आनुपूर्व्येण समुद्रम् भीम निह्स्वनम् || ६-४-९७_END
BEGIN_They crossed Sahya mountain and Malaya mountain and systematically approached the ocean 
having terrific sound._END

B_6_C_13_16
BEGIN_
को हि सिम्हमिवासीनम् सुप्तम् गिरिगुहाशये |
क्रुद्धम् मृत्युमिवाऽसीनम् सम्बोधयितुमिच्चति || ६-१३-१७_END
BEGIN_
"If not otherwise, who wants to arouse me (for a combat) as one would awaken a lion
asleep, sitting at a place in a mountain cave or arouse into activity an enraged Death?"_END

B_6_C_12_23
BEGIN_
तस्य कामपरीतस्य निशम्य परिदेवितम् |
कुम्भकर्णः प्रचुक्रोध वचनम् चेदमब्रवीत् || ६-१२-२७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the lamentation of Ravana who was captivated by lust, Kumbhakarana became
angry and spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_4_81
BEGIN_अवरुह्य जगाम आशु वेला वनम् अनुत्तमम् |
रामो रमयताम् श्रेष्ठः ससुग्रीवः सलक्ष्मणः || ६-४-९८_END
BEGIN_Rama the foremost of those who entrance the mind, together with Sugreeva and Lakshmana 
quickly descended the mountain and went to the excellent woodland adjoining the sea._END

B_6_C_13_17
BEGIN_
न मत्तो निर्गतान् बाणान् द्विजिह्वान् पन्न्गानिव |
रामः पश्यति सम्ग्रामे तेन मामभिगच्चति || ६-१३-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Rama did not see the arrows, looking like two tongued serpents, coming forth from
me. That is why he is marching against me for a battle"_END

B_6_C_12_24
BEGIN_
यदा तु रामस्य सलक्ष्मणस्य |
प्रसह्य सीता खलु पा इहाऽहृता |
सकृत्समीक्षैव सुनिश्चितम् तदा |
भजेत चित्तम् यमुनेव यामुनम् || ६-१२-२८_END
BEGIN_
"You should have contemplated thoroughly that very moment when Seetha was brought
here forcibly only after a single impulsive thought from the hermitage of Rama, who was accompanied
by Lakshmana, even like the river Yamuna fills the depression at its source the moment it descends
on earth."_END

B_6_C_4_82
BEGIN_अथ धौत उपल तलाम् तोय ओघैः सहसा उत्थितैः |
वेलाम् आसाद्य विपुलाम् रामो वचनम् अब्रवीत् || ६-४-९९_END
BEGIN_Then Rama reached the extensive ocean with rocks underneath washed by floods of water 
risen vehemently and spoke these words._END

B_6_C_13_18
BEGIN_
क्षिप्रम् वज्रसमैर्बाणैः शतधा कार्मुकचुतैः |
राममादीपयिष्यामि उल्कभिरिव कुञ्जरम् || ६-१३-१९_END
BEGIN_
"I shall blaze up Rama swiftly with my arrows in hundreds resembling thunder bolts
discharged from my bow, like tormenting an elephant with fire brands."_END

B_6_C_12_25
BEGIN_
सर्वमेतन्महाराज कृतमप्रतिमम् तव |
विधीयेत सहास्माभिरादावेवास्य कर्मणः || ६-१२-२९_END
BEGIN_
"O, emperor! If all this act of consultation with us was done at the beginning of
this action itself (of bringing Seetha here), it would have been worthy of you."_END

B_6_C_4_83
BEGIN_एते वयम् अनुप्राप्ताः सुग्रीव वरुण आलयम् |
इह इदानीम् विचिन्ता सा या न पूर्वम् समुत्थिता || ६-४-१००_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Sugreeva! We have reached the abode of Varuna. We should consider now the matter 
(of how to cross the ocean) with which we were formerly preoccupied."_END

B_6_C_13_19
BEGIN_
तच्चास्य बलमादास्ये बलेन महता वृतः |
उदितः सविता काले नक्षत्राणाम् प्रभामिव || ६-१३-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Surrounded by great army, I shall take away that strength of Rama, as a rising sun
at dawn takes away radiance of the stars."_END

B_6_C_12_26
BEGIN_
न्यायेन राजकार्याणि यः करोति दशानन |
न स सम्तप्यते पश्चान्निश्चतार्थमतिर्नृपः || ६-१२-३०_END
BEGIN_
"O, Ravana! A king who performs king's functions with a mind duly ascertained by
justice, will not repent thereafter."_END

B_6_C_4_84
BEGIN_अतः परम् अतीरो अयम् सागरः सरिताम् पति |
न च अयम् अनुपायेन शक्यस् तरितुम् अर्णवः || ६-४-१०१_END
BEGIN_"This ocean, the lord of Rivers, is shore less beyond. This sea is impossible to be crossed 
without a proper strategy."_END

B_6_C_13_20
BEGIN_
न वासवेनापि सहस्रचक्षुषा |
युधास्मि शक्यो वरुणेन वा पुनः |
मया त्वियम् बाहुबलेन निर्जिता |
पुरा पुरी वैश्रवणेन पालिता || ६-१३-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Even Devendra (lord of celestials) with thousand eyes or Varuna (king of the
Universe) can not conquer me in battle. Once upon a time, this city of Lanka ruled by Kubera (Lord
of riches) was conquered by me with the power of my arms."_END

B_6_C_12_27
BEGIN_
अनुपायेन कर्माणि विपरीतानि यानि च |
क्रियमाणानि दुष्यन्ति हवीम्ष्यप्रयतेष्विन || ६-१२-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Actions done pervertedly without use of any stratagem get spoiled, even as
oblations not intent on devotion got spoiled._END

B_6_C_4_85
BEGIN_तद् इह एव निवेशो अस्तु मन्त्रः प्रस्तूयताम् इह |
यथा इदम् वानर बलम् परम् पारम् अवाप्नुयात् || ६-४-१०२_END
BEGIN_"For this reason, let the military be assembled here only. Here, let us discuss the plan 
how this military of monkeys will reach the other shore."_END

B_6_C_12_28
BEGIN_
यः पश्चात्पूर्वकार्याणि कर्माण्यभिचिकीर्षति |
पूर्वम् चापरकर्याणि न स वेद नयानयौ || ६-१२-३२_END
BEGIN_
"He who is not aware of prudence and imprudence, wants to do actions which are to be
done before at a later stage and actions which are to be done later at a stage before."_END

B_6_C_4_86
BEGIN_इति इव स महाबाहुः सीता हरण कर्शितः |
रामः सागरम् आसाद्य वासम् आज्ञापयत् तदा || ६-४-१०३_END
BEGIN_Rama, the mighty armed, emaciated due to taking away of Seetha, then reached the sea 
and ordered thus for the halt of the army there._END

B_6_C_12_29
BEGIN_
चपलस्य तु कृत्येषु प्रसमीक्स्याधिकम् बलम् |
चिद्रमन्ये प्रपद्यन्ते क्रौञ्चस्य खमिव द्विजाः || ६-१२-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing superior strength in a hasteful enemy, some look for his weak point, even as
swans seek the cleavage in the Kraunca mountain."_END

B_6_C_4_87
BEGIN_सर्वाः सेना निवेश्यन्ताम् वेलायाम् हरिपुङ्गव |
सम्प्राप्तो मन्त्र कालो नः सागरस्य इह लन्घने || ६-४-१०४_END
BEGIN_"Let all the army be stationed at the sea-shore, Sugreeva! Here, the time has come for 
us to think about the subject of crossing the ocean."_END

B_6_C_12_30
BEGIN_
त्वयेदम् महादारभम् कार्य मप्रतिचिन्तितम् |
दिष्ट्या त्वाम् नावधीद्रामो विषमिश्रमिवामृतम् || ६-१२-३४_END
BEGIN_
"This great act was undertaken by you without proper thinking. By good fortune, Rama
did not kill you even as the meat mixed with poison would kill the consumer."_END

B_6_C_4_88
BEGIN_स्वाम् स्वाम् सेनाम् समुत्स्ऱ्ज्य मा च कश्चित् कुतो व्रजेत् |
गच्चन्तु वानराः शूरा ज्ञेयम् चन्नम् भयम् च नः || ६-४-१०५_END
BEGIN_"Let not anyone slip away in any direction, leaving his respective unit of army. Let 
valiant monkeys make a more and it should be known whether there is a hidden danger for us."_END

B_6_C_12_31
BEGIN_
तस्मात्त्वया समारब्धम् कर्म ह्यप्रतिमम् परैः |
अहम् समीकरिष्यामि हत्वा शत्रूम् स्तनानघ || ६-१२-३५_END
BEGIN_
"O, irreproachable brother! Therefore by killing your enemies, I shall neutralize
the dishonourable act undertaken by you in relation to your enemies."_END

B_6_C_4_89
BEGIN_रामस्य वचनम् श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवः सह लक्ष्मणः |
सेनाम् न्यवेशयत् तीरे सागरस्य द्रुम आयुते || ६-४-१०६_END
BEGIN_Hearing Rama's words, Sugreeva along with Lakshmana made the army to halt at the sea-shore, 
stretched with trees._END

B_6_C_12_32
BEGIN_
अहमुत्सादयिष्यामि शत्रूंस्तव निशाचर |
यदि शक्रविवस्वन्तौ यदि पावकमारुतौ || ६-१२-३६
तावहम् योधयिष्यामि कुबेरवरुणावपि |_END
BEGIN_
"O, ranger of night! I shall destroy your enemies. I shall do battle with the two
brothers, even if they are Indra and the sun-god or the god of fire and the wind-god or Kubera (the
god of riches) and Varuna (the god of water)._END

B_6_C_14_0
BEGIN_
निशाचरेन्द्रस्य निशम्य वाक्यम् |
स कुम्भकर्णस्य च गर्जितानि |
विभीषणो राक्षसराजमुख्य |
मुवाच वाक्यम् हितम्र्थयुक्तम् || ६-१४-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Ravana the king of demons and the growls of Kumbhakarna,
Vibhishana spoke the following friendly and meaningful words to Ravana the foremost king of
ogres:_END

B_6_C_4_90
BEGIN_विरराज समीपस्थम् सागरस्य तु तद् बलम् |
मधु पाण्डु जलः श्रीमान् द्वितीय इव सागरः || ६-४-१०७_END
BEGIN_That army, stationed at the vicinity of the ocean, shined like a second ocean splendid 
with yellowish white honey-coloured water._END

B_6_C_12_33
BEGIN_
गिरिमात्रशरीरस्य महापरिघयोधिनः || ६-१२-३७
नर्दतस्तीक्ष्णदम्ष्ट्रस्य बिभीयाद्वै पुरन्दरः |_END
BEGIN_
"Entering the combat with a mountain-sized body and fiery teeth, roaring the while
and attacking with an immense bludgeon, I shall strike terror in Indra himself!"_END

B_6_C_14_1
BEGIN_
वृतो हि बाह्वन्तरभोगराशि |
श्चिन्ताविषः सुस्मिततीक्षणदम्ष्ट्रः |
पञ्चाङ्गुलीपञ्चशिरोऽतिकायः |
सीतामहाहिस्तव केन राजन् || ६-१४-२_END
BEGIN_
"By whom, O, king, has been wrapped around your neck, this great serpent of gigantic
body called Sita, with heap of expended hoods as her bosom, having poison as her anxiety and with
sharp fangs as her sweet smile and with five hoods as her five fingers."_END

B_6_C_4_91
BEGIN_वेला वनम् उपागम्य ततस् ते हरि पुम्गवाः |
विनिविष्टाः परम् पारम् कान्क्षमाणा महाउदधेः || ६-४-१०८_END
BEGIN_There, those foremost of monkeys reached the woodlands at the shore and settled down, 
desiring to reach the other shore of the vast sea._END

B_6_C_12_34
BEGIN_
पुनर्माम् सद्वितीयेन शरेण निहनिष्यति || ६-१२-३८
ततोऽहम् तस्य पास्यामि रुधिरम् काममाश्वस |_END
BEGIN_
"Even before Rama strikes me once more with a second arrow, I shall drink his blood.
Cheer up freely._END

B_6_C_14_2
BEGIN_
यावन्न लङ्का समभिद्रवन्ति |
वलीमुखाः पर्वतकूटमात्राः |
दम्ष्ट्रयुधाश्चैव नखायुधाश्च |
प्रदीयताम् दाशरथाय मैथिली || ६-१४-३_END
BEGIN_
"Even before the monkeys with their body size as mountain peaks, having their teeth
and nails as weapons, rush full upon the city of Lanka, give back Sita to Rama."_END

B_6_C_4_92
BEGIN_तेषाम् निविशमानानाम् सैन्यसम्नाहनिःस्वनः |
अन्तर्धाय महानादमर्णवस्य प्रशुश्रुवे || ६-४-१०९_END
BEGIN_While all the monkeys were halting there, the noise created out of their movement was 
dominantly heard, concealing the roar of the sea._END

B_6_C_12_35
BEGIN_
वधेव वै दाशरथेह् सुखावहम् |
जयम् तवाहर्तुमहम् तयिष्ये |
हत्वा च रामम् सह लक्ष्मणेन |
खादामि सर्वान् हरियूथमुख्यान् || ६-१२-३९_END
BEGIN_
"I shall try to fetch victory, which brings pleasure to you, by the killing of Rama.
By exterminating Rama along with Lakshmana, I shall devour all the leaders of monkey-troops."_END

B_6_C_14_3
BEGIN_
यावन्न गृह्णन्ति शिरांसि बाणा |
रामेरिता राक्षसपुङ्गवानाम् |
वज्रोपमा वायुसमानवेगाः |
प्रदीयताम् दाशरथाय मैथिली || ६-१४-४_END
BEGIN_
"Even before arrows resembling thunder bolts and with a speed equal to wind,
dispatched by Rama, take away the heads of chiefs of demons, give back Sita to Rama."_END

B_6_C_4_93
BEGIN_सा महाअर्णवम् आसाद्य ह्ऱ्ष्टा वानर वाहिनी |
त्रिधा निविष्टा महती रामस्यार्थपराभवत् || ६-४-११०_END
BEGIN_That army of the monkeys ruled by Sugreeva, stationed as three divisios (viz. 1. bears 
2. long tailed monkes and 3. monkeys) looked fully dedicated to the cause of Rama._END

B_6_C_12_36
BEGIN_
रमस्व कामम् पिब चाग्र्यवारुणीम् |
कुरुष्व कार्वाणि हितानि विज्वरः |
मया तु रामे गमिते यमक्षयम् |
चिराय सीता वशगा भविष्यति || ६-१२-४०_END
BEGIN_
"Enjoy yourself freely. Drink excellent of wines to the extent of your desire
without any anxiety. Rama, having been dispatched by me to the abode of death, Seetha will be at
your disposal forever."_END

B_6_C_14_4
BEGIN_
न कुम्भकर्णेन्द्रजितौ च राजम् |
स्तथा महापार्श्वमहोदरौ वा |
निकुम्भकुम्भौ च तथातिकायः |
स्थातुम् समर्था युधि राघवस्य || ६-१४-५_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! Either Kumbhakarna or Indrajit and either Mahaparsva or Mahodara and
either Nikumbha or Kumbha or even Atikaya cannot withstand Rama in battle."_END

B_6_C_4_94
BEGIN_सा महार्णवमासाद्य हृष्टा वानरवाहिनी |
वायु वेग समाधूतम् पश्यमाना महाअर्णवम् || ६-४-१११_END
BEGIN_That army of monkeys reached the mighty ocean and was delighted to behold the mighty 
ocean being diffused by the velocity of wind._END

B_6_C_14_5
BEGIN_
जीवंस्तु रामस्य न मोक्स्यसे त्वम् |
गुप्तः सवित्राप्यथवा मरुद्भिः |
न वासवस्याङ्कगतो न मृत्यो |
र्नभो न पातालमनुप्रविष्टः || ६-१४-६_END
BEGIN_
"Even if you are protected by the sun god, or by Maruts (storm gods) nor even seated
in the lap of Indra or god of Death nor if you have penetrated into the regions of heaven or under
the earth you will not be spared by the arrows of Rama."_END

B_6_C_4_95
BEGIN_दूर पारम् असम्बाधम् रक्षो गण निषेवितम् |
पश्यन्तो वरुण आवासम् निषेदुर् हरि यूथपाः || ६-४-११२_END
BEGIN_Seeing the sea, the abode of Varuna, which was boundless and having the opposite shore 
far off, inhabitd by a number of demons, the monkey-troups sat down there._END

B_6_C_14_6
BEGIN_
निशम्य वाक्यम् तु विभीषणस्य |
ततः प्रहस्तो वचनम् बभाषे |
न नो भयम् विद्म न दैवतेभ्यो |
न दानवेभ्योऽप्यथवा कदाचित् || ६-१४-७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Vibhishana, Prahasta spoke as follows: "We are not knowing of
fear at all. We do not have fear of either celestials or demons at any time."_END

B_6_C_4_96
BEGIN_चण्ड नक्र ग्रहम् घोरम् क्षपा आदौ दिवस क्षये |
हसन्तमिव फेनौघैर्नृत्यन्तमिव चोर्मिभिः || ६-४-११३_END
BEGIN_Rendered appalling by the ferocity of fierce alligators and crocodiles, that ocen with 
its foaming waves at the end of the day and at the beginning of the night, appeared to laugh and dance._END

B_6_C_14_7
BEGIN_
न यक्षगन्धर्वमहोरगेभ्यो |
भयम् न सम्ख्ये पतगोरगेभ्यः |
कथम् नु रामाद्भविता भयम् नो |
नरेन्द्रपुत्रात्समरे कदाचित् || ६-१४-८_END
BEGIN_
"We do not have fear from Yakshas (demi- gods) or Gandharvas (celestial musicians)
or eminent Nagas (serpent demons) or from birds and reptiles on the field of battle. When such is
the case, how can we have fear from Rama, the son of a human king at any time in battle?"_END

B_6_C_4_97
BEGIN_चन्द्र उदये समाधूतम् प्रतिचन्द्र समाकुलम् |
चण्ड अनिल महाग्राहैः कीर्णम् तिमि तिमिम्गिलैः || ६-४-११४_END
BEGIN_The ocean surged, when the moon rose. The image of moon was reflected limitlessly in 
it. The sea was full of huge alligators swift as fierce winds along with whales and great fish._END

B_6_C_14_8
BEGIN_
प्रहस्तवाक्यम् त्वहितम् निशम्य |
विभीषणो राजहितानुकाङिक्षी |
ततो महार्थम् वचनम् बभाषे |
धर्मार्थकामेषु निविष्टबुद्धिः || ६-१४-९_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana who desired the welfare of the king and who possessed a stable mind in
virtue wealth and pleasure, after hearing the inimical words of Prahasta, spoke highly meaningful
words as follows:_END

B_6_C_4_98
BEGIN_दीप्त भोगैर् इव आक्रीर्णम् भुजम्गैर् वरुण आलयम् |
अवगाढम् महासत्तैर् नाना शैल समाकुलम् || ६-४-११५
सुदुर्गम् द्रुगम् अमार्गम् तम् अगाधम् असुर आलयम् |_END
BEGIN_That sea, the abode of Varuna was filled with serpents bestowed with flaming hoods, plunged 
with mighty aquatic creatures, abounding in various types of mountains, too difficult to cross, with 
an inaccessible path, suffocationly fathomless and an abode of demons._END

B_6_C_14_9
BEGIN_
प्रहस्त राजा च महोदरश्च |
त्वम् कुम्भकर्णश्च यथार्थजातम् |
ब्रवीत रामम् प्रति तन्न शक्यम् |
यथा गतिः स्वर्गमधर्मबुद्धेः || ६-१४-१०_END
BEGIN_
"O, Prahasta! The series of actions king or Mahodara as also yourself and
Kumbhakarna propose to take against Rama are impossible of being accomplished, any more than going
to heaven by wicked minded persons."_END

B_6_C_4_99
BEGIN_मकरैर् नाग भोगैः च विगाढा वात लोहिताः || ६-४-११६
उत्पेतुः च निपेतुः च प्रवृद्धा जल राशयः |_END
BEGIN_Increasing waves of the sea in which sharks and bodies of serpents swarmed, rose and 
fell whipped into motion by the breeze._END

B_6_C_14_10
BEGIN_
वधस्तु रामस्य मया त्वया च |
प्रहस्त सर्वैरपि राक्षसैर्वा |
कथम् भवेदर्थविशारदस्य |
महार्णवम् तर्तु मिवाप्लवस्य || ६-१४-११_END
BEGIN_
"How is it possible by me or by you or by all the demons to kill Rama, who is expert
in all matters, any more than a person without a bark to cross a great ocean."_END

B_6_C_4_100
BEGIN_अग्नि चूर्णम् इव आविद्धम् भास्कर अम्बु मनो रगम् || ६-४-११७
सुर अरि विषयम् घोरम् पाताल विषमम् सदा |_END
BEGIN_Emitting whirled sparkles, shining with large water-snakes, a fearful abode of enemies 
of gods forever, the sea reaches upto the uneven Patala (subterranean region)._END

B_6_C_15_0
BEGIN_
बृहस्पतेस्तुल्यमतेर्वचस्त |
न्निशम्य यत्नेन विभीषणस्य |
ततो महात्मा वचनम् बभाषे |
तत्रेन्द्रजिन्नैरृतयूथमुख्यः || ६-१५-१_END
BEGIN_
Carefully hearing the words of Vibhishana, whose intellect was equal to that of
Brihaspati (god Of wisdom and eloquence) the high spirited Indrajit, the chief of army of demons
spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_14_11
BEGIN_
धर्मप्रधानस्य महारथस्य |
इक्स्वाकुवंशप्रभवस्य राज्ञः |
पुरोऽस्य देवाश्च तथाविधस्य |
कृत्येषु शक्तस्य भवन्ति मूढाः || ६-१४-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Even the celestials would feel bewildered when placed in front of the king Rama who
gives priority to righteousness, is a great car warrior, was born in the dynasty of Ikshvaku and is
capable of accomplishing his objects."_END

B_6_C_4_101
BEGIN_सागरम् च अम्बर प्रख्यम् अम्बरम् सागर उपमम् |
सागरम् च अम्बरम् च इति निर्विशेषम् अदृश्यत || ६-४-११८_END
BEGIN_The ocean looked like the sky. The sky looked like the ocean. The ocean and the sky looked 
alike without any distinction._END

B_6_C_15_1
BEGIN_
किम् नाम ते तात कनिष्ठ वाक्य |
मन्र्थकम् वै बहुभीतवच्च |
अस्मिन् कुले योऽपि भवेन्न जातः |
सोऽपीदृशम् नैव वदेन्न कुर्यात् || ६-१५-२_END
BEGIN_
"O, youngest uncle! Pray, what? Your words are meaningless and very much
frightening. Even he who is not born in this race would neither speak such words nor do such a
thing (as you suggest)."_END

B_6_C_14_12
BEGIN_
तीक्षणा न तावत्तव कङ्कपत्रा |
दुरापदा राघवविप्रमुक्ताः |
भित्त्वाशरीरम् प्रविशन्ति बाणाः |
प्रहस्त तेनैव विकत्थसे त्वम् || ६-१४-१३_END
BEGIN_
"O, Prahasta! The sharp arrows discharged by Rama, which are furnished with heron's
feathers and are dangerous to be approached, have not yet penetrated, duly piercing, your body.
That is why, you indulge in a boastful talk."_END

B_6_C_4_102
BEGIN_सम्पृक्तम् नभसा हि अम्भः सम्प्ऱ्क्तम् च नभो अम्भसा || ६-४-११९
ताद्ऱ्ग् रूपे स्म द्ऱ्श्येते तारा रत्न समाकुले |_END
BEGIN_The water blended with sky and the sky blended with water. Filled with stars above and 
the pearls below, both the sky and the sea looked with the same splendour._END

B_6_C_15_2
BEGIN_
सत्त्वेन वीर्येण पराक्रमेण
धैर्येण शौर्येण च तेजसा च |
एकः कुलेऽस्मिन् पुरुषो विमुक्तो |
विभीषणस्तातकनिष्ठ एषः || ६-१५-३_END
BEGIN_
"In our race, this Vibhishana the youngest uncle is the only individual lacking in
strength, heroism, prowess, courage, valor and vital powers" W.w m._END

B_6_C_14_13
BEGIN_
भित्त्वा न तावत्प्रविशन्ति कायम् |
प्राणान्तकास्तेऽशनितुल्य्वेगाः |
शिताः शरा राघवविप्रमुक्ताः |
प्रहस्त तेनैव विकत्थसे त्वम् || ६-१४-१४_END
BEGIN_
"The sharp and fatal arrows, discharged by Rama with the speed of a thunderbolt,
have not yet penetrated, duly splitting your body. That is why; you are indulged in a boastful
talk."_END

B_6_C_15_3
BEGIN_
किम् नाम तौ मानुषराजपुत्रा |
वस्माकमेकेन हि राक्षसेन |
सुप्राकृतेनापि निहन्तुमेतौ |
शक्यौ कुतो भीषयसे स्म भीरो || ६-१५-४_END
BEGIN_
"What after all are those princes who are mere human beings? They can be killed even
by one very ordinary demon among us. O, coward! Why are you frightening us? "_END

B_6_C_4_103
BEGIN_समुत्पतित मेघस्य वीच्चि माला आकुलस्य च |
विशेषो न द्वयोर् आसीत् सागरस्य अम्बरस्य च || ६-४-१२०_END
BEGIN_There was no distinction between the two, of the sea filled with a row of waves and of 
the sky with a row of falling clouds._END

B_6_C_14_14
BEGIN_
न रावणो नाइबलस्त्रीशीर्षो |
न कुम्भकर्णस्य सुतो निकुभः |
न चेन्द्रजिद्दाशरथिम् प्रसोढुम् |
त्वम् वा रणे शक्रसमम् समर्थः || ६-१४-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Ravana or Triseersha, with great strength or Nikumbha the son of Kumbhakarna or
Indrajit or yourself are not capable to withstand Rama, who is equal in strength to Indra, in
battle."_END

B_6_C_15_4
BEGIN_
त्रिलोकनाथो नम देवराजः |
शक्तो मया भूमितले विविष्टः |
भयार्मिताश्चापि दिशः प्रपन्नाः |
सर्वे तदा देवगणाः समग्राः || ६-१५-५_END
BEGIN_
"At one time, the competent Devendra, the lord of three worlds, was indeed tossed
down on the floor by me. All the flocks of celestials were cast into fear and all of them fled to
different quarters."_END

B_6_C_4_104
BEGIN_अन्योन्यैर् आहताः सक्ताः सस्वनुर् भीम निह्स्वनाः || ६-४-१२१
ऊर्मयः सिन्धु राजस्य महाभेर्य इव आहवे |_END
BEGIN_The waves of the ocean together banging one another with a terrific resonance, sounded 
like a kettle-drum in the sky._END

B_6_C_14_15
BEGIN_
देवान्तको वापि नरान्तको वा |
तथातिकायोऽतिरथो महात्मा |
अकम्पननश्चाद्रिसमानसारः |
स्थातुम् न शक्ता युधि राघवस्य || ६-१४-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Even Devantaka or Narantaka or Atikaya or Atiratha of gigantic proportions, or
Akampana who is mighty as an ocean are not capable to withstand against Rama in battle."_END

B_6_C_15_5
BEGIN_
ऐरावतो विस्वरमुन्नदन् स |
निपातितो भूमितले मया तु |
विकृष्य दन्तौ तु मया प्रपह्य |
वित्रासिता देवगणाः समग्राः || ६-१५-६_END
BEGIN_
"Airavata (Indra`s elephant), which was making noise discordantly, was hurled down
by me on the floor. I forcibly extracted its teeth and frightened the entire flock of
celestials."_END

B_6_C_4_105
BEGIN_रत्न ओघ जल सम्नादम् विषक्तम् इव वायुना || ६-४-१२२
उत्पतन्तम् इव क्रुद्धम् यादो गण समाकुलम् |
ददृशुस् ते महात्मानो वात आहत जल आशयम् || ६-४-१२३
अनिल उद्धूतम् आकाशे प्रवल्गतम् इव ऊर्मिभिः |_END
BEGIN_Those high-souled monkeys saw the sea lashed with winds, resonating with abundance of 
precious stones and water, rising high as if enraged in a grip of hurricane, filled with a number of 
aquatic creatures and tossed by them in the air by seemingly murmuring waves._END

B_6_C_14_16
BEGIN_
अयम् च राजा न्यसनाभिभूतो |
मित्रैरमित्रप्रतिमैर्भवद्भिः |
अन्वास्यते राक्षसनाशनार्थे |
तीक्षणः प्रकृत्या ह्यसमीक्ष्यकारी || ६-१४-१७_END
BEGIN_
"This king who is overcome by evil addictions, * is rude in nature and acts
inconsiderately. Such a king is being surrounded as a caucus by you who are his companions taking
the form of his enemies for the ultimate destruction of demons."_END

B_6_C_15_6
BEGIN_
सोऽहम् सुराणामपि दर्पहन्ता |
दैत्योत्तमानामपि शोककर्ता |
कथम् नरेन्द्रत्मजयोर्न शक्तो |
ममष्ययोः प्राकृतयोः सुवीर्यः || ६-१५-७_END
BEGIN_
"How can I, with great valor, who suppressed the arrogance of even the celestials
and who made the lives of even excellent of the demons miserable, not capable of conquering the two
princes who are ordinary human beings?"_END

B_6_C_4_106
BEGIN_ततो विस्मयामापन्ना हरयो ददृशुः स्थिताः || ६-४-१२४
ब्रान्त ऊर्मि जल सम्नादम् प्रलोलम् इव सागरम् |_END
BEGIN_The standing monkeys were struck with amazement to see the ocean seemed moving, full 
of resonance produced by a multitude of dashing waves rolling to and fro._END

B_6_C_16_0
BEGIN_
सुनिविष्टम् हितम् वाक्यम् उक्तवन्तम् विभीषणम् |
अब्रवीत् परुषम् वाक्यम् रावणः काल चोदितः || ६-१६-१_END
BEGIN_
Ravana, goaded by death, spoke the following harsh words to Vibhishana, who was very
stable and who had spoken wholesome words:_END

B_6_C_14_17
BEGIN_
अनन्तभोगेन सहस्रमूर्ध्ना |
वागेन भीमेन महाबलेन |
बलात्परिक्षिप्तमिमम् भवन्तो |
राजानमुत्क्षिप्य विमोचयन्तु || ६-१४-१८_END
BEGIN_
"You lift up and release this king, who has been wrapped forcibly by a terrific and
exceedingly strong snake of boundless proportions having thousand hoods and make him completely
free."_END

B_6_C_15_7
BEGIN_
अथेन्द्रकल्पस्य दुरासदस्य |
महाजसस्तद्वचनम् निशम्य |
ततो महार्थम् वचनम् बभाषे |
विभीषणः शस्त्रभृताम् वरिष्ठः || ६-१५-८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Indrajit, who was equal to Indra (god of celestials),
dangerous to be approached, and possessing great vital power, Vibhishana the excellent one among
bearers of weapons spoke then the following highly meaningful words:_END

B_6_C_16_1
BEGIN_
वसेत् सह सपत्नेन क्रुद्धेन आशी विषेण च |
न तु मित्र प्रवादेन सम्वस्च्चत्रुणा सह || ६-१६-२_END
BEGIN_
"One can stay together with an enemy or even with a furious snake, but one cannot
stay together with an adversary yet avowing himself as a friend"_END

B_6_C_14_18
BEGIN_
यावद्धि केशग्रहणात्सुहृद्भिः |
समेत्य सर्वैः परिपूर्णकामैः |
निगृह्य राजा परिरक्षितव्यो |
भूतैर्यथा भीमबलैर्गृहीअः || ६-१४-१९_END
BEGIN_
"All the well-wishers who are getting their desires fulfilled by the king, should
come together and protect the king by coercion even by pulling his hair if necessary as one who is
taken ossession of by evil spirits with terrific strength, is protected by one's kith and kin."_END

B_6_C_16_2
BEGIN_
जानामि शीलम् ज्ञातीनाम् सर्व लोकेषु राक्षस |
हृष्यन्ति व्यसनेष्वेते ज्ञातीनाम् ज्ञातयः सदा || ६-१६-३_END
BEGIN_
"O, demon! I know the conduct of kinsmen in all the worlds. These kinsmen always are
rejoiced at the calamities of their kinsmen"_END

B_6_C_15_8
BEGIN_
न तात मन्त्रे तव निश्चयोऽस्ति |
बालस्त्वमद्याप्यविपक्वबुद्धिः |
तस्मात्त्वयाप्यात्मविनाशनाय |
वचोऽर्थ्हीनम् बहु विप्रलप्तम् || ६-१५-९_END
BEGIN_
"O, child! There is no stability of thought in you. Being a boy, you are still
immature in mind. That is why, many a meaningless word was prattled by you too, for only your
self-destruction."_END

B_6_C_14_19
BEGIN_
सुवारिणा राघवसागरेण |
प्रच्चाद्यमानस्तरसा भवद्भिः |
प्रच्चाद्यमानस्तरसा भवद्भिः |
युक्तस्त्वयम् तारयितुम् समेत्य |
काकुत्थ्सपातालमुखे पतन्सः || ६-१४-२०_END
BEGIN_
"This Ravana, for his part who is going to be enveloped forcibly by an ocean in the
shape of Rama - which is full of excellent water (who possesses excellent moral character) and who
is about to fall into the mouth of Patala (the nethermost subterranean region) in the shape of
Rama, is fit to be rescued united by you."_END

B_6_C_16_3
BEGIN_
प्रधानम् साधकम् वैद्यम् धर्म शीलम् च राक्षस |
ज्ञातयो ह्यनमन्यन्ते शूरम् परिभवन्ति च || ६-१६-४_END
BEGIN_
"O, demon! The kinsmen indeed insult and even humiliate their kinsman, who is an
effective leader, a person of education and right conduct and a valiant man."_END

B_6_C_15_9
BEGIN_
पुत्रप्रवादेन तु रावणस्य |
त्वमिन्द्रजिन्मित्रमुखोऽसि शत्रुः |
यस्येदृशम् राघवतो विनाशम् |
विशम्य मोहादनुवन्यसे त्वम् || ६-१५-१०_END
BEGIN_
"In the guise of a son, O, Indrajit, you are an enemy of Ravana putting on the mask
of a well wisher in that even hearing (from me) of his destruction at the hands of Rama, you are
blindly agreeing with him."_END

B_6_C_14_20
BEGIN_
इदम् पुरस्यास्य सराक्षसस्य |
राज्ञश्च पथ्यम् ससुहृज्जनस्य |
सम्यग्घि वाक्यम् स्वमतम् ब्रवीमि |
नरेन्द्रपुत्राय ददातु मैथिलीम् || ६-१४-२१_END
BEGIN_
"I am telling these right and wholesome words, as per my opinion, to this city and
the demons inhabiting in it as well as to the king and his well wishers: Let Sita be given back to
Rama."_END

B_6_C_16_4
BEGIN_
नित्यम् अन्योन्य सम्हृष्टा व्यसनेष्वाततायिनः |
प्रच्चन्न हृदया घोरा ज्ञातयस् तु भय आवहाः || ६-१६-५_END
BEGIN_
"The horrible kinsmen with their concealed thoughts and treacherous minds, terrific
ones as they are, always rejoice each other in adversities."_END

B_6_C_15_10
BEGIN_
त्वमेव वध्यश्च सुदुर्मतिश्च |
स चापि वध्यो य ऐहानयत्त्वाम् |
बालम् दृढम् साहासिकम् च योऽद्य |
प्रावेशयन्मन्त्रक्ऱ्^ताम् समीपम् || ६-१५-११_END
BEGIN_
"You surely are fit to be killed. Nay, he too is fit to be killed, who brought you,
a reckless boy here today and ushered you foolishly in the proximity of counselors"._END

B_6_C_14_21
BEGIN_
परस्य वीर्यम् स्वबलम् च बुद्ध्वा |
स्थानम् क्षयम् चैव तथैव वृद्धिम् |
तथा स्वपक्षे प्यनुमृश्य बुद्ध्या |
वद्त् क्षमम् स्वामिहितम् स मन्त्री || ६-१४-२२_END
BEGIN_
"A counselor is he, who after knowing the strength of the enemies and that of his
own (master) and even so duly grasping with his intellect, the status quo, fall, or rise in
military power like-wise on both sides, renders advice which is appropriate to the interest of his
king."_END

B_6_C_16_5
BEGIN_
श्रूयन्ते हस्तिभिर् गीताः श्लोकाः पद्म वने पुरा |
पाश हस्तान् नरान् दृष्ट्वा शृणु तान् गदतो मम || ६-१६-६_END
BEGIN_
"Previously in a forest called Padmavana, some maxims were spoken by elephants,
which saw men with nooses in hand. Hear and I shall tell them."_END

B_6_C_15_11
BEGIN_
मूढोऽप्रगल्भोऽविनयोपपन्न |
स्तीक्षणस्वभावोऽल्पमतिर्दुरात्मा |
मूर्खस्त्वमत्यन्तसुदुर्मतिश्च |
त्वमिन्द्रजिद्बालतया ब्रवीषि || ६-१५-१२_END
BEGIN_
"O, Indrajit! You are a stupid, irresolute, without humility, rude natured; unwise;
evil person, inexperienced and highly evil minded. You are speaking in this manner because you are
an immature boy"._END

B_6_C_16_6
BEGIN_
नाग्निर्नान्यानि शस्त्राणि न नः पाशा भयावहाः |
घोराः स्वार्थप्रयुक्तास्तु ज्ञातयो नो भयावहाः || ६-१६-७_END
BEGIN_
"For us, fire or weapons or nooses are not begetting fear. The terrific kinsmen,
incited by selfishness are begetting fear to us."_END

B_6_C_15_12
BEGIN_
को ब्रह्मदण्डप्रतिमप्रकाशा |
नर्चिष्मतः कालनिकाशरूपान् |
सहेत बाणान्यमदण्डकल्पा |
न्समक्षमुक्तान्युधि राघवेण || ६-१५-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Who can endure the arrows, discharged by Rama in battle right in front of the
enemy, which resemble Brahma's (creator's) staff in glory, which present a form similar to that of
God of Death and are equal to the Yama's staff?"_END

B_6_C_16_7
BEGIN_
उपायमेते वक्ष्यन्ति ग्रहणे नात्रसंशयः |
कृत्स्नाद् भयाज्ज्ञातिभयम् सुकष्टम् विदितम् च नः || ६-१६-८_END
BEGIN_
"These kinsmen will inform the strategy to our enemies to seize us. There is no
doubt about this. Out of all fears, the fear of kinsmen is very much troublesome for us. It is a
well known thing."_END

B_6_C_17_0
BEGIN_
इति उक्त्वा परुषम् वाक्यम् रावणम् रावण अनुजः |
आजगाम मुहूर्तेन यत्र रामः सलक्ष्मणः ||६-१७-१_END
BEGIN_
Having spoken the aforesaid harsh words to Ravana, Vibhishana arrived almost
immediately to the place where Rama was together with Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_15_13
BEGIN_
धनानि रत्नानि सुभूषणानि |
वापाम्पि दिव्यानि मणींश्च चित्रान् |
सीताम् च रामाय निवेद्य देवीम् |
वसेम राजन्निह वीतशोकाः || ६-१५-१४_END
BEGIN_
" O, king! Offering riches, precious stones, good jewellery, excellent clothes,
bright colored gems and the god-like Sita to Rama, let us live here, free from anguish."_END

B_6_C_16_8
BEGIN_
विद्यते गोषु सम्पन्नम् विद्यते ज्ञातितो भयम् |
विद्यते स्त्रीषु चापल्यम् विद्यते ज्ञातितो भयम् || ६-१६-९_END
BEGIN_
"There is wealth in cows. There is fear for kinsmen. There is fickleness in women.
There is austerity in Brahmins."_END

B_6_C_17_1
BEGIN_
तम् मेरु शिखर आकारम् दीप्ताम् इव शत ह्रदाम् |
गगनस्थम् महीस्थास् ते ददृशुर् वानर अधिपाः ||६-१७-२_END
BEGIN_
Those leaders of monkeys standing on the ground saw Vibhishana, resembling the peak
of Mount Meru and shining like a thunderbolt in the sky._END

B_6_C_16_9
BEGIN_
ततो नेष्टम् इदम् सौम्य यदहम् लोक सत्कृतः |
ऐश्वर्यम् अभिजातः च रिपूणाम् मूर्ध्नि च स्थितः || ६-१६-१०_END
BEGIN_
"O, gentleman! Hence, it is not of liking to you that the people are venerating me,
that I obtained riches and that I am sitting tight in the heads of enemies"._END

B_6_C_17_2
BEGIN_
ते चाप्यनुचरास्तस्य चत्वारो भीमविक्रमाः |
तेऽपि वर्मायुधोपेता भूषणोत्तमभूषिताः ||६-१७-३_END
BEGIN_
His four companions of terrific prowess were also there with him. They were wearing
weapons and armour and were adorned with excellent ornaments._END

B_6_C_17_3
BEGIN_
स च मेघाचलप्रख्यो वज्रायुधसमप्रभः |
वरायुधधरो वीरो दिव्याभरणभूषितः ||६-१७-४_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana also resembled a mass of cloud, the equal of the God who wields the
thunderbolt. He was holding excellent weapons and was adorned with wonderful jewels._END

B_6_C_16_10
BEGIN_
यथा पुष्करपत्रेषु पतितास्तोयबिन्दवः |
न श्लेषमभिगच्चन्ति तथानार्येषु सौहृदम् || ६-१६-११_END
BEGIN_
"As drops of water fallen on lotus leaves do not get clung to those leaves, so also
a friendship does not cling to vulgar ones."_END

B_6_C_16_11
BEGIN_
यथा शरदि मेघानाम् सिञ्चातामपि गर्जताम् |
न भवत्यमुबसम्क्लेदस्तथानार्येषु सौहृदम् || ६-१६-१२_END
BEGIN_
"As rainy clouds in autumn, even though thundering, cannot get the earth saturated
with water, so also friendship does not have tenderness of heart in vulgar people."_END

B_6_C_17_4
BEGIN_
तम् आत्म पन्चमम् दृष्ट्वा सुग्रीवो वानर अधिपः |
वानरैः सह दुर्धर्षः चिन्तयाम् आस बुद्धिमान् ||६-१७-५_END
BEGIN_
Sugriva the valiant of monkeys, who was difficult to be overpowered, having seen
Vibhishana, the fifth one along with four others, became thoughtful along with monkeys._END

B_6_C_16_12
BEGIN_
यथा मधुकरस्तर्षाद्रासम् विन्दन्न तिष्ठति |
तथा त्वमपि तत्रैव तथानार्येषु सौहृदम् || ६-१६-१३_END
BEGIN_
"As a honey bee, even though getting nectar from a flower, does not stick on to that
flower due to its eager desire for more, you also belong to that category as friendship does not
stick on to vulgar people."_END

B_6_C_17_5
BEGIN_
चिन्तयित्वा मुहूर्तम् तु वानरांस् तान् उवाच ह |
हनूमत् प्रमुखान् सर्वान् इदम् वचनम् उत्तमम् ||६-१७-६_END
BEGIN_
Having thought for a moment, Sugriva spoke these sterling words to all those monkeys
and to Hanuman in particular._END

B_6_C_16_13
BEGIN_
यथा मधुकर्स्तराषात्काशपुष्पम् पिबन्नपि |
रसमत्र न विन्देत तथानार्येषु सौहृदम् || ६-१६-१४_END
BEGIN_
"As even though trying to drink nectar from a flower of grass, a honey bee cannot
get it, so also friendship cannot be extracted from vulgar persons."_END

B_6_C_17_6
BEGIN_
एष सर्व आयुध उपेतः चतुर्भिः सह राक्षसैः |
राक्षसो अभ्येति पश्यध्वम् अस्मान् हन्तुम् न संशयः ||६-१७-७_END
BEGIN_
"See this demon possessing all types of weapons, coming along with four demons.
There is no doubt that he is coming to kill us."_END

B_6_C_17_7
BEGIN_
सुग्रीवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा सर्वे ते वानर उत्तमाः |
सालान् उद्यम्य शैलामः च इदम् वचनम् अब्रुवन् ||६-१७-८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Sugriva's words, all those excellent monkeys lifted trees and mountains and
spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_16_14
BEGIN_
यथा पूर्वम् गजः स्नात्वा गृह्य हस्तेन वै रजः |
दूषयत्यात्मनो देहम् तथानार्येषु सौहृदम् || ६-१६-१५_END
BEGIN_
"How an elephant abuses its body by helping itself with dust after taking bath
earlier with its trunk, friendship gets an abuse in vulgar persons in the same manner."_END

B_6_C_17_8
BEGIN_
शीघ्रम् व्यादिश नो राजन् वधाय एषाम् दुरात्मनाम् |
निपतन्तु हताः च एते धरण्याम् अल्प जीविताः ||६-१७-९_END
BEGIN_
"Do you swiftly order us to slay these wicked doers, O, king? Let us strike these
fools down so that they drop to the ground!"_END

B_6_C_16_15
BEGIN_
योऽन्यस्त्वेवम्विधम् ब्रूयाद् वाक्यमेतन्निशाचर |
अस्मिन् मुहूर्ते न भवेत् त्वाम् तु धिक् कुलपांसनम् || ६-१६-१६_END
BEGIN_
"O, demon, walking about by night! If any other person utters these words in this
manner, he will be ceasing to exit at this moment. O, destroyer of race! A curse upon you!"_END

B_6_C_17_9
BEGIN_
तेषाम् सम्भाषमाणानाम् अन्योन्यम् स विभीषणः |
उत्तरम् तीरम् आसाद्य खस्थ एव व्यतिष्ठत ||६-१७-१०_END
BEGIN_
While the monkeys were speaking thus among one another, Vibhishana had reached the
northern shore and indeed coolly halted there._END

B_6_C_16_16
BEGIN_
इतिउक्तः परुषम् वाक्यम् न्यायवादी विभीषणः |
उत्पपात गदापाणिःचतुर्भिः सह राक्षसैः || ६-१६-१७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those harsh words from Ravana, Vibhishana who advocates justice, wielding a
mace in his hand, soared high into the sky, along with four other demons._END

B_6_C_17_10
BEGIN_
स उवाच च महाप्राज्ञः स्वरेण महता महान् |
सुग्रीवम् तामः च सम्प्रेक्ष्य खस्थ एव विभीषणः ||६-१७-११_END
BEGIN_
That great and highly intelligent Vibhishana, halting in the sky itself, saw Sugriva
and those monkeys and spoke to them in a loud voice (as follows):_END

B_6_C_16_17
BEGIN_
अब्रवीच्च तदा वाक्यम् जातक्रोधो विभीषणः |
अन्तरिक्षगतः श्रीमान् भ्रातरम् राक्षस अधिपम् || ६-१६-१८_END
BEGIN_
Then, the illustrious Vibhishana who became angry also spoke these words to king
Ravana, his brother after moving into the sky._END

B_6_C_16_18
BEGIN_
स त्वम् भ्राता असि मे राजन् ब्रूहि माम् यद् यद् इच्चसि |
ज्येष्ठो मान्यः पितृसमो न च धर्मपथे स्थितः || ६-१६-१९
इदम् तु परुषम् वाक्यम् न क्षमामि अनृतम् तव |_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! You are a brother to me. You utter whatever you like. Elder brother is
like a father. Even if he is not staying in a right path, he is to be respected. But I cannot
forbear these harsh words from you."_END

B_6_C_17_11
BEGIN_
रावणो नाम दुर्वृत्तो राक्षसो राक्षस ईश्वरः |
तस्य अहम् अनुजो भ्राता विभीषण इति श्रुतः ||६-१७-१२_END
BEGIN_
"There is a demon called Ravana, the king of demons, having a bad conduct. I am his
younger brother, known as Vibhishana."_END

B_6_C_17_12
BEGIN_
तेन सीता जन स्थानाद्द् हृता हत्वा जटायुषम् |
रुद्ध्वा च विवशा दीना राक्षसीभिः सुरक्षिता ||६-१७-१३_END
BEGIN_
"It is Ravana who, having killed a bird Jatayu, took away Sita from Janasthana.That
unfortunate lady is held captive against her will and she is now amidst the female titans who guard
her jealously"_END

B_6_C_16_19
BEGIN_
सुनीतम् हित कामेन वाक्यम् उक्तम् दश आनन || ६-१६-२०
न गृह्णन्ति अकृत आत्मानः कालस्य वशमागताः |_END
BEGIN_
"Those who have an ill composed mind and who get conceded to the occasion do not
assimilate the words of prudence, spoken by a well wisher."_END

B_6_C_17_13
BEGIN_
तम् अहम् हेतुभिर् वाक्यैर् विविधैः च न्यदर्शयम् |
साधु निर्यात्यताम् सीता रामाय इति पुनः पुनः ||६-१७-१४_END
BEGIN_
"I persuaded Ravana again and again by my diverse words and arguments to restore
Sita smoothly to Rama._END

B_6_C_16_20
BEGIN_
सुलभाः पुरुषा राजन् सततम् प्रिय वादिनः || ६-१६-२१
अप्रियस्य तु पथ्यस्य वक्ता श्रोता च दुर्लभः |_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! Men who forever speak pleasing words are easy to be obtained. But one who
speaks of useful but unpleasing words as also the one who listens to them, are rare to be
obtained"_END

B_6_C_17_14
BEGIN_
स च न प्रतिजग्राह रावणः काल चोदितः |
उच्यमानो हितम् वाक्यम् विपरीत इव औषधम् ||६-१७-१५_END
BEGIN_
"That Ravana, impelled by fate, did not receive my sage advice, as a perverted
person does not accept his prescribed medicine"_END

B_6_C_16_21
BEGIN_
बद्धम् कालस्य पाशेन सर्व भूत अपहारिणा || ६-१६-२२
न नश्यन्तम् उपेक्षेयम् प्रदीप्तम् शरणम् यथा |_END
BEGIN_
"I could not ignore you, being destroyed by the noose of Yama (god of death); tied
around you and which snatches away all beings, as none can ignore a burning house."_END

B_6_C_17_15
BEGIN_
सो अहम् परुषितस् तेन दासवच् च अवमानितः |
त्यक्त्वा पुत्रामः च दारामः च राघवम् शरणम् गतः ||६-१७-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Reviled by him and humiliated as a slave, I, leaving my sons and my wife, have come
to take refuge with Rama."_END

B_6_C_16_22
BEGIN_
दीप्त पावक सम्काशैः शितैः कान्चन भूषणैः || ६-१६-२३
न त्वाम् इच्चामि अहम् द्रष्टुम् रामेण निहतम् शरैः |_END
BEGIN_
"I do not wish to see you, being killed by Rama with his sharp arrows, adorned with
gold and each resembling like a blazing fire."_END

B_6_C_17_16
BEGIN_
निवेदेअयत माम् क्षिप्रम् राघवाय महात्मने |
सर्व लोक शरण्याय विभीषणम् उपस्थितम् ||६-१७-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Inform immediately to high soled Rama, the protector of all the worlds, that I,
Vibhishana, have come here."_END

B_6_C_16_23
BEGIN_
शूराः च बलवन्तः च कृत अस्त्राः च नर आजिरे || ६-१६-२४
काल अभिपन्ना सीदन्ति यथा वालुक सेतवः |_END
BEGIN_
"Persons who are valiant, strong and skilled in weaponry, when time comes, sink down
(ruin) as a dam constructed with sand sinks down."_END

B_6_C_17_17
BEGIN_
एतत्तु वचनम् श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवो लघु विक्रमः |
लक्ष्मणस्य अग्रतो रामम् सम्रब्धम् इदम् अब्रवीत् ||६-१७-१८_END
BEGIN_
The swift-paced Sugriva, having heard the words of Vibhishana, spoke more hurriedly
to Rama, in front of Lakshmana as follows:_END

B_6_C_16_24
BEGIN_
तनर्षयतु यच्चोक्तम् गुरुत्वाद्धितमिच्चता || ६-१६-२५
आत्मानम् सर्वथा रक्ष पुरीम् च इमाम् सराक्षसाम् |
स्वस्ति ते अस्तु गमिष्यामि सुखी भव मया विना || ६-१६-२६_END
BEGIN_
"As an elder brother, bear the words spoken by me, who desire your welfare. Guard
this city and yourself along with demons, by all means. Let all be well with you. I am departing.
Be a happy person without me."_END

B_6_C_17_18
BEGIN_
प्रविष्टः शत्रु सैन्यम् हि प्राप्तः शत्रुरतर्कितः |
निहन्यादन्न्तरम् लब्ध्वा उलूको वायसानिव ||६-१७-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Belonging to the enemy force, here is an adversary taking us unawares, who
unexpectedly has come here to slay us at the first opportunity like an owl destroying crows!"_END

B_6_C_16_25
BEGIN_
निवार्यमाणस्य मया हित एषिणा |
न रोचते ते वचनम् निशा चर |
परीत काला हि गत आयुषो नरा |
हितम् न गृह्णन्ति सुहृद्भिर् ईरितम् || ६-१६-२७_END
BEGIN_
"O, Ravana the ranger of the night! My words are not relishing to you, who are being
restrained by me duly desiring your welfare. Persons whose duration of life is to end, do not
accept the salutary words spoken by their well wishers"_END

B_6_C_17_19
BEGIN_
मन्त्रे व्यूहे नये चारे युक्तो भवितुमर्हसि |
वानराणाम् च भद्रम् ते परेषाम् च परम्तप ||६-१७-२०_END
BEGIN_
"O, annihilator of enemies! You ought to be aware of the design, distribution,
leading of the army and the secret service of the monkeys and also of your foes. May good come to
you!"_END

B_6_C_17_20
BEGIN_
अन्तर्धनगताह्येते राक्षसाः कामरूपिणः |
शूराश्च निकृतिज्ञाश्च तेषाम् जातु न विश्वसेत् ||६-१७-२१_END
BEGIN_
"These demons can assume any form at will and can disappear. They are valiant and
deceitful. We can not trust them at any time."_END

B_6_C_17_21
BEGIN_
प्रणीधी राक्षसेन्द्रस्य रावणस्य भवेदयम् |
अनुप्रविश्य सोऽ स्मासु भेदम् कुर्यान्न संशयः ||६-१७-२२_END
BEGIN_
"He may be a spy of Ravana the king of demons. He will succeed to become a member
among us and create differences. There is no doubt."_END

B_6_C_18_0
BEGIN_
अथ रामः प्रसन्न आत्मा श्रुत्वा वायु सुतस्य ह |
प्रत्यभाषत दुर्धर्षः श्रुतवान् आत्मनि स्थितम् ||६-१८-१_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter the inviolable Rama who possesses sacred knowledge, after hearing
Hanuman's words, spoke with a clear understanding, the following opinion that was firm in his
mind:_END

B_6_C_17_22
BEGIN_
अथवा स्वयमेवैष चिद्रमासाद्य बुद्धिमान् |
अनुप्रविश्य विश्वस्ते कदाचित्प्रहरेदपि ||६-१७-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Otherwise he , intelligent by himself, can get into possession of a weak point in
us. Having first gained our confidence by craft, he may even at any time attack us."_END

B_6_C_18_1
BEGIN_
मम अपि तु विवक्षा अस्ति काचित् प्रति विभीषणम् |
श्रुतम् इच्चामि तत् सर्वम् भवद्भिः श्रेयसि स्थितैः ||६-१८-२_END
BEGIN_
"I also wish to tell my opinion about Vibhishana. I want it to be heard by you, who
are firmly established in our welfare."_END

B_6_C_17_23
BEGIN_
मित्राटवीबलम् चैव मौलभृत्यबलम् तथा |
सर्वमेतद्बलम् ग्राह्यम् वर्जयित्वा द्विषद्बलम् ||६-१७-२४_END
BEGIN_
"A contingent supplied by friends or an inhabitant of the woods (like our selves),
or furnished by hereditary warriors or paid servants - all these contingents can be accepted but
not that furnished by an enemy."_END

B_6_C_18_2
BEGIN_
मित्र भावेन सम्प्राप्तम् न त्यजेयम् कथंचन |
दोषो यदि अपि तस्य स्यात् सताम् एतद् अगर्हितम् ||६-१८-३_END
BEGIN_
"By any means, I do not desert anyone who arrives with a friendly appearance, even
if he has a defect. His acceptance is irreproachable in the eyes of good men"_END

B_6_C_17_24
BEGIN_
प्रकृत्या राक्षसो ह्येष भ्रातामित्रस्य वै प्रभो |
आगतश्च रिपोः साक्षात्कथमस्मिंश्च विश्वसेत् ||६-१७-२५_END
BEGIN_
"O, Lord! He is indeed a demon by nature and a brother of an enemy who came directly
from an adversary. How can we keep trust in him?"_END

B_6_C_18_3
BEGIN_
सुग्रीवस्त्वथ तद्वाक्यमाभाष्य च विमृश्य च |
ततः शुभतरम् वाक्यमुवाच हरिपुङ्गवः ||६-१८-४_END
BEGIN_
Then, Sugreeva the chief of monkeys closely analyzed and examined the aforesaid
words of Rama and thereafter spoke the following most auspicious words:_END

B_6_C_17_25
BEGIN_
रावणस्य अनुजो भ्राता विभीषण इति श्रुतः |
चतुर्भिः सह रक्षोभिर् भवन्तम् शरणम् गतः ||६-१७-२६_END
BEGIN_
The younger brother of the famous Ravana, called Vibhishana along with four other
demons approached you for refuge."_END

B_6_C_18_4
BEGIN_
सुदुष्टो वाप्यदुष्टो वा किम्मेष रजनीचरः |
ईदृशम् व्यसनम् प्राप्तम् भ्रातरम् यः परित्यजेत् ||६-१८-५
को वाम स भवेत्तस्य यमेष न परित्यजेत् |_END
BEGIN_
"What matters if this ranger of night is very dangerous or other wise, if he can
desert his own brother at a time of peril? Whom will he not betray subsequently?"_END

B_6_C_17_26
BEGIN_
रावणेन प्रणिहितम् तम् अवेहि विभीषणम् |
तस्य अहम् निग्रहम् मन्ये क्षमम् क्षमवताम् वर ||६-१७-२७_END
BEGIN_
"O, the excellent one among men knowing what is right! Know that Ravana is sending
Vibhishana. I opine that Vibhishana is fit for arrest."_END

B_6_C_19_0
BEGIN_
राघवेन अभये दत्ते सम्नतो रावण अनुजः |
विभीषणो महाप्राज्ञो भूमिम् समवलोकयत् || ६-१९-१_END
BEGIN_
While the assurance of protection having been given to Rama, the highly sagacious
Vibhishana the brother of Ravana bent down and glanced towards the earth._END

B_6_C_18_5
BEGIN_
वानराधिपते र्वाक्यम् श्रुत्वा सर्वानुदीक्स्य तु ||६-१८-६
ईषदुत्स्मयमानस्तु लक्स्मणम् पुण्यलक्षणम् |
इति होवाच काकुत्थ्सो वाक्यम् सत्यपराक्रमः ||६-१८-७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Sugreeva, Rama who was truly mighty looked round all of them ,
smiled a little and spoke the following words to Lakshmana, of virtuous characteristics:_END

B_6_C_17_27
BEGIN_
राक्षसो जिह्मया बुद्ध्या संदिष्टो अयम् उपस्थितः |
प्रहर्तुम् मायया चन्नो विश्वस्ते त्वयि राघव ||६-१७-२८_END
BEGIN_
"O, the faultless one! Being sent with a crooked intent, this demon came here to
attack when you are going to repose faith in him, (remaining hidden by his witchcraft)._END

B_6_C_19_1
BEGIN_
खात् पपात अवनिम् हृष्टो भक्तैर् अनुचरैः सह |
स तु रामस्य धर्म आत्मा निपपात विभीषणः || ६-१९-२_END
BEGIN_
The virtuous Vibhishana descended joyously from the sky to the ground along with his
faithful companions and alighted in the vicinity of Rama._END

B_6_C_18_6
BEGIN_
अनधीत्य च शास्त्राणि वृद्धाननुपसेव्य च |
न शक्यमीदृशम् वक्तुम् यदुवाच हरीश्वरः ||६-१८-८_END
BEGIN_
"Without studying scriptures and without serving elders, it is not possible to speak
such words as Sugreeva spoke."_END

B_6_C_17_28
BEGIN_
बध्यताम् एष तीव्रेण दण्डेन सचिवैः सह |
रावणस्य नृशंसस्य भ्राता हि एष विभीषणः ||६-१७-२९_END
BEGIN_
"This Vibhishana is indeed the brother of cruel Ravana. Hence, let him along with
his ministers be killed, by imposing severe punishment on them."_END

B_6_C_19_2
BEGIN_
पादयोः शरण अन्वेषी चतुर्भिः सह राक्षसैः |
अब्रवीच् च तदा रामम् वाक्यम् तत्र विभीषणः || ६-१९-३
धर्म युक्तम् च युक्तम् च साम्प्रतम् सम्प्रहर्षणम् |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, Vibhishana along with the four demons fell prostrate and spoke to Rama
the following words which were equitable suitable and delightful._END

B_6_C_18_7
BEGIN_
अस्ति सूक्ष्मतरम् किंचिद्यदत्र प्रतिभाति मा |
प्रत्यक्षम् लौकिकम् चापि वर्तते सर्वराजसु ||६-१८-९_END
BEGIN_
"It appears to my mind that there is however something peculiar in these
circumstances which are clearly to be seen in all lives of kings and even occurring in ordinary
life."_END

B_6_C_17_29
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा तु तम् रामम् सम्रब्धो वाहिनी पतिः |
वाक्यज्ञो वाक्य कुशलम् ततो मौनम् उपागमत् ||६-१७-३०_END
BEGIN_
The chief of army Sugriva, who knew how to speak expressed thus hurriedly to Rama,
who was skilled in oratory and thereafter entered into silence._END

B_6_C_19_3
BEGIN_
अनुजो रावणस्य अहम् तेन च अस्मि अवमानितः || ६-१९-४
भवन्तम् सर्व भूतानाम् शरण्यम् शरणम् गतः |_END
BEGIN_
"I am the younger brother of Ravana and was humiliated by him. I sought refuge in
you, who are the refuge for all the beings."_END

B_6_C_18_8
BEGIN_
अमित्रास्तत्कुलीनाश्च प्रातिदेश्याश्च कीर्तिता |
व्यसनेषु प्रहर्तारस्तस्मादयमिहागतः ||६-१८-१०_END
BEGIN_
"It is told that persons of the same family and rulers belonging to adjoining
territories become enemies and strike in times of adversities. For this reason, he came here."_END

B_6_C_17_30
BEGIN_
सुग्रीवस्य तु तद् वाक्यम् श्रुत्वा रामो महाबलः |
समीपस्थान् उवाच इदम् हनूमत् प्रमुखान् हरीन् ||६-१७-३१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Sugriva, the exceedingly strong Rama addressed as follows to
the monkeys in front of Hanuman staying near by:_END

B_6_C_19_4
BEGIN_
परित्यक्ता मया लंका मित्राणि च धनानि च || ६-१९-५
भवद् गतम् हि मे राज्यम् च जीवितम् च सुखानि च |_END
BEGIN_
"Abandoning Lanka, friends and possessions, I place my kingdom, life and happiness
at your disposal."_END

B_6_C_18_9
BEGIN_
अपापास्तत्कुलीवाश्च मानयन्ति स्वकान् हितान् |
एष प्रायो नरेन्द्राणाम् शङ्कनीयस्तु शोभनः ||६-१८-११_END
BEGIN_
"Even if belonging to the same family, persons who are virtuous do respect their own
well wishers in that family. Generally among kings, even a virtuous person is apprehended."_END

B_6_C_17_31
BEGIN_
यद् उक्तम् कपि राजेन रावण अवरजम् प्रति |
वाक्यम् हेतुमद् अत्यर्थम् भवद्भिर् अपि तत् श्रुतम् ||६-१७-३२_END
BEGIN_
"The very reasonable words uttered by Sugriva about Vibhishana were heard by you
too."_END

B_6_C_19_5
BEGIN_
तस्य तद्वचनम् श्रुत्वा रामो वचनमब्रवीत् || ६-१९-६
वचसा सान्त्वयित्वैनम् लोचनाभ्याम् पिबन्निव |
आख्याहि मम तत्वेन राक्षसानाम् बलाबलम् || ६-१९-७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Vibhishana, Rama in a soothing tone and with a refreshing
look in his eyes, spoke these words: "Tell me really the strengths and weaknesses of the
demons."_END

B_6_C_20_0
BEGIN_
ततो निविष्टाम् ध्वजिनीम् सुग्रीवेणाभिपालिताम् |
ददर्श राक्षसोऽभ्येत्य शार्दूलो नाम वीर्यवान् || ६-२०-१_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, an energetic demon named Shardula came and saw the army, commanded by
Sugriva, which was drawn up in a battle array._END

B_6_C_18_10
BEGIN_
यस्तु दोषस्त्वया प्रोक्तो ह्यादानेर्इबलस्य च |
तत्र ते कीर्तयुष्यामि यथाशास्त्रमिदम् शृणु ||६-१८-१२_END
BEGIN_
"With regard to the draw back you told me in the matter of accepting a person coming
from the side of an adversary, hear from me what the scriptures say."_END

B_6_C_17_32
BEGIN_
सुहृदा हि अर्थ कृच्चेषु युक्तम् बुद्धिमता सता |
समर्थेन अपि संदेष्टुम् शाश्वतीम् भूतिम् इच्चता ||६-१७-३३_END
BEGIN_
"An efficient and intelligent person ever desirous of everlasting well being of his
friends should properly advise them well in difficult matters. Hence, tell your opinion one by
one"_END

B_6_C_19_6
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तम् तदा रक्षो रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा |
रावणस्य बलम् सर्वमाख्यातुमुपचक्रमे || ६-१९-८_END
BEGIN_
Thus asked then by Rama who was unwearied in action, Vibhishana started telling
about the detailed strength of Ravana._END

B_6_C_20_1
BEGIN_
चारो राक्षसराजस्य रावणस्य दुरात्मनः |
ताम् दृष्ट्वा सर्वतोऽव्यग्रम् प्रतिगम्य स राक्षसः || ६-२०-२
आविश्य लङ्काम् वेगेन राजानमिदमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
That demon, the spy of Ravana the evil natured king of ogres, coolly observed that
army from all sides, speedily returned to Lanka and spoke to their king as follows:_END

B_6_C_18_11
BEGIN_
न वयम् तत्कुलीनाश्च राज्यकाम्क्षी च राक्षसः |
पण्डिता हि भविष्यन्ति तस्माद्ग्राह्यो विभीषणः ||६-१८-१३_END
BEGIN_
"We do not belong to the same family. Further, Vibhishana the demon is desirous of
acquiring the kingdom. A few of the demons also may be rather learned ones. That is why, Vibhishana
is acceptable."_END

B_6_C_17_33
BEGIN_
इति एवम् परिपृष्टास् ते स्वम् स्वम् मतम् अतन्द्रिताः |
स उपचारम् तदा रामम् ऊचुर् हित चिकीर्षवः ||६-१७-३४_END
BEGIN_
Thus asked by Rama, those monkeys free from lassitude, wishing to do good and out of
their politeness, spoke their respective opinions to Rama as follows:_END

B_6_C_19_7
BEGIN_
अवध्यः सर्वभूतानाम् गन्धर्वोरगपक्षिणाम् |
राजपुत्र दशग्रीवो वरदानात्स्वयम्भुवः || ६-१९-९_END
BEGIN_
"O, prince! Because of a special boon given by Brahma (lord of creation), Ravana can
not be killed by all beings, Gandharvas (celestial musicians), serpents, and birds."_END

B_6_C_20_2
BEGIN_
एष वै वानरर्क्षघो लङ्काम् समभिवर्तते || ६-२०-३
अगाधश्चाप्रमेयश्च द्वितीय इव सागरः |_END
BEGIN_
"Boundless and immeasurable like another ocean, this multitude of monkeys and bears
is approaching Lanka."._END

B_6_C_18_12
BEGIN_
अव्यग्राश्च प्रहृष्टाश्च न भविष्यन्ति सम्गताः |
प्रणादश्च महानेष ततोऽस्य भयमागतम् ||६-१८-१४
इति भेदम् गमिष्यन्ति तस्मात्प्रोप्तो विभीषणः |_END
BEGIN_
"Kinsfolk do not live together in a fearless mode and in a delightful manner. Hence,
they get a split among themselves. For this reason, a fear has come to him. This loud appeal is
also major cause. That is why, Vibhishana can be accepted."_END

B_6_C_17_34
BEGIN_
अज्ञातम् न अस्ति ते किंचित् त्रिषु लोकेषु राघव |
आत्मानम् पूजयन् राम पृच्चसि अस्मान् सुहृत्तया ||६-१७-३५_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! Nothing is unknown to you in the three worlds. You are consulting us with
a friendly heart, as an honor to us."_END

B_6_C_19_8
BEGIN_
रावणानन्तरो भ्राता मम ज्येष्ठश्च वीर्यवान् |
कुम्भकर्णो महातेजाः शक्रप्रतिबलो युधि || ६-१९-१०_END
BEGIN_
Kumbhakarna, my elder brother born after Ravana, who is valiant and highly powerful,
has enough strength to fight against Indra (Lord of celestials) in battle._END

B_6_C_20_3
BEGIN_
पुत्रौ दशरथस्येमौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ || ६-२०-४
उत्तमौ रूपसम्पन्नौ सीतायाः पदमागतौ |
एतौ सागरमासाद्य सम्निविष्टौ महाद्युती || ६-२०-५_END
BEGIN_
"These brothers Rama and Lakshmana, the sons of Dasaratha, the excellent and the
most dignified men endowed with beauty have arrived in the cause of Sita and settled in a camp
after reaching the sea shore" ._END

B_6_C_18_13
BEGIN_
न सर्वे भ्रातरस्तात भवन्ति भरतोपमाः ||६-१८-१५
मद्विधा ना पितुः पुत्राः सुहृदो वा भवद्विधाः |_END
BEGIN_
"My dear one! Neither all brothers are like Bharata, nor all sons of a father like
me nor all friends are like you."_END

B_6_C_17_35
BEGIN_
त्वम् हि सत्य व्रतः शूरो धार्मिको दृढ विक्रमः |
परीक्ष्य कारा स्मृतिमान् निसृष्ट आत्मा सुहृत्सु च ||६-१७-३६_END
BEGIN_
"You are avowed to truth, a valiant man and a righteous man of firm fortitude. You
take action only after proper investigation. You have good memory. You are committed in your heart
to your friends."_END

B_6_C_19_9
BEGIN_
राम सेनापतिस्तस्य प्रहस्तो यदि ते श्रुतः |
कैलासे येन सम मणिभद्रः पराजितः || ६-१९-११_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! You might have heard about Prahasta, his chief of army. He defeated
Manibhadra in a battle on the mountain of Kailasa."_END

B_6_C_20_4
BEGIN_
बलम् चाकाशमावृत्य सर्वतो दशयोजनम् |
तत्त्वभूतम् महारज क्षिप्रम् वेदितुमर्हसि || ६-२०-६_END
BEGIN_
"O, monarch! Their army is employed around a radius of ten yojanas (eighty miles)on
all sides. You have to ascertain this truth quickly"_END

B_6_C_18_14
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण सुग्रीवः सहलक्स्मणः ||६-१८-१६
उत्थाअयोदम् महाप्राज्ञः प्रणतो वाक्यमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Rama's words Sugreeva who was together with the highly wise Lakshmana stood
up saluting and spoke these words:_END

B_6_C_17_36
BEGIN_
तस्माद् एक एकशस् तावद् ब्रुवन्तु सचिवास् तव |
