हेतुतो मति सम्पन्नाः समर्थाः च पुनः पुनः ||६-१७-३७_END
BEGIN_
"Hence, your counselors, who are rich in their minds and are moreover efficient, one
by one, will tell their opinion with reason."_END

B_6_C_19_10
BEGIN_
बद्दगोधाङ्गुलित्रश्च अवध्यकवचो युधि |
धनुरादाय यस्तिष्ठन्नदृश्यो भवतीन्द्रजित् || ६-१९-१२_END
BEGIN_
"When furnished with gloves made of the skin of Iguana (to prevent injury from the
bowstring) and when clad in armor that no arrow can pierce, that Indrajit (son of Ravana) standing
in battle wielding a bow, becomes invisible."_END

B_6_C_20_5
BEGIN_
तव दूता महाराज क्षिप्रमर्हन्ति वेदितुम् |
उपप्रदानम् सान्त्वम् वा भेदो वात्र प्रयुज्यताम् || ६-२०-७_END
BEGIN_
"O, monarch! Your other spies also ought to ascertain the fact quickly. Under such
circumstances, either conciliation or an act of giving away or sowing dissention (in the enemy's
ranks) may be employed."_END

B_6_C_18_15
BEGIN_
रावणेन प्रणिहितम् तमवेहि निशाचरम् ||६-१८-१७
तस्याहम् निग्रहम् मन्ये क्षमम् क्षमवताम् वर |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama the excellent among the tolerant! Realise that Ravana has sent Vibhishana,
the demon. I think of him to be worthy of being taken as a captive."_END

B_6_C_17_37
BEGIN_
इति उक्ते राघवाय अथ मतिमान् अन्गदो अग्रतः |
विभीषण परीक्षा अर्थम् उवाच वचनम् हरिः ||६-१७-३८_END
BEGIN_
Having spoken thus by the monkeys, Angada the intelligent monkey told Rama to
arrange for examination of Vibhishana before hand."_END

B_6_C_19_11
BEGIN_
सम्ग्रामे सुमहद्व्यूहे तर्पयित्वा हुताशनम् |
अन्तर्धानगतः श्रीमानिन्द्रजिद्धन्ति राघव || ६-१९-१३_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! The glorious Indrajit, having propitiated the God of Fire, strikes his
enemy while remaining invisible in the battle field with a huge battle array (on both sides)"_END

B_6_C_20_6
BEGIN_
शार्दूलस्य वचः श्रुत्वा रावणो राक्षसेश्वरः |
उवाच सहसा व्यग्रः सम्प्रधार्यार्थमात्मनः || ६-२०-८
शुकम् नाम तदा रक्षो वाक्यमर्थविदाम् वरम् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Shardula's words Ravana the lord of demons was perturbed and immediately
determined his cause of action. Then he spoke the following words to a demon by name, Shuka the
foremost among those who know their duty._END

B_6_C_18_16
BEGIN_
राक्षसो जिह्मया बुद्ध्या संदिष्टोऽय मिहागतः ||६-१८-१८
प्रहर्तुम् त्वयि विश्वस्ते विश्वस्ते मयि वानघ |
लक्ष्मणे वा महाबाहो स बध्यः सचिवैः सह ||६-१८-१९
रावणस्य नृशंसस्य भ्राता ह्येष विभीषणः |_END
BEGIN_
"O, the mighty armed Rama! The faultless one! This demon is being sent to kill you
who are unsuspecting, or to kill Lakshmana or me in trust. He came here with a crooked mind. He
with his counselors is fit to be imprisoned. Is not Vibhishana the brother of cruel Ravana?"_END

B_6_C_17_38
BEGIN_
शत्रोः सकाशात् सम्प्राप्तः सर्वथा शन्क्य एव हि |
विश्वास योग्यः सहसा न कर्तव्यो विभीषणः ||६-१७-३९_END
BEGIN_
"Vibhishana who came from an enemy is indeed to be doubted by all means. He is not
to be made as a trust worthy person so soon."_END

B_6_C_21_0
BEGIN_
ततः सागरवेलायाम् दर्भानास्तीर्य राघवः |
अञ्जलिम् प्राङ्मुखः कृत्वा प्रतिशिश्ये महोदधेः || ६-२१-१
बाहुम् भुजङ्गभोगाभमुपधायारिसूदनः |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter Rama, the annihilator of enemies, spreading sacred grass on the sea
shore, making a respectful salutation (by joining his palms) to the great ocean with his face
turned eastward, lied down with his arm, resembling the body of a snake , as his pillow._END

B_6_C_19_12
BEGIN_
महोदरमहापार्स्वौ राक्षसश्चाप्यकम्पनः |
अवीकपास्तु तप्यैते लोकपालसमा युधि || ६-१९-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Mahodara and Mahaparsva along with a demon called Akampana who are equal to the
guardians of the world in battle - they are the commanders of his army."_END

B_6_C_20_7
BEGIN_
सुग्रीवम् ब्रूहि गत्वाशु राजानम् वचनान्मनु || ६-२०-९
यथासंदेशमक्लीबम् शल्क्स्णया परया गिरा |_END
BEGIN_
"Going quickly, speak fearlessly to king Sugriva on my behalf, according to my
command, in an excellent and gentle voice, as follows:"_END

B_6_C_18_17
BEGIN_
एवमुक्त्वा रघुश्रेष्टं सुग्रीवो वाहिनीपतिः || ६-१८-२०
वाक्यज्ञो वाक्यकुशलं ततो मौनमुपागमत् |_END
BEGIN_
Speaking thus to Rama, the best of Raghu dynasty, Sugreeva who knew the mode of
expression, thereafter kept silent._END

B_6_C_17_39
BEGIN_
चादयित्वा आत्म भावम् हि चरन्ति शठ बुद्धयः |
प्रहरन्ति च रन्ध्रेषु सो अनर्थः सुमहान् भवेत् ||६-१७-४०_END
BEGIN_
"Deceitful persons move around, concealing their peculiar nature and attack at weak
places. They will create a very great misfortune."_END

B_6_C_21_1
BEGIN_
मणिकाञ्चनकेयूरमुक्ताप्रवरभूषणैः || ६-२१-२
भुजैः परमनारीणामभिमृष्टमनेकधा || ६-२१-३_END
BEGIN_
His arm formerly adorned with armlets of gems and gold and the most excellent jewels
of pearls, was touched more than once, by excellent women ( Kausalya and other mothers or by royal
maids)._END

B_6_C_19_13
BEGIN_
दशकोटिसहस्राणि रक्षसाम् कामरूपिणाम् |
मांसशोणितभक्ष्याणाम् लङ्कापुरनिवासिनाम् || ६-१९-१५_END
BEGIN_
"In the city of Lanka, are residing ten thousand crore demons, who can assume any
form at will and who consume flesh and blood as their staple food"_END

B_6_C_20_8
BEGIN_
त्वम् वै महारज कुलप्रसूतो |
महाबलश्चर्क्षरजःसुतश्च |
न कश्चनार्थस्तव वास्त्यनर्थ |
स्तथापि मे भ्रातृसमो हरीश || ६-२०-१०_END
BEGIN_
O, great king! You are indeed born in a noble family, possessor of a great strength
and are a son of Riksharaja. No gain whatsoever or any harm will accrue to you (from this battle)
.O, lord of monkeys! Nevertheless, you are like a brother to me."_END

B_6_C_18_18
BEGIN_
स सुग्रीवस्य तद् वाक्यय्म् रामः श्रुत्वा विमृश्य च ||६-१८-२१
ततः शुभतरम् वाक्यम् उवाच हरि पुम्गवम् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Sugreeva, Rama pondered over the words and thereafter spoke
more auspicious words to Sugreeva as follows:_END

B_6_C_17_40
BEGIN_
अर्थ अनर्थौ विनिश्चित्य व्यवसायम् भजेत ह |
गुणतः सम्ग्रहम् कुर्याद् दोषतस् तु विसर्जयेत् ||६-१७-४१_END
BEGIN_
"One must take a decision, after ascertaining the pros and cons of it. One should
take up the action, if there is an advantage and reject it, if it is faulty."_END

B_6_C_21_2
BEGIN_
चन्दनागुरुभिश्चैव पुरस्तादभिसेवितम् || ६-२१-४
बालसूर्यप्रकाशैश्च चन्दनैरुपशोभितम् |_END
BEGIN_
Formerly, his arm used to be tended with sandalwood and aloe and with saffron pastes
and made beautiful like the splendor of a rising sun._END

B_6_C_19_14
BEGIN_
स तैस्तु सहितो राजा लोकपालानयोधयत् |
सह देवैस्तु ते भग्ना रावणेन दुरात्मना || ६-१९-१६_END
BEGIN_
"King Ravana along with those demons made war against the guardians of the earth.
Those guardians of the earth along with the celestials were defeated by the wicked Ravana."_END

B_6_C_20_9
BEGIN_
अहम् यद्यहरम् भार्याम् राजपुत्रस्य धीमतः |
किम् तत्र तव सुग्रीव किश्किन्धाम् प्रति गम्यताम् || ६-२०-११_END
BEGIN_
"What does it matter to you, if I have embezzled the wife of a wise prince?
(Therefore) return to Kishkindha"_END

B_6_C_18_19
BEGIN_
सुदुष्टो वा अपि अदुष्टो वा किम् एष रजनी चरः ||६-१८-२२
सूक्ष्मम् अपि अहितम् कर्तुम् मम अशक्तः कथंचन |_END
BEGIN_
"What does it matter whether that demon is very bad or not bad? He is incapable of
doing even a little harm to me."_END

B_6_C_17_41
BEGIN_
यदि दोषो महांस् तस्मिंस् त्यज्यताम् अविशन्कितम् |
गुणान् वा अपि बहून् ज्ञात्वा सम्ग्रहः क्रियताम् नृप ||६-१७-४२_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! If there are great faults in him, let him be rejected undoubtedly. If we
recognize many good qualities in him, let him be accepted."_END

B_6_C_21_3
BEGIN_
शयने चोत्तमाङ्गेन सीतायाः शोभितम् पुरा || ६-२१-५
तक्षकस्येव सम्भोगम् गङ्गाजलनिषेवितम् |_END
BEGIN_
In the past, the aforesaid arm was graced by the head of Seetha on the couch. It
resembled the body of Takshaka. (A snake) supported on the water of the Ganga._END

B_6_C_20_10
BEGIN_
न हीयम् हरिभिर्लङ्का प्राप्तुम् शक्या कथम् चन |
देवैरपि सगन्धर्वैः किम् पुनर्नरवानरैः || ६-२०-१२_END
BEGIN_
"This Lanka cannot be reached by monkeys in any way. It cannot be acquired even by
celestials and Gandharvas (celestial musicians), why to talk about men and monkeys?"_END

B_6_C_19_15
BEGIN_
विभीषणस्य तु वचस्तछ्रुत्वा रघुसत्तमः |
अन्वीक्ष्य मनसा सर्वमिदम् वचनमब्रवीत् || ६-१९-१७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the aforesaid words of Vibhishana, Rama scrutinized them all attentively and
spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_18_20
BEGIN_
पिशाचान् दानवान् यक्षान् पृथिव्याम् चैव राक्षसान् ||६-१८-२३
अन्गुलि अग्रेण तान् हन्याम् इच्चन् हरि गण ईश्वर |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Sugreeva, Lord of monkey-troops! If I wish, I can kill those devilish beings,
demons, supernatural beings and ogres living on earth with just a tip of my finger"_END

B_6_C_17_42
BEGIN_
शरभस् त्व् अथ निश्चित्य सार्थम् वचनम् अब्रवीत् |
क्षिप्रम् अस्मिन् नर व्याघ्र चारः प्रतिविधीयताम् ||६-१७-४३_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter Sharabha on his part spoke the following meaningful and decisive words:
"O, tiger among men! Let a spy be sent to shadow him"_END

B_6_C_21_4
BEGIN_
सम्गे युगसम्काशम् शत्रूणाम् शोकवर्धनम् | ६-२१-६
सुह्ऱ्^दाम् नन्दनम् दीर्घम् सागरान्तव्यपाश्रयम् |_END
BEGIN_
The aforesaid arm resembled a yoke. It enhanced the grief of his enemies in battle.
It was delightful to his friends. It is now placed at the shore of the sea._END

B_6_C_20_11
BEGIN_
स तदा राक्षसेन्द्रेण संदिष्टो रजनीचरः |
शुको विहम्गमो भूत्वा तूर्णमाप्लुत्य चाम्बरम् || ६-२०-१३_END
BEGIN_
Then Shuka the demon heralded by Ravana turned himself into the form of a bird and
quickly flew into the sky._END

B_6_C_18_21
BEGIN_
श्रूयते हि कपोतेन शत्रुः शरणम् आगतः ||६-१८-२४
अर्चितः च यथा न्यायम् स्वैः च मांसैर् निमन्त्रितः |_END
BEGIN_
"It is narrated how by a dove, its enemy ( a fowler) when it came for a refuge, was
received according to rules of hospitality and was invited for a feast with its own flesh."_END

B_6_C_19_16
BEGIN_
यानि कर्मापदानानि रावणस्य विभीषण |
अख्यातानि च तत्त्वेन ह्यवगच्चामि तान्यहम् || ६-१९-१८_END
BEGIN_
"O, Vibhishana! I indeed know those feats standing to the credit of Ravana, which
were told by you, as true."_END

B_6_C_17_43
BEGIN_
प्रणिधाय हि चारेण यथावत् सूक्ष्म बुद्धिना |
परीक्ष्य च ततः कार्यो यथा न्यायम् परिग्रहः ||६-१७-४४_END
BEGIN_
"By sending out a spy and causing a suitable investigation by a keenly intellectual
spy, he can then be accepted as per justice."_END

B_6_C_21_5
BEGIN_
अस्यता च पुनः सव्यम् ज्याघातविगतत्वचम् |
दक्षिणो कक्षिणम् बहुम् महापरिघसम्निभम् || ६-२१-७
गोसहस्रप्रदातारम् ह्युपधाय भुजम् महत् |
अद्य मे मरणम् वाथ तरणम् सागरस्य वा || ६-२१-८
इति रामो धृतिम् कृत्वा महाबाहुर्महोदधिम् |
अधिशिश्ये च विधिवत्प्रयतोऽत्र स्थितो मुनिः || ६-२१-९_END
BEGIN_
The aforesaid arm whose skin had been hardened by the strokes of the bow string, off
the left arm resembling a great mace and that mighty right arm that bestowed thousands of cows in
charity was used as a pillow. Rama, the competent man and the mighty armed said: " Either crossing
of the ocean or a death should occur to me today". Making that resolve he laid down by the ocean,
restraining his speech and with a pious disposition according to tradition._END

B_6_C_20_12
BEGIN_
स गत्वा दूरमध्वानमुपर्युपरि सागरम् |
संस्थितो ह्यम्बरे वाक्यम् सुग्रीव मदिमब्रवीत् || ६-२०-१४_END
BEGIN_
Proceeding in the sky for a distance continuously over the ocean, Shuka then stood
up in the sky itself and spoke these words to Sugriva:_END

B_6_C_18_22
BEGIN_
स हि तम् प्रतिजग्राह भार्या हर्तारम् आगतम् ||६-१८-२५
कपोतो वानर श्रेष्ठ किम् पुनर् मद् विधो जनः |_END
BEGIN_
"O, the excellent of monkeys! The aforesaid dove indeed accepted as a guest, the
fowler as he came, although he killed its wife .How much more a man like me has to do?"_END

B_6_C_19_17
BEGIN_
अहम् हत्वा दशग्रीवम् सप्रहस्तम् सहात्मजम् |
राजानम् त्वाम् करिष्यामि सत्यमेतच्छृणोतु मे || ६-१९-१९_END
BEGIN_
"After killing Ravana along with Prahasta and his son (Indrajit), I will make you
the king. Hear this truth from me."_END

B_6_C_17_44
BEGIN_
जाम्बवांस् त्व् अथ सम्प्रेक्ष्य शास्त्र बुद्ध्या विचक्षणः |
वाक्यम् विज्ञापयाम् आस गुणवद् दोष वर्जितम् ||६-१७-४५_END
BEGIN_
Then, the discerning Jambavan on his part, perceiving the matter through his
learning derived from scriptures, advised the following fault-less and qualitative words:_END

B_6_C_21_6
BEGIN_
तस्य रामस्य सुप्तस्य कुश आस्तीर्णे मही तले |
नियमाद् अप्रमत्तस्य निशास् तिस्रो अतिचक्रमुः || ६-२१-१०_END
BEGIN_
Following the scriptural injunction, that Rama who was devoted to his sacred vow,
while sleeping on the ground spread with Kusha grass, spent a time of three nights there._END

B_6_C_20_13
BEGIN_
सर्वमुक्तम् यथादिष्टम् रावणेन दुरात्मना |
तत्प्रपयन्तम् वचनम् तूर्णमाप्लुत्य वानराः || ६-२०-१५
प्रापद्यन्त तदा क्षिप्रम् लोप्तुम् हन्तुम् च मुष्टिभिः |_END
BEGIN_
Shuka repeated all the words the wicked Ravana had told him to say to Sugriva. As he
was still speaking, the monkeys bounded into the air to reach him at that moment quickly to tear
off his wings and to smite him by their fists._END

B_6_C_18_23
BEGIN_
ऋषेः कण्वस्य पुत्रेण कण्डुना परम ऋषिणा ||६-१८-२६
शृणु गाथाम् पुरा गीताम् धर्मिष्ठाम् सत्य वादिना |_END
BEGIN_
"Hear the verses inculcating virtue so long ago, by Kandu, the son of a sage called
Kanva, a great sage and a speaker of truth."_END

B_6_C_19_18
BEGIN_
रसातलम् वा प्रविशेत्पातालम् वापि रावणः |
पितामहसकाशम् वा न मे जीवन्विमोक्ष्यते || ६-१९-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Ravana may well plunge into Rasaatala (the penultimate subterranean region) or even
Paataala (the nethermost subterranean region) or seek the presence of Brahma and he will not be
left alive by me."_END

B_6_C_17_45
BEGIN_
बद्ध वैराच् च पापाच् च राक्षस इन्द्राद् विभीषणः |
अदेश काले सम्प्राप्तः सर्वथा शन्क्यताम् अयम् ||६-१७-४६_END
BEGIN_
"This Vibhishana came from sinful Ravana who has contracted hostility with you and
that too at a wrong place and time. He is to be suspected by all means."_END

B_6_C_21_7
BEGIN_
स त्रिरात्रोषितस्तत्र नयज्ञो धर्मवत्सलः |
उपासत तदा रामः सागरम् सरिताम् पतिम् || ६-२१-११_END
BEGIN_
Remaining there for three nights, Rama who was skilled in policy and fond of piety,
waited upon the ocean, the lord of rivers._END

B_6_C_20_14
BEGIN_
सर्वैः प्लवण्गैः प्रसभम् निगृहीतो निशाचरह् || ६-२०-१६
गगनाद्भूतले चाशु प्रतिगृह्यावतारितः |_END
BEGIN_
The demon thus attacked was forcibly seized by all the monkeys and immediately
brought down to the ground from the sky._END

B_6_C_18_24
BEGIN_
बद्ध अन्जलि पुटम् दीनम् याचन्तम् शरण आगतम् ||६-१८-२७
न हन्याद् आनृशंस्य अर्थम् अपि शत्रुम् परम् पत |_END
BEGIN_
"O, king the terminator of enemies! Even an enemy, who formed a cup with his
hollowed hands, a miserable person, a person who is begging and who is seeking a refuge should not
be killed with the aim of not being cruel."_END

B_6_C_19_19
BEGIN_
अहत्वा रावणम् सम्ख्ये सपुत्रजनबान्धवम् |
अयोध्याम् न प्रवेक्ष्यामि त्रिभिस्तैर्भ्रतृभिः शपेः || ६-१९-२१_END
BEGIN_
"I will not enter Ayodhya without killing Ravana together with his sons, companions
and relatives in battle. I take oath on my three brothers."_END

B_6_C_17_46
BEGIN_
ततो मैन्दस् तु सम्प्रेक्ष्य नय अपनय कोविदः |
वाक्यम् वचन सम्पन्नो बभाषे हेतुमत्तरम् ||६-१७-४७_END
BEGIN_
Then Mainda, skilled in discriminating good and bad conduct in others observed the
matter carefully and spoke in his perfect oratory in the following highly reasonable words:_END

B_6_C_21_8
BEGIN_
न च दर्शयते मन्दस् तदा रामस्य सागरः |
प्रयतेन अपि रामेण यथा अर्हम् अभिपूजितः || ६-२१-१२_END
BEGIN_
Though honored according to his worth by the self subdued Rama, the careless ocean
did not appear in his personal form to Rama._END

B_6_C_20_15
BEGIN_
वानरैः पीड्यमानस्तु शुको वचनमब्रवीत् || ६-२०-१७
न दूतान् घ्नन्ति काकुत्थ्स वार्यन्ताम् साधु वानराः |_END
BEGIN_
Shuka being harassed by monkeys spoke the following words: "O, Rama! Messengers are
not to be killed. Let your monkeys be restrained properly."_END

B_6_C_22_0
BEGIN_
अथोवाच रघुश्रेष्ठः सागरम् दारुणम् वचः |
अद्य त्वाम् शोषयिष्यामि सपातालम् महार्णव || २-२२-१_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama spoke these harsh words to the ocean: "O, ocean! I will make you dry up
now along with your nethermost subterranean region."_END

B_6_C_18_25
BEGIN_
अर्तो वा यदि वा दृप्तः परेषाम् शरणम् गतः ||६-१८-२८
अरिः प्राणान् परित्यज्य रक्षितव्यः कृत आत्मना |_END
BEGIN_
"An enemy who comes for protection against others, even if the aforesaid enemy is
oppressed or arrogant, is to be protected by one who has a disciplined mind, even by abandoning
one's life."_END

B_6_C_19_20
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा तु वचनम् तस्य रामस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः |
शिरसा वन्द्य धर्मात्मा वक्तुमेव प्रचक्रमे || ६-१९-२२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of that Rama, who was unwearied in action, the right minded
Vibhishana saluted him by bowing his head and started telling as follows:_END

B_6_C_17_47
BEGIN_
अनुहो नाम तस्य एष रावणस्य विभीषणः |
पृच्च्यताम् मधुरेण अयम् शनैर् नर वर ईश्वर ||६-१७-४८_END
BEGIN_
"O, king of kings! This Vibhishana is indeed the younger brother of that Ravana. Let
him be questioned slowly by sweet words"_END

B_6_C_21_9
BEGIN_
समुद्रस्य ततः क्रुद्धो रामो रक्त अन्त लोचनः |
समीपस्थम् उवाच इदम् लक्ष्मणम् शुभ लक्ष्मणम् || ६-२१-१३_END
BEGIN_
Rama becoming angry with the ocean, having the outer corners of his eyes turned red,
spoke those words to Lakshmana, having auspicious marks, who was in his vicinity:_END

B_6_C_20_16
BEGIN_
यस्तु हित्वा मतम् भर्तुः स्वमतम् सम्प्रभाषते || ६-२०-१८
अनुक्तवादी दूतः सन्न् स दूतो वधमर्हति |_END
BEGIN_
"That messenger, who by abandoning the opinion of his king will speak about his own
opinion though he being a messenger and he who on the other hand speaks that which was not told to
him, that messenger is indeed fit to be killed."_END

B_6_C_22_1
BEGIN_
शरनिर्दग्धतोयस्य परिशुष्कस्य सागर |
मया निहतसत्त्वस्य पांसुरुत्पद्यते महान् || २-२२-२_END
BEGIN_
"O, Ocean! A vast stretch of sand will appear, when your water gets consumed by my
arrows; when you get dried up and the creatures inhabiting you get destroyed by me."_END

B_6_C_18_26
BEGIN_
स चेद् भयाद् वा मोहाद् वा कामाद् वा अपि न रक्षति ||६-१८-२९
स्वया शक्त्या यथा तत्त्वम् तत् पापम् लोक गर्हितम् |_END
BEGIN_
"If he does not protect rightly through his strength, by fear or by ignorance or by
desire, it is a sin to be reproached by the world."_END

B_6_C_19_21
BEGIN_
राक्षसानाम् वधे साह्यम् लंकायाः च प्रधर्षणे |
करिष्यामि यथा प्राणम् प्रवेक्ष्यामि च वाहिनीम् || ६-१९-२३_END
BEGIN_
"I will extend my help in killing the demons and in attacking the city of Lanka.
According to my strength, I will also penetrate into the army of the adversary to fight."_END

B_6_C_17_48
BEGIN_
भावम् अस्य तु विज्ञाय ततस् तत्त्वम् करिष्यसि |
यदि दृष्टो न दुष्टो वा बुद्धि पूर्वम् नरषभ ||६-१७-४९_END
BEGIN_
"O, the best among men! Having read actually his mind whether he is dangerous or
not, you should act according to your feelings."_END

B_6_C_21_10
BEGIN_
अवलेपम् समुद्रस्य न दर्शयति यत् स्वयम् |
प्रशमः च क्षमा चैव आर्जवम् प्रिय वादिता || ६-२१-१४
असामर्थ्यम् फलन्ति एते निर्गुणेषु सताम् गुणाः |_END
BEGIN_
"O, what arrogance of the ocean, who does not appear himself personally before me!
Indeed calmness, forbearance kind spoken ness and straight -forwardness- these qualities of noble
men give weak results, when directed towards those having no virtues."_END

B_6_C_20_17
BEGIN_
शुकस्य वचनम् रामः श्रुत्वा तु परिदेवितम् || ६-२०-१९
उवाच मा वधिस्टेति घ्नतः शाखामृगर्षभान् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Shuka's complaining words, Rama spoke to the foremost of monkeys, who were
beating him as aforesaid, saying "Do not kill him"_END

B_6_C_22_2
BEGIN_
मत्कार्मुकनिसृष्टेन शरवर्षेण सागर |
परम् तीरम् गमिष्यन्ति पद्भिरेव प्लवङ्गमाः || २-२२-३_END
BEGIN_
"By a gush of arrows released by my bow, our monkeys can proceed to the other shore
even by foot; O, ocean!"_END

B_6_C_18_27
BEGIN_
विनष्टः पश्यतस् तस्य रक्षिणः शरण आगतः ||६-१८-३०
आदाय सुकृतम् तस्य सर्वम् गच्चेद् अरक्षितः |_END
BEGIN_
"If having not been protected, a refugee dies before the eyes of a man who is able
to protect him, the former takes along all his moral merit and goes."_END

B_6_C_19_22
BEGIN_
इति ब्रुवाणम् रामस् तु परिष्वज्य विभीषणम् |
अब्रवील् लक्ष्मणम् प्रीतः समुद्राज् जलम् आनय || ६-१९-२४_END
BEGIN_
Rama on his part, duly delighted, embraced Vibhishana who was speaking as aforesaid
and spoke to Lakshmana as follows: "Bring some water from the ocean."_END

B_6_C_17_49
BEGIN_
अथ संस्कार सम्पन्नो हनूमान् सचिव उत्तमः |
उवाच वचनम् श्लक्ष्णम् अर्थवन् मधुरम् लघु ||६-१७-५०_END
BEGIN_
Then the well educated Hanuman, the excellent among counselors; spoke the following
smooth meaningful, sweet and brief words:_END

B_6_C_21_11
BEGIN_
आत्म प्रशंसिनम् दुष्टम् धृष्टम् विपरिधावकम् || ६-२१-१५
सर्वत्र उत्सृष्ट दण्डम् च लोकः सत् कुरुते नरम् |_END
BEGIN_
"This world honors that man, who boasts himself, is corrupt and shameless, runs
about in all directions advertising himself and commits every kind of excess"_END

B_6_C_20_18
BEGIN_
स च पत्रलघुद्भूत्वा हरिभिर्दर्शितेऽभये || ६-२०-२०
अन्तरिक्षे स्थितो भूत्वा पुनर्वचन मब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Perceiving no fear from monkeys, Shuka became light winged, virtually standing in
the sky and spoke again the following words._END

B_6_C_22_3
BEGIN_
विचिन्वन्नाभिजानासि पौरुषम् वापि विक्रमम् |
दाव्नवालय सम्तापम् मत्तो नाम गमिष्यसि || २-२२-४_END
BEGIN_
"O, Sea the abode of demons! You are not able to recognize my valor or prowess
through your intelligence .You will indeed get repentance at my hands."_END

B_6_C_18_28
BEGIN_
एवम् दोषो महान् अत्र प्रपन्नानाम् अरक्षणे ||६-१८-३१
अस्वर्ग्यम् च अयशस्यम् च बल वीर्य विनाशनम्_END
BEGIN_
"In not protecting thus the persons who take refuge, there is a great blemish
involved in it. It does not bestow heaven. It destroys reputation. It devastates strength and
valor"_END

B_6_C_19_23
BEGIN_
तेन च इमम् महाप्राज्ञम् अभिषिन्च विभीषणम् |
राजानम् रक्षसाम् क्षिप्रम् प्रसन्ने मयि मानद || ६-१९-२५_END
BEGIN_
"O, Lakshmana who bestows honor on others! Quickly consecrate as a king of demons
this greatly intelligent Vibhishana with that water, so that I am pleased."_END

B_6_C_17_50
BEGIN_
न भवन्तम् मति श्रेष्ठम् समर्थम् वदताम् वरम् |
अतिशाययितुम् शक्तो बृहस्पतिर् अपि ब्रुवन् ||६-१७-५१_END
BEGIN_
"Even Brihaspati, while talking cannot excel you, who are possessing an exalted
intellect. You are powerful and the foremost man among those who are eloquent."_END

B_6_C_21_12
BEGIN_
न साम्ना शक्यते कीर्तिर् न साम्ना शक्यते यशः || ६-२१-१६
प्राप्तुम् लक्ष्मण लोके अस्मिन् जयो वा रण मूधनि |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Lakshmana! In this world, it is not possible to obtain fame, glory or victory at
the end of a battle, by conciliation"_END

B_6_C_20_19
BEGIN_
सुग्रीव सत्त्वसम्पन्न महाबलपराक्रम || ६-२०-२१
किम् मया खलु नक्तव्यो रावणो लोकरावणः |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Sugriva, rich in courage and possessing great strength and valor! What am I to
tell Ravana, whose nature is to cause world to cry?"_END

B_6_C_18_29
BEGIN_
करिष्यामि यथा अर्थम् तु कण्डोर् वचनम् उत्तमम् ||६-१८-३२
धर्मिष्ठम् च यशस्यम् च स्वर्ग्यम् स्यात् तु फल उदये |_END
BEGIN_
"I will follow the excellent words of Kandu. It becomes a very righteous thing,
gives reputation, leads to heaven and the rewards appear consequently."_END

B_6_C_22_4
BEGIN_
ब्राह्मेणास्त्रेण सम्योज्य ब्रह्मदण्डनिभम् शरम् |
सम्योज्य धनुषि श्रे ष्ठे विचकर्ष महाबलः || २-२२-५_END
BEGIN_
"Fixing an arrow resembling the Rod of Brahma (the creator) charged with a missile
(presided over by Brahama) to his excellent bow, the exceedingly powerful Rama stretched it towards
the sea."_END

B_6_C_19_24
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्तस् तु सौमित्रिर् अभ्यषिन्चद् विभीषणम् |
मध्ये वानर मुख्यानाम् राजानम् राम शासनात् || ६-१९-२६_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Rama's words, Lakshmana consecrated Vibhishana as a king, as per the royal
instructions, amidst the leaders of monkeys._END

B_6_C_17_51
BEGIN_
न वादान् न अपि सम्घर्षान् न आधिक्यान् न च कामतः |
वक्ष्यामि वचनम् राजन् यथा अर्थम् राम गौरवात् ||६-१७-५२_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! O, Rama! I am talking neither for argument, nor for competition (with
other counselors, nor for superiority, nor out of passion for debate but on account of importance
of this matter in hand."_END

B_6_C_21_13
BEGIN_
अद्य मद् बाण निर्भिन्नैर् मकरैर् मकर आलयम् |
निरुद्ध तोयम् सौमित्रे प्लवद्भिः पश्य सर्वतः || ६-२१-१७_END
BEGIN_
"O, Lakshmana! Behold now this ocean, having its water made suffocated soon with its
crocodiles floated on all sides and broken asunder by my arrows"._END

B_6_C_20_20
BEGIN_
स एवमुक्तः प्लवगाधिपस्तदा |
प्लवङ्गमानामृषभो महाबलः |
उवाच वाक्यम् रजनीचरस्य |
चारम् शुकम् शुद्ध मदीनसत्त्वः || ६-२०-२२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the aforesaid words, the mightily strong Sugriva the king of monkeys and the
foremost among them, with a merciless mind then spoke to the blame less Shuka, Ravana's spy, as
follows:_END

B_6_C_18_30
BEGIN_
सकृद् एव प्रपन्नाय तव अस्मि इति च याचते ||६-१८-३३
अभयम् सर्व भूतेभ्यो ददामि एतद् व्रतम् मम |_END
BEGIN_
"He who seeks refuge in me just once, telling me that �I am yours', I shall give him
assurance of safety against all types of beings. This is my solemn pledge"_END

B_6_C_22_5
BEGIN_
तस्मिन्विकृष्टे सहसा राघवेण शरासने |
रोदसी सम्पफालेव पर्वताश्च चकम्पिरे || २-२२-६_END
BEGIN_
While Rama was stretching that bow, both the heaven and earth suddenly seemed to be
split asunder. Mountains also were shaken._END

B_6_C_19_25
BEGIN_
तम् प्रसादम् तु रामस्य दृष्ट्वा सद्यः प्लवम् गमाः |
प्रचुक्रुशुर् महानादान् साधु साध्व् इति च अब्रुवन् || ६-१९-२७_END
BEGIN_
Perceiving that instant graciousness in Rama, the monkeys cried, proclaiming
"excellent, excellent" about the high soled Rama._END

B_6_C_17_52
BEGIN_
अर्थ अनर्थ निमित्तम् हि यद् उक्तम् सचिवैस् तव |
तत्र दोषम् प्रपश्यामि क्रिया न हि उपपद्यते ||६-१७-५३_END
BEGIN_
"I am perceiving an error in what was advised by your counselors assigned to look
into advantages and disadvantages, accruing from accepting Vibhishana. It is not possible for such
a judicious investigation into his character."_END

B_6_C_21_14
BEGIN_
भोगामः च पश्य नागानाम् मया भिन्नानि लक्ष्मण || ६-२१-१८
महाभोगानि मत्स्यानाम् करिणाम् च करान् इह |_END
BEGIN_
"See here, O, Lakshmana, the coils of water snakes, the huge bodies of alligators
and the trunks of sea elephants being shattered by me."_END

B_6_C_20_21
BEGIN_
स मेऽसि मित्रम् व तथानुकम्प्यो |
न चोपकर्तासि न मे प्रियोऽपि |
अरिश्च रामस्य सहानुबन्ध |
स्ततोऽसि वालीव वधार्ह वध्यः || ६-२०-२३_END
BEGIN_
"O, Ravana, worthy of killing! You are not my companion. You are not worthy of
sympathy. You are not the person who helped me in any way. I do not like you, as you are Rama's
enemy. Hence, You are worthy to be killed like Vali, along with your associates"_END

B_6_C_23_0
BEGIN_
निमित्तानि निमित्तज्ञो दृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः |
सौमित्रिम् सम्परिष्वज्य इदम् वचनम्ब्रवीत् || ६-२१-१_END
BEGIN_
Rama, who was well acquainted with portents, on seeing the portents around, embraced
Lakshmana and spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_18_31
BEGIN_
आनय एनम् हरि श्रेष्ठ दत्तम् अस्य अभयम् मया ||६-१८-३४
विभीषणो वा सुग्रीव यदि वा रावणः स्वयम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Sugreeva, the chief of monkeys! Let him either be Vibhishana or even Ravana
himself; I have given an assurance of safety to him. Bring him here."_END

B_6_C_22_6
BEGIN_
तमश्च लोकमावव्रे दिशश्च न चकाशिरे |
प्रतिचुक्षुभिरे चाशु सरांसि सरितस्तदा || २-२२-७_END
BEGIN_
Darkness enveloped the world. All the quarters were obscured. Lakes and rivers were
soon agitated._END

B_6_C_19_26
BEGIN_
अब्रवीच् च हनूमामः च सुग्रीवः च विभीषणम् |
कथम् सागरम् अक्षोभ्यम् तराम वरुण आलयम् || ६-१९-२८
सैन्यैः परिवृताः सर्वे वानराणाम् महौजसाम् |_END
BEGIN_
Hanuman and Sugreeva asked Vibhishana as follows: " How can we cross the
imperturbable ocean, the habitation of Varuna, the god of water by all of us along with our army of
monkeys possessing a great splendor?"_END

B_6_C_17_53
BEGIN_
ऋते नियोगात् सामर्थ्यम् अवबोद्धुम् न शक्यते |
सहसा विनियोगो हि दोषवान् प्रतिभाति मे ||६-१७-५४_END
BEGIN_
"Without entrusting any work, it is not possible to understand his ability. But at
the same time, it occurs to me as a mistake to entrust any work so soon to a stranger."_END

B_6_C_21_15
BEGIN_
सशन्ख शुक्तिका जालम् समीन मकरम् शरैः || ६-२१-१९
अद्य युद्धेन महता समुद्रम् परिशोषये |_END
BEGIN_
"I will make the ocean with its multitude of conches, oyster shells, fishes and
crocodiles, dry up now in this great battle"_END

B_6_C_20_22
BEGIN_
निहन्म्यहम् त्वाम् ससुतम् सबन्धुम् |
सज्ञातिवर्गम् रजनीचरेश |
लङ्काम् च सर्वाम् महता बलेन |
सर्वैः करिष्यामि समेत्य भस्म || ६-२०-२४_END
BEGIN_
"O, the king of demons! I am killing you along with your sons, relatives and other
kinsfolk. Arriving with a great army, I will reduce the entire Lanka and all of you to ashes."_END

B_6_C_23_1
BEGIN_
परिगृह्योदकम् शीतम् वनानि फलवन्ति च |
बलौ घम् सम्विभज्येमम् व्यूह्य तिष्ठेम लक्ष्मण || ६-२१-२_END
BEGIN_
"O, Lakshmana! Acquiring this region endowed with cold water and woods abounding in
fruits, let us speedily divide this multitude of forces into battalions and drawing it up in battle
array, we shall stand attentive."_END

B_6_C_18_32
BEGIN_
रामस्य वचनम् श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवः प्लवग ईश्वरः ||६-१८-३५
प्रत्यभाषत काकुत्स्थम् सौहार्देन अभिचोदितः |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Rama' s words, Sugreeva the lord of monkeys, overwhelmed as he was with
cordial friendship, replied to Rama as follows:_END

B_6_C_22_7
BEGIN_
तिर्यक् च सह नक्षत्रैः सम्गतौ चन्द्रभास्करौ |
भास्करांशुभिरादीप्तम् तमसा च समावृतम् || २-२२-८
प्रचकाशे तदाकाशमुल्काशतविदीपितम् |
अन्तरिक्षाच्च निर्घाता निर्जग्मुरतुलस्वनाः || २-२२-९_END
BEGIN_
The moon sun and the stars moved obliquely and though the sun's rays lighted the
sky, it was enveloped by darkness and shined with a blaze of hundreds of meteors while thunders
reverberated with an unparalleled sound in the sky._END

B_6_C_19_27
BEGIN_
उपायैर् अभिगच्चामो यथा नद नदी पतिम् || ६-१९-२९
तराम तरसा सर्वे ससैन्या वरुण आलयम् |_END
BEGIN_
"In what manner shall we along with the army swiftly cross the sea, the lord of
streams and rivers, and arrive at that strategy?"_END

B_6_C_17_54
BEGIN_
चार प्रणिहितम् युक्तम् यद् उक्तम् सचिवैस् तव |
अर्थस्य असम्भवात् तत्र कारणम् न उपपद्यते ||६-१७-५५_END
BEGIN_
"What ever was told by your counselors that it was befitting to send spies to
Vibhishana, that action is not possible due to impracticality of the proposition."_END

B_6_C_21_16
BEGIN_
क्षमया हि समायुक्तम् माम् अयम् मकर आलयः || ६-२१-२०
असमर्थम् विजानाति धिक् क्षमाम् ईदृशे जने |_END
BEGIN_
"This ocean is considering me as an incapable man endowed as I am with forbearance.
It is a great mistake to show forbearance to such an individual."_END

B_6_C_20_23
BEGIN_
न मोक्ष्यसे रावण राघवस्य |
सर्वैः सहेन्द्रैदपि मूढ गुप्तः |
अन्तर्हतः सूर्यपथम् गतोऽपि|
तथैव पातालमनुप्रविष्टः || ६-२०-२५
गिरीशपादम्बुजसम्गतो वा |
हतोऽसि रामेण शानुजस्त्वम् || ६-२०-२६_END
BEGIN_
"O, stupid Ravana! You along with your younger brother will not be left unkilled by
Rama, even if you are protected by all including Indra (the lord of celestials) or even if you have
disappeared (by virtue of conjuring trick) or obtained, the solar orbit or entered the nethermost
subterranean region or even if approached the lotus feet of Shiva (the lord of Kailasa
mountain)"_END

B_6_C_23_2
BEGIN_
लोकक्षयकरम् भीमम् भयम् पश्याम्युपस्थितम् |
प्रबर्हणम् प्रवीराणामृक्षवानररक्षसाम् || ६-२१-३_END
BEGIN_
"I perceive an impending danger which will be terrific, causing destruction to the
world, and torture to the eminent heroes among bears monkeys and demons."_END

B_6_C_18_33
BEGIN_
किम् अत्र चित्रम् धर्मज्ञ लोक नाथ शिखा मणे ||६-१८-३६
यत् त्वम् आर्यम् प्रभाषेथाः सत्त्ववान् सपथे स्थितः |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama, who knows righteousness, the crest jewel among lords of the world! What
surprise is there in thinking that you, duly endowed with true essence of life and established in a
right path, speak these venerable words?"_END

B_6_C_22_8
BEGIN_
वपुःप्रकर्षेण ववुर्दिव्यमारुतपङ्क्त्यः |
बभञ्ज च तदा वृक्षान् जलदानुद्वहन् मुहुः || २-२२-१०_END
BEGIN_
Series of celestial winds blew in their colossal form and the winds, then sweeping
away the clouds, tore up the trees again and again._END

B_6_C_19_28
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्तस् तु धर्मज्ञः प्रत्युवाच विभीषणः || ६-१९-३०
समुद्रम् राघवो राजा शरणम् गन्तुम् अर्हति |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing their words, the right minded Vibhishana replied as follows: "It is apt if
prince Rama seeks ocean as his refuge"_END

B_6_C_17_55
BEGIN_
अदेश काले सम्प्राप्त इति अयम् यद् विभीषणः |
विवक्षा च अत्र मे अस्ति इयम् ताम् निबोध यथा मति ||६-१७-५६_END
BEGIN_
"It has been said that Vibhishana came into a wrong place and time. In that matter,
I have to express my thought. Listen to it."_END

B_6_C_21_17
BEGIN_
स दर्शयति साम्ना मे सागरो रूपमात्मनः || ६-२१-२१
चापम् आनय सौमित्रे शरामः च आशी विष उपमान् |
समुद्रम् शोषयिष्यामि पद्भ्याम् यान्तु प्लवङ्गमाः || ६-२१-२२_END
BEGIN_
"The Ocean is not appearing himself before me on kind words. O, Lakshmana! Bring the
bow and the serpentine arrows. I shall dry up this ocean, so that our monkeys can cross it by
feet."_END

B_6_C_20_24
BEGIN_
तस्य ते त्रिषु लोकेषु न पिशाचम् न राक्षसम् |
त्रातारमनुपश्यामि न गन्धर्वम् न चासुरम् || ६-२०-२७_END
BEGIN_
"I do not see any protector to you as such in the three worlds, nor do I see any
devilish being or a demon or a Gandharva (celestial musician) or an ogre coming forward to protect
you."_END

B_6_C_23_3
BEGIN_
वाताश्च कलुषा वान्ति कम्पते च वसुन्धरा |
पर्वताग्राणि वेपन्ते पतन्ति च महीरुःआः || ६-२१-४_END
BEGIN_
"Winds are blowing with dust and earth is trembling. Mountain- tops are quivering
and trees are falling down."_END

B_6_C_22_9
BEGIN_
आरुजंश्चैव शैलाग्रान् शिखराणि बभञ्ज च |
दिवि च स्म महावेगाः सम्हताः समहास्वनाः || २-२२-११
मुमुचुर्वैद्युतानग्नींस्ते महाशनयस्तदा |_END
BEGIN_
The wind, shattering the mountain peaks, broke off the points of the rocks. Winds of
great velocity struck together in the sky and emitted flashes of radiance proceeding from lightning
with a great sound and then there were great thunders._END

B_6_C_18_34
BEGIN_
मम च अपि अन्तर् आत्मा अयम् शुद्धिम् वेत्ति विभीषणम् ||६-१८-३७
अनुमनाच् च भावाच् च सर्वतः सुपरीक्षितः |_END
BEGIN_
"My inmost spirit also feels Vibhishana to be a genuine person, he being well
examined from all angles, by act of inference and by his appearance."_END

B_6_C_19_29
BEGIN_
खानितः सगरेण अयम् अप्रमेयो महाउदधिः || ६-१९-३१
कर्तुम् अर्हति रामस्य ज्ञातेः कार्यम् महाउदधिः |_END
BEGIN_
"This immeasurable great ocean was excavated by Sagara*. Hence, this great ocean
will be inclined to do the act for Rama, his kinsman"._END

B_6_C_17_56
BEGIN_
स एष देशः कालः च भवति इह यथा तथा |
पुरुषात् पुरुषम् प्राप्य तथा दोष गुणाव् अपि ||६-१७-५७_END
BEGIN_
"This place and time become rightly obtained in his mind , as he has thought that
you are superior to Ravana and also found merits in you and demerits in Ravana."_END

B_6_C_21_18
BEGIN_
अद्य अक्षोभ्यम् अपि क्रुद्धः क्षोभयिष्यामि सागरम् |
वेलासु कृत मर्यादम् सहसा ऊर्मि समाकुलम् || ६-२१-२३
निर्मर्यादम् करिष्यामि सायकैर् वरुण आलयम् |
महार्णवम् क्षोBहयिष्ये महादानवसम्कुलम् || ६-२१-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Being provoked now, I will shake this ocean, even if it is unshakable. I will force
the ocean, which is demarcated by banks and agitated with thousands of waves, bereft of a boundary,
by my arrows. I will agitate the great ocean, thronged with great demons."_END

B_6_C_20_25
BEGIN_
अवधीस्त्वम् जरावृद्धम् गृध्राराजम् जटायुषम् |
किम् मते रामसाम्निध्ये सकाशे लक्ष्मणस्य च || ६-२०-२८
हृता सीता विशालाक्षि याम् त्वम् गृह्य न बुध्यसे |_END
BEGIN_
"You killed Jatayu, the king of vultures and who was senior to you in old age. Why
the wide-eyed Sita was not taken away in the presence of Rama and Lakshmana? Having made her
captive, you do not recognize her for what she is."_END

B_6_C_23_4
BEGIN_
मेघाः क्रव्यादसम्काशाः परुषाः परुषस्वनाः |
क्रूराः क्रूरम् प्रवर्षन्ति मिश्रम् शोणितबिन्दुभिः || ६-२१-५_END
BEGIN_
"Ferocious clouds resembling wild beasts were dirty colored and emit a terrific
roaring and let loose dreadful showers mingled with drops of blood."_END

B_6_C_22_10
BEGIN_
यानि भूतानि दृश्यानि चुक्रुशुश्चाशनेः समम् || २-२२-१२
अदृश्यानि च भूतानि मुमुचुर्भैरवस्वनम् |
शिश्यरे चाभिभूतानि सम्त्रस्ताम्यद्विजन्ति च || २-२२-१३
सम्प्रविव्यथिरे चापि न च पस्पन्दिरे भयात् |_END
BEGIN_
The visible creatures cried out along with the thunders. The invisible beings too
gave off a terrific noise. The creatures were overpowered, frightened, agitated, lied down and also
very much anguished. They did not move due to fear._END

B_6_C_18_35
BEGIN_
तस्मात् क्षिप्रम् सह अस्माभिस् तुल्यो भवतु राघव ||६-१८-३८
विभीषणो महाप्राज्ञः सखित्वम् च अभ्युपैतु नः |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! Hence, let the highly wise Vibhishana be equal among us soon together. Let
him get our friendship too"_END

B_6_C_19_30
BEGIN_
एवम् विभीषणेन उक्ते राक्षसेन विपश्चिता || ६-१९-३२
आजगामथ सुग्रीवो यत्र रामः सलक्ष्मणः |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the aforesaid words of the learned demon Vibhishana, Sugreeva came to the
place where Rama and Lakshmana were there._END

B_6_C_17_57
BEGIN_
दौरात्म्यम् रावणे दृष्ट्वा विक्रमम् च तथा त्वयि |
युक्तम् आगमनम् तस्य सदृशम् तस्य बुद्धितः ||६-१७-५८_END
BEGIN_
"It is indeed appropriate for him to arrive at this place and time, by seeing the
prowess in you and the wickedness in Ravana. It is worthy of his judgment."_END

B_6_C_21_19
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा धनुष् पाणिः क्रोध विस्फारित ईक्षणः |
बभूव रामो दुर्धर्षो युग अन्त अग्निर् इव ज्वलन् || ६-२१-२५_END
BEGIN_
Speaking as aforesaid, Rama with his eyes made larger by anger and wielding a bow
with his hand, became dreadful to look at, as a blazing fire at the end of the world._END

B_6_C_20_26
BEGIN_
महाबलम् महात्मानम् दुराधर्षम् सुरैरपि || ६-२०-२९
न बुध्यसे रघुश्रेष्ठम् यस्ते प्राणान् हरिष्यति |_END
BEGIN_
"You are unaware how strong, high soled and irresistible even to celestials, is this
Rama the excellent man of Raghu dynasty, who shall deprive you of your life."_END

B_6_C_23_5
BEGIN_
रक्तचन्दनसम्काशा संध्या परमदारुणा |
ज्वलतः प्रपतत्येतदादित्यादग्निमण्डलम् || ६-२१-६_END
BEGIN_
"Evening twilight resembling red sandal wood is very much dreadful. From the blazing
sun, balls of fire fall."_END

B_6_C_22_11
BEGIN_
सहभूतैः सतोयोर्मिः सनागः सहराक्षसः || २-२२-१४
सहसाभूत्ततो वेगाद्भीमवेगो महोदधिः |
योजनम् व्यतिचक्राम वेलामन्यत्र सम्प्लवात् || २-२२-१५_END
BEGIN_
The great ocean with its waves and water, along with its living creatures including
snakes and demons soon became possessed of a terrific velocity. Due to that speed and swelling of
waters, the ocean crossed beyond the other shore to the extent of a Yojana (eight miles)._END

B_6_C_18_36
BEGIN_
ततस् तु सुग्रीव वचो निशम्यत|
हरि ईश्वरेण अभिहितम् नर ईश्वरः |
विभीषणेन आशु जगाम सम्गमम् |
पतत्रि राजेन यथा पुरम् दरः ||६-१८-३९_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Sugreeva, Rama the king of men, as acknowledged by Sugreeva,
held meeting with Vibhishana, as Indra the lord of celestials once met Garuda the king of
birds._END

B_6_C_19_31
BEGIN_
ततश्चाख्यातुमारेभे विभीषणवचः शुभम् || ६-१९-३३
सुग्रीवो विपुलग्रीवः सागरस्योपवेशनम् |_END
BEGIN_
The long necked Sugreeva then started to tell the auspicious words of Vibhishana,
advising Rama to approach the ocean (to allow him a passage)._END

B_6_C_17_58
BEGIN_
अज्ञात रूपैः पुरुषैः स राजन् पृच्च्यताम् इति |
यद् उक्तम् अत्र मे प्रेक्षा काचिद् अस्ति समीक्षिता ||६-१७-५९_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! Whatever was told by your counselors that let Vibhishana be questioned by
spies of unknown identity, my considered view is as follows:_END

B_6_C_21_20
BEGIN_
सम्पीड्य च धनुर् घोरम् कम्पयित्वा शरैर् जगत् |
मुमोच विशिखान् उग्रान् वज्राणि इव शत क्रतुः || ६-२१-२६_END
BEGIN_
Swaying his terrific bow and making the earth tremble by his violence Rama released
the arrow resembling a powerful thunderbolt of Indra. (god of celestials)._END

B_6_C_24_0
BEGIN_
सा वीरसमिती राज्ञा विरराज व्यवस्थिता |
शशिना शुभिनक्षत्रा पौर्णमासीव शारदी || ६-२४-१_END
BEGIN_
That army of valiant monkeys along with the king Sugriva looked charming like a full
moon night in autumn presided over by the moon and illuminated by bright stars._END

B_6_C_20_27
BEGIN_
ततोऽब्रवीद्वालिसुतोऽप्यङ्गदो हरिसत्तमः || ६-२०-३०
वायम् दूतो महाप्राज्ञ चारकः प्रतिभाति मे |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, Angada the son of Vali and the foremost of the monkeys spoke as follows:
"O, Sugriva the highly intelligent! He is not an ambassador. He appears to me as a spy."_END

B_6_C_23_6
BEGIN_
दीना दीनस्वराः क्रूराः सर्वतो मृगपक्षिणः |
प्रत्यादित्यम् विनर्दन्ति जनयन्तो महद्भयम् || ६-२१-७_END
BEGIN_
"Wild animals and birds from all sides are roaring pitiably with melancholic sound,
facing towards the sun in great fear."_END

B_6_C_22_12
BEGIN_
तम् तथा समतिक्रान्तम् नातिचक्राम राघवः |
समुद्धतममित्रघ्नो रामो नदनदीपतिम् || २-२२-१६_END
BEGIN_
Rama born in Raghu dynasty and the annihilator of enemies, did not retreat before
that ocean, which swelled and crossed its limits._END

B_6_C_19_32
BEGIN_
प्रकृत्या धर्म शीलस्य राघवस्य अपि अरोचत || ६-१९-३४
स लक्ष्मणम् महातेजाः सुग्रीवम् च हरि ईश्वरम् |
सत् क्रिया अर्थम् क्रिया दक्षः स्मित पूर्वम् उवाच ह || ६-१९-३५_END
BEGIN_
That advice found favor with Rama who by nature is of pious attitude. Then that
highly illustrious Rama replied to Sugreeva, the ruler of monkeys who was skillful in action and
who was accompanied by Lakshmana. Full of respect for Vibhishana's words, he told him as also his
brother Lakshmana smilingly as follows:_END

B_6_C_17_59
BEGIN_
पृच्च्यमानो विशन्केत सहसा बुद्धिमान् वचः |
तत्र मित्रम् प्रदुष्येत मिथ्य पृष्टम् सुख आगतम् ||६-१७-६०_END
BEGIN_
"A wise man being questioned suddenly would be apprehensive of that questioning. In
those circumstances, an easily obtained friend becomes faithless upon facing a deceitful
questioning."_END

B_6_C_21_21
BEGIN_
ते ज्वलन्तो महावेगास् तेजसा सायक उत्तमाः |
प्रविशन्ति समुद्रस्य सलिलम् त्रस्त पन्नगम् || ६-२१-२७_END
BEGIN_
Those excellent arrows having a great speed and ablaze by their splendor, penetrated
the waters of the ocean, striking the water- snakes with terror._END

B_6_C_24_1
BEGIN_
प्रचचाल च वेगेन त्रस्ता चैव वसुन्धरा |
पीड्यमाना बलौ घेन तेन सागरवर्चसा || ६-२४-२_END
BEGIN_
The earth pressed under foot by that multitude of army which was energetic like a
sea, was trembled with fear by the rapid movement of that army._END

B_6_C_20_28
BEGIN_
तुलितम् हि बलम् सर्वमनेन तव तिष्ठता || ६-२०-३१
गृह्यताम् मागमल्लङ्का मेतद्धि मम रोचते |_END
BEGIN_
"All our army has been indeed evaluated by him, standing here. Let him be made
captive. Let him not return to Lanka. This indeed finds favor with me."_END

B_6_C_23_7
BEGIN_
रजन्यामप्रकाशस्तु सम्तापयति चन्द्रमाः |
कृष्णरक्तांशुपर्यन्तो लोकक्षय इवोदितः || ६-२१-८_END
BEGIN_
"The splendorous moon as though rising at the time of universal dissolution,
invested with a black and red halo is tormenting the mind this night."_END

B_6_C_22_13
BEGIN_
ततो मध्यात् समुद्रस्य सागरः स्वयम् उत्थितः |
उदयन् हि महाशैलान् मेरोर् इव दिवा करः || २-२२-१७_END
BEGIN_
Then, Sagara (the ocean god) himself rose from the middle of the ocean as the sun
rises at dawn from the huge mountain of Meru._END

B_6_C_19_33
BEGIN_
विभीषणस्य मन्त्रो अयम् मम लक्ष्मण रोचते |
सुग्रीवः पण्डितो नित्यम् भवान् मन्त्र विचक्षणः || ६-१९-३६
उभाभ्याम् सम्प्रधार्य आर्यम् रोचते यत् तद् उच्यताम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Lakshmana! This idea of Vibhishana is agreeable to me. Sugreeva is a learned
person. You are ever wise in your thoughts. Both of you decide on the matter and inform whichever
is agreeable to you."_END

B_6_C_17_60
BEGIN_
अशक्यः सहसा राजन् भावो वेत्तुम् परस्य वै |
अन्तः स्वभावैर् गीतैस् तैर् नैपुण्यम् पश्यता भृशम् ||६-१७-६१_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! Without possessing a high skill of reading his diversified tones, it is
not possible rapidly to comprehend his intention."_END

B_6_C_21_22
BEGIN_
ततो वेगः समुद्रस्य सनक्र मकरो महान् |
स बभूव महाघोरः समारुत रवस् तदा || ६-२१-२८_END
BEGIN_
The great jerk of water with fishes and alligators of the ocean, together with the
resonance of the wind became very much dreadful._END

B_6_C_24_2
BEGIN_
ततः शुश्रुपुराक्रुष्टम् लङ्कायाः काननौकसः |
भेरीमृदङ्गसम्घुष्टम् तुमुलम् रोमहर्षणम् || ६-२४-३_END
BEGIN_
Then the monkeys heard a great tumult arising in Lanka and noisy sounds of
kettledrums and tabours, which caused their hair to stand on end._END

B_6_C_20_29
BEGIN_
ततो राज्ञा समादिष्टाः समुत्पत्य वलीमुखाः || ६-२०-३२
जगृहुश्च बबन्धुश्च विलपन्तमनाथवत् |_END
BEGIN_
Commanded then by the king Sugriva, the monkeys jumped up, seized and bound him, who
without defence, wailed loudly._END

B_6_C_23_8
BEGIN_
ह्रस्वो रूक्षोऽप्रशस्तश्च परिवेषस्तु लोहितः |
आदित्ये विमले वीलम् लक्ष्म लक्ष्मण दृश्यते || ६-२१-९_END
BEGIN_
"O, Lakshmana! A dark stain appears on the cloudless solar disc, which is
diminished, dreary, inauspicious and coppery."_END

B_6_C_22_14
BEGIN_
पन्नगैः सह दीप्त आस्यैः समुद्रः प्रत्यदृश्यत |
स्निग्ध वैदूर्य सम्काशो जाम्बू नद विभूषितः || २-२२-१८_END
BEGIN_
That ocean along with snakes of flaming jaws appeared with a hue of glossy emerald
adorned with gold._END

B_6_C_19_34
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्तौ तु तौ वीराव् उभौ सुग्रीव लक्ष्मणौ || ६-१९-३७
समुदाचार सम्युक्तम् इदम् वचनम् ऊचतुः |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Rama's words, Sugreeva and Lakshmana both, valiant as they were, spoke with
proper courtesy, the following words: ._END

B_6_C_17_61
BEGIN_
न त्वस्य ब्रुवतो जातु लक्ष्यते दुष्ट भावता |
प्रसन्नम् वदनम् च अपि तस्मान् मे न अस्ति संशयः ||६-१७-६२_END
BEGIN_
"I am not seeing any bad intention at all in his talk. His face is also bright.
Hence, I do not doubt him."_END

B_6_C_21_23
BEGIN_
महाऊर्मि माला विततः शन्ख शुक्ति समाकुलः |
सधूम परिवृत्त ऊर्मिः सहसा अभून् महाउदधिः || ६-२१-२९_END
BEGIN_
Immediately that great ocean, became shaken by the cluster of huge waves enveloped
by a multitude of conches in its rolling waves and a smoke came out._END

B_6_C_24_3
BEGIN_
बभूवुस्तेन घोषेण सम्हृष्टा हरियूथपाः |
अमृष्यमाणास्तम् घोषम् विनेदुर्घोषवत्तरम् || ६-२४-४_END
BEGIN_
The leaders of monkeys were rejoiced by that sound. But by not tolerating that
sound, they emitted shouts, which surpassed that uproar._END

B_6_C_20_30
BEGIN_
शुकस्तु वानरैश्च ण्डैस्तत्र तैः सम्प्रपीडितः || ६-२०-३३
व्याचुक्रोश महात्मानम् रामम् दशरथात्मजम् |_END
BEGIN_
Harassed by those monkeys there, Shuka on his part cried loudly towards Rama, the
high soled son of Dasaratha as follows:_END

B_6_C_23_9
BEGIN_
रजसा महता चापि नक्षत्राणि हतानि च |
युगान्तमिव लोकानाम् पश्य शसन्ति लक्ष्मण || ६-२१-१०_END
BEGIN_
"O, Lakshmana! Look! Stars enveloped in enormous dust, appear to announce a
dissolution of the world."_END

B_6_C_22_15
BEGIN_
रत्न माल्य अम्बर धरः पद्म पत्र निभ ईक्षणः |
सर्वपुष्पमयीम् दिव्याम् शिरसा धारयन् स्रजम् || २-२२-१९
जातरूपमयैश्चैव तपनीयविभूषितो भूषणोत्तमैः |
आत्मजानाम् च रत्नानाम् भूषितो भूषणोत्तमैः || २-२२-२०
धातुभिर्मण्डितः शैलो विविधैर्हमवानिव |
एकावलीमध्यगतम् तरलम् पाण्डरप्रभम् || २-२२-२१
विपुलेनोरसा बिभ्रत्कौस्तुभस्य सहोदरम् |
आघूर्णिततरङ्गौघःकालिकानिलसम्कुलः || २-२२-२२
गङ्गासिन्धुप्रधानाभिरापगाभिः समावृतः |
देवतानाम् सरूपाभिर्नानारूपाभिरीश्वरः || २-२२-२३
सागरः समतिक्रम्य पूर्वम् आमन्त्र्य वीर्यवान् |
अब्रवीत् प्रान्जलिर् वाक्यम् राघवम् शर पाणिनम् || २-२२-२४_END
BEGIN_
The valiant ocean, the lord of rivers, wearing a wreath of pearls, with his eyes
resembling lotus leaves, bearing a beautiful garland made of all kinds of flowers on his head, with
ornaments of refined gold, adorned with excellent jewels made of pearls from his domain, decorated
with different kinds of gems and metals, resembling Himavat mountain, wearing on his broad chest a
locket shedding a white luster, resembling a Kaustubha gem (adorning the blossom of Lord Vishnu)
and hanging in the middle of a single string of pearls, with a multitude of waves whirled around
him, encircled by the clouds and winds, escorted by rivers mainly the Ganga and Sindhu, endowed
with diverse forms resembling various deities, approached Rama with joined palms, who stood with
arrows in hand, addressing him first as �Rama!' and spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_19_35
BEGIN_
किम् अर्थम् नो नर व्याघ्र न रोचिष्यति राघव || ६-१९-३८
विभीषणेन यत् तु उक्तम् अस्मिन् काले सुख आवहम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama the tiger among men! Why not Vibhishana's words, which are soothing at this
time of crisis be agreeable also to us?"_END

B_6_C_17_62
BEGIN_
अशन्कित मतिः स्वस्थो न शठः परिसर्पति |
न च अस्य दुष्टा वागस्ति तस्मान् न अस्ति इह संशयः ||६-१७-६३_END
BEGIN_
"A deceitful person does not approach so fearlessly and confidently. His expression
too is not bad. Hence, there is no doubt to me on him."_END

B_6_C_21_24
BEGIN_
व्यथिताः पन्नगाः च आसन् दीप्त आस्या दीप्त लोचनाः |
दानवाः च महावीर्याः पाताल तल वासिनः || ६-२१-३०_END
BEGIN_
Sea-snakes having brilliant faces and glittering eyes and the very valiant demons
residing in nethermost subterranean region of the sea, were perturbed._END

B_6_C_24_4
BEGIN_
राक्षसास्तम् प्लवङ्गानाम् शुश्रुवुस्तेऽपि गर्जितम् |
वर्दतामिव दृप्तानाम् मेघानामम्बरे स्वनम् || ६-२४-५_END
BEGIN_
Those demons too heard the roaring of the wildly delighted monkeys, which roar
sounded like thundering of clouds in the sky._END

B_6_C_23_10
BEGIN_
काकाः श्येनास्तथा नीचा गृध्राः परिपतन्ति च |
शिवाश्चाप्यशुभान्नादान्नदन्ति सुमहाभयान् || ६-२१-११_END
BEGIN_
"Crows, eagles and vultures are flying low. Jackals too are howling very dreadful
and inauspicious sounds."_END

B_6_C_20_31
BEGIN_
लुप्येते मे बलात्पक्षौ भिद्येते मे तथाक्षिणी || ६-२०-३४
याम् च रात्रिम् मरिष्यामि जाये रात्रिम् च यामहम् |
एतस्मिन्नन्त्रे काले मन्मया चाशुभम् कृतम् || ६-२०-३५
सर्वम् तदुपपद्येथा जह्यम् चेद्यदि जीवितम् |_END
BEGIN_
"My wings are being pulled out forcibly. My eyes are being pierced. If I die, all
the sins incurred by me between my birth and my death would fall to your share."_END

B_6_C_19_36
BEGIN_
अबद्ध्वा सागरे सेतुम् घोरे अस्मिन् वरुण आलये || ६-१९-३९
लंका न आसादितुम् शक्या स इन्द्रैर् अपि सुर असुरैः |_END
BEGIN_
"Without constructing a bridge across this fiery ocean, which is an abode of Lord
Varuna, even the celestials and demons along with Indra cannot reach the city of Lanka."_END

B_6_C_22_16
BEGIN_
पृथिवी वायुर् आकाशम् आपो ज्योतिः च राघवः |
स्वभावे सौम्य तिष्ठन्ति शाश्वतम् मार्गम् आश्रिताः || २-२२-२५_END
BEGIN_
"O, beloved Rama! Earth, wind ether, water and light remain fixed in their own
nature, resorting to their eternal path."_END

B_6_C_17_63
BEGIN_
आकारः चाद्यमानो अपि न शक्यो विनिगूहितुम् |
बलाद्द् हि विवृणोति एव भावम् अन्तर् गतम् नृणाम् ||६-१७-६४_END
BEGIN_
"It is not possible to hide expression of the face, even if it is concealed. By
force, the internal intent of the persons certainly gets revealed."_END

B_6_C_21_25
BEGIN_
ऊर्मयः सिन्धु राजस्य सनक्र मकरास् तदा |
विन्ध्य मन्दर सम्काशाः समुत्पेतुः सहस्रशः || ६-२१-३१_END
BEGIN_
Thousands of waves, so large resembling Vindhya and Mandhara mountains, jumped up
from the sea with its crocodiles and sea monsters._END

B_6_C_24_5
BEGIN_
दृष्ट्वा दाशरथिर्लङ्काम् चित्रध्वजपताकिनिम्म् |
जगाम मनसा सीताम् दूयमानेन चेतसा || ६-२४-६_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Lanka dressed with multi colored flags and buntings, Rama bethought himself
of Sita and his heart was filled with grief._END

B_6_C_23_11
BEGIN_
शैलैः शूलैश्च खड्गैश्च विमुकैः कपिराक्षसैः |
भविष्यत्यावृता भूमिर्मांसशोणितकर्दमा || ६-२१-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Earth will become a quagmire of flesh and blood, covered with rocks spears and
swords hurled by monkeys and demons."_END

B_6_C_20_32
BEGIN_
नाघातयत्तदा रामः श्रुत्वा तत्परिदेवितम् || ६-२०-३६
वानरानब्रवीद्रामो मुच्यताम् दूत आगतः |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that lamentation of Shuka, Rama did not allow his killing by the monkeys.
Rama ordered monkeys to release him, as he came as an ambassador._END

B_6_C_19_37
BEGIN_
विभीषणस्य शूरस्य यथा अर्थम् क्रियताम् वचः || ६-१९-४०
अलम् काल अत्ययम् कृत्वा समुद्रो अयम् नियुज्यताम् |
यथा कालात्ययम् कृत्वा सागराय नियुज्यताम् || ६-१९-४१_END
BEGIN_
"Let the valiant Vibhishana's words be followed suitably. It is enough that we have
already wasted our time. Let the ocean be commanded to yield a passage for the army to reach the
city being ruled by Ravana."_END

B_6_C_22_17
BEGIN_
तत् स्वभावो मम अपि एष यद् अगाधो अहम् अप्लवः |
विकारस् तु भवेद् राध एतत् ते प्रवदामि अहम् || २-२२-२६_END
BEGIN_
"Therefore, I am fathomless and my nature is that it is impossible of being swum
across. It becomes unnatural if I am shallow. I am telling you the following device to cross
me."_END

B_6_C_17_64
BEGIN_
देश काल उपपन्नम् च कार्यम् कार्यविदाम् वर |
सफलम् कुरुते क्षिप्रम् प्रयोगेण अभिसम्हितम् ||६-१७-६५_END
BEGIN_
"O, the eminently skillful man in work! An action endowed with proper place and time
transacts successfully, if it is performed quickly."_END

B_6_C_21_26
BEGIN_
आघूर्णित तरन्ग ओघः सम्ब्भ्रान्त उरग राक्षसः |
उद्वर्तित महाग्राहः सम्वृत्तः सलिल आशयः || ६-२१-३२_END
BEGIN_
That ocean with its multitude of fluctuating waves, with its frightened serpents and
demons, with huge crocodiles coming out, became full of noise._END

B_6_C_24_6
BEGIN_
अत्र सा मृगशाबाक्षी रावणेनोपरुध्यते |
अभिभूता ग्रहेणेव लोहिताङ्गेन रोहिणी || ६-२४-७_END
BEGIN_
"Sita whose eyes resemble those of a young deer, was detained by Ravana there, as
Rohini star is overshadowed by the red bodied planet (mars)."_END

B_6_C_23_12
BEGIN_
क्षिप्रमद्यैव दुर्धर्षाम् पुरीम् रावणपालिताम् |
अभियाम जवेनैव सर्वैर्हरिभिरावृताः || ६-२१-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Abounding with all the monkeys we shall attack the city ruled by Ravana, now itself
at a quick pace."_END

B_6_C_19_38
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्तः कुश आस्तीर्णे तीरे नद नदी पतेः |
सम्विवेश तदा रामो वेद्याम् इव हुत अशनः || ६-१९-४२_END
BEGIN_
Having been thus exhorted, Rama then sat on the shore of the ocean covered with
blades of Kusha grass, as the God of Fire ascends the altar._END

B_6_C_22_18
BEGIN_
न कामान् न च लोभाद् वा न भयात् पार्थिव आत्मज |
रागान्नक्राकुलजलम् स्तम्भयेयम् कथंचन || २-२२-२७_END
BEGIN_
"O, prince! Neither from desire nor ambition nor fear nor from affection, I am able
to solidify my waters inhabited by alligators."_END

B_6_C_21_27
BEGIN_
ततस्तु तम् राघव मुग्रवेगम् |
प्रकर्षमाणम् ध्मरप्रमेयम् |
सौमित्रिरुत्पत्य विनिःश्वसन्तम् |
मामेति चोक्त्वा धनुराललम्बे || ६-२१-३३_END
BEGIN_
Then Lakshmana rushed towards Rama who in a terrific velocity was stretching his
incomparable bow, with a penetrating sigh, crying: "No further, no farther" and took hold of the
bow._END

B_6_C_17_65
BEGIN_
उद्योगम् तव सम्प्रेक्ष्य मिथ्या वृत्तम् च रावणम् |
वालिनः च वधम् श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवम् च अभिषेचितम् ||६-१७-६६
राज्यम् प्रार्थयमानः च बुद्धि पूर्वम् इह आगतः |
एतावत् तु पुरस् कृत्य युज्यते त्व् अस्य सम्ग्रहः ||६-१७-६७_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing your perseverance and the improper conduct of Ravana as well as hearing
about Vali having been killed and Sugriva anointed as king, he deliberately came here, with a
desire to obtain the kingdom of demons. On consideration of this aspect alone, he is worthy of
acceptance by us."_END

B_6_C_24_7
BEGIN_
दीर्घमुष्णम् च निःश्वस्य समुद्वीक्ष्य च लक्ष्मणम् |
उवाच वचनम् वीरस्तत्कालहितमात्मनः || ६-२४-८_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Lakshmana after a warm and deep sigh, the heroic Rama spoke the following
words, which were beneficial for him at that time :-_END

B_6_C_23_13
BEGIN_
इत्येवमुक्त्वा धन्वी स रामः सम्ग्रामधर्षणः |
प्रतस्थे पुरतो रामो लङ्कामभिमुखो विभुः || ६-२१-१४_END
BEGIN_
Rama the lord, the conqueror of enemies and a charming man thus speaking, wielded a
bow and sallied forth in front, facing towards Lanka._END

B_6_C_22_19
BEGIN_
विधास्ये येन गन्तासि विषहिष्ये ह्यहम् तथा |
न ग्राहा विधमिष्यन्ति यावत्सेना तरिष्यति || २-२२-२८
हरीणाम् तरणे राम करिष्यामि यथास्थलम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! I shall make it possible to see that you are able to cross over. I will
arrange a place for the monkeys to cross me and bear with it. As far as the army crosses me, the
crocodiles will not be aggressive to them."_END

B_6_C_17_66
BEGIN_
यथा शक्ति मया उक्तम् तु राक्षसस्य आर्जवम् प्रति |
प्रमाणम् तु शेषस्य श्रुत्वा बुद्धिमताम् वर ||६-१७-६८_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama the best among the wise! It has been told by me this according to my
ability about the sincerity of this demon. After hearing my words, you are indeed the final judge
of the issue."_END

B_6_C_21_28
BEGIN_
एतद्विनापि ह्युदधेस्तवार्य |
सम्पत्स्यते वीरतमस्य कार्यम् |
भवद्विधाः क्रोधवशम् न यान्ति |
दीर्घम् भवान्पश्यतु साधुवृत्तम् || ६-२१-३४_END
BEGIN_
"O, honorable man! Even without the destruction of the ocean, the purpose of you the
greatest hero will be fulfilled. Men like you do not fall into the sway of anger. You see some
durable and noble alternative"_END

B_6_C_25_0
BEGIN_
सबले सागरम् तीर्णे रामे दशरथ आत्मजे |
अमात्यौ रावणः श्रीमान् अब्रवीत् शुक सारणौ || ६-२५-१_END
BEGIN_
While Rama, the son of Dasaratha, crossed the ocean along with his army, the
illustrious Ravana spoke to Shuka and Sarana, his ministers as follows:_END

B_6_C_24_8
BEGIN_
आलिखन्तीमिवाकाशमुत्थिताम् पश्य लक्ष्मण |
मन्सेव कृताम् लङ्काम् नगाग्रे विश्वकर्मणा || ६-२४-९_END
BEGIN_
"O, Lakshmana! Look at this Lanka, which appears as though constructed on a hilltop
by Visvakarma with his imagination and so elevated scraping the sky."_END

B_6_C_23_14
BEGIN_
सविभीषणसुग्रीवाः सर्वे ते वानरर्षभाः |
प्रतस्थिरे विनर्दन्तो धृतानाम् द्विषताम् वधे || ६-२१-१५_END
BEGIN_
All those excellent monkeys, together with Vibhishana and Sugriva making roaring
sounds surged forth for the destruction of the audacious enemies._END

B_6_C_22_20
BEGIN_
तमब्रवीत्तदा रामः शृणु मे वरुणालय || २-२२-२९
अमोघोऽयम् महाबाणः कस्मिन् देशे निपात्यताम् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama spoke to that ocean as follows: "Listen to me. This great arrow should
not go in vain. In which region should it be descended?"_END

B_6_C_21_29
BEGIN_
अन्तर्हितैश्चापि तथान्तरिक्षे |
ब्रह्मर्षिभिश्चैव सुरर्षिभिश्च |
शब्दः कृतः कष्टमिति ब्रुवद्भि |
र्मा मेति चोक्त्वा महता स्वरेण || ६-२१-३५_END
BEGIN_
Brahmana-sages and celestial sages, stationed in the interior of the sky cried in a
loud voices, saying "No farther, no farther" and making a noise "Ah,Oh,Alas!"_END

B_6_C_25_1
BEGIN_
समग्रम् सागरम् तीर्णम् दुस्तरम् वानरम् बलम् |
अभूत पूर्वम् रामेण सागरे सेतु बन्धनम् || ६-२५-२_END
BEGIN_
"The entire army of monkeys crossed the impassable ocean. The construction of the
bridge, unprecedented, across the ocean was executed by Rama."_END

B_6_C_24_9
BEGIN_
विमानैर्बहुभिर्लङ्क सम्कीर्णा रचिता पुरा |
विष्णोः पदमिवाकाशम् चादितम् पाण्डुभिर्घनैः || ६-२४-१०_END
BEGIN_
The city of Lanka was constructed densely with many seven storied buildings and
appears like a sky the abode of Vishnu (the all pervaded), covered with white clouds."_END

B_6_C_23_15
BEGIN_
राघवस्य प्रियार्थम् तु सुतराम् वीर्यशालिनाम् |
हरीणाम् कर्मचेष्टाभिस्तुतोष रघुनन्दनः || ६-२१-१६_END
BEGIN_
Rama on his part was pleased by the act and gestures of those very strong monkeys,
with their intention to gratify him._END

B_6_C_22_21
BEGIN_
रामस्य वचनम् श्रुत्वा तम् च दृष्ट्वा महाशरम् || २-२२-३०
महोदधिर्महातेजा राघवम् वाक्यमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Rama's words and seeing that powerful arrow, the large splendid Ocean spoke
the following words to Rama:_END

B_6_C_25_2
BEGIN_
सागरे सेतु बन्धम् तु न श्रद्दध्याम् कथंचन |
अवश्यम् च अपि सम्ख्येयम् तन् मया वानरम् बलम् || ६-२५-३_END
BEGIN_
"I am not able to believe under any circumstances that a pass-way has been
constructed across the ocean. Certainly, that army of monkeys is worth to be counted (carried
weight) by me."_END

B_6_C_24_10
BEGIN_
पुष्पितैः शोभिता लङ्का वनैश्चत्ररथोपमैः |
नानापतगसम्घुष्टफलपुष्पोपगैः शुभैः || ६-२४-११_END
BEGIN_
"Lanka is made beautiful by the garden vying with chaitraratha (the garden of Kubera
the god of riches) with songs of birds of various species, with fruit bearing flowers and charms in
bloom._END

B_6_C_22_22
BEGIN_
उत्तरेणावकाशोऽस्ति कश्चित्पुण्यतरो मम || २-२२-३१
द्रुमकुल्य इति ख्यातो लोके ख्यातो यथा भवान् |_END
BEGIN_
"Towards my northern side, there is a holy place. It is well known as Drumatulya, in
the same way as you are well known to this world."_END

B_6_C_25_3
BEGIN_
भवन्तौ वानरम् सैन्यम् प्रविश्य अनुपलक्षितौ |
परिमाणम् च वीर्यम् च ये च मुख्याः प्लवम् गमाः || ६-२५-४
मन्त्रिणो ये च रामस्य सुग्रीवस्य च सम्मताः |
ये पूर्वम् अभिवर्तन्ते ये च शूराः प्लवम् गमाः || ६-२५-५
स च सेतुर् यथा बद्धः सागरे सलिल अर्णवे |
निवेशः च यथा तेषाम् वानराणाम् महात्मनाम् || ६-२५-६
रामस्य व्यवसायम् च वीर्यम् प्रहरणानि च |
लक्ष्मणस्य च वीरस्य तत्त्वतो ज्ञातुम् अर्हथ || ६-२५-७_END
BEGIN_
"Become unrecognisable to others, enter the army of monkeys and make out the real
quantum of their army, their prowess, as to which monkeys are important among them, which ministers
of Rama and Sugreeva have come together, which monkeys are abiding in front, which monkeys are
valiant, how that bridge was constructed across the ocean full of water, how the encamping is done
for those great-souled monkeys; the determination, strength and the striking senses of Rama and of
the heroic Lakshmana."_END

B_6_C_24_11
BEGIN_
पश्य मत्तविहङ्गनि प्रलीनभ्रमराणि च |
कोकिलाकुलखण्डानि दोधवीति शिवोऽविलः || ६-२४-१२_END
BEGIN_
"See how a gentle breeze sways the branches where the cuckoos abound where bees
swarm and where the birds are excited with joy."_END

B_6_C_22_23
BEGIN_
उग्रदर्शनकर्माणो बहवस्तत्र दस्यवः || २-२२-३२
आभीरप्रमुखाः पापाः पिबन्ति सलिलम् मम |_END
BEGIN_
"Numerous robbers of fearful aspect and deeds, having the sinful Abhiras as their
chief, drink my waters there."_END

B_6_C_25_4
BEGIN_
कः च सेना पतिस् तेषाम् वानराणाम् महाओजसाम् |
एतज् ज्ञात्वा यथा तत्त्वम् शीघ्रम् अगन्तुम् अर्हथः || ६-२५-८_END
BEGIN_
"Knowing also accurately who the Chief of Army of those high-souled monkeys is, you
have to come back quickly."_END

B_6_C_24_12
BEGIN_
इति दाशरथीरमो लक्ष्मणम् समभाषत |
बलम् च तत्र विभजच्चास्त्रदृष्टेन कर्मणा || ६-२४-१३_END
BEGIN_
Rama the son of Dasaratha spoke as aforesaid to Lakshmana. The army there was
divided into battalions according to the procedure found in scriptures._END

B_6_C_22_24
BEGIN_
तैर्न तत्स्पर्शनम् पापम् सहेयम् पापकर्मभिः || २-२२-३३
अमोघः क्रियताम् राम तत्र तेषु शरोत्तमः |_END
BEGIN_
"I am not able to bear that touch of those wicked people, the evil doers, O, Rama!
Let this excellent arrow with out vain be released over them there."_END

B_6_C_25_5
BEGIN_
इति प्रतिसमादिष्टौ राक्षसौ शुक सारणौ |
हरि रूप धरौ वीरौ प्रविष्टौ वानरम् बलम् || ६-२५-९_END
BEGIN_
Having thus been commanded by Ravana, the valiant demons Shuka and Sarana , both in
the disguise of monkeys, entered that army of monkeys._END

B_6_C_24_13
BEGIN_
शशास कपिसेमाम् ताम् बलादादाय वीर्यवान् |
अङ्गदः सह नीलेन तिष्ठे दुरपि दुर्जयः || ६-२४-१४_END
BEGIN_
He issued the following commands: --"Taking these troops of monkeys from the army,
let the valiant and the invincible Angada take up his position with Nila at the center of the
formation._END

B_6_C_22_25
BEGIN_
तस्य तद्वचनम् श्रुत्वा सागरस्य महात्मनः || २-२२-३४
मुमोच तम् शरम् दीप्तम् परम् सागरदर्शनात् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of the high-soled Ocean, Rama released that excellent and
splendid arrow towards that place as directed by the ocean._END

B_6_C_25_6
BEGIN_
ततस् तद् वानरम् सैन्यम् अचिन्त्यम् लोम हर्षणम् |
सम्ख्यातुम् न अध्यगच्चेताम् तदा तौ शुक सारणौ || ६-२५-१०_END
BEGIN_
Shuka and Sarana were not able to count then that inconeviable army of monkeys,
causing their hair to stand on end._END

B_6_C_24_14
BEGIN_
तिष्ठेद्वानरवाहिन्या वानरौघसमावृतः |
आशिर्तो दक्षिणम् पार्श्वमृषभो नाम वानरः || ६-२४-१५_END
BEGIN_
Let Rishabha along with the multitude of monkeys take up his position, having
recourse to the right side of the army."_END

B_6_C_26_0
BEGIN_
तद् वचः पथ्यम् अक्लीबम् सारणेन अभिभाषितम् |
निशम्य रावणो राजा प्रत्यभाषत सारणम् || ६-२६-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words, which were truthful and coward less, as spoken by Sarana, the
king Ravana spoke to Sarana as follows:_END

B_6_C_22_26
BEGIN_
तेन तन्मरुकान्तारम् प्^इथिव्याम् किल विश्रुतम् || २-२२-३५
विपातितः शरो यत्र वज्राशनिसमप्रभः |_END
BEGIN_
The place where the arrow, whose splendor was akin to that of a thunder and a
thunder bolt, was descended by Rama- that place is indeed famous as desert of Maru* on this
earth._END

B_6_C_25_7
BEGIN_
तत् स्थितम् पर्वत अग्रेषु निर्दरेषु गुहासु च |
समुद्रस्य च तीरेषु वनेषु उपवनेषु च || ६-२५-११
तरमाणम् च तीर्णम् च तर्तु कामम् च सर्वशः |
निविष्टम् निविशच् चैव भीम नादम् महाबलम् || ६-२५-१२
तद्बलार्णवमक्षोभ्यम् ददृशाते निशाचरौ |_END
BEGIN_
That army was stationed on the tops of mountains, round about the waterfalls, in the
caves, on the sea-shores, in the woodlands and in the gardens. It was either in the process of
crossing the ocean, or was intending to cross it in its entirety. It had either encamped or was
still encamping, making a terrible noise. The two demons saw that very strong and imperturbable sea
of army._END

B_6_C_24_15
BEGIN_
गन्धहस्तीव दुर्धर्षस्तरस्वी गन्धमादनः |
तिष्ठेद्वानरवाहिन्याः सव्यम् पक्षमधिष्ठतः || ६-२४-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Let Gandhamadana, the strong and unconquerable, resembling an elephant in rut, take
his position superintending the left side of the monkey troops."_END

B_6_C_26_1
BEGIN_
यदि माम् अभियुन्जीरन् देव गन्धर्व दानवाः |
न एव सीताम् प्रदास्यामि सर्व लोक भयाद् अपि || ६-२६-२_END
BEGIN_
"I do not give Seetha even if the celestials, celestial musicians or demons attack
me or even if there is a terror from all the worlds."_END

B_6_C_22_27
BEGIN_
ननाद च तदा तत्र वसुधा शल्यपीडिता || २-२२-३६
तस्माद्बाणमुखात्तोयमुत्पपात रसातलात् |_END
BEGIN_
The earth there, pierced by the dart, then emitted a sound . The waters of the
penultimate subterranean region gushed forth from the mouth of that cleft._END

B_6_C_25_8
BEGIN_
तौ ददर्श महातेजाः प्रच्चन्नौ च विभीषणः || ६-२५-१३
आचचक्षे अथ रामाय गृहीत्वा शुक सारणौ |_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana with great splendour beheld both of them in disguise. He caught hold of
Shuka and Sarana and told Rama as follows:_END

B_6_C_24_16
BEGIN_
मूर्ध्नि स्थास्याम्यहम् यत्तो लक्ष्मणेन समन्वितः |
जाम्बवांश्च सुषेणश्च वेगदर्शी च वानरः || ६-२४-१७
ऋक्षमुख्या महात्मानः कुक्षिम् रक्षन्तु ते त्रयः |_END
BEGIN_
"I shall stand alert in the forefront of the army along with Lakshmana. Let
Jambavan, Sushena and Vegadarshi the monkey - those three exceeding wise leaders of bears and
monkeys- protest the belly portion of the army."_END

B_6_C_26_2
BEGIN_
त्वम् तु सौम्य परित्रस्तो हरिभिर् निर्जितो भृशम् |
प्रतिप्रदानम् अद्य एव सीतायाः साधु मन्यसे || ६-२६-३_END
BEGIN_
"O, gentle one! As you were harassed very much by the monkeys and hence fearful; you
are thingking of giving back Seetha now itself as good."_END

B_6_C_22_28
BEGIN_
स बभूव तदा कूपो व्रण इत्येव विश्रुतः || २-२२-३७
सततम् चोत्थितम् तोयम् समुद्रस्येव दृश्यते |_END
BEGIN_
Then the hollow became known as Vrana. Water constantly seen, gushing forth from it
resembled seawater._END

B_6_C_25_9
BEGIN_
तस्यैतौ राक्षसेन्द्रस्य मन्त्रिणौ शुक्सारणौ || ६-२५-१४
लंकायाः समनुप्राप्तौ चारौ पर पुरम् जयौ |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama the conqueror of hostile citadels! These two demons are Shuka and Sarana,
the ministers of Ravana and they came here as spies from Lanka."_END

B_6_C_24_17
BEGIN_
जघनम् कपिसेनायाः कपिराजोऽभिरक्षतु || ६-२४-१८
पश्चार्धमिव लोकस्य प्रचेतास्तेजपा वृतः |_END
BEGIN_
"Let Sugriva the king of monkeys protect the rear guard of the army, resembling
Varuna (the god of water) who remains enveloped with splendor protects the western quarter of the
earth."_END

B_6_C_26_3
BEGIN_
को हि नाम सपत्नो माम् समरे जेतुम् अर्हति |
इति उक्त्वा परुषम् वाक्यम् रावणो राक्षस अधिपः || ६-२६-४
आरुरोह ततः श्रीमान् प्रासादम् हिम पाण्डुरम् |
बहु ताल समुत्सेधम् रावणो अथ दिदृक्षया || ६-२६-५_END
BEGIN_
"Which enemy can defeat me in battle?" The illustrious Ravana, the lord of demons,
causing the world to cry, spoke harsh words as aforesaid and then from there ascended the roof of
his palace which was shining white like his snow and which was equal to the height his snow and
which was equal to the height of several palmyrah trees, with a desire to see the army of
monkeys._END

B_6_C_22_29
BEGIN_
अवदारणशब्दश्च दारुणः समपद्यत || २-२२-३८
तस्मात्तद्बाणपातेन अपः कुक्षिष्वशोषयत् |_END
BEGIN_
A terrific splitting sound was born in that place. Water was dried up in those
cavities, as a result of hurling of that arrow by Rama._END

B_6_C_25_10
BEGIN_
तौ दृष्ट्वा व्यथितौ रामम् निराशौ जीविते तदा || ६-२५-१५
कृत अन्जलि पुटौ भीतौ वचनम् च इदम् ऊचतुः |_END
BEGIN_
Both of them, having seen Rama, were trembled with fear, without any hope for their
lives and having joined their palms, spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_24_18
BEGIN_
सुविभक्तमहाव्यूहा महावानररक्षिता || ६-२४-१९
अनीकिनी सा विबभौ यथाद्यौः साभ्रसम्प्लवा |_END
BEGIN_
That army with innumerable divisions, being skillfully distributed led by the
foremost of monkeys, resembled heavens with their mass of clouds._END

B_6_C_26_4
BEGIN_
ताभ्याम् चराभ्याम् सहितो रावणः क्रोध मूर्चितः |
पश्यमानः समुद्रम् च पर्वतामः च वनानि च || ६-२६-६
ददर्श पृथिवी देशम् सुसम्पूर्णम् प्लवम् गमैः |_END
BEGIN_
Ravana, stupefied with anger, along with his spies, saw that ocean, the mountains
and the forests and beheld the entire land completely filled with monkeys._END

B_6_C_25_11
BEGIN_
आवाम् इह आगतौ सौम्य रावण प्रहिताव् उभौ || ६-२५-१६
परिज्ञातुम् बलम् कृत्स्नम् तव इदम् रघु नन्दन |_END
BEGIN_
"O, excellent man! O, Rama! We both of us, as sent by Ravana, came here together to
know everything about your entire army."_END

B_6_C_22_30
BEGIN_
विख्यातम् त्रिषु लोकेषु मधुकान्तारमेव च || २-२२-३९
शोषयित्वा तु तम् कुक्षिम् रामो दशरथात्मजः |
वरम् तस्मै ददौ विद्वान्मरवेऽमरविक्रमः || २-२२-४०_END
BEGIN_
That desert of Maru became famous in the three worlds. Rama (the son of Dasaratha),
a wise man and a valiant man resembling a celestial, made that cavity dried up and gave a boon to
that desert of Maru._END

B_6_C_24_19
BEGIN_
प्रग़ृह्य गिरिशृङ्गाणि महतश्च महीरुहान् || ६-२४-२०
आसेदुर्वानरा लङ्काम् मिमर्दयुषवो रणे |_END
BEGIN_
With a desire to crush the demons in battle, the monkeys, seizing peaks of mountains
and gigantic trees, reached Lanka._END

B_6_C_26_5
BEGIN_
तद् अपारम् असम्ख्येयम् वानराणाम् महद् बलम् || ६-२६-७
आलोक्य रावणो राजा परिपप्रच्च सारणम् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that great army of monkeys, which was boundless and intolerable, the king
Ravana asked Sarana as follows:-_END

B_6_C_25_12
BEGIN_
तयोस् तद् वचनम् श्रुत्वा रामो दशरथ आत्मजः || ६-२५-१७
अब्रवीत् प्रहसन् वाक्यम् सर्व भूत हिते रतः |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing their aforesaid words, Rama the son of Dasaratha who was interested in the
welfare of all beings, smilingly spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_22_31
BEGIN_
पशव्यश्चाल्परोगश्च फलमूलरसायुतः |
बहुस्नेहो बहुक्षीरः सुगन्धिर्विविधौषधिः || २-२२-४१
एवमेतैर्गुणैर्युक्तो बहिभिः सम्युतो मरुः |
रामस्य वरदानाच्च शिवः पन्था बभूव ह || २-२२-४२_END
BEGIN_
Due to granting of a boon by Rama, that desert of Maru became the most congenial
place for cattle rearing, a place with a little of disease, producing tasty fruits and roots, with
a lot of clarified butter, a lot of milk and various kinds of sweet- smelling herbs. Thus it became
an auspicious and suitable move, bestowing these merits._END

B_6_C_26_6
BEGIN_
एषाम् वानर मुख्यानाम् के शूराः के महाबलाः || ६-२६-८
के पूर्वम् अभिवर्तन्ते महाउत्साहाः समन्ततः |_END
BEGIN_
"Which monkeys are important among them? Who are valiant ones? Who are the very
strong ones? Who will stay in front at all places, with great energy?"_END

B_6_C_24_20
BEGIN_
शिखरैर्विकिरामैनाम् लङ्काम् मुष्टिभिरेव वा || ६-२४-२१
इति स्म दधिरे सर्वे मानांसि हरिपुङ्गवाः |_END
BEGIN_
All the heroic monkeys held the following resolve in their minds, "It is with peak
of mountains or with our bare fists even, we shall shatter this Lanka into pieces."_END

B_6_C_25_13
BEGIN_
यदि दृष्टम् बलम् कृत्स्नम् वयम् वा सुसमीक्षिताः || ६-२५-१८
यथा उक्तम् वा कृतम् कार्यम् चन्दतः प्रतिगम्यताम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Has the entire army been observed by you? Have you observed us well? Have you
accomplished the task, as entrusted to you? If so, you may go back now according to your free
will."_END

B_6_C_22_32
BEGIN_
तस्मिन् दग्धे तदा कुक्षौ समुद्रः सरिताम् पतिः |
राघवम् सर्वशास्त्रज्ञमिदम् वचनम्ब्रवीत् || २-२२-४३_END
BEGIN_
While that cavity was burning, Ocean the lord of rivers spoke these words to Rama
who knew all scientific treatises._END

B_6_C_27_0
BEGIN_
तांस्तु ते सम्प्रक्ष्यामि प्रेक्षमाणस्य यूथपान् |
राघव अर्थे पराक्रान्ता ये न रक्षन्ति जीवितम् || ६-२७-१_END
BEGIN_
"I on my part shall tell you, who are keenly observing about those army-chiefs, who
are ready to show their valour in the case of Rama, even without caring for their lives."_END

B_6_C_26_7
BEGIN_
केषाम् शृणोति सुग्रीवः के वा यूथप यूथपाः || ६-२६-९
सारण आचक्ष्व मे सर्वम् के प्रधानाः प्लवम् गमाः |_END
BEGIN_
"To whom Sugreeva will hear? Who are the generals of the commanders of the
monkey-heads? What is the influence of the monkeys? O, Sarana! Tell me all."_END

B_6_C_24_21
BEGIN_
ततो रामो महातेजाः सुग्रीव मिदमब्रवीत् || ६-२४-२२
सुविभक्तानि सैन्यानि शुक एष विमुच्यताम् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama with great splendor spoke the following words to Sugriva, "Our forces are
properly marshaled. Let this Shuka be released."_END

B_6_C_22_33
BEGIN_
अयम् सौम्य नलो नाम तनुजो विश्व कर्मणः |
पित्रा दत्त वरः श्रीमान् प्रतिमो विश्व कर्मणः || २-२२-४४_END
BEGIN_
"O, excellent man! This one, named Nala, a glorious person, is the son of
Vishvakarma; who was given a boon by his father and is equal to Visvakarma."_END

B_6_C_25_14
BEGIN_
अथ किंचिददृष्टम् वा भूयस्तद्द्रष्टुमर्हथः || ६-२५-१९
विभीषनो वा कार्त्स्न्येन पुनः संदर्शयिष्यति |_END
BEGIN_
"Even if you have not seen something you may see it now also. Otherwise, Vibhishana
will show it to you again entirely."_END

B_6_C_27_1
BEGIN_
स्निग्धा यस्य बहु श्यामा बाला लान्गूलम् आश्रिताः |
ताम्राः पीताः सिताः श्वेताः प्रकीर्णा घोर कर्मणः || ६-२७-२
प्रगृहीताः प्रकाशन्ते सूर्यस्य इव मरीचयः |
पृथिव्याम् च अनुकृष्यन्ते हरो नाम एष यूथपः || ६-२७-३_END
BEGIN_
"He is a monkey called Hara, who has terrific acts to his credit. The hair on his
tail, measuring many fathoms, soft, red in colour, yellow, white and super-white, wavery and
shining like the rays of the sun standing erect thrown about are dragging along the ground."_END

B_6_C_26_8
BEGIN_
सारणो राक्षस इन्द्रस्य वचनम् परिपृच्चतः || ६-२६-१०
आचचक्षे अथ मुख्यज्ञो मुख्यांस् तांस् तु वन ओकसः |_END
BEGIN_
Then, Sarana who knew the chiefs of monkeys, spoke the following words about the
chiefs of the monkeys i them, to the lord of demons who was enquiring about them._END

B_6_C_24_22
BEGIN_
रामस्य तु वचः श्रुत्वा वानरेन्द्रो महाबलः || ६-२४-२३
मोचयामास तम् दूतम् शुकम् रामस्य शासनात् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Rama, Sugriva the lord of monkeys released Shuka the messenger,
as per the order of Rama._END

B_6_C_22_34
BEGIN_
एष सेतुम् महाउत्साहः करोतु मयि वानरः |
तम् अहम् धारयिष्यामि तथा हि एष यथा पिता || २-२२-४५_END
BEGIN_
"Let this greatly energetic monkey build a bridge across me. I can hold that bridge.
He is just the same as his father."_END

B_6_C_25_15
BEGIN_
न चेदम् ग्रहम् णम् प्रप्य भेतव्यम् जीवितम् प्रति || ६-२५-२०
व्यस्तशस्त्रौ गृहीतौ च न दूतौ वधमर्हतः |_END
BEGIN_
"You, having been caught, need not fear about your life. The captured messengers
holding no weapons indeed deserve no killing."_END

B_6_C_27_2
BEGIN_
यम् पृष्ठतो अनुगच्चन्ति शतशो अथ सहस्रशः |
वृक्षानुद्यम्य सहसा लङ्का रोहणतत्पराः || ६-२७-४
यूथपा हरिराजस्य किम्कराः समुपस्थिताः |_END
BEGIN_
"Hundreds and thousands of troop-leaders who are resolved to be the servants of
Sugreeva rally behind him, carrying trees with them and with an intention to attack Lanka
soon."_END

B_6_C_26_9
BEGIN_
एष यो अभिमुखो लंकाम् नर्दंस् तिष्ठति वानरः || ६-२६-११
यूथपानाम् सहस्राणाम् शतेन परिवारितः |
यस्य घोषेण महता सप्राकारा सतोरणा || ६-२६-१२
लंका प्रवेपते सर्वा सशैल वन कानना |
सर्व शाखा मृग इन्द्रस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः || ६-२६-१३
बल अग्रे तिष्ठते वीरो नीलो नाम एष यूथपः |_END
BEGIN_
"He, the valiant one, who holds his arms high, who tramples the earth under his feet
as he marches, whose face is turned towards Lanka, who in fury is knitting his brows very much, who
is resembling a mountain- peak in stature, who is like filaments of a louts in hue, who is excess
of anger continuously lashes out his tail and the swish of which is heard in ten regions, he is the
prince named Angada, anointed by Sugreeva the king of monkeys and is challenging you to the
battle."_END

B_6_C_24_23
BEGIN_
मोचितो रामवाक्येन वानरैश्च निपीडितः || ६-२४-२४
शुकः परमसम्त्रस्तो रक्षोधिपमुपागमत् |_END
BEGIN_
Shuka who was harassed by the monkeys and released then as per the words of Rama,
was trembling with great fear and reached Ravana._END

B_6_C_22_35
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा उदधिर् नष्टः समुत्थाय नलस् ततः |
अब्रवीद् वानर श्रेष्ठो वाक्यम् रामम् महाबलः || २-२२-४६_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking, the god of Ocean disappeared from that place. Then Nala, the more
distinguished among monkeys stood up and spoke the following words to Rama of great power:_END

B_6_C_25_16
BEGIN_
प्रच्चन्नौ च विमुञ्चएमौ चारौ रात्रिंच रावुभौ || ६-२५-२१
शत्रुपक्षस्य सततम् विभीषण विकर्षिणौ |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Vibhishana! Always try to draw a bow-string on the opponents and not on these
two demons. Set them both, who are spies in disguise, free."_END

B_6_C_27_3
BEGIN_
नीलान् इव महामेघांस् तिष्ठतो यांस् तु पश्यसि || ६-२७-५
असितान् जन सम्काशान् युद्धे सत्य पराक्रमान् |
असम्ख्येयान् अनिर्देश्यान् परम् पारम् इव उदधेः || ६-२७-६
पर्वतेषु च ये केचिद् विषमेषु नदीषु च |
एते त्वाम् अभिवर्तन्ते राजन्न् ऋष्काः सुदारुणाः || ६-२७-७_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! Those who appear black like black-clouds and akin to black collyrium are
extremely ferocious bears, truly mighty in combat, which are in exceedingly large number,
indefinable like the other shore of an ocean, whom you are observing and serve of whom reside in
mountains, plains and on river-banks. They are all coming towards you."_END

B_6_C_26_10
BEGIN_
बाहू प्रगृह्य यः पद्भ्याम् महीम् गच्चति वीर्यवान् || ६-२६-१४
लंकाम् अभिमुखः कोपाद् अभीक्ष्णम् च विजृम्भते |
गिरि शृन्ग प्रतीकाशः पद्म किन्जल्क सम्निभः || ६-२६-१५
स्फोटयति अभिसम्रब्धो लान्गूलम् च पुनः पुनः |
यस्य लान्गूल शब्देन स्वनन्ति इव दिशो दश || ६-२६-१६
एष वानर राजेन सुर्ग्रीवेण अभिषेचितः |
यौवराज्ये अन्गदो नाम त्वाम् आह्वयति सम्युगे || ६-२६-१७_END
BEGIN_
"He, the valiant one, who holds his arms high, who tramples the earth under his feet
as he marches, whose face is turned towards Lnaka, who in fury is knitting his brows very much, who
is remsebling amountain- peak in stature, who is like filaments ofa louts in hue, who is excess of
anger continuously lashes out his tail and the swish of hwich is heard in ten regious, he is the
prince named Angada, anointed by Sugreeva the king of monkeys and is challenging you to the
battle."_END

B_6_C_24_24
BEGIN_
रावणः प्रहसन्नेव शुकम् वाक्यमुवाच ह || ६-२४-२५
किमिमौ ते सितौ पक्षौ लूनपक्ष्श्च दृश्यसे |
कच्चिन्नानेकचित्तानाम् तेषाम् त्वम् वशमागतः || ६-२४-२६_END
BEGIN_
Ravana, even while laughing, enquired Shuka with the following words: " why were
your wings tied up? You appear with your wings plucked up. Have you not fallen as a victim to their
various fickle minds?"_END

B_6_C_22_36
BEGIN_
अहम् सेतुम् करिष्यामि विस्तीर्णे वरुण आलये |
पितुः सामर्थ्यम् आस्थाय तत्त्वम् आह महाउदधिः || २-२२-४७_END
BEGIN_
"The great Ocean disclosed a truth. I will construct a bridge across this large
Ocean, taking recourse to the skill and ability of my father."_END

B_6_C_27_4
BEGIN_
एषाम् मध्ये स्थितो राजन् भीम अक्षो भीम दर्शनः |
पर्जन्य इव जीमूतैः समन्तात् परिवारितः || ६-२७-८
ऋक्षवन्तम् गिरि श्रेष्ठम् अध्यास्ते नर्मदाम् पिबन् |
सर्व ऋक्षाणाम् अधिपतिर् धूम्रो नाम एष यूथपः || ६-२७-९_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! He who is standing in the middle, with terrific eyes and of fearful
appearance, encircled by all like Parjanya (the rain-god) being encircled by clouds; is the
army-chief called Dhumra, the Lord of all bears, who drinks the waters of River Narmada and resides
on an excellent mountain named Rikshavanta."_END

B_6_C_25_17
BEGIN_
प्रविश्य नगरीम् लंकाम् भवद्भ्याम् धनद अनुजः || ६-२५-२२
वक्तव्यो रक्षसाम् राजा यथा उक्तम् वचनम् मम |_END
BEGIN_
"When you return to the city of Lanka, repeat my words faithfully to Ravana the
younger half-brother of Kubera and the king of demons."_END

B_6_C_26_11
BEGIN_
वालिनः सदृशः पुत्रः सुग्रीवस्य सदा प्रियः |
राघवार्थे पराक्रान्तः शक्रार्थे वरुणो यथा || ६-२६-१८_END
BEGIN_
"This Angada, a worthy son of Vali and always dear to Sugreeva, is coming forwards
for Rama's interests, as Varuna is to Indra's."_END

B_6_C_24_25
BEGIN_
ततस्प भयसम्विग्न स्तदा राज्ञाभिचोदितः |
वचनम् प्रत्युवाचेदम् राक्षसाधिपमुत्तमम् || ६-२४-२७
सागरस्योत्तरे तीरेऽब्रवम् ते वचनम् तथा |
यथासंदेशमक्लिष्टम् सान्त्वयन् श्लक्ष्णया गिरा || ६-२४-२८_END
BEGIN_
Asked as aforesaid by the king Ravana, Shuka agitated as he was with fear, gave him
the following excellent reply: "On the northern shore of the ocean, I conveyed your message in a
smooth tone, conciliating and without any ambiguity exactly as per your instructions."_END

B_6_C_27_5
BEGIN_
यवीयान् अस्य तु भ्राता पश्य एनम् पर्वत उपमम्
भ्रात्रा समानो रूपेण विशिष्टस् तु पराक्रमे || ६-२७-१०
