स एष जाम्बवान् नाम महायूथप यूथपः |
प्रशान्तो गुरु वर्ती च सम्प्रहारेष्व् अमर्षणः || ६-२७-११_END
BEGIN_
"See him who is appearing like a mountain the younger brother of Dhumra, though in
form resembling like his brother, is more distinguished in prowess. He as such is a commander of
even the mighty generals called Jambavan, who is setting on the march (for the battle). He has a
respectful behaviour towards venerable persons impatient in battle."_END

B_6_C_22_37
BEGIN_
असौ तु सागरो भीमः सेतुकर्मदिदृक्षया |
ददौ दण्डभयाद्गाधम् राघवाय महोदधिः || २-२२-४८_END
BEGIN_
"This Sagara, the formidable mass of water, in fear of punishment, gave a passage to
Rama, wishing to see a bridge constructed on it."_END

B_6_C_25_18
BEGIN_
यद् बलम् च समाश्रित्य सीताम् मे हृतवान् असि || ६-२५-२३
तद् दर्शय यथा कामम् ससैन्यः सह बान्धवः |_END
BEGIN_
"That force on which you relied when you were taking away Seetha from me, display
that force at your will along with your troops and allies."_END

B_6_C_26_12
BEGIN_
एतस्य सा मतिः सर्वा यद्दृष्टा जनकात्मजा |
हनूमता वेगवता राघवस्य हितैषिणा || ६-२६-१९_END
BEGIN_
"It is all due to Angada's design that Seetha was found by Hanuman, who is a swift
monkey and a well-wisher of Rama."_END

B_6_C_24_26
BEGIN_
क्रुद्धैस्तेरहमुत्प्लुत्य दृष्टमात्रः प्लवङ्गमैः |
गृहितोऽस्म्यपि चारब्धो हन्तुम् लोप्तुम् च मुष्टिभिः || ६-२४-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Just on seeing me, the enraged monkeys jumped on me and seized me. They soon
started beating and plucking me with their fists."_END

B_6_C_27_6
BEGIN_
एतेन साह्यम् सुमहत् कृतम् शक्रस्य धीमता |
देव असुरे जाम्बवता लब्धाः च बहवो वराः || ६-२७-१२_END
BEGIN_
By the intelligent Jambavan, a great help was rendered to Indra (the lord of
celestials) in a battle between celestials and demons and many boons were obtained."_END

B_6_C_22_38
BEGIN_
मम मातुर् वरो दत्तो मन्दरे विश्व कर्मणा |
औरसस् तस्य पुत्रो अहम् सदृशो विश्व कर्मणा || २-२२-४९_END
BEGIN_
"On the mountain of Mandara, the following boon was given by Visvakarma to my
mother: "O, god like lady! A son equal to me will be born to you."_END

B_6_C_25_19
BEGIN_
श्वः काले नगरीम् लंकाम् सप्राकाराम् सतोरणाम् || ६-२५-२४
राक्षसम् च बलम् पश्य शरैर् विध्वंसितम् मया |_END
BEGIN_
"Tomorrow, at break of day, you will see my arrows demolish the city of Lanka with
its ramparts and arches as well as the army of demons."_END

B_6_C_26_13
BEGIN_
बहूनि वानरेन्द्राणामेष यूथानि वीर्यवान् |
परिगृह्याभियाति त्वाम् स्वेनानीकेन मर्दितुम् || ६-२६-२०_END
BEGIN_
"This valiant Angada, bringing along with him innumerable cheifs of monkeys, is
approaching to crush you, with the help of his own army."_END

B_6_C_24_27
BEGIN_
न ते सम्भाषितुम् शक्याः सम्प्रश्नोऽत्र न विद्यते |
प्रकृत्या कोपनास्तीक्षिणा वानरा राक्षसाधिप || ६-२४-३०_END
BEGIN_
"O, Lord of demons! Those monkeys are not capable of being spoken to, or possible of
being questioned in this matter. Monkeys, by their very nature, are angry and ferocious."_END

B_6_C_27_7
BEGIN_
आरुह्य पर्वत अग्रेभ्यो महाअभ्र विपुलाः शिलाः |
मुन्चन्ति विपुल आकारा न मृत्योर् उद्विजन्ति च || ६-२७-१३
राक्षसानाम् च सदृशाः पिशाचानाम् च रोमशाः |
एतस्य सैन्ये बहवो विचरन्ति अग्नि तेजसः || ६-२७-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Jambavan's giant bodied troops, resembling demons and devils, having thick hair and
endowed with unlimited energy, wander about, climbing mountain-heights and hurl massive rocks as
big as huge clouds. They do not have a fear in facing death."_END

B_6_C_22_39
BEGIN_
औरसस्तस्य पुत्रोऽहम् सदृशो विश्वकर्मणा|
स्मारितोऽस्म्यहमेतेन तत्त्वमाह महोदधिः || २-२२-५०
न च अपि अहम् अनुक्तो वै प्रब्रूयाम् आत्मनो गुणान् |_END
BEGIN_
"I am a son born of Visvakarma's own loins. I am equal to Visvakarma. This god of
Ocean has reminded me. The great ocean spoke the truth. Being unasked, I have not told you my
details earlier."_END

B_6_C_25_20
BEGIN_
खोधम् भीममहम् मोक्ष्ये बलम् धारय रावण || ६-२५-२५
श्वः काले वज्रवान् वज्रम् दानवेष्व् इव वासवः |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Ravana! Tomorrow, at break of day I will cast my dreadful anger on you and your
army as Indra the Lord of celestials wielding a thunderbolt casts the thunderbolt on demons."_END

B_6_C_26_14
BEGIN_
अनुवालिसुतस्यापि बलेन महता वृतः |
वीरस्तिष्ठति सम्ग्रामे सेतुहेतुरयम् नलः || ६-२६-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Surrounded by a large army, here stands the valiant Nala the creator of the bridge,
next to Angada the son of Vali, prepared for the battle."_END

B_6_C_24_28
BEGIN_
स च हन्ता विराधस्य कबन्धस्य खरस्य च |
सुग्रीवसहितो रामः सीतायाः पदमागतः || ६-२४-३१_END
BEGIN_
"That Rama the killer of Viraadha, Kabandha and Khara came along with Sugriva to the
place of Sita."_END

B_6_C_27_8
BEGIN_
यम् त्व् एनम् अभिसम्रब्धम् प्लवमानम् इव स्थितम् |
प्रेक्षन्ते वानराः सर्वे स्थितम् यूथप यूथपम् || ६-२७-१५
एष राजन् सहस्र अक्षम् पर्युपास्ते हरि ईश्वरः |
बलेन बल सम्पन्नो रम्भो नाम एष यूथपः || ६-२७-१६_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! This Lord of monkeys- the commander of commanders on whom, whether he is
in a hurried fury or leaping or standing still and all the monkeys stand looking - he is called
Dambha who along with his bulky troops dwell on Sahasraksha mountain."_END

B_6_C_22_40
BEGIN_
समर्थ्श्चाप्यहम् सेतुम् कर्तुम् वै वरुणालये || २-२२-५१
तस्मादद्यैव बध्नन्तु सेतुम् वानरपुङ्गवाः |_END
BEGIN_
"I am capable of constructing a bridge across the ocean. Hence, let the foremost of
monkeys build the bridge now itself."_END

B_6_C_25_21
BEGIN_
इति प्रतिसमादिष्टौ राक्षसौ शुक सारणौ || ६-२५-२६
जयेति प्रतिनन्द्यैनम् राघवम् धर्मवत्सलम् |
आगम्य नगरीम् लंकाम् अब्रूताम् राक्षस अधिपम् || ६-२५-२७_END
BEGIN_
Receiving this command, the two demons, Shuka and Sarana, admiring his justice,
cried out: "May you be victorious!", reached the city of Lanka and spoke to Ravana as follows:_END

B_6_C_26_15
BEGIN_
ये तु विष्टभ्य गात्राणि क्ष्वेडयन्ति नदन्ति च |
उत्थाय च विजृम्भन्ते क्रोधेन हरि पुम्गवाः || ६-२६-२२
एते दुष्प्रसहा घोराः चण्डाः चण्ड पराक्रमाः |
अष्टौ शत सहस्राणि दश कोटि शतानि च || ६-२६-२३
य एनम् अनुगच्चन्ति वीराः चन्दन वासिनः |
एष आशंसते लंकाम् स्वेन अनीकेन मर्दितुम् || ६-२६-२४_END
BEGIN_
"These excellent monkeys, numbering a thousand crores and eight lakhs, lodging in
sandalwood groves, yelling with a lion's roar and having stiffened their limbs, are knitting their
eye=brows raised in anger. These valiant monkeys, who are terrific and fierceful having a feroceous
zeal are going after Nala. Nala himself with his aforesaid army aspires to smash Lanka
forthwith."_END

B_6_C_24_29
BEGIN_
स कृत्वा सागरे सेतुम् तीर्त्वा च लवणोदधिम् |
एष रक्षासि निर्धूय धन्वी तिष्ठति राघवः || ६-२४-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Having constructed a bridge across the sea and crossed the salty ocean and
expelling the demons, here stands Rama wielding a bow."_END

B_6_C_27_9
BEGIN_
यः स्थितम् योजने शैलम् गच्चन् पार्श्वेन सेवते |
ऊर्ध्वम् तथैव कायेन गतः प्राप्नोति योजनम् || ६-२७-१७
यस्मान् न परमम् रूपम् चतुष्पादेषु विद्यते |
श्रुतः सम्नादनो नाम वानराणाम् पितामहः || ६-२७-१८
येन युद्धम् तदा दत्तम् रणे शक्रस्य धीमता |
पराजयः च न प्राप्तः सो अयम् यूथप यूथपः || ६-२७-१९_END
BEGIN_
"He who, walking on all fours touches with his flanks, a mountain situated at a
distance of one Yojana (eight miles) and reaching an object one Yojana high, obtains it with his
body, whose huge form no other four-begged animal is having, by which intelligent monkey, battle
was given earlier to Indra the Lord of celestials on a field of battle but no defeat was sustained
by him, he is a commander of commanders and the grand-father of monkeys, famous as Samnadana by
name."_END

B_6_C_22_41
BEGIN_
ततो निसृष्ट रामेण सर्वतो हरि यूथपाः || २-२२-५२
अभिपेतुर् महाअरण्यम् हृष्टाः शत सहस्रशः |_END
BEGIN_
Then, being sent by Rama, hundreds and thousands of monkey heroes jumped in joy on
all sides towards the great forest._END

B_6_C_25_22
BEGIN_
विभीषण गृहीतौ तु वध अर्हौ राक्षस ईश्वर |
दृष्ट्वा धर्म आत्मना मुक्तौ रामेण अमित तेजसा || ६-२५-२८_END
BEGIN_
"O, king of demons! We were seized by Vibhishana with the intention of killing us.
But, Rama, the pious minded wose valour is immeasurable, seeing us, set us free."_END

B_6_C_26_16
BEGIN_
श्वेतो रजत सम्काशः सबलो भीम विक्रमः |
बुद्धिमान् वानरः शूरस् त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतः || ६-२६-२५
तूर्णम् सुग्रीवम् आगम्य पुनर् गच्चति वानरः |
विभजन् वानरीम् सेनाम् अनीकानि प्रहर्षयन् || ६-२६-२६_END
BEGIN_
"A monkey called Sweta of sivlver hue who is quick-witted and cleaver, of terricfic
prowess and a warrior renowned in the three worlds, has come to Sugreeva swiftly, dividing the army
of monkeys and brining great delight to the troops, he goes back at once."_END

B_6_C_24_30
BEGIN_
ऋक्षवानरसम्घानामनीकानि सहस्रशः |
गिरिमेघनिकाशानाम् चादयन्ति वसुन्धराम् || ६-२४-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Thousands of divisions of hordes of bears and monkeys resembling mountains and
clouds, cover the earth."_END

B_6_C_27_10
BEGIN_
यस्य विक्रममाणस्य शक्रस्य इव पराक्रमः |
एष गन्धर्व कन्यायाम् उत्पन्नः कृष्ण वर्त्मना || ६-२७-२०
तत्र देवासुरे युद्धे साह्यार्थम् त्रिदिवौकसाम् |_END
BEGIN_
"This Samnada, whose striding prowess is equal to that of Indra the Lord of
Celestials was born of a youthful Gandharva maiden and krishnavartman for the purpose of helping
the celestials in a combat between celestials and demoneous."_END

B_6_C_22_42
BEGIN_
ते नगान् नग सम्काशाः शाखा मृग गण ऋषभाः || २-२२-५३
बभन्जुर् वानरास् तत्र प्रचकर्षुः च सागरम् |_END
BEGIN_
Those army-chiefs of monkeys, who resembled mountains, broke the rocks and trees
there and dragged them away towards the sea._END

B_6_C_25_23
BEGIN_
एक स्थान गता यत्र चत्वारः पुरुष ऋषभाः |
लोक पाल उपमाः शूराः कृत अस्त्रा दृढ विक्रमाः || ६-२५-२९
रामो दाशरथिः श्रीमाम्ल् लक्ष्मणः च विभीषणः |
सुग्रीवः च महातेजा महाइन्द्र सम विक्रमः || ६-२५-३०
एते शक्ताः पुरीम् लंकाम् सप्राकाराम् सतोरणाम् |
उत्पाट्य सम्क्रामयितुम् सर्वे तिष्ठन्तु वानराः || ६-२५-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Where the four eminent persons who are equal to the protector of the worlds, the
valiant ones skilled in the use of weapons and of proven prowess namely Rama the son of Dasaratha,
the illustrious Lakshmana, the great resplendent Vibhishana and Sgreeva whose valour is equal to
Indra the Lord of celestials, arestationed at the same place, they can pluck up the city of Lanka
with its ramparts and arches and transplant it elswhere, even if all the monkeys keep aloof."_END

B_6_C_26_17
BEGIN_
यः पुरा गोमती तीरे रम्यम् पर्येति पर्वतम् |
नाम्ना सम्कोचनो नाम नाना नग युतो गिरिः || ६-२६-२७
तत्र राज्यम् प्रशास्ति एष कुमुदो नाम यूथपः |
यो असौ शत सहस्राणाम् सहस्रम् परिकर्षति || ६-२६-२८
यस्य वाला बहु व्यामा दीर्घ लान्गूलम् आश्रिताः |
ताम्राः पीताः सिताः श्वेताः प्रकीर्णा घोर कर्मणः || ६-२६-२९
अदीनो रोषणः चण्डः सम्ग्रामम् अभिकान्क्षति |
एष एव आशंसते लंकाम् स्वेन अनीकेन मर्दितुम् || ६-२६-३०_END
BEGIN_
"There was mountain called Ramya, on the banks of River Gomati. That mountain filled
with various kinds of trees was also called Samrochana. An army-chief, named Kumuda used to roam
around that mountainous region. He also used to rule that kingdom. He is the leader for lakhs of
monkeys. He has a very long hair-coppery, yellow, pale and white and hideous to cook upon- thrown
about on his tail is the intrepid and fierceful monkey called Kanda. He yearns to fight and boast
that he with destroy Lanka his forces."_END

B_6_C_24_31
BEGIN_
राक्षसानाम् बलौघस्य वानरेन्द्रबलस्य च |
नैतयोर्विद्यते संधिर्देवदानवयोरिव || ६-२४-३४_END
BEGIN_
"There is no more possibility of an alliance between these two armies - the army of
demons and the army of monkeys- than between a God and a demon."_END

B_6_C_27_11
BEGIN_
यत्र वैश्रवणो राजा जम्बूमुपनिषेवते || ६-२७-२१
यो राजा पर्वत इन्द्राणाम् बहु किम्नर सेविनाम् |
विहार सुखदो नित्यम् भ्रातुस् ते राक्षस अधिप || ६-२७-२२
तत्र एष वसति श्रीमान् बलवान् वानर ऋषभः |
युद्धेष्व् अकत्थनो नित्यम् क्रथनो नाम यूथपः || ६-२७-२३_END
BEGIN_
"O king of demons! This commander named Krathana, the son of Visravasa, the
illustrious one, sits beneath the Jambu tree, on that mountain, the king of peaks, which is
frequented by Kinneras, and which mountain affords delight constantly to your brother. It is near
there, Krathana, that fortunate one, that powerful lord of the monkeys, whose prowess in not
confined to words in battles, sports."_END

B_6_C_22_43
BEGIN_
ते सालैः च अश्व कर्णैः च धवैर् वंशैः च वानराः || २-२२-५४
कुटजैर् अर्जुनैस् तालैस् तिकलैस् तिमिशैर् अपि |
बिल्वकैः सप्तपर्णैश्च कर्णिकारैश्च पुष्पितैः || २-२२-५५
चूतैः च अशोक वृक्षैः च सागरम् समपूरयन् |_END
BEGIN_
Those monkeys filled the ocean with all types of trees like Sala and Asvakarna,
Dhava and bamboo, Kutaja, Arjuna, palmyra,Tilaka, Tinisa, Bilva, Saptaparna, Karnika, in blossom as
also mango and Asoka._END

B_6_C_25_24
BEGIN_
यादृशम् तस्य रामस्य रूपम् प्रहरणानि च |
वधिष्यति पुरीम् लंकाम् एकस् तिष्ठन्तु ते त्रयः || ६-२५-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Such is Rama's form and such are his weapons, that he can alone overthrow the city
of Lanka, his three other companious standing by."_END

B_6_C_26_18
BEGIN_
यस् त्व् एष सिम्ह सम्काशः कपिलो दीर्घ केसरः |
निभृतः प्रेक्षते लंकाम् दिधक्षन्न् इव चक्षुषा || ६-२६-३१
विन्ध्यम् कृष्ण गिरिम् सह्यम् पर्वतम् च सुदर्शनम् |
राजन् सततम् अध्यास्ते रम्भो नाम एष यूथपः || ६-२६-३२
शतम् शत सहस्राणाम् त्रिंशच् च हरि यूथपाः |
यम् यान्तम् वानरा घोराश्चण्डाश्चण्ड्पराक्रमाः || ६-२६-३३
परिवार्य अनुगच्चन्ति लंकाम् मर्दितुम् ओजसा |_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! He who resembles a tawny lion with a long mane and who is looking at Lanka
attentively as though he wishes to consume it with his glasses, who dwells mostly on the mountains
of Krishna and Sahya of Vindhya range of pleasing aspect, is the General named Rambha. Three
thousand crores of excellent monkeys, who are formidable of impetuous valour and vigour, surround
him who is marching ahead and follow in his goot-sets to destroy Lanka."_END

B_6_C_24_32
BEGIN_
पुरा प्राकारमायान्ति क्षिप्रमेकतरम् कुरु |
सीताम् वास्मै प्रयच्चाशु युद्धम् वापि प्रदीयताम् || ६-२४-३५_END
BEGIN_
"Very soon they will come to our rampart. Immediately, do any one of these two acts-
either to restore Sita or to offer a combat to him."_END

B_6_C_27_12
BEGIN_
वृतः कोटि सहस्रेण हरीणाम् समवस्थितः |
एषैवाशंसते लङ्काम् स्वेनानीकेन मर्दितुम् || ६-२७-२४_END
BEGIN_
"He indeed is standing, surrounded by a thousand crores of monkeys. He hopes to
crush Lanka with the help of his army."_END

B_6_C_22_44
BEGIN_
समूलामः च विमूलामः च पादपान् हरि सत्तमाः || २-२२-५६
इन्द्र केतून् इव उद्यम्य प्रजह्रुर् हरयस् तरून् |_END
BEGIN_
The excellent monkeys, the forest animals lifted and brought, like Indra's flag
posts, some trees with roots intact and some others without roots._END

B_6_C_25_25
BEGIN_
राम लक्ष्मण गुप्ता सा सुग्रीवेण च वाहिनी |
बभूव दुर्धर्षतरा सर्वैर् अपि सुर असुरैः || ६-२५-३३_END
BEGIN_
"That army protected by Rama and Lakshmana as well as Sugreeva, are exceedingly
unconquerable even by all the gods and demons."_END

B_6_C_26_19
BEGIN_
यस् तु कर्णौ विवृणुते जृम्भते च पुनः पुनः || ६-२६-३४
न च सम्विजते मृत्योर् न च यूथाद् विधावति |
प्रकम्पते च रोषेन तिर्यक्च पुनरीक्षते || ६-२६-३५
पश्यन् लाङ्गूलमपि च क्स्वेडत्येष महाबलः |
महाबलो वीत भयो रम्यम् साल्वेय पर्वतम् || ६-२६-३६
राजन् सततम् अध्यास्ते शरभो नाम यूथपः |_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! Look! The one who is yawning continuously and shaking his ears, he who
does not have fear of death, he who never retreats from a battle, but violently moves with rage,
who again sees obliquely, he who lashes out his tail and roars like a lion with great vigour, he
who constantly dwells on the lovely Salveya mountain, he is Sarabha by name, the commander of
monkeys with immense energy and devoid of fear."_END

B_6_C_24_33
BEGIN_
शुकस्य वचनम् श्रुत्वा रावणो वाक्य मब्रवीत् |
रोषसम्रक्तनयनो निर्दहन्निव चक्षुषा || ६-२४-३६_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Shuka, Ravana with his eyes becoming blood red in anger, as if
he would consume him with his glance, said as follows:_END

B_6_C_27_13
BEGIN_
यो गङ्गामनुपर्येति त्रासयन् गजयूथपान् |
हस्तिनाम् वानराणाम् च पूर्ववैरमनुस्मरन् || ६-२७-२५
एष यूथपतिर्नेता गर्जन् गिरिगुहाशयः |
गजान् रोधयते वन्यानारुजंश्च महीरुहान् || ६-२७-२६_END
BEGIN_
"He who usually roams by the Ganges, sowing terror among leaders of herds of
elephants, remembering as he does the old quarrel between elephants and monkeys, thundering and
uprooting trees, he is the commander and leader of monkeys called Pramathim who dwells in
mountain-caves, subduing wild elephants."_END

B_6_C_22_45
BEGIN_
तालान् दाडिमगुल्मांश्च नारिकेलविभीतकान् || २-२२-५७
करीरान् बकुलान्निम्बान् समाजह्रुरितस्ततः |_END
BEGIN_
From here and there the monkeys brought Palmyra trees, pomegranate shrubs, coconut
and Vibhitaka, Karira, Bakula and neem trees._END

B_6_C_25_26
BEGIN_
प्रहृष्ट रूपा ध्वजिनी वन ओकसाम् |
वनौकसाम् सम्प्रति योद्धुम् इच्चताम् |
अलम् विरोधेन शमो विधीयताम् |
प्रदीयताम् दाशरथाय मैथिली || ६-२५-३४_END
BEGIN_
"Now, the army of the mighty monkeys, who are readily inclined to fight, consists of
cheerful warriors. Mae peace, insted of enmity with them. Restore Seetha to Rama."_END

B_6_C_26_20
BEGIN_
एतस्य बलिनः सर्वे विहारा नाम यूथपाः || ६-२६-३७
राजन् शत सहस्राणि चत्वारिंशत् तथैव च |_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! All his one lakh and forty thousand army-chiefs called Viharas* are
strong._END

B_6_C_24_34
BEGIN_
यदि माम् प्रतियुध्येरन् देवगन्धर्वदानवाः |
नैव सीताम् प्रदास्यामि सर्वलोकभयादपि || ६-२४-३७_END
BEGIN_
"Even if I were frightened by all the worlds or even if I were to face a battle with
celestials or Gandharvas (celestial singers) or demons, I would not give back Sita."_END

B_6_C_27_14
BEGIN_
हरीणाम् वाहिनी मुख्यो नदीम् हैमवतीम् अनु |
उशीर बीजम् आश्रित्य पर्वतम् मन्दर उपमम् || ६-२७-२७
रमते वानर श्रेष्ठो दिवि शक्र इव स्वयम् |_END
BEGIN_
"This excellent one among the monkeys and this army-chief of monkeys, taking shelter
in Mandara the foremost of mountains and the mountain called ushirabija alongside the River Ganga,
passes his life happily like unto Indra himself."_END

B_6_C_22_46
BEGIN_
हस्तिमात्रान् महाकायाः पाषाणांश्च महाबलाः || २-२२-५८
पर्वतांश्च समुत्पाट्य यन्त्रैः परिवहन्ति च |_END
BEGIN_
The huge bodied monkeys with mighty strength uprooted elephant-sized rocks and
mountains and transported them by mechanical contrivances._END

B_6_C_26_21
BEGIN_
यस् तु मेघ इव आकाशम् महान् आवृत्य तिष्ठति || ६-२६-३८
मध्ये वानर वीराणाम् सुराणाम् इव वासवः |
भेरीणाम् इव सम्नादो यस्य एष श्रूयते महान् || ६-२६-३९
घोरः शाखा मृग इन्द्राणाम् सम्ग्रामम् अभिकान्क्षताम् |
एष पर्वतम् अध्यास्ते पारियात्रम् अनुत्तमम् || ६-२६-४०
युद्धे दुष्प्रसहो नित्यम् पनसो नाम यूथपः |_END
BEGIN_
"The one who is like a great cloud, enveloping the space and who stays in teh middle
of monkey-warriors like Indra the god of celestials, the great voice of whose monkeys wishing for
battle is heard like the roll of drums, is the General named Panasa, who is always invincible in
battle. He dwells in Pariyatra, a mountain that is exceeded by none in height."_END

B_6_C_24_35
BEGIN_
कदा समभिधानन्ति मामका राघवम् शराः |
वसन्ते पुष्पितम् मत्ता भ्रमरा इव पादपम् || ६-२४-३८_END
BEGIN_
"When will my arrows soon fall upon Rama, as large black bees excited with joy fall
upon a tree in bloom at spring time?"_END

B_6_C_27_15
BEGIN_
एनम् शत सहस्राणाम् सहस्रम् अभिवर्तते || ६-२७-२८
वीर्यविक्रमदृप्तानाम् नर्दताम् बाहुशालिनाम् |_END
BEGIN_
"A hundred thousands of monkeys; proud of their strength and prowess with their
radiant fore-arms, making a roaring noise, are following him."_END

B_6_C_22_47
BEGIN_
प्रक्षिप्यमाणैर् अचलैः सहसा जलम् उद्धतम् || २-२२-५९
समुत्पतितम् आकाशम् अपासर्पत् ततस् ततः |_END
BEGIN_
The water, raised up due to sudden throwing of mountains in the sea, soured upward
towards the sky and from there again, gushed back._END

B_6_C_26_22
BEGIN_
एनम् शत सहस्राणाम् शत अर्धम् पर्युपासते || ६-२६-४१
यूथपा यूथप श्रेष्ठम् येषाम् यूथानि भागशः |_END
BEGIN_
Troop-commanders numbering fifty lakhs commanding separate units attend obediently
to him, who is excellent among the Generals."_END

B_6_C_24_36
BEGIN_
कदा शोणितदिग्धाङ्गम् दीपैः कार्मुकविच्युतैः |
शरैरादीपयिष्यामि उल्काभिरिव कुञ्जरम् || ६-२४-३९_END
BEGIN_
"When shall I consume his body flowing with blood, by the blazing arrows released
from my bow, as flaming torches destroy an elephant?"_END

B_6_C_27_16
BEGIN_
स एष नेता न्हैतेषाम् वानराणाम् महात्मनम् || ६-२७-२९
स एष दुर्मर्षणो राजन् प्रमाथी नाम यूथपः |_END
BEGIN_
"He is the leader of these high-soled monkeys. O, king! He is the commander called
Pramathi, the one difficult to be conquered."_END

B_6_C_22_48
BEGIN_
समुद्रम् क्षोभयामासुर्निपतन्तः समन्ततः || २-२२-६०
सूत्राण्यन्ये प्रगृह्णन्ति ह्यायतम् शतयोजनम् |_END
BEGIN_
The rocks befalling on all sides perturbed the ocean. Some others drew up strings a
hundred Yojanas long (in order to keep the rocks in a straight line.)_END

B_6_C_26_23
BEGIN_
यस् तु भीमाम् प्रवल्गन्तीम् चमूम् तिष्ठति शोभयन् || ६-२६-४२
स्थिताम् तीरे समुद्रस्य द्वितीय इव सागरः |
एष दर्दर सम्काशो विनतो नाम यूथपः || ६-२६-४३
पिबमः चरति पर्णाशाम् नदीनाम् उत्तमाम् नदीम् |
षष्टिः शत सहस्राणि बलम् अस्य प्लवम् गमाः || ६-२६-४४_END
BEGIN_
"He who is encamped with sixty lakhs monkeys as his army-strength on the sea-shore
like unto a second ocean is the commander called Vinata who resembles Dardura mountain (in size)
and is positioned there lending charm to the formidable army marching ahead and moves about,
drinking the water of River Vena, the foremost of all rivers."_END

B_6_C_24_37
BEGIN_
तच्चास्य बलमादास्ये बलेन महता वृतः |
ज्योतिषामिव सर्वेषाम् प्रभामुद्यन्दिवाकरः || ६-२४-४०_END
BEGIN_
"Endowed with a huge army I shall eclipse the aforesaid army of Rama, as the
brilliance of all stars is obscured at the rising of the sun."_END

B_6_C_27_17
BEGIN_
वातेन इव उद्धतम् मेघम् यम् एनम् अनुपश्यसि || ६-२७-३०
अनीकमपि सम्रब्धम् वानराणाम् तरस्विनाम् |
उद्धूतमरुणाभासम् पवनेन समन्ततः || ६-२७-३१
विवर्तमानम् बहुशो यत्र एतद् बहुलम् रजः |_END
BEGIN_
"He whom you are beholding a cloud raised by wind is Pramathi. At that place, a
great quantity of red illumined dust is tossed about and raised by wind in various ways in
different directions. Energetic and excited army of monkeys is also stationed there along with
Pramathi."_END

B_6_C_22_49
BEGIN_
नलः चक्रे महासेतुम् मध्ये नद नदी पतेः || २-२२-६१
स तदा क्रियते सेतुर्वानरै र्घोरकर्मभिः |_END
BEGIN_
Nala on his part initiated a monumental bridge in the middle of the ocean. The
bridge was built at that time with the cooperation of other monkeys, of terrible doings._END

B_6_C_26_24
BEGIN_
त्वाम् आह्वयति युद्धाय क्रथनो नाम यूथपः |
विक्रान्ता बलवन्तश्च यथा यूथानि भागशः || ६-२६-४५_END
BEGIN_
"A monkey called krathana, keeping the courageous, strong monkeys and the
army-lieutenants in separate units, is inviting you for the battle."_END

B_6_C_24_38
BEGIN_
सागरस्येव मे वेगो मारुतस्येव मे बलम् |
न च दाशरथिर्वेद तेन माम् योद्धुमिच्चति || ६-२४-४१_END
BEGIN_
"My rashness is like that of the sea and my strength is like that of the wind. Rama
is not aware of it. That is why, he is desirous of meeting me in a combat."_END

B_6_C_27_18
BEGIN_
एते असित मुखा घोरा गो लान्गूला महाबलाः || ६-२७-३२
शतम् शत सहस्राणि दृष्ट्वा वै सेतु बन्धनम् |
गो लान्गूलम् महावेगम् गव अक्षम् नाम यूथपम् || ६-२७-३३
परिवार्य अभिवर्तन्ते लंकाम् मर्दितुम् ओजसा |_END
BEGIN_
"O, monarch! One hundred lakhs of monkeys with their black faces, with fearful
appearance and with great strength, experiencing the crossing of the bridge, surrounds the
troop-leader by name Gavaksha, a monkey and are making a roaring noise, ready to crush Lanka by
their bodily strength."_END

B_6_C_22_50
BEGIN_
दण्डनन्ये प्रगृह्णन्ति विचिन्वन्ति तथापरे || २-२२-६२
वानरैः शतशस्तत्र रामस्यज्ञापुरःसरैः |
मेघाभैः पर्वताभश्च तृणैः काष्ठैर्बबन्धरे || २-२२-६३_END
BEGIN_
Some monkeys were holding poles for measuring the bridge and some others collected
the material. Reeds and logs resembling clouds and mountains, brought by hundreds of monkeys, lead
by the command of Rama, fastened some parts of the bridge._END

B_6_C_26_25
BEGIN_
यस् तु गैरिक वर्ण आभम् वपुः पुष्यति वानरः |
अवमत्य सदा सर्वान्वानरान् बलदर्पितः || ६-२६-४६
गवयो नाम तेजस्वी त्वाम् क्रोधाद् अभिवर्तते |_END
BEGIN_
"That resplendent monkey who for his part nourishes his body having the hue of a red
chalk and proud of his strength, stands facing you with anger despising all other monkeys."_END

B_6_C_24_39
BEGIN_
न मे तूणीशयान् बाणान् सनिषानिव पन्नगान् |
रामः पश्यति सम्ग्रामे तेन माम् योद्धुमिच्चति || ६-२४-४२_END
BEGIN_
"Rama has not seen my arrows resembling venomous serpents lying in my quiver. That
is why, he desires to fight with me."_END

B_6_C_27_19
BEGIN_
भ्रमर आचरिता यत्र सर्व काम फल द्रुमाः || ६-२७-३४
यम् सूर्य तुल्य वर्ण आभम् अनुपर्येति पर्वतम् |
यस्य भासा सदा भान्ति तद् वर्णा मृग पक्षिणः || ६-२७-३५
यस्य प्रस्थम् महात्मानो न त्यजन्ति महर्षयः |
सर्वकामफला वृक्षाः सर्वे फलसमन्विताः || ६-२७-३६
मधूनि च महार्हाणि यस्मिन् पर्वतसत्तमे |
तत्र एष रमते राजन् रम्ये कान्चन पर्वते || ६-२७-३७
मुख्यो वानर मुख्यानाम् केसरी नाम यूथपः |_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! This army-chief called Kesari, the chief of the commanders of monkeys,
wanders in Kanchana mountain wherein there are trees which yield fruits in all seasons, inhabited
by large black-bees, to which the sun circumambulates clock-wise, the mountain shining with its own
colour and splendour, by whose brightness, the animals and birds ever shine with the same hue,
whose table-land on the top of the mountain the great sages do not leave, wherein trees, all
mango-trees laden with fruits on all sides and wherein inhabit honey-bees of excellent
variety."_END

B_6_C_22_51
BEGIN_
पुष्पिताग्रैश्च तरुभिः सेतुम् बध्नन्ति वानराः |
पाषाणांश्च गिरिप्रख्यान् गिरीणाम् शिखराणि च || २-२२-६४
दृश्यन्ते परिधावन्तो गृह्य दानवसम्निभाः |_END
BEGIN_
Monkeys constructed the bridge with trees having blossom at the end of their boughs.
Some monkeys looking like demons seized rocks resembling mountains and peaks of mountains and
appeared running hither and thither._END

B_6_C_26_26
BEGIN_
एनम् शत सहस्राणि सप्ततिः पर्युपासते |
एष आशंसते लंकाम् स्वेन अनीकेन मर्दितुम् || ६-२६-४७_END
BEGIN_
"Seventy lakhs monkeys are attending on him. He himself wishes to crush the city of
Lanka with the help of his army."_END

B_6_C_24_40
BEGIN_
न जानाति पुरा वीर्यम् मम युद्धे स राघवः |
मम चापमयीम् वीणाम् शरकोणैः प्रवादिताम् || ६-२४-४३
ज्याशबदतुमुलाम् घोरामार्तगीतमहास्वनाम् |
नाराचतलसम्नादाम् ताम् ममाहितवाहिनीम् || ६-२४-४४
अवगाह्य महरङ्गम् वादयिष्यान्तगन् रणे |_END
BEGIN_
Rama was not formerly aware of my prowess in battle. I shall cause to resound Vina
(a musical instrument) in the form of my bow, which is played on with the heads of my arrows, the
bow string producing a tumultuous sound, the huge cries of the wounded its terrible accompaniment,
the darts sounding its innumerable notes, when I enter a vast stage in the form of my enemy ranks
in that battle."_END

B_6_C_27_20
BEGIN_
षष्टिर् गिरि सहस्राणाम् रम्याः कान्चन पर्वताः || ६-२७-३८
तेषाम् मध्ये गिरि वरस् त्वम् इव अनघ रक्षसाम् |
तत्र एते कपिलाः श्वेतास् ताम्र आस्या मधु पिन्गलाः || ६-२७-३९
निवसन्ति उत्तम गिरौ तीक्ष्ण दम्ष्ट्रा नख आयुधाः |
सिम्ह इव चतुर् दम्ष्ट्रा व्याघ्रा इव दुरासदाः || ६-२७-४०
सर्वे वैश्वनर समा ज्वलित आशी विष उपमाः |
सुदीर्घ अन्चित लान्गूला मत्त मातम्ग सम्निभाः || ६-२७-४१
महापर्वत सम्काशा महाजीमूत निस्वनाः |
वृत्तपिङ्गलनेत्रा हि महाभीमगतिस्वनाः || ६-२७-४२
मर्दयन्तीव ते सर्वे तस्थुर्लङ्काम् समीक्ष्य ते |_END
BEGIN_
"O, faultless king! There are sixty thousand mountains in that beautiful golden
mountain ranges. There is an excellent mountain the middle of that mountain range as you the middle
of that demons. In that mountain range there, in the last mountain these monkeys reside. Some of
the monkeys are tawny coloured, some are white-coloured and with nails as their weapons; having
four tusks, with nails as their weapons having four tusks like lions, difficult to be approached
like tigers, resembling fire, like unto serpents vomiting poison with their very long coiling
tails, resembling elephants in rut, equal to mighty mountains and making great thunderous sound
like that of clouds. All of them stand looking on your Lanka as if they are about to crush it."_END

B_6_C_22_52
BEGIN_
शिलानाम् क्षिप्यमाणानाम् शैलानाम् तत्र पात्यताम् || २-२२-६५
बभूव तुमुलः शब्दस् तदा तस्मिन् महाउदधौ |_END
BEGIN_
Then, a tumultuous sound occurred when the rocks were thrown into the sea and when
mountains were caused to fall there._END

B_6_C_26_27
BEGIN_
एते दुष्प्रसहा घोरा बलिनः काम रूपिणः |
यूथपा यूथप श्रेष्ठा येषाम् सम्ख्या न विद्यते || ६-२६-४८_END
BEGIN_
"These commanders and commanders-in-chief are difficult to be conquered and their
number is hard to be counted. Their troops are divided into distinct units."_END

B_6_C_24_41
BEGIN_
न वासवेनापि स हस्रचक्षुषा |
युद्धेऽस्मि शक्यो वरुणेन वास्वयम् |
यमेव वा धर्षयितुम् शराग्निना |
महाहवे वैश्रवणेन वा स्वयम् || ६-२४-४५_END
BEGIN_
"Neither by the thousand eyed Indra the god of celestials nor by Varuna the God of
waters in person in a combat, nor by Yama the god of death with the fire of his arrows, nor by
Kubera the lord of riches in person, can I be able to be attacked in a great battle."_END

B_6_C_27_21
BEGIN_
एष चैषामधिपतिर्मध्ये तिष्ठति वीर्यवान् || ६-२७-४३
जयार्थी नित्यमादित्यमुपतिष्ठति बुद्धिमान् |
नाम्ना पृथिव्याम् विख्यातो राजन् शत बली इति यः || ६-२७-४४
एष एव आशंसते लंकाम् स्वेन अनीकेन मर्दितुम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! He who stands in the middle is the powerful leader of the monkeys who ever
faces the sun, who is a wise man, eager to conquer you and is famous in the world by the name,
Shatabali. He swears to destroy Lanka with his troops."_END

B_6_C_22_53
BEGIN_
कृतानि प्रथमेनाह्ना योजनानि चतुर्दश || २-२२-६६
प्रहृष्टैजसम्काशैस्त्वरमाणैः प्लवङ्गमैः |_END
BEGIN_
On the first day, fourteen Yojanas of bridge were constructed by the monkeys
speedily, thrilled with delight as they were, resembling elephants._END

B_6_C_27_22
BEGIN_
विक्रान्तो बलवान् शूरः पौरुषे स्वे व्यवस्थितः || ६-२७-४५
रामप्रियार्थम् प्राणानाम् दयाम् न कुरुते हरिः |_END
BEGIN_
"This Shatabali the monkey is courageous, strong, valiant and is established in his
manliness. He does not care for his life, in the cause of Rama."_END

B_6_C_22_54
BEGIN_
द्वितीयेन तथैवाह्ना योजनानि तु विशतिः || २-२२-६७
कृतानि प्लवगैस्तूर्णम् भीमकायैर्महाबलैः |_END
BEGIN_
In the same manner, on the second day twenty Yojanas of bridge were constructed
speedily by the monkeys of terrific bodies and of mighty strength._END

B_6_C_27_23
BEGIN_
गजो गव अक्षो गवयो नलो नीलः च वानरः |
एक एक एव यूथानाम् कोटिभिर् दशभिर् वृतः || ६-२७-४६_END
BEGIN_
"Each and every single one, like Gaja, Gavaya, Nala and a monkey called Nila is
surrounded by crores of warriors."_END

B_6_C_22_55
BEGIN_
अह्ना तृतीयेन तथा योजनानि तु सागरे || २-२२-६८
त्वरमाणैर्महाकयैरेकविंशतिरेव च |_END
BEGIN_
Thus, on the third day twenty-one Yojanas of the bridge were constructed in the
ocean speedily by the monkeys with their colossal bodies._END

B_6_C_22_56
BEGIN_
चतुर्थेन तथा चाह्ना द्वाविंशतिरथापि वा || २-२२-६९
योजनानि महावेगैः कृतानि त्वरितैस्ततः |_END
BEGIN_
On the forth day, a further of twenty-two Yojanas were constructed by the dashing
monkeys with a great speed._END

B_6_C_27_24
BEGIN_
तथा अन्ये वानर श्रेष्ठा विन्ध्य पर्वत वासिनः |
न शक्यन्ते बहुत्वात् तु सम्ख्यातुम् लघु विक्रमाः || ६-२७-४७_END
BEGIN_
"Besides, other excellent monkeys residing in Vindhya mountain are quick-paced and
are impossible to be counted because of their multitude."_END

B_6_C_22_57
BEGIN_
पञ्चमेन तथा चाह्ना प्लवगैः क्षिप्रकारिभिः || २-२२-७०
योजनानि त्रयोविंशत्सुवेलमधिकृत्य वै |_END
BEGIN_
In that manner, on the fifth day, the monkeys working quickly constructed
twenty-three yojanas of the bridge up to the other seashore._END

B_6_C_27_25
BEGIN_
सर्वे महाराज महाप्रभावाः |
सर्वे महाशैल निकाश कायाः |
सर्वे समर्थाः पृथिवीम् क्षणेन |
कर्तुम् प्रविध्वस्त विकीर्ण शैलाम् || ६-२७-४८_END
BEGIN_
"O, monarch! All of them are highly prominent, their stature equal to high hills and
all of them are capable in a moment to level the earth by uprooting and razing its mountains earth
by uprooting and razing its mountains to the ground."_END

B_6_C_22_58
BEGIN_
स वानरवरः श्रीमान् विश्वकर्मात्मजो बली || २-२२-७१
बबन्ध सागरे सेतुम् यथा चास्य तथा पिता |_END
BEGIN_
That Nala, the strong and illustrious son of Visvakarma and an excellent monkey
built the bridge across the sea as truly as his father would have built it._END

B_6_C_22_59
BEGIN_
स नलेन कृतः सेतुः सागरे मकर आलये || २-२२-७२
शुशुभे सुभगः श्रीमान् स्वाती पथ इव अम्बरे |_END
BEGIN_
That beautiful and lovely bridge constructed by Nala across the ocean the abode of
alligators, shone brightly like a milky way of stars in the sky._END

B_6_C_22_60
BEGIN_
ततो देवाः सगन्धर्वाः सिद्धाः च परम ऋषयः || २-२२-७३
आगम्य गगने तस्थुर्द्रष्टुकामास्तदद्भुतम् |_END
BEGIN_
With a desire to behold that marvel, celestials along with Gandharvas, the heavenly
musicians, Siddhas (semi-divine beings of great purity and perfection, possessing super natural
qualities) and great sages came then and stood up in the sky._END

B_6_C_22_61
BEGIN_
दशयोजनविस्तीर्णम् शतयोजन मायतम् || २-२२-७४
ददृशुर्देवगन्धर्वा नलसेतुम् सुदुष्करम् |_END
BEGIN_
The celestials and Gandharvas, the heavenly musicians saw Nala's bridge, having a
width of ten yojanas and a length of hundred yojanas and which was very difficult to be built._END

B_6_C_28_0
BEGIN_
सारणस्य वचः श्रुत्वा रावणम् राक्षस अधिपम् |
बलम् आलोकयन् सर्वम् शुको वाक्यम् अथ अब्रवीत् || ६-२८-१_END
BEGIN_
After listening to Sarana's words Shuka, pointing out all that army of monkeys,
spoke the following words to Ravana the Lord of Demons._END

B_6_C_22_62
BEGIN_
आप्लवन्तः प्लवन्तः च गर्जन्तः च प्लवम् गमाः || २-२२-७५
तम् अचिन्त्यम् असह्यम् च अद्भुतम् लोम हर्षणम् |
ददृशुः सर्व भूतानि सागरे सेतु बन्धनम् || २-२२-७६_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys taking long leaps and short leaps shouted in joy. All other beings saw
that construction of the bridge across the ocean as unimaginable, impossible and wonderful, causing
their hair to stand on end in amazement._END

B_6_C_28_1
BEGIN_
स्थितान् पश्यसि यान् एतान् मत्तान् इव महाद्विपान् |
न्यग्रोधान् इव गान्गेयान् सालान् हैमवतीन् इव || ६-२८-२
एते दुष्प्रसहा राजन् बलिनः काम रूपिणः |
दैत्य दानव सम्काशा युद्धे देव पराक्रमाः || ६-२८-३_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! Do you observe those monkeys resembling huge elephants in rut, rising like
banyan trees on the banks of River Ganga or Sala trees on Himalayas? Those warriors, able to change
their form at will, are irresistible, equal to celestials and demons, and in a battle, are endowed
with the valour of the gods."_END

B_6_C_22_63
BEGIN_
तानि कोटि सहस्राणि वानराणाम् महाओजसाम् |
बध्नन्तः सागरे सेतुम् जग्मुः पारम् महाउदधेः || २-२२-७७_END
BEGIN_
Those thousand crores of monkeys in a great spectacle reached the other shore of the
great ocean soon after building that bridge across the sea._END

B_6_C_28_2
BEGIN_
एषाम् कोटि सहस्राणि नव पन्च च सप्त च |
तथा शन्ख सहस्राणि तथा वृन्द शतानि च || ६-२८-४_END
BEGIN_
"There are twenty one thousand crores, a thousand Shankus and a hundred Vrindas of
these monkeys."_END

B_6_C_22_64
BEGIN_
विशालः सुकृतः श्रीमान् सुभूमिः सुसमाहितः |
अशोभत महासेतुः सीमन्त इव सागरे || २-२२-७८_END
BEGIN_
That colossal bridge, which was broad, well-constructed, glorious, well postured and
held together firmly, looked beautiful like a separating straight line in the ocean._END

B_6_C_28_3
BEGIN_
एते सुग्रीव सचिवाः किष्किन्धा निलयाः सदा |
हरयो देव गन्धर्वैर् उत्पन्नाः काम रूपिणः || ६-२८-५_END
BEGIN_
"These monkeys, the attendants of Sugreeva born of celestials and celestial
musicians, are able to change their form at will and always stay in Kishkindha."_END

B_6_C_22_65
BEGIN_
ततः परे समुद्रस्य गदा पाणिर् विभीषणः |
परेषाम् अभिघत अर्थम् अतिष्ठत् सचिवैः सह || २-२२-७९_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana, wielding a mace in his hand, stood up on the seashore along with his
ministers, for the purpose of invading the enemies._END

B_6_C_28_4
BEGIN_
यौ तौ पश्यसि तिष्ठन्तौ कुमारौ देव रूपिणौ |
मैन्दः च द्विविदः च उभौ ताभ्याम् न अस्ति समो युधि || ६-२८-६_END
BEGIN_
"The two who stand there, who have the same resemblance and have the appearance of
celestials, are Mainda and Dvivida. None can equal them in combat."_END

B_6_C_22_66
BEGIN_
सुग्रीवस्तु ततः प्राह रामम् सत्यपराक्रमम् |
हनुमन्तम् त्वमारोह अङ्गदम् त्वथ लक्ष्मणः || २-२२-८०
अयम् हि विपुलो वीर सागरो मकरालयः |
वैहायसौ युवामेतौ वानरौ धारयिष्यतः || २-२२-८१_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, Sugriva on his part spoke to Rama, the truly brave man as follows: "O,
valiant man! This ocean, the abode of alligators, is indeed vast. You ascend the shoulder of
Hanuman and let Lakshmana ascend the shoulder of Angada. These monkeys can hold both of you while
flying in the sky."_END

B_6_C_28_5
BEGIN_
ब्रह्मणा समनुज्ञाताव् अमृत प्राशिनाव् उभौ |
आशंसेते युधा लंकाम् एतौ मर्दितुम् ओजसा || ६-२८-७_END
BEGIN_
"These two, who ate ambrosion on due authorization by Brahma, are hopefully of
destroying Lanka by their power."_END

B_6_C_22_67
BEGIN_
अग्रतस् तस्य सैन्यस्य श्रीमान् रामः सलक्ष्मणः |
जगाम धन्वी धर्म आत्मा सुग्रीवेण समन्वितः || २-२२-८२_END
BEGIN_
Rama the glorious and righteous man, wielding a bow along with Lakshmana together
with Sugriva, went in front of that army._END

B_6_C_29_0
BEGIN_
शुकेन तु समाख्यातांस् तान् दृष्ट्वा हरि यूथपान् |
लक्ष्मणम् च महावीर्यम् भुजम् रामस्य दक्षिणम् || २-२९-१
समीपस्थम् च रामस्य भ्रातरम् स्वम् विभीषणम् |
सर्व वानर राजम् च सुग्रीवम् भीम विक्रमम् || २-२९-२
अङ्गदम् चापि बलिनम् वज्रहस्तात्मजात्मजम् |
हनूमन्तम् च विक्रान्तम् जाम्बवन्तम् च दुर्जयम् || २-२९-३
सुषेणम् कुमुदम् नीलम् नलम् च प्लवगर्षभम् |
गजम् गवाक्षम् शरभम् वैन्दम् च द्विविदम् तथा || २-२९-४
किंचिद् आविग्न हृदयो जात क्रोधः च रावणः |
भर्त्सयाम् आस तौ वीरौ कथा अन्ते शुक सारणौ || २-२९-५_END
BEGIN_
Beholding those foremost of monkey leaders pointed out by Shuka- the most valiant
Lakshmana; Rama's right arm, his own brother Vibhishana standing close to Rama, the terribly
powerful Sugreeva the king of all monkeys, the strong Angada grandson of Indra the wielder of
thunderbolt, the powerful Hanuman, the imincible Jambavan, Sushena, Kumuda, Nila, Nala the
excellent of monkeys, Gaja, Gavaksha, Sharabha, Mainda and Dvivida- that Ravana - his heart became
agitated a little, was enraged and then abused those two heroes Shuka and Sarana who had completed
their report._END

B_6_C_28_6
BEGIN_
यम् तु पश्यसि तिष्ठन्तम् प्रभिन्नम् इव कुन्जरम् |
यो बलात् क्षोभयेत् क्रुद्धः समुद्रम् अपि वानरः || ६-२८-८
एषो अभिगन्ता लंकाया वैदेह्यास् तव च प्रभो |
एनम् पश्य पुरा दृष्टम् वानरम् पुनर् आगतम् || ६-२८-९_END
BEGIN_
"As for that monkey who you see there, resembling an intoxicated elephant, who in
strength and fury is able to churn up the ocean itself, it is he who came to Lanka to find Seetha
and spy on you, O, Lord! See that monkey, who was seen earlier and who appears here again."_END

B_6_C_22_68
BEGIN_
अन्ये मध्येन गच्चन्ति पार्श्वतो अन्ये प्लवम् गमाः |
सलिले प्रपतन्ति अन्ये मार्गम् अन्ये न लेभिरे || २-२२-८३
केचिद् वैहायस गताः सुपर्णा इव पुप्लुवुः |_END
BEGIN_
Some monkeys went along the middle of the bridge. Some others went along the sides.
Some others were jumping into water. Some others marched forward on the path. Some monkeys entered
the sky and aviated like Garuda the eagle._END

B_6_C_29_1
BEGIN_
अधो मुखौ तौ प्रणताव् अब्रवीत् शुक सारणौ |
रोष गद्गदया वाचा सम्रब्धः परुषम् वचः || २-२९-६_END
BEGIN_
Ravana spoke (the following) excited and harsh words, in a voice choked in anger to
Shuka and Sarana who stood saluting with their faces bent down._END

B_6_C_28_7
BEGIN_
ज्येष्ठः केसरिणः पुत्रो वात आत्मज इति श्रुतः |
हनूमान् इति विख्यातो लन्घितो येन सागरः || ६-२८-१०_END
BEGIN_
"This monkey, by whom the ocean was traversed, is the eldest son of Kesari. He is
known as the son of wind-god and famously called as Hanuman."_END

B_6_C_22_69
BEGIN_
घोषेण महता घोषम् सागरस्य समुच्च्रितम् || २-२२-८४
भीमम् अन्तर् दधे भीमा तरन्ती हरि वाहिनी |_END
BEGIN_
The highly terrific sound of the ocean was covered up by the great sounds of the
terrific monkeys who were crossing the sea._END

B_6_C_29_2
BEGIN_
न तावत् सदृशम् नाम सचिवैर् उपजीविभिः |
विप्रियम् नृपतेर् वक्तुम् निग्रह प्रग्रहे विभोः || २-२९-७_END
BEGIN_
"It is not befitting to utter unpleasant words by dependent ministers to their king
who has the power to mete out any punishment or reward."_END

B_6_C_28_8
BEGIN_
काम रूपी हरि श्रेष्ठो बल रूप समन्वितः |
अनिवार्य गतिः चैव यथा सततगः प्रभुः || ६-२८-११_END
BEGIN_
"This excellent monkey can assume any form at will. He is endowed with a good
strength and form always moving like the wind-god, having an uninterrupted mobility."_END

B_6_C_22_70
BEGIN_
वानराणाम् हि सा तीर्णा वाहिनी नल सेतुना || २-२२-८५
तीरे निविविशे राज्ञा बहु मूल फल उदके |_END
BEGIN_
That army of monkeys, which crossed the ocean by the bridge constructed by Nala, was
encamped by Sugriva at a shore having many fruits tubers and water._END

B_6_C_29_3
BEGIN_
रिपूणाम् प्रतिकूलानाम् युद्ध अर्थम् अभिवर्तताम् |
उभाभ्याम् सदृशम् नाम वक्तुम् अप्रस्तवे स्तवम् || २-२९-८_END
BEGIN_
"Is it proper for both of you to shower irrelevant praise on our enemies who are
adverse to us and are approaching for a war?"_END

B_6_C_22_71
BEGIN_
तद् अद्भुतम् राघव कर्म दुष्करम् |
समीक्ष्य देवाः सह सिद्ध चारणैः |
उपेत्य रामम् सहिता महर्षिभिः |
समभ्यषिन्चन् सुशुभिअर् जलैः पृथक् || २-२२-८६_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that Rama's accomplishment, which was amazing and arduous; celestials,
Siddhas (semi-divine beings possessing supernatural faculties) and Charanas (celestial bards) along
with great sages, forthwith approached Rama and consecrated him with very splendid waters
separately._END

B_6_C_28_9
BEGIN_
उद्यन्तम् भास्करम् दृष्ट्वा बालः किल पिपासितः |
त्रियोजन सहस्रम् तु अध्वानम् अवतीर्य हि || ६-२८-१२
आदित्यम् आहरिष्यामि न मे क्षुत् प्रतियास्यति |
इति संचिन्त्य मनसा पुरा एष बल दर्पितः || ६-२८-१३_END
BEGIN_
"While yet a child, seeing the sun rise, he desired to eat it and took off to a
distance of three thousand yojanas (or twenty four thousand miles) reflecting: �I shall seize hold
of the sun and my hunger will not be appeased otherwise' and they say, he leapt up (into the air)
intoxicated as he was with his own strength."_END

B_6_C_29_4
BEGIN_
आचार्या गुरवो वृद्धा वृथा वाम् पर्युपासिताः |
सारम् यद् राज शास्त्राणाम् अनुजीव्यम् न गृह्यते || २-२९-९_END
BEGIN_
"In vain have you sat at the feet of your elders, your preceptors and the aged,
since the essence to be followed from political sciences has not been grasped by both of you."_END

B_6_C_22_72
BEGIN_
जयस्व शत्रून् नर देव मेदिनीम् |
ससागराम् पालय शाश्वतीः समाः |
इति इव रामम् नर देव सत्कृतम् |
शुभैर् वचोभिर् विविधैर् अपूजयन् || २-२२-८७_END
BEGIN_
The celestials, Siddhas and others exalted Rama, who was duly respected by kings
with their auspicious -words as follows: " O, king! Defeat the enemies. Rule the earth and ocean
eternally for years."_END

B_6_C_28_10
BEGIN_
अनाधृष्यतमम् देवम् अपि देव ऋषि दानवैः |
अनासाद्य एव पतितो भास्कर उदयने गिरौ || ६-२८-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Without even reaching the sun, which is most unassailable even to celestials, sages
or demons, he however fell on a mountain, where that radiant orb rises."_END

B_6_C_29_5
BEGIN_
गृहीतो वा न विज्ञातो भारो ज्ञानस्य वा उच्यते |
ईदृशैः सचिवैर् युक्तो मूर्खैर् दिष्ट्या धरामि अहम् || २-२९-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Or if you have imbibed them, you have not remembered them. You are over-burdened
with ignorance! Being associated with such foolish ministers, it is a miracle that I am still able
to retain my sovereignty."_END

B_6_C_28_11
BEGIN_
पतितस्य कपेर् अस्य हनुर् एका शिला तले |
किंचिद् भिन्ना दृढ हनोर् हनूमान् एष तेन वै || ६-२८-१५_END
BEGIN_
"One of the jaws of this monkey who fell down on the head of the rock, was a little
fractured. For this reason, because of his strong jaw, he is called Hanuma."_END

B_6_C_29_6
BEGIN_
किम् नु मृत्योर् भयम् न अस्ति माम् वक्तुम् परुषम् वचः |
यस्य मे शासतो जिह्वा प्रयच्चति शुभ अशुभम् || २-२९-११_END
BEGIN_
"Have you no fear of death that you dare address me thus rudely, I whose tongue that
you dare tongue dispenses good and evil?"_END

B_6_C_28_12
BEGIN_
सत्यम् आगम योगेन मम एष विदितो हरिः |
न अस्य शक्यम् बलम् रूपम् प्रभावो वा अनुभाषितुम् || ६-२८-१६_END
BEGIN_
"This monkey is known to me actually through the words of my bosom friends. It is
not possible to describe his strength or physical form or glory."_END

B_6_C_30_0
BEGIN_
ततस्तमक्षोभ्य बलम् लंका अधिपतये चराः |
सुवेले राघवम् शैले निविष्टम् प्रत्यवेदयन् || ६-३०-१_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, the spies informed Ravana about Rama, with his unperturbable army,
having encamped on Suvela Mountain._END

B_6_C_29_7
BEGIN_
अपि एव दहनम् स्पृष्ट्वा वने तिष्ठन्ति पादपाः |
राज दोष परामृष्टास् तिष्ठन्ते न अपराधिनः || २-२९-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Trees may survive in the forest, even if disturbed by fire. But the guilty cannot
survive, if touched by the royal scepter."_END

B_6_C_28_13
BEGIN_
एष आशंसते लंकाम् एको मर्दितुम् ओजसा |
येव जाज्वल्यतेऽसौ वै धूमकेतुस्तवाद्य वै || ६-२८-१७
लंकायाम् निहितश्चापि कथम् विस्मरसे कसिम् |_END
BEGIN_
"He alone wants to destroy Lanka by his valour. How do you forget this monkey by
whom this fire was lighted and is still blazing up Lanka."_END

B_6_C_30_1
BEGIN_
चाराणाम् रावणः श्रुत्वा प्राप्तम् रामम् महाबलम् |
जात उद्वेगो अभवत् किंचित् शार्दूलम् वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् || ६-३०-२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing from the spies about the arrival of Rama, the exceedingly strong man, Ravana
became a little perturbed and spoke to Shardula as follows:_END

B_6_C_29_8
BEGIN_
हन्याम् अहम् इमौ पापौ शत्रु पक्ष प्रशंसकौ |
यदि पूर्व उपकारैर् मे न क्रोधो मृदुताम् व्रजेत् || २-२९-१३_END
BEGIN_
"If my anger is not softened by the services they rendered earlier, I would have
killed thse two miscreants who are praising the band of enemies."_END

B_6_C_30_2
BEGIN_
अयथावच् च ते वर्णो दीनः च असि निशा चर |
न असि कच्चिद् अमित्राणाम् क्रुद्धानाम् वशम् आगतः || ६-३०-३_END
BEGIN_
O, demon! Your complexion is not so as it should be. You look miserable too. I hope
that you have not fallen a victim to the enraged monkeys."_END

B_6_C_28_14
BEGIN_
यः च एषो अनन्तरः शूरः श्यामः पद्म निभ ईक्षणः || ६-२८-१८
इक्ष्वाकूणाम् अतिरथो लोके विख्यात पौरुषः |
यस्मिन् न चलते धर्मो यो धर्मम् न अतिवर्तते || ६-२८-१९
यो ब्राह्मम् अस्त्रम् वेदामः च वेद वेदविदाम् वरः |
यो भिन्द्याद् गगनम् बाणैः पर्वतामः च अपि दारयेत् || ६-२८-२०
यस्य मृत्योर् इव क्रोधः शक्रस्य इव पराक्रमः |
यस्य भार्या जन्स्थानात्सीता चापि हृता त्वया || ६-२८-२१
स एष रामस् त्वाम् योद्धुम् राजन् समभिवर्तते |_END
BEGIN_
"Nearby is a warrior, dark of hue with eyes like lotuses, a chief warrior among
Ikshvakus, his heroism is well-known in the world, his sense of duty never wavers, nor does he ever
transgress the righteousness, he knows to loose Brahma's weapon and is conversant with Veda, he is
the most learned of the Vedic scholars, he shatters the firmament with his arrows, and rends even
the earth, his anger is akin to that of Death, his valour equal to that of Indra the god of
celestials, his consort is Seetha who was taken away by you from a place called Janasthana, he is
Rama who has come to wage war on you, O king!"_END

B_6_C_29_9
BEGIN_
अपध्वंसत गच्चध्वम् सम्निकर्षाद् इतो मम |
न हि वाम् हन्तुम् इच्चामि स्मरन्न् उपकृतानि वाम् || २-२९-१४
हताव् एव कृतघ्नौ तौ मयि स्नेह परान् मुखौ |_END
BEGIN_
"Keep away from my neighbourhood. Do not be seen anywhere here. I am recollecting
your past services and hence do not wish to kill you. Both of you, who are ungrateful and
unfaithful towards me, are just as dead to me."_END

B_6_C_30_3
BEGIN_
इति तेन अनुशिष्टस् तु वाचम् मन्दम् उदीरयत् |
तदा राक्षस शार्दूलम् शार्दूलो भय विह्वलः || ६-३०-४_END
BEGIN_
Thus questioned by Ravana, Shardula afflicted with fear, then sluggishly spoke the
following words to Ravana the tiger among demons:_END

B_6_C_28_15
BEGIN_
यः च एष दक्षिणे पार्श्वे शुद्ध जाम्बू नद प्रभः || ६-२८-२२
विशाल वक्षास् ताम्र अक्षो नील कुन्चित मूर्धजः |
एषो अस्य लक्ष्मणो नाम भ्राता प्राण समः प्रियः || ६-२८-२३
नये युद्धे च कुशलः सर्व शास्त्रभृताम् वरः |_END
BEGIN_
"This man, having the radiance of pure gold, with a broad chest, having red eyes,
with black and curled hair, standing at the right side of Rama, he is called Lakshmana, who is
interested in the care and welfare of his brother, skilled in leadership of combat and excellent
among the wielders of all weapons."_END

B_6_C_29_10
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्तौ तु सव्रीडौ ताव् उभौ शुक सारणौ || २-२९-१५
रावणम् जय शब्देन प्रतिनन्द्य अभिनिह्सृतौ |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Ravana's words, Shuka and Sarana felt ashamed to see Ravana paid obeisance
to him saying, "Be thou victorious!" and went away._END

B_6_C_28_16
BEGIN_
अमर्षी दुर्जयो जेता विक्रान्तो बुद्धिमान् बली || ६-२८-२४
रामस्य दक्षिणो बाहुर् नित्यम् प्राणो बहिः चरः |_END
BEGIN_
This Lakshmana is an angry person, difficult to be conquered, victorious, wise and
mighty. He has always been the right arm of Rama and in outward moving life (of Rama)._END

B_6_C_30_4
BEGIN_
न ते चारयितुम् शक्या राजन् वानर पुम्गवाः |
विक्रान्ता बलवन्तः च राघवेण च रक्षिताः || ६-३०-५_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! Those strong, bold and excellent monkeys protected by Rama are not capable
of being spied upon."_END

B_6_C_29_11
BEGIN_
अब्रवीत् स दशग्रीवः समीपस्थम् महाउदरम् || २-२९-१६
उपस्थापय शीघ्रम् मे चारान् नीति विशारदान् |_END
BEGIN_
The demon Ravana spoke to Mahodara who was standing nearby as follows: "Bring me the
spies here quickly."_END

B_6_C_28_17
BEGIN_
न हि एष राघवस्य अर्थे जीवितम् परिरक्षति || ६-२८-२५
एष एव आशंसते युद्धे निहन्तुम् सर्व राक्षसान् |_END
BEGIN_
"He does not indeed care for his life in the cause of Rama. He alone wishes to kill
all the demons in battle."_END

B_6_C_30_5
BEGIN_
न अपि सम्भाषितुम् शक्याः सम्प्रश्नो अत्र न लभ्यते |
सर्वतो रक्ष्यते पन्था वानरैः पर्वत उपमैः || ६-३०-६_END
BEGIN_
"They are not capable of being talked with and nothing can be found in interrogating
with them. The entire path is being protected by the monkeys looking like mountains."_END

B_6_C_29_12
BEGIN_
महोदरस्तथोक्तस्तु शीघ्रमाज्ञापयच्चरान् || २-२९-१७
ततश्चाराः सम्त्वरिताः प्राप्ताः पार्थिवशासनात् |
उपस्थिथाः प्राञ्जलयो वर्धयित्वा जयाशिषः || २-२९-१८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words, Mahodara immediately ordered for the spies. The spies came
hurriedly as per the orders of the king, paid obeisance to him by joining their palms and
approached him, having made a complement expressing their desire to see him victorious._END

B_6_C_28_18
BEGIN_
यस् तु सव्यम् असौ पक्षम् रामस्य आश्रित्य तिष्ठति || ६-२८-२६
रक्षो गण परिक्षिप्तो राजा हि एष विभीषणः |_END
BEGIN_
"He who is standing there, taking guard at the left side of Rama, surrounded by a
troop of demons he is the king Vibhishana."_END

B_6_C_30_6
BEGIN_
प्रविष्ट मात्रे ज्ञातो अहम् बले तस्मिन्न् अचारिते |
बलाद् गृहीतो बहुभिर् बहुधा अस्मि विदारितः || ६-३०-७_END
BEGIN_
"I was identified when that army was merely penetrated into (by me) and began to be
examined. I was seized forcibly by the demons (forming the retinue of Vibhishana), who investigated
me in various ways."_END

B_6_C_29_13
BEGIN_
तान् अब्रवीत् ततो वाक्यम् रावणो राक्षस अधिपः || २-२९-१९
चारान् प्रत्ययिकान् शूरान् भक्तान् विगत साध्वसान् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, Ravana the king of demons spoke the following words to those spies, who were
faithful, brave, energetic and free from fear:_END

B_6_C_28_19
BEGIN_
श्रीमता राज राजेन लंकायाम् अभिषेचितः || ६-२८-२७
त्वाम् एव प्रतिसम्रब्धो युद्धाय एषो अभिवर्तते |_END
BEGIN_
"He, who was consecrated as a king for Lanka by the illustrious Rama, the king of
kings, is enraged really with you and is to attack us in the battle."_END

B_6_C_30_7
BEGIN_
जानुभिर् मुष्टिभिर् दन्तैस् तलैः च अभिहतो भृशम् |
परिणीतो अस्मि हरिभिर् बलवद्भिर् अमर्षणैः || ६-३०-८_END
BEGIN_
"I was beaten on all sides with knees, fists, teeth and palms by the enraged
monkeys. I was also paraded round in the midst of their army."_END

B_6_C_29_14
BEGIN_
इतो गच्चत रामस्य व्यवसायम् परीक्षथ || २-२९-२०
मन्त्रेष्व् अभ्यन्तरा ये अस्य प्रीत्या तेन समागताः |_END
BEGIN_
"You go from here to investigate about the first impression concerning Rama, as
regards who are his intimate friends and in respect of those who joined on his side with a liking
towards him."_END

B_6_C_28_20
BEGIN_
यम् तु पश्यसि तिष्ठन्तम् मध्ये गिरिम् इव अचलम् || ६-२८-२८
सर्व शाखा मृग इन्द्राणाम् भर्तारम् अपराजितम् |
तेजसा यशसा बुद्ध्या ज्ञानेन अभिजनेन च || ६-२८-२९
यः कपीन् अति बभ्राज हिमवान् इव पर्वतान् |
किष्किन्धाम् यः समध्यास्ते गुहाम् सगहन द्रुमाम् || ६-२८-३०
दुर्गाम् पर्वत दुर्गस्थाम् प्रधानैः सह यूथपैः |
यस्य एषा कान्चनी माला शोभते शत पुष्करा || ६-२८-३१
कान्ता देव मनुष्याणाम् यस्याम् लक्ष्मीः प्रतिष्ठिता |
एताम् च मालाम् ताराम् च कपि राज्यम् च शाश्वतम् || ६-२८-३२
सुग्रीवो वालिनम् हत्वा रामेण प्रतिपादितः |_END
BEGIN_
"The other whom you see as an unshakable mountain and standing in the centre of
monkeys as a Lord of all chiefs of monkeys, with a boundless energy and who, like a Himalayan hill,
very much radiating the other monkeys by his splendour, glory, wisdom, strength and his noble
descent, who occupies along with the chiefs of Army Generals, a secret place called Kishkindha,
with its forests and trees and the place inaccessible because of its impassable mountains, in which
is established a good fortune of celestials and human beings, whose charming and golden coloured
garland with hundred lotuses is beautifying, that person is Sugreeva. This garland along with a
lady called Tara as well as the permanent kingdom of monkeys were presented to him by Rama after
having killed Vali (Sugreeva's brother)."_END

B_6_C_30_8
BEGIN_
परिणीय च सर्वत्र नीतो अहम् राम संसदम् |
रुधिर आदिग्ध सर्व अन्गो विह्वलः चलित इन्द्रियः || ६-३०-९_END
BEGIN_
"Having been paraded all around thus, I was finally taken to the court of Rama. All
my limbs were bleeding and Rama. All my limbs were bleeding and I was trembling, with my senses
disturbed."_END

B_6_C_29_15
BEGIN_
कथम् स्वपिति जागर्ति किम् अन्यच् च करिष्यति || २-२९-२१
विज्ञाय निपुणम् सर्वम् आगन्तव्यम् अशेषतः |_END
BEGIN_
"Find out what are his hours of sleeping and waking and what he intends to do next.
You ought to come here, after acquainting with all this information completely and skillfully."_END

B_6_C_28_21
BEGIN_
शतम् शतसहस्राणाम् कोटिमाहुर्मनीषिणः || ६-२८-३३
शतम् कोटिसहस्राणाम् शङ्कुरित्यभिधीयते |_END
BEGIN_
"Wise men call a hundred lakhs as a crore. A hundred thousand crores is reckoned as
a Shanku."_END

B_6_C_30_9
BEGIN_
हरिभिर् वध्यमानः च याचमानः कृत अन्जलिः |
राघवेण परित्रातो जीवामि ह यदृच्चया || ६-३०-१०_END
BEGIN_
"While being plagued by the monkeys and asked for protection with joined palms, I
was saved fortunately by Rama, saying �stay!stay!'_END

B_6_C_29_16
BEGIN_
चारेण विदितः शत्रुः पण्डितैर् वसुधा अधिपैः || २-२९-२२
युद्धे स्वल्पेन यत्नेन समासाद्य निरस्यते |_END
BEGIN_
"An enemy in battle, got known through spies by kings, will be defeated with only a
little of effort."_END

B_6_C_30_10
BEGIN_
एष शैलैः शिलाभिः च पूरयित्वा महाअर्णवम् |
द्वारम् आश्रित्य लंकाया रामस् तिष्ठति सायुधः || ६-३०-११_END
BEGIN_
"Rama has filled the sea with boulders and rocks, taking up his position at the
gates of Lanka and stands there, well-equipped with weapons."_END

B_6_C_28_22
BEGIN_
शतम् शङ्कुसहस्राणाम् महाशङ्कुरिति स्मृतः || ६-२८-३४
महाशङ्क्य्सहस्राणाम् शतम् वृन्दमिहोच्यते |
शतम् नृन्दसहस्राणाम् महावृन्दमिति स्मृतम् || ६-२८-३५
महावृन्दसहस्राणाम् शतम् पद्ममिहोच्यते |
शतम् पद्मसहस्राणाम् महापद्ममिति स्मृतम् || ६-२८-३६
महापद्मसहस्राणाम् शतम् खर्वमिहोच्यते |
शतम् खर्वसहस्राणाम् महाखर्वमिति स्मृतम् || ६-२८-३७
महाखर्वसहस्राणाम् समुद्रमभिधीयते |
शतम् समुद्रसाहस्रमोघ इत्यभिधीयते || ६-२८-३८
शतमोघसहस्राणाम् महौघ इति विश्रुतः |_END
BEGIN_
"A hundred thousand Shankus are said to be one Maha Shanku. A hundred thousand Maha
Shankus are called one Vrindam here. A hundred thousand Vrindas are said to be one Maha vrindam. A
hundred thousand Mahavrindas are called one Padmam here. A hundred thousand padmas are said to be
one Mahapadmam. A hundred thousand Mahapadmas are called one Kharvam here. A hundred thousand
kharvas are said to be one Mahakharvam. A hundred thousand Mahakharvas are called one Samundram. A
hundred thousand Samudras are said to be one ogha here. A hundred thousand oghas are acclaimed a
one Mahaugha."_END

B_6_C_29_17
BEGIN_
चारास् तु ते तथा इति उक्त्वा प्रहृष्टा राक्षस ईश्वरम् || २-२९-२३
शार्दूलमग्रतः कृत्वा ततश्चक्रुः प्रदक्षिणम् |_END
BEGIN_
Those spies on their part delightfully replied, "May it be so", kept Shardula in
their front and made their circumambulation clockwise around Ravana._END

B_6_C_30_11
BEGIN_
गरुड व्यूहम् आस्थाय सर्वतो हरिभिर् वृतः |
माम् विसृज्य महातेजा लंकाम् एव अभिवर्तते || ६-३०-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Having released me, Rama of great splendour arranged the army in the form of Garuda
(an eagle). He is encircled on all sides by the monkeys and is approaching towards Lanka."_END

B_6_C_28_23
BEGIN_
एवम् कोटि सहस्रेण शन्कूनाम् च शतेन च || ६-२८-३९
महाशङ्कुसहस्रेण तथा वृन्दशतेन च |
महावृन्दसहस्रेण तथा पद्मशतेन च || ६-२८-४०
महापद्मसहस्रेण तथा खर्वशतेन च |
समुद्रेण च तेनैव महुघेन तथैव च || ६-२८-४१
एष कोटिमहौघेन समुद्रसदृशेन च |
विभीषणेन वीरेण सचिवैः परिवारितः || ६-२८-४२
सुग्रीवो वानर इन्द्रस् त्वाम् युद्ध अर्थम् अभिवर्तते |
महाबलवृतो नित्यम् महाबलपराक्रमः || ६-२८-४३_END
BEGIN_
"This Sugreeva, the king of monkeys, having great strength and valour, always
surrounded by a colossal army, is approaching you to make war, accompanied by the valiant
Vibhishana and the ministers, as also a hundred thousand crores of Shankas, a thousand Mahashankus,
a hundred Vrindas, a thousand mahavrindas, a hundred padmas, a thousand Mahapadmas, a hundred
kharves, samudras and Mahaughas of the same number, and a crore of Mahanghas wholearmy as such is
identical of an ocean."_END

B_6_C_29_18
BEGIN_
ततस्तम् तु महात्मानम् चारा राक्षससत्तमम् || २-२९-२४
कृत्वा प्रदक्षिणम् जग्मुर् यत्र रामः सलक्ष्मणः |_END
BEGIN_
Having thus made circumambulation to Ravana the excellent and the distinguished
demon, the spies went to the place where Rama along with Lakshmana were there._END

B_6_C_30_12
BEGIN_
पुरा प्राकारम् आयाति क्षिप्रम् एकतरम् कुरु |
सीताम् च अस्मै प्रयच्च आशु सुयुद्धम् वा प्रदीयताम् || ६-३०-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Before he reaches the ramparts, do one thing or the other quickly or give away
Seetha immediately or even offer him battle."_END

B_6_C_28_24
BEGIN_
इमाम् महाराज समीक्ष्य वाहिनीम् |
उपस्थिताम् प्रज्वलित ग्रह उपमाम् |
ततः प्रयत्नः परमो विधीयताम् |
यथा जयः स्यान् न परैः पराजयः || ६-२८-४४_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! Carefully observing this army, which appears much the same as a blazing
planet, prepare yourself for a great effort to get victory and take measures to avoid defeat from
the enemies."_END

B_6_C_30_13
BEGIN_
मनसा सम्तताप अथ तत् श्रुत्वा राक्षस अधिपः |
शार्दूलस्य महद् वाक्यम् अथ उवाच स रावणः || ६-३०-१४_END
BEGIN_
Having heard those words, Ravana the lord of demons reflected on it and thereafter
spoke the following significant words to Shardula._END

B_6_C_29_19
BEGIN_
ते सुवेलस्य शैलस्य समीपे राम लक्ष्मणौ || २-२९-२५
प्रच्चन्ना ददृशुर् गत्वा ससुग्रीव विभीषणौ |_END
BEGIN_
Having gone in a disguised manner, those spies saw Rama and Lakshman together with
Sugreeva and Vibhishana in the neighbourhood of Mountain Suvela._END

B_6_C_30_14
BEGIN_
यदि माम् प्रतियुध्येरन् देव गन्धर्व दानवाः |
न एव सीताम् प्रदास्यामि सर्व लोक भयाद् अपि || ६-३०-१५_END
BEGIN_
"I will not give away Seetha even if the celestials or Gandharvas the celestial
musicians or the demons were to fight against me or even under danger from all beings."_END

B_6_C_29_20
BEGIN_
प्रेक्षमाणाश्चमूम् ताम् च बभूवुर्भयविह्वलाः || २-२९-२६
ते तु धर्म आत्मना दृष्टा राक्षस इन्द्रेण राक्षसाः |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that army, those demons became overwhelmed with fear. However, they were
observed by the high-souled Vibhishana the Lord of demons._END

B_6_C_30_15
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा महातेजा रावणः पुनर् अब्रवीत् |
चारिता भवता सेना के अत्र शूराः प्लवम् गमाः || ६-३०-१६_END
BEGIN_
After uttering the aforesaid words, the heroic Ravana again spoke as follows: "Has
the army been espied by you? Who are the valiant monkeys among them?"_END

B_6_C_29_21
BEGIN_
विभीषणेन तत्रस्था निगृहीता यदृच्चया || २-२९-२७
शार्दूलो ग्राहितस्त्वेकः पापोऽयमिति राक्षसः |_END
BEGIN_
Accidentally, the deomons there were caught by Vibhishana, who said that the demon
Shardula among them was wicked and got him alone seized._END

B_6_C_29_22
BEGIN_
मोक्षितः सोऽपि रामेण वध्यमानः प्लवङ्गमैः || २-२९-२८
अनृशंसेन रामेण मोक्षिता राक्षसाः सरे |_END
BEGIN_
That Shardula also, who was going to be killed by the monkeys, was got released by
Rama. The other demons also were got released by Rama, the kind man._END

B_6_C_30_16
BEGIN_
कीदृशाः किम् प्रभावाः च वानरा ये दुरासदाः |
कस्य पुत्राः च पौत्राः च तत्त्वम् आख्याहि राक्षस || ६-३०-१७_END
BEGIN_
"O, the virtuous gentle Shardula! What radiance do the monkeys, who are difficult to
be conquered possess of? what kind? Whose sons and grandsons are they? You tell me that
information."_END

B_6_C_29_23
BEGIN_
वानरैर् अर्दितास् ते तु विक्रान्तैर् लघु विक्रमैः || २-२९-२९
पुनर् लंकाम् अनुप्राप्ताः श्वसन्तो नष्ट चेतसः |_END
BEGIN_
Those demons, harassed by the courageous and the quick-paced monkeys, became
insensible, heaved a sigh and reached back Lanka._END

B_6_C_30_17
BEGIN_
तथात्र प्रतिपत्स्यामि ज्ञात्वा तेषाम् बल अबलम् |
अवश्यम् बल सम्ख्यानम् कर्तव्यम् युद्धम् इच्चता || ६-३०-१८_END
BEGIN_
"After knowing their strengths and weakness, I will decide in this matter
accordingly. Is it not necessary to count clearly those who are really yearning to fight the
battle?"_END

B_6_C_29_24
BEGIN_
ततो दशग्रीवम् उपस्थितास् ते |
चारा बहिर् नित्य चरा निशा चराः |
गिरेः सुवेलस्य समीप वासिनम् |
न्यवेदयन् भीम बलम् महाबलाः || २-२९-३०_END
BEGIN_
Those spies, who always wander outside and who were valiant rangers of the night,
thereafter approached Ravana and informed him that Rama's army was camping in the vicinity of the
Suvela mountain._END

B_6_C_30_18
BEGIN_
अथ एवम् उक्तः शार्दूलो रावणेन उत्तमः चरः |
इदम् वचनम् आरेभे वक्तुम् रावण सम्निधौ || ६-३०-१९_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Ravana's words, Shardula the excellent spy then started to narrate these
words for Ravana's information:_END

B_6_C_30_19
BEGIN_
अथ ऋक्ष रजसः पुत्रो युधि राजन् सुदुर्जयः |
गद्गदस्य अथ पुत्रो अत्र जाम्बवान् इति विश्रुतः || ६-३०-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Certainly, king Sugreeva, the son of Riksharajasa, is difficult to be conquered in
battle. Here is the son of Gadgada, famously called as Jambavan."_END

B_6_C_30_20
BEGIN_
गद्गदस्य एव पुत्रो अन्यो गुरु पुत्रः शत क्रतोः |
कदनम् यस्य पुत्रेण कृतम् एकेन रक्षसाम् || ६-३०-२१_END
BEGIN_
"The other one is the son of the same Gadgada. Another one is the son of Brihaspati
the teacher of Indra the lord of celestials, called Kesari by whose son Hanuman the demons were
destroyed."_END

B_6_C_30_21
BEGIN_
सुषेणः च अपि धर्म आत्मा पुत्रो धर्मस्य वीर्यवान् |
सौम्यः सोम आत्मजः च अत्र राजन् दधि मुखः कपिः || ६-३०-२२_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! Here is Sushena the son of Yama the Lord of Death who is valiant and
virtuous, as well as a monkey called Dadhimukha, the cool-minded, who is the son of moon."_END

B_6_C_30_22
BEGIN_
सुमुखो दुर्मुखः च अत्र वेग दर्शी च वानरः |
मृत्युर् वानर रूपेण नूनम् सृष्टः स्वयम्भुवा || ६-३०-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Sumukha, Durmukha and a monkey called Vegadarshi are surely the personifications of
death in the form of monkeys, created by Brahma, the Lord of creation."_END

B_6_C_30_23
BEGIN_
पुत्रो हुत वहस्य अथ नीलः सेना पतिः स्वयम् |
अनिलस्य च पुत्रो अत्र हनूमान् इति विश्रुतः || ६-३०-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Here is Nila the army-general himself, the son of Agni the Lord of Fire. Here is
the son of Vayu the Lord of Wind well- known as Hanuman."_END

B_6_C_30_24
BEGIN_
नप्ता शक्रस्य दुर्धर्षो बलवान् अन्गदो युवा |
मैन्दः च द्विविदः च उभौ बलिनाव् अश्वि सम्भवौ || ६-३०-२५
पुत्रा वैवस्वतस्य अत्र पन्च काल अन्तक उपमाः |
गजो गव अक्षो गवयः शरभो गन्ध मादनः || ६-३०-२६
दश वानरकोट्यश्च शूराणाम् युद्धकाङ्ग्क्षिणाम् |
श्रीमताम् देवपुत्राणाम् शेषम् नाख्यातुमुत्सहे || ६-३०-२७_END
BEGIN_
"The young Angada, Indra's grandson, the strong and invincible one, both the mighty
Mainda and Dvinda born of the two divinties of Ashvin* as well as Gaja, Gavaksha, Gavaya, Sharabha
and Gandhamadhana the five sons of Yama the God of Death all of them resembling Yama at the time of
dissolution of the world, the valiant ten crores of monkeys who are yearning for battle are all
here. I cannot venture to tell about the remaining glorious sons of god."_END

B_6_C_30_25
BEGIN_
पुत्रो दशरथस्येष सिम्हसम्हननो युवा |
दूषणो निहतो येन खरश्च त्रिशिरास्तथा || ६-३०-२८_END
BEGIN_
"This young man is Rama, Dasartha's son, who is well-built like a lion, by whom
Dushana ws killed as also Khara and Trishana._END

B_6_C_30_26
BEGIN_
नास्ति रामस्य सदृशो विक्रमे भुवि कश्चन |
विराधो निहतो येन कबन्धश्चान्तकोपमः || ६-३०-२९_END
BEGIN_
"There is no one on earth who is equal in prowess to Rama, by whom Viradha was
killed as also Kabandha who was equal to Yama."_END

B_6_C_30_27
BEGIN_
वक्तुम् न शक्तो रामस्य गुणान् कश्चिन्नरः क्षितौ |
जनस्थानगता येन तावन्तो राक्षसा हताः || ६-३०-३०_END
BEGIN_
"No man on this earth is able to narrate the qualities of Rama, by whom all the
demons staying in Janasthana were killed."_END

B_6_C_30_28
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणश्चात्र धर्मात्मा मातङ्गवामिवर्षभः |
यस्य बाणपथम् प्राप्य व जीवेदपि वासवः || ६-३०-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Here too is the virtuous Lakshamana, resembling the most excellent elephant among
elephants, in the path of whose arrows, even Indra the Lord of celestials himself could not
survive_END

B_6_C_30_29
BEGIN_
श्वेतो ज्योतिर् मुखः च अत्र भास्करस्य आत्म सम्भवौ |
वरुणस्य च पुत्रो अथ हेम कूटः प्लवम् गमः || ६-३०-३२
विश्व कर्म सुतो वीरो नलः प्लवग सत्तमः |
विक्रान्तो वेगवान् अत्र वसु पुत्रः सुदुर्धरः || ६-३०-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Sweta and Jyotirmukha, the sons of the sun-god, a monkey called Hemakuta, another
son of Varuna, Nila the son of Visvakarma the strong and the best of monkeys, as well as that
mighty and swift Durdhara the son of Vasus are all here."_END

B_6_C_30_30
BEGIN_
राक्षसानाम् वरिष्ठः च तव भ्राता विभीषणः |
परिगृह्य पुरीम् लंकाम् राघवस्य हिते रतः|| ६-३०-३४_END
BEGIN_
"There is the prince of demons Vibhishana, your brother, who having secured the city
of Lanka (as a prospective gift from Rama) remains devoted to the good of Rama."_END

B_6_C_30_31
BEGIN_
इति सर्वम् समाख्यातम् तव इदम् वानरम् बलम् |
सुवेले अधिष्ठितम् शैले शेष कार्ये भवान् गतिः || ६-३०-३५_END
BEGIN_
"Thus, I have described about the entire army of monkeys stationed on the Mount
Suvela. Now, it is for you to decide what remains to be done!"_END

B_6_C_31_0
BEGIN_ततस्तमक्षोभ्यबलम् लङ्कायां नृपतेश्चराः |
			सुवेले राघवं शैले निविष्टं प्रत्यवेदयन् || ६-३१-१_END
BEGIN_The spies of king Ravana informed him that Rama with his imperturbable army 
			was encamped at Mount Suvela in Lanka._END

B_6_C_31_1
BEGIN_चाराणाम् रावणः श्रुत्वा प्राप्तम् रामम् महाबलम् |
			जातोद्वेगोऽभवत्किंचित्सचिवानिदमब्रवीत् || ६-३१-२_END
BEGIN_Hearing through his spies that Rama with his mighty army had arrived to Lanka, 
			Ravana was a little agitated and spoke to his counsellors as follows:_END

B_6_C_31_2
BEGIN_मन्त्रिणः शीघ्रमायान्तु सर्वे वै सु समाहिताः |
			अयम् नो मन्त्रकालो हि सम्प्रास्त इति राक्षसाः || ६-३१-३_END
BEGIN_"The time for deliberation has come to us. Let our ministerial colleagues 
			come quickly with their keenly attentive minds."_END

B_6_C_31_3
BEGIN_तस्य तच्चासनम् श्रुत्वा मन्त्रिणोऽभ्यागमन् द्रुतम् |
			ततः स मन्त्रयामास राक्षसैः सचिवैः सह || ६-३१-४_END
BEGIN_As per his command, the ministers came instantly. Ravana conferred with the 
			ogres, his ministers._END

B_6_C_31_4
BEGIN_मन्त्रयित्वा तु दुर्धर्षः क्षमं यत्तदन्न्तरम् |
			विसर्जयित्वा सचिवान् प्रविवेश स्वमालयम् || ६-३१-५_END
BEGIN_The dreadful Ravana discussed about the ensuing things to be done immediately. 
			He sent away the ministers and entered his palace._END

B_6_C_32_0
BEGIN_सा सीता तच्चिरो दृष्ट्वा तच् च कार्मुकम् उत्तमम् | |
सुग्रीव प्रतिसंसर्गम् आख्यातम् च हनूमता || ६-३२-१
नयने मुख वर्णम् च भर्तुस् तत् सदृशम् मुखम् |
केशान् केश अन्त देशम् च तम् च चूडा मणिम् शुभम् || ६-३२-२
एतैह् सर्वैर् अभिज्नानैर् अभिज्नाय सुदुह्खिता |
विजगर्हे अथ कैकेयीम् क्रोशन्ती कुररी यथा || ६-३२-३_END
BEGIN_Seetha saw the illusory head and bow. She heard Ravana narrating about Rama's friendly 
relationship with Sugreeva, as earlier apprised by Hanuman. Recognizing that head as that of Rama, with 
a proof resembling her husband's eyes, facial complexion, hair, expanse of his forehead and the beautiful 
jewel worn on the top of his head, she was very much afflicted with sorrow, cried like an osprey and 
abused Kaikeyi who was the originator of the present calamity (as follows):_END

B_6_C_31_5
BEGIN_ततो राक्षसमादाय विद्युज्जिह्वम् महाबलम् |
			मायाविदम् महामायः प्रविशद्यत्र मैथिली || ६-३१-६_END
BEGIN_Thereafter, Ravana the practiser of conjuring tricks, took the exceedingly 
			strong Vidyujjihva who was a great sourcerer along with him and went to Seetha's place._END

B_6_C_31_6
BEGIN_विद्युज्जिह्वम् च मायाज्ञ्मब्रवीद्राक्षसाधिपः |
			मोहयिष्यावहे सीताम् मायया जनकात्मजाम् || ६-३१-७_END
BEGIN_Ravana the lord of demons spoke to Vidyujjihva, who was a knower of conjuring 
			tricks as follows: "With your spells, create an illusion in order to deceive Seetha, daughter 
			of Janaka."_END

B_6_C_32_1
BEGIN_सकामा भव कैकेयि हतो अयम् कुल नन्दनः |
कुलम् उत्सादितम् सर्वम् त्वया कलह शीलया || ६-३२-४_END
BEGIN_Kaikeyi! Be a fulfiller of your craving! This Rama, causing a joy to the family, has 
been slain. The entire race has been destroyed by a woman of squabbling nature._END

B_6_C_31_7
BEGIN_शिरो मायामयम् गृह्य राघवस्य विशाचर |
			मां त्वं समुपतिष्ठस्व महच्च सशरम् धनुः || ६-३१-८_END
BEGIN_"O, demon! Produce a head resembling Rama's along with a great bow and arrows 
			created deceptively and present yourself before me."_END

B_6_C_32_2
BEGIN_आर्येण किम् नु कैकेय्याः कृतम् रामेण विप्रियम् |
यन्मया चीर वसनस् तया प्रस्थापितो वनम् || ६-३२-५_END
BEGIN_"You gave clothes made of bark to the venerable Rama and sent him on exile to the forest 
along with me. What harm has he done to you?"_END

B_6_C_32_3
BEGIN_एवम् उक्त्वा तु वैदेही वेपमाना तपस्विनी |
जगाम जगतीम् बाला चिन्ना तु कदली यथा || ६-३२-६_END
BEGIN_Thus speaking, Seetha the miserable girl was trembling and fell on the ground like a 
plantain tree that was cut off. Thus speaking, Seetha the miserable girl was trembling and fell on the 
ground like a plantain tree that was cut off._END

B_6_C_31_8
BEGIN_एवमुक्त स्तथेत्याह विद्युज्जिह्वो निशाचतः |
			दर्शयामास ताम् मायाम् सुप्रयुक्ताम् स रावणे || ६-३१-९
			तस्य तुष्टोऽभवद्राजा प्रददौ च विभूषणम् |_END
BEGIN_Hearing Ravana's words, the demon Vidyujjihva said, "Be it so". He showed 
			to Ravana those things of his conjuring trick, well-performed. The king became satisfied 
			of his work and gave him an ornament (as a gift)._END

B_6_C_32_4
BEGIN_सा मुहूर्तात् समाश्वस्य प्रतिलभ्य च चेतनाम् |
तत् शिरह् समुपाघ्राय विललाप आयत ईक्षणा || ६-३२-७_END
BEGIN_The wide eyed Seetha thereafter was consoled in a moment, regained consciousness, approached 
near that illusory head and lamented as follows:_END

B_6_C_31_9
BEGIN_अशोकवनिकायाम् च सीतादर्शनलालसः || ६-३१-१०
			नैरृतानामधिपतिः सम्विवेश महाबलः |_END
BEGIN_The exceedingly strong Ravana the suzerain lord of demons, duly entered the 
			Ashoka grove, eagerly longing for the sight of Seetha._END

B_6_C_31_10
BEGIN_ततो दीनामदैन्यार्हाम् ददर्श धनदामजः || ६-३१-११
			अधोमुखीं शोकपरामुपविष्टाम् महीतले |
			भर्तारमेव ध्यायन्तीमशोकवनिकाम् गताम् || ६-३१-१२_END
BEGIN_Then, Ravana the younger brother of Kubera ( the god of riches) saw Seetha 
			the unfortunate one, who did not deserve that fate, seated on the ground with her head bent 
			down in the Ashoka grove plunged in grief as she was and absorbed in the thought of her 
			husband._END

B_6_C_32_5
BEGIN_हा हता अस्मि महा बाहो वीर व्रतम् अनुव्रता |
इमाम् ते पश्चिम अवस्थाम् गता अस्मि विधवा कृता || ६-३२-८_END
BEGIN_"O, the long armed Rama! The pursuer of a strong will! Alas, you have been killed! I 
have become a witness to your last fate. I have been made a widow."_END

B_6_C_33_0
BEGIN_
सीताम् तु मोहिताम् दृष्ट्वा सरमा नाम राक्षसी |
आससाद आशु वैदेहीम् प्रियाम् प्रणयिनी सखी || ६-३३-१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the bewildered Seetha, a demon named Sarama*, an affectionate female
companion then approached Seetha, her beloved Seetha, her beloved friend._END

B_6_C_31_11
BEGIN_उपास्यमानाम् घोराभी राक्षसीभिरदूरतः |
			उपसृत्य ततः सीताम् प्रहर्षं नाम कीर्तयन् || ६-३१-१३
			इदम् च वचनम् धृष्टमुवाच जनकात्मजाम् |_END
BEGIN_Then, approaching Seetha who was attended upon by ghastly ogresses seated 
			not far distance from her and mentioning his own name with great delight, Ravana spoke the 
			following audacious words to Seetha._END

B_6_C_32_6
BEGIN_प्रथमम् मरणम् नार्या भर्तुर् वैगुण्यम् उच्यते |
सुवृत्तः साधु वृत्तायाः सम्वृत्तस् त्वम् मम अग्रतः || ६-३२-९_END
BEGIN_"It is said that the early death of a husband is the misfortune of a wife. You, having 
good conduct, have preceded me in death."_END

B_6_C_33_1
BEGIN_
मोहिताम् राक्षसेन्द्रेण सीताम् परमदुःखिताम् |
आश्वासयामास तदा सरमा मृदुभाषिणी || ६-३३-२_END
BEGIN_
Sarama, the soft-spoken woman, consoled Seetha who having been infatuated by Ravana
was very much in distress._END

B_6_C_31_12
BEGIN_सान्त्व्यमाना मया भद्रे यमाश्रित्य विमन्यसे || ६-३१-१४
			खरहन्ता स ते भर्ता राघवः समरे हतः |_END
BEGIN_"O, Beautiful one! He in whom you trusted and repelled me when I sought to 
			console you - that murderer of Khara, your husband Rama has been killed in battle."_END

B_6_C_32_7
BEGIN_दुह्खाद् दुह्कःअम् प्रपन्नाया मग्नायाः शोक सागरे |
यो हि माम् उद्यतस् त्रातुम् सो अपि त्वम् विनिपातितः || ६-३२-१०_END
BEGIN_"Even you who were actually intent on protecting me, fallen in great affliction and immersed 
in an ocean of grief, have been killed by the enemies"_END

B_6_C_33_2
BEGIN_
सा हि तत्र कृता मित्रम् सीतया रक्ष्यमाणया |
रक्षन्ती रावणाद् इष्टा सानुक्रोशा दृढ व्रता || ६-३३-३_END
BEGIN_
Sarma, who was assigned by Ravana to guard Seetha, was kind hearted and firm in
austerity. She was indeed made a companion by Seetha, who was being protected by her there._END

B_6_C_31_13
BEGIN_चिन्नम् ते सर्वथा मूलम् दर्पश्च विहतो मया || ६-३१-१५
			व्यसनेनात्मनः सीते मम भार्या भविष्यसि |_END
BEGIN_"O, Seetha! Your root has been cut off in all ways by me and your pride has 
			been slain. By your present evil predicament, you will become my wife."_END

B_6_C_32_8
BEGIN_सा श्वश्रूर् मम कौसल्या त्वया पुत्रेण राघव |
वत्सेन इव यथा धेनुर् विवत्सा वत्सला कृता || ६-३२-११_END
BEGIN_"O, Rama! My mother- in-law Kausalya who cherished you tenderly has been left without 
a son and resembles a cow that has lost its calf."_END

B_6_C_33_3
BEGIN_
सा ददर्श सखीम् सीताम् सरमा नष्ट चेतनाम् |
उपावृत्य उत्थिताम् ध्वस्ताम् वडवाम् इव पांसुषु || ६-३३-४_END
BEGIN_
The affectionate Sarama found Seetha stupefied and just risen after rolling in the
dust and soiled, resembling a female horse._END

B_6_C_31_14
BEGIN_विसृजैतां मतिं मूढे किं मृतेन करिष्यसि || ६-३१-१६
			भवस्व भद्रे भार्याणां सर्वासामीश्वरी मम |_END
BEGIN_"O, Foolish one! Give up this resolution. What will you do with one dead. 
			O, beautiful one! Become the Chief Queen over all my consorts."_END

B_6_C_32_9
BEGIN_उदिष्टम् दीर्घम् आयुस् ते यैर् अचिन्त्य पराक्रम |
अनृतम् वचनम् तेषाम् अल्प आयुर् असि राघव || ६-३२-१२_END
BEGIN_"O, Rama! It was mentioned even by astrologers that your life span is lengthy. O, Rama! 
Their words are wrong. You are short lived."_END

B_6_C_33_4
BEGIN_
ताम् समाश्वासयाम् आस सखी स्नेहेन सुव्रता |
उक्ता यद् रावणेन त्वम् प्रत्युक्तम् च स्वयम् त्वया || ६-३३-५_END
BEGIN_
Sarama consoled the very virtuous Seetha as follows "O, Seetha! Be comfortable! Do
not get perturbed in your mind._END

B_6_C_34_0
BEGIN_
अथ ताम् जात सम्तापाम् तेन वाक्येन मोदिताम् |
सरमा ह्लादयाम् आस महीं दग्धामिवाम्भसा || ६-३४-१_END
BEGIN_
Seetha, who was overwhelmed with anguish on hearing Ravana's words, was comforted
and rendered happy by Sarama, as parched earth is solaced by rain._END

B_6_C_31_15
BEGIN_अल्पपुण्ये निवृत्तार्थे मूढे पण्डितमानिनि || ६-३१-१७
			सृणु भर्तृनधम् सीते घोरं वृत्रवधं यथा |_END
BEGIN_"O, Foolish one, with scant virtue and failed purpose! You think yourself 
			as wise! O, Seetha! Hear about the dreadful killing of your husband in battle, as the killing 
			of the demon Vritra (at the hands of Indra)"_END

B_6_C_33_5
BEGIN_
उक्ता यद्रावणेन त्वम् प्रत्युक्तश्च स्वयम् त्वया |
सखी स्नेहेन तद् भीरु मया सर्वम् प्रतिश्रुतम् || ६-३३-६
लीनया गनहे शूह्ये भयम् उत्सृज्य रावणात् |
तव हेतोर् विशाल अक्षि न हि मे जीवितम् प्रियम् || ६-३३-७_END
BEGIN_
timid woman! Because of my friendship with you, I overheard Ravana's words and all
the words you have spoken in reply to him, by hiding nearby in a barren sky without fear. O, large
eyed woman! I do not have any fear of Ravana, owing to my affection towards you"._END

B_6_C_32_10
BEGIN_अथ वा नश्यति प्रज्ना प्राज्नस्य अपि सतस् तव |
पचत्य् एनम् तथा कालो भूतानाम् प्रभवो ह्ययम् || ६-३२-१३_END
BEGIN_"Otherwise, your prudence might have disappeared even though you were sagacious, for, 
Time the master of all beings has brought you to an end."_END

B_6_C_34_1
BEGIN_
ततस् तस्या हितम् सख्याश् चिकीर्षन्ती सखी वचः |
उवाच काले कालज्ना स्मित पूर्व अभिभाषिणी || ६-३४-२_END
BEGIN_
Desiring to be of further service to her friend Seetha, the affectionate Sarama,
skilled in the knowledge of time, smiling while talking, spoke the following words at that
appropriate time._END

B_6_C_33_6
BEGIN_
स सम्भ्रान्तश च निष्क्रान्तो यत् कृते राक्षस अधिपः |
तच् च मे विदितम् सर्वम् अभिनिष्क्रम्य मैथिलि || ६-३३-८_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha! Every thing was ascertained by me on the spot, after going out, about
the reason for which Ravana has gone away agitated."_END

B_6_C_31_16
BEGIN_समायातः समुद्रान्तं हन्तुं मां किल राघवः || ६-३१-१८
			वानरेन्द्रप्रणीतेन बलेव महता वृतः |_END
BEGIN_"Rama, encircled by an extensive army led forward by Sugreeva, is said to 
			have arrived at the sea-shore, to kill me."_END

B_6_C_32_11
BEGIN_अदृष्टम् मृत्युम् आपन्नः कस्मात् त्वम् नय शास्त्रवित् |
व्यसनानाम् उपायज्नः कुशलो ह्यसि वर्जने || ६-३२-१४_END
BEGIN_"How is it possible that you, who knew the doctrine of political ethics obtained an unforeseen 
death? You, who knew the science of expediency, were indeed skilled in warding off calamities"_END

B_6_C_34_2
BEGIN_
उत्सहेयम् अहम् गत्वा त्वद् वाक्यम् असित ईक्षणे |
निवेद्य कुशलम् रामे प्रतिच्चन्ना निवर्तितुम् || ६-३४-३_END
BEGIN_
"O, black eyed lady! I am capable of carrying a message of your words and good will
to Rama and to return secretly."_END

B_6_C_33_7
BEGIN_
न शक्यम् सौप्तिकम् कर्तुम् रामस्य विदित आत्मनः |
वधश्च पुरुष व्याघ्रे तस्मिन्न् एव उपपद्यते || ६-३३-९_END
BEGIN_
"It is not possible to attack Rama, a man of self awareness, while he is asleep. Nay
even killing him, the tiger among men, is well nigh impossible."_END

B_6_C_31_17
BEGIN_सम्निविष्टः समुद्रस्य पीड्य तीरमथोत्तरम् || ६-३१-१९
			बलेन महता रामो व्रजत्यस्तम् दिवाकरे |_END
BEGIN_"While sun was going to set, Rama with his mighty army was encamped there, 
			encroaching upon the northern shore of the sea."_END

B_6_C_32_12
BEGIN_तथा त्वम् सम्परिष्वज्य रौद्रया अतिनृशंसया |
काल रात्र्या मया आच्चिद्य हृतः कमल लोचन || ६-३२-१५_END
BEGIN_"O, Rama, the lotus eyed! The night of destroying time which was very much cruel and 
terrible thus has encircled you, embezzled you and snatched you away from me."_END

B_6_C_34_3
BEGIN_
न हि मे क्रममाणाया निरालम्बे विहायसि |
समर्थो गतिम् अन्वेतुम् पवनो गरुडो अपि वा || ६-३४-४_END
BEGIN_
"When I am journeying in the sky self -supported, neither the god of wind nor Garuda
the eagle can follow my movement."_END

B_6_C_33_8
BEGIN_
न च एव वानरा हन्तुम् शक्याः पादप योधिनः |
सुरा देव ऋषभेण इव रामेण हि सुरक्षिताः || ६-३३-१०_END
BEGIN_
"It is not possible to kill in this manner even monkeys, who perform fighting with
trees, in as much as they are fully protected by Rama, even as celestials are protected by Indra
their lord"_END

B_6_C_31_18
BEGIN_अथाध्वनि परिश्रान्तमर्धरात्रे स्थितम् बलम् || ६-३१-२०
			सुखसुप्तं समासाद्य चरितम् प्रथमं चरैः |_END
BEGIN_"Their army stationed there, comfortably asleep at the middle of the night 
			and completely fatigued in the course of the journey, was approached first and espied by 
			our spies."_END

B_6_C_32_13
BEGIN_उपशेषे महा बाहो माम् विहाय तपस्विनीम् |
प्रियाम् इव शुभाम् नारीम् पृथिवीम् पुरुष ऋषभ || ६-३२-१६_END
BEGIN_"O, the mighty armed! O, the best of men! Leaving the miserable me, you lied down here, 
embracing the earth as your beloved"_END

B_6_C_34_4
BEGIN_
एवम् ब्रुवाणाम् ताम् सीता सरमाम् पुनर् अब्रवीत् |
मधुरम् श्लक्ष्णया वाचा पूर्व शोक अभिपन्नया || ६-३४-५_END
BEGIN_
