To Sarama, who was speaking as aforesaid, Seetha her voice no longer charged with
grief, gently and sweetly replied in the following words:_END

B_6_C_31_19
BEGIN_तत्प्रहस्तप्रणीतेन बलेन महता मम || ६-३१-२१
			बलमस्य हतम् रात्रौ यत्र रामः सलक्ष्मणः |_END
BEGIN_"By my great army, which was led by Prahasta, Rama's army was killed in the 
			night at the place where Rama and Lakshmana were there."_END

B_6_C_33_9
BEGIN_
दीर्घ वृत्त भुजह् श्रीमान् महा उरस्कह् प्रतापवान् |
धन्वी सम्हनन उपेतो धर्म आत्मा भुवि विश्रुतः || ६-३३-११
विक्रान्तो रक्षिता नित्यम् आत्मनश्च परस्य च |
लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा कुशली नय शास्त्रवित् || ६-३३-१२
हन्ता पर बल ओघानाम् अचिन्त्य बल पौरुषः |
न हतो राघवः श्रीमान् सीते शत्रु निबर्हणः || १३_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha! Rama, who is endowed with long and well rounded arms, an illustrious
man, who is large-chested, a man of great energy, an archer well known in the world, a man endowed
with muscularity, a righteous minded man, a person of celebrity on earth, a man of eternal
strength, a protector for himself and for others, while together with his brother Lakshmana, a man
of high descent, a knower of doctrines of conduct and behavior, the killer of a stream of enemy
forces, a man of inconceivable strength and valor, a venerable man and an annihilator of
adversaries, has not been killed."_END

B_6_C_32_14
BEGIN_अर्चितम् सततम् यत्नाद् गन्ध माल्यैर् मया तव |
इदम् ते मत् प्रियम् वीर धनुः कान्चन भूषितम् || ६-३२-१७_END
BEGIN_"O, valiant Rama! Here is your bow which was decorated with gold, dear to me and worshipped 
diligently by you with sandal paste and wreath of flowers."_END

B_6_C_34_5
BEGIN_
समर्था गगनम् गन्तुम् अपि वा त्वम् रसा तलम् |
अवगच्चाम्य् अकर्तव्यम् कर्तव्यम् ते मद् अन्तरे || ६-३४-६_END
BEGIN_
"You are capable of going to heaven or to the penultimate subterranean region. Know
from me today the duty that has got to be performed by you for my sake."_END

B_6_C_31_20
BEGIN_पट्टिशान् परिघांश्चक्रानृष्टीर्दण्डान्महायुधान् || ६-३१-२२
			बाणजालानि शूलानि भास्वरान् कूटमुद्गरान् |
			यष्टीश्च तोमरान् प्रासांश्चक्राणि मुसलानि च || ६-३१-२३
			उद्यम्योद्यम्य रक्षोभिर्वानरेषु निपातिताः |_END
BEGIN_The demons wielding harpoons, maces, discus, daggers, sticks, great arrows 
			spears, shining maces with spikes, picks lances, darts, massed weapons, clubs and circular 
			missiles, made use of them again and again in order to strike down the monkeys."_END

B_6_C_33_10
BEGIN_
अयुक्त बुद्धि कृत्येन सर्व भूत विरोधिना |
इयम् प्रयुक्ता रौद्रेण माया मायाविदा त्वयि || ६-३३-१४_END
BEGIN_
"A trickery has been hurled on you here by the cruel Ravana, a conjurer, who is
perverse in thinking and action and an enemy of all beings."_END

B_6_C_32_15
BEGIN_पित्रा दशरथेन त्वम् श्वशुरेण मम अनघ |
पूर्वैसः च पितृभिः सार्धम् नूनम् स्वर्गे समागतः || ६-३२-१८_END
BEGIN_"O, the faultless Rama! Surely, you must have met in heaven your father and my father-in- 
law Dasaratha as well as all the multitude of manes."_END

B_6_C_34_6
BEGIN_
मत् प्रियम् यदि कर्तव्यम् यदि बुद्धिः स्थिरा तव |
ज्नातुम् इच्चामि तम् गत्वा किम् करोति इति रावणः || ६-३४-७_END
BEGIN_
"If your intention is to act kindly towards me and your resolve is firm , I wish you
to go and know what Ravana is doing now."_END

B_6_C_31_21
BEGIN_अथ सुप्तस्य रामस्य प्रहस्तेन प्रमाथिना || ६-३१-२४
			असक्तम् कृतहस्तेन शिरश्छिन्नं महासिना |_END
BEGIN_"The impetuous Prahasta, with his steady hand, severed the head of Rama sleeping 
			there, with his mighty sword without a resistance from any one."_END

B_6_C_32_16
BEGIN_दिवि नक्षत्र भूतस् त्वम् महत् कर्म कृतम् प्रियम् |
पुण्यम् राज ऋषि वंशम् त्वम् आत्मनः समुपेक्षसे || ६-३२-१९_END
BEGIN_"You have abandoned your own pious lineage of royal sages but whereas you performed a 
great act, which illuminated the heaven like a luminary."_END

B_6_C_33_11
BEGIN_
शोकस् ते विगतः सर्वः कल्याणम् त्वाम् उपस्थितम् |
ध्रुवम् त्वाम् भजते लक्ष्मीः प्रियम् प्रीति करम् शृणु || ६-३३-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Your sorrow is (now) gone once for all. An all-pervading auspiciousness will await
you. Accordingly prosperity will attend on you. Hear me."_END

B_6_C_35_0
BEGIN_
तेन शन्ख विमिश्रेण भेरी शब्देन राघवः |
उपयतो महा बाहू रामह् पर पुरम् जयः || ६-३५-१_END
BEGIN_
The mighty armed Rama, the conqueror of hostile cities sallied forth with the
resonant roll of kettle drums, mingled with the blast of couches._END

B_6_C_34_7
BEGIN_
स हि माया बलः क्रूरो रावणः शत्रु रावणः |
माम् मोहयति दुष्ट आत्मा पीत मात्रा इव वारुणी || ६-३४-८_END
BEGIN_
"That cruel and evil minded Ravana, equipped with strength in the shape of conjuring
tricks, who makes his enemies cry has bemused me, as spirituous liquor bemuses one, the moment it
is imbibed."_END

B_6_C_31_22
BEGIN_विभीषणः समुत्पत्य निगृहीतो यदृच्छया || ६-३१-२५
			दिशम् प्रव्राजितः सैन्यैर्लक्ष्मणः प्लवगैः सह |_END
BEGIN_"Fortunately, Vibhishana was over leaped and held captive. Lakshmana along 
			with the monkeys were made to run away in all directions."_END

B_6_C_33_12
BEGIN_
उत्तीर्य सागरम् रामः सह वानर सेनया |
सम्निविष्टः समुद्रस्य तीरम् आसाद्य दक्षिणम् || ६-३३-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Rama, along with his army of monkeys, having crossed the ocean, reached its
southern shore and is encamped there."_END

B_6_C_32_17
BEGIN_किम् मान् न प्रेक्षसे राजन् किम् माम् न प्रतिभाषसे |
बालाम् बालेन सम्प्राप्ताम् भार्याम् माम् सह चारिणीम् || ६-३२-२०_END
BEGIN_"O, prince! Why don't you look at me? Why don't you reply me, a wife who lived with you 
together since the time of obtaining me as a girl by you as a boy."_END

B_6_C_35_1
BEGIN_
तम् निनादम् निशम्य अथ रावणो राक्षस ईश्वरः |
मुहूर्तम् ध्यानम् आस्थाय सचिवान् अभ्युदैक्षत ||६-३५-२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that sound, Ravana the Lord of demons, paused for a moment to reflect and
looked towards his ministers._END

B_6_C_31_23
BEGIN_सुग्रीवो ग्रीवया सीते भग्नया प्लवगाधिपः || ६-३१-२६
			निरस्तहनुकः श्रेते हनुमान् राक्षसैःर्हतः |_END
BEGIN_"O, Seetha! Sugreeva the king of monkeys with his neck broken and Hanuman 
			with his jaw removed were laid down and killed by the demons."_END

B_6_C_34_8
BEGIN_
तर्जापयति माम् नित्यम् भर्त्सापयति च असक्र्त् |
राक्षसीभिः सुघोराभिर् या माम् रक्षन्ति नित्यशः || ६-३४-९_END
BEGIN_
"He causes me to be threatened by words all the time by the most frightful ogresses,
who always surround me and insult me by their act repeatedly."_END

B_6_C_33_13
BEGIN_
दृष्टो मे परिपूर्ण अर्थः काकुत्स्थः सह लक्ष्मणः |
सहितैः सागर अन्तस्थैर् बलैस् तिष्ठति रक्षितः || ६-३३-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Rama, who was along with fully meaningful Lakshmana, was perceived by me. He stands
protected by the troops gathered together at the vicinity of the ocean."_END

B_6_C_32_18
BEGIN_संश्रुतम् गृह्णता पाणिम् चरिष्यामि इति यत् त्वया |
स्मर तन् मम काकुत्स्थ नय माम् अपि दुह्खिताम् || ६-३२-२१_END
BEGIN_"O, Rama! Remember your solemn promise at the time of our marriage, saying I shall have 
righteous conduct with you' Take me also with you, wretched as I Am."_END

B_6_C_35_2
BEGIN_
अथ तान् सचिवांस् तत्र सर्वान् आभाष्य रावणः |
सभाम् सम्नादयन् सर्वाम् इत्य् उवाच महा बलः || ६-३५-३
जगत्पम्तापनः क्रूरोगर्हयन् राक्षसेश्वरः |_END
BEGIN_
Ravana of great strength the tormentor of the world, and a cruel lord of demons then
addressed all his ministers in a voice that resounded the entire hall as follows, accusing
none._END

B_6_C_31_24
BEGIN_जाम्बवानथ जानुभ्यामुत्पतन्निहतो युधि || ६-३१-२७
			पट्टिशैर्बहुभिश्छन्नो विकृत्तः सादपो यथा |_END
BEGIN_"Thereafter Jambavan who was rising up on his knees was killed in the battle. 
			His body was cut off with many sharp-edged spears, like a tree is cut off."_END

B_6_C_34_9
BEGIN_
उद्विग्ना शन्किता च अस्मि न च स्वस्थम् मनो मम |
तद् भयाच् च अहम् उद्विग्ना;अशोक वनिकाम् गताः || ६-३४-१०_END
BEGIN_
"I am depressed in mind and distrustful. My mind is not in its natural state.
Staying in Ashoka grove, I am distressed because of his fear."_END

B_6_C_33_14
BEGIN_
अनेन प्रेषिता ये च राक्षसा लघु विक्रमः |
राघवस् तीर्णैत्य् एवम् प्रवृत्तिस् तैर् इह आहृता || ६-३३-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Some swift paced demons, who were dispatched by Ravana, brought this very news here
that Rama has crossed the ocean."_END

B_6_C_32_19
BEGIN_कस्मान् माम् अपहाय त्वम् गतो गतिमताम् वर |
अस्माल् लोकाद् अमुम् लोकम् त्यक्त्वा माम् इह दुह्खिताम् || ६-३२-२२_END
BEGIN_"O, Rama the best of beings! Why have you gone away, quitting me like this? Leaving me, 
the miserable woman, why have you gone to the other world from this world?"_END

B_6_C_35_3
BEGIN_
तरणम् सागरस्य अपि विक्रमम् बल संचयम् || ६-३५-४
यद् उक्तवन्तो रामस्य भवन्तस् तन् मया श्रुतम् |_END
BEGIN_
"I have heard what you told me about Rama's crossing the ocean, his prowess,
strength and heroism."_END

B_6_C_31_25
BEGIN_मैन्दश्च द्विविदश्चोभौ तौ वानरवरर्षभौ || ६-३१-२८
			निःश्वसन्तौ रुदन्तौ च रुधिरेण परीवृतौ |
			असिना व्यायतौ चिन्नौ मध्ये ह्यरिनिषूदनौ || ६-३१-२९_END
BEGIN_"Mainda and Dvivida - those two great scourgers of their foes, the long bodied 
			and the foremost of the monkeys, groaning and breathless, their limbs bathed in blood-were 
			cut to pieces at the waist-level, by a sword."_END

B_6_C_34_10
BEGIN_
यदि नाम कथा तस्य निश्चितम् वा अपि यद् भवेत् |
निवेदयेथाः सर्वम् तत् परो मे स्याद् अनुग्रहः ||६-३४-११_END
BEGIN_
"Report to me, all that is decided by him during his talk going on with his
ministers about the matter of releasing me or keeping me captive. It will be of great service to
me."_END

B_6_C_32_20
BEGIN_कल्याणैर् उचितम् यत् तत् परिष्वक्तम् मया एव तु |
क्रव्य अदैस् तत् शरीरम् ते नूनम् विपरिकृष्यते || ६-३२-२३_END
BEGIN_"That beautiful body, which was cuddled by me with divine essences, is now being dragged 
about by wild beasts."_END

B_6_C_33_15
BEGIN_
स ताम् श्रुत्वा विशाल अक्षि प्रवृत्तिम् राक्षस अधिपः |
एष मन्त्रयते सर्वैः सचिवैः सह रावणः || ६-३३-१९_END
BEGIN_
"O, the wide-eyed Seetha! Hearing that news, yonder Ravana is busy making
deliberations with all his ministers."_END

B_6_C_35_4
BEGIN_
भवतश्चाप्यहम् वेद्मि युद्धे सत्यपराक्रमान् || ६-३५-५
तूष्णीकानीक्षतोन्योन्यम् विदित्वाम् रामविक्रमम् |_END
BEGIN_
"I know that you are truly brave in the battle-field, yet, on beholding that valiant
Rama, you too look on each other in silence."_END

B_6_C_31_26
BEGIN_अनुष्वनति मेदिन्याम् पनसः यथा || ६-३१-३०
			वाराचैर्बहुभिश्छन्नः श्रेते दर्याम् दरीमुखः |
			कुमुदस्तु महातेजा निष्कूजन् सायकैर्हतः || ६-३१-३१_END
BEGIN_"Panasa, crying for help was stretched on the earth under a tree of the same 
			name. Pierced by lying in a pit. The exceedingly valiant kumuda on his part, shrieking, 
			was killed by a hail of missiles."_END

B_6_C_34_11
BEGIN_
साप्येवम् ब्रुवतीम् सीताम् सरमा वल्गु भाषिणी |
उवाच वचनम् तस्याः स्पृशन्ती बाष्प विक्लवम् || ६-३४-१२_END
BEGIN_
The soft spoken Sarama, wiping her face, which got moist with tears, replied as
follows to Seetha who was speaking as aforesaid:_END

B_6_C_33_16
BEGIN_
इति ब्रुवाणा सरमा राक्षसी सीतया सह |
सर्व उद्योगेन सैन्यानाम् शब्दम् शुश्राव भैरवम् || ६-३३-२०_END
BEGIN_
While Sarama, the ogre was talking as aforesaid with Seetha; a terrific sound was
heard, from the troops engaged in the impending war._END

B_6_C_32_21
BEGIN_अग्निष्तोम आदिभिर् यज्नैर् इष्टवान् आप्त दक्षिणैः |
अग्नि होत्रेण संस्कारम् केन त्वम् तु न लप्स्यसे || ६-३२-२४_END
BEGIN_"Why are you not securing the privilege of being cremated with a sacrificial fire, even 
though you have worshipped the Lord through sacrificial performances such as Agnishtoma, duly furnished 
with abundant gifts?"._END

B_6_C_36_0
BEGIN_तत्तु माल्यवतो वाक्यम् हितम् उक्तम् दज़ आननः |
न मर्षयति दुष्ट अत्मा कालस्य वज़म् आगतः || ६-३६-१_END
BEGIN_The evil- minded Ravana the ten-faced monster, who had fallen under the sway of Death; 
could not brook that beneficial advice tendered by Malyavan._END

B_6_C_31_27
BEGIN_अङ्गदो बहुभिश्छ्न्नः शरैरासाद्य राक्षसैः |
			परितो रुधिरोद्गारी क्षितौ निपतिताङ्गदः || ६-३१-३२_END
BEGIN_"Angada, who was adorned with bracelets lies fallen down, emitting blood 
			on all sides, as he was pierced by the demons with many arrows, after approaching him."_END

B_6_C_35_5
BEGIN_
ततस् तु सुमहा प्राज्नो माल्यवान् नाम राक्षसः || ६-३५-६
रावणस्य वचः श्रुत्वा मातुः पैतामहो अब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those word of Ravana whose maternal grandfather he was, the highly
intelligent demon called Malyavan, answered him thus:_END

B_6_C_34_12
BEGIN_
एष ते यद्य् अभिप्रायस् तस्माद् गच्चामि जानकि |
गृह्य शत्रोर् अभिप्रायम् उपाव्र्त्ताम् च पश्य माम् || ६-३४-१३_END
BEGIN_
"If your opinion is like this, I shall go on that account, O, Seetha! Having grasped
the feeling of the enemies, I shall return O, Seetha!"_END

B_6_C_33_17
BEGIN_
दण्ड निर्घात वादिन्याः श्रुत्वा भेर्या महा स्वनम् |
उवाच सरमा सीताम् इदम् मधुर भाषिणी || ६-३३-२१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the crashing sound of kettle drums, made to sound like a thunder storm with
a drum stick, Sarama in her sweet voice spoke to Seetha as follows:_END

B_6_C_32_22
BEGIN_प्रव्रज्याम् उपपन्नानाम् त्रयाणाम् एकम् आगतम् |
परिप्रक्ष्यति कौसल्या लक्ष्मणम् शोक लालसा || ६-३२-२५_END
BEGIN_"Kausalya absorbed as she was with grief can only see Lakshmana alone returned out of 
the three who attained exile."_END

B_6_C_36_1
BEGIN_स बद्ध्वा भ्रु कुटिम् वक्त्रे क्रोधस्य वज़म् आगतः |
अमर्षात् परिवृत्त अक्षो माल्यवन्तम् अथ अब्रवीत् || ६-३६-२_END
BEGIN_He had fallen under the sway of anger, knitting his brows on the face as he was, rolling 
his eyes in fury and spoke to Malyavan (as follows)_END

B_6_C_31_28
BEGIN_हरयो मथिता वागैरथ जालैस्तथापरे |
			शयाना मृदितास्तत्र वायुवेगैरिवाम्बुदाः || ६-३१-३३_END
BEGIN_"The monkeys sleeping there were crushed by elephants and multitude of chariots, 
			like clouds are crushed to pieces by the velocity of wind."_END

B_6_C_35_6
BEGIN_
विद्यास्वभिविनीतो यो राजा राजन् नय अनुगः || ६-३५-७
स शास्ति चिरम् ऐश्वर्यम् अरींश्च कुरुते वशे |_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! He who is well-versed in (fourteen)* sciences and follows the path of
prudence, enjoys sovereignty for a long time and compels his enemies too into subjugation."_END

B_6_C_34_13
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा ततो गत्वा समीपम् तस्य रक्षसः |
शुश्राव कथितम् तस्य रावणस्य समन्त्रिणः || ६-३४-१४_END
BEGIN_
Speaking thus, Surama thereafter went to the vicinity of that demon and heard the
conversation of Ravana who was with his ministers._END

B_6_C_33_18
BEGIN_
सम्नाह जननी ह्य् एषा भैरवा भीरु भेरिका |
भेरी नादम् च गम्भीरम् शृणु तोयद निस्वनम् || ६-३३-२२_END
BEGIN_
"O, timid Seetha! This frightful sound of a kettledrum is indeed indicative of
preparation for a war. Hear also the thundering crash of the kettle drums, which resembles the
rumbling of clouds"_END

B_6_C_32_23
BEGIN_स तस्याः परिपृच्चन्त्या वधम् मित्र बलस्य ते |
तव च आख्यास्यते नूनम् निशायाम् राक्षसैर् वधम् || ६-३२-२६_END
BEGIN_"He will narrate surely to her when enquired, about your slaughter as also the killing 
of the army of your alley, by demons at night."_END

B_6_C_36_2
BEGIN_हित बुद्ध्या यद् अहितम् वचह् परुषम् उच्यते |
पर पक्षम् प्रविज़्य एव न एतत् ज़्रोत्र गतम् मम || ६-३६-३_END
BEGIN_"I have closed my ears to the speech you have made, albeit with good intentions and even 
by taking sides with the enemy."_END

B_6_C_31_29
BEGIN_प्रसृताश्च परे त्रस्ताः हन्यमाना जघन्यतः |
			अनुद्रुतास्तु रक्षोBहिः सिम्हैरिव महाद्विपाः || ६-३१-३४_END
BEGIN_"The enemy fled in terror, pursued by demons, while being struck on the bak, 
			like lions pursuing great elephants."_END

B_6_C_35_7
BEGIN_
संदधानो हि कालेन विगृह्णंसः चारिभिः सह || ६-३५-८
स्व पक्ष वर्धनम् कुर्वन् महद् ऐश्वर्यम् अश्नुते ||_END
BEGIN_
"He who concludes peace even with enemies or wages war at a fitting time strengthens
his own party and attains a great power."_END

B_6_C_34_14
BEGIN_
सा श्रुत्वा निश्चयम् तस्य निश्चयज्ना दुरात्मनः |
पुनर् एव अगमत् क्षिप्रम् अशोक वनिकाम् तदा || ६-३४-१५_END
BEGIN_
Sarama, who knew how to investigate could hear the wicked Ravana's resolve and soon
returned to Ashoka grove._END

B_6_C_33_19
BEGIN_
कल्प्यन्ते मत्त मातम्गा युज्यन्ते रथ वाजिनः |
तत्र तत्र च सम्नद्धाः सम्पतन्ति पदातयः || ६-३३-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Elephants in rut are being caparisoned for war. Chariot horses are being prepared
for a battle. Thousands of horsemen carrying darts in their hands are seen."_END

B_6_C_32_24
BEGIN_सा त्वाम् सुप्तम् हतम् श्रुत्वा माम् च रक्षो गृहम् गताम् |
हृदयेन विदीर्णेन न भविष्यति राघव || ६-३२-२७_END
BEGIN_"O, Rama! Hearing that you were killed while sleeping and that I was kept in the house 
of ogres, she will be no more, as her heart will be broken."_END

B_6_C_36_3
BEGIN_मानुषम् कृपणम् रामम् एकम् ज़ाखा मृग आज़्रयम् |
समर्थम् मन्यसे केन त्यक्तम् पित्रा वन आलयम् || ६-३६-४_END
BEGIN_"How can you hold Rama, who is a mere human being, a small feeble man, taking help from 
monkeys and dwelling in a forest having been abandoned by his father, to be a competent person?"_END

B_6_C_35_8
BEGIN_
हीयमानेन कर्तव्यो राज्ना संधिः समेन च || ६-३५-९
न शत्रुम् अवमन्येत ज्यायान् कुर्वीत विग्रहम् |_END
BEGIN_
"A treaty of peace should be reached by a king who is weaker or equal to an enemy.
The king should never underrate that enemy. If the king is more powerful, he should make war on the
enemy."_END

B_6_C_31_30
BEGIN_सागरे पतिताः केचित्केचिद्गगनमाश्रिताः |
			ऋक्षा वृक्षामपारूढा वानरैर्व्यतिमिश्रिताः || ६-३१-३५_END
BEGIN_"Some monkeys fell in the sea and some sought shelter in the sky. The bears 
			with the monkeys climbed the trees."_END

B_6_C_34_15
BEGIN_
सा प्रविष्टा पुनस् तत्र ददर्श जनक आत्मजाम् |
प्रतीक्षमाणाम् स्वाम् एव भ्रष्ट पद्माम् इव श्रियम् || ६-३४-१६_END
BEGIN_
Sarama, who entered the Ashoka grove, saw Seetha who looked like Lakshmi the goddess
of prosperity (and the wife of Vishnu); bereft of the lotus and waiting for her only._END

B_6_C_33_20
BEGIN_
तत्र तत्र च सन्नद्धाः सम्पतन्ति सहस्रशः |
आपूर्यन्ते राज मार्गाः सैन्यैर् अद्भुत दर्शनैः || ६-३३-२४
वेगवद्भिर् नदद्भिश्च तोय ओघैर् इव सागरः |_END
BEGIN_
"Thousands of soldiers equipped with armor are marching quickly hither and thither.
Royal highways are filled with wonderfully looking warriors like a swift flowing sea with its flood
of waters making a roaring sound."_END

B_6_C_32_25
BEGIN_मम हेतोरनार्याया अवघः पार्थिवात्मजः |
रामः सागमुत्तीर्य वीर्यवान् गोष्पदे हतः || ६-३२-२८_END
BEGIN_"The strong and faultless prince Rama was killed in a small puddle, after crossing the 
ocean, for the cause of me, an unworthy woman."_END

B_6_C_36_4
BEGIN_रक्षसाम् ईज़्वरम् माम् च देवतानाम् भयम् करम् |
हीनम् माम् मन्यसे केन;अहीनम् सर्व विक्रमैः || ६-३६-५_END
BEGIN_"How can you hold me, the Lord of demons, terrifying celestials and possessing all powers 
in full, to be a weaker person?"_END

B_6_C_35_9
BEGIN_
तन्मह्यम् रोचते संधिः सह रामेण रावण || ६-३५-१०
यद् अर्थम् अभियुक्ताः स्म सीता तस्मै प्रदीयताम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Ravana! For that reason, alliance with Rama finds favour with me. Let Seetha,
for whose sake you are being attacked, be restored to him."_END

B_6_C_31_31
BEGIN_सागरस्य च तीरेषु शैलेषु च वनेषु च |
			पिङ्गलास्ते विरूपाक्षे राक्षसैर्बहवो हताः || ६-३१-३६_END
BEGIN_"By the demons with monstrous eyes, were killed a multitude of monkeys, at 
			the shores of the sea, in the mountains an in the woods."_END

B_6_C_34_16
BEGIN_
ताम् तु सीता पुनः प्राप्ताम् सरमाम् वल्गु भाषिणीम् |
परिष्वज्य च सुस्निग्धम् ददौ च स्वयम् आसनम् || ६-३४-१७_END
BEGIN_
Seetha affectionately embraced the kindly speaking Surama who returned there and
offered personally a seat to her._END

B_6_C_33_21
BEGIN_
शास्त्राणाम् च प्रसन्नानाम् चर्मणाम् वर्मणाम् तथा || ६-३३-२५
रथ वाजि गजानाम् च भूषितानाम् च रक्षसाम् |
सम्भ्रमो रक्षसामेष हृषितानाम् तरस्विनाम् || ६-३३-२६
प्रभाम् विसृजताम् पश्य नाना वर्णाम् समुत्थिताम् |
वनम् निर्दहतो धर्मे यथा रूपम् विभावसोः || ६-३३-२७_END
BEGIN_
"See hurriedly, this sheen of polished weapons, shields and coats of mail sending
forth luster of many hues like the splendor of fire consuming a forest in summer. Here is seen the
flurry of chariots, horses and elephants following the lead of Ravana as well as of energetic
demons thrilled with joy."_END

B_6_C_32_26
BEGIN_अहम् दाशरथेनोढा मोहात्स्वकुपांसनी |
आर्यपुत्रस्य रामस्य भार्या मृत्युरजायत || ६-३२-२९_END
BEGIN_"I, the obloquy of my race, was wedded by Rama due to ignorance. Thus, a wife herself 
has eventually proved to be the cause for death of Rama, an honorable man."_END

B_6_C_36_5
BEGIN_वीर द्वेषेण वा ज़न्के पक्ष पातेन वा रिपोः |
त्वया अहम् परुषाण्य् उक्तः पर प्रोत्साहनेन वा || ६-३६-६_END
BEGIN_"I suspect that you spoke these harsh words to me because of your envy of my prowess 
or your partiality towards the enemies or my lenience towards you."_END

B_6_C_35_10
BEGIN_
तस्य देव ऋषयः सर्वे गन्धर्वासः च जय एषिणः || ६-३५-११
विरोधम् मा गमस् तेन संधिस् ते तेन रोचताम् |_END
BEGIN_
"All the celestials, sages and Gandharvas the celestial musicians are wishing for
victory of Rama. Do not get an enmity with them. Let alliance with him be acceptable to you."_END

B_6_C_31_32
BEGIN_एवम् तव हतो भर्ता ससैन्यो मम सेवया |
			क्षतजार्द्रं रजोध्वस्तमिदं चाप्याहृतम् शिरः || ६-३१-३७_END
BEGIN_"Thus, your husband together with his army was killed by my troops. This 
			head, drenched in his blood and besmeared with dust has been gathered up."_END

B_6_C_34_17
BEGIN_
इह आसीना सुखम् सर्वम् आख्याहि मम तत्त्वतः |
क्रूरस्य निश्चयम् तस्य रावणस्य दुरात्मनः || ६-३४-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Sitting here comfortably, tell me about the real design of that cruel and wicked
Ravana"_END

B_6_C_33_22
BEGIN_
घण्टानाम् शृणु निर्घोषम् रथानाम् शृणु निस्वनम् |
हयानाम् हेषमाणानाम् शृणु तूर्य ध्वनिम् यथा || ६-३३-२८
उद्यत आयुध हस्तानाम् राक्षस इन्द्र अनुयायिनाम् |
सम्भ्रमो रक्षसाम् एष तुमुलो लोम हर्षणः || ६-३३-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Hear the sound of bells of elephants. Hear the ratting of chariots. Hear the cry of
neighing horses, resembling the flourish of trumpets. Here is the bustle of demons, carrying
uplifted weapons in their hands; following the lead of Ravana. This bustling activity is causing
hair to stand erect through terror."_END

B_6_C_32_27
BEGIN_मानमाव्याम् मया जातिम् वारितम् दानमुत्तमम् |
याहमद्येह शोचामि भार्या सर्वातिथेरपि || ६-३२-३०_END
BEGIN_"Even though I was a wife of Rama who showed hospitality to all the guests, it is I, 
that very person, who is weeping here and now, because without doubt, in a previous existence, an excellent 
gift was refused by me (to an eligible person)."_END

B_6_C_36_6
BEGIN_प्रभवन्तम् पदस्थम् हि परुषम् को अह्बिधास्यति |
पण्डितह् ज़ास्त्र तत्त्वज्नो विना प्रोत्साहनाद् रिपोः || ६-३६-७_END
BEGIN_"Which learned man, understand the truth in the scriptures, would speak thus harshly 
to a mighty person in power, were it not to instigate him?"_END

B_6_C_35_11
BEGIN_
असृजद् भगवान् पक्षौ द्वाव् एव हि पितामहः || ६-३५-१२
सुराणाम् असुराणाम् च धर्म अधर्मौ तद् आश्रयौ |_END
BEGIN_
"Brahma, the lord of creation, created only two classes of beings, the celestials
and the demons. Celestials take refuge in righteousness and demons in unrighteousness."_END

B_6_C_31_33
BEGIN_ततः परमदुर्धर्षो रावणो राक्षसेश्वरः |
			सीतायामुपशृण्वत्यां राक्षसीमिद मब्रवीत् || ६-३१-३८_END
BEGIN_Thereafter, Ravana the Lord of demons who was very much difficult to be attacked, 
			spoke the following words to an ogress, while Seetha was overhearing them._END

B_6_C_34_18
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्ता तु सरमा सीतया वेपमानया |
कथितम् सर्वम् आचष्त रावणस्य समन्त्रिणः || ६-३४-१९_END
BEGIN_
When Seetha trembling with fear enquired thus, Sarama narrated all the conversation
of Ravana together with his ministers._END

B_6_C_33_23
BEGIN_
श्रीस् त्वाम् भजति शोकघ्नी रक्षसाम् भयम् आगतम् |
रामात् कमल पत्र अक्षि दैत्यानाम् इव वासवात् || ६-३३-३०
अवजित्य जित क्रोधस् तम् अचिन्त्य पराक्रमः |
रावणम् समरे हत्वा भर्ता त्वा अधिगमिष्यति || ६-३३-३१_END
BEGIN_
"A good fortune, which will bring your sorrow to an end, awaits you. A peril has
arrived for demons. The lotus eyed Rama, your husband, who has overcome his anger but having an
unimaginable strength will kill Ravana in battle and win you back"_END

B_6_C_32_28
BEGIN_साधु पातय माम् क्षिप्रम् रामस्य उपरि रावणः |
समानय पतिम् पत्न्या कुरु कल्याणम् उत्तमम् || ६-३२-३१_END
BEGIN_"Unite the wife with the husband and without delay, arrange to kill me right at the head 
of Rama. Thus, you will perform an admirable and auspicious act."_END

B_6_C_36_7
BEGIN_आनीय च वनात् सीताम् पद्म हीनाम् इव ज़्रियम् |
किम् अर्थम् प्रतिदास्यामि राघवस्य भयाद् अहम् || ६-३६-८_END
BEGIN_"Why should I give back Seetha, who is like Lakshmi the goddess of fortune without the 
lotus, having brought her away from the forest, through fear of Rama?"_END

B_6_C_35_12
BEGIN_
धर्मो हि श्रूयते पक्षः सुराणाम् च महात्मनाम् || ६-३५-१३
अधर्मो रक्षसाम् पक्षोह्य असुराणाम् च रावण |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Ravana! Righteous is said to be on the side of the high-souled celestials.
Unrighteousness is indeed on the side of ogres and demons."_END

B_6_C_31_34
BEGIN_राक्षसम् क्रूरकर्माणम् विद्युज्जिह्वम् समानय |
			येन तद्रघनशिरः सङ्ग्रमात्स्वयमाहृतम् || ६-३१-३९_END
BEGIN_"Bring Vidyujjihva, the demon of the cruel deed, by whom himself Raghava's 
			head was brought back from the battle-field."_END

B_6_C_34_19
BEGIN_
जनन्या राक्षस इन्द्रो वै त्वन् मोक्ष अर्थम् बृहद् वचः |
अविद्धेन च वैदेहि मन्त्रि वृद्धेन बोधितः || ६-३४-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Excellent words were spoken by Kaikasi, the mother of Ravana as well as Aviddha the
aged minister asking for your release, O Seetha!"_END

B_6_C_33_24
BEGIN_
विक्रमिष्यति रक्षह्सु भर्ता ते सह लक्ष्मणः |
यथा शत्रुषु शत्रुघ्नो विष्णुना सह वासवः || ६-३३-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Your consort along with Lakshmana will show his valor against the demons, like
Indra the lord of celestials along with Vishnu the lord of preservation, the annihilator of enemies
exhibited his strength over his adversaries."_END

B_6_C_32_29
BEGIN_शिरसा मे शिरसः च अस्य कायम् कायेन योजय |
रावण अनुगमिष्यामि गतिम् भर्तुर् महात्मनः || ६-३२-३२_END
BEGIN_"O, Ravana! Join my head with his head and my body with his body. I shall go along the 
path of my magnanimous Lord."_END

B_6_C_36_8
BEGIN_वृतम् वानर कोटीभिः ससुग्रीवम् सलक्ष्मणम् |
पज़्य कैज़्चिद् अहोभिस् त्वम् राघवम् निहतम् मया || ६-३६-९_END
BEGIN_"See Rama killed within a few days by me, along with Lakshama together with Sugreeva 
in the midst of crores of monkeys."_END

B_6_C_35_13
BEGIN_
धर्मो वै ग्रसते अधर्मम् ततः कृतम् अभूद् युगम् || ६-३५-१४
अधर्मो ग्रसते धर्मम् ततस् तिष्यः प्रवर्तते |_END
BEGIN_
"When righteousness swallows unrighteousness, it becomes kR^ita Yuga, a golden age.
When unrighteousness swallows righteousness, it incites Kali Yuga the fourth age."_END

B_6_C_31_35
BEGIN_विद्युज्जिह्व स्तदा गृह्य शिरस्तत्सशरासनम् |
			प्रणामम् शिरसा कृत्वा रावणस्याग्रतः स्थितः || ६-३१-४०_END
BEGIN_Holding that head along with a bow, Vidyujjihva making a respectful salute 
			with his head bent low, stood in front of Ravana._END

B_6_C_34_20
BEGIN_
दीयताम् अभिसत्क्र्त्य मनुज इन्द्राय मैथिली |
निदर्शनम् ते पर्याप्तम् जन स्थाने यद् अद्भुतम् || ६-३४-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Let Seetha, be restored honorably to Rama the Lord of men. That wonderful** thing
happened in Janasthana is an enough eye- opener to you."_END

B_6_C_33_25
BEGIN_
आगतस्य हि रामस्य क्षिप्रम् अन्क गताम् सतीम् |
अहम् द्रक्ष्यामि सिद्ध अर्थाम् त्वाम् शत्रौ विनिपातिते || ६-३३-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Very soon, I shall see you, mounted on the lap of Rama who actually arrived, your
object of his coming being fulfilled and the enemy fallen."_END

B_6_C_37_0
BEGIN_
नर वानर राजौ तौ स च वायु सुतः कपिः |
जाम्बवान् ऋक्ष राजसः च राक्षससः च विभीषणः || ६-३७-१
अन्गदो वालि पुत्रसः च सौमित्रिः शरभः कपिः |
सुषेणः सह दायादो मैन्दो द्विविद;एव च || ६-३७-२
गजो गव अक्षो कुमुदो नलो अथ पनसस् तथा |
अमित्र विषयम् प्राप्ताः समवेताः समर्थयन् || ६-३७-३_END
BEGIN_
Meanwhile, Rama the king of men and Sugreeva the Sovereign of monkeys, Hanuman the
son of the wind, Jambavan the king of the Bears, Vibhishana the demon, Angada the son of Vali,
Lakshmana, Sushena along with his kinsfolk, Mainda, Dvivida, Gaja, Gavaksha, Kumuda, Nala and
Panasa, all having reached the enemy's territory, assembled to take counsel together._END

B_6_C_32_30
BEGIN_इति सा दुह्ख सम्तप्ता विललाप आयत ईक्षणा |
भर्तुः शिरो धनुस् तत्र समीक्ष्य जनक आत्मजा || ६-३२-३३_END
BEGIN_The wide-eyed Sita, seeing her husband's head and bow there again and again, was tormented 
with grief and lamented as aforesaid._END

B_6_C_36_9
BEGIN_द्वन्द्वे यस्य न तिष्ठन्ति दैवतान्य् अपि सम्युगे |
स कस्माद् रावणो युद्धे भयम् आहारयिष्यति || ६-३६-१०_END
BEGIN_"How should this Ravana, whom in combat, the celestials themselves dare not meet in a 
duel, entertain fear in this encounter?"_END

B_6_C_35_14
BEGIN_
तत् त्वया चरता लोकान् धर्मो विनिहतो महान् || ६-३५-१५
अधर्मः प्रगृहीतसः च तेन अस्मद् बलिनः परे |_END
BEGIN_
"Therefore, while you were wandering in the worlds, even the great righteousness was
destroyed and unrighteousness favoured by you. So, the enemies are stronger than us."_END

B_6_C_31_36
BEGIN_तमब्रवीत्ततो राजा रावणो राक्षसम् स्थितम् |
			विद्युज्जिह्वम् महाजिह्वम् समीपपरिवर्तिनम् || ६-३१-४१_END
BEGIN_Thereafter, the king Ravana spoke the following words to Vidyujjihva, the 
			demon who had a large tongue and who was standing and moving closely._END

B_6_C_34_21
BEGIN_
लन्घनम् च समुद्रस्य दर्शनम् च हनूमतः |
वधम् च रक्षसाम् युद्धे कः कुर्यान् मानुषो भुवि || ६-३४-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Which mortal would accomplish the crossing of the ocean, the discovery of Seetha by
Hanuman, and the carnage of the demons in combat on this earth?"_END

B_6_C_33_26
BEGIN_
अश्रूण्य् आनन्दजानि त्वम् वर्तयिष्यसि शोभने |
समागम्य परिष्वक्ता तस्य उरसि महा उरसः || ६-३३-३४_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha! You will shed tears of joy on the bosom of that broad-chested Rama, re-
united with you and holding you clasped to his breast."_END

B_6_C_37_1
BEGIN_
इयम् सा लक्ष्यते लन्का पुरी रावण पालिता |
सासुर उरग गन्धर्वैर् अमरैर् अपि दुर्जया || ६-३७-४_END
BEGIN_
"Observe this city of Lanka, ruled by Ravana, impregnable both to celestials and the
demons together, or the uragas (the serpent-demons) and Gandharvas (celestial musicians)."_END

B_6_C_32_31
BEGIN_एवम् लालप्यमानायाम् सीतायाम् तत्र राक्षसः |
अभिचक्राम भर्तारम् अनीकस्थः क्ऱ्त अन्जलिः || ६-३२-३४_END
BEGIN_While Seetha was lamenting thus, a demon who was a royal guard approached his Lord there 
with his joined palms in salutation (and cried as follows):_END

B_6_C_36_10
BEGIN_द्विधा भज्येयम् अप्य् एवम् न नमेयम् तु कस्यचित् |
एष मे सहजो दोषह् स्वभावो दुरतिक्रमः || ६-३६-११_END
BEGIN_"Rather would I be cut into two pieces than bend before anybody! Such was I from birth, 
it is my nature by difacult and unalterable."_END

B_6_C_35_15
BEGIN_
स प्रमादाद् विवृद्धस् ते अधर्मो अहिर् ग्रसते हि नः || ६-३५-१६
विवर्धयति पक्षम् च सुराणाम् सुर भावनः |_END
BEGIN_
"Due to your negligence, that well nourished unrighteousness is swallowing us. Being
favourable to demons, the sect of demons is thereby getting augmented."_END

B_6_C_31_37
BEGIN_अग्रतः कुरु सीतायाः श्रीघ्रं दाशरथेः शिरः |
			अवस्थां पशिचमां भर्तुः कृपणा साधु पश्यतु || ६-३१-४२_END
BEGIN_"Keep Rama's head immediately in front of Seetha. Let the miserable Seetha 
			see well the final condition of her husband._END

B_6_C_34_22
BEGIN_
एवम् स मन्त्रि वृद्धैश्च मात्रा च बहु भाषितः |
न त्वाम् उत्सहते मोक्तुम् अर्तह्म् अर्थ परो यथा || ६-३४-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Though admonished in many ways by the aged ministers and his mother he is not
inclined to set you free, any more than a miser would leave his hold on his riches._END

B_6_C_33_27
BEGIN_
अचिरान् मोक्ष्यते सीते देवि ते जघनम् गताम् |
धृताम् एताम् बहून् मासान् वेणीम् रामो महा बलः || ६-३३-३५_END
BEGIN_
"Before long, O divine Seetha, that mighty Rama will loosen the one single plait
which has reached past your hips, which you have worn these many months."_END

B_6_C_37_2
BEGIN_
कार्य सिद्धिम् पुरस् क्ऱ्त्य मन्त्रयध्वम् विनिर्णये |
नित्यम् सम्निहितो ह्य् अत्र रावणो राक्षस अधिपः || ६-३७-५_END
BEGIN_
"Ravana, the lord of demons always stays in the City. Think of the ways and means
for the success of our expedition."_END

B_6_C_32_32
BEGIN_विजयस्व आर्य पुत्र इति सो अभिवाद्य प्रसाद्य च |
न्यवेदयद् अनुप्राप्तम् प्रहस्तम् वाहिनी पतिम् || ६-३२-३५_END
BEGIN_"May you be victorious, O noble Lord!" he respectfully announced thus, thereby winning 
his pleasure and informed that Prahasta the army chief had come._END

B_6_C_36_11
BEGIN_यदि तावत् समुद्रे तु सेतुर् बद्धो यदृच्चया |
रामेण विस्मयः को अत्र येन ते भयम् आगतम् || ६-३६-१२_END
BEGIN_"What great marvel is there in that which gave way to terror if by happy chance, a bridge 
indeed was constructed by Rama across the ocean."_END

B_6_C_35_16
BEGIN_
विषयेषु प्रसक्तेन यत् किंचित् कारिणा त्वया || ६-३५-१७
ऱ्षीणाम् अग्नि कल्पानाम् उद्वेगो जनितो महान् |_END
BEGIN_
"You, who are interested in sensual enjoyments, doing whatever you like, have
created a great alarm in the sages, having the nature of fire."_END

B_6_C_34_23
BEGIN_
न उत्सहत्य् अम्र्तो मोक्तुम् युद्धे त्वाम् इति मैथिलि |
सामात्यस्य नृशंसस्य निश्चयो ह्य् एष वर्तते || ६-३४-२४_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha! He does not want to release you, without dying himself in a battle. This
is the resolve of the cruel Ravana along with his ministers."_END

B_6_C_31_38
BEGIN_एवमुक्तं तु तद्रक्षः शिरस्तत्प्रियदर्शनम् |
			उपनिक्षिप्य सीतायाः क्षिप्रमन्तरधीयत || ६-३१-४३_END
BEGIN_Hearing Ravana's words, that demon deposited the cherished head in the vicinity 
			of Seetha and soon disappeared from the site._END

B_6_C_33_28
BEGIN_
तस्य दृष्ट्वा मुखम् देवि पूर्ण चन्द्रम् इव उदितम् |
मोक्ष्यसे शोकजम् वारि निर्मोकम् इव पन्नगी || ६-३३-३६_END
BEGIN_
"O, Queen! Seeing his face, looking like a rising moon, you will renounce your tears
born of grief, like a female snake casts off its slough."_END

B_6_C_37_3
BEGIN_
तथा तेषु ब्रुवाणेषु रावण अवरजो अब्रवीत् |
वाक्यम् अग्राम्य पदवत् पुष्कल अर्थम् विभीषणः || ६-३७-६_END
BEGIN_
While they were talking thus, Vibhishana the younger brother of Ravana spoke the
following meaningful and polished words:_END

B_6_C_32_33
BEGIN_अमात्यैः स हितः सर्वैः प्रहस्तस्त्वामुपस्थितः |
तेन दर्शनकामेन अहम् प्रस्थापितः प्रभो || ६-३२-३६_END
BEGIN_"O, Lord! Prahasta has come with all ministers. He has sent me, eager as he is, to see 
you."_END

B_6_C_36_12
BEGIN_स तु तीर्त्वा अर्णवम् रामः सह वानर सेनया |
प्रतिजानामि ते सत्यम् न जीवन् प्रतियास्यति || ६-३६-१३_END
BEGIN_"That Rama along with his army of monkeys, having crossed the ocean, will not go back 
alive. It is my true promise to you."_END

B_6_C_35_17
BEGIN_
तेषाम् प्रभावो दुर्धर्षः प्रदीप्त;इव पावकः || ६-३५-१८
तपसा भावित आत्मानो धर्मस्य अनुग्रहे रताः |
मुख्यैर् यज्नैर् यजन्त्य् एते नित्यम् तैस् तैर् द्विजातयः || ६-३५-१९
जुह्वत्य् अग्नींसः च विधिवद् वेदांसः च उच्चैर् अधीयते |
अभिभूय च रक्षांसि ब्रह्म घोषान् उदैरयन् || ६-३५-२०
दिशो विप्रद्रुताः सर्वे स्तनयित्नुर् इव उष्णगे |_END
BEGIN_
"The power of those sages is insurmountable like an igniting fire. Having purified
their minds through penance, they are intent on promotion of righteousness, in as much as these
Brahamans worship the gods through different principal sacrifices, also pour oblations into the
sacred fires with due ceremony and read the Vedas (Sacred texts) in a loud voice. Having subdued
the demons, they continued to chant the sacred text, on hearing which all the demons scattered in
all directions, as thundering clouds in a hot season."_END

B_6_C_34_24
BEGIN_
तद् एषा सुस्थिरा बुद्धिर्मृत्यु लोभाद् उपस्थिता |
भयान् न शक्तस् त्वाम् मोक्तुम् अनिरस्तस् तु सम्युगे || ६-३४-२५
राक्षसानाम् च सर्वेषाम् आत्मनश् च वधेन हि |_END
BEGIN_
-"Thereafter, due to infatuation caused by his impending death, his aforesaid
determination is very firm .He is not in a position to release you, not through sheer fear, but
until he is actually defeated in battle through the carnage of all the demons and of himself."_END

B_6_C_31_39
BEGIN_रावणश्चापि चिक्षेप भास्वरम् कार्मुकम् महत् |
			त्रिषु लोकेषु विख्यातम् रामस्यैतदिति ब्रुवन् || ६-३१-४४_END
BEGIN_"Here is Rama's bow famous in the three worlds!" - saying thus, Ravana threw 
			a great shining bow in front of Seetha._END

B_6_C_33_29
BEGIN_
रावणम् समरे हत्वा नचिराद् एव मैथिलि |
त्वया समग्रम् प्रियया सुख अर्हो लप्स्यते सुखम् || ६-३३-३७_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha! Having killed Ravana in combat within no time, Rama (who deserves
facility); will enjoy happiness in the company of the beloved, namely yourself."_END

B_6_C_37_4
BEGIN_
अनलः शरभसः चैव सम्पातिः प्रघसस् तथा |
गत्वा लन्काम् मम अमात्याः पुरीम् पुनर् इह आगताः || ६-३७-७_END
BEGIN_
"My counsellors named Anala, Panasa, Sampati and Pramati went to the City of Lanka
and returned here."_END

B_6_C_32_34
BEGIN_मानमस्ति महारा ज राजभावात् क्षमान्वित |
किंचिद् आत्ययिकम् कार्यम् तेषाम् त्वम् दर्शनम् कुरु || ६-३२-३७_END
BEGIN_"O, king, endowed with patience! There is a little urgent work by way of king's duty. 
Please accord them your audience now."_END

B_6_C_36_13
BEGIN_एवम् ब्रुवाणम् सम्रब्धम् रुष्टम् विज्नाय रावणम् |
व्रीडितो माल्यवान् वाक्यम् न उत्तरम् प्रत्यपद्यत || ६-३६-१४_END
BEGIN_Beholding Ravana to be highly excited and speaking with such fury, Malyavan, abashed, 
did not reply._END

B_6_C_35_18
BEGIN_
ऋषीणाम् अग्नि कल्पानाम् अग्नि होत्र समुत्थितः || ६-३५-२१
आदत्ते रक्षसाम् तेजो धूमो व्याप्य दिशो दश |_END
BEGIN_
"The smoke coming forth from the sacred fire of the sage who resemble the fire (in
brilliance), enveloping the ten directions, takes away the magical power of the demons."_END

B_6_C_31_40
BEGIN_इदम् तत्तव रामस्य कार्मुकं ज्यासमाव्ऱ्६इतम् |
			इह प्रहस्तेवानीतम् तम् हत्वा निशि मानुषम् || ६-३१-४५_END
BEGIN_"This is the bow with its cord stretched, belonging to Rama, that was brought 
			back by Prahasta here, after killing that hero in the night."_END

B_6_C_34_25
BEGIN_
निहत्य रावणम् सम्ख्ये सर्वथा निशितैः शरैः || ६-३४-२६
प्रतिनेष्यति रामस् त्वाम् अयोध्याम् असित ईक्षणे |_END
BEGIN_
"O, dark eyed Seetha! Killing Ravana by his sharp arrows in combat, Rama will take
you back to Ayodhya by all means."_END

B_6_C_33_30
BEGIN_
समागता त्वम् रामेण मोदिष्यसि महात्मना |
सुवर्षेण समायुक्ता यथा सस्येन मेदिनी || ६-३३-३८_END
BEGIN_
Acclaimed by the high soled Rama, you will be so happy as how the earth, endowed
with crops, feels after the onset of good rains."_END

B_6_C_37_5
BEGIN_
भूत्वा शकुनयः सर्वे प्रविष्टासः च रिपोर् बलम् |
विधानम् विहितम् यच् च तद् द्ऱ्ष्ट्वा समुपस्थिताः || ६-३७-८_END
BEGIN_
"Assuming the form of birds, all the four entered that enemy's citadel and observed
the measures taken by Ravana closely."_END

B_6_C_32_35
BEGIN_एतत् श्रुत्वा दशग्रीवो राक्षस प्रतिवेदितम् |
अशोक वनिकाम् त्यक्त्वा मन्त्रिणाम् दर्शनम् ययौ || ६-३२-३८_END
BEGIN_Hearing the aforesaid communication of the demon, Ravana left the garden of Ashoka and 
bestowed audience to his ministers._END

B_6_C_36_14
BEGIN_जय आज़िषा च राजानम् वर्धयित्वा यथा उचितम् |
माल्यवान् अभ्यनुज्नातो जगाम स्वम् निवेज़नम् || ६-३६-१५_END
BEGIN_Invoking blessings of victory to the king as courtesy demanded Malyavan took permission 
and went home._END

B_6_C_35_19
BEGIN_
तेषु तेषु च देशेषु पुण्येषु च दृढ व्रतैः || ६-३५-२२
चर्यमाणम् तपस् तीव्रम् सम्तापयति राक्षसान् |_END
BEGIN_
"The severe austerity practised by the sages, firm of resolve, in different
countries torment the demons."_END

B_6_C_31_41
BEGIN_स विद्युजिह्वेन सहैव तच्छिरो |
			धमश्च भूमौ विनिकीर्य रावणः |
			विदेहराजस्य सुताम् यशस्विनीं |
			ततोऽब्रवीत्ताम् भव मे वशामुगा || ६-३१-४६_END
BEGIN_That Rama's head and bow on the ground in front of Seetha the illustrious 
			daughter of Janaka, saying: "You now become submissive to my desire."_END

B_6_C_34_26
BEGIN_
एतस्मिन्न् अन्तरे शब्दो भेरी शन्ख समाकुलः || ६-३४-२७
श्रुतो वै सर्व सैन्यानाम् कम्पयन् धरणी तलम् |_END
BEGIN_
In the meantime was heard the sound of all the monkey troops blended with the sound
of kettle drums, causing earth to shake._END

B_6_C_38_0
BEGIN_स तु कृत्वा सुवेलस्य मतिम् आरोहणम् प्रति |
लक्ष्मण अनुगतो रामह् सुग्रीवम् इदम् अब्रवीत् || ६-३८-१
विभीषणम् च धर्मज्नम् अनुरक्तम् निज़ा चरम् |
मन्त्रज्नम् च विधिज्नम् च ज़्लक्ष्णया परया गिरा || ६-३८-२_END
BEGIN_Rama, who was followed by Lakshmana, having made up his mind to ascend Mount Suvela, 
spoke in a gentle and prime voice to Sugreeva and to Vibhishana who was the knower of what is right, 
a demon devoted to him who was experienced in counsel and a knower of prescribed rules (as follows):_END

B_6_C_33_31
BEGIN_
गिरि वरम् अभितो अनुवर्तमानो |
हय इव मण्डलम् आशु यः करोति |
तम् इह शरणम् अभ्युपेहि देवि
दिवस करम् प्रभवो ह्ययम् प्रजानाम् ६-३३-३९_END
BEGIN_
"O, queen! Seek refuge now with him - the sun that rolls towards Meru the highest
mountain, like a horse that makes its round rapidly. That sun is indeed the source of all
creatures."_END

B_6_C_37_6
BEGIN_
सम्विधानम् यथा आहुस् ते रावणस्य दुरात्मनः |
राम तद् ब्रुवतः सर्वम् यथातथ्येन मे शृणु || ६-३७-९_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! I give a detailed report as it was given to me of the defence-arrangements
made by tha evil-minded Ravana, hear me."_END

B_6_C_32_36
BEGIN_स तु सर्वम् समर्थ्य एव मन्त्रिभिः क्ऱ्त्यम् आत्मनः |
सभाम् प्रविश्य विदधे विदित्वा राम विक्रमम् || ६-३२-३९_END
BEGIN_He deliberated with his ministers as to what action in its entirety to be pursued and 
entered the council-chamber and issued his commands in accordance with the knowledge he possessed of 
Rama's forces._END

B_6_C_36_15
BEGIN_रावणस् तु सह अमात्यो मन्त्रयित्वा विमृज़्य च |
लन्कायाम् अतुलाम् गुप्तिम् कारयाम् आस राक्षसः || ६-३६-१६_END
BEGIN_Ravana the demon on his part, assisted by his ministers having deliberated on the things 
to be examined, set about planning the defense of Lanka._END

B_6_C_35_20
BEGIN_
देवदानवयक्षेभो गृहीतश्च वरस्त्वया || ६-३५-२३
मनुष्या वानरा ऋक्षा गोलाङ्गूला महाबलाः |
बलवन्त इहागम्य गर्जन्ति दृढविक्रमाः ||६-३५-२४_END
BEGIN_
"You received a boon of invincibility from celestials, demons and semi-divine
beings, but then are men, bears as well as powerful and very efficacious having strong prowess who
are coming hither, roaring like lions."_END

B_6_C_34_27
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा तु तम् वानर सैन्य शब्दम् |
लन्का गता राक्षस राज भ्र्त्याः |
नष्ट ओजसो दैन्य परीत चेष्टाः |
श्रेयो न पश्यन्ति न्र्पस्य दोषैः || ६-३४-२८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that sound of that monkey troops, the servants of Ravana stationed in Lanka
were lack- luster with their movements, overcome by depression. They did not see anything salutary
in it, owing to the fault of their king._END

B_6_C_38_1
BEGIN_सुवेलम् साधु ज़ैल इन्द्रम् इमम् धातु ज़तैज़् चितम् |
अध्यारोहामहे सर्वे वत्स्यामो अत्र निज़ाम् इमाम् || ६-३८-३_END
BEGIN_"We shall ascend up on high this Suvela mountain, shining well with hundreds of minerals. 
All of us will stay on this mountain for this night."_END

B_6_C_37_7
BEGIN_
पूर्वम् प्रहस्तः सबलो द्वारम् आसाद्य तिष्ठति |
दक्षिणम् च महा वीर्यौ महा पार्श्व महा उदरौ || ६-३७-१०_END
BEGIN_
"The very strong Prashata is standing near the eastern gate. Mahaparshva and
Mahodara of mighty prowess are at the southern gate."_END

B_6_C_32_37
BEGIN_अन्तर्धानम् तु तत् शीर्षम् तच् च कार्मुकम् उत्तमम् |
जगाम रावणस्य एव निर्याण समनन्तरम् || ६-३२-४०_END
BEGIN_Soon after the departure of Ravana, the illusory head and bow had vanished._END

B_6_C_36_16
BEGIN_व्यादिदेज़ च पूर्वस्याम् प्रहस्तम् द्वारि राक्षसम् |
दक्षिणस्याम् महा वीर्यौ महा पार्ज़्व महा उदरौ || ६-३६-१७
पज़्चिमायाम् अथो द्वारि पुत्रम् इन्द्रजितम् तथा |
व्यादिदेज़ महा मायम् राक्षसैर् बहुभिर् वृतम् || ६-३६-१८_END
BEGIN_Thereafter, he assigned the eastern gate to the demon, Prahasta and the southern gate 
to Maha Parshva and Mhodara both of great prowess. At the western gate, he placed his son Indrajit, 
a powerful conjuror, with considerable force of demons._END

B_6_C_35_21
BEGIN_
उत्पातान् विविधान् दृष्ट्वा घोरान् बहु विधांस् तथा |
विनाशम् अनुपश्यामि सर्वेषाम् रक्षसाम् अहम् || ६-३५-२५_END
BEGIN_
"By seeing various kinds of unexpected events (portents) and many types of terrific
things, I am perceiving a destruction of all the demons."_END

B_6_C_38_2
BEGIN_लन्काम् च आलोकयिष्यामो निलयम् तस्य रक्षसह् |
येन मे मरण अन्ताय हृता भार्या दुरात्मना || ६-३८-४
येन धर्मो न विज्नातो न वृत्तम् न कुलम् तथा |
राक्षस्या नीचया बुद्ध्या येन तद् गर्हितम् कृतम् || ६-३८-५_END
BEGIN_"We shall see Lanka the abode of that demon, Ravana the evil-minded by whom my wife was 
taken away for the sake of his own death, by whom virtue was not understood, good character was not 
known and noble lineage was not seen and by whom that contemptible act was done with an inferior demoniacal 
mind."_END

B_6_C_37_8
BEGIN_
इन्द्रजित् पश्चिम द्वारम् राक्षसैर् बहुभिर् वृतः |
पट्टस असि धनुष्मद्भिः शूल मुद्गर पाणिभिः || ६-३७-११
नाना प्रहरणैः शूरैर् आवृतो रावण आत्मजः |_END
BEGIN_
"Indragit, the son of Ravana is at the western gate along with many demons armed
with harpoons, swords, bows, spears and hammers together with warriors furnished with weapons of
various kinds."_END

B_6_C_32_38
BEGIN_राक्षस इन्द्रस् तु तैः सार्धम् मन्त्रिभिर् भीम विक्रमैः |
समर्थयाम् आस तदा राम कार्य विनिश्चयम् || ६-३२-४१_END
BEGIN_Then, Ravana the king of demons in consultation with his highly powerful ministers, decided 
on the measures he would adopt against Rama._END

B_6_C_36_17
BEGIN_उत्तरस्याम् पुर द्वारि व्यादिज़्य ज़ुक सारणौ |
स्वयम् च अत्र भविष्यामि मन्त्रिणस् तान् उवाच ह || ६-३६-१९_END
BEGIN_Placing Shuka and Sarana at the northern city-gate, Ravana told his ministers that he 
would go there personally._END

B_6_C_35_22
BEGIN_
खराभिस् तनिता घोरा मेघाह् प्रतिभयम् करः |
शोणितेन अभिवर्षन्ति लन्काम् उष्णेन सर्वतः || ६-३५-२६_END
BEGIN_
"With terrifying clamour, monstrous clouds, inspiring horror, rain hot blood on
Lanka on every side."_END

B_6_C_38_3
BEGIN_यस्मिन् मे वर्धते रोषह् कीर्तिते राक्षस अधमे |
यस्य अपराधान् नीचस्य वधम् द्रक्ष्यामि रक्षसाम् || ६-३८-६_END
BEGIN_"My anger is increased on hearing the name of that demon. Because of the offence committed 
by him, I shall see that all these demons are destroyed."_END

B_6_C_37_9
BEGIN_
राक्षसानाम् सहस्रैस् तु बहुभिः शस्त्र पाणिभिः || ६-३७-१२
युक्तः परम सम्विग्नो राक्षसैर् बहुभिर् व्ऱ्तः |
उत्तरम् नगर द्वारम् रावणः स्वयम् आस्थितः || ६-३७-१३_END
BEGIN_
"A prey to great anxiety, Ravana knower of magical formulas, is himself stationed at
the northern gate, along with several thousands of demons holding lances in their hand."_END

B_6_C_32_39
BEGIN_अविदूर स्थितान् सर्वान् बल अध्यक्षान् हित एषिणः |
अब्रवीत् काल सद्ऱ्शो रावणो राक्षस अधिपः || ६-३२-४२_END
BEGIN_Ravana the king of demons, resembling Yama the god of death, addressed all the generals 
standing nearby, devoted to his interests as follows:_END

B_6_C_36_18
BEGIN_राक्षसम् तु विरूप अक्षम् महा वीर्य पराक्रमम् |
मध्यमे अस्थापयद् गुल्मे बहुभिह् सह राक्षसैः || ६-३६-२०_END
BEGIN_He place the demon Virupaksha, who was full of energy and courage, to be in the center 
of the fort, with a large number of demons._END

B_6_C_35_23
BEGIN_
रुदताम् वाहनानाम् च प्रपतन्त्य् अस्र बिन्दवः |
ध्वजा ध्वस्ता विवर्णासः च न प्रभान्ति यथा पुरम् || ६-३५-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Drops of tears drop from the weeping elephants, horses etc., whose skins became
discoloured, covered with dust and are not shining as before."_END

B_6_C_38_4
BEGIN_एको हि कुरुते पापम् काल पाज़ वज़म् गतः |
नीचेन आत्म अपचारेण कुलम् तेन विनज़्यति || ६-३८-७_END
BEGIN_"Falling into that power of trap of death, one does an evil act. Because of the offence 
committed by him the vilest, his lineage is destroyed."_END

B_6_C_37_10
BEGIN_
विरूप अक्षस् तु महता शूल खड्ग धनुष्मता |
बलेन राक्षसैः सार्धम् मध्यमम् गुल्मम् आस्थितः || ६-३७-१४_END
BEGIN_
"As for Virupaksha he with mighty army carrying spears, clubs and bows along with
other demons, occupies the center of the fort."_END

B_6_C_32_40
BEGIN_शीघ्रम् भेरी निनादेन स्फुट कोण आहतेन मे |
समानयध्वम् सैन्यानि वक्तव्यम् च न कारणम् || ६-३२-४३_END
BEGIN_"By a sound of a drum beaten audibly with a drum stick, immediately summon all my forces. 
Do not tell them the reason for which I am calling."_END

B_6_C_36_19
BEGIN_एवम् विधानम् लन्कायाम् कृत्वा राक्षस पुम्गवः |
मेने कृत अर्थम् आत्मानम् कृत अन्त वज़म् आगतः || ६-३६-२१_END
BEGIN_Making an arrangement in Lanka in this manner, that bull among demons, under the sway 
of Time, deemed his purpose as accomplished._END

B_6_C_35_24
BEGIN_
व्याला गोमायवो ग्ऱ्^ इध्रा वाशन्ति च सुभैरवम् |
प्रविश्य लन्काम् अनिशम् समवायांसः च कुर्वते || ६-३५-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Flesh-eating animals, jackals and eagles and howling horribly. Entering Lanka, they
are in the groves, forming into groups."_END

B_6_C_38_5
BEGIN_एवम् सम्मन्त्रयन्न् एव सक्रोधो रावणम् प्रति |
रामह् सुवेलम् वासाय चित्र सानुम् उपारुहत् || ६-३८-८_END
BEGIN_Rama, thus thinking of Ravana in anger, approached and ascended the mountain of Suvela 
with its conspicuous summits._END

B_6_C_37_11
BEGIN_
एतान् एवम् विधान् गुल्माम्ल् लन्कायाम् समुदीक्ष्य ते |
मामकाः सचिवाः सर्वे शीघ्रम् पुनर् इह आगताः || ६-३७-१५_END
BEGIN_
"All these counsellors of mine watched those groups of troops arranged in Lanka in
this manner and immediately returned here."_END

B_6_C_32_41
BEGIN_ततस् तथा इति प्रतिगृह्य तद् वचो |
स्तदैव दूताः सहसा महाद्बलम् |
समानयंसः चैव समागतम् च ते |
न्यवेदयन् भर्तरि युद्ध कान्क्षिणि || ६-३२-४४_END
BEGIN_Then, the messengers answered, "So be it" obedient as they were to his words and instantly 
gathered a huge army together and informed their lord longing for fight, that they had since assembled 
the army._END

B_6_C_36_20
BEGIN_विसर्जयाम् आस ततह् स मन्त्रिणो |
विधानम् आज्नाप्य पुरस्य पुष्कलम् |
जय आज़िषा मन्त्र गणेन पूजितो |
विवेज़ सो अन्तह् पुरम् ऋद्धिमन् महत् || ६-३६-२२_END
BEGIN_Having ordered for adequate arrangements for the defence of the city, Ravana then let 
his ministers depart. Having been honoured with blessings of victory by the body of counsellors, he 
entered his mighty and sumptuous inner apartments._END

B_6_C_35_25
BEGIN_
कालिकाः पाण्डुरैर् दन्तैः प्रहसन्त्य् अग्रतः स्थिताः |
स्त्रियः स्वप्नेषु मुष्णन्त्यो गृहाणि प्रतिभाष्य च || ६-३५-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Black women, chattering incoherently in dreams and robbing different houses stand
in front, laughing loudly with their white teeth."_END

B_6_C_38_6
BEGIN_पृष्ठतो लक्ष्मण च एनम् अन्वगच्चत् समाहितः |
सज़रम् चापम् उद्यम्य सुमहद् विक्रमे रतः || ६-३८-९
तम् अन्वरोहत् सुग्रीवह् सामात्यह् सविभीषणह् |_END
BEGIN_Lakshamana too who took delight in his own valour and steadfastness, keeping ready his 
mighty bow with arrows, followed behind Rama Sugreeva along with his ministers and Vibhishana ascended 
the mountain, by following him._END

B_6_C_37_12
BEGIN_
गजानाम् च सहस्रम् च रथानाम् अयुतम् पुरे |
हयानाम् अयुते द्वे च साग्र कोटी च रक्षसाम् || ६-३७-१६
विक्रान्ता बलवन्तसः च सम्युगेष्व् आततायिनः |
इष्टा राक्षस राजस्य नित्यम् एते निशा चराः || ६-३७-१७_END
BEGIN_
"The elephants and chariots number some ten thousand each, the cavalry twenty
thousand and there are more than a crore foot soldiers. These strong and intrepid demons
endeavouring to kill someone in battle have ever been their sovereign's favourites."_END

B_6_C_35_26
BEGIN_
गृहाणाम् बलि कर्माणि श्वानः पर्युपभुन्जते |
खरा गोषु प्रजायन्ते मूषिका नकुलैः सह || ६-३५-३०_END
BEGIN_
"Dogs devour the sacred offerings offered in homes. Donkeys are born of cows and
rats of mongoose."_END

B_6_C_39_0
BEGIN_
ताम् रात्रिम् उषितास् तत्र सुवेले हरि पुम्गवाः |
लन्कायाम् ददृशुर् वीरा वनान्य् उपवनानि च || ६-३९-१_END
BEGIN_
The valiant army-chiefs of monkeys stayed on Suvela mountain for that night and saw
the garden and groves in Lanka._END

B_6_C_38_7
BEGIN_हनूमान् अन्गदो नीलो मैन्दो द्विविद;एव च || ६-३८-१०
गजो गव अक्षो गवयह् ज़रभो गन्ध मादनह् |
पनसह् कुमुदज़् चैव हरो रम्भज़् च यूथपह् || ६-३८-११
जाम्बवांश्च सुषेणश्च ऋषभश्च महामतिः |
दुर्मुखश्च महातेजास्तथा शतबलिः कपिः || ६-३८-१२
एते च अन्ये च बहवो वानराह् ज़ीघ्र गामिनह् |
ते वायु वेग प्रवणास् तम् गिरिम् गिरि चारिणह् || ६-३८-१३
अध्यारोहन्त ज़तज़ह् सुवेलम् यत्र राघवह् |_END
BEGIN_Hanuman, Angada, Nila, Mainda, Dvivida, Gaja, Gavaksha, Gavaya, Sharabha, Gandhamadana, 
Panasa, Kumuda, Hara, Rambha the chief of the troop, Jambavan, sushena, the greatly wise Rishabha, Durmukha 
of great splendour, Shatabali the monkey and other hundreds of monkeys which are fast-moving, which 
can wander easily on mountains with a speed akin to that of wind, ascended that Suvela mountain which 
Rama ascended._END

B_6_C_37_13
BEGIN_
एक एकस्य अत्र युद्ध अर्थे राक्षसस्य विशाम् पते |
परिवारः सहस्राणाम् सहस्रम् उपतिष्ठते || ६-३७-१८_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! In these demons, a retinue of ten lacs each is near at hand for each
demon."_END

B_6_C_35_27
BEGIN_
मार्जारा द्वीपिभिः सार्धम् सूकराः शुनकैः सह |
किम्नरा राक्षसैसः च अपि समेयुर् मानुषैः सह || ६-३५-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Cats mate with tigers, pigs with dogs, Kinnaras (a species of demi-gods with the
human figure and the head of a horse or with a horse's body and the head of a man) with demons and
men."_END

B_6_C_39_1
BEGIN_
सम सौम्यानि रम्याणि विशालान्य् आयतानि च |
दृष्टि रम्याणि ते दृष्ट्वा बभूवुर् जात विस्मयाः || ६-३९-२_END
BEGIN_
Seeing those gardens which were levelled, beautiful, spacious, majestic and
enchanting to look at, they became astonished._END

B_6_C_38_8
BEGIN_ते त्व् अदीर्घेण कालेन गिरिम् आरुह्य सर्वतह् || ६-३८-१४
ददृज़ुह् ज़िखरे तस्य विषक्ताम् इव खे पुरीम् |_END
BEGIN_Having ascended the mountain from all sides within no long time, they saw at its apex, 
the city of Lanka which appeared as though it was hanging in the sky._END

B_6_C_37_14
BEGIN_
एताम् प्रवृत्तिम् लन्कायाम् मन्त्रि प्रोक्तम् विभीषणः |
रामम् कमल पत्र अक्षम् इदम् उत्तरम् अब्रवीत् || ६-३७-१९_END
BEGIN_
The mighty armed Vibhishana showed those counsellors to Rama after reporting the
aforesaid news pertaining to Lanka, thus informed by his counsellors._END

B_6_C_35_28
BEGIN_
पाण्डुरा रक्त पादासः च विहगाः काल चोदिताः |
राक्षसानाम् विनाशाय कपोता विचरन्ति च || ६-३५-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Red-footed and white pigeons, messengers of death, move in different directions,
foretelling the extermination of demons."_END

B_6_C_39_2
BEGIN_
चम्पक अशोक पुम्नाग साल ताल समाकुला |
तमाल वन संचन्ना नाग माला समावृता || ६-३९-३
हिन्तालैर् अर्जुनैर् नीपैः सप्त पर्णैश् च पुष्पितैः |
तिलकैः कर्णिकारैश् च पटालैश् च समन्ततः || ६-३९-४
शुशुभे पुष्पित अग्रैश् च लता परिगतैर् द्रुमैः |
लन्का बहु विधैर् दिव्यैर् यथा इन्द्रस्य अमरावती || ६-३९-५
विचित्र कुसुम उपेतै रक्त कोमल पल्लवैः |
शाद्वलैश् च तथा नीलैश् चित्राभिर् वन राजिभिः || ६-३९-६_END
BEGIN_
Thick with Champaka, Ashoka, Vakula Sala and palmyra trees, covered with groves of
Tamala and Panasa trees, surrounded with rows of Nagakesara trees, Lanka looked splended on all
sides like the city of Amaravati reigned by Indra the god of celestials, with green lawns and
variegated avenues and with beautiful trees of various kinds like Hintala, Arjuna, Nipa Saptaparna
in full flowering, Tilaka, Karnikara and Patal whose crests were laden with flowers and which were
intertwined with climbers laden with multi-coloured flowers and red tender leaves._END

B_6_C_38_9
BEGIN_ताम् ज़ुभाम् प्रवत द्वाराम् प्राकार वर ज़ोभिताम् || ६-३८-१५
लन्काम् राक्षस सम्पूर्णाम् ददृज़ुर् हरि यूथपाह् |_END
BEGIN_The chiefs of monkey-troops saw that beautiful City of Lanka, furnished with excellent 
gates, enriched with exquisitc ramparts and pervaded all over with demons._END

B_6_C_37_15
BEGIN_
लङ्कायाम् सचिवैः रामाय प्रत्यवेदयत् |
रामं कमलपत्राक्षमिदमुत्तरमब्रवीत् || ६-३७-२०
रावणावरजः श्रीमान् रामप्रियचिकीर्षया |_END
BEGIN_
The counsellors of Vibhishana themselves confirmed all that was known regarding
Lanka. Thereafter, the illustrious Vibhishana, in his desire to please Rama, addressed that
lotus-eyed one, further with the following words:_END

B_6_C_35_29
BEGIN_
वीचीकूचीति वाशन्त्यः शारिका वेश्मसु स्थिताः |
पतन्ति ग्रथितासः च अपि निर्जिताः कलह एषिणः || ६-३५-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Domesticated minas (a kind of birds) making a chirping sound, defeated by other
bellicose birds drop down, being twined together in groups."_END

B_6_C_39_3
BEGIN_
गन्ध आढ्यान्य् अभिरम्याणि पुष्पाणि च फलानि च |
धारयन्त्य् अगमास् तत्र भूषणानि इव मानवाः || ६-३९-७_END
BEGIN_
The trees there were laden with fragrant and greatly enchanting flowers and fruits,
as human beings were laden with ornaments._END

B_6_C_38_10
BEGIN_प्राकार चय संस्थैज़् च तथा नीलैर् निज़ा चरैह् || ६-३८-१६
ददृज़ुस् ते हरि ज़्रेष्ठाह् प्राकारम् अपरम् कृतम् |_END
BEGIN_Those excellent monkeys saw another rampart formed out of the black demons so standing 
together scribble on that existing exquisite rampart._END

B_6_C_37_16
BEGIN_
कुबेरम् तु यदा राम रावणः प्रत्ययुध्यत || ६-३७-२१
षष्टिः शत सहस्राणि तदा निर्यान्ति राक्षसाः |
पराक्रमेण वीर्येण तेजसा सत्त्व गौरवात् || ६-३७-२२
सदृशा यो अत्र दर्पेण रावणस्य दुरात्मनः |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! When Ravana attacked Kubera in battle, sixty lacs of demons sallied forth
with him. All of them were akin to the evil-minded Ravana in prowess, in strength, in courage and
in pride."_END

B_6_C_35_30
BEGIN_
पक्षिणश्च मृगाः सर्वे प्रत्यादित्यम् रुदन्ति ते |
करालो विकटो मुण्डः पुरुषः कृष्ण पिन्गलः || ६-३५-३४
कालो गृहाणि सर्वेषाम् काले काले अन्ववेक्षते |
एतान्य् अन्यानि दुष्टानि निमित्तान्य् उत्पतन्ति च || ६-३५-३५_END
BEGIN_
"Birds and wild animals, facing towards the sun, cry out. Death, in the form of a
frightful, monstrous and cruel blackish fellow with a shaven head casts his eyes on all our
dwellings, both morning and evening. These and such other sinister omens appear."_END

B_6_C_39_4
BEGIN_
तच् चैत्र रथ सम्काशम् मनोज्नम् नन्दन उपमम् |
वनम् सर्व ऋतुकम् रम्यम् शुशुभे षट्पद आयुतम् || ६-३९-८_END
BEGIN_
That garden, which bore flowers and fruits in relation to all seasons and with full
of bees, like chaitraratha (garden of Kubera, the god of riches), was quite charming, like Nandana
(garden of Indra the Lord of celestials)_END

B_6_C_38_11
BEGIN_ते दृष्ट्वा वानराह् सर्वे राक्षसान् युद्ध कान्क्षिणह् || ६-३८-१७
मुमुचुर् विपुलान् नादांस् तत्र रामस्य पज़्यतह् |_END
BEGIN_Seeing the demons who were craving for war, all those monkeys made various types of noises, 
while Rama was witnessing the scene._END

B_6_C_37_17
BEGIN_
अत्र मन्युर् न कर्तव्यो रोषये त्वाम् न भीषये || ६-३७-२३
समर्थो ह्य् असि वीर्येण सुराणाम् अपि निग्रहे |_END
BEGIN_
"Indignation need not be resorted to (by you) based on this report. I am not
terrifying you, bt only arousing your wrath. You are indeed capable of overpowering even celestials
by your valour."_END

B_6_C_35_31
BEGIN_
विष्णुम् मन्यामहे रामम् मानुषम् देहम् आस्थितम् |
न हि मानुष मात्रो असौ राघवो दृढ विक्रमः || ६-३५-३६
येन बद्धः समुद्रस्य स सेतुः परम अद्भुतः |
कुरुष्व नर राजेन संधिम् रामेण रावण || ६-३५-३७
ज्ञात्वावधार्य कर्माणि क्रियतामायतिक्षमम् |_END
BEGIN_
"I deem Rama of firm fortitude as Vishnu dwelling in human form. This Rama is not a
mere human being, he by whom that most wonderful bridge was built across the sea. O, Ravana!
Conclude peace with Rama, who is the king of men. Having come to know of his acts, let that which
is good for the future be done after a mature understanding."_END

B_6_C_39_5
BEGIN_
नत्यूह कोयष्टि भकैर् नृत्यमानैश् च बर्हिभिः |
रुतम् पर भृतानाम् च शुश्रुवे वन निर्झरे || ६-३९-९_END
BEGIN_
In that garden abounding in cascades, the songs of birds like gallinules,
lapwings(small white cranes), dancing peacocks and cuckoos were heard._END

B_6_C_38_12
BEGIN_ततो अस्तम् अगमत् सूर्यह् संध्यया प्रतिरन्जितह् || ६-३८-१८
पूर्ण चन्द्र प्रदीपा च क्षपा समभिवर्तते |_END
BEGIN_Then, the sun reddened with evening-twillight went down and the night shining with full 
moon arrived._END

B_6_C_37_18
BEGIN_
तद् भवांसः चतुर् अन्गेण बलेन महता वृतः || ६-३७-२४
व्यूह्य इदम् वानर अनीकम् निर्मथिष्यसि रावणम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Having set out these monkey-forces in battle-array, you shall destryoy Ravana with
this great army of monkeys, composed of four divisions, which surround you."_END

B_6_C_35_32
BEGIN_
इदम् वचस् तत्र निगद्य माल्यवन् |
परीक्ष्य रक्षो अधिपतेर् मनः पुनः |
अनुत्तमेषु उत्तम पौरुषो बली |
बभूव तूष्णीम् समवेक्ष्य रावणम् || ६-३५-३८_END
BEGIN_
Having spoken thus, the mighty Malyavan, who was foremost in valour among the
bravest warriors, being aware of what was passing in Ravana's mind, eyeing him, became silent._END

B_6_C_39_6
BEGIN_
नित्य मत्त विहम्गानि भ्रमर आचरितानि च |
कोकिल आकुल षण्डानि विहग अभिरुतानि च || ६-३९-१०
भृन्ग राज अभिगीतानि भ्रमरैः सेवितानि च |
कोणालक विघुष्टानि सारस अभिरुतानि च || ६-३९-११
विविशुस् ते ततस् तानि वनान्य् उपवनानि च |
हृष्टाह् प्रमुदिता वीरा हरयः काम रूपिणः || ६-३९-१२_END
BEGIN_
Then, those monkeys, thrilling with rapture, delighted, brave and assuming any shape
at will, entered the aforesaid groves and gardens, with birds ever excited with joy, wandered by
bees, with clusters of trees occupied by cuckoos, having variegated sounds of birds and song of the
large bees, abounding with sounds of ospreys, with the music of wagtails and cries of canes._END

B_6_C_38_13
BEGIN_ततः स रामो हरि वाहिनी पतिर् |
विभीषणेन प्रतिनन्द्य सत्कृतः |
सलक्ष्मणो यूथप यूथ सम्वृतः |
सुवेल पृष्ठे न्यवसद् यथा सुखम् || ६-३८-१९_END
BEGIN_Thereafter, Rama along with Lakshmana as well as Sugreeva the Lord of monkeys together 
with troops and captions of troops, duly greeted welcomingly and treated hospitably by Vibhishana, halted 
happily on the mountain resort of Suvela._END

B_6_C_37_19
BEGIN_
रावण अवरजे वाक्यम् एवम् ब्रुवति राघवः || ६-३७-२५
शत्रूणाम् प्रतिघात अर्थम् इदम् वचनम् अब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana having spoken thus Rama gave the following orders for the attack of the
adversaries._END

B_6_C_39_7
BEGIN_
तेषाम् प्रविशताम् तत्र वानराणाम् महा ओजसाम् |
पुष्प संसर्ग सुरभिर् ववौ घ्राण सुखो अनिलः || ६-३९-१३_END
BEGIN_
While those mighty and splendid monkeys were entering the groves a breeze with
flowery fragrance, delightful to the nose, blew._END

B_6_C_37_20
BEGIN_
पूर्व द्वारे तु लन्काया नीलो वानर पुम्गवः || ६-३७-२६
प्रहस्तम् प्रतियोद्धा स्याद् वानरैर् बहुभिर् वृतः |_END
BEGIN_
"At the eastern gate of Lanka, Nila that lion among monkeys for his part, surrounded
by many monkeys, should attack Prahasta."_END

B_6_C_39_8
BEGIN_
अन्ये तु हरि वीराणाम् यूथान् निष्क्रम्य यूथपाः |
सुग्रीवेण अभ्यनुज्नाता लन्काम् जग्मुः पताकिनीम् || ६-३९-१४_END
BEGIN_
Some other troop-leaders of the valiant monkeys came out of their troops with due
permission from sugreeva and went towards Lanka, the city adorned with flags_END

B_6_C_40_0
BEGIN_
ततो रामः सुवेलाग्रं योजनद्वयमण्डलम् |
उपारोहत्ससुग्रीवो हरियूथैः समन्वितः || ६-४०-१_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama along with Sugreeva, together with the troop leaders of monkeys, ascended
the top of Suvela mountain which was having a circumference of sixteen miles._END

B_6_C_37_21
BEGIN_
अन्गदो वालि पुत्रस् तु बलेन महता वृतः || ६-३७-२७
दक्षिणे बाधताम् द्वारे महा पार्श्व महा उदरौ |_END
BEGIN_
"At the southern gate, Angada the son of Vali, surrounded by his mighty army, should
oppose Mahaparshva and Mahodara."_END

B_6_C_39_9
BEGIN_
वित्रासयन्तो विहगांस् त्रासयन्तो मृग द्विपान् |
कम्पयन्तश् च ताम् लन्काम् नादैः स्वैर् नदताम् वराः || ६-३९-१५_END
BEGIN_
Those monkeys, great in making noises causing the birds to frighten and displeasing
to the animals and elephants, went, causing that Lanka to tremble, by their noises._END

B_6_C_40_1
BEGIN_
स्थित्वा मुहूर्तं तत्रैव दिशो दश विलोकयन् |
त्रिख़ूटशिखरे रम्ये निर्मितां विश्वकर्मणा || ६-४०-२
ददर्श लङ्कां सुन्यस्तां रम्यकाननशोभिताम् |_END
BEGIN_
Halting there just for a while and surveying the ten cardinal points, Rama saw the
city of Lanka, which was beautifully constructed by Visvakarma, the divine architect on the top of
Trikuta Mountain with nice arrangements and ravishing with enchanting groves._END

B_6_C_37_22
BEGIN_
हनूमान् पश्चिम द्वारम् निपीड्य पवन आत्मजः || ६-३७-२८
प्रविशत्व् अप्रमेय आत्मा बहुभिः कपिभिर् वृतः |_END
BEGIN_
"Let Hanuman that son of the Wind and of inscrutable spirit, surrounded by a
multitude of monkeys, enter the City through the western gate."_END

B_6_C_39_10
BEGIN_
कुर्वन्तस् ते महा वेगा महीम् चारण पीडिताम् |
अजश् च सहसा एव ऊर्ध्वम् जगाम चरण उद्धतम् || ६-३९-१६_END
BEGIN_
Those monkeys with great speed marched ahead, making the earth flattened by their
feet and the dust thus raised by their feet went up instant aneously._END

B_6_C_40_2
BEGIN_
तस्यां गोपुरशृङ्गस्थं राक्षसेन्द्रं दुरासदम् || ६-४०-३
श्वेतचामरपर्यन्तं विजयच्चत्रशोभितम् |
रक्तचन्दनसंलिप्तं रक्ताभरणभूषितम् || ६-४०-४
वीलजीमूतसंकाशं हेमसंचादिताम्बरम् |
ऐरावतविषाणाग्रैरुत्कृष्टकिणवक्षसम् || ६-४०-५
शशलोहितरागेण सम्वीतं रक्तवाससा |
संध्यातपेन संचन्नं मेघराशिमिवाम्बरे || ६-४०-६_END
BEGIN_
There above a gateway, stood the invincible Ravana the lord of demons, who was being
fanned with white whisks on both sides, was graced with a triumphal parasol, was smeared with red
sandal paste, adorned with scarlet ornaments, attired in raiment embroidered in gold, resembling a
dark cloud, who bore on his breast scars of wounds inflicted on him by Airavata (the elephant who
carries Indra the Lord of celestials, on his back) with his tusks, wrapped in a cloak of red colour
resembling the colour of hare's blood and looked like a mass of clouds in the sky enveloped with
sunshine at sunset._END

B_6_C_37_23
BEGIN_
दैत्य दानव सम्घानाम् ऋषीणाम् च महात्मनाम् || ६-३७-२९
विप्रकार प्रियः क्षुद्रो वर दान बल अन्वितः |
परिक्रामति यः सर्वाम्ल् लोकान् सम्तापयन् प्रजाः || ६-३७-३०
तस्य अहम् राक्षस इन्द्रस्य स्वयम् एव वधे धृतः |
उत्तरम् नगर द्वारम् अहम् सौमित्रिणा सह || ६-३७-३१
निपीड्य अभिप्रवेक्ष्यामि सबलो यत्र रावणः |_END
BEGIN_
I am myself determined to slay that wicked who owing to the boon he has received,
enjoys oppressing multitudes of Daityas (gaints) and Daanavas (demons), as also the magnanimous
sages and who ranges the world, persenting all being. With the aid of Lakshmana, I shall forcibly
enter the northern gate where Ravana is stationed along with his army."_END

B_6_C_39_11
BEGIN_
ऋक्षाः सिम्हा वराहाश् च महिषा वारणा मृगाः |
तेन शब्देन वित्रस्ता जग्मुर् भीता दिशो दश || ६-३९-१७_END
BEGIN_
Frightened by that sound, bears lions buffaloes elephants, deers and birds were
trembled and terrified and hastened towards ten different directions._END

B_6_C_40_3
BEGIN_
पश्यतां वानरेन्द्राणाम् राघवस्यापि पश्यतः |
दर्शनाद्राक्षसेन्द्रस्य सुग्रीवः सहसोत्थितः || ६-४०-७_END
BEGIN_
On seeing Ravana, Sugreeva got up all at once, while Rama and the chiefs of the army
of monkeys were looking on._END

B_6_C_37_24
BEGIN_
वानर इन्द्रसः च बलवान् ऋक्ष राजसः च जाम्बवान् || ६-३७-३२
राक्षस इन्द्र अनुजसः चैव गुल्मे भवतु मध्यमे |_END
BEGIN_
"Let the mighty Sugreeva the king of monkeys, the valiant Jambavan the king of bears
and Vibhishana, the younger brother of the Lord of demons occupy the central position of the
army."_END

B_6_C_39_12
BEGIN_
शिखरम् तु त्रिकूटस्य प्रांशु च एकम् दिवि स्पृशम् |
समन्तात् पुष्प संचन्नम् महा रजत सम्निभम् || ६-३९-१८
शत योजन विस्तीर्णम् विमलम् चारु दर्शनम् |
श्लक्ष्णम् श्रीमन् महच् चैव दुष्प्रापम् शकुनैर् अपि || ६-३९-१९
मनसा अपि दुरारोहम् किम् पुनः कर्मणा जनैः |_END
BEGIN_
The solitary peak of Trikuta mountain, which is so high as if touching the sky, all
over covered with flowers entirely, resembling gold; to an extent of eight hundred miles; bright;
charming to look at, beautiful, glorious, majestic, inaccessible even by birds, hard to be ascended
by people may, even by the mind-how much more by an act of walking?_END

B_6_C_40_4
BEGIN_
क्रोधवेगेन सं युक्तः सत्त्वेन च बलेन च |
अचलाग्रादथोत्थाय पुप्लुवे गोपुरस्थले || ६-४०-८_END
BEGIN_
Gathering up his strength and courage, Sugreeva, in an impulse of fury, bounded from
the summit of the mountain and then sprang to the top of the gate (where Ravana was)._END

B_6_C_37_25
BEGIN_
न च एव मानुषम् रूपम् कार्यम् हरिभिर् आहवे || ६-३७-३३
एषा भवतु नः सम्ज्ना युद्धे अस्मिन् वानरे बले |_END
BEGIN_
"Monkeys should not assume human form in the battle, for, in the army of monkeys,
this monkey-shape should serve as a sign of recognition among us."_END

B_6_C_39_13
BEGIN_
निविष्टा तत्र शिखरे लन्का रावण पालिता || ६-३९-२०
दशयोजनविस्तीर्णा विंशद्योजनमायता |_END
BEGIN_
Lanka, ruled by Ravana, with a breadth of eighty mile and a length of one hundred
sixty miles, was located on the apex of the mountain there._END

B_6_C_40_5
BEGIN_
स्थित्वा मुहूर्तं सम्प्रेक्ष्य निर्भयेनान्तरात्मना |
तृणीकृत्य च तद्रक्षः सोऽब्रवीत्परुषं वचः || ६-४०-९_END
BEGIN_
For a moment, he paused and then with a fearless soul, he saw that demon, whom he
regarded as a mere straw and thereafter spoke the following words harshly:_END

B_6_C_37_26
BEGIN_
वानरा;एव निश्चिह्नम् स्व जने अस्मिन् भविष्यति || ६-३७-३४
वयम् तु मानुषेण एव सप्त योत्स्यामहे परान् |
अहम् एव सह भ्रात्रा लक्ष्मणेन महा ओजसा || ६-३७-३५
आत्मना पन्चमसः च अयम् सखा मम विभीषणः |_END
BEGIN_
"Among our own people also, the form of monkeys will become a sign of recognition
for us. Seven of us will attack the foe in our human form, I, my brother Lakshmana, who is full of
valour, my friend Vibhishana and his four companions."_END

B_6_C_39_14
BEGIN_
सा पुरी गोपुरैर् उच्चैः पाण्डुर अम्बुद सम्निभैः |
कान्चनेन च सालेन राजतेन च शोभिता || ६-३९-२१_END
BEGIN_
The city of Lanka looked beautiful with its towering City-gates resembling white
clouds as well as with golden and silver ramparts._END

B_6_C_40_6
BEGIN_
लोकनाथस्य रामस्य सखा दासोऽस्मि राक्षस |
न मया मोक्यसे.द्य त्वं पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य तेजसा || ६-४०-१०_END
BEGIN_
"O, demon! I am a friend and a servant of Rama, the Lord of the world. You will not
be spared by me today, by the inspiring grace of Rama."_END

B_6_C_37_27
BEGIN_
स रामः कार्य सिद्ध्य् अर्थम् एवम् उक्त्वा विभीषणम् || ६-३७-३६
सुवेल आरोहणे बुद्धिम् चकार मतिमान् मतिम् |
रमणीयतरम् दृष्ट्वा सुवेलस्य गिरेस्तट्म् || ६-३७-३७_END
BEGIN_
Having said thus to Vibhishana for the success of the enterprise, Rama in the role
of a wise leader, decided to stay on Mount Suvela, after observing its charming slopes._END

B_6_C_39_15
BEGIN_
प्रासादैश् च विमानैश् च लन्का परम भूषिता |
घनैर् इव आतप अपाये मध्यमम् वैष्णवम् पदम् || ६-३९-२२_END
BEGIN_
The city of Lanka, greatly adorned by palaces and seven storied mansions, looked
like the sky with clouds at the end of a summer and as a region of Vishnu (the god of preservation)
between earth and heaven._END

B_6_C_40_7
BEGIN_
इत्युक्त्वा सहसोत्पत्य प्लुप्लुवे तस्य चोपरि |
आकृष्य मुकुटं चित्रं पातयामास तद्भुवि || ६-४०-११_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking, Sugreeva jumped up all at once, bounced over on ravana, pulled his
brightly coloured crown from his head and threw it away on the ground._END

B_6_C_37_28
BEGIN_
ततस् तु रामो महता बलेन |
प्रच्चाद्य सर्वाम् पृथिवीम् महात्मा |
प्रहृष्ट रूपो अभिजगाम लन्काम् |
कृत्वा मतिम् सो अरि वधे महात्मा || ६-३७-३८_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, having covered the entire filed with his great army and having made up
his mind to destroy the enemies, that high-souled Rama of great courage, set out for Lanka with a
joyous and exultant air._END

B_6_C_39_16
BEGIN_
तस्याम् स्तम्भ सहस्रेण प्रासादः समलम्कृतः |
कैलास शिखर आकारो दृश्यते खम् इव उल्लिखन् || ६-३९-२३
चैत्यः स राक्षस इन्द्रस्य बभूव पुर भूषणम् |
शतेन रक्षसाम् नित्यम् यः समग्रेण रक्ष्यते || ६-३९-२४_END
BEGIN_
A palace, duly graced with a thousand pillars, which looked like a peak of Mount
Kailasa was three in the City of Lanka, which was always the City of Lanka, which was always
protected by a complete army of demons. The palace seemed to be scraping the skies and was to be
seen as an ornament to the City of Ravana._END

B_6_C_40_8
BEGIN_
समीक्स्य तूर्णमायान्तं बभाषे तं निशाचरः |
सुग्रीवस्त्वं परोक्षे मे हीनग्रीवो भविष्यसि || ६-४०-१२_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Sugreeva about to rush upon him again, Ravana spoke as follows: "You were
Sugreeva (one who has a handsome neck), when your were not present before my eyes. But now, you
will now become Hinagriva bereft of your neck."_END

B_6_C_39_17
BEGIN_
मनोज्ञाम् काञ्चनवतीम् सर्वतैरुपशोभिताम् |
नानाधातुविचित्रैश्च उद्यानैरुपशोभिताम् || ६-३९-२५
नानाविहगसम्घष्टाम् नानामृगनिषेविताम् |
नानाकुसुमसंपन्नाम् नानाराक्षससेविताम् || ६-३९-२६
ताम् समृद्धाम् समृद्ध अर्थो लक्ष्मीवाम्ल् लक्ष्मण अग्रजः |
रावणस्य पुरीम् रामो ददर्श सह वानरैः || ६-३९-२७_END
BEGIN_
The glorious Rama the elder brother of Lakshmana along with monkeys saw that
charming golden city of Ravana, graced with mountains picturesque with various minerals, splendid
with gardens reechoing with songs of birds of every kind, frequented by varieties of deer, richly
endowed with various kinds of flowers, inhabited by demons of every degree and duly flourishing,
having increased its wealth._END

B_6_C_40_9
BEGIN_
इत्युक्त्वोत्थाय तं क्षिप्रं बाहुभ्यामाक्षिपत्तले |
कन्दुवत्स समुत्थाय बाहुभ्यामाक्षिपद्धरिः || ६-४०-१३_END
BEGIN_
Speaking thus, Ravana raised up and quickly flung Sugreeva to the ground with both
his arms. Bouncing like a ball, Sugreeva flung back his adversary with his arms._END

B_6_C_39_18
BEGIN_
ताम् महागृहसम्बाधां दृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः |
नगरीं त्रिदिवप्रख्यां विस्मयं प्राप वीर्यवान् ६-३९-२८_END
BEGIN_
Beholding that City, which looks like heaven and crammed with huge palaces, the
valiant Rama the elder brother of Lakshmana was seized with astonishment._END

B_6_C_40_10
BEGIN_
परस्परं स्वेदविदिग्धगात्रौ |
परस्परम् शोणितरक्तदेहौ |
परस्परं श्लिष्टनिरुद्धचेष्टौ |
परस्परं शाल्मलिकिंशुकाविव || ६-४०-१४
मुष्टिप्रहारैश्च तलप्रहारै |
ररत्निघातैश्च कराग्रघातैः |
तौ चक्रतुर्युद्धमसह्यरूपं |
महाबलौ राक्षसवानरेन्द्रौ || ६-४०-१५_END
BEGIN_
Ravana and Sugreeva of great strength carried on a duel which was unbearable, with
perspiration broke out on their limbs, with their bodies red with blood, each clung to other other
paralyzing his opponent's movements resembling silk-cotton and Kimshuka trees, followed by blows of
fists, slaps of hands blows of elbows and blows of fingers on each other._END

B_6_C_41_0
BEGIN_अथ तस्मिन् निमित्तानि दृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मण पूर्वजः |
सुग्रीवम् सम्परिष्वज्य रामो वचनमब्रवीत् || ६-४१-१_END
BEGIN_Seeing the marks of conflict on the person of Sugreeva, Rama the elder brother of Lakshmana 
after embracing Sugreeva spoke these words._END

B_6_C_39_19
BEGIN_
ताम् रत्न पूर्णाम् बहु सम्विधानाम् |
प्रासाद मालाभिर् अलम्कृताम् च |
पुरीम् महा यन्त्र कवाट मुख्याम् |
ददर्श रामो महता बलेन || ६-३९-२९_END
BEGIN_
Rama with his great army saw that City, full of precious gems, having all kinds of
facilities, adorned with rows of mansions, having excellent doors with huge mechanical appliances
and with a large armed forces protecting the City._END

B_6_C_40_11
BEGIN_
कृत्वा नियुद्धं भृशमुग्रवेगौ |
कालं चिरं गोपुरवेदिमध्ये |
उत्क्षिप्य चोत्क्षिप्य विनम्य देहौ |
पादक्रमाद्गोपुरवेदिलग्नौ || ६-४०-१६_END
BEGIN_
Having wrestled for a long time in the center of the flat floor of the gate way,
each in turn repeatedly lifting their bodies and bending their feet in a particular way, the two
highly swift combatants remained in that flat roof of the gate way._END

B_6_C_41_1
BEGIN_असंमन्त्य्र मया सार्थम् तदिदम् साहसं कृतम् |
एवम् साहसयुक्तानि न कुर्वन्ति जनेश्वराः || ६-४१-२_END
BEGIN_"Without consulting me closely, such a reckless act has been done by you, such a rashness 
is not seemly in a king."_END

B_6_C_40_12
BEGIN_
अन्योन्यमापीड्य विलग्नदेहौ |
तौ पेतुतुः पालनिखातमध्ये |
उत्पेततुर्भूमितलम् स्पृशन्तौ |
स्थित्वा मुहूर्तं त्वभिनिःश्वसन्तौ || ६-४०-१७_END
BEGIN_
Crushing one another and their bodies clung together, they both dropped down between
the defensive walls and the moat. They would leap up again, seizing each other from the ground,
after pausing an instant to regain their breath._END

B_6_C_41_2
BEGIN_संशये स्थाप्य माम् चेदम् बलम् चेमम् विभीषनम् |
कष्टं कृतमिदं वीर साहसं साहसप्रिय || ६-४१-३_END
BEGIN_"O, warrior longing for acts of daring! This wrong and reckless act has been done by 
you, causing me, this army and Vibhishana great anxiety."_END

B_6_C_40_13
BEGIN_
आलिङ्ग्य चालिङ्ग़्य च बाहुयोक्त्रैः |
संयोजयामासतुराहवे तौ |
सम्रम्भशिक्षाबलसम्प्रयुक्तौ |
सुचेरतुः सम्प्रति युद्धमार्गे || ६-४०-१८_END
BEGIN_
With arms interlaced like with ropes joined together, they remained locked together
in the struggle. Both of them, who had received training in wrestling and fully endowed with night,
were now moving to and fro in the arena._END

B_6_C_41_3
BEGIN_इदानीं मा कृथा वीर एवम् विधमरिंदम |
त्वयि किंचित्समापन्ने किम् कार्यम् सीतया मम || ६-४१-४
भरतेन महाबाहो लक्ष्मणेन यवीयसा |
शत्रुघ्नेन च शत्रुघ्न स्वशरीरेण वा पुनः || ६-४१-५_END
BEGIN_"O, warrior! O, vanquisher of foes! Do not act thus in future. O, the mighty armed! O, 
annihilator of enemies! If you have come by some misfortune, I would have had nothing to do with Seetha, 
Bharata, Lakshmana or still younger Shatrughna or even with my own person."_END

B_6_C_40_14
BEGIN_
शार्दूलसिंहविव जातदंष्ट्रौ |
गजेन्द्रपोताविव संप्रयुक्तौ |
संहत्य संवेद्य च तौ कराभ्यां |
तऊ पेतुतुर्वै युगपद्धरायाम् || ६-४०-१९_END
BEGIN_
The two heroes, who resembled a tiger and a a lion having their tusks growing or two
young lordly elephants encountening in a hostile manner, with arms interlaced and having duly tried
their strength, fell on the ground together._END

B_6_C_41_4
BEGIN_त्वयि चानागते पूर्वमिति मे निश्चिता मतिः |
जानतश्चापि ते वीर्यम् महेन्द्रवरुणोपनु || ६-४१-६
हत्वाहम् रावणम् रावणम् युद्धे सपुत्रबलवाहन्म् |
अभिषिच्य च लङ्कायाम् विभीषण मथापि च || ६-४१-७
भरते राज्यमारोप्य त्यक्ष्ये देहम् महाबल |_END
BEGIN_"O, monkey of great strength, equal to Indra the god of celestials and Varuna the king 
of universe! If you have not returned, though I am conversant with your valour, this was my pre-determined 
resolve that having killed Ravana in fight with his sons forces and chariots, I should have installed 
Vibhishana as king of Lanka, placing the kingdom of Ayodhya in the hands of Bharata and renounced my 
life."_END

B_6_C_40_15
BEGIN_
उद्यम्य चान्योन्यमधिक्षिपन्तौ |
संचक्रमाते बहु युद्धमार्गे |
व्यायामशिक्षाबलसंप्रयुक्तौ |
क्लमं न तौ जग्मतुराशु वीरौ || ६-४०-२०_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter rising, those two heroes hurled themselves on each other, circling around
the arena again and again, like skilled and mighty wrestlers, nor were they easily fatigued._END

B_6_C_41_5
BEGIN_तमेवम्वादिनं रामं सुग्रीवः प्रत्यभाषत || ६-४१-८
तव भार्यापहर्तारं दृष्ट्वा राघव रावणम् |
मर्षयामि कथम् वीर जानन्विक्रममात्मनः || ६-४१-९_END
BEGIN_Hearing Rama's words, Sugreeva replied as follows: "O, brave Rama! Seeing Ravana who 
had taken away your consort and being conscious of my own strength, how can I act otherwise?"_END

B_6_C_42_0
BEGIN_
ततस् ते राक्षसास् तत्र गत्वा रावण मन्दिरम् |
न्यवेदयन् पुरीम् रुद्धाम् रामेण सह वानरैः || ६-४२-१_END
BEGIN_
Then, the demons there, approached Ravana and informed him that the city had been
besieged by Rama along with his monkeys._END

B_6_C_40_16
BEGIN_
बाहुत्तमैर्वारणवारणाभै |
र्निवारयन्तौ परवारणाभौ|
चिरेण कालेन भृशं प्रयुद्धौ |
संचेरतुर्मण्डलमार्गमाशु || ६-४०-२१_END
BEGIN_
Like unto great tuskers with their enormous arms resembling the trunks, those two
warriors were keeping back each other, fought vehemently for a long time and moved speedily in a
circular arena._END

B_6_C_41_6
BEGIN_इत्येवंवादिनं वीरमभिनन्द्य च राघवः |
लक्ष्मणम् लक्ष्मि सम्पन्नम् इदम् वचनम् अब्रवीत् || ६-४१-१०_END
BEGIN_Complimenting that hero Sugreeva who was thus speaking, Rama addressed Lakshmana, who 
was endowed with auspicious marks, saying:_END

B_6_C_42_1
BEGIN_
रुद्धाम् तु नगरीम् ज़्रुत्वा जात क्रोधो निज़ा चरः |
विधानम् द्विगुणम् ज़्रुत्वा प्रासादम् सो अध्यरोहत || ६-४२-२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that the city has been attacked, Ravana exhibiting his anger, doubly made
the necessary arrangements for the war and ascended his mansion._END

B_6_C_40_17
BEGIN_
तौ परस्पर मासाद्य यत्तावन्योन्यसूदने |
मार्जाराविव भक्षार्थेऽवतस्थाते मुहुर्मुहुः || ६-४०-२२_END
BEGIN_
Approaching each other like tow wild cats fighting over a piece of meat trying to
kill each other, they stood growling again and again._END

B_6_C_41_7
BEGIN_परिगृह्य उदकम् शीतम् वनानि फलवन्ति च |
बल ओघम् सम्विभज्य इमम् व्यूह्य तिष्ठेम लक्ष्मण || ६-४१-११_END
BEGIN_"O, Lakshmana! Beside these fresh waters and trees laden with fruit, let us divide this 
multitude of troops, drawing it up in a battle array and remain alert."_END

B_6_C_42_2
BEGIN_
स ददर्ज़ आवृताम् लन्काम् सज़ैल वन काननाम् |
असम्ख्येयैर् हरि गणैः सर्वतो युद्ध कान्क्षिभिः || ६-४२-३_END
BEGIN_
That Ravana caught a glimpse of the city of Lanka, with its mountains, groves and
forests all being covered by innumerable troops of monkeys, waiting for war._END

B_6_C_40_18
BEGIN_
मण्डलानि विचित्राणि स्थानानि विविधानि च |
गोमूत्रकाणि चित्राणि गतप्रत्यागतानि च || ६-४०-२३
तीर्शीनगतान्येव तथा वक्रगतानि च |
परिमोक्षं प्रहाराणां वर्जनं परिधावनम् || ६-४०-२४
अभिद्रवणमाप्लावमवस्थानं सविग्रहम् |
परावृत्तमपावृत्तमपद्रुतमवप्लुतम् || ६-४०-२५
उपन्यस्तमपन्यस्तं युद्धमार्गविशारदौ |
तौ विचेरतुर्न्योन्यं वानरेन्द्रश्च रावणः || ६-४०-२६_END
BEGIN_
The two warriors, Sugreeva and Ravana, who were skilled in wrestling, excuted
innumerable and myraid evolutions, taking up diverse postures, moving in a curved line like an ox's
