urine, coming and going, stepping side ways, having a retrograde motion to avoid blows, turning
about abandoning the attack, dashing towards each other, leaping, standing firm and erect,
retreated, turned sideways, rushed in a bent posture, ran lifting their foot to kick the opponent
and by letting go or stealing away._END

B_6_C_41_8
BEGIN_लोक क्षय करम् भीमम् भयम् पश्याम्य् उपस्थितम् |
निबर्हणम् प्रवीराणाम् ऋक्ष वानर रक्षसाम् || ६-४१-१२_END
BEGIN_"I foresee a terrible calamity to come, boding universal destruction and death to the 
intrepid bears, monkeys and demons."_END

B_6_C_42_3
BEGIN_
स दृष्ट्वा वानरैह् सर्वाम् वसुधाम् कवली कृताम् |
कथम् क्षपयितव्याह् स्युर् इति चिन्ता परो अभवत् || ६-४२-४_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the earth made all brown with innumerable monkeys, Ravana in great perplexity
reflected: "How can they be exterminated?"_END

B_6_C_40_19
BEGIN_
एतस्मिन्नन्तरे रक्षो मायाबलमथात्मनः |
आरब्दुमुपसम् पेदे ज्ञात्वा तम् वानराधिपः || ६-४०-२७
उत्पपात तदाकाशं जितकाशी जितक्लमः |
रावणः स्थित एवात्र हरिराजेन वञ्चितः || ६-४०-२८_END
BEGIN_
Meanwhile, Ravana decided to common using his magic power. Knowing it, Sugreeva flew
into the sky triumphantly shaking off all fatigue, while Ravana, baffled by Sugreeva stood
confounded there alone._END

B_6_C_41_9
BEGIN_वाताश् च परुषम् वान्ति कम्पते च वसुम् धरा |
पर्वत अग्राणि वेपन्ते पतन्ति धरणी धराः || ६-४१-१३_END
BEGIN_"Harsh winds blow. The earth trembles. Mountain-peaks shake and the elephants bearing 
the earth trumpet."_END

B_6_C_42_4
BEGIN_
स चिन्तयित्वा सुचिरम् धैर्यम् आलम्ब्य रावणः |
राघवम् हरि यूथाम्ज़् च ददर्ज़ आयत लोचनः || ६-४२-५_END
BEGIN_
Having pondered for long, regaining his confidence and with his eyes widened by
surprise, Ravana gazed on Rama and his troops of monkeys._END

B_6_C_40_20
BEGIN_
अथ हरिवरनाथः प्राप्तसंग्रामकीर्ति |
र्निशिचरपतिमाजौ योजयित्वा श्रमेण |
गगनमतिविशालं लङ्घयित्वार्कसूम |
र्हरिगणबलमध्ये रामपार्श्वं जगाम् || ६-४०-२९_END
BEGIN_
Thus, the Lord of the monkeys, acquiring fame as a warrior, reducing Ravana to
exhaustion, ascended into the infinite sky and the offspring of the Sun then went to the side of
Rama, who as in the middle of the mokye-troops._END

B_6_C_41_10
BEGIN_मेघाः क्रव्याद सम्काशाह् परुषाह् परुष स्वनाः |
क्रूराह् क्रूरम् प्रवर्षन्ति मिश्रम् शोणित बिन्दुभिः || ६-४१-१४_END
BEGIN_"Sinister clouds prey-roar violently like carnivorous animals and let fall a rain mixed 
with drops of blood."_END

B_6_C_42_5
BEGIN_
राघवः सहसैन्येन मुदितो नाम पुप्लुवे |
लङ्काम् ददर्श गुप्ताम् वै सर्वतो राक्षसैर्वृताम् || ६-४२-६_END
BEGIN_
Full of delight, Rama passed forward (on the back of a monkey) along with his army
and saw Lanka being guarded on all sides and thronged with demons._END

B_6_C_43_0
BEGIN_
युध्यताम् तु ततस् तेषाम् वानराणाम् महात्मनाम् |
रक्षसाम् सम्बभूव अथ बल कोपह् सुदारुणः || ६-४३-१_END
BEGIN_
While highly wise monkey-troops and the demons were fighting a terrible military
ferocity arose in them._END

B_6_C_40_21
BEGIN_
स इति सवितृसूनुस्तत्र तत्कर्म कृत्वा |
पवनगतिरनीकं प्राविशत्संप्रहृष्टः |
रघुवरनृपसूनोद्वर्धयन् युद्धहर्षं |
तरुमृगगणमुख्यैः पूज्यमानो हरीन्द्रः || ६-४०-३०_END
BEGIN_
That Sugreeva, the offspring of the Sun, who was endowed with a speed of the wind,
having accomplished that feat there, increasing the military zeal of the foremost of Raghu dynasty,
honoured by the monkey leaders and delighted, rejoined the army._END

B_6_C_41_11
BEGIN_रक्त चन्दन सम्काशा संध्या परम दारुणा |
ज्वलच् च निपतत्य् एतद् आदित्याद् अग्नि मण्डलम् || ६-४१-१५_END
BEGIN_"The dusk, red as sandal, is full of horror and from the sun, this blazing mass of fire 
falls."_END

B_6_C_42_6
BEGIN_
दृष्ट्वा दाशरथिर्लङ्काम् चित्रध्वजपताकिनीम् |
जगाम मनसा सीताम् दूयमानेन चेतसा || ६-४२-७_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that city of Lanka duly decorated with banners and flags, Rama remembered
Seetha with a distressed heart._END

B_6_C_43_1
BEGIN_
ते हयैः कान्चन आपीडैर् ध्वजैश च अग्नि शैख उपमैः |
रथैश च आदित्य सम्काशाइह् कवचैश च मनो रमैः || ६-४३-२
निर्ययू राक्षस व्याघ्रा नादयन्तो दिशओ दशा |
राक्षसा भीम कर्माणो रावणस्य जय एषिणः || ६-४३-३_END
BEGIN_
Those demons, the best of ogres, doing terrific acts and eager to triumph in
Ravana's name, marched ahead on steeds with golden trappings or elephants resembling pointed
flames, or in chariots flashing like the sun and themselves wearing beautiful armours, creating
reverberant sounds in the ten regions._END

B_6_C_41_12
BEGIN_आदित्यम् अभि वाश्यन्ते जनयन्तो महद् भयम् |
दीना दीन स्वरा घोरा;अप्रशस्ता मृग द्विजाः || ६-४१-१६_END
BEGIN_"Wile beasts and birds emit frantic cries, ill at ease and ominous, inspiring great fear, 
facing the sun."_END

B_6_C_42_7
BEGIN_
अत्र सा मृगशाबाक्षी मत्कृते जनकात्मजा |
पीड्यते शोकसंतप्ता कृशा स्थण्डिलशायिनी || ६-४२-८_END
BEGIN_
He said to himself, "Here is that daughter of Janaka, whose eyes resemble those of a
fawn, tormented with grief, emacitated, with a bare ground as her bed and suffering here on my
account."_END

B_6_C_43_2
BEGIN_
वानराणाम् अपि चमूर् महती जयम् इच्चताम् |
अभ्यधावत ताम् सेनाम् रक्षसाम् काम रूपिणाम् || ६-४३-४_END
BEGIN_
The great army of monkeys, also eager to triumph, marched opposite to those troops
of demons of terrible acts._END

B_6_C_41_13
BEGIN_रजन्याम् अप्रकाशश् च सम्तापयति चन्द्रमाः |
कृष्ण रक्त अंशु पर्यन्तो यथा लोकस्य सम्क्षये || ६-४१-१७_END
BEGIN_"The moon shorn of its radiance, surrounded by black and fiery rays, burns red as at 
the time of destruction of the word and is creating an anguish in the night."_END

B_6_C_42_8
BEGIN_
निपीड्यमानां धर्मात्मा वैदेहीमनुचिन्तयन् |
क्षिप्रमाज्ञापयद्रामो वानरान् द्विषताम् वधे || ६-४२-९_END
BEGIN_
Reflecting on Seetha being troubled, the virtuous Rama speedily issued a command to
the monkeys to destroy the enemies forthwith._END

B_6_C_43_3
BEGIN_
एतस्मिन्न् अन्तरे तेषाम् अन्योन्यम् अभिधावताम् |
रक्षसाम् वानराणाम् च द्वन्द्व युद्धम् अवर्तत || ६-४३-५_END
BEGIN_
Extra-ordinary duels arose between those demons and monkeys, who ran up towards each
other._END

B_6_C_41_14
BEGIN_ह्रस्वो रूक्षो अप्रशस्तश् च परिवेषह् सुलोहितः |
आदित्य मण्डले नीलम् लक्ष्म लक्ष्मण दृश्यते || ६-४१-१८_END
BEGIN_"O, Lakshmana! In the disk of the sun, a small halo with a black mark, fiery, shorn of 
its radiance and of coppery hue is seen."_END

B_6_C_42_9
BEGIN_
एवमुक्ते तु वचसि रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा |
संघर्षमाणाः प्लवगाः सिम्हनादै रपूर्यन् || ६-४२-१०_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Rama, who was unwearied in action, the monkeys vying with one
another filled the air with their roaring resembling those of lion._END

B_6_C_43_4
BEGIN_
अन्गदेन इन्द्रजित् सार्धम् वालि पुत्रेण राक्षसः |
अयुध्यत महा तेजास् त्र्यम्बकेण यथा अन्धकः || ६-४३-६_END
BEGIN_
The demon Indrajit of immense energy fought with Angada the son of Vali, as the
demon Andhaka fought with Shiva the Lord of destruction._END

B_6_C_42_10
BEGIN_
शिखरैर्विकिरामैतां लङ्काम् मुष्टिभिरेव वा |
इति स्म दधिरे सर्वे मनांसि हरियूथपाः || ६-४२-११_END
BEGIN_
"We shall tear asunder this Lanka with mountain-peaks or with fists alone." - thus
resolved all the monkey- generals._END

B_6_C_41_15
BEGIN_दृश्यन्ते न यथावच् च नक्षत्राण्य् अभिवर्तते |
युग अन्तम् इव लोकस्य पश्य लक्ष्मण शंसति || ६-४१-१९_END
BEGIN_"O, Lakshmana! The stars are not appearing as they should be duly foretelling their intention 
to hasten a final dissolution of the world."_END

B_6_C_43_5
BEGIN_
प्रजन्घेन च सम्पातिर् नित्यम् दुर्मर्षणो रणे |
जम्बू मालिनम् आरब्धो हनूमान् अपि वानरः || ६-४३-७_END
BEGIN_
The ever indomitable Sampati fought with Prajangha and Hanuman the monkey measured
his strength with Jambumali._END

B_6_C_42_11
BEGIN_
उद्यम्य गिरिशृङ्गाणि महान्ति शिखराणि च |
तरूंश्चोत्पाट्य विविधांस्तिष्ठन्ति हरियूथपाः || ६-४२-१२_END
BEGIN_
Lifting up mountain peaks and huge rocks and plucking up various kinds of trees, the
monkey-generals stood prepared (for the attack)._END

B_6_C_41_16
BEGIN_काकाः श्येनास् तथा गृध्रा नीचैह् परिपतन्ति च |
शिवाश् च अप्य् अशिवा वाचह् प्रवदन्ति महा स्वनाः || ६-४१-२०_END
BEGIN_"Crows, eagles and vultures are whirling round at a lower level. Jackals too are howling 
inauspicious sounds."_END

B_6_C_43_6
BEGIN_
सम्गतः सुमहा क्रोधो राक्षसो रावण अनुजः |
समरे तीक्ष्ण वेगेन मित्रघ्नेन विभीषणः || ६-४३-८_END
BEGIN_
The demon with great fury, Vibhishana the younger brother of Ravana confronted with
Shatrughna possessing fiery velocity in battle._END

B_6_C_42_12
BEGIN_
प्रेक्षतो राक्षस इन्द्रस्य तान्य् अनीकानि भागज़ः |
राघव प्रिय काम अर्थम् लन्काम् आरुरुहुस् तदा || ६-४३-१३_END
BEGIN_
In order to fulfill Rama's cherished desire, those troops, forming themselves into
columns, began to scale the heights of Lanka, while Ravana stood gazing._END

B_6_C_41_17
BEGIN_शैलैः शूलैश्च खड्गैश्च विमुक्तेः कपिराक्षसैः |
भविष्यत्यावृता भूमिर्मांसशोणितकर्दमा || ६-४१-२१_END
BEGIN_"The earth, crowded with rocks, darts and daggers discharged by monkeys and demons, will 
become a slime of flesh and blood."_END

B_6_C_43_7
BEGIN_
तपनेन गजह् सार्धम् राक्षसेन महा बलः |
निकुम्भेन महा तेजा नीलो अपि समयुध्यत || ६-४३-९_END
BEGIN_
Gaja of great strength fought with a demon called Tapana and Nila too of great
energy fought with Nikumbha._END

B_6_C_41_18
BEGIN_क्षिप्रम् अद्य दुराधर्षाम् पुरीम् रावण पालिताम् |
अभियाम जवेन एव सर्वतो हरिभिर् वृताः || ६-४१-२२_END
BEGIN_"Now surrounded by the monkeys from all sides, let us make an attack on that invincible 
citadel ruled by Ravana quickly and swiftly."_END

B_6_C_43_8
BEGIN_
वानर इन्द्रस् तु सुग्रीवह् प्रघसेन समागतः |
सम्गतः समरे शरीमान् विरूप अक्षेण लक्ष्मणः || ६-४३-१०_END
BEGIN_
Sugreeva the king of monkeys confronted well with Praghasa and the glorious
Lakshmana confronted with Virupaksha in the battle._END

B_6_C_42_13
BEGIN_
ते ताम्र वक्त्रा हेम आभा राम अर्थे त्यक्त जीविताः |
लन्काम् एव अह्यवर्तन्त साल ताल ज़िला आयुधाः || ६-४२-१४_END
BEGIN_
Those monkeys, of golden hue with coppery countenance, fighting with Sala trees and
mountain-peaks, marched ahead towards the city of Lanka, ready as they were to lay down their lives
in Rama's service._END

B_6_C_42_14
BEGIN_
ते द्रुमैः पर्वत अग्रैज़् च मुष्टिभिज़् च प्लवम् गमाः |
प्रासाद अग्राणि च उच्चानि ममन्तुस् तोरणानि च || ६-४२-१५_END
BEGIN_
Those monkeys demolished innumerable defensive walls and arches with blows from
trees, mountain-tops and fists._END

B_6_C_41_19
BEGIN_इत्य् एवम् तु वदन् वीरो लक्ष्मणम् लक्ष्मण अग्रजः |
तस्माद् अवातरत् शीघ्रम् पर्वत अग्रान् महा बलः || ६-४१-२३_END
BEGIN_Thus speaking to Lakshmana, the heroic Rama of great strength climbed down from that 
mountain-peak._END

B_6_C_43_9
BEGIN_
अग्नि केतुश च दुर्धर्षो रशमि केतुश च राक्षसः |
सुप्तघ्नो यज्न कोपश च रामेण सह सम्गताः || ६-४३-११_END
BEGIN_
The invincible Agniketu, Rashmiketu, Mitraghnu and Yajnakopa confronted with
Rama._END

B_6_C_42_15
BEGIN_
पारिखाः पूरयन्ति स्म प्रसन्न सलिल आयुताः |
पांसुभिह् पर्वत अग्रैज़् च तृणैः काष्ठैज़् च वानराः || ६-४२-१६_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys filled the moats containing clear water with sands, mountain-tops,
grasses and logs of wood._END

B_6_C_41_20
BEGIN_अवतीर्य तु धर्म आत्मा तस्मात् शैलात् स राघवः |
परैः परम दुर्धर्षम् ददर्श बलम् आत्मनः || ६-४१-२४_END
BEGIN_Having descended from that mountain, Rama, whose mind was set on righeousness, held a 
review of his own army, which was verily difficult to conquer for the enemies._END

B_6_C_43_10
BEGIN_
वज्र मुष्टिश्च मैन्देन द्विविदेन अशानि प्रभः |
राक्षसाभ्याम् सुघोराभ्याम् कपि मुख्यौ समागतौ || ६-४३-१२_END
BEGIN_
Vajramushti confronted with Mainda and Ashaniprabha with Dvivida. Those principal
monkeys Mainda and Dvivida confronted with those highly terrific demons._END

B_6_C_42_16
BEGIN_
ततः सहस्र यूथाज़् च कोटि यूथाज़् च यूथपाः |
कोटी ज़त युताज़् च अन्ये लन्काम् आरुरुहुस् तदा || ६-४२-१७_END
BEGIN_
The commanders scaled the walls of Lanks, taking with them battalions of monkeys in
thousands, in crores and even hundreds of crores._END

B_6_C_43_11
BEGIN_
वीरह् प्रतपनो घोरो राक्षसो रण दुर्धरः |
समरे तीक्ष्ण वेगेन नलेन समयुध्यत || ६-४३-१३_END
BEGIN_
Pratapana, the valiant, terrific and invincible in battle fought well with Nala of
intense speed in battle._END

B_6_C_41_21
BEGIN_सम्नह्य तु ससुग्रीवह् कपि राज बलम् महत् |
कालज्नो राघवह् काले सम्युगाय अभ्यचोदयत् || ६-४१-२५_END
BEGIN_Rama, who knew the fitting moment to act, along with Sugreeva made ready the great army 
and commanded the army to advance, at the appropriate moment for the battle._END

B_6_C_44_0
BEGIN_
युध्यताम् एव तेषाम् तु तदा वानर रक्षसाम् |
रविर् अस्तम् गतो रात्रिह् प्रवृत्ता प्राण हारिणी || ६-४४-१_END
BEGIN_
While those monkeys and demons were fighting, the sun sank below the horizon,
setting in motion a night of carnage._END

B_6_C_42_17
BEGIN_
कान्चनानि प्रम्ऱ्द्नन्तस् तोरणानि प्लवम् गमाः |
कैलास ज़िखर आभानि गोपुराणि प्रमथ्य च || ६-४२-१८_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys stood tearing up the golden arches and breaking down the gates that
equaled the peak of Kailasa the mountainous abode of Shiva the Lord of Destruction._END

B_6_C_43_12
BEGIN_
धर्मस्य पुत्रो बलवान् सुषेण;इति विशरुतः |
स विद्युन् मालिना सार्धम् अयुध्यत महा कपिः || ६-४३-१४_END
BEGIN_
That great monkey called Sushena, the strong son of Yama fought with Vidyunmali._END

B_6_C_41_22
BEGIN_ततः काले महा बाहुर् बलेन महता वृतः |
प्रस्थितह् पुरतो धन्वी लन्काम् अभिमुखह् पुरीम् || ६-४१-२६_END
BEGIN_Rama, the mighty armed, together with the mighty army marched in front, wielding a bow, 
towards the city of Lanka, at the befitting moment._END

B_6_C_44_1
BEGIN_
अन्योन्यम् बद्ध वैराणाम् घोराणाम् जयम् इच्चताम् |
सम्प्रवृत्तम् निशाअ युद्धम् तदा वारण रक्षसाम् || ६-४४-२_END
BEGIN_
Then, a nocturnal was commenced between the terrific monkeys and demons, who
contracted hostility with each other, wishing for their victory._END

B_6_C_42_18
BEGIN_
आप्लवन्तः प्लवन्तज़् च गर्जन्तज़् च प्लवम् गमाः |
लन्काम् ताम् अभ्यवर्तन्त महा वारण सम्निभाः || ६-४२-१९_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys who resembled great elephants hurled themselves towards that Lanka,
springing, leaping and roaring._END

B_6_C_43_13
BEGIN_
वानराश च अपरे भीमा राक्षसैर् अपरैह् सह |
द्वन्द्वम् समीयुर् बहुधा युद्धाय बहुभिह् सह || ६-४३-१५_END
BEGIN_
Some other dreadful monkeys, having finished their fight with many demons, swiftly
got a duel with some other demons._END

B_6_C_41_23
BEGIN_तम् विभीषण सुग्रीवौ हनूमान् जाम्बवान् नलः |
ऋक्ष राजस् तथा नीलो लक्ष्मणश् च अन्ययुस् तदा || ६-४१-२७_END
BEGIN_Then, Vibhishana, Sugreeva, Hanuman, Jambavan the king of bears, Nala, Nila and Lakshmana 
accompanied that Rama._END

B_6_C_44_2
BEGIN_
राक्षसो असि इति हरयो हरिश च असि इति राक्षसाः |
अन्योन्यम् समरे जघ्नुस् तस्मिंस् तमसि दारुणे || ६-४४-३_END
BEGIN_
"You are a demon" said the monkeys "You are a monkey" said the demons and killed at
each other in battle; during that dreadful darkness._END

B_6_C_42_19
BEGIN_
जयत्य् अतिबलो रामो लक्ष्मणज़् च महा बलः |
राजा जयति सुग्रीवो राघवेण अभिपालितः || ६-४२-२०
इत्य् एवम् घोषयन्तज़् च गर्जन्तज़् च प्लवम् गमाः |
अभ्यधावन्त लन्कायाह् प्राकारम् काम रूपिणः || ६-४२-२१_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys, who were able to change their form at will, shouting - "Victory to the
mighty Rama and the valiant Lakshmana!" "Victory of Sugreeva protected by Raghava!" and roaring,
rushed towards the defensive walls of Lanka._END

B_6_C_43_14
BEGIN_
तत्र आसीत् सुमहद् युद्धम् तुमुलम् लोम हर्षणम् |
रक्षसाम् वानराणाम् च वीराणाम् जयम् इच्चताम् || ६-४३-१६_END
BEGIN_
A very great tumultuous battle, which caused hair to stand on end, continued there
between heroic demons and monkeys, who were eager to triumph._END

B_6_C_41_24
BEGIN_ततः पश्चात् सुमहती पृतना ऋक्ष वन ओकसाम् |
प्रच्चाद्य महतीम् भूमिम् अनुयाति स्म राघवम् || ६-४१-२८_END
BEGIN_Thereafter, fully covering a vast stretch of land, the great army of bears and monkeys, 
followed in the wake of Rama._END

B_6_C_44_3
BEGIN_
जहि दारय च एति इति कथम् विद्रवसि इति च |
एवम् सुतुमुलह् शाब्दस् तस्मिंस् तमसि शौशरुवे || ६-४४-४_END
BEGIN_
"Strike!" "Tear asunder!" "come near!" "Why are you running away?" - very tumultuous
sounds like this could be heard in that army._END

B_6_C_42_20
BEGIN_
वीर बाहुः सुबाहुज़् च नलज़् च वन गोचरः |
निपीड्य उपनिविष्टास् ते प्राकारम् हरि यूथपाः || ६-४२-२२
एतस्मिन्न् अन्तरे चक्रुह् स्कन्ध आवार निवेज़नम् |_END
BEGIN_
Those monkey-generals Virabahu, Subahu, Nala and Panasa, having position on them.
Meanwhile, they formed an encampment of a multitude of military divisions there._END

B_6_C_43_15
BEGIN_
हरि राक्षस देहेभ्यह् प्रसृताह् केशा शाअड्वलाः |
शारीर सम्घाट वहाह् प्रसुस्रुह् शओणित आपगाः || ६-४३-१७_END
BEGIN_
Streams of blood flowed from the bodies of monkeys and demons, with turfs of hair
and carrying bodies in the stream, like timber._END

B_6_C_41_25
BEGIN_शैल शृन्गाणि शतशह् प्रवृद्धांश् च मही रुहाम् |
जगृहुह् कुन्जर प्रख्या वानराह् पर वारणाः || ६-४१-२९_END
BEGIN_Monkeys, the annihilator of enemies, resembling elephants, took hold of mountain-peaks 
and hundreds of well-grown huge trees._END

B_6_C_44_4
BEGIN_
कालाह् कान्चन सम्नाहास् तस्मिंस् तमसि राक्षसाः |
सम्प्रादृशयन्त शाइल इन्द्रा दीप्त ओषधि वना;इव || ६-४४-५_END
BEGIN_
The black demons in that darkness, wearing golden mails, were appearing as mountains
with groves of medicinal plants emitting their light._END

B_6_C_42_21
BEGIN_
पूर्व द्वारम् तु कुमुदह् कोटिभिर् दज़भिर् वृतः || ६-४२-२३
आवृत्य बलवांस् तस्थौ हरिभिर् जित काज़िभिः |_END
BEGIN_
The mighty Kumuda, surrounded by a crore of monkeys, who behaved like conquerors,
stood besieging the eastern gate (while remaining stationed in north-east)._END

B_6_C_43_16
BEGIN_
आजघान इन्द्रजित् क्रुद्धो वज्रेण इव शात क्रतुः |
अन्गदम् गदया वीरम् शात्रु सैन्य विदारणम् || ६-४३-१८_END
BEGIN_
The enraged Indrajit struck the valiant Angada (who can tear asunder the enemy
forces) with a mace, like Indra the Lord of celestials with his thunder-bolt._END

B_6_C_41_26
BEGIN_तौ त्व् अदीर्घेण कालेन भ्रातरौ राम लक्ष्मणौ |
रावणस्य पुरीम् लन्काम् आसेदतुर् अरिम् दमौ || ६-४१-३०_END
BEGIN_Those two brothers Rama and Lakshmana, the destroyers of their adversaries, reached the 
city of Lanka ruled by Ravana, in not a long time._END

B_6_C_44_5
BEGIN_
तस्मिंस् तमसि दुष्पारे राक्षसाह् क्रोध मूर्चिताः |
परिपेतुर् महा वेगा भक्षयन्तह् प्लवम् गमान् || ६-४४-६_END
BEGIN_
In that darkness, which was difficult to be overcome, the demons agitated as they
were with anger, attacked with great speed, duly destroying the monkeys._END

B_6_C_42_22
BEGIN_
सहायार्थे तु तस्येव निविष्टः प्रसभो हरिः || ६-४२-२४
पनसश्च महाबाहुर्वानरै रभिसम्वृतः |_END
BEGIN_
Surrounded by other monkeys, a monkey called Prasabha and the mighty armed Panasa
too up their position, in order to assist Kumuda himself._END

B_6_C_43_17
BEGIN_
तस्य कान्चन चित्र अन्गम् रथम् साशवम् ससारथिम् |
जघान समरे शरीमान् अन्गदो वेगवान् कपिः || १९_END
BEGIN_
The swift monkey, Angada struck his chariot, having a variegated body of gold, along
with horses and the charioteer in the battle._END

B_6_C_41_27
BEGIN_पताका मालिनीम् रम्याम् उद्यान वन शोभिताम् |
चित्र वप्राम् सुदुष्प्रापाम् उच्च प्राकार तोरणाम् || ६-४१-३१
ताम् सुरैर् अपि दुर्धर्षाम् राम वाक्य प्रचोदिताः |
यथा निदेशम् सम्पीड्य न्यविशन्त वन ओकसः || ६-४१-३२_END
BEGIN_The monkeys, encouraged by the sound of Rama's voice and obedient to his command, halted 
before the city of Lanka, garlanded with banners, beautiful and splendid with pleasure-gardens, having 
an unusual rampart which is inaccessible with its elevated arched door-ways and invincible even by the 
celestials._END

B_6_C_44_6
BEGIN_
ते हयान् कान्चन आपीडन् ध्वजांश च अग्नि शैखा उपमान् |
आप्लुत्य दशानैस् तीक्ष्णैर् भीम कोपा व्यदारयन् || ६-४४-७
वानरा बलिनो युद्धेऽक्षोभयन् राक्षसीं चमूम् |_END
BEGIN_
Those strong monkeys with a terrific rage leapt forward and tore asunder by their
sharp teeth, the steeds with gold ornaments on their head, the serpentine banners and frightened
the demoniac army._END

B_6_C_42_23
BEGIN_
दक्षिण द्वारम् आगम्य वीरह् ज़त बलिह् कपिः || ६-४२-२५
आवृत्य बलवांस् तस्थौ विम्ज़त्या कोटिभिर् वृतः |_END
BEGIN_
The strong and valiant monkey, Shatabali accompanied by twenty crores of monkeys,
approached the southern gate (while remaining stationed in south-east) and stood there, to obstruct
the exit._END

B_6_C_43_18
BEGIN_
सम्पातिस् तु त्रिभिर् बाणैह् प्रजन्घेन समाहतः |
निजघान अशव कर्णेन प्रजन्घम् रण मूर्धनि || ६-४३-२०_END
BEGIN_
Sampati, who was struck by Prajangha with three arrows, killed Prajangha by an
Ashvakarna tree, at the zenith of the combat._END

B_6_C_41_28
BEGIN_लन्कायास् तु उत्तर द्वारम् शैल शृन्गम् इव उन्नतम् |
रामः सह अनुजो धन्वी जुगोप च रुरोध च || ६-४१-३३
लन्काम् उपनिविष्टश् च रामो दशरथ आत्मजः |
लक्ष्मण अनुचरो वीरह् पुरीम् रावण पालिताम् || ६-४१-३४
उत्तर द्वारम् आसाद्य यत्र तिष्ठति रावणः |
न अन्यो रामाद्द् हि तद् द्वारम् समर्थह् परिरक्षितुम् || ६-४१-३५
रावण अधिष्ठितम् भीमम् वरुणेन इव सागरम् |
सायुधौ राक्षसैर् भीमैर् अभिगुप्तम् समन्ततः || ६-४१-३६
लघूनाम् त्रास जननम् पातालम् इव दानवैः |_END
BEGIN_Reaching the city of Lanka ruled by Ravana, the heroic Rama the son of Dasaratha accompanied 
by Lakshmana, halted near the northern gate, where Ravana stayed. Who else but Rama is capable of protecting 
the army besieging that gate, regulated by Ravana, as an ocean, regulated by Varuna, guarded by awful 
demons on all sides and creating fear to the weak as a subterranean region is guarded by demons?_END

B_6_C_44_7
BEGIN_
कुन्जरान् कुन्जर आरोहान् पताका ध्वजिनो रथान् || ६-४४-८
चकर्षुश च ददंशौश च दशानैह् क्रोध मूर्चिताः |_END
BEGIN_
Agitated with anger, the monkeys dragged the elephants and those mounted on them and
also the chariots with their banners and flag-staffs duly breaking them to pieces with their
teeth._END

B_6_C_42_24
BEGIN_
सुषेणह् पज़्चिम द्वारम् गतस् तारा पिता हरिः || ६-४२-२६
आवृत्य बलवांस् तस्थौ षष्टि कोटिभिर् आवृतः |_END
BEGIN_
The mighty monkey named Sushena, the father of Tara (Vali's wife), going to the
western gate (while remaining stationed in the south-west) surrounded by crores and croes of
monkeys, stood besieging that gate._END

B_6_C_43_19
BEGIN_
जम्बू माली रथस्थस् तु रथ शाक्त्या महा बलः |
बिभेद समरे क्रुद्धो हनूमन्तम् स्तन अन्तरे || ६-४३-२१_END
BEGIN_
Jambumali, standing in his chariot, full of strength and fury banged on Hanuman's
breast, with a javelin kept in his chariot, on the field of battle._END

B_6_C_41_29
BEGIN_विन्यस्तानि च योधानाम् बहूनि विविधानि च |
ददर्श आयुध जालानि तथैव कवचानि च || ६-४१-३७_END
BEGIN_Rama saw various types and multitude of weapons and shields kept there by the warriors._END

B_6_C_44_8
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणश च अपि रामश च शारैर् आशैइ विष उमपैः || ६-४४-९
दृशय अदृशयानि रक्षांसि प्रवराणि निजघ्नतुः |_END
BEGIN_
Rama and Lakshmana killed the foremost of the demons, both those who were visible
and those who were invisible, with their arrows resembling venomous snakes._END

B_6_C_42_25
BEGIN_
उत्तर द्वारम् आसाद्य रामह् सौमित्रिणा सह || ६-४२-२७
आवृत्य बलवांस् तस्थौ सुग्रीवज़् च हरि ईज़्वरः |_END
BEGIN_
Rama along with Lakshmana and Sugreeva the mighty lord of the monkeys, seeking the
northern gate (while remaining stationed in the north west) stood besieging that gate._END

B_6_C_43_20
BEGIN_
तस्य तम् रथम् आस्थाय हनूमान् मारुत आत्मजः |
प्रममाथ तलेन आशौ सह तेन एव रक्षसा || ६-४३-२२_END
BEGIN_
Hanuman, the son of the wind-god, ascended his chariot and soon overthrew it
together with the demon, with the palm of his hand._END

B_6_C_41_30
BEGIN_पूर्वम् तु द्वारम् आसाद्य नीलो हरि चमू पतिः |
अतिष्ठत् सह मैन्देन द्विविदेन च वीर्यवान् || ६-४१-३८_END
BEGIN_Nila, the valiant army-chief of monkeys together with Mainda and Dvivida reached and 
halted before the Eastern gate._END

B_6_C_44_9
BEGIN_
तुरम्ग खुर विध्वस्तम् रथ नेमि समुद्धतम् || ६-४४-१०
रुरोध कर्ण नेत्राणिण्युध्यताम् धरणी रजः |_END
BEGIN_
The dust rising from the hooves of horses and the wheels of the chariots blocked the
ears and the eyes of the combatants._END

B_6_C_43_21
BEGIN_
भिन्न गात्रः शारैस् तीक्ष्णैह् क्षिप्र हस्तेन रक्षसा |
प्रजघान अद्रि शऋन्गेण तपनम् मुष्टिना गजः || ६-४३-२३_END
BEGIN_
That terrific Pratapana, while roaring, ran towards Nala. Nala suddenly scratched
out Pratapana's eyes._END

B_6_C_42_26
BEGIN_
ऋष्काणाम् भीम वेगानाम् धूम्रह् ज़त्रु निबर्हणः || ६-४२-२८
वृतह् कोट्या महा वीर्यस् तस्थौ रामस्य पार्ज़्वतः |_END
BEGIN_
Accompanied by a crore of bears having terrific rage, Dhumra (brother of Jambavan,
the king of bears) of great prowess and the annihilator of enemies, took up his position by the
side of Rama._END

B_6_C_41_31
BEGIN_अन्गदो दक्षिण द्वारम् जग्राह सुमहा बलः |
ऱ्षभेण गव अक्षेण गजेन गवयेन च || ६-४१-३९_END
BEGIN_Angada of very mighty prowess, together with Rishhabha, Gavaksha, Gaja and Gavaya took 
charge of the Southern gate._END

B_6_C_44_10
BEGIN_
वर्तमाने तथा घोरे सम्ग्रामे लोम हर्षणे || ६-४४-११
रुधिर उदा महा वेगा नद्यस् तत्र प्रसुस्रुवुः |_END
BEGIN_
While that terrible battle was taking place, causing the hair to bristle; very
terrible rivers with streams of blood were flowing there._END

B_6_C_43_22
BEGIN_
ग्रसन्तम् इव सैन्यानि प्रघसम् वानर अधिपः |
सुग्रीवः सप्त पर्णेन निर्बिभेद जघान च || ६-४३-२४_END
BEGIN_
Pierced in the limbs by sharp arrows by Praghasa the swift-handed demon, Sugreeva
the Lord of demons immediately killed Praghasa (who was appearing to swallow the monkey-troops)
with a Saptaparna tree._END

B_6_C_42_27
BEGIN_
सम्नद्धस् तु महा वीर्यो गदा पाणिर् विभीषणः || ६-४२-२९
वृतो यस् तैस् तु सचिवैस् तस्थौ तत्र महा बलः |_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana of great energy with mace in hand, clad in defensive armour and
accompanied by his watchful ministers, took his position where the mighty Rama is stationed._END

B_6_C_41_32
BEGIN_हनूमान् पश्चिम द्वारम् ररक्ष बलवान् कपिः |
प्रमाथि प्रघसाभ्याम् च वीरैर् अन्यैश् च सम्गतः || ६-४१-४०_END
BEGIN_The strong monkey Hanuman together with Prajangha, Tarasa and other warriors, guarded 
the western gate._END

B_6_C_44_11
BEGIN_
ततो भेरी मृदन्गानाम् पणवानाम् च निस्वनः || ६-४४-१२
शान्ख वेणु स्वन उन्मिशरह् सम्बभूव अद्भुत उपमः |_END
BEGIN_
There arose a marvelous sound of kettle drums and tabors, mixed with the sounds of
counches, fellies of chariot-wheels and drums._END

B_6_C_43_23
BEGIN_
प्रपीड्य शार वर्षेण राक्षसम् भीम दर्शानम् |
निजघान विरूप अक्षम् शारेण एकेन लक्ष्मणः || ६-४३-२५_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana with a terrific look, having tormented Virupaksha the demon with a shower
of arrows, finally killed him with an arrow._END

B_6_C_42_28
BEGIN_
गजो गव अक्षो गवयह् ज़रभो गन्ध मादनः || ६-४२-३०
समन्तात् परिघावन्तो ररक्षुर् हरि वाहिनीम् |_END
BEGIN_
Gavaksha, Gavaya, Sharabha and Gandhamadana, galloping on all sides, defended the
army of monkeys._END

B_6_C_41_33
BEGIN_मध्यमे च स्वयम् गुल्मे सुग्रीवह् समतिष्ठत |
सह सर्वैर् हरि श्रेष्ठैह् सुपर्ण श्वसन उपमैः || ६-४१-४१_END
BEGIN_Sugreeva, along with all the chiefs of monkeys equal to the strength of Garuda (the eagle 
and the vehicle of Vishnu) as well as Vayu the god of the wind, was stationed himself in the middle 
of the fort._END

B_6_C_44_12
BEGIN_
हयानाम् स्तनमानानाम् राक्षसानाम् च निस्वनः || ६-४४-१३
शस्त्राणाम् वानराणाम् च सम्बभूव अतिदारुणः |_END
BEGIN_
There appeared a terrific sound resonated by horses, demons and monkeys being
wounded._END

B_6_C_43_24
BEGIN_
अग्नि केतुश च दुर्धर्षो रशमि केतुश च राक्षसः |
सुप्तिघ्नो यज्न कोपश च रामम् निर्बिभिदुह् शारैः || ६-४३-२६_END
BEGIN_
The invincible Agniketu, Rashmiketu, Mitrughna and Yajnakopa wounded Rama by
arrows._END

B_6_C_42_29
BEGIN_
ततः कोप परीत आत्मा रावणो राक्षस ईज़्वरः || ६-४२-३१
निर्याणम् सर्व सैन्यानाम् द्रुतम् आज्नापयत् तदा |_END
BEGIN_
Ravana the lord of demons with his mind filled in anger, then commanded for the
decamping of the entire army immediately._END

B_6_C_41_34
BEGIN_वानराणाम् तु षट् त्रिंशत् कोट्यह् प्रख्यात यूथपाः || ६-४१-४२
निपीड्य उपनिविष्टाश् च सुग्रीवो यत्र वानरः |_END
BEGIN_Thirty six crores of monkeys, highly renowned generals stood besiezed, where the monkey 
Sugreeva was there, having exerted pressure on the demons occupying that post._END

B_6_C_45_0
BEGIN_स तस्य गतिम् अन्विच्चन् राज पुत्रह् प्रतापवान् |
दिदेश अतिबलो रामो दश वानर यूथपान् || ६-४५-१_END
BEGIN_That very strong and powerful Rama the son of Dasaratha ordered ten monkey-generals to 
search for the whereabouts of Indrajit._END

B_6_C_44_13
BEGIN_
हतैर्वानरमुख्येश्च शक्तिशूलपरश्वधैः || ६-४४-१४
निहतैः पर्वताकारै राक्षसैः कामरूपिभिः |
शस्त्र पुष्प उपहारा च तत्र आसीद् युद्ध मेदिनी || ६-४४-१५
दुर्ज्नेया दुर्निवेशाअ च शओणित आस्रव कर्दमा |_END
BEGIN_
The assassinated great monkeys, spears, maces, axes and the slaughtered demons, who
were able to change their form at will and with their bodies appearing like mountains were lying
there on the battle-field. And those weapons appeared to be offered up as a profusion of flowers by
the earth, which became hidden and rendered impassable by the slime formed out of streams of
blood._END

B_6_C_43_25
BEGIN_
तेषाम् चतुर्णाम् रामस् तु शैरांसि समरे शारैः |
क्रुद्धश चतुर्भिश चिच्चेद घोरैर् अग्नि शैख उपमैः || ६-४३-२७_END
BEGIN_
The enraged Rama on his part chopped the hands of those four demons in the battle by
his four terrific arrows having fire-like points._END

B_6_C_42_30
BEGIN_
एतच्च्रुत्वा तदा वाक्यं रावणस्य मुखेरितम् || ६-४२-३२
सहसा भीमनिर्घोषमुद्घुष्टं रजनीचरैः |_END
BEGIN_
At this command coming from Ravana lips, a tremendous clamour arose among the
demons._END

B_6_C_41_35
BEGIN_शासनेन तु रामस्य लक्ष्मणह् सविभीषणः || ६-४१-४३
द्वारे द्वारे हरीणाम् तु कोटिम् कोटिम् न्यवेशयत् |_END
BEGIN_Meanwhile, under Rama's command, Lakshmana along with Vibhishana distributed a crore 
each of his monkeys at each gate._END

B_6_C_45_1
BEGIN_द्वौ सुषेणस्य दायादौ नीलम् च प्लवग ऋषभम् |
अन्गदम् वालि पुत्रम् च शरभम् च तरस्विनम् || ६-४५-२
द्विनतम् जाम्बवन्तम् च सानुप्रस्थम् महा बलम् |
ऋषभम् च ऋषभ स्कन्धम् आदिदेश परम् तपः || ६-४५-३_END
BEGIN_Rama the scourger of his enemies ordered both the sons of Sushena, Nila the chief of 
monkeys, Angada the son of Vali, the stron Sharabha, Dvivida, Hanuman, the very strong Sanuprastha, 
Rishabha and Rishabha skandha._END

B_6_C_44_14
BEGIN_
सा बभूव निशाअ घोरा हरि राक्षस हारिणी || ६-४४-१६
काल रात्री इव भूतानाम् सर्वेषाम् दुरतिक्रमा |_END
BEGIN_
That fatal night became as calamitous to the monkeys and demons, as a night of
dissolution, which is difficult to be overcome by all beings._END

B_6_C_43_26
BEGIN_
वज्र मुष्टिस् तु मैन्देन मुष्टिना निहतो रणे |
पपात सरथह् साशवह् पुराट्ट इव भू तले || ६-४३-२८_END
BEGIN_
Struck with a fist by Mainda in the battle, Vajramushti along with his chariot fell
to the ground like a watch-tower on a city-wall._END

B_6_C_42_31
BEGIN_
ततः प्रबोधिता भेर्यश्चन्द्रपाण्डुरपुष्कराः || ६-४२-३३
हेमकोणैरभिहता राक्षसानां समन्ततः |_END
BEGIN_
By beating with sticks of gold, the demons stirred up on every side, kettle drums
whose discs were white as the moon._END

B_6_C_41_36
BEGIN_पश्चिमेन तु रामस्य सुग्रीवह् सह जाम्बवान् || ६-४१-४४
अदूरान् मध्यमे गुल्मे तस्थौ बहु बल अनुगः |_END
BEGIN_Behind Rama and not far from him, Sushena together with Jambavan, followed by a multitude 
of forces, stood at the intermediate post._END

B_6_C_45_2
BEGIN_ते सम्प्रहृष्टा हरयो भीमान् उद्यम्य पादपान् |
आकाशम् विविशुह् सर्वे मार्गामाणा दिशो दश || ६-४५-४_END
BEGIN_All those monkeys, thrilled with enthusiasm, flung into the air brandishing huge trunks 
of trees in order to explore the ten regions._END

B_6_C_44_15
BEGIN_
ततस् ते राक्षसास् तत्र तस्मिंस् तमसि दारुणे || ६-४४-१७
रामम् एव अभ्यधावन्त सम्हृष्टा शार वृष्टिभिः |_END
BEGIN_
In that very terrible darkness, those demons thrilling with rapture attacked Rama
with showers of arrows._END

B_6_C_43_27
BEGIN_
वज्र अशानि सम स्पर्शओ द्विविदो अप्य् अशानि प्रभम् |
जघान गिरि शऋन्गेण मिषताम् सर्व रक्षसाम् || ६-४३-२९_END
BEGIN_
Nikumbha chopped Nila, having a radiance of a mass of collyrium in battle, by his
sharp arrows, like a cloud by the rays of the sun._END

B_6_C_42_32
BEGIN_
विनेदुश्च महाघोषाः शङ्खः शतसहस्रशः || ६-४२-३४
राक्षसानां सुघोराणां मुखमारुतपूरिताः |_END
BEGIN_
Hundreds and thousands of sonorous couches blared forth, blown with their cheeks
extended to the full, by the most ghastly demons._END

B_6_C_41_37
BEGIN_ते तु वानर शार्दूलाह् शार्दूला;इव दम्ष्ट्रिणः || ६-४१-४५
गृहीत्वा द्रुम शैल अग्रान् हृष्टा युद्धाय तस्थिरे |_END
BEGIN_Those lions among the monkeys, possessing the teeth of tigers, taking hold of trees and 
rocks, waited delightedly for the signal to fight._END

B_6_C_45_3
BEGIN_तेषाम् वेगवताम् वेगम् इषुभिर् वेगवत्तरैः |
अस्त्रवित् परम अस्त्रेण वारयाम् आस रावणिः || ६-४५-५_END
BEGIN_Indrajit, the son of Ravana, who was skilled in the use of magic weapons, by means of 
his arrows with great speed, released from his most excellent of bows, arrested the impetuous outbreak 
of the monkeys._END

B_6_C_44_16
BEGIN_
तेषाम् आपतताम् शाब्दह् क्रुद्धानाम् अभिगर्जताम् || ६-४४-१८
उद्वर्त;इव सप्तानाम् समुद्राणाम् अभूत् स्वनः |_END
BEGIN_
Yelling in fury, the sound of those demons approaching in order to assault Rama was
like the noise of the oceans at the time of destruction of all the creatures._END

B_6_C_43_28
BEGIN_
द्विविदम् वानर इन्द्रम् तु द्रुम योधिनम् आहवे |
शारैर् अशानि सम्काशाइह् स विव्याध अशानि प्रभः || ६-४३-३०_END
BEGIN_
Then, Nikumbha the swift-handed demon again wounded Nila by a hundred arrows in the
battle and laughed continuously._END

B_6_C_42_33
BEGIN_
ते बभुः शुभनीलाङ्गाः सशङ्खा रजनीचराः || ६-४२-३५
विध्युन्मण्डलसंनद्धाः सबलाका इवाम्बुदाः |_END
BEGIN_
With their handsome limbs equipped with couches, those rangers of night shone like
clouds bordered with lightning accompanied by rows of cranes._END

B_6_C_45_4
BEGIN_तम् भीम वेगा हरयो नाराचैह् क्षत विक्षताः |
अन्ध कारे न ददृशुर् मेघैह् सूर्यम् इव आवृतम् || ६-४५-६_END
BEGIN_Those monkeys of terrific bound, whose bodes were cruelly pierced by those shafts, were 
unable to see Indrajit in the darkness, as the sun is obscured when veiled in clouds._END

B_6_C_41_38
BEGIN_सर्वे विकृत लान्गूलाह् सर्वे दम्ष्ट्रा नख आयुधाः || ६-४१-४६
सर्वे विकृत चित्र अन्गाह् सर्वे च विकृत आननाः |_END
BEGIN_All of them were lashing their tails feverishly, using their jaws and nails as weapons, 
trembling in every limb and had their faces set grimly._END

B_6_C_44_17
BEGIN_
तेषाम् रामह् शारैह् षड्भिह् षड् जघान निशाअ चरान् || ६-४४-१९
निमेष अन्तर मात्रेण शैतैर् अग्नि शैख उपमैः |_END
BEGIN_
Within a twinkling of an eye, Rama with six sharp arrows resembling tongues of
flame, struck down six of those demons._END

B_6_C_43_29
BEGIN_
स शारैर् अतिविद्ध अन्गो द्विविदह् क्रोध मूर्चितः |
सालेन सरथम् साशवम् निजघान अशानि प्रभम् || ६-४३-३१_END
BEGIN_
Nila chopped the head of the charioteer of Nikumbha by the wheel of the same chariot
in that fight, as Vishnu the Lord of preservation (by his Chakra, a circular missile weapon) in a
battle._END

B_6_C_42_34
BEGIN_
निष्पतन्ति ततः सैन्या हृष्टा रावण चोदिताः || ६-४२-३६
समये पूर्यमाणस्य वेगा;इव महा उदधेः |_END
BEGIN_
The battalions rushed forth under Ravana's instructions like the rushing forth of
the ocean, which is swollen by the clouds, at the time of universal dissolution._END

B_6_C_41_39
BEGIN_दश नाग बलाह् केचित् केचिद् दश गुण उत्तराः || ६-४१-४७
केचिन् नाग सहस्रस्य बभूवुस् तुल्य विक्रमाः |_END
BEGIN_Some were having the strength of ten elephants, some a ten times of that and some were 
equal to the strength of a thousand elephants._END

B_6_C_44_18
BEGIN_
यज्न शात्रुश च दुर्धर्षो महा पार्शव महा उदरौ || ६-४४-२०
वज्र दम्ष्ट्रो महा कायस् तौ च उभौ शौक सारणौ |
ते तु रामेण बाण ओघह् सर्व मर्मसु ताडिताः || ६-४४-२१
युद्धाद् अपसृतास् तत्र सावशएष आयुषो अभवन् |_END
BEGIN_
The unconquerable Yagnashatru, Mahaparashva, Mahodara, the giant bodied
Vajradamshtra, both Shuka and Sarana - all those six having been beaten by Rama on their vital
organs with a flood of his arrows, retreated from the battle and somehow survived for the rest of
their life._END

B_6_C_45_5
BEGIN_राम लक्ष्मणयोर् एव सर्व मर्म भिदह् शरान् |
भृशम् आवेशयाम् आस रावणिह् समितिम् जयः || ६-४५-७_END
BEGIN_Indrajit, the victorious in battle, transfixed Rama and Lakshmana with those arrows that 
lacerated their flesh in great measure._END

B_6_C_43_30
BEGIN_
निकुम्भस् तु रणे नीलम् नील अन्जन चय प्रभम् |
निर्बिभेद शारैस् तीक्ष्णैह् करैर् मेघम् इव अंशौमान् || ६-४३-३२_END
BEGIN_
Even Dvivida, whose impact was like a flash of lightening of a thunder bolt, struck
Ashaniprabha with a rock before the eyes of all the demons._END

B_6_C_42_35
BEGIN_
ततो वानरसैन्येन मुक्तो नादः समन्ततः || ६-४२-३७
मलयः पूरितो येन ससानुप्रस्थकन्दरः |_END
BEGIN_
Then, from every side a clamour, arose from the army of monkeys, which filled Malaya
mountain with its ridges, plains and caves._END

B_6_C_46_0
BEGIN_
ततो द्याम् पृथिवीम् चैव वीक्षमाणा वन ओकसः |
ददृशुः सम्ततौ बाणैर् भ्रातरौ राम लक्ष्मणौ || ६-४६-१_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, surveying the earth and the sky, the monkeys beheld the brothers Rama
and Lakshmana, covered with arrows._END

B_6_C_41_40
BEGIN_सन्ति च ओघा बलाह् केचित् केचित् शत गुण उत्तराः || ६-४१-४८
अप्रमेय बलाश् च अन्ये तत्र आसन् हरि यूथपाः |_END
BEGIN_Some were having the strength of an ogha* of elephants. Some were endowed with a strength 
of ten times to that. some others there were chiefs of monkeys, having an immeasurable strength._END

B_6_C_44_19
BEGIN_
ततः कान्चन चित्र अन्गैह् शारैर् अग्नि शैख उपमैः |
दिशाश चकार विमलाह् प्रदिशाश च महा बलः || ६-४४-२२_END
BEGIN_
Rama the great warrior, merely within an instant, made the quarters and the
intermediate quarters, clear of all the demons, by his arrows resembling flames of fire._END

B_6_C_45_6
BEGIN_निरन्तर शरीरौ तु भ्रातरौ राम लक्ष्मणौ |
क्रुद्धेन इन्द्रजोता वीरौ पन्नगैह् शरताम् गतैः || ६-४५-८_END
BEGIN_The bodies of both those warriors, Rama and Lakshmana were densely transfixed with serpentine 
arrows by the enraged Indrajit._END

B_6_C_43_31
BEGIN_
पुनः शार शातेन अथ क्षिप्र हस्तो निशाअ चरः |
बिभेद समरे नीलम् निकुम्भह् प्रजहास च || ६-४३-३३_END
BEGIN_
That Ashaniprabha wounded Dvivida the monkey leader by his thunder bolt-like arrows,
while Dvivida was fighting with trees in the battle._END

B_6_C_42_36
BEGIN_
शङ्खदुन्दुभिनिर्घोषः सिम्हनादस्तरस्विनाम् || ६-४२-३८
पृथिवीं चान्तरिक्षम् च सागरं चाभ्यनादयत् |_END
BEGIN_
The sound of couches and drums made by the demons and the leouine roars of those
monkey- warriors re-echoed over the earth, sky and sea._END

B_6_C_46_1
BEGIN_
वृष्ट्वा इव उपरते देवे कृत कर्मणि राक्षसे |
आजगाम अथ तम् देशम् ससुग्रीवो विभीषणः || ६-४६-२_END
BEGIN_
Then, along with Sugreeva, Vibhishana came to that place, after Indrajit finished
his work and retired; even as Indra* would, after raining._END

B_6_C_41_41
BEGIN_अद्भुतश् च विचित्रश् च तेषाम् आसीत् समागमः || ६-४१-४९
तत्र वानर सैन्यानाम् शलभानाम् इव उद्गमः |_END
BEGIN_Marvellous and astonishing was the gathering of those troops of monkeys there, like a 
swarm of locusts._END

B_6_C_44_20
BEGIN_
ये त्वन्ये राक्षसा वीरा रामस्य अभिमुखे स्थिताः || ६-४४-२३
ते अपि नष्टाह् समासाद्य पतम्गा;इव पावकम् |_END
BEGIN_
The other valiant demons, who were standing with their face turning towards Rama,
also perished like moths, having encountered the same fire._END

B_6_C_45_7
BEGIN_तयोह् क्षतज मार्गेण सुस्राव रुधिरम् बहु |
ताव् उभौ च प्रकाशेते पुष्पिताव् इव किंशुकौ || ६-४५-९_END
BEGIN_Blood flowed from the wound-marks of both Rama and Lakshmana and both of them shone like 
Kimshuka trees in flowring._END

B_6_C_43_32
BEGIN_
तस्य एव रथ चक्रेण नीलो विष्णुर् इव आहवे |
शैरश चिच्चेद समरे निकुम्भस्य च सारथेः || ६-४३-३४_END
BEGIN_
With his limbs struck by arrows, that Dvivida agitated as he was by anger, struck
with a Sala tree, Ashaniprabha, his chariot and the horses._END

B_6_C_42_37
BEGIN_
गजानां बृंहितैः सार्धं हयानां हेषितैरपि || ६-४२-३९
रथानां नेमिनिर्घोषै रक्षसाम् पदनिःस्वनैः |_END
BEGIN_
With the trumpeting of elephants, the neighing of the horses, the clattering of the
chariot-wheels and the sounds of the foot-steps, the sound of the couches reechoed over the earth,
sky and sea._END

B_6_C_46_2
BEGIN_
नील द्विविद मैन्दाश् च सुषेण सुमुख अन्गदाः |
तूर्णम् हनुमता सार्धम् अन्वशोचन्त राघवौ || ६-४६-३_END
BEGIN_
Nila, Dvivida, Mainda, Sushena, kumuda, Angada along with Hanuman forthwith began to
grieve for Rama and Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_41_42
BEGIN_पतिपूर्णम् इव आकाशम् संचन्ना इव च मेदिनी || ६-४१-५०
लन्काम् उपनिविष्टैश् च सम्पतद्भिश् च वानरैः |_END
BEGIN_By the monkeys who reached Lanka and by those stationed already beneath its walls, the 
air and earth seem to be completely filled._END

B_6_C_44_21
BEGIN_
सुवर्ण पुन्खैर् विशैखैह् सम्पतद्भिह् सहस्रशाः || ६-४४-२४
बभूव रजनी चित्रा ख द्योतैर् इव शाअरदी |_END
BEGIN_
That night, with the golden shafts of arrows, flying on all sides, appeared
bright-coloured, like an autumnal night with its fire-flies on all sides._END

B_6_C_45_8
BEGIN_ततः पर्यन्त रक्त अक्षो भिन्न अन्जन चय उपमः |
रावणिर् भ्रातरौ वाक्यम् अन्तर्धान गतो अब्रवीत् || ६-४५-१०_END
BEGIN_At that instant, though still invisible, Indrajit, Ravana's son, with his inflamed eyes, 
which resembled a mass of collyrium mixed with oil, spoke the following words to those two brothers._END

B_6_C_43_33
BEGIN_
विद्युन् माली रथस्थस् तु शारैह् कान्चन भूषणैः |
सुषेणम् ताडयाम् आस ननाद च मुहुर् मुहुः || ६-४३-३५_END
BEGIN_
Vidyunmali, seated in a chariot, struck Sushena repeatedly with arrows adorned with
gold and made a roaring sound._END

B_6_C_42_38
BEGIN_
एतस्मिन्न् अन्तरे घोरह् सम्ग्रामह् समपद्यत || ६-४२-४०
रक्षसाम् वानराणाम् च यथा देव असुरे पुरा |_END
BEGIN_
In the meantime, a terrible struggle ensued between the demons and the monkeys, as
in the former times between celestials and demons._END

B_6_C_46_3
BEGIN_
अचेष्टौ मन्द निह्श्वासौ शोणित ओघ परिप्लुतौ |
शर जाल आचितौ स्तब्धौ शयानौ शर तल्पयोः || ६-४६-४
निह्श्वसन्तौ यथा सर्पौ निश्चेष्टौ मन्द विक्रमौ |
रुधिर स्राव दिग्ध अन्गौ तापनीयाव् इव ध्वजौ || ६-४६-५
तौ वीर शयने वीरौ शयानौ मन्द चेष्टितौ |
यूथपैस् तैह् परिवृतौ बाष्प व्याकुल लोचनैः || ६-४६-६
राघवौ पतितौ दृष्ट्वा शर जाल समावृतौ |
बभूवुर् व्यथिताह् सर्वे वानराह् सविभीषणाः || ६-४६-७_END
BEGIN_
Breathing but faintly, bathed in blood; riddled with innumerable arrows, motionless
and lying inactive, they lay stretched on a bed of arrows, sighing like serpants, helpless, having
little prowess, their limbs smeared with a stream of blood, resembling two golden standards, and
lying on heroes' couch, those warriors with tardy movement of their limbs, were surrounded by their
monkey-leaders, whose eyes were suffused with tears. Seeing the two Raghavas, pierced by a
multitude of arrows, all the monkeys along with Vibhishana became perturbed._END

B_6_C_41_43
BEGIN_शतम् शत सहस्राणाम् पृथग् ऋक्ष वन ओकसाम् || ६-४१-५१
लन्का द्वाराण्य् उपाजग्मुर् अन्ये योद्धुम् समन्ततः |_END
BEGIN_A hundred divisions of one lakh each of bears and monkeys poured towards the gates of 
Lanka, while others proceeded to fight on every side._END

B_6_C_44_22
BEGIN_
राक्षसानाम् च निनदैर् हरीणाम् च अपि गर्जितैः || ६-४४-२५
सा बभूव निशाअ घोरा भूयो घोरतरा तदा |_END
BEGIN_
The terrible night on that day became more terrible again by the sound of
kettle-drums and by the roaring sounds of the demons._END

B_6_C_45_9
BEGIN_युध्यमानम् अनालक्ष्यम् शक्रो अपि त्रिदश ईश्वरः |
द्रष्टुम् आसादितुम् वा अपि न शक्तह् किम् पुनर् युवाम् || ६-४५-११_END
BEGIN_"When I enter into combat, making myself invisible, even Indra the lord of celestials 
is not able to see or approach me. How much less, you two!"_END

B_6_C_43_34
BEGIN_
तम् रथस्थम् अथो दृष्ट्वा सुषेणो वानर उत्तमः |
गिरि शऋन्गेण महता रथम् आशौ न्यपातयत् || ६-४३-३६_END
BEGIN_
Sushena the excellent monkey, seeing him mounted on a chariot, quickly caused the
chariot to fall down, by a huge rock._END

B_6_C_42_39
BEGIN_
ते गदाभिह् प्रदीप्ताभिह् ज़क्ति ज़ूल परज़्वधैः || ६-४२-४१
निजघ्नुर् वानरान् घोराह् कथयन्तह् स्व विक्रमान् |_END
BEGIN_
Exhibiting their native prowess, the demons began to strike all the monkeys with
their flaming maces, spears, harpoons and axes._END

B_6_C_46_4
BEGIN_
अन्तरिक्षम् निरीक्षन्तो दिशह् सर्वाश् च वानराः |
न च एनम् मायया चन्नम् ददृशू रावणिम् रणे || ६-४६-८_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys surveyed all the quarters in the sky, without being able to discover
Indrajit (the son of Ravana), who was veiled by his magic powers in the fight._END

B_6_C_41_44
BEGIN_आवृतह् स गिरिह् सर्वैस् तैह् समन्तात् प्लवम् गमैः || ६-४१-५२
अयुतानाम् सहस्रम् च पुरीम् ताम् अभ्यवर्तत |_END
BEGIN_Those monkeys covered the mountain on every side. A crore of them ranged round that city._END

B_6_C_44_23
BEGIN_
तेन शाब्देन महता प्रवृद्धेन समन्ततः || ६-४४-२६
त्रिकूटह् कन्दर आकीर्णह् प्रव्याहरद् इव अचलः |_END
BEGIN_
By that great sound, which re-echoed on all sides, the mountain Trikuta, full of
caves, appeared to be uttering confused murmurs._END

B_6_C_45_10
BEGIN_प्रावृताव् इषु जालेन राघवौकन्क पत्रिणा |
एष रोष परीत आत्मा नयामि यम सादनम् || ६-४५-१२_END
BEGIN_"O, Descendents of Raghu! Having imprisoned you in this net work of arrows furnished 
with heron's feathers, I, yielding myself up to the violence of my wrath, am about to dispatch you to 
the region of Yama the Lord of Death."_END

B_6_C_43_35
BEGIN_
लाघवेन तु सम्युक्तो विद्युन् माली निशाअ चरः |
अपक्रम्य रथात् तूर्णम् गदा पाणिह् क्षितौ स्थितः || ६-४३-३७_END
BEGIN_
Retreating soon from the chariot, Vidyunmali the demon endowed with a skill, stood
on the ground with a mace in his hand._END

B_6_C_42_40
BEGIN_
तथो वृक्षैर् महा कायाः पर्वत अग्रैज़् च वानराः || ६-४२-४२
निजघ्नस्तानि रक्षांसि नगैर्दनैश्च वेगिनः |
राजा जयति सुग्रीव इति शब्दो महानभूत् || ६-४२-४३_END
BEGIN_
Then, the gigantic monkeys swiftly struck those demons with trees, mountain-tops,
nails and teeth "Victorious is king Sugreeva" - thus arose a loud war-cry._END

B_6_C_46_5
BEGIN_
तम् तु माया प्रतिच्चिन्नम् मायया एव विभीषणः |
वीक्षमाणो ददर्श अथ भ्रातुह् पुत्रम् अवस्थितम् || ६-४६-९_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana, beholding by his magic arts, saw that nephew, standing nearby, duly
hidden by his occult power._END

B_6_C_41_45
BEGIN_वानरैर् बलवद्भिश् च बभूव द्रुम पाणिभिः || ६-४१-५३
सर्वतह् सम्वृता लन्का दुष्प्रवेशा अपि वायुना |_END
BEGIN_Even winds were unable to penetrate Lanka being surrounded on all sides by heroic monkeys 
holding tree trunks in their hands._END

B_6_C_44_24
BEGIN_
गो लान्गूला महा कायास् तमसा तुल्य वर्चसः || ६-४४-२७
सम्परिष्वज्य बाहुभ्याम् भक्षयन् रजनी चरान् |_END
BEGIN_
Long-tailed and black faced monkeys with their gigantic bodies and dark-like figure,
crushed the demons with their arms and allowed them to be eaten (by jackals, vultures etc)._END

B_6_C_45_11
BEGIN_एवम् उक्त्वा तु धर्मज्नौ भ्रातरौ राम लक्ष्मणौ |
निर्बिभेद शितैर् बाणैह् प्रजहर्ष ननाद च || ६-४५-१३_END
BEGIN_Speaking thus to the brothers Rama and Lakshmana, who were aware of righteousness, Indrajit 
pierced them with pointed arrows and shouted too exultantly._END

B_6_C_43_36
BEGIN_
ततह् क्रोध समाविष्टह् सुषेणो हरि पुम्गवः |
शैलाम् सुमहतीम् गृह्य निशाअ चरम् अभिद्रवत् || ६-४३-३८_END
BEGIN_
Then, the excellent monkey, Sushena engulfed as he was with anger, seizing a very
huge rock in his hands, chased that demon._END

B_6_C_42_41
BEGIN_
राजन् जय जयेत्युक्त्वा स्वस्वनामकथां ततः |
राक्षसास्त्वपरे भीमाः प्राकारस्थामहीं गतान् || ६-४२-४४
वानरान् भिन्दिपालैश्च शूलै श्चैव व्यदारयन् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, some other terrifying demons on their part, shouting "Be winsome! Be
victorious!", proclaimed their own respective names. While some demons standing on walls hacked at
the monkeys standing on the ground (below) with hooks and harpoons._END

B_6_C_46_6
BEGIN_
तम् अप्रतिम कर्माणम् अप्रतिद्वन्द्वम् आहवे |
ददर्श अन्तर्हितम् वीरम् वर दानाद् विभीषणः || ६-४६-१०
तेजसा यशसा चैव विक्रमेण च सम्युतः |_END
BEGIN_
Althought that warrior who had no peer in the field and who had unique exploits, had
made himself invisible by virtue of the boon he had received, he was recognized by Vibhishana, who
was full of energy, glory and prowess._END

B_6_C_41_46
BEGIN_राक्षसा विस्मयम् जग्मुह् सहसा अभिनिपीडिताः || ६-४१-५४
वानरैर् मेघ सम्काशैह् शक्र तुल्य पराक्रमैः |_END
BEGIN_The demons, who in their valour equaled Indra the ruler of gods, seeing themselves besieged, 
as by clouds, were struck with sudden terror._END

B_6_C_44_25
BEGIN_
अन्गदस् तु रणे शात्रुम् निहन्तुम् समुपस्थितः || ६-४४-२८
रावणेर् निजघान आशौ सारथिम् च हयान् अपि |_END
BEGIN_
Angada on his part, who came to annihilate the enemies in that battle-field, struck
Indrajit, his charioteer and the horses all at once._END

B_6_C_45_12
BEGIN_भिन्न अन्जन चय श्यामो विस्फार्य विपुलम् धनुः |
भूयो भूयह् शरान् घोरान् विससर्ज महा मृधे || ६-४५-१४_END
BEGIN_Indrajit, who was as black as a heap of shattered collyrium, stretching his immense bow, 
discharged formidable arrows even once more, in that great fight._END

B_6_C_43_37
BEGIN_
तम् आपतन्तम् गदया विद्युन् माली निशाअ चरः |
वक्षस्य् अभिजग्नान आशौ सुषेणम् हरि सत्तमम् || ६-४३-३९_END
BEGIN_
Vidyunmali the ranger of the night; struck that approaching Sushena the excellent
monkey, quickly with a mace on his chest._END

B_6_C_42_42
BEGIN_
वानराचापि सम्क्रुद्धाह् प्राकारस्थान् मही गताः || ६-४२-४५
राक्षसान् पातयाम् आसुह् समाप्लुत्य प्लवम् गमाः |_END
BEGIN_
The enraged monkeys, who wee standing on the ground, leapt into the air and dragged
down the demons stationed on the walls by seizing them with their arms._END

B_6_C_46_7
BEGIN_
इन्द्रजित् त्व् आत्मनह् कर्म तौ शयानौ समीक्ष्य च || ६-४६-११
उवाच परम प्रीतो हर्षयन् सर्व नैरृतान् |_END
BEGIN_
Contemplating his own feat, Indrajit gazed on those two warriors, stretched on the
earth and in excess of joy, wishing to share it with all the demons, said._END

B_6_C_41_47
BEGIN_महान् शब्दो अभवत् तत्र बल ओघस्य अभिवर्ततः || ६-४१-५५
सागरस्य इव भिन्नस्य यथा स्यात् सलिल स्वनः |_END
BEGIN_While the flock of monkey- troops was advancing there, a tremendous clamour arose, resembling 
a roar in the ocean beating against its shore._END

B_6_C_44_26
BEGIN_
वर्तमाने तदा घोरे सम्ग्रामे भृशदारुणे || ६-४४-२९
इन्द्रजित् तु रथम् त्यक्त्वा हत अशवो हत सारथिः |
अन्गदेन महा मायस् तत्र एव अन्तर् अधीयत || ६-४४-३०_END
BEGIN_
While that awful and very intense battle was going on, Indrajit a great trickster,
leaving the chariot, with its horses and charioteer killed by Angada, vanished from that very spot
itself._END

B_6_C_45_13
BEGIN_ततो मर्मसु मर्मज्नो मज्जयन् निशितान् शरान् |
राम लक्ष्मणयोर् वीरो ननाद च मुहुर् मुहुः || ६-४५-१५_END
BEGIN_That warrior, Indrajit, who was aware of their vital parts, set up a continual shouting, 
digging sharp arrows into the vital parts of Rama and Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_43_38
BEGIN_
गदा प्रहारम् तम् घोरम् अचिन्त्य प्लवग उत्तमः |
ताम् शैलाम् पातयाम् आस तस्य उरसि महा मृधे || ६-४३-४०_END
BEGIN_
Not minding that terrific blow with the mace in the great battle, Sushena the
excellent monkey silently threw that huge rock on his chest._END

B_6_C_42_43
BEGIN_
स सम्प्रहारस् तुमुलो मांस ज़ोणित कर्दमः || ६-४२-४६
रक्षसाम् वानराणाम् च सम्बभूव अद्भुत उपमाः |_END
BEGIN_
That tumultuous combat between demons and monkeys transformed into a wonder, leaving
a mire of flesh and blood._END

B_6_C_46_8
BEGIN_
दूषणस्य च हन्तारौ खरस्य च महा बलौ || ६-४६-१२
सादितौ मामकैर् बाणैर् भ्रातरौ राम लक्ष्मणौ |_END
BEGIN_
"The exceedingly strong brothers Rama and Lakshmana, the killers of Khara and
Dushana have been killed by my arrows."_END

B_6_C_41_48
BEGIN_तेन शब्देन महता सप्राकारा सतोरणा || ६-४१-५६
लन्का प्रचलिता सर्वा सशैल वन कानना |_END
BEGIN_By that great tumult, the entire Lanka with its ramparts arches, hills, woods and forests 
began to tremble._END

B_6_C_45_14
BEGIN_बद्धौ तु शर बन्धेन ताव् उभौ रण मूर्धनि |
निमेष अन्तर मात्रेण न शेकतुर् उदीक्षितुम् || ६-४५-१६_END
BEGIN_Those two princes, in the forefront of battle, bounded by that net work of arrows in 
the twinkling of an eye, became incapable of even looking up._END

B_6_C_44_27
BEGIN_
तत्कर्म वालिपुत्रस्य सर्वे देवाः सहर्षिभिः |
तुष्टुवुः पूजनार्हस्य तौ चोभौ रामलक्ष्मणौ || ६-४४-३१_END
BEGIN_
All the celestials, both Rama and Lakshmana together with all sages were pleased
with that act of the venerable Angada the son of Vali._END

B_6_C_43_39
BEGIN_
शैला प्रहार अभिहतो विद्युन् माली निशाअ चरः |
निष्पिष्ट हृदयो भूमौ गत असुर् निपपात ह || ६-४३-४१_END
BEGIN_
Struck by the thump of that rock, Vidyunmali the demon, his chest crushed, fell
lifeless on the earth._END

B_6_C_46_9
BEGIN_
न इमौ मोक्षयितुम् शक्याव् एतस्माद् इषु बन्धनात् |
सर्वैर् अपि समागम्य सर्षि सन्घैह् सुर असुरैः || ६-४६-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Even were they aided by the gods and demons with the host of sages, these two
brothers would never be able to release themselves from those arrows that paralyse them."_END

B_6_C_41_49
BEGIN_राम लक्ष्मण गुप्ता सा सुग्रीवेण च वाहिनी || ६-४१-५७
बभूव दुर्धर्षतरा सर्वैर् अपि सुर असुरैः |_END
BEGIN_That army of monkeys, guarded by Rama, Lakshmana and Sugreeva became even more invinceible 
than all the celestials and demons put together._END

B_6_C_44_28
BEGIN_
प्रभावं सर्वभूतानि विदुरिन्द्रजितो युधि |
ततस्तेन महात्मानम् दृष्ट्वा तुष्टाः प्रधर्षितम् || ६-४४-३२_END
BEGIN_
Since all the living beings knew the supernatural powers of Indrajit in battle, they
were pleased on seeing that highly gifted demon being defeated by Angada._END

B_6_C_45_15
BEGIN_ततो विभिन्न सर्व अन्गौ शर शल्य आचिताव् उभौ |
ध्वजाव् इव महा इन्द्रस्य रज्जु मुक्तौ प्रकम्पितौ || ६-४५-१७
तौ सम्प्रचलितौ वीरौ मर्म भेदेन कर्शितौ |
निपेततुर् महा इष्वासौ जगत्याम् जगती पती || ६-४५-१८_END
BEGIN_Pierced in their vital parts, exhausted, and covered all over with heads of arrows, those 
two mighty and courageous archers fell to the earth, they who were the lords of the earth, shaking violently 
like a pair of flag-staffs in honour of Indra the Lord celestials and freed from their raised of chords._END

B_6_C_43_40
BEGIN_
एवम् तैर् वानरैह् शौउरैह् शौउरास् ते रजनी चराः |
द्वन्द्वे विमृदितास् तत्र दैत्या;इव दिव ओकसैः || ६-४३-४२_END
BEGIN_
Those strong demons were destroyed thus by those valiant monkeys there in a series
of hand to hand encounters, as the demons were destroyed by the blows of the celestials._END

B_6_C_46_10
BEGIN_
यत् कृते चिन्तयानस्य शोक आर्तस्य पितुर् मम || ६-४६-१४
अस्पृष्ट्वा शयनम् गात्रैस् त्रि यामा याति शर्वती |
कृत्स्ना इयम् यत् कृते लन्का नदी वर्षास्व् इव आकुला || ६-४६-१५
सो अयम् मूल हरो अनर्थह् सर्वेषाम् निहतो मया |_END
BEGIN_
"This non- sensical pest, which was wearing away the very roots of us all, on whose
account, the three watches of the night slipped past my father, who is unable even to touch his
couch with his limbs, who remains absorbed in thought and stricken with grief and because of whom,
the entire city of Lanka remains agitated, like a river during the rains, has ban destroyed by
me."_END

B_6_C_41_50
BEGIN_राघवह् सम्निवेश्य एवम् सैन्यम् स्वम् रक्षसाम् वधे || ६-४१-५८
सम्मन्त्र्य मन्त्रिभिह् सार्धम् निश्चित्य च पुनह् पुनः |
आनन्तर्यम् अभिप्रेप्सुह् क्रम योग अर्थ तत्त्ववित् || ६-४१-५९
विभीषणस्य अनुमते राज धर्मम् अनुस्मरन् |
अन्गदम् वालि तनयम् समाहूय इदम् अब्रवीत् || ६-४१-६०_END
BEGIN_Having thus ranged his forces, with a view to destroy the demons, Rama who knew about 
the four expedients (to be used against an enemy in the shape of conciliation, gift, sowing dissension 
and punishment) employed in succession, took counsel again and again with his ministers and arrived 
at a decision. Calling to his mind the duty of the kings, Rama who was eager to undertake what was to 
be done next, in concurrence with Vibhishana, summoned Angada the son of Vali and spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_44_29
BEGIN_
ततः प्रहृष्टाः कपयः ससुग्रीवविभीषणाः |
साधुसाध्विति नेदुश्च दृष्ट्वा शत्रुम् पराजितम् || ६-४४-३३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the enemy defeated, those monkeys along with Sugreeva and Vibhishana were
delighted and praised Angada as an efficient warrior._END

B_6_C_45_16
BEGIN_तौ वीर शयने वीरौ शयानौ रुधिर उक्षितौ |
शर वेष्टित सर्व अन्गाव् आर्तौ परम पीडितौ || ६-४५-१९_END
BEGIN_Those warriors, Rama and Lakshmana, lying on that heroes' bed (on the battle-ground), 
bathed in blood, all their limbs bristling with arrows and extremely injured, felt distressed._END

B_6_C_43_41
BEGIN_
भल्लैः खड्गैर् गदाभिश च शाक्ति तोमर पट्टसैः |
अपविद्धश च भिन्नश च रथैः साम्ग्रामिकैर् हयैः || ६-४३-४३
निहतैः कुन्जरैर् मत्तैस् तथा वानर राक्षसैः |
चक्र अक्ष युग दण्डैश च भग्नैर् धरणि संशरितैः || ६-४३-४४
बभूव आयोधनम् घोरम् गोमायु गण सेवितम् |_END
BEGIN_
The battle-field became frightening with extra-ordinary spears, other arrows, maces,
javelins, lances and some other weapons with three points, shattered chariots and military steeds
elephants in rut, monkeys and demons which had been killed, wheels axles and yokes broken and lying
on the ground and frequented as it was by herds of jackals._END

B_6_C_47_0
BEGIN_
तस्मिन् प्रतिप्रविष्टे लन्काम् तु कृत अर्थे रावण आत्मजे |
राघवम् परिवार्य आर्ता ररक्षुर् वानर ऋषभाः || ६-४७-१_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit, the son of Ravana having returned to Lanka, his purpose accomplished, the
leading monkeys surrounded Rama in order to watch over him._END

B_6_C_46_11
BEGIN_
रामस्य लक्ष्मणस्य एव सर्वेषाम् च वन ओकसाम् || ६-४६-१६
विक्रमा निष्फलाह् सर्वे यथा शरदि तोयदाः |_END
BEGIN_
"As clouds are useless in the autumn, so are all the exploits of Rama, Lakshmana and
all the monkeys."_END

B_6_C_41_51
BEGIN_गत्वा सौम्य दशग्रीवम् ब्रूहि मद् वचनात् कपे |
लन्घयित्वा पुरीम् लन्काम् भयम् त्यक्त्वा गत व्यथः || ६-४१-६१
भ्रष्ट श्रीक गत ऐश्वर्य मुमूर्षो नष्ट चेतनः |_END
BEGIN_"Go my gentle Angada on my behalf and, passing thought the city of Lanka without fear 
and anxiety and Lanka without fear and anxiety and approaching Ravana - the unfortunate demon devoid 
of sovereignty and who has lost his splendour because of his inclination to die - admonish him in the 
following words:"_END

B_6_C_44_30
BEGIN_
इन्द्रजित्तु तदानेन निर्जितो भीमकर्मणा |
संयुगे वालिपुत्रेण क्रोधं चक्रे सुदारुणम् || ६-४४-३४_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit, on the other hand, then was driven to a very terrible rage, as he was
defeated in battle by Angada the son of Vali a dreadful monkey._END

B_6_C_45_17
BEGIN_न ह्य् अविद्धम् तयोर् गात्रम् बभूव अन्गुलम् अन्तरम् |
न अनिर्भिन्नम् न च अस्तब्धम् आ कर अग्राद् अजिह्मगैः || ६-४५-२०_END
BEGIN_There was not a finger's breadth on their bodies form the tips of their fingers to the 
end of their feet that was not lacerated, implanted and pierced by those arrows._END

B_6_C_43_42
BEGIN_
कबन्धानि समुत्पेतुर् दिक्षु वानर रक्षसाम् |
विमर्दे तुमुले तस्मिन् देव असुर रण उपमे || ६-४३-४५_END
BEGIN_
The headless trunks of monkeys and demons sprang up here and there in the midst of
that tumultuous conflict, which resembled the war between celestials and demons._END

B_6_C_47_1
BEGIN_
हनूमान् अन्गदो नीलह् सुषेणह् कुमुदो नलः |
गजो गव अक्षो गवयह् शरभो गन्ध मादनः || ६-४७-२
जाम्बवान् ऋषभह् सुन्दो रम्भह् शत बलिह् पृथुः |
व्यूढ अनीकाश् च यत्ताश् च द्रुमान् आदाय सर्वतः || ६-४७-३
वीक्षमाणा दिशह् सर्वास् तिर्यग् ऊर्ध्वम् च वानराः |
तृणेष्व् अपि च चेष्टत्सु राक्षसा;इति मेनिरे || ६-४७-४_END
BEGIN_
Hanuman, Angada, Nila, Sushena, Kumuda, Nala, Gaja, Gavaksha, Panasa, Sanuprastha
and the mighty Jambavan with Sunda, Rambha, Shatabali and Prithu all these monkeys, armed with
trees, reorganized their ranks, stood alert, surveyed the quarters of the sky up and down and on
every side and, even if a grass stirred, they exclaimed, "It is a demon!"_END

B_6_C_46_12
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा तु तान् सर्वान् राक्षसान् परिपार्श्वगान् || ६-४६-१७
यूथपान् अपि तान् सर्वांस् ताडयाम् आस रावणिः |_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking to all those demons, Indrajit the son of Ravana (by his arrows0 struck
the monkey chief._END

B_6_C_41_52
BEGIN_ऋषीणाम् देवतानाम् च गन्धर्व अप्सरसाम् तथा || ६-४१-६२
नागानाम् अथ यक्षाणाम् राज्नाम् च रजनी चर |
यच् च पापम् कृतम् मोहाद् अवलिप्तेन राक्षस || ६-४१-६३
नूनम् अद्य गतो दर्पह् स्वयम्भू वर दानजः |
तस्य दण्ड धरस् ते अहम् दार आहरण कर्शितः || ६-४१-६४_END
BEGIN_"O, Ravana the Ranger of the Night! In your reckless arrogance, sages, celestials, celestial 
musicians and their wives, serpent - demons, yakshas the semi-divine beings and kings have been oppressed 
by you. From now on, that arrogance, born of the boon you received from Brahma the Lord of creation, 
shall be subdued."_END

B_6_C_44_31
BEGIN_
सो अन्तर्धान गतह् पापो रावणी रण कर्कशाः |
ब्रह्म दत्त वरो वीरो रावणिह् क्रोध मूर्चितः || ६-४४-३५_END
BEGIN_
That Indrajit the son of Ravana, the sinful demon who had gone out of sight and was
cruel in battle, rendered himself as invisible again and hurled forth sharp arrows, bright as
lightning._END

B_6_C_45_18
BEGIN_तौ तु क्रूरेण निहतौ रक्षसा काम रूपिणा |
असृक् सुस्रुवतुस् तीव्रम् जलम् प्रस्रवणाव् इव || ६-४५-२१_END
BEGIN_Struck down by that ferocious demon, who was able to change his shape at will, the hot 
blood gushed forth from both Rama and Lashmana, as water from a spring._END

B_6_C_43_43
BEGIN_
निहन्यमाना हरि पुम्गवैस् तदा |
निशाअ चराह् शओणित दिग्ध गात्राह् |
पुनः सुयुद्धम् तरसा समाशरिता |
दिवाकरस्य अस्तमय अभिकान्क्षिणह् || ६-४३-४६_END
BEGIN_
Then, the rangers of the night, with their limbs anointed with blood after being
attacked by the excellent monkeys, longed for sun-set and again with strength, assembled for a good
combat._END

B_6_C_47_2
BEGIN_
रावणश् च अपि सम्हृष्टो विसृज्य इन्द्रजितम् सुतम् |
आजुहाव ततह् सीता रक्षणी राक्षसीस् तदा || ६-४७-५_END
BEGIN_
Ravana, meanwhile, full of joy, dismissed his son Indrajit and thereafter summoned
the female demons who guarded Seetha._END

B_6_C_46_13
BEGIN_
नीलं नवभिराहत्य मैन्दं सद्विविदम् तथा || ६-४६-१८
त्रिभिस्त्रिभिरमित्रघ्नस्तताअ परमेषुभिः |_END
BEGIN_
Striking Nila with nine arrows, Indrajit the destroyer of foes tormented Mainda and
Dvivida with three superb arrows on each._END

B_6_C_41_53
BEGIN_तस्य दण्डधरस्तेऽहम् दाराहरणकर्शितः |
दण्डम् धारयमाणस् तु लन्का द्वरे व्यवस्थितः || ६-४१-६५_END
BEGIN_"I shall inflict a fitting penalty for your ruthless abduction of my consort. I am stationed 
myself at the gate of Lanka, with a Rod of chastisement."_END

B_6_C_44_32
BEGIN_
रामं च लक्ष्मणम् चैव घोरैर्नागमयैः शरैः |
बिभेद समरे क्रुद्धः सर्वगात्रेषु राघवौ || ६-४४-३६_END
BEGIN_
Being enraged in battle, Indrajit bursted out serpent-like terrible arrows into all
the limbs of Rama and Lakshmana who were born in Raghu dynasty._END

B_6_C_45_19
BEGIN_पपात प्रथमम् रामो विद्धो मर्मसु मार्गणैः |
क्रोधाद् इन्द्रजिता येन पुरा शक्रो विनिर्जितः || ६-४५-२२_END
BEGIN_Rama fell first, his vital parts pierced by arrows of the wrathful Indrajit, who had 
formerly vanquished Indra the Lord of celestials._END

B_6_C_47_3
BEGIN_
राक्षस्यस् त्रिजटा च अपि शासनात् तम् उपस्थिताः |
ता उवाच ततो हृष्टो राक्षसी राक्षस ईश्वरः || ६-४७-६_END
BEGIN_
Following his orders, the female-demons along with Trijata appeared before him.
Then, the rejoiced Ravana said to them as follows:_END

B_6_C_46_14
BEGIN_
जाम्बवन्तम् महेष्वासो विद्ध्वा बाणेन वक्षसि || ६-४६-१९
हनूमतो वेगवतो विससर्ज शरान्दश |_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit the wielder of a great bow smacked the chest-region of Jambavan with an
arrow and released ten arrows towards Hanuman, the swift monkey._END

B_6_C_41_54
BEGIN_पदवीम् देवतानाम् च महर्षीणाम् च राक्षस |
राजर्षीणाम् च सर्वेणाम् गमिष्यसि मया हतः || ६-४१-६६_END
BEGIN_"O, demon! Slain by me, you will attain the region of Gods, of all the great sages and 
all the royal sages."_END

B_6_C_44_33
BEGIN_
मायया संवृतस्तत्र मोहयन् राघवौ युधि |
अदृशयो निशैतान् बाणान् मुमोच अशानि वर्चसः || ६-४४-३७
बबन्ध शरबन्धेन भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ |_END
BEGIN_
Enveloped by illusion, he sought to confuse Rama and Lakshmana in the struggle there
and invisible to all beings through his magic arts, Indrajit the ranger of the night bound those
two brothers Rama and Lakshmana with a net work of arrows._END

B_6_C_45_20
BEGIN_रुक्मपुङ्खेः प्रसन्नाग्रैरधोगतिभिराशुगैः |
नारचैर् अर्ध नाराचैर् भल्लैर् अन्जलिकैर् अपि || ६-४५-२३
विव्याध वत्स दन्तैश् च सिम्ह दम्ष्ट्रैह् क्षुरैस् तथा |_END
BEGIN_Indrajit pierced Rama by arrows with golden shafts, with sharp points, which had downward 
movement, which go fast, Narchas, Demi-narachas, Bhallas (with wide tips), Anjalis, Vatsa dantas, Simha 
dantas and those shafts like unto razors._END

B_6_C_47_4
BEGIN_
हताव् इन्द्रजिता आख्यात वैदेह्या राम लक्ष्मणौ |
पुष्पकम् च समारोप्य दर्शयध्वम् हतौ रणे || ६-४७-७_END
BEGIN_
"Tell Seetha that Rama and Lakshmana have been killed by Indrajit. Take her in
Pushpaka the aeroplane and show her Rama and Lakshman who were killed in battle."_END

B_6_C_46_15
BEGIN_
गवाक्षम् शरभम् चैव तावप्यमितविक्रमौ || ६-४६-२०
द्वाभ्याम् द्वाभ्याम् महावेगो विव्याध युधि रावणिः |_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit the son of Ravana of great swiftness, struck both Gavaksha and Sharabha of
unbounded valour with two arrows on each of them, in that battle._END

B_6_C_41_55
BEGIN_बलेन येन वै सीताम् मायया राक्षस अधम |
माम् अतिक्रामयित्वा त्वम् हृतवांस् तद् विदर्शय || ६-४१-६७_END
BEGIN_"O, the worst demon! Demonstrate the same courage and magic that you did employ in bearing 
Seetha away from me."_END

B_6_C_44_34
BEGIN_
तेन रौ पुरुषव्याघ्रौ क्रुद्धेनाशीविषैः शरैः || ६-४४-३८
सहसाभिहतौ वीरौ तदा प्रैक्षन्त वानराः |_END
BEGIN_
Then, the monkeys saw the two warriors, those lions among men, being wounded quickly
by the serpentine arrows of that enraged demons._END

B_6_C_45_21
BEGIN_स वीर शयने शिश्ये विज्यम् आदाय कार्मुकम् || ६-४५-२४
भिन्न मुष्टि परीणाहम् त्रिणतम् रुक्म भूषितम् |_END
BEGIN_Throwing asunder his bow bent at three places, adorned with gold, with its string loosened 
away and detached from the hold of his fist, Rama lied down on the battle-ground._END

B_6_C_47_5
BEGIN_
यद् आश्रयाद् अवष्टब्धो न इयम् माम् उपतिष्ठति |
सो अस्या भर्ता सह भ्रात्रा निरस्तो रण मूर्धनि || ६-४७-८_END
BEGIN_
"Her husband, the one depending on whom rendered her so proud that she refused to be
united with me, lies there killed with his brother in the battle-front."_END

B_6_C_46_16
BEGIN_
गोलाङ्गूलेश्वरं चैव वालिपुत्रमथाङ्गदम् || ६-४६-२१
विव्याध बहुभिर्बाणैस्त्वरमाणोऽथ रावणिः |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, Indrajit the son of Ravana swiftly with his various arrows, struck
Gavaksha (the ruler of golangulas) and then Angada the son of Vali too._END

B_6_C_41_56
BEGIN_अराक्षसम् इमम् लोकम् कर्ता अस्मि निशितैह् शरैः |
न चेत् शरणम् अभ्येषि माम् उपादाय मैथिलीम् || ६-४१-६८_END
BEGIN_"If you do not make an appeal to my clemency by returning Seetha, I shall make this world 
devoid of all demons."_END

B_6_C_44_35
BEGIN_
प्रकाशरूपस्तु तदा न शक्त |
स्तौ बाधितुं राक्षसराजपुत्रः |
मायां प्रयोक्तुं समुपाजगाम |
बबन्ध तौ राजसुतौ दुरात्मा || ६-४४-३९_END
BEGIN_
Not being able to hurt those two princes in his manifest form, Indrajit the son of
the king of demons with his perverse mind, had recourse to magic in order to make them captive._END

B_6_C_45_22
BEGIN_बाण पात अन्तरे रामम् पतितम् पुरुष ऋषभम् || ६-४५-२५
स तत्र लक्ष्मणो दृष्ट्वा निराशो जीविते अभवत् |_END
BEGIN_Seeing Rama the excellent man fallen, at a distance of an arrows range, Lakshman became 
hopeless about his own life._END

B_6_C_47_6
BEGIN_
निर्विशन्का निरुद्विग्ना निरपेक्षा च मैथिली |
माम् उपस्थास्यते सीता सर्व आभरण भूषिता || ६-४७-९_END
BEGIN_
"From now on, free from anxiety, grief and expectation of reunion, Seetha the
princess of Mithila kingdom, adorned in all her jewels, will submit herself to me."_END

B_6_C_46_17
BEGIN_
तान्वानरवरान् भित्त्वा शरैरग्निशिखोपमैः || ६-४६-२२
ननाद बलवांस्तत्र महासत्त्वः स रावणिः |_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit, that strong and highly courageous demons, pierced those jewels among the
monkeys there with his arrows which resembled flames of fire and began to shout in triumph._END

B_6_C_41_57
BEGIN_धर्म आत्मा रक्षसाम् श्रेष्ठह् सम्प्राप्तो अयम् विभीषणः |
लन्का ऐश्वर्यम् ध्रुवम् श्रीमान् अयम् प्राप्नोत्य् अकण्टकम् || ६-४१-६९_END
BEGIN_"This pious minded Vibhishana, the foremost of demons has come to me. Surely, this illustrious 
demon will obtain the kingdom of Lanka, which will henceforth be free from troubles."_END

B_6_C_45_23
BEGIN_रामम् कमलपत्राक्षं शरबन्धपरिक्षतम् || ६-४५-२६
शुशोच भ्रातरं दृष्ट्वा पतितम् धरणीतले |_END
BEGIN_Seeing his elder brother Rama, with his eyes resembling lotus-leaves, having fallen on 
the ground, wounded as he was by a net work of arrows, Lakshmana felt sad._END

B_6_C_48_0
BEGIN_
भर्तारम् निहतम् दृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मणम् च महा बलम् |
विललाप भृशम् सीता करुणम् शोक कर्शिता || ६-४८-१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing her husband and the mighty Lakshmana having been killed, Seetha was very much
emaiated through grief and lamented pitiably (as follows):_END

B_6_C_47_7
BEGIN_
अद्य काल वशम् प्राप्तम् रणे रामम् सलक्ष्मणम् |
अवेक्ष्य विनिवृत्त आशा न अन्याम् गतिम् अपश्यती || ६-४७-१०
अनपेक्षा विशालाक्षी मामुपस्थस्यते स्वयम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Beholding Rama and Lakshmana fallen under the sway of death on the battle-field
today, finding no other haven and hoping for nothing else, the large-eyed Seetha will voluntarily
seek refuge with me!"_END

B_6_C_46_18
BEGIN_
तान् अर्दयित्वा बाण ओघैस् त्रासयित्वा च वानरान् || ६-४६-२३
प्रजहास महा बाहुर् वचनम् च इदम् अब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Tormenting them with a multitude of arrows and frightening the monkeys, the mighty
armed Indrajit heartily laughed and spoke (as follows)._END

B_6_C_41_58
BEGIN_न हि राज्यम् अधर्मेण भोक्तुम् क्षणम् अपि त्वया |
शक्यम् मूर्ख सहायेन पापेन अविजित आत्मना || ६-४१-७०_END
BEGIN_"You, without a knowledge of the self and a sinful demon having stupid followers around 
you, cannot indeed enjoy the kingdom even for a moment, by this unrighteousness."_END

B_6_C_45_24
BEGIN_हरयश्चापि तम् दृष्ट्वा सम्तापम् परमं गताः || ६-४५-२७
शोकार्ताश्चुक्रुशुर्घोरमश्रुपूरितलोचनाः |_END
BEGIN_Beholding that Rama, the monkeys too were in great grief and wept terribly, with their 
eyes filled in tears, being afflicted as they were by sorrow._END

B_6_C_48_1
BEGIN_
ऊचुर् लक्षणिका ये माम् पुत्रिण्य् अविधवा इति च |
ते अस्य सर्वे हते रामे अज्नानिनो अनृत वादिनः || ६-४८-२_END
BEGIN_
"The sooth sayers, reading the marks and signs on my body, prophesized that I shall
bear sons and never be widowed. Now that Rama has been slain, their words have proved to be
untrue."_END

B_6_C_47_8
BEGIN_
तस्य तद् वचनम् श्रुत्वा रावणस्य दुरात्मनः || ६-४७-११
राक्षस्यस् तास् तथा इत्य् उक्त्वा प्रजग्मुर् यत्र पुष्पकम् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing these words of the cruel Ravana, they all replied, "Be it so" and went to
where the Pushpaka chariot was._END

B_6_C_41_59
BEGIN_युध्यस्व वा धृतिम् कृत्वा शौर्यम् आलम्ब्य राक्षस |
मत् शरैस् त्वम् रणे शान्तस् ततह् पूतो भविष्यसि || ६-४१-७१_END
BEGIN_"O, demon! Otherwise, get ready for a battle, by gathering courage and laying hold of 
your valour. Having been slain by my arrows in combat, you will be laid in peace._END

B_6_C_46_19
BEGIN_
शर बन्धेन घोरेण मया बद्धौ चमू मुखे || ६-४६-२४
सहितौ भ्रातराव् एतौ निशामयत राक्षसाः |_END
BEGIN_
"O, demons! At the forefront of the army, behold those two brothers (Rama and
Lakshmana) bound together by me by a terrible net work of my arrows."_END

B_6_C_45_25
BEGIN_बद्धौ तु वीरौ पतितौ शयानौ |
तौ वानराह् सम्परिवार्य तस्थुह् |
समागता वायु सुत प्रमुख्या |
विषदम् आर्ताह् परमम् च जग्मुह् || ६-४५-२८_END
BEGIN_Those monkeys with Hanuman in first place gathered at a place and stood surrounding Rama 
and Lakshmana, who wee bound by a net work of arrows and lying down on the battle ground. They were 
disturbed and afflicted sorrow._END

B_6_C_48_2
BEGIN_
यज्वनो महिषीम् ये माम् ऊचुह् पत्नीम् च सत्रिणः |
ते अद्य सर्वे हते रामे अज्नानिनो अनृत वादिनः || ६-४८-३_END
BEGIN_
"Since Rama is slian, all those astrologers, who predicted that I shold be the
companio of a sattra sacrifice and the consort of the performer of great sacrifices, now have
proved to be utteres of falsehood."_END

B_6_C_47_9
BEGIN_
ततः पुष्पकम् आदय राक्षस्यो रावण आज्नया || ६-४७-१२
अशोक वनिकास्थाम् ताम् मैथिलीम् समुपानयन् |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, the female-demons brought the aerial car, Pushpaka as per the
instructions of Ravana and carried it nearer to Seetha who was staying in Ashoka-grove._END

B_6_C_41_60
BEGIN_यद्याविशसि लोकांस् त्रीन् पक्षि भूतो मनो जवः |
मम चक्षुष् पथम् प्राप्य न जीवन् प्रतियास्यसि || ६-४१-७२_END
BEGIN_"O, Ranger of the Night! Even if you range the three worlds in the forms of a bird, you 
will not return alive, when you come into my range of sight."_END

B_6_C_46_20
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्तास् तु ते सर्वे राक्षसाह् कूट योधिनः || ६-४६-२५
परम् विस्मयम् आजग्मुह् कर्मणा तेन तोषिताः |_END
BEGIN_
All those demons, the treacherous fighters on their part, after hearing the words of
Indrajit, were seized with a great wonder and were overjoyed._END

B_6_C_48_3
BEGIN_
वीर पार्थिव पत्नी त्वम् ये धन्या इति च माम् विदुः |
ते अद्य सर्वे हते रामे अज्नानिनो अनृत वादिनः || ६-४८-४_END
BEGIN_
"Now that Rama has been slain, all those sooth-sayers who predicted that I should be
honoured by my husband as well as the wives of warriors and kings, are proved to be liars."_END

B_6_C_47_10
BEGIN_
ताम् आदाय तु राक्षस्यो भर्तृ शोक परायणाम् || ६-४७-१३
सीताम् आरोपयाम् आसुर् विमानम् पुष्पकम् तदा |_END
BEGIN_
The female-demons brought Seetha who was afflicted with grief for her husband and
made her to ascend Pushpaka-plane._END

B_6_C_41_61
BEGIN_ब्रवीमि त्वाम् हितम् वाक्यम् क्रियताम् और्ध्वदेकिकम् |
सुदृष्टा क्रियताम् लन्का जीवितम् ते मयि स्थितम् || ६-४१-७३_END
BEGIN_"I give you this salutary counsel prepare for your obsequies. Let Lanka be obliged to 
be seen well by you (like your last sight), as your survival is in my hands."_END

B_6_C_46_21
BEGIN_
विनेदुश् च महा नादान् सर्वे ते जलद उपमाः || ६-४६-२६
हतो राम;इति ज्नात्वा रावणिम् समपूजयन् |_END
BEGIN_
All of them cheered Indrajit unanimously with a roar like unto thunder, crying "Rama
is dead"._END

B_6_C_48_4
BEGIN_
ऊचुः संश्रवणे ये माम् द्विजाह् कार्तान्तिकाह् शुभाम् |
ते अद्य सर्वे हते रामे अज्नानिनो अनृत वादिनः || ६-४८-५_END
BEGIN_
"Now that Rama has been slain, all those astrologers among the wise brahmins. Who
openly foretold that I should remain happy with my husband are proved to have spoken falsely!"_END

B_6_C_47_11
BEGIN_
ततः पुष्पकम् आरोप्य सीताम् त्रिजटया सह || ६-४७-१४
जग्मुर्दर्शयितुं तस्यै राक्षस्यो रामलक्ष्मणौ |_END
BEGIN_
The female-demons along with Trijata made Seetha to ascend Pushpaka-plane and
proceeded to show her Rama and Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_41_62
BEGIN_इत्य् उक्तह् स तु तारेयो रामेण अक्लिष्ट कर्मणा |
जगाम आकाशम् आविश्य मूर्तिमान् इव हव्य वाट् || ६-४१-७४_END
BEGIN_Hearing the words of Rama, who was unwearied in action, Angada the son of Tara, leapt 
into air like a god of fire personified and marched ahead._END

B_6_C_46_22
BEGIN_
निष्पन्दौ तु तदा दृष्ट्वा ताव् उभौ राम लक्ष्मणौ || ६-४६-२७
वसुधायाम् निरुच्च्वासौ हताव् इत्य् अन्वमन्यत |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the two brothers - Rama and Lakshmana lying motionless and breathless on the
floor, Indrajit thought they were dead._END

B_6_C_48_5
BEGIN_
इमानि खलु पद्मानि पादयोर् यैह् किल स्त्रियः |
अधिराज्ये अभिषिच्यन्ते नर इन्द्रैह् पतिभिह् सह || ६-४८-६_END
BEGIN_
"Yet I bear the marks of lotus on my soles by virtue of which high-born women are
consecrated on an imperial throne with their husbands and lords."_END

B_6_C_47_12
BEGIN_
रावणो अकारयल् लन्काम् पताका ध्वज मालिनीम् || ६-४७-१५
प्राघोषयत हृष्टश् च लन्कायाम् राक्षस ईश्वरः |
राघवो लक्ष्मणश् चैव हताव् इन्द्रजिता रणे || ६-४७-१६_END
BEGIN_
Ravana the king of demons, thrilled with rapture, caused Lanka to be garlanded with
flags and banners and arranged a proclamation to be made in Lanka announcing that Rama and
Lakshmana had been slain by Indrajit in battle._END

B_6_C_46_23
BEGIN_
हर्षेण तु समाविष्ट;इन्द्रजित् समितिम् जयः || ६-४६-२८
प्रविवेश पुरीम् लन्काम् हर्षयन् सर्व नैरृतान् |_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit, full of joy and victorious in conflict, returned to Lanka, spreading
happiness among the demons._END

B_6_C_41_63
BEGIN_सो अतिपत्य मुहूर्तेन श्रीमान् रावण मन्दिरम् |
ददर्श आसीनम् अव्यग्रम् रावणम् सचिवैह् सह || ६-४१-७५_END
BEGIN_Reaching Ravana's palace in an instant, the illustrious Angada saw Ravana, seated coolly 
along with his ministers._END

B_6_C_48_6
BEGIN_
वैधव्यम् यान्ति यैर् नार्यो अलक्षणैर् भाग्य दुर्लभाः |
न आत्मनस् तानि पश्यामि पश्यन्ती हत लक्षणा || ६-४८-७_END
BEGIN_
"I do not find those marks of ill-fortune which betoken widowhood in women who are
ill-starred and as I examine, all the auspicious signs appear to be rendered void for me."_END

B_6_C_47_13
BEGIN_
विमानेन अपि सीता तु गत्वा त्रिजटया सह |
ददर्श वानराणाम् तु सर्वम् सिन्यम् निपातितम् || ६-४७-१७_END
BEGIN_
Seetha along with Trijata, transported by that plane, saw all the monkey-troops who
had been slain._END

B_6_C_46_24
BEGIN_
राम लक्ष्मणयोर् दृष्ट्वा शरीरे सायकैश् चिते || ६-४६-२९
सर्वाणि च अन्ग उपान्गानि सुग्रीवम् भयम् आविशत् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Rama and Lakshmana riddle with arrows and pierced in every limb and bone of
their bodies, a great fear had taken possession of Sugreeva._END

B_6_C_41_64
BEGIN_ततस् तस्य अविदूरेण निपत्य हरि पुम्गवः |
दीप्त अग्नि सदृशस् तस्थाव् अन्गदह् कनक अन्गदः || ६-४१-७६_END
BEGIN_Angada, the foremost of the monkeys, wearing golden bracelets, descended close to the 
king and stood there like a flaming torch._END

B_6_C_49_0
BEGIN_
घोरेण शर बन्धेन बद्धौ दशरथ आत्मजौ |
निश्वसन्तौ यथा नागौ शयानौ रुधिर उक्षितौ || ६-४९-१
सर्वे ते वानर श्रेष्ठाह् ससुग्रीवा महा बलाः |
परिवार्य महात्मानौ तस्थुह् शोक परिप्लुताः || ६-४९-२_END
BEGIN_
Bound by that formidable network of arrows, the two high-souled sons of dasaratha
lay bathed in blood, breathing like serpants. All those foremost of monkeys who were exceedingly
strong, including Sugreeva, plunged in grief, were standing around those two illustrious
warriors._END

B_6_C_47_14
BEGIN_
प्रहृष्ट मनसश् च अपि ददर्श पिशित अशनान् |
वानरांश् च अपि दुह्ख आर्तान् राम लक्ष्मण पार्श्वतः || ६-४७-१८_END
BEGIN_
Seetha saw the demons who were delighted at heart and monkeys disturbed with grief,
standing round Rama and Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_48_7
BEGIN_
सत्यानि इमानि पद्मानि स्त्रीणाम् उक्त्वानि लक्षणे |
तान्य् अद्य निहते रामे वितथानि भवन्ति मे || ६-४८-८_END
BEGIN_
"Those marks of the lotus said to be good angury for women by wise men, have become
meaningless, now that Rama is slain."_END

B_6_C_46_25
BEGIN_
तम् उवाच परित्रस्तम् वानर इन्द्रम् विभीषणः || ६-४६-३०
सबाष्प वदनम् दीनम् शोक व्याकुल लोचनम् |_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana then spoke to that Sugreeva, who was frightened, whose eyes were filled
with tears, looking helpless and whose eyes were agitated in grief._END

B_6_C_41_65
BEGIN_तद् राम वचनम् सर्वम् अन्यून अधिकम् उत्तमम् |
सामात्यम् श्रावयाम् आस निवेद्य आत्मानम् आत्मना || ६-४१-७७_END
BEGIN_Having made himself known, Angada communicated, that whole of the excellent speech of 
Rama without adding or subtracting anything to Ravana in the presence of Ravana's ministers, saying:_END

B_6_C_49_1
BEGIN_
एतस्मिन्न् अन्तेरे रामह् प्रत्यबुध्यत वीर्यवान् |
स्थिरत्वात् सत्त्व योगाच् च शरैह् संदानितो अपि सन् || ६-४९-३_END
BEGIN_
In the meanwhile, the mighty Rama by virtue of his hardihood and native strength,
awoke from his swwon, despite the shafts that held him captive._END

B_6_C_47_15
BEGIN_
ततः सीता ददर्श उभौ शयानौ शत तल्पयोः |
लक्ष्मणम् चैव रामम् च विसम्ज्नौ शर पीडितौ || ६-४७-१९
विध्वस्त कवचौ वीरौ विप्रविद्ध शर आसनौ |
सायकैश् चिन्न सर्व अन्गौ शर स्तम्भमयौ क्षितौ || ६-४७-२०_END
BEGIN_
Then, Seetha beheld those two warriors Rama and Lakshmana lying unconscious on the
ground on a bed of arrows, their limbs pierced with arrows, riddled with weapons, their armour
shattered, their bows cast aside at a distance and their entire body transfixed by darts._END

B_6_C_48_8
BEGIN_
केशाह् सूक्ष्माह् समा नीला भ्रुवौ च असम्गते मम |
वृत्ते च अलोमशे जन्घे दन्ताश् च अविरला मम || ६-४८-९_END
BEGIN_
"My hair is fine, black in colour and smooth. My eye-brows are disunited. My shanks
are hair-less and well rounded. My teeth are contiguous, without any gaps between them."_END

B_6_C_46_26
BEGIN_
अलम् त्रासेन सुग्रीव बाष्प वेगो निगृह्यताम् || ६-४६-३१
एवम् प्रायाणि युद्धानि विजयो न अस्ति नैष्ठिकः |_END
BEGIN_
"Have no fear, O Sugreeva! Stay this rush of tears. Wars are like this. Victory is
not certain."_END

B_6_C_41_66
BEGIN_दूतो अहम् कोसल इन्द्रस्य रामस्य अक्लिष्ट कर्मणः |
वालि पुत्रो अन्गदो नाम यदि ते श्रोत्रम् आगतः || ६-४१-७८_END
BEGIN_"I am the son of Vali, Angada by name. I have come as a messenger for the king of Koshala, 
Rama of imperishable exploits. Has my name ever reached your ears?"_END

B_6_C_49_2
BEGIN_
ततो दृष्ट्वा सरुधिरम् विषण्णम् गाढम् अर्पितम् |
भ्रातरम् दीन वदनम् पर्यदेवयद् आतुरः || ६-४९-४_END
BEGIN_
Then, beholding his brother, bleeding unconscious, firmly thrown on teh floor, and
his features changed, Rama full of grief lamented thus:_END

B_6_C_46_27
BEGIN_
सशेष भाग्यता अस्माकम् यदि वीर भविष्यति || ६-४६-३२
मोहम् एतौ प्रहास्येते भ्रातरौ राम लक्ष्मणौ |_END
BEGIN_
"O, warrior! If a remnance of luck is there with us, the highly-souled and the
exceedingly strong Rama and Lakshmana will drive off this loss of consciousness."_END

B_6_C_48_9
BEGIN_
शन्खे नेत्रे करौ पादौ गुल्फाव् ऊरू च मे चितौ |
अनुवृत्ता नखाह् स्निग्धाह् समाश् च अन्गुलयो मम || ६-४८-१०_END
BEGIN_
