"My temples, eyes, arms, feet, ankles and thights are homogenous and
well-proportioned. My fingers have well-rounded and glossy nails, having a right lenght."_END

B_6_C_47_16
BEGIN_
तौ दृष्ट्वा भ्रातरौ तत्र प्रवीरौ पुरुष ऋषभौ |
शयानौ पुण्डरीकाक्षौ कुमाराविव पावकी || ६-४७-२१
शरतल्पगतौ वीरौ तथाभूतौ नरर्षभौ |
दुह्ख आर्ता सुभृशम् सीता करुणम् विललाप ह || ६-४७-२२_END
BEGIN_
On seeing those two brothers, who were filled with valour, having lotus-eyes, the
excellent of men, lying streteched on a bed of arrows there in that wretched plight like the two
sons of the fire-god (Shkha and Vishakha) lying on a bed of reeds, Seetha wailed piteously,
stricken as she was with a great agony._END

B_6_C_41_67
BEGIN_आह त्वाम् राघवो रामह् कौसल्य आनन्द वर्धनः |
निष्पत्य प्रतियुध्यस्व नृशंसम् पुरुष अधम || ६-४१-७९_END
BEGIN_"Rama who is born in Raghu dynasty and who augements the joy of Kausalya speaks thus 
to you, �O, ruthless demon! Come forth and enter into combat. Prove to be the representative of your 
race!' "_END

B_6_C_49_3
BEGIN_
किम् नु मे सीतया कार्यम् किम् कार्यम् जीवितेन वा |
शयानम् यो अद्य पश्यामि भ्रातरम् युधि निर्जितम् || ६-४९-५_END
BEGIN_
"Of what use to me is the recovery of Seetha or even life itself, since my brother
now lying, before my eyes, has been struck down in teh fight?"_END

B_6_C_46_28
BEGIN_
पर्यवस्थापय आत्मानम् अनाथम् माम् च वानर || ६-४६-३३
सत्य धर्म अनुरक्तानाम् न अस्ति मृत्यु कृतम् भयम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Sugreeva! Be courageous and bring about courage in me, having no protector. For
those who are devoted to truth and righteousness, there is no fear of death."_END

B_6_C_48_10
BEGIN_
स्तनौ च अविरलौ पीनौ मम इमौ मग्न चूचुकौ |
मग्ना च उत्सन्गिनी नाभिह् पार्श्व उरस्कम् च मे चितम् || ६-४८-११_END
BEGIN_
"My breasts are close to each other, fully developed and have depressed nipples. My
navel is deeply idented. My flanks and bossom are well-formed."_END

B_6_C_47_17
BEGIN_
भर्तारमनवद्याङ्गी लक्ष्मणम् चासितेक्षणा |
प्रेक्ष्य पांसुषु चेष्टन्तौ रुरोद जनकात्मजा || ६-४७-२३_END
BEGIN_
The dark-eyed Seetha the daughter of Janaka with her faultless limbs, beholding her
lord and Lakshmana lying in the dust, burst into sobs._END

B_6_C_41_68
BEGIN_हन्ता अस्मि त्वाम् सह अमात्यम् सपुत्र ज्नाति बान्धवम् |
निरुद्विग्नास् त्रयो लोका भविष्यन्ति हते त्वयि || ६-४१-८०_END
BEGIN_" �I shall kill you along with your ministers, sons, cousins and other relatives. You 
being dead, all the three worlds will be rid of fear.'"_END

B_6_C_49_4
BEGIN_
शक्या सीता समा नारी प्राप्तुम् लोके विचिन्वता |
न लक्ष्मण समो भ्राता सचिवह् साम्परायिकः || ६-४९-६_END
BEGIN_
"It can be possible, if I were to look for her, to find a consort equal to Seetha in
this world of mortals but not a brother, a friend and a comrade in a hostile war, such as
Lakshmana!"_END

B_6_C_46_29
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा ततस् तस्य जल क्लिन्नेन पाणिना || ६-४६-३४
सुग्रीवस्य शुभे नेत्रे प्रममार्ज विभीषणः |_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking, Vibhishana then wiped the charming eyes of Sugreeva with his hand
moistened in water._END

B_6_C_48_11
BEGIN_
मम वर्णो मणि निभो मृदून्य् अन्ग रुहाणि च |
प्रतिष्ठिताम् द्वदशभिर् माम् ऊचुह् शुभ लक्षणाम् || ६-४८-१२_END
BEGIN_
"My complexion has the sheen of a pearl. The hair on my skin are soft. It is said of
me as endowed with auspicious signs, in that I touched the ground with my twelve limbs (viz. the
ten toes and two soles)._END

B_6_C_47_18
BEGIN_
सा बाष्प शोक अभिहता समीक्ष्य |
तौ भ्रातरौ देव सम प्रभावौ |
वितर्कयन्ती निधनम् तयोह् सा |
दुह्ख अन्विता वाक्यम् इदम् जगाद || ६-४७-२४_END
BEGIN_
Witnessing those brothers, the prominent sons of god, Seetha afflicted with tearful
sorrow, believing their death, spoke with grief the following words._END

B_6_C_41_69
BEGIN_देव दानव यक्षाणाम् गन्धर्व उरग रक्षसाम् |
शत्रुम् अद्य उद्धरिष्यामि त्वाम् ऋषीणाम् च कण्टकम् || ६-४१-८१_END
BEGIN_" �Now, I shall uproot you, a thorn to sages and an enemy to celestials, demons, semi-divine 
beings, celestial musicians, serpent-gods and ogres'."_END

B_6_C_49_5
BEGIN_
परित्यक्ष्याम्य् अहम् प्राणान् वानराणाम् तु पश्यताम् |
यदि पन्चत्वम् आपन्नह् सुमित्र आनन्द वर्धनः || ६-४९-७_END
BEGIN_
"If Lakshmana returned to the five elements, he the increaser of Sumitra's joy, I
will yield up my life-breaths while the monkeys stand looking on."_END

B_6_C_46_30
BEGIN_
ततः सलिलमादाय विद्यया परिजप्य च || ६-४६-३५
सुग्रीवनेत्रे धर्मात्मा प्रममार्ज विभीषणः |_END
BEGIN_
Then, the pious minded Vibhishana took water, enchanted it with an incantation and
wiped the eyes of Sugreeva._END

B_6_C_48_12
BEGIN_
समग्र यवम् अच्चिद्रम् पाणि पादम् च वर्णवत् |
मन्द स्मिता इत्य् एव च माम् कन्या लक्षणिका विदुः || ६-४८-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Those who interpret the marks of youthful maidens spoke of me that my hands and
feet are rosy, fully provided with marks each resembling a barley corn, devoid of space between my
fingers and toes and that my smile is gentle."_END

B_6_C_41_70
BEGIN_विभीषणस्य च ऐश्वर्यम् भविष्यति हते त्वयि |
न चेत् सत्कृत्य वैदेहीम् प्रणिपत्य प्रदास्यसि || ६-४१-८२_END
BEGIN_"If you do not restore Seetha honourably, by bowing respectfully before me, you are slain 
and Vibhishana will become the king.'"_END

B_6_C_49_6
BEGIN_
किम् नु वक्ष्यामि कौसल्याम् मातरम् किम् नु कैकयीम् |
कथम् अम्बाम् सुमित्रांच पुत्र दर्शन लालसाम् || ६-४९-८_END
BEGIN_
"What shall I say to my mother, Kausalya or to Kaikeyi? How can I talk to my mother
Sumitra, sighing for the sight of her son?"_END

B_6_C_46_31
BEGIN_
विमृज्य वदनम् तस्य कपि राजस्य धीमतः || ६-४६-३६
अब्रवीत् काल सम्प्रातम् असम्भ्रान्तम् इदम् वचः |_END
BEGIN_
Having dried the face of the wise Sugreeva Vibhishana spoke the following words full
of good sense and comfort._END

B_6_C_48_13
BEGIN_
अधिराज्ये अभिषेको मे ब्राह्मणैह् पतिना सह |
कृत अन्त कुशलैर् उक्तम् तत् सर्वम् वितथी कृतम् || ६-४८-१४_END
BEGIN_
"All that was told by brahmins well-versed in sooth-saying, of me that- I should be
consecrated on the imperial throne along with my husband -proved to be in vain."_END

B_6_C_41_71
BEGIN_इत्य् एवम् परुषम् वाक्यम् ब्रुवाणे हरि पुम्गवे |
अमर्ष वशम् आपन्नो निशा चर गण ईश्वरः || ६-४१-८३_END
BEGIN_Hearing these harsh words from Angada the lion among the monkeys, Ravana the Lord of 
the demon-tribe was infuriated._END

B_6_C_49_7
BEGIN_
विवत्साम् वेपमानाम् च क्रोशन्तीम् कुररीम् इव |
कथम् आश्वासयिष्यामि यदि यास्यामि तम् विना || ६-४९-९_END
BEGIN_
"How shall I console Sumitra, trembling and crying out like an osprey, bereft of her
son, if I return to Ayodhya without lakshmana?"_END

B_6_C_46_32
BEGIN_
न कालः कपि राज इन्द्र वैक्लव्यम् अनुवर्तितुम् || ६-४६-३७
अतिस्नेहो अप्य् अकाले अस्मिन् मरणाय उपपद्यते |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Sugreeva the king of monkeys! This is not the time to cling to despondency. At
this hour, even too much attachment leads to death."_END

B_6_C_48_14
BEGIN_
शोधयित्वा जन स्थानम् प्रवृत्तिम् उपलभ्य च |
तीर्त्वा सागरम् अक्षोभ्यम् भ्रातरौ गोष्पदे हतौ || ६-४८-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Having searched all the resorts of men, received the tidings of my fate, and
crossed the impassable ocean, those two brothers have perishe din the imprint of a cow's hoof ( a
small puddle)."_END

B_6_C_49_8
BEGIN_
कथम् वक्ष्यामि शत्रुघ्नम् भरतम् च यशस्विनम् |
मया सह वनम् यातो विना तेन आगतह् पुनः || ६-४९-१०_END
BEGIN_
"How shall I tell Shatrughna and the illustrious Bharata when I return without
Lakshmana, who followed to the forest along with me?"_END

B_6_C_41_72
BEGIN_ततः स रोष ताम्र अक्षह् शशास सचिवांस् तदा |
गृह्यताम् एष दुर्मेधा वध्यताम् इति च असकृत् || ६-४१-८४_END
BEGIN_Then, the enraged Ravana repeatedly commanded his attendants, saying: "Let this stupid 
monkey be seized and put to death."_END

B_6_C_46_33
BEGIN_
तस्माद् उत्सृज्य वैक्लव्यम् सर्व कार्य विनाशनम् || ६-४६-३८
हितम् राम पुरोगाणाम् सैन्यानाम् अनुचिन्त्यताम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Therefore, abandoning your despair, which ruins all actions, focus now on how best
to serve the troops which have Rama going before them._END

B_6_C_48_15
BEGIN_
ननु वारुणम् आग्नेयम् ऐन्द्रम् वायव्यम् एव च |
अस्त्रम् ब्रह्म शिरश् चैव राघवौ प्रत्यपद्यताम् || ६-४८-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Rama and Lakshmana surely knew the use of the arrows of Varuna, Agni, Indra and
Vayu, as also the Brahmashira weapon."_END

B_6_C_49_9
BEGIN_
उपालम्भम् न शक्ष्यामि सोढुम् बत सुमित्रया |
इह एव देहम् त्यक्ष्यामि न हि जीवितुम् उत्सहे || ६-४९-११_END
BEGIN_
"Alas! I should not be able to endure Sumitra's reproaches. I will leave my body
here itself. I do not wish to continue living."_END

B_6_C_41_73
BEGIN_रावणस्य वचह् श्रुत्वा दीप्त अग्नि सम तेजसः |
जगृहुस् तम् ततो घोराश् चत्वारो रजनी चराः || ६-४१-८५_END
BEGIN_Hearing Ravana's words, four terrible demons seized Angada who, in his splendour, resembled 
a blazing torch._END

B_6_C_46_34
BEGIN_
अथ वा रक्ष्यताम् रामो यावत् सम्ज्ना विपर्ययः || ६-४६-३९
लब्ध सम्ज्नौ तु काकुत्स्थौ भयम् नो व्यपनेष्यतः |_END
BEGIN_
"Or else, let Rama be protected till he regains consciousness. Having regained
consciousness, Rama and Lakshmana can indeed drive away the fear of both of us."_END

B_6_C_48_16
BEGIN_
अदृश्यमानेन रणे मायया वासव उपमौ |
मम नाथाव् अनाथाया निहतौ राम लक्ष्मणौ || ६-४८-१७_END
BEGIN_
"By means of magic arts, an invisible foe has slain Rama and Lakshmana, my
protectors, who are equal to Indra in battle and I am now bereft of any support."_END

B_6_C_49_10
BEGIN_
धिग् माम् दुष्कृत कर्माणम् अनार्यम् यत् कृते ह्य् असौ |
लक्ष्मणह् पतितह् शेते शर तल्पे गत असुवत् || ६-४९-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Woe unto me to my wicked deed and to my lack of nobility. Through my fault,
Lakshmana has fallen and lies indeed on a bed of arrows as on who has yielded up his life!"_END

B_6_C_41_74
BEGIN_ग्राहयाम् आस तारेयह् स्वयम् आत्मानम् आत्मना |
बलम् दर्शयितुम् वीरो यातु धान गणे तदा || ६-४१-८६_END
BEGIN_Then, the prudent and heroic Angada the son of Tara voluntarily allowed himself to be 
seized, in order to display his prowess before the host of demons._END

B_6_C_48_17
BEGIN_
न हि दृष्टि पथम् प्राप्य राघवस्य रणे रिपुः |
जीवन् प्रतिनिवर्तेत यद्य् अपि स्यान् मनो जवः || ६-४८-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Having reached the range of sight of Rama in a combat, no enemy could return alive,
eventhough he were endowed with the swiftness of thought."_END

B_6_C_46_35
BEGIN_
न एतत् किंचन रामस्य न च रामो मुमूर्षति || ६-४६-४०
न ह्य् एनम् हास्यते लक्ष्मीर् दुर्लभा या गत आयुषाम् |_END
BEGIN_
"This is nothing to Rama nor Rama is going to die. The bodily splendour, which is
difficult to be found in those whose longevity of life has run out; is not abandoning him."_END

B_6_C_49_11
BEGIN_
त्वम् नित्यम् सुविषण्णम् माम् आश्वासयसि लक्ष्मण |
गत असुर् न अद्य शक्नोषि माम् आर्तम् अभिभाषितुम् || ६-४९-१३_END
BEGIN_
"O, Lakshmana! You always used to consoe me whenever I was in a great sorrow. You,
having lost your life now are not able to allay my sufferings with your words."_END

B_6_C_41_75
BEGIN_स तान् बाहु द्वये सक्तान् आदाय पतगान् इव |
प्रासादम् शैल सम्काशम् उत्पापात अन्गदस् तदा || ६-४१-८७_END
BEGIN_Then, seizing like unto birds those attendants clung to his arms, Angada leapt on to 
the palace that resembled like a mountain._END

B_6_C_48_18
BEGIN_
न कालस्य अतिभारो अस्ति कृत अन्तश् च सुदुर्जयः |
यत्र रामह् सह भ्रात्रा शेते युधि निपाथितः || ६-४८-१९_END
BEGIN_
There is no burden too heavy for death to shoulder, as Rama along with his brother
are lying struck down on the battle-field. Fate is inexorable."_END

B_6_C_49_12
BEGIN_
येन अद्य बहवो युद्धे राक्षसा निहताह् क्षितौ |
तस्याम् एव क्षितौ वीरह् स शेते निहतह् परैः || ६-४९-१४_END
BEGIN_
"You, who in this battle today, struck down inummerable demons to the earth, are
fallen, pierced by darts, like a hero on the self same field."_END

B_6_C_46_36
BEGIN_
तस्माद् आश्वासय अत्मानम् बलम् च आश्वासय स्वकम् || ६-४६-४१
यावत् सर्वाणि सैन्यानि पुनह् संस्थापयाम्य् अहम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Therefore console yourself and call on your prowess, till I restore confidence in
the entire ranks."_END

B_6_C_41_76
BEGIN_तेस्योत्पतनवेगेन निर्धूतास्तत्र राक्षसाः |
भुमौ निपतिताह् सर्वे राक्षस इन्द्रस्य पश्यतः || ६-४१-८८_END
BEGIN_All those four demons were shaken out by Angada's impetuous leap and fell on the ground 
there under the eyes of their king._END

B_6_C_49_13
BEGIN_
शयानह् शर तल्पे अस्मिन् स्व शोणित परिप्लुतः |
शर जालैश् चितो भाति भास्करो अस्तम् इव व्रजन् || ६-४९-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Lying on this bed of arrows, bathed in blood, you are piled up; sharajaalaiH= in a
heap of arrows; saH= you, as such; bhaasi= look; bhaaskaraH= iva= like the sun; vrajan= setting
behind; astam= the horizon._END

B_6_C_48_19
BEGIN_
न अहम् शोचामि भर्तारम् निहतम् न च लक्ष्मणम् |
न आत्मानम् जननी च अपि यथा श्वश्रूम् तपस्विनीम् || ६-४८-२०_END
BEGIN_
"I do not repent so much for Rama and Lakshmana or for myself or even my mother but
for my unfortunate mother-in-law, Kausalya."_END

B_6_C_46_37
BEGIN_
एते हि उत्फुल्ल नयनास् त्रासाद् आगत साध्वसाः || ६-४६-४२
कर्णे कर्णे प्रकथिता हरयो हरि पुम्गव |_END
BEGIN_
"O, the foremost of monkeys! These monkeys, having their eyes dilated due to fear,
are signaling some words into each other's ear, terrified as they were."_END

B_6_C_41_77
BEGIN_ततः प्रासाद शिखरम् शैल शृन्गम् इव उन्नतम् |
तत् पफाल तदा आक्रान्तम् दशग्रीवस्य पश्यतः || ६-४१-८९_END
BEGIN_Thereafter, the glorious Angada the son of Vali ascended the roof of Ravana's palace, 
which equaled the summit of a mountain in height._END

B_6_C_48_20
BEGIN_
सा हि चिन्तयते नित्यम् समाप्त व्रतम् आगतम् |
कदा द्रक्ष्यामि सीताम् च रामम् च सह लक्ष्मणम् || ६-४८-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Kausalya for her part, forever remains absorbed in the thought 'When shall I see
Lakshmana and Seetha with Rama returned (to Ayodhya) having completed his vow (of remaining in
exile in the forest for fourteen years)?"_END

B_6_C_49_14
BEGIN_
बाण अभिहत मर्मत्वान् न शक्नोत्य् अभिवीक्षितुम् |
रुजा च अब्रुवतो ह्य् अस्य दृष्टि रागेण सूच्यते || ६-४९-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Your vital parts having been pierced with arrows, you are not able even to speak
now. Eventhough you not speaking, your agony is disclosed by the redness of your eyes."_END

B_6_C_46_38
BEGIN_
माम् तु दृष्ट्वा प्रधावन्तम् अनीकम् सम्प्रहर्षितुम् || ६-४६-४३
त्यजन्तु हरयस् त्रासम् भुक्त पूर्वाम् इव स्रजम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Let the monkeys cast off their fear, even as one would discard a used garland, on
seeing me running about to activate the troops."_END

B_6_C_41_78
BEGIN_पफाल च तदाक्रान्तं दशग्रीवस्य पश्यतः |
पुरा हिमवतः शृङ्गं वज्रेणेव विदारितम् ६-४१-९०_END
BEGIN_That roof of the palace, trampled by Angada, crumbled - as a peak of Himalayan range 
was shattered long ago by lightening - before Ravana's gaze._END

B_6_C_49_15
BEGIN_
यथा एव माम् वनम् यान्तम् अनुयातो महा द्युतिः |
अहम् अप्य् अनुयास्यामि तथैव एनम् यम क्षयम् || ६-४९-१७_END
BEGIN_
"I shall follow him to the region of Yama, as that illustrious warrior accompanied
me when I retired to the forest."_END

B_6_C_48_21
BEGIN_
परिदेवयमानाम् ताम् राक्षसी त्रिजटा अब्रवीत् |
मा विषादम् कृथा देवि भर्ता अयम् तव जीवति || ६-४८-२२_END
BEGIN_
The demoness Trijata spoke to that lamenting Seetha as follows : "O, the god-like
lady! Do not despair. Your husband, Rama is still living."_END

B_6_C_41_79
BEGIN_भन्क्त्वा प्रासाद शिखरम् नाम विश्राव्य च आत्मनः |
विनद्य सुमहा नादम् उत्पपात विहायसा || ६-४१-९१_END
BEGIN_After destroying the roof of the palace, Angada proclaimed his name and with a triumphant 
roar, rose into the air._END

B_6_C_46_39
BEGIN_
समाश्वास्य तु सुग्रीवम् राक्षस इन्द्रो विभीषणः || ६-४६-४४
विद्रुतम् वानर अनीकम् तत् समाश्वासयत् पुनः |_END
BEGIN_
Having emboldened Sugreeva, Vibhishana the foremost of demons once again reassured
that army of monkeys, who were pushing away._END

B_6_C_48_22
BEGIN_
कारणानि च वक्ष्यामि महान्ति सदृशानि च |
यथा इमौ जीवतो देवि भ्रातरौ राम लक्ष्मणौ || ६-४८-२३_END
BEGIN_
"O, godlike lady! I will tell you mighty and cogent reasons, how these two brothers
Rama and Lakshmana are living."_END

B_6_C_49_16
BEGIN_
इष्ट बन्धु जनो नित्यम् माम् च नित्यम् अनुव्रतः |
इमाम् अद्य गतो अवस्थाम् मम अनार्यस्य दुर्नयैः || ६-४९-१८_END
BEGIN_
"He who loved his own kinsfolk and was filled iwth devotion for me, got this state
to which my misdeeds have brought him, wretched that I am!"_END

B_6_C_41_80
BEGIN_व्यथयन् राक्षसान् सर्वान् हर्षयंश्चापि वानरान् |
स वानराणां मध्ये तु रामपार्श्वमुपागतः ६-४१-९२_END
BEGIN_Causing restlessness to all the demons but delight to the monkeys, Angada approached 
close to Rama, who was stationed in the middle of the monkey-forces._END

B_6_C_46_40
BEGIN_
इन्द्रजित् तु महा मायह् सर्व सैन्य समावृतः || ६-४६-४५
विवेश नगरीम् लन्काम् पितरम् च अभ्युपागमत् |_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit, the great conjurer, surrounded by all his forces, re-entered the city of
Lanka._END

B_6_C_50_0
BEGIN_
अथ उवाच महा तेजा हरि राजो महा बलः |
किम् इयम् व्यथिता सेना मूढ वाता इव नौर् जले || ६-५०-१_END
BEGIN_
Meanwhile, Sugreeva the king of Monkeys, possessing a great splendour and a mighty
power, enquired saying, "Why is this army agitated, like a ship driven out of its course in
water?"_END

B_6_C_48_23
BEGIN_
न हि कोप परीतानि हर्ष पर्युत्सुकानि च |
भवन्ति युधि योधानाम् मुखानि निहते पतौ || ६-४८-२४_END
BEGIN_
"The leader having been lost, the faces of the soldiers on the field of battle are
never seized by anger nor are they animated with joy."_END

B_6_C_49_17
BEGIN_
सुरुष्टेन अपि वीरेण लक्ष्मणेना न संस्मरे |
परुषम् विप्रियम् वा अपि श्रावितम् न कदाचन || ६-४९-१९_END
BEGIN_
"I do not remember to have heard any harsh or hateful words from that valiant
Lakshmana, even if he is deeply provoked."_END

B_6_C_41_81
BEGIN_रावणस् तु परम् चक्रे क्रोधम् प्रासाद धर्षणात् |
विनाशम् च आत्मनह् पश्यन् निह्श्वास परमो अभवत् || ६-४१-९३_END
BEGIN_Because of the destruction of his palace, Ravana on his part got extremely angry. Foreseeing 
his own destruction, he became a desponded demon._END

B_6_C_46_41
BEGIN_
तत्र रावणम् आसीनम् अभिवाद्य कृत अन्जलिः || ६-४६-४६
आचचक्षे प्रियम् पित्रे निहतौ राम लक्ष्मणौ |_END
BEGIN_
Approaching Ravana there and saluting with joined palms, Indrajit informed his
father in pleasing words that both Rama and Lakshmana had been slain._END

B_6_C_50_1
BEGIN_
सुग्रीवस्य वचह् श्रुत्वा वालि पुत्रो अन्गदो अब्रवीत् |
न त्वम् पश्यसि रामम् च लक्ष्मणम् च महा बलम् || ६-५०-२
शर जाल आचितौ वीराव् उभौ दशरथ आत्मजौ |
शर तल्पे महात्मानौ शयानाउ रुधिर उक्षितौ || ६-५०-३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Sugreeva, Angada the son of Vali replied, saying "Do you not
see the high-souled Rama and Lakshmana of the great chariot, those two valiant sons of Dasaratha
covered with darts lying all bloody in a bed of arrows?"_END

B_6_C_48_24
BEGIN_
इदम् विमानम् वैदेहि पुष्पकम् नाम नामतः |
दिव्यम् त्वाम् धारयेन् न इदम् यद्य् एतौ गज जीवितौ || ६-४८-२५_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha! This aerial car called Pushpaka by name, celestial as it is, would not
have brought you here, if those two heroes have lost their lives."_END

B_6_C_41_82
BEGIN_रामस् तु बहुभिर् हृष्टैर् निनदद्भिह् प्लवम् गमैः |
वृतो रिपु वध आकान्क्षी युद्धाय एव अभ्यवर्तत || ६-४१-९४_END
BEGIN_Surrounded by many monkeys, roaring with delight, Rama on his part was proceeding ahead 
already for the battle, with an intent to wipe out the enemy._END

B_6_C_49_18
BEGIN_
विससर्ज एक वेगेन पन्च बाण शतानि यः |
इष्व् अस्त्रेष्व् अधिकस् तस्मात् कार्तवीर्याच् च लक्ष्मणः || ६-४९-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Lakshmana, who was able to loose five hundred arrows in one shot, was surpassing
kartavirya himself in the science of archery."_END

B_6_C_46_42
BEGIN_
उत्पपात ततो हृष्टह् पुत्रम् च परिषस्वजे || ६-४६-४७
रावणो रक्षसाम् मध्ये श्रुत्वा शत्रू निपातितौ |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing in the midst of demons, the news that both the enemies having been killed,
Ravana forthwith sprang on his feet in joy and embraced his son._END

B_6_C_50_2
BEGIN_
अथ अब्रवीद् वानर इन्द्रह् सुग्रीवह् पुत्रम् अन्गदम् |
न अनिमित्तम् इदम् मन्ये भवितव्यम् भयेन तु || ६-५०-४_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Sugreeva the Lord of Monkeys said to his son Angada: "To my mind, there
is some othere cause why the monkeys are bewildereed. There must be some danger ahead."_END

B_6_C_48_25
BEGIN_
हत वीर प्रधाना हि हत उत्साहा निरुद्यमा |
सेना भ्रमति सम्ख्येषु हत कर्णा इव नौर् जले || ६-४८-२६_END
BEGIN_
"An army that sees its valiant commander falll, is bereft of courage and wanders
aimlessly about on the battle field, like a ship which has broken its rudder in water."_END

B_6_C_49_19
BEGIN_
अस्त्रैर् अस्त्राणि यो हन्यात् शक्रस्य अपि महात्मनः |
सो अयम् उर्व्याम्हतह् शेते महा अर्ह शयन उचितः || ६-४९-२१_END
BEGIN_
"This Lakshmana, who was accustomed to a rich couch and who by his arrows severe the
weapons the mighty Indra the Lord of celestials, is lying slain on the ground."_END

B_6_C_41_83
BEGIN_सुषेणस् तु महा वीर्यो गिरि कूट उपमो हरिः |
बहुभिह् सम्वृतस् तत्र वानरैह् काम रूपिभिः || ६-४१-९५_END
BEGIN_Now, Sushena the highly valiant monkey, was stationed there like the head of the mountain 
surrounded by innumerable monkeys, who were bale to change their form at will._END

B_6_C_46_43
BEGIN_
उपाघ्राय स मूर्ध्न्य् एनम् पप्रच्च प्रीत मानसः || ६-४६-४८
पृच्चते च यथा वृत्तम् पित्रे सर्वम् न्यवेदयत् |
यथा तौ शरबन्धेन निश्चेष्टौ निष्प्रभौ कृतौ || ६-४६-४९_END
BEGIN_
Smelling on his head, Ravana delighted at heard, made enquiries in the matter.
Indrajit reported the matter as it happened, to his enquiring father, as to how both Rama and
Lakshmana were made motion-less and luster-less by entwining them with arrows._END

B_6_C_50_3
BEGIN_
विषण्ण वदना ह्य् एते त्यक्त प्रहरणा दिशः |
प्रपलायन्ति हरयस् त्रासाद् उत्फुल्ल लोचनाः || ६-५०-५_END
BEGIN_
"Here, these monkeys are runnng away in all directions, with their eyes distended
with terror, throwing down their arms and looking dejected."_END

B_6_C_49_20
BEGIN_
तच् च मिथ्या प्रलप्तम् माम् प्रधक्ष्यति न संशयः |
यन् मया न कृतो राजा राक्षसानाम् विभीषणः || ६-४९-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Those vain words uttered by me, will ndoubtedly consume me since I have not made
Vibhishana the king of demons."_END

B_6_C_48_26
BEGIN_
इयम् पुनर् असम्भ्रान्ता निरुद्विग्ना तरस्विनी |
सेना रक्षति काकुत्स्थौ मायया निर्जितौ रणे || ६-४८-२७_END
BEGIN_
"This army for its part is neither confused nor perturbed and is guarding Rama and
Lakshman. I am pointing this out to you on account of my affection for you, O lady given to
austerities!"_END

B_6_C_41_84
BEGIN_स तु द्वाराणि सर्वाणि सुग्रीव वचनात् कपिः |
पर्याक्रमत दुर्धर्षो नक्षत्राणि इव चन्द्रमाः || ६-४१-९६_END
BEGIN_Under the order of Sugreeva, the invincible monkey, Sushena was patrolling the gates 
and wandering like a moon among the stars._END

B_6_C_46_44
BEGIN_
स हर्ष वेग अनुगत अन्तर आत्मा |
श्रुत्वा वचस् तस्य महा रथस्य |
जहौ ज्वरम् दाशरथेह् समुत्थितम् |
प्रहृष्य वाचा अभिननन्द पुत्रम् || ६-४६-५०_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Indrajit the great charioteer, Ravana with his heart filled
with a gush of joy, relinquished his anguish, caused on account of Rama and applauded his son with
pleasing words._END

B_6_C_50_4
BEGIN_
अन्योन्यस्य न लज्जन्ते न निरीक्षन्ति पृष्ठतः |
विप्रकर्षन्ति च अन्योन्यम् पतितम् लन्घयन्ति च || ६-५०-६_END
BEGIN_
"They are not ashamed of one another. They are not looking behind than even. They
are jostling each other and leaping over those who have fallen."_END

B_6_C_48_27
BEGIN_
सा त्वम् भव सुविस्रब्धा;अनुमानैह् सुख उदयैः |
अहतौ पश्य काकुत्स्थौ स्नेहाद् एतद् ब्रवीमि ते || ६-४८-२८_END
BEGIN_
"You as such, be reassured by these auspicious omens. Behold Rama and Lakshman who
are not dead. I am telling you this, on account of my affection for you."_END

B_6_C_49_21
BEGIN_
अस्मिन् मुहूर्ते सुग्रीव प्रतियातुम् इतो अर्हसि |
मत्वा हीनम् मया राजन् रावणो अभिद्रवेद् बली || ६-४९-२३_END
BEGIN_
"O, Sugreeva! You ought to return at once from here since knowing that you are
bereft of my support, Ravana will overcome you, O king!"_END

B_6_C_41_85
BEGIN_तेषाम् अक्षौहिणि शतम् समवेक्ष्य वन ओकसाम् |
लन्काम् उपनिविष्टानाम् सागरम् च अतिवर्तताम् || ६-४१-९७
राक्षसा विस्मयम् जग्मुस् त्रासम् जग्मुस् तथा अपरे |
अपरे समर उद्धर्षाद्द् हर्षम् एव उपपेदिरे || ६-४१-९८_END
BEGIN_Seeing hundreds of divisions of those monkeys encamped under the walls of Lanka, marshaled 
on the shores of the sea, the demons were amazed and some others were terror-struck while others, overjoyed 
at the prospect of fighting, leapt even in exultation._END

B_6_C_50_5
BEGIN_
एतस्मिन्न् अन्तरे वीरो गदा पाणिर् विभीषणः |
सुग्रीवम् वर्धयाम् आस राघवम् च निरैक्षत || ६-५०-७_END
BEGIN_
In the midst of this turmoil, the valiant Vibhishana, wielding a mace in his hand
came there and cheered Sugreeva and Rama saying "Victory to Rama! Victory to Rama!."_END

B_6_C_48_28
BEGIN_
अनृतम् न उक्त पूर्वम् मे न च वक्ष्ये कदाचन |
चारित्र सुख शीलत्वात् प्रविष्टा असि मनो मम || ६-४८-२९_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha! I have not spoken falsehood before, nor shall I ever do so. By your
conduct and natural gaiety, you have found a place in my heart!"_END

B_6_C_49_22
BEGIN_
अन्गदम् तु पुरस् कृत्य ससैन्यह् ससुहृज् जनः |
सागरम् तर सुग्रीव पुनस् तेन एव सेतुना || ६-४९-२४_END
BEGIN_
"O, Sugreeva! Recross the sea with your army, keeping Angada in front and with your
followers, Nila and Nala."_END

B_6_C_41_86
BEGIN_कृत्स्नम् हि कपिभिर् व्याप्तम् प्राकार परिख अन्तरम् |
ददृशू राक्षसा दीनाह् प्राकारम् वानरी कृतम् || ६-४१-९९
हाहाकारमकुर्वन्त राक्षसा भयमागताः |_END
BEGIN_Those miserable demons saw the entire extensive space between the walls and the moat 
being occupied by the monkeys, like unto a second rampart. The demons cried out, "Woe! Alas!" in panic._END

B_6_C_50_6
BEGIN_
विभीषणम् तम् सुग्रीवो दृष्ट्वा वानर भीषणम् |
ऋक्ष राजम् समीपस्थम् जाम्बवन्तम् उवाच ह || ६-५०-८_END
BEGIN_
Observing Vibhishana to be the cause of panic among the monkeys, Sugreeva spoke to
the illustrious Jambavan the king of Bears who stood near (as follows):_END

B_6_C_48_29
BEGIN_
न इमौ शक्यौ रणे जेतुम् स इन्द्रैर् अपि सुर असुरैः |
एतयोर् आननम् दृष्ट्वा मया च आवेदितम् तव || ६-४८-३०_END
BEGIN_
"Even celestials and demons along with Indra cannot vanquish there two heroes in
battle. This is what I have observed and communicated to you."_END

B_6_C_49_23
BEGIN_
कृतम् हनुमता कार्यम् यद् अन्यैर् दुष्करम् रणे |
ऋक्ष राजेन तुष्यामि गो लान्गूल अधिपेन च || ६-४९-२५_END
BEGIN_
"I am fully satisfied by the great military exploit, done by Jambavan the king of
Bears and the General of the Monkeys, which was impossible to any other in battle."_END

B_6_C_41_87
BEGIN_तस्मिन् महा भीषणके प्रवृत्ते |
कोलाहले राक्षस राजधान्याम् |
प्रगृह्य रक्षांसि महा आयुधानि |
युग अन्त वाता;इव सम्विचेरुह् || ६-४१-१००_END
BEGIN_As a result of that appalling tumult in the capital city of the demons, the soldiers 
of Ravana seized hold of their great weapons and sallied forth like the winds that blow at the dissolution 
of the worlds._END

B_6_C_50_7
BEGIN_
विभीषणो अयम् सम्प्राप्तो यम् दृष्ट्वा वानर ऋषभाः |
विद्रवन्ति परित्रस्ता रावण आत्मज शन्कया || ६-५०-९_END
BEGIN_
"It is Vibhishana who has come here. On seeing him, the foremost of monkeys seized
with terror have fled, deeming him to be Indrajit, Ravana's son."_END

B_6_C_48_30
BEGIN_
इदम् च सुमहच् चिह्नम् शनैह् पश्यस्व मैथिलि |
निह्सम्ज्नाव् अप्य् उभाव् एतौ न एव लक्ष्मीर् वियुज्यते || ६-४८-३१_END
BEGIN_
"O Seetha!; See this, a great marvel !; See how, fallen under those shafts and
deprived of their senses, thier beauty has not deserted them."_END

B_6_C_49_24
BEGIN_
अन्गदेन कृतम् कर्म मैन्देन द्विविदेन च |
युद्धम् केसरिणा सम्ख्ये घोरम् सम्पातिना कृतम् || ६-४९-२६_END
BEGIN_
"A great act was done by Angada, Mainda and Dvivida. A terrible combat was done by
Kesari and Sampati in the battle-field."_END

B_6_C_50_8
BEGIN_
शीघ्रम् एतान् सुवित्रस्तान् बहुधा विप्रधावितान् |
पर्यवस्थापय आख्याहि विभीषणम् उपस्थितम् || ६-५०-१०_END
BEGIN_
"You reassemble those monkeys immediately, who in fear have scattered in many
directions and inform them that it is Vibhishana who has come!"_END

B_6_C_48_31
BEGIN_
प्रायेण गत सत्त्वानाम् पुरुषाणाम् गत आयुषाम् |
दृश्यमानेषु वक्त्रेषु परम् भवति वैकृतम् || ६-४८-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Generally, the faces of those who lost their lives and whose vital power has
vanished, will be appearing with an appalling alteration"._END

B_6_C_49_25
BEGIN_
गवयेन गव अक्षेण शरभेण गजेन च |
अन्यैश् च हरिभिर् युद्धम् मद् आर्थे त्यक्त जीवितैः || ६-४९-२७_END
BEGIN_
"By Gavaya, Gavaksha, Sharabha, Gaja and other monkeys, who are willing to sacrifice
their lives for me, the battle was carried on."_END

B_6_C_50_9
BEGIN_
सुग्रीवेण एवम् उक्तस् तु जाम्बवान् ऋक्ष पार्थिवः |
वानरान् सान्त्वयाम् आस सम्निवर्त्य प्रहावतः || ६-५०-११_END
BEGIN_
Thus spoken by Sugreeva, Jambavan the king of Bears called the fugitive monkeys back
and restored them to confidence._END

B_6_C_48_32
BEGIN_
त्यज शोकम् च दुह्खम् च मोहम् च जनक आत्मजे |
राम लक्ष्मणयोर् अर्थे न अद्य शक्यम् अजीवितुम् || ६-४८-३३_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha! Banish your grief, pain and ignorance on account of Rama and Lakshmana.
It is impossible, now with the splendour seen in their faces, for Rama and Lakshmana to die."_END

B_6_C_49_26
BEGIN_
न च अतिक्रमितुम् शक्यम् दैवम् सुग्रीव मानुषैः |
यत् तु शक्यम् वयस्येन सुहृदा वा परम् तप || ६-४९-२८
कृतम् सुग्रीव तत् सर्वम् भवता अधर्म भीरुणा |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Sugreeva! It is not possible for mortals to avoid their destiny. O, Sugreeva the
tormentat of enemies! Fearing to fail in your duty, you have done all that which a friend and a
comrade could do."_END

B_6_C_50_10
BEGIN_
ते निवृत्ताह् पुनह् सर्वे वानरास् त्यक्त सम्भ्रमाः |
ऋक्ष राज वचह् श्रुत्वा तम् च दृष्ट्वा विभीषणम् || ६-५०-१२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Jambavan the king of Bears, all those monkeys, on perceiving
Vibhishana, retraced their steps, shaking off their fear._END

B_6_C_48_33
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा तु वचनम् तस्याह् सीता सुर सुता उपमा |
कृत अन्जलिर् उवाच इदम् एवम् अस्त्व् इति मैथिली || ६-४८-३४_END
BEGIN_
Hearing her words, Seetha, the daughter of Mithila kingdom resembling a daughter of
gods, with joined palms exclaimed, "May it be so."_END

B_6_C_49_27
BEGIN_
मित्र कार्यम् कृतम् इदम् भवद्भिर् वानर ऋषभाः || ६-४९-२९
अनुज्नाता मया सर्वे यथा इष्टम् गन्तुम् अर्हथ |_END
BEGIN_
"O. foremost of Monkyes! You have accomplished all this due to your friendship. I
take leave of you all; go where it seems best to you!"_END

B_6_C_50_11
BEGIN_
विभीषणस् तु रामस्य दृष्ट्वा गात्रम् शरैश् चितम् |
लक्ष्मणस्य च धर्म आत्मा बभूव व्यथित इन्द्रियः || ६-५०-१३_END
BEGIN_
Meanwhile, the virtuous Vibhishana, on beholding Rama's body as also of Lakshmana's
covered with arrows, felt distressed._END

B_6_C_48_34
BEGIN_
विमानम् पुष्पकम् तत् तु समिवर्त्य मनो जवम् |
दीना त्रिजटया सीता लन्काम् एव प्रवेशिता || ६-४८-३५_END
BEGIN_
After sending back that aerial car, Pushpaka which was as swift as the thought, the
sorrowful Seetha was caused by Trijata to enter Lanka once more._END

B_6_C_50_12
BEGIN_
जल क्लिन्नेन हस्तेन तयोर् नेत्रे प्रमृज्य च |
शोक सम्पीडित मना रुरोद विललाप च || ६-५०-१४_END
BEGIN_
Washing their eyes with his hands dipped in water, Vibhishana began to weap, with
anguish seizing his heart and lamented, saying:_END

B_6_C_49_28
BEGIN_
शुश्रुवुस् तस्य ते सर्वे वानराह् परिदेवितम् || ६-४९-३०
वर्तयाम् चक्रुर् अश्रूणि नेत्रैह् कृष्ण इतर ईक्षणाः |_END
BEGIN_
All the tawny eyed monkeys, who heard Rama's lament thus, allowed tears to fall from
their eyes._END

B_6_C_48_35
BEGIN_
ततस् त्रिजटया सार्धम् पुष्पकाद् अवरुह्य सा |
अशोक वनिकाम् एव रक्षसीभिह् प्रवेशिता || ६-४८-३६_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, Seetha along with Trijata who descended from Pshpaka the aerial car,
were caused by the female demons, to enter the Ashoka grove again._END

B_6_C_50_13
BEGIN_
इमौ तौ सत्त्व सम्पन्नौ विक्रान्तौ प्रिय सम्युगौ |
इमाम् अवस्थाम् गमितौ राकसैह् कूट योधिभिः || ६-५०-१५_END
BEGIN_
"These two powerful and valiant warrriors have been brought tot his state by the
demons, the treacherous combatants."_END

B_6_C_49_29
BEGIN_
ततः सर्वाण्य् अनीकानि स्थापयित्वा विभीषणः || ६-४९-३१
आजगाम गदा पाणिस् त्वरितो यत्र राघवः |_END
BEGIN_
Meanwhile, Vibhishana having established order in all the ranks, with mace in his
hand, came quickly to Rama._END

B_6_C_48_36
BEGIN_
प्रविश्य सीता बहु वृक्ष षण्डाम् |
ताम् राक्षस इन्द्रस्य विहार भूमिम् |सम्प्रेक्ष्य संचिन्त्य च राज पुत्रौ |
परम् विषादम् समुपाजगाम || ६-४८-३७_END
BEGIN_
Entering that Ashoka grove, planted with a multitude of trees, sporting ground of
Ravana and recalling the two princes who she had just seen, Seetha gave way to extreme grief._END

B_6_C_50_14
BEGIN_
भ्रातुः पुत्रेण मे तेन दुष्पुत्रेण दुरात्मना |
राक्षस्या जिह्मया बुद्ध्या चलिताव् ऋजु विक्रमौ || ६-५०-१६_END
BEGIN_
"The son of my brother, that wicked youth of perverse soul in his demoniac cunning
mind, has decived those two honourable fighters."_END

B_6_C_49_30
BEGIN_
तम् दृष्ट्वा त्वरितम् यान्तम् नील अन्जन चय उपमम् || ६-४९-३२
वानरा दुद्रुवुह् सर्वे मन्यमानास् तु रावणिम् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing him, who resembled a mass of collyrium, hastening towards them thus, all the
monkeys thinking him to be Indrajit the son of Ravana, fled away._END

B_6_C_50_15
BEGIN_
शरैर् इमाव् अलम् विद्धौ रुधिरेण समुक्षितौ |
वसुधायाम् इम सुप्तौ दृश्येते शल्यकाव् इव || ६-५०-१७_END
BEGIN_
"These two warriors, Rama and Lakshmana, who were struck badly by arrows and covered
with blood are lying on the earth, like two porcupines."_END

B_6_C_50_16
BEGIN_
ययोर् वीर्यम् उपाश्रित्य प्रतिष्ठा कान्क्षिता मया |
ताव् उभौ देह नाशाय प्रसुप्तौ पुरुष ऋषभौ || ६-५०-१८_END
BEGIN_
"These two lions among men, on whom depended the positon aspired by me, are lying
insensible, waiting for the dissolution of the body."_END

B_6_C_50_17
BEGIN_
जीवन्न् अद्य विपन्नो अस्मि नष्ट राज्य मनो रथः |
प्राप्त प्रतिज्नश् च रिपुह् सकामो रावणह् कृतः || ६-५०-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Deprived of the hope now of becoming a king, I am as one dead, eventhough
surviving; while my rival Ravana sees his vow fulfilled and gets his desires realised."_END

B_6_C_50_18
BEGIN_
एवम् विलपमानम् तम् परिष्वज्य विभीषणम् |
सुग्रीवः सत्त्व सम्पन्नो हरि राजो अब्रवीद् इदम् || ६-५०-२०_END
BEGIN_
Then, Sugreeva the magnanimous King of Monkeys embraced that Vibhishana thus
lamenting and spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_50_19
BEGIN_
राज्यम् प्राप्स्यसि धर्मज्न लन्कायाम् न अत्र संशयः |
रावणः सह पुत्रेण स राज्यम् न इह लप्स्यते || ६-५०-२१_END
BEGIN_
"O, knower of what is right! You shall certainly reign over Lanka. Ravana and his
son will not acheive their purpose."_END

B_6_C_50_20
BEGIN_
न रुजापीडिताव् एताव् उभौ राघव लक्ष्मणौ |
त्यक्त्वा मोहम् वधिष्येते सगणम् रावणम् रणे || ६-५०-२२_END
BEGIN_
"The injury done to Rama and Lakshmana is not grave. Emerging from their swoon, they
will destroy Ravana with his hordes in battles."_END

B_6_C_50_21
BEGIN_
तम् एवम् सान्त्वयित्वा तु समाश्वास्य च राक्षसम् |
सुषेणम् श्वशुरम् पार्श्वे सुग्रीवस् तम् उवाच ह || ६-५०-२३_END
BEGIN_
Consoling and convincing Vibhishana thus, Sugreeva spoke to Sushena, his
father-in-law, who was on his side (as follows):_END

B_6_C_50_22
BEGIN_
सह शूरैर् हरि गणैर् लब्ध सम्ज्नाव् अरिम् दमौ |
गच्च त्वम् भ्रातरौ गृह्य किष्किन्धाम् राम लक्ष्मणौ || ६-५०-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Taking these two brothers, Rama and Lakshmana with the troops of monkeys who are
strong, you go to Kishkindha, till these two scourgers of their foes have recovered their
consciousness."_END

B_6_C_50_23
BEGIN_
अहम् तु रावणम् हत्वा सपुत्रम् सह बान्धवम् |
मैथिलीम् आनयिष्यामि शक्रो नष्टाम् इव श्रियम् || ६-५०-२५_END
BEGIN_
"As for me, I shall slay Ravana with his son and his relatives and bring back Seetha
as did Indra the Lord of celestials, the prosperity he had lost."_END

B_6_C_50_24
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा एतद् वानर इन्द्रस्य सुषेणो वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् |
देव असुरम् महा युद्धम् अनुभूतम् सुदारुणम् || ६-५०-२६_END
BEGIN_
"Hearing the words of Sugreeva, Sushena replied as followers: " A highly terrific
and great was between celestials and demons was perceived by me."_END

B_6_C_50_25
BEGIN_
तदा स्म दानवा देवान् शर संस्पर्श कोविदाः |
निजघ्नुः शस्त्र विदुषश् चादयन्तो मुहुर् मुहुः || ६-५०-२७_END
BEGIN_
"By making themselves invisible again and again, the demons skilled in the use of
arrows overcame the celestials despite their skill in bearing arms."_END

B_6_C_50_26
BEGIN_
तान् आर्तान् नष्ट सम्ज्नांश् च पर असूंश् च बृहस्पतिः |
विध्याभिर् मन्त्र युक्ताभिर् ओषधीभिश् चिकित्सति || ६-५०-२८_END
BEGIN_
"To those celestials who were wounded, unconscious and almost deprived of life,
Brihaspati treated them by the aid of herbs accompanied by his spells of sacred formulas."_END

B_6_C_50_27
BEGIN_
तान्य् औषधान्य् आनयितुम् क्षीर उदम् यान्तु सागरम् |
जवेन वानराह् शीघ्रम् सम्पाति पनस आदयः || ६-५०-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Let the monkeys Sampati, Panasa and others go quickly in speed, to the ocean of
milk, to bring those herbs."_END

B_6_C_50_28
BEGIN_
हरयस् तु विजानन्ति पार्वती ते महा ओषधी |
सम्जीव करणीम् दिव्याम् विशल्याम् देव निर्मिताम् || ६-५०-३०_END
BEGIN_
"These monkeys are conversant with those efficacious mountianous herbs - the
celestial Sanjivakarani and Vishalya, which were created by a God."_END

B_6_C_50_29
BEGIN_
चन्द्रसः च नाम द्रोणश् च पर्वतौ सागर उत्तमे |
अमृतम् यत्र मथितम् तत्र ते परम ओषधी || ६-५०-३१_END
BEGIN_
"In the bosom of the milky ocean the best of oceans, rise the mountains called
Chandra and Drona, where the ambrosia was formerly churned. These two excellent herbs exist
there."_END

B_6_C_50_30
BEGIN_
तौ तत्र निहिते देवैः पर्वते परम ओषधी |
अयम् वायु सुतो राजन् हनूमांस् तत्र गच्चतु || ६-५०-३२_END
BEGIN_
"The celestials place dthose two mountain in the vast sea. O, King! Let Hanuman the
son of Wind-God go there."_END

B_6_C_50_31
BEGIN_
एतस्मिन्न् अन्तरे वायुर् मेघांश् च अपि सविद्युतः |
पर्यस्यन् सागरे तोयम् कम्पयन्न् इव पर्वतान् || ६-५०-३३_END
BEGIN_
In the meantime, a great wind arose, accompanied by massed clouds and lightning,
whipping up the salty waves in the ocean, causing the mountains to tremble as from an
earthquake._END

B_6_C_50_32
BEGIN_
महता पक्ष वातेन सर्वे द्वीप महा द्रुमाः |
निपेतुर् भग्न विटपाः समूला लवण अम्भसि || ६-५०-३४_END
BEGIN_
"Large trees on the sand-banks had their branches broken by the mighty stroke of
Vata's wings and fell headlong into the briny waters of the ocean."_END

B_6_C_50_33
BEGIN_
अभवन् पन्नगास् त्रस्ता भोगिनस् तत्र वासिनः |
शीघ्रम् सर्वाणि यादांसि जग्मुश् च लवण अर्णवम् || ६-५०-३५_END
BEGIN_
"The snakes became frightened. The snakes inhabiting there and all the marine
animals plunged quickly into the briny ocean."_END

B_6_C_50_34
BEGIN_
ततो मुहूर्तद् गरुडम् वैनतेयम् महा बलम् |
वानरा ददृशुः सर्वे ज्वलन्तम् इव पावकम् || ६-५०-३६_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, all the monkeys saw within a moment, a mighty eagle, Garuda, the son of
Vinata, like unto a blazing torch._END

B_6_C_50_35
BEGIN_
तम् आगतम् अभिप्रेक्ष्य नागास् ते विप्रदुद्रुवुः |
यैस् तौ सत् पुरुषौ बद्धौ शर भूतैर् महा बलौ || ६-५०-३७_END
BEGIN_
On beholding Garuda the eagle which came there, the serpants who bound those two
warriors Rama and Lakshmana in the form of mighty arrows, fled away._END

B_6_C_50_36
BEGIN_
ततः सुपर्णह् काकुत्स्थौ दृष्ट्वा प्रत्यभिनन्द्य च |
विममर्श च पाणिभ्याम् मुखे चन्द्र सम प्रभे || ६-५०-३८_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Garuda the eagle, coming into contact iwth Rama and Lakshmana d offering
them his good wishes, with his hands caressly touched their faces that were radiant like the
moon._END

B_6_C_50_37
BEGIN_
वैनतेयेन संस्पृष्टास् तयोह् सम्रुरुहुर् व्रणाः |
सुवर्णे च तनू स्निग्धे तयोर् आशु बभूवतुः || ६-५०-३९_END
BEGIN_
Their wounds, touched by Garuda the eagle, were healed. Their bodies soon became
smooth and well-rounded._END

B_6_C_50_38
BEGIN_
तेजो वीर्यम् बलम् च ओज;उत्साहश् च महा गुणाः |
प्रदर्शनम् च बुद्धिश् च स्मृतिश् च द्विगुणम् तयोः || ६-५०-४०_END
BEGIN_
Their lustre, valour, strength, endurance and resolution, those great qualities,
also their perspicacity, intelligence and memory were re-doubled._END

B_6_C_50_39
BEGIN_
ताव् उत्थाप्य महा वीर्यौ गरुडो वासव उपमौ |
उभौ तौ सस्वजे हृष्टौ रामश् च एनम् उवाच ह || ६-५०-४१_END
BEGIN_
Lifting them up both who were like Indra, the highly majestic Garuda the eagle
embraced them. Rama also, being pleased, spoke to him (as follows):_END

B_6_C_50_40
BEGIN_
भवत् प्रसादाद् व्यसनम् रावणि प्रभवम् महत् |
आवाम् इह व्यतिक्रान्तौ शीघ्रम् च बलिनौ कृतौ || ६-५०-४२_END
BEGIN_
"Now, by your grace, we both have overcome a great disaster created by Indrajit the
son of Ravana. We have been made strong as before."_END

B_6_C_50_41
BEGIN_
यथा तातम् दशरथम् यथा अजम् च पितामहम् |
तथा भवन्तम् आसाद्य हृषयम् मे प्रसीदति || ६-५०-४३_END
BEGIN_
"By meeting you thus, my heart is gladdened in the same manner as I am meeting
Dasaratha, my fatehr and Aja, my paternal grandfather."_END

B_6_C_50_42
BEGIN_
को भवान् रूप सम्पन्नो दिव्य स्रग् अनुलेपनः |
वसानो विरजे वस्त्रे दिव्य आभरण भूषितः || ६-५०-४४_END
BEGIN_
"Who are you, the one endowed with beauty, having blissful garlands and anointments,
wearing clean garments and adorned iwth divine ornaments?"_END

B_6_C_50_43
BEGIN_
तम् उवाच महा तेजा वैनतेयो महा बलः |
पतत्रि राजह् प्रीत आत्मा हर्ष पर्याकुल ईक्षणः || ६-५०-४५_END
BEGIN_
The highly majestic and the mighty Garuda the eagle, the King of Birds, with his eys
widened in gladness and with a pleased heart, spoke to Rama as follows:_END

B_6_C_51_0
BEGIN_
तेषाम् सुतुमुलम् शब्दम् वानराणाम् तरस्विनाम् |
नर्दताम् राक्षसैह् सार्धम् तदा शुश्राव रावणः || ६-५१-१_END
BEGIN_
That tumultuous sound, set up by the monkeys who were full of martial ardour,
arrested the attention of Ravana and his demons._END

B_6_C_50_44
BEGIN_
अहम् सखा ते काकुत्स्थ प्रियह् प्राणो बहिश् चरः |
गरुत्मान् इह सम्प्राप्तो युवयोह् साह्य कारणात् || ६-५०-४६_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! I am your dearest friend Garuda dear as your own breath moving outside I
came here for the purpose of helping you, both."_END

B_6_C_51_1
BEGIN_
स्निग्ध गम्भीर निर्घोषम् श्रुत्वा स निनदम् भृशम् |
सचिवानाम् ततस् तेषाम् मध्ये वचनम् अब्रवीत् || ६-५१-२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that mighty clamour, sounding smooth and deep, Ravana spoke to his ministers
who surrounded him._END

B_6_C_50_45
BEGIN_
असुरा वा महा वीर्या दानवा वा महा बलाः |
सुरासः च अपि सगन्धर्वाह् पुरस् कृत्य शत क्रतुम् || ६-५०-४७
नेमम् मोक्षयितुम् शक्ताह् शर बन्धम् सुदारुणम् |
माया बलाद् इन्द्रजिता निर्मितम् क्रूर कर्मणा || ६-५०-४८_END
BEGIN_
"Either the most valiant demons or the exceedingly strong monkeys or the celestials
together with the celestial musicians having Devendra the Lord of celestials in their forefront are
unable to untie this awfully terrific entanglement of arrows created through his power of sorcery
by Indrajit of terrific deeds."_END

B_6_C_51_2
BEGIN_
यथा असौ सम्प्रहृष्टानाम् वानराणाम् समुत्थितः |
बहूनाम् सुमहान् नादो मेघानाम् इव गर्जताम् || ६-५१-३
व्यक्तम् सुमहती प्रीतिर् एतेषाम् न अत्र संशयः |
तथा हि विपुलैर् नादैश् चुक्षुभे वरुण आलयः || ६-५१-४_END
BEGIN_
"A great uproar, resembling the rumbling of clouds, has arisen from that horde of
rejoiced monkeys. Undoubtedly their joy is great, their mighty roars are agitating the briny ocean
itself._END

B_6_C_51_3
BEGIN_
तौ तु बद्धौ शरैस् तीष्क्णैर् भ्रातरौ राम लक्ष्मणौ |
अयम् च सुमहान् नादह् शन्काम् जनयति इव मे || ६-५१-५_END
BEGIN_
"Those two brothers Rama and Lakshmana were tied by sharp arrows. This sound of a
great magnitude being heard by me, is begetting an apprehension in me."_END

B_6_C_50_46
BEGIN_
एते नागाह् काद्रवेयास् तीक्ष्ण दम्ष्ट्रा विष उल्बणाः |
रक्षो माया प्रभावेन शरा भूत्वा त्वद् आश्रिताः || ६-५०-४९_END
BEGIN_
"These serpents, which took their base at, were none other than the sons of Kadru
with their sharp fangs, abundantly filled with poison, transformed into arrows, by the dint of
sorcery by Indrajit the demon."_END

B_6_C_51_4
BEGIN_
एवम् च वचनम् च उक्त्वा मन्त्रिणो राक्षस ईश्वरः |
उवाच नैरृतांस् तत्र समीप परिवर्तिनः || ६-५१-६_END
BEGIN_
Having spoken thus to his ministers, Ravana the Lord of Demons said to his demons
who stood round him there (as follows)_END

B_6_C_50_47
BEGIN_
सभाग्यसः च असि धर्मज्न राम सत्य पराक्रम |
लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा समरे रिपु घातिना || ६-५०-५०_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama the knower of righeousness and true to your promise! You, along with your
brother Lakshmana the annihilator of enemies, indeed are lucky."_END

B_6_C_52_0
BEGIN_
धूम्र अक्षम् प्रेक्ष्य निर्यान्तम् राक्षसम् भीम निस्वनम् |
विनेदुर् वानराह् सर्वे प्रहृष्टा युद्ध कान्क्षिणः || ६-५२-१_END
BEGIN_
Beholding the demon, Dhumraksha of terrible prowess coming forth, all the monkeys
waiting for the war, roared with joy._END

B_6_C_51_5
BEGIN_
ज्नायताम् तूर्णम् एतषाम् सर्वेषाम् वन चारिणाम् |
शोक काले समुत्पन्ने हर्ष कारणम् उत्थितम् || ६-५१-७_END
BEGIN_
"You immediately discover from what cause this general rejoicing among all these
monkeys coming for the their present grievous situation!'_END

B_6_C_50_48
BEGIN_
इमम् श्रुत्वा तु वृत्त अन्तम् त्वरमाणो अहम् आगतः |
सहसा युवयोह् स्नेहात् सखित्वम् अनुपालयन् || ६-५०-५१_END
BEGIN_
"Hearing about this incident, I have hastened all at once, duly cherishing the love
and friendship (for you)."_END

B_6_C_52_1
BEGIN_
तेषाम् तु तुमुलम् युद्धम् सम्जज्ने हरि रक्षसाम् |
अन्योन्यम् पादपैर् घोरैर् निघ्नतम् शूल मुद्गरैः || ६-५२-२_END
BEGIN_
A highly tumultuous battle was seen between those monkeys and demons, who were
slaying each other, with terrible trees, lances and maces._END

B_6_C_50_49
BEGIN_
मोक्षितौ च महा घोराद् अस्मात् सायक बन्धनात् |
अप्रमादसः च कर्तव्यो युवाभ्याम् नित्यम् एव हि || ६-५०-५२_END
BEGIN_
"You have been released from this quite terrific shackle of arrows. Both of you
should maintain vigilance, all the time."_END

B_6_C_51_6
BEGIN_
तथा उक्तास् तेन सम्भ्रान्ताह् प्राकारम् अधिरुह्य ते |
ददृशुह् पालिताम् सेनाम् सुग्रीवेण महात्मना || ६-५१-८
तौ च मुक्तौ सुघोरेण शर बन्धेन राघवौ |
समुत्थितौ महा भागौ विषेदुह् प्रेक्ष्य राक्षसाः || ६-५१-९_END
BEGIN_
Thus commanded by Ravana, they mounted the rampart very briskly and saw the army
lead by the high-souled Sugreeva and also the highly fortunate Rama and Lakshmana who were relieved
of the terrific shackle of arrow a and risen up together. All the demons felt desponded on seeing
it._END

B_6_C_52_2
BEGIN_
राक्षसैर् वानरा घोरा विनिकृत्ताह् समन्ततः |
वानरै राक्षसाश् च अपि द्रुमैर् भूमौ समी कृताः || ६-५२-३_END
BEGIN_
The terrible monkeys were moved down on all sides by the demons. The demon too were
levelled down to the earth with trees by the monkeys._END

B_6_C_51_7
BEGIN_
सम्त्रस्त हृदया सर्वे प्राकाराद् अवरुह्य ते |
विवर्ण रक्षनाः घोरा राक्षस इन्द्रम् उपस्थिताः || ६-५१-१०_END
BEGIN_
With their hearts trembling with fear and faces turning pale, all those terrific
demons descended from the rampart and approached Ravana._END

B_6_C_50_50
BEGIN_
प्रकृत्या राक्षसाह् सर्वे सम्ग्रामे कूट योधिनः |
शूराणाम् शुद्ध भावानाम् भवताम् आर्जवम् बलम् || ६-५०-५३_END
BEGIN_
"All the demons by their very nature are treacherous fighters in battle. For you,
the warriors, your pue-mindedness and straight forwardeness are the strengths."_END

B_6_C_52_3
BEGIN_
राक्षसाश् च अपि सम्क्रुद्धा वानरान् निशितैह् शरैः |
विव्यधुर् घोर सम्काशैह् कन्क पत्रैर् अजिह्मगैः || ६-५२-४_END
BEGIN_
Enraged with anger, the demons, on their part, paralyzed the monkeys with sharp and
frightful arrows, going as straight as wings of eagle._END

B_6_C_51_8
BEGIN_
तद् अप्रियम् दीन मुखा रावणस्य निशा चराः |
कृत्स्नम् निवेदयाम् आसुर् यथावद् वाक्य कोविदाः || ६-५१-११_END
BEGIN_
With downcast faces, those demons skilled in speech, faithfully informed Ravana of
those unpleasant tidings, saying:_END

B_6_C_50_51
BEGIN_
तन् न विश्वसितव्यम् वो राक्षसानाम् रण अजिरे |
एतेन एव उपमानेन नित्य जिह्मा हि राक्षसाः || ६-५०-५४_END
BEGIN_
"What Indrajit has done, exemplifies how the demons are always crooked-minded. For
this reason, you should not trust the demons in battle."_END

B_6_C_52_4
BEGIN_
ते गदाभिसः च भीमाभिह् पट्टसैह् कूट मुद्गरैः |
घोरैसः च परिघैसः चित्रैस् त्रिशूलैसः च अपि संशितैः || ६-५३-५
विदार्यमाणा रक्षोभिर् वानरास् ते महा बलाः |
अमर्षाज् जनित उद्धर्षासः चक्रुः कर्माण्य् अभीतवत् || ६-५२-६_END
BEGIN_
While being torn asunder by the demons with terrible maces, spears, hammers,
frightful iron bars and variegated tridents, the mighty monkeys fearlessly accomplished their tasks
with an excitement born of anger._END

B_6_C_51_9
BEGIN_
यौ ताव् इन्द्रजिता युद्धे भ्रातरौ राम लक्ष्मणौ |
निबद्धौ शर बन्धेन निष्प्रकम्प भुजौ कृतौ || ६-५१-१२
विमुक्तौ शर बन्धेन तौ दृश्येते रण अजिरे |
पाशान् इव गजाउ चित्त्वा गज इन्द्र सम विक्रमौ || ६-५१-१३_END
BEGIN_
"The two brothers, Rama and Lakshmana, whom Indrajit had bound with his benumbing
shafts and whose arms he had pinioned, are free from the arrows which paralyzed them and now appear
on the field of battle, as two strong elephants who have snapped their fetters."_END

B_6_C_50_52
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा ततो रामम् सुपर्णह् सुमहा बलः |
परिष्वज्य सुहृत् स्निग्धम् आप्रष्टुम् उपचक्रमे || ६-५०-५५_END
BEGIN_
That mighty Garuda, having spoken thus to Rama then and having affectionately
embraced him, began to take leave of him._END

B_6_C_52_5
BEGIN_
शर निर्भिन्न गात्रास् ते शूल निर्भिन्न देहिनः |
जगृहुस् ते द्रुमांस् तत्र शिलाश् च हरि यूथपाः || ६-५२-७_END
BEGIN_
While their bodies were split up by the tridents and their limbs broken by arrows,
those leaders of monkeys took up trees and rocks there to fight._END

B_6_C_51_10
BEGIN_
तत् श्रुत्वा वचनम् तेषाम् राक्षस इन्द्रो महा बलः |
चिन्ता शोक समाक्रान्तो विषण्ण वदनो अब्रवीत् || ६-५१-१४_END
BEGIN_
Hearing their words, the might Ravana was filled with anxiety and fury. His face
became pale (and he spoke as follows):_END

B_6_C_50_53
BEGIN_
सखे राघव धर्मज्न रिपूणाम् अपि वत्सल |
अभ्यनुज्नातुम् इच्चामि गमिष्यामि यथा आगतम् || ६-५०-५६_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama the knower of piety, affectionate even towards your enemies and my dear
fried! I wish to take leave of you." I shall proceed happily."_END

B_6_C_52_6
BEGIN_
ते भीम वेगा हरयो नर्दमानास् ततस् ततः |
ममन्थू राक्षसान् भीमान् नामानि च बभाषिरे || ६-५२-८_END
BEGIN_
Those terribly swift monkeys, roaring aloud harassed the valiant demons at all
places, by calling out their names._END

B_6_C_51_11
BEGIN_
घोरैर् दत्त वरैर् बद्धौ शरैर् आशी विष उमपैः |
अमोघैह् सूर्य सम्काशैह् प्रमथ्य इन्द्रजिता युधि || ६-५१-१५
तम् अस्त्र बन्धम् आसाद्य यदि मुक्तौ रिपू मम |
संशयस्थम् इदम् सर्वम् अनुपश्याम्य् अहम् बलम् || ६-५१-१६_END
BEGIN_
"If my adversaries, having thus been bound by Indrajit are freed, despite their
injuries in battle by his formidable arrows which were infallible those rare boons, resembling
serpents, bright as the sun, I perceive my entire army in jeopardy."_END

B_6_C_52_7
BEGIN_
तद् बभूव अद्भुतम् घोरम् युद्धम् वानर रक्षसाम् |
शिलाभिर् विविधाभिश् च बहु शाखैश् च पादपैः || ६-५२-९_END
BEGIN_
That awful battle with all kinds of rocks and trees furnished with many branches
between monkeys and demons appeared wonderful._END

B_6_C_50_54
BEGIN_
न च कौतूहलम् कार्यम् सखित्वम् प्रति काङ्क्षिणा |
कृतकर्मा रणे वीर क्\sakhitvam प्रतिवेत्स्यसि || ६-५०-५७_END
BEGIN_
"O, hero! You need not be so curious to know the casue of my friendship. You will
know of it, once you have accomplished success in battle."_END

B_6_C_51_12
BEGIN_
निष्फलाह् खलु सम्वृत्ताह् शरा वासुकि तेजसः |
आदत्तम् यैस् तु सम्ग्रामे रिपूणाम् मम जीवितम् || ६-५१-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Those very arrows, bright as fire, which in battle have taken the life of my
enemies, have now been rendered void indeed!"_END

B_6_C_52_8
BEGIN_
राक्षसा मथिताह् केचिद् वानरैर् जित काशिभिः |
ववर्षू रुधिरम् केचिन् मुखै रुधिर भोजनाः || ६-५२-१०_END
BEGIN_
Some demons were crushed by monkeys, who conquered fear and some blood-sucking
demons vomited blood from their mouths._END

B_6_C_50_55
BEGIN_
बाल वृद्ध अवशेषाम् तु लन्काम् कृत्वा शर ऊर्मिभिः |
रावणम् च रिपुम् हत्वा सीताम् समुपलप्स्यसे || ६-५०-५८_END
BEGIN_
"When, under the flutter of your arrows, Lanka has been destroyed save for the aged
and the children and you have slain Ravana,. your enemy, you will bring back Seetha."_END

B_6_C_51_13
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा तु सम्क्रुद्धो निश्वसन्न् उरगो यथा |
अब्रवीद् रक्षसाम् मध्ये धूम्र अक्षम् नाम राकसम् || ६-५१-१८_END
BEGIN_
Having spoken thus in furious tones, hissing like a snake, he addressed a demon
called Dhumraksha who was seated amidst the demons and said._END

B_6_C_52_9
BEGIN_
पार्श्वेषु दारिताह् केचित् केचिद् राशी कृता द्रुमैः |
शिलाभिसः चूर्णिताः केचित् केचिद् दन्तैर् विदारिताः || ६-५२-११_END
BEGIN_
Some demons were slashed open at their sides. Some were formed into a heap by the
trees. Some others were crushed by stones and yet others torn to pieces by the monkeys teeth._END

B_6_C_50_56
BEGIN_
इत्य् एवम् उक्त्वा वचनम् सुपर्णह् शीघ्र विक्रमः |
रामम् च विरुजम् कृत्वा मध्ये तेषाम् वन ओकसाम् || ६-५०-५९
प्रदक्षिणम् ततह् कृत्वा परिष्वज्य च वीर्यवान् |
जगाम आकाशम् आविश्य सुपर्णह् पवनो यथा || ६-५०-६०_END
BEGIN_
Having spoken thus, Garuda of swift flight, having beautiful wings, who had just
healed Rama's wounds in the presence of monkeys, having paid obeisance presence of monkeys, having
paid obeisance to him (by circumambulation) and taken him into his arms, entered the sky with the
speed of the wind._END

B_6_C_51_14
BEGIN_
बलेन महता युक्तो रक्षसाम् भीम कर्मणाम् |
त्वम् वधाय अभिनिर्याहि रामस्य सह वानरैः || ६-५१-१९_END
BEGIN_
"You, with a terrific prowess, go quickly with a considerable force of demons and
slay Rama, Lakshmana and his monkeys."_END

B_6_C_52_10
BEGIN_
ध्वजैर् विमथितैर् भग्नैः खरैश् च विनिपातितैः |
रथैर् विध्वंसितैसः च अपि पतितै रजनी चरैः || ६-५२-१२_END
BEGIN_
With their standards crushed and broken, their swords snapped and their chariots
overturned, some demons were perturbed._END

B_6_C_50_57
BEGIN_
निरुजौ राघवौ दृष्ट्वा ततो वानर यूथपाः |
सिम्ह नादांस् तदा नेदुर् लान्गूलम् दुधुवुश् च ते || ६-५०-६१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Rama and Lakshmana healed of their wounds, the cheifs of monkeys haowled like
roars of lions and lashed their tails._END

B_6_C_51_15
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्तस् तु धूम्र अक्षो राक्षस इन्द्रेण धीमता |
कृत्वा प्रणामम् सम्हृष्टो निर्जगाम नृप आलयात् || ६-५१-२०_END
BEGIN_
Thus commanded by Ravana, the intelligent Dhumraksha, going past from there, quickly
departed front her royal palace._END

B_6_C_50_58
BEGIN_
ततो भेरीः समाजघ्नुर् मृदन्गांश् च व्यनादयन् |
दध्मुः शन्खान् सम्प्रहृष्टाह् क्ष्वेलन्त्य् अपि यथा पुरम् || ६-५०-६२_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, gongs were beaten, drums resounded, and couches were blown amid jumping
in joy of the monkeys as before._END

B_6_C_52_11
BEGIN_
गजेन्द्रैः पर्वताकारैः पर्वताग्रैर्वनौकसाम् |
मथितैर्वाजिभिः कीर्णम् सारोहैर्वसुधातलम् || ६-५२-१३_END
BEGIN_
Crushed by the great rocks of monkeys, the earth was scattered with corpses of great
elephants resembling hills and horses with their riders._END

B_6_C_53_0
BEGIN_
धूम्राक्षं निहतम् दृष्ट्वा रावणो राक्षसेश्वरः |
क्रोधेन महताविष्टो निःश्वसन्नुरगो यथा || ६-५३-१
दीर्घमुष्टं विनिःश्वस्य क्रोधेन कलुषीकृतः |
अब्रवीदाक्षसं क्रूरं वज्रदंष्ट्रं महाबलम् || ६-५३-२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the death of Dhumraksha, Ravana the King of demons was possessed of anger
and began to hiss like a serpent. Polluted by anger, with long and burning sighs, he addressed the
cruel and mighty Vajradamshtra, a demon (as follows)_END

B_6_C_51_16
BEGIN_
अभिनिष्क्रम्य तद् द्वारम् बल अध्यक्षम् उवाच ह |
त्वरयस्व बलम् तूर्णम् किम् चिरेण युयुत्सतः || ६-५१-२१_END
BEGIN_
Having crossed that gate, he spoke to the General of the Forces as follows:
"Mobilize the army. Hasten quickly. What need is there for the delay?"_END

B_6_C_50_59
BEGIN_
आपरे आस्फोट्य विक्रान्ता वानरा नग योधिनः |
द्रुमान् उत्पाट्य विविधांस् तस्थुह् शत सहस्रशः || ६-५०-६३_END
BEGIN_
Some other strong monkeys who use trees as maces in battle, waving their arms and
uprooting hundreds and thousands of various trees, stood there, ready for the battle._END

B_6_C_53_1
BEGIN_
गच्छत्वं वीर निर्याहि राक्षनैः परिवारितः |
जहि दाशरथिं रामं सुग्रीवं वानरैः सह || ६-५३-३_END
BEGIN_
"O, warrior! Go ahead as the head of the demons and slay Rama the son of Dasaratha,
as also Sugreeva and his monkeys!"_END

B_6_C_52_12
BEGIN_
वानरैर् भीम विक्रान्तैर् आप्लुत्य आप्लुत्य वेगितैः |
राक्षसाः करजैस् तीक्ष्णैर् मुखेषु विनिकर्तिताः || ६-५२-१४_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys of terrific prowess rushed upon the demons, flinging themselves upon
them with great bounds horizontically and vertically and scratching their faces with their sharp
nails._END

B_6_C_51_17
BEGIN_
धूम्र अक्षस्य वचह् श्रुत्वा बल अध्यक्षो बल अनुगः |
बलम् उद्योजयाम् आस रावणस्य आज्नया द्रुतम् || ६-५१-२२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Dhumraksha, the general of forces, having the army which
followed him, kept the army ready quickly, as per Ravana's command._END

B_6_C_50_60
BEGIN_
विसृजन्तो महा नादांस् त्रासयन्तो निशा चरान् |
लन्का द्वाराण्य् उपाजग्मुर् योद्धु कामाह् प्लवम् गमाः || ६-५०-६४_END
BEGIN_
Uttering great noises, frightning the demons and desirous to fight, the monkeys
reached the gates of Lanka._END

B_6_C_52_13
BEGIN_
विवर्ण वदना भूयो विप्रकीर्ण शिरो रुहाः |
मूढाः शोणित गन्धेन निपेतुर् धरणी तले || ६-५२-१५_END
BEGIN_
With their faces dejected very much, their hair torn out and maddened by the smell
of blood, those demons fell on the ground._END

B_6_C_53_2
BEGIN_
तथेत्युक्त्वा क्रुततरं मायावी राक्षसेश्वरः |
निर्जगाम बलैः सार्थं बहुभिः परिवारितः || ६-५३-४
नागैरश्वैः खरैरुष्ट्रैः संयुक्तः सुसमाहितः |
पताकाध्वजचित्रैश्च रथैश्च समलंकृतः || ६-५३-५_END
BEGIN_
"So it be" answered the leader of the demons who was a conjurer and departed with
many divisions of the army that surrounded him. With the utmost attention, he assembled teams of
elephants, horses mules camels and chariots adorning them with conspicuous flags and banners and he
himself was well-prepared._END

B_6_C_51_18
BEGIN_
ते बद्ध घण्टा बलिनो घोर रूपा निशा चराः |
विनर्दमानाह् सम्हृष्टा धूम्र अक्षम् पर्यवारयन् || ६-५१-२३_END
BEGIN_
Those strong demons of terrific form, making sounds with bells hung on their bodies,
joyously surrounded Dhumraksha._END

B_6_C_50_61
BEGIN_
ततस् तु भीमस् तुमुलो निनादो ततस् तु भीमस् तुमुलो निनादो |
बभूव शाखा मृग यूथपानाम् |
क्षये निदाघस्य यथा घनानाम् |
नादह् सुभीमो नदताम् निशीथे || ६-५०-६५_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, a highly terrible and tumuluous sound arose among the leaders of the
monkeys, as, at the end of summer the roaring of thunder clouds in the mid-night._END

B_6_C_52_14
BEGIN_
नये तु परम क्रुद्धा राक्षसा भीम विक्रमाः |
तलैर् एव अभिधावन्ति वज्र स्पर्श समैर् हरीन् || ६-५२-१६_END
BEGIN_
Some other demons of exceeding valour, who were enraged, very much, ran up towards
the monkeys to attack them with their palms having a diamond-like blow._END

B_6_C_53_3
BEGIN_
ततो विचित्रकेयूरमुकुटेन विभूषितः |
तनुत्रं च समावृत्य सधनुर्निर्ययौ द्रुतम् || ६-५३-६_END
BEGIN_
Adorned with colourful bracelets and a diadem, Vajradamshtra set out immediately,
wielding a bow and well-covered by an armour._END

B_6_C_51_19
BEGIN_
विविध आयुध हस्ताश् च शूल मुद्गर पाणयः |
गदाभिह् पट्टसैर् दण्डैर् आयसैर् मुसलैर् भृशम् || ६-५१-२४
परिघैर् भिण्डि पालैश् च भल्लैह् प्रासैह् परश्वधैः |
निर्ययू राक्षसा घोरा नर्दन्तो जलदा यथा || ६-५१-२५_END
BEGIN_
Furnished with every kind of weapon, brandishing spears, hammers, maces, harpoons,
sticks, iron cudgels, bars, clubs, javelins, missiles, nooses and axes, those terrible demons
sallied forth with the noise of thunder._END

B_6_C_52_15
BEGIN_
वनरैर् आपतन्तस् ते वेगिता वेगवत्तरैः |
मुष्टिभिसः चरणैर् दन्तैः पादपैसः चाप पोथिताः || ६-५२-१७_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys, receiving that sharp shock, with even a greater ferocity, crushed the
demons with blows of their fists, feet teeth and trees._END

B_6_C_53_4
BEGIN_
पताकालंकृतं दीप्तं तप्तकाञ्चनभूषितम् |
रथम् प्रदक्षिणम् कृत्वा समारोहच्चमूपतिः || ६-५३-७_END
BEGIN_
That army-general circumambulated and ascended his chariot, duly decorated with
flags and shiningly adorned with purpose._END

B_6_C_51_20
BEGIN_
रथैह् कवचिनस् त्व् अन्ये ध्वजैश् च समलम्कृतैः |
सुवर्ण जाल विहितैह् खरैश् च विविध आननैः || ६-५१-२६
हयैः परम शीघ्रैश् च गज इन्द्रैश् च मद उत्कटैः |
निर्ययू राक्षस व्याघ्रा व्याघ्रा;इव दुरासदाः || ६-५१-२७_END
BEGIN_
Clad in mail, mounted on chariots that were magnificently dressed with flags and
decorated with bands of pure gold, harnessed to mules of many heads or steeds of exceeding
fleetness or elephants in furious rut, some other excellent demons went forth like veritable
tigers._END

B_6_C_52_16
BEGIN_
सन्यम् तु विद्रुतम् दृष्ट्वा धूम्र अक्षो राक्षस ऋषभः |
रोषेण कदनम् चक्रे वानराणाम् युयुत्सताम् || ६-५२-१८_END
BEGIN_
Seeing his army routed, Dhumraksha that lion among the demons, in his anger began to
create a blood-shed of the monkeys wishing to fight._END

B_6_C_53_5
BEGIN_
यष्टिभिस्तोमरैश्चित्रैः श्लक्ष्लैश्च मुसलैरपि |
भिन्दिपालैश्च चापैश्च शक्तिभिः पट्टिशैरपि || ६-५३-८
खड्गैश्चक्रैर्गदाभिश्च निशितैश्च परश्वधैः |
पदातयश्च निर्यान्ति विविधाः शस्त्रपाणयः || ६-५३-९_END
BEGIN_
Infantry of every kind issued forth, furnished in their hands with weapons such as
clubs, excellent javelins, smooth pestles, harpoons, bows, lances, spears, swords, discus, maces
and sharp axes._END

B_6_C_51_21
BEGIN_
मृग सिम्ह मुखैर् युक्तम् खरैह् कनक भूषणैः |
आरुरोह रथम् दिव्यम् धूम्र अक्षह् खर निस्वनः || ६-५१-२८_END
BEGIN_
Dhumraksha, with a mule-like clatter, set out in a celestial chariot to which mules
adorned with gold and heads of deer and lions were hitched._END

B_6_C_53_6
BEGIN_
विचित्रवाससः सर्वे दीप्ता राक्षसपुङ्गवाः |
गज मदोत्कटाः शूराश्चलन्त इव पर्वता || ६-५३-१०_END
BEGIN_
All those excellent demons in their resplendent and coloured uniforms, full of
strength and mounted on elephants furious with rut, resembled moving mountains._END

B_6_C_52_17
BEGIN_
प्रासैः प्रमथिताः केचिद् वानराः शोणित स्रवाः |
मुद्गरैर् आहताः केचित् पतिता धरणी तले || ६-५२-१९_END
BEGIN_
Some monkeys pierced with spears lost rivers of blood while others struck down by
blows of axe, fell to the earth's surface._END

B_6_C_51_22
BEGIN_
स निर्यातो महा वीर्यो धूम्र अक्षो राक्षसैर् वृतः |
प्रहसन् पश्चिम द्वारम् हनूमान् यत्र यूथपः || ६-५१-२९_END
BEGIN_
That Dhumraksha of mighty prowess, surrounded by demons, set forth amidst mocking
laughter, through the western gate where the army-chief Hanuman was stationed._END

B_6_C_53_7
BEGIN_
ते युद्धकुशला रूढास्तोमराङ्कुवाः |
अन्ये लक्षणसंयुक्ताः शूरारूढा महाबलाः || ६-५३-११_END
BEGIN_
All those excellent demons in their resplendent and coloured uniforms, full of
strength and mounted on elephants furious with rut, resembled moving mountains._END

B_6_C_52_18
BEGIN_
परिघैर् मथितह् केचिद् भिण्डि पालैर् विदारिताः |
पट्टसैर् आहताह् केचिद् विह्वलन्तो गत असवः || ६-५२-२०_END
BEGIN_
Some were crushed by iron bars, others torn by harpoons, some others pierced by
javelins, all exhausted and lost their lives._END

B_6_C_51_23
BEGIN_
रथप्रवरमास्थाय खरयुक्तं खरस्वनम् |
प्रयान्तम् तु महा घोरम् राक्षसम् भीम दर्शनम् || ६-५१-३०
अन्तरिक्ष गताह् क्रूराह् शकुनाह् प्रत्यवारयन् |_END
BEGIN_
As he mounted and advanced in an excellent chariot harnessed to mules, whose voices
he emulated, birds of ill-omen in the sky obstructed that advancing demon of very terrible and
fearful appearance._END

B_6_C_53_8
BEGIN_
तद्राक्षसबलं सर्वं विप्रस्थितमशोभत |
प्रावृट्काले यथा मेघा नर्दमानाः सविद्युतः || ६-५३-१२
निःसृता दक्षिणद्वारादङ्गदो यत्र यूथपः |_END
BEGIN_
That whole army of demons paraded, looking as brilliant as the clouds, with
lightning and sound in the rainy season. They emerged from the southern gate where the General
Angada is stationed._END

B_6_C_52_19
BEGIN_
केचिद् विनिहता भूमौ रुधिर आर्द्रा वन ओकसः |
केचिद् विद्राविता नष्टाह् सम्क्रुद्धै राक्षसैर् युधि || ६-५२-२१_END
BEGIN_
Slain in battle by infuriated demons, some monkeys, drenched with blood, fell on the
ground and some others disappeared, having been driven away._END

B_6_C_51_24
BEGIN_
रथ शीर्षे महा भीमो गृध्रश् च निपपात ह || ६-५१-३१
ध्वज अग्रे ग्रथिताश् चैव निपेतुह् कुणप अशनाः |_END
BEGIN_
A highly terrible vulture alighted on the top of his chariot, while those devourers
of corpses clustered on the point of his standard._END

B_6_C_52_20
BEGIN_
विभिन्न हृदयाः केचिद् एक पार्श्वेन शायिताः |
विदारित अस्त्र शूलै च केचिद् आन्त्रैर् विनिस्रुताः || ६-५२-२२_END
BEGIN_
With pierced hearts, some monkeys were made to lie down on one side. Some were torn
asunder by tridents that even their intestines came out._END

B_6_C_53_9
BEGIN_
तेषां निष्क्रममाणानामशुभं समजायत || ६-५३-१३
आकाशाद्विघनात्तीव्रादुल्मुका न्यपतंस्तदा |
वमन्तः पावकज्वालाः शिवा घोरा ववाशिरे || ६-५३-१४_END
BEGIN_
While those demons set forth, inauspicious portents appeared. From a cloudless yet
burning sky, meteors fell. Fearful jackals, emitting their howls, belched forth flames and
fire._END

B_6_C_51_25
BEGIN_
रुधिर आर्द्रो महान् श्वेतह् कबन्धह् पतितो भुवि || ६-५१-३२
विस्वरम् च उत्सृजन् नादम् धूम्र अक्षस्य समीपतः |
ववर्ष रुधिरम् देवह् संचचाल च मेदिनी || ६-५१-३३_END
BEGIN_
Streming with blood, a huge decapitated trunk fell to earth, emitting inarticulate
noise in Dhumraksha's vicinity and the sky rained down blood. The earth trembled._END

B_6_C_52_21
BEGIN_
तत् सुभीमम् महद् युद्धम् हरि राकस सम्कुलम् |
प्रबभौ शस्त्र बहुलम् शिला पादप सम्कुलम् || ६-५२-२३_END
BEGIN_
That mighty battle assumed most awful proportions in that monkeys and demons were
crammed with rocks, trees and multitude of weapons._END

B_6_C_53_10
BEGIN_
व्याहरन्त मृगा घोरा रक्षसां निधनं तदा |
समापतन्तो योधास्तु प्रास्खलंस्तत्र दारुणम् || ६-५३-१५_END
BEGIN_
The dreadful beasts then foretold destruction of demons, who while entering the
combat, stumbled miserably._END

B_6_C_51_26
BEGIN_
प्रतिलोमम् ववौ वायुर् निर्घात सम निस्वनः |
तिमिर ओघ आवृतास् तत्र दिशश् च न चकाशिरे || ६-५१-३४_END
BEGIN_
The wind with noise resembling a thunder blew adversely. Every quarter, obscured by
abundant darkness, did not dazzle._END

B_6_C_53_11
BEGIN_
एतानौत्पातिकान् दृष्ट्वा वज्रदंष्ट्रो महाबलः |
धैर्यमालम्ब्य तेजस्वी निर्जगाम रणोत्सुकः || ६-५३-१६_END
BEGIN_
Ever after seeing these portents Vajradamshtra of exceeding prowess and sharpness,
shored up courage and being fond of battle, set out for the combat._END

B_6_C_52_22
BEGIN_
धनुर् ज्या तन्त्रि मधुरम् हिक्का ताल समन्वितम् |
मन्द्र स्तनित सम्गीतम् युद्ध गान्धर्वम् आबभौ || ६-५२-२४_END
BEGIN_
With the bow-strings as the tuneful lute, the neighing of horses as a measure rhythm
and the trumpeting of elephants as the vocal music, the whole battle resembled a symphony._END

B_6_C_51_27
BEGIN_
स तु उत्पातांस् ततो दृष्ट्वा राक्षसानाम् भय आवहान् |
प्रादुर् भूतान् सुघोरांश् च धूम्र अक्षो व्यथितो अभवत् || ६-५१-३५
मुमुहू राक्षसाः सर्वे धूम्राक्षस्य पुरःसराः |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing those terrible amones that appeared in all their horror to the demons,
Dhumraksha became perturbed. Terror seized all the demons who were advancing in front of
Dhumraksha._END

B_6_C_52_23
BEGIN_
धूम्र अक्षस् तु धनुष् पाणिर् वानरान् रण मूर्धनि |
हसन् विद्रावयाम् आस दिशस् तान् शर वृष्टिभिः || ६-५२-२५_END
BEGIN_
Dhumraksha on his part, wielding a bow in his hand and laughing at the battle-front,
made those monkeys to run away to all the quarters by a shower of his arrows._END

B_6_C_53_12
BEGIN_
तांस्तु निष्क्रमतो दृष्ट्वा वानरा जितकाशिनः |
प्रणेदुः सुमहानादान् पूरयंश्च दिशो दशः || ६-५३-१७_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys, burning for victory, seeing their enemies advancing, made tremendous
shouts which echoed every quarter._END

B_6_C_51_28
BEGIN_
ततः सुभीमो बहुभिर् निशा चरैर् |
र्वृतो अभिनिष्क्रम्य रण उत्सुको बली |
ददर्श ताम् राघव बाहु पालिताम् |
समुद्र कल्पाम् बहु वानरीम् चमूम् || ६-५१-३६_END
BEGIN_
Then, Dhumraksha, the highly terrible and strong demon, surrounded by a multitude of
demons, eager to enter into combat, set out and beheld that army of a multitude of monkeys,
resembling a flood, protected by the arms of Rama._END

B_6_C_53_13
BEGIN_
ततः प्रवृत्तं तुमुलं हरीणां राक्षसैः सह |
घोराणाम् भीमरूपाणामन्योन्यवधकान्क्षिणाम् || ६-५३-१८_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, a tumultuous battle ensured between the monkeys and the demons, who were
cruel, of ferocious form and desirous of each other's destruction._END

B_6_C_52_24
BEGIN_
धूम्र अक्षेण अर्दितम् सैन्यम् व्यथितम् दृश्य मारुतिः |
अभ्यवर्तत सम्क्रुद्धह् प्रगृह्य विपुलाम् शिलाम् || ६-५२-२६_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the army perturbed due to tormented by Dhumraksha, Hanuman was enraged and
turned towards him, taking a gigantic rock in his hands._END

B_6_C_52_25
BEGIN_
क्रोधाद् द्विगुण ताम्र अक्षह् पितृ तुल्य पराक्रमः |
शिलाम् ताम् पातयाम् आस धूम्र अक्षस्य रथम् प्रति || ६-५२-२७_END
BEGIN_
Hanuman, who was equal in strength to his father, with his eyes inflamed with anger,
flung the rock on the chariot of Dhumraksha._END

B_6_C_53_14
BEGIN_
निष्पतन्तो महोत्साहा भिन्नदेहशोरोधराः |
रुधिरोक्षितसर्वाङ्गा न्यपतन्धरणीतले || ६-५३-१९_END
BEGIN_
Some warriors of great energy, coming for war, their necks, and bodies severed, fell
to the surface of the earth, their entire bodies bathed in blood._END

B_6_C_52_26
BEGIN_
आपतन्तीम् शिलाम् दृष्ट्वा गदाम् उद्यम्य सम्भ्रमात् |
रथाद् आप्लुत्य वेगेन वसुधायाम् व्यतिष्ठत || ६-५२-२८_END
BEGIN_
Beholding the befalling rock, Dhumraksha lifting his mace hurriedly, jumped down
speedily from the chariot and stood there on the earth._END

B_6_C_53_15
BEGIN_
केचिदन्योन्यमासाद्य शूराः परिघपाणयः |
चिक्षिपुर्विविधान् शस्त्रान्समरेष्वनिवर्तिनः || ६-५३-२०_END
BEGIN_
Some other warriors, who did not turn back in battle, with arms resembling steel,
approached one another, attacking with various kinds of weapons._END

B_6_C_52_27
BEGIN_
सा प्रमथ्य रथम् तस्य निपपात शिला भुवि |
सचक्र कूबरम् साश्वम् सध्वजम् सशर आसनम् || ६-५२-२९_END
BEGIN_
Shattering his chariot with its wheels, its pole, its crest along with banner and
bows, that rock rolled down to the ground._END

B_6_C_53_16
BEGIN_
द्रुमाणां च शिलानां च शस्त्राणां चापि निःस्वनः |
श्रूयते सुमहांस्तत्र घोरो हृदयभेदनः || ६-५३-२१_END
BEGIN_
An extremely great and terrible noise, breaking the hearts, was heard there from
trees, rocks and weapons._END

B_6_C_52_28
BEGIN_
स भन्क्त्वा तु रथम् तस्य हनूमान् मारुत आत्मजः |
रक्षसाम् कदनम् चक्रे सस्कन्ध विटपैर् द्रुमैः || ६-५२-३०_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, Hanuman the son of Maruta (the wind-god), after breaking the chariot,
destroyed the demons with trunks of trees furnished with their branches._END

B_6_C_53_17
BEGIN_
रथनेमि स्वनस्तत्र धनुषश्चापि घोरवत् || ६-५३-२२
शङ्खभेरीमृदङ्गनां बभूव तुमुलः स्वनः |_END
BEGIN_
A terrific noise of the wheel-rims of chariots and the bow, along with the
tumultuous sounds of couches, kettle-drums and tabours arose there._END

B_6_C_54_0
BEGIN_
स्वबलस्य च घातेन अङ्गदस्य बलेन च |
राषसः क्रोधमाविष्टो वज्रदंष्ट्रो महाबलः || ६-५४-१_END
BEGIN_
The devastation of his army through Angada's prowess filled the mighty Vajradamstra
with anger._END

B_6_C_53_18
BEGIN_
केचिदस्त्राणि संत्यज्य बाहुयुद्धमकुर्वत || ६-५३-२३
तलैश्च चरणैश्चापि मुष्टिभिश्च द्रुमैरपि |
जानुभिश्च हताः केचिद्भग्नदेहाश्च राक्षसाः || ६-५३-२४
शिलाभिश्चूर्णिताः केचिद्वानरैर्युद्धदुर्मदैः |_END
BEGIN_
Some demons, leaving weapons, performed battle with their arms. The demons were
beaten and their bodies made fragmented by the monkeys of fighting arrogance, with their palms,
feet, fists, trees and knees. Some demons were crushed to powder with rocks._END

B_6_C_52_29
BEGIN_
विभिन्न शिरसो भूत्वा राक्षसाह् शोणित उक्षिताः |
द्रुमैः प्रमथितासः च अन्ये निपेतुर् धरणी तले || ६-५२-३१_END
BEGIN_
With their heads crushed, the demons were drenched with blood. Some others were
crunched by the trees and fell down to the earth._END

B_6_C_54_1
BEGIN_
विस्फार्य च धनुर्घोरं शक्राशनिसमप्रभम् |
वानराणामनीकानि प्राकिरच्छरवृष्टिभिः || ६-५४-२_END
BEGIN_
Stretching his terrific bow, like unto Indra's thunder bolt, he assailed the monkey
battalions with a flood of arrows._END

B_6_C_53_19
BEGIN_
वज्रदंष्ट्रो भृशं बानै रणे वित्रासयन् हरीन् || ६-५३-२५
च्चार लोकसम्हारे पाशहस्त इवान्तकः |_END
BEGIN_
Tremendously frightening the monkeys in the battle by his arrows, Vajradamshtra
moved himself in the battle-field like Yama the God of Death moving at the time of dissolution of
the worlds, wielding a noose in his hand._END

B_6_C_52_30
BEGIN_
विद्राव्य राक्षसम् सैन्यम् हनूमान् मारुत आत्मजः |
गिरेः शिखरम् आदाय धूम्र अक्षम् अभिदुद्रुवे || ६-५२-३२_END
BEGIN_
Having driven away the army of demons, Hanuma born of Maruta, breaking off the peak
of a mountain, ran towards Dhumraksha._END

B_6_C_54_2
BEGIN_
राक्षसाश्चापि मुख्यास्ते रथैश्च समवस्थिताः |
नानाप्रहरणाः शूराः प्रायुध्यन्त तदा रणे || ६-५४-३_END
BEGIN_
Then, the foremost of the demons mounted on chariots, fought the battle with every
kind of weapon._END

B_6_C_52_31
BEGIN_
तम् आपतन्तम् धूम्र अक्षो गदाम् उद्यम्य वीर्यवान् |
विनर्दमानः सहसा हनूमन्तम् अभिद्रवत् || ६-५२-३३_END
BEGIN_
The valiant Dhumraksha lifted his mace and making a roaring sound, ran towards that
Hanuman who was rushing on him suddenly._END

B_6_C_53_20
BEGIN_
बलवन्तोऽस्त्रविदुषो नानाप्रहरणा रणे || ६-५३-२६
जघ्नर्वानरसैन्यानि राक्षसाः क्रोधमूर्चिताः |_END
BEGIN_
The strong demons skilled in weaponry and wielding various kinds of weapons, killed
the army of monkeys in that battle, with their increased anger._END

B_6_C_54_3
BEGIN_
वानराणाम् च शूरास्तु ते सर्वे प्लवगर्षभाः |
आयुध्यन्त शिलाहस्तः समवेताः समन्ततः || ६-५४-४_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys, those valiant bulls among the Plavagas, assembling on all sides, fought
with rocks._END

B_6_C_53_21
BEGIN_
जघ्ने तान् राक्षसान् सर्वान् धृष्टो वालिसुतो रणे || ६-५३-२७
क्रोधेन द्विगुणाविष्टः संवर्तक इवानलः |_END
BEGIN_
The courageous Angada the son of Vali, twice possessed of anger, killed all those
demons in the battle, like a world-destroying fire._END

B_6_C_52_32
BEGIN_
ततः क्रुद्धस् तु वेगेन गदाम् ताम् बहु कण्टकाम् |
पातयाम् आस धूम्र अक्षो मस्तके तु हनूमतः || ६-५२-३४_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, Dhumraksha with an outrage, brought down that mace studded with
countless spikes on the head of that Hanuma._END

B_6_C_54_4
BEGIN_
तत्रायुधसहस्राणि तस्मिन्नायोधने भृशम् |
राक्षसाः कपिमुख्येषु पातयांचक्रिरे तदा || ६-५४-५_END
BEGIN_
Then in that battle there, the demons abundantly hurled thousands of weapons on the
foremost of monkeys._END

B_6_C_53_22
BEGIN_
तान् राक्षसगणान् सर्वान्वऋक्षमुद्यम्य वीर्यवान् || ६-५३-२८
अङ्गदह् क्रोधताम्राक्षः सिम्हह् क्षुद्रमृगानिव |
चकार कदनम् घोरम् शक्रतुल्यपराक्रमः || ६-५३-२९_END
BEGIN_
The valiant Angada with his raging red eyes lifted a tree and killed all those troop
of demons, like a lion killing small animals. Angada, with his prowess resembling that of Indra the
Lord of celestials, brought about a terrific destroyer of the enemies._END

B_6_C_52_33
BEGIN_
ताडितह् स तया तत्र गदया भीम रूपया |
स कपिर् मारुत बलस् तम् प्रहारम् अचिन्तयन् || ६-५२-३५
धूम्र अक्षस्य शिरो मध्ये गिरि शृन्गम् अपातयत् |_END
BEGIN_
That Hanuman, who was endowed with an energy similar to the wind, was in no way
disturbed by that blow but struck Dhumraksha on the middle of his skull with his rocky peak._END

B_6_C_54_5
BEGIN_
वानराश्चैव रक्षसु गिरिवृक्षान् महाशिलाः |
प्रवीराः पातयामासुर्मत्तवारणसम्निभाः || ६-५४-६_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys of mighty prowess, resembling elephants in rut, showered down giant
trees and huge lumps of rock on the demons._END

B_6_C_55_0
BEGIN_
वज्रदम्र अक्षम् निहतम् श्रुत्वा रावणो राक्षस ईश्वरः |
बल अध्यक्षम् उवाच इदम् कृत अन्जलिम् उपस्थितम् || ६-५५-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that Vajradamshtra was killed by Angada, Ravana spoke the following words to
the General of his forces who, with joined palms, stood near him._END

B_6_C_53_23
BEGIN_
अङ्गदाभिहतास्तत्त राक्षसा भीमविक्रमाः |
विभिन्नशिरसः पेतुर्निकृत्ता इव पादपाः || ६-५३-३०_END
BEGIN_
The terribly strong demons, struck by Angada there, had their heads shattered and
fell down like chopped off trees._END

B_6_C_52_34
BEGIN_
स विह्वलित सर्व अन्गो गिरि शृन्गेण ताडितः || ६-५२-३६
पपात सहसा भूमौ विकीर्ण;इव पर्वतः |_END
BEGIN_
That Dhumraksha, struck by the rocky peak, which shattered all his limbs, soon fell
down on the ground like a mountain crumbling._END

B_6_C_54_6
BEGIN_
शूराणाम् युध्यमानानाम् समरेष्वनिवर्त्नाम् |
तद्रक्षसगणानाम् च स्युद्धं समवर्तत || ६-५४-७_END
BEGIN_
Between those courageous warriors, the demons and the monkeys, who never retreated
in battle, a tremendous struggle ensued._END

B_6_C_55_1
BEGIN_
शीघ्रम् निर्यान्तु दुर्धर्षा राक्षसा भीम विक्रमाः |
अकम्पनम् पुरस् कृत्य सर्व शस्त्र प्रकोविदम् || ६-५५-२_END
BEGIN_
"Let the invincible demons of irresistible courage go forth soon, with Akampana as
their head, who is skilled in the use of every weapon and missile."_END

B_6_C_53_24
BEGIN_
रथैश्चित्रैर्ध्यजैरश्वैः शरीर्हैररिरक्षसाम् |
रुधिरौघेण संचन्ना भूमिर्भयकरा तदा || ६-५३-३१_END
BEGIN_
The earth then appeared fearful, it being covered with chariots, conspicuous flags,
horses, bodies of monkeys and demons with streams of blood flowing there._END

B_6_C_52_35
BEGIN_
धूम्र अक्षम् निहतम् दृष्ट्वा हत शेषा निशा चराः || ६-५२-३७
त्रस्ताः प्रविविशुर् लन्काम् वध्यमानाः प्लवम् गमैः |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Dhumraksha having been killed, the demons left surviving were frightened of
being killled by the monkeys and re entered Lanka._END

B_6_C_54_7
BEGIN_
प्रभग्नशिरसः केचिछिन्नैः पादैश्च बाहुभिः |
सस्त्रैरर्दितदेहास्तु रुधिरेण समुक्षिताः || ६-५४-८
हरयो राक्षसाश्चैन शेरते गाम् समाश्रिताः |
कङ्कगृध्राबलाढ्यश्च गोमायुकुलसंकुलाः || ६-५४-९_END
BEGIN_
Some monkeys and demons, with their shattered heads, but bereft of arms and legs,
lay on the earth bathed in blood with their bodies wounded by weapons, a prey to herons vultures
and crows or devoured by troops of jackals._END

B_6_C_55_2
BEGIN_
एष शास्ता च गोप्ता च नेता च युधि सत्तमः |
भूतिकामश्च मे नित्यं नित्यम् च समरप्रियः || ६-५५-३_END
BEGIN_
"This excellent demon is a chastiser, a protector and a leader in battle. He ever
desired my welfare and always loved war."_END

B_6_C_53_25
BEGIN_
हारकेयूरवस्त्रैश्च चत्रैश्च समलम्कृता |
भूमिर्भाति रणे तत्र शारदीव यथा निशा || ६-५३-३२_END
BEGIN_
That battle-field, decorated with necklaces, bracelets worn on upper arm, garments
and umbrellas looked like an autumnal night._END

B_6_C_52_36
BEGIN_
स तु पवन सुतो निहत्य शत्रुम् |
क्षतज वहाह् सरितश् च सम्विकीर्य |
रिपु वध जनित श्रमो महात्मा |
मुदम् अगमत् कपिभिश् च पूज्यमानः || ६-५२-३८_END
BEGIN_
That illustrious Hanuman the son of Pavana having destroyed his enemies, causing
rivers of blood to flow, weary of slaughter of the enemies, with delight, received the cordial
felicitations by the monkeys._END

B_6_C_54_8
BEGIN_
कबन्धानि समुत्पेतुर्भीमाणाम् भीषणानि वै |
भुजपाणिशिरश्छिन्नाश्छिन्नकायाश्च भूतले || ६-५४-१०
वानरा राक्षसाश्चापि निपेतुस्तत्र भूतले |_END
BEGIN_
Monkeys and demons fell on the battle-field; headless trunks leaps up to the terror
of all the fearful, their limbs hacked to pieces in the combat._END

B_6_C_55_3
BEGIN_
एष जेष्यति काकत्थ्सौ सुग्रीवं च महाबलम् |
वानरांश्चापरान् घोरान् हनिष्यति न संशयः || ६-५५-४_END
BEGIN_
"There is no doubt that he will prove victorious and Rama, Lakshmana, the mighty
Sugreeva and the other terrible monkeys."_END

B_6_C_53_26
BEGIN_
अङ्गदस्य च वेगेन तद्राक्षसबलम् महत् |
प्राकम्पत तदा तत्र पवनेनाम्बुदो यथा || ६-५३-३३_END
BEGIN_
By the swiftness of Angada, that great army of demons there trembled then, like a
cloud by the swiftness of wind._END

B_6_C_54_9
BEGIN_
ततो वानरसैन्येन हन्यमानम् निशाचरम् || ६-५४-११
प्राभज्यत बलं सर्वं वज्रदंष्ट्रस्य पश्यत |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, under the eyes of Vajradamshtra, all his army of demons were killed and
broken up by the monkey-troops._END

B_6_C_55_4
BEGIN_
परिगृह्य स तामाज्ञाम् रावणस्य महाबलः |
बलं सम्प्रेरयामास तदा लघुपराक्रमः || ६-५५-५_END
BEGIN_
Taking that command of Ravana, the mighty Akampana of quick resolution then
mobilized the army._END

B_6_C_54_10
BEGIN_
राक्षसान् भयवित्रस्तान् हन्यमानान् प्लवङ्गमैः || ६-५४-१२
दृष्ट्वा स रोषताम्राक्षो वज्रदंष्ट्रः प्रतापवान् |
प्रविवेश धनुष्पाणि स्त्रासयन् हरिवाहिनीम् || ६-५४-१३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the demons terrified with fear and decimated by the monkeys, that powerful
Vajradamshtra, his eyes red with anger, bow in hand, penetrated the army of monkeys, sowing panic
among them._END

B_6_C_55_5
BEGIN_
ततो नानाप्रहरणा भीमाक्षा भीमदर्शनाः |
निष्पेतू राक्षसा मुख्या बलाध्यक्षप्रचोदिताः || ६-५५-६_END
BEGIN_
Those foremost of demons of terrifying appearance, furnished with every kind of
weapon and fearful to look upon, rushed into the fray where their general had dispatched them._END

B_6_C_56_0
BEGIN_
तद् दृष्ट्वा सुमहत् कर्म कृतम् वानर सत्तमैः |
क्रोधम् आहारयाम् आस युधि तीव्रम् अकम्पनः || ६-५६-१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that very great exploit executed by the chiefs of monkeys in the battle,
Akampana was seized with a fierce anger._END

B_6_C_54_11
BEGIN_
शरैर्विदारयामास कङ्कपत्रैरजिह्मगैः |
बिभेद वानरांस्तत्र सप्तष्टौ नव पञ्च च || ६-५४-१४
विव्याध परमक्रुद्धो वज्रदंष्ट्रः प्रतापवान् |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, in his fury, the vigorous Vajradamshtra dispatched those monkeys with
arrows resembling wings of an eagle that flew straight to their target and pierced seven, eight,
nine or five of his opponents simultaneously, thus destroying them._END

B_6_C_55_6
BEGIN_
रथमास्थाय विपुलं तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणम् |
मेघाभो मेघवर्णश्च मेघस्वनमहास्वनः || ६-५५-७_END
BEGIN_
Then, Akampana of the stature and colour of a cloud, whose voice resembled a
