thunder, ascended his great chariot, decorated with fine gold and set out, surrounded by dreadful
demons._END

B_6_C_56_1
BEGIN_
क्रोध मूर्चित रूपस् तु ध्नुवन् परम कार्मुकम् |
दृष्ट्वा तु कर्म शत्रूणाम् सारथिम् वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् || ६-५६-२_END
BEGIN_
Witnessing that work of the enemies, his features were distorted by anger and
brandishing his powerful bow, Akampana addressed his charioteer in these words._END

B_6_C_54_12
BEGIN_
त्रस्ताः सर्वे हरिगणाः शरैः संकृत्तदेहिनः || ६-५४-१५
अङ्गदं सम्प्रधावन्ति प्रजापतिमिव प्रजाः |_END
BEGIN_
With their limbs crippled by those arrows and frightened, those monkey battalions
sought refuge with Angada, as all creatures with Brahma the Lord of Creation._END

B_6_C_55_7
BEGIN_
न हि कम्पयितुम् शक्यह् सुरैऋअपि महा मृधे || ६-५५-८
अकम्पनस् ततस् तेषाम् आदित्य;इव तेजसा |_END
BEGIN_
Even celestials were indeed unable to upset Akampana in a great battle. Hence, among
the demons, he was shining like the sun, by his splendour._END

B_6_C_56_2
BEGIN_
तत्र एव तावत् त्वरितम् रथम् प्रापय सारथे |
एते अत्र बहवो घ्नन्ति सुबहून् राक्षसान् रणे || ६-५६-३_END
BEGIN_
"Drive the chariot quickly to that place, for, those monkeys are killing innumerable
demons on the battle field."_END

B_6_C_54_13
BEGIN_
ततो हरिगणान् भग्नान् दृष्ट्वा वालिसुतस्तदा || ६-५४-१६
क्रोधेन वज्रदंष्ट्रम् त मुदीक्षन्तमुदैक्षत |_END
BEGIN_
When he beheld those monkey troops fleeing in disorder, Angada the son Vali
exchanged glances of hatred with Vajradamshtra._END

B_6_C_55_8
BEGIN_
तस्य निधावमानस्य सम्रब्धस्य युयुत्सया || ६-५५-९
अकस्माद् दैन्यम् आगच्चद्द् हयानाम् रथ वाहिनाम् |_END
BEGIN_
As he sped on his way, hastened and eager to enter the battle, the horses drawing
his chariot were suddenly deprived of their energy._END

B_6_C_56_3
BEGIN_
एते अत्र बलवन्तो हि भीम कायाश् च वानराः |
द्रुम शैल प्रहरणास् तिष्ठन्ति प्रमुखे मम || ६-५६-४_END
BEGIN_
"Those arrogant monkeys of terrific ferocity, armed with trees and rocks, dare to
affront me here."_END

B_6_C_54_14
BEGIN_
वज्रदम्ष्ट्रोऽङ्गदस्चोभौ योयुध्येते परस्परम् || ६-५४-१७
चेरतुः परमक्रुद्धौ हरिमत्तगजाविव |_END
BEGIN_
Both Vajradamshtra and Angada fought against each other like a lion and an elephant
in rut. They strolled din a tremendous fury._END

B_6_C_55_9
BEGIN_
व्यस्फुरन् नयनम् च अस्य सव्यम् युद्ध अभिनन्दिनः || ६-५५-१०
विवर्णो मुख वर्णश् च गद्गदश् च अभवत् स्वरः |_END
BEGIN_
The left eye of Akampana, who delighted in warfare, began to twitch. His countenance
grew pale and his voice trembled._END

B_6_C_56_4
BEGIN_
एतान् निहन्तुम् इच्चामि समर श्लाघिनो ह्य् अहम् |
एतैः प्रमथितम् सर्वम् दृश्यते राक्षसम् बलम् || ६-५६-५_END
BEGIN_
"I wish to kill those andicious monkeys, who are seen herassing all the army of
demons."_END

B_6_C_54_15
BEGIN_
ततः शतसहस्रेण हरिपुत्रं महाबलम् || ६-५४-१८
जघान मर्मदेशेषु शरैरग्निशिखोपमैः |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, that Vajradamshtra knocked the mighty Angada at his vital organs with
his arrows resembling hundred thousand flames of fire._END

B_6_C_55_10
BEGIN_
अभवत् सुदिने च अपि दुर्दिने रूक्ष मारुतम् || ६-५५-११
ऊचुह् खगा मृगाह् सर्वे वाचह् क्रूरा भय आवहाः |_END
BEGIN_
At a time of a good day, marked by fine weather, it turned into a day of bad weather
with a bitter wind beginning to blow. Birds and beasts uttered cruel and fearful cries._END

B_6_C_56_5
BEGIN_
ततः प्रजवित अश्वेन रथेन रथिनाम् वरः |
हरीन् अभ्यहनत् क्रोधात् शर जालैर् अकम्पनः || ६-५६-६_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, in his chariot, drawn by fast-moving horses, Akampana the most skillful
of chariot-warriors, with a hail of darts, assailed the monkeys from a distance._END

B_6_C_54_16
BEGIN_
रुधिरोक्षितसर्वाङ्गो वालिसूनुर्महाबलः || ६-५४-१९
चिक्षेप वज्रदंष्ट्रय वृक्षं भीमपराक्रमः |_END
BEGIN_
With all his limbs drenched in blood, the mighty Angada having a terrific prowess
threw a tree on Vajradamshtra._END

B_6_C_55_11
BEGIN_
स सिम्ह उपचित स्कन्धह् शार्दूल सम विक्रमः || ६-५५-१२
तान् उत्पातान् अचिन्त्य एव निर्जगाम रण आजिरम् |_END
BEGIN_
That demon, who had the shoulders of a lion and the agility of a tiger, disregarding
those portents, rushed towards the battle-field._END

B_6_C_56_6
BEGIN_
न स्थातुम् वानराह् शेकुह् किम् पुनर् योद्धुम् आहवे |
अकम्पन शरैर् भग्नाह् सर्व;एव प्रदुद्रुवुः || ६-५६-७_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys were no longer able to maintain their formation, much less fight in the
battle. all of them were crushed under the shifts of Akampana and took to their heels._END

B_6_C_54_17
BEGIN_
दृष्ट्वापतन्तं तम् वृक्षमसंभ्रान्तश्च राक्षसः || ६-५४-२०
चिछेद बहुधा सोऽपि मथितः प्रापतद्भुवि |_END
BEGIN_
That unperplexed demon, seeing that tree falling on him, cut it into innumerable
pieces which fell in heaps on earth._END

B_6_C_55_12
BEGIN_
तदा निर्गच्चतस् तस्य रक्षसह् सह राक्षसैः || ६-५५-१३
बभूव सुमहान् नादह् क्षोभयन्न् इव सागरम् |_END
BEGIN_
While Akampana advanced thus with his troops, an immense tumult arose that seemed to
convulse the ocean._END

B_6_C_54_18
BEGIN_
तं दृष्ट्वा स रथादाप्लुत्य वीर्यवान् || ६-५४-२१
गदापाणिरसंभ्रान्तः पृथिव्यां समतिष्ठत |_END
BEGIN_
Witnessing the strength of Vajradamshtra, Angada that lion among the monkeys seized
hold of a large rock and emitting a shout, threw it on him._END

B_6_C_56_7
BEGIN_
तान् मृत्यु वशम् आपन्नान् अकम्पन वशम् गतान् |
समीक्ष्य हनुमान् ज्नातीन् उपतस्थे महा बलः || ६-५६-८_END
BEGIN_
Seeing those companions, getting under the sway of death pursued by Akampana's
darts, the mighty Hanuman went to their rescue._END

B_6_C_55_13
BEGIN_
तेन शब्देन वित्रस्ता वानराणाम् महा चमूः || ६-५५-१४
द्रुम शैल प्रहरणा योद्धुम् समवतिष्ठत |_END
BEGIN_
By hearing that clamour of the demons coming for the battle, the huge army of the
monkeys, brandishing trees and rocks, was frightened._END

B_6_C_56_8
BEGIN_
तम् महा प्लवगम् दृष्ट्वा सर्वे प्लवग यूथपाः |
समेत्य समरे वीराह् सहिताह् पर्यवारयन् || ६-५६-९_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Hanuman their great leader, all those valiant and the best of the monkeys
together rallied and grouped themselves boldly round him._END

B_6_C_54_19
BEGIN_
तमापतन्तं दृष्ट्वा स रथादाप्लुत्य वीर्यवान् || ६-५४-२२
गदापाणिरसंभ्रान्तः पृथिव्यां समतिष्ठत |_END
BEGIN_
As the rock descended, that vigorous Vajradamshtra leaping down from his chariot,
armed with his mace, stood waiting unperplexed, on the battle-field._END

B_6_C_55_14
BEGIN_
तेषाम् युद्धम् महा रौद्रम् सम्जज्ने कपि रक्षसाम् || ६-५५-१५
राम रावणयोऋअर्थे समभित्यक्त जीविनाम् |_END
BEGIN_
A highly fierce battle ensued between those monkeys and demons, who were ready to
lose their lives for the sake of Rama and Ravana._END

B_6_C_54_20
BEGIN_
अङ्गदेन शिला क्षिप्ता गत्वा तु रणमूर्धनि || ६-५४-२३
सचक्रकूबरं साश्वं प्रममाथ रथं तदा |_END
BEGIN_
Meanwhile, the rock thrown by Angada, falling into the forefront of the battle, then
crushed the chariot with its wheels shafts and horses_END

B_6_C_56_9
BEGIN_
व्यवस्थितम् हनूमन्तम् ते दृष्ट्वा हरि यूथपाः |
बभूवुर् बलवन्तो हि बलवन्तम् उपाश्रिताः || ६-५६-१०_END
BEGIN_
Observing Hanuman's courage, those excellent monkeys took shelter in his
powerfulness and became powerfulness and became powerful indeed._END

B_6_C_55_15
BEGIN_
सर्वे ह्य् अतिबलाह् शूराह् सर्वे पर्वत सम्निभाः || ६-५५-१६
हरयो राक्षसाश् चैव परस्पर जिघंसवः |_END
BEGIN_
All the monkeys and demons, who were willing to kill each other, were very strong
and valiant. All were resembling mountains._END

B_6_C_56_10
BEGIN_
अकम्पनस् तु शैल आभम् हनूमन्तम् अवस्थितम् |
महा इन्द्र;इव धाराभिह् शरैर् अभिववर्ष ह || ६-५६-११_END
BEGIN_
Akampana, like Mahendra the Lord of celestials, assailed a hail of arrows on
Hanuman, who remained as firm as a rock._END

B_6_C_54_21
BEGIN_
ततोऽन्यच्छिखरं गृह्य विपुलं द्रुमभूषितम् || ६-५४-२४
वज्रदंष्ट्रस्य शिरसि पातयामास वानरः |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, Angada the monkey, seizing another large peak of a mountain adorned with
trees, threw it on Vajradamshtra's head._END

B_6_C_55_16
BEGIN_
तेषाम् विनर्दाताम् शब्दह् सम्युगे अतितरस्विनाम् || ६-५५-१७
शुश्रुवे सुमहान् क्रोधाद् अन्योन्यम् अभिगर्जताम् |_END
BEGIN_
The tremendous clamour of the aforesaid warriors, yelling in their rage and
strength, making savage cries, were distinctly heard on the battle-field._END

B_6_C_57_0
BEGIN_
अकम्पन वधम् श्रुत्वा क्रुद्धो वै राक्षस ईश्वरः |
किंचिद् दीन मुखश् च अपि सचिवांस् तान् उदैक्षत || ६-५७-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing of Akampana's killing, Ravana the Lord of demons, with a little depressed
face, was enraged and looked towards his ministers._END

B_6_C_56_11
BEGIN_
अचिन्तयित्वा बाण ओघान् शरीरे पतितान् शितान् |
अकम्पन वध अर्थाय मनो दध्रे महा बलः || ६-५६-१२_END
BEGIN_
Heedless of the flood of weapons that fell upon his body, the mighty Hanuman
resolved in his mind to slay Akampana._END

B_6_C_55_17
BEGIN_
रजसः च अरुण वर्ण आभम् सुभीमम् अभवद् भृशम् || ६-५५-१८
उद्धूतम् हरि रक्षोभिः सम्रुरोध दिशो दश |_END
BEGIN_
A highly terrific dust, in a thick coppery colour, raised by the monkeys and demons
enveloped all the ten quarters._END

B_6_C_54_22
BEGIN_
अभवच्छोणितोद्गारी वज्रदंष्ट्रः स मूर्छितः || ६-५४-२५
मूहूर्तमभवन्मूढो गदामालिङ्ग्य निःश्वसन् |_END
BEGIN_
Beginning to vomit blood, Vajradamshtra became fainted, clenching his mace
convulsively and breathing heavily for a moment._END

B_6_C_57_1
BEGIN_
स तु ध्यात्वा मुहूर्तम् तु मन्त्रिभिह् सम्विचार्य च |
ततस्तु रावणः पूर्वदिवसे राक्षसाधिपः || ६-५७-२
पुरीम् परिययौ लन्काम् सर्वान् गुल्मान् अवेक्षितुम् |_END
BEGIN_
Having reflected awhile and deliberated with his ministers, Ravana the king of
Demons then passed that forenoon in inspecting his defenses in the City of Lanka._END

B_6_C_56_12
BEGIN_
स प्रहस्य महा तेजा हनूमान् मारुत आत्मजः |
अभिदुद्राव तद् रक्षह् कम्पयन्न् इव मेदिनीम् || ६-५६-१३_END
BEGIN_
Laughing heartily , that Hanuman, the son of Maruta the wind-god and possessing a
great splendour, leapt on the demon, causing the earth to shake as it were._END

B_6_C_54_23
BEGIN_
संलब्धसंज्ञो गदया वालिपुत्रमवस्थितम् || ६-५४-२६
जघान परमक्रुद्धो वक्षोदेशे निशाचरः |_END
BEGIN_
Regaining his consciousness, Vajradamshtra the demon was very much enraged and hit
Angada full on the chest with his mace._END

B_6_C_55_18
BEGIN_
अन्योन्यम् रजसा तेन कौशेय उद्धूत पाण्डुना || ६-५५-१९
सम्वृतानि च भूतानि ददृशुऋन रण अजिरे |_END
BEGIN_
The combatants, enveloped by that dust, which was whitish like a piece of silk
shaken by the wind, could no longer distinguish each other on the battle-field._END

B_6_C_57_2
BEGIN_
ताम् राक्षस गणैर् गुप्ताम् गुल्मैर् बहुभिर् आवृताम् || ६-५७-३
ददर्श नगरीम् लन्काम् पताका ध्वज मालिनीम् |_END
BEGIN_
The king Ravana saw that City, guarded by groups of demons, filled with innumerable
troops and decorated with banners and flags._END

B_6_C_56_13
BEGIN_
तस्य अभिनर्दमानस्य दीप्यमानस्य तेजसा |
बभूव रूपम् दुर्धर्षम् दीप्तस्य इव विभावसोः || ६-५६-१४_END
BEGIN_
As he roared burning with energy, the form of Hanuman became difficult to overpower,
like a blazing fire._END

B_6_C_55_19
BEGIN_
न ध्वजो न पताका वा वर्म वा तुरगो अपि वा || ६-५५-२०
आयुधम् स्यन्दनम् वा अपि ददृशे तेन रेणुना |_END
BEGIN_
Neither standard, banner and shield, nor horse, weapon and chariot could be
discerned in that pall of dust._END

B_6_C_54_24
BEGIN_
गदां त्यक्त्वा ततस्तत्र मुष्टियुद्धमकुर्वत || ६-५४-२७
अन्योन्यं जघ्नतुस्तत्र तावुभौ हरिराक्षसौ |_END
BEGIN_
Leaving his mace, he performed a pugilistic encounter there. Both the monkey and the
demon thus hit each other in that combat._END

B_6_C_57_3
BEGIN_
रुद्धाम् तु नगरीम् दृष्ट्वा रावणो राक्षस ईश्वरः || ६-५७-४
उवाच अमर्षितह् काले प्रहस्तम् युद्ध कोविदम् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Lanka besieged, Ravana the Lord of Demons spoke as follows to Prahasta who
was skilled in war-fare and who wished well of him even at a critical time._END

B_6_C_56_14
BEGIN_
आत्मानम् त्व् अप्रहरणम् ज्नात्वा क्रोध समन्वितः |
शैलम् उत्पाटयाम् आस वेगेन हरि पुम्गवः || ६-५६-१५_END
BEGIN_
Knowing himself to be bereft of any weapon, Hanuman the excellent monkey, with a
rage, uplifted a mountain quickly._END

B_6_C_55_20
BEGIN_
शब्दसः च सुमहांस् तेषाम् नर्दताम् अभिधावताम् || ६-५५-२१
श्रूयते तुमुले युद्धे न रूपाणि चकाशिरे |_END
BEGIN_
A great tumultuous clamour, of warriors, making challenging cries and rushing upon
each other, was heard on the battle-field, yet in that confusion, no form was visible._END

B_6_C_54_25
BEGIN_
रुधिरोद्गारिणौ तौ तु प्रहारैर्जनितशमौ || ६-५४-२८
बभूवतुः सुविक्रन्तावङ्गारक बुधाविव |_END
BEGIN_
Exhausted by the blows, spitting blood, those valiant warriors were like the planets
Mars and Mercury._END

B_6_C_57_4
BEGIN_
पुरस्य उपनिविष्टस्य सहसा पीडितस्य ह || ६-५७-५
न अन्यम् युद्धात् प्रपश्यामि मोक्षम् युद्ध विशारद |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Prahasta the proficient in war-free! I do not see any other deliverance than a
battle for this city, which is besieged suddenly and being devastated."_END

B_6_C_56_15
BEGIN_
तम् गृहीत्वा महा शैलम् पाणिना एकेन मारुतिः |
विनद्य सुमहा नादम् भ्रामयाम् आस वीर्यवान् || ६-५६-१६_END
BEGIN_
That valiant Hanuman, seizing a very great mountain with one hand and letting up a
roar, began to spin it rapidly._END

B_6_C_55_21
BEGIN_
हरीन् एव सुसम्क्रुद्धा हरयो जघ्नुऋआहवे || ६-५५-२२
राक्षसाश् च अपि रक्षांसि निजघ्नुस् तिमिरे तदा |_END
BEGIN_
In the darkness, the greatly enraged monkeys killed the monkeys themselves and the
demons killed the demons themselves in battle._END

B_6_C_54_26
BEGIN_
ततः परमतेजस्वी अङ्गदः प्लवगर्षभः || ६-५४-२९
उत्पाट्य वृक्षं स्थितवान् बहुपुष्प फलाचितम् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, Angada the lion among the monkeys, possessing a great splendour, uprooted a
tree full with many flowers and fruits and stood waiting._END

B_6_C_57_5
BEGIN_
अहम् वा कुम्भ कर्णो वा त्वम् वा सेना पतिर् मम || ६-५७-६
इन्द्रजिद् वा निकुम्भो वा वहेयुर् भारम् ईदृशम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Either myself or Kumbhakarna or yourself my army-chief or Indrajit or Nikumbha and
none else could undertake such a task!"_END

B_6_C_56_16
BEGIN_
ततस् तम् अभिदुद्राव राक्षस इन्द्रम् अकम्पनम् |
यथा हि नमुचिम् सम्ख्ये वज्रेण इव पुरम् दरः || ६-५६-१७_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, as formerly in an encounter Indra the Lord of celestials hurled his
thunderbolt at Namuchi, Hanuman rushed towards Akampana._END

B_6_C_55_22
BEGIN_
ते परांश्च विनिघ्नन्तः स्वांश्च वानरराक्षसाः || ६-५५-२३
रुधिरार्द्राम् तदा चक्रुर्म हीं पङ्कानुलेपनाम् |_END
BEGIN_
Those monkeys and demons killing other and their own people then made the earth
dampened with blood, anointing its body with mud._END

B_6_C_54_27
BEGIN_
जग्राह चार्षभं चर्म खड्गं च विपुलं शुभम् || ६-५४-३०
किङ्किणाजालसंभन्नम् चर्मणा च परिष्कृतम् |_END
BEGIN_
The demon too seized hold of a shield covered with the hide of a bull as well as a
great beautiful sword decorated richly with a multitude of golden bells._END

B_6_C_57_6
BEGIN_
स त्वम् बलम् इतह् शीघ्रम् आदाय परिगृह्य च || ६-५७-७
विजयाय अभिनिर्याहि यत्र सर्वे वन ओकसः |_END
BEGIN_
"For that reason, taking a company of warriors, you quickly place yourself in their
midst and set forth in order to triumph over all those monkeys."_END

B_6_C_56_17
BEGIN_
अकम्पनस् तु तद् दृष्ट्वा गिरि शृन्गम् समुद्यतम् |
दूराद् एव महा बाणैर् अर्ध चन्द्रैर् व्यदारयत् || ६-५६-१८_END
BEGIN_
Beholding that crag flying towards him, Akampana shattered it even from a distance
by means of his great crescent-shaped arrows._END

B_6_C_55_23
BEGIN_
ततस् तु रुधिर ओघेण सिक्तम् व्यपगतम् रजः || ६-५५-२४
शरीर शव सम्कीर्णा बभूव च वसुम् धरा |_END
BEGIN_
Under the stream of blood being sprinkled, the dust was laid, revealing the earth
covered with bodies and corpses._END

B_6_C_54_28
BEGIN_
चित्रांश्च रुचिरान्मार्गांश्चेरतुः कपिराक्षसौ || ६-५४-३१
जघ्नतुश्च तदान्योन्यम् नर्दन्तौ जयाकाङिक्षिणौ |_END
BEGIN_
Thirsting for victory, the monkeys and the demons, making roaring sounds, roamed
about in different ways and collided with each other._END

B_6_C_57_7
BEGIN_
निर्याणाद् एव ते नूनम् चपला हरि वाहिनी || ६-५७-८
नर्दताम् राक्षस इन्द्राणाम् श्रुत्वा नादम् द्रविष्यति |_END
BEGIN_
"Unsettled in no time on knowing your decision to enter the battle-field, the army
of monkeys will run away on hearing the raring sound of the leaders of demons."_END

B_6_C_56_18
BEGIN_
तत् पर्वत अग्रम् आकाशे रक्षो बाण विदारितम् |
विकीर्णम् पतितम् दृष्ट्वा हनूमान् क्रोध मूर्चितः || ६-५६-१९_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that rocky peak shatterd in the air by the demon's arrows and falling in
pieces, Hanuman became mad with anger._END

B_6_C_55_24
BEGIN_
द्रुम शक्ति शिला प्रासैऋगदा परिघ तोमरैः || ६-५५-२५
हरयो राक्षसास् तूर्णम् जघ्नुऋअन्योन्यम् ओजसा |_END
BEGIN_
The demons and the monkeys vigorously struck each other swiftly with blows from
trees, spears, maces, javelins, stones, bars and picks._END

B_6_C_54_29
BEGIN_
व्रणैः समुथैः शोभेतां पुष्पिताविव किंशुकौ || ६-५४-३२
युध्यमानौ परिश्रानौ जानुभ्यामवनीम् गतौ |_END
BEGIN_
With their gaping wounds, they shone like a pair of kimshuka trees in blossom.
Exhausted were both of them while fighting and they sank their knees on the earth._END

B_6_C_56_19
BEGIN_
सो अश्व कर्णम् समासाद्य रोष दर्प अन्वितो हरिः |
तूर्णम् उत्पाटयाम् आस महा गिरिम् इव उच्च्रितम् || ६-५६-२०_END
BEGIN_
Approaching an Ashwakarna tree as large as a mountain, in the transport of rage that
possessed him, that Hanuman uprooted it speedily._END

B_6_C_57_8
BEGIN_
चपला ह्य् अविनीताश् च चल चित्ताश् च वानराः || ६-५७-९
न सहिष्यन्ति ते नादम् सिम्ह नादम् इव द्विपाः |_END
BEGIN_
"The monkeys are unsteady, mis-behaved and fickle-minded. They do not tolerate your
sound, as elephants the lion's roar."_END

B_6_C_55_25
BEGIN_
बाहुभिः परिघा आकारैऋयुध्यन्तह् पर्वत उपमाः || ६-५५-२६
हरयो भीम कर्माणो राक्षसान् जघ्नुऋआहवे |_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys of dreadful deeds, resembling mountains, fighting with their arms
appearing like iron bars, killed the demons in battle._END

B_6_C_54_30
BEGIN_
निमेषान्तरमात्रेण अङ्गदह् कपिकुञ्जरः || ६-५४-३३
उदतिष्ठत दीप्ताक्षो दण्डाहत इवोरगः |_END
BEGIN_
Angada, the foremost of the monkeys, just after a moment, with his glittering eyes,
rose up like a serpent struck with a stick._END

B_6_C_56_20
BEGIN_
तम् गृहीत्वा महा स्कन्धम् सो अश्व कर्णम् महा द्युतिः |
प्रगृह्य परया प्रीत्या भ्रामयामास भूतले || ६-५६-२१_END
BEGIN_
Taking hold of that Ashvakarna tree with large branches, in his great strength,
Hanuman with immense delight spinned it, while standing on the ground._END

B_6_C_57_9
BEGIN_
विद्रुते च बले तस्मिन् रामह् सौमित्रिणा सह || ६-५७-१०
अवशस्ते निरालम्बह् प्रहस्त वशम् एष्यति |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Prahasta! As that army takes to its heels, Rama along with Lakshmana being
supportless, will fall into your power though unwillingly."_END

B_6_C_55_26
BEGIN_
राक्षसासः च अपि सम्क्रुद्धाह् प्रास तोमर पाणयः || ६-५५-२७
कपीन् निजघ्निरे तत्र शस्त्रैह् परम दारुणैः |_END
BEGIN_
The enraged demons with darts and javelins in their hands, struck the monkeys there
with their cruel weapons._END

B_6_C_54_31
BEGIN_
निर्मलेन सुधौतेन खड्गेनास्य महच्छिरः || ६-५४-३४
जघान वज्रदंष्ट्रस्य वालिसूनुर्महाबलः |_END
BEGIN_
The mighty Angada assaulted the giant head of Vajradamshtra with a well-sharpened
and stainless sword._END

B_6_C_57_10
BEGIN_
आपत् संशयिता श्रेयो न अत्र निह्संशयी कृता || ६-५७-११
प्रतिलोम अनुलोमम् वा यद् वा नो मन्यसे हितम् |_END
BEGIN_
"A skeptical misfortune is preferable to one that is certain! Whether it is
unpleasing to hear or not, say what you consider as an advantage to us."_END

B_6_C_56_21
BEGIN_
प्रधावन्न् उरु वेगेन प्रभन्जंस् तरसा द्रुमान् |
हनूमान् परम क्रुद्धश् चरणैर् दारयत् क्षितिम् || ६-५६-२२_END
BEGIN_
Then, the highly enraged Hanuman began to run with great strides, breaking down the
trees by his strength and tearing up the earth with his feet._END

B_6_C_55_27
BEGIN_
अकम्पनः सुसंक्रुद्धो राक्षसानां चमूपतिः || ६-५५-२८
संहर्षयति तान्सर्वान्राक्षसान् भीमविक्रमान् |_END
BEGIN_
The extremely enraged Akampana, the general of the army of demons, cheered all those
demons by his terrible prowess._END

B_6_C_58_0
BEGIN_
ततः प्रहस्तं निर्यान्तम् दृष्ट्वा रणकृतोद्यमम् |
उवाच पस्मितं रामो विभीषणमरिंदमः || ६-५८-१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Prahasta setting out with a martial ardour, Rama the conqueror of enemies,
smiling, spoke to Vibhishana as follows:_END

B_6_C_54_32
BEGIN_
रुधिरोक्षितगात्रस्य बभूव पतितम् द्विधा || ६-५४-३५
तच्च तस्य परीताक्षं शुभम् खड्गहतम् शिरः |_END
BEGIN_
Struck by the sword, that charming head of Vajradamshtra, with his limbs drenched in
blood and eyes rolling, fell into two pieces._END

B_6_C_57_11
BEGIN_
रावणेन एवम् उक्तस् तु प्रहस्तो वाहिनी पतिः || ६-५७-१२
राक्षस इन्द्रम् उवाच इदम् असुर इन्द्रम् इव उशना |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Ravana, Prahasta the Army-General spoke the following words to
Ravana, like Ushana the preceptor of demons would speak to Bali, the king of demons._END

B_6_C_56_22
BEGIN_
गजांसः च सगज आरोहान् सरथान् रथिनस् तथा |
जघान हनुमान् धीमान् राक्षसांश् च पदातिकान् || ६-५६-२३_END
BEGIN_
Hanuman struck down elephants as also who rode upon them and charioteers with their
chariots and the terrific infantry of demons._END

B_6_C_55_28
BEGIN_
हरयस् त्व् अपि रक्षांसि महा द्रुम महा अश्मभिः || ६-५५-२९
विदारयन्त्य् अभिक्रम्य शस्त्राण्य् आच्चिद्य वीर्यतः |_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys however leaping upon them and snatching their weapons through their
strength, crushed those demons with blows from large trees and stones._END

B_6_C_58_1
BEGIN_
क एष सुमहाकायो बलेन महता वृतः |
आगच्छति महावेगः किम्रूपबलपौरुषः || ६-५८-२
आचक्ष्व मे महाबाहो वीर्यवन्तम् निशाचरम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Who is he with a very huge body, coming with a great speed along with a large army?
O, the mighty armed! Tell me about this strong demon."_END

B_6_C_54_33
BEGIN_
वज्रदंष्ट्रम् हतम् दृष्ट्वा राक्षसा भयमोहिताः || ६-५४-३६
त्रस्तह्यभ्यद्रवन् लङ्काम् वध्यमानाः प्लवङ्गमैः |
विषण्ळवदना दीना ह्रिया किंचिदवाङ्मुखाः || ६-५४-३७_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Vajradamshtra having been slain, the demons, deluded with fear, fled
panic-stricken towards Lanka, harassed by the monkeys with their down-cast faces, their heads bowed
in shame._END

B_6_C_57_12
BEGIN_
राजन् मन्त्रित पूर्वम् नह् कुशलैह् सह मन्त्रिभिः || ६-५७-१३
विवादसः च अपि नो वृत्तह् समवेक्ष्य परस्परम् |_END
BEGIN_
O, king! Formerly, we deliberated this matter with our wise ministers and, after
having a good dialogue with each other, a disagreement arose between us."_END

B_6_C_55_29
BEGIN_
एतस्मिन्न् अन्तरे वीरा हरयह् कुमुदो नलः || ६-५५-३०
मैन्दसः च परम क्रुद्धश् चक्रुऋवेगम् अनुत्तमम् |_END
BEGIN_
Meanwhile Kumuda, Nala and Mainda the courageous monkeys in an outburst of anger,
displayed unsuprassed rashness._END

B_6_C_56_23
BEGIN_
तम् अन्तकम् इव क्रुद्धम् समरे प्राण हारिणम् |
हनूमन्तम् अभिप्रेक्ष्य राक्षसा विप्रदुद्रुवुः || ६-५६-२४_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that Hanuman, like unto Yama the Destroyer of vital Breaths, full of wrath
armed with a tree and taking off lives, the demons took of flight._END

B_6_C_58_2
BEGIN_
राघवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा प्रत्युवाच विभीषणः || ६-५८-३
एष सेनापतिस्तस्य प्रहस्तो नाम राक्ससः |
लङ्कायाम् राक्षसेन्द्रस्य त्रिभागबलसंवृतः || ६-५८-४
वीर्यवानस्त्रविच्छूरः सुप्रख्यातपराक्रमः |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Rama's words, Vibhishana replied as follows "He is guarded by two-thirds of
the army of Lanka. He is a demon of prowess, skilled in the use of mystic weapons and valiant. He
is the demon named Prahasta, the Army general of Ravana."_END

B_6_C_54_34
BEGIN_
निहत्य तम् वज्रधरप्रतापः |
स वालिसूनुः कपिसैन्यमध्ये |
जगाम हर्षम् महितो महाबलः |
सहस्रनेत्रस्त्रिदशैरिवावृतः || ६-५४-३८_END
BEGIN_
The mighty Angada experienced a great joy amidst the monkey forces, honoured by them
for his high courage and he resembled the Lord of a Thousand Eyes surrounded by the celestials._END

B_6_C_57_13
BEGIN_
प्रदानेन तु सीतायाह् श्रेयो व्यवसितम् मया || ६-५७-१४
अप्रदाने पुनर् युद्धम् दृष्टम् एतत् तथैव नः |_END
BEGIN_
"To return Seetha was what I considered preferable. Not to do so meant war; we
foresaw this."_END

B_6_C_55_30
BEGIN_
ते तु वृक्षैऋमहा वेगा राक्षसानाम् चमू मुखे || ६-५५-३१
कदनम् सुमह चक्रुर् लीलया हरि यूथपाः |
ममन्थू राक्षसान् सर्वे नानाप्रहरणैर्भृशम् || ६-५५-३२_END
BEGIN_
Those exceedingly valiant chiefs of monkeys, as in sport, in the battle-front, with
mighty blows of trees, created a great carnage among the demons. All of them repeatedly crushed the
demons with every kind of weapon._END

B_6_C_56_24
BEGIN_
तम् आपतन्तम् सम्क्रुद्धम् राक्षसानाम् भय आवहम् |
ददर्श अकम्पनो वीरश् चुक्रोध च ननाद च || ६-५६-२५_END
BEGIN_
The valiant Akampana, beholding that Hanuman who was enraged and rushing on, sowing
terror among his soldiers, was greatly perturbed and set up a mighty shout._END

B_6_C_58_3
BEGIN_
ततः प्रहस्तम् निर्यान्तम् भीमम् भीम पराक्रमम् || ६-५८-५
गर्जन्तम् सुमहा कायम् राक्षसैर् अभिसम्वृतम् |
ददर्श महती सेना वानराणाम् बलीयसाम् || ६-५८-६
अभिसम्जात रोषाणाम् प्रहस्तम् अभिगर्जताम् |_END
BEGIN_
That huge and powerful army of monkeys, who began to emit cries of defiance with
fury, thereupon saw the terrible Prahasta of formidable exploits coming forth towards them._END

B_6_C_57_14
BEGIN_
सो अहम् दानैश् च मानैश् च सततम् पूजितस् त्वया || ६-५७-१५
सान्त्वैसः च विविधैह् काले किम् न कुर्याम् प्रियम् तव |_END
BEGIN_
"I have ever been honoured by you at appropriate times by gifts, felicitations and
nice words. When the opportunity arises, is it not for me to render you a service?"_END

B_6_C_56_25
BEGIN_
स चतुर्दशभिर् बाणैह् शितैर् देह विदारणैः |
निर्बिभेद हनूमन्तम् महा वीर्यम् अकम्पनः || ६-५६-२६_END
BEGIN_
With fourteen sharp arrows that tore the flesh, that Akampana pierced the highly
valiant Hanuman._END

B_6_C_58_4
BEGIN_
खड्ग शक्त्य् अष्टि बाणाश् च शूलानि मुसलानि च || ६-५८-७
गदाश्च परिघाह् प्रासा विविधाश् च परश्वधाः |
धनूम्षि च विचित्राणि राक्षसानाम् जय एषिणाम् || ६-५८-८
प्रगृहीतान्य् अशोभन्त वानरान् अभिधावताम् |_END
BEGIN_
Swords, lances, daggers, darts, spears, clubs, maces bars, barbed missiles, various
kinds of axes and different bows glittered in the hands of demons, who were running up towards the
monkeys and seeking victory._END

B_6_C_57_15
BEGIN_
न हि मे जीवितम् रक्ष्यम् पुत्र दार धनानि वा || ६-५७-१६
त्वम् पश्य माम् जुहूषन्तम् त्वद् अर्थे जीवितम् युधि |_END
BEGIN_
"Neither wives nor sons nor riches are going to be spared by me. See you me,
intending to sacrifice my life for your sake in the battle."_END

B_6_C_56_26
BEGIN_
स तथा प्रतिविद्धस् तु बह्वीभिह् शर वृष्टिभिः |
हनूमान् ददृशे वीरह् प्ररूढ;इव सानुमान् || ६-५६-२७_END
BEGIN_
Riddled with sharp-pointed shafts, that warrior Hanuman appeared like a mountain on
which a number of plants shooted up._END

B_6_C_58_5
BEGIN_
जगृहुः पादपांश् च अपि पुष्पितान् वानर ऋषभाः || ६-५८-९
शिलाश्च विपुला दीर्घा योद्धु कामाह् प्लवम् गमाः |_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys who were burning to fight took hold of trees in flower, rocks and lofty
and thick stones._END

B_6_C_57_16
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा तु भर्तारम् रावणम् वाहिनी पतिः || ६-५७-१७
उवाचेदम् बलाध्यक्षान् प्रहस्तह् पुरतः स्थितान् |_END
BEGIN_
Having spoken thus to Lord Ravana, the General Prahasta said to his leading officers
who stood before him as follows:_END

B_6_C_56_27
BEGIN_
विरराज महावीर्यो महाकायो महाबलः |
पुष्पिताशोकसम्काशो विधूम इव पावकः || ६-५६-२८_END
BEGIN_
That mighty Hanuman of great strength with a large body shone like a fire without
smoke and resembled a blooming Ashoka tree._END

B_6_C_58_6
BEGIN_
तेषाम् अन्योन्यम् आसाद्य सम्ग्रामह् सुमहान् अभूत् || ६-५८-१०
बहूनाम् अश्म वृष्टिम् च शर वृष्टिम् च वर्षताम् |_END
BEGIN_
As they approached each other, a very great battle arose between those combatants
who showered down a hail of arrows and a bombardment of stones._END

B_6_C_57_17
BEGIN_
समानयत मे शीघ्रम् राक्षसानाम् महद् बलम् || ६-५७-१८
मद् बाण अशनि वेगेन हतानाम् तु रण अजिरे |
अद्य तृप्यन्तु मांसेन पक्षिणह् कानन ओकसाम् || ६-५७-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Gather a large army of demons together for me. Today, the flesh-eating birds and
beasts shall feed on the enemy that I strike down on the battle-field with my swift arrows."_END

B_6_C_56_28
BEGIN_
ततो अन्यम् वृक्षम् उत्पाट्य कृत्वा वेगम् अनुत्तमम् |
शिरस्य् अभिजघान आशु राक्षस इन्द्रम् अकम्पनम् || ६-५६-२९_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, showing a great haste in uprooting another tree, Hanuman struck the head
of Akampana the General of demons._END

B_6_C_58_7
BEGIN_
बहवो राक्षसा युद्धे बहून् वानर यूथपान् || ६-५८-११
वानरा राक्षसांश् च अपि निजघ्नुर् बहवो बहून् |_END
BEGIN_
In that battle, many of the demons killed several excellent monkeys and several
monkeys killed many of the demons._END

B_6_C_56_29
BEGIN_
स वृक्षेण हतस् तेन सक्रोधेन महात्मना |
राक्षसो वानर इन्द्रेण पपात स ममार च || ६-५६-३०_END
BEGIN_
Struck with a tree by that high-souled and enraged Hanuman, that demon fell down and
died._END

B_6_C_57_18
BEGIN_
तस्य तद्वचनम् श्रुत्वा बलाध्यक्षा महाबलाः |
बलम् उद्योजयाम् आसुस् तस्मिन् राक्षस मन्दिरे || ६-५७-२०_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that command of Prahasta, the mighty leaders of the army assembled the
forces in the abode of that demon._END

B_6_C_58_8
BEGIN_
शूलैः प्रमथिताह् केचित् केचित् तु परम आयुधैः || ६-५८-१२
परिघैर् आहताह् केचित् केचिच् चिन्नाह् परश्वधैः |_END
BEGIN_
Some monkeys were smashed by spears and some others by finer weapons. Some were
struck by iron bars and some others were slit by axes._END

B_6_C_56_30
BEGIN_
तम् दृष्ट्वा निहतम् भूमौ राक्षस इन्द्रम् अकम्पनम् |
व्यथिता राक्षसाह् सर्वे क्षिति कम्प;इव द्रुमाः || ६-५६-३१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing their leader Akampana lying lifeless on earth, all the demons trembled as the
trees do during an earthquake._END

B_6_C_57_19
BEGIN_
सा बभूव मुहूर्तेन तिग्म नाना विध आयुधैः |
लन्का राक्षस वीरैस् तैर् गजैर् इव समाकुला || ६-५७-२१_END
BEGIN_
Within a short while, that City of Lanka was filled with those terrific
demon-warriors, resembling elephants and wielding various types of weaponry._END

B_6_C_58_9
BEGIN_
निरुच्च्वासाह् पुनह् केचित् पतिता धरणी तले || ६-५८-१३
विभिन्न हृदयाह् केचिद् इषु सम्तान संदिताः |_END
BEGIN_
Yet again, some fell breathlessly on the ground and some were destroyed by the
arrows aimed at them with their hearts splits asunder._END

B_6_C_56_31
BEGIN_
त्यक्त प्रहरणाह् सर्वे राक्षसास् ते पराजिताः |
लङ्काम् अभिययुस् त्रस्ता वानरैस् तैर् अभिद्रुताः || ६-५६-३२_END
BEGIN_
All those defeated warriors, throwing their arms, escaped in the direction of Lanka,
terrified, pursued by those monkeys._END

B_6_C_57_20
BEGIN_
हुत अशनम् तर्पयताम् ब्राह्मणांश् च नमस्यताम् |
आज्य गन्ध प्रतिवहह् सुरभिर् मारुतो ववौ || ६-५७-२२_END
BEGIN_
While some demons propitiated the fire-god with their offerings and paid homage to
Brahmanas, a fragrant freeze bearing the scent of clarified butter, began to blow._END

B_6_C_58_10
BEGIN_
केचिद् द्विधा कृताह् खड्गैः स्फुरन्तः पतिता भुवि || ६-५८-१४
वानरा राक्षसैः शूलैः पार्श्वतश् च विदारिताः |_END
BEGIN_
Cut into two with the strokes of swords by those powerful demons, some monkeys,
trembling, fell on the earth, their sides torn open._END

B_6_C_57_21
BEGIN_
स्रजसः च विविध आकारा जगृहुस् त्व् अभिमन्त्रिताः |
सम्ग्राम सज्जाः सम्हृष्टा धारयन् राक्षसास् तदा || ६-५७-२३_END
BEGIN_
Then, the demons who were ready for the battle, delightedly wore garlands of
different shapes, consecrated by certain Mantras (sacred formulas)._END

B_6_C_56_32
BEGIN_
ते मुक्त केशाः सम्भ्रान्ता भग्न मानाह् पराजिताः |
स्रवत् श्रम जलैर् अन्गैह् श्वसन्तो विप्रदुद्रुवुः || ६-५६-३३_END
BEGIN_
Their hair loosened, bewildered, their pride broken by defeat, their limbs dripping
with sweat, those demons fled, blowing out their breaths._END

B_6_C_58_11
BEGIN_
वानरैसः च अपि सम्क्रुद्धै राक्षस ओघाः समन्ततः || ६-५८-१५
पादपैर् गिरि शृन्गैश् च सम्पिष्टा वसुधा तले |_END
BEGIN_
Even the flock of demons on all sides were crushed on to the earth by the furious
monkeys with tree and mountain-peaks._END

B_6_C_56_33
BEGIN_
अन्योन्यम् प्रममन्तुस् ते विविशुर् नगरम् भयात् |
पृष्ठतस् ते सुसम्मूढाह् प्रेक्षमाणा मुहुर् मुहुः || ६-५६-३४_END
BEGIN_
Mad with fear, looking back again and again and crushing each other in haste, they
entered the city._END

B_6_C_57_22
BEGIN_
सधनुष्काह् कवचिनो वेगाद् आप्लुत्य राक्षसाः |
रावणम् प्रेक्ष्य राजानम् प्रहस्तम् पर्यवारयन् || ६-५७-२४_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, armed with bows and armours, the demons with their eyes turned towards
their king Ravana, marched at a brisk pace and ranged themselves round Prahasta._END

B_6_C_58_12
BEGIN_
वज्र स्पर्श तलैर् हस्तैर् मुष्टिभिश् च हता भृशम् || ६-५८-१६
वमन् शोणितम् आस्येभ्यो विशीर्ण दशन ईक्षणः |_END
BEGIN_
Having been administered thundering slaps with their hands and terrific blows with
their fists, the faces and eyes of demons were were lacerated. The demons vomited plenty of blood
from their months._END

B_6_C_56_34
BEGIN_
तेषु लन्काम् प्रविष्टेषु राक्षसेषु महा बलाः |
समेत्य हरयह् सर्वे हनूमन्तम् अपूजयन् || ६-५६-३५_END
BEGIN_
When those demons had entered Lanka, all the mighty monkeys approached Hanuman and
paid homage to him._END

B_6_C_57_23
BEGIN_
अथ आमन्त्र्य च राजानम् भेरीम् आहत्य भैरवाम् |
आरुरोह रथम् दिव्यम् प्रहस्तह् सज्ज कल्पितम् || ६-५७-२५
हयैर् महा जवैर् युक्तम् सम्यक् सूत सुसम्युतम् |
महा जलद निर्घोषम् साक्षाच् चन्द्र अर्क भास्वरम् || ६-५७-२६
उरग ध्वज दुर्धर्षम् सुवरूथम् स्वपस्करम् |
सुवर्ण जाल सम्युक्तम् प्रहसन्तम् इव श्रिया || ६-५७-२७_END
BEGIN_
Then, Prahasta who got ready with his weapons and armour, after bidding obeisance to
the king and striking a terrible kettle-drum, mounted his chariot, which was kept ready, yoked to
an extremely swift horses, well controlled by a charioteer, emanating a noise resembling that of a
large cloud, actually shining like moon-light, inviolable with a flag bearing an ensign of snake,
with a good collision-guard, with nice wheels and decorated with a net of pure gold smiling as it
were in its magnificence._END

B_6_C_58_13
BEGIN_
आर्त स्वरम् च स्वनताम् सिम्ह नादम् च नर्दताम् || ६-५८-१७
बभूव तुमुलः शब्दो हरीणाम् रक्षसाम् युधि |_END
BEGIN_
A tumultuous clamour arose among monkeys and demons, as cries of pain and leonine
roars were bellowed._END

B_6_C_57_24
BEGIN_
ततस् तम् रथम् आस्थाय रावण अर्पित शासनः |
लन्काया निर्ययौ तूर्णम् बलेन महता वृतः || ६-५७-२८_END
BEGIN_
Then, Prahasta the one who was commanded by Ravana, ascended his chariot and set out
from Lanka soon along with a huge army._END

B_6_C_56_35
BEGIN_
सो अपि प्रहृष्टस् तान् सर्वान् हरीन् सम्प्रत्यपूजयत् |
हनूमान् सत्त्व सम्पन्नो यथा अर्हम् अनुकूलतः || ६-५६-३६_END
BEGIN_
That Hanuman, of noble nature honoured all those delighted monkeys, in accord with
their rank and the occasion._END

B_6_C_58_14
BEGIN_
वानरा राक्षसाह् क्रुद्धा वीर मार्गम् अनुव्रताः || ६-५८-१८
विवृत्त नयनाह् क्रूराश् चक्रुह् कर्माण्य् अभीतवत् |_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys and the demons with anger, following the path of heroes, with their
cruel and hostile eyes, accomplished their deeds with great courage._END

B_6_C_57_25
BEGIN_
ततो दुंदुभि निर्घोषह् पर्जन्य निनद उपमः || ६-५७-२९
शुश्रुवे शन्ख शब्दश् च प्रयाते वाहिनी पतौ |_END
BEGIN_
While Prahasta the general sallied forth, the sound of a kettle-drum, the resonance
of musical instruments and the sound of conches were heard, as though filling the earth like the
roar of a cloud._END

B_6_C_56_36
BEGIN_
विनेदुसः च यथा प्राणम् हरयो जित काशिनः |
चकर्षुसः च पुनस् तत्र सप्राणान् एव राक्षसान् || ६-५६-३७_END
BEGIN_
The triumphant monkeys shouted in accord with their nighty and once again dragged
the demons who were still alive there on the battle-field._END

B_6_C_58_15
BEGIN_
नर अन्तकः कुम्भ हनुर् महा नादह् समुन्नतः || ६-५८-१९
एते प्रहस्त सचिवाह् सर्वे जघ्नुर् वन ओकसः |_END
BEGIN_
Narantaka Kumbhahanu, Mahanada and Samunnata all these companions of Prahasta killed
the monkeys._END

B_6_C_57_26
BEGIN_
निनदन्तः स्वरान् घोरान् राक्षसा जग्मुर् अग्रतः || ६-५७-३०
भीम रूपा महा कायाह् प्रहस्तस्य पुरह् सराः |_END
BEGIN_
The demons with terrific forms and bulky bodies, shouting with dreadful voices, went
in front, as forerunners of Prahasta._END

B_6_C_56_37
BEGIN_
स वीर शोभाम् अभजन् महा कपिः |
समेत्य रक्षांसि निहत्य मारुतिः |
महा असुरम् भीमम् अमित्र नाशनम् |
यथैव विष्णुर् बलिनम् चमू मुखे || ६-५६-३८_END
BEGIN_
That great monkey, born of Maruta having encountered and killed the demons, enjoyed
the same renown as Vishnu when he overcame the mighty and terrific demon of immense power
destroying his enemies in the forefront of the battle._END

B_6_C_58_16
BEGIN_
तेषाम् आपतताम् शीघ्रम् निघ्नताम् च अपि वानरान् || ६-५८-२०
द्विविदो गिरि शृन्गेण जघान एकम् नर अन्तकम् |_END
BEGIN_
Dvivida, with a mountain-peak, struck down Narantaka, the one among them who was
rushing upon quickly and killing the monkeys._END

B_6_C_57_27
BEGIN_
नरान्तकः कुम्भहनुर्महानादः समुन्नतः | ६-५७-३१
प्रहस्तसचिवा ह्येते निर्ययुः परिवार्य तम् |_END
BEGIN_
Narantaka, Kumbhahanu, Mahanada and Samunnata, attendants of Prahasta sallied forth,
surrounding him on all sides._END

B_6_C_56_38
BEGIN_
अपूजयन् देव गणास् तदा कपिम् |
स्वयम् च रामो अतिबलश् च लक्ष्मणह् |
तथैव सुग्रीव मुखाह् प्लवम् गमा |
विभीषणश् चैव महा बलस् तदा || ६-५६-३९_END
BEGIN_
Then, the troops of deities along with Rama himself, the exceedingly strong
Lakshmana, Sugreeva and other monkeys and the mighty Vibhishana paid homage to Hanuman._END

B_6_C_58_17
BEGIN_
दुर्मुखः पुनर् उत्पाट्य कपिः स विपुल द्रुमम् || ६-५८-२१
राक्षसम् क्षिप्र हस्तस् तु समुन्नतम् अपोथयत् |_END
BEGIN_
The ape Durmukha on his part, with a ready hand, uprooted a very large tree and
crushed the demon Samunnata._END

B_6_C_57_28
BEGIN_
व्यूढेन एव सुघोरेण पूर्व द्वारात् स निर्ययौ || ६-५७-३२
गज यूथ निकाशेन बलेन महता वृतः |_END
BEGIN_
He emerged from the eastern gate in the midst of an immense, formidable and orderly
arranged army, resembling a herd of elephants._END

B_6_C_59_0
BEGIN_
तस्मिन् हते राक्षस सैन्य पाले |
प्लवम् गमानाम् ऋषभेण युद्धे |
भीम आयुधम् सागर तुल्य वेगम् |
विदुद्रुवे राक्षस राज सैन्यम् || ६-५९-१_END
BEGIN_
While Prahasta the Army chief of demons was slain in the battle by Nila the foremost
among the monkeys, Ravana's army possessing terrible arms took to flight with the speed of a
tide._END

B_6_C_57_29
BEGIN_
सागर प्रतिम ओघेन वृतस् तेन बलेन सः || ६-५७-३३
प्रहस्तो निर्ययौ तूर्णम् क्रुद्धह् काल अन्तक उपमः |_END
BEGIN_
In the centre of that army, vast as the sea, that Prahasta in his fury, came forth
appearing like Death at the end of the world._END

B_6_C_58_18
BEGIN_
जाम्बवांस् तु सुसम्क्रुद्धः प्रगृह्य महतीम् शिलाम् || ६-५८-२२
पातयाम् आस तेजस्वी महा नादस्य वक्षसि |_END
BEGIN_
The energetic Jambavan with a great fury seized a huge rock and threw it on the
chest-region of Mahanada._END

B_6_C_59_1
BEGIN_
गत्वा तु रक्षो अधिपतेह् शशंसुह् |
सेना पतिम् पावक सूनु शस्तम् |
तच् च अपि तेषाम् वचनम् निशम्य |
रक्षो अधिपह् क्रोध वशम् जगाम || ६-५९-२_END
BEGIN_
The demons went and told Ravana that Prahasta the Army chief had been killed by Nila
the son of Fire-god. Hearing those words of the demons, Ravana was possessed of anger._END

B_6_C_57_30
BEGIN_
तस्य निर्याण घोषेण राक्षसानाम् च नर्दताम् || ६-५७-३४
लन्कायाम् सर्व भूतानि विनेदुर् विकृतैह् स्वरैः |_END
BEGIN_
The uproar that arose on his setting forth with his demons raising the war-cries
drew sinister answering calls from all creatures in Lanka._END

B_6_C_58_19
BEGIN_
अथ कुम्भ हनुस् तत्र तारेण आसाद्य वीर्यवान् || ६-५८-२३
वृक्षेण अभिहतो मूर्ध्नि प्राणांस् तत्याज राक्षसः |_END
BEGIN_
Then, the valiant Kumbhahanu there in the battle, having attacked the General Tara,
who was armed with a huge tree, received a blow immediately cost him his life._END

B_6_C_59_2
BEGIN_
सम्ख्ये प्रहस्तम् निहतम् निशम्य |
शोक अर्दितह् क्रोध परीत चेताह् |
उवाच तान् नैरृत योध मुख्यान् |
इन्द्रो यथा च अमर योध मुख्यान् || ६-५९-३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that Prahasta had perished in the fight, Ravana was afflicted with anger and
his heart filled with grief and he addressed the foremost of his leaders as Indra the Lord of
celestials to the leaders of the celestial troops (as follows):_END

B_6_C_57_31
BEGIN_
व्यभ्रम् आकाशम् आविश्य मांस शोणित भोजनाः || ६-५७-३५
मण्डलान्य् अपसव्यानि खगाश् चक्रू रथम् प्रति |_END
BEGIN_
In a cloudless sky, birds of prey eating flesh and blood, flew in circles from left
to right towards the chariot._END

B_6_C_58_20
BEGIN_
अमृष्यमाणस् तत् कर्म प्रहस्तो रथम् आस्थितः || ६-५८-२४
चकार कदनम् घोरम् धनुष् पाणिर् वन ओकसाम् |_END
BEGIN_
Not tolerating the aforesaid act, Prahasta having occupied his chariot with bow in
hand, caused a terrible havoc among the monkeys._END

B_6_C_59_3
BEGIN_
न अवज्ना रिपवे कार्या यैर् इन्द्र बल सूदनह् |
सूदितह् सैन्य पालो मे सानुयात्रह् सकुन्जरह् || ६-५९-४_END
BEGIN_
"That enemy is not to be despised; under whose blows the destroyer of Indra's host
the leader of my army with his followers and elephants fell."_END

B_6_C_57_32
BEGIN_
वमन्त्यह् पावक ज्वालाह् शिवा घोरा ववाशिरे || ६-५७-३६
अन्तरिक्षात् पपात उल्का वायुश् च परुषो ववौ |_END
BEGIN_
Fearful jackals vomited forth fire and flames, howling repeatedly. A meteor fell
from the sky and the wind blew harshly._END

B_6_C_58_21
BEGIN_
आवर्त;इव सम्जज्ने;उभयोह् सेनयोस् तदा || ६-५८-२५
क्षुभितस्य अप्रमेयस्य सागरस्य इव निस्वनः |_END
BEGIN_
Then, with the rapid movement of both the armies, there arose of clamour resembling
the roar of an unfathomable and tempestuous ocean in a time of dissolution._END

B_6_C_59_4
BEGIN_
सो अहम् रिपु विनाशाय विजयाय अविचारयन् |
स्वयम् एव गमिष्यामि रण शीर्षम् तद् अद्भुतम् || ६-५९-५_END
BEGIN_
"I myself shall go to that wonderful battle-front without hesitation in order to
destroy the enemies and to gain victory."_END

B_6_C_57_33
BEGIN_
अन्योन्यम् अभिसम्रब्धा ग्रहाश् च न चकाशिरे || ६-५७-३७
मेघाश्च खरनिर्घोषा रथस्योपरि रक्षसः |
ववर्षू रुधिरम् च अस्य सिषिचुश् च पुरह् सरान् || ६-५७-३८_END
BEGIN_
The plants, in opposition to each other, lost their brilliance. The clouds, with
their raucous sound, showered blood on Prahasta's chariot and dampened those who were walking in
front of it._END

B_6_C_58_22
BEGIN_
महता हि शर ओघेण प्रहस्तो युद्ध कोविदः || ६-५८-२६
अर्दयाम् आस सम्क्रुद्धो वानरान् परम आहवे |_END
BEGIN_
The demon Prahasta, who was hard to be subdued in battle, with full of anger,
tormented the monkeys by an immense avalanche of arrows in that great combat._END

B_6_C_59_5
BEGIN_
अद्य तद् वानर अनीकम् रामम् च सह लक्ष्मणम् |
निर्दहिष्यामि बाण ओघैर् वनम् दीप्तैर् इव अग्निभिह् || ६-५९-६
अद्य सम्तर्पयिष्यामि पृथिवीम् कपिशोणितैः |_END
BEGIN_
"As a forest is consumed by blazing fires, so shall I scorch that army of monkeys
now along with Lakshmana and Rama with a multitude of arrows. Today, I shall satiate the earth with
the blood of the monkeys."_END

B_6_C_57_34
BEGIN_
केतु मूर्धनि गृध्रो अस्य विलीनो दक्षिणा मुखः |
नदन्नुभयतः पार्श्वं समग्रामहरत्प्रभाम् || ६-५७-३९_END
BEGIN_
A vulture facing the south alighted on the top of the standard, croaking towards
both of its sides and deprived the demon of his entire lustre._END

B_6_C_58_23
BEGIN_
वानराणाम् शरीरैस् तु राक्षसानाम् च मेदिनी || ६-५८-२७
बभूव निचिता घोरा पतितैर् इव पर्वतैः |_END
BEGIN_
By the frightening corpses of monkeys and demons, appearing like hideous mountains,
a very extensive area of the ground is covered._END

B_6_C_60_0
BEGIN_
स प्रविश्य पुरीम् लङ्काम् रामबाणभयार्दितः |
भग्नदर्पस्तदा राजा बभूव व्यथितेन्द्रियः || ६-६०-१_END
BEGIN_
Returning to the City of Lanka, Ravana the King of Demons was afflicted with the
fear of Rama's arrows, his pride was humbled and his senses troubled._END

B_6_C_57_35
BEGIN_
सारथेर् बहुशसः च अस्य सम्ग्रामम् अवगाहतः |
प्रतोदो न्यपतद्द् हस्तात् सूतस्य हय सादिनः || ६-५७-४०_END
BEGIN_
The goad fell several times then from the hand of the charioteer, himself a Suta
(the son of a Kshatriya by a Brahamana woman) eventhough skilled in controlling the horses, as he
entered the battle-field._END

B_6_C_59_6
BEGIN_
स;एवम् उक्त्वा ज्वलन प्रकाशम् |
रथम् तुरम्ग उत्तम राजि युक्तम् |
प्रकाशमानम् वपुषा ज्वलन्तम् |
समारुरोह अमर राज शत्रुह् || ६-५९-७_END
BEGIN_
Speaking thus, Ravana the enemy of the Lord of celestials ascended his chariot which
shone like a flame and was yoked to a team of excellent horses with its brilliance of an effulgent
body._END

B_6_C_58_24
BEGIN_
सा मही रुधिर ओघेण प्रच्चन्ना सम्प्रकाशते || ६-५८-२८
संचन्ना माधवे मासि पलाशैर् इव पुष्पितैः |_END
BEGIN_
That ground, covered by the stream of blood, shone as in the month of spring when
overspread fully with the bloossoming crimson-coloured Palasa flowers._END

B_6_C_60_1
BEGIN_
मातङ्ग इव सिम्हेन गरुडेनेव पन्नगः |
अभिभूतोऽभवद्राजा राघवेण महात्मना || ६-६०-२_END
BEGIN_
The king was overcome by the high-souled Rama, like an elephant is by a lion or a
serpent by an eagle._END

B_6_C_59_7
BEGIN_
स शन्ख भेरी पटह प्रणादैर् |
आस्फोटित क्ष्वेडित सिम्ह नादैह् |
पुण्यैह् स्तवैश् च अप्य् अभिपूज्यमानस् |
स्तदा ययौ राक्षस राज मुख्यह् || ६-५९-८_END
BEGIN_
Ravana the best among the kings of demons sallied forth with the sound of couches,
kettle-drums, cymbals, clapping of hands and leonine roars and well-acclaimed by agreeable
encomiums._END

B_6_C_57_36
BEGIN_
निर्याण श्रीश् च या अस्य आसीद् भास्वरा च सुदुर्लभा |
सा ननाश मुहूर्तेन समे च स्खलिता हयाः || ६-५७-४१_END
BEGIN_
That rarely splendour which clothed Prahasta at the time of his exit vanished in an
instant and horses stumbled on the even ground._END

B_6_C_58_25
BEGIN_
हरि वीर ओघ वप्राम् तु भग्न आयुध महा द्रुमाम् || ६-५८-२९
शोणित ओघ महा तोयाम् यम सागर गामिनीम् |
यकृत् प्लीह महा पन्काम् विनिकीर्ण अन्त्र शैबलाम् || ६-५८-३०
भिन्न काय शिरो मीनाम् अन्ग अवयव शाड्वलाम् |
गृध्र हंस गण आकीर्णाम् कन्क सारस सेविताम् || ६-५८-३१
मेधः फेन समाकीर्णाम् आर्त स्तनित निस्वनाम् |
ताम् कापुरुष दुस्ताराम् युद्ध भूमिमयीम् नदीम् || ६-५८-३२
नदीम् इव घन अपाये हंस सारस सेविताम् |
राक्षसाह् कपि मुख्याश् च तेरुस् ताम् दुस्तराम् नदीम् || ६-५८-३३
यथा पद्म रजो ध्वस्ताम् नलिनीम् गज यूथपाः |_END
BEGIN_
With the heaps of warriors for its banks the broken weapons its trees, the torrents
of blood its huge waves, death appeared like an ocean receiving its floods, livers and spleens its
mire, entrails its moss, severed heads and trunks the fish, and morsels of flesh the grass, the
innumerable vultures its lovely swans, herons its geese, covered as it was with fat for the foam,
the tumult the sound of its waters, the battle field resembled a river, incapable of being crossed
by cowards, visited by water-fowls at the end of the rainy season, those demons and the foremost of
the monkeys crossed over that impassable river, as elephants lead their herds across a lake that
the lotuses have covered with pollen._END

B_6_C_60_2
BEGIN_
ब्रह्मदण्डप्रतीकानाम् विद्युच्चलितवर्चसाम् |
स्मतन् राघवबाणानाम् विव्यथे राक्षसेश्वरः || ६-६०-३_END
BEGIN_
The Lord of Demons was maddened in recollecting Rama's arrows resembling the Rod of
Brahma the Lord of creation and possessed of the splendour of lightning._END

B_6_C_57_37
BEGIN_
प्रहस्तम् त्व् अभिनिर्यान्तम् प्रख्यात बल पौरुषम् |
युधि नाना प्रहरणा कपि सेना अभ्यवर्तत || ६-५७-४२_END
BEGIN_
Beholding that Prahasta, renowned for his excellences and martial valour; as he
advanced to give battle, the army of monkeys went forward to attack him._END

B_6_C_59_8
BEGIN_
स नीलजीमूतनिकाशरूपै |
र्मांस अशनैह् पावक दीप्त नेत्रैह् |
बभौ वृतो राक्षस राज मुख्यैर् |
भूतैर् वृतो रुद्र;इव अमर ईशह् || ६-५९-९_END
BEGIN_
That Ravana along with the flesh-eating demons whose forms resembled mountains and
clouds and whose glances flashed like torches shone like Rudra the Lord of Immortals surrounded by
genii._END

B_6_C_60_3
BEGIN_
स काञ्चनमयम् दिव्यमाश्रित्य परमासनम् |
विप्रेक्षमाणो रक्षांसि रावणो वाक्यमब्रवीत् || ६-६०-४_END
BEGIN_
Resting on an excellent and charming throne made of gold, Ravana looked at the
demons and spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_58_26
BEGIN_
ततः सृजन्तम् बाण ओघान् प्रहस्तम् स्यन्दने स्थितम् || ६-५८-३४
ददर्श तरसा नीलो विनिघ्नन्तम् प्लवम् गमान् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, Nila saw Prahasta who was employing a multitude of arrows sitting in the
chariot and annihilating the monkeys swiftly._END

B_6_C_57_38
BEGIN_
अथ घोषह् सुतुमुलो हरीणाम् समजायत |
वृक्षान् आरुजताम् चैव गुर्वीश् च अगृह्णताम् शिलाः || ६-५७-४३_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, an exceedingly tumultuous clamour arose among the monkeys as they tore
up the trees and seized hold of huge rocks._END

B_6_C_59_9
BEGIN_
ततो नगर्याह् सहसा महा ओजा |
निष्क्रम्य तद् वानर सैन्यम् उग्रम् |
महा अर्णव अभ्र स्तनितम् ददर्श |
समुद्यतम् पादप शैल हस्तम् || ६-५९-१०_END
BEGIN_
Ravana who was endowed with extraordinary energy, issuing all at once from the city,
observed a ferocious army of monkeys with trees and rocks in their hands, ready for combat and
roaring like a vast ocean and a mass of thunder-clouds._END

B_6_C_58_27
BEGIN_
उद्धूत इव वायुः खे महादभ्रबलं बलात् || ६-५८-३५
समीक्ष्याभिद्रुतम् युद्धे प्रहस्तो वाहिनीपतिः |
रथेनादित्यवर्णेन नीलमेवाभिदुद्रुवे || ६-५८-३६_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Nila who was running towards him in the battle-field, as a rocking wind in
the sky rushes towards a large massive clouds, Prahasta the Army general attacked Nila himself with
his chariot having the sun's colour._END

B_6_C_60_4
BEGIN_
सर्वम् तत्खलु मे मोघम् यत्तप्तम् परमम् तपः |
यत्समानो महेन्द्रेण मानुषेण विनिर्जितः || ६-६०-५_END
BEGIN_
"All that great penance performed by me became a waste indeed, for, I who am equal
to Mahendra the Lord of Celestials have been defeated by a mere man!"_END

B_6_C_57_39
BEGIN_
नदताम् राक्षसानां च वानराणाम् च गर्जताम् |
उभे प्रमुदिते सैन्ये रक्षो गण वन ओकसाम् || ६-५७-४४
वेगितानाम् समर्थानाम् अन्योन्य वध कान्क्षिणाम् |
परस्परम् च आह्वयताम् निनादह् श्रूयते महान् || ६-५७-४५_END
BEGIN_
Both the armies of the yelling demons and the roaring monkeys were delighted,
impetuous and powerful with impatience to slay each other and challenging each other with great
shouts._END

B_6_C_58_28
BEGIN_
स धनुर्धन्विनां श्रेष्ठो विकृष्य परमाहवे || ६-५८-३७
नीलाय व्यसृजद्बाणान् प्रहस्तो वाहिनीपतिः |_END
BEGIN_
That Prahasta the Army General, who was excellent among the wielders of bow, drew
the bow-string and hurled the arrows towards Nila in that great battle._END

B_6_C_59_10
BEGIN_
तद् राक्षस अनीकम् अतिप्रचण्डम् |
आलोक्य रामो भुजग इन्द्र बाहुह् |
विभीषणम् शस्त्रभृताम् वरिष्ठम् |
उवाच सेना अनुगतह् पृथु श्रीह् || ६-५९-११_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that army of demons who were excessively furious, Rama whose arms resembled
great serpents, accompanied by his forces and having great fortune, spoke to Vibhishana the best
among the wielders of weapons (as follows):_END

B_6_C_60_5
BEGIN_
इदम् तद्ब्रह्मणो घोरम् वाक्यम् मामभ्युपस्थितम् |
मानुषेभ्यो विजानीहि भयम् त्वमिति तत्तथा || ६-६०-६_END
BEGIN_
"The terrible words of Brahma the Lord of Creation saying, 'You know of the threat
from men' appear true. That is so."_END

B_6_C_61_0
BEGIN_
ततो रामो महातेजा धनुरादाय वीर्यवान् |
किरीटिनम् महाकायम् कुम्भकर्णम् ददर्श ह || ६-६१-१_END
BEGIN_
Having taken his bow, Rama of great brilliance and prowess, then beheld the bulky
Kumbhakarna, adorned with a diadem._END

B_6_C_57_40
BEGIN_
ततः प्रहस्तः कपि राज वाहिनीम् |
अभि प्रतस्थे विजयाय दुर्मतिः |
विवृद्ध वेगाम् च विवेश ताम् चमूम् |
यथा मुमूर्षुह् शलभो विभावसुम् || ६-५७-४६_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, the evil-minded Prahasta sallied forth for victory towards the army of
Sugreeva, whom in his folly, imagined he would destroy, with an accelerated speed as a grass-hopper
rushes towards a flame._END

B_6_C_59_11
BEGIN_
नाना पताका ध्वज शस्त्र जुष्टम् |
प्रास असि शूल आयुध चक्र जुष्टम् |
सैन्यम् नग इन्द्र उपम नाग जुष्टम् |
कस्य इदम् अक्षोभ्यम् अभीरु जुष्टम् || ६-५९-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Who is in command of this army, furnished with every kind of standard, banner and
canopy, armed with javelins, swords, stakes and other weapons and missiles and composed of
imperturbable soldiers and elephants as high as the Mahendra Mountain?"_END

B_6_C_58_29
BEGIN_
ते प्रेत्य निशिखा नीलं विनिर्भिद्य समाहिताः || ६-५८-३८
महीम् जग्मुर्महावेगा रोषिता इव पन्नगाः |_END
BEGIN_
Those arrows with a great speed resembling furious snakes employed by Prahasta
proceeded towards Nila, pierced him and fell on the ground._END

B_6_C_60_6
BEGIN_
देवदानवगन्धर्वैर्यक्षराक्षसपन्नगैः |
अवध्यत्वम् मया प्राप्तम् मानुषेभ्यो न याचितम् || ६-६०-७_END
BEGIN_
"I sought immunity from death at the hands of celestials, titans or celestials
musicians, or semi divine beings or demons or serpent-demons, but f man I made no mention."_END

B_6_C_61_1
BEGIN_
तम् दृष्ट्वा राक्षसश्रेष्ठम् पर्वताकारदर्शनम् |
क्रममाणमिवाकाशम् पुरा नारायणम् प्रभुम् || ६-६१-२_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that paramount demon, whose appearance was in the form of a mountain and
looking like Lord Narayana (the son of the original Man); taking strides across space, (manifested
in the form of Trivikrama, who measured the whole universe in a couple of strides) Rama became
vigilant._END

B_6_C_59_12
BEGIN_
ततस् तु रामस्य निशम्य वाक्यम् |
विभीषणह् शक्र समान वीर्यह् |
शशंस रामस्य बल प्रवेकम् |
महात्मनाम् राक्षस पुम्गवानाम् || ६-५९-१३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Rama, Vibhishana the equal of Indra in valour, then narrated to
Rama about the choicest army of the foremost among demons of the highest peculiarity (as
follows):_END

B_6_C_58_30
BEGIN_
नीलः शरैरभिहतो निशितैर्ज्वलनोपमैः || ६-५८-३९
स तम् परम दुर्धर्षम् आपतन्तम् महा कपिः |
प्रहस्तम् ताडयाम् आस वृक्षम् उत्पाट्य वीर्यवान् || ६-५८-४०_END
BEGIN_
That great ape of prowess Nila, who was struck by sharp arrows resembling flames,
uprooted a tree and thumped it on the descending Prahasta who was most difficult to be
assaulted._END

B_6_C_60_7
BEGIN_
विदितम् मानुषम् मन्ये रामं दशरथात्मजम् |
इक्ष्वाकुकुलजातेन अनर्ण्येन यत् पुरा || ६-६०-८
उत्पत्स्यति हि मद्वंशे पुरुषो राक्षसाधम |
यस्त्वाम् सपुत्रम् सामात्यम् सबलम् साश्वसारथिम् || ६-६०-९
निहनिष्यति सम्ग्रामे त्वाम् कुलाधम दुर्मते |_END
BEGIN_
"Rama the son of Dasaratha is the man I think of whom Anaranya born of Ikshvaku
dynasty formerly spoke, saying: 'O, the worst of demons, the worst of your race and the wretched
one! In my race will be born a man who will slay you in battle with your sons, ministers, army,
horses and charioteer."_END

B_6_C_61_2
BEGIN_
सतोयाम्बुदसम्काशम् काञ्चनाङ्गदभूषणम् |
दृष्ट्वा पुनः प्रदुद्राव वानराणाम् महाचमूः || ६-६१-३_END
BEGIN_
Beholding him again, who was appear like a rainy black cloud and wearing a golden
bracelet as an ornament on his upper arm, that huge army of monkeys took to their heels in full
speed._END

B_6_C_59_13
BEGIN_
यो असौ गज स्कन्ध गतो महात्मा |
नव उदित अर्क उपम ताम्र वक्त्रह् |
प्रकम्पयन् नाग शिरो अभ्युपैति ह्य् |
अकम्पनम् त्व् एनम् अवेहि राजन् || ६-५९-१४_END
BEGIN_
"O Prince! That hero who has a face with a coppery hue resembling a newly rising
sun, coming on the back of an elephant causing its head to sway, know him to be Akampana."_END

B_6_C_58_31
BEGIN_
तस्य बाणगणानेव राक्षसस्य दुरात्मनः |
अपारयन् वारयितुम् प्रत्यगृह्णान् निमीलितः || ६-५८-४१_END
BEGIN_
Being unable to restrain the series of arrows hurled at him by that evil-minded
demon, nila received them with closed eyes._END

B_6_C_60_8
BEGIN_
शप्तोऽहम् वेदवत्या च यदा सा धर्षिता पुरा || ६-६०-१०
सेयम् सीता महाभागा जाता जनकनन्दिनी |_END
BEGIN_
"Further, I was formerly cursed by Vedavati when she was humiliated by me. The same
Vedavati is born as the highly fortunate Seetha the daughter of Janaka."_END

B_6_C_61_3
BEGIN_
विद्रुताम् वाहिनीम् दृष्ट्वा वर्धमानम् च राक्षसम् |
सविस्मितमिदम् रामो विभीषणमुवाच ह || ६-६१-४_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the army running away and the demon increasing his body, Rama with a
surprise, spoke to vibhishana as follows:_END

B_6_C_59_14
BEGIN_
यो असौ रथस्थो मृग राज केतुर् |
धून्वन् धनुह् शक्र धनुह् प्रकाशम् |
करी इव भात्य् उग्र विवृत्त दम्ष्ट्रह् |
स;इन्द्रजिन् नाम वर प्रधानह् || ६-५९-१५_END
BEGIN_
"He who, standing in his chariot, brandish his bow which has a splendour of Indra's
bow, whose standard bears the image of a lion, and who shines like unto an elephant with its
terrible curved tusks, he is Indrajit who is renowned for the boons he had received from
Brahma."_END

B_6_C_58_32
BEGIN_
यथैव गो वृषो वर्षम् शारदम् शीघ्रमागतम् |
एवम् एव प्रहस्तस्य शर वर्षम् दुरासदम् || ६-५८-४२
निमीलित अक्षः सहसा नीलः सेहे सुदारुणम् |_END
BEGIN_
Like a bull standing under a sudden autumnal down-pour, so under that intolerable
and sudden rain of darts released by Prahasta, Nila endured with closed eyes though it was scarce
to be endured._END

B_6_C_60_9
BEGIN_
उमा नन्दीश्वरश्चापि रम्भा वरुणकन्यका || ६-६०-११
यथोक्तास्तन्मया प्राप्तम् न मिध्या ऋषिभाषितम् |_END
BEGIN_
"What was predicted by Parvati the consort of Shiva, Nandishvara the attendant of
Shiva, Rambha the wife of Nalakubara and Punjikasthala the daughter of Varunda has come to pass!
The words of the sages never prove false."_END

B_6_C_61_4
BEGIN_
कोऽसु पर्वतसम्काशः किरीटी हरिलोचनः |
लङ्कायाम् दृश्येते वीरः सविद्युदिव तोयदः || ६-६१-५_END
BEGIN_
"This eminent demon, appearing as a mountain, with a diadem and tawmy eyes and
looking like a cloud with a flash of lightning, is seen in Lanka. Who is he?"_END

B_6_C_59_15
BEGIN_
यश् च एष विन्ध्य अस्त महा इन्द्र कल्पो |
धन्वी रथस्थो अतिरथो अतिवीर्यह् |
विस्फारयंश् चापम् अतुल्य मानम् |
नाम्ना अतिकायो अतिविवृद्ध कायह् || ६-५९-१६_END
BEGIN_
"He who, the archer like unto the Vindhya, Asta or Mahendra Mountains, standing in
his chariot, a mighty warrior, of superior strength, who wields a bow of unequalled size and having
an exceedingly grown body, he is called Atikaya."_END

B_6_C_58_33
BEGIN_
रोषितः शर वर्षेण सालेन महता महान् |
प्रजघान हयान् नीलह् प्रहस्तस्य मनो जवान् || ६-५८-४३_END
BEGIN_
The exceedingly strong and the great Nila, enraged over the volley of darts, killed
Prahasta's horses by hurling a huge Sala tree on them._END

B_6_C_60_10
BEGIN_
एतदेवाभ्युपागम्य यत्नम् कर्तुमहार्हथ || ६-६०-१२
राक्षसाश्चापि तिष्ठन्तु चर्यागोपुरमूर्धसु |_END
BEGIN_
"On account of all this and admitting it, you should exert yourselves to the
uttermost. Let the demons go to the summit of Charya Mountain."_END

B_6_C_61_5
BEGIN_
पृथिव्याम् केतुभूतोऽसौ महानेकोऽत्र दृश्यते |
यम् दृष्ट्वा वानराः सर्वे विद्रवन्ति यतस्ततः || ६-६१-६_END
BEGIN_
"He alone with a huge body here on this earth, is appearing like a solitary meteror,
by seeing whom all the monkeys are running away hither and thither."_END

B_6_C_59_16
BEGIN_
यो असौ नव अर्क उदित ताम्र चक्षुर् |
आरुह्य घण्टा निनद प्रणादम् |
गजम् खरम् गर्जति वै महात्मा |
महा उदरो नाम स;एष वीरह् || ६-५९-१७_END
BEGIN_
"He who, with tawny eyes resembling the dawn, riding an elephant with its bells
jangling, who is shouting aloud, he is that strong demon of the highest peculiarity is called
Mahodara."_END

B_6_C_58_34
BEGIN_
ततो रोषपरीतात्मा धनुस्तस्य दुरात्मनः |
बभञ्ज तरसा नीलो ननाद च पुनः पुनः || ६-५८-४४_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter the greatly enraged Nila quickly broke the bow of Prahasta the
evil-minded demon and shouted again and again._END

B_6_C_60_11
BEGIN_
स चाप्रतिमगाम्भीर्यो देवदानवदर्पहा || ६-६०-१३
ब्रह्मशापाभिभूतस्तु कुम्भकर्णो विबोध्यताम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Awaken that kumbhakarna, who is without equal in prowess, who humbles the pride of
the celestials and demons, and on whom the curse of Brahma the Lord of creation rests."_END

B_6_C_61_6
BEGIN_
आचक्ष्व सुमहान् कोऽसौ रक्षो वा यदि वासुरः |
न मयैवम्विधम् भूतम् दृष्टपूर्वम् कदाचन || ६-६१-७_END
BEGIN_
"Who is he with such a colossal body? Tell me whether he is a demon or an evil
spirit. I have not seen such a creature earlier at any time."_END

B_6_C_59_17
BEGIN_
यो असौ हयम् कान्चन चित्र भाण्डम् |
आरुह्य संध्या अभ्र गिरि प्रकाशम् |
प्रासम् समुद्यम्य मरीचि नद्धम् |
पिशाच;एष अशनि तुल्य वेगह् || ६-५९-१८_END
BEGIN_
"He who, ascending the brilliantly caparisoned horse raising high a gleaming
javelin, possesses a velocity of a well-directed thunder-bolt and resembles a mass of evening
clouds and a mountain, he is Pishacha."_END

B_6_C_62_0
BEGIN_
स तु राक्षसशार्दूलो निद्रामदसमाकुलः |
राजमार्गम् श्रिया जुष्टम् ययौ विपुलविक्रमः || ६-६२-१_END
BEGIN_
That Kumbhakarna of great prowess and the foremost, having full of intoxicating
drowsiness, marched along the king's highway, full of royal dignity._END

B_6_C_58_35
BEGIN_
विधनुस् तु कृतस् तेन प्रहस्तो वाहिनी पतिः |
प्रगृह्य मुसलम् घोरम् स्यन्दनाद् अवपुप्लुवे || ६-५८-४५_END
BEGIN_
Deprived of his bow, Prahasta the leader of the army, seizing a formidable mace,
leapt down from the chariot._END

B_6_C_60_12
BEGIN_
समरे जितमात्मानम् प्रहस्तम् च निषूदितम् || ६-६०-१४
ज्ञात्वा रक्षोबलम् भीममादिदेश महाबलः |_END
BEGIN_
Having known that Prahasta being slain and knowing himself to have been defeated in
the battle, Ravana issued his commands tot he dreadful army, saying:_END

B_6_C_61_7
BEGIN_
सम्पृष्टो राजपुत्रेण रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा |
विभीषणो महाप्राज्ञः काकुत्थ्समिदमब्रवीत् || ६-६१-८_END
BEGIN_
Thus asked by Rama the prince, who was unweary in action, the highly intelligent
Vibhishana replied to Rama as follows:_END

B_6_C_59_18
BEGIN_
यश् च एष शूलम् निशितम् प्रगृह्य |
विद्युत् प्रभम् किम्कर वज्र वेगम् |
वृष इन्द्रम् आस्थाय गिरि प्रकाशम् |
आयाति सो असौ त्रिशिरा यशस्वी || ६-५९-१९_END
BEGIN_
"He who, seizing a sharp spike with a possesses the velocity of a well-directed
thunder bolt and comes mounting on an excellent bull which shines like a moon, he is the
illustrious Trishiras."_END

B_6_C_62_1
BEGIN_
राक्षसानाम् सहस्रैश्च वृतः परमदुर्जयः |
गृहेभ्यः पुष्पवर्षेण कीर्यमाणस्तदा ययौ || ६-६२-२_END
BEGIN_
Then, that Kumbhakarna, who was very difficult to be conquered, accompanied by
thousands of demons, sallied forth, covered with a shower of flowers from the houses (lining the
way)._END

B_6_C_58_36
BEGIN_
ताव् उभौ वाहिनी मुख्यौ जात रोषौ तरस्विनौ |
स्थितौ क्षतज दिग्ध अन्गौ प्रभिन्नाव् इव कुन्जरौ || ६-५८-४६_END
BEGIN_
Those two army-chiefs, who were courageous and in whom enmity had sprung up, with
their limbs covered with blood, wee standing like two elephants in rut._END

B_6_C_60_13
BEGIN_
द्वारेषु यत्नः क्रियताम् प्राकारश्चाधिरुह्यताम् || ६-६०-१५
निद्रावशसमाविष्टः कुम्भकर्णो विबोध्यताम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Guard the gates with utmost care. Man the ramparts. Rouse Kumbhakarna who is
slumbering soundly."_END

B_6_C_61_8
BEGIN_
येन वैवस्वतो युद्धे वासवश्च पराजितः |
सैष विश्रवसः पुत्रः कुम्भकर्णः प्रतापवान् || ६-६१-९
अस्य प्रमाणसदृशो राक्षसोऽन्यो न विद्यते |_END
BEGIN_
"He is the powerful Kumbhakarna, the son of Visravasa. He conquered Yama and Indra
in battle. Tehre is no other demon, corresponding to the size of his body."_END

B_6_C_62_2
BEGIN_
स हेमजालविततम् भानुभास्वरदर्शनम् |
ददर्श विपुलम् रम्यम् राक्षसेन्द्रनिवेशनम् || ६-६२-३_END
BEGIN_
He saw Ravana's abode, covered with golden grilled windows, spacious and looking
beautiful, like a shining sun._END

B_6_C_59_19
BEGIN_
असौ च जीमूत निकाश रूपह् |
कुम्भह् पृथु व्यूढ सुजात वक्षाह् |
समाहितह् पन्नग राज केतुर् |
विस्फारयन् भाति धनुर् विधून्वन् || ६-५९-२०_END
BEGIN_
"The other resembling a thunder-bolt, of large and well-developed chest, who has an
attentive mind, has the King of Snakes as his standard, who is moving and twanging his bow, he is
Kumbha."_END

B_6_C_58_37
BEGIN_
उल्लिखन्तौ सुतीक्ष्णाभिर् दम्ष्ट्राभिर् इतरेतरम् |
सिम्ह शार्दूल सदृशौ सिम्ह शार्दूल चेष्टितौ || ६-५८-४७
विक्रान्त विजयौ वीरौ समरेष्व् अनिवर्तिनौ |
कान्क्षमाणौ यशः प्राप्तुम् वृत्र वासवयोः समौ || ६-५८-४८_END
BEGIN_
Lion and tiger in gait, lion and tiger in gestures, those two warriors tore each
other with their shap teeth. Vanquishers of other heroes and intrepid combatants, both of them,
thirsting for fame, resembled Vritra and Indra._END

B_6_C_60_14
BEGIN_
सुखम् स्वपिति निश्चिन्तः कालोपहतचेतनः || ६-६०-१६
नव सप्त दशाष्टौ च मासान् स्वपिति राक्षसः |_END
BEGIN_
"Kumbhakarna is sleeping happily, his understanding vitiated by lust and free from
all anxieties. The demon sleeps for nine, seven, ten or eight months._END

B_6_C_61_9
BEGIN_
एतेन देवा युधि दानवाश्च |
यक्षाभुजम्गाः पिशिताशनाश्च |
गंधर्वविद्याधरपन्नगाश्च |
सहस्रशो राघव सम्प्रभग्नाः || ६-६१-१०_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama! He conquered thousands of celestials, demons, a class of demi-gods, serpent
demons, ogres, Gandharvas teh celestial musicians, Vidyadharas the celestials artistes and Kinnaras
(the semi-divine beings with the human form and the head of a horse) in battle."_END

B_6_C_62_3
BEGIN_
स तत्तदा सूर्य इवाभ्रजालम् |
प्रविश्य रक्षोधिपतेर्निवेशनम् |
ददर्श दूरेऽग्रजमासनस्थम् |
स्वयंभुवम् शक्र इवासनस्थम् || ६-६२-४_END
BEGIN_
Entering Ravana's palace, like the sun entering a mass of clouds, Kumbhakarna then
saw from of distance his brother seated on a throne, as Indra saw Brahma perched on his seat._END

B_6_C_59_20
BEGIN_
यश् च एष जाम्बू नद वज्र जुष्टम् |
दीप्तम् सधूमम् परिघम् प्रगृह्य |
आयाति रक्षो बल केतु भूतह् |
सो असौ निकुम्भो अद्भुत घोर कर्मा || ६-५९-२१_END
BEGIN_
"He who, holding a mace decorated with gold and diamonds, which are radiant (as
fire) and also smoky (studded with sapphires), who advances as a standard bearer tot he army of
demons, he is Nikumbha of Prodigious exploits."_END

B_6_C_58_38
BEGIN_
आजघान तदा नीलम् ललाटे मुसलेन सः |
प्रहस्तः परम् आयस्तस् तस्य सुस्राव शोणितम् || ६-५८-४९_END
BEGIN_
Then, that Prahasta exerting himself well struck Nila on his forehead with a mace
and blood oozed from his forehead._END

B_6_C_60_15
BEGIN_
मन्त्रम् कृत्वा प्रसुप्तोऽयमिअस्तु नवमेऽहनि || ६-६०-१७
तम् तु बोधयत क्षिप्रम् कुम्भकर्णम् महाबलम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Having deliberated with me nine days ago, he has since fallen asleep. Awaken
quickly that mighty Kumbhakarna."_END

B_6_C_61_10
BEGIN_
शूलपाणिं विरूपाक्षम् कुम्भकर्णम् महाबलम् |
हन्तुम् न शेकुस्त्रिंदशाः कालोऽयमिति मोहिताः || ६-६१-११_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing the mighty Kumbharana with ghastly eyes and a spear in hand, the celestials
were not able to kill him, having confused to think that he was yama the god of Death."_END

B_6_C_62_4
BEGIN_
भ्रातुः स भवनं गच्छन् रक्षोगणसमन्वितः |
कुम्भकर्णः पदन्यासैरकम्पयत् मेदिनीम् || ६-६२-५_END
BEGIN_
While going to his brother's palace, that Kumbhakarna, accompanied by troops of
demons, caused the earth to shake with his stamping strides._END

B_6_C_59_21
BEGIN_
यश् च एष चाप असि शर ओघ जुष्टम् |
पताकिनम् पावक दीप्त रूपम् |
रथम् समास्थाय विभात्य् उदग्रो |
नर अन्तको असौ नग शृन्ग योधी || ६-५९-२२_END
BEGIN_
"He who, mounted in a chariot, adorned with flags, gleaming like a glowing blazer,
who is furnished with bows swords and a multitude of arrows, he is Narantaka who shines brightly
over there and who, in combat, fights with mountain-tops."_END

B_6_C_58_39
BEGIN_
ततः शोणित दिग्ध अन्गह् प्रगृह्य सुमहा तरुम् |
प्रहस्तस्य उरसि क्रुद्धो विससर्ज महा कपिः || ६-५८-५०_END
BEGIN_
Whereupon, that great ape, his limbs smeared with blood, seized a huge tree and
struck Prahasta full in his chest with fury._END

B_6_C_60_16
BEGIN_
स हि सम्ख्ये महाबाहुः ककुदम् सर्वरक्षसाम् || ६-६०-१८
वानरान् राजपुत्रौ च क्षिप्रमेव हनिष्यति |_END
BEGIN_
"The mighty armed Kumbhakarna, the foremost of all demons will kill the monkeys and
the two princes at once in the battle."_END

B_6_C_61_11
BEGIN_
प्रकृत्या ह्येष तेजस्वी कुम्भकर्णो महाबलः |
अन्येषाम् राक्षसेंद्राणाम् वरदानकृतम् बलम् || ६-६१-१२_END
BEGIN_
"This Kumbhakarna, by his very nature, is energetic and mighty. The strength of the
other demon-chiefs is attributable to boons (granted on request by gods)."_END

B_6_C_62_5
BEGIN_
सोऽभिगम्य गृहम् भ्रातुः कक्ष्यामभिविगाह्य च |
ददर्शोद्विग्नमासीनम् विमाने पुष्पके गुरुम् || ६-६२-६_END
BEGIN_
Reaching his brother's house and entering the inner apartment, Kumbhakarna saw his
worried brother sitting in Pushpaka, a self-moving aerial car._END

B_6_C_58_40
BEGIN_
तम् अचिन्त्य प्रहारम् स प्रगृह्य मुसलम् महत् |
अभिदुद्राव बलिनम् बली नीलम् प्लवम् गमम् || ६-५८-५१_END
BEGIN_
Ignoring that blow, he seized a huge mace and ran in strength towards Nila the
strong monkey._END

B_6_C_59_22
BEGIN_
यश् च एष नाना विध घोर रूपैर् |
व्याघ्र उष्ट्र नाग इन्द्र मृग इन्द्र वक्त्रैह् |
भूतैर् वृतो भाति विवृत्त नेत्रैह् |
सो असौ सुराणाम् अपि दर्प हन्ता || ६-५९-२३
यत्र एतद् इन्दु प्रतिमम् विभातिच् |
चत्त्रम् सितम् सूक्ष्म शलाकम् अग्र्यम् |
अत्र एष रक्षो अधिपतिर् महात्मा |
भूतैर् वृतो रुद्र;इव अवभाति || ६-५९-२४_END
BEGIN_
"He who, surrounded by ghosts of dreadful form of rolling eyes, with heads of
tigers, buffalo mighty elephants, deer and horses, under an excellent white canopy with slender
ribs and shining like a moon, he who is the humbler of the gods themselves, shining like unto Rudra
amidst the genii, is the suzerain Lord of Demons there."_END

B_6_C_60_17
BEGIN_
एष केतुः परं सम्ख्ये मुख्ये वै सर्वरक्षसाम् || ६-६०-१९
कुम्भकर्णः सदा शेते मूढो ग्राम्यसुखे रतः |_END
BEGIN_
"This Kumbhakarna, the chief among all the demons and a great mark in the battle,
being fond of a rustic comfort, is always sleeping stupidly."_END

B_6_C_61_12
BEGIN_
एतेन जातमात्रेण क्षुधार्तेन महात्मना |
भक्षितानि सहस्राणि सत्त्वानाम् सुबहून्यपि || ६-६१-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Soon after his birth, this great-souled demon, afflicted as he was by hunger, ate
thousands of living creatures."_END

B_6_C_62_6
BEGIN_
अथ दृष्ट्वा दशग्रीवः कुम्भकर्णमुपस्थितम् |
तूर्णमुत्थाय सम्हृष्टः सम्निकर्षमुपानयत् || ६-६२-७_END
BEGIN_
On seeing Kumbhakarna who arrived there, Ravana then quickly rose up from his seat,
delighted and brought him nearer to his side._END

B_6_C_58_41
BEGIN_
तम् उग्र वेगम् सम्रब्धम् आपतन्तम् महा कपिः |
ततः सम्प्रेक्ष्य जग्राह महा वेगो महा शिलाम् || ६-५८-५२_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Prahasta of terrible velocity briskly rushing towards him, Nila the great
monkey took a huge rock swiftly._END

B_6_C_59_23
BEGIN_
असौ किरीटी चल कुण्डल आस्यो |
नाग इन्द्र विन्ध्य उपम भीम कायह् |
महा इन्द्र वैवस्वत दर्प हन्ता |
रक्षो अधिपह् सूर्य;इव अवभाति || ६-५९-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Ravana, decked with a diadem, who has brought Indra the Lord of celestials and
Vaivasvata the Lord of Death low, is shining like the sun. His countenance is graced by ear-rings.
His formidable stature equals the Vindhya the Lord of Mountains."_END

B_6_C_63_0
BEGIN_तस्य राक्षसराजस्य निशम्य परिदेवितम् |
कुम्भकर्णो बभा षेदं वचनम् प्रजहास च || ६-६३-१_END
BEGIN_Hearing the lamentation of Ravana, Kumbhakarna laughed at a full volume and spoke as 
follows:_END

B_6_C_60_18
BEGIN_
रामेणाभिनिरस्तस्य सम्ग्रामेऽस्मिन् सुदारुणे || ६-६०-२०
भविष्यति न मे शोकः कुम्भकर्णे विबोधिते |_END
BEGIN_
"If Kumbhakarna is awaken, there will be no worry for me, who stand defeated by Rama
in this highly terrific battle."_END

B_6_C_61_13
BEGIN_
तेषु सम्भक्ष्यमाणेषु प्रजा भयनि पीडिताः |
यान्ति स्म शरणम् शक्रम् तमप्यर्थम् न्यवेदयन् || ६-६१-१४_END
BEGIN_
"While the living being were being eaten, the frightened people sought refuge with
Indra and even reported the matter about him."_END

B_6_C_58_42
BEGIN_
तस्य युद्ध अभिकामस्य मृधे मुसल योधिनः |
प्रहस्तस्य शिलाम् नीलो मूर्ध्नि तूर्णम् अपातयत् || ६-५८-५३_END
BEGIN_
Nila quickly hurled that rock on the head of Prahasta who was longing for war and
fighting with a mace in the battle._END

B_6_C_62_7
BEGIN_
अथासीनस्य पर्यङ्के कुम्भकर्णो महाबलः |
भ्रातुर्ववन्दे चरणौ किम् कृत्यमिति चाब्रवीत् || ६-६२-८_END
BEGIN_
Then, the mighty Kumbhakarna having offered salutation to the feet of his brother
sitting on a sofa, asked him, "What is to be done?"_END

B_6_C_59_24
BEGIN_
प्रत्युवाच ततो रामो विभीषणम् अरिम् दमम् |
अहो दीप्तो महा तेजा रावणो राक्षस ईश्वरह् || ६-५९-२६_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama the annihilator of enemies, answered Vibhishana and said "Alas! What
glory, what majesty is Ravana's the Lord of Demons!_END

B_6_C_63_1
BEGIN_दृष्टो दोषो हि योऽस्माभिः पुरा मन्त्रविनिर्णये |
हितेष्वनभियुक्तेन सोऽयमासादितस्त्वया || ६-६३-२_END
BEGIN_"The same bad consequence, which was imagined by us earlier while taking the final decision 
after our consultation, is faced by you now, due to your utter disregard of the words spoken by your 
well-wishers."_END

B_6_C_60_19
BEGIN_
किम् करिष्याम्यहम् तेन शक्रतुल्यबलेन हि || ६-६०-२१
ईदृशे व्यसने घोरे यो न साह्याय कल्पते |_END
BEGIN_
"What is the use of him, who possessing a strength equal to that of Indra the Lord
of celestials, cannot help me in such a dreadful catastrophe?"_END

B_6_C_61_14
BEGIN_
स कुम्भकर्णम् कुपितो महेन्द्रो
जघान वज्रेण शितेन वज्री |
स शक्रवज्रभिहतो महात्मा |
चचाल कोपाच्च भृशम् ननाद || ६-६१-१५_END
BEGIN_
That Mahendra wielding a thunder-bolt was enraged and struck Kumbhakarna with his
weapon of the white thunderbolt. The great souled Kumbhakarna struck by Indra's thunderbolt was
quite agitatated at it and roared loudly with anger."_END

B_6_C_59_25
BEGIN_
आदित्य;इव दुष्प्रेक्ष्यो रश्मिभिर् भाति रावणह् |
सुव्यक्तम् लक्षये ह्य् अस्य रूपम् तेजह् समावृतम् || ६-५९-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Ravana is beaming like the sun with his rays difficult to be gazed, neither can the
eye rest on him such is the binding strength of his magnificence!"_END

B_6_C_58_43
BEGIN_
नीलेन कपिमुख्येन विमुक्ता महती शिला |
बिभेद बहुधा घोरा प्रहस्तस्य शिरस् तदा || ६-५८-५४_END
BEGIN_
Then, that huge and terrific rock hurled by Nila the leader of the monkeys broke
Prahasa's head into myriad pieces._END

B_6_C_62_8
BEGIN_
उत्पत्य चैनम् मुदितो रावणः परिषस्वजे |
स भ्रात्रा सम्परिष्वक्तो यथावच्छाभिनन्दितः || ६-६२-९
कुम्भकर्णः शुभं दिव्यम् प्रतिपेदे वरासनम् |_END
BEGIN_
Rising up from his seat, Ravana embraced him. That Kumbhakarna, who was thus
embraced and made happy by his brother, occupied an auspicious, charming and excellent seat._END

B_6_C_63_2
BEGIN_श्रीघ्रम् खल्वभ्युपेतम् त्वाम् फलम् पापस्य कर्मणः |
निरयेष्वेव पतनम् यथा दुष्कृतकर्मणः || ६-६३-३_END
BEGIN_"How a doer of wicked deeds indeed falls into damnation, so also a punishment for your 
sinful act has indeed reached your fast."_END

B_6_C_60_20
BEGIN_
ते तु तद्वचनम् श्रुत्वा राक्षसेन्द्रस्य राक्षसाः || ६-६०-२२
जग्मुः परमसम्भ्रान्ताः कुम्भकर्णनिवेशनम् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Ravana, those demons very briskly went to the abode of
Kumbhakarna._END

B_6_C_61_15
BEGIN_
तस्य नानद्यमानस्य कुम्भकर्णस्य रक्षसः |
श्रुत्वा निनादम् वित्रस्ताः प्रजा भूयो वितत्रसुः || ६-६१-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Hearing the roar of that Kumbakarna, the demon, wh was howling loudly, the
grigthened people were further frightened."_END

B_6_C_59_26
BEGIN_
देव दानव वीराणाम् वपुर् न एवम् विधम् भवेत् |
यादृशम् राक्षस इन्द्रस्य वपुर् एतत् प्रकाशते || ६-५९-२८_END
BEGIN_
"The body of celestial or demonical heroes may not be so radiant in this manner as
this body of the king of demons."_END

B_6_C_58_44
BEGIN_
स गत असुर् गत श्रीको गत सत्त्वो गत इन्द्रियः |
पपात सहसा भूमौ चिन्न मूल;इव द्रुमः || ६-५८-५५_END
BEGIN_
That Prahasta who lost his breath, was disfigured and dead, bereft of his senses and
at once fell on the ground like a tree cut up by the root._END

B_6_C_62_9
BEGIN_
स तदासनमाश्रित्य कुम्भकर्णो महाबलः || ६-६२-१०
सम्रक्तनयनः क्रोधाद्रवणम् वाक्यमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Resting on that seat, the mighty Kumbhakarna, with his blood-shot eyes in anger,
spoke to Ravana as follows:_END

B_6_C_63_3
BEGIN_प्रथमम् वै महाराज कृत्यमेतदचिन्तितम् |
केवलम् वीर्यदर्पेणनानुबन्धो विचिन्तितः || ६-६३-४_END
BEGIN_"O emperor! This course of action was not excepted by you at first. You did not conceive 
this consequence, only because of your sheer arrogance of power."_END

B_6_C_60_21
BEGIN_
ताम् प्रविश्य महाद्वाराम् सर्वतो योजनायताम् || ६-६०-२३
कुम्भक्र्णगुहाम् रम्याम् पुष्पगन्धप्रवाहिनीम् |
कुम्भकर्णस्य निःश्वासादवधूता महाबलाः || ६-६०-२४
प्रतिष्ठमानाः कृच्छ्रेण यत्ना त्प्रविविशुर्गुहाम् |_END
BEGIN_
Entering the beautiful cave of Kumbhakarna, with a large door, having an area of a
Yojana on all sides and bearing a floral perfume, the demons of mighty strength, though shaken off
by Kumbhakarna's breaths, remained stable forcefully with difficulty and went into the cave._END

B_6_C_61_16
BEGIN_
ततः क्रुद्धो महेन्द्रस्य कुम्भकर्णो महाबलः |
निष्कृष्यैरावताद्दन्तम् जघानोरसि वासवम् || ६-६१-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Enraged as he was on Mahendra, the mighty Kumbhakarna then pulled out a tusk of
Airavata, Indra's elephant and struck it into Indra's chest."_END

B_6_C_59_27
BEGIN_
सर्वे पर्वत सम्काशाह् सर्वे पर्वत योधिनह् |
सर्वे दीप्त आयुध धरा योधश् च अस्य महा ओजसह् || ६-५९-२९_END
BEGIN_
"All the warriors of the suzerain Ravana are as high as hills. All fight with
mountains. All wield fiery weapons."_END

B_6_C_58_45
BEGIN_
विभिन्न शिरसस् तस्य बहु सुस्राव शोणितम् |
शरीराद् अपि सुस्राव गिरेह् प्रस्रवणम् यथा || ६-५८-५६_END
BEGIN_
A lot of blood oozed from his broken head. From his body two, blood streamed forth
like a cascade from a mountain._END

B_6_C_62_10
BEGIN_
किम्मर्थमहमादृत्य त्वया राजन् प्रबोधितः || ६-६२-११
शस कस्माद्भयम् तेऽत्र को वा प्रेतो भविष्यति |_END
BEGIN_
"O king! For what purpose have I been woken up by you, with effort? Tell me from
whom is the danger for you here and who is to be killed."_END

B_6_C_63_4
BEGIN_यः पश्चात्पूर्वकार्याणि कुर्यादैश्वर्यमास्थितः |
पूर्वं चोत्तरकार्याणि न स वेद नयानयौ || ६-६३-५_END
BEGIN_"He who, abiding in power, performs duties to be done earlier at a later stage and duties 
to be done later, at an early stage, does not know what is a right course and what is a wrong course."_END

B_6_C_60_22
BEGIN_
ताम् प्रविश्य गुहाम् रम्याम् रत्नकाञ्चनकुट्टिमाम् || ६-६०-२५
ददृशुर्नैरृतव्याघ्राः शयानम् भीमविक्रमम् |_END
BEGIN_
Entering that beautiful cave inlaid with diamonds and gold, those tigers among
demons beheld Kumbhakarna, of terrific prowess, who was sleeping._END

B_6_C_61_17
BEGIN_
कुम्भकर्णप्रहारार्तो विजज्वाल स वासवः |
ततो विषेदुः सहसा देवा ब्रह्मर्षिदानवाः || ६-६१-१८
प्रजाभिः सह शक्रश्च ययौ स्थानम् स्वयम्भूवः |_END
BEGIN_
"That Devendra, tormented by the hit of Kumbhakarna, was burning with rage. The
celestials, Brahmanical sages and demons were suddenly aggrieved. Even Indra with his people went
to the abode of Brahma the Lord of creation."_END

B_6_C_59_28
BEGIN_
भाति राक्षस राजो असौ प्रदीप्तैर् भीम विक्रमैह् |
भूतैह् परिवृतस् तीक्ष्णैर् देहवद्भिर् इव अन्तकह् || ६-५९-३०_END
BEGIN_
"Amidst the fiery ghosts of terrible aspect, this king of demons shines like Yama
the Lord of Death surrounded by blazing genii endowed with hideous forms."_END

B_6_C_58_46
BEGIN_
हते प्रहस्ते नीलेन तद् अकम्प्यम् महद् बलम् |
रक्षसाम् अप्रहृष्टानाम् लन्काम् अभिजगाम ह || ६-५८-५७_END
BEGIN_
Thier leader having been slain by Nila that unshakable and large army of demons,
becoming disconsolated, withdrew to Lanka._END

B_6_C_62_11
BEGIN_
भ्रातरम् रावणः क्रुद्धं कुम्भकर्णमवस्थितम् || ६-६२-१२
रोषेण परिवृत्ताभ्याम् नेत्राभ्याम् वाक्यमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Ravana, with his eyes rolling with annoyance, spoke to Kumbhakarna, his brother, who
was there with anger (as follows):_END

B_6_C_63_5
BEGIN_देशकालविहीनानि कर्माणि विपरीतवत् |
क्रियमाणानि दुष्यन्ति हवीम्ष्यप्रयतेष्विव || ६-६३-६_END
BEGIN_"Action done perversely, regardless of space and time, get spoiled like offering oblations 
without properly making the fire well-prepared."_END

B_6_C_60_23
BEGIN_
ते तु तम् विकृतम् सुप्तम् विकीर्णमिव पर्वतम् || ६-६०-२६
कुम्भम् महानिद्रम् समेताः प्रत्यबोधयन् |_END
BEGIN_
They together tried to awaken Kumbhakarna who was sleeping nastily like a spread-out
mountain in a great slumber._END

B_6_C_64_0
BEGIN_
तदुक्तमतिकायस्य बलिनो बाहुशालिनः |
कुम्भकर्णस्य वचनम् श्रुत्वोवाच महोदरः || ६-६४-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words spoken by the mighty Kumbhakarna of colossal body and large
arms, Mahodara spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_59_29
BEGIN_
दिष्ट्यायमद्य पापात्मा मम दृष्टिपथम् गतः |
अद्य क्रोधं विमोक्ष्यामि सीताहरणसम्भवम् || ६-५९-३१_END
BEGIN_
"By good luck, that wretch comes today within my range of sight! Today, I shall
expunge my wrath, born of Seetha's abduction!"_END

B_6_C_61_18
BEGIN_
कुम्भकर्णस्य दौरात्म्यम् शशंसुस्ते प्रजापतेः || ६-६१-१९
प्रजानाम् भक्षणम् चापि धर्षणम् च दिवौकसाम् |
आश्रमध्वंसनम् चापि परस्त्रीहरणम् तथा || ६-६१-२०_END
BEGIN_
"They informed about the evil-mind of Kumbhakarna to Brahma, how he devoured the
living creatures, his assault on celestials, the destroyal of hermitages and his taking away of
others' wives."_END

B_6_C_58_47
BEGIN_
न शेकुः समवस्थातुम् निहते वाहिनी पतौ |
सेतु बन्धम् समासाद्य विशीर्णम् सलिलम् यथा || ६-५८-५८_END
BEGIN_
Thier chief of Army having been killed, those demons could not continue to stand
firmy there, any more than water on reaching a breached bridge._END

B_6_C_62_12
BEGIN_
अयम् ते सुमहन् कालः शयानस्य महाबल || ६-६२-१३
सुषुप्तस्त्वम् न जानीषे मम रामकृतम् भयम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O mighty Kumbhakarna! You slept for a long period. You, who were fast asleep, do
not know about the fear created by Rama in me."_END

B_6_C_63_6
BEGIN_त्रयाणाम् पञ्चधा योगम् कर्मणाम् यः प्रपद्यते |
सचिवैः समयम् कृत्वा स सम्यगभिवर्तते || ६-६३-७_END
BEGIN_"He, who acts according to an agreement done with his counsellors, considering three 
types of duties*, by harassing five types of means**, moves along a right course."_END

B_6_C_60_24
BEGIN_
ऊर्ध्वलोमाञ्चिततनुम् श्वसन्तमिव पन्नगम् || ६-६०-२७
भ्रामयन्तम् विनिःश्वासैः शयानम् भीमविक्रमम् |
भीमनासापुटम् तम् तु पातालविपुलाननम् || ६-६०-२८
शयने न्यस्तसर्वाङ्गम् मेदोरुधिरगन्धिनम् |
काञ्चनाङ्गदनद्धाङ्गम् मेदोरुधिरगन्धिनम् || ६-६०-२९
ददृशुर्नैरृतव्याघ्रम् कुम्भकर्णमरिन्दमम् |_END
BEGIN_
His limbs covered with down which stood on end, breathing like a serpent, as he
slept, Kumbhakarna of irresistible valour emitted dreadful snores, his nostrils being horrible, and
his mouth a gaping hell. Stretched to his full length on the earth, he gave forth an odour of
