marrow and blood, his limbs were adorned with golden armlets and he wore a diadem as bright as the
sun, thus did that lion among demons, Kumbhakarna, the slayer of his foes, appear!_END

B_6_C_64_1
BEGIN_
कुम्भकर्णकुले जातो धृष्टः प्राकृतदर्शनः |
अवलिप्तो न शक्नोषि कृत्यम् सर्वत्र वेदितुम् || ६-६४-२_END
BEGIN_
"O Kumbhakarna! Though born in a good race, you are audacious, having the perception
of an ordinary man as also arrogant. You are unable to know the right to be done at all times."_END

B_6_C_61_19
BEGIN_
एवम् प्रजा यदि त्वेष भक्षयिष्यति नित्यशः |
अचिरेणैव कालेन शून्यो लोको भविष्यति || ६-६१-२१_END
BEGIN_
"If he eats away the created beings continuously like this, the world will become
desolate just soon after some time."_END

B_6_C_59_30
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा ततो रामो धनुर् आदाय वीर्यवान् |
लक्ष्मण अनुचरस् तस्थौ समुद्धृत्य शर उत्तमम् || ६-५९-३२_END
BEGIN_
Having spoken thus, the valiant Rama who was accompanied by Lakshmana, took up his
bow and then standing erect, drew out an excellent arrow._END

B_6_C_58_48
BEGIN_
हते तस्मिंसः चमू मुख्ये राक्षसस् ते निरुद्यमाः |
रक्षः पति गृहम् गत्वा ध्यान मूकत्वम् आगताः || ६-५८-५९
प्रप्ताः शोकार्णावम् तीव्रम् विसम्ज्ञा इव ते.भवन् |_END
BEGIN_
That Prahasta the chief of Army having been slain, those demons dumb dispirited and
inactive, regained the abode of their king. They became unconscious as it were plunged in an ocean
of burning grief._END

B_6_C_62_13
BEGIN_
एष दाशरथी रामः सुग्रीवसहितो बली || ६-६२-१४
समुद्रम् लङ्घयित्वा तु कुलम् नः परिकृन्तति |_END
BEGIN_
"This Rama, the son of Dasaratha, a strong man along with Sugreeva, having crossed
the ocean, is cutting short our race."_END

B_6_C_63_7
BEGIN_यथागमम् च यो राजा समयम् च चिकीर्षति |
बुध्यते सचिवैर्बुद्ध्या सुहृदश्चानुपश्यति || ६-६३-८_END
BEGIN_"A king who wishes to execute am agreement as per law, understands it through his own 
intellect as well as the counsellors and discovers it through his friends, is on a right course."_END

B_6_C_60_25
BEGIN_
ततश्चक्रुर्महात्मानः कुम्भकर्णस्य चाग्रातः || ६-६०-३०
भूतानाम् मेरुसम्काशम् राशिम् परमतर्पणम् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, those powerful demons, in order to satisfy him, placed a heap of venison as
high as Mount Meru, in front of Kumbhakarna._END

B_6_C_64_2
BEGIN_
न हि राजा न जानीते कुम्भकर्ण नयानयौ |
त्वम् तु कैशोरकाद्धृष्टः केवलम् वक्तुमिच्छसि || ६-६४-३_END
BEGIN_
"O Kumbhakarna! It is not that the king does not know about the prudent and the
imprudent conducts. Due to childishness and audacity, you, on your part, are craving merely to
talk."_END

B_6_C_61_20
BEGIN_
वासवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा सर्वलोकपितामहः |
रक्षांस्यावाहयामास कुम्भकर्णम् ददर्श ह || ६-६१-२२_END
BEGIN_
"On hearing the words of Indra, Brahama, the great grandfather of the entire world,
called for the demons and saw Kumbhakarna too along with them."_END

B_6_C_59_31
BEGIN_
ततह् स रक्षो अधिपतिर् महात्मा |
रक्षांसि तान्य् आह महा बलानि |
द्वारेषु चर्या गृह गोपुरेषु |
सुनिर्वृतास् तिष्ठत निर्विशन्काह् || ६-५९-३३_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, that powerful Ravana spoke to those exceedingly strong demons as
follows: "Take up your positions unfalteringly and happily at the gates and principal exits, the
outposts and fortifications."_END

B_6_C_58_49
BEGIN_
ततस् तु नीलो विजयी महा बलः |
प्रशस्यमानः स्वकृतेन कर्मणा |
समेत्य रामेण सलक्ष्मणेन |
प्रहृष्ट रूपस् तु बभूव यूथपः || ६-५८-६०_END
BEGIN_
The triumphant Nila, however, was honoured by Rama and Lakshmana for his task well
accomplished and experienced supreme joy._END

B_6_C_62_14
BEGIN_
हन्त पश्यस्व लङ्कया वनान्युपवनानि च || ६-६२-१५
सेतुना सुखमागत्य वानरैकार्णवम् कृतम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Alas! See! Coming happily by a bridge, the forests and groves have been covered
with an ocean full of monkeys."_END

B_6_C_63_8
BEGIN_धर्ममर्थम् च कामम् च सर्वान्वा रक्षसाम् पते |
भजते पुरुषः काले त्रिणि द्वन्द्वानि वा पुनः || ६-६३-९_END
BEGIN_"O king of demons! A man resorts to virtue or worldly gain or pleasure or all the three 
together or a twin combination of virtue and worldly gain or virtue and pleasure or worldly gain and 
pleasure or worldly gain and pleasure, according to an appointed time*."_END

B_6_C_60_26
BEGIN_
मृगाणाम् महिषाणाम् च वराहाणाम् च संचयान् || ६-६०-३१
चक्रुर्नैरृतशार्दूला राशिमन्नस्य चाद्भुतम् |_END
BEGIN_
Those excellent demons piled up a great mass of wonderful food with the meat of
deers, buffaloes and pigs._END

B_6_C_64_3
BEGIN_
स्थानम् वृद्धिम् च हानिं च देशकालविभागवित् |
आत्मनश्च परेषाम् च बुध्यते राक्षसर्षभ || ६-६४-४_END
BEGIN_
"The king of demons, knowing about apportioning of place and time, understands the
subject about strengthening and mining (of relationships) as well as his own position and the
position of others."_END

B_6_C_61_21
BEGIN_
कुम्भकर्णम् समीक्ष्यैव वितत्रास प्रजापतिः |
कुम्भकर्णमथाश्वस्तः स्वयम्भूरिदमब्रवीत् || ६-६१-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Just on seeing Kumbhakarna even Brahma was frightened. Thereafter on restoring his
confidence, Brahma cursed Kumbhakarna as follows:_END

B_6_C_59_32
BEGIN_
इहागतम् माम् सहितम् भवद्भि |
र्वनौकसश्चिद्रमित्दम् विदित्वा |
शून्याम् पुरीम् दुष्प्रसहाम् प्रमथ्य |
प्रधर्षयेयुः सहसा समेताः || ६-५९-३४_END
BEGIN_
"Learning of my presence along with you here, taking this to be a weak point and
storming this desolate city which is otherwise difficult to be overpowered, the monkeys when united
may destroy it by surprise."_END

B_6_C_62_15
BEGIN_
ये राक्षसा मुख्यतमा हतास्ते वानरैर्युधि || ६-६२-१६
वानराणाम् क्षयम् युधे न पश्यामि कथंचन |
न चापि वानरा युद्धे जितपूर्वाः कदाचन || ६-६२-१७_END
BEGIN_
"The monkeys killed very important demons in battle. I do not envisage, in any way,
the destroyable of monkeys on the battle-field. It seems the monkeys were not even defeated at any
time before, in a combat."_END

B_6_C_63_9
BEGIN_त्रिषु चैतेषु यच्छ्रेष्ठम् श्रुत्वा तन्नावबुध्यते |
राजा वा राजमात्रो वा व्यर्थम् तस्य बहु श्रुतम् || ६-६३-१०_END
BEGIN_"That sovereign king or crown prince, who, having heard which one is the best out of 
these three but does not keep it in mind, his extensive learning would be in vain."_END

B_6_C_60_27
BEGIN_
ततः शोणितकुम्भांश्च मांसानि विविधानि च || ६-६०-३२
पुरस्तात्कुम्भकर्णस्य चक्रुस्त्रिदशशत्रवः |_END
BEGIN_
Then, the demons placed pots of blood and various kinds of meat in front of
Kumbhakarna._END

B_6_C_64_4
BEGIN_
यत्तु शक्यं बलवता कर्तुं प्राकृतबुद्धिना |
अनुपासितवृद्धेन कः कुर्यात्तादृशं बुधः || ६-६४-५_END
BEGIN_
"What would a wise man attempt to do that which cannot be achieved by a man of
ordinary intellect, though strong, does not sever his elders?"_END

B_6_C_61_22
BEGIN_
ध्रुवम् लोकविनाशाय पौलस्त्येनासि निर्मितः |
तस्मात्त्वमद्यप्रभृति मृतकल्पः शयिष्यसे || ६-६१-२४_END
BEGIN_
"It is sure that you were created by visravasa for the destroyal of people. On that
account, you will be sleeping apparently dead from now onwards."_END

B_6_C_59_33
BEGIN_
विसर्जयित्वा सहसा ततस् तान् |
गतेषु रक्षह्सु यथानियोगम् |
व्यदारयद् वानर सागर ओघम् |
महा झषह् पूर्मम् इव अर्णव ओघम् || ६-५९-३५_END
BEGIN_
Having dismissed those counsellors and as the demons departed as ordered, Ravana
thereafter began to split under the waters of the sea of monkeys, in the same way as a gigantic
fish would rend the entire expanse of the sea._END

B_6_C_62_16
BEGIN_
तदेतद्भयमुत्पन्नम् त्रायस्वेह महाबल |
नाशय त्वमिमानद्य तदर्थम् बोधितो भवान् || ६-६२-१८_END
BEGIN_
"O mighty Kumbhakarna! Such a danger has arisen. You have to help us now. Get them
destroyed now. You have been woken up solely for that purpose."_END

B_6_C_63_10
BEGIN_उपप्रदानम् सान्त्वम् च भेदम् काले च विक्रमम् |
योगम् च रक्षसाम् श्रेष्ठ तावुभौ च नयानयौ || ६-६३-११
काले धर्मार्थकामान्यः सम्मन्त्य्र सचिवैह् सह |
निषेवेतात्मवान् लोके न स व्यसनमाप्नुयात् || ६-६३-१२_END
BEGIN_"O the foremost of demons! Whosoever deliberates with his counsellors and resorts to 
an act of with his counsellors and resorts to an act of bestowing gifts or conciliation or sowing dissension 
at appropriate occasion or exhibits valour or resorts to them all together or takes recourse to both 
right action and the reverse of it at the right time or pursues virtue or worldly gain or pleasure at 
the appropriate time, that intelligent person never confronts a misfortune in this world."_END

B_6_C_60_28
BEGIN_
लिलिपुश्च परार्ध्येन चन्दनेन परम्तपम् || ६-६०-३३
दिव्यैराश्वासयामासुर्माल्यैर्गन्धैश्च गन्धिभिः |_END
BEGIN_
They rubbed Kumbhakarna the scourge of his foes with the most rare sandalwood and
refreshed him with celestial and fragrant garlands as well as sweet-smelling perfumes._END

B_6_C_64_5
BEGIN_
यांस्तु धर्मार्थकामांस्त्वं ब्रवीषि पृथगाश्रयान् |
अवबोद्धुम् स्वभावेन न हि लक्षणमस्ति ते || ६-६४-६_END
BEGIN_
"You are speaking as though virtue, wealth and pleasure are dwelling separately (in
water-tight compartments). By their very nature, there is no accurate description to know those
things."_END

B_6_C_61_23
BEGIN_
ब्रह्मशापाभिभूतोऽथ निपपाताग्रतः प्रभोः |
ततः परमसम्भ्रान्तो रावणो वाक्यमब्रवीत् || ६-६१-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Humbled by Brahma's curse, Kumbhakarna then fell down in front of Ravana.
Thereupon, the highly perplexed Ravana spoke the following words:"_END

B_6_C_59_34
BEGIN_
तम् आपतन्तम् सहसा समीक्ष्य |
दीप्त इषु चापम् युधि राक्षस इन्द्रम् |
महत् समुत्पाट्य मही धर अग्रम् |
दुद्राव रक्षो अधिपतिम् हरि ईशह् || ६-५९-३६_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Ravana with his radiant bow, in the battle, Sugreeva the Lord of Monkeys
tearing up a huge mountain-top, ran towards that king of demons._END

B_6_C_62_17
BEGIN_
सर्वक्षपितकोशम् च स त्वमभ्युपपद्य माम् |
त्रायस्वेमाम् पुरीम् लङ्काम् बालवृद्धावशेषिताम् || ६-६२-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Rescuing me, whose treasury has become completely diminished, you protect this city
of Lanka, where only the children and the aged are left over."_END

B_6_C_63_11
BEGIN_हितानुबन्धमालोक्य कुर्यात्कार्यमिहात्मनः |
राजा सहार्थतत्त्वज्ञैः सचिवैर्बुद्धिजीविभिः || ६-६३-१३_END
BEGIN_"A sovereign has to do an act here, looking into his welfare as a consequence along with 
his counsellors who make their subsistence by their intelligence and who understand the true state of 
the things."_END

B_6_C_60_29
BEGIN_
धूपगन्धांश्च ससृजुस्तुष्टुवुश्च परम्तपम् || ६-६०-३४
जलदा इव चानेदुर्यातुधानास्ततस्ततः |_END
BEGIN_
They burnt incenses and hymned the praises of that warrior who proved fatal to his
foes. They cried out noises which burst forth on every side like thunder._END

B_6_C_64_6
BEGIN_
कर्म चैव हि सर्वेषाम् कारणानां प्रयोजनम् |
श्रेयः पापीयसाम् चात्र फलं भवति कर्मणाम् || ६-६४-७_END
BEGIN_
"Action alone is indeed the means to get all the consequences. Even sinful acts
spring up into a fruit of prosperity!"_END

B_6_C_61_24
BEGIN_
प्रवृद्धः काञ्चनो वृक्षः फलकाले निकृन्त्यते |
न नप्तारम् स्वकम् न्याय्यम् शप्तुमेवम् प्रजापते || ६-६१-२६_END
BEGIN_
"'O Brahma! You are cutting off a well-grown golden tree, just at the time of
yielding its fruit. It is not fair on your part to curse your own great grandson like this."_END

B_6_C_59_35
BEGIN_
तत् शैल शृन्गम् बहु वृक्ष सानुम् |
प्रगृह्य चिक्षेप निशा चराय |
तम् आपतन्तम् सहसा समीक्ष्य |
बिभेद बाणैस् तपनीय पुन्खैह् || ६-५९-३७_END
BEGIN_
Seizing a mountain-top with its many trees and ridges, Sugreeva hurled it on Ravana
the demon. Seeing that mountain-top coming towards him, Ravana quickly broke it asunder with his
arrows with golden shafts._END

B_6_C_62_18
BEGIN_
भ्रातुरर्थे महाबाहो कुरु कर्म सुदुष्करम् |
मयैवम् नोक्तपुर्वो हि कश्चिद्भ्रातः परम्तप || ६-६२-२०_END
BEGIN_
"O the great armed Kumbhakarna. For the sake of your brother, perform this act,
which is very difficult to do. O brother, the annihilator of enemies! In this way, I did not
request anyone ever before."_END

B_6_C_63_12
BEGIN_अनभिज्ज़्नाय शास्त्रार्थान् पुरुषाः पशुबुद्धयः |
प्रागल्भ्याद्वक्त्मिच्छिन्ति मन्त्रेष्वभ्यन्तरीकृताः || ६-६३-१४_END
BEGIN_"Men with brutal ideas, who are initiated in discussions, aspire to tell haughty things, 
without fully knowing the precepts of the scriptures."_END

B_6_C_60_30
BEGIN_
शङ्खांश्च पूरयामासुः शशाङ्कसदृशप्रभान् || ६-६०-३५
तुमुलम् युगपच्चापि विनेदुश्चाप्यमर्षिताः |_END
BEGIN_
They blew couches which were as bright as the moon and with impatience, made with
impatience, made sounds tumultuously all at once._END

B_6_C_64_7
BEGIN_
निःश्रेयस फलावेव धर्मार्थावितरावपि |
अधर्मानर्थयोः प्राप्तिः फलम् च प्रत्यवायिकम् || ६-६४-८_END
BEGIN_
"Acts instrumental to virtue and wealth as well as other acts (instrumental to
injustice and non-value) have just the prosperity as their fruit. But, acts instrumental to
injustice and non-value gain the fruit of offence of omission."_END

B_6_C_61_25
BEGIN_
न मिथ्यावचनश्च त्वम् स्वप्स्यत्येव न संशयः |
कालस्तु क्रियतामस्य शयने जागरे तथा || ६-६१-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Your words can never prove to be in vain. There is no doubt about it. He will have
to sleep certainly. Let some space of time be fixed for his sleeping and waking."_END

B_6_C_59_36
BEGIN_
तस्मिन् प्रवृद्ध उत्तम सानु वृक्षे |
शृन्गे विकीर्णे पतिते पृथिव्याम् |
महा अहि कल्पम् शरम् अन्तक आभम् |
समाददे राक्षस लोक नाथह् || ६-५९-३८_END
BEGIN_
While that mountain-top with its well-developed ridges and excellent trees was rent
asunder and fell on the earth, Ravana like unto another Yama the Lord of Death, loosed an arrow
resembling a great serpent._END

B_6_C_63_13
BEGIN_अशास्त्रविदुषाम् तेषाम् कार्यम् नाभिहितं वचः |
अर्थशास्त्रानभिज्ञानाम् विपुलाम् श्रियमिच्छताम् || ६-६३-१५_END
BEGIN_"The words spoken by those who did not know the scriptures, who do not recollect the 
books dealing with practical life and who covet for abundant wealth are not to be implemented."_END

B_6_C_62_19
BEGIN_
त्वय्यस्ति मम च स्नेहः परा सम्भावना च मे |
दैवासुरेषु युद्धेषु बहुशो राक्षसर्षभ || ६-६२-२१
त्वया देवाः प्रतिव्यूह्य निर्जिताश्चासुरा युधि |_END
BEGIN_
"I have a great respect and affection towards you. O the foremost of demons! For
several times, in battles between gods and demons, you conquered the celestials and demons, after
attacking them in the battle."_END

B_6_C_60_31
BEGIN_
नेदुरास्फोटयामासुश्चिक्षिपुस्ते निशाचराः || ६-६०-३६
कुम्भकर्णविबोधार्थम् चक्रुस्तेविपुलम् स्वनम् |_END
BEGIN_
Those demons made sounds by clapping their hands, in order to awaken Kumbhakarna and
shook him too, creating a great clamour._END

B_6_C_64_8
BEGIN_
ऐहलौकिकपारत्र्यम् कर्म पुम्भिर्निषेव्यते |
कर्माण्यपि तु कल्प्यानि लभते काममास्थितः || ६-६४-९_END
BEGIN_
Living beings reap the fruit of good actions in this and in the other world.
However, he who remains diligently devoted to actions with a view to attaining sensuous pleasure
enjoys blessing even in this life."_END

B_6_C_61_26
BEGIN_
रावस्य वचः श्रुत्वा स्वयम्भूरिदमब्रवीत् |
शयिता ह्येष षण्मासानेकाहम् जागरिष्यति || ६-६१-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Hearing the words of Ravana, Brahma spoke as follows: He will indeed sleep for six
months and wake-up for a day."_END

B_6_C_59_37
BEGIN_
स तम् गृहीत्वा अनिल तुल्य वेगम् |
सविस्फुलिन्ग ज्वलन प्रकाशम् |
बाणम् महा इन्द्र अशनि तुल्य वेगम् |
चिक्षेप सुग्रीव वधाय रुष्टह् || ६-५९-३९_END
BEGIN_
The enraged Ravana, taking that arrow with the speed of a thunder bolt of Indra the
Lord of celestials and possessing the brilliance of a fire, hurled it to kill Sugreeva._END

B_6_C_63_14
BEGIN_अहितम् च हिताकारम् धार्ष्ट्याज्जल्पन्ति ये नराः |
अवश्यम् मन्त्रबाह्यास्ते कर्तव्याः कृत्यदूषकाः || ६-६३-१६_END
BEGIN_"Those men who talk with audacity, some inimical things in a friendly way, are to be 
kept out of deliberations, as they certainly spoil the work to be done."_END

B_6_C_62_20
BEGIN_
तदेतत्सर्वमातिष्ठ वीर्यम् भीमपराक्रम् || ६-६२-२२
न हि ते सर्वभूतेषु दृश्यते सदृशो बली |_END
BEGIN_
"O Kumbhakarna of terrible prowess! Therefore, show your entire prowess. There is
indeed no one, in the entire beings, who is equal to you in strength."_END

B_6_C_65_0
BEGIN_
स तथोक्तस्तु निर्भर्त्स्य कुम्भकर्णो महोदरम् |
अब्रवीद्राक्षसश्रेष्ठं भ्रातरम् रावणं ततः || ६-६५-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Mahodara, Kumbhakarna rebuked him and then spoke to his
brother, Ravana, the chief of demons (as follows):_END

B_6_C_64_9
BEGIN_
तत्र कॢप्तमिदम् राज्ञा हृदि कार्यं मतम् च नः |
शत्रौ हि साहसम् यत्स्यात्किमिवात्रापनीयते || ६-६४-१०_END
BEGIN_
"In such a situation, this act of pursuit of sensuous pleasure has been cherished in
his heart by the king and was approved by us. What violation is there in doing this daring act
against the enemy?"_END

B_6_C_60_32
BEGIN_
सशङ्खभेरीपणवप्रणाद |
मास्फोटितक्ष्वेलितसिम्हनादम् |
दिशो द्रवन्तस्त्रिदिवम् किरन्तः |
श्रुत्वा विहम्गाः सहसा निपेतुः || ६-६०-३७_END
BEGIN_
The birds passing through the sky ran helter-shelter and fell down soon on hearing
the sounds of the couches, drums, gongs, clapping of hands and leonine roars._END

B_6_C_61_27
BEGIN_
एकेनाह्ना त्वसौ वीरश्च रन् भूमिम् बुभुक्षितः |
व्यात्तास्यो भक्षयेल्लोकान् सम्वृद्ध इव पावकः || ६-६१-२९_END
BEGIN_
"On that single day, this male demon, having starved for six months, will wander
over the earth and eat the human race with his month wide open, like an augmented fire."_END

B_6_C_59_38
BEGIN_
स सायको रावण बाहु मुक्तह् |
शक्र अशनि प्रख्य वपुह् शित अग्रह् |
सुग्रीवम् आसाद्य बिभेद वेगाद् |
गुह ईरिता क्रौचम् इव उग्र शक्तिह् || ६-५९-४०_END
BEGIN_
That arrow released by Ravana's arm reached Sugreeva, having a bodily splendour
equal to that of Indra's thunder bolt, and pierced his body in its flight as formerly Guha's spear
when he discharged it at the Krauncha Mountain._END

B_6_C_62_21
BEGIN_
कुरुष्व मे प्रियहितमेतदुत्तमम् |
यथाप्रियम् प्रियरण बान्धवप्रिय |
स्वतेजसा विधम सपत्नवाहिनीम् |
शरद्घनम् पवन इवोद्यतो महान् || ६-६२-२३_END
BEGIN_
"O Kumbhakarna, delighting in war and feeling affection for relatives! Perform this
excellent act, which is dear and beneficial to me, as per your liking. Blow away the army of
adversaries by your vital power, as an autumnal cloud is blown away by a high-rising wind."_END

B_6_C_63_15
BEGIN_विनाशयन्तो भर्तारम् सहिताः शत्रुभिर्बुधैः |
विपरीतानि कृत्यानि कारयन्तीह मन्त्रिणः || ६-६३-१७_END
BEGIN_"Some counsellors, colluding with some learned adversaries, spoil their king and make 
them do wrong deeds."_END

B_6_C_65_1
BEGIN_
सोऽहम् तव भयं घोरम् वधात्तस्य दुरात्मनः |
रामस्याद्य प्रमार्जामि निर्वैरस्त्वम् सुखीभव || ६-६५-२_END
BEGIN_
"By annihilation of that evil-minded Rama, I will wipe-off your terrifc fear today.
Be happy, indeed without any enmity."_END

B_6_C_64_10
BEGIN_
एकस्यैवाभियाने तु हेतुर्यः प्रकृतस्त्वया |
तत्राप्यनुपपन्नम् ते वक्ष्यामि यदसाधु च || ६-६४-११_END
BEGIN_
"Regarding the reason which you have adduced for marching all alone for the
encounter, I shall tell you what is irrelevant and not so good."_END

B_6_C_60_33
BEGIN_
यदा भृशम् तैर्निनदैर्महात्मा |
न कम्भकर्णो बुबुधे प्रसुप्तः |
ततो भुशुण्डीर्मुसलानि सर्वे |
रक्षोगणास्तम् जगृहुर्गदाश्च || ६-६०-३८_END
BEGIN_
As the illustrious Kumbhakarna did not waken from his slumber despite those great
sounds, all troops of demons seized hold of bars, pestles and maces towards him._END

B_6_C_61_28
BEGIN_
सोऽसौ व्यसनमापन्नः कुम्भकर्णमबोधयत् |
त्वत्पराक्रमभीतश्च राजा सम्प्रति रावणः || ६-६१-३०_END
BEGIN_
"Ravana, the king of demons, who got into an evil plight and frightened as he was in
seeing your prowess, now got Kumbhakarna awakened."_END

B_6_C_59_39
BEGIN_
स सायक आर्तो विपरीत चेताह् |
कूजन् पृथिव्याम् निपपात वीरह् |
तम् प्रेक्ष्य भूमौ पतितम् विसम्ज्मम् |
नेदुह् प्रहृष्टा युधि यातु धानाह् || ६-५९-४१_END
BEGIN_
Wounded by that arrow, which bereft him of consciousness, that warrior fell moaning
to the earth. Beholding him falling on the ground, deprived of his senses in the battle-field, the
demons raised a shout of triumph._END

B_6_C_63_16
BEGIN_तान् भर्ता मित्रसम्काशानमित्रान् मन्त्रनिर्णये |
व्यवहारेण जानीयात्सचिवानुपसम्हितान् || ६-६३-१८_END
BEGIN_"The king should make-out those ministers who have been transformed by the enemy to their 
side (through bribery and other things) and are enemies though looking like friends, through their conduct 
when a final decision is being taken after deliberation."_END

B_6_C_65_2
BEGIN_
गर्जन्ति न वृथा शूर निर्जला इव तोयदाः |
पश्य सम्पाद्यमानम् तु गर्जितम् युधि कर्मणा || ६-६५-३_END
BEGIN_
"Warriors do not roar in vain as waterless clouds. Hear my roar, only on completion
of my said task in battle."_END

B_6_C_60_34
BEGIN_
तम् शैलशृङ्गेर्मुसलैर्गदाभि |
र्वक्षःस्थले मुद्गरमुष्टिभिश्च |
सुखप्रसुप्तम् भुवि कुम्भकर्णम् |
रक्षांस्युदग्राणि तदा निजघ्नः || ६-६०-३९_END
BEGIN_
Then, the cruel demons struck that sleeping Kumbhakarna on his chest with
mountain-tops, pestles, maces, hammers and their fists._END

B_6_C_64_11
BEGIN_
येन पूर्वम् जनस्थाने बहवोऽतिबला हताः |
राक्षसा राघवम् तं त्वं कथमेको जयिष्यसि || ६-६४-१२_END
BEGIN_
"How will you conquer, single-handed, that Rama by whom several mighty demons were
destroyed in Janasthana earlier."_END

B_6_C_61_29
BEGIN_
स एष निर्गतो वीरः शिबिराद्भीमविक्रमः |
वानरान् भृशसम्क्रुद्धो भक्षयन् परिधावति || ६-६१-३१_END
BEGIN_
"This Kumbhakarna the male-demon with a terrific prowess started his tent. The
highly enraged Kumbhakara devourincg the monkeys on is way, is running towards us."_END

B_6_C_59_40
BEGIN_
ततो गव अक्षो गवयह् सुदम्ष्ट्रस् |
तथा ऋषभो ज्योति मुखो नलश् च |
शैलान् समुद्यम्य विवृद्ध कायाह् |
प्रदुद्रुवुस् तम् प्रति राक्षस इन्द्रम् || ६-५९-४२_END
BEGIN_
Then, Gavaksha, Gavaya, Sushena, Rishabha, Jyotimukha and Nala; of exceeding
corpulence tearing up rocks, rushed towards Ravana._END

B_6_C_63_17
BEGIN_चपलस्येह कृत्यानि सहसानुप्रधावतः |
चिद्रमन्ये प्रपद्यन्ते क्रौञ्चस्य खमिव द्विजाः || ६-६३-१९_END
BEGIN_"Outsiders find out the fickleness of a ruler, who is led away by false appearances and 
quickly performs the acts, as birds discover the hole (made by the arrow of Skanda, the commander-in-chief 
of gods) in the Kruancha mountain."_END

B_6_C_65_3
BEGIN_
न मर्षयति चात्मानम् सम्भावयति नात्मना |
अदर्शयित्वा शूरास्तु कर्म कुर्वन्ति दुष्करम् || ६-६५-४_END
BEGIN_
"Warriors do not indulge in eulogizing themselves. They do difficult acts, without a
show."_END

B_6_C_60_35
BEGIN_
तस्य निःश्वासवातेन कुम्भकर्णस्य रक्षसः |
राक्षसा बलवन्तोऽपि स्थातुम् शेकुर्न चाग्रतः || ६-६०-४०_END
BEGIN_
Even with all their strength, the demons could not stand upright before the
breathing winds of Kumbhakarna, the demon._END

B_6_C_64_12
BEGIN_
ये पुरा निर्जितास्तेन जनस्थाने महौजसः |
राक्षसांस्तान्पुरे सर्वान्भीतानद्यापि पश्यसि || ६-६४-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Are you not seeing those frightened demons (though highly energetic) who are now
staying in the City, but who were earlier conquered by Rama in Janasthana?"_END

B_6_C_61_30
BEGIN_
कुम्भकर्णम् प्रतीक्ष्यैव हरयोऽद्य प्रदुद्रुवुः |
कथमेनम् रणे क्रुद्धम् वारयिष्यन्ति वानराः || ६-६१-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Even on merely seeing Kumbhakarna, the monkeys have now fled away. How can the
monkeys check him, who is thus enraged in battle?"_END

B_6_C_59_41
BEGIN_
तेषाम् प्रहारान् स चकार मेघान् |
रक्षो अधिपो बाण गणैह् शित अग्रैह् |
तान् वानर इन्द्रान् अपि बाण जालैर् |
बिभेद जाम्बू नद चित्र पुन्खैह् || ६-५९-४३_END
BEGIN_
That Lord of Demons, with hundreds of arrows, possessed of sharp points, rendered
their projectiles fruitless and pierced those leaders of the monkeys with a multitude of marvellous
golden shafted arrows._END

B_6_C_63_18
BEGIN_यो हि शत्रुमवज्ञाय नात्मानमभिरक्षति |
अवाप्नोति हि सोऽनर्थान् स्थानाच्च व्यवरोप्यते || ६-६३-२०_END
BEGIN_"A king who disregards an enemy and does not protect himself, indeed faces disappointing 
occurrences and would be removed from his position."_END

B_6_C_65_4
BEGIN_
विक्लवानामबुद्धीनाम् राञां पण्डितमानिनाम् |
शृण्वतामादित इदम् त्वद्विधानां महोदर || ६-६५-५_END
BEGIN_
"O Mahodara! Your words may be agreeable to those kings who are confused, who fancy
themselves as the learned, and who themselves are stupid."_END

B_6_C_60_36
BEGIN_
ततः परिहिता गाढम् राक्षसा भीमविक्रमाः |
मृदङ्गपणवान् भेरीः शङ्खकुम्भगणांस्तथा || ६-६०-४१_END
BEGIN_
Then, the terribly strong demons firmly seated themselves round him and began to
beat drums, cymbals, kettle-drums and myriads of couches and trumpets._END

B_6_C_64_13
BEGIN_
तम् सिम्हमिव सङ्क्रुद्धं रामम् दशरथात्मजम् |
सर्पम् सुप्तमिवाबुध्ह्या प्रबोधयितुमिच्छसि || ६-६४-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Though you know that Rama, the son of Dsasratha, is like an enraged lion, you wish
to awaken a serpent, who is sleeping."_END

B_6_C_61_31
BEGIN_
उच्यन्ताम् वानराः सर्वे यन्त्रमेतत्समुच्छ्रितम् |
इति विज्ञाय हरयो भविष्यन्तीह निर्भयाः || ६-६१-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Let all the monkeys be told that it is a kind of machine, advancing forward. By
knowing this, they can become fearless by now."_END

B_6_C_66_0
BEGIN_
स लङ्घायित्वा प्राकारम् गिरिकूटोपमो महान् |
निर्ययौ निगरात्तूत्णम् कुम्भकर्णो महाबलः || ६-६६-१_END
BEGIN_
That mighty Kumbhakarna, with his colossal body resembling the peak of a mountain,
having crossed the rampart, sallied forth from the city._END

B_6_C_59_42
BEGIN_
ते वानर इन्द्रास् त्रिदश अरि बाणैर् |
भिन्ना निपेतुर् भुवि भीम रूपाह् |
ततस् तु तद् वानर सैन्यम् उग्रम् |
प्रच्चादयाम् आस स बाण जालैह् || ६-५९-४४_END
BEGIN_
Pierced by the arrows of Ravana the Enemy of Gods, those monkey-Generals of
terrifying stature fell on the ground. Thereupon, he covered that formidable army of monkeys with a
shower of arrows._END

B_6_C_65_5
BEGIN_
युद्धे कापुरुषैर्नित्यं भवद्भिः प्रियवादिभिः |
राजानमनुगच्छद्भिः कृत्यमेतद्विनाशितम् || ६-६५-६_END
BEGIN_
"You are all cowards in battle. You always speak pleasantly and go according to the
wishes of the king. You, as such, have spoiled all the undertakings."_END

B_6_C_63_19
BEGIN_यदुक्तमिह ते पूर्वम् क्रियतामनुजेन च |
तदेव नो हितम् वाक्यम् यदिच्छसि च तत्कुरु || ६-६३-२१_END
BEGIN_"That advice which was tendered to you earlier by vibhishana is beneficial to us. Do 
whatever you wish to do."_END

B_6_C_64_14
BEGIN_
ज्वलन्तम् तेजसा नित्यं क्रोधेन च दुरासदम् |
कस्तं मृत्युमिवासह्यमासादयितुमर्हति || ६-६४-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Who would be competent to approach that Rama, who is forever shining with a
splendour, dangerous to catch-up and as unbearable as death?"_END

B_6_C_60_37
BEGIN_
दश राक्षससाहस्रम् युगपत्पर्यवारयत् |
नीलञ्जनचयाकारम् ते तु तम् प्रत्य्बोधयन् || ६-६०-४२
अभिघ्नन्तो नदन्तश्च न च सम्बुबुधे तदा |_END
BEGIN_
Ten thousand demons surrounded him all at once. Beating that colossus who resembled
a heap of antimony, the demons on their part tried to rouse him by making sounds. Even then, he did
not wake._END

B_6_C_61_32
BEGIN_
विभीषणवचः श्रुत्वा हेतुमत्सुमुखोद्गतम् |
उवाच राघवो वाक्यम् नीलम् सेनापतिम् तदा || ६-६१-३४_END
BEGIN_
On hearing Vibhishana's words, which were well-founded to make the monkeys
well-inclined to fight the battle, Rama then spoke the follwoing words to neela, the chief of
army:_END

B_6_C_66_1
BEGIN_
ननाद च महानादम् समुद्रमभिनादयन् |
विजयन्निव निर्घातान्विधमन्निव पर्वतान् || ६-६६-२_END
BEGIN_
Kumbhakarna emitted a roar, making the sea to reverberate, causing the mountains to
quake and drowning the thunder-claps, as it were._END

B_6_C_59_43
BEGIN_
ते वध्यमानाह् पतित अग्र्य वीरा |
नानद्यमाना भय शल्य विद्धाह् |
शाखा मृगा रावण सायक आर्ता |
जग्मुह् शरण्यम् शरणम् स्म रामम् || ६-५९-४५_END
BEGIN_
Assailed and fallen down, those monkey-warriors, emitted cries as though struck by
an arrow of terror, whom Ravana was destroying with his darts and fled for refuge to Rama who is
capable of affording protection to all._END

B_6_C_63_20
BEGIN_तत्तु श्रुत्वा दशग्रीवः कुम्भकर्णस्य भाषितम् |
भ्रुकुटिम् चैव संचक्रे क्रुद्धश्चैनमभाषत || ६-६३-२२_END
BEGIN_On hearing those words of Kumbhakarna, Ravana, on his part, twisted his eye-brows in 
anger and spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_65_6
BEGIN_
राजशेषा कृता लङ्का क्षीणः कोशो बलम् हतम् |
राजानमिममासाद्य सुहृच्चिह्नममित्रकम् || ६-६५-७_END
BEGIN_
"Having access to this king, who has friends merely for a name-sake as also behaving
unfriendly, the treasury got depleted, the army destroyed and king alone is left the Lanka."_END

B_6_C_64_15
BEGIN_
संशयस्थमिदम् सर्वं शत्रोः प्रतिसमासने |
एकस्य गमनम् तत्र न हि मे रोचते तव || ६-६४-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Standing face-to-face with that enemy is all remaining in doubt. Going there
single-handed does not indeed find favour with me."_END

B_6_C_60_38
BEGIN_
यदा चैनम् न शेकुस्ते प्रतिबोधयितुम् तदा || ६-६०-४३
ततो गुरुतरम् यत्नम् दारुणम् समुपाक्रमन् |_END
BEGIN_
As they were unable to rouse him by these means, they resorted to more energetic and
ruthless methods._END

B_6_C_61_33
BEGIN_
गच्छ सैन्यानि सर्वाणि व्यूह्य तिष्टस्य पावके |
द्वाराण्यादाय लङ्कायाश्चर्याश्चाप्यथ सम्क्रमान् || ६-६१-३५_END
BEGIN_
"O Neela the son of fire-god. Go, marshalling the entire army. Occupying the
door-ways, high-ways and bridges of Lanka, stand ready for operation."_END

B_6_C_66_2
BEGIN_
तमवध्यं मघवता यमेन वरुणेन च |
प्रेक्ष्य भीमाक्षमायान्तं वानरा विप्रदुद्रुवुः || ६-६६-३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that demons of terrific eyes who could not be destroyed either by Indra the
lord of celestials or by Yama the lord of death or by Varuna the god of water, the monkeys ran
away._END

B_6_C_59_44
BEGIN_
ततो महात्मा स धनुर् धनुष्मान् |
आदाय रामह् सहरा जगाम |
तम् लक्ष्मणह् प्रान्जलिर् अभ्युपेत्य |
उवाच वाक्यम् परम अर्थ युक्तम् || ६-५९-४६_END
BEGIN_
Then the high-souled Rama the skilful archer, taking his bow, set out at once.
Lakshmana, however, approaching him with joined palms, spoke very meaningful words follows:_END

B_6_C_63_21
BEGIN_मन्यो गुरुरिवाचार्यः कि माम् त्वमनुशाससे |
किमेवम् वाक्ष्रमम् कृत्वा काले युक्तम् विधीयताम् || ६-६३-२३_END
BEGIN_"Why are you advising me like a venerable great teacher? What is the use in getting wearied 
of your speech? Let a work, most befitting of time, be performed."_END

B_6_C_65_7
BEGIN_
एष निर्याम्यहम् युद्धमुद्यतः शत्रुनिर्जये |
दुर्नयं भवतामद्य समीकर्तुं महाहवे || ६-६५-८_END
BEGIN_
"Intent on conquering the enemy, I sally for the battle today to set right your
imprudent policy."_END

B_6_C_64_16
BEGIN_
हीनार्थस्तु समृद्धार्थम् को रिपुं प्राकृतो यथा |
निश्चितम् जीवितत्यागे वशमानेतुमिच्छति || ६-६४-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Having lost his advantage, who would feel inclined to reduce to submission, an
enemy, who is rich in advantage and determined to lay down his life, as an ordinary person?"_END

B_6_C_60_39
BEGIN_
अश्वानुष्ट्रान् खरान्नागान् जघ्नर्दण्डकशाङ्कुशैः || ६-६०-४४
भेरीशङ्खेमृदङ्गांश्च सर्वप्राणैरवादयन् |_END
BEGIN_
They beat horses, camels, donkeys, and elephants with sticks whips and thongs, so
that they trample upon him and blasted kettle-drums, couches and drums._END

B_6_C_61_34
BEGIN_
शैलशृङ्गाणि वृक्षांश्च शिलाश्चाप्युपसम्हर |
तिष्ठन्तु सायुधाः सर्वे वानराः शैलपाणयः || ६-६१-३६_END
BEGIN_
"Draw together the mountain-tops, trees and even the rocks. Let all the monkeys with
their weapons and rocks in hand, stand ready."_END

B_6_C_66_3
BEGIN_
तांस्तु विद्रवतो दृष्ट्वा वालिपुत्रोऽङ्गदोऽब्रवीत् |
नलं नीलं गवाक्षं च कुमुदं च महाबलम् || ६-६६-४_END
BEGIN_
Seeing them running away, Angada the prince spoke to Nala, Neela, Gavaksha and the
mighty Kumuda as follows:_END

B_6_C_59_45
BEGIN_
कामम् आर्यह् सुपर्याप्तो वधाय अस्य दुरात्मनह् |
विधमिष्याम्य् अहम् नीचम् अनुजानीहि माम् विभो || ६-५९-४७_END
BEGIN_
"O, noble Brother! Of my own accord, I am able to kill this wretched Ravana. O,
Lord! I shall slay him. Permit me to do so."_END

B_6_C_63_22
BEGIN_विभ्रमाच्चित्तमोहाद्वा बलवीर्याश्रयेण वा |
नाभिपन्नमिदानीम् यद्व्यर्था तस्य पुनः कथा || ६-६३-२४_END
BEGIN_"Now, it is a waste to tell again of that act which was wrongly done before, either by 
mistake or by an illusion of mind or by taking shelter in strength and prowess."_END

B_6_C_65_8
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तवतो वाक्यम् कुम्भकर्णस्य धीमतः |
प्रत्युवाच ततो वाक्यं प्रहसन्राक्षसाधिपः || ६-६५-९_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of the intellectual Kumbhakarna, Ravana the king of demons,
bursting into laughter, replied as follows:_END

B_6_C_64_17
BEGIN_
यस्य नास्ति मनुष्येषु सदृशो राक्षसोत्तम |
कथमाशंससे योद्धुम् तुल्येनेन्द्रविवस्वतोः || ६-६४-१८_END
BEGIN_
"O Kumbhakarna, the foremost among the demons! How do you wish to combat with Rama,
with whom none in the human beings is equal and who is equal of Indra and the sun?"_END

B_6_C_60_40
BEGIN_
निजघ्नश्चास्य गात्राणि महाकाष्ठकटम्करैः || ६-६०-४५
मुद्गरैर्मुसलैश्चापि सर्वप्राणसमुद्यतैः |_END
BEGIN_
They crushed his limbs under piles of heavy logs and pillars, as also maces lifted
with all their strength._END

B_6_C_61_35
BEGIN_
राघवेण समादिष्टो नीलो हरिचमूपतिः |
शशास वानरानीकम् यथावत्कपिकुञ्जरः || ६-६१-३७_END
BEGIN_
As directed by Raghavana, Neela the commander-in-chief and the foremost of the
monkeys, ordered the monkey-troops suitably._END

B_6_C_66_4
BEGIN_
आत्मानमत्र विस्मृत्य वीर्याण्यभिजनानि च |
क्व गच्छत भयत्रस्ताः प्राकृता हरयो यथा || ६-६६-५_END
BEGIN_
"Where do you go, forgetting your own dignities as also nobilities of birth and
trembling with fear like common monkeys?"_END

B_6_C_59_46
BEGIN_
तम् अब्रवीन् महा तेजा रामह् सत्य पराक्रमह् |
गच्च यत्न परश् च अपि भव लक्ष्मण सम्युगे || ६-५९-४८_END
BEGIN_
The exceedingly powerful and the truly courageous Rama spoke to that Lakshmana as
follows: "Go, Lakshmana and also be strenuous in this duel."_END

B_6_C_63_23
BEGIN_अस्मिन् काले तु यद्युक्तम् तदिदानीम् विचिन्त्यताम् |
गतम् तु नानुशोचन्ति गतम् तु गतमेव हि || ६-६३-२५_END
BEGIN_"Let whatever be appropriate at this moment be thought of now. Wise men do not repent 
over the past. Past is indeed but the past."_END

B_6_C_64_18
BEGIN_
एवमुक्त्वा तु सम्रब्धम् कुम्भकर्णं महोदरः |
उवाच रक्षसां मध्ये रावणो लोकरावणम् || ६-६४-१९_END
BEGIN_
Having thus spoken to the enraged Kumbhakarna, Mahodara on his part spoke as
follows, in the midst of demons, to Ravana, who made the people cry._END

B_6_C_60_41
BEGIN_
तेन नादेन महाअ लङ्का समभिपूरिता || ६-६०-४६
सपर्वतवना सर्वा सोऽपि नैव प्रबुध्यते |_END
BEGIN_
The entire Lanka, with its mountain and groves, was filled with great noise. He
nevertheless did not wake._END

B_6_C_65_9
BEGIN_
महोदरोऽयम् रामात्तु परित्रस्तो न संशयः |
न हि रोचयते तात युद्धम् युद्धविशारद || ६-६५-१०_END
BEGIN_
"O dear brother, well-versed in the art of war-fare! This Mahodara is frightened of
Rama. There is no doubt. He is not indeed inclined of a war."_END

B_6_C_61_36
BEGIN_
तत्तो गवाक्षः शरभो हनूमानङ्गदस्तथा |
शैलशृङ्गाणि शैलाभा गृहीत्वा द्वारमभ्ययुः || ६-६१-३८_END
BEGIN_
Then, Gavaksha, Sharabha, Hanuma and Angada looking like mountains, reached the
gate, taking the mountian-tops._END

B_6_C_66_5
BEGIN_
साधु सौम्या निवर्तध्वं किं प्राणान्परिरक्षथ |
नालं युद्धाय वै रक्षो महतीयं विभीषिकाः || ६-६६-६_END
BEGIN_
"O auspicious monkeys! Please return! Why do you so fully guard your lives? This
demon is not competent for a combat. He is merely a great toy of terror."_END

B_6_C_59_47
BEGIN_
रावणो हि महा वीर्यो रणे अद्भुत पराक्रमह् |
त्रैलोक्येन अपि सम्क्रुद्धो दुष्प्रसह्यो न संशयह् || ६-५९-४९_END
BEGIN_
"Ravana is endowed with great strength and possesses an outstanding prowess during a war. The Three Worlds themselves could not withstand his fury. There is no doubt about it."_END

B_6_C_64_19
BEGIN_
लब्ध्वा पुनस्ताम् वैदेहीम् किमर्थं त्वं प्रजल्पसि |
यदेच्छसि तदा सीता वशगा ते भविष्यति || ६-६४-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Why are you delaying further, after having captured Seetha already? If you do so
wish, Seetha will be submissive to you."_END

B_6_C_63_24
BEGIN_ममापनयजं दुःखम् विक्रमेण समीकुरु |
यदि खल्वस्ति मे स्नेहो विक्रमम् वाधिगच्छसि || ६-६३-२६
यदि कार्यम् ममैतत्ते हृदि कार्यतमम् मतम् |_END
BEGIN_"If you have affection indeed for me or if you discover your own prowess and if you think 
it fit in your heart that my work is to be done very much, you nullify the hardship, born out of my 
wicked conduct, by your prowess."_END

B_6_C_60_42
BEGIN_
ततः सहस्रम् भेरीणाम् युगपत्समहन्यत || ६-६०-४७
मृष्टकाञ्चनकोणाना मासक्तानाम् समन्ततः |_END
BEGIN_
Then, they beat a thousand drums all around with sticks of refined gold._END

B_6_C_65_10
BEGIN_
कश्चिन्मे त्वत्समो नास्ति सौहृदेन बलेन च |
गच्छ शत्रुवधाय त्वम् कुम्भकर्णजयाय च || ६-६५-११_END
BEGIN_
"O Kumbhakarna! None is equal to you in friendship and strength, in my eyes. You
march to the battlefield for destroying the enemies and for achieving victory."_END

B_6_C_61_37
BEGIN_
रामवाक्यमुपश्रुत्य हरयो जीतकाशिनः |
पादपैरर्दयन्वीरा वानराः परवाहिनीम् || ६-६१-३९_END
BEGIN_
On hearing Rama's words, the fearless monkeys started their operation. The heroic
monkeys began to torment the enemy-troops with uplifted trees._END

B_6_C_66_6
BEGIN_
महतीमुत्थितामेनां राक्षसानां विभीषिकाम् |
विक्रमाद्विधमिष्यामो निवर्तध्वं प्लवङ्गमाः || ६-६६-७_END
BEGIN_
"O monkeys! By our prowess, we shall destroy this giant toy produced by demons. Come
back!"_END

B_6_C_59_48
BEGIN_
तस्य चिद्राणि मार्गस्व स्वच् चिद्राणि च गोपय |
चक्षुषा धनुषा यत्नाद् रक्ष आत्मानम् समाहितह् || ६-५९-५०_END
BEGIN_
"Seek out his weak points and guard against your own. Defend yourself vigilantly
with your eye and bow."_END

B_6_C_64_20
BEGIN_
दृष्टः कश्चिदुपायो मे सीतोपस्थानकारकः |
रुचितश्चेत्स्वया बुद्ध्या राक्षसेश्वर तम् शृणु || ६-६४-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Some strategy has been discovered by me, as a means of bringing her round. If it is
found agreeable to your intellect, then listen to it._END

B_6_C_60_43
BEGIN_
एवनओततुबुद्रस्त्य् तदा बौव ओरव्य्द्ग्तत || ६-६०-४८
शापस्य वशमापन्नस्ततः क्रुद्धा निशाचराः |_END
BEGIN_
Yet, as he did not wake from his profound slumber, being under the spell of a curse,
the demons were enraged._END

B_6_C_63_25
BEGIN_स सुहृद्यो विपन्नार्थम् दीनमभ्युपपद्यते || ६-६३-२७
स बन्धुर्योऽपनीतेषु साहाय्यायोपकल्पते |_END
BEGIN_"He who rescues an afflicted soul, whose fortune is ruined, he is the real friend. He 
who is ready at hand to help those who have deviated from the right course, is a kinsman."_END

B_6_C_65_11
BEGIN_
शयानः शत्रुनाशार्थम् भवान् सम्बोधितो मया |
आयम् हि कालः सुमहान् राक्षानामरिंदम || ६-६५-१२_END
BEGIN_
"O destroyer of enemies! You, who were sleeping, were awakened by me, for the
purpose of destroying the enemies. This is indeed a grand time for our demons."_END

B_6_C_61_38
BEGIN_
ततो हरीणाम् तदनीकमुग्रम् |
रराज शैलोद्यतवृक्षहस्तम् |
गिरेः समीपानुगतम् यथैव |
महन्महाम्भोधरजालमुग्रम् || ६-६१-४०_END
BEGIN_
That terrific army of monkeys, with uplifted rocks and tress in their hands, shone
like a big collection of gigantic clouds, hanging close to a mountain._END

B_6_C_66_7
BEGIN_
कृच्छ्रेण तु समाश्वास्य सङ्गम्य च ततस्ततः |
वृक्षाद्रिहस्ता हरयः सम्प्रतस्थू रणाजिरम् || ६-६६-८_END
BEGIN_
Reconciling themselves with some difficulty, the monkeys, from all sides, assembled
together at a place and snatching some trees, the monkeys for their part, towards the
battle-field._END

B_6_C_59_49
BEGIN_
राघवस्य वचह् श्रुत्वा सम्परिष्वज्य पूज्य च |
अभिवाद्य ततो रामम् ययौ सौमित्रिर् आहवम् || ६-५९-५१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Rama, Lakshmana embraced him, thereafter offering obeisance and
bidding him farewell, he entered the battle-field._END

B_6_C_64_21
BEGIN_
अहम् द्विजिह्वः सम्ह्रादी कुम्भकर्णो वितर्दनः |
पञ्चरामवधायैते निर्यान्तीत्यवघोषय || ६-६४-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Announce (by a beat of drum in the city-streets) that myself, Dvijihva, Samhraadi,
Kumbhakarna and Vitardana these five demons are setting out for the battle to kill Rama."_END

B_6_C_60_44
BEGIN_
महाक्रोधसमाविष्टाः सर्वे भीमपराक्रमाः || ६-६०-४९
तद्रक्षो बोधयिष्यन्तश्चक्रुरन्ये पराक्रमम् |_END
BEGIN_
All those demons of terrible strength were filled with a great fury. Some others
assembled their strength to awaken that demon._END

B_6_C_63_26
BEGIN_तमथैवम् ब्रुवाणम् स वचनम् धीरदारुणम् || ६-६३-२८
रुष्ट्ऽयमिति विज्ञाय शनैः श्लक्ष्णमुवाच ह |_END
BEGIN_Thereupon, hearing those deeply harsh words spoken by Ravana and understanding that he 
is quite enraged, Kumbhakarna spoke slowly and smoothly._END

B_6_C_65_12
BEGIN_
तद्गच्छ शूलमादाय पाशहस्त इवान्तकः |
वानरान् राजपुत्रौ च भक्षयादित्यतेजसौ || ६-६५-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Therefore, go like Yama the god of death, by taking a dart and a noose in your
hand. Devour the monkeys and the princes whose splendour is like that of the sun."_END

B_6_C_66_8
BEGIN_
ते निवृत्य तु सङ्क्रुद्धाः कुम्भकर्णं वनौकसः |
निजघ्नुः परमक्रुद्धाः समदा इव कुञ्जराः || ६-६६-९_END
BEGIN_
Like elephants in rut, those monkeys, having came back, hurriedly hit Kumbhakarna,
very much enraged as they were._END

B_6_C_59_50
BEGIN_
स रावणम् वारण हस्त बाहुर् |
ददर्श दीप्त उद्यत भीम चापम् |
प्रच्चादयन्तम् शरवृष्टि जालैस् |
तान् वानरान् भिन्न विकीर्ण देहान् || ६-५९-५२_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana then saw Ravana with arms as large as the trunks of elephants, who was
brandishing his dreadful and fiery bow, covering those monkeys whose bodies he had severed with a
close rain of darts._END

B_6_C_64_22
BEGIN_
ततो गत्वा वयम् युद्धम् दास्यामस्तस्य यत्नतः |
जेष्यामो यदि ते शत्रून्नोपायैः कृत्यमस्ति नः || ६-६४-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Thereupon, having gone to the battle field deliberately, we shall give him a fight.
If we conquer your enemies, there is no need for any strategies to us."_END

B_6_C_63_27
BEGIN_अतीव हि समालक्ष्य भ्रातरम् क्षुभितेन्द्रियम् || ६-६३-२९
कुम्भकर्णः शनैर्वाक्यम् बभाषे परिसान्त्वयन् |_END
BEGIN_Observing that his brother is highly perturbed and excited of his senses, Kumbhakarna, 
while consoling him, gently spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_60_45
BEGIN_
अन्ये भेरीः समाजघ्नरन्ये चक्रुर्महास्वनम् || ६-६०-५०
केशानन्ये प्रलुलुपुः कर्णावन्ये दशन्ति च |_END
BEGIN_
Some beat drums, some shouted, some tore out his hair and some others bit his
ears._END

B_6_C_65_13
BEGIN_
समालोक्य तु ते रूपम् विद्रविष्यन्ति वानराः |
रामलक्ष्मणयोश्चापि हृदये प्रस्फुटिष्यतः || ६-६५-१४_END
BEGIN_
"By seeing your very form, the monkeys will run away. The hearts of Rama and
Lakshmana will get broken asunder."_END

B_6_C_66_9
BEGIN_
प्रांशुभिर्गिरिशृङ्गैश्च शिलाभिश्च महाबलाः |
पादपैः पुष्पिताग्रैश्च हन्यमानो न कम्पते || ६-६६-१०_END
BEGIN_
The mighty Kumbhakarna, though assaulted with lofty mountain-tops, rocks and trees
with blossoms at their ends, stood unshaken._END

B_6_C_59_51
BEGIN_
तम् आलोक्य महा तेजा हनूमान् मारुत आत्मजा |
निवार्य शर जालानि प्रदुद्राव स रावणम् || ६-५९-५३_END
BEGIN_
The exceedingly energetic Hanuma, born of Maruta the god of wind, beholding this,
rushed on Ravana in order to bring that rain of arrows to an end._END

B_6_C_64_23
BEGIN_
अथ जीवति नः शत्रुर्वयम् च कृतसम्युगाः |
ततः समभिपत्स्यामो मनसा यत्समीक्षितुम् || ६-६४-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Otherwise, if our enemy survives, we, who have engaged in the fight, then shall
implement the plan which was resolved by us in the mind."_END

B_6_C_63_28
BEGIN_शृणु राजन्नवहितो मम वाक्यमरिंदम || ६-६३-३०
अलम् राक्षसराजेन्द्र सम्तापमुपपद्य ते |
रोषम् च सम्परित्यज्य स्वस्थो चवितुमर्हसि || ६-६३-३१_END
BEGIN_"O king, the annihilator of adversaries! Listen to my words attentively. O emperor of 
demons! Enough of your giving way to the anguish. Abandoning your anger completely, you ought to be 
your normal self again."_END

B_6_C_60_46
BEGIN_
उदकुम्भशतान्यन्ये समसिञ्चन्त कर्णयोः || ६-६०-५१
न कुम्भकर्णः पस्पन्दे महानिद्रावशं गतः |_END
BEGIN_
Some poured hundreds of pitchers of water into his ears but Kumbhakarna, plunged in
deep sleep, did not stir._END

B_6_C_65_14
BEGIN_
एवमुक्त्वा महातेजाः कुम्भकर्णम् महाब्लम् |
पुनर्जातमिवात्मानम् मेने राक्षसपुम्गवः || ६-६५-१५_END
BEGIN_
Ravana, the king of demons, having a great energy, thus speaking to the mighty
Kumbhakarna, thought himself as though he was born again._END

B_6_C_66_10
BEGIN_
तस्य गात्रेषु पतिता भिद्यन्ते शतशः शिलाः |
पादपाः पुष्पिताग्राश्च भग्नाः पेतुर्महीतले || ६-६६-११_END
BEGIN_
Many rocks, fallen on his limbs, got burst into pieces. The trees, with blossoms at
their ends, were broken and fell shattered on the floor._END

B_6_C_59_52
BEGIN_
रथम् तस्य समासाद्य भुजम् उद्यम्य दक्षिणम् |
त्रासयन् रावणम् धीमान् हनूमान् वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् || ६-५९-५४_END
BEGIN_
Approaching his chariot, the sagacious Hanuma lifted his right arm and spoke the
following threatening words to Ravana:_END

B_6_C_64_24
BEGIN_
वयम् युद्धादिहैष्यामो रुधिरेण समुक्षिताः |
विदार्या स्वातानुं बाणै रामनामाङ्कितैः शितैः || ६-६४-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Moistened with blood on having our bodies torn with arrows marked with the name of
Rama engraved on them, we shall come back here from the battle."_END

B_6_C_60_47
BEGIN_
न कुम्भकर्णः पस्पन्दे महानिद्रावशम् गतः || ६-६०-५२
मूर्ध्नि वक्षसि गात्रेषु पातयन् कूटमुद्गरान् |_END
BEGIN_
Some strong ones, armed with rocks and hammers, struck the rocks and hammers on his
head, chest and other limbs._END

B_6_C_63_29
BEGIN_नैतन्मनसि कर्तव्यम् मयि जीवति पार्थिव |
तमहम् नाशयिष्यामि यत्कृते परितप्येते || ६-६३-३२_END
BEGIN_"O king! Until I live, this idea should not be formed in your mind. I shall destroy him, 
for whose account, you are feeling anguished."_END

B_6_C_65_15
BEGIN_
कुम्भकर्णबलाभिज्ञो जानंस्तस्य पराक्रमम् |
बभूव मुदितो राजा शशाङ्क इव निर्मलः || ६-६५-१६_END
BEGIN_
The king, knowing the strength and prowess of Kumbhakarna, was delighted and became
as bright as the moon._END

B_6_C_66_11
BEGIN_
सोऽपि सैन्यानि सङ्क्रुद्धो वानराणां महौजसाम् |
ममन्थ परमायत्तो वनान्यग्निरिवोत्थितः || ६-६६-१२_END
BEGIN_
Kumbhakarna too, very much enraged, crushed the ranks of monkeys though they were
greatly energetic, with his extreme exertion even as a rising fire would consume the woods._END

B_6_C_59_53
BEGIN_
देव दानव गन्धर्वा यक्षाश् च सह राक्षसैह् |
अवध्यत्वात् त्वया भग्ना वानरेभ्यस् तु ते भयम् || ६-५९-५५_END
BEGIN_
"You have obtained the boon of invulnerability to the celestials, demons, celestial
musicians, ogres and semi-divine beings. But monkeys are a danger to you."_END

B_6_C_64_25
BEGIN_
भक्षितो राघवोऽस्माभिर्लक्ष्मणश्चेति वादिनः |
तव पादौ ग्रहीष्यामस्त्वं नः काम प्रपूरय || ६-६४-२६_END
BEGIN_
Saying "Rama as well as Lakshmana has been devoured by us", we shall clasp your
feet. You fully grant our desire."_END

B_6_C_63_30
BEGIN_अवश्यम् च हितम् वाच्यम् सर्वावस्थाम् गतम् मया |
बन्धुभावादभिहितम् भ्रातृस्नेहाच्च पार्थिव || ६-६३-३३_END
BEGIN_"O king! In whatever situation you are placed, I have to give certainly a good advice 
to you. I gave this advice, because of our relation and brotherly affection."_END

B_6_C_60_48
BEGIN_
रज्जुबन्धनबद्धाभिः शतग्नीभिश्च सर्वशः || ६-६०-५३
वध्यमानो महाकायो न प्राबुध्यत राक्षसः |_END
BEGIN_
Though smitten by missiles fastened with ropes on all sides, the giant bodied demon
did not wake._END

B_6_C_65_16
BEGIN_
इत्येवमुक्तः सम्हृष्टो निर्जगाम महाबलः |
राज्ञ्स्तु वचनम् श्रुत्वा योद्धुमुद्युक्तवांस्तदा || ६-६५-१७_END
BEGIN_
Some were drowned in the ocean. Some had recourse into the caves. Some others
escaped. Some could not even stand stable on the ground. Some fell down. Some lied down, as though
they were dead._END

B_6_C_66_12
BEGIN_
लोहितार्द्रास्तु बहवः शेरते वानरर्षभाः |
निरस्ताः पतिता भूमौ ताम्रपुष्पा इव द्रुमाः || ६-६६-१३_END
BEGIN_
Many of the foremost among the monkeys lay on the ground, bathed in blood as they
were, fallen like trees with crimson flowers, when tossed up by the demon._END

B_6_C_59_54
BEGIN_
एष मे दक्षिणो बाहुह् पन्च शाखह् समुद्यतह् |
विधमिष्यति ते देहाद् भूत आत्मानम् चिर उषितम् || ६-५९-५६_END
BEGIN_
"This five-branched right hand of mine, which I now raise, will rob you of your life
that has long been resident in your body."_END

B_6_C_64_26
BEGIN_
ततोऽवघोषय पुरे गजस्कन्धेन पार्थिव |
हतो रामः सह भ्रात्रा ससैन्य इति सर्वतः || ६-६४-२७_END
BEGIN_
"O king! Then, have it proclaimed by beating of trumpets in the entire city, on the
back of an elephant, that Rama has been killed along with his brother and his army."_END

B_6_C_63_31
BEGIN_सदृशम् यच्च कालेऽस्मिन् कर्तुम् स्नेहेन बन्धुना |
शत्रूणाम् कदनम् पश्य क्रियमाणम् मया रणे || ६-६३-३४_END
BEGIN_"See that which is to be done and this juncture, out of affection by a brother, viz. 
the destruction of adversaries in battle, will be done by me."_END

B_6_C_60_49
BEGIN_
वारणानाम् सहस्रम् च शरीरेऽस्य प्रधावितम् || ६-६०-५४
कुम्भकर्णस्तदा बुद्ध्वा स्पर्शम् परमबुध्यत |_END
BEGIN_
A thousand elephants ran up and down on his body till Kumbhakarna lightly woke up
and became aware of the pressure._END

B_6_C_65_17
BEGIN_
आददे निशितम् शूलं वेगाच्छत्रुनिबर्हणः |
सर्वकालायसम् दीप्तं तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणम् || ६-६५-१८_END
BEGIN_
Kumbhakarna, the annihilator of enemies, speedily took up a sharp spike fully made
of iron, adorned with pure gold and splendidly shining._END

B_6_C_66_13
BEGIN_
लङ्घयन्तः प्रधावन्तो वानरा नावलोकयन् |
के चित्समुद्रे पतिताः के चिद्गगनमाश्रिताः || ६-६६-१४_END
BEGIN_
Some monkeys, while jumping and running away, did not look back. Some fell in the
ocean. Some inhabited the sky._END

B_6_C_59_55
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा हनूमतो वाक्यम् रावणो भीम विक्रमह् |
सम्रक्त नयनह् क्रोधाद् इदम् वचनम् अब्रवीत् || ६-५९-५७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Hanuma, the exceedingly valiant Ravana, his eyes inflamed with
anger, answered._END

B_6_C_63_32
BEGIN_अद्य पश्य महाबाहो मया समरमूर्धनि |
हते रामे सहभ्रात्रा द्रवन्तीम् हरिवाहिनीम् || ६-६३-३५_END
BEGIN_"See today, O mighty armed king, the fleeing army of monkeys and Rama along with his 
brother being killed by me in the fore-front of the battle-field."_END

B_6_C_64_27
BEGIN_
प्रीतो नाम ततो भूत्वा भृत्यानाम् त्वमरिन्दम |
भोगांश्च परिवारांश्च कामांश्च वसुदापय || ६-६४-२८_END
BEGIN_
"O annihilator of enemies! Becoming pleased for the name-sake, arrange to bestow on
your servants, objects of enjoyment, other desired objects and gold."_END

B_6_C_60_50
BEGIN_
स पात्यमानैर्गिरिशृङ्गवृक्षै |
रचिन्तयंस्तान्विपुलान् प्रहारान् |
निद्राक्षयात् क्षुद्भयपीडितश्च |
विजृम्भमाणः सहसोत्पपाप || ६-६०-५५_END
BEGIN_
Being insensible to those violent blows of crags and trees hurled upon him, but
under the prompting of extreme hunger, Kumbhakarna suddenly sprang up from sleep, yawning due to
loss of sleep._END

B_6_C_65_18
BEGIN_
इन्द्राशनिसमं भीमम् वज्रप्रतिमगौरवम् |
देवदानवगन्धर्वयक्षकिंनरसूदनम् || ६-६५-१९
रक्तमाल्य महादाम स्वतश्चोद्गतपावकम् |
आदाय निशितम् शूलं शत्रुशोणितरञ्जितम् || ६-६५-२०
कुम्भकर्णो महातेजा रावणम् वाक्यमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Taking hold of that large spike tinted with the blood of enemies, shining like
Indra's thunderbolt and equally heavy, capable of tormenting celestials, demons, Gandharvas, the
celestial musicians, Yakshas a class of demi-gods and Nagas the celestial serpents, wreathed in
garlands of crimson flowers with excessive splendour and emitting flames by itself naturally,
Kumbhakarna of great brilliance spoke to Ravana the following words:_END

B_6_C_66_14
BEGIN_
वध्यमानास्तु ते वीरा राक्षसेन बलीयसा |
सागरं येन ते तीर्णाः पथा तेनैव दुद्रुवुः || ६-६६-१५_END
BEGIN_
While that demon was killing some warriors of monkeys playfully, some others ran
away by the same route, by which they earlier crossed the ocean._END

B_6_C_59_56
BEGIN_
क्षिप्रम् प्रहर निह्शन्कम् स्थिराम् कीर्तिम् अवाप्नुहि |
ततस् त्वाम् ज्नाति विक्रान्तम् नाशयिष्यामि वानर || ६-५९-५८_END
BEGIN_
"Strike quickly without fear, O Monkey! Win eternal renown. Thereafter, I shall
destroy you, after measuring your strength."_END

B_6_C_63_33
BEGIN_अद्य रामस्य तद्दृष्ट्वा मयानीतम् रणाच्छिरः |
सुखि भव महाबाहो सीता भवतु दुःखिता || ६-६३-३६_END
BEGIN_"O the mighty armed! Be happy by seeing that Rama's head, which I shall bring today from 
the battle. Let Seetha be unhappy."_END

B_6_C_64_28
BEGIN_
ततो माल्यानि वासांसि वीराणाम् अनुलेपनम् |
देयम् च बहु योधेभ्यः स्वयं च मुदितः पिब || ६-६४-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Then, present garlands, garments and cosmetics to champions as well as abundant
gifts to other warriors. Drink yourself delighted."_END

B_6_C_65_19
BEGIN_
गमिष्याम्यहमेकाकी तिष्ठत्विह बलं महत् || ६-६५-२१
अद्य तान्क्षुधितः क्रुद्धो भक्षयिष्यामि वानरान् |_END
BEGIN_
"Let this large army stay back here. I shall go all alone. Being angry with hunger,
I shall devour those monkeys now."_END

B_6_C_60_51
BEGIN_
स नागभोगाचलशृङ्गकल्पौ |
विक्षिप्य बाहू जितवज्रसारौ |
विवृत्य वक्त्रम् वडवामुखाभम् |
निशाचरोऽसौ विकृतम् जजृम्भे || ६-६०-५६_END
BEGIN_
Waving his arms resembling serpent's coils or the peaks of mountains, hard as cut
diamonds, that demons opening his monstrous month like unto the face of a submarine fire,
yawned._END

B_6_C_66_15
BEGIN_
ते स्थलानि तथा निम्नं विषण्णवदना भयात् |
ऋक्षा वृक्षान्समारूढाः के चित्पर्वतमाश्रिताः || ६-६६-१६_END
BEGIN_
While some monkeys becoming pale-faced due to fear, inhabited the mounds and the low
grounds, some bears ascended the trees. Some escaped to a hill._END

B_6_C_59_57
BEGIN_
रावणस्य वचह् श्रुत्वा वायु सूनुर् वचो अब्रवीत् |
प्रहृतम् हि मया पूर्वम् अक्षम् स्मर सुतम् तव || ६-५९-५९_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Ravana, Hanuma the son of wind-god spoke the following words:
"Recollect that I have killed your son Aksha already."_END

B_6_C_63_34
BEGIN_अद्य रामस्य पश्यन्तु निधनम् सुमहत्प्रियम् |
लङ्कायाम् राक्षसाः सर्वे ये ते निहतबान्धवाः || ६-६३-३७_END
BEGIN_"Let all those demons in Lanka, whose relatives have died in battle, witness the death 
of the most beloved Rama today."_END

B_6_C_65_20
BEGIN_
कुम्भकर्णवचः श्रुत्वा रावणो वाक्यमब्रवीत् || ६-६५-२२
सैन्यैः परिवृतो गच्छ शूलमुद्गलपाणिभिः |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Kumbhakarna, Ravana said, "Go along with army, with their
spikes and hammers in hand."_END

B_6_C_64_29
BEGIN_
ततोऽस्मिन्बहुलीभूते कौलीने सर्वतो गते |
भक्षितः ससुह्ऱिद्रामो राक्षसैरिति विश्रुते || ६-६४-३०
प्रविश्याश्वास्य चापि त्वम् सीतां रहसि सान्त्वय |
धनधान्यैश्च कामैश्च रत्नैश्चैनां प्रलोभय || ६-६४-३१_END
BEGIN_
"When this thick rumour has gone to all sides that Rama along with his companions
have been devoured by the demons and you approach Seetha in private and restoring her to confidence
and even conciliating her, tempt her with gold and grain, as well as luxuries and precious
tones."_END

B_6_C_60_52
BEGIN_
तस्य जाजृम्भमाणस्य वक्त्रम् पातालसम्निभम् |
दद्ऱ्^उशे मेरुशृङ्गाग्रे दिवाकर इवोदितः || ६-६०-५७_END
BEGIN_
His mouth yawning horribly resembled hell and appeared like the sun rising under the
high peak of Meru Mountain._END

B_6_C_66_16
BEGIN_
ममज्जुरर्णवे के चिद्गुहाः के चित्समाश्रिताः |
निषेदुः प्लवगाः के चित्के चिन्नैवावतस्थिरे || ६-६६-१७
केचिद्भूमौ निपतिताः केचित्सुप्ता मृता इव |_END
BEGIN_
Some were drowned in the ocean. Some had recourse into the caves. Some others
escaped. Some could not even stand stable on the ground. Some fell down. Some lied down, as though
they were dead._END

B_6_C_59_58
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्तो महा तेजा रावणो राक्षस ईश्वरह् |
आजघान अनिल सुतम् तलेन उरसि वीर्यवान् || ६-५९-६०_END
BEGIN_
Thus spoken, the highly energetic and the valiant Ravana the Lord of Demons struck
Hanuma the son of Anila a violent blow on his chest with the palm of his hand._END

B_6_C_63_35
BEGIN_अद्य शोकपरीतानाम् स्वबन्धुवधशोचिनाम् |
शत्रोर्युधि विनाशेन करोम्यश्रुप्रमार्जनम् || ६-६३-३८_END
BEGIN_"Today, I shall do the act of wiping off tears of demons, who have been afflicted with 
grief and lamenting because of the destruction of their relatives in combat by the adversaries."_END

B_6_C_65_21
BEGIN_
वानरा हि महात्मानः शीघ्राश्च व्यवसायिनः || ६-६५-२३
एकाकिनं प्रमत्तम् वा नयेयुर्दशनैः क्षयम् |_END
BEGIN_
"The monkeys, with their huge bodies, valiant, with a much determination and with
their teeth, will destroy anyone who is either alone or off one's guard."_END

B_6_C_64_30
BEGIN_
अनयोपधया राजन्भयशोकानुबन्धया |
अकामा त्वद्वशम् सीता नष्टनाथा गमिष्यति || ६-६४-३२_END
BEGIN_
"By this false pretence, creating fear and anguish, Seetha who thinks she lost her
husband, will submit reluctantly to your will."_END

B_6_C_60_53
BEGIN_
स जृम्भमाणोऽतिबलः प्रबुद्धस्तु निशाचरः |
निःश्वासश्चास्य सम्जज्ञे पर्वदादिव मारुतः || ६-६०-५८_END
BEGIN_
That mighty demon, being awake, yawned, heaving a sigh, like unto a tempest arising
from a mountain._END

B_6_C_59_59
BEGIN_
स तल अभिहतस् तेन चचाल च मुहुर् मुहुह् |
आजघान अभिसम्क्रुद्धस् तलेन एव अमर द्विषम् || ६-५९-६१
आजघान च सम्क्रुद्धस्तलेनैवामरद्विषम् |_END
BEGIN_
Hanuma, thus struck with Ravana's palm, reeled repeatedly. Thereafter the highly
sagacious and illustrious Hanuma secured his balance within a moment and in fury, struck Ravana the
enemy of Immortals with the very palm of his hand._END

B_6_C_66_17
BEGIN_
तान्समीक्ष्याङ्गदो भङ्गान्वानरानिदमब्रवीत् || ६-६६-१८
अवतिष्ठत युध्यामो निवर्तध्वं प्लवङ्गमाः |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing those monkeys disorderly retreated, Angada spoke these words, "Stay. We shall
carry on the battle. Come back."_END

B_6_C_63_36
BEGIN_अद्य पर्वतसम्काशम् ससूर्यमिव तोयदम् |
विकीर्णम् पश्य समरे सुग्रीवम् प्लवगेश्वरम् || ६-६३-३९_END
BEGIN_"See today in battle, the mountain-like Sugreeva, the king of monkeys, looking like a 
cloud illuminated by the sun, thrown about, dissipated."_END

B_6_C_65_22
BEGIN_
तस्मात्परमदुर्धर्षैः सैन्यैः परिवृतो व्रज || ६-६५-२४
रक्षसामहितम् सर्वं शत्रुपक्षं निसूदय |_END
BEGIN_
"Therefore, go along with your troops as a person who is very difficult to be
assaulted. Destroy the entire enemy-side, which in inimical to our demons."_END

B_6_C_64_31
BEGIN_
रमनीयम् हि भर्तारं विनष्टमवगम्य सा |
नैराश्यात्स्त्रीलघुत्वाच्च त्वद्वशं प्रतिपत्स्यते || ६-६४-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Believing that her charming husband is destroyed, Seetha from her hopelessness and
feminine feeling of flexibility, will come to your will."_END

B_6_C_60_54
BEGIN_
रूपमुत्तिष्ठतस्तस्य कुम्भकर्णस्य तद् बभौ |
युगाने सर्वभूतानि कालस्येव दिधक्षतः || ६-६०-५९_END
BEGIN_
That figure of Kumbhakarna, rising up, stood out resembling Time at the dissolution
of the world, prepared to devour all beings._END

B_6_C_59_60
BEGIN_
ततस् तलेन अभिहतो वानरेण महात्मना || ६-५९-६२
दशग्रीवह् समाधूतो यथा भूमि चले अचलह् |_END
BEGIN_
Under the violent impact of the blow of the mighty Hanuma Ravana shook like a
mountain when the earth trembles._END

B_6_C_66_18
BEGIN_
भग्नानां वो न पश्यामि परिगम्य महीमिमाम् || ६-६६-१९
स्थानं सर्वे निवर्तध्वं किं प्राणान्परिरक्षथ |_END
BEGIN_
"I do not catch sight of any place for you, who have retreated, even if you roam
over the entire earth. Let all of you come back. Why do you safeguard your lives?"_END

B_6_C_63_37
BEGIN_कथम् च राक्षसैरेभिर्मया च परिसान्त्वितः |
जिघांसुभिर्दाशरथिम् व्यथसे त्वमिहानघ || ६-६३-४०_END
BEGIN_"O faultless Ravana! Why are you agitated now, when you are being consoled by those demons 
and by me, who are desirous of killing Rama?"_END

B_6_C_65_23
BEGIN_
अथासनात्समुत्पत्य स्रजं मणिकृतान्तराम् || ६-६५-२५
आबबन्ध महातेजाः कुम्भकर्णस्य रावणः |_END
BEGIN_
Rising up swiftly from his throne, Ravana endowed with a great energy, then placed
around the neck of Kumbhakarna, a necklace studded with a course of jewels._END

B_6_C_64_32
BEGIN_
सा पुरा सुखसम्वृद्धा सुखार्हा दुःखकर्षिता |
त्वय्यधीनः सुखम् ज्ञात्वा सर्वथोपगमिष्यति || ६-६४-३४_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha, who grew up with comfort, who is deserving of happiness; but emaciated with
grief, knowing that her happiness depends on you, will by all means come near to you."_END

B_6_C_60_55
BEGIN_
तस्याग्निदीप्तिसदृशे विद्युत्सदृशवर्चसी |
ददृशाते महानेत्रे दीप्ताविव महाग्रहौ || ६-६०-६०_END
BEGIN_
His huge eyes, resembling flames of fire, with a glitter equal to that of lightning,
appeared like great blazing planets._END

B_6_C_59_61
BEGIN_
सम्ग्रामे तम् तथा दृष्ट्व रावणम् तल ताडितम् || ६-५९-६३
ऋषयो वानराह् सिद्धा नेदुर् देवाह् सह असुराह् |_END
BEGIN_
Beholding Ravana struck in the fight by Hanuma's palm; the sages, monkeys,
semi-divine beings, along with celestials and demons raised a resounding approbation._END

B_6_C_66_19
BEGIN_
निरायुधानां द्रवतामसङ्गगतिपौरुषाः || ६-६६-२०
दारा ह्यपहसिष्यन्ति स वै घातस्तु जीविताम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O valiant monkeys, moving without hindrances! Your wives, seeing you running away
leaving your weapos aside, will mock at you. It is indeed a death for those who lived well."_END

B_6_C_63_38
BEGIN_माम् निहत्य किल त्वाम् हि निहनिष्यति राघवः |
नाहामात्मनि सम्तापम् गच्छेयम् राक्षसाधिप || ६-६३-४१_END
BEGIN_"O king of demons! Rama will indeed kill you, only after killing me. On that account, 
I do not regret for myself."_END

B_6_C_65_24
BEGIN_
अञ्गदानङ्गुलीवेष्टान्वराण्याभरणानि च || ६-६५-२६
हारम् च शशिसम्ण्काशमाबबन्ध महात्मनः |_END
BEGIN_
Ravana placed on the person of Kumbhakarna, armlets, rings, excellent jewellery and
a handsome chain._END

B_6_C_64_33
BEGIN_
एतत्सुनीतं मम दर्शनेन
रामम् हि दृष्ट्वैव भवेदनर्थः |
इहैव ते सेत्स्यति मोत्सुकोभू |
र्महानयुद्धेन सुखस्य लाभः || ६-६४-३५_END
BEGIN_
"After contemplating very well, I have conveyed like this. As soon as you see Rama,
a calamity will happen. While you stay here itself without fighting, you will obtain a great
benefit of happiness. Do not become restless."_END

B_6_C_60_56
BEGIN_
ततस्त्वदर्शयन् सर्वान् भक्ष्यांश्च विविधान् बहून् |
वराहान् महिषांश्चैव बभक्ष स महाबलः || ६-६०-६१_END
BEGIN_
Then, the demons pointed to various kinds of victuals, boar and buffalo. The mighty
Kumbhakarna devoured them._END

B_6_C_59_62
BEGIN_
अथ आश्वस्य महा तेजा रावणो वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् || ६-५९-६४
साधु वानर वीर्येण श्लाघनीयो असि मे रिपुह् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, the extremely spirited Ravana, having regained his breath, spoke the following
words: "Well done! Well done! O, monkey! You are my adversary, worthy of praise by your
valour!"_END

B_6_C_66_20
BEGIN_
कुलेषु जाताः सर्वे स्म विस्तीर्णेषु महत्सु च || ६-६६-२१
क्व गच्छत भयत्रस्ताः प्राकृता हरयो यथा |
अनार्याः खलु यद्भीतास्त्यक्त्वा वीर्यं प्रधावत || ६-६६-२२_END
BEGIN_
"All of us are born in distinguished races; which are well developed. Where to you
go frightened, like ordinary monkeys? As you are running away with fear, leaving all your valour,
you are indeed unworthy of honour."_END

B_6_C_63_39
BEGIN_कामम् त्विदानीमपि माम् व्यादिश त्वम् परम्तप |
न परः प्रेक्षणीयस्ते युद्धायातुलविक्रम || ६-६३-४२_END
BEGIN_"O Ravana, having unequal prowess and the annihilator of enemies! You can command me, 
even now, as you wish. No other person need be sought, for a dispatch to the battle."_END

B_6_C_65_25
BEGIN_
दिव्यानि च सुगन्धीनि माल्यदामानि रावणः || ६-६५-२७
गात्रेषु सज्जयामास श्रीमती चास्य कुण्डले |_END
BEGIN_
Ravana arranged for ornamentation of his limbs with beautiful and sweet-smelling
garlands as well as ear-rings to his ears._END

B_6_C_64_34
BEGIN_
अनष्टसैन्यो ह्यनवाप्तसंशयो
रिपूनयुद्धेन जयन् जनाधिप |
यशश्च पुण्यम् च महन्महीपते |
श्रियम् च कीर्तिं च चिरम् समश्नुते || ६-६४-३६_END
BEGIN_
"O king! An emperor who conquers his enemies without losing his army, without
meeting with danger and without a combat will obtain for long, a great fame, merit, prosperity and
glory."_END

B_6_C_60_57
BEGIN_
आदद्बुभुक्षितो मांसम् शोणितम् तृषितोऽपिबत् |
मेदःकुम्भांश्च मद्यांश्च पपौ शक्ररिपुस्तदा || ६-६०-६२_END
BEGIN_
Then, the hungry Kumbhakarna, the enemy of Indra, ate the meat and being thirsty
drank the blood and gulped pitchers full of fat and wine._END

B_6_C_59_63
BEGIN_
रावणेन एवम् उक्तस् तु मारुतिर् वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् || ६-५९-६५
धिग् अस्तु मम वीर्यम् तु यत् त्वम् जीवसि रावण |_END
BEGIN_
Then, Hanuma answered, "O, Ravana! Cursed by that strength since you do still
survive!"_END

B_6_C_66_21
BEGIN_
विकत्थनानि वो यानि यदा वै जनसंसदि |
तानि वः क्व च यतानि सोदग्राणि महान्ति च || ६-६६-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Where did those boasting words of you melt away, in which you highly projected
yourself in front of the people just before coming for the battle?_END

B_6_C_63_40
BEGIN_अहमुत्सादयिष्यामि शत्रूंस्तव महाबलान् |
यदि शक्रो यदि यमो यदि पावकमारुतौ || ६-६३-४३
तानहम् योधयिष्यामि कुबेरवरुणावपि |_END
BEGIN_"I can destroy your enemies, who have a great strength. I can engage in combat with all 
those persons, whether he is Indra or Yama or the fire-god to the wind-god or even Varuna."_END

B_6_C_65_26
BEGIN_
काञ्चनाङ्गदकेयूरो निष्काभरणभूषितः || ६-६५-२८
कुम्भकर्णो बृहत्कर्णः सुहुतोऽग्निरिवाबभौ |_END
BEGIN_
Kumbhakarna with large ears, adorned with golden armlets and bracelets worn on his
upper arms along with ornament for his breast, shone like fire, well-fed with oblations._END

B_6_C_60_58
BEGIN_
ततस्तृप्त इति ज्ञात्वा समुत्पेरुर्निशाचराः |
शिरोभिश्च प्रणम्यैनम् सर्वतः पर्यवारयन् || ६-६०-६३_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, knowing that Kumbhakarna was gratified of his hunger, the demons
approached him, saluting him with their heads bent and surrounded him on all sides._END

B_6_C_59_64
BEGIN_
सकृत् तु प्रहर इदानीम् दुर्बुद्धे किम् विकत्थसे || ६-५९-६६
ततस् त्वाम् मामको मुष्टिर् नयिष्यामि यथा क्षयम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O, foolish fellow! Why this boasting? Now come, strike me once! My fist is about to
dispatch you to the Abode of Yama the Lord of Death!"_END

B_6_C_66_22
BEGIN_
भीरुप्रवादाः श्रूयन्ते यस्तु जीवति धिक्कृतः |
मार्गः सत्पुरुषैर्जुष्टः सेव्यतां त्यज्यतां भयम् || ६-६६-२४_END
BEGIN_
"The cowards, who survive even after being reproached, have to hear slanders from
the people. Let the path trodden by the good people be followed. Let your fear be abandoned."_END

B_6_C_63_41
BEGIN_गिरिमात्रशरीरस्य शितशूलधरस्य मे || ६-६३-४४
नर्दतस्तीक्ष्णदम्ष्ट्रस्य बिभीयाद्वै पुरंदरः |_END
BEGIN_"Indra also gets frightened of me, having a mountain-sized body wielding a sharpened 
pike, having pointed tusks and even as I roar."_END

B_6_C_65_27
BEGIN_
श्रोणीसूत्रेण महता मेचकेन विराजितः || ६-६५-२९
अमृतोत्पादने नद्धो भुजङ्गेनेव मन्दरः |_END
BEGIN_
With a large, black and shining string worn round his loins, he was looking like
Mount Mandara encircled by a serpent at the time of churning the ambrosia._END

B_6_C_60_59
BEGIN_
निद्राविशदनेत्रस्तु कलुषीकृतलोचनः |
चारयन् सर्वतो दृष्टिम् तानुवाच निशाचरान् || ६-६०-६४_END
BEGIN_
Raising his eyelids that were heavy with sleep, his gaze still veiled, he directed
his glance towards those demons and spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_67_0
BEGIN_
ते निवृत्ता महाकायाः श्रुत्वाङ्गदवचस्तदा |
नैष्ठिकीं बुद्धिमास्थाय सर्वे सम्ग्रामकांक्षिणः || ६-६६-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Angada, all those large-bodied monkeys who came back, having
arrived at a firm resolution, were waiting for the battle._END

B_6_C_66_23
BEGIN_
शयामहे वा निहताः पृथिव्यामल्पजीविताः |
प्राप्नुयामो ब्रह्मलोकम् दुष्प्रपम् च कुयोधिभिः || ६-६६-२५_END
BEGIN_
"If our longevity is short, we shall lie down, being killed by the enemies, on the
earth and reach the realm of Brahma (residence of pious spirits), which is difficult to be attained
by bad warriors."_END

B_6_C_59_65
BEGIN_
ततो मारुति वाक्येन क्रोधस् तस्य तदा अज्वलत् || ६-५९-६७
सम्रक्त नयनो यत्नान् मुष्टिम् उद्यम्य दक्षिणम् |
पातयाम् आस वेगेन वानर उरसि वीर्यवान् || ६-५९-६८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Hanuma, the powerful Ravana, enraged, his eyes red with fury
and whirling his fist with force knocked it down violently on Hanuma's chest._END

B_6_C_63_42
BEGIN_अथवा त्यक्तशस्त्रस्य मृद्नतस्तरसा रिपून् || ६-६३-४५
न मे प्रतिमुखः कश्चित् स्थातुम् शक्तो जिजीविषुः |_END
BEGIN_"Even otherwise, no one can stand alive in front of me, who is even weaponless and smashing 
the enemies by me strength alone."_END

B_6_C_65_28
BEGIN_
स काञ्चनं भारसहं निवातं |
विद्युत्प्रभम् दीप्तमिवात्मभासा |
आबध्यमानः कवचम् रराज |
सन्ध्याभ्रसम्वीत इवाद्रिराजः || ६-६५-३०_END
BEGIN_
Secured with a golden armour, carrying a great load, impenetrable by weapons and as
if blazing with its own splendour with flashing like lightning, Kumbhakarna shone as a king of
Mountains, enveloped by clouds at sunset._END

B_6_C_60_60
BEGIN_
स सर्वान् सान्त्वयामास नैर्ऱ्^तान् नैरृतर्षभः |
बोधनाद्विस्मितश्चापि राक्षसानिदमब्रवीत् || ६-६०-६५_END
BEGIN_
That excellent demons kindly addressing all the demons and surprised at being
roused, spoke the following words to the demons:_END

B_6_C_66_24
BEGIN_
अवाप्नुयामः कीर्तिम् वा निहत्वा शत्रुमाहवे |
निहता वीरलोकस्य भोक्ष्यामो वसु वानराः || ६-६६-२६_END
BEGIN_
"O monkeys! We shall obtain glory by killing our enemies in battle or if killed on
the other hand, we shall enjoy the heaven, attained by the warriors."_END

B_6_C_67_1
BEGIN_
समुदीरितवीर्यास्ते समारोपितविक्रमाः |
पर्यवस्थापिता वाक्यैरङ्गदेन बकूतसा || ६-६७-२
प्रयाताश्च गता हर्षं मरणे कृतनिश्चयाः |
चक्रुः सुतुमुलं युद्धं वानरास्त्यक्तजीविताः || ६-६७-३_END
BEGIN_
Restored to confidence by the words of the mighty Angada, those monkeys, whose
energy was well-augmented and prowess well-elevated, restored to a thrill of rapture and as they
were determined to die, marched forward to fight. Ready to abandon their lives, they were engaged
in a tumultuous battle._END

B_6_C_59_66
BEGIN_
हनूमान् वक्षसि व्यूधे संचचाल हतह् पुनह् |
विह्वलम् तम् तदा दृष्ट्वा हनूमन्तम् महा बलम् || ६-५९-६९
रथेन अतिरथह् शीघ्रम् नीलम् प्रति समभ्यगात् |_END
BEGIN_
Under the shock, Hanuma reeled once again. Seeing that mighty Hanuma exhausted,
Ravana turned his chariot towards Nila._END

B_6_C_63_43
BEGIN_नैव शक्त्या न गदया नासिना निशितैः शरैः || ६-६३-४६
हस्ताभ्यामेव सम्रब्धो हनिष्याम्यपि वज्रिणम् |_END
BEGIN_"Without using a javelin or a mace or a sword or sharp arrows, I myself, on getting excited, 
can kill even Indra, with my bare hands."_END

B_6_C_65_29
BEGIN_
सर्वाभरणनद्धाङ्गः शूलपाणिः स राक्षसः |
त्रिविक्रमकृतोत्साहो नारायण इवाबभौ || ६-६५-३१_END
BEGIN_
Adorned with all ornaments to all his limbs and with a spike in his hand, that demon
shone like Narayana, the all-embracing Lord, enthusiastic to take the three long strides (which
were meant to cover the entire universe)._END

B_6_C_60_61
BEGIN_
किमर्थमहामादृत्य भवद्भिः प्रतिबोधितः |
कच्चित्सुकुशलम् राज्ञो भयम् वा नेह किंचन् || ६-६०-६६_END
BEGIN_
"For what reason have you thus wakened me so suddenly? Is all well with the king or
anything in peril here?"_END

B_6_C_66_25
BEGIN_
न कुम्भकर्णः काकुत्स्थं दृष्ट्वा जीवन्गमिष्यति |
दीप्यमानमिवासाद्य पतङ्गो ज्वलनं यथा || ६-६६-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Coming face to face with Rama, Kumbhakarna will not go back alive, any more than a
moth meeting a blazing fire."_END

B_6_C_67_2
BEGIN_
अथ वृक्षान् महाकायाः सानूनि सुमहान्ति च |
वानरास्तूर्णमुद्यम्य कुम्भकर्णमभिद्रवन् || ६-६७-४_END
BEGIN_
Lifting up trees and very large mountain-rocks, the large-bodied monkeys thereupon
briskly ran towards Kumbhakarna._END

B_6_C_59_67
BEGIN_
राक्षसानामधिपतिर्दशग्रीवः || ६-५९-७०
पन्नग प्रतिमैर् भीमैह् पर मर्म अतिभेदिभिह् |
शरैर् आदीपयाम् आस नीलम् हरि चमू पतिम् || ६-५९-७१_END
BEGIN_
With his terrific arrows in the likeness of serpents, Ravana the powerful Lord of
Demons pierced the vital parts of his enemy, thus overwhelming Nila the Monkey-general._END

B_6_C_63_44
BEGIN_यदि मे मुष्टिवेगम् स राघवोऽद्य सहिष्यति || ६-६३-४७
ततः पास्यन्ति बाणौघा रुधिरम् राघवस्य मे |_END
BEGIN_"If Rama today survives even after facing the rapid blows of my fists, then my flood 
of arrows will drink the blood of Rama."_END

B_6_C_65_30
BEGIN_
भ्रातरम् सम्परिष्वज्य कृत्वा चापि प्रदक्षिणम् |
प्रणम्य शिरसा तस्मै सम्प्रतस्थे महाबलिः || ६-६५-३२_END
BEGIN_
Embracing his brother and even circumambulating him, the mighty Kumbhakarna sallied
forth, after offering salutation to him by bowing down to him respectfully._END

B_6_C_60_62
BEGIN_
अथवा ध्रुवमन्येभ्यो भयम् परमुपस्थितम् |
यदर्थमेव त्वरिरैर्भवद्भिः प्रतिबोधितः || ६-६०-६७_END
BEGIN_
"Surely, there must be some great danger from an external source since you have
wakened me in haste."_END

B_6_C_66_26
BEGIN_
पलायनेन चोद्दिष्टाः प्राणान्रक्षामहे वयम् |
एकेन बहवो भग्ना यशो नाशं गमिष्यति || ६-६६-२८_END
BEGIN_
"If we, in large numbers, who are intended to fight, are conquered by one person
alone and if we protect our lives by running away, our glory will undergo a damage."_END

B_6_C_67_3
BEGIN_
कुम्भकर्णः सम्क्रुद्धो गदामुद्यम्य वीर्यवान् |
धर्षयन् स महाकायः समन्ताद्व्यक्षिपद्रिपून् || ६-६७-५_END
BEGIN_
The mighty and valiant Kumbhakarna, who got very much enraged, lifting a mace and
frightening his enemies, diffused them on all sides._END

B_6_C_59_68
BEGIN_
स शर ओघ समायस्तो नीलह् कपि चमू पतिह् |
करेण एकेन शैल अग्रम् रक्षो अधिपतये असृजत् || ६-५९-७२_END
BEGIN_
Nila, the Army General of Monkeys, tormented by that hail of arrows, with one hand
hurled a great rock at Ravana the king of demons._END

B_6_C_65_31
BEGIN_
निष्पतन्तं महाकायं महानादं महाबलम् |
तमाशीर्भिः प्रशस्ताभिः प्रेषयामास रावणः || ६-६५-३३_END
BEGIN_
Ravana sent off the mighty Kumbhakarna, having a colossal body, who was then
sallying forth, with a great sound (of drums and musical instruments) and with laudable
benedictions._END

B_6_C_63_45
BEGIN_चिन्तया तप्यसे राजन् किमर्थम् मयि तिष्ठति || ६-६३-४८
सोऽहम् शत्रुविनाशाय तव निर्यातुमुद्यतः |_END
BEGIN_"O king! When I exist, why do you suffer from anxiety? Here, I am ready to sally forth 
for the destruction of your enemies."_END

B_6_C_60_63
BEGIN_
अद्य राक्षसराजस्य भयमुत्पाटयाम्यहम् |
दारयिष्ये महेन्द्रम् वा शीतयिष्ये तथानलम् || ६-६०-६८_END
BEGIN_
"Now, I shall drive away the misfortune from Ravana the King of Demons, even if I
have to cut Mahendra himself to pieces or to freeze the Fire._END

B_6_C_66_27
BEGIN_
एवं ब्रुवाणं तं शूरमङ्गदं कनकाङ्गदम् |
द्रवमाणास्ततो वाक्यमूचुः शूरविगर्हितम् || ६-६६-२९_END
BEGIN_
Then, those fleeing monkeys spoke the following words, which were contemptible by
the warriors, to that valiant Angada, who was adorneed with golden armlets._END

B_6_C_67_4
BEGIN_
शतानि सप्त चाष्टौ च सहस्राणि च वानराः |
प्रकीर्णाः शेरते भूमौ कुम्भकर्णेन ताडिताः || ६-६७-६_END
BEGIN_
Seven hundred, eight hundred and thousands of monkeys struck by Kumbhakarna, lay
scattered on the ground._END

B_6_C_65_32
BEGIN_
तम् गजैश्च तुरम्गैश्च स्यन्दनैश्चाम्बुदस्वनैः |
अनुजग्मुर्महात्मानम् रथिनो रथिनां वरम् || ६-६५-३४_END
BEGIN_
With loud sounds of counches and kettle-drums, with an army wielding excellent
weapons, with elephants, with horses and with chariots making sounds of clouds, mighty charioteers
accompanied him who was the foremost among the charioteers._END

B_6_C_59_69
BEGIN_
हनूमान् अपि तेजस्वी समाश्वस्तो महा मनाह् |
विप्रेक्षमाणो युद्ध ईप्सुह् सरोषम् इदम् अब्रवीत् || ६-५९-७३
नीलेन सह सम्युक्तम् रावणम् राक्षस ईश्वरम् |
अन्येन युध्यमानस्य न युक्तम् अभिधावनम् || ६-५९-७४_END
BEGIN_
Meanwhile, Hanuma of exalted mind, burning with courage, regained his breath and in
his martial ire cried out furiously towards Ravana, the Lord of Demons who occupied in fight with
Nila as follows: "It is not proper to engage in a combat with a person who is already doing a fight
with another."_END

B_6_C_63_46
BEGIN_मुञ्च रामद्भयम् घोरम् निहनिष्यामि सम्युगे || ६-६३-४९
राघवम् लक्ष्मणम् चैव सुग्रीवम् च महाबलम् |
हनूमन्तम् च रक्षोघ्नम् येन लङ्का प्रदीपिता || ६-६३-५०_END
BEGIN_"Be free from the terrific fear of Rama. In the battle, I will kill Rama, Lakshmana, 
the mighty Sugreeva and even Hanuma, by whom the city of Lanka was burnt off and the demons were killed."_END

B_6_C_66_28
BEGIN_
कृतं नः कदनं घोरं कुम्भकर्णेन रक्षसा |
न स्थानकालो गच्छामो दयितं जीवितं हि नः || ६-६६-३०_END
BEGIN_
"For us, it is enough of this terrific battle with Kumbhakarna, the demon. It is not
the proper time to stay back but it is to time to go away. Life is indeed dear to us."_END

B_6_C_60_64
BEGIN_
स ह्यल्पकारणे सुप्तम् बोधयिष्यति मादृशम् |
तदाख्यातार्थतत्त्वेन मत्प्रबोधनकारणम् || ६-६०-६९_END
BEGIN_
"For a petty reason, one does not indeed awaken, one such as I, from my slumber.
Hence, tell me frankly, for what reason you have roused me."_END

B_6_C_67_5
BEGIN_
षोडशाष्टौ च दश च विंशत्त्रिंशत्तथैव च |
परिक्षिप्य च बाहुभ्यां खादन्वि परिधावति || ६-६७-७
भक्षयन् भृशसंक्रुद्धो गरुडः पन्नगानिव |_END
BEGIN_
That highly enraged Kumbhakarna, putting in his mount, (as many as) sixteen or eight
or ten or even twenty or thirty monkeys by his hands and devouring them like. Garuda the mythical
bird devouring the serpents in lots, ran about the battle-field._END

B_6_C_65_33
BEGIN_
सर्पैरुष्ट्रैः खरैरश्वैः सिम्हद्विपमृगद्विजैः |
अनुजग्मुश्च तम् घोरं कुम्भकर्णं महाबलम् || ६-६५-३५_END
BEGIN_
Those demons followed that terrific and mighty Kumbhakarna, mounting on serpents,
camels donkeys, lions, elephants, wild beasts and birds._END

B_6_C_59_70
BEGIN_
रावणो अपि महा तेजास् तत् शृन्गम् सप्तभिह् शरैह् |
आजघान सुतीक्ष्ण अग्रैस् तद् विकीर्णम् पपात ह || ६-५९-७५_END
BEGIN_
Then, the mighty Ravana, however, shattered the rock hurled by Nila with seven
pointed arrows and it fell down, crumbling to pieces._END

B_6_C_63_47
BEGIN_हरींश्च भक्षयिष्यामि सम्युगे समुपस्थिते |
असाधारणमिच्छमि तव दातुम् महद्यशः || ६-६३-५१_END
BEGIN_"I shall devour the monkeys in battle, which is near at hand. I wish to contribute a 
tremendous and extraordinary reputation for you."_END

B_6_C_66_29
BEGIN_
एतावदुक्त्वा वचनं सर्वे ते भेजिरे दिशः |
भीमं भीमाक्षमायान्तं दृष्ट्वा वानरयूथपाः || ६-६६-३१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that terrific Kumbhakarna coming with his dreadful eyes, all those commanders
of monkey-troops, speaking words only thus far, scattered in all directions._END

B_6_C_60_65
BEGIN_
एवम् ब्रुवाणम् सम्रब्धम् कुम्भकर्णमरिंदमम् |
यूपाक्षः सचिवो राज्ञः कृताञ्जलिरभाषत || ६-६०-७०_END
BEGIN_
Yupaksha, a minister of the King, with his hands joined salutation, spoke (as
follows) to Kumbhakarna, the annihilator of his enemies, thus talking excitedly._END

B_6_C_67_6
BEGIN_
कृच्छ्रेण च समाश्वस्ताः सम्गम्य च ततस्ततः || ६-६७-८
वृक्षाद्रिहस्ता हरयस्तस्थुः सम्ग्राममूर्धनि |_END
BEGIN_
Restored to confidence with difficulty, the monkeys assembling together from all
sides, stood in the battle-front, with trees and rocks in their hands._END

B_6_C_65_34
BEGIN_
स पुष्पवर्णैरवकीर्यमाणो |
धृतातपत्रः शितशूलपाणिः |
मदोत्कटः शोणितगन्धमत्तो |
विनिर्ययौ दानवदेवशत्रुः || ६-६५-३६_END
BEGIN_
That Kumbhakarna, the enemy of ogres and celestials, wielding a sharp spike in his
hand, while sallying forth, over whose head a parasol was held and drink and intoxicated by the
smell of blood._END

B_6_C_59_71
BEGIN_
तद् विकीर्णम् गिरेह् शृन्गम् दृष्ट्वा हरि चमू पतिह् |
काल अग्निर् इव जज्वाल क्रोधेन पर वीरहा || ६-५९-७६_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that rock crumbling to pieces, Nila the Army-general the destroyer of enemies
who resembled the Fire of Time, glowed with fury._END

B_6_C_63_48
BEGIN_यदिचेन्द्राद्भयम् राजन्यदि चापि स्वयम्भुवः |
ततोऽहम् नाशयिष्यामि नैशम् तम इवांशुमान् || ६-६३-५२
अपि देवाः शयिष्यान्ते मयि क्रुद्धे महीतले |_END
BEGIN_'O king! If you have a fear for Indra or even for Brahma, I shall remove it then, as 
the sun removes darkness of the night. When I am enraged, even celestials will lay down on the floor."_END

B_6_C_66_30
BEGIN_
द्रवमाणास्तु ते वीरा अङ्गदेन वलीमुखाः |
सान्त्वैश्च बहुमानैश्च ततः सर्वे निवर्तिताः || ६-६६-३२_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, with the coaxing words and inferential arguments by Angada, all those
fleeing commanders of monkeys turned back._END

B_6_C_60_66
BEGIN_
न नो देवकृतम् किंचिद्भयमस्ति कदाचन |
मानुषान्नो भयम् राजंस्तुमुलम् सम्प्रबाधते || ६-६०-७१_END
BEGIN_
"O, Prince! There is no threat whatsoever at anytime for us from celestials but a
mere man is driving us back by a tumultuous tremor."_END

B_6_C_67_7
BEGIN_
ततः पर्वतमुत्पाट्य द्विविदः प्लवगर्षभः || ६-६७-९
दुद्राव गिरिशृङ्गाभम् विलम्ब इव तोयदः |_END
BEGIN_
Pulling out a mountain and looking like a hanging cloud, Dvivida the foremost among
the monkeys, ran towards Kumbhakarna, who resembled a mountain-peak._END

B_6_C_65_35
BEGIN_
पदातयश बहवो महानादा महाबलाः |
अन्वयू राक्षसा भीमा भीमाक्षाः शस्त्रपाणयः || ६-६५-३७_END
BEGIN_
Many demons, possessing a great energy and great strength, with terrific forms and
fearful eyes, as also wielding weapons in their hands, accompanied him as foot-soldiers._END

B_6_C_59_72
BEGIN_
सो अश्व कर्णान् धवान् सालांश् चूतांश् च अपि सुपुष्पितान् |
अन्यांश् च विविधान् वृक्षान् नीलश् चिक्षेप सम्युगे || ६-५९-७७_END
BEGIN_
In that fight, Nila hurled Aswakarna trees, Shala trees with extensive flowering,
Chuta trees and other various types of trees._END

B_6_C_63_49
BEGIN_यमम् च शमयिष्यामि भक्षयिष्यामि पावकम् || ६-६३-५३
आदित्यम् पातयिष्यामि सनक्षत्रम् महीतले |_END
BEGIN_"I shall extinguish even Yama the god of death. I shall devour the fire-god. I shall 
cause the sun along with the stars to fall asunder on the floor."_END

B_6_C_68_0
BEGIN_
कुम्भकर्णम् हतम् दृष्ट्वा राघवेण महात्मना |
राक्षसा राक्षस इन्द्राय रावणाय न्यवेदयन् || ६-६८-१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that the great-souled Rama killed Kumbhakarna, the demons reported the matter
to Ravana, the king of demons (as follows):_END

B_6_C_66_31
BEGIN_
प्रहर्षमुपनीताश्च वालिपुत्रेण धीमता |
आज्ञाप्रतीक्षास्तुस्थुश्च सर्वे वानरयूथपाः || ६-६६-३३_END
BEGIN_
Having been cheered up by the intellectual Angada, all those commanders of the
army-troops stood awaiting his command._END

B_6_C_60_67
BEGIN_
न दैत्यदानवेभ्यो वा भयमस्ति हि तादृशम् |
यादृशम् मानुषम् राजन् भयमस्मानुपस्थितम् || ६-६०-७२_END
BEGIN_
"O, Prince! It is not indeed the celestials or demons who have put us in such a
peril as it comes to us from a man."_END

B_6_C_67_8
BEGIN_
तं समुत्पत्य चिक्षेप कुम्भकर्णाय वानरः || ६-६७-१०
तमप्राप्य महाकायम् तस्य सैन्येऽपतत्ततः |_END
BEGIN_
Dvivida, springing up, hurled that mountain towards Kumbhakarna. Even without
reaching the colossal bodied Kumbhakarna, it however fell on his army._END

B_6_C_65_36
BEGIN_
रक्ताक्षाः सुमहाकाया नीलाञ्जनचयोपमाः |
शूरानुद्यम्य खड्गांश्च निशितांश्च परश्वधान् || ६-६५-३८
बहुव्यामांश्च परिघान् गदाश्च मुसलानि च |
