तालस्कन्धांश्च विपुलान्क्षेपणीयान्दुरासदान् || ६-६५-३९_END
BEGIN_
The demons followed, with their red hot eyes, large colossal bodies resembling a
mass of collyrium in hue, lifting up spikes, swords, sharp axes, javelins, iron rods, maces,
mallets, enormous trunks of palmyrah trees to be hurled at and difficult to be met._END

B_6_C_59_73
BEGIN_
स तान् वृक्षान् समासाद्य प्रतिचिच्चेद रावणह् |
अभ्यवर्षत् सुघोरेण शर वर्षेण पावकिम् || ६-५९-७८_END
BEGIN_
Ravana, confronting those trees, bursted them and showered a hail of dangerous darts
on Nila the son of Fire-God._END

B_6_C_63_50
BEGIN_शतक्रतुम् वधिष्यामि पास्यामि वरुणालयम् || ६-६३-५४
पर्वतांश्चूर्णयिष्यामि दारयिष्यामि मेदिनीम् |_END
BEGIN_"I shall kill Indra. I shall drink away the ocean. I shall crush the mountains into a 
powder. I shall tear up the earth."_END

B_6_C_68_1
BEGIN_
राजन् स कालसंकाशः संयुक्तः कालकर्मणा |
विद्राव्य वानरीम् सेनाम् भक्षयित्वा च वानरान् || ६-६८-२_END
BEGIN_
"O king! That Kumbhakarna, looking like Yama the god of death, driving away the army
of monkeys and devouring some monkeys, met with death, the time's act."_END

B_6_C_66_32
BEGIN_
ऋषभशरभमैन्दधूम्रनीलाः |
कुमुदसुषेणगवाक्षरम्भताराः|
द्विविदपनसवायुपुत्रमुख्यास् |
त्वरिततराभिमुखं रणं प्रयाताः || ६-६६-३४_END
BEGIN_
Rishabha, Sharabha, Mainda, Dhumra, Neela, Kumuda, sushena, Gavaksha, Rambha, Tara
and more particularly Dvipada, Panasa and hanuma marched ahead very quickly, with their faces
turned towards the battle._END

B_6_C_60_68
BEGIN_
वानरैः पर्वताकारैर्लङ्केयम् परिवारिता |
सीताहरणसम्तप्ताद्रामान्नस्तुमुलम् भयम् || ६-६०-७३_END
BEGIN_
"Monkeys, whose forms are as large as mountains, are besieging Lanka. There is a
tumultuous peril for us from Rama, who is furious on account of Seetha's abduction."_END

B_6_C_67_9
BEGIN_
ममर्दाश्वान् गजांश्चापि रथांश्चापि नगोत्तमः || ६-६७-११
तानि चान्यानि रक्षांसि एवम् चान्यद्गिरेः शिरः |_END
BEGIN_
That excellent mountain crushed the horses, elephants and the chariots. Another
mountain-top, when hurled, crushed the other demons._END

B_6_C_65_37
BEGIN_
अथान्यद्वपुरादाय दारुणम् लोमहर्षणम् |
निष्पपात महातेजाः कुम्भकर्णो महाबलः || ६-६५-४०
धनुःशतपरीणाहः स षट्शतसमुच्छितः |
रौद्रः शकटचक्राक्षो महापर्वतसंनिभः || ६-६५-४१_END
BEGIN_
Then, that Kumbhakarna, of a great splendour and a great strength, assuming another
body of a formidable and terrific form, with a breadth of a hundred bows and six hundred bows in
height, with his eyes resembling the wheels of a cart, looking like a huge mountain and terrible to
look at, sallied forth._END

B_6_C_59_74
BEGIN_
अभिवृष्टह् शर ओघेण मेघेन इव महा अचलह् |
ह्रस्वम् कृत्वा तदा रूपम् ध्वज अग्रे निपपात ह || ६-५९-७९_END
BEGIN_
Showered by a multitude of shafts, as from a cloud, the mighty Nila assumed a
diminutive form and leapt on to the point of Ravana's standard._END

B_6_C_63_51
BEGIN_दीर्घकालम् प्रसुप्तस्य कुम्भकर्णस्य विक्रमम् || ६-६३-५५
अद्य पश्यन्तु भूतानि भक्ष्यमाणानि सर्वशः |
नन्विदम् त्रिदिवम् सर्वमाहारस्य न पूर्यते || ६-६३-५६_END
BEGIN_"Let all the living beings, being devoured from all sides see today the prowess of Kumbhakarna, 
who slept for a long time. The entire heaven is not enough for my food."_END

B_6_C_68_2
BEGIN_
प्रतिपित्वा मुहूर्तं तु प्रशान्तो रामतेजसा |
कायेनार्धप्रविष्टेन समुद्रं भीमदर्शनम् || ६-६८-३
निकृत्तनासाकर्णेन विक्षरद्रुधिरेण च|
रुद्ध्वा द्वारं शरीरेण लङ्कायाः पर्वतोपमः || ६-६८-४
कुम्भकर्णस्तव भ्राता काकुत्थ्सशरपीडितः |
लगण्डभूतो विकृतो दावदग्ध इव द्रुमः || ६-६८-५_END
BEGIN_
"Showing his prowess for a moment, Kumbhakarna your brother, was extinguished by the
fiery energy of Rama. Injured by Rama's arrows, Kumbhakarna who was looking like a mountain became
an ugly mass, with his body discharging blood, as his nose and ears were cut off, resembling a tree
scorched by a forest-fire, with his trunk half-submerged in a terribly looking sea and obstructing
the main gate of Lanka."_END

B_6_C_60_69
BEGIN_
एकेन वानरेणेयम् पूर्वम् दग्धा महापुरी |
कुमारो निहतश्चाक्षः सानुयात्रः सकुञ्जरः || ६-६०-७४_END
BEGIN_
"Already, a single monkey set fire to our great city of slew the youthful Prince
Aksha with his escort of elephants and retinue."_END

B_6_C_67_10
BEGIN_
तच्छएलवेगाभिहतं हताश्वं हतसारथि || ६-६७-१२
रक्षसाम् रुधिरक्लिन्नम् बभूवायोधनम् महत् |_END
BEGIN_
Struck by the jerk of the mountain, that great battle-field of demons, with its
horses and charioteers killed, became dampened with blood._END

B_6_C_65_38
BEGIN_
संनिपत्य च रक्षांसि दग्धशैलोपमो महान् |
कुम्भकर्णो महावक्त्रः प्रहसन्निदमब्रवीत् || ६-६५-४२_END
BEGIN_
Kumbhakarna with his colossal body and a huge mouth, looking like a scorched hill,
approaching the demons and laughing loudly, spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_59_75
BEGIN_
पावक आत्मजम् आलोक्य ध्वज अग्रे समवस्थितम् |
जज्वाल रावणह् क्रोधात् ततो नीलो ननाद ह || ६-५९-८०_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Nila the son of Fire-God standing well on the point of his standard, Ravana
inflamed with fury. Then, Nila shouted loudly._END

B_6_C_63_52
BEGIN_वधेन ते दाशरथेः सुखावहम् |
सुखम् समाहर्तुमहम् व्रजामि |
निहत्य रामम् सह लक्ष्मणेन |
खादामि सर्वान् हरियूथमुख्यान् || ६-६३-५७_END
BEGIN_"I am going to bring you happiness, conferring you a delight by the destroyal of Rama. 
Having killed Rama along with Lakshmana, I shall devour all the chiefs of army of monkeys."_END

B_6_C_68_3
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा विनिहतम् सम्ख्ये कुम्भ कर्णम् महा बलम् |
रावणः शोक सम्तप्तो मुमोह च पपात च || ६-६८-६_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that the mighty Kumbhakarna was killed in battle, Ravana was tormented with
grief and fell down, fainted._END

B_6_C_60_70
BEGIN_
स्वयम् रक्षोधिपश्चापि पौलस्त्यो देवकण्टकः |
व्रजेति सम्युगे मुक्तो रामेणादित्यवर्चसा || ६-६०-७५_END
BEGIN_
" ' Get thee hence' were the words addressed by Rama who is equal to the sun in
splendour, to Ravana in person the Lord of Demons and the trouble-some person to celestials."_END

B_6_C_67_11
BEGIN_
रथिनो वानरेन्द्राणाम् शरैः कालान्तकोपमैः || ६-६७-१३
शिरांसि नर्दताम् जह्रुः सहसा भीमनिःस्वनाः |_END
BEGIN_
The demons who fight from the chariots, with their terrific roar, at once discarded
the heads of the clamouring chiefs of monkeys, with their arrows, which were resembling the god of
death at the time of universal dissolution._END

B_6_C_65_39
BEGIN_
अद्य वानरमुख्यानाम् तानि यूथानि भागशः |
निर्दहिष्यामि संक्रुद्धः शलभानिव पावकः || ६-६५-४३_END
BEGIN_
"Charged with anger, I shall burn up those troops of the foremost of monkeys, in
lots today, as a flash of fire would burn up the moths."_END

B_6_C_59_76
BEGIN_
ध्वज अग्रे धनुषश् च अग्रे किरीट अग्रे च तम् हरिम् |
लक्ष्मणो अथ हनूमांश् च दृष्ट्वा रामश् च विस्मिताह् || ६-५९-८१_END
BEGIN_
Beholding that monkey sometimes leaping on to the point of Ravana's standard
sometimes on to the tip of his bow and sometimes on to the peak of his diadem, Lakshmana, Hanuma
and Rama were astonished._END

B_6_C_63_53
BEGIN_रमस्व राजन् पिब चाद्य वारुणीम् |
कुरुष्व कृत्यानि विनीय दुःखम् |
मयाद्य रामे गमिते यमक्षयम् |
चिराय सीता वशगा भविष्यति || ६-६३-५८_END
BEGIN_"O king! You make merry today and drink wine. Throw away your agony and perform your 
usual duties. While I send Rama to the world of Yama, the god of death, Seetha will be subservient to 
your after a log time."_END

B_6_C_68_4
BEGIN_
पितृव्यम् निहतम् श्रुत्वा देव अन्तक नर अन्तकौ |
त्रिशिरासः च अतिकायसः च रुरुदुः शोक पीडिताः || ६-६८-७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that his paternal uncle was killed; Devantaka, Narantaka, Trishira and
Atikaya were afflicted with sorrow and wept._END

B_6_C_60_71
BEGIN_
यन्न देवैः कृतो राजा नापि दैत्यैर्न दानवैः |
कृतः स इह रामेण विमुक्तः प्राणसंशयात् || ६-६०-७६_END
BEGIN_
"That which this king never suffered at the hands of Gods or Demons or Danavas, he
has had to endure here from Rama, who released him from the danger to his life."_END

B_6_C_67_12
BEGIN_
वानराश्च महात्मानः समुत्पाट्य महाद्रुमान् || ६-६७-१४
रथानश्वान् गजानुष्ट्रान्राक्षसानभ्यसूदयन् |_END
BEGIN_
Uprooting large trees, the mighty monkeys too began to destroy the chariots, horses,
Camels and demons._END

B_6_C_65_40
BEGIN_
नापराध्यन्ति मे कामम् वानरा वनचारिणः |
जातिरस्मद्विधानाम् सा पुरोद्यानविभूषणम् || ६-६५-४४_END
BEGIN_
"The monkeys who are in the habit of roaming about in the woods, have not offended
me of their own accord. That race of monkeys serves as an embellishment for the urban gardens in a
city like ours."_END

B_6_C_59_77
BEGIN_
रावणो अपि महा तेजाह् कपि लाघव विस्मितह् |
अस्त्रम् आहारयाम् आस दीप्तम् आग्नेयम् अद्भुतम् || ६-५९-८२_END
BEGIN_
The mighty Ravana, amazed at the monkey's agility, seized a marvellous and glowing
arrow called Agneya the weapon of Fire._END

B_6_C_68_5
BEGIN_
भ्रातरम् निहतम् श्रुत्वा रामेण अक्लिष्ट कर्मणा |
महा उदर महा पार्श्वौ शोक आक्रान्तौ बभूवतुः || ६-६८-८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that Kumbhakarna, their brother was killed by Rama, who was unwary in his
actions, Mahodara and Mahaparshva (step-brothers of Kumbhakarna) were overcome with grief._END

B_6_C_60_72
BEGIN_
स यूपाक्षवचः श्रुत्वा भ्रातुर्युधि पराभवम् |
कुम्भक्र्णो विवृत्ताक्षो यूपाक्षमिदमब्रवीत् || ६-६०-७७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing about the humiliation of his brother in the battle through the words of
Yupaksha, Kumbhakarna rolling his great eyes, spoke to Yupaksha (as follows):_END

B_6_C_67_13
BEGIN_
हनूमान् शैलशृङ्गाणि वृक्षांश्च विविधान् ध्रुमान् || ६-६७-१५
ववर्ष कुम्भकर्णस्य शिरस्यम्बरमास्थितः |_END
BEGIN_
Staying in the sky, Hanuma showered mountain-tops, rocks and various types of trees
on Kumbhakarna's head._END

B_6_C_65_41
BEGIN_
पुररोधस्य मूलम् तु राघवः सहलक्ष्मणः |
हते तस्मिन्हतम् सर्वम् तं वधिष्यामि सम्युगे || ६-६५-४५_END
BEGIN_
"Rama, together with Lakshmana, is the root-cause for the attack on our city. If he
is killed, all will be destroyed. Therefore, I shall kill that Rama in battle."_END

B_6_C_59_78
BEGIN_
ततस् ते चुक्रुशुर् हृष्टा लब्ध लक्ष्याह् प्लवम् गमाह् |
नील लाघव सम्भ्रान्तम् दृष्ट्वा रावणम् आहवे || ६-५९-८३_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, those monkeys who felt rejoiced to see Ravana disconcerted at the
agility of Nila and had found an occasion for jubilation, shouted joyously._END

B_6_C_67_14
BEGIN_
तानि पर्वतशृङ्गाणि शूलेन तु बिभेद ह || ६-६७-१६
बभञ्ज वृक्षवर्षम् च कुम्भकर्णो महाबलः |_END
BEGIN_
The mighty Kumbhakarna broken those mountain-tops and shattered the torrent of trees
with his spike._END

B_6_C_68_6
BEGIN_
ततः कृच्च्रात् समासाद्य सम्ज्ञाम् राक्षस पुम्गवः |
कुम्भ कर्ण वधाद् दीनो विललाप स रावणः || ६-६८-९_END
BEGIN_
Then, recovering his consciousness with difficulty, distressed as he was for the
killing of Kumbhakarna and perplexed in mind, Ravana the foremost of demons, lamented (as
follows):_END

B_6_C_60_73
BEGIN_
सर्वमद्यैव यूपाक्ष हरिसैन्यम् सलक्ष्मणम् |
राघवम् च रणे जित्वा ततो द्रक्ष्यामि रावणम् || ६-६०-७८_END
BEGIN_
"O, Yupaksha! Now itself, after conquering the entire army of monkeys with Lakshmana
and Rama on the battle-field, then only I shall see Ravana."_END

B_6_C_65_42
BEGIN_
एवम् तस्य ब्रुवाणस्य कुम्भकर्णस्य राक्षसाः |
नादम् चक्रुर्महाघोरं कम्पयन्त इवार्णवम् || ६-६५-४६_END
BEGIN_
While Kumbhakarna was speaking in that way, the demons made a very terrific noise,
as though they were agitating the ocean._END

B_6_C_59_79
BEGIN_
वानराणाम् च नादेन सम्रब्धो रावणस् तदा |
सम्भ्रम आविष्ट हृदयो न किंचित् प्रत्यपद्यत || ६-५९-८४_END
BEGIN_
Then, provoked by the shouts of the monkeys, his heart possessed with confusing,
Ravana did not know what to do._END

B_6_C_67_15
BEGIN_
ततो हरीणां तदनीकमुग्रं |
दुद्राव शूलं निशितं प्रगृह्य |
तस्थौ ततोऽस्यापततः पुरस्तान् |
न्महीधराग्रम् हनुमान् प्रगृह्य || ६-६७-१७_END
BEGIN_
Then, taking the dreadful spike in his hand, Kumbhakarna ran towards that terrific
army of monkeys. Taking a mountain-peak in his hands, Hanuma stood in front of the approaching
Kumbhakarna._END

B_6_C_68_7
BEGIN_
हा वीर रिपु दर्पघ्न कुम्भ कर्ण महा बल |
शत्रु सैन्यम् प्रताप्य एकः क्व माम् सम्त्यज्य गच्चसि || ६-६८-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Alas! O hero, destroying the pride of enemies! O mighty Kumbhakarna! Leaving me
behind, you have gone by divine will to the abode of Yama the lord of death."_END

B_6_C_60_74
BEGIN_
राक्षसांस्तर्पयिष्यामि हरीणाम् मांसशोणितैः |
रामलक्ष्मणयोश्चापि स्वयम् पास्यामि शोणितम् ||६-६०-७९_END
BEGIN_
"I shall satiate the demons with the flesh and blood of monkeys and, as for Rama and
Lakshmana, I shall drink their blood myself."_END

B_6_C_65_43
BEGIN_
तस्य निष्पततस्तूर्णम् कुम्भकर्णस्य धीमतः |
बभूवुर्घोररूपाणि निमित्तानि समन्ततः || ६-६५-४७_END
BEGIN_
As that intelligent Kumbhakarna was sallying forth quickly for the battle, omens of
terrific patterns appeared on all sides._END

B_6_C_59_80
BEGIN_
आग्नेयेन अथ सम्युक्तम् गृहीत्वा रावणह् शरम् |
ध्वज शीर्ष स्थितम् नीलम् उदैक्षत निशा चरह् || ६-५९-८५_END
BEGIN_
Ravana the demon, taking up an arrow, charged with the missile presided over by the
fire-God, aimed at Nila who had perched on the tip of his standard._END

B_6_C_67_16
BEGIN_
स कुम्भकर्णम् कुपितो जघान |
वेगेन शैलोत्तमभीमकायम् |
स चुक्षुभे तेन तदाभिबूतो |
मेदार्द्रगात्रो रुधिरावसिक्तः || ६-६७-१८_END
BEGIN_
The enraged Hanuma struck with violence Kumbhakarna, who was endowed with a
magnificent body and looking like the most elevated mountain. Thus attacked by Hanuma, Kumbhakarna
was stumbled with a sprinkling of blood and with his limbs succulent with flesh._END

B_6_C_68_8
BEGIN_
मम शल्यमनुद्धृत्य बान्धवानाम् महाबल |
शत्रुसैन्यम् प्रताप्यैकः क्व माम् सम्त्यज्य गच्छसि || ६-६८-११_END
BEGIN_
"O mighty Kumbhakarna! Where are you going alone, leaving me behind, after having
tormented the army of enemies and without taking away the thorn of grief from relatives and
me."_END

B_6_C_60_75
BEGIN_
तत्तस्य वाक्यम् ब्रुवतो निशम्य |
सगर्वितम् रोषविवृद्धदोषम् |
महोदरो नैरृतयोधमुख्यः |
कृताञ्जलिर्वाक्यमिदम् बभाषे || ६-६०-८०_END
BEGIN_
Hearing these haughty from that demon, whose anger increased his ferocity, Mahodara
the chief of warriors of demons, having offered obeisance with joined palms, spoke the following
words:_END

B_6_C_65_44
BEGIN_
उल्काशनियुता मेघा विनेदुश्च सुदारुणाः |
ससागरवना चैव वसुधा समकम्पत || ६-६५-४८_END
BEGIN_
Clouds, ashy in colour like asses, combined with meteors and strokes of lightning
appeared. Even the earth trembled, together with its oceans and forests._END

B_6_C_59_81
BEGIN_
ततो अब्रवीन् महा तेजा रावणो राक्षस ईश्वरह् |
कपे लाघव युक्तो असि मायया परया अनया || ६-५९-८६_END
BEGIN_
Then, Ravana the king of demons said,: "O monkey! You are endowed with agility
combined with a supreme power of magic."_END

B_6_C_67_17
BEGIN_
स शूलमाविध्य तडित्प्रकाशं |
गिरिर्यथा प्रज्वलिताग्रशृङ्गम् |
बाह्वन्तरे मारुति माजघान |
गुहोऽचलं क्रौञ्चमिवोग्रशक्त्या || ६-६७-१९_END
BEGIN_
Holding firmly the spike, which was bright as lightning and looking like a blazing
mountain-peak, Kumbhakarna struck Hanuma on his chest, as Guha (the son of Shiva) struck Krauncha
mountain with his powerful javelin._END

B_6_C_68_9
BEGIN_
इदानीम् खल्व् अहम् न अस्मि यस्य मे पतितो भुजः |
दक्षिणो यम् समाश्रित्य न बिभेमि सुर असुरान् || ६-६८-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Indeed I shall no longer live now, that this right hand of mine, taking refuge on
when I had no fear of celestials and ogres, has fallen down."_END

B_6_C_60_76
BEGIN_
रावणस्य वचः श्रुत्वा गुणदोषौ विमृश्य च |
पश्चादपि महाबाहो शत्रून्युधि विजेष्यसि || ६-६०-८१_END
BEGIN_
"O, the mighty armed! When you have listened to the words of Ravana and considered
the advantages and disadvantages of the matter, even afterwards you can conquer the enemies in
battle."_END

B_6_C_65_45
BEGIN_
घोररूपाः शिवा नेदुः सज्वालकवलैर्मुखैः |
मण्डलान्यपसव्यानि बबन्धुश्च विहंगमाः || ६-६५-४९_END
BEGIN_
Jackals of terrific form howled with flaming morsels in their mouths and birds
twirled in circles from right to left._END

B_6_C_69_0
BEGIN_
एवम् विलपमानस्य रावणस्य दुरात्मनः |
श्रुत्वा शोक अभितप्तस्य त्रिशिरा वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् || ६-६९-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of the evil-minded Ravana, who was thus lamenting, as he was
overcome with grief, Trishira (one of his sons) spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_59_82
BEGIN_
जीवितम् खलु रक्षस्व यदि शक्नोषि वानर |
तानि तान्य् आत्म रूपाणि सृजसे त्वम् अनेकशह् || ६-५९-८७_END
BEGIN_
"Do you save your life if you can, eventhogh you are creating numerous deeds of
various kinds indeed worthy of your own self, O, monkey!"_END

B_6_C_68_10
BEGIN_
कथम् एवम् विधो वीरो देव दानव दर्पहा |
काल अग्नि प्रतिमो हि अद्य राघवेण रणे हतः || ६-६८-१३_END
BEGIN_
"How such a hero, who destroyed the pride of celestials and demons, as also who was
an image of fire that was to destroy the world, was killed by Rama today in battle?"_END

B_6_C_60_77
BEGIN_
महोदरवचः श्रुत्वा राक्षसैः परिवारितः |
कुम्भकर्णो महातेजाः सम्प्रतस्थे महाबलः || ६-६०-८२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Mahodara, the might Kumbhakarna of great valour prepared to
depart, surrounded by demons._END

B_6_C_67_18
BEGIN_
स शूलनिर्भिन्न महाभुजान्तरः |
प्रविह्वलः शोणितमुद्वमन्मुखात् |
ननाद भीमं हनुमान् महाहवे |
युगान्तमेघस्तनितस्वनोपमम् || ६-६७-२०_END
BEGIN_
That Hanuma, struck in his broad chest by the spike in that great combat, was highly
perturbed and while vomiting blood from his mouth, awfully roared like the sound of thunderous
clouds at the time of dissolution of the world._END

B_6_C_69_1
BEGIN_
एवम् एव महा वीर्यो हतो नस् तात मध्यमः |
न तु सत् पुरुषा राजन् विलपन्ति यथा भवान् || ६-६९-२_END
BEGIN_
"Truly in such a manner, the highly valiant Kumbhakarna, (the middle of our father
and uncles) has been killed. But good persons like you do not lament as you are doing, O king!"_END

B_6_C_65_46
BEGIN_
निष्पपात च गृध्रेऽस्य शूले वै पथि गच्छतः |
प्रास्फुरन्नयनम् चास्य सव्यो बाहुरकम्पत || ६-६५-५०_END
BEGIN_
A vulture descended on the spike of Kumbhakarna, as he was sallying forth along the
road. His left eye twitched and his left arm throbbed._END

B_6_C_59_83
BEGIN_
तथा अपि त्वाम् मया मुक्तह् सायको अस्त्र प्रयोजितह् |
जीवितम् परिरक्षन्तम् जीविताद् भ्रंशयिष्यति || ६-५९-८८_END
BEGIN_
"Even then, the arrow charged with a mystic missile I am about to loose, will severe
you from life, which existence you seek to preserve."_END

B_6_C_68_11
BEGIN_
यस्य ते वज्र निष्पेषो न कुर्याद् व्यसनम् सदा |
स कथम् राम बाण आर्तः प्रसुप्तो असि मही तले || ६-६८-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Having been afflicted by Rama's arrows, how are you, whom not even a clash of a
thunder-bolt ever caused any fall, falling now insensibly on the earth's surface?"_END

B_6_C_60_78
BEGIN_
सुप्तमुत्थाप्य भीमाक्षम् भीमरूपपराक्रमम् |
राक्षसास्त्वरिता जग्मुर्दशग्रीवनिवेशनम् || ६-६०-८३_END
BEGIN_
The demons, having awaken that sleeping Kumbhakarna of dreadful eyes, form and
valour, went to the King's palace in haste._END

B_6_C_67_19
BEGIN_
ततो विनेदुः सहसा प्रहृष्टा |
रक्षोगणास्तं व्यथितं समीक्ष्य |
प्लवम्गमास्तु व्यथिता भयार्ताः |
प्रदुद्रुवुः सम्यति कुम्भकर्णात् || ६-६७-२१_END
BEGIN_
Looking at the perturbed Hanuma, all the troops of demons then suddenly shouted with
rejoice. The monkeys, on their part, felt restless and being oppressed with fear, ran away from the
battle-field._END

B_6_C_69_2
BEGIN_
नूनम् त्रिभुवनस्य अपि पर्याप्तस् त्वम् असि प्रभो|
स कस्मात् प्राकृत;इव शोकस्य आत्मानम् ईदृशम् || ६-६९-३_END
BEGIN_
"O Lord! You are capable of conquering even the three worlds. Why are you, as such,
lamenting about yourself, as a common person?"_END

B_6_C_65_47
BEGIN_
निष्पपात तदा चोक्ला ज्वलन्ती भीमनिस्वना |
आदित्यो निष्प्रभश्चासीन्न प्रवाति सुखोऽनिलः || ६-६५-५१_END
BEGIN_
Then, a blazing meteor fell down with a dreadful noise. Even the sun became
lusterless and the wind was not blowing comfortably._END

B_6_C_59_84
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा महा बाहू रावणो राक्षस ईश्वरह् |
संधाय बाणम् अस्त्रेण चमू पतिम् अताडयत् || ६-५९-८९_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking, Ravana the long-armed King of Demons, having placed Agni Missile with
his arrow, struck Nila the Army-General._END

B_6_C_68_12
BEGIN_
एते देव गणाः सार्धम् ऋषिभिर् गगने स्थिताः |
निहतम् त्वाम् रणे दृष्ट्वा निनदन्ति प्रहर्षिताः || ६-६८-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing you killed in battle, these troops of celestials and sages, standing in the
sky, are shouting with rejoice."_END

B_6_C_60_79
BEGIN_
तेऽभिगम्य दशग्रीवमासीनम् परमासने |
ऊचुर्बद्धाञ्जलिपुटाः सर्व एव निशाचराः || ६-६०-८४_END
BEGIN_
All those demons, approaching Ravana who was seated on the throne, said to him with
joined palms, as follows:_END

B_6_C_67_20
BEGIN_
ततस्तु नीलो बलवान् पर्यवस्थापयन् बलम् |
प्रविचिक्षेप शैलाग्रम् कुम्भकर्णाय धीमते || ६-६७-२२_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, cheering up the army and stopping them, the mighty Neela then hurled a
mountain-top on the intellectual Kumbhakarna._END

B_6_C_69_3
BEGIN_
ब्रह्म दत्ता अस्ति ते शक्तिः कवचः सायको धनुः|
सहस्र खर सम्युक्तो रथो मेघ सम स्वनः || ६-६९-४_END
BEGIN_
"You do continue to have a javelin given by Brahma, an armour, a bow and an arrow
together with a chariot yoked to a thousand donkeys, emitting a sound resembling the rumbling of a
cloud."_END

B_6_C_65_48
BEGIN_
अचिन्तयन्महोत्पातानुत्थिताम्ल्लोमहर्षणान् |
निर्ययौ कुम्भकर्णस्तु कृतान्तबलचोदितः || ६-६५-५२_END
BEGIN_
Disregarding those great portents indicated, causing the hair to stand erect,
Kumbhakarna on his part marched on, driven by the power of fate._END

B_6_C_59_85
BEGIN_
सो अस्त्र युक्तेन बाणेन नीलो वक्षसि ताडितह् |
निर्दह्यमानह् सहसा निपपात मही तले || ६-५९-९०_END
BEGIN_
Struck on the chest by the arrow combined with a missile, Nila being burnt all over,
suddenly fell to the ground._END

B_6_C_68_13
BEGIN_
ध्रुवम् अद्य एव सम्हृष्टा लब्ध लक्ष्याः प्लवम् गमाः |
आरोक्ष्यन्ति इह दुर्गाणि लन्का द्वाराणि सर्वशः || ६-६८-१६_END
BEGIN_
"It is doubly sure that the monkeys, having achieved their purpose, will be rejoiced
and now itself will ascend the inaccessible door-ways of Lanka here from all sides."_END

B_6_C_60_80
BEGIN_
कुम्भकर्णः प्रबुद्धोऽसौ भ्राता ते राक्षसेश्वर |
कथम् तत्रैव निर्यातु द्रक्ष्यसे तमिहागतम् || ६-६०-८५_END
BEGIN_
"O, Lord of Demons! Kumbhakarna, your brother, has wakened. Is it your will that he
should enter the battle field from there itself or do you desire him to come here and see you?"_END

B_6_C_67_21
BEGIN_
तदापतन्तं सम्प्रेक्ष्ये मुष्टिनाभिजघान ह |
मुष्टिप्रहाराभिहतम् तच्छैलाग्रम् व्यशीर्यत || ६-६७-२३
सविस्फुलिम्गम् सज्वालं निपपात महीतले |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that mountain-top befalling on him, Kumbhakarna then struck it with his fist.
By that strike of the fist, that mountain-top was burst into pieces and fallen down on the ground,
with sparks of fire and blaze._END

B_6_C_69_4
BEGIN_
त्वया असकृद् विशस्तेण विशस्ता देव दानवाः|
स सर्व आयुध सम्पन्नो राघवम् शास्तुम् अर्हसि || ६-६९-५_END
BEGIN_
"The celestials and giants were indeed destroyed several times by you with your
various types of weapons. As such, you can punish Rama, when endowed with all weapons."_END

B_6_C_65_49
BEGIN_
स लङ्घयित्वा प्राकारं पद्भ्यां पर्वतसंनिभः |
ददर्शाभ्रघनप्रख्यम् वानरानीकमद्भुतम् || ६-६५-५३_END
BEGIN_
Kumbhakarna, looking like a mountain, traversing the rampart with his feet alone,
saw a wonderful army of monkeys, looking similar to a thick coverage of clouds._END

B_6_C_59_86
BEGIN_
पितृ माहात्म्य सम्योगाद् आत्मनश् च अपि तेजसा |
जानुभ्याम् अपतद् भूमौ न च प्राणैर् व्ययुज्यत || ६-५९-९१_END
BEGIN_
Yet by virtue of the powerful aid of his father and his own native vigour, though
brought to his knees on to the earth, he was not deprived of his life._END

B_6_C_68_14
BEGIN_
राज्येन न अस्ति मे कार्यम् किम् करिष्यामि सीतया |
कुम्भ कर्ण विहीनस्य जीविते न अस्ति मे रतिः || ६-६८-१७_END
BEGIN_
"I have nothing to do with a kingdom and what shall I do with Seetha? I have no
intention to live, bereft of Kumbhakarna."_END

B_6_C_60_81
BEGIN_
रावणस्त्वब्रवीद्धृष्टो राक्षसांस्तानुपस्थितान् |
द्रष्टुमेनमिहेच्छामि यथान्यायम् च पूज्यताम् || ६-६०-८६_END
BEGIN_
Ravana answered those demons who stood before him and with a glad heart, said: "I
want to see him here. Bring him after extending the honours due to him in a befitting manner."_END

B_6_C_67_22
BEGIN_
ऋषभः शरभो नीलो गवाक्षो गन्धमादनः || ६-६७-२४
पञ्च वानर शार्दूलाः कुम्भकर्णमुपाद्रवन् |_END
BEGIN_
The five excellent monkeys, viz. Rishabha, Sharabha, Neela, Gavaksha and
Gandhamadana marched ahead quickly towards Kumbhakarna._END

B_6_C_69_5
BEGIN_
कामम् तिष्ठ महा राज निर्गमिष्यामि अहम् रणम्|
उद्धरिष्यामि ते शत्रून् गरुडः पन्नगान् इह || ६-६९-६_END
BEGIN_
"You stay on, O monarch! I will set out and eradicate your enemies in battle, as
Garuda the eagle eradicates the serpents."_END

B_6_C_65_50
BEGIN_
ते दृष्ट्वा राक्षसश्रेष्ठम् वानराः पर्वतोपमम् |
वायुनुन्ना इव घना ययुः सर्वा दिशस्तदा || ६-६५-५४_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that Kumbhakarna, the excellent among demons, looking equal to a mountain,
the monkeys then ran away to all directions, as clouds are driven away by the wind._END

B_6_C_59_87
BEGIN_
विसम्ज्नम् वानरम् दृष्ट्वा दशग्रीवो रण उत्सुकह् |
रथेन अम्बुद नादेन सौमित्रिम् अभिदुद्रुवे || ६-५९-९२_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Nila unconscious, Ravana, eager for fight, in his chariot whose rattling
sounded like thunder-clouds, rushed on Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_60_82
BEGIN_
तथेत्युक्त्वा तु ते सर्वे पुनरागम्य राक्षसाः |
कुम्भकर्णमिदम् वाक्यमूचू रावणचोदिताः || ६-६०-८७_END
BEGIN_
Uttering "Be it so", all those demons as commanded by Ravana, returned to
Kumbhakarna and spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_68_15
BEGIN_
यदि अहम् भ्रातृ हन्तारम् न हन्मि युधि राघवम् |
ननु मे मरणम् श्रेयो न च इदम् व्यर्थ जीवितम् || ६-६८-१८_END
BEGIN_
"If I cannot kill Rama, who killed my brother, in battle, I would indeed prefer
death, but in no case this useless life which has no meaning."_END

B_6_C_67_23
BEGIN_
शैलैर्वृक्षैस्तलैः पादैर्मुष्टिभिश्च महाबलाः || ६-६७-२५
कुम्भकर्णं महाकाम् निजघ्नुः सर्वतो युधि |_END
BEGIN_
Those five mighty monkeys struck the large-bodied Kumbhakarna from all sides, with
crags, trees, palms of their hands, feet and fists in battle._END

B_6_C_69_6
BEGIN_
शम्बरो देव राजेन नरको विष्णुना यथा|
तथा अद्य शयिता रामो मया युधि निपातितः|_END
BEGIN_
"Beaten down by me, as Shambara by Indra and Naraka* by Vishnu, I will lay down Rama
today in battle."_END

B_6_C_65_51
BEGIN_
तद्वानरानीकमतिप्रचण्डं |
दिशो द्रवद्भिन्नमिवाभ्रजालम् |
स कुम्भकर्णः समवेक्ष्य हर्षान् |
ननाद भूयो घनवद्घनाभः || ६-६५-५५_END
BEGIN_
Looking towards that highly fierce army of monkeys, running away to different
quarters, as a net-work of broken clouds, that Kumbhakarna with the hue of a black cloud, highly
rejoiced, repeatedly emitted a roar-like thunder._END

B_6_C_59_88
BEGIN_
आसाद्य रणमध्ये तं वारैत्वा स्थितो ज्वलन् |
धनुर्विष्फारयामास राक्षसेन्द्रः प्रतापवान् || ६-५९-९३_END
BEGIN_
Coming to the centre of the battle-field, the powerful Ravana the King of Demons
prevented Lakshmana to go forward, halted, standing there in his glory and lifted up his bow._END

B_6_C_68_16
BEGIN_
अद्य एव तम् गमिष्यामि देशम् यत्र अनुजो मम |
न हि भ्रातृऋन् समुत्सृज्य क्षणम् जीवितुम् उत्सहे || ६-६८-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Now itself, I will go to that place, where my younger brother is there. I do not
wish to live even for a moment, after abandoning my brothers."_END

B_6_C_60_83
BEGIN_
द्रष्टुम् त्वाम् काम्क्षते राजा सर्वराक्षसपुम्गवः |
गमने क्रियताम् बुद्धिर्भ्रातरम् सम्प्रहर्षय || ६-६०-८८_END
BEGIN_
"The king, the lion of all the demons, desires to see you. Go and gratify your
brother!"_END

B_6_C_69_7
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा त्रिशिरसो वाक्यम् रावणो राक्षस अधिपः|
पुनर् जातम् इव आत्मानम् मन्यते काल चोदितः || ६-६९-८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Trishira, Ravana the king of demons considered himself as
though born anew, after being summoned by Death._END

B_6_C_67_24
BEGIN_
स्पर्शानिव प्रहारांस्तान्वेदयानो न विव्यथे || ६-६७-२६
ऋषभम् तु महावेगं बाहुभ्यां परिषस्वजे |_END
BEGIN_
Perceiving those blows merely as the senses of touch, Kumbhakarna was not at all
perturbed. He enfolded the greatly agitated Rishabha in his arms._END

B_6_C_65_52
BEGIN_
ते तस्य घोरं निनदं निशम्य |
यथा निनादम् दिवि वारिदस्य |
पेतुर्धरण्यां बहवः प्लवम्गा |
निकृत्तमूला इव सालवृक्षाः || ६-६५-५६_END
BEGIN_
Hearing his terrific roar, similar to the rumbling of a cloud in the sky, many of
those monkeys fell down on the ground, like Sal trees cut-up by the roots._END

B_6_C_68_17
BEGIN_
देवा हि माम् हसिष्यन्ति दृष्ट्वा पूर्व अपकारिणम् |
कथम् इन्द्रम् जयिष्यामि कुम्भ कर्ण हते त्वयि || ६-६८-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing me, who did harm to them in the past, the celestials will indeed mock me. O
Kumbhakarna! Now that you are dead, how can I conquer Indra the lord of celestials?"_END

B_6_C_59_89
BEGIN_
तम् आह सौमित्रिर् अदीन सत्त्वो |
विस्फारयन्तम् धनुर् अप्रमेयम् |
अभेहि माम् एव निशा चर इन्द्र |
न वानरांस् त्वम् प्रति योद्धुम् अर्हसि || ६-५९-९४_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana of indomitable courage spoke to that Ravana who was lifting up his
unfathomable bow (as follows): "O, King of Demons! Now enter into combat with me; cease from
fighting with the monkeys!"_END

B_6_C_60_84
BEGIN_
कुम्भकर्णस्तु दुर्धर्षो भ्रातुराज्ञाय शासनम् |
तथेत्युक्त्वा महावीर्यः शयनादुत्पपात ह || ६-६०-८९_END
BEGIN_
Hearing his brother's wish, Kumbhakarna the inviolable demon of great prowess,
uttering "so be it", leapt up from his couch._END

B_6_C_67_25
BEGIN_
कुम्भकर्णभुजाभ्याम् तु पीडितो वानरर्षभः || ६-६७-२७
निपपातर्षभो भीमः प्रमुखागतशोणितः |_END
BEGIN_
Squeezed by Kumbhakarna's arms, the awful Rishabha, the foremost among the monkeys,
fell down with blood coming out of his mouth._END

B_6_C_69_8
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा त्रिशिरसो वाक्यम् देव अन्तक नर अन्तकौ|
अतिकायसः च तेजस्वी बभूवुर् युद्ध हर्षिताः || ६-६९-९_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Trishira, Devantaka, Narantaka and the energetic Atikaya were
rejoiced of war._END

B_6_C_65_53
BEGIN_
विपुलपरिघवान्स कुम्भकर्णो |
रिपुनिधनाय विनिःसृतो महात्मा |
कपि गणभयमाददत्सुभीमं |
प्रभुरिव किम्ण्करदण्डवान्युगान्ते || ६-६५-५७_END
BEGIN_
Wielding a large iron rod for the destroyable of the enemies, that gigantic
Kumbhakarna looked like Yama the lord of death armed with a rod of punishment, waiting upon him as
his attendant at the time of dissolution of the world and caused a great terrific fear to the
troops of monkeys._END

B_6_C_68_18
BEGIN_
तद् इदम् माम् अनुप्राप्तम् विभीषण वचः शुभम् |
यद् अज्ञानान् मया तस्य न गृहीतम् महात्मनः || ६-६८-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Those words of that great-souled Vibhishana, which I did not accept due to
ignorance, have come true."_END

B_6_C_59_90
BEGIN_
स तस्य वाक्यम् परिपूर्ण घोषम् |
ज्या शब्दम् उग्रम् च निशम्य राजा |
आसाद्य सौमित्रिम् अवस्थितम् तम् |
कोप अन्वितम् वाक्यम् उवाच रक्षह् || ६-५९-९५_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that marvellously modulated voice that resounded like the twanging of a
bow-string, Ravana drawing near his adversary, who stood close to his chariot, answered in
anger:_END

B_6_C_60_85
BEGIN_
प्रक्षाल्य वदनम् ह्ऱ्^ष्टः स्नातः परमभूषितः |
पिपासुस्त्वरयामास पानम् बलसमीरणम् || ६-६०-९०_END
BEGIN_
Washing his face and bathing, refreshed and delighted, adorning himself well and
feeling thirsty, he hastened them to bring him a drink which can boost up his strength._END

B_6_C_67_26
BEGIN_
मुष्टिना शरभम् हत्वा जानुना नीलमाहवे || ६-६७-२८
आजघान गवाक्षं च तलेनेन्द्ररिपुस्तदा |
पादेनाभ्यहनत्कृद्ध स्तरसा गन्धमादनम् || ६-६७-२९_END
BEGIN_
Then, in battle, the enraged Kumbhakarna, the enemy of Indra, beating Sharabha with
his fist and Neela with his knee, struck Gavaksha with a palm of his hand and struck Gandhamadana
violently with his feet._END

B_6_C_69_9
BEGIN_
ततो अहम् अहम् इति एवम् गर्जन्तो नैरृत ऋषभाः |
रावणस्य सुता वीराः शक्र तुल्य पराक्रमाः || ६-६९-१०_END
BEGIN_
Then, the brave Ravana's sons, whose prowess was equal to Indra and the foremost of
demons, roared asserting their superiority saying "I will lead, I will lead!"_END

B_6_C_68_19
BEGIN_
विभीषण वचो यावत् कुम्भ कर्ण प्रहस्तयोः |
विनाशो अयम् समुत्पन्नो माम् व्रीडयति दारुणः || ६-६८-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Ever since this cruel end of Kumbhakarna and Prahasta has happened, I am feeling
shameful."_END

B_6_C_60_86
BEGIN_
ततस्ते त्वरितास्तत्र राक्षसा रावणाज्ञया |
मद्यम् भक्ष्यांश्च विविधान् क्षिप्रमेवोपहारयन् || ६-६०-९१_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, those demons brought him quickly the wine and various kinds of eatable
there, in their hurry to take Kumbhakarna with them as per Ravana's commands._END

B_6_C_59_91
BEGIN_
दिष्ट्या असि मे राघव दृष्टि मार्गम् |
प्राप्तो अन्त गामी विपरीत बुद्धिह् |
अस्मिन् क्षणे यास्यसि मृत्यु देशम् |
संसाद्यमानो मम बाण जालैह् || ६-५९-९६_END
BEGIN_
"O, Lakshmana! By my good fortune, you in your perverted mind, reached within my
range of sight so as to meet your death. This very instant, you will go to the region of Death,
after having collapsed by the bang of my rain of arrows."_END

B_6_C_70_0
BEGIN_
नरान्तकम् हतम् दृष्ट्वा चुक्रुशुर् नैरृतर्षभाः।
देवान्तकः त्रिमूर्धा च पौलस्त्यः च महोदरः॥ ६-७०-०१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Narantaka dying, Devantaka, Trishira and Mahodara the son of Pulastya the
foremost of demons, wept._END

B_6_C_69_10
BEGIN_
अन्तरिक्ष चराः सर्वे सर्वे माया विशारदाः |१
सर्वे त्रिदश दर्पघ्नाः सर्वे च रण दुर्मदाः || ६-६९-११_END
BEGIN_
All of them wee capable of passing through the sky. All were skilled in magic. All
had humbled the pride of gods. All were fierce in battle._END

B_6_C_67_27
BEGIN_
दत्तप्रहरव्यथिता मुमुहुः शोणितोक्षिताः |
निपेतुस्ते तु मेदिन्यां निकृत्ता इव किंशुकाः || ६-६७-३०_END
BEGIN_
Perturbed by the blows given by Kumbhakarna, those monkeys being moistened with
blood, were bewildered and fell down on the ground, like chopped off Kimsuka trees._END

B_6_C_68_20
BEGIN_
तस्य अयम् कर्मणः प्रातो विपाको मम शोकदः |
यन् मया धार्मिकः श्रीमान् स निरस्तो विभीषणः || ६-६८-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Since that venerable Vibhishana, my pious brother was banished by me, this bitter
fruit of that painful deed has come to me."_END

B_6_C_60_87
BEGIN_
पीत्वा घटसहस्रे द्वे गमनायोपचक्रमे |
ईषत्समुत्कटो मत्तस्तेजोबलसमन्वितः || ६-६०-९२_END
BEGIN_
Having drunk two thousand pitchers, Kumbhakarna prepared to set out and slightly
inebriated and flushed, he was exhilarated and filled with energy._END

B_6_C_59_92
BEGIN_
तम् आह सौमित्रिर् अविस्मयानो |
गर्जन्तम् उद्वृत्त सित अग्र दम्ष्ट्रम् |
राजन् न गर्जन्ति महा प्रभावा |
विकत्थसे पापकृताम् वरिष्ठ || ६-५९-९७_END
BEGIN_
Then, Lakshmana, unmoved spoke to that Ravana who was roaring with his sharp and
protruding teeth (as follows): "Greatly dignified ones eschew bragging! O, the foremost of
evil-doers! You are sounding your own praises!"_END

B_6_C_70_1
BEGIN_
आरूढो मेघ सम्काशम् वारण इन्द्रम् महा उदरः |
वालि पुत्रम् महा वीर्यम् अभिदुद्राव वीर्यवान् || ६-७०-०२_END
BEGIN_
Mounting an excellent elephant, resembling a cloud, Mahodara hurrily attacked Angada
of great energy._END

B_6_C_69_11
BEGIN_
सर्वे अस्त्र बल सम्पन्नाः सर्वे विस्तीर्ण कीर्तयः|
सर्वे समरम् आसाद्य न श्रूयन्ते स्म निर्जिताः || ६-६९-१२
देवैरपि सगन्धर्वैः सकिम्नरमहोरगैः |_END
BEGIN_
All were endowed with great strength. All were widely renowned. All were such as had
never been heard of having been conquered by celestials or Gandharvas or Kinnaras or large serpents
while encountering a battle._END

B_6_C_67_28
BEGIN_
तेषु वानरमुख्येषु पतितेषु महात्मसु |
वानराणाम् सहस्राणि कुम्भकर्णं प्रदुद्रुवुः || ६-६७-३१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing those mighty chief commanders of monkeys falling down on the ground,
thousands of monkeys ran towards Kumbhakarna._END

B_6_C_60_88
BEGIN_
कुम्भकर्णो बबौ रुष्टः कालान्तकयमोपमः |
भ्रूतुः स भवनम् गच्छन् रक्षोबलसमन्वितः || ६-६०-९३
कुम्भकर्णः पदन्यासैरकम्पयत मेदिनीम् |_END
BEGIN_
The fuming Kumbhakarna, going to his brother's palace along with the army of demons,
appeared like Yama the Lord of Death at the end of all-destroying Time. He caused the earth to
tremble with his foot-steps, while marching._END

B_6_C_68_21
BEGIN_
इति बहु विधम् आकुल अन्तर् आत्मा |
कृपणम् अतीव विलप्य कुम्भ कर्णम् |
न्यपतद् अथ दश आननो भृश |
स्तमनुजम् इन्द्र रिपुम् हतम् विदित्वा || ६-६८-२४_END
BEGIN_
Having thus lamented very much piteously in various ways on coming to know that
Kumbhakarna, his younger brother and the enemy of Indra having been killed, Ravana the ten-headed
demon, whose inner feelings were agitated, even sank down, extremely disturbed._END

B_6_C_59_93
BEGIN_
जानामि वीर्यम् तव राक्षस इन्द्र |
बलम् प्रतापम् च पराक्रमम् च |
अवस्थितो अहम् शर चाप पाणिर् |
आगच्च किम् मोघ विकत्थनेन || ६-५९-९८_END
BEGIN_
"O, King of Demons! I know your valour, strength, energy and courage! Come! I now
stand here, with my bow and arrows in hand. O what use are vain boasts."_END

B_6_C_70_2
BEGIN_
भ्रातृ व्यसन सम्तप्तस् तदा देव अन्तको बली |
आदाय परिघम् दीप्तम् अन्गदम् समभिद्रवत् || ६-७०-०३_END
BEGIN_
The strong Devantaka, tormented at his brother's calamity, then taking a terrific
iron rod, ran towards Angada._END

B_6_C_69_12
BEGIN_
सर्वे अस्त्र विदुषो वीराः सर्वे युद्ध विशारदाः || ६-६९-१३
सर्वे प्रवर जिज्नानाः सर्वे लब्ध वरास् तथा |_END
BEGIN_
All the demons were valiant ones, well-versed in weaponry. All were skilled in
war-fare. All were greatly knowledgeable and all had obtained boons._END

B_6_C_67_29
BEGIN_
तम् शैलमिव शैलाभाः सर्वे तु प्लवगर्षभाः |
समारुह्य समुत्पत्य ददंशुश्च महाबलाः || ६-६७-३२_END
BEGIN_
All those champions of monkeys, looking like mountains, jumping up on Kumbhakarna
who was looking like a mountain, ascended him and bit him with their teeth._END

B_6_C_60_89
BEGIN_
स राजमार्गम् वपुषा प्रकाशयन् |
सहस्ररस्मिर्धरणीमिवांशुभिः |
जगाम तत्राञ्जलिमालया वृतः |
शतक्रतुर्गेहमिव स्वयम्भुवः || ६-६०-९४_END
BEGIN_
The royal high way was illumined by his body, like unto that orb of a thousand rays
(the sun) by its flashes illumines the earth and he went there, surrounded by a circle of demons
paying obeisance, resembling Indra the Lord of Celestials approaching the abode of Brahma the Lord
of Creation._END

B_6_C_59_94
BEGIN_
स;एवम् उक्तह् कुपितह् ससर्ज |
रक्षो अधिपह् सप्त शरान् सुपुन्खान् |
ताम्ल् लक्ष्मणह् कान्चन चित्र पुन्खैश् |
चिच्चेद बाणैर् निशित अग्र धारैह् || ६-५९-९९_END
BEGIN_
Thus accosted, the King of Demons, infuriated, loosened seven marvellously plumed
arrows which Lakshmana shattered with his beautiful golden-shafted arrows of sharp ends and
edges._END

B_6_C_69_13
BEGIN_
स तैस् तथा भास्कर तुल्य वर्चसैः
सुतैर् वृतः शत्रु बल प्रमर्दनैः |
रराज राजा मघवान् यथा अमरैर् |
वृतो महा दानव दर्प नाशनैः वृतो || ६-६९-१४_END
BEGIN_
That Ravana the king, surrounded by his sons, who were radiant as the sun and who
tormented the strength and fortune of the enemies, shone like Indra surrounded by celestials who
can destroy the pride of gigantic demons._END

B_6_C_70_3
BEGIN_
रथम् आदित्य सम्काशम् युक्तम् परम वाजिभिः |
आस्थाय त्रिशिरा वीरो वालि पुत्रम् अथ अभ्ययात् || ६-७०-०४_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, the valiant Trishira, mounting a chariot resembling the sun and yoked
with excellent horses, marched towards Angada._END

B_6_C_67_30
BEGIN_
तं नखैर्दशनैश्चापि मुष्टिभिर्जानुभिस्तथा |
कुम्भकर्णं महाकायं ते जघ्नुः प्लवगर्षभाः || ६-६७-३३_END
BEGIN_
Those mighty armed excellent monkeys encountered that Kumbhakarna with their nails,
teeth, fists and arms._END

B_6_C_60_90
BEGIN_
तम् राजमार्गस्थममित्रघातिनम् |
वनौकसस्ते सहसा बहिःस्थिताः |
दृष्ट्वाऽ प्रमेयम् गिरिशृङ्गकल्पम् |
वितत्रसुस्ते सह यूथपालैः || ६-६०-९५_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that slayer of his foes on the royal high way, that monster as high as the
peak of a mountain, those monkeys stationed outside the city, as also their leaders, were
frightened suddenly._END

B_6_C_59_95
BEGIN_
तान् प्रेक्षमाणह् सहसा निकृत्तान् |
निकृत्त भोगान् इव पन्नग इन्द्रान् |
लन्का ईश्वरह् क्रोध वशम् जगाम |
ससर्ज च अन्यान् निशितान् पृषत्कान् || ६-५९-१००_END
BEGIN_
Beholding those arrows shattered like great cobras with their hoods shattered,
Ravana got angry and loosened other sharp arrows._END

B_6_C_70_4
BEGIN_
स त्रिभिर् देव दर्पघ्नैर् नैरृत इन्द्रैर् अभिद्रुतः |
वृक्षम् उत्पाटयाम् आस महा विटपम् अन्गदः || ६-७०-०५_END
BEGIN_
That Angada, being attacked by the three chief demons, who were capable of smashing
the pride of celestials, uplifted a tree with its large boughs._END

B_6_C_69_14
BEGIN_
स पुत्रान् सम्परिष्वज्य भूषयित्वा च भूषणैः |
आशीर्भिसः च प्रशस्ताभिः प्रेषयाम् आस सम्युगे || ६-६९-१५_END
BEGIN_
Embracing his sons, embellishing them with ornaments and blessing them profusely,
Ravana sent them to battle._END

B_6_C_67_31
BEGIN_
स वानरसहस्त्रैस्तु विचितः पर्वतोपमः |
रराज राक्षसव्याघ्रो गिरिरात्मरुहैरिव || ६-६७-३४_END
BEGIN_
Covered by thousands of monkeys that foremost among demons looking like a mountain,
stood out in a crowd, as a hill overgrown with trees._END

B_6_C_60_91
BEGIN_
केचिछरण्यम् शरणम् स्म रामम् |
व्रजन्ति केचिद्व्यथिताः पतन्ति |
केचिद्दिशश्च व्यथिताः पतन्ति |
केचिद्बयार्ताभुवि शेरते स्म || ६-६०-९६_END
BEGIN_
Some gained refuge in Rama who affords protection, some fell down tottering, some
fled away perturbed in all directions and some others lay on the ground, confounded with fear._END

B_6_C_59_96
BEGIN_
स बाण वर्षम् तु ववर्ष तीव्रम् |
राम अनुजह् कार्मुक सम्प्रयुक्तम् |
क्षुर अर्ध चन्द्र उत्तम कर्णि भल्लैह् |
शरांश् च चिच्चेद न चुक्षुभे च || ६-५९-१०१_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana, however, caused a well-aimed rain of missiles from his bow to fall on
Ravana and nay, even broke Ravana's arrows with his arrows called Khura, Ardhachandra, the
excellent Karni and Bhalla. He did not feel perturbed._END

B_6_C_69_15
BEGIN_
युद्धोन्मत्तम् च मत्तं च भ्रातरौ च अपि रावणः |
रक्षण अर्थम् कुमाराणाम् प्रेषयाम् आस सम्युगे || ६-६९-१६_END
BEGIN_
For the defense of his sons, Ravana sent Yuddhonmatta and Matta (better known as
Mahodara and Mahaparshva), his brothers to the battle._END

B_6_C_70_5
BEGIN_
देव अन्तकाय तम् वीरसःचिक्षेप सहसा अन्गदः |
महा वृक्षम् महा शाखम् शक्रो दीप्तम् इव अशनिम् || ६-७०-०६_END
BEGIN_
The valiant Angada hurled that large tree with big branches quickly on Devantaka as
Indra the lord of celestials would a blazing thunderbolt._END

B_6_C_67_32
BEGIN_
बाहुभ्याम् वानरान् सर्वान् प्रगृह्य स महाबलः |
भक्षयामास सम्क्रुद्धो गरुडः पन्नगानिव || ६-६७-३५_END
BEGIN_
Seizing all the monkeys with his arms, that mighty Kumbhakarna devoured them like an
enraged Garuda the eagle devouring the serpents._END

B_6_C_60_92
BEGIN_
तमद्रिशृङ्गप्रतिमम् किरीटिनम् |
स्पृशन्तमादित्यमिवात्मतेजसा |
वनौकसः प्रेक्ष्य विवृद्धमद्भुतम् |
भयार्दिता दुद्रुविरे यतस्ततः || ६-६०-९७_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that colossus appearing like a great peak, having a diadem who seemed to
touch the sun with his brilliance, the monkeys were seized with terror and had grown immensely in
size, fled hither and thither._END

B_6_C_59_97
BEGIN_
स बाणजालान्यपि तानि तानि |
मोघानि पश्यांस्त्रिदशारिराजः |
विसिस्मिये लक्ष्मणलाघवेन |
पुनश्च बाणान्निशितान्मुमोच || ६-५९-१०२_END
BEGIN_
Seeing his successive arrows proving in vain, Ravana the King of those hostile to
Gods was astonished at Lakshmana's skill and released more whetted shafts upon him._END

B_6_C_69_16
BEGIN_
ते अभिवाद्य महात्मानम् रावणम् रिपु रावणम् |
कृत्वा प्रदक्षिणम् चैव महा कायाः प्रतस्थिरे || ६-६९-१७_END
BEGIN_
Those demons with colossal bodies, paid obeisance (by circumambulating) to Ravana
(who caused the people to cry in terror) and departed._END

B_6_C_67_33
BEGIN_
प्रक्षिप्ताः कुम्भकर्णेन वक्त्रे पातालसंनिभे |
नासापुटाभ्यां निर्जग्मुः कर्णाभ्याम् चैव वानराः || ६-६७-३६_END
BEGIN_
Hurled by Kumbhakarna in his mouth which was looking like a hole in the earth, the
monkeys again came out from his nostrils and ears._END

B_6_C_70_6
BEGIN_
त्रिशिरास् तम् प्रचिच्चेद शरैर् आशी विष उपमैः |
स वृक्षम् कृत्तम् आलोक्य;उत्पपात ततो अन्गदः || ६-७०-०७_END
BEGIN_
Trishira chopped off that tree with arrows looking like serpents. Seeing the tree
chopped off, that Angada then sprang up._END

B_6_C_59_98
BEGIN_
स लक्ष्मणश् च आशु शरान् शित अग्रान् |
महा इन्द्र वज्र अशनि तुल्य वेगान् |
संधाय चापे ज्वलन प्रकाशान् |
ससर्ज रक्षो अधिपतेर् वधाय || ६-५९-१०३_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana, the equal of Mahendra the Lord of celestials, fixing some sharpened
arrows, swift as lightning and of blazing effulgence on his bow-string, discharged them on Ravana
in order to strike him down._END

B_6_C_69_17
BEGIN_
सर्व ओषधीभिर् गन्धैसः च समालभ्य महा बलाः |
निर्जग्मुर् नैरृत श्रेष्ठाः षड् एते युद्ध कान्क्षिणः || ६-६९-१८_END
BEGIN_
Anointing their bodies with all types of herbs and perfumes, those six mighty and
excellent demons went away, eager to fight._END

B_6_C_67_34
BEGIN_
भक्षयन् भृशसम्क्रुद्धो हरीन् पर्वतसंनिभः |
बभञ्ज वानरान् सर्वान् सम्क्रुद्धो राक्षसोत्तमः || ६-६७-३७_END
BEGIN_
Kumbhakarna, the best among the demons, looking like a mountain, was very much
enraged and mutilated the monkeys angrily, before devouring them._END

B_6_C_70_7
BEGIN_
स ववर्ष ततो वृक्षान् शिलासःच कपि कुन्जरः |
तान् प्रचिच्चेद सम्क्रुद्धस् त्रिशिरा निशितैःशरैः || ६-७०-०८_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, that foremost of monkeys streamed forth trees and rocks. The enraged
Trishara chopped them off with his sharp arrows._END

B_6_C_59_99
BEGIN_
स तान् प्रचिच्चेद हि राक्षस इन्द्रश् |
चित्त्वा च ताम्ल् लक्ष्मणम् आजघान |
शरेण काल अग्नि सम प्रभेण |
स्वयम्भु दत्तेन ललाट देशे || ६-५९-१०४_END
BEGIN_
Whereupon, Ravana the King of Demons shattered those pointed arrows and struck
Lakshmana in the forehead with a struck Lakshmana in the forehead with a shaft as bright as the
Fire of Time, which had been bestowed on him by Brahma the Lord of Creation._END

B_6_C_69_18
BEGIN_
त्रिशिराश्चातिकायश्च देवान्तकनरान्तकौ |
महोदरमहापार्श्वौ निर्जग्मुः कालचोदिताः || ६-६९-१९_END
BEGIN_
Trishira, Atikaya, Devantaka, Narantaka, Mahodara and Mahaparshva, under the clout
of destiny; set out for the battle._END

B_6_C_67_35
BEGIN_
मांसशोणितसम्क्लेदां कुर्वन् भूमिम् कुर्वन्स राक्षसः |
चचार हरिसैन्येषु कालाग्निरिव मूर्छितः || ६-६७-३८_END
BEGIN_
Making the earth dampened with flesh and blood, that demon, like an excited fire at
the time of dissolution, strolled among that army of monkeys._END

B_6_C_70_8
BEGIN_
परिघ अग्रेण तान् वृक्षान् बभन्ज च सुर अन्तकः |
त्रिशिरासःच अन्गदम् वीरम् अभिदुद्राव सायकैः || ६-७०-०९_END
BEGIN_
That Mahodra broke those trees with the tip of his club. Trishira too with his
arrows attacked the valiant Angada._END

B_6_C_59_100
BEGIN_
स लक्ष्मणो रावण सायक आर्तश् |
चचाल चापम् शिथिलम् प्रगृह्य |
पुनश् च सम्ज्नाम् प्रतिलभ्य कृच्च्राच् |
चिच्चेद चापम् त्रिदश इन्द्र शत्रोह् || ६-५९-१०५_END
BEGIN_
Struck by Ravana's arrow, Lakshmana reeled a little and was scarcely able to retain
his bow. But, coming to his consciousness with difficulty, he shattered that weapon belonging to
Ravana, Indra's enemy._END

B_6_C_71_0
BEGIN_
स्वबलम् व्यथितम् दृष्ट्वा तुमुलं लोमहर्षणम् |
भ्रातॄंश्च निहतान्दृष्ट्वा शक्रतुल्यपराक्रमान् || ६-७१-१
पितृव्यौ चापि सन्दृश्य समरे संनिषूदितौ |
युद्धोन्मत्तम् च मत्तम् च भ्रातरौ राक्षसर्षभौ || ६-७१-२
चुकोप च महातेजा ब्रह्मदत्तवरो युधि |
अतिकायोऽद्रिसङ्काशो देवदानवदर्पहा || ६-७१-३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing his own army making a tumultuous sound tottering with excessive fear, seeing
his brothers having a prowess equal to that of Indra the lord of celestials having been killed, and
seeing his paternal uncles as also Yuddhonmatta and Matta (Mahodara and Mahaparshva) his brothers
and the foremost of demons having been fallen down, Atikaya of great splendour, having boons
bestowed by Brahma the lord of creation, having appearance of a mountain and who removed the pride
of celestials and ogres, was enraged._END

B_6_C_69_19
BEGIN_
ततः सुदर्शनम् नाम नील जीमूत सम्निभम् |
ऐरावत कुले जातम् आरुरोह महा उदरः || ६-६९-२०_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Mahodara mounted an elephant called Sudarshana, like unto a dark-cloud
and born in Airavata-race._END

B_6_C_67_36
BEGIN_
वज्रहस्तो यथा शक्रः पाशहस्त इवान्तकः |
शूलहस्तो बभौ कुम्भकर्णो महाबलः || ६-६७-३९_END
BEGIN_
Wielding a spike in his hand in the battle-front, the mighty Kumbhakarna shone like
Indra the lord of celestials wielding a thunderbolt in his hand and like Yama the god of death
wielding a noose in his hand._END

B_6_C_70_9
BEGIN_
गजेन समभिद्रुत्य वालि पुत्रम् महा उदरः |
जघान उरसि सम्क्रुद्धस् तोमरैर् वज्र सम्निभैः || ६-७०-१०_END
BEGIN_
Marching ahead quickly towards Angada on an elephant, the enraged Mahodara struck on
his chest with javelins looking like thunderbolts._END

B_6_C_59_101
BEGIN_
निकृत्त चापम् त्रिभिर् आजघान |
बाणैस् तदा दाशरथिह् शित अग्रैह् |
स सायक आर्तो विचचाल राजा |
कृच्च्राच् च सम्ज्नाम् पुनर् आससाद || ६-५९-१०६_END
BEGIN_
Then, Lakshmana the son of Dasaratha struck Ravana, whose bow was broken, with three
pointed darts. The king, pierced by those arrows, swooned and regained his senses with
difficulty._END

B_6_C_69_20
BEGIN_
सर्व आयुध समायुक्तम् तूणीभिसः च स्वलम्कृतम् |
रराज गजम् आस्थाय सविता इव अस्त मूर्धनि || ६-६९-२१_END
BEGIN_
That Mahodara, adorned with quivers, endowed with all types of armoury and mounting
the elephant, shone like the sun on the peak of Ashtachala mountain._END

B_6_C_71_1
BEGIN_
स भास्करसहस्रस्य सङ्घातमिव भास्वरम् |
रथमास्थाय शक्रारिरभिदुद्राव वानरान् || ६-७१-४_END
BEGIN_
That Atikaya, the enemy of Indra the lord of celestials, mounting a chariot shining
like a cluster of thousand suns, ran towards the monkeys._END

B_6_C_67_37
BEGIN_
यथा शुष्काण्यरण्यानि ग्रीष्मे दहति पावकः |
तथा वानरसैन्यानि कुम्भकर्णो ददाह सः || ६-६७-४०_END
BEGIN_
That Kumbhakarna scorched away that army of monkeys in the same way as the fire
scorches away the dried-up forests in summer._END

B_6_C_70_10
BEGIN_
देव अन्तकसःच सम्क्रुद्धःपरिघेण तदा अन्गदम् |
उपगम्य अभिहत्य आशु व्यपचक्राम वेगवान् || ६-७०-११_END
BEGIN_
Then, the enraged Devantaka with a speed, approached Angada, struck him quickly with
a club and went off to a distance._END

B_6_C_59_102
BEGIN_
स कृत्त चापह् शर ताडितश् च |
स्वेद आर्द्र गात्रो रुधिर अवसिक्तह् |
जग्राह शक्तिम् समुदग्र शक्तिह् |
स्वयम्भु दत्ताम् युधि देव शत्रुह् || ६-५९-१०७_END
BEGIN_
Ravana, the enemy of celestials, whose bow was broken, struck by the arrows, his
limbs spattered with flesh, and streaming with blood, himself of formidable energy, seized in the
battle a spear gifted to him by Brahma the Lord of Creation._END

B_6_C_69_21
BEGIN_
हय उत्तम समायुक्तम् सर्व आयुध समाकुलम् |
आरुरोह रथ श्रेष्ठम् त्रिशिरा रावण आत्मजः|| ६-६९-२२_END
BEGIN_
Trishira, the son of Ravana, ascended an exquisite chariot, yoked to excellent
horses and filled with all types of armoury._END

B_6_C_71_2
BEGIN_
स विस्फार्य तदा चापम् किरीटी मृष्टकुण्डलः |
नाम संश्रावयामास ननाद च महास्वनम् || ६-७१-५_END
BEGIN_
Wearing a crown and well-cleansed ear-rings as also drawing his bow, he roared with
a big noise, making his name loudly heard._END

B_6_C_67_38
BEGIN_
ततस्ते वध्यमानास्तु हतयूथा विनायकाः |
वानरा भयसंविग्ना विनेदुर्विस्वरं भृशम् || ६-६७-४१_END
BEGIN_
Those monkeys, without a commander, having their troops killed and terrified with
fear they were being destroyed by Kumbhakarna, roared with rebellious voices._END

B_6_C_70_11
BEGIN_
स त्रिभिर् नैरृत श्रेष्ठैर् युगपत् समभिद्रुतः |
न विव्यथे महा तेजा वालि पुत्रःप्रतापवान् || ६-७०-१२_END
BEGIN_
Eventhough attacked at the same time by those three foremost of demons, that Angada
of great prowess and splendour, did not get alarmed._END

B_6_C_59_103
BEGIN_
स ताम् विधूम अनल सम्निकाशाम् |
वित्रासनीम् वानर वाहिनीनाम् |
चिक्षेप शक्तिम् तरसा ज्वलन्तीम् |
सौमित्रये राक्षस राष्ट्र नाथह् || ६-५९-१०८_END
BEGIN_
Ravana the Lord of the country of demons hurled with strength on Lakshmana, that
blazing spear, emitting smoke and as bright as fire, frightening the monkeys in the fray._END

B_6_C_69_22
BEGIN_
त्रिशिरा रथम् आस्थाय विरराज धनुर् धरः |
सविद्युद् उल्कः सज्वालः स इन्द्र चापिव अम्बुदः || ६-६९-२३_END
BEGIN_
Trishira, wielding a bow and mounting the chariot, shone like a cloud with
glittering meteors, illuminations and a rain-bow._END

B_6_C_71_3
BEGIN_
तेन सिम्हप्रणादेन नामविश्रावणेन च |
ज्याशब्देन च भीमेन त्रासयामास वानरान् || ६-७१-६_END
BEGIN_
By that lion-like roar, making his name loudly heard and by that terrific sound of
the bow-string, it created terror to the monkeys._END

B_6_C_67_39
BEGIN_
अनेकशो वध्यमानाः कुम्भकर्णेन वानराः |
राघवम् शरणम् जग्मुर्व्यथिताः खिन्नचेतसः || ६-६७-४२_END
BEGIN_
While Kumbhakarna was destroying them in many ways, the agitated monkeys sought
refuge in Rama, with their distressed minds._END

B_6_C_70_12
BEGIN_
स वेगवान् महावेगम् कृत्वा परमदुर्जयः |
तलेन भृशम् उत्पत्य जघान अस्य महा गजम् || ६-७०-१३_END
BEGIN_
The speedy and quite unconquerable Angada, acting with a great swiftness and
attacking well, struck Devantaka's elephant with his palm._END

B_6_C_69_23
BEGIN_
त्रिभिः किरीटैस् त्रिशिराः शुशुभे स रथ उत्तमे |
हिमवान् इव शैल इन्द्रस् त्रिभिः कान्चन पर्वतैः || ६-६९-२४_END
BEGIN_
That Trishira with three diadems in that exquisite chariot, stood out like Mount
Himavat, the king of mountains with its three golden hills._END

B_6_C_59_104
BEGIN_
ताम् आपतन्तीम् भरत अनुजो अस्त्रैर् |
जघान बाणैश् च हुत अग्नि कल्पैह् |
तथा अपि सा तस्य विवेश शक्तिर् |
भुज अन्तरम् दाशरथेर् विशालम् || ६-५९-१०९_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana the younger brother of Bharata struck that weapon falling upon him with
arrows and darts, as if it were a sacrificial fire. Nevertheless, that spear entered Lakshmana's
broad chest._END

B_6_C_71_4
BEGIN_
ते दृष्ट्वा देहमाहात्म्यम् कुम्भकर्णोऽयमुत्थितः |
भयार्ता वानराः सर्वे संश्रयन्ते परस्परम् || ६-७१-७_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the bulkiness of his body, all the monkeys, thinking that Kumbhakarna woke up
again, took refuge with each other, afflicted as they were, with fear._END

B_6_C_67_40
BEGIN_
प्रभग्नान् वानरान् दृष्ट्वा वज्रहस्तात्मजात्मजः |
अभ्यधावत वेगेन कुम्भकर्णम् महाहवे || ६-६७-४३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the monkeys defeated in that great battle, Angada the son of Indra, ran
rapidly towards Kumbhakarna._END

B_6_C_70_13
BEGIN_
तस्य तेन प्रहारेण नागराजस्य सम्युगे |
पेततुर् लोचने तस्य विननाद स वारणः || ६-७०-१४_END
BEGIN_
By that blow of Angada in battle, the eyes of that royal elephant fell down and that
elephant died._END

B_6_C_69_24
BEGIN_
अतिकायो अपि तेजस्वी राक्षस इन्द्र सुतस् तदा |
आरुरोह रथ श्रेष्ठम् श्रेष्ठः सर्व धनुष्मताम् || ६-६९-२५_END
BEGIN_
Then, Atikaya, having very fiery energy, the son of Ravana and the foremost among
the wielders of bow, mounted an excellent chariot._END

B_6_C_59_105
BEGIN_
स शक्तिमान् शक्तिसमाहतः सन् |
जज्वाल भूमौ स रघुप्रवीरः |
तं विह्वलन्तं सहसाभुपेत्य |
जग्राह राजा तरसा भुजाभ्याम् || ६-५९-११०_END
BEGIN_
The mighty Lakshmana, struck by the spear, lay on the earth, breathing fire. The
king, rushing suddenly on him who was yet insensible, seized him brutally in his hands._END

B_6_C_71_5
BEGIN_
ते तस्य रूपमालोक्य यथा विष्णोस्त्रिविक्रमे |
भयाद्वानरयोधास्ते विद्रवन्ति ततस्ततः || ६-७१-८_END
BEGIN_
Seeing his form appearing like Vishnu who strided over the three worlds in three
steps, the those renowned monkey-warriors with fear, ran away hither and thither._END

B_6_C_67_41
BEGIN_
शैलशृङ्गं महद्गृह्य विनदन् स मुहुर्मुहुः |
त्रासयन् राक्षसान् सर्वा कुम्भकर्णपदानुगान् || ६-६७-४४
चिक्षेप शैलशिखरं कुम्भकर्णस्य मूर्धनि |_END
BEGIN_
Taking a large mountain-top, Angada, roaring repeatedly and frightening all the
demons following Kumbhakarna's heels, hurled the mountain-top on Kumbhakarna's head._END

B_6_C_70_14
BEGIN_
विषाणम् च अस्य निष्कृष्य वालि पुत्रो महा बलः |
देव अन्तकम् अभिद्रुत्य ताडयाम् आस सम्युगे || ६-७०- १५_END
BEGIN_
Pulling out a tusk of that elephant in battle, the mighty Angada ran towards
Devantaka quickly and struck him._END

B_6_C_59_106
BEGIN_
हिमवान् मन्दरो मेरुस्त्रैलोक्यम् वा सहामरैः |
शक्यम् भुजाभ्यामुद्दर्तुम् न शक्यो भरतानुजः || ६-५९-१११_END
BEGIN_
Though he was able to lift up Himavat, Mandara and Meru mountains as also the Three
Worlds with the Gods, he could not raise Lakshmana the younger brother of Bharata._END

B_6_C_69_25
BEGIN_
सुचक्र अक्षम् सुसम्युक्तम् सानुकर्षम् सकूबरम् |
तूणी बाण आसनैर् दीप्तम् प्रास असि परिघ आकुलम् || ६-६९-२६_END
BEGIN_
Atikaya mounted that chariot, having first-rate wheels and axles, well-yoked, having
a good carriage and pole, filled with quivers and bows and flashingly full of missiles, swords and
maces._END

B_6_C_71_6
BEGIN_
तेऽतिकायम् समासाद्य वानरा मूढचेतसः |
शरण्यम् शरणम् जग्मुर्लक्ष्मणाग्रजमाहवे || ६-७१-९_END
BEGIN_
When Atikaya was to be attacked, the monkeys were bewildered in mind and sought in
the battle, a refuge with Rama, who affords protection._END

B_6_C_67_42
BEGIN_
स तेनाभिहतो मूर्ध्नि शैलेनेन्द्ररिपुस्तदा || ६-६७-४५
कुम्भकर्णः प्रजज्वाल क्रोधेन महता तदा |
सोऽभ्यधावत वेगेन वालिपुत्रममर्षणम् || ६-६७-४६_END
BEGIN_
Struck on the head with that mountain, that Kumbhakarna, Indra's adversary, with a
great rage, was excited and then ran rapidly towards the wrathful Angada._END

B_6_C_70_15
BEGIN_
स विह्वलित सर्व अन्गो वात उद्धत;इव द्रुमः |
लाक्षा रस सवर्णम् च सुस्राव रुधिरम् मुखात् || ६-७०-१६_END
BEGIN_
That energetic Devantaka swayed to and fro in disorder, like a tree being tossed up
by the wind and emitted plenty of blood with the colour of a lacquer._END

B_6_C_59_107
BEGIN_
शक्त्याब्राह्म्या तु सौमित्रिस्ताडितोऽपि स्तनान्तरे |
विष्णोरमीमांस्यभागमात्मानं प्रत्यनुस्मरत् || ६-५९-११२_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana, though wounded in the breast by Brahma's weapon, recollected that he was
an inconceivable fraction of Vishnu Himself._END

B_6_C_69_26
BEGIN_
स कान्चन विचित्रेण किरीटेन विराजता |
भूषणैसः च बभौ मेरुः प्रभाभिर् इव भास्वरः || ६-६९-२७_END
BEGIN_
He was radiant with his diadem, shining in brilliant gold and other ornaments, like
Mount Meru, causing to shine with its splendours (by the sun)._END

B_6_C_71_7
BEGIN_
ततोऽतिकायम् काकुत्स्थो रथस्थं पर्वतोपमम् |
ददर्श धन्विनम् दूराद्गर्जन्तं कालमेघवत् || ६-७१-१०_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama saw from a distance, Atikaya, who resembled a mountain in size, stationed
in a chariot, armed with a bow and rumbling like a cloud appearing at the time of universal
dissolution._END

B_6_C_67_43
BEGIN_
कुम्भकर्णो महानादस्त्रासयन् सर्ववानरान् |
शूलम् ससर्ज वै रोषादङ्गदे तु महाबलः || ६-६७-४७_END
BEGIN_
Frightening all the monkeys with his great roar, the mighty Kumbhakarna hurled his
spike at Angada with anger._END

B_6_C_70_16
BEGIN_
अथ आश्वास्य महा तेजाःकृच्च्राद् देव अन्तको बली |
आविध्य परिघम् घोरम् आजघान तदा अन्गदम् || ६-७०-१७_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, the strong Devantaka of great splendour, recovering his breath with a
great difficulty, then struck Angada violently, by firmly holding an iron rod._END

B_6_C_59_108
BEGIN_
ततो दानवदर्पघ्नं सौमित्रिम् देवकण्टकः |
तं पीडयित्वा बाहुभ्यां न प्रभुर्णङ्घनेऽभवत् || ६-५९-११३_END
BEGIN_
Ravana that thorn in the side of the Gods, though overcoming that Lakshmana who
removed the pride of demons, was unable to bear him away with his hands._END

B_6_C_69_27
BEGIN_
स रराज रथे तस्मिन् राज सूनुर् महा बलः |
वृतो नैरृत शार्दूलैर् वज्र पाणिर् इव अमरैः || ६-६९-२८_END
BEGIN_
In that chariot, Atikaya that mighty prince, surrounded by the foremost of demons,
shone like Indra surrounded by celestials._END

B_6_C_71_8
BEGIN_
स तम् दृष्ट्वा महाकायम् राघवस्तु सुविस्मितः |
वानरान्सान्त्वयित्वा च विभीषणमुवाच ह || ६-७१-११_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that Atikaya, having a colossal body, Rama for his part was quite surprised
and after consoling the monkeys, spoke to Vibhishana (as follows):_END

B_6_C_67_44
BEGIN_
त मापतन्तम् बुद्ध्वा तु युद्धमार्गविशारदः |
लाघवान्मोचयामास बलवान् वानरर्षभः || ६-६७-४८_END
BEGIN_
Knowing that the spike is going to fall on him, the mighty Angada, the chief of the
monkeys, who was skilled in war-fare, avoided it with his alacrity._END

B_6_C_70_17
BEGIN_
परिघ अभिहतसःच अपि वानर इन्द्र आत्मजस् तदा |
जानुभ्याम् पतितो भूमौ पुनर् एव उत्पपात ह || ६-७०-१८_END
BEGIN_
Then, Angada the son of king Vali, struck by the iron rod, fell down on his knees on
the earth, but again jumped up._END

B_6_C_69_28
BEGIN_
हयम् उच्चैः श्रवः प्रख्यम् श्वेतम् कनक भूषणम् |
मनो जवम् महा कायम् आरुरोह नर अन्तकः || ६-६९-२९_END
BEGIN_
Narantaka mounted a white gigantic horse, similar to Uchchaishrava (the mount of
Indra), adorned with gold ornaments and as swift as thought._END

B_6_C_59_109
BEGIN_
ततः क्रुद्धो वायुसुतो रावणं समभिद्रवत् |
आजघानोरसि क्रुद्धो वज्रकल्पेन मुष्टिना || ६-५९-११४_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, the enraged Hanuma the son of the Wind-God, rushed towards Ravana and
struck angrily on his chest with his fist, resembling a thunder-bolt._END

B_6_C_71_9
BEGIN_
कोऽसौ पर्वतसङ्काशो धनुष्मान्हरिलोचनः |
युक्ते हयसहस्रेण विशाले स्यन्दने स्थितः || ६-७१-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Who is he, resembling a mountain in size, armed with a bow, brown-eyed and seated
in a spacious chariot yoked with a thousand horses?"_END

B_6_C_67_45
BEGIN_
उत्पत्य चैनम् तरसा तलेनोरस्यताडयत् |
स तेनाभिहतः कोपात्प्रमुमोहाचलोपमः || ६-६७-४९_END
BEGIN_
Jumping up Angada struck on Kumbhakarna's chest, with the palm of his hand. Thus
beaten with anger by him, Kumbhakarna resembling a mountain, became giddy._END

B_6_C_70_18
BEGIN_
तमुत्पतन्तम् त्रिशिरास् त्रिभिर् आशी विष उपमैः |
घोरैर् हरि पतेःपुत्रम् ललाटे अभिजघान ह || ६-७०-१९_END
BEGIN_
While Angada, the son of Vali was jumping up, Trishira struck him with three
terrific and straight-going arrows on his forehead._END

B_6_C_69_29
BEGIN_
गृहीत्वा प्रासम् उक्ल आभम् विरराज नर अन्तकः |
शक्तिम् आदाय तेजस्वी गुहः शत्रुष्व् इव आहवे || ६-६९-३०_END
BEGIN_
Narantaka, holding a javelin, which was resplendent like a meteor, appeared shining,
like Guha (the offspring of Shiva) holding a spear and riding a beautiful peacock._END

B_6_C_59_110
BEGIN_
तेन मुष्टिप्रहारेण रावणो राक्षसेश्वरः |
जानुभ्यामगमद्भूमौ चचाल च पपात च || ६-५९-११५_END
BEGIN_
By that blow of the fist, Ravana the Lord of Demons reeled and fell on his knees to
the ground._END

B_6_C_71_10
BEGIN_
य एष निशितैः शूलैः सुतीक्ष्णैः प्रासतोमरैः |
अर्चिष्मद्भिर्वृतो भाति भूतैरिव महेश्वरः || ६-७१-१३_END
BEGIN_
He is shining like Lord Shiva surrounded by genii, with resplendent and sharp
spikes, with very sharply barbed javelins and lances._END

B_6_C_67_46
BEGIN_
स लब्धसम्ज्ञोऽतिबलो मुष्टिम् सम्गृइह्य राक्षसः |
अपहासेन चिक्षेप विसम्ज्ञः स पपात ह || ६-६७-५०_END
BEGIN_
Getting his consciousness, that mighty demon threw down Angada by tightening his
fist with a scorn. Angada fell down unconscious._END

B_6_C_69_30
BEGIN_
देव अन्तकः समादाय परिघम् वज्र भूषणम् |
परिगृह्य गिरिम् दोर्भ्याम् वपुर् विष्णोर् विडम्बयन् || ६-६९-३१_END
BEGIN_
Devantaka, holding a glided iron-bar, marched ahead, resembling an incarnation of
Vishnu holding Mandara-mountain in his arms._END

B_6_C_70_19
BEGIN_
ततो अन्गदम् परिक्षिप्तम् त्रिभिर् नैरृत पुम्गवैः |
हनूमान् अपि विज्नाय नीलसःच अपि प्रतस्थतुः || ६-७०-२०_END
BEGIN_
Noticing Angada being surrounded by the three demon-warriors, Hanuma and Neela went
there._END

B_6_C_59_111
BEGIN_
आस्यैश्च नेत्रैः श्रवणैः पपात रुधिरं बहु |
विघार्णमानो निश्चेष्टो रथोपस्थ उपाचिशत् || ६-५९-११६_END
BEGIN_
A lot of blood oozed out from his face, eyes, and ears. Reeled and motionless, he
became and sat in the middle of the chariot._END

B_6_C_71_11
BEGIN_
कालजिह्वाप्रकाशाभिर्य एषोऽभिविराजते |
आवृतो रथशक्तीभिर्विद्युद्भिरिव तोयदः || ६-७१-१४_END
BEGIN_
"He is shining like a lightening cloud and moving round with staffs which support
the banners of the war-chariot, appearing like tongues of the Time-Sprit."_END

B_6_C_67_47
BEGIN_
तस्मिन् प्लवगशार्दूले विसम्ज्ञे पतिते भुवि |
तचुछूलम् समुपादाय सुग्रीवमभिदुद्रुवे || ६-६७-५१_END
BEGIN_
When that Angada the foremost among the monkeys fell down unconscious on the ground,
Kumbhakarna ran towards Sugreeva, taking that spike in his hand._END

B_6_C_70_20
BEGIN_
ततसःचिक्षेप शैल अग्रम् नीलस् त्रिशिरसे तदा |
तद् रावण सुतो धीमान् बिभेद निशितैःशरैः || ६-७०-२१_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Neela then hurled a mountain-peak on Trishira. The intelligent Trishira
the son of Ravana broke it by using his sharp arrows._END

B_6_C_69_31
BEGIN_
महा पार्श्वो महा तेजा गदाम् आदाय वीर्यवान् |
विरराज गदा पाणिः कुबेर;इव सम्युगे || ६-६९-३२_END
BEGIN_
Mahaparshva, possessing a great splendour and vigour and wielding a mace in his arm
in battle, looked like Kubera the lord of wealth._END

B_6_C_59_112
BEGIN_
विसंज्ञो मूर्चितश्चासीन्न च स्थानम् समालभत् |
विसम्ज्ञम् रावणम् दृष्ट्वा समरे भीमविक्रमम् || ६-५९-११७
ऋषय् वानराश्चैव नेदुर्देवाश्च सासुराः |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Ravana despite his redoubtable strength swooned on the battle-field, sages
and monkeys began to shout in triumph as did also celestials and the demons (invisibly present on
the scene)._END

B_6_C_71_12
BEGIN_
धनूंसि चास्य सज्यानि हेमपृष्ठानि सर्वशः |
शोभयन्ति रथश्रेष्ठम् शक्रपातमिवाम्बरम् || ६-७१-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Bows adhered with golden backs in his excellent chariot are shining on all sides
like a rainbow in the sky."_END

B_6_C_67_48
BEGIN_
तमापतन्तं सम्प्रेक्ष्य कुम्भकर्णं महाबलम् |
उत्पपात तदा वीरः सुग्रीवो वानराधिपः || ६-६७-५२_END
BEGIN_
Then, seeing the mighty Kumbhakarna coming suddenly towards him, the valiant
Sugreeva, the king of the monkeys, sprang up all at once._END

B_6_C_70_21
BEGIN_
तद् बाण शत निर्भिन्नम् विदारित शिला तलम् |
सविस्फुलिन्गम् सज्वालम् निपपात गिरेःशिरः || ६-७०-२२_END
BEGIN_
That mountain-peak, broken into pieces by a multitude of arrows, with its split up
rocks, fell down with sparks of fire and flames._END

B_6_C_69_32
BEGIN_
ते प्रतस्थुर् महात्मानो बलैर् अप्रतिमैर् वृताः |
तान् गजैसः च तुरम्गैसः च रथैसः च अम्बुद निस्वनैः || ६-६९-३३
अनुजग्मुर् महात्मानो राक्षसाः प्रवर आयुधाः |_END
BEGIN_
Those distinguished demons set out from. Lanka, like the gods leaving Amaravati.
Mighty demons, holding excellent weaponry, accompanied them, mounting on elephants, horses and
chariots making sounds of rumbling clouds._END

B_6_C_59_113
BEGIN_
हनूमनथ तेजस्वी लक्ष्मणम् रावणार्दितम् || ६-५९-११८
अनयद्रघवाभ्याशं बाहुभ्याम् परिगृह्य तम् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, the courageous Hanuma lifting up Lakshmana in his arms, who had been wounded
by Ravana, brought him to Rama's presence._END

B_6_C_71_13
BEGIN_
य एष रक्षः शार्दूलो रणभूमिम् विराजयन् |
अभ्येति रथिनाम् श्रेष्ठो रथेनादित्यतेजसा || ६-७१-१६
ध्वजशृङ्गप्रतिष्ठेन राहुणाभिविराजते |
सूर्यरश्मिप्रभैर्बाणैर्दिशो दश विराजयन् || ६-७१-१७_END
BEGIN_
"That warrior of demons, the eminent of charioteers, making the battle-front to
shine, is coming in a chariot with the splendour of the sun, with arrows having gleams of
sun-beams, shining in ten directions and embellishing brilliance by an emblem of Rahu installed on
the point of his standard."_END

B_6_C_70_22
BEGIN_
स विजृम्भितम् आलोक्य हर्षाद् देव अन्तकस् तदा |
परिघेण अभिदुद्राव मारुत आत्मजम् आहवे || ६-७०-२३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Hanuma rushing with enthusiasm in the battle-front, that strong Devantaka ran
towards him with his iron rod._END

B_6_C_69_33
BEGIN_
ते विरेजुर् महात्मानो कुमाराः सूर्य वर्चसः || ६-६९-३४
किरीटिनः श्रिया जुष्टा ग्रहा दीप्ता;इव अम्बरे |_END
BEGIN_
Those mighty princes, having sun's brilliance, wearing diadems and possessed of
prosperity, shone like glowing planets in the sky._END

B_6_C_67_49
BEGIN_
स पर्वताग्रमुत्क्षिप्य समाविध्य महाकपिः |
अभिदुद्राव वेगेन कुम्भकर्णं महाबलम् || ६-६७-५३_END
BEGIN_
Uplifting and tightly holding a mountain-top, the mighty Sugreeva ran towards the
sturdy Kumbhakarna with speed._END

B_6_C_59_114
BEGIN_
वायुसूनोः सुहृत्त्वेन भक्त्या परमया च सः || ६-५९-११९
शत्रूणामप्रकम्प्योऽपि लघुत्वमगमत्कपेः |_END
BEGIN_
That Lakshmana, whom his foes were unable to move, became light for Hanuma because
of friendship and great devotion of Hanuma the son of Wind-God towards him._END

B_6_C_71_14
BEGIN_
त्रिणतं मेघनिर्ह्रादम् हेमपृष्ठमलङ्कृतम् |
शतक्रतुधनुःप्रख्यम् धनुश्चास्य विराजते || ६-७१-१८_END
BEGIN_
"His triply curved, golden backed and decorated bow, having a rumbling sound of the
cloud, is shining like a rain-bow."_END

B_6_C_70_23
BEGIN_
तम् आपतन्तम् उत्पत्य हनूमान् मारुत आत्मजः |
आजघान तदा मूर्ध्नि वज्र वेगेन मुष्टिना || ६-७०-२४_END
BEGIN_
Then, Hanuma the foremost of monkeys, while jumping up, struck on the head of
Devantaka rushing upon him with his fist equal to a thunder-bolt._END

B_6_C_67_50
BEGIN_
तमापतन्तं सम्प्रेक्ष्य कुम्भकर्णः प्लवंगमम् |
तस्थौ विवृतसर्वाङ्गो वानरेन्द्रस्य संमुखः || ६-६७-५४_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that Sugreeva coming rapidly towards him, Kumbhakarna, with all his limbs
braced, stood facing the king of monkeys._END

B_6_C_69_34
BEGIN_
प्रगृहीता बभौ तेषाम् चत्राणाम् आवलिः सिता || ६-६९-३५
शारद अभ्र प्रतीकाशाम् हंस आवलिर् इव अम्बरे |_END
BEGIN_
The row of auspicious attire worn by them, shone like an autumnal cloud or like a
flock of cranes in the sky._END

B_6_C_59_115
BEGIN_
तं समुत्सृज्य सा शक्तिः सौमित्रिम् युथि निर्जितम् || ६-५९-१२०
रावणस्य रथे तस्मिन् स्थानं पुनरुपागमत् |_END
BEGIN_
That spear leaving Lakshmana, who was overcome in the battle, returned to its
position in that chariot of Ravana._END

B_6_C_71_15
BEGIN_
सध्वजः सपताकश्च सानुकर्षो महारथः |
चतुःसादिसमायुक्तो मेघस्तनितनिस्वनः || ६-७१-१९_END
BEGIN_
"His large chariot, with its flag and emblem, with its axle-tree at the bottom, and
having the sound of a cloud's lightning, consists of four charioteers."_END

B_6_C_70_24
BEGIN_
शिरसि प्राहरद्वीरस्तदा वायुसुतो बली |
नादेनाकम्पयच्चैव राक्षसान् स महाकै || ६-७०-२५_END
BEGIN_
Then, the valiant and the strong Hanuma struck him on his head. That great ape made
the demons shake with the sound._END

B_6_C_69_35
BEGIN_
मरणम् वा अपि निश्चित्य शत्रूणाम् वा पराजयम् || ६-६९-३६
इति कृत्वा मतिम् वीरा निर्जग्मुः सम्युग अर्थिनः |_END
BEGIN_
Determined either to die or to vanquish their enemies, those valiant demons went
forward, thus making their courageous resolve, eager to fight._END

B_6_C_67_51
BEGIN_
कपिशोणितदिग्धाङ्गं भक्षयन्तं महाकपीन् |
कुम्भकर्णं स्थितं दृष्ट्वा सुग्रीवो वाक्यमब्रवीत् || ६-६७-५५_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Kumbhakarna who stood devouring the monkeys and with his body smeared with
the blood of the monkeys, Sugreeva spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_59_116
BEGIN_
रावणोऽपि महातेजाः प्राप्य सम्ज्ञां महाहवे || ६-५९-१२१
आददे निशितान् बाणान् जग्रह च महद्धनुः |_END
BEGIN_
The mighty Ravana too, regaining his consciousness in the great battle-field, picked
up his sharp arrows and the great bow._END

B_6_C_71_16
BEGIN_
विंशतिर्दश चाष्टौ च तूणीररथमास्थिताः |
कार्मुकाणि च भीमानि ज्याश्च काञ्चनपिङ्गलाः || ६-७१-२०_END
BEGIN_
Twenty quivers, ten terrific bows and eight bow-strings, golden and reddish brown in
colour, are abiding in his chariot."_END

B_6_C_70_25
BEGIN_
स मुष्टि निष्पिष्ट विकीर्ण मूर्धा |
निर्वान्त दन्त अक्षि विलम्बि जिह्वः |
देव अन्तको राक्षस राज सूनुर् |
गत असुर् उर्व्याम् सहसा पपात || ६-७०-२६_END
BEGIN_
That Devantaka, the son of Ravana, with his head crushed and broken by the blow of
the fist, with his teeth and eyes coming out and with his tongue hanging down, swiftly fell down
dead on the earth._END

B_6_C_67_52
BEGIN_
पातिताश्च त्वया वीराः कृतं कर्म सुदुष्करम् |
भक्षितानि च सैन्यानि प्राप्तं ते परमम् यशः || ६-६७-५६_END
BEGIN_
"You struck down eminent monkeys. You have done a very difficult act. You have
devoured the armies. You obtained a great fame."_END

B_6_C_69_36
BEGIN_
जगर्जुसः च प्रणेदुसः च चिक्षिपुसः च अपि सायकान् || ६-६९-३७
जहृषुसः च महात्मानो निर्यान्तो युद्ध दुर्मदाः |_END
BEGIN_
Those mighty demons set out with a mad conception of war, roared and made a
reverberatory sound, took up arrows and dispatched them._END

B_6_C_71_17
BEGIN_
द्वौ च खड्गौ रथगतौ पार्श्वस्थौ पार्श्वशोभिनौ |
चतुर्हस्तत्सरुचितौ व्यक्तहस्तदशायतौ || ६-७१-२१_END
BEGIN_
"On that chariot are hanging two swords, clearly measuring ten cubits in length and
provided with measuring four cubits, casting their splendour on his two sides."_END

B_6_C_59_117
BEGIN_
अश्वस्तश्च विशल्यश्च लक्ष्मणः शत्रुसूदनः || ६-५९-१२२
विष्णोर्भागममीमांस्यमात्मानम् प्रत्यनुस्मरन् |_END
BEGIN_
Healed and free from that lance, Lakshmana the annihilator of his foes, recollected
of himself as a part of the inconceivable Vishnu the Lord of Preservation._END

B_6_C_70_26
BEGIN_
तस्मिन् हते राक्षस योध मुख्ये |
महा बले सम्यति देव शत्रौ |
क्रुद्धस् त्रिमूर्धा निशित अग्रम् उग्रम् |
ववर्ष नील उरसि बाण वर्षम् || ६-७०-२७_END
BEGIN_
When that Devantaka the mighty chief of demon-warriors and the enemy of celestials
was killed in battle, the enraged Trishira showered a terrible rain of sharp-pointed arrows on
Neela's chest._END

B_6_C_69_37
BEGIN_
क्ष्वेडित आस्फोट निनदैः संचचाल इव मेदिनी || ६-६९-३८
रक्षसाम् सिम्ह नादैसः च पुस्फोट इव तदा अम्बरम् |_END
BEGIN_
The earth trembled as it were, by their battle-cries and clapping of arms. The sky
appeared breached, by the lion's roars of the demons._END

B_6_C_67_53
BEGIN_
त्यज तद्वानरानीकं प्राकृतैः किम् करिष्यसि |
सहस्वैकं निपातं मे पर्वतस्यास्य राक्षस || ६-६७-५७_END
BEGIN_
"Leave that army of monkeys. What will you do with these common beings? O demon! You
bear up against the falling of this one mountain being hurled by me."_END

B_6_C_71_18
BEGIN_
रक्तकण्ठगुणो धीरो महापर्वतसंनिभः |
कालः कालमहावक्त्रो मेघस्थ इव भास्करः || ६-७१-२२_END
BEGIN_
"This brave warrior, with a red garland adorning his neck, resembling a large
mountain black in colour and having a month as large as Death, looks like the sun veiled by a
cloud."_END

B_6_C_59_118
BEGIN_
निपातितमहावीराम् वानराणाम् महाचमूम् || ६-५९-१२३
राघवस्तु रणे दृष्ट्वा रावणम् समभिद्रवत् |_END
BEGIN_
Beholding the great army of monkeys whose great warriors were overthrown on the
battle-field, Rama rushed on Ravana._END

B_6_C_70_27
BEGIN_
महोदरस्तु सम्क्रुद्धः कुञ्जरं पर्वतोपमम् |
भूयः समधिरुह्यशु मन्दरं रश्मिमानिव || ६-७०-२८
ततो बाणमयं वर्षं नीलस्योपर्यपातयत् |
गिरौ वर्षं तडिच्चक्रम् स गर्जन्निव तोयदः || ६-७०-२९_END
BEGIN_
Again mounting an elephant resembling a mountain, as the sun mounting Mandara
Mountain, that enraged Mahodara on his part, caused rain of arrows to fall quickly on Neela, like
rumbling cloud with a circle of lightning, showers rain on a mountain._END

B_6_C_69_38
BEGIN_
ते अभिनिष्क्रम्य मुदिता राक्षस इन्द्रा महा बलाः || ६-६९-३९
ददृशुर् वानर अनीकम् समुद्यत शिला नगम् |_END
BEGIN_
Those mighty leaders of demons, having set out, were delighted to see the army of
monkeys having uplifted rocks as their weapons._END

B_6_C_67_54
BEGIN_
तद्वाक्यम् हरिराजस्य सत्त्वधैर्यसमन्वितम् |
श्रुत्वा राक्षसशार्दूलः कुम्भकर्णोऽब्रवीद्वचः || ६-६७-५८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words, endowed with strength and courage, spoken by Sugreeva,
Kumbhakarna, the foremost of demons, spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_71_19
BEGIN_
काञ्चनाङ्गदनद्धाभ्यां भुजाभ्यामेष शोभते |
शृङ्गाभ्यामिव तुङ्गाभ्याम् हिमवान्पर्वतोत्तमः || ६-७१-२३_END
BEGIN_
"With his arms adorned with gold armlets, he shines like the Himalaya, the highest
mountain with its two lofty peaks."_END

B_6_C_70_28
BEGIN_
ततः शरौघैरभिवर्ष्यमाणो |
विभिन्न गात्रःकपि सैन्य पालः |
नीलो बभूव अथ विसृष्ट गात्रो |
विष्टम्भितस् तेन महा बलेन || ६-७०-३०_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, by the rain of a multitude of arrows, the body of Neela the commander of
the army of monkeys became blown up. Thus the mighty Mahodara then made his loosened limbs
paralyzed._END

B_6_C_59_119
BEGIN_
अथैनमुपसम्गम्य हनूमान्वाक्यमब्रवीत् || ६-५९-१२४
मम पृष्ठों समारुह्य राक्षसम् शास्तुमर्हसि |
विष्णुर्यथा गरुत्मन्तमारुह्यमरवैरिणम् || ६-५९-१२५_END
BEGIN_
Meanwhile, Hanuma approaching Rama spoke the following words: "You have to punish
the demon by climbing my back, as Vishnu on Garuda in order to fight with the Enemy of Gods."_END

B_6_C_69_39
BEGIN_
हरयो अपि महात्मानो ददृशुर् नैरृतम् बलम् || ६-६९-४०
हस्ति अश्व रथ सम्बाधम् किन्किणी शत नादितम् |
नील जीमूत सम्काशम् समुद्यत महा आयुधम् || ६-६९-४१
दीप्त अनल रवि प्रख्यैर् नैरृतैः सर्वतो वृतम् |_END
BEGIN_
The mighty monkeys too saw that army of demons, which appeared like a black cloud
but blazing like fire and sun on all sides, abounding with elephants, horses and chariots, made to
resound with hundreds of small bells and wielding well-raised great weaponry._END

B_6_C_71_20
BEGIN_
कुण्डलाभ्याम् तु यस्यैतद्भाति वक्त्रम् शुभेक्षणम् |
पुनर्वस्वन्तरगतं पूर्णबिम्बमिवैन्दवम् || ६-७१-२४_END
BEGIN_
"His awfully dreadful face, with two ear-rings, is shining like a full moon
appearing between the two stars constituting the constellation, Punnarvasu."_END

B_6_C_67_55
BEGIN_
प्रजापतेस्तु पौत्रस्त्वम् तथैवर्क्षरजःसुतः |
धृतिपौरुषसम्पन्नः कस्माद्गर्जसि वानर || ६-६७-५९_END
BEGIN_
"O monkey! You are the grandson of Lord Brahma and even the son of Riksharaja
(sprung from the yawn of Brahma) endowed with firmness and valour. Why do you roar?"_END

B_6_C_72_0
BEGIN_
अतिकायं हतं श्रुत्वा लक्ष्मणेन महात्मना |
उद्वेगमगमद्राजा वचनम् चेदमब्रवीत् || ६-७१-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Atikaya having been killed in the hands of the great-souled Lakshmana,
Ravana was worried and spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_70_29
BEGIN_
ततस् तु नीलःप्रतिलभ्य सम्ज्नाम् |
शैलम् समुत्पाट्य सवृक्ष षण्डम् |
ततःसमुत्पत्य भृश उग्र वेगो |
महा उदरम् तेन जघान मूर्ध्नि || ६-७०-३१_END
BEGIN_
After regaining consciousness, Neela uplifted a mountain consisting of a number of
trees and then jumping up with a great speed, struck with it on the head of Mahodara._END

B_6_C_59_120
BEGIN_
तच्छ्रुत्वा रागवो वाक्यम् वायुपुत्रेण भाषितम् |
अथारुरोह सहसा हनूमन्तं महाकपिम् || ६-५९-१२६
रथस्थम् रावणम् सम्ख्ये ददर्श मनुजाधिपः |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words spoken by Hanuma the son of Wind-God, Rama soon after mounted
the great monkey, Hanuma. Rama the Lord of men then saw Ravana standing in his chariot in the
battle-field._END

B_6_C_69_40
BEGIN_
तद् दृष्ट्वा बलम् आयान्तम् लब्ध लक्ष्याः प्लवम् गमाः || ६-६९-४२
समुद्यत महा शैलाः सम्प्रणेदुर् मुहुर् मुहुः |
अमृष्यमाणा रक्षांसि प्रतिनर्दन्त वान्राः || ६-६९-४३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that army which arrived and as they got the target for their fight, the
monkeys, having the great mountains uplifted, roared again and again. The monkeys, not tolerating
the demons, thus shouted, standing opposite to them._END

B_6_C_67_56
BEGIN_
स कुम्भकर्णस्य वचो निशम्य |
व्याविध्य शैलम् सहसा मुमोच |
तेनाजघानोरसि कुम्भकर्णं |
शैलेन वज्राशनिसंनिभेन || ६-६७-६०_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Kumbhakarna, Sugreeva, firmly holding the mountain, hurled it
quickly on him. He struck Kumbhakarna's chest by that mountain, which was as strong enough as
Indra's thunderbolt._END

B_6_C_71_21
BEGIN_
आचक्ष्व मे महाबाहो त्वमेनम् राक्षसोत्तमम् |
यम् दृष्ट्वा वानराः सर्वे भयार्ता विद्रूता दिशः || ६-७१-२५_END
BEGIN_
"O the long armed! Tell me who this foremost of demons is! On seeing him all the
monkeys, afflicted with fear, are running away in different directions."_END

B_6_C_72_1
BEGIN_
धूम्राक्षः परमामर्षी सर्वशस्त्रभृतां वरः |
अकम्पनः प्रहस्तश्च कुम्भकर्णस्त्तथैव च || ६-७१-२
एते महाबला वीरा राक्षसा युद्धकाङिक्षणः |
जेतारः परसैन्यानां परैर्नित्यापराजिताः || ६-७१-३
ससैन्यास्ते हता वीरा रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा |
राक्षसाः सुमहाकाया नानाशस्त्रविशारदाः || ६-७१-४
अन्ये च बहवः शूरा महात्मानो निपातिताः |_END
BEGIN_
"Dhumraksha, who was greatly impatient Akampana who was excellent among all wielders
of weapons, Prahasta and Kumbhakarna were killed by Rama, who was unwearied in battle. The mighty
and valiant demons longing for battle, who conquer the adversaries, who was never defeated in
battle by the enemies they along with their enemies were killed. Many other mighty warriors._END

B_6_C_59_121
BEGIN_
तमालोक्य महातेजाः प्रदुद्राव स रावणम् || ६-५९-१२७
वैरोचनमिव क्रुद्धो विष्णुरभ्युद्यतायुधः |_END
BEGIN_
The mighty Rama became angry on seeing him and rushed upon that Ravana like unto
Vishnu with his uplifted mace rushed upon Virochana._END

B_6_C_70_30
BEGIN_
ततः स शैल अभिनिपात भग्नो |
महा उदरस् तेन सह द्विपेन |
विपोथितो भूमि तले गत असुः |
पपात वर्ज अभिहतो यथा अद्रिः || ६-७०-३२_END
BEGIN_
That Mahodara, then shattered by the fall of that mountain and crushed by that large
elephant too, lost his life and fell down on the earth like a mountain struck by a thunderbolt._END

B_6_C_69_41
BEGIN_
ततः समुद्घुष्ट रवम् निशम्य |
रक्षो गणा वानर यूथपानाम् |
अमृष्यमाणाः पर हर्षम् उग्रम् |
महा बला भीमतरम् विनेदुः || ६-६९-४४_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the enhanced noise of the leaders of the army of monkeys, the troops of
demons who were terrible in might, not tolerating the rejoice of the enemies, then made a noise
more terribly._END

B_6_C_71_22
BEGIN_
स पृष्ठो राजपुत्रेण रामेणामिततेजसा |
आचचक्षे महातेजा राघवाय विभीषणः || ६-७१-२६_END
BEGIN_
Thus asked by Rama, the prince having an unlimited splendour, that Vibhishana of
great brilliance, replied to Rama as follows:_END

B_6_C_72_2
BEGIN_
प्रख्यातबलवीर्येण पुत्रेणेन्द्रजिता मम || ६-७१-५
तौ भ्रातरौ तदा बद्धौ घोरैर्दत्तवरैः शरैः |_END
BEGIN_
"That day, Indrajit, my son, whose strength and prowess are renowned, bound both
Rama and Lakshmana, the brothers with terrific arrows, on which boons had been conferred."_END

B_6_C_67_57
BEGIN_
तच्छैलशृङ्गं सहसा विकीर्णं |
भुजान्तरे तस्य तदा विशाले |
ततो विषेदुः सहसा प्लवम्गा |
रक्षोगणाश्चापि मुदा विनेदुः || ६-६७-६१_END
BEGIN_
Soon after falling on his broad chest, that mountain was crushed to pieces. Then,
the monkeys were suddenly distressed. The troops of demons roared with rejoice._END

B_6_C_59_122
BEGIN_
ज्याशब्दमकरोत्तीव्रम् वज्रनिष्पेषनिष्ठुरम् || ६-५९-१२८
गिरा गम्भीरया रामो राक्षसेन्द्रमुवाच ह |_END
BEGIN_
Rama made a sound in drawing the cord of his bow and like unto the roll of thunder,
spoke in a deep voice to Ravana as follows:_END

B_6_C_70_31
BEGIN_
पितृव्यम् निहतम् दृष्ट्वा त्रिशिरासःचापम् आददे |
