हनूमन्तम् च सम्क्रुद्धो विव्याध निशितैःशरैः || ६-७०-३३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Mahodara his young paternal uncle killed. Trishira was enraged seized hold of
his bow and struck Hanuma with sharp arrows._END

B_6_C_69_42
BEGIN_
ते राक्षस बलम् घोरम् प्रविश्य हरि यूथपाः |
विचेरुर् उद्यतैः शैलैर् नगाः शिखरिणो यथा || ६-६९-४५_END
BEGIN_
Entering that terrific army of demons, those monkey-leaders, with their raised
mountains, roamed about like mountains with their peaks._END

B_6_C_71_23
BEGIN_
दशग्रीवो महातेजा राजा वैश्रवणानुजः |
भीमकर्मा महोत्साहो रावणो राक्षसाधिपः || ६-७१-२७_END
BEGIN_
"The ten-necked king Ravana, having great brilliance, the brother of Kubera the lord
of wealth, doing terrific deeds and possessing a great power, is the lord of demons."_END

B_6_C_72_3
BEGIN_
यन्न शक्यम् सुरैः सर्वैरसुरैर्वा महाबलैः || ६-७१-६
मोक्तुम् तद् बन्धनम् घोरं यक्षगन्धर्वपन्नगैः |
तन्न जाने प्रभावैर्वा मायया मोहनेन वा || ६-७१-७
शरबन्धाद्विमुक्तौ तौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ |_END
BEGIN_
"That terrific bind of arrow cannot be released by any celestial or a mighty demon
or by Yakshas the supernatural beings or Gandharvas the celestial musicians or Pannagas the
serpent-demons. Rama and Lakshmana, the two brothers were released from that tie of arrows either
by their power or by their sorcery or by their marvel I do not know that."_END

B_6_C_59_123
BEGIN_
तिष्ठ तिष्ठ मम त्वम् हि कृत्वा विप्रियमीदृशम् || ६-५९-१२९
क्व नु राक्षसशार्दूल गत्वा मोक्षमवाप्स्यसि |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Tiger among the Demons! Stay, stay! Having evoked such a displeasure to me,
where will you flee and get an abandonment?"_END

B_6_C_67_58
BEGIN_
स शैलशृङ्गाभिहतश् चुकोप |
ननाद कोपाच्च विवृत्य वक्त्रम् |
व्याविध्य शूलम् च तडित्प्रकाशं |
चिक्षेप हर्यृक्षपतेर्वधाय || ६-६७-६२_END
BEGIN_
Struck by the mountain-top, that Kumbhakarna was enraged and roared with his mouth
wide open with anger. Holding firmly the spike, which was emitting a flash of lightning, he hurled
it to kill Sugreeva, the king of monkeys and bears._END

B_6_C_69_43
BEGIN_
केचिद् आकाशम् आविश्य केचिद् उर्व्याम् प्लवम् गमाः |
रक्षः सैन्येषु सम्क्रुद्धासः चेरुर् द्रुम शिला आयुधाः || ६-६९-४६_END
BEGIN_
Some monkeys entering the sky and some others enraged, staying on earth with trees
and rocks as their weapons, wandered among the army of demons._END

B_6_C_70_32
BEGIN_
स वायुसूनुः कुपितश्चिक्षेप शिखरं गिरेः |
त्रिशिरास्तच्छरैस्तीक्ष्णैर्बिभेद बहुधा बली || ६-७०-३४_END
BEGIN_
While that enraged Hanuma hurled a mountain-peak, the strong Trishira broke it into
several pieces with his sharp arrows._END

B_6_C_71_24
BEGIN_
तस्यासीद्वीर्यवान्पुत्रो रावणप्रतिमो रणे |
वृद्धसेवी श्रुतधरः सर्वास्त्रविदुषाम् वरः || ६-७१-२८_END
BEGIN_
"To him, there is a valiant son, equal to Ravana in combat, who serves elders,
holding that which is heard from them and skilled in the use of weaponry."_END

B_6_C_72_4
BEGIN_
ये योधा निर्गताह् शूरा राक्षसा मम शासनात् ६-७१-८
ते सर्वे निहता युद्धे वानरैः सुमहाबलैः |_END
BEGIN_
"All of those valiant demon-warriors set out for battle, at my command, were killed
by those exceptionally mighty monkeys."_END

B_6_C_59_124
BEGIN_
यदीन्द्रवैवस्वतभास्करान्वा |
स्वयमुभवैश्वानरशंकरान्वा |
गमिष्यसि त्वं दशधा दिशो वा |
तथापि मे नाद्य गतो विमोक्ष्यसे || ६-५९-१३०_END
BEGIN_
"Even if you seek refuge in the region of Indra the Lord of celestials or Yama the
Lord of Death or the Sun or Brahma the Lord of Creation or Agni the Lord of Fire or Shiva the Lord
of dissolution or in the ten regions, even in those abodes you will elude me from now on."_END

B_6_C_67_59
BEGIN_
तत्कुम्भकर्णस्य भुजप्रविद्धं |
शूलम् शितम् काञ्चन दामजुष्टम् |
क्षिप्रम् समुत्पत्य निगृह्य दोर्भ्यां |
बभञ्ज वेगेन सुतोऽनिलस्य || ६-६७-६३_END
BEGIN_
Hanuma, jumping up and holding with his arms that sharp spike, furnished with golden
wreaths, and propelled by Kumbhakarna's arms, wreaths, and smashed it rapidly._END

B_6_C_69_44
BEGIN_
द्रुमांस्च विपुलस्कन्धान् गृह्य वानरपुम्गवाः |
तद्युद्धमभवद्घोरं रक्षोवानरसम्कुलम् || ६-६९-४७_END
BEGIN_
The foremost among the monkeys, holding trees, having extensive branches, roamed
about in the battle-field. That battle-front, filled with demons and monkeys, looked terrific._END

B_6_C_70_33
BEGIN_
तद्व्यर्थम् शिखरं दृष्ट्वा द्रुमवर्षं तदा कपिः |
विससर्ज रणे तस्मिन् रावणस्य सुतं प्रति || ६-७०-३५_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that mountain-peak becoming useless, Hanuma then hurled a volley of trees
towards Trishira in that battle-field._END

B_6_C_71_25
BEGIN_
अश्वपृष्ठे रथे नागे खड्गे धनुषि कर्षणे |
भेदे सान्त्वे च दाने च नये मन्त्रे च संमतः || ६-७१-२९_END
BEGIN_
"He is respected for his counsel, for his rides on the backs of horses and
elephants, for his drawing out of the sword and the bow, for his strategy winning over to his side
by sowing dissention negotiation and bribery and for his steering capacity of an army._END

B_6_C_72_5
BEGIN_
तं न पश्याम्यहम् युद्धे यो.द्य रामं सलक्ष्मणम् ६-७१-९
नाशयेत्सबलम् वीरं ससुग्रीवविभीषणम् |_END
BEGIN_
"I do not find any demon, who can destroy the valiant Rama along with Lakshmana,
Sugreeva and Vibhishana accompanied by their army in battle now."_END

B_6_C_59_125
BEGIN_
यश्चैष शक्त्या निहतस्त्वयाद्य |
गच्छन्विषादं सहसाभ्युपेत्य |
स एष रक्षोगणराज मृत्युः |
सपुत्रपौत्रस्य तवाद्य युद्धे || ६-५९-१३१_END
BEGIN_
"O, Ravana the King of Demons! The one who was struck by the spear, fell swooping
this day only to recover consciousness immediately, will now, assuming the form of death, claim
you, your sons and grandsons in battle."_END

B_6_C_67_60
BEGIN_
कृतं भारसहस्रस्य शूलम् कालायसं महत् |
बभञ्ज जनौमारोप्य प्रहृष्टः प्लवगर्षभः || ६-६७-६४_END
BEGIN_
Then, the rejoiced Hanuma, placing on his knee, that large spike made of iron
weighing twenty thousand Tulas, broke it._END

B_6_C_70_34
BEGIN_
तमापतन्तमाकाशे द्रुमवर्षं प्रतापवान् |
त्रिशिरा निशितैर्बाणैश्चिच्छेद च ननाद च || ६-७०-३६_END
BEGIN_
The valiant Trishira chopped off that volley of trees descending on him, with his
sharp arrows in the sky itself and roared aloud._END

B_6_C_69_45
BEGIN_
ते पादप शिला शैलैसः चक्रुर् वृष्टिम् अनुत्तमाम् |
बाण ओघैर् वार्यमाणासः च हरयो भीम विक्रमाः || ६-६९-४८_END
BEGIN_
Those monkeys, of terrific prowess, though impeded by a flood of arrows, initiated a
matchless rain of trees, rocks and mountains._END

B_6_C_72_6
BEGIN_
अहो सुबलवान् रामो महदस्त्रबलम् च वै || ६-७१-१०
यस्य विक्रममासाद्य राक्षसा निधनम् गताः |_END
BEGIN_
"By Rama's valour, the demons were destroyed. Alas! How great is Rama's strength!
How great is the power of his arrow!"_END

B_6_C_59_126
BEGIN_
एतेन चात्यद्भुतदर्शनानि |
शरैर्जनस्थानकृतालयानि |
चतुर्दशान्यात्तवरायुधानि |
रक्षः सहस्राणि निषूदितानि || ६-५९-१३२_END
BEGIN_
"Here is he, under whose blows of arrows, fourteen thousand demons of terrible form
perished, who had established themselves in Janasthana and were furnished with excellent
weapons."_END

B_6_C_71_26
BEGIN_
यस्य बाहुम् समाश्रित्य लङ्का भवति निर्भया |
तनयम् धान्यमालिन्या अतिकायमिमम् विदुः || ६-७१-३०_END
BEGIN_
"He is Atikaya, the son of Dhanyamali. Lanka is feeling fearless, by resting on his
arm."_END

B_6_C_67_61
BEGIN_
शूलम् भग्नम् हनुमता दृष्ट्वा वानरवाहिनी |
हृष्टा ननाद बहुशः सर्वतश्चापि दुद्रुवे || ६-६७-६५_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Hanuma breaking the spike, that army of monkeys was rejoiced, roared several
times and came back quickly from all quarters._END

B_6_C_70_35
BEGIN_
हनूमांस् तु समुत्पत्य हयांस् त्रिशिरसस् तदा |
विददार नखैःक्रुद्धो गज इन्द्रम् मृग राड् इव || ६-७०-३७_END
BEGIN_
Then, the enraged Hanuma on his part, bouncing up, tore asunder with his nails,
Trishira's horse, as a lion tears asunder a large elephant._END

B_6_C_69_46
BEGIN_
सिम्ह नादान् विनेदुसः च रणे राक्षस वानराः |
शिलाभिसः चूर्णयाम् आसुर् यातु धानान् प्लवम् गमाः || ६-६९-४९_END
BEGIN_
In the battle, the demons and the monkeys made a noise of lion's roars. The monkeys
pounded the demons with rocks._END

B_6_C_72_7
BEGIN_
अप्रमत्तेश्च सर्वत्रा गुल्मै रक्ष्या पुरी त्वियम् || ६-७१-११
अशोकवनिका चैव यत्र सीताभिरक्ष्यते |_END
BEGIN_
"Some regiments of the army have to protect this City and even Ashoka garden where
Seetha is being guarded, vigilantly on all sides."_END

B_6_C_71_27
BEGIN_
एतेनाराधितो ब्रह्मा तपसा भावितात्मना |
अस्त्राणि चाप्यवाप्तानि रिपवश्च पराजिताः || ६-७१-३१_END
BEGIN_
"He, who purified his soul by meditating on the universal soul, worshipped Brahma
the lord of creation, obtained missiles too and conquered the enemies._END

B_6_C_67_62
BEGIN_
बभूवाथ परित्रस्तो राक्षसो विमुखोऽभवत् |
सिम्हनादम् च ते चक्रुः प्रहृष्टा वनगोचराः || ६-६७-६६
मारुतिं पूजयांचक्रुर्दृष्ट्वा शूलम् तथागतम् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, the frightened Kumbhakarna became down-cast. Those monkeys were rejoiced and
made a lion's roar. Seeing the fate of spike in such a broken condition, they adored Hanuma._END

B_6_C_59_127
BEGIN_
राघवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा राक्षसेन्द्रो महाबलः |
वायुपुत्रम् महावेगम् वहन्तं राघवं रणे || ६-५९-१३३
रोषेण महताविष्टः पूर्ववैरमनुस्मरन् |
आजघान शरैर्दीपैः कालानलशिखोपमैः || ६-५९-१३४_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Rama, Ravana of great strength, full of rage and recollecting
his former hostility struck with flaming arrows resembling the tongues of the Fire of Dissolution,
on Hanuman the son of Wind-God, who with extreme velocity, was bearing Rama in the
battle-field._END

B_6_C_70_36
BEGIN_
अथ शक्तिम् समादाय काल रात्रिम् इव अन्तकः |
चिक्षेप अनिल पुत्राय त्रिशिरा रावण आत्मजः || ६-७०-३८_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Trishira the son of Ravana seizing hold of a spear, as Yama the lord of
death takes in his service Kalaratri, a night of all-destroying time, hurled it on Hanuma._END

B_6_C_69_47
BEGIN_
निजघ्नुः सम्युगे क्रुद्धाः कवच आभरण आवृतान् |
केचिद् रथ गतान् वीरान् गज वाजि गतान् अपि || ६-६९-५०_END
BEGIN_
The enraged monkeys killed demons wearing armours and ornaments. Some killed valiant
demons, sitting or standing in chariots and also those demons mounted on elephants and horses._END

B_6_C_71_28
BEGIN_
सुरासुरैरवध्यत्वम् दत्तमस्मै स्वयम्भुवा |
एतच्च कवचम् दिव्यम् रथश्चैषोऽर्कभास्करः || ६-७१-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Brahma, the lord of creation, granted a boon, exempting him from death at the hands
of celestials and demons as also this wonderful armour and the chariot shining like the sun."_END

B_6_C_72_8
BEGIN_
निष्क्रमो वा प्रवेशो वा ज्ञात्व्यः सर्वदैव नः || ६-७१-१२
यत्र यत्र भवेद्गुल्मस्तत्र तत्र पुनः पुनः |_END
BEGIN_
"We should know the locations of army-regiments and also the places where persons
are exiting and entering at all times, again and again._END

B_6_C_59_128
BEGIN_
राक्षसेनाहवे तस्य ताडितस्यापि सायकैः |
स्वभावतेजोयुक्तस्य भूयस्तेजोऽभ्यवर्धत || ६-५९-१३५_END
BEGIN_
Even when struck by that demon with his arrows in the battle, the vigour of Hanuman,
who was endowed with native strength, increased still further._END

B_6_C_67_63
BEGIN_
स तत्तदा भग्नमवेक्ष्य शूलं |
चुकोप रक्षोऽधिपतिर्महात्मा |
उत्पाट्य लङ्कामलयात्स शृङ्गं |
जघान सुग्रीवमुपेत्य तेन || ६-६७-६७_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that spike broken in that way, that mighty Kumbhakarna was enraged. Uprooting
a crest from Malaya mountain standing in the vicinity of Lanka and approaching Sugreeva, he struck
him with it._END

B_6_C_70_37
BEGIN_
दिवि क्षिप्ताम् इव उल्काम् ताम् शक्तिम् क्षिप्ताम् असम्गताम् |
गृहीत्वा हरि शार्दूलो बभन्ज च ननाद च || ६-७०-३९_END
BEGIN_
Capturing that spear coming like a meteor in the sky, Hanuma the foremost of monkeys
broke it, even without its descending on him and roared too._END

B_6_C_69_48
BEGIN_
निजघ्नुः सहसा आप्लुत्य यातु धानान् प्लवम् गमाः |
शैल शृन्ग निपातैसः च मुष्टिभिर् वान्त लोचनाः || ६-६९-५१
चेलुः पेतुसः च नेदुसः च तत्र राक्षस पुम्गवाः |_END
BEGIN_
Valiant monkeys struck the demons vehemently. Those foremost of demons trembled, as
their bodies were attacked by mountain-peaks and blows of fists, down and roared._END

B_6_C_71_29
BEGIN_
एतेन शतशो देवा दानवाश्च पराजिताः |
रक्षितानि च रक्षामि यक्षाश्चापि निषूदिताः || ६-७१-३३_END
BEGIN_
"He conquered the celestials and the ogres several times, destroyed Yakshas the
supernatural beings and defended the demons."_END

B_6_C_72_9
BEGIN_
सर्वतश्चापि तिष्ठध्वम् स्वैः स्वैः परिवृता बलैः || ६-७१-१३
द्रष्टव्यम् च पदम् तेषाम् वानराणां निशाचराः |_END
BEGIN_
"O demons! Stay on all sides with your respective armies. The various positioning of
those monkeys are to be watched."_END

B_6_C_59_129
BEGIN_
ततो रामो महातेजा रावणेन कृतव्रणम् |
दृष्ट्वा प्लवगशार्दूलं क्रोधस्य वशमेयुवान् || ६-५९-१३६_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, seeing Hanuman the Tiger among the monkeys getting wounded by Ravana,
Rama was transported with anger._END

B_6_C_67_64
BEGIN_
स शैलशृङ्गाभिहतो विसम्ज्ञः |
पपात भूमौ युधि वानरेन्द्रः |
तं प्रेक्ष्य भूमौ पतितम् विसम्ज्ञं |
नेदुः प्रहृष्टा युधि यातुधानाः || ६-६७-६८_END
BEGIN_
Struck by the mountain-top in battle, that Sugreeva fell unconscious on the ground.
Seeing him falling unconscious on the ground in battle, the demons wee exceedingly pleased and
cried out loudly._END

B_6_C_70_38
BEGIN_
ताम् दृष्ट्वा घोर सम्काशाम् शक्तिम् भग्नाम् हनूमता |
प्रहृष्टा वानर गणा विनेदुर् जलदा;इव || ६-७०-४०_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that spear of a terrific form broken up by Hanuma, the monkey-troops were
very much delighted and roared aloud like rumbling clouds._END

B_6_C_69_49
BEGIN_
राक्षसाश्च शरैस्तीक्ष्णैर्बभिदुः कपिकुञ्जरान् |
शूलामुद्गरखड्गैश्च जघ्नुः प्रासैश्च शक्तिभिः || ६-६९-५२_END
BEGIN_
Those demons also pierced the foremost of monkeys with sharp arrows, striking them
with spears mallets, swords, javelins and lances._END

B_6_C_71_30
BEGIN_
वज्रम् विष्टम्भितं येन बाणैरिन्द्रस्य धीमतः |
पाशः सलिलराजस्य युद्धे प्रतिहतस्तथा || ६-७१-३४
एषोऽतिकायो बलवान् राक्षसानामथर्षभः |
स रावणस्य सुतो धीमान् देवदनव दर्पहा || ६-७१-३५_END
BEGIN_
"He is Atikaya, who paralyzed the thunderbolt of the intelligent Indra with his
arrows. He struck down the noose of Varuna, the seizer of transgressors. This wise Ravana's son,
who is strong and the foremost of demons took off the pride of celestials and ogres."_END

B_6_C_59_130
BEGIN_
तस्याभिसम्क्रम्य रथम् सचक्रम् |
साश्वध्वजच्छत्रमहापताकम् |
ससारथिम् साशनिशूलखड्गम् |
रामः प्रचिच्छेद शितैः शराग्रैः || ६-५९-१३७_END
BEGIN_
Going near his chariot with his sharp and pointed arrows, Rama shattered it along
with its wheels, horses, banner, canopy, great standard, charioteer, darts, spears and swords._END

B_6_C_72_10
BEGIN_
प्रदोषे वार्धरात्रे वा प्रत्यूषे वापि सर्वशः || ६-७१-१४
नावज्ञा तत्र कर्तव्या वानरेषु कदाचन |
द्विषतां बलमुद्युक्तमापतत्किं स्थितं तथा || ६-७१-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Indifference should not be shown to monkeys in any way at any time, either at
evening or at midnight or at dawn. You have watch whether the army of adversaries is fervently
active or advancing or staying where it was."_END

B_6_C_67_65
BEGIN_
तमभ्युपेत्याद्भुतघोरवीर्यं |
स कुम्भकर्णो युधि वानरेन्द्रम् |
जहार सुग्रीवमभिप्रगृह्य |
यथानिलो मेघमतिप्रचण्डः || ६-६७-६९_END
BEGIN_
Seizing hold of that Sugreeva having wonderful and terrific prowess in battle, that
Kumbhakarna took him away, as an impetuous wind takes away a cloud._END

B_6_C_70_39
BEGIN_
ततःखड्गम् समुद्यम्य त्रिशिरा राक्षस उत्तमः |
निचखान तदा रोषाद् वानर इन्द्रस्य वक्षसि || ६-७०-४१_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, lifting up a sword, Trishira the foremost of demons them dug it into
Hanuma's breast._END

B_6_C_69_50
BEGIN_
अन्योन्यम् पातयामासुः परस्परजयैषिण || ६-६९-५३
रिपुशोणितदिग्धाङ्गास्त्र वानरराक्षसाः |_END
BEGIN_
There, the monkeys and demons having their limbs smeared with the blood of their
foes, mowed each other with a desire to conquer each other._END

B_6_C_71_31
BEGIN_
तदस्मिन् क्रियताम् यत्नः क्षिप्रं पुरुषपुङ्गव |
पुरा वानरसैन्यानि क्षयं नयति सायकैः || ६-७१-३६_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama, the foremost of men! Therefore let the effort to destroy him be made
quickly. Otherwise shortly, he will bring in destruction for our army of monkeys, with his
arrows."_END

B_6_C_59_131
BEGIN_
अथेन्द्रशत्रुम् तरसा जघान |
बाणेन वज्राशनिसम्निभेन |
भुजान्तरे व्यूढसुजातरूपे |
वज्रेण मेरुं भगवानिवेन्द्रः || ६-५९-१३८_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, with a great force, Rama struck with his shaft shining brightly as the
thunderbolt, that Ravana, the enemy of Indra, in his broad and beautiful chest, even as the mighty
Indra would strike the Mount Meru with his thunderbolt._END

B_6_C_72_11
BEGIN_
ततस्ते राक्षसाह् सर्वे श्रुत्वा लङ्काधिपस्य तत् |
वचनं सर्वमातिष्ठन् यथावत्तु महाबलाः || ६-७१-१६_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Ravana, all the mighty demons then precisely carried it out
forthwith in its totality._END

B_6_C_67_66
BEGIN_
स तं महामेघनिकाशरूपम् |
उत्पाट्य गच्छन्युधि कुम्भकर्णः |
रराज मेरुप्रतिमानरूपो |
मेरुर्यथात्युच्छ्रितघोरशृङ्गः || ६-६७-७०_END
BEGIN_
Lifting up Sugreeva appearing like a huge cloud in the battle-field and marching
forward, Kumbhakarna shone like Mount Meru, distinguished by its very high and formidable peak._END

B_6_C_70_40
BEGIN_
खड्ग प्रहार अभिहतो हनूमान् मारुत आत्मजः |
आजघान त्रिमूर्धानम् तलेन उरसि वीर्यवान् || ६-७०-४२_END
BEGIN_
Hurt by the thrust of the sword, the valiant Hanuma the son of wind-god, struck
Trishira on his breast, with his palm._END

B_6_C_69_51
BEGIN_
ततः शैलैसः च खड्गैसः च विसृष्टैर् हरि राक्षसैः || ६-६९-५४
मुहूर्तेन आवृता भूमिर् अभवत् शोणित आप्लुता |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, within an instant, the battle-field became dampened with blood and
covered by the mountains and swords thrown by the monkeys and demons._END

B_6_C_71_32
BEGIN_
ततोऽतिकायो बलवान्प्रविश्य हरिवाहिनीम् |
विस्फारयामास धनुर्ननाद च पुनः पुनः || ६-७१-३७_END
BEGIN_
Entering the army of monkeys, the strong Atikaya then stretched his bow and roared
again and again._END

B_6_C_72_12
BEGIN_
स तान् सर्वान् हि संदिश्य रावणो राक्षसाधिपः |
मन्युशल्यम् वहन् दीनः प्रविवेश स्वमालयम् || ६-७१-१७_END
BEGIN_
Having thus instructed all of them, Ravana the king of demons, suffering from
prickly sorrow and depression, penetrated deeply into his palace._END

B_6_C_59_132
BEGIN_
यो वज्रपाताशनिसंनिपाता |
न्न चुक्षुभे नापि च्चाल राजा |
स रामबाणाभिहतो भृशार्त |
श्चचाल चापं च मुमोच वीरः || ६-५९-१३९_END
BEGIN_
That valiant King of Demons, whom neither thunder nor lightning could cause
disturbance or trembling; stumbled letting fall his bow at the valiant impact of Rama's missile
which created a deep injury._END

B_6_C_67_67
BEGIN_
ततः समुत्पाट्य जगाम वीरः |
संस्तूयमानो युधि राक्षसेन्द्रैः |
शृण्वन्निनादम् त्रिदशालयानां |
प्लवम्गराजग्रहविस्मितानाम् || ६-६७-७१_END
BEGIN_
Then, being praised in the battle-field by the demons for having seized hold of
Sugreeva and hearing the sounds of the celestials who were wondering at the seizure of Sugreeva,
Kumbhakarna the valiant chief of demons, sallied forth._END

B_6_C_69_52
BEGIN_
विकीर्ण पर्वत आकारै रक्षोभिर् अरि मर्दनैः || ६-६९-५५
आसीद्वसुमती पूर्णा तदा युद्धमदान्वितैः |_END
BEGIN_
Then the battle-field became filled with dead bodies of demons, who had an ardent
passion for battle, having their colossal bodies devastated and scattered all over._END

B_6_C_70_41
BEGIN_
स तल भिहतस् तेन स्रस्त हस्त अम्बरो भुवि |
निपपात महा तेजास् त्रिशिरास् त्यक्त चेतनः || ६-७०-४३_END
BEGIN_
Struck by Hanuma's palm, that Trishira of great splendour fell down unconscious on
the earth with the weapons slipping from his hand._END

B_6_C_71_33
BEGIN_
तं भीमवपुषम् दृष्ट्वा रथस्थम् रथिनां वरम् |
अभिपेतुर्महात्मानो ये प्रधानाः ये वनौकसः || ६-७१-३८_END
BEGIN_
Seeing him with a terrific body, seated in the chariot, as the excellent one among
the charioteers, powerful chiefs of monkeys rushed towards him._END

B_6_C_72_13
BEGIN_
ततः स संदीपितकोपपह्नि |
र्निशाचराणामधिपो महाबलः |
तदेव पुत्रव्यसनम् विचिन्तयन् |
मुहुर्मुहुश्चैव तदा व्यनिःश्वसत् || ६-७१-१८_END
BEGIN_
Blazed as he was with a fire of anger, Ravana the mighty lord of demons, then
remained broading about the loss of his son (Atikaya) and also sighing again and again._END

B_6_C_59_133
BEGIN_
तम् विह्वलन्तं प्रसमीक्ष्य रामः |
समाददे दीप्तमथार्धचन्द्रम् |
तेनार्कवर्णं सहसा किरीटं |
चिच्छेद रक्षोधिपतेर्महात्मा || ६-५९-१४०_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that Ravana swooning, the magnanimous Rama took up a blazing arrow shaped
like a crescent moon and immediately used it to shatter the diadem of Ravana the Lord of Demons,
which was of bright hue._END

B_6_C_67_68
BEGIN_
ततस्तमादाय तदा स मेने |
हरीन्द्रमिन्द्रोपममिन्द्रवीर्यः |
अस्मिन्हृते सर्वमिदम् हृतं स्यात् |
सराघवम् सैन्यमितीन्द्रशत्रुः || ६-६७-७२_END
BEGIN_
While taking away that Sugreeva looking like Indra, Kumbhakarna the adversary of
Indra and having the prowess of Indra, thought, "If he is killed, all this army including Rama gets
destroyed."_END

B_6_C_69_53
BEGIN_
आक्षिप्ताः क्षिप्यमाणासः च भग्न शूलासः च वानरैः || ६-६९-५६
पुनरङ्गैस्तदा चक्रुरासन्ना युद्धमद्भुतम् |_END
BEGIN_
The demons, already thrown down and still being thrown down, with their spears
broken by the monkeys at that time, approached the monkeys and carried out a wonderful combat with
their limbs, arms and legs._END

B_6_C_70_42
BEGIN_
स तस्य पततःखड्गम् समाच्चिद्य महा कपिः |
ननाद गिरि सम्काशस् त्रासयन् सर्व नैरृतान् || ६-७०-४४_END
BEGIN_
Hanuma, that large ape, equal to a mountain in size, snatching away that falling
sword of Trishira, roared loudly frightening all the demons there._END

B_6_C_71_34
BEGIN_
कुमुदो द्विविदो मैन्दो नीलः शरभ एव च |
पादपैर्गिरिशृङ्गैश् च युगपत्समभिद्रवन् || ६-७१-३९_END
BEGIN_
Taking trees and mountain peaks, Kumuda, Dvivida, Mainda, Nila and Sharabha marched
forwards quickly to attack him at once._END

B_6_C_59_134
BEGIN_
तं निर्विषाशीविषसंनिकाशं |
शान्तार्चिषं सूर्यमिवाप्रकाशम् |
गतश्रियं कृत्तकिरीटकूट |
मुवाच रामो युधि राक्षसेन्द्रम् || ६-५९-१४१_END
BEGIN_
In that battle-field, Rama said to that Lord of Demons whose splendour was dimmed,
the setting of his diadem river, who resembled a venomous snake robbed of its poison or like a sun
its rays extinguished, bereft of lustre._END

B_6_C_67_69
BEGIN_
विद्रुताम् वाहिनीम् दृष्ट्वा वानराणां ततस्ततः |
कुम्भकर्णेन सुग्रीवम् गृहीतं चापि वानरम् || ६-६७-७३
हनूमांश्चिन्तयामास मतिमान् मारुतात्मजः |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the army of monkeys running away hither and thither and Sgureeva the monkey
even being taken away by Kumbhakarna, the intellectual Hanuma, the son of wind-god thought as
follows:_END

B_6_C_69_54
BEGIN_
वानरान् वानरैर् एव जग्नुस् ते रजनी चराः || ६-६९-५७
राक्षसान् राक्षसैर् एव जघ्नुस् ते वानरा अपि |_END
BEGIN_
Those foremost of demons struck the monkeys with their own corpses and the monkeys
also struck the titans with their own dead bodies._END

B_6_C_70_43
BEGIN_
अमृष्यमाणस् तम् घोषम् उत्पपात निशा चरः|
उत्पत्य च हनूमन्तम् ताडयाम् आस मुष्टिना || ६-७०-४५_END
BEGIN_
Unable to bear that roar, the demon jumped up and struck Hanuma with his fist._END

B_6_C_71_35
BEGIN_
तेषाम् वृक्षांश्च शैलांश्च शरैः काञ्चनभूषणैः |
अतिकायो महातेजाश्चिच्छेदास्त्रविदाम् वरः || ६-७१-४०_END
BEGIN_
Atikaya of great splendour, the foremost among those skilled in weaponry, chopped
off their trees and crags with his arrows decked with gold._END

B_6_C_59_135
BEGIN_
कृतं त्वया कर्म महत्सुभीमं |
हतप्रवीरश्च कृतस्त्वयाहम् |
तस्मात्परिश्रान्त इति व्यवस्य |
न्न त्वां शरैर्मऋत्युवशम् नयामि || ६-५९-१४२_END
BEGIN_
"You have accomplished a highly terrific great feat and my brave soldiers have
succumbed beneath your blows. Now, you are weary and in this condition, I shall not put you under
the clutches of Death."_END

B_6_C_69_55
BEGIN_
आक्षिप्य च शिलास् तेषाम् निजघ्नू राक्षसा हरीन् || ६-६९-५८
तेषाम् च आच्चिद्य शस्त्राणि जघ्नू रक्षांसि वानराः |_END
BEGIN_
Then, grabbing the rocks and mountains, those titans struck the monkeys with them.
The apes too, snatching away their weapons, struck the titans._END

B_6_C_67_70
BEGIN_
एवम् गृहीते सुग्रीवे किं कर्तव्यं मया भवेत् || ६-६७-७४
यद्वै न्याय्यं मया कर्तुम् तत्करिष्यामि सर्वथा |
भूत्वा पर्वतसम्काशो नाशयिष्यामि राक्षसं || ६-६७-७५_END
BEGIN_
"While Sugreeva is being taken away in this way, what is to be done by me? I shall
certainly do that which is justifiable to be done by me. Growing to the size of a mountain, I shall
destroy this Kumbhakarna."_END

B_6_C_70_44
BEGIN_
तेन मुष्टि प्रहारेण संचुकोप महा कपिः |
कुपितसःच निजग्राह किरीटे राक्षस ऋषभम् || ६-७०-४६_END
BEGIN_
Enraged as he was by the blow of Trishiras's fist, Hanuma seized hold of Trishira
the foremost of demons by his head covered by his diadem._END

B_6_C_71_36
BEGIN_
तांश्चैव सरान्स हरीञ्शरैः सर्वायसैर्बली |
विव्याधाभिमुखः सङ्ख्ये भीमकायो निशाचरः || ६-७१-४१_END
BEGIN_
That strong and skilled Atikaya with a terrific body, struck all those monkeys,
facing in front of him in battle with arrows fully made of iron._END

B_6_C_59_136
BEGIN_
प्रयाहि जानामि रणार्दितस्त्वं |
प्रविश्य रात्रिंचरराज लङ्काम् |
अश्वस्य निर्याहि रथी च धन्वी |
तदा बलम् प्रेक्ष्यसि मे रथस्थः || ६-५९-१४३_END
BEGIN_
"O, King of the Ranger of night! I know you have been tormented in the battle. Go
and return to Lanka. Having regained your breath, come back in your chariot with your bow and then
standing in your chariot, you will witness once more my prowess."_END

B_6_C_69_56
BEGIN_
निर्जघ्नुः शैल शूल अस्त्रैर् विभिदुसः च परस्परम् || ६-६९-५९
सिम्ह नादान् विनेदुसः च रणे वानर राक्षसाः |_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys and demons fractured each other with crags and made a noise with lion's
roars._END

B_6_C_70_45
BEGIN_
स तस्य शीर्षाण्य् असिना शितेन |
किरीट जुष्टानि सकुण्डलानि |
क्रुद्धःप्रचिच्चेद सुतो अनिलस्य |
त्वष्टुःसुतस्य इव शिरांसि शक्रः || ६-७०-४७_END
BEGIN_
That enraged Hanuma the son of wind-god chopped off with that sharp sword, his three
heads furnished with diadems and ear-rings, like Indra the lord of celestials chopped off the heads
of Vishvarupa the son of Tvashta._END

B_6_C_67_71
BEGIN_
मया हते सम्यति कुम्भकर्णे |
महाबले मुष्टिविशीर्णदेहे |
विमोचिते वानरपार्थिवे च |
भवन्तु हृष्टाः प्रवगाः समग्राः || ६-६७-७६_END
BEGIN_
"Let all the monkeys be delighted while Sugreeva the king of monkeys is liberated
and the mighty Kumbhakarna, with his body crumbled by the blows of my fists, killed by me in
battle."_END

B_6_C_71_37
BEGIN_
तेऽर्दिता बाणबर्षेण भिन्नगात्राः प्लवङ्गमाः |
न शेकुरतिकायस्य प्रतिकर्तुं महारणे || ६-७१-४२_END
BEGIN_
Those overthrown monkeys, injured with their blown out bodies, by the shower of
Atikaya's arrows in that great battle, were unable to retaliate on him._END

B_6_C_69_57
BEGIN_
चिन्न वर्म तनु त्राणा राक्षसा वानरैर् हताः || ६-६९-६०
रुधिरम् प्रस्रुतास् तत्र रस सारम् इव द्रुमाः |_END
BEGIN_
The titans, having their armours broken, as struck by the apes, emitted blood at
that place, like trees oozing their sap._END

B_6_C_59_137
BEGIN_
स एवमुक्तो हतदर्पहर्षो |
निकृत्तचापः स हताश्वसूतः |
शरार्दितो भग्नमहाकिरीटो |
विवेश लङ्काम् सहसा स्म राजा || ६-५९-१४४_END
BEGIN_
At these words, that King Ravana, his joy boasting subdued, his bow shattered, his
horses and chariot slain pierced with arrows, his great diadem broken, he soon returned to
Lanka._END

B_6_C_70_46
BEGIN_
तान्यायत अक्षाण्य् अग सम्निभानि |
प्रदीप्त वैश्वानर लोचनानि |
पेतुःशिरांसि इन्द्र रिपोर् धरण्याम् |
ज्योतीम्षि मुक्तानि यथा अर्क मार्गात् || ६-७०-४८_END
BEGIN_
Those mountain-like heads of Trishira the enemy of Indra, having longish organs of
senses and having fire-like blazing eyes, fell down on earth, as planets and stars drop from the
track of the sun._END

B_6_C_67_72
BEGIN_
अथ वा स्वयमप्येष मोक्षं प्राप्स्यति पार्थिवः |
गृहीतोऽयम् यदि भवेत्त्रिदशैः सासुरोरगैः || ६-६७-७७_END
BEGIN_
"Even otherwise, this Sugreeva can win the freedom himself despite he is taken away
by celestials including demons and serpent-demons."_END

B_6_C_71_38
BEGIN_
तत्सैन्यम् हरिवीराणाम् त्रासयामास राक्षसः |
मृगयूथमिव क्रुद्धो हरिर्यौवनमास्थितः || ६-७१-४३_END
BEGIN_
That demon, who was arrogant of his youth, frightened that army of monkey-warriors,
as an enraged lion frightens a herd of deers._END

B_6_C_59_138
BEGIN_
तस्मिन् प्रविष्टे रजनीचरेन्द्रे |
महाबले दानवदेवशत्रौ |
हरीन् विशल्यान् सह लक्ष्मणेन |
चकार रामः परमाहवाग्रे || ६-५९-१४५_END
BEGIN_
While that mighty Ravana the Lord of Demons and the enemy of celestials and titans
returned to Lanka, Rama arranged for drawing out arrows from monkeys and from Lakshmana too, in the
forefront of that vast battle-field._END

B_6_C_69_58
BEGIN_
रथेन च रथम् च अपि वारणेन च वारणम् || ६-६९-६१
हयेन च हयम् केचिन् निजघ्नुर् वानरा रणे |_END
BEGIN_
Some monkeys in the battle-front destroyed chariot with chariots, elephants with the
very elephants and horse by the very horses._END

B_6_C_70_47
BEGIN_
तस्मिन् हते देव रिपौ त्रिशीर्षे |
हनूमत शक्र पराक्रमेण |
नेदुःप्लवम्गाःप्रचचाल भूमी |
रक्षांस्य् अथो दुद्रुविरे समन्तात् || ६-७०-४९
हतम् त्रिशिरसम् दृष्ट्वा तथैव च महा उदरम् |
हतौ प्रेक्ष्य दुराधर्षौ देव अन्तक नर अन्तकौ || ६-७०-५०
चुकोप परम अमर्षी महा पार्श्वो महा बलः |_END
BEGIN_
When that Trishira, the enemy of celestials, having a prowess equal to that of Indra
was killed, the monkeys made a loud noise. The earth trembled. Then, the demons ran away
everywhere. Seeing Trishira, Mahodara and the invincible Devantaka killed, Matta (Mahaparshva) was
enraged with indignation._END

B_6_C_71_39
BEGIN_
स राषसेन्द्रो हरिसैन्यमध्ये |
नायुध्यमानं निजघान कम् चित् |
उपेत्य रामम् सधनुः कलापी |
सगर्वितम् वाक्यमिदं बभाषे || ६-७१-४४_END
BEGIN_
That chief of demons did not strike whomsoever of the monkey-warriors who were
unable to fight. That Atikaya, with his bow and quiver of arrows, going up quickly towards Rama,
spoke haughty words (to him) as follows:_END

B_6_C_67_73
BEGIN_
मन्ये न तावदात्मानं बुध्यते वानराधिपः |
शैलप्रहाराभिहतः कुम्भकर्णेन सम्युगे || ६-६७-७८_END
BEGIN_
"I think Sugreeva is not yet conscious of his self, as Kumbhakarna struck him with
the blow of a mountain in the battle."_END

B_6_C_59_139
BEGIN_
तस्मिन् प्रभग्ने त्रिदशेन्द्रशत्रौ |
सुरासुरा भूतगणा दिशश्च |
ससागराः सर्वमहोरगाश्च |
तथैव भूम्यम्बुच राः प्रहृष्टाः || ६-५९-१४६_END
BEGIN_
That Ravana, the adversary of the King of the Gods being vanquished, the celestials,
Asuras the multitude of beings in all the quarters, the creatures of the ocean with the great
serpents as also all beings on earth and in waters rejoiced very much._END

B_6_C_69_59
BEGIN_
क्षुरप्रैर् अर्ध चन्द्रैसः च भल्लैसः च निशितैः शरैः || ६-६९-६२
राक्षसा वानर इन्द्राणाम् चिच्चिदुः पादपान् शिलाः |_END
BEGIN_
The titans broke the trees and rocks of monkey-chiefs with their sharp arrows with
their hoe-shaped head, those arrows with crescent-shaped head and those with spear-like head._END

B_6_C_70_48
BEGIN_
जग्राह अर्चिष्मतीम् च अपि गदाम् सर्व आयसीम् शुभाम् || ६-७०-५१
हेम पट्ट परिक्षिप्ताम् मांस शोणित लेपनाम् |
विराजमानाम् वपुषा शत्रु शोणित रन्जिताम् || ६-७०-५२
तेजसा सम्प्रदीप्त अग्राम् रक्त माल्य विभूषिताम् |
ऐरावत महा पद्म सार्वभौम भय आवहाम् || ६-७०-५३_END
BEGIN_
Then, Mahaparshva was holding a large mace, which was resplendent, completely made
of iron, wound round with golden wires, filled with a froth of flesh and blood, satiated with the
blood enemies, the upper most part of which was blazing with splendour, decked with red coloured
garlands and which frightened the elephants supporting the quarters like Airavata, Mahapadma and
Sarvabhauma._END

B_6_C_67_74
BEGIN_
अयं मुहूर्तात्सुग्रीवो लब्धसम्ज्ञो महाहवे |
आत्मनो वानराणाम् च यत्पथ्यं तत्करिष्यति || ६-६७-७९_END
BEGIN_
"Regaining his consciousness within a moment in this great battle, this Sugreeva
will do what is good for himself and for his monkeys."_END

B_6_C_71_40
BEGIN_
रथे स्थितोऽहम् शरचापपाणि |
न प्राकृतम् कं चन योधयामि |
यस्यास्ति शक्तिर्व्यवसाय युक्ता |
ददातुं मे क्षिप्रमिहाद्य युद्धम् || ६-७१-४५_END
BEGIN_
"I am seated in the chariot with arrows and a bow in my hand. I would not give
battle with any common warrior. He who has ability and energy can give his fight to me now and here
quickly."_END

B_6_C_69_60
BEGIN_
विकीर्णैः पर्वत अग्रैसः च द्रुमैसः चिन्नैसः च सम्युगे || ६-६९-६३
हतैसः च कपि रक्षोभिर् दुर्गमा वसुधा अभवत् |_END
BEGIN_
The battle-field, filled with those mountains, broken trees and dead bodies of apes
and titans, became difficult to be traversed._END

B_6_C_67_75
BEGIN_
मया तु मोक्षितस्यास्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः |
अप्रीतश्च भवेत्कष्टा कीर्तिनाशश्च शाश्वतः || ६-६७-८०_END
BEGIN_
"If I liberate this great-souled Sugreeva, there will be a painful dislike for him
and a perpetual in fame."_END

B_6_C_70_49
BEGIN_
गदाम् आदाय सम्क्रुद्धो महा पार्श्वो महा बलः |
हरीन् समभिदुद्राव युग अन्त अग्निर् इव ज्वलन् || ६-७०-५४_END
BEGIN_
Taking that mace, the enraged Matta, the foremost of demons, went quickly to the
monkeys like the blazing fire at the end of the world._END

B_6_C_71_41
BEGIN_
तत्तस्य वाक्यं ब्रुवतो निशम्य |
चुकोप सौमित्रिरमित्रहन्ता |
अमृष्यमाणश्च समुत्पपात |
जग्राह चापम् च ततः स्मयित्वा || ६-७१-४६_END
BEGIN_
Hearing his words, Lakshmana the annihilator of enemies was enraged. Then, unable to
bear his words and smiling, he rose up quickly and took up his bow._END

B_6_C_67_76
BEGIN_
तस्मान्मुहूर्तम् काम्क्षिष्ये विक्रमं पार्थिवस्य नः |
भिन्नम् च वानरानीकं तावदाश्वासयाम्यहम् || ६-६७-८१_END
BEGIN_
'Therefore, I shall wait for a while, for the king to show his prowess. Meanwhile, I
shall cheer up the scattered army of monkeys."_END

B_6_C_69_61
BEGIN_
ते वानरा गर्वितहृष्टचेष्टाः |
सम्ग्राममासाद्य भयं विमुच्य |
युद्धम् स्म सर्वे सह राक्षसै स्त्रै |
र्नानायुधैश्चक्रुरदीनसत्त्वाः || ६-६९-६४_END
BEGIN_
Reaching the battle-field and abandoning their fear, all those monkeys, with their
thrilling martial arts full of pride, nay, who were having various weapons (like trees, rocks,
teeth and nails) and unrepressed in spirit, carried out battle with the demons._END

B_6_C_70_50
BEGIN_
अथ ऋषयःसमुत्पत्य वानरो रवण अनुजम् |
महा पार्श्वम् उपागम्य तस्थौ तस्य अग्रतो बली || ६-७०-५५_END
BEGIN_
Then, a strong monkey called Rishabha came jumping and stood in front of that
Mattanika (Mahaparshva), the younger brother of Ravana._END

B_6_C_71_42
BEGIN_
क्रुद्धः सौमित्रिरुत्पत्य तूणादाक्षिप्य सायकम् |
पुरस्तादतिकायस्य विचकर्ष महद्धनुः || ६-७१-४७_END
BEGIN_
The enraged Lakshmana, coming forward quickly and taking off an arrow from his
quiver pulled out his great bow in front of Atikaya._END

B_6_C_67_77
BEGIN_
इत्येवम् चिन्तयित्वा तु हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः |
भूयः संस्तम्भयामास वानराणां महाचमूम् || ६-६७-८२_END
BEGIN_
Thinking in this way, Hanuma the son of wind-god, then again brought firmness to the
large army of monkeys._END

B_6_C_69_62
BEGIN_
तस्मिन् प्रवृत्ते तुमुले विमर्दे |
प्रहृष्यमाणेषु वली मुखेषु |
निपात्यमानेषु च राक्षसेषु |
महर्षयो देव गणासः च नेदुः || ६-६९-६५_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the monkeys rejoicing in that tumultuous battle which commenced and the
demons falling down, the great sages and troop of celestials emitted shouts of triumph._END

B_6_C_70_51
BEGIN_
तम् पुरस्तात् स्थितम् दृष्ट्वा वानरम् पर्वत उपमम् |
आजघान उरसि क्रुद्धो गदया वज्र कल्पया || ६-७०-५६_END
BEGIN_
Enraged in seeing that Rishabha, looking like a mountain, standing before him,
Mahaparshva struck him upon his breast with a mace equaling a thunderbolt._END

B_6_C_71_43
BEGIN_
पूरयन्स महीम् शैलानाकाशं सागरम् दिशः |
ज्याशब्दो लक्ष्मणस्योग्रस्त्रासयन्रजनीचरान् || ६-७१-४८_END
BEGIN_
That twang of the bow of Lakshmana, filling the entire quarters, earth, sky and the
ocean, was angry, frightening the demons._END

B_6_C_67_78
BEGIN_
स कुम्भकर्णोऽथ विवेश लङ्कां |
स्फुरन्तमादाय महाहरिम् तम् |
विमानचर्यागृहगोपुरस्थैः
पुष्पाग्र्यवर्षैरवकीर्यमाणः || ६-६७-८३_END
BEGIN_
Taking that Sugreeva who was throbbing, that kumbhakarna entered the City of Lanka,
where he was greatly revered with showers of foremost flowers by the citizens staying in celestial
cars, streets, houses and gate-ways of temples._END

B_6_C_69_63
BEGIN_
ततो हयम् मारुत तुल्य वेगम् |
अरुह्य शक्तिम् निशिताम् प्रगृह्य |
नर अन्तको वानर राज सैन्यम् |
महा अर्णवम् मीन;इव आविवेश || ६-६९-६६_END
BEGIN_
Meanwhile, mounting on a horse having speed equal to the wind, and taking a barbed
javelin, Narantaka entered the terrific army of monkeys, as a fish entering the ocean._END

B_6_C_70_52
BEGIN_
स तया अभिहतस् तेन गदया वानर ऋषभः |
भिन्न वक्षाःसमाधूतःसुस्राव रुधिरम् बहु || ६-७०-५७_END
BEGIN_
When he struck with his mace, the breast of that Rishabha the foremost of demons was
broken. He then trembled and exuded blood profusely._END

B_6_C_71_44
BEGIN_
सौमित्रेश्चापनिर्घोषम् श्रुत्वा प्रतिभयम् तदा |
विसिष्मिये महातेजा राक्षसेन्द्रात्मजो बली || ६-७१-४९_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the terrific twang of Lakshmana's bow, the strong Atikaya of great
splendour, was surprised._END

B_6_C_69_64
BEGIN_
स वानरान् सप्त शतानि वीरः |
प्रासेन दीप्तेन विनिर्बिभेद |
एकः क्षणेन इन्द्र रिपुर् महात्मा |
जघान सैन्यम् हरि पुम्गवानाम् || ६-६९-६७_END
BEGIN_
That valiant and mighty Narantaka, the enemy of Indra, single-handedly within an
instant, rent asunder seven hundred monkeys with that shining javelin and killed that army of the
foremost of monkeys._END

B_6_C_67_79
BEGIN_
लाजगन्धोदवर्षैस्तु सेव्यमानः शनैः शनैः |
राजवीथ्यास्तु शीतत्वात्सम्ज्ञाम् प्राप महाबलः || ६-६७-८४_END
BEGIN_
Sprinkled by those showers of pop-corn and fragrant waters and due to the coolness
of the royal roads, the mighty Sugreeva gradually regained his consciousness._END

B_6_C_70_53
BEGIN_
स सम्प्राप्य चिरात् सम्ज्नाम् ऋषभो वानर ऋषभः |
क्रुद्धो विस्फुरमाण ओष्ठो महा पार्श्वम् उदैक्षत || ६-७०-५८_END
BEGIN_
That Rishabha, the supreme monkey regained his consciousness after a long while and
enraged as he was with his lips quivering, looked towards Mahaparshva._END

B_6_C_71_45
BEGIN_
तदातिकायः कुपितो दृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मणमुत्थितम् |
आदाय निशितं बाणमिदम् वचनमब्रवीत् || ६-७१-५०_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Lakshmana standing in front of him for the battle, Atikaya then was enraged
and taking a sharp arrow, spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_70_54
BEGIN_
स वेगवान् वेगवदभ्युपेत्य |
तं राक्षसम् वानरवीरमुख्य |
संवर्त्य मुष्टिम् सहसा जघान् |
बाह्वतरे शैलनिकाशरूपः || ६-७०-५९_END
BEGIN_
That Rishabha, the supreme monkey regained his consciousness after a long while and
enraged as he was with his lips quivering, looked towards Mahaparshva._END

B_6_C_69_65
BEGIN_
ददृशुसः च महात्मानम् हय पृष्ठे प्रतिष्ठितम् |
चरन्तम् हरि सैन्येषु विद्या धर महर्षयः || ६-६९-६८_END
BEGIN_
Vidyadharas, the super natural beings and great sages, saw the mighty Narantaka,
seated on the back of a horse and hacking a path way for himself through the army of monkeys._END

B_6_C_67_80
BEGIN_
ततः स सम्ज्ञामुपलभ्य कृच्छ्रा |
द्बलीयसस्तस्य भुजान्तरस्थः |
अवेक्षमाणः पुरराजमार्गं |
विचिन्तयामास मुहुर्महात्मा || ६-६७-८५_END
BEGIN_
The great souled Sugreeva, who was interposed between Kumbhakarna's shoulders,
regaining his consciousness with great difficulty and observing the royal highway of the city,
repeatedly thought (as follows):_END

B_6_C_71_46
BEGIN_
बालस्त्वमसि सौमित्रे विक्रमेष्वविचक्षणः |
गच्छ किम् कालसदृशं माम् योधयितुमिच्छसि || ६-७१-५१_END
BEGIN_
"O Lakshmana! You are still a boy. You are ignorant of a fight. Why do you wish to
fight with me, who is like Yama the Lord of Death? Go away."_END

B_6_C_69_66
BEGIN_
स तस्य ददृशे मार्गो मांस शोणित कर्दमः |
पतितैः पर्वत आकारैर् वानरैर् अभिसम्वृतः || ६-६९-६९_END
BEGIN_
His path-way was covered with a mire of flesh and blood, along with heaps of
fallen-down dead-bodes of monkeys, looking like hills._END

B_6_C_67_81
BEGIN_
एवम् गृहीतेन कथं नु नाम |
शक्यं मया सम्प्रति कर्तुमद्य |
तथा करिष्यामि यथा हरीणां |
भविष्यतीष्टम् च हितं च कार्यम् || ६-६७-८६_END
BEGIN_
"Having been captivated in this way, what should I do now? I have to do a proper act
now which is desirable and beneficial to the monkeys."_END

B_6_C_70_55
BEGIN_
स कृत्तमूलः सहसेव वृषः |
क्षितौ पपात क्षतजोक्षिताङ्गह् |
ताम् चास्य घोराम् यमदण्डकल्पाम् |
गदां प्रगृह्याशु तदा ननाद || ६-७०-६०_END
BEGIN_
With his body drenched in blood, that Mahaparshva suddenly fell unconscious on the
ground, like a tree with its root cut off. Then, taking quickly Mahaparshva's mace, which was
looking like Yama's rod, he roared loudly._END

B_6_C_69_67
BEGIN_
यावद् विक्रमितुम् बुद्धिम् चक्रुः प्लवग पुम्गवाः |
तावद् एतान् अतिक्रम्य निर्बिभेद नर अन्तकः || ६-६९-७०_END
BEGIN_
Whenever the foremost of the monkeys thought of showing their valour, so often
Narantaka overtook and cleaved them._END

B_6_C_67_82
BEGIN_
ततः कराग्रैः सहसा समेत्य |
राजा हरीणा ममरेन्द्रशत्रोः |
नखैश्च कर्णौ दशनैश्च नासां |
ददंश पादैर्विददार पर्श्वौ || ६-६७-८७_END
BEGIN_
Thus thinking, Sugreeva tore asunder Kumbhakarna's ears by his nails as also nose by
his teeth and ribs by his feet._END

B_6_C_71_47
BEGIN_
न हि मद्बाहुसृष्टानामस्त्राणाम् हिमवानपि |
सोढुमुत्सहते वेगमन्तरिक्षमथो मही || ६-७१-५२_END
BEGIN_
"Even the Himalayan Mountains or the sky or the earth would be unable to endure the
speed of arrows released by my arms."_END

B_6_C_70_56
BEGIN_
मुहूर्तमासीत्स गतासुकल्पः |
प्रत्यागाअत्मा सहसा सुरारिः |
उत्पत्य संध्याभ्रसमानवर्ण |
स्तं वारिराजात्मजमाजघान || ६-७०-६१_END
BEGIN_
Mahaparshva remained as though he was dead for a while. Springing suddenly after
regaining his consciousness, that demon, whose colour resembled his consciousness, that demon,
whose colour resembled an evening cloud, struck that Rishabha, the son of Varuna the lord of
waters._END

B_6_C_67_83
BEGIN_
स कुम्भकर्णौ हृतकर्णनासो |
विदारितस्तेन रदैर्नखैश्च |
रोषाभिभूतः क्षतजार्द्रगारः |
सुग्रीवमाविध्य पिपेष भूमौ || ६-६७-८८_END
BEGIN_
Torn asunder with teeth and nails by Sugreeva, that Kumbhakarna with his ears and
nose deprived and his limbs moistened with blood, was subdued with rage, threw Sugreeva down on the
floor and crushed him._END

B_6_C_69_68
BEGIN_
ददाह हरि सैन्यानि वनानि इव विभावसुः |
यावद् उत्पाटयाम् आसुर् वृक्षान् शैलान् वन ओकसः || ६-६९-७१
तावत् प्रासहताः पेतुर् वज्र कृत्ता;इव अचलाः |_END
BEGIN_
He burn away the army of monkeys, as the fire burns away the forests. Even before
the monkeys get time to uplift the trees and mountains, the javelin struck them and they fell down,
as mountains riven by lightning._END

B_6_C_71_48
BEGIN_
सुखप्रसुप्तम् कालाग्निं प्रबोधयितुमिच्छसि |
न्यस्य चापं निवर्तस्व मा प्राणाञ्जहि मद्गतः || ६-७१-५३_END
BEGIN_
"You wish to arouse a fire of dissolution, when it is sleeping happily. Placing your
bow here, go back. Do not lose your life, by fighting against me."_END

B_6_C_70_57
BEGIN_
स मूर्चितो भूमितले पपात |
मुहूर्तमुत्पत्य पुनः ससम्ज्ञः |
तामेव तस्याद्रिवराद्रिकल्पाम् |
गदाम् समाविध्य जघान सम्ख्ये || ६-७०-६२_END
BEGIN_
That Rishabha fell unconscious for a while on the ground. Rising after regaining
consciousness and tightly holding just the same mace, which was looking like a large mountain-peak,
banged it on Mahapatra in the battle-field._END

B_6_C_69_69
BEGIN_
ज्वलन्तं प्रासमुद्यम्य संग्रामान्ते नरान्तकः || ६-६९-७२
दिक्षु सर्वासु बलवान् विचचार नर अन्तकः |
प्रमृद्नन् सर्वतो युद्धे प्रावृट् काले यथा अनिलः || ६-६९-७३_END
BEGIN_
That mighty Narantaka, the destroyer of men, roamed in all directions in the
battle-field, holding up his shiny javelin, ravaging in all directions like the wind ravaging the
earth in a rainy season._END

B_6_C_71_49
BEGIN_
अथ वा त्वं प्रतिष्टब्धो न निवर्तितुमिच्छसि |
तिष्ठ प्राणान्परित्यज्य गमिष्यसि यमक्षयम् || ६-७१-५४_END
BEGIN_
"If you do not go back, with an obstinance, then you rather stay back. Abandoning
your lives, you will reach the abode of Yama."_END

B_6_C_67_84
BEGIN_
स भूतले भीमबलाभिपिष्टः |
सुरारिभिस्तैरभिहन्यमानः |
जगाम खम् कन्दुकवज्जवेन |
पुनश्च रामेण समाजगाम || ६-६७-८९_END
BEGIN_
Crushed down on the floor by that terrific Kumbhakarna and struck by the demons,
Sugreeva moved with speed like a ball towards the sky and got united with Rama._END

B_6_C_70_58
BEGIN_
सा तस्य रौद्रा समुपेत्य देहम् |
रौद्रस्य देवाध्वरविप्रशत्रोः |
बिभेद वक्षः क्षतजम् च भूरि |
सुस्राव धात्वम्भ इवाद्रिराजः || ६-७०-६३_END
BEGIN_
That terrific mace, reaching the body of Mahaparshva, the fierce demon, the enemy of
celestials, sacrificial rites and Brahmanas, broke his chest. Mahaparshva started exuding copious
blood, as a supreme mountain exudes water full of minerals._END

B_6_C_69_70
BEGIN_
न शेकुर् धावितुम् वीरा न स्थातुम् स्पन्दितुम् कुतः |
उत्पतन्तम् स्थितम् यान्तम् सर्वान् विव्याध वीर्यवान् || ६-६९-७४_END
BEGIN_
Narantaka, a single demon, equal to so many demons, struck the armies of mokeys with
his javelin, having the sun's splendour and they fell down on the earth._END

B_6_C_67_85
BEGIN_
कर्णनासाविहीनस्य कुम्भकर्णो महाबलः |
रराज शोणितोत्सिक्तो गिरिः प्रस्रवणैरिव || ६-६७-९०_END
BEGIN_
Bereft of his ears and nose, the mighty Kumbhakarna, pouring out blood, shone like a
mountain with its streaming cascades._END

B_6_C_71_50
BEGIN_
पश्य मे निशितान् बाणान रिदर्पनिषूदनान् |
ईश्वरायुधसङ्काशांस्तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणान् || ६-७१-५५_END
BEGIN_
"See my sharp arrows decked with pure gold, which can remove the pride of my enemies
and which are like the weapons of Ishvara the lord of destruction."_END

B_6_C_70_59
BEGIN_
अभिदुद्राव वेगेन गदां तस्य महात्मनः |
ताम् गृहीत्वा गदाम् भीमाम् आविध्य च पुनःपुनः || ६-७०-६४
मत्त अनीकम् महा पार्श्वम् जघान रण मूर्धनि |_END
BEGIN_
The great souled Rishabha quickly ran towards the mace of that mighty Mahaparshva.
Seizing that dreadful mace and striking it repeatedly on the floor, he struck it on Mahaparshva in
the battle-front._END

B_6_C_69_71
BEGIN_
एकेन अन्तक कल्पेन प्रासेन आदित्य तेजसा |
भिन्नानि हरि सैन्यानि निपेतुर् धरणी तले || ६-६९-७५_END
BEGIN_
Narantaka, a single demon, equal to so many demons, struck the armies of mokeys with
his javelin, having the sun's splendour and they fell down on the earth._END

B_6_C_67_86
BEGIN_
शोणितार्द्रो महाकायो राक्षसो भीमदर्शनः |
अमर्षाच्छोणितोद्गारी शुशुभे रावणानुजः || ६-६७-९१
नीलाञ्जनचयप्रख्याः ससंध्य इव तोयदः |
युद्धायाभिमुखो भीमो मनश्चक्रे निशाचरः || ६-६७-९२_END
BEGIN_
Kumbhakarna the demon and the brother of Ravana, having his large body bathed in
blood, frightful in appearance, vomiting blood with rage, and looking like a mound of black
antimony shone akin to a cloud with an evening-twilight. With his face directed towards the
battle-front, Kumbhakarna the terrific demon made up his mind to continue his combat._END

B_6_C_71_51
BEGIN_
एष ते सर्पसङ्काशो बाणः पास्यति शोणितम् |
मृगराज इव क्रुद्धो नागराजस्य शोणितम् || ६-७१-५६_END
BEGIN_
"This arrow looking like a serpent will drink your blood as a lion drinks the blood
of an elephant. "Thus speaking, Atikaya was enraged and fixed an arrow on his bow._END

B_6_C_70_60
BEGIN_
स स्वया गदया भिन्नो विकीर्ण दशन ईक्षणः |
निपपात महा पार्श्वो वज्र आहत;इव अचलः || ६-७०-६५_END
BEGIN_
Struck by his own mace, that Mahaparshva with his teeth and eyes fallen out, fell
down like a mountain struck by a thunderbolt._END

B_6_C_69_72
BEGIN_
वज्र निष्पेष सदृशम् प्रासस्य अभिनिपातनम् |
न शेकुर् वानराः सोढुम् ते विनेदुर् महा स्वनम् || ६-६९-७६_END
BEGIN_
Those monkeys were unable to tolerate the down-onslaught of the javelin, which was
similar to the striking of a thunderbolt and they shouted with a great uproar._END

B_6_C_67_87
BEGIN_
गते च तस्मिन् सुरराजशत्रुह् |
क्रोधात्प्रदुद्राव रणाय भूयः |
अनायुधोऽस्मीति विचिन्त्य रौद्रो |
घोरम् तदा मुद्गरमाससाद || ६-६७-९३_END
BEGIN_
After the departure of Sugreeva, Kumbhakarna the adversary of Indra, with a rage,
marched ahead quickly for the battle. Finding out that he is then without any weapon, the dreadful
Kumbhakarna got possession of a hammer-like weapon._END

B_6_C_70_61
BEGIN_
विदीर्णनयने भूमौ गतस्त्त्वे गतायुषि |
पतिते राक्षसे तस्मिन् विद्रुतं राक्षसम् बलम् || ६-७०-६६_END
BEGIN_
When that demon depleted his strength, burst open his eyes, with his long life gone
away and fallen down on the ground, the army of demons ran away._END

B_6_C_71_52
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वातिकायस्य वचः सरोषं |
सगर्वितम् सम्यति राजपुत्रः |
स सञ्चुकोपातिबलो मस्वी |
उवाच वाक्यम् च ततो महार्थम् || ६-७१-५७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Atikaya, filled with anger and arrogance in that battle-field,
Lakshmana was enraged. Thereafter, that Lakshmana, having a great strength wisdom and great glory,
also spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_69_73
BEGIN_
पतताम् हरि वीराणाम् रूपाणि प्रचकाशिरे |
वज्र भिन्न अग्र कूटानाम् शैलानाम् पतताम् इव || ६-६९-७७_END
BEGIN_
The images of the falling monkeys were flashing like those of falling mountains,
with their peaks shattered by a thunderbolt._END

B_6_C_67_88
BEGIN_
ततः स पुर्याः सहसा महात्मा |
निष्क्रम्य तद्वानरसैन्यमुग्रम् |
बभक्ष रक्षो युधि कुम्भकर्णः |
प्रजा युगान्ताग्निरिव प्रदीप्तः || ६-६७-९४_END
BEGIN_
Starting from the city quickly, that mighty Kumbhakarna then devoured that huge army
of monkeys in battle, like the devour of people by the augmented fire at the time of dissolution of
the world._END

B_6_C_71_53
BEGIN_
न वाक्यमात्रेण भवान्प्रधानो |
न कत्थनात्सत्पुरुषा भवन्ति |
मयि स्थिते धन्विनि बाणपाणौ |
विदर्शयस्वात्मबलम् दुरात्मन् || ६-७१-५८_END
BEGIN_
"O the evil-minded! Just by uttering mere words, you cannot by a very important
person. People cannot become good persons, just by boasting of themselves. You rather show your
strength in me, who is standing with an arrow in hand and wielding a bow."_END

B_6_C_70_62
BEGIN_
तस्मिन् हते भ्रातरि रावणस्य |
तन् नैरृतानाम् बलम् अर्णव आभम् |
त्यक्त आयुधम् केवल जीवित अर्थम् |
दुद्राव भिन्न अर्णव सम्निकाशम् || ६-७०-६७_END
BEGIN_
When that Mahaparshva was killed, that army of demons, which was as extensive as an
ocean, abandoning their weapons in the battle-field, fled for mere lives, like a sea which has
burst its shores._END

B_6_C_67_89
BEGIN_
बुभुक्षितः शोणितमांसगृध्नुः |
प्रविश्य तद्वानरसैन्यमुग्रम् |
चखाद रक्षांसि हरीन्पिशाचान् |
ऋक्षांश्च मोहाद्युधि कुम्भकर्णः |
यथैव मृत्युर्हरते युगान्ते |
स भक्षयामास हरींश्च मुख्यान् || ६-६७-९५_END
BEGIN_
Penetrating that huge army of monkeys, Kumbhakarna who was greedily desirous of
flesh and blood in hunger, due to his deep bewilderment in battle, ate away even the demons,
monkeys, devils and bears. He devoured the principal monkeys just as the death devours people at
the time of the end of the world._END

B_6_C_69_74
BEGIN_
ये तु पूर्वम् महात्मानः कुम्भ कर्णेन पातिताः |
ते अस्वस्था वानर श्रेष्ठाः सुग्रीवम् उपतस्थिरे || ६-६९-७८_END
BEGIN_
Those great-souled and the foremost of monkeys, who were earlier thrown down by
Kumbhakarna, regained their self and approached Sugreeva._END

B_6_C_71_54
BEGIN_
कर्मणा सूचयात्मानं न विकत्थितुमर्हसि |
पौरुषेण तु यो युक्तः स तु शूर इति स्मृतः || ६-७१-५९_END
BEGIN_
"Reveal yourself by your deeds. You do not deserve to boast of yourself. A person
with valour alone is declared as a warrior."_END

B_6_C_69_75
BEGIN_
प्रेक्षमाणः सुग्रीवो ददर्श हरि वाहिनीम् |
नर अन्तक भय त्रस्ताम् विद्रवन्तीम् इतस् ततः || ६-६९-७९_END
BEGIN_
That Sugreeva, while looking on, saw the army of monkeys running away hither and
thither, as they were tormented of the fear of Narantaka._END

B_6_C_71_55
BEGIN_
सर्वायुधसमायुक्तो धन्वी त्वम् रथमास्थितः |
शरैर्वा यदि वाप्यस्त्रैर्दर्शयस्व पराक्रमम् || ६-७१-६०_END
BEGIN_
"You are seated in a chariot, with all the weaponry and wielding a bow. Show your
prowess either by your arrows or even by your weapons."_END

B_6_C_67_90
BEGIN_
एकम् द्वौ त्रीन् बहून् क्रुद्धो वानरान् सह राक्षसैः |
समादायैकहस्तेन प्रचिक्षेप त्वरन्मुखे || ६-६७-९६_END
BEGIN_
The enraged Kumbhakarna, quickly taking with his single hand, the monkeys and
demons, in one's two's, three's or in many and hurled them into his mouth_END

B_6_C_69_76
BEGIN_
विद्रुताम् वाहिनीम् दृष्ट्वा स ददर्श नर अन्तकम् |
गृहीत प्रासम् आयान्तम् हय पृष्ठे प्रतिष्ठितम् || ६-६९-८०_END
BEGIN_
To that Sugreeva who was seeing his army running away, Narantaka appeared, coming
seated on the back of a horse, holding a javelin in his hand._END

B_6_C_71_56
BEGIN_
ततः शिरस्ते निशितैः पातयिष्याम्यहम् शरैः |
मारुतः कालसम्पक्वम् वृन्तात्तालफलं यथा || ६-७१-६१_END
BEGIN_
"Thereupon, with sharp arrows, I shall strike down your head like a fruit of a
fan-palm, ripened by its time, is fallen down from its stalk by the gust of a wind."_END

B_6_C_67_91
BEGIN_
सम्प्रस्रवंस्तदा मेदः शोणित च महाबलः |
वध्यमानो नगेन्द्राग्रैर्भक्षयामास वानरान् || ६-६७-९७_END
BEGIN_
Struck with mountain-peaks, by the monkeys, the mighty Kumbhakarna, then, gushing
forth his flesh and blood, devoured the monkeys._END

B_6_C_69_77
BEGIN_
दृष्ट्वोवाच महा तेजाः सुग्रीवो वानर अधिपः |
कुमारम् अन्गदम् वीरम् शक्र तुल्य पराक्रमम् || ६-६९-८१_END
BEGIN_
After seeing Narantaka, the vastly splendoured Sugreeva, the king of monkeys spoke
thus, to Angada, the valiant prince, having a prowess equal to Indra's (as follows):_END

B_6_C_67_92
BEGIN_
ते भक्ष्यमाणा हरयो रामम् जग्मुस्तदा गतिम् |
कुम्भकर्णो भृशम् क्रुद्धः कपीन् खादन् प्रधावति || ६-६७-९८_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, those monkeys, who were being devoured, sought Rama as their refuge. The
very much enraged Kumbhakarna, while eating away the monkeys, marched forward._END

B_6_C_71_57
BEGIN_
अद्य ते मामका बाणास्तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणाः |
पास्यन्ति रुधिरम् गात्राद्बाणशल्यान्तरोत्थितम् || ६-७१-६२_END
BEGIN_
"Today, these arrows of mine decked with pure gold, will drink blood oozing forth
from the holes formed in your body by the sharp points of my arrows."_END

B_6_C_67_93
BEGIN_
शतानि सप्त चाष्टौ च विंशत्त्रिंशत्तथैव च |
सम्परिष्वज्य बहुभ्याम् खादन्विपरिधावति || ६-६७-९९_END
BEGIN_
Grasping a hundred, a seven, an eight, a twenty and a thirty with his arms,
Kumbhakarna was devouring the monkeys and running about in the battle-field._END

B_6_C_69_78
BEGIN_
गच्च एनम् राक्षसम् वीर यो असौ तुरगम् आस्थितः |
क्षोभयन्तम् हरि बलम् क्षिप्रम् प्राणैर् वियोजय || ६-६९-८२_END
BEGIN_
"Go out and quickly detach the lives of this valiant demon, who is riding a horse
and consuming the army of his enemies."_END

B_6_C_71_58
BEGIN_
बालोऽयमिति विज्ञाय न मावज्ञातुमर्हसि |
बालो वा यदि वा वृद्धो मृत्युम् जानीहि सम्युगे || ६-७१-६३
बालेन विष्णुना लोकास्त्रयः क्रान्तास्त्रिविक्रमैः |_END
BEGIN_
"Thinking me to be a boy, you need not disregard me. Either as the boy or as the
aged, you indeed know me in battle-front as the god of Death. Vishnu, as a boy occupied the three
worlds just with his three strides, Didn't he?"_END

B_6_C_67_94
BEGIN_
मेदोवसाशोणितदिग्धगात्रः |
कर्णावसक्तग्रथितान्त्रमालः |
ववर्षशूलानि सुतीक्षणदंष्ट्रः |
कालो युगान्तस्थ इव प्रवृद्धः || ६-६७-१००_END
BEGIN_
Having his entire body besmeared with flesh, marrow and blood together with wreaths
of tangled viscera hung over his ears, the demon with his very sharp teeth, rained spikes on the
monkeys, like Yama, the god of death, risen to power at the end of the world-cycle._END

B_6_C_69_79
BEGIN_
स भर्तुर् वचनम् श्रुत्वा निष्पपात अन्गदस् तदा |
अनीकान् मेघ सम्काशान् मेघ अनीकाद् इव अंशुमान् || ६-६९-८३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Sugreeva his sovereign, that valiant Angada then came bouncing
from his army, as the sun coming out of a cloud._END

B_6_C_71_59
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणस्य वचः श्रुत्वा हेतुमत्परमार्थवत् || ६-७१-६४
अतिकायः प्रचुक्रोध बाणम् चोत्तममाददे |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the reasonable and highly meaningful words of Lakshmana, Atikaya was very
much enraged and took out an excellent arrow._END

B_6_C_69_80
BEGIN_
शैल सम्घत सम्काशो हरीणाम् उत्तमो अन्गदः |
रराज अन्गद सम्नद्धः सधातुर् इव पर्वतः || ६-६९-८४_END
BEGIN_
Angada the excellent of monkeys, resembling a rocky mass, wearing bracelets on his
upper arms, looked brilliant like a mountain with its metallic streaks._END

B_6_C_67_95
BEGIN_
तस्मिन् काले सुमित्रायाः पुत्रः परबलार्दनः |
चकार लक्ष्मणः क्रुद्धो युद्धम् परपुरम्जयः || ६-६७-१०१_END
BEGIN_
Immediately, Lakshmana the son of Sumitra, the annihilator of the foe's army and
conqueror of the cities of adversaries, commenced the battle with a rage._END

B_6_C_71_60
BEGIN_
ततो विद्याधरा भूता देवा दैत्या महर्षयः || ६-७१-६५
गुह्यकाश्च महात्मानस्तद्युद्धम् ददृशुस्तदा |_END
BEGIN_
Then, Vidyadharas the supernatural beings, Bhutas the spirits, Devas the celestials,
Daityas the demons, Maharshies the great sages and Guhyakas a class of demi-gods, all the great
souled ones saw that battle._END

B_6_C_69_81
BEGIN_
निरायुधो महा तेजाः केवलम् नख दम्ष्ट्रवान् |
नर अन्तकम् अभिक्रम्य वालि पुत्रो अब्रवीद् वचः || ६-६९-८५_END
BEGIN_
Angada the son of Vali, bereft of arms but only nails and teeth besides having a
great splendour, approached Narantaka and spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_67_96
BEGIN_
स कुम्भकर्णस्य शराञ्शरीरे सप्त वीर्यवान् |
निचखानाददे चान्यान्विससर्ज च लक्ष्मणः || ६-६७-१०२_END
BEGIN_
The valiant Lakshmana pierced seven arrows into the body of Kumbhakarna. He took
some more arrows and released them too._END

B_6_C_71_61
BEGIN_
ततोऽतिकायः कुपितश्चापमारोप्य सायकम् || ६-७१-६६
लक्ष्मणस्य प्रचिक्षेप सङ्क्षिपन्निव चाम्बरम् |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, the enraged Atikaya, stringing an arrow to his bow, dispatched it
towards Lakshmana, as though he were shrinking up the space in between._END

B_6_C_69_82
BEGIN_
तिष्ठ किम् प्राकृतैर् एभिर् हरिभिस् त्वम् करिष्यसि |
अस्मिन् वज्र सम स्पर्शे प्रासम् क्षिप मम उरसि || ६-६९-८६_END
BEGIN_
"Stop! What can you do with these common monkeys? Throw your javelin, having the
sensation equal to a thunderbolt, towards my chest."_END

B_6_C_67_97
BEGIN_
पीड्यमानस्तदस्त्रम् तु विशेषम् ततस राक्षसः |
ततश्चुकोप बलवान् सुमित्रानंदवर्धनः || ६-६७-१०३_END
BEGIN_
Tormented by that weapon of Lakshmana, that demon destroyed it completely.
Thereupon, the aggressive Lakshmana was enraged._END

B_6_C_69_83
BEGIN_
अन्गदस्य वचः श्रुत्वा प्रचुक्रोध नर अन्तकः |
संदश्य दशनैर् ओष्ठम् निश्वस्य च भुजम्गवत् || ६-६९-८७
अभिगम्याङ्गदं क्रुद्धो वालिपुत्रम् नरान्तकः |
स प्रासमाविध्य तदाङ्गदाय |
स प्रासम् आविध्य तदा अन्गदाय|
समुज्ज्वलन्तम् सहसा उत्ससर्ज |
स वालि पुत्रोर् असि वज्र कल्पे |
बभूव भग्नो न्यपतच् च || ६-६९-८८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Angada, Narantaka was very much enraged. The enraged Narantaka,
tightly biting his lip with his teeth, hissing like a serpent, approaching Angada and firmly
holding that highly radiant javelin, then quickly released it towards Angada. That javelin broke
against Angada's chest, that was as hard as a diamond and fell to the earth._END

B_6_C_71_62
BEGIN_
तमापतन्तं निशितम् शरमाशीविषोपमम् || ६-७१-६७
अर्धचन्द्रेण चिच्छेद लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा |_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana, the annihilator of enemy-warriors, chopped off that serpent-like sharp
arrow, which was falling down on him, with his crescent-pointed arrow._END

B_6_C_67_98
BEGIN_
अथस्य कवचम् शुभ्रम् जामुबूनदमयम् शुभम् |
प्रच्छादयामास शरैः संध्याभ्रमिव मारुतः || ६-६७-१०४_END
BEGIN_
Then, Lakshmana covered the shining and charming golden armour of Kumbhakarna with
his arrows, even as the wind would make an evening-twilight cloud completely disappear._END

B_6_C_73_0
BEGIN_
ततो हतान्राक्षसपुङ्गवांस्तान् |
देवान्तकादित्रिशिरोऽतिकायान् |
रक्षोगणास्तत्र हतावशिष्टास् |
ते रावणाय त्वरितं शशंसुः || ६-७३-१_END
BEGIN_
Then, those surviving troops of demons hastily told Ravana that Devantaka, Trishira,
Atikaya and other foremost of demons had been killed._END

B_6_C_67_99
BEGIN_
नीलाञ्जनचयप्रख्याः शैरैः काञ्चनभूषणैः |
आपीड्यमानः शुशुभे मेघैः सूर्य इवांशुमान् || ६-६७-१०५_END
BEGIN_
Kumbhakarna, looking like a mound of collyrium, tormented by the arrows, decked with
gold, shone like the radiant sun with its rays screened by clouds._END

B_6_C_71_63
BEGIN_
तं निकृत्तम् शरम् दृष्ट्वा कृत्तभोगमिवोरगम् || ६-७१-६८
अतिकायो भृशम् क्रुद्धः पञ्चबाणान्समाददे |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that arrow which was chopped off as a snake's hood severed into pieces,
Atikaya was very much enraged and fitted five arrows to his bow._END

B_6_C_73_1
BEGIN_
ततो हतांस्तान्सहसा निशम्य |
राजा मुमोहाश्रुपरिप्लुताक्षः|
पुत्रक्षयं भ्रातृवधं च घोरं |
विचिन्त्य राजा विपुलं प्रदध्यौ || ६-७३-२_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, suddenly hearing of those who had been killed, Ravana the prosperous king
of demons, having his eyes filled with profuse tears; boarding over the terrific destroyal of his
son as also the death of his brothers, contemplated for long._END

B_6_C_69_84
BEGIN_
तम् प्रासम् आलोक्य तदा विभग्नम् |
सुपर्ण कृत्त उरग भोग कल्पम् |
तलम् समुद्यम्य स वालि पुत्रस् |
स्तुरम्गमस्य अभिजघान मूर्ध्नि || ६-६९-८९_END
BEGIN_
Then seeing his javelin shattered, like a serpent whose powerful coils were cut off
by Garuda the eagle, Angada stretched out his palm and struck the head of the horse._END

B_6_C_67_100
BEGIN_
ततः स राक्षसो भीमः सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनम् |
सावज्ञ्मेव प्रोवाच वाक्यम् मेघौघनिःस्वनः || ६-६७-१०६_END
BEGIN_
Then, that terrific demon, with a thunderous noise of multiple clouds, spoke the
following words disrespectfully to Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_73_2
BEGIN_
ततस्तु राजानमुदीक्ष्य दीनं |
शोकार्णवे सम्परिपुप्लुवानम्|
अथर्षभो राक्षसराजसूनुर् |
अथेन्द्रजिद्वाक्यमिदं बभाषे || ६-७३-३_END
BEGIN_
Then, seeing Ravana the king, miserably submerged in a sea of sorrow, Indrajit,
Ravana's son, the best among charioteers, spoke to him as follows:_END

B_6_C_71_64
BEGIN_
ताञ्शरान्सम्प्रचिक्षेप लक्ष्मणाय निशाचरः || ६-७१-६९
तानप्राप्ताञ्शरैस्तीक्ष्णैश्चिच्छेद भरतानुजः |_END
BEGIN_
That demon hurled those arrows towards Lakshmana. Even before they reached him,
Lakshmana chopped them off with his sharp arrows._END

B_6_C_69_85
BEGIN_
निभग्न पादः स्फुटित अक्षि तारो |
निष्क्रान्त जिह्वो अचल सम्निकाशः |
स तस्य वाजी निपपात भूमौ |
तल प्रहारेण विकीर्ण मूर्धा || ६-६९-९०_END
BEGIN_
That mountain-like Narantaka's horse, struck by a blow of the palm, had its head
shattered, feet broken, eyes and pupils put out and tongue come out. It fell down on the earth._END

B_6_C_73_3
BEGIN_
न तात मोहं प्रतिगन्तुमर्हसि |
यत्रेन्द्रजिज्जीवति राक्षसेन्द्र|
नेन्द्रारिबाणाभिहतो हि कश् चित् |
प्राणान्समर्थः समरेऽभिधर्तुम् || ६-७३-४_END
BEGIN_
"O father, the king of demons! You ought not to get embarrassed, while Indrajit is
alive. Anyone who is struck by Indrajit's arrows cannot indeed protect his life."_END

B_6_C_67_101
BEGIN_
अन्तकस्याप्यकष्टेन युधि जेतारमाहवे |
युध्यता मामभीतेन ख्यापिता वीरता त्वया || ६-६७-१०७_END
BEGIN_
"You declared your heroism fearlessly in battle, by attacking me, who has conquered
even the lord of death effortlessly in a combat."_END

B_6_C_71_65
BEGIN_
स तांश्छित्त्वा शरैस्तीक्ष्णैर्लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा || ६-७१-७०
आददे निशितं बाणम् ज्वलन्तमिव तेजसा |_END
BEGIN_
Cutting off those arrows with his sharp arrows that Lakshmana, the destroyer of
enemy-warriors, took up a sharp arrow, as though it was blazing with a glow._END

B_6_C_73_4
BEGIN_
पश्याद्य रामं सहलक्ष्मणेन |
मद्बाणनिर्भिन्नविकीर्णदेहम्|
गतायुषं भूमितले शयानं |
शरैः शितैराचितसर्वगात्रम् || ६-७३-५_END
BEGIN_
"Today, you will see Rama along with Lakshmana, with their bodies undistinguished,
scattered and dead, lying down on the floor, with their limbs diffused all over."_END

B_6_C_69_86
BEGIN_
नर अन्तकः क्रोध वशम् जगाम |
हतम् तुरगम् पतितम् निरीक्ष्य |
स मुष्टिम् उद्यम्य महा प्रभावो |
जघान शीर्षे युधि वालि पुत्रम् || ६-६९-९१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing his horse fallen down dead, Narantaka was enraged. Raising his fist, that
exceedingly powerful Narantaka in battle struck Angada on his head._END

B_6_C_67_102
BEGIN_
प्रगृहीतायुधस्येह मृत्योरिव महामृधे |
तिष्ठन्नप्रग्रतः पूज्यः किमु युद्धप्रदायकः || ६-६७-१०८_END
BEGIN_
"Anyone who even stands before me, the god of death, holding forth a weapon in a
great battle here, is venerable. What to tell about a person who bestows battle on me?"_END

B_6_C_71_66
BEGIN_
तमादाय धनुः श्रेष्ठे योजयामास लक्ष्मणः || ६-७१-७१
विचकर्ष च वेगेन विससर्ज च सायकम् |_END
BEGIN_
Taking that arrow, Lakshmana harnessed it on his excellent bow, stretched it with
force and released it._END

B_6_C_73_5
BEGIN_
इमां प्रतिज्ञां शृणु शक्रशत्रोः |
सुनिश्चितां पौरुषदैवयुक्ताम्|
अद्यैव रामं सहलक्ष्मणेन |
सन्तापयिष्यामि शरैरमोघैः || ६-७३-६_END
BEGIN_
"Listen to Indrajit's promise, which is very firm, backed by valour and divine
blessing. Now itself, I will overwhelm Rama together with Lakshmana unfailing flood of arrows._END

B_6_C_69_87
BEGIN_
अथ अन्गदो मुष्टि विभिन्न मूर्धा|
सुस्राव तीव्रम् रुधिरम् भृश उष्णम् |
मुहुर् विजज्वाल मुमोह च अपि |
सम्ज्नाम् समासाद्य विसिष्मिये च || ६-६९-९२_END
BEGIN_
Then, Angada having his head shattered by the blow of the fist, heavily oozed out
very hot blood, repeatedly felt a burning sensation and swooned. On regaining consciousness, he was
surprised._END

B_6_C_67_103
BEGIN_
ऐरावतम् समारूडो वृतः सर्वामरैह् प्रभुः |
नैव शक्रोऽपि समरे स्थित पूर्वः कदाचन || ६-६७-१०९_END
BEGIN_
"Even the powerful Indra, the lord of celestials, who mounted Airavata the elephant
and accompanied by all celestials, did not ever stand before me in battle."_END

B_6_C_71_67
BEGIN_
पूर्णायतविसृष्टेन शरेणानत पर्वणा || ६-७१-७२
ललाटे राक्षसश्रेष्ठमाजघान स वीर्यवान् |_END
BEGIN_
That valiant Lakshmana, by a flat-jointed arrow released fully, struck it on the
forehead of that excellent demon._END

B_6_C_69_88
BEGIN_
अथ अन्गदो वज्र समान वेगम् |
सम्वर्त्य मुष्टिम् गिरि शृन्ग कल्पम् |
निपातयाम् आस तदा महात्मा |
नर अन्तकस्य उरसि वालि पुत्रः || ६-६९-९३_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, the great-souled Angada, the son of Vali, clinching his fist and then
with a force equal to death, rushed it against the chest of Narantaka._END

B_6_C_73_6
BEGIN_
अद्येन्द्रवैवस्वतविष्णुमित्र |
साध्याश्विवैश्वानरचन्द्रसूर्याः|
द्रक्ष्यन्ति मे विक्रममप्रमेयं |
विष्णोरिवोग्रं बलियज्ञवाटे || ६-७३-७_END
BEGIN_
"Now itself, Indra, Yama, Vishnu, Rudra, Sadhyas (a class of celestial beings), the
fire-god, the sun and the moon can see my unlimited prowess, like the terrific prowess of Vishnu
(in his dwarf incarnation as Vamana) in the enclosure where a sacrifice was being performed by
Bali, the demon-king."_END

B_6_C_67_104
BEGIN_
अद्य त्वयाहम् सौमित्रे बलेनापि पराक्रमैः |
तोषितो गन्तुमिच्छामि त्यामनुज्ञाप्य राघवम् || ६-६७-११०_END
BEGIN_
"O Lakshmana! Today, I am gratified by your strength and abilities. Taking leave of
you, I desire to march forward towards Rama."_END

B_6_C_71_68
BEGIN_
स ललाटे शरो मग्नस्तस्य भीमस्य रक्षसः || ६-७१-७३
ददृशे शोणितेनाक्तः पन्नगेन्द्र इवाहवे |_END
BEGIN_
That arrow, sunken into the forehead of that terrible demon, smeared with blood,
appeared like a serpent-king on a mountain._END

B_6_C_73_7
BEGIN_
स एवमुक्त्वा त्रिदशेन्द्रशत्रुर् |
आपृच्छ्य राजानमदीनसत्त्वः |
समारुरोहानिलतुल्यवेगं |
रथं खरश्रेष्ठसमाधियुक्तम् || ६-७३-८_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking, that Indrajit, with an undepressed mind, after seeking permission
from the king, mounted his chariot with a speed equal to that of wind and yoked with excellent
donkeys._END

B_6_C_69_89
BEGIN_
स मुष्टि निष्पिष्ट विभिन्न वक्षा |
ज्वालाम् वमन् शोणित दिग्ध गात्रः |
नर अन्तको भूमि तले पपात |
यथा अचलो वज्र निपात भग्नः || ६-६९-९४_END
BEGIN_
Having his chest deeply sunk back by that fist-blow, giving out flames and with his
limbs smeared by blood, that Narantaka fell down as a mountain is broken up by the fall of a
thundr-bolt._END

B_6_C_67_105
BEGIN_
यत्तु वीर्यबलोत्साहैस्तोषितोऽहं रणे त्वया |
राममेवैकमिच्छमि हन्तुम् यस्मिन् हते हतम् || ६-६७-१११_END
BEGIN_
"Because I have been gratified by you by way of your ability, strength and firmness
in battle, I for my part desire to kill Rama alone, for when he is killed, all the army will be
killed."_END

B_6_C_71_69
BEGIN_
राक्षसः प्रचकम्पे च लक्ष्मणेषु प्रकम्पितः || ६-७१-७४
रुद्रबाणहतं भीमम् यथा त्रिपुरगोपुरम् |_END
BEGIN_
The demon, tormented by Lakshmana's arrow, then trembled violently as when the
terrific town-gate of Tripura City, (built of gold, silver and iron in the sky, air and earth by
Maya for the demons) was struck by Shiva's arrow._END

B_6_C_69_90
BEGIN_
थदान्तरिक्षे त्रिदश उत्तमानाम् |
वन ओकसाम् चैव महा प्रणादः |
बभूव तस्मिन् निहते अग्र्य वीरे |
नर अन्तके वालि सुतेन सम्ख्ये || ६-६९-९५_END
BEGIN_
When that Narantaka of great prowess was killed by Angada in battle, the chiefs of
celestials and the monkeys too then emitted a great roar of triumph in the sky._END

B_6_C_67_106
BEGIN_
रामे मयात्र निहते येऽन्ये स्थास्यन्ति संयुगे |
तानहं योधयिष्यामि स्वबलेन प्रमाथिना || ६-६७-११२_END
BEGIN_
"When Rama is killed by me battle here, I will make my army to fight with others who
remain on the battle filled and destroy them."_END

B_6_C_73_8
BEGIN_
समास्थाय महातेजा रथं हरिरथोपमम्|
जगाम सहसा तत्र यत्र युद्धमरिन्दम || ६-७३-९_END
BEGIN_
That greatly resplendent Indrajit, the annihilator of enemies, having ascended a
chariot looking like the chariot of the sun, quickly went to the battle-front._END

B_6_C_71_70
BEGIN_
चिन्तयामास चाश्वस्य विमृश्य च महाबलः || ६-७१-७५
साधु बाणनिपातेन श्वाघनीयोऽसि मे रिपुः |_END
BEGIN_
That demon of great strength, recovering his breath, reasoningly reflected as
follows: "Well! By flying down an arrow, you have become a commendable enemy for me."_END

B_6_C_69_91
BEGIN_
अथ अन्गदो राम मनः प्रहर्षणम् |
सुदुष्करम् तम् कृतवान् हि विक्रमम् |
विसिष्मिये सो अपि अतिवीर्य विक्रमः |
पुनसः च युद्धे स बभूव हर्षितः || ६-६९-९६_END
BEGIN_
Then, that Angada, who showed that forcible means, which was very difficult to do,
and which rejoiced Rama's intellect. So much so, Angada too was surprised. Thereupon Angada, of
terrible acts, was infused with vigour and again showed enthusiasm in battle._END

B_6_C_67_107
BEGIN_
इत्युक्तवाक्यम् तद्रक्षः प्रोवाच स्तुतिसंहितम् |
मृधे घोरतरं वाक्यं सौमित्रिः प्रहसन्निव || ६-६७-११३_END
BEGIN_
To that demon in battle, who has given his opinion thus, abounding in enology,
Lakshmana as though bursting with laughter, spoke the following extremely terrific words:_END

B_6_C_73_9
BEGIN_
तं प्रस्थितं महात्मानमनुजग्मुर्महाबलाः|
संहर्षमाणा बहवो धनुःप्रवरपाणयः || ६-७३-१०
गजस्कन्धगताः के चित्के चित्परमवाजिभिः|
व्याघ्रवृश्चिकमार्जारखरोष्ट्ट्रैश्च भुजम्गमैः || ६-७३-११
वराहैः श्वापदैः सिम्हैर्जम्बुकैः पर्वतोपमैः |
काकहंसमयूरैश्च राक्षसा भीमविक्रमाः || ६-७३-१२
प्रासमुद्गरनिस्त्रिंश परश्वधगदाधराः |
भुशुण्डिमुद्गरायष्टिशतग्नीपरिघायुधाः || ६-७३-१३_END
BEGIN_
Many mighty demons with terrific prowess, with joy, holding excellent bows in their
hands, carrying lances, sharp-edged spears, swords, axes and maces as also armed with Bhushundis
(probably a kind of fire arms), mallets, cudgels, Shataghnis (cylindrical piece of wood studded
with iron spikes) and iron rods, followed that great souled Indrajit. Some rode on the back of
elephants, some ascended excellent horses, tigers, scorpions, cats, donkeys and camels,
looking._END

B_6_C_71_71
BEGIN_
विचार्यैवम् विनम्यास्यं विनम्य च भुजावुभौ || ६-७१-७६
स रथोपस्थमास्थाय रथेन प्रचचार ह |_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking with his mouth wide open, Atikaya bent down with his large shoulder,
ascended the top of his chariot and roamed about hither and thither by his chariot._END

B_6_C_67_108
BEGIN_
यस्त्वं शक्रादिभिर्वीरैरसह्यः प्राप्य पौरुषम् |
तत्सत्यम् नान्यथा वीर दृष्टस्तेऽद्य पराक्रमः || ६-६७-११४
एष दाशरथी रामस्तिष्ठत्यद्रिरिवाचलः |_END
BEGIN_
"O brave demon! You are telling that while you show your prowess, the heroes like
Indra and others feel unbearable; it is true. Just now, I have seen your prowess. But, see Rama the
son of Dasaratha, standing here unmoving like a mountain."_END

B_6_C_73_10
BEGIN_
स शङ्खनिनदैर्भीमैर्भेरीणां च महास्वनैः|
जगाम त्रिदशेन्द्रारिः स्तूयमानो निशाचरैः || ६-७३-१४_END
BEGIN_
That valiant Indrajit swiftly went to the battle-field with full blasts of couches
and kettle-drums._END

B_6_C_71_72
BEGIN_
एकम् त्रीन्पञ्च सप्तेति सायकान्राक्षसर्षभः || ६-७१-७७
आददे सन्दधे चापि विचकर्षोत्ससर्ज च |_END
BEGIN_
Atikaya, the foremost of demons, seized hold of one, three, five and seven arrows
and fixed them to his bow, stretched it and released the arrows._END

B_6_C_67_109
BEGIN_
इति श्रुत्वा ह्यनादृत्य लक्ष्मणम् स निशाचरः || ६-६७-११५
अतिक्रम्य च सौमित्रिम् कुम्भकर्णो महाबलः |
राममेवाभिदुद्राव दारयन्निव मेदिनीम् || ६-६७-११६_END
BEGIN_
Hearing in this manner, that mighty Kumbhakarna the demon, brushing aside Lakshmana
and crossing him, ran, as though he is causing an earth-quake, towards Rama._END

B_6_C_73_11
BEGIN_
स शङ्खशशिवर्णेन छत्रेण रिपुसादनः|
रराज परिपूर्णेन नभश्चन्द्रमसा यथा || ६-७३-१५_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit, the tormentator of enemies, with a parasol white as a couch and the moon,
shone like the sky with the full moon._END

B_6_C_71_73
BEGIN_
ते बाणाः कालसङ्काशा राक्षसेन्द्रधनुश्च्युताः || ६-७१-७८
हेमपुङ्खा रविप्रख्याश्चक्रुर्दीप्तमिवाम्बरम् |_END
BEGIN_
Those arrows, released from the bow of Atikaya, the leader of demons, appearing as
Death, with golden shafts and shining like the sun, set the sky ablaze._END

B_6_C_67_110
BEGIN_
अथ दाशरथी रामो रौद्रमस्त्रं प्रयोजयन् |
कुम्भकर्णस्य हृदये ससर्ज निशितान् शरान् || ६-६७-११७_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Rama, the son of Dasaratha, employing a spell (used to charm arrows)
called Raudra, discharged sharp arrows into Kumbhakarna's chest._END

B_6_C_73_12
BEGIN_
अवीज्यत ततो वीरो हैमैर्हेमविभूषितैः|
चारुचामरमुख्यैश्च मुख्यः सर्वधनुष्मताम् || ६-७३-१६_END
BEGIN_
The valiant Indrajit, the foremost among all the wielders of bow and decked with
gold ornaments, was being fanned then with supremely charming whisks with handles of gold._END

B_6_C_71_74
BEGIN_
ततस्तान्राक्षसोत्सृष्टाञ्शरौघान्रावणानुजः || ६-७१-७९
असम्भ्रान्तः प्रचिच्छेद निशितैर्बहुभिः शरैः |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Lakshmana coolly chopped off those gluts of arrows released by that
foremost of demons, by the multitude of his sharp arrows._END

B_6_C_67_111
BEGIN_
तस्य रामेण विद्धस्य सहसाभिप्रधावतः |
अङ्गारमिश्राः क्रुद्धस्य मुखान्निश्चेरुरर्चिषः || ६-६७-११८_END
BEGIN_
Flames of fire mixed with particles of charcoal came forth from the face of
Kumbhakarna, who was thus struck and who was running quickly towards Rama._END

B_6_C_73_13
BEGIN_
स तु दृष्ट्वा विनिर्यान्तम् बलेन महता वृतम् |
राक्षसाधिपतिः श्रीमान् रावणः पुत्रमब्रवीत् || ६-७३-१७_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that son setting out with a large army, that glorious Ravana, the king of
demons, spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_71_75
BEGIN_
ताञ्शरान्युधि सम्प्रेक्ष्य निकृत्तान्रावणात्मजः || ६-७१-८०
चुकोप त्रिदशेन्द्रारिर्जग्राह निशितम् शरम् |_END
BEGIN_
That Atikaya, of great splendour, fixing that arrow to his bow and by instantly
releasing it, struck the approaching Lakshmana in the middle of his chest._END

B_6_C_73_14
BEGIN_
त्वमप्रतिरथः पुत्र त्वया वै वासवो जितः |
किम्पुनर्मानुषम् धृष्यम् निहनिष्यसि राघवम् || ६-७३-१८
तथोक्तो राक्षसेन्द्रेण प्रत्यगृह्णान्महाश्षः |_END
BEGIN_
"O my dear son! There is no charioteer who can stand you as your rival. Indra the
lord of celestials was conquered by you. You can kill Rama, a mere human being, who is assailable.
How much more can I tell?" After hearing these words of Ravana Indrajit accepted his great
blessings._END

B_6_C_67_112
BEGIN_
रामस्त्रविद्धो घोरम् वै नर्दन् राक्षसपुंगनः |
अभ्यधावत तम् क्रुद्धो हरीन् विद्रावयन् रणे || ६-६७-११९_END
BEGIN_
That foremost among demons, struck by Rama's arrow, roaring terribly with rage,
making the monkeys to run away in battle, ran himself towards Rama._END

B_6_C_71_76
BEGIN_
स सन्धाय महातेजास्तं बाणम् सहसोत्सृजत् || ६-७१-८१
ततः सौमित्रिमायान्तमाजघान स्तनान्तरे |_END
BEGIN_
That Atikaya, of great splendour, fixing that arrow to his bow and by instantly
releasing it, struck the approaching Lakshmana in the middle of his chest._END

B_6_C_73_15
BEGIN_
ततस्त्विन्द्रजिता लङ्का सूर्यप्रतिमतेजसा || ६-७३-१९
रराजाप्रतिवीर्येण द्यौरिवार्केण भास्वता |_END
BEGIN_
With that Indrajit, having a splendour equal to that of the sun and having no
warrior who can stand him as his rival, the City of Lanka shone, like the sky shining with the
sun._END

B_6_C_67_113
BEGIN_
तस्योरसि निमग्नाश्च शरा बर्हिणवाससः |
हस्ताच्चास्य परिभ्रष्टा गदा चोर्व्याम् पपात ह || ६-६७-१२०_END
BEGIN_
Those arrows, adorned with peacock's plumes, penetrated into his chest. His mace
dropped off from his hand and fell on the ground._END

B_6_C_71_77
BEGIN_
अतिकायेन सौमित्रिस्ताडितो युधि वक्षसि || ६-७१-८२
सुस्राव रुधिरम् तीव्रं मदं मत्त इव द्विपः |_END
BEGIN_
Struck in battle by Atikaya in his chest, Lakshmana oozed out blood severely, like
the fluid exuding from a rutting elephant._END

B_6_C_73_16
BEGIN_
स सम्प्राप्य महातेजा युद्धभूमिमरिन्दमः || ६-७३- २०
स्थापयामास रक्षांसि रथं प्रति समन्ततः |_END
BEGIN_
Reaching the battle-field, Indrajit of great splendour, the annihilator of enemies,
stationed his demons around his chariot._END

B_6_C_67_114
BEGIN_
आयुधानि च सर्वाणि समकीर्यन्त भूतले |
स निरायुधमात्मानम् यदा मेने महाबलः || ६-६७-१२१
मुष्टिभ्याम् च कराभ्याम् च चकार कदनम् महत् |_END
BEGIN_
All his weapons fell scattered on the ground. Considering himself as weaponless,
that mighty Kumbhakarna then fought fiercely with his fists and arms._END

B_6_C_73_17
BEGIN_
ततस्तु हुतभोक्तारं हुतभुक्सदृशप्रभः || ६-७३- २१
जुहुवे राक्षसश्रेष्ठो मन्त्रवद्विधिवत्तदा |_END
BEGIN_
Then, that foremost of demons, having a radiance equal to that of fire, with
excellent sacrificial incantations, performed a sacrifice, as per rules, making an oblation to the
fire._END

B_6_C_71_78
BEGIN_
स चकार तदात्मानम् विशल्यं सहसा विभुः || ६-७१-८३
जग्राह च शरम् तीष्णमस्त्रेणापि समादधे |_END
BEGIN_
That powerful Lakshmana, then quickly made himself freed from that arrow-head, took
up a sharp arrow and fixed it with a missile._END

B_6_C_67_115
BEGIN_
स बाणैरतिविद्धाङ्गः क्षतजेन समुक्षितः || ६-६७-१२२
रुधिरम् परिसुस्राव गिरिः प्रस्रावणम् यथा |_END
BEGIN_
That Kumbhakarna, with his body struck fiercely by arrows and bathed in blood,
poured forth blood, even as a mountain would pour forth a cascade._END

B_6_C_73_18
BEGIN_
स हविर्जालसंस्कारैर्माल्यगन्धपुरस्कृतैः || ६-७३-२२
जुहुवे पावकं तत्र राक्षसेन्द्रः प्रतापवान् |_END
BEGIN_
That valiant leader of demons offered oblations to fire there, with garlands and
pounded sandalwood, including clarified butter and parched grain._END

B_6_C_71_79
BEGIN_
आग्नेयेन तदास्त्रेण योजयामास सायकम् || ६-७१-८४
स जज्वाल तदा बाणो धनुश्चास्य महात्मनः |_END
BEGIN_
When Lakshmana employed the missile of fire on his arrow, that arrow of the great
souled Lakshmana and as also the bow, caused a flame to blaze._END

B_6_C_67_116
BEGIN_
स तीव्रेण च कोपेन रुधिरेण च मूर्छितः |
वानरान्राक्षसानृक्षान् खादन् स परिधावति || ६-६७-१२३_END
BEGIN_
With a terrific wrath, he felt insensible with blood. He roamed about, devouring the
monkeys, demons and bears._END

B_6_C_71_80
BEGIN_
अतिकायोऽतितेजस्वी सौरमस्त्रम् समाददे || ६-७१-८५
तेन बाणं भुजङ्गाभम् हेमपुङ्खमयोजयत् |_END
BEGIN_
Atikaya of great splendour took up a solar missile and employed it on that arrow,
having a golden shaft as also looking like a serpent._END

B_6_C_73_19
BEGIN_
शस्त्राणि शरपत्राणि समिधोऽथ विभीतकः || ६-७३-२३
लोहितानि च वासांसि स्रुवं कार्ष्णायसं तथा |_END
BEGIN_
That sacrificial rite was performed with weapons serving as reeds, chips of
Vibhishaka tree serving as fuel, then using red pieces of cloth and the sacrificial ladle made of
iron._END

B_6_C_67_117
BEGIN_
अथ शृङ्गम् समाविध्य भीमम् भीमपराक्रमः |
चिक्षेप राममुद्दिश्य बलवानन्तकोपमः || ६-६७-१२४_END
BEGIN_
Then, that Kumbhakarna, comparable to Yama the god of death, of terrific prowess and
strength, firmly holding a fearful mountain-peak, hurled it towards Rama._END

B_6_C_71_81
BEGIN_
ततस्तम् ज्वलितं घोरम् लक्ष्मणः शरमाहितम् || ६-७१-८६
अतिकायाय चिक्षेप कालदण्डमिवान्तकः |_END
BEGIN_
Meanwhile, Lakshmana hurled at Atikaya, that blazing and awful arrow employed with
that mystic missile as Yama the lord of Death would hurl his rod of destruction._END

B_6_C_73_20
BEGIN_
स तत्राग्निं समास्तीर्य शरपत्रैः सतोमरैः || ६-७३-२४
छागस्य सर्वकृष्णस्य गलं जग्राह जीवतः |_END
BEGIN_
Duly spreading fire with reeds (in the form of other weapons) accompanied by lances
there, Indrajit elapsed the neck of a live goat of dark hue (for offering it to the fire as an
oblation)._END

B_6_C_67_118
BEGIN_
अप्राप्तमन्तरा रामः सप्तभीस्तमजिह्मगैः |
चिच्छेद गिरिशृङ्गम् तम् पुनः संधाय कार्मुकम् || ६-६७-१२५_END
BEGIN_
Wile that mountain peak was still on its way and had not yet reached him Rama,
fixing together his well-known bow and arrows, split the mountain in the middle, with seven
straight-going arrows._END

B_6_C_71_82
BEGIN_
आग्नेयेनाभिसम्युक्तम् दृष्ट्वा बाणं निशाचरः || ६-७१-८७
उत्ससर्ज तदा बाणम् दीप्तम् सूर्यास्त्रयोजितम् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that arrow charged with a mystic missile of fire, Atikaya the demon then
released the awful arrow charged with the solar missile._END

B_6_C_73_21
BEGIN_
सकृदेव समिद्धस्य विधूमस्य महार्चिषः || ६-७३-२५
बभूवुस्तानि लिङ्गानि विजयं यान्यदर्शयन् |_END
BEGIN_
From the great fire of flames, set ablaze by that offering having been thrown into
it acting at once without smoke, appeared such signs as had beckoned victory (of the past)._END

B_6_C_71_83
BEGIN_
तावुभावम्बरे बाणावन्योन्यमभिजघ्नतुः || ६-७१-८८
तेजसा सम्प्रदीप्ताग्रौ क्रुद्धाविव भुजम् गमौ |_END
BEGIN_
Those two arrows, having their points blazed in splendour, struck at each other in
the sky, like two enraged serpents._END

B_6_C_67_119
BEGIN_
ततस्तु रामो धर्मात्मा तस्य शृङ्गम् महत्तदा || ६-६७-१२६
शरैः काञ्चनचित्राङ्गै श्चिच्छेद भरतग्रज |_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama, the virtuous man and the elder brother of Bharata, split the large
mountain-peak which was hurled by Kumbhakarna at that time, with his variegated arrows made of
gold._END

B_6_C_73_22
BEGIN_
प्रदक्षिणावर्तशिखस्तप्तकाञ्चनसंनिभः || ६-७३-२६
