हविस्तत्प्रतिजग्राह पावकः स्वयमुत्थितः |_END
BEGIN_
The fire, resembling the molten gold, rising up on its own and having flames
revolving from left to right, accepted that oblation._END

B_6_C_71_84
BEGIN_
तावन्योन्यम् विनिर्दह्य पेततुर्धरणीतले || ६-७१-८९
निरर्चिषौ भस्मकृतौ न भ्राजेते शरोत्तमौ |
तावुभरु दीप्यमानौ स्म न भ्राजेते महीतले || ६-७१-९०_END
BEGIN_
Those two excellent arrows, eventhough they were both blazing, did not radiate any
longer on the earth's surface, in that they were without a flame and had been reduced to ashes._END

B_6_C_73_23
BEGIN_
सोऽस्त्रमाहारयामास ब्राह्ममस्त्रविदां वरः || ६-७३-२७
धनुश्चात्मरथं चैव सर्वं तत्राभ्यमन्त्रयत् |_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit, who was skilled in the use of mystic missiles, invoked the missile
presided over by Brahma and charged it on his bow, chariot and all._END

B_6_C_67_120
BEGIN_
तन्मेरुशिखराकारम् द्योतमानमिव श्रिया || ६-६७-१२७
द्वे शते वानराणाम् च पतमानमपातयत् |_END
BEGIN_
That mountain-peak, in the form of a peak of Mount Meru, as if shining with
splendour, while falling, caused two hundred monkeys to fall._END

B_6_C_67_121
BEGIN_
तस्मिन् काले स धर्मात्मा लक्ष्मणो राममब्रवीत् || ६-६७-१२८
कुम्भकर्णवधे युक्तो योगान्परिमृशन्बहून् |_END
BEGIN_
At that time, considering various strategies appropriate for killing Kumbhakarna,
the righteous Lakshmana spoke to Rama as follows:_END

B_6_C_73_24
BEGIN_
तस्मिन्नाहूयमानेऽस्त्रे हूयमाने च पावके || ६-७३-२८
सार्कग्रहेन्दु नक्षत्रं वितत्रास नभस्तलम् |_END
BEGIN_
While that missile was being invoked and the sacrificial fire propitiated, the
firmament including the sun, the moon, other planets and lunar mansions trembled with fear._END

B_6_C_71_85
BEGIN_
ततोऽतिकायः सङ्क्रुद्धस्त्वस्त्रमैषीकमुत्सृजत् |
तत्प्रचिच्छेद सौमित्रिरस्त्रमैन्द्रेण वीर्यवान् || ६-७१-९१_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, the enraged Atikaya released an arrow made of cane (a missile) presided
over by Tvasha (the architect of gods). Then, the valiant LakShmana chopped off that missile, by
his missile presided over by Indra the lord of celestials._END

B_6_C_73_25
BEGIN_
स पावकं पावकदीप्ततेजा |
हुत्वा महेन्द्रप्रतिमप्रभावः|
स चापबाणासिरथाश्वसूतः |
खेऽन्तर्दध आत्मानमचिन्त्यरूपः || ६-७३-२९_END
BEGIN_
Having propitiated offering in fire, Indrajit, having a splendour shining like the
fire, having a might similar to that of Indra, and possessing an unimaginable prowess, became
himself invisible in the sky, with the bow, arrows, sword, chariot, horses, charioteer and all._END

B_6_C_67_122
BEGIN_
नैवायम् वानरान्राजन्न विजानाति राक्षसान् || ६-६७-१२९
मत्तः शोणितगन्धेन स्वान् परांश्चैव खादति |_END
BEGIN_
"O king! He is not able to recognize who the monkeys are and who the demons are.
Intoxicated with the smell of blood, he is devouring his own persons and also others."_END

B_6_C_71_86
BEGIN_
ऐषीकं निहतम् दृष्ट्वा कुमारो रावणात्मजः |
याम्येनास्त्रेण सङ्क्रुद्धो योजयामास सायकम् || ६-७१-९२_END
BEGIN_
Seeing his arrow made of cane struck down, that young Atikaya was quite enraged and
fixed his arrow with a missile presided over by Yama the lord of retribution._END

B_6_C_67_123
BEGIN_
साध्वेनमधिरोहन्तु सर्वतो वानरर्षभाः || ६-६७-१३०
यूथपाश्च यथामुख्यास्तिष्ठन्त्वस्य समन्ततः |_END
BEGIN_
"Let the foremost of monkeys ascend well upon his body from all sides. Following the
commanders of their troops, let the monkey-leaders stand, surrounding him."_END

B_6_C_71_87
BEGIN_
ततस्तदस्त्रम् चिक्षेप लक्ष्मणाय निशाचरः |
वायव्येन तदस्त्रम् तु निजघान स लक्ष्मणः || ६-७१-९३_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Atikaya hurled that missile on Lakshmana. That Lakshmana struck it down
by a missile presided over by the wind-god._END

B_6_C_73_26
BEGIN_
ततो हयरथाकीर्णं पताकाध्वजशोभितम् |
निर्ययौ राक्षसबलम् नर्दमानम् युयुत्सया || ६-७३-३०_END
BEGIN_
Then, the army of demons, extensive with horses and chariots, embellished by banners
and flags, set out with a desire to fight, roaring._END

B_6_C_73_27
BEGIN_
ते शरैर्बहुभिश्चित्रैस्तीक्षणवेगैरलङ्कृतैः |
तोमरैरङ्कुशश्चापि वानरान् जघ्नुराहवे || ६-७३-३१_END
BEGIN_
They killed the monkeys in the battle-field with many wonderful and ornamental
arrows, possessing great velocity as also lances and goads._END

B_6_C_71_88
BEGIN_
अथैनम् शरधाराभिर्धाराभिरिव तोयदः |
अभ्यवर्षत सङ्क्रुद्धो लक्ष्मणो रावणात्मजम् || ६-७१-९४_END
BEGIN_
Then, the furious Lakshmana showered forth hails of arrows on Atikaya, as a rainy
cloud showers hails of down-pour._END

B_6_C_67_124
BEGIN_
अद्ययं दुर्मतिः काले गुरुभारप्रपीडितः || ६-६७-१३१
प्रपतन्राक्षसो भूमौ नान्यान्हन्यात्प्लवङ्गमान् |_END
BEGIN_
"If we do in that way, that evil-minded demon would be harassed by the huge weight,
making him to crawl on the floor and cannot kill the other monkeys."_END

B_6_C_71_89
BEGIN_
तेऽतिकायम् समासाद्य कवचे वज्रभूषिते |
भग्नाग्रशल्याः सहसा पेतुर्बाणा महीतले || ६-७१-९५_END
BEGIN_
Reaching Atikaya, those arrows with the points of their shafts shattered on his
armour, adorned with diamonds and instantly fell on the earth's surface._END

B_6_C_73_28
BEGIN_
रावणिस्तु सुसम्क्रुद्धस्तान्निरीक्ष्य निशाचरान् |
हृष्टा भवन्तो युध्यन्तु वानराणां जिघांसया || ६-७३-३२_END
BEGIN_
Seeing those demons, the most enraged Indrajit on his part spoke to them as follows:
"All of you fight enthusiastically with an intent to kill the monkeys."_END

B_6_C_67_125
BEGIN_
तस्य तद्वचनम् श्रुत्वा राजपुत्रस्य धीमतः || ६-६७-१३२
ते समारुरुहुर्हृष्टाः कुम्भकर्णं प्लवम्गमाः |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of that intelligent Lakshmana, those monkeys were rejoiced and
mounted on the body of Kumbhakarna._END

B_6_C_71_90
BEGIN_
तान्मोघानभिसम्प्रेक्ष्य लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा |
अभ्यवर्षत बाणानाम् सहस्रेण महायशाः || ६-७१-९६_END
BEGIN_
Seeing those arrows becoming unsuccessful, the highly famous Lakshmana the
annihilator of enemy-warriors, showered forth arrows in thousands._END

B_6_C_73_29
BEGIN_
ततस्ते राक्षसाः सर्वे गर्जन्तो जयकाङिक्षिणः |
अभ्यवर्षंस्ततो घोरं वानरान् शरवृष्टिभिः || ६-७३-३३_END
BEGIN_
Roaring with a desire for victory, all those demons thereafter terribly rained
showers of arrows on monkeys._END

B_6_C_67_126
BEGIN_
कुम्भकर्णस्तु सम्क्रुद्धः समारूढः प्लवम्गमैः || ६-६७-१३३
व्यधूनयत्तान्वेगेन दुष्टहस्तीव हस्तिपान् |_END
BEGIN_
Kumbhakarna, when climbed upon by the monkeys, was enraged and shook them off with
violence, as a vicious elephant would shake off its mahout._END

B_6_C_73_30
BEGIN_
स तु नालीकनाराचैर्गदाभिर्मुसलैरपि |
रक्षोभिः संवृतः संख्ये वानरान् विचकर्त ह || ६-७३-३४_END
BEGIN_
That Indrajit, on his part, along with his demons in the battle-field, destroyed the
monkeys with Nalika (broad-headed) arrows, steel arrows, maces and clubs._END

B_6_C_67_127
BEGIN_
तान्दृष्ट्वा निर्धूतान्रामो रुष्टोऽयमिति राक्षसः || ६-६७-१३४
समुत्पपात वेगेन धनुरुत्तममाददे |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the monkeys shaken down, Rama on his part understanding that he was enraged,
jumped up speedily towards the demon and took an excellent bow._END

B_6_C_71_91
BEGIN_
स वर्ष्यमाणो बाणौघैरतिकायो महाबलः |
अवध्यकवचः सङ्ख्ये राक्षसो नैव विव्यथे || ६-७१-९७_END
BEGIN_
Atikaya, that mighty demon, though deluged with a flood of arrows, was not agitated
in battle because of the inviolability of his armour._END

B_6_C_73_31
BEGIN_
ते वध्यमानाः समरे वानराः पादपायुधाः |
अभ्यवर्षन्त सहसा रावणिं शैलपादपैः || ६-७३-३५_END
BEGIN_
Those monkeys, wielding trees as their weapons, being struck in the battle-field,
quickly rained mountains and trees on Indrajit._END

B_6_C_71_92
BEGIN_
शरं चाशीविषाकारं लक्ष्मणाय व्यपासृजत् |
स तेन विद्धः सौमित्रिर्मर्मदेशे शरेण ह || ६-७१-९८
मुहूर्तमात्रं निःसम्ज्ञो ह्यभव च्छत्रुतापनः |_END
BEGIN_
Atikaya released an arrow having a serpent-like form on Lakshmana. Struck by that
arrow on his vital parts, that Lakshmana, the tormentator of his enemies, felt unconscious just for
a moment._END

B_6_C_67_128
BEGIN_
क्रोधरक्तेक्षणो वीरो निर्दहन्निव चक्षुषा || ६-६७-१३५
राघवो राक्षसम् रोषादभिदुद्राव वेगितः |
यूथपान् हर्षयन् सर्वान् कुम्भकर्णभयार्दितान् || ६-६७-१३६_END
BEGIN_
The heroic Rama, enraged with red-hot eyes, as though he was scorching the enemy
with his looks, walked with speed, causing delight to all the leaders of the monkey-troops, who
were tormented with the fear of Kumbhakarna and quickly marched towards the demon._END

B_6_C_73_32
BEGIN_
इन्द्रजित्तु तदा क्रुद्धो महातेजा महाबलः |
वानराणां शरीराणि व्य्धमद्रावणात्मजः || ६-७३-३६_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit the son of Ravana, on his part, possessing great splendour and great
strength, was enraged and wounded the bodies of the monkeys._END

B_6_C_71_93
BEGIN_
ततः सम्ज्ञामुपालभ्य चतुर्भिः सायतोत्तमैः || ६-७१-९९
निजघान हयान् संख्ये सारथिम् च महाबलः |
ध्वजस्योन्मथनम् कृत्वा शरवर्षै ररिंदमः|| ६-७१-१००_END
BEGIN_
Having regained his consciousness, the mighty Lakshmana, the annihilator of enemies,
with his flood of arrows threw down the flag-staff and killed the horses and the charioteer in
combat, with his four excellent arrows._END

B_6_C_67_129
BEGIN_
स चापमादाय भुजङ्गकल्पं |
दृढज्यमुग्रम् तपनीयचित्रम् |
हरीन्समाश्वास्य समुत्पपात |
रामो निबद्धोत्तमतूणबाणः || ६-६७-१३७_END
BEGIN_
Taking in his hand, a terrific bow with a firmly fastened cord looking like a snake
and looking variegated with its crust of gold, with a quiver full of excellent arrows fastened on
his back and fully restoring the monkeys to confidence, that Rama quickly marched forward._END

B_6_C_73_33
BEGIN_
शरेणैकेन च हरीन्नव पञ्च च सप्त च |
बिभेद समरे क्रुद्धो राक्षसान् संप्रहर्षयन् || ६-७३-३७_END
BEGIN_
Bringing enormous delight to the demons that enraged Indrajit severed off the
monkeys by nines, fives and sevens with a single arrow._END

B_6_C_71_94
BEGIN_
असंभ्रान्तः स सौमित्रिस्तान् शरानभिलक्षितान् |
मुमोच लक्ष्मणो बाणान् वधार्थं तस्य रक्षसः || ६-७१-१०१_END
BEGIN_
Free from flurry, that Lakshmana, the son of Sumitra, released those arrows, exactly
aiming at that demon, for the purpose of killing him._END

B_6_C_67_130
BEGIN_
स वानरगणैस्तैस्तु वृतः परमदुर्जयः |
लक्ष्मणानुचरो रामः सम्प्रतस्थे महाबलः || ६-६७-१३८_END
BEGIN_
That mighty and heroic Rama, who was highly unconquerable, accompanied by Lakshmana,
duly marched forward, surrounded by those troops of monkeys._END

B_6_C_71_95
BEGIN_
न शशाक रुजम् कर्तुम् युधि तस्य नरोत्तमः |
अथैनमभ्युपागम्य वायुर्वाक्यमुवाच ह || ६-७१-१०२_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana, the best among men, was not able to afflict any injury to Atikaya in
battle. Then, the wind-god came to him and spoke to him as follows:_END

B_6_C_73_34
BEGIN_
स शरैः सूर्यसम्काशैः शातकुम्भविभूषणैः |
वानरान् समरे वीरः प्रममाथ सुदुर्जयः || ६-७३-३८_END
BEGIN_
That most invincible chief of demons, with arrows decked with gold, having
brilliance equal to the sun, destroyed the monkeys in battle._END

B_6_C_67_131
BEGIN_
स ददर्श महात्मानम् किरीटिनमरिन्दमम् |
शोणितावृतरक्ताक्षम् कुम्भकर्णं महाबलम् || ६-६७-१३९_END
BEGIN_
The mighty Rama saw the powerful Kumbhakarna, the annihilator of enemies, wearing a
crown and his eyes blood-red with anger._END

B_6_C_71_96
BEGIN_
ब्रह्मदत्तवरो ह्येष अवध्य कवचावृतः |
ब्राह्मेणास्त्रेण भिन्ध्येनमेष वध्यो हि नान्यथा || ६-७१-१०३
अवध्य एष ह्यन्येषामस्त्राणाम् कवची बली |_END
BEGIN_
"He, endowed with a boon by Brahma the lord of creation, is cloaked by inviolable
armour. Split him with a missile of Brahma. He cannot be killed by any other means. The mighty
Atikaya, with that armour, cannot be destroyed by other missiles."_END

B_6_C_67_132
BEGIN_
सर्वान् समभिधावन्तम् यथा रुष्टम् दिशागजम् |
मार्गमाणम् हरीन् क्रुद्धं राक्षसैः परिवारितम् || ६-६७-१४०_END
BEGIN_
Rama saw the angry Kumbhakarna, chasing all, like the mythical elephant guarding one
of the quarters, searching for the monkeys, enraged as he was and surrounded by the demons._END

B_6_C_73_35
BEGIN_
ते भिन्नगात्राः समरे वानराः शरपीडिताः |
पेतुर्मथितसंकल्पाः सुरैरिव महासुराः || ६-७३-३९_END
BEGIN_
Those monkeys, tormented by the arrows in battle, with their limbs severed, fell
down with their aspirations shaken, like the great demons fallen down by the celestials._END

B_6_C_71_97
BEGIN_
ततः स वायोर्वचनं निशम्य |
सौमित्रिरिन्द्रप्रतिमानवीर्यः |
समाददे बाणममोघवेगं |
तद्ब्राह्ममस्त्रम् सहसा नियोज्य || ६-७१-१०४_END
BEGIN_
Then, hearing the words of the wind-god, Lakshmana having a prowess equal to that of
Indra the lord of celestials, adjusting his arrow with a missile presided over by Vrahma, quickly
directed the arrow with a terrific force._END

B_6_C_67_133
BEGIN_
विन्ध्यमन्दरसम्काशम् काञ्चनाङ्गदभूषणम् |
स्रवन्तम् रुधिरं वक्त्राद्वर्षमेघमिवोत्थितम् || ६-६७-१४१_END
BEGIN_
Rama saw that Kumbhakarna, looking like Vindhya and Mandara mountains, adorned with
armlets of gold, emitting blood from his mouth and appearing as a rising rainy cloud._END

B_6_C_73_36
BEGIN_
ते तपन्तमिवादित्यं घोरै र्बाणगभस्तिभिः |
अभ्याधावन्त सम्क्रुद्धाः सम्युगे वानरर्षभाः || ६-७३-४०_END
BEGIN_
Those excellent monkeys with anger attacked Indrajit, who was tormenting them like
the sun with his terrific ray-like the sun with his terrific ray-like arrows._END

B_6_C_71_98
BEGIN_
तस्मिन्वरास्त्रे तु नियुज्यमाने |
सौमित्रिणा बाणवरे शिताग्रे |
दिशः सचन्द्रार्कमहाग्रहाश् च |
नभश्च तत्रास ररास चोर्वी || ६-७१-१०५_END
BEGIN_
While fixing that excellent missile on that superior sharp-pointed arrow by
Lakshmana, all the quarters, the sun, the moon, the great planets and the sky were frightened.
Earth also made an uproar._END

B_6_C_67_134
BEGIN_
जिह्वया परिलिह्यन्तम् सृक्किणी शोणितोक्षितम् |
मृद्नन्तम् वानरानीकम् कालान्तकयमोपमम् || ६-६७-१४२_END
BEGIN_
Rama saw that Kumbhakarna, who was licking the corners of his mouth which were
bathed in blood, all they way trampling the monkeys and resembling Yama in the form of
all-destroying time._END

B_6_C_73_37
BEGIN_
ततस्तु वानराः सर्वे भिन्नदेहा विचेतसः |
व्यथिता विद्रवन्ति स्म रुधिरेण समुक्षिताः || ६-७३-४१_END
BEGIN_
Then, all the monkeys, with their bodies severed, having lost their consciousness
and perturbed as they were, having their limbs dampened with blood, took to their heels._END

B_6_C_71_99
BEGIN_
तं ब्रह्मणोऽस्त्रेण नियुज्य चापे |
शरम् सुपुङ्खं यमदूतकल्पम् |
सौमित्रिरिन्द्रारिसुतस्य तस्य |
ससर्ज बाणम् युधि वज्रकल्पम् || ६-७१-१०६_END
BEGIN_
Having charged the missile of Brahma on that arrow with the feathers and all, equal
to a messenger of Yama the lord of Death over his bow, Lakshmana released that arrow looking like a
thunderbolt on Atikaya, the son of Ravana._END

B_6_C_73_38
BEGIN_
तामस्यार्थे पराक्रम्य वानरास्त्यक्तजीविताः |
नर्दन्तस्तेऽनिवृत्तास्तु समरे सशिलायुधाः || ६-७३-४२_END
BEGIN_
Those monkeys, wielding mountains as their weapons, roaring in the battle field,
without turning back, abandoned their lives, showing their courage for the sake of Rama._END

B_6_C_67_135
BEGIN_
तम् दृष्ट्वा राक्षसश्रेष्ठं प्रदीप्तानलवर्चसं |
विस्फारयामास तदा कार्मुकं पुरुषर्षभः || ६-६७-१४३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that Kumbhakarna, the foremost of demons, having a splendour of blazing fire,
Rama, the excellent of men, then stretched his bow._END

B_6_C_71_100
BEGIN_
तम् लक्ष्मणोत्सृष्टममोघवेगं |
समापतन्तम् ज्वलनप्रकाशम् |
सुवर्णवज्रोत्तमचित्रपुङ्खं |
तदातिकायः समरे ददर्श || ६-७१-१०७_END
BEGIN_
Atikaya saw that arrow, released with augmented force by Lakshmana, moving so fastly
as the wind, having beautiful wings with variegated feathers and looking like a thunderous
thunderbolt, approaching him in battle._END

B_6_C_67_136
BEGIN_
स तस्य चापनिर्घोषात्कुपितो नैरृतर्षभः |
अमृष्यमाणस्तम् घोषमभिदुद्राव राघवम् || ६-६७-१४४_END
BEGIN_
Enraged by the twang of Rama's bow, Kumbhakarna, the foremost of demons, not
tolerating that sound, ran towards Rama._END

B_6_C_73_39
BEGIN_
ते द्रुमैः पर्वताग्रैश्च शिलाभिश्च प्लवंगमाः |
अभ्यवर्षन्त समरे रावणिं समवस्थिताः || ६-७३-४३_END
BEGIN_
Continuing to stay in the battle-field, those monkeys rained trees, mountain-peaks
and rocks on Indrajit._END

B_6_C_71_101
BEGIN_
तं प्रेक्षमाणः सहसातिकायो |
जघान बाणैर्निशितैरनेकैः |
स सायकस्तस्य सुपर्णवेगस् |
तदातिवेगेन जगाम पार्श्वम् || ६-७१-१०८_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that arrow, Atikaya quickly struck with several sharp arrows. That
Lakshmana's arrow, with a speed equal to Garuda the eagle, thus reached Atikaya's proximity._END

B_6_C_67_137
BEGIN_
ततस्तु वातोद्धतमेघकल्पं |
भुजम्गराजोत्तमभोगबाहुम् |
तमापतन्तम् धरणीधराभम् |
उवाच रामो युधि कुम्भकर्णम् || ६-६७-१४५_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Rama spoke to the dashing Kumbhakarna looking like a cloud driven by the
wind, whose arms were like the coils of Vasuki (the king of serpents) and appearing like a mountain
in the battle-field (as follows):_END

B_6_C_73_40
BEGIN_
तं द्रुमाणाम् शिलानां च वर्षं प्राणहरं महत् |
व्यपोहत महातेजा रावणिः समितिंजयः || ६-७३-४४_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit of great splendour and the conqueror of battles, kept off that great rain
of deadly hail of trees and rocks._END

B_6_C_71_102
BEGIN_
तमागतं प्रेक्ष्य तदातिकायो बाणं प्रदीप्तान्तककालकल्पम् |
जघान शक्त्यृष्टिगदाकुठारैः शूलैर्हलैश्चाप्यविपन्नचेष्टः || ६-७१-१०९_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that blazing arrow, looking like Yama the lord of Death and black in colour,
approaching him, Atikaya then struck it with spike, spear, mace, axe and arrows._END

B_6_C_67_138
BEGIN_
आगच्छ रक्षोऽधिपमा विषादम् |
अवस्थितोऽहं प्रगृहीतचापः |
अवेहि माम् राक्षसवंशवाशनम् |
अयं मुहूर्ताद्भविता विचेताः || ६-६७-१४६_END
BEGIN_
"O leader of the demons! Come on. Do not regret. I sand, wielding a bow in my hand.
Know me to be the annihilator of the race of demons. You will be dead within a moment."_END

B_6_C_73_41
BEGIN_
ततः पावकसंकाशैः शरैराशीविषोपमैः |
वानराणामनीकानि बिभेद समरे प्रभुः || ६-७३-४५_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, the capable Indrajit with his arrows, identical of fire and looking like
serpents in battle, split the armies of monkeys._END

B_6_C_71_103
BEGIN_
तान्यायुधान्यद्भुतविग्रहाणि |
मोघानि कृत्वा स शरोऽग्निदीप्तः |
प्रसह्य तस्यैव किरीटजुष्टं |
तदातिकायस्य शिरो जहार || ६-७१-११०_END
BEGIN_
Then, that arrow, blazing like fire, made in vain those weapons of wonderful form
and taking Atikaya's head, carried it away._END

B_6_C_73_42
BEGIN_
अष्टादशशरैस्तीक्षणैः स विद्ध्वा गन्धमादनम् |
विव्याध नवभिश्चैव नलं दूरादवस्थितम् || ६-७३-४६_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit struck Gandhamadana with eighteen sharp arrows and also struck Neela, who
was standing at a far-away place, with nine arrows._END

B_6_C_67_139
BEGIN_
रामोऽयमिति विज्ञाय जहास विकृतस्वनम् |
अभ्यधावत सम्क्रुद्धो हरीन्विद्रावयन् रणे || ६-६७-१४७_END
BEGIN_
Coming to know that he was Rama, Kumbhakarna laughed in a rebellious tone and ran up
enraged towards the monkeys, driving them away in the battle-field._END

B_6_C_73_43
BEGIN_
सप्तभिस्तु महावीर्यो मैन्दं मर्मविदारणैः |
पञ्चभिर्विशिखैश्चैव गजम् विव्याध संयुगे || ६-७३-४७_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit having a great prowess, struck Mainda with seven arrows, which can tear
asunder vital parts and also struck Gaja with five arrows in battle._END

B_6_C_67_140
BEGIN_
दारयन्निव सर्वेषां हृदयानि वनौकसाम् |
प्रहस्य विकृतं भीमम् स मेघस्वनितोपमम् || ६-६७-१४८
कुम्भकर्णो महातेजा राघवं वाक्यमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
That Kumbhakarna of great splendour, as though bursting the hearts of all the
monkeys, laughed unnaturally as also awfully and spoke the following words to Rama:_END

B_6_C_71_104
BEGIN_
तच्छिरः सशिरस्त्राणम् लक्ष्मणेषुप्रपीडितम् |
पपात सहसा भूमौ शृङ्गम् हिमवतो यथा || ६-७१-१११_END
BEGIN_
That head with its diadem, chopped off by Lakshmana, quickly fell down on the
ground, like a peak of the Himalayan Mountain._END

B_6_C_73_44
BEGIN_
जाम्बवन्तं तु दशभिर्नीलं त्रिंशद्भिरेव च |
सुग्रीवमृषभं चैव सोऽङ्गदम् द्विविदं तथा || ६-७३-४८
घोरैर्दत्तवरैस्तीक्षणैर्निष्प्रानकरोत्तदा |_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit then struck Jambavan with ten arrows and Nila with thirty arrows. He also
struck Sugreeva, Rishabha, Angada and Dvivida with sharp and terrific arrows endowed with boons and
made them breathless._END

B_6_C_71_105
BEGIN_
तं भूमौ पतितं दृष्ट्वा विक्षिप्ताम्बरभूषणम् |
बभूवुर्व्यथिताः सर्वे हरशेषा निशाचराः|| ६-७१-११२_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Atikaya falling on the ground, with his clothes and ornaments scattered away,
all the surviving demons became perturbed._END

B_6_C_67_141
BEGIN_
नाहम्न् विराधो विज्ञेयो न कबन्धः खरो न च |
न वाली न च मारीचः कुम्भकर्णोऽहमागतः || ६-६७-१४९_END
BEGIN_
'I am neither to be considered as Viradha nor Kabandha nor Khara nor Vali nor
Maricha. It is Kumbhakarna who arrived here."_END

B_6_C_73_45
BEGIN_
अन्यानपि तदा मुख्यान्वानरान् बहुभिः शरैः || ६-७३-४९
अर्दयामास सम्क्रुद्धः कालाग्निरिव मूर्चितः |_END
BEGIN_
That enraged Indrajit, then looking like an excited fire that is to destroy the
world, tormented other chiefs of monkeys too with many arrows._END

B_6_C_71_106
BEGIN_
ते विषण्णमुखा दीनाः प्रहारजनितश्रमाः |
विनेदुरुच्चैर्बहवः सहसा विस्वरैः स्वरैः|| ६-७१-११३_END
BEGIN_
Many of those depressed demons, dejected as they were, showing fatigue born of
fighting, in their faces, suddenly began to shout loudly, with their voices in discordant
notes._END

B_6_C_67_142
BEGIN_
पश्य मे मुद्गरम् भीमम् सर्वकालायसं महत् |
अनेन निर्जिता देवा दानवाश्च मया पुरा || ६-६७-१५०_END
BEGIN_
"See my large terrific hammer, completely made of iron. By it, the celestials and
the demons were conquered by me before."_END

B_6_C_73_46
BEGIN_
स शरैः सूर्यसम्काशैः सुमुखैः शीग्रगामिभिः || ६-७३-५०
वानराणामनीकानि निर्ममन्थ महारणे |_END
BEGIN_
He harassed the armies of monkeys' fast-moving arrows looking like the sun in their
splendour._END

B_6_C_71_107
BEGIN_
ततस्तत्परितो याता निरपेक्षा निशाचराः |
पुरीमभिमुखा भीता द्रवन्तो नायके हते || ६-७१-११४_END
BEGIN_
As their leader was dead, the demons were then frightened and becoming indifferent
to fight, went running away all around, with their faces turned towards that City of Lanka._END

B_6_C_67_143
BEGIN_
विकर्णनास इति मां नावज्ञातुम् त्वमर्हसि |
स्वल्पापि हि न मे पीडा कर्णनासाविनाशनात् || ६-६७-१५१_END
BEGIN_
"You need not treat me with contempt, as I am deprived of my ear and nose. To me,
there is no agony even indeed a little, for having lost the ear and the nose."_END

B_6_C_71_108
BEGIN_
प्रहर्षयुक्ता बहवस्तु वानरा |
प्रबुद्धपद्मप्रतिमाननास्तदा |
अपूजयम्ल्लक्ष्मणमिष्टभागिनं |
हते रिपौ भीमबले दुरासदे || ६-७१-११५_END
BEGIN_
When the dangerous demon with the terrific strength was killed, the multitude of
monkeys then were endowed with a great delight, with their faces looking like full blown lotuses
and worshipped Lakshmana who got his desire fulfilled._END

B_6_C_73_47
BEGIN_
आकुलां वानरीम् सेनां शरजालेन पीडिताम् || ६-७३-५१
हृष्टः स परया प्रीत्या ददर्श क्षतजोक्षिताम् |_END
BEGIN_
That enthusiastic Indrajit, with a great pleasure, saw that exclusive army of
monkeys, drenched in blood and tormented by a multitude of arrows._END

B_6_C_67_144
BEGIN_
दर्शयेक्ष्वाकुशार्दूल वीर्यम् गात्रेषु मे लघु |
ततस्त्वां भक्षयिष्यामि दृष्टपौरुषविक्रमम् || ६-६७-१५२_END
BEGIN_
"O faultless excellent Rama born in Ikshavaku dynasty! Show your prowess on my
limbs. After seeing your strength and prowess, I will be devouring you."_END

B_6_C_71_109
BEGIN_
अतिबल मतिकायमभ्रकल्पं |
युधि विनिपात्य स लक्ष्मणः प्रहृष्टः |
त्वरितमथ तदा स रामपार्श्वं
कपिनिवहैश्च सुपूजितो जगाम || ६-७१-११६_END
BEGIN_
Throwing down in battle, that Atikaya who was exceedingly strong and looking like a
cloud, Lakshmana was greatly delighted and while he was being worshipped by the multitude of
monkeys, thereupon quickly hastened towards the proximity of Rama._END

B_6_C_73_48
BEGIN_
पुनरेव महातेजा राक्षसेन्द्रात्मजो बली || ६-७३-५२
संसृज्य बाणवर्षं च शस्त्रवर्षं च दारुणम् |
ममर्द वानरानीकं परितस्त्विन्द्रजिद्बली || ६-७३-५३_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit, the son of Ravana, possessing a great splendour power and strength, again
generating a terrific rain of arrows and weapons, destroyed the army of monkeys from all sides._END

B_6_C_67_145
BEGIN_
स कुम्भकर्णस्य वचो निशम्य |
रामः सुपुङ्खान्विससर्ज बाणान् |
तैराहतो वज्रसमप्रवेगैर् |
न चुक्षुभे न व्यथते सुराइः || ६-६७-१५३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Kumbhakarna, that Rama released plumed arrows. Even after
struck by them, whose speed was equal to a thunderbolt, that demon was neither shaken nor
afflicted._END

B_6_C_73_49
BEGIN_
स सैन्यमुत्सृज्य समेत्य तूर्णं |
महारणे वानरवाहिनीषु|
अदृश्यमानः शरजालमुग्रं |
ववर्ष नीलाम्बुधरो यथाम्बु || ६-७३-५४_END
BEGIN_
Leaving off his army from that great battle-field and becoming invisible, Indrajit
advanced towards the monkeys and quickly rained terrific hail of arrows on those armies of monkeys,
as black cloud downpours the rain._END

B_6_C_67_146
BEGIN_
यैः सायकैः सालवरा निकृत्ता |
वाली हतो वानरपुङ्गवश् च |
ते कुम्भकर्णस्य तदा शरीरं |
वज्रोपमा न व्यथयां प्रचक्रुः || ६-६७-१५४_END
BEGIN_
Those arrows, which chopped off the Sala trees and killed Vali the foremost of
monkeys, could not torment Kumbhakarna's body which was like a thunderbolt._END

B_6_C_73_50
BEGIN_
ते शक्रजिद्बाणविशीर्णदेहा |
मायाहता विस्वरमुन्नदन्तः|
रणे निपेतुर्हरयोऽद्रिकल्पा |
यथेन्द्रवज्राभिहता नगेन्द्राः || ६-७३-५५_END
BEGIN_
In that battle, those mountain-like monkeys as victims of conjuring tricks with
their bodies torn into pieces by Indrajit's arrows and roaring as they were with discordant notes,
fell down on earth, like mountains struck by Indra's thunder bolt._END

B_6_C_67_147
BEGIN_
स वारिधारा इव सायकांस्तान् |
पिबन् शरीरेण महेन्द्रशत्रुः |
जघान रामस्य शरप्रवेगं |
व्याविध्य तं मुद्गरमुग्रवेगम् || ६-६७-१५५_END
BEGIN_
Sucking those arrows with his body, as mountains suck up torments of water, that
Kumbhakarna, flourishing his hammer with terrible speed, hindered the tremendous speed of Rama's
arrows._END

B_6_C_67_148
BEGIN_
ततस्तु रक्षः क्षतजानुलिप्तं |
वित्रासनं देवमहाचमूनाम् |
व्याविध्य तं मुद्गरमुग्रवेगं |
विद्रावयामास चमूं हरीणाम् || ६-६७-१५६_END
BEGIN_
Then, flourishing that hammer which was smeared with blood and which can frighten
the great army of celestials, in terrific speed, that demon scared away the army of monkeys._END

B_6_C_73_51
BEGIN_
ते केवलं सन्ददृशुः शिताग्रान् |
बाणान्रणे वानरवाहिनीषु|
माया निगूढं च सुरेन्द्रशत्रुं |
न चात्र तं राक्षसमभ्यपश्यन् || ६-७३- ५६_END
BEGIN_
Those monkeys in battle saw only arrows with pointed tips falling on the armies of
monkeys. They could not see there, that Indrajit the demon, the enemy of Indra, remaining concealed
by his conjuring trick._END

B_6_C_73_52
BEGIN_
ततः स रक्षोऽधिपतिर्महात्मा |
सर्वा दिशो बाणगणैः शिताग्रैः|
प्रच्छादयामास रविप्रकाशैर् |
विषादयामास च वानरेन्द्रान् || ६-७३-५७_END
BEGIN_
Then, the mighty Indrajit, the leader of demons, covered all the quarters with
hundreds of sharply pointed arrows, having splendour of the sun and tore asunder the
monkey-chiefs._END

B_6_C_67_149
BEGIN_
वायव्यमादाय ततो वरास्त्रं |
रामः प्रचिक्षेप निशाचराय |
समुद्गरम् तेन जहार बाहुं |
स कृत्तबाहुस्तुमुलं ननाद || ६-६७-१५७_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, taking a great missile called Vayavya, Rama hurled it on the demon. By
that weapon, he chopped off Kumbhakarna's arm along with the hammer. With his arm chopped off,
Kumbhakarna roared tumultuously._END

B_6_C_73_53
BEGIN_
स शूलनिस्त्रिंश परश्वधानि |
व्याविध्य दीप्तानलसंनिभानि|
सविस्फुलिङ्गोज्ज्वलपावकानि |
ववर्ष तीव्रं प्लवगेन्द्रसैन्ये || ६-७३-५८_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit excessively rained on the army of monkeys' pikes, swords and axes, shining
like augmented and flaming fire and shooting forth incandescent flames with sparks._END

B_6_C_67_150
BEGIN_
स तस्य बाहुर्गिरिशृङ्गकल्पः |
समुद्गरो राघवबाणकृत्तः |
पपात तस्मिन् हरिराजसैन्ये |
जघान ताम् वानरवाहिनीं च || ६-६७-१५८_END
BEGIN_
That Kumbhakarna's arm, identical to a mountain-peak, which was chopped off by
Rama's arrow, fell along with the hammer on that army of Sugreeva and killed that regiment of
monkeys._END

B_6_C_67_151
BEGIN_
ते वानरा भग्नहतावशेषाः |
पर्यन्तमाश्रित्य तदा विषण्णाः |
प्रपिडिताङ्गा ददृशुः सुघोरं |
नरेन्द्ररक्षोऽधिपसंनिपातम् || ६-६७-१५९_END
BEGIN_
Those monkeys who had escaped being broken and slain by that arm, though dejected
with their tormented limbs and taking recourse to the sides, witnessed a highly terrific encounter
between Rama and Kumbhakarna._END

B_6_C_73_54
BEGIN_
ततो ज्वलनसङ्काशैः शितैर्वानरयूथपाः|
ताडिताः शक्रजिद्बाणैः प्रफुल्ला इव किंशुकाः || ६-७३-५९_END
BEGIN_
Struck by the Indrajit's arrows, shining brightly as fire, the monkey-commanders
then looked like Kimshuka trees bearing crimson flowers._END

B_6_C_73_55
BEGIN_
तेऽन्योन्यमभिसर्पन्तो निनदन्तश् च विस्वरम्|
राक्षसेन्द्रास्त्रनिर्भिन्ना निपेतुर्वानरर्षभाः || ६-७३-६०_END
BEGIN_
Those excellent monkeys, torn asunder by that chief of demons, approaching at each
other and roaring in a discordant tone, fell down on the ground._END

B_6_C_67_152
BEGIN_
स कुम्भकर्णोऽस्त्रनिकृत्तबाहुर् |
र्महासिकृत्ताग्र इवाचलेन्द्रः |
उत्पाटयामास करेण वृक्षं |
ततोऽभिदुद्राव रणे नरेन्द्रम् || ६-६७-१६०_END
BEGIN_
Having an arm chopped off by the arrow like a mountain-peak chopped off by a
gigantic sword, that Kumbhakarna with his another arm, pulled up a tree by its roots and then ran
towards Rama the lord of men in that battle-front._END

B_6_C_67_153
BEGIN_
स तस्य बाहुम् सह सालवृक्षं |
समुद्यतं पन्नगभोगकल्पम् |
ऐन्द्रास्त्रयुक्तेन जहार रामो |
बाणेन जाम्बूनदचित्रितेन || ६-६७-१६१_END
BEGIN_
By his arrow, which was made variegated by gold and furnished with a mystic spell of
Indra used for charming it, Rama chopped off Kumbhakarna's remaining arm, appearing like the coil
of a serpent along with his uprooted palm-tree._END

B_6_C_73_56
BEGIN_
उदीक्षमाणा गगनं के चिन्नेत्रेषु ताडिताः|
शरैर्विविशुरन्योन्यं पेतुश्च जगतीतले || ६-७३-६१_END
BEGIN_
Banged in the eyes by arrows, some monkeys looking up towards the sky, joined each
other and fell down on the floor._END

B_6_C_67_154
BEGIN_
स कुम्भकर्णस्य भुजो निकृत्तः |
पपात भूमौ गिरिसंनिकाशः |
विवेष्टमानो निजघान वृक्षान् |
शैलाञ्शिलावानरराक्षसांश् च || ६-६७-१६२_END
BEGIN_
That Kumbhakarna's arm, which appeared like a hill, was chopped off and fell down on
the ground. Wallowing hither and thither, it dashed with trees, rocks, monkeys and demons._END

B_6_C_73_57
BEGIN_
हनूमन्तं च सुग्रीवमङ्गदं गन्धमादनम्|
जाम्बवन्तं सुषेणं च वेगदर्शिनमेव च || ६-७३-६२
मैन्दं च द्विविदं नीलं गवाक्षं गजगोमुखौ|
केसरिं हरिलोमानं विद्युद्दंष्ट्रं च वानरम् || ६-७३-६३
सूर्याननं ज्योतिमुखं तथा दधिमुखं हरिम्|
पावकाक्षं नलं चैव कुमुदं चैव वानरम् || ६-७३- ६४
प्रासैः शूलैः शितैर्बाणैरिन्द्रजिन्मन्त्रसंहितैः|
विव्याध हरिशार्दूलान्सर्वांस्तान्राक्षसोत्तमः || ६-७३-६५_END
BEGIN_
With lances, spikes and sharp arrows, charged with sacred texts, Indrajit the
excellent demon struck all those foremost of monkeys, namely Hanuman, Sugreeva, Angada,
Gandhamadana, Jambavan, Sushena, Vegadarshina, Mainda, Dvivida, Nila, Gavaksha, Gavaya, Kesari,
Hariloma, Vidyuddamshtra, Suryanana, Jyothimukha, a monkey called Dadhimukha, Pavakaksha, Nala as
also a monkey named Kumuda._END

B_6_C_67_155
BEGIN_
तम् छिन्नबाहुम् समवेक्ष्य रामः |
समापतन्तम् सहसा नदन्तम् |
द्वावर्धचन्द्रौ निशितौ प्रगृह्य |
चिच्छेद पादौ युधि राक्षसस्य || ६-६७-१६३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Kumbhakarna with his arms chopped off, abruptly with a roar, coming upon him
and taking two sharp arrows with a shape of a half-moon each, Rama chopped off the feet of the
demon in that battle._END

B_6_C_73_58
BEGIN_
स वै गदाभिर्हरियूथमुख्यान् |
निर्भिद्य बाणैस्तपनीयपुङ्खैः |
ववर्ष रामं शरवृष्टिजालैः |
सलक्ष्मणं भास्कररश्मिकल्पैः || ६-७३-६६_END
BEGIN_
Tearing asunder the principal monkey-warriors by maces and arrows, which were of
golden colour, that Indrajit rained a multitude of showers of arrows equal to sun's rays on Rama
and Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_73_59
BEGIN_
स बाणवर्षैरभिवर्ष्यमाणो |
धारानिपातानिव तान्विचिन्त्य|
समीक्षमाणः परमाद्भुतश्री |
रामस्तदा लक्ष्मणमित्युवाच ||६-७३-६७_END
BEGIN_
Ignoring that showering rain of arrows, as though they are mere showers of rain,
that Rama of the most wonderful luster, looking around thoroughly, then spoke to Lakshmana as
follows:_END

B_6_C_67_156
BEGIN_
तौ तस्य पादौ प्रदिशो दिशश्च |
गिरेर्गुहाश्चैव महार्णवम् च |
लङ्काम् च सेनाम् कपिराक्षसानां |
विनादयन्तौ विनिपेततुश्च || ६-६७-१६४_END
BEGIN_
Creating a resound everywhere in all directions, even in hill-caves, in the great
ocean, in Lanka as also in the armies of monkeys and demons, Kumbhakarna's feet fell down._END

B_6_C_67_157
BEGIN_
निकृत्तबाहुर्विनिकृत्तपादो |
विदार्य वक्त्रं वडवामुखाभम् |
दुद्राव रामम् सहसाभिगर्जन् |
राहुर्यथा चन्द्रमिवान्तरिक्षे || ६-६७-१६५_END
BEGIN_
Widely opening his mouth like the mouth of a submarine fire and roaring, Kumbhakarna
whose arms and feet were cut off, ran (with thighs) quickly towards Rama, like Rahu the
seizer-demon going to seize the moon in the sky._END

B_6_C_73_60
BEGIN_
असौ पुनर्लक्ष्मण राक्षसेन्द्रो |
ब्रह्मास्त्रमाश्रित्य सुरेन्द्रशत्रुः|
निपातयित्वा हरिसैन्यमुग्रम् |
अस्माञ्शरैरर्दयति प्रसक्तम् ||६-७३-६८_END
BEGIN_
"O Lakshmana! This Indrajit, by a great missile, is throwing down our army of
monkeys and tormenting us incessantly with his sharp arrows."_END

B_6_C_67_158
BEGIN_
अपूरयत्तस्य मुखं शिताग्रै |
रामः शरैर्हेमपिनद्धपुङ्खैः |
स पूर्णवक्त्रो न शशाक वक्तुं |
चुकूज कृच्छ्रेण मुमोह चापि || ६-६७-१६६_END
BEGIN_
Rama filled up Kumbhakarna's mouth with sharply pointed arrows, having shafts
covered with gold. With his mouth full of arrows, Kumbhakarna was unable to speak. He moaned with
difficulty and even became unconscious._END

B_6_C_73_61
BEGIN_
स्वयम्भुवा दत्तवरो महात्मा |
खमास्थितोऽन्तर्हितभीमकायः |
कथं नु शक्यो युधि नष्टदेहो |
निहन्तुमद्येन्द्रजिदुद्यतास्त्रः ||६-७३-६९_END
BEGIN_
"How can the mighty and composed Indrajit on whom a boon has been bestowed by Brahma
and who has concealed his terrible form who stands with his weapons uplifted eventhough his body is
visible be killed in the battle today?_END

B_6_C_67_159
BEGIN_
अथाददे सूर्यमरीचिकल्पं |
स ब्रह्मदण्डान्तककालकल्पम् |
अरिष्टमैन्द्रं निशितम् सुपुङ्खं |
रामः शरं मारुततुल्यवेगम् || ६-६७-१६७_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, that Rama got hold of an arrow spelled with a missile presided over by
Indra the lord of celestials, effulgent as sun's rays, resembling the rod of Brahma the lord of
creation as also the destructive Kala, the Time-Spirit, and having its speed equal to the wind._END

B_6_C_73_62
BEGIN_
मन्ये स्वयम्भूर्भगवानचिन्त्यो |
यस्यैतदस्त्रं प्रभवश् च योऽस्य|
बाणावपातांस्त्वमिहाद्य धीमन्
मया सहाव्यग्रमनाः सहस्व || ६-७३-७०_END
BEGIN_
"I think the self-born Brahma who is the source of the universe is inconceivable and
this missile is presided over by him. O wise one! Remaining undistracted in mind, you bear along
with me today the hail of arrows here."_END

B_6_C_67_160
BEGIN_
तम् वज्रजाम्बूनदचारुपुङ्खं |
प्रदीप्तसूर्यज्वलनप्रकाशम् |
महेन्द्रवज्राशनितुल्यवेगं |
रामः प्रचिक्षेप निशाचराय || ६-६७-१६८_END
BEGIN_
Rama discharged against the demon, that arrow, whose shaft was inlaid with diamonds
and gold, which was shining as the dazzling sun and fire set ablaze, and which vied with the speed
of Indra's thunderbolt._END

B_6_C_73_63
BEGIN_
प्रच्छादयत्येष हि राक्षसेन्द्रः |
सर्वा दिशः सायकवृष्टिजालैः|
एतच्च सर्वं पतिताग्र्यवीरं |
न भ्राजते वानरराजसैन्यम् || ६-७३-७१_END
BEGIN_
"Let this chief of demons, who is surpassing all, be covered with a multitude of
showers of arrows. This entire army of Sugreeva, whose leading warriors have fallen, looks no more
charming."_END

B_6_C_67_161
BEGIN_
स सायको राघवबाहुचोदितो |
दिशः स्वभासा दश सम्प्रकाशयन् |
विधूमवैश्वानरदीप्तदर्शनो |
जगाम शक्राशनितुल्यविक्रमः || ६-६७-१६९_END
BEGIN_
That arrow, propelled by Rama's arm, with a terrific aspect like the smokeless fire,
having a formidable energy of Indra's thunderbolt and illuminating the ten quarters with its own
splendour, proceeded forward._END

B_6_C_73_64
BEGIN_
आवां तु दृष्ट्वा पतितौ विसंज्ञौ |
निवृत्तयुद्धौ हतरोषहर्षौ|
ध्रुवं प्रवेक्ष्यत्यमरारिवासं |
असौ समादाय रणाग्रलक्ष्मीम् || ६-७३-७२_END
BEGIN_
"Finding both of us fallen unconscious without displaying any joy or anger as also
having desisted from fighting, Indrajit will certainly return to Lanka, after having obtained
laurels of battle in its beginning itself."_END

B_6_C_67_162
BEGIN_
स तन्महापर्वतकूटसंनिभं |
सुवृत्तदंष्ट्रं चलचारुकुण्डलम् |
चकर्त रक्षोऽधिपतेः शिरस्तदा |
यथैव वृत्रस्य पुरा पुरन्दरः || ६-६७-१७०_END
BEGIN_
That Rama slashed Kumbhakarna's head, which was looking like a huge mountain-peak,
having well-rounded tusks and with charming and quivering ear-rings, as like Indra the destroyer of
strong-holds, in the past, chopped off the head of Vritra, the demon of darkness and drought._END

B_6_C_73_65
BEGIN_
ततस्तु ताविन्द्रजिदस्त्रजालैर् |
बभूवतुस्तत्र तदा विशस्तौ|
स चापि तौ तत्र विषादयित्वा |
ननाद हर्षाद्युधि राक्षसेन्द्रः || ६-७३-७३_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, Rama and Lakshmana there became struck by a multitude of arrows of
Indrajit. That leader of demons also there, causing affliction to both of them, roared with a
thrill of rapture in battle._END

B_6_C_67_163
BEGIN_
कुम्भकर्णशिरो भाति कुण्डलालम्कृतं महत् |
आदित्येऽभ्युदिते रात्रौ मध्यस्थ इव चन्द्रमाः || ६-६७-१७१_END
BEGIN_
The large Kumbhakarna's head, adorned with ear-rings, shone like the moon being in
the middle, when the constellation, Punarvasu (presided over by Aditi the mother of gods and
consisting of twin-stars) has risen at the night._END

B_6_C_73_66
BEGIN_
ततस्तदा वानरराजसैन्यं |
रामं च सङ्ख्ये सहलक्ष्मणेन|
विषादयित्वा सहसा विवेश |
पुरीं दशग्रीवभुजाभिगुप्ताम् || ६-७३-७४
संस्तूयमानः स तु यातुधानैः |
पित्रे च सर्वं हृषितोऽभ्युवाच || ६-७३-७५_END
BEGIN_
Thus causing the army of monkeys along with Rama and Lakshmana to become despondent
in battle, that Indrajit, getting eulogized by the demons, quickly reached the city of Lanka which
was being protected by Ravana's arms. Then, Indrajit cheerfully informed all that had happened, to
his father._END

B_6_C_67_164
BEGIN_
तद्रामबाणाभिहतं पपात |
रक्षःशिरः पर्वतसंनिकाशम् |
बभञ्ज चर्यागृहगोपुराणि |
प्राकारमुच्चं तमपातयच्च || ६-६७-१७२_END
BEGIN_
That demon's head, equal in size to a mountain, struck by Rama's arrow, fell down.
It broke the buildings on the king's high-way and their gates as also threw down that high
rampart._END

B_6_C_67_165
BEGIN_
तच्चातिकायं हिमवत्प्रकाशं |
रक्षस्तदा तोयनिधौ पपात |
ग्राहान् परान् मीनचयान्भुजंगमान् |
ममर्द भूमिम् च तथा विवेश || ६-६७-१७३_END
BEGIN_
Then, that colossal demon of a great splendour fell into the sea. It crushed the
principal alligators, beautiful fishes as also snakes and entered the bowels of the earth._END

B_6_C_74_0
BEGIN_
तयोस्तदा सादितयो रणाग्रे |
मुमोह सैन्यं हरियूथपानाम् |
सुग्रीवनीलाङ्गदजाम्बवन्तो |
न चापि किं चित्प्रतिपेदिरे ते || ६-७४-१_END
BEGIN_
Then, in the battle-front, Rama and Lakshmana were knocked down senseless. The army
of monkey-leaders fainted. Sugreeva, Nila, Angada and Jambavan could not understand what to do._END

B_6_C_67_166
BEGIN_
तस्मिर्हते ब्राह्मणदेवशत्रौ |
महाबले सम्यति कुम्भकर्णे |
चचाल भूर्भूमिधराश् च सर्वे |
हर्षाच्च देवास्तुमुलं प्रणेदुः || ६-६७-१७४_END
BEGIN_
While that mighty Kumbhakarna, the enemy of brahmanas and celestials was killed in
battle, the earth and mountains shook. Even the celestials raised a tumultuous roar with joy._END

B_6_C_74_1
BEGIN_
ततो विषण्णं समवेक्ष्य सैन्यं |
विभीषणो बुद्धिमतां वरिष्ठः |
उवाच शाखामृगराजवीरान् |
नाश्वासयन्नप्रतिमैर्वचोभिः || ६-७४-२_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the entire army looking worried, Vibhishana, the best among the intelligent
ones, spoke the following matchless words, consoling the warriors of Sugreeva, the lord of
monkeys:_END

B_6_C_67_167
BEGIN_
ततस्तु देवर्षिमहर्षिपन्नगाः |
सुराश्च भूतानि सुपर्णगुह्यकाः |
सयक्षगन्धर्वगणा नभोगताः |
प्रहर्षिता राम पराक्रमेण || ६-६७-१७५_END
BEGIN_
Then, saints of the celestial class, great sages*, serpents, gods, genii, Suparnas
(a class of bird-like beings of a semi-divine character), Guhyakas (another class of demi-gods),
including troops of Yakshas and Gandharvas (celestial musicians) standing in the sky, were rejoiced
at Rama's prowess._END

B_6_C_74_2
BEGIN_
मा भैष्ट नास्त्यत्र विषादकालो |
यदार्यपुत्राववशौ विषण्णौ |
स्वयम्भुवो वाक्यमथोद्वहन्तौ |
यत्सादिताविन्द्रजिदस्त्रजालैः || ६-७४-३_END
BEGIN_
"Honouring the spell sacred of Brahma the creator, the two sons of the venerable
Dasaratha have actually lost their free will and became dejected and have allowed themselves to be
knocked down by the missiles of Indrajit. Hence do not be afraid. There is no occasion for
despondency now."_END

B_6_C_74_3
BEGIN_
तस्मै तु दत्तं परमास्त्रमेतत् |
त्स्वयम्भुवा ब्राह्मममोघवेगम् |
तन्मानयन्तौ यदि राजपुत्रौ |
निपातितौ को अत्र विषादकालः || ६-७४-४_END
BEGIN_
"This excellent missile, presided over by Brahma the creator, with never-failing
strength, was given to Indrajit by Brahma. Honouring it, Rama and Lakshmana the princes fell down
in battle. This not a time for despondency here."_END

B_6_C_67_168
BEGIN_
ततस्तु ते तस्य वधेन भूरिणा |
मनस्विनो नैरृतराजबान्धवाः |
विनेदुरुच्छैर्व्यथिता रघूत्तमम् |
हरिं समीक्ष्यैव यथा मतङ्गजाः || ६-६७-१७६_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, at the mere sight of Rama, Ravana's relatives were perturbed at the
killing of Ravana of great intelligence and loudly roared, as elephants roar at the sight of a
lion._END

B_6_C_74_4
BEGIN_
ब्राह्ममस्त्रं तदा धीमान्मानयित्वा तु मारुतिः |
विभीषणवचः श्रुत्वा हनूमांस्तमथाब्रवीत् || ६-७४-५_END
BEGIN_
Then, the intelligent Hanuma, the son of wind-god, paying honour to the missile
presided over by Brahma and hearing the words of Vibhishana, spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_67_169
BEGIN_
स देवलोकस्य तमो निहत्य |
सूर्यो यथा राहुमुखाद्विमुक्तः |
तथा व्यभासीद्धरिसैन्यमध्ये |
निहत्य रामो यधि कुम्भकर्णम् || ६-६७-१७७_END
BEGIN_
Having destroyed Kumbhakarna in battle, that Rama shone in the midst of the army of
monkeys, in the same way as the sun shines in the midst of the celestial world, having destroyed
darkness, duly getting delivered from the mouth of Rahu._END

B_6_C_74_5
BEGIN_
अस्मिन्निहते सैन्ये वानराणां तरस्विनाम् |
यो यो धारयते प्राणांस्तं तमाश्वासयावहे || ६-७४-६_END
BEGIN_
"Let us restore to confidence whosoever is in this army of energetic monkeys, after
having been struck by the missile."_END

B_6_C_67_170
BEGIN_
प्रहर्षमीयुर्बहवस्तु वानराः |
प्रबुद्धपद्मप्रतिमैरिवाननैः |
अपूजयन् राघवमिष्टभागिनं |
हते रिपौ भीमबले दुरासदे || ६-६७-१७८_END
BEGIN_
Several monkeys were highly rejoiced, with their faces flowing like full-blown
lotuses. They adored Rama, who was dangerous to be attacked and as a beloved young man, killed an
enemy possessing a terrible strength._END

B_6_C_74_6
BEGIN_
तावुभौ युगपद्वीरौ हनूमद्राक्षसोत्तमौ |
उल्काहस्तौ तदा रात्रौ रणशीर्षे विचेरतुः || ६-७४-७_END
BEGIN_
Both those valiant ones, Hanuma and Vibhishana, together at that time of the night,
roamed about in the battle-front, with torches in their hands._END

B_6_C_67_171
BEGIN_
स कुम्भकर्णं सुरसैन्यमर्दनं |
महत्सु युद्धेष्वपराजितश्रमम् |
ननन्द हत्वा भरताग्रजो रणे |
महासुरं वृत्रमिवामराधिपः || ६-६७-१७९_END
BEGIN_
By killing Kumbhakarna, who tormented the army of celestials and who was not
defeated at any time in great battles, Rama was rejoiced in the same way as Indra the lord of
celestials was rejoiced in killing Vritra, the great demon._END

B_6_C_74_7
BEGIN_
भिन्नलाङ्गूलहस्तोरुपादाङ्गुलि शिरो धरैः |
स्रवद्भिः क्षतजं गात्रैः प्रस्रवद्भिः समन्ततः || ६-७४-८
पतितैः पर्वताकारैर्वानरैरभिसङ्कुलाम् |
शस्त्रैश्च पतितैर्दीप्तैर्ददृशाते वसुन्धराम् || ६-७४-९_END
BEGIN_
Hanuma and Vibhishana saw the battle-field, covered on all sides, with
mountain-sized monkeys fallen with heir tails, arms, thighs, feet, fingers and heaps of heads
fractured with blood oozing from their limbs and urine flowing out. The earth was also covered with
flaming weapons fallen around._END

B_6_C_74_8
BEGIN_
सुग्रीवमङ्गदं नीलं शरभं गन्धमादनम् |
गवाक्षम् च सिष्जेंणम् च वेगदर्शनमाहुकम् || ६-७४-१०
मैन्दं नलं ज्योतिमुखं द्विविदं पनसं तथा |
विभीषणो हनूमांश्च ददृशाते हतान्रणे || ६-७४-११_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana and Hanuma saw Sugreeva, Angada, Nila, Sharabha, Gandhamadana, Gavaksha,
Sushena, Vegadarshi, Mainda, Nala, Jyotimukha and a monkey called Dvivida, who were struck down on
the battle-field._END

B_6_C_74_9
BEGIN_
सप्तषष्टिर्हताः कोट्यो वानराणां तरस्विनाम् |
अह्नः पञ्चमशेषेण वल्लभेन स्वयम्भुवः || ६-७४-१२_END
BEGIN_
Sixty seven crores of powerful monkeys were struck down by the cherished missile of
Brahma, the self-born creator, in the fifth and last period* of the day._END

B_6_C_74_10
BEGIN_
सागरौघनिभं भीमं दृष्ट्वा बाणार्दितं बलम् |
मार्गते जाम्बवन्तं स्म हनूमान्सविभीषणः || ६-७४-१३_END
BEGIN_
Hanuma, along with Vibhishana, began to search for Jambavan, while looking at the
terrific army (wounded by the arrows) which appeared like the tide of an ocean._END

B_6_C_74_11
BEGIN_
स्वभावजरया युक्तं वृद्धं शरशतैश् चितम् |
प्रजापतिसुतं वीरं शाम्यन्तमिव पावकम् || ६-७४-१४
दृष्ट्वा तमुपसङ्गम्य पौलस्त्यो वाक्यमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Looking at Jambavan, the son of Brahma, who was naturally bequeathed with old age,
an elderly person, with his body conspicuous of hundreds of arrows and a valiant person looking
like an extinguishing fire, Vibhishana approached him and spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_74_12
BEGIN_
कच्चिदार्यशरैस्तीर्ष्णैर्न प्राणा ध्वंसितास्तव || ६-७४-१५
विभीषणवचः श्रुत्वा जाम्बवानृक्षपुङ्गवः |
कृच्छ्रादभ्युद्गिरन्वाक्यमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् || ६-७४-१६_END


B_6_C_74_13
BEGIN_
नैरृतेन्द्रमहावीर्यस्वरेण त्वाभिलक्षये |
विद्धगात्रः शितैर्बाणैर्न त्वां पश्यामि चक्षुषा || ६-७४-१७_END
BEGIN_
"O Vibhishana, the leader of demons, with a great prowess! I am able to recognize
you by your voice alone. Pierced with sharp arrows, I am not able to see you with my eyes."_END

B_6_C_74_14
BEGIN_
अञ्जना सुप्रजा येन मातरिश्वा च नैरृत |
हनूमान्वानरश्रेष्ठः प्राणान्धारयते क्व चित् || ६-७४-१८_END
BEGIN_
"O Vibhishana, of good manners! Does Hanuma, the foremost among monkeys, because of
whom, Anjana (his mother) and the wind-god are his blessed parents survive, holding his life any
where nearby?"_END

B_6_C_74_15
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा जाम्बवतो वाक्यमुवाचेदं विभीषणः |
आर्यपुत्रावतिक्रम्य कस्मात्पृच्छसि मारुतिम् || ६-७४-१९_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Jambavana, Vibhishana spoke the following words, "why do you
enquire about Hanuman, passing over the venerable sons of Dasaratha?"_END

B_6_C_74_16
BEGIN_
नैव राजनि सुग्रीवे नाङ्गदे नापि राघवे |
आर्य सन्दर्शितः स्नेहो यथा वायुसुते परः || ६-७४-२०_END
BEGIN_
"O venerable one! The exceptional affection, you are showing towards Hanuma, is not
being shown towards Sugreeva or Angada or even Rama."_END

B_6_C_74_17
BEGIN_
विभीषणवचः श्रुत्वा जाम्बवान्वाक्यमब्रवीत् |
शृणु नैरृतशार्दूल यस्मात्पृच्छामि मारुतिम् || ६-७४-२१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Vibhishana, Jambavan replied as follows: "O the foremost among
demons! Listen to me, why I am enquiring about Hanuma."_END

B_6_C_74_18
BEGIN_
अस्मिञ्जीवति वीरे तु हतमप्यहतं बलम् |
हनूमत्युज्झितप्राणे जीवन्तोऽपि मृता वयम् || ६-७४-२२_END
BEGIN_
"If that brave Hanuma is surviving, the whole army even if killed, is unhurt. On the
other hand, if Hanuma has given up is life, we are all dead, even though living."_END

B_6_C_74_19
BEGIN_
ध्रियते मारुतिस्तात मारुतप्रतिमो यदि |
वैश्वानरसमो वीर्ये जीविताशा ततो भवेत् || ६-७४-२३_END
BEGIN_
"O dear child! If Hanuma, who is equal to the wind and the fire in prowess,
survives; then there is a hope for all of us to survive.'_END

B_6_C_74_20
BEGIN_
ततो वृद्धमुपागम्य नियमेनाभ्यवादयत् |
गृह्य जाम्बवतः पादौ हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः || ६-७४-२४_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, Hanuma the son of wind-god approaching the elderly Jambavan, offered his
salutation, by grasping the feet of Jambavan with modesty._END

B_6_C_74_21
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा हनुमतो वाक्यं तथापि व्यथितेन्द्रियः |
पुनर्जातमिवात्मानं स मेने ऋक्षपुङ्गवः || ६-७४-२५_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the voice of Hanuma, Jambavan, the foremost among monkeys, with perturbed
senses, considered himself as though born again._END

B_6_C_74_22
BEGIN_
ततोऽब्रवीन्महातेजा हनूमन्तं स जाम्बवान् |
आगच्छ हरिशार्दूलवानरांस्त्रातुमर्हसि || ६-७४-२६_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, that Jambavan of great splendour spoke to Hanuma as follows: "Come on, O
foremost of monkeys! You ought to protect the lives of monkeys."_END

B_6_C_74_23
BEGIN_
नान्यो विक्रमपर्याप्तस्त्वमेषां परमः सखा |
त्वत्पराक्रमकालोऽयं नान्यं पश्यामि कञ् चन || ६-७४-२७_END
BEGIN_
"You are the great companion for these monkeys, by your copious prowess. There is no
other person. This is the appropriate time to show your prowess. I do not see any other person to
do it."_END

B_6_C_74_24
BEGIN_
ऋक्षवानरवीराणामनीकानि प्रहर्षय |
विशल्यौ कुरु चाप्येतौ सादितौ रामलक्ष्मणौ || ६-७४-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Cheer up the martial warriors of both monkeys and bears. Heal Rama and Lakshmana
from their arrow-wounds."_END

B_6_C_74_25
BEGIN_
गत्वा परममध्वानमुपर्युपरि सागरम् |
हिमवन्तं नगश्रेष्ठं हनूमन्गन्तुमर्हसि || ६-७४-२९_END
BEGIN_
"O Hanuma! You ought to go to Himalaya, the foremost of mountains, by traveling
higher and higher over the large ocean."_END

B_6_C_74_26
BEGIN_
ततः काञ्चनमत्युग्रमृषभं पर्वतोत्तमम् |
कैलासशिखरं चापि द्रक्ष्यस्यरिनिषूदन || ६-७४-३०_END
BEGIN_
"O annihilator of enemies! Thereafter, you will see there the Mount Rishabha, the
excellent mountain and the very much powerful peak of Kailasa, with a golden hue."_END

B_6_C_74_27
BEGIN_
तयोः शिखरयोर्मध्ये प्रदीप्तमतुलप्रभम् |
सर्वौषधियुतं वीर द्रक्ष्यस्यौषधिपर्वतम् || ६-७४-३१_END
BEGIN_
"O valiant Hanuma! In the midst of these two peaks, you will see a blazing and
unequally brilliant herbal mountain, containing all kinds of herbs."_END

B_6_C_74_28
BEGIN_
तस्य वानरशार्दूलचतस्रो मूर्ध्नि सम्भवाः |
द्रक्ष्यस्योषधयो दीप्ता दीपयन्त्यो दिशो दश || ६-७४-३२_END
BEGIN_
"O foremost of monkeys! Sprouted on the head of that mountain, are four blazing
herbs. You can see them, illuminating the ten quarters."_END

B_6_C_74_29
BEGIN_
मृतसञ्जीवनीं चैव विशल्यकरणीम् अपि |
सौवर्णकरणीं चैव सन्धानीं च महौषधीम् || ६-७४-३३_END
BEGIN_
"You can see there, Mrita Sanjivani (capable of restoring the dead to life),
Vishalyakarani (capable of extracting weapons and healing all wounds inflicted by weapons),
Suvarnakarani (restoring the body to its original complexion) and Sandhani, the great herb (capable
of joining severed limbs or fractured bone)."_END

B_6_C_74_30
BEGIN_
ताः सर्वा हनुमन्गृह्य क्षिप्रमागन्तुमर्हसि |
आश्वासय हरीन्प्राणैर्योज्य गन्धवहात्मजः || ६-७४-३४_END
BEGIN_
"O Hanuma! Bring all those herbs quickly. O son of wind-god! Bring succour to the
monkeys, by injecting lives into them."_END

B_6_C_74_31
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा जाम्बवतो वाक्यं हनूमान्हरिपुङ्गवः |
आपूर्यत बलोद्धर्षैस्तोयवेगैरिवार्णवः || ६-७४-३५_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Jambavan, Hanuma the son of wind-god was infused with animated
strength, as the ocean gets animated with the force of the wind._END

B_6_C_74_32
BEGIN_
स पर्वततटाग्रस्थः पीडयन्पर्वतोत्तरम् |
हनूमान्दृश्यते वीरो द्वितीय इव पर्वतः || ६-७४-३६_END
BEGIN_
Standing on the summit of Trikuta mountain and pressing the foremost of mountains
(with his feet), that valiant Hanuma appeared like a second mountain._END

B_6_C_74_33
BEGIN_
हरिपादविनिर्भिन्नो निषसाद स पर्वतः |
न शशाक तदात्मानं सोढुं भृशनिपीडितः || ६-७४-३७_END
BEGIN_
Then, increasingly pressed and bent by Hanuma's feet, that mountain was not able to
bear its weight and sank._END

B_6_C_74_34
BEGIN_
तस्य पेतुर्नगा भूमौ हरिवेगाच्च जज्वलुः |
शृङ्गाणि च व्यकीर्यन्त पीडितस्य हनूमता || ६-७४-३८_END
BEGIN_
The trees on that mountain, pressed by Hanuma, fell to the ground and caught fire
due to rapidity of Hanuma. Its peaks also got broken._END

B_6_C_74_35
BEGIN_
तस्मिन्सम्पीड्यमाने तु भग्नद्रुमशिलातले |
न शेकुर्वानराः स्थातुं घूर्णमाने नगोत्तमे || ६-७४-३९_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys were unable to stand on that excellent mountain, which started to reel,
while being pressed severely by Hanuma, as the trees standing on it and the rocks got broken._END

B_6_C_74_36
BEGIN_
स घूर्णितमहाद्वारा प्रभग्नगृहगोपुरा |
लङ्का त्रासाकुला रात्रौ प्रनृत्तेवाभवत्तदा || ६-७४-४०_END
BEGIN_
Confounded with panic, the City of Lanka, whose principal gates were broken, whose
houses and town-gates were shattered, appeared as though dancing at night._END

B_6_C_74_37
BEGIN_
पृथिवीधरसङ्काशो निपीड्य धरणीधरम् |
पृथिवीं क्षोभयामास सार्णवां मारुतात्मजः || ६-७४-४१_END
BEGIN_
Pressing hard the mountain, Hanuma equal to a mountain, caused the earth along with
the ocean to shake._END

B_6_C_74_38
BEGIN_
आरुरोह तदा तस्माद्धरिर्मलयपर्वतम् |
मेरुमन्दरसंकाशं नानाप्रस्रवणाकुलम् || ६-७४-४२
नानाद्रुमलताकीर्णम् विकासिकमलोत्पलम् |
सेवितम् देवगन्धर्वैः षष्टियोजनमुच्छ्रितम् || ६-७४-४३
विद्याधरैर्मुनिगणैरप्सरोभिर्निषेवितम् |
नानामृगगणाकीर्णम् बहुकन्दरशोभितम् || ६-७४-४४
सर्वानाकुलयंस्तत्र यक्षगन्धर्वकिम्नरान् |
हनुमान् मेघसम्काशो ववृधे मारुतात्मजः || ६-७४-४५_END
BEGIN_
From that mountain, Hanuma then ascended Mount Malaya, appearing as Mounts Meru and
Mandara, filled with several kinds of cascades, full of many trees and creepers, having Kamala and
Utpala lotuses blooming, visited by celestials and celestial musicians, having a height of sixty
Yojanas (four hundred eighty miles), frequented by Vidyodharas, a number of sages and Apsaras the
nymphs, filled with various kinds of animal-troupes and illuminated by many caves, Hanuma grew his
body, appearing like a cloud, bewildering Yakshas, Gandharvas and Kinnaras._END

B_6_C_74_39
BEGIN_
पद्भ्यां तु शैलमापीड्य वडवामुखवन्मुखम् |
विवृत्योग्रं ननादोच्चैस्त्रासयन्निव राक्षसान् || ६-७४-४६_END
BEGIN_
Pressing the mountain hard with his feet, opening his terrific mouth which shone
like a submarine fire and frightening the demons, Hanuma roared loudly._END

B_6_C_74_40
BEGIN_
तस्य नानद्यमानस्य श्रुत्वा निनदमद्भुतम् |
लङ्कास्था राक्षसाः सर्वे न शेकुः स्पन्दितुं भयात् || ६-७४-४७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing his loud noise, roaring clamorously, the foremost of demons residing in the
City of Lanka, were not able to stir anywhere._END

B_6_C_74_41
BEGIN_
नमस्कृत्वाथ रामाय मारुतिर्भीमविक्रमः |
राघवार्थे परं कर्म समैहत परन्तपः || ६-७४-४८_END
BEGIN_
Hanuma of terrific prowess, annihilator of his enemies, after offering salutation to
the ocean, made up his mind to embark on a prime act for the sake of Rama._END

B_6_C_74_42
BEGIN_
स पुच्छमुद्यम्य भुजङ्गकल्पं |
विनम्य पृष्ठं श्रवणे निकुञ्च्य |
विवृत्य वक्त्रं वडवामुखाभम् |
आपुप्लुवे व्योम्नि स चण्डवेगः || ६-७४-४९_END
BEGIN_
Raising his tail which resembled on serpent, bending his back, contracting his ears
and opening his month which shone like a terrific submarines-fire, Hanuma jumped into the sky, with
a head long speed._END

B_6_C_74_43
BEGIN_
स वृक्षषण्डांस्तरसा जहार |
शैलाञ्शिलाः प्राकृतवानरांश् च |
बाहूरुवेगोद्धतसम्प्रणुन्नास् |
स्ते क्षीणवेगाः सलिले निपेतुः || ६-७४-५०_END
BEGIN_
By his velocity, he carried away a multitude of trees, mountains and some ordinary
monkeys. Driven up and away by the momentum generated from his arms and thighs, they fell down in
water when their speed diminished._END

B_6_C_74_44
BEGIN_
स तौ प्रसार्योरगभोगकल्पौ |
भुजौ भुजङ्गारिनिकाशवीर्यः |
जगाम मेरुं नगराजमग्र्यं |
दिशः प्रकर्षन्निव वायुसूनुः || ६-७४-५१_END
BEGIN_
Stretching his arms, looking like coils of serpents, that Hanuma vying with the
prowess of hostile Garuda the eagle, headed towards the excellent mountain of Himalayas, with gush
as though he was drawing away the four quarters._END

B_6_C_74_45
BEGIN_
स सागरं घूर्णितवीचिमालं
तथा भृशं भ्रामितसर्वसत्त्वम् |
समीक्षमाणः सहसा जगाम
चक्रं यथा विष्णुकराग्रमुक्तम् || ६-७४-५२_END
BEGIN_
Beholding the sea, whose waves along with its water were made to agitate and all
whose creatures were caused to whirl round, Hanuma quickly speeded up, like the discuss loosed by
the fingers of Lord Vishnu._END

B_6_C_74_46
BEGIN_
स पर्वतान्वृक्षगणान्सरांसि |
नदीस्तटाकानि पुरोत्तमानि |
स्फीताञ्जनांस्तानपि सम्प्रपश्यञ् |
जगाम वेगात्पितृतुल्यवेगः || ६-७४-५३_END
BEGIN_
Gazing at the hills, flocks of birds, lakes, rivers, pools and excellent towns full
of people, that Hanuma with a speed equal to that of the wind-god his father, shot forth towards
Himalayas._END

B_6_C_74_47
BEGIN_
आदित्यपथमाश्रित्य जगाम स गतश्रमः |
हनुमांस्त्वरितो वीरः पितुस्तुल्यपराक्रमः || ६-७४-५४_END
BEGIN_
That valiant Hanuma, with a prowess equal to that of his father, whose fatigue was
gone, swiftly rushed, taking recourse to the orbit of the sun._END

B_6_C_74_48
BEGIN_
जवेन महता युक्तो मारुतिर्मारुतो यथा |
जगाम हरिशार्दूलो दिशः शब्देन नादयन् || ६-७४-५५_END
BEGIN_
With a great speed of wind, reverberating the four quarters with sound, Hanuma the
foremost of monkeys, hastened towards Himalayas._END

B_6_C_74_49
BEGIN_
स्मर्न् जाम्बवतो वाक्यम् मारुतिर्भीमविक्रमः |
ददर्श सहसा चापि हिमवन्तं महाकपिः || ६-७४-५६_END
BEGIN_
Remembering the words of Jambavan, Hanuma the great monkey with a terrific stride,
suddenly saw Mount Himalaya too._END

B_6_C_75_0
BEGIN_
ततोऽब्रवीन्महातेजाः सुग्रीवो वानरेश्वरः |
अर्थ्यम् विज्ञापयंश्चापि हनूमन्तमिदं वचः || ६-७५-१_END
BEGIN_
Then, Sugreeva of great majesty, the king of monkeys spoke (the following)
meaningful words to Hanuma, in order to inform him what they should do next._END

B_6_C_74_50
BEGIN_
नानाप्रस्रवणोपेतं बहुकन्दरनिर्झरम् |
श्वेताभ्रचयसङ्काशैः शिखरैश्चारुदर्शनैः || ६-७४-५७
शोभितं विविधैर्वृक्तैरगमत्पर्वतोत्तमम् |_END
BEGIN_
Hanuma went to Mount Himalaya, the foremost of mountains, embellished with various
kinds of cascades, many kinds of caves, mountain-streams and summits resembling an assemblage of
white clouds as also many kinds of trees._END

B_6_C_75_1
BEGIN_
यतो हतः कुम्भकर्णः कुमाराश्च निषूदिताः |
नेदानीमुपनिर्हारम् रावनो दातुमर्हति || ६-७५-२_END
BEGIN_
"Since Kumbhakarna and his four sons were killed, Ravana cannot give any defense
now"._END

B_6_C_74_51
BEGIN_
स तम् समासाद्य महानगेन्द्रम् |
मतिप्रवृद्धोत्तमघोरशृङ्गम् |
ददर्श पुण्यानि महाश्रमाणि |
सुरर्षिसङ्घोत्तमसेवितानि || ६-७४-५८_END
BEGIN_
Having approached that great mountain having excellent overbearing summits, he saw
great holy hermitages, inhabited by a multitude of divine sages._END

B_6_C_75_2
BEGIN_
ये ये महाबलाः सन्ति लघवश्च प्लवंगमाः |
लङ्कामभिपतन्त्वाशु गृह्योल्काः प्लवगर्षभाः || ६-७५-३
हरयो हरिसंकाशाः प्रदग्धुम् रावणालयम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Let those dexterous monkeys, possessing the strength of lions, taking torches in
their hands, rush towards Lanka quickly, in order to set ablaze the abode of Ravana."_END

B_6_C_74_52
BEGIN_
स ब्रह्मकोशं रजतालयं च |
शक्रालयं रुद्रशरप्रमोक्षम् |
हयाननं ब्रह्मशिरश्च दीप्तं |
ददर्श वैवस्वत किङ्करांश् च || ६-७४-५९_END
BEGIN_
He saw the abode of Brahma the lord of creation, Kailasa the abode of Shiva the lord
of dissolution, the abode of Indra the lord of celestials, the arrow-discharging place of Rudra,
the worshipping place of Hayagriva, the horse-faced form of Vishnu, the shining place at which
Brahma's head fell down, the sun-god and Kimkaras._END

B_6_C_75_3
BEGIN_
ततोऽस्तं गत आदित्ये रौद्रे तस्मिन्निशामुखे || ६-७५-४
लङ्कामभिमुखाः सोल्का जग्मुस्ते प्लवगर्षभाः |_END
BEGIN_
Then at the sunset of that awful evening, those foremost of the monkeys, went
towards Lanka, with torches in their hands._END

B_6_C_75_4
BEGIN_
उल्काहस्तैर्हरिगणैः सर्वतः समभिद्रुताः || ६-७५-५
आरक्षस्था विरूपाक्षाः सहसा विप्रदुद्रुवुः |_END
BEGIN_
When the troops of monkeys, with torches in their hands, attacked Lanka on all
sides, the diversely eyed demons who were holding the position of guards, suddenly fled away._END

B_6_C_74_53
BEGIN_
वज्रालयं वैश्वरणालयं च |
सूर्यप्रभं सूर्यनिबन्धनं च |
ब्रह्मासनं शङ्करकार्मुकं च |
ददर्श नाभिं च वसुन्धरायाः || ६-७४-६०_END
BEGIN_
He saw the abode of Agni the fire-god, the abode of Kubera (son of Visrava) shining
like the sun, the spot where the sun was tied down, the abode of Brahma, the abode of bow belonging
to Lord Shiva and the novel of the earth (containing the hole through which one can enter Patala
the nethermost subterranean region)._END

B_6_C_75_5
BEGIN_
गोपुराट्टप्रतोलीषु चर्यासु विविधासु च || ६-७५-६
प्रासादेषु च संहृष्टाः ससृजुस्ते हुताशनम् |_END
BEGIN_
Those monkeys, feeling gladdened, threw fire to the towering gates, attics, streets,
various byways and mansions._END

B_6_C_74_54
BEGIN_
कैलासमग्र्यं हिमवच्छिलां च |
तथर्षभं काञ्चनशैलमग्र्यम् |
स दीप्तसर्वौषधिसम्प्रदीप्तं |
ददर्श सर्वौषधिपर्वतेन्द्रम् || ६-७४-६१_END
BEGIN_
He saw the gigantic Mount Kailasa, the rock of Mount Himalaya (on which Lord Shiva
is believed to have practiced austerities and abstract meditation) and Mount Rishabha, the lofty
golden mountain, which was highly illumined by the flaming herbs and the lord of mountains on which
all types of herbs grew._END

B_6_C_75_6
BEGIN_
तेषां गृहसहस्राणि ददाह हुतभुक्तदा || ६-७५-७
प्रासादाः पर्वताकाराः पतन्ति धरणीतले |_END
BEGIN_
Then, the fire consumed thousands of houses of demons. Mansions of mountainous forms
fell down on the ground._END

B_6_C_74_55
BEGIN_
स तं समीक्ष्यानलरश्मिदीप्तं |
विसिष्मिये वासवदूतसूनुः |
आप्लुत्य तं चौषधिपर्वतेन्द्रं |
तत्रौषधीनां विचयं चकार || ६-७४-६२_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that mountain shining with a heap of fire, Hanuma the son of wind-god, who is
the envoy of Indra, was surprised to see that great mountain of herbs and then made a search for
the herbs._END

B_6_C_75_7
BEGIN_
अगुरुर्दह्यते तत्र परं चैव सुचन्दनम् || ६-७५-८
मौक्तिका मणयः स्निग्धा वज्रं चापि प्रवालकम् |_END
BEGIN_
Aloe, excellent sandalwood of great value, pearls, glossy gems, diamonds and corals
were burnt there._END

B_6_C_74_56
BEGIN_
स योजनसहस्राणि समतीत्य महाकपिः |
दिव्यौषधिधरं शैलं व्यचरन्मारुतात्मजः || ६-७४-६३_END
BEGIN_
That Hanuma, the great monkey, having crossed thousands of yojanas, walked around
that mountain, searching for the heavenly herbs._END

B_6_C_75_8
BEGIN_
क्षौमम् च दह्यते तत्र करुशेयं चापि शोभनम् || ६-७५-९
आविकं विविधं चौर्णं काञ्चनं भाण्डमायुधम् |_END
BEGIN_
Linen, charming silk, blankets of sheep's wool, various kinds of ram's wool, gold
ornaments and weapons were burnt there._END

B_6_C_74_57
BEGIN_
महौषध्यस्तु ताः सर्वास्तस्मिन्पर्वतसत्तमे |
विज्ञायार्थिनमायान्तं ततो जग्मुरदर्शनम् || ६-७४-६४_END
BEGIN_
Knowing then that somebody was coming in search of them, all the distinguished herbs
on that mountain disappeared from Hanuma's view._END

B_6_C_75_9
BEGIN_
नानाविकृतसंस्थानम् वाजिभाण्डपरिच्छदम् || ६-७५-१०
गजग्रैवेयकक्ष्याश्च रथभाण्डाश्च संस्कृताः |_END
BEGIN_
The ornaments, saddles etc. of diverse and peculiar designs of horses, the chains
worn round the neck of the elephants as also their girths and polished ornaments meant for the
chariots were also burnt._END

B_6_C_74_58
BEGIN_
स ता महात्मा हनुमान पश्यं |
शुकोप कोपाच्च भृशं ननाद |
अमृष्यमाणोऽग्निनिकाशचक्षुर् |
र्महीधरेन्द्रं तमुवाच वाक्यम् || ६-७४-६५_END
BEGIN_
In not seeing them thus, that great souled Hanuma was enraged. He made a loud noise
in anger unable to bear it, Hanuma with his eyes as red as the fire, spoke the following words to
the prince of mountains._END

B_6_C_74_59
BEGIN_
किमेतदेवं सुविनिश्चितं ते |
यद्राघवे नासि कृतानुकम्पः |
पश्याद्य मद्बाहुबलाभिभूतो
विकीर्णमात्मानमथो नगेन्द्र || ६-७४-६६_END
BEGIN_
"O prince of mountains! Is it quite sure that you have not shown any compassion for
Rama? If it is so, overcome by the strength of my arms; find yourself shattered to pieces
today."_END

B_6_C_75_10
BEGIN_
तनुत्राणि च योधानां हस्त्यश्वानाम् च चर्म च || ६-७५-११
खड्गा धनूंषि ज्याबाणास्तोमराङ्कुशशक्तयः |_END
BEGIN_
Coats of mail of the warriors, the armour of the elephants and horses, swords, bows,
bow-strings, arrows, lances, goads and javelins were burnt there._END

B_6_C_74_60
BEGIN_
स तस्य शृङ्गं सनगं सनागं |
सकाञ्चनं धातुसहस्रजुष्टम् |
विकीर्णकूटं चलिताग्रसानुं
प्रगृह्य वेगात्सहसोन्ममाथ || ६-७४-६७_END
BEGIN_
Fiercely seizing hold of the top of that mountain, furnished with thousands of
minerals, with its trees, elephants and gold, with the projections of mountain shattered and the
crest of its plateau set on fire, at once sprang up with speed._END

B_6_C_75_11
BEGIN_
रोओमजं वालजं चर्म व्याघ्रजं चाण्डजं बहु || ६-७५-१२
मुक्तामणिविचित्रांश्च प्रासादांश्च समन्ततः |
विविधानस्त्रसंघातानग्निर्दहति तत्र वै || ६-७५-१३_END
BEGIN_
The fire raging on all sides burnt blankets and rugs made of the hair of animals,
whisks made of the hair of the tails, the skins of tigers, many birds, palaces inlaid with pearls
and gems and various kinds of stores of arms._END

B_6_C_75_12
BEGIN_
नानाविधान् गृहांश्चित्रान् ददाह हुतभुक्तदा |
आवासान् राक्षसानां च सर्वेषां गृहगृद्नुनाम् || ६-७५-१४
हेमचित्रतनुत्राणाम् स्रग्भाण्डाम्बरधारिणाम् |
सीधुपानचलाक्षाणां मदविह्वलगामिनाम् || ६-७५-१५
कान्तालम्बितवस्त्राणाम् शत्रुसंजातमन्युनाम् |
गदाशूलासिहस्तानां खादतां पिबतामपि || ६-७५-१६
शयनेषु महार्हेषु प्रसुप्तानां प्रियैः सह |
त्रस्तानां गच्छतां तूर्णम् पुत्रानादाय सर्वतः || ६-७५-१७
तेषां शतसहस्राणि तदा लङ्कानिवासिनाम् |
अदहत्पावकस्तत्र जज्वाल च पुनः पुनः || ६-७५-१८_END
BEGIN_
Then, the fire burnt away many kinds of bright coloured houses of all demons, who
were greedily desirous of their homes. The fire there burnt away hundreds and thousands of
inhabitants of Lanka, who were protected by gold coloured armoury and decked with garlands,
ornaments and garments, with quivering eyes due to inebriation, moving with lustful walking, who
were seized with fury against their enemy, who carried maces, pikes and swords in their hands, who
were eating and drinking too or lay fast asleep on splendid beds with their loved ones and who were
decamping quickly to all sides, taking their sons with them, frightened and fearing up again and
again._END

B_6_C_74_61
BEGIN_
स तं समुत्पाट्य खमुत्पपात |
वित्रास्य लोकान्ससुरान्सुरेन्द्रान् |
संस्तूयमानः खचरैरनेकैर् |
जगाम वेगाद्गरुडोग्रवीर्यः || ६-७४-६८_END
BEGIN_
Having uprooted that mountain, frightening the worlds together with the leaders of
celestials and demons inhabiting them and being praised by many aerial beings, Hanuma sprang up
into the sky and proceeded expeditiously with the terrible speed of Garuda the eagle._END

B_6_C_75_13
BEGIN_
सारवन्ति महार्हाणि गम्भीरगुणवन्ति च |
हेमचन्द्रार्धचन्द्राणि चन्द्रशालोत्तमानि च || ६-७५-१९
तत्र चित्रगवाक्षाणि साधिष्टानानि सर्वशः |
मणिविद्रुमचित्रानि स्पृशन्तीव दिवाकरम् || ६-७५-२०
क्रौञ्चबर्हिणानां भूषणानां च निःस्वनैः |
नादितान्यचलाभानि वेश्मान्यग्निर्ददाह ह || ६-७५-२१_END
BEGIN_
The fire there burnt away the houses, which were strong, very valuable, with
profound qualities, decked in gold with moon shapes and crescent shapes, which rose high with their
top rooms, provided all round with beautiful windows, furnished with seats coaches etc., decorated
with gems and corals, as though touching the sky, rendered noisy with notes of herons, peacocks,
veena the Indian lute and the jingling of ornaments as also appearing like mountains._END

B_6_C_74_62
BEGIN_
स भास्कराध्वानमनुप्रपन्नस् |
तद्भास्कराभं शिखरं प्रगृह्य |
बभौ तदा भास्करसंनिकाशो |
रवेः समीपे प्रतिभास्कराभः || ६-७४-६९_END
BEGIN_
Grasping that mountain-peak, radiant as the sun, that Hanuma who resembled the sun,
having reached the orbit of the sun, shone as a second sun (as sun's image) in the vicinity of the
sun._END

B_6_C_75_14
BEGIN_
ज्वलनेन परीतानि तोरणानि चकाशिरे |
विद्युद्भिरिव नद्धानि मेघजालानि घर्मगे || ६-७५-२२_END
BEGIN_
Surrounded by fire, the arch-ways shone like a collection of clouds bound by
lightning, at the end of a summer season._END

B_6_C_74_63
BEGIN_
स तेन शैलेन भृशं रराज |
शैलोपमो गन्धवहात्मजस्तु |
सहस्रधारेण सपावकेन |
चक्रेण खे विष्णुरिवार्पितेन || ६-७४-७०_END
BEGIN_
In the sky, with that mountain in his hand, that Hanuma the offspring of the
wind-god, who resembled a mountain himself, appeared mostly like Vishnu with his flaming discuss
with its thousand edges holding his hand._END

B_6_C_75_15
BEGIN_
ज्वलनेन परीतानि गृहाणि प्रचकाशिरे |
दावाग्निदीप्तानि यथा शिखराणि महागिरेः || ६-७५-२३_END
BEGIN_
The houses, surrounded by fire shone like the peaks of a large mountain, ignited by
a forest-fire._END

B_6_C_74_64
BEGIN_
तं वानराः प्रेक्ष्य तदा विनेदुः |
स तानपि प्रेक्ष्य मुदा ननाद |
तेषां समुत्कृष्टरवं निशम्य |
लङ्कालया भीमतरं विनेदुः || ६-७४-७१_END
BEGIN_
Then, seeing Hanuma, the monkeys made a noise. Seeing them, Hanuma in turn roared in
delight. Hearing their awfully excessive noises the inhabitants of Lanka roared still more
terribly._END

B_6_C_74_65
BEGIN_
ततो महात्मा निपपात तस्मिञ् |
शैलोत्तमे वानरसैन्यमध्ये |
हर्युत्तमेभ्यः शिरसाभिवाद्य |
विभीषणं तत्र च सस्वजे सः || ६-७४-७२_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, the great souled Hanuma descended on that prince of mountains (Trikuta)
in the midst of that army of monkeys. Having offered salutation to the illustrious monkeys there
with his head bent low, he then embraced Vibhishana_END

B_6_C_75_16
BEGIN_
विमानेषु प्रसुप्ताश्च दह्यमाना वराङ्गनाः |
त्यक्ताभरणसर्वाङ्ग हा हेत्युच्चैर्विचुक्रुशुः || ६-७५-२४_END
BEGIN_
Getting scorched in fire, beautiful women, while lying fast asleep in their
seven-storeyed mansions, gave up all connection with their ornaments and screamed loudly, saying
"ah! Alas!"_END

B_6_C_75_17
BEGIN_
तत्र चाग्निपरीतानि निपेतुर्भवनान्यपि |
वज्रिवज्रहतानीव शिखराणि महागिरेः || ६-७५-२५_END
BEGIN_
The houses too, surrounded by fire there, fell down like peaks of a great mountain,
struck by the thunder-bolt of Indra._END

B_6_C_74_66
BEGIN_
तावप्युभौ मानुषराजपुत्रौ |
तं गन्धमाघ्राय महौषधीनाम् |
बभूवतुस्तत्र तदा विशल्या |
उत्तस्थुरन्ये च हरिप्रवीराः || ६-७४-७३_END
BEGIN_
By inhaling that fragrance of those great herbs, both Rama and Lakshamana became
healed of their wounds then and there. Other monkey-warriors rose up._END

B_6_C_74_67
BEGIN_
सर्वे विशल्या विरुजाः क्षणेन |
हरिप्रवीराश्च हता श्च ये स्युः |
गन्धेन तासाम् प्रवरौषधीनां |
सुप्ता निशान्तेष्विव संप्रबुद्धाः || ६-७४-७४_END
BEGIN_
By the fragrance of those most powerful herbs, all those monkey-warriors who were
earlier dead were healed momentarily of their wounds, relieved of their pain, even as those who are
asleep fully get up at the close of night._END

B_6_C_75_18
BEGIN_
तानि निर्दह्यमानानि दूरतः प्रचकाशिरे |
हिमवच्छिखराणीव दह्यमानानि सर्वशः || ६-७५-२६_END
BEGIN_
Those houses, while being burnt, shone, from afar, like the peaks of Himalayas being
consumed by fire on all sides._END

B_6_C_74_68
BEGIN_
यदाप्रभृति लङ्कायां युध्यने हरिराक्षसाः |
तदाप्रभृति मानार्थ्माज्ञया रावणस्य च || ६-७४-७५
ये हन्यन्ते रणे तत्र राक्षसाः कपिकुञ्जरैः |
हता हतास्तु क्षिप्यन्ते सर्व एव तु सागरे || ६-७४-७६_END
BEGIN_
From the day the monkeys and demons began to fight in Lanka, from that day onwards,
under the orders of Ravana, all those demons, who were being killed by the foremost of monkeys were
being thrown away into the sea as and when they were killed, merely or the sake of honour (so that
their number may not be known to the monkeys)._END

B_6_C_75_19
BEGIN_
हर्म्याग्रैर्दह्यमानैश्च ज्वालाप्रज्वलितैरपि |
रात्रौ सा दृश्यते लङ्का पुष्पितैरिव किंशुकैः || ६-७५-२७_END
BEGIN_
That City of Lanka at night with its house-tops being burnt ablaze with flames,
looked like Kimshuka trees in full bloom._END

B_6_C_74_69
BEGIN_
ततो हरिर्गन्धवहात्मजस्तु |
तमोषधीशैलमुदग्रवीर्यः |
निनाय वेगाद्धिमवन्तमेव
पुनश्च रामेण समाजगाम ||६-७४-७७_END
BEGIN_
Then, Hanuma the son of wind-god, with a great speed, carried away that mountain of
herbs quickly back to the mountains of Himalayas and again joined Rama._END

B_6_C_75_20
BEGIN_
हस्त्यध्यक्षैर्गजैर्मुकैर्मुकैश्च तुरगैरपि |
बभूव लङ्का लोकान्ते भ्रान्तग्राह इवार्णवः || ६-७५-२८_END
BEGIN_
With their elephants let loose by the superintendents of the elephants and horses
too set free, Lanka was like an ocean, with roaming alligators in it at the end of a
world-cycle._END

B_6_C_75_21
BEGIN_
अश्वं मुक्तं गजो दृष्ट्वा क्वचिद्भीतोऽपसर्पति |
भीतो भीतं गजं दृष्ट्वा क्वचिदश्वो निवर्तते || ६-७५-२९_END
BEGIN_
Here, seeing a horse being let loose, an elephant went back frightened. There,
seeing a frightened elephant, a horse turned back with an alarm._END

B_6_C_75_22
BEGIN_
लङ्कायाम् दह्यमानायाम् शुशुभे च महोदधिः |
चायासंसक्तसलिलो लोहितोद इवार्णवः || ६-७५-३०_END
BEGIN_
While Lanka was being burnt, the great ocean, with its image reflected on its
waters, assumed like a great sea with red waters._END

B_6_C_75_23
BEGIN_
सा बभूव मुहूर्तेन हरिभिर्दीपिता पुरी |
लोकस्यास्य क्षये घोरे प्रदीप्तेव वसुंधरा || ६-७५-३१_END
BEGIN_
That City burnt by the monkeys, within a short time, became transformed like the
earth burning at the time of terrific dissolution of this world._END

B_6_C_75_24
BEGIN_
नारीजनस्य धूमेन व्याप्तस्योच्चैर्विनेदुषः |
स्वनो ज्वलनतप्तस्य शुश्रुवे शतयोजनम् || ६-७५-३२_END
BEGIN_
The noise of the women-folk, who were burnt by fire and covered with smoke, roaring
loudly, was heard upto one hundred Yojanas (or eight hundred miles)._END

B_6_C_75_25
BEGIN_
प्रदग्धकायानपरान् राक्षसान्निर्गतान् बहिः |
सहसा ह्युत्पतन्ति स्म हरयोऽथ युयुत्सवः || ६-७५-३३_END
BEGIN_
Then the monkeys, eager to fight, bounced suddenly upon the other demons, whose
bodies had been severely burnt and who rushed out (to save their lives)._END

B_6_C_75_26
BEGIN_
उद्घुष्टं वानराणां च राक्षसानां च निःस्वनः |
दिशो दश समुद्रं च पृथिवीम् च व्यनादयत् || ६-७५-३४_END
BEGIN_
The loud noise made by the monkeys and the cry of the demons caused resounding of
all the ten quarters, the ocean and the earth._END

B_6_C_75_27
BEGIN_
विशल्यौ च महात्मानौ तावुभौ रामलक्ष्मणौ |
असम्भ्रान्तौ जगृहतुस्ते उभे धनुषी वरे || ६-७५-३५_END
BEGIN_
Healed of their wounds and unperplexed, both those great souled princes, Rama and
Lakshmana seized hold of those two excellent bows._END

B_6_C_75_28
BEGIN_
ततो विस्फारयामास रामश्च धनुरुत्तमम् |
बभूव तुमुलः शब्दो राक्षसानाम् भयावहः || ६-७५-३६_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Rama pulled his excellent bow, making a tumultuous twang, which struck
terror in demons._END

B_6_C_75_29
BEGIN_
अशोभत तदा रामो धनुर्विस्फारयन् महत् |
भगवानिव सम्क्रुद्धो भवो वेदमयं धनुः || ६-७५-३७_END
BEGIN_
Rama, drawing his great bow, was as shining at that time as Lord Shiva (the source
of Universe), stretching his bow, consisting of the Vedas in a great wrath (as at the time of
dissolution of the Universe)._END

B_6_C_75_30
BEGIN_
उद्गुष्टं वानराणां च राक्षसानां च निःस्वनम् |
ज्याशब्दस्तावुभौ शब्दावति रामस्य शुश्रुवे || ६-७५-३८_END
BEGIN_
The twang of the bow-string of Rama could be heard above both of those sounds. The
sound of the monkeys and the cry of the demons._END

B_6_C_75_31
BEGIN_
वानरोद्घुष्टशब्दश्च राक्षसानां च निःस्वनः |
ज्याशब्दश्चापि रामस्य त्रयं व्याप दिशो दसः || ६-७५-३९_END
BEGIN_
The raised voice of the monkeys, the cry of the demons and even the twang of Rama's
bow-string these three sounds pervaded all the ten quarters._END

B_6_C_75_32
BEGIN_
तस्य कार्मुकनिर्मुक्तैः शरैस्तत्पुरगोपुरम् |
कैलासशृङ्गप्रतिमं विशीर्णमपतद्भुवि || ६-७५-४०_END
BEGIN_
By the arrows released from Rama's bow, the main gate of that City looking like a
peak of Mount Kailasa, tumbled down, shattered, to the ground._END

B_6_C_75_33
BEGIN_
ततो रामशरान् दृष्ट्वा विमानेषु गृहेषु च |
संनाहो राक्षसेन्द्राणां तुमुलः समपद्यत || ६-७५-४१_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, seeing Rama's arrows descending on seven-storeyed mansions and other
houses, the war-preparedness of the leaders of demons got disturbed._END

B_6_C_75_34
BEGIN_
तेषां सम्नह्यमानानाम् सिम्हनादं च कुर्वताम् |
शर्वरी राक्षसेन्द्राणाम् द्रौद्रीव समपद्यत || ६-७५-४२_END
BEGIN_
To those demoniac leaders, who were preparing for the battle and emitting lion's
roars, that night became a night of final dissolution (presided over by Rudra, the lord of
destruction)._END

B_6_C_75_35
BEGIN_
आदिष्टा वानरेन्द्रास्ते सुग्रीवेण महात्मना |
असन्नम् द्वारमासाद्य युध्यध्वं च प्लवंगमाः || ६-७५-४३
यश्च वो वितथं कुर्यात्तत्र तत्राप्युपस्थितः |
स हन्तव्योऽभिसम्प्लुत्य राजशासनदूषकः || ६-७५-४४_END
BEGIN_
The monkey-chiefs were commanded by Sugreeva as follows: "O monkeys! Approaching the
nearest gate, begin to wage the war. Even though present at the scene of fighting, he among you who
proves futile by an escape, should be overtaken and killed as he will be quality of disobeying the
royal command."_END

B_6_C_75_36
BEGIN_
तेषु वानरमुख्येषु दीप्तोल्कोज्ज्वलपाणिषु |
स्थितेषु द्वारमाश्रित्य रावणं क्रोध आविशत् || ६-७५-४५_END
BEGIN_
Seeing those monkey-chiefs, standing at the gate, with flaming torches in their
hands, Ravana was enraged with fury._END

B_6_C_75_37
BEGIN_
तस्य जृम्भितविक्षेपाद्व्यामिश्रा वै दिशो दश |
रूपवानिव रुद्रस्य मन्युर्गात्रेष्वदृश्यत || ६-७५-४६_END
BEGIN_
All the ten directions were distracted because of Ravana's act of disorderly
movement of his body due to yawning and he looked like the wrath manifest in the limbs of Rudra
appearing with a form._END

B_6_C_75_38
BEGIN_
स कुम्भं च निकुम्भं च कुम्भकर्णात्मजावुभौ |
प्रेषयामास संक्रुद्धो राक्षसैर्बहुभिः सह || ६-७५-४७_END
BEGIN_
The enraged Ravana sent both Kumbha and Nimkumbha, the sons of Kumbhakarna, along
with a multitude of demons._END

B_6_C_75_39
BEGIN_
यूपाक्षः शोणिताक्षश्च प्रजङ्घः कम्पनस्तथा |
निर्ययुः कौम्भकर्णिभ्यां सह रावणशासनात् || ६-७५-४८_END
BEGIN_
By the orders of Ravana, Yupaksha, Shonitaksha, Prajangha and Kampana along with the
aforesaid sons of Kumbhakarna set out for the battle._END

B_6_C_76_0
BEGIN_
प्रवृत्ते सङ्कुले तस्मिन्घोरे वीरजनक्षये |
अङ्गदः कम्पनं वीरमाससाद रणोत्सुकः || ६-७६-१_END
BEGIN_
While that terrific battle, which destroyed many eminent heroes, was in progress,
Angada, who was eager to fight, attacked the valiant Kampana._END

B_6_C_75_40
BEGIN_
शशास चैव तान् सर्वान् राक्षसान् स महाबलान् |
राक्षसा गच्छताद्यैव सिम्हनादं च नादयन् || ६-७५-४९_END
BEGIN_
Ravana instructed all those mighty demons thus, "O demons! Proceed now itself,
bellowing a lion's roar."_END

B_6_C_76_1
BEGIN_
आहूय सोऽङ्गदं कोपात्ताडयामास वेगितः |
गदया कम्पनः पूर्वं स चचाल भृशाहतः || ६-७६-२_END
BEGIN_
Calling Angada to fight, Kampana with fury, rapidly struck him with a mace in
anticipation. Violently hit by him, Angada was reeled._END

B_6_C_75_41
BEGIN_
ततस्तु चोदितास्तेन राक्षसा ज्वलितायुधाः |
लङ्काया निर्ययूर्वीराः प्रणदन्तः पुनः पुनः || ६-७५-५०_END
BEGIN_
Incited by Ravana, the valiant demons then, wielding shining weapons and roaring
repeatedly, sallied forth from Lanka._END

B_6_C_76_2
BEGIN_
स संज्ञां प्राप्य तेजस्वी चिक्षेप शिखरं गिरेः |
अर्दितश्च प्रहारेण कम्पनः पतितो भुवि || ६-७६-३_END
BEGIN_
Restoring consciousness, the energetic Angada hurled a mountain peak. Tormented by
that stroke, Kampana fell down on the ground._END

B_6_C_75_42
BEGIN_
रक्षसां भूषणस्थाभिर्भाभिः स्वाभिश्च सर्वशः |
चक्रुस्ते सप्रभं व्योम हरयश्चाग्निभिः सह || ६-७५-५१_END
BEGIN_
By the gleams of ornaments worn by their own natural splendour, those demons and
monkeys with their fires, made the sky fluorescent on all sides._END

B_6_C_75_43
BEGIN_
तत्र ताराधिपस्याभा ताराणाम् भा तथैव च |
तयोराभरणाभा च ज्वलिता द्यामभासयत् || ६-७५-५२_END
BEGIN_
The effulgence of the moon there, the light of the stars and the splendour of the
ornaments of both the armies, while blazing, made the sky brilliant._END

B_6_C_76_3
BEGIN_
ततस्तु कम्पनं दृष्ट्वा शोणिताक्षो हतं रणे |
रथेनाभ्यपतत् क्षिप्रं तत्राङ्गदमभीतवत् || ६-७६-४_END
BEGIN_
Then, seeing Kampana killed in battle, Shonitaksha fearlessly rushed there towards
Angada quickly in a chariot._END

B_6_C_76_4
BEGIN_
सोऽङ्गदं निशितैर्बाणैस्तदा विव्याध वेगितः |
शरीरदारणैस्तीक्षणैः कालाग्निसमविग्रहैः || ६-७६-५
क्षुरक्षुरप्रनाराचैर्वत्सदनैः शिलीमुखैः |
कर्णिशल्यविपाठैश्च बहुभिर्निशितैः शरैः || ६-७६-६_END
BEGIN_
He then swiftly struck Angada with sharp pointed arrows which can tear up the limbs
and with fire-like forms which can destroy the world. He struck with many sharp arrows by the names
of Kshura, Kshurapra, Naaraacha, Vatsatanta, Shilimukha, Karni, Shalya and Vipatha._END

B_6_C_75_44
BEGIN_
चन्द्राभा भूषणाभा च ग्रहाणाम् ज्वलिता च भा |
हरिराक्षससैन्यानि भ्राजयामास सर्वतः || ६-७५-५३_END
BEGIN_
The effulgence of the moon, the splendour of the ornaments and the fluorescence of
the blazing planets made the armies of monkeys and demons glitter on all sides._END

B_6_C_76_5
BEGIN_
अङ्गदः प्रतिविद्धाङ्गो वालिपुत्रः प्रतापवान् |
धनुरुग्रं रथं बाणान् ममर्द तरसा बली || ६-७६-७_END
BEGIN_
The strong and powerful Angada, the son of Vali, with his wounded limbs, crushed his
terrific bow, chariot and darts with his might._END

B_6_C_75_45
BEGIN_
तत्र चार्धप्रदीप्तानां गृहाणाम् सागरः पुनः |
भाभिः संसक्तसलिलश्चलोर्मिः शुशुभेऽधिकम् || ६-७५-५४_END
BEGIN_
With the flames of the half-scorched houses there, the ocean on its part with its
agitated waves mingled with water, shone abundantly._END

B_6_C_76_6
BEGIN_
शोणिताक्षस्ततः क्षिप्रमसिचर्म समाददे |
उत्पपात तदा क्रुद्धो वेगवानविचारयन् || ६-७६-८_END
BEGIN_
Then, Shonitaksha quickly took a sword and a shield. Enraged as he was, he swiftly
jumped down (from his chariot) unhesitatingly._END

B_6_C_75_46
BEGIN_
पताकाध्वजसम्युक्तमुत्तमासिपरश्वधम् |
भीमाश्वरथमातङ्गं नानापत्तिसमाकुलम् || ६-७५-५५
दीप्तशूलगदाखड्गप्रासतोमरकार्मुकम् |
तद्राक्षसं बलं भीमम् घोरविक्रमपौरुषम् || ६-७५-५६
ददृशे ज्वलितप्रसं किङ्किणीशतनादितम् |
हेमजालाचितभुजं व्यावेष्टितपरश्वधम् || ६-७५-५७
व्याघूर्णितमहाशस्त्रं बाणसंयुक्तकार्मुकम् |
गन्धमाल्यमधूत्सेकसंमोदितमहानिलम् || ६-७५-५८_END
BEGIN_
