That army of demons was looking awful with flags and banners, with excellent axes
shaped like swords, consisting of terrific horses, chariots and elephants, crowded with
foot-soldiers of every description, distinguished by shining pikes, maces, swords, spears, lances
and bows, noted for its redoubtable valour and prowess, with shining lances and rendered noisy by
hundreds of tiny bells (tied around chariots, elephants etc), the arms of its warriors adorned with
sets of gold ornaments, their axes being brandished, mighty weapons being waved about, arrows
fitted to the bows and the whole atmosphere rendered fragrant by the abundance of sandal paste,
garlands and wine._END

B_6_C_76_7
BEGIN_
तं क्षिप्रतरमाप्लुत्य परामृश्याङ्गदो बली |
करेण तस्य तं खड्गं समाच्चिद्य ननाद च || ६-७६-९_END
BEGIN_
Springing forward more swiftly, seizing hold of him with his hand and snatching away
the sword, the strong Angada made a lion's roar._END

B_6_C_75_47
BEGIN_
घोरं शूरजनाकीर्णम् महाम्बुधरनिःस्वनम् |
तद्दृष्ट्वा बलमायातं राक्षसानां दुरासदम् || ६-७५-५९
संचचाल प्लवंगानां बलमुच्चैर्ननाद च |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the army of demons, which came crowded with gallant warriors, thundered like
a huge cloud which was difficult to assail, the army of monkeys marched forth and made a loud
noise._END

B_6_C_76_8
BEGIN_
तस्यांसफलके खड्गं निचखान ततोऽङ्गदः |
यज्ञोपवीतवच्चैनं चिच्चेद कपिकुञ्जरः || ६-७६-१०_END
BEGIN_
Angada the foremost of monkeys the sword into the flat surface of his shoulder and
cut him from left to right diagonally._END

B_6_C_75_48
BEGIN_
जवेनाप्लुत्य च पुनस्तद्बलं रक्षसां महत् || ६-७५-६०
अभ्ययात्प्रत्यरिबलं पतम्गा इव पावकम् |_END
BEGIN_
That large army of demons on its part went springing forward with all speed, towards
the hostile army, as moths towards a flame._END

B_6_C_75_49
BEGIN_
तेषां भुजपरामर्शव्यामृष्टपरिघाशनि || ६-७५-६१
राक्षसानां बलम् श्रेष्ठं भूयः परमशोभत |_END
BEGIN_
The excellent army of those demons, in which iron clubs and the tips of missiles
being brandished through the action of their arms, shone all the more brightly._END

B_6_C_76_9
BEGIN_
तं प्रगृह्य महाखड्गं विनद्य च पुनः पुनः |
वालिपुत्रोऽभिदुद्राव रणशीर्षं परानरीन् || ६-७६-११_END
BEGIN_
Taking hold of that large sword and repeatedly roaring, Angada rushed towards the
other surviving enemies in the battle-front._END

B_6_C_75_50
BEGIN_
तत्रोन्मत्ता इवोत्पेतुर्हरयोऽथ युयुत्सवः || ६-७५-६२
तरुशैलैरभिघ्नन्तो मुष्टिभिश्च निशाचरान् |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, the monkeys desirous to fight there, striking the demons with trees,
rocks and fists, jumped up as though frenzied._END

B_6_C_76_10
BEGIN_
प्रजङ्घसहितो वीरो यूपाक्षस्तु ततो बली |
रथेनाभिययौ क्रुद्धो वालिपुत्रं महाबलम् || ६-७६-१२_END
BEGIN_
Taking hold of that large sword and repeatedly roaring, Angada rushed towards the
other surviving enemies in the battle-front._END

B_6_C_75_51
BEGIN_
तथैवापततां तेषां हरीणाम् निशितैः शरैः || ६-७५-६३
शिरांसि सहसा जह्रू राक्षसा भीमविक्रमाः |_END
BEGIN_
Likewise, the demons with their terrific prowess instantly tore off the heads of
those monkeys bouncing upon them, with sharp arrows._END

B_6_C_76_11
BEGIN_
आयसीम् तु गदाम् गृह्य स वीरः कनकाङ्गदः |
शोणिताक्षः समाश्वस्य तमेवानुपपात ह || ६-७६-१३_END
BEGIN_
That valiant Shonitaksha, wearing golden armlets, restoring his consciousness, took
an iron mace and rushed quickly towards the same Angada._END

B_6_C_75_52
BEGIN_
दशनैर्हतकर्णाश्च मुष्टिभिर्भिन्नमस्तकाः || ६-७५-६४
शिलाप्रहारभग्नाङ्ग विचेरुस्तत्र राक्षसाः |_END
BEGIN_
The demons there strolled in the streets of Lanka, with their ears bitten off with
teeth, their skulls smashed with fists and their limbs broken by crag blows._END

B_6_C_76_12
BEGIN_
प्रजङ्घस्तु महावीरो यूपाक्षसहितो बली |
गदयाभिययौ क्रुद्धो वालिपुत्रं महाबलम् || ६-७६-१४_END
BEGIN_
The strong and the great warrior, Prajangha on his part, along with Yupaksha, was
enraged and rushed towards the mighty Angada with his mace._END

B_6_C_75_53
BEGIN_
तथैवाप्यपरे तेषां कपीनामसिभिः शितैः || ६-७५-६५
प्रवरानभितो जघ्नुर्घोररूपा निशाचराः |_END
BEGIN_
Even so, some demons with terrific form struck those chiefs among the monkeys, with
sharp swords, on all sides of the battle field._END

B_6_C_76_13
BEGIN_
तयोर्मध्ये कपिश्रेष्ठः शोणिताक्षप्रजङ्घयोः |
विशाखयोर्मध्यगतः पूर्णचन्द्र इवाबभौ || ६-७६-१५_END
BEGIN_
Angada, the chief of monkeys, between the two warriors, Shonitaksha and Prajangha,
shone like a full moon between the two asterisms known as Vishakhas._END

B_6_C_76_14
BEGIN_
अङ्गदं परिरक्षनौ मैन्दो द्विविद एव च |
तस्य तस्थतुरभ्याशे परस्परदिदृक्षया || ६-७६-१६_END
BEGIN_
Protecting Angada, Mainda and Dvivida took their position near Angada, with an
intent to exhibit each of their own martial skill._END

B_6_C_75_54
BEGIN_
घ्नन्तमन्यं जघानान्यः पातयन्तमपातयत् || ६-७५-६६
गर्हमाणम् जगर्हन्यो दशन्तमपरोऽदशत् |_END
BEGIN_
One warrior killed the one who was killing another, a second one threw down the one
throwing down another; a third one scolded another who was scolding the other one; while a fourth
one chewed the one chewing another._END

B_6_C_76_15
BEGIN_
अभिपेतुर्महाकायाः प्रतियत्ता महाबलाः |
राक्षसा वानरान् रोषादसिबाणगदाधराः || ६-७६-१७_END
BEGIN_
The mighty demons with their colossal bodies retaliated and rushed in anger,
wielding swords, arrows and maces, towards the monkeys._END

B_6_C_75_55
BEGIN_
देहीत्यन्यो ददात्यन्यो ददामीत्यपरः पुनः || ६-७५-६७
किं क्लेशयसि तिष्ठेति तत्रान्योन्यम् बभाषिरे |_END
BEGIN_
There, one said "Give me the blow. Another said, "He is giving". Yet another said,
"I am giving" some talked with one another, saying "Wait. Why do you take pains?"_END

B_6_C_75_56
BEGIN_
विप्रलम्भित शस्त्रं च विमुक्तकवचायुधम् || ६-७५-६८
समुद्यतमहाप्रासं यष्टिशूलासिंसम्कुलम् |
प्रावर्त महा रौद्रं युद्धम् वानररक्षसाम् || ६-७५-६९_END
BEGIN_
In that very terrific war between monkeys and demons, some weapons were made futile.
Some weapons were dug into armours. Long lances were lifted up. Fists, pikes, swords and spears
were used as weapons of war._END

B_6_C_76_16
BEGIN_
त्रयाणां वानरेन्द्राणाम् त्रिभिराक्षसपुम्गवैः |
संसक्तानाम् महद्युद्धमभवद्रोमहर्षणम् || ६-७६-१८_END
BEGIN_
A great battle, causing hair to stand on end, was waged by the three monkey-chiefs
who encountered the three excellent demons._END

B_6_C_76_17
BEGIN_
ते तु वृक्षान् समादाय सम्प्रचिक्षिपुराहवे |
खड्गेन प्रतिचिक्षेप तान् प्रजङ्ग महाबलः || ६-७६-१९_END
BEGIN_
In the battle-field, the monkeys, seizing hold of trees, hurled them against the
demon-chiefs. The mighty Prajangha, however, cut them down with his sword._END

B_6_C_75_57
BEGIN_
वानरान् दश सप्तेति राक्षसा जघ्नराहवे |
राक्षसान् दश सप्तेति वानराश्चाभ्यपातयन् || ६-७५-७०_END
BEGIN_
In the battle-front, the demons killed monkeys in tens and sevens. The monkeys too
threw the demons down in tens and sevens._END

B_6_C_76_18
BEGIN_
रथानश्वान् द्रुमान् शैलान् प्रतिचिक्षिपुराहवे |
शरौघैः प्रतिचिच्छेद तान्यूपाक्षो महाबलः || ६-७६-२०_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys in the battle-field hurled trees and rocks towards chariots and horses.
The mighty Yupaksha chopped them off with a flood of arrows._END

B_6_C_75_58
BEGIN_
विस्रस्तकेशवसनम् विमुक्तकवचध्वजम् |
बलम् राक्षसमालम्ब्य वानराः पर्यवारयन् || ६-७५-७१_END
BEGIN_
Catching hold of the army of demons, whose hair and raiment's were kept in order
with difficulty and whose armours and standards were thrown away, the monkeys surrounded them on
all sides._END

B_6_C_76_19
BEGIN_
सृष्टान् द्विवदमैन्दाभ्यां द्रुमानुत्पाट्य वीर्य्वान् |
बभञ्ज गदया मद्य शोणिताक्षः प्रतापवान् || ६-७६-२१_END
BEGIN_
Shonitaksha, the valiant and the powerful demon, chopped off the trees uplifted and
hurled by Dvivida and Mainda with his mace in the midway itself._END

B_6_C_76_20
BEGIN_
उद्यम्य विपुलं खड्गं परमर्मविदारणम् |
प्रजङ्घो वालिपुत्राय अभिदुद्राव वेगितः || ६-७६-२२_END
BEGIN_
Prajangha, lifting a large sword, which can chop off vital parts of the enemies,
rushed swiftly towards Angada._END

B_6_C_76_21
BEGIN_
तमभ्याशगतं दृष्ट्वा वानरेन्द्रो महाबलः |
आजघानाश्वकर्णेन द्रुमेणातिबलस्तदा || ६-७६-२३_END
BEGIN_
Then the mighty Angada, who was exceedingly strong, seeing him coming nearer, struck
him with an Ashvakarna tree._END

B_6_C_76_22
BEGIN_
बाहुं चास्य सनिस्त्रिंशमाजघान स मुष्टिना |
वालिपुत्रस्य घातेन स पपात क्षितावसिः || ६-७६-२४_END
BEGIN_
Angada struck, with his fist, the arm of Prajangha, holding the sword. By that blow,
the sword fell on the ground._END

B_6_C_76_23
BEGIN_
तं दृष्ट्वा पतितं भूमौ खड्गम् मुसलसंनिभम् |
मुष्टिं संवर्तयामास वज्रकल्पं महाबलः || ६-७६-२५_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that sword looking like a pebble (in shape), which fell on the ground, the
mighty Prajangha tightened his thunderbolt like fist._END

B_6_C_76_24
BEGIN_
स ललाटे महावीर्यमङ्गदं वानरर्षभम् |
आजघान महातेजाः स मुहूर्तं च्चाल ह || ६-७६-२६_END
BEGIN_
When that Prajangha of great splendour struck Angaa, the excellent monkey with a
great strength on his forehead, Angada shuddered for a moment._END

B_6_C_76_25
BEGIN_
स संज्ञाम् प्राप्य तेजस्वी वालिपुत्रः प्रतापवान् |
प्रजङ्घस्य शिरः कायात्पातयामास मुष्टिना || ६-७६-२७_END
BEGIN_
That Angada of splendour and prowess, restoring his consciousness, struck with his
fist and shattered Prajangha's head off his trunk._END

B_6_C_76_26
BEGIN_
स यूपाक्षोऽश्रुपूर्णाक्षः पितृव्ये निहते रणे |
अवरुह्य रथान् क्षिप्रं क्षीणेषुः खड्गमाददे || ६-७६-२८_END
BEGIN_
That Yupaksha, with tears filled in his eyes because of the death of his paternal
uncle in battle, quickly took a sword as his arrows were exhausted and descended from his
chariot._END

B_6_C_76_27
BEGIN_
तमापतन्तं संप्रेक्ष्य यूपाक्षं द्विविदस्त्वरन् |
आजघानोरसि क्रुद्धो जग्राह च बलाद्बली || ६-७६-२९_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that Yupaksha rushing on him, Dvivida hurriedly struck Yupaksha on his chest
and with a rage, forcibly caught hold of him._END

B_6_C_76_28
BEGIN_
गृहीतं भ्रातरं दृष्ट्वा शोणिताक्षो महाबलम् |
आजघान महातेजा वक्षसि द्विविदं ततः || ६-७६-३०_END
BEGIN_
Seeing his mighty brother being seized, Shonitaksha, of great splendour, then struck
Dvivida on his chest._END

B_6_C_76_29
BEGIN_
स ततोऽभिहतस्तेन चचाल च महाबलः |
उद्यतां च पुनस्तस्य जहार द्विविदो गदाम् || ६-७६-३१_END
BEGIN_
That mighty Dvivida, struck by Shonitaksha was tottered; but pulled off the
platter's mace when lifted again on him._END

B_6_C_76_30
BEGIN_
एतस्मिन्नन्तरे मैन्दो द्विविदाभ्याशमागमत् |
यूपाक्षं ताडमामास तलेनोरसि वीर्यवान् || ६-७६-३२_END
BEGIN_
Meanwhile, Mainda came nearer to Dvivida and banged Yupaksha on his chest with his
palm._END

B_6_C_76_31
BEGIN_
तौ शोणिताक्षयूपाक्षौ प्लवम्गाभ्यां तरस्विनौ |
चक्रतुः समरे तीव्रमाकर्षोत्पाटनं भृशम् || ६-७६-३३_END
BEGIN_
Those two demons, Shonitaksha and Yupaksha, who were full of violence, carried on a
keen contest with the two monkeys in the battle field, by pulling and overthrowing them vehemently
and severely._END

B_6_C_76_32
BEGIN_
द्विविदः शोणिताक्षं तु विददार नखैर्मुखे |
निष्पिपेष च वीर्येण क्षितावाविध्य वीर्यवान् || ६-७६-३४_END
BEGIN_
The valiant Dvivida, after splitting open shonitaksha's face with his claws, threw
him down on the floor by his strength and crushed him down._END

B_6_C_76_33
BEGIN_
यूपाक्षमभिसंक्रुद्धो मैन्दो वानरपुंगवः |
पीडयामास बाहुभ्यां पपात स हतः क्षितौ || ६-७६-३५_END
BEGIN_
Mainda, the foremost of monkeys, was enraged and pressed Yupaksha with his arms.
Yupaksha fell down dead on the ground._END

B_6_C_76_34
BEGIN_
हतप्रप्रवीरा व्यथिता राक्षसेन्द्रचमूस्तदा |
जगामाभिमुखी सा तु कुम्भकर्णात्मजो यतः || ६-७६-३६_END
BEGIN_
That army of demons, which was perturbed with their great warriors killed, then
moved with its face turned towards the place where Kumbha (the son of Kumbhakarna) was carrying on
battle._END

B_6_C_76_35
BEGIN_
आपतन्तीम् च वेगेन कुम्भस्तां सान्त्वयच्चमूम् |
अथोत्कृष्टं महावीर्यैर्लब्धलक्षैः प्लवम्गमैः || ६-७६-३७
निपातितमहावीरां दृष्ट्वा रक्षश्चमूं तदा |
कुम्भः प्रचक्रे तेजस्वी रणे कर्म सुदुष्करम् || ६-७६-३८_END
BEGIN_
Kumbha, restored to confidence, that army which was coming towards him with speed.
Then, seeing the army of demons whose chief-warriors were thrown down by the most powerful monkeys
who could fulfill their aim, the powerful Kumbha then performed a great feat which was very
difficult to do in a battle._END

B_6_C_76_36
BEGIN_
स धनुर्धन्विनां श्रेष्ठः प्रगृह्य सुसमाहितः |
मुमोचाशीविषप्रख्याञ्शरान्देहविदारणान् || ६-७६-३९_END
BEGIN_
That Kumbha, the foremost among the wielders of bow, taking his bow and fully
composed, released serpentine arrows which can split open the bodies._END

B_6_C_76_37
BEGIN_
तस्य तच्छुशुभे भूयः सशरं धनुरुत्तमम् |
विद्युदैरावतार्चिष्मद्द्वितीयेन्द्रधनुर्यथा || ६-७६-४०_END
BEGIN_
That excellent bow of his, fitted with an arrow, shone like a second bow of Indra
(the rain-god), illumined by flashes of lightning and the splendour of Airavata (the elephant
carrying Indra on its back)._END

B_6_C_76_38
BEGIN_
आकर्णकृष्टमुक्तेन जघान द्विविदं तदा |
तेन हाटकपुङ्खेन पत्रिणा पत्रवाससा || ६-७६-४१_END
BEGIN_
By that arrow with a golden shaft and fastened with feathers, drawn upto his ear and
discharged, he then struck Dvivida._END

B_6_C_76_39
BEGIN_
सहसाभिहतस्तेन विप्रमुक्तपदः स्फुरन् |
निपपाताद्रिकूटाभो विह्वलः प्लवगोत्तमः || ६-७६-४२_END
BEGIN_
Suddenly struck by that arrow, that excellent monkey possessing a splendour of Mount
Trikuta, was perturbed, with his feet swaying to and fro and fell down throbbing._END

B_6_C_76_40
BEGIN_
मैन्दस्तु भ्रातरं दृष्ट्वा भग्नं तत्र महाहवे |
अभिदुद्राव वेगेन प्रगृह्य महतीं शिलाम् || ६-७६-४३_END
BEGIN_
Beholding his brother defeated in that great battle, Mainda there on his part,
taking a large rock, rushed with speed to attack the demon._END

B_6_C_76_41
BEGIN_
तां शिलां तु प्रचिक्षेप राक्षसाय महाबलः |
बिभेद तां शिलां कुम्भः प्रसन्नैः पञ्चभिः शरैः || ६-७६-४४_END
BEGIN_
While that mighty Mainda hurled that rock towards the demon, Kumbha broke that rock
into pieces with his five shining arrows._END

B_6_C_76_42
BEGIN_
सन्धाय चान्यं सुमुखं शरमाशीविषोपमम् |
आजघान महातेजा वक्षसि द्विविदाग्रजम् || ६-७६-४५_END
BEGIN_
Stretching another arrow resembling a serpent and with a good pointed tip, Kumbha of
a great splendour, struck it on the chest of Mainda the brother of Dvivida._END

B_6_C_76_43
BEGIN_
स तु तेन प्रहारेण मैन्दो वानरयूथपः |
मर्मण्यभिहतस्तेन पपात भुवि मूर्छितः || ६-७६-४६_END
BEGIN_
As that blow of Kumbha's arrow struck that Mainda, the monkey-chief, on his vital
parts, he fell unconscious on the ground._END

B_6_C_76_44
BEGIN_
अङ्गदो मातुलौ दृष्ट्वा पतितौ तौ महाबलौ |
अभिदुद्राव वेगेन कुम्भमुद्यतकार्मुकम् || ६-७६-४७_END
BEGIN_
Seeing both his mighty maternal uncles wounded, Angada rushed speedily towards
Kumbha, who was standing with his bow uplifted._END

B_6_C_76_45
BEGIN_
तमापतन्तं विव्याध कुम्भः पञ्चभिरायसैः |
त्रिभिश्चान्यैः शितैर्बाणैर्मातङ्गमिव तोमरैः || ६-७६-४८_END
BEGIN_
With five steel arrows and with three other sharp-edged arrows, Kumbha pierced that
Angada advancing towards him, as on would pierce an elephant with goads._END

B_6_C_76_46
BEGIN_
सोऽङ्गदं विविधैर्बाणैः कुम्भो विव्याध वीर्यवान् |
अकुण्ठधारैर्निशितैस्तीक्ष्णैः कनकभूषणैः || ६-७६-४९_END
BEGIN_
That valiant Kumbha pierced Angada with a multiple of sharp arrows, decked in gold,
with edges which were harsh and sharp._END

B_6_C_76_47
BEGIN_
अङ्गदः प्रतिविद्धाङ्गो वालिपुत्रो न कम्पते |
शिलापादपवर्षाणि तस्य मूर्ध्नि ववर्ष ह || ६-७६-५०_END
BEGIN_
Angada, the son of wind-god, though pierced all over the body with sharp arrows, was
however not shaken. He showered a rain of rocks and trees on Kumbha's head._END

B_6_C_76_48
BEGIN_
स प्रचिच्छेद तान्सर्वान्बिभेद च पुनः शिलाः |
कुम्भकर्णात्मजः श्रीमान्वालिपुत्रसमीरितान् || ६-७६-५१_END
BEGIN_
The glorious Kumbha the son of Kumbhakarna chopped off all those trees hurled by
Angada and burst off the rocks further._END

B_6_C_76_49
BEGIN_
आपतन्तं च सम्प्रेक्ष्य कुम्भो वानरयूथपम् |
भ्रुवोर्विव्याध बाणाभ्यामुल्काभ्यामिव कुञ्जरम् || ६-७६-५२_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Angada the monkey-chief rushing upon him, Kumbha pierced his brows with his
brows with his arrows, as an elephant would be struck with flaming torches._END

B_6_C_76_50
BEGIN_
तस्य सुस्राव रुधिरं पिहिते चास्य लोचने |
अङ्गदः पाणिना नेत्रे पिधाय रुधिरोक्षिते || ६-७६-५३
सालमासन्नमेकेन परिजग्राह पाणिना |_END
BEGIN_
Since Angada's blood was oozing out, his eyes were covered with blood; Covering his
eyes, dampened with blood, with one hand, he caught hold of a Sala tree nearby with another
hand._END

B_6_C_76_51
BEGIN_
सम्पीड्योरसि सस्कन्धम् करेणाभिनिवेश्य च || ६-७६-५४
किञ्चिदभ्यवनम्यैनमुन्ममाथ महारणे |_END
BEGIN_
In the battle-field, propping that tree with branches and all, on his chest, holding
it with his hand and bending a little, Angada uprooted it from the ground._END

B_6_C_76_52
BEGIN_
तमिन्द्रकेतुप्रतिमं वृक्षं मन्दरसंनिभम् || ६-७६-५५
समुत्सृजन्तं वेगेन पश्यतां सर्वरक्षसाम् |_END
BEGIN_
While all the demons were looking on, Angada hurled that tree-which was tall like
Indra's banner and resembled Mount Mandara in size._END

B_6_C_76_53
BEGIN_
स चिच्छेद शितैर्बाणैः सप्तभिः कायभेदनैः || ६-७६-५६
अङ्गदो विव्यथेऽभीक्ष्णं ससाद च मुमोह च |_END
BEGIN_
That Kumbha chopped off that tree with seven sharp arrows which were capable of
splitting asunder the body. That Angada was very much perturbed and fell down, swooning._END

B_6_C_76_54
BEGIN_
अङ्गदं व्यथितं दृष्ट्वा सीदन्तमिव सागरे || ६-७६-५७
दुरासदं हरिश्रेष्ठा राघवाय न्यवेदयन् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the unconquerable Angada fallen down and sinking into depression as though in
an ocean, the monkey-chiefs informed the matter to Rama._END

B_6_C_76_55
BEGIN_
रामस्तु व्यथितं श्रुत्वा वालिपुत्रं महाहवे || ६-७६-५८
व्यादिदेश हरिश्रेष्ठाञ्जाम्बवत्प्रमुखांस्ततः |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing of Angada being seized with anguish in that great combat, Rama sent out for
help, leaders of monkeys, headed by Jambavan._END

B_6_C_76_56
BEGIN_
ते तु वानरशार्दूलाः श्रुत्वा रामस्य शासनम् || ६-७६-५९
अभिपेतुः सुसङ्क्रुद्धाः कुम्भमुद्यतकार्मुकम् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Rama's message, those excellent monkeys were very much enraged and quickly
rushed towards Kumbha who was wielding a bow in his hand._END

B_6_C_76_57
BEGIN_
ततो द्रुमशिलाहस्ताः कोपसंरक्तलोचनाः || ६-७६-६०
रिरक्षिषन्तोऽभ्यपतन्नङ्गदं वानरर्षभाः |_END
BEGIN_
With an intent to defend Angada, the monkey-chiefs then holding trees and rocks in
their hands and with their furious blood-red eyes, rushed on._END

B_6_C_76_58
BEGIN_
जाम्बवांश्च सुषेणश्च वेगदर्शी च वानरः || ६-७६-६१
कुम्भकर्णात्मजं वीरं क्रुद्धाः समभिदुद्रुवुः |_END
BEGIN_
The enraged Jambavan, Sushena and Vegadarshi, the monkey ran up towards Kumbha the
son of Kumbhakarna to attack him._END

B_6_C_76_59
BEGIN_
समीक्ष्यातततस्तांस्तु वानरेन्द्रान्महाबलान् || ६-७६-६२
आववार शरौघेण नगेनेव जलाशयम् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing those mighty monkey-chiefs coming nearer to him, Kumbha covered them with a
flood of arrows, as one would obstruct the course of a stream by means of a rock._END

B_6_C_76_60
BEGIN_
तस्य बाणचयं प्राप्य न शोकेरतिवर्तितुम् || ६-७६-६३
वानरेन्द्रा महात्मानो वेलामिव महोदधिः |_END
BEGIN_
Reaching the range of his arrows, the great souled monkey-chiefs were unable even to
look at him, much less advance towards him, any more than a great ocean would overstep its
shore._END

B_6_C_76_61
BEGIN_
तांस्तु दृष्ट्वा हरिगणाञ्शरवृष्टिभिरर्दितान् || ६-७६-६४
अङ्गदं पृष्ठतः कृत्वा भ्रातृजं प्लवगेश्वरः |
अभिदुद्राव वेगेन सुग्रीवः कुम्भमाहवे || ६-७६-६५
शैलसानु चरं नागं वेगवानिव केसरी |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing those troops of monkeys being tormented by a flood of arrows, Sugreeva the
king of monkeys, keeping Angada his brother's son in the rear, rushed headlong towards Kumbha in
the battle, as a swift lion would bounce upon an elephant walking along the slopes of a
mountain._END

B_6_C_76_62
BEGIN_
उत्पाट्य च महाशैलानश्वकर्णान्धवान्बहून् || ६-७६-६६
अन्यांश्च विविधान्वृक्षांश्चिक्षेप च महाकपिः |_END
BEGIN_
Uprooting many large trees beginning with Ashvakarna and many kinds of trees,
Sugreeva the king of monkeys hurled them on Kumbha._END

B_6_C_76_63
BEGIN_
तां छादयन्तीमाकाशं वृक्षवृष्टिं दुरासदाम् || ६-७६-६७
कुम्भकर्णात्मजः श्रीमांश्चिच्छेद निशितैः शरैः |_END
BEGIN_
The illustrious Kumbha, the son of Kumbhakarna, with his sharp arrows, chopped off
that down pour of trees, which was obscuring the sky and which was difficult to be assailed._END

B_6_C_76_64
BEGIN_
अभिलक्ष्येण तीव्रेण कुम्भेन निशितैः शरैः || ६-७६-६८
निर्भिद्यमानास्ते रेजुर्यथा घोरशतघ्नयः |_END
BEGIN_
The trees, chopped off with his sharp arrows by the brutal Kumbha, skilled in
hitting his target, shone like terrific Shataghnis (stones or cylindrical pieces of wood studded
with iron spikes)._END

B_6_C_76_65
BEGIN_
द्रुमवर्षं तु तच्छिन्नं दृष्ट्वा कुम्भेन वीर्यवान् || ६-७६-६९
वानराधिपतिः श्रीमान्महासत्त्वो न विव्यथे |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that shower of trees chopped off by Kumbha, the mighty and illustrious
Sugreeva of valour was not disturbed._END

B_6_C_76_66
BEGIN_
स विध्यमानः सहसा सहमानश्च ताञ्शरान् || ६-७६-७०
कुम्भस्य धनुराक्षिप्य बभञ्जेन्द्रधनुःप्रभम् |_END
BEGIN_
Enduring those arrows being hit, Sugreeva snatched away Kumbha's bow, possessing the
splendour of a rain-bow and broke it all at once._END

B_6_C_76_67
BEGIN_
अवप्लुत्य ततः शीघ्रं कृत्वा कर्म सुदुष्करम् || ६-७६-७१
अब्रवीत्कुपितः कुम्भं भग्नशृङ्गमिव द्विपम् |_END
BEGIN_
Thus bouncing swiftly and doing that most difficult task, the enraged Sugreeva spoke
(as follows) to Kumbha, who was looking like an elephant with a broken tusk._END

B_6_C_76_68
BEGIN_
निकुम्भाग्रज वीर्यं ते बाणवेगं तदद्भुतम् || ६-७६-७२
संनतिश्च प्रभावश्च तव वा रावणस्य वा |_END
BEGIN_
"O Kumbha, the elder brother of Nikumbha! Both your prowess and the swiftness of
your arrow are wonderful. Both Ravana and you are equal in complaisance towards demons and the
majesty too exists._END

B_6_C_76_69
BEGIN_
प्रह्रादबलिवृत्रघ्नकुबेरवरुणोपम || ६-७६-७३
एकस्त्वमनुजातोऽसि पितरं बलवत्तरः |_END
BEGIN_
"O Kumbha, the compeer of Prahlada, Bali, Indra (the destroyer of the demon Vritra),
Kubera (the god of riches) and Varuna (the god of water)! You alone are born with a likeness of
your father (Kumbhakarna) who was exceedingly strong."_END

B_6_C_76_70
BEGIN_
त्वामेवैकं महाबाहुं शूलहस्तमरिन्दमम् || ६-७६-७४
त्रिदशा नातिवर्तन्ते जितेन्द्रियमिवाधयः |
विक्रमस्व महाबुद्धे कर्माणि मम पश्य च || ६-७६-७५_END
BEGIN_
"The celestials cannot surpass even you alone, with a spike in hand, who can destroy
the enemy with your large arms, as mental agonies cannot overwhelm the one who subdued his senses.
Hence, exhibit your prowess, O demon of great intellect and see my exploits."_END

B_6_C_76_71
BEGIN_
वरदानात्पितृव्यस्ते सहते देवदानवान् |
कुम्भकर्णस्तु वीर्येण सहते च सुरासुरान् || ६-७६-७६_END
BEGIN_
"Because of the boon received by him, Ravana your uncle is able to attack the
celestials and demons. But Kumbhakarna (your father) on his part is tolerating the celestials and
demons."_END

B_6_C_76_72
BEGIN_
धनुषीन्द्रजितस्तुल्यः प्रतापे रावणस्य च |
त्वमद्य रक्षसां लोके श्रेष्ठोऽसि बलवीर्यतः || ६-७६-७७_END
BEGIN_
"You are equal in archery to Indrajit and in prowess to Ravana. Hence, you are now
the foremost in strength and heroism among the demon-folk."_END

B_6_C_76_73
BEGIN_
महाविमर्दं समरे मया सह तवाद्भुतम् |
अद्य भूतानि पश्यन्तु शक्रशम्बरयोरिव || ६-७६-७८_END
BEGIN_
"Let the created beings see your great wonderful fight with me in the battle field
today, as they saw that fight between Indra and Shambara, the demon."_END

B_6_C_76_74
BEGIN_
कृतमप्रतिमं कर्म दर्शितं चास्त्रकौशलम् |
पातिता हरिवीराश्च त्वयैते भीमविक्रमाः || ६-७६-७९_END
BEGIN_
"You have performed an incomparable task. You have also shown your skill in missile
weaponry. You have struck down these monkey-heroes possessing a terrific prowess."_END

B_6_C_76_75
BEGIN_
उपालम्भभयाच्चापि नासि वीर मया हतः |
कृतकर्मा परिश्रान्तो विश्रान्तः पश्य मे बलम् || ६-७६-८०_END
BEGIN_
"O valiant demon! Since you look tired after performing your martial duty, I did not
kill you, with a fear of public censure. Identify my strength, after taking some rest."_END

B_6_C_76_76
BEGIN_
तेन सुग्रीववाक्येन सावमानेन मानितः |
अग्नेराज्यहुतस्येव तेजस्तस्याभ्यवर्धत || ६-७६-८१_END
BEGIN_
Kumbha was thus honoured with those insulting words of Sugreeva. Kumbha's splendour
then enhanced, like the splendour of the sacrificial fire, when a melted butter is offered to it as
an oblation."_END

B_6_C_76_77
BEGIN_
ततः कुम्भस्तु सुग्रीवं बाहुभ्यां जगृहे तदा |
गजाविवातमदौ निःश्वसन्तौ मुहुर्मुहुः || ६-७६-८२
अन्योन्यगात्रग्रथितौ घर्षन्तावितरेतरम् |
सधूमां मुखतो ज्वालां विसृजन्तौ परिश्रमात् || ६-७६-८३_END
BEGIN_
The reopen, Kumbha pressingly clasped Sugreeva in his arms. Then, they stood
breathing heavily again and again as elephants in rut, having their bodies fastened against each
other, rubbing one another and emitting a flame to blaze with smoke from their faces because of
their fatigue._END

B_6_C_76_78
BEGIN_
तयोः पादाभिघाताच्च निमग्ना चाभवन्मही |
व्याघूर्णिततरङ्गश्च चुक्षुभे वरुणालयः || ६-७६-८४_END
BEGIN_
The battle-ground sank under the trampling of their feet. With their waves whirled
about, the ocean became turbulent._END

B_6_C_76_79
BEGIN_
ततः कुम्भं समुत्क्षिप्य सुग्रीवो लवणाम्ब्भसि |
पातयामास वेगेन दर्शयन्नुदधेस्तलम् || ६-७६-८५_END
BEGIN_
Then tossing up Kumbha, Sugreeva threw him down speedily into the ocean, showing him
the bottom of the sea._END

B_6_C_76_80
BEGIN_
ततः कुम्भनिपातेन जलराशिः समुत्थितः |
विन्ध्यमन्दरसंकाशो विससर्प समन्ततः|| ६-७६-८६_END
BEGIN_
Due to the hurling down of Kumbha, the fully risen sea, reaching a height of as to
that of Mount Vindhya, diffused on all sides._END

B_6_C_76_81
BEGIN_
तस्य चर्म च पुस्फोट सञ्जज्ञे चास्य शोणितम् |
स च मुष्टिर्महावेगः प्रतिजघ्नेऽस्थिमण्डले || ६-७६-८७_END
BEGIN_
The enraged Kumbha, then jumping up and throwing down Sugreeva, struck him on his
chest with his thunderbolt-like fist._END

B_6_C_76_82
BEGIN_
तदा वेगेन तत्रासीत्तेजः प्रज्वालितं मुहुः |
वज्रनिष्पेषसञ्जातज्वाला मेरौ यथा गिरौ || ६-७६-८८_END
BEGIN_
Sugreeva's armour was burst asunder. Even blood appeared oozing out of his chest.
His cage of bones gave a counter-strike to that awfully forceful fist._END

B_6_C_76_83
BEGIN_
स तत्राभिहतस्तेन सुग्रीवो वानरर्षभः |
मुष्टिं संवर्तयामास वज्रकल्पं महाबलः || ६-७६-८९_END
BEGIN_
Then, by the force of that fist shot forth there, a mighty flame resembling the fire
that bursts up on Mount Meru, was born out of a stroke of lightning._END

B_6_C_76_84
BEGIN_
अर्चिःसहस्रविकचं रविमण्डलसप्रभम् |
स मुष्टिं पातयामास कुम्भस्योरसि वीर्यवान् || ६-७६-९०_END
BEGIN_
Thus struck by Kumbha there, that mighty Sugreeva, the chief of monkeys, tightened
his fist which appeared like a thunderbolt._END

B_6_C_76_85
BEGIN_
स तु तेन प्रहरेण विह्वलो भृशपीडितः |
निपपात तदा कुम्भो गतार्चिरिव पावकः || ६-७६-९१_END
BEGIN_
The valiant Sugreeva forcefully descended his fist, which shone like the solar disc
encircled by a thousand rays, on the breast of Kumbha._END

B_6_C_76_86
BEGIN_
मुष्टिनाभिहतस्तेन निपपाताशु राक्षसः |
लोहिताङ्ग इवाकाशाद्दीप्तरश्मिर्यदृच्छया || ६-७६-९२_END
BEGIN_
That Kumbha, very much hurt by that blow, was exhausted and then fell down, like
fire whose flame has extinguished._END

B_6_C_76_87
BEGIN_
कुम्भस्य पततो रूपं भग्नस्योरसि मुष्टिना |
बभौ रुद्राभिपन्नस्य यथारूपं गवां पतेः || ६-७६-९३_END
BEGIN_
Thus struck with Sugreeva's fist, that demon fell down suddenly, as the planet Mars,
of splendid rays, would drop down from the sky accidentally._END

B_6_C_76_88
BEGIN_
तस्मिन्हते भीमपराक्रमेण |
प्लवङ्गमानामृषभेण युद्धे |
मही सशैला सवना चचाल |
भयं च रक्षांस्यधिकं विवेश || ६-७६-९४_END
BEGIN_
When Kumbha was killed in battle by Sugreeva the chief of monkeys, possessing a
terrific prowess, the earth with its mountains and forests trembled. Too much fear seized the
demons._END

B_6_C_77_0
BEGIN_निकुम्भो भ्रातरं दृष्ट्वा सुग्रीवेण निपातितम् |
प्रदहन्निव कोपेन वानरेन्द्रमुदैक्षत || ६-७७-१_END
BEGIN_Seeing his brother stretched on the ground, Nikumbha cast angry looks at Sugreeva, as 
it would burn him into ashes._END

B_6_C_77_1
BEGIN_ततः स्रग्दामसंनद्धं दत्तपञ्चाङ्गुलम् शुभम् |
आददे परिघं धीरो महेन्द्रशिखरोपमम् || ६-७७-२_END
BEGIN_Then, Nikumbha of firm mind grasped his iron club, stupendous like the crest of Mount 
Mandara and which was bright, festooned with wreaths and provided with iron plates, measuring five digits 
in breadth._END

B_6_C_77_2
BEGIN_हेमपट्टपरिक्षिप्तं वज्रविद्रुमभूषितम् |
यमदण्डोपमं भीमं रक्षसां भयनाशनम् || ६-७७-३_END
BEGIN_Round it ran a broad strip of gold while diamonds and rubies studded it all over. Like 
the death-dealing rod of Yama, it seemed causing dismay to the monkeys and nerving the demons with courage._END

B_6_C_77_3
BEGIN_तमाविध्य महातेजाः शक्रध्वजसमौजसम् |
निननाद विवृत्तास्यो निकुम्भो भीमविक्रमः || ६-७७-४_END
BEGIN_Wielding that weapon, which in size resembled the flag-staff of Indra, Nikumbha of terrific 
prowess, roared with his mouth yawing wide._END

B_6_C_77_4
BEGIN_उरोगतेन निष्केण भुजस्थैरङ्गदैरपि |
कुण्डलाभ्यां च चित्राभ्यां मालया च स चित्रया || ६-७७-५
निकुम्भो भूषणैर्भाति तेन स्म परिघेण च |
यथेन्द्रधनुषा मेघः स विद्युत्स्तनयित्नुमान् || ६-७७-६_END
BEGIN_On his chest shone a medal of gold. His arms were held by beautiful bracelets. Lustrous 
pendants depended from his ear. Resplendent garland enfolded his neck. With these ornaments and with 
his club, Nikumbha assumed the threatening semblance of a cloud, with lightning and thunder and shot 
with a vivid rainbow._END

B_6_C_77_5
BEGIN_परिघाग्रेण पुस्फोट वातग्रन्थिर्महात्मनः |
प्रजज्वाल सघोषश्च विधूम इव पावकः || ६-७७-७_END
BEGIN_The strong Nikumbha, with his arms as strong as his club, hurled his club having sun-like 
splendour, on the breast of that mighty Hanuma._END

B_6_C_77_6
BEGIN_नगर्या विटपावत्या गन्धर्वभवनोत्तमैः |
सताराग्रहनक्षत्रं सचन्द्रं समहाग्रहम् || ६-७७-८
निकुम्भपरिघाघूर्णं भ्रमतीव नभःस्थलम् |_END
BEGIN_The sky above appeared whirled around in the toss of Nikumbha's club, as though Alaka 
the City with the palaces of Gandharvas performed rapid revolutions and the moon and the stars and the 
planets joining the rotating race._END

B_6_C_77_7
BEGIN_दुरासदश्च संजज्ञे परिघाभरणप्रभः || ६-७७-९
क्रोधेन्धनो निकुम्भाग्निर्युगान्ताग्निरिवोत्थितः |_END
BEGIN_The hot tempered fire of Nikumbha, which had his club and ornaments for its flame and 
his fury as its fuel, became dangerous to be approached, like the fire rising at the time of dissolution 
of the world._END

B_6_C_77_8
BEGIN_राक्षसा वानराश्चापि न शेकुः स्पन्दितुं भयात् || ६-७७-१०
हनुमांस्तु विवृत्योरस्तस्थौ प्रमुखतो बली |_END
BEGIN_The demons and the monkeys too, out of fear, were unable even to make the slightest movement. 
The mighty Hanuma, on his part, stood alone among them, with his breast bared to the fury of the attack, 
in front of Nikumbha._END

B_6_C_77_9
BEGIN_परिघोपमबाहुस्तु परिघं भास्करप्रभम् || ६-७७-११
बली बलवतस्तस्य पातयामास वक्षसि |_END
BEGIN_The strong Nikumbha, with his arms as strong as his club, hurled his club having sun-like 
splendour, on the breast of that mighty Hanuma._END

B_6_C_77_10
BEGIN_स्थिरे तस्योरसि व्यूढे परिघः शतधा कृतः || ६-७७-१२
विकीर्यमाणः सहसा उल्काशतमिवाम्बरे |_END
BEGIN_The titanic club, which fell on the wide and rock-like chest of Hanuma, at once shattered 
into hundreds of fragments, like hundreds of meteors shattering into the sky._END

B_6_C_77_11
BEGIN_स तु तेन प्रहारेण विचचाल महाकपिः || ६-७७-१३
परिघेण समाधूतो यथा भूमिचलेऽचलः |_END
BEGIN_That Hanuma, struck by that blow of the club, was unmoved like a mountain in an earthquake._END

B_6_C_77_12
BEGIN_स तथाभिहतस्तेन हनुमान् पवगोत्तमः || ६-७७-१४
मुष्टिं सम्वर्तयामास बलेनातिमहाबलः |_END
BEGIN_Thus struck by him, the mighty Hanuma the monkey-chief clenched his fist forcibly._END

B_6_C_77_13
BEGIN_तमुद्यम्य महातेजा निकुम्भोरसि वीर्यवान् || ६-७७-१५
अभिचिक्षेप वेगेन वेगवान् वायुविक्रमः |_END
BEGIN_The greatly splendoured, powerful and swift Hanuma, with the violence of the wind-god, 
his father, lifting that fist, struck it against, Nikumbha's breast with force._END

B_6_C_77_14
BEGIN_तत्र पुस्फोट वर्मास्य प्रसुस्राव च शोणितम् |
मुष्टिना तेन संजज्ञे मेघे विद्युदिवोत्थिता || ६-७७-१६_END
BEGIN_By the blow of that fist there, his armour got split up and red blood profusely oozed 
out, as a black cloud streaked suddenly with fierce lightning._END

B_6_C_77_15
BEGIN_स तु तेन प्रहारेण निकुम्भो विचचाल ह |
स्वस्थश्चापि निजग्राह हनूमन्तं महाबलम् || ६-७७-१७_END
BEGIN_But, by that blow, Nikumbha was unmoved, recovered soon and grasped the unwieldy bulk 
of Hanuma._END

B_6_C_77_16
BEGIN_चुक्रुशुश्च तदा संख्ये भीमं लङ्कानिवासिनः |
निकुम्भेनोद्यतं दृष्ट्वा हनूमन्तं महाबलम् || ६-७७-१८_END
BEGIN_Seeing the mighty Hanuma lifted off the ground in battle, loud roar of exultant joy rose 
from the ranks of demons._END

B_6_C_77_17
BEGIN_स तथा ह्रियमाणोऽपि हनुमांस्तेन रक्षसा |
आजघानानिलसुतो वज्रकल्पेन मुष्टिना || ६-७७-१९_END
BEGIN_Eventhough he was being carried off in that way by that demon, Hanuma the son of wind-god, 
struck him with his thunderbolt-like fist._END

B_6_C_77_18
BEGIN_आत्मानं मोक्षयित्वाथ क्षितावभ्यवपद्यत |
हनूमानुन्ममाथाशु निकुम्भं मारुतात्मजः || ६-७७-२०_END
BEGIN_Freeing himself from Nikumbha, Hanuma the son of wind-god then threw him down on the 
ground and treated him with blows._END

B_6_C_77_19
BEGIN_निक्षिप्य परमायत्तो निकुम्भं निष्पिपेष च |
उत्पत्य चास्य वेगेन पपातोरसि वेगवान् || ६-७७-२१_END
BEGIN_Throwing down Nikumbha by main force and with a supreme effort, Hanuma descended on him, 
leaped on his chest and pounded it mercilessly._END

B_6_C_77_20
BEGIN_परिगृह्य च बाहुभ्यां परिवृत्य शिरोधराम् |
उत्Pआटयामास शिरो भैरवं नदतो महत् || ६-७७-२२_END
BEGIN_Then with both hands, he caught the enemy's neck, twisted it about and tore off his huge 
head, while Nikumbha was horribly roaring._END

B_6_C_77_21
BEGIN_अथ निनदति सादिते निकुम्भे |
पवनसुतेन रणे बभूव युद्धम् |
दशरथसुतराक्षसेन्द्रसून्वो |
र्भृशतरमागतरोषयोः सुभीमम् || ६-७७-२३_END
BEGIN_Then, while the roaring Nikumbha was killed in battle by Hanuma, there ensued an exceedingly 
terrific struggle between the enraged Rama and Makaraksha, son of Khara, a ruler of demons._END

B_6_C_77_22
BEGIN_व्यपेते तु जीवे निकुम्भस्य हृष्टा |
विनेदुः प्लवंगा दिशः सस्वनुश्च |
चचालेव चोर्वी पपातेव सा द्वौ |
र्बलं राक्षसानां भयम् चाविवेश || ६-७७-२४_END
BEGIN_When it was clear that Nikumbha had expired, the monkeys shouted with glee, the quarters 
thundered with satisfaction, the earth rocked with joy, the heaven appeared to crumble and fear seized 
the army of demons._END

B_6_C_78_0
BEGIN_
निकुम्भं निहतं श्रुत्वा कुम्भम् च विनिपातितम् |
रावणः परमामर्षी प्रजज्वालानलो यथा || ६-७८-१_END
BEGIN_
On hearing of Nikumbha and Kumbha having been killed, Ravana was very much flared up
like fire._END

B_6_C_78_1
BEGIN_
नैरृतः क्रोधशोकाभ्यां द्वाभ्यां तु परिमूर्चितः |
खरपुत्र विशालाक्षं मकराक्षमचोदयत् || ६-७८-२_END
BEGIN_
Engulfed with both anger and sorrow, Ravana ordered the wide-eyed Makaraksha, the
son of Khara (as follows):_END

B_6_C_78_2
BEGIN_
गच्छ पुत्र मयाज्ञप्तो बलेनाभिसमन्वितः |
राघवं लक्ष्मणम् चैव जहि तौ सवनौकसौ || ६-७८-३_END
BEGIN_
"I am commanding you! Accompanied by an army, go my son! Kill Rama, Lakshmana and
the monkeys."_END

B_6_C_78_3
BEGIN_
तावणस्य वचः श्रुत्वा शूरमानी खरात्मजः |
बाढमित्यब्रवीद्धृष्टो मकराक्षो निशाचारम् || ६-७८-४_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Ravana's words, Makaraksha, the son of Khara, thinking himself as a hero,
was rejoiced and assured Ravana that he would do it certainly as commanded._END

B_6_C_78_4
BEGIN_
सोऽभिवाद्य दशग्रीवं कृत्वा चापि प्रदक्षिणम् |
निर्जगाम गृहाच्छुभ्राद्रावणस्याज्ञया बली || ६-७८-५_END
BEGIN_
Having respectfully saluted, even by performing circumambulation, the mighty
Makaraksha, by the orders of Ravana, came forth from these shining palace of Ravana._END

B_6_C_78_5
BEGIN_
समीपस्थं बलाध्यक्षं खरपुत्रोऽब्रवीद्वचः |
रथमानीयतां तूर्णम् सैन्यं त्वानीयतां त्वरात् || ६-७८-६_END
BEGIN_
Makaraksha the son of Khara asked the commander of an army who was in the vicinity
to bring a chariot and the army swiftly._END

B_6_C_78_6
BEGIN_
तस्य तद्वचनम् श्रुत्वा बलाध्यक्षो निशाचरः |
स्यन्दनं च बलं चैव समीपं प्रत्यपादयत् || ६-७८-७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing his words, the army-commander of the demons brought the chariot and the army
to his proximity._END

B_6_C_78_7
BEGIN_
प्रदक्षिणं रथं कृत्वा समाहूय निशाचरः |
सूतं संचोदयामास शीग्रं वै रथ मावह || ६-७८-८_END
BEGIN_
Walking clockwise round the chariot and ascending it, Makaraksha asked the
charioteer to drive forward the chariot quickly to the battle-field._END

B_6_C_78_8
BEGIN_
अथ तान् राक्षसान् सर्वान् मकराक्षोऽब्रवीदिदम् |
यूयं सर्वे प्रयुध्यध्वं पुरस्तान्मम राक्षसाः || ६-७८-९_END
BEGIN_
Then Makaraksha spoke the following words to those demons, "O demons! All of you
begin your fight before my presence."_END

B_6_C_78_9
BEGIN_
अहं राक्षसराजेन रावणेन महात्मना |
आज्ञ्प्तः समरे हन्तुं रावुभौ रामल्क्ष्मणौ || ६-७८-१०_END
BEGIN_
"The mighty Ravana, the king of demons commanded me to kill both Rama and Lakshmana
in battle."_END

B_6_C_78_10
BEGIN_
अद्य रामं वधिष्यामि लक्ष्मणम् च निशाचराः |
शाखामृगं च सुग्रीवं वानरांश्च शरोत्तमैः || ६-७८-११_END
BEGIN_
"Today, I will kill Rama, Lakshmana, Sugreeva the monkey and the other monkeys with
my excellent arrows, O demons!"_END

B_6_C_78_11
BEGIN_
अद्य शूलनिपातैश्च वानराणां महाचमूम् |
प्रदहिष्यामि संप्राप्तां शुष्केन्धनमिवानलः || ६-७८-१२_END
BEGIN_
"By hurling the spears, I will destroy completely the huge army of monkeys who
arrived today to the battle-field, as the fire destroys the dry wood."_END

B_6_C_78_12
BEGIN_
मकराक्षस्य तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं ते निशाचराः |
सर्वे नानायुधोपेता बलवन्तः समाहिताः || ६-७८-१३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Makaraksha, all those strong demons, wielding various kinds
of weapons, were steadfast to fight._END

B_6_C_78_13
BEGIN_
ते कामरूपिणः क्रूरा दंष्ट्रिणः पिङ्गलेक्षणाः |
मातङ्ग इव नर्दन्तो ध्वस्तकेशा भयावहाः || ६-७८-१४
परिवार्य महाकाया महाकायं खरात्मजम् |
अभिजघ्नस्ततो हृष्टाश्चलयन्तो नभस्तलम् || ६-७८-१५_END
BEGIN_
Those cruel demons, who can change their forms at will, who had protruding tusks,
had tawny coloured eyes, had their disheveled hair, creating terror with their colossal bodies,
then marched forward like roaring elephants, shaking the firmament and surrounded the huge-bodied
Makaraksha._END

B_6_C_78_14
BEGIN_
शङ्खभेरीसहस्राणामाहतानां समन्ततः |
क्ष्वेलितास्फोटितानां च तत्र महानभूत् || ६-७८-१६_END
BEGIN_
There arose a great tumult sounded, on all sides, of thousands of couches and
kettle-drums including leonine roars and clapping of arms._END

B_6_C_78_15
BEGIN_
प्रभ्रष्टोऽथ करात्तस्य प्रतोदः सारथेस्तदा |
पपात सहसा दैवाद्ध्वजस्तस्य तु रक्षसः || ६-७८-१७_END
BEGIN_
The long whip then slipped down from the hands of Makaraksha's charioteer and the
flag-staff of that demon also suddenly fell down by the will of the province._END

B_6_C_78_16
BEGIN_
तस्य ते रथसम्युक्ता हया विक्रमवर्जिताः |
चरणैराकुलैर्गत्वा दीनाः सास्रमुखा ययुः || ६-७८-१८_END
BEGIN_
Those horses, yoked to his chariot, deprived of their diversified gait, were walking
with flurried feet and went timidly, with tears in their eyes._END

B_6_C_78_17
BEGIN_
प्रवाति पवनस्तस्मिन् सपांसुः खरदारुणः |
निर्याणे तस्य रौद्रस्य मकराक्षस्य दुर्मतेः || ६-७८-१९_END
BEGIN_
At the time of marching of that dreadful and evil-minded Makaraksha, a harsh and
fearful dust-storm blew forth._END

B_6_C_78_18
BEGIN_
तानि दृष्ट्वा निमित्तानि राक्षसा वीर्यवत्तमाः |
अचिन्त्य निर्गताः सर्वे यत्र तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ || ६-७८-२०_END
BEGIN_
Though seeing those portents, all those highly valiant demons ignored them and set
out to the place, where both Rama and Lakshmana were there._END

B_6_C_78_19
BEGIN_
घनगजमहिषाङ्गतुल्यवर्णाः |
समरमुखेष्वसकृद्गदासिभिन्नाः |
अहमहमिति युद्धकौशलास्ते |
रजनिचराः परिबभ्रामुर्नदन्तः || ६-७८-२१_END
BEGIN_
Saying thunderously, "I shall take the lead", those demons who resembled black
clouds, elephants and buffaloes in hue, who had been wounded pointedly more than once by maces and
swords in the battle-front and who were skilled in martial art, moved hither and thither in the
battle-field._END

B_6_C_79_0
BEGIN_
निर्गतं मकराक्षं ते दृष्ट्वा वानरपुंगवाः |
आप्लुत्य सहसा सर्वे योद्धुकामा व्यवस्थ्ताः || ६-७९-१_END
BEGIN_
On seeing Markaraksha come out, all those chiefs of monkeys, leaping all at once,
took their positions, with intent to give fight._END

B_6_C_79_1
BEGIN_
ततः प्रवृत्तं सुमहत्तद्युद्धं रोमहर्षणम् |
निशाचरैः प्लवंगानां देवानां दानवैरिव || ६-७९-२_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, a very great battle ensued between monkeys and demons, which caused
one's hair to bristle, like the encounter between celestials and demons._END

B_6_C_79_2
BEGIN_
वृक्षशूलनिपातैश्च गदापरिघपातनैः |
अन्योन्यं मर्दयन्ति स्म तदा कपिनिशाचराः || ६-७९-३_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys and demons then, by hurling trees and spikes and by throwing maces and
clubs, began to crush each other._END

B_6_C_79_3
BEGIN_
शक्तिखड्गगदाकुनैस्तोमरैश्च निशाचराः |
पट्टिशैर्भिन्दिपालैश्च बाणपातैः समन्ततः || ६-७९-४
पाशमुद्गरदण्डैश्च निर्गातैश्चापरैस्तथा |
कदनं कपिसिम्हानाम् चक्रुस्ते रजनीचराः || ६-७९-५_END
BEGIN_
Those demons, who were prowlers of might, made a slaughter of the lions among the
monkeys, by means of their javelins, swords, maces, spears, lances, sharp edged spears, Bhindipalas
(slings for throwing stones), nooses, mallets, staffs, missiles and other weapons and by throwing
arrows on all sides._END

B_6_C_79_4
BEGIN_
बाणौघैरर्दिताश्चापि खरपुत्रेण वानराः |
संभ्रान्तमनसः सर्वे दुद्रुवुर्भयपीडिताः || ६-७९-६_END
BEGIN_
Tormented by Makaraksha with a multitude of arrows, all the monkeys were bewildered
in mind, agonized with fear and ran away._END

B_6_C_79_5
BEGIN_
तान् दृष्ट्वा राक्षसाः सर्वे द्रवमाणान् वनौकसः |
नेदुस्ते सिंहवद्दृप्ता राक्षसा जितकाशिनः || ६-७९-७_END
BEGIN_
On seeing those monkeys fleeing, all the arrogant demons roared like lions, assuming
a triumphant feeling._END

B_6_C_79_6
BEGIN_
विद्रवत्सु तदा तेषे वानरेषु समन्ततः |
रामस्तान्वारमायास शरवर्षेण राक्षसान् || ६-७९-८_END
BEGIN_
While those monkeys were fleeing on all sides, Rama then, with a shower of arrows,
intercepted those demons on that occasion._END

B_6_C_79_7
BEGIN_
वारितान् राक्षसान् दृष्ट्वा मकराक्षो निशाचरः |
कोपानलसमाविष्टो वचनं चेदमब्रवीत् || ६-७९-९_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Rama thus interrupting the demons, Makaraksha, the demon, engrossed in a fire
of anger, spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_79_8
BEGIN_
तिष्ठ राम मया सार्थं द्वन्द्वयुद्धं भविष्यति |
त्याजयुष्यामि ते प्राणान् धनुर्मुक्तैः शितैः शरैः || ६-७९-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Pause, O Rama! You will have a dual with me. I will make your life to quit, by the
sharp arrows discharged from my bow."_END

B_6_C_79_9
BEGIN_
यत्तदा दण्डकारण्ये पितरं हतवान्मम |
तदग्रतः स्वकर्मस्थं दृष्ट्वा रोषोऽभिवर्धते || ६-७९-११_END
BEGIN_
"Since you killed my father on that day in Dandaka forest, my anger is still growing
violent, when I think of you engaged in such nefarious acts"._END

B_6_C_79_10
BEGIN_
दह्यन्ते भृशमङ्गानि दुरात्मन्मम राघव |
यन्मयासि न दृष्टस्त्वं तस्मिन् काले महावने || ६-७९-१२_END
BEGIN_
"O evil minded Rama! Since you were not being seen by me from that time in that
large forest, my limbs were getting very much fumed."_END

B_6_C_79_11
BEGIN_
दिष्ट्यासि दर्मनं राम मम त्वं प्राप्तवानिह |
कांक्षितोऽसि क्षुधार्तस्य सिम्हस्येवेतरो मृगः || ६-७९-१३_END
BEGIN_
"By a good fortune, you came into my sight here, O Rama! You are being sought by me,
as a lion in hunger seeks other animal to eat."_END

B_6_C_79_12
BEGIN_
अद्य मद्बाणवेगेन प्रेतराड्विषयं गतः |
ये त्वया निहताः शूराः सह तैश्च वसिष्यसि || ६-७९-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Now, by the flight of my arrows, you will go to the world of Death and reside there
with those warriors, who were killed by you earlier."_END

B_6_C_79_13
BEGIN_
बहुनात्र किमुक्तेन शृणु राम वचो मम |
पश्यन्तु सकला लोकास्त्वां मां चैव रणाजिरे || ६-७९-१५_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama! What is the use, by telling too much on this topic? Hear my words. All the
worlds will look at you and me, in this battle-front."_END

B_6_C_79_14
BEGIN_
अस्त्रैर्वा गदया वापि बाहुभ्यां वा रणाजिरे |
अभ्यस्तं येन वा राम वर्ततां तेन वा मृधम् || ६-७९-१६_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama! The battle will proceed in the battle-field, either with the weapons, or
with a mace or by our arms or by any other means as learnt by you."_END

B_6_C_79_15
BEGIN_
मकराक्षवचः श्रुत्वा रामो दशरथात्मजः |
अब्रवीत्प्रहसम् वाक्यमुत्तरोत्तरवादिनम् || ६-७९-१७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Makaraksha, Rama the son of Dasaratha laughingly spoke the
following words to him, who was still talking further and further (without interruption)._END

B_6_C_79_16
BEGIN_
कत्थसे किं वृथा रक्षो बहून्यसदृशानि ते |
न रणे शक्यते जेतुं विना युद्धेन वाग्बलात् || ६-७९-१८_END
BEGIN_
"O demon! Why are you boasting yourself with so many unworthy words, in vain?
Without fighting in the battle-field, it is well nigh impossible for you to attain victory with the
strength of a mere speech."_END

B_6_C_79_17
BEGIN_
चतुर्दश सहस्राणि रक्षसां त्वत्पिता च यः |
त्रिशिरा दूषणश्चापि दण्डके निहता मया || ६-७९-१९_END
BEGIN_
"I killed fourteen thousand demons along with Khara your father, Trishira and even
Dushana in Dandaka forest."_END

B_6_C_79_18
BEGIN_
स्वाशिताश्चापि मांसेन गृध्रगोमायुवायसाः |
भविष्यन्त्यद्य वै पाप तीक्षणतुण्डनखाङ्कुराः || ६-७९-२०_END
BEGIN_
"O sinful one! Today, vultures jackals and crows with their sharp beaks and
goad-like claws will be satiated with your flesh."_END

B_6_C_79_19
BEGIN_
राघवेणैवमुक्तस्तु मकराक्षो महाबलः |
बाणौघानमुचत्तस्मै राघवाय रणाजिरे || ६-७९-२१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Rama's words, the mighty Makaraksha discharged a multitude of arrows on that
Rama in the battle-field._END

B_6_C_79_20
BEGIN_
रान् शरान् शरवर्षेण रामश्चिच्छेद नैअधा |
निपेतुर्भुवि ते चिन्ना रुक्मपुङ्खाः सहस्रशः || ६-७९-२२_END
BEGIN_
Rama tore those arrows in many ways, by his array of arrows. Those arrows, which
were provided with golden shafts, fell to the ground, when torn in thousands._END

B_6_C_79_21
BEGIN_
तद्युद्धमभवत्तत्र समेत्यान्योन्यमोजसा |
खरराक्षसपुत्रस्य सूनोर्दशरथस्य च || ६-७९-२३_END
BEGIN_
That battle raged furiously, on their meeting each other there, between Makaraksha
the son of Khara the demon and Rama the son of Dasaratha._END

B_6_C_79_22
BEGIN_
जीमूतयोरिवाकाशे शब्दो ज्यातलयोस्तदा |
धनुर्मुक्तः स्वनोत्कृष्टः श्रूयते च रणाजिरे || ६-७९-२४_END
BEGIN_
Then, the sound emanated by the bows, with a great resonance, was heard on the
battle-front, like the rumbling of clouds in space._END

B_6_C_79_23
BEGIN_
देवदानवगन्धर्वाः किम्नराश्च महोरगाः |
अन्तरिक्षगताः सर्वे द्रष्टुकामास्तदद्भुतम् || ६-७९-२५_END
BEGIN_
With an intent to see that wonderful battle, all the celestials, the demons, the
celestial musicians kinnaras the mythical beings and Mahoragas the great serpents reached the
sky._END

B_6_C_79_24
BEGIN_
विद्धमन्योन्यगात्रेषु द्विगुणं वर्धते बलम् |
कृतप्रतिकृतान्योन्यं कुरुतां तौ रणाजिरे || ६-७९-२६_END
BEGIN_
Though the limbs of both were pierced by each other, their strength was redoubled.
The two warriors inflicted wounds on each other, returned the blows of the other in the
battle-front and continued the combat._END

B_6_C_79_25
BEGIN_
राममुक्तांस्तु बाणौघान् राक्षसस्त्वच्छिनद्रणे |
रक्षोमुक्तांस्तु रामो वै नैकधा प्राच्छिनच्छरैः || ६-७९-२७_END
BEGIN_
In the battle, that demon broke the multitude of arrows discharged by Rama. Rama
snapped off, in many ways, the arrows released by the demon._END

B_6_C_79_26
BEGIN_
बाणौघवितताः सर्वा दिशश्च प्रदिशस्तथा |
संचन्ना वसुधा चव समन्तान्न प्रकाशते || ६-७९-२८_END
BEGIN_
All the four quarters and the intermediate points were diffused with a multitude of
arrows. Even the earth was covered on all sides and did not become visible._END

B_6_C_79_27
BEGIN_
ततः क्रुद्धो महाबाहुर्धनुश्चिच्छेद संयुगे |
अष्टाभिरथ नाराचैः सूतं विव्याध राघवः || ६-७९-२९_END
BEGIN_
Then, the long-armed Rama, full of anger in battle, broke off the bow of the demon.
Thereupon, by his eight iron arrows, struck the charioteer._END

B_6_C_79_28
BEGIN_
भित्त्वा रथं शरै रामो हत्वा अश्वाअम[आतौअत् |
विरथो वसुधास्थः स मकराक्षो निशाचरः || ६-७९-३०_END
BEGIN_
Rama, breaking the chariot with his arrows and killing its horses, made them to fall
down dead. That Makaraksha the demon, bereft of his chariot, stood on the ground._END

B_6_C_79_29
BEGIN_
तत्तिष्ठद्वसुधां रक्षः शूलं जग्राह पाणिना |
त्रासनम् सर्वभूतानां युगान्ताग्निसमप्रभम् || ६-७९-३१_END
BEGIN_
That demon, standing on the ground, took into his hand, a spike, which created
fright among all living beings and whose splendour was equal to the fire at the end of the
world._END

B_6_C_79_30
BEGIN_
दुरवापं महच्छूलं रुद्रदत्तं भयंकरम् |
जाज्वल्यमानमाकाशे संहारास्त्रमिवापरम् || ६-७९-३२
यं दृष्ट्वा देवताः सर्वा भयार्ता विद्रुता दिशः |_END
BEGIN_
That great spike, which was difficult to be obtained, was gifted to him by Rudra,
one of the eight forms of Shiva the Lord of Dissolution. That terrible spike, which flamed
violently in the sky, looked like another new weapon of destruction of the world. On seeing it, all
the godheads were afflicted with fear and fled to different quarters._END

B_6_C_79_31
BEGIN_
विभ्राम्य च महच्चूलं प्रज्वलन्तं निशाचरः || ६-७९-३३
स क्रोधात्प्राहिणोत्तस्मै राघवाय महात्मने |_END
BEGIN_
Brandishing that flaming great spike, that enraged demon hurled it against that
great-souled rama._END

B_6_C_79_32
BEGIN_
तमापतन्तं ज्वलितं खरपुत्रकराच्च्युतम् || ६-७९-३४
बाणैश्चतुर्भिराकाशे शूलं च्छेद राघवः |_END
BEGIN_
Rama broke, by his four arrows, that flaming spike coming forth from Makaraksha's
arm and rushing towards him in the sky._END

B_6_C_79_33
BEGIN_
स भिन्नो नैकधा शूलो दिव्यहाटकमण्डितः || ६-७९-३५
व्यशीर्यत महोल्केव रामबाणार्दितो भुवि |_END
BEGIN_
That spike, adored with charming gold, broken in many ways, struck by Rama's arrows,
fell scattered on the earth, like a mighty meteor._END

B_6_C_79_34
BEGIN_
तच्छूलं निहतम् दृष्ट्वा रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा || ६-७९-३६
साधुसाध्विति भूतानि व्याहरन्ति नभोगताः |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that spike struck by Rama, who was unwearied in action, the beings standing
in the air, cried, saying 'Excellent, Excellent!'._END

B_6_C_79_35
BEGIN_
तं दृष्ट्वा निहतं शूलं मकराक्षो निशाचरः || ६-७९-३७
मुष्टिमुद्यम्य काकुत्थ्सं तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति चाब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that spike destroyed, Makaraksha the demon, rising his fist, called out to
Rama, saying "Wait, Wait!"._END

B_6_C_79_36
BEGIN_
स तं दृष्ट्वापतन्तं तु प्रहस्य रघुनन्दनः || ६-७९-३८
पावकास्त्रं ततो रामः संदधे तु शरासने |_END
BEGIN_
Then, seeing Makaraksha rushing towards him, that Rama the delight of Raghu dynasty,
while smiling, fitted to his bow, a mystic missile presided over by fire._END

B_6_C_79_37
BEGIN_
तेनास्त्रेण हतं रक्षः काकुत्स्थेन तदा रणे || ६-७९-३९
सच्छिन्नहृदयं तत्र पपात च ममार च |_END
BEGIN_
Struck by that missile by Rama, the demon with his heart split open, fell down dead
then and there, in the battle-field._END

B_6_C_79_38
BEGIN_
दृष्ट्वा ते राक्षसाः सर्वे मकराक्षस्य पातनम् || ६-७९-४०
लङ्कामेव प्रधावन्त रामबाणभयार्दिताः |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the fall of Makaraksha, all those demons, tormented by the fear of Rama's
arrows, ran away straight to Lanka._END

B_6_C_79_39
BEGIN_
दशरथनृपसूनुबाणवेगै |
रजनिचरं निहतम् खरात्मजं तम् |
प्रददृशुरथ देवताः प्रहृष्टा |
गिरिमिव वज्रहतं यथा विकीर्णम् || ६-७९-४१_END
BEGIN_
Thrilled with delight, the celestials watched that demon, the son of Khara,
destroyed by the flights of Rama's arrows and resembling a mountain shattered, after struck by
lightning._END

B_6_C_80_0
BEGIN_
मकराक्षंहतं श्रुत्वा रावणः समितिंजयः |
रोषेण महताविष्टो दन्तान् कटकटाय्य च || ६-८०-१
कोपितश्च तदा तत्र किं कार्यमिति चिन्तयन् |
आदिदेशाथ सम्क्रुद्धो रणायेन्द्रजितं सुतम् || ६-८०-२_END
BEGIN_
On hearing Makaraksha having been killed, Ravana who had been ever victorious in
battle, grinding his teeth in rage, reflected on what to do then and there, and as greatly furious
as he was, instructed Indrajit, his son to proceed to the battle-field._END

B_6_C_80_1
BEGIN_
जहि वीर महावीर्यौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ |
अदृश्यो दृश्यमानो वा सर्वथा त्वं बलाधिकः || ६-८०-३_END
BEGIN_
"O hero! Either remaining yourself invisible or visible, kill Rama and Lakshmana,
the brothers of great prowess. You are superior in strength by all means."_END

B_6_C_80_2
BEGIN_
त्वमप्रतिमकर्माणमिन्द्रं जयसि संयुगे |
किं पुनर्मानुषौ दृष्ट्वा न वधिष्यसि संयुगे || ६-८०-४_END
BEGIN_
"You have conquered Indra, of incomparable deeds, in battle. Can you not kill those
two men, on seeing them in the battle-field?"_END

B_6_C_80_3
BEGIN_
तथोक्तो राक्षसेन्द्रेण प्रतिगृह्य पितुर्वचः |
यज्ञभूमौ स विधिवत् पावकं जुहवेन्द्रजित् || ६-८०-५_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Ravana, that Indrajit, bowing to the command of his father,
poured oblations into the sacred fire, with due ceremony, on the sacrificial ground._END

B_6_C_80_4
BEGIN_
जुह्वतश्चापि तत्राग्निं रक्तोष्णीषधराः स्त्रियः |
आजग्मुस्तत्र सम्भ्रान्ता राक्षस्यो यत्र रावणिः || ६-८०-६_END
BEGIN_
Even as he was pouring oblations into the sacred fire there, the female-demons
carrying red turbans (for the use of priests) hastily arrived at the spot where Indrajit was
there._END

B_6_C_80_5
BEGIN_
शस्त्राणि शरपत्राणि समिधो|अ अथ विभीतकाः |
लोहितानि च वासांसि स्रुवं कार्ष्णायसं तथा || ६-८०-७_END
BEGIN_
Weapons (such as a lance) served as blades of Shara grass (for being spread around
the sacrificial fire). Chips of wood of Vibhitaka tree served as wooden sticks to feed the
sacrificial fire as also red robes and iron ladles were used for cleaning and pouring clarified
melted butter into the sacrificial fire._END

B_6_C_80_6
BEGIN_
सर्वतो|अग्निं समास्तीर्य शरपत्रैः सतोमरैः |
चागस्य सर्वकृष्णस्य गलं जग्राह जीवतः || ६-८०-८_END
BEGIN_
Having spread on the ground around all the sides of the sacrificial fire with other
weapons along with lances, the demon seized hold of the neck of a live goat, entirely black and
consigned it to the fire._END

B_6_C_80_7
BEGIN_
सकृद्धोमसमिद्धस्य विधूमस्य महार्चिषः |
बभूवुस्तानि लिङ्गानि विजयं दर्शयन्ति च || ६-८०-९_END
BEGIN_
Such omens as betokened victory appeared in the smokeless fire which burst into
mighty flames, when it was fully aroused by that single offering._END

B_6_C_80_8
BEGIN_
प्रदक्षिणावर्तशिखस्तप्तहाटकसन्निभः |
हविस्तत्प्रतिजग्राह पावकः स्वयमुत्थितः || ६-८०-१०_END
BEGIN_
Becoming visible in person, the god of fire, who was shooting out flames towards the
right and who shone brightly like refined gold, received that offering._END

B_6_C_80_9
BEGIN_
हुत्वाग्निम् तर्पयित्वाथ देवदानवराक्षसान् |
आरुरोह रथश्रेष्ठमन्तर्धानगरं शुभम् || ६-८०-११_END
BEGIN_
Offering oblations in fire and gratifying the gods, the devils and demons, Indrajit
ascended an excellent and splendid chariot, capable of disappearing from sight._END

B_6_C_80_10
BEGIN_
स वाजिभिश्चतुर्भिस्तु बाणैस्तु निशितैर्युतः |
आरोपितमहाचापः शुशुभे स्यन्दनोत्तमः || ६-८०-१२_END
BEGIN_
Drawn by four horses, provided with sharp arrows and a mighty bow placed on it, that
excellent chariot looked beautiful._END

B_6_C_80_11
BEGIN_
जाज्वल्यमानो वपुषा तपनीयपरिच्छदः |
मृगैश्चन्द्रार्धचन्द्रैश्च स रथः समलंकृतः || ६-८०-१३_END
BEGIN_
Adorned with gold, that chariot glittered on account of its body and was decorated
with carved images of antelopes, full moons and crescents._END

B_6_C_80_12
BEGIN_
जाम्बूनदमहाकम्बुर्दीप्तपावकसन्निभः |
बभूवेन्द्रजितः केतुर्वैदूर्यसमलंकृतः || ६-८०-१४_END
BEGIN_
The flag-post of Indrajit shone like a flaming fire, provided, as it was, with large
rings of gold and decorated with cat's eye gems._END

B_6_C_80_13
BEGIN_
तेन चादित्यकल्पेन ब्रह्मस्त्रेण च पालितः |
स बभूव दुराधर्षो रावणिः सुमहाबलः || ६-८०-१५_END
BEGIN_
Protected by the missile presided over by Brahma, which was as efflugent as the sun,
that Indrajit endowed with exceptional strength, became difficult to be attacked._END

B_6_C_80_14
BEGIN_
सो|अभिनिर्याय नगरादिन्द्रजित्समितिञ्जयः |
हुत्वाग्निं राक्षसैर्मन्रैरन्तर्धानगतो|अब्रवीत् || ६-८०-१६_END
BEGIN_
Coming forth from the city and having acquired the capacity of vanishing from the
sight, by offering oblations into the sacred fire, with the uttereance of spells sacred to demons,
that indrajit, who was ever victorious in war, spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_80_15
BEGIN_
अद्य हत्वा रणे यौ तौ मिथ्याप्रव्रजितौ वने |
जयं पित्रे प्रदास्यामि रावणाय रणार्जितम् || ६-८०-१७_END
BEGIN_
"By killing both the princes who left home to become religious mendicants in the
forest in vain, I will present a gift of victory secured in the battle, to my father, Ravana
today."_END

B_6_C_80_16
BEGIN_
अद्य निर्वानरामुर्वीम् हत्वा रामं च लक्ष्मणम् |
करिष्ये परमां प्रीतिमित्युक्त्वान्तरधीयत || ६-८०-१८_END
BEGIN_
"By making the earth bereft of monkeys today and by killing Rama and Lakshmana, I
will create a great spleasure". Thus speaking, Indrajit vanished from thes sight._END

B_6_C_80_17
BEGIN_
आपपाताथ सम्क्रुद्धो दशग्रीवेण चोदितः |
तीक्षणकार्मुकनाराचैस्तीक्षणस्त्विन्द्ररिपू रणे || ६-८०-१९_END
BEGIN_
Impelled, as he was, by Ravana, the fiery Indrajit, with his barbarons bow and steel
arrows, swiftly came to the battle-field enraged._END

B_6_C_80_18
BEGIN_
स ददर्श महावीर्यौ नागौ त्रिशिरसाविव |
सृजन्ताविषुजालानि वीरौ वानरमध्यगौ || ६-८०-२०_END
BEGIN_
That Indrajit saw the two heroes, showering a multitude of arrows. Both the princes,
having mighty prowess, looked like three- hooded serpents in the middle of the monkeys._END

B_6_C_80_19
BEGIN_
इमौ ताविति संचिन्त्य सज्यं कृत्वा च कार्मुकम् |
सन्ततानेषुधाराभिः पर्जन्य इव वृष्टिमान् || ६-८०-२१_END
BEGIN_
Concluding that both of them were the two princes, Rama and Lakshmana and stringing
his bow, he covered them with a flood of arrows, as the rainy clouds do._END

B_6_C_80_20
BEGIN_
स तु वैहायसं प्राप्य सरथो रामलक्ष्मणौ |
अचक्षुर्विषये तिष्ठन्विव्याध निशितैः शरैः || ६-८०-२२_END
BEGIN_
That Indrajit with his chariot, reaching the sky and remaining invisible, struck
Rama and Lakshmana with his sharp arrows._END

B_6_C_80_21
BEGIN_
तौ तस्य शरवेगेन परीतौ रामलक्ष्मणौ |
धनुषी सशरे कृत्वा दिव्यमस्त्रं प्रचक्रतुः || ६-८०-२३_END
BEGIN_
When enveloped by a stream of arrows Rama and Lakshamana, fitted arrows to their
bows and revealed divine missiles._END

B_6_C_80_22
BEGIN_
प्रच्छादयन्तौ गगनम् शरजालैर्महाबलौ |
तमस्त्रैः सुरसङ्काशौ नैव पस्पर्शतुः शरैः || ६-८०-२४_END
BEGIN_
Though covering the sky with a net-work of arrows, the two mighty princes could not
touch Indrajit with their arrows charged with mystic missiles and which were efflugent like the
sun._END

B_6_C_80_23
BEGIN_
स हि धूमान्धकारं च चक्रे प्रच्छादयन्नभः |
दिशश्चान्तर्दधे श्रीमान्नीहारतमसावृतः || ६-८०-२५_END
BEGIN_
Covering the sky, the illustrious Indrajit created a dark-like smoke. He made the
quarters also invisible, by enclosing them with mist-liek darkness._END

B_6_C_80_24
BEGIN_
नैव ज्यातलनिर्घोषो न च नेमिखुरस्वनः |
शुश्रुवे चरतस्तस्य न च रूपं प्रकाशते || ६-८०-२६_END
BEGIN_
While Indrajit was moving about, neither the sound produced by the impact of his
palm on the bow string was heard, nor the sound of his wheels or the clattering of hoofs of his
horses could be heard, nor did his form come tot he view._END

B_6_C_80_25
BEGIN_
घनान्धकारे तिमिरे शरवर्षमिवाद्भुतम् |
स ववर्ष महाबाहुर्नाराचशरवृष्टिभिः || ६-८०-२७_END
BEGIN_
In that thick darkness, that long-armed Indrajit showered hails of his steel arrows,
like wonderful shower of rocks._END

B_6_C_80_26
BEGIN_
स रामं सूर्यसङ्काशैः शरैर्दत्तवरो भृशम् |
विव्याध समरे क्रुद्धः सर्वगात्रेषु रावणिः || ६-८०-२८_END
BEGIN_
That enraged Indrajit in battle, abundantly pierced Rama in all his limbs with his
arrows, which were earlier granted as boons to him and which were effluent like the sun._END

B_6_C_80_27
BEGIN_
तौ हन्यमानौ नाराचैर्धाराभिरिव पर्वतौ |
हेमपुङ्खान्नरव्याघ्रौ तिग्मान्मुमुचतुः शरान् || ६-८०-२९_END
BEGIN_
Both Rama and Lakshmana, the foremost of men, who were being struck with steel
arrows, like two mountains being hit by torrents, released sharp golden-shafted arrows._END

B_6_C_80_28
BEGIN_
अन्तरिक्षं समासाद्य रावणिं कङ्कपत्रिणः |
निकृत्य पतगा भूमौ पेतुस्ते शोणितोक्षिताः || ६-८०-३०_END
BEGIN_
Those arrows, adorned with plumes of heron, reaching Indrajit in the sky and
piercing him, fell to the ground, soaked in blood._END

B_6_C_80_29
BEGIN_
अतिमात्रं शरौघेण पीड्यमानौ नरोत्तमौ |
तानिषून्पततो भल्लैरनेकैर्निचकर्ततुः || ६-८०-३१_END
BEGIN_
Shining beyond measure with a flood of arrows, the two excellent men began to chop
off those arrows which were falling on them with many arrows called by the name of Bhallas._END

B_6_C_80_30
BEGIN_
यतो हि ददृशाते तौ शरान्निपतिताञ्शितान् |
ततस्ततो दाशरथी ससृजातेऽस्त्रमुत्तमम् || ६-८०-३२_END
BEGIN_
Both Rama and Lakshmana for their part directed their excellent missiles in the
direction from which they saw the aforesaid sharp arrows, fallen._END

B_6_C_80_31
BEGIN_
रावणिस्तु दिशः सर्वा रथेनातिरथः पतन् |
विव्याध तौ दाशरथी लघ्वस्त्रो निशितैः शरैः || ६-८०-३३_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit for his part, who was a superior chariot-warrior and who was swift in
discharging missiles, rushed on towards all sides and pierced Rama and Lakshmana with his sharp
arrows._END

B_6_C_80_32
BEGIN_
तेनातिविद्धौ तौ वीरौ रुक्मपुङ्खैः सुसंहतैः |
बभूवतुर्दाशरथी पुष्पिताविव किंशुकौ || ६-८०-३४_END
BEGIN_
Those valiant princes, Rama and Lakshmana pierced deeply with well-made goldne
shafted arrows, appeared like two Kamshuka trees in flowering._END

B_6_C_80_33
BEGIN_
नास्य वेद गतिं कश्चिन्न च रूपं धनुः शरान् |
न चान्यद्विदितं किं चित्सूर्यस्येवाभ्रसम्प्लवे || ६-८०-३५_END
BEGIN_
No one could perceive his rapid movement, like the position of the sun when the sky
is thickly overcast with clouds, nor his form nor his bows and arrows, nor any other thing about
him whatsoever could be known._END

B_6_C_80_34
BEGIN_
तेन विद्धाश्च हरयो निहताश्च गतासवः |
बभूवुः शतशस्तत्र पतिता धरणीतले || ६-८०-३६_END
BEGIN_
Struck down by him, the monkeys were killed. The monkeys dropped dead in hundreds on
the earth's surface there._END

B_6_C_80_35
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणस्तु सुसङ्क्रुद्धो भ्रातरं वाक्यमब्रवीत् |
ब्राह्ममस्त्रं प्रयोक्ष्यामि वधार्थं सर्वरक्षसाम् || ६-८०-३७_END
BEGIN_
Then, Lakshmana for his part was enraged and told his brother that he would employ
the missile presided over by Brahma for the purpose of killing all the demons._END

B_6_C_80_36
BEGIN_
तमुवाच ततो रामो लक्ष्मणं शुभलक्षणम् |
नैकस्य हेतो रक्षांसि पृथिव्यां हन्तुमर्हसि || ६-८०-३८_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama spoke to that Lakshmana, who was endowed with auspicious bodily marks as
follows: "You ought not to kill all the demons on earth, merely for the sake of a single
demon."_END

B_6_C_80_37
BEGIN_
अयुध्यमानं प्रच्छन्नं प्राञ्जलिं शरणागतम् |
पलायन्तं प्रमत्तं वा न त्वं हन्तुमिहार्हसि || ६-८०-३९_END
BEGIN_
"You ought not to kill on this earth one who is not fighting or one who is hiding or
one who seeks refuge with joined palms or is fleeing or is intoxicated."_END

B_6_C_80_38
BEGIN_
अस्यैव तु वधे यत्नं करिष्यावो महाबल |
आदेक्ष्यावो महावेगानस्त्रानाशीविषोपमान् || ६-८०-४०_END
BEGIN_
"O long-armed Lakshmana! We shall try to kill Indrajit alone. We will employ mystic
mssiles with great impetuosity and which are equal to venomous serpents."_END

B_6_C_80_39
BEGIN_
तमेनं मायिनं क्षुद्रमन्तर्हितरथं बलात् |
राक्षसं निहनिष्यन्ति दृष्ट्वा वानरयूथपाः || ६-८०-४१_END
BEGIN_
"On seeing this demons, the leaders of mokey-troops will forcibly kill this petty
demon, who is skilled in conjuring tricks and whose chariot remains invisible."_END

B_6_C_80_40
BEGIN_
यद्येष भूमिं विशते दिवं वा |
रसातलं वापि नभस्तलं वा |
एवं निगूढोऽपि ममास्त्रदग्धः |
पतिष्यते भूमितले गतासुः || ६-८०-४२_END
BEGIN_
"Scorched by my mystic missiles, he will fall dead on the ground, even if he enters
the earth or into heaven or into the subterrranean world or penetrates the vault of heaven and
remains completely hidden in this manner."_END

B_6_C_80_41
BEGIN_
इत्येवमुक्त्वा वचनं महात्मा |
रघुप्रवीरः प्लवगर्षभैर्वृतः |
वधाय रौद्रस्य नृशंसकर्मणस् |
तदा महात्मा त्वरितं निरीक्षते || ६-८०-४३_END
BEGIN_
Speaking highly meaningful words in the aforesaid manner, the great-souled Rama,
surrounded by the foremost of monkeys, started to reflect on the speedy means of killing the
furious Indrajit, the demons of cruel deeds._END

B_6_C_81_0
BEGIN_
विज्ञाय तु मनस्तस्य राघवस्य महात्मनः |
संनिवृत्याहवात्तस्मात्प्रविवेश पुरं ततः || २-८१-१_END
BEGIN_
Guessing the mind of that great-souled Rama, Indrajit turning away from that battle,
entered the City._END

B_6_C_81_1
BEGIN_
सोऽनुस्मृत्य वधं तेषां राक्षसानां तरस्विनाम् |
क्रोधताम्रेक्षणः शूरो निर्जगाम महाद्युतिः || २-८१-२_END
BEGIN_
Then, recalling the killing of those energetic demons like Kumbhakarna and others,
that valiant Indrajit sallied forth (for the fight) with red-hot eyes in anger._END

B_6_C_81_2
BEGIN_
स पश्चिमेन द्वारेण निर्ययौ राक्षसैर्वृतः |
इन्द्रजित्तु महावीर्यः पौलस्त्यो देवकण्टकः || २-८१-३_END
BEGIN_
That Indrajit, of very great prowess, the adversary of gods and who was born in Sage
Pulstya's dynasty, accompanied by an army of demons, came forth from the western gate._END

B_6_C_81_3
BEGIN_
इन्द्रजित्तु ततो दृष्ट्वा भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ |
रणायाभ्युद्यतौ वीरौ मायां प्रादुष्करोत्तदा || २-८१-४_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the two valiant brothers, Rama and Lakshamana, who were prepared for the
encounter, Indrajit for his part, then started to demonstrate his conjuring tricks._END

B_6_C_81_4
BEGIN_
इन्द्रजित्तु रथे स्थाप्य सूतां मायामयीं तदा |
बलेन महतावृत्य तस्या वधमरोचयत् || २-८१-५_END
BEGIN_
Placing an illusory image of Seetha on his chariot and a large army surrounding the
chariot, Indrajit intended to kill her._END

B_6_C_81_5
BEGIN_
मोहनार्थं तु सर्वेषां बुद्धिं कृत्वा सुदुर्मतिः |
हन्तुं सीतां व्यवसितो वानराभिमुखो ययौ || २-८१-६_END
BEGIN_
Making up his mind to purposefully confuse all, by playing a trick to kill Seetha's
illusory image, the exceedingly evil-minded Indrajit sallied forth towards the direction of the
monkeys._END

B_6_C_81_6
BEGIN_
तं दृष्ट्वा त्वभिनिर्यान्तं नगर्याः काननौकसः |
उत्पेतुरभिसङ्क्रुद्धाः शिलाहस्ता युयुत्सवः || २-८१-७_END
BEGIN_
Seeing him coming forth towards their direction, all those monkeys were enraged and
bounced towards him, with rocks in their hands and with an intent to fight._END

B_6_C_81_7
BEGIN_
हनूमान्पुरतस्तेषां जगाम कपिकुञ्जरः |
प्रगृह्य सुमहच्छृङ्गं पर्वतस्य दुरासदम् || २-८१-८_END
BEGIN_
Hanuma, the foremost among the monkeys, taking hold of a very large mountain-peak,
which was difficult to be reached by others, marched in front._END

B_6_C_81_8
BEGIN_
स ददर्श हतानन्दां सीताम् इन्द्रजितो रथे |
एकवेणीधरां दीनामुपवासकृशाननाम् || २-८१-९
परिक्लिष्टैकवसनाममृजां राघवप्रियाम् |
रजोमलाभ्यामालिप्तैः सर्वगात्रैर्वरस्त्रियम् || २-८१-१०_END
BEGIN_
That Hanuma saw Seetha, the wife of Rama, the best among women, bereft of joy,
wearing only a single braid of hair, looking miserable, with her face emaciated due to fasting,
dressed in a single worn-out clothing, unadorned and with all her limbs covered with dust and dirt;
in the chaiot of Indrajit._END

B_6_C_81_9
BEGIN_
तां निरीक्ष्य मुहूर्तं तु मैथिलीम् अध्यवस्य च |
बाष्पपर्याकुलमुखो हनूमान्व्यथितोऽभवत् || २-८१-११_END
BEGIN_
On seeing her for a moment, Hanuma ascertained her as Seetha and became dejected.
That Seetha was indeed seen by him, not long ago._END

B_6_C_81_10
BEGIN_
अब्रवीत्तां तु शोकार्तां निरानन्दां तपस्विनाम् |
दृष्ट्वा रथे स्तितां सीतां राक्षसेन्द्रसुताश्रिताम् || २-८१-१२
किं समर्थितमस्येति चिन्तयन्स महाकपिः |
सह तैर्वानरश्रेष्ठैरभ्यधावत रावणिम् || २-८१-१३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing her stricken with grief bereft of joy, looking distreseed, miserable and
sitting under the sway of Indrajit, Hanuma wondered as to what his intention might be. Thus
thinking, he along with those leaders of mnkeys, rushed towards Indrajit._END

B_6_C_81_11
BEGIN_
तद्वानरबलं दृष्ट्वा रावणिः क्रोधमूर्छितः |
कृत्वा विशोकं निस्त्रिंशं मूर्ध्नि सीतां परामृशत् || २-८१-१४_END
BEGIN_
Beholding that army of monkeys, Indrajit was excited with anger, pulled Seetha by
the hair on her head and unsheathed his sword._END

B_6_C_81_12
BEGIN_
तं स्त्रियं पश्यतां तेषां ताडयामास रावणिः |
क्रोशन्तीं राम रामेति मायया योजितां रथे || २-८१-१५_END
BEGIN_
While those monkeys were seeing, demon began to strike that woman who was placed in
the chariot by the dint of his conjuring trick and who was crying "Rama! Rama!"_END

B_6_C_81_13
BEGIN_
गृहीतमूर्धजां दृष्ट्वा हनूमान्दैन्यमागतः |
दुःखजं वारिनेत्राभ्यामुत्सृजन्मारुतात्मजः || २-८१-१६_END
BEGIN_
On seeing her seized by the hair Hanuma the son of wind-god was confounded with
affliction and shed tears, in agony from his eyes._END

B_6_C_81_14
BEGIN_
ताम् दृष्ट्वा चारुसर्वाङ्गीं रामस्य महिषीं प्रियाम् |
अब्रवीत्परुषं वाक्यं क्रोधाद्रक्षोधिपात्मजम् || २-८१-१७_END
BEGIN_
On seeing Seetha with all her charming limbs, the beloved wife of Rama, Hanuma
angrily addressed the foolowing harsh words to Indrajit:_END

B_6_C_81_15
BEGIN_
दुरात्मन्नात्मनाशाय केशपक्षे परामृशः |
ब्रह्मर्षीणां कुले जातो राक्षसीं योनिमाश्रितः || २-८१-१८_END
BEGIN_
"O evil minded one! Born in a dynasty of Brahmanical sages, but belonging to
demoniacal race, you touched a lock of her hair, for your hair, for your own ruin."_END

B_6_C_81_16
BEGIN_
धिक्त्वां पापसमाचारं यस्य ते मतिरीदृशी |
नृशंसानार्य दुर्वृत्त क्षुद्र पापपराक्रम || २-८१-१९
अनार्यस्येदृशं कर्म घृणा ते नास्ति निर्घृण |_END
BEGIN_
"O cruel, vulgar and mean fellow! O wicked demon of sinful prowess! O pitiless
fellow! Woe be to you, of sinful conduct, in whom such a resolve has taken place. Such an act is
worthy of a barbarian. There is no pity in you."_END

B_6_C_81_17
BEGIN_
च्युता गृहाच्च राज्याच्च रामहस्ताच्च मैथिली || २-८१-२०
किं तवैषापराद्धा हि यदेनां हिंसि निर्दय |_END
BEGIN_
"O pitiless one! Seetha came away from her house, from her kingdom and from her
huband's (Rama's) protection. What wrong has Seetha done to you, that you are killing her?"_END

B_6_C_81_18
BEGIN_
सीतां च हत्वा न चिरं जीविष्यसि कथं चन || २-८१-२१
वधार्हकर्मणानेन मम हस्तगतो ह्यसि |_END
BEGIN_
"By killing Seetha, you will not survivie for long in any way. O demon, desrving of
death! By your act, you indeed fell into my hands."_END

B_6_C_81_19
BEGIN_
ये च स्त्रीघातिनां लोका लोकवध्यैश्च कुत्सिताः || २-८१-२२
इह जीवितमुत्सृज्य प्रेत्य तान्प्रतिलप्स्यसे |_END
BEGIN_
"Abandoning your life in this world, you shall, after death, descend to those worlds
which are the lot of the killers of women and are condemned even by those who deserved to be killed
by the people."_END

B_6_C_81_20
BEGIN_
इति ब्रुवाणो हनुमान्सायुधैर्हरिभिर्वृतः || २-८१-२३
अभ्यधावत सङ्क्रुद्धो राक्षसेन्द्रसुतं प्रति |_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking, Hanuma surrounded as he was by monkeys with their weapons and very
much enraged, rushed headlong towards Indrajit._END

B_6_C_81_21
BEGIN_
आपतन्तं महावीर्यं तदनीकं वनौकसाम् || २-८१-२४
रक्षसां भीमवेगानामनीकेन न्यवारयत् |_END
BEGIN_
The army of demons of terrible rage intercepted that army of mokeys possessing a
high prowess and advancing towards them._END

B_6_C_81_22
BEGIN_
स तां बाणसहस्रेण विक्षोभ्य हरिवाहिनीम् || २-८१-२५
हरिश्रेष्ठं हनूमन्तमिन्द्रजित्प्रत्युवाच ह |_END
BEGIN_
Stirring up that army of mokeys with a multitude of his arrows, Indrajit replied to
Hanuma, the foremost of mokeys as follows:_END

B_6_C_81_23
BEGIN_
सुग्रीवस्त्वं च रामश्च यन्निमित्तमिहागताः || २-८१-२६
तां हनिष्यामि वैदेहीमद्यैव तव पश्यतः |_END
BEGIN_
"For whose sake, Sugreeva, yourself and Rama came here, I am going to kill Seetha
now itself, while you stand looking on."_END

B_6_C_81_24
BEGIN_
इमां हत्वा ततो रामं लक्ष्मणं त्वां च वानर || २-८१-२७
सुग्रीवं च वधिष्यामि तं चानार्यं विभीषणम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O monkey! After killing her, I will make a short work of Rama, Lakshmana, yourself
too, Sugreeva and that vulgar Vibhishana thereafter."_END

B_6_C_81_25
BEGIN_
न हन्तव्याः स्त्रियश्चेति यद्ब्रवीषि प्लवङ्गम || २-८१-२८
पीडा करममित्राणां यत्स्यात्कर्तव्यमेत तत् |_END
BEGIN_
"O monkey! What you have said just now viz. that women are not to be killed, is
correct. But that which causes tormentation to the enemies indeed needs to be done."_END

B_6_C_81_26
BEGIN_
तमेवमुक्त्वा रुदतीं सीतां मायामयीं ततः || २-८१-२९
शितधारेण खड्गेन निजघानेन्द्रजित्स्वयम् |_END
BEGIN_
Having spoken thus to Hanuma, Indrajit personally killed that illusory Seetha, who
ahd been sobbing all the while, with his sharp-edged sword._END

B_6_C_81_27
BEGIN_
यज्ञोपवीतमार्गेण छिन्ना तेन तपस्विनी || २-८१-३०
सा पृथिव्यां पृथुश्रोणी पपात प्रियदर्शना |_END
BEGIN_
Split asunder by him diagonally, that miserable lady of broad hips and pleasant to
the sight, fell down on the ground._END

B_6_C_81_28
BEGIN_
तामिन्द्रजित्स्त्रियं हत्वा हनूमन्तमुवाच ह || २-८१-३१
मया रामस्य पश्येमां कोपेन च निषूदिताम् |
एषा विशस्ता वैदेही निष्फलो वः परिश्रमः || २-८१-३२_END
BEGIN_
After killing that woman, Indrajit told Hanuma as follows: "See, I killed Rama's
wife with my weapon. This Seetha is dead and all your labour is in vain."_END

B_6_C_81_29
BEGIN_
ततः खड्गेन महता हत्वा ताम् इन्द्रजित्स्वयम् |
हृष्टः स रथमास्थाय विननाद महास्वनम् || २-८१-३३_END
BEGIN_
After killing her with a large sword personally, that Indrajit then sitting on his
chariot, pleasurefully roared loudly._END

B_6_C_81_30
BEGIN_
वानराः शुश्रुवुः शब्दमदूरे प्रत्यवस्थिताः |
व्यादितास्यस्य नदतस्तद्दुर्गं संश्रितस्य तु || २-८१-३४_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys standing in vicinity heard his roar, even as he shouted with his mouth
wide open, while comfortable sitting in that tower of the aerial chriot, which was actually
difficult of access for others._END

B_6_C_81_31
BEGIN_
तथा तु सीतां विनिहत्य दुर्मतिः |
प्रहृष्टचेताः स बभूव रावणिः |
तं हृष्टरूपं समुदीक्ष्य वानरा |
विषण्णरूपाः समभिप्रदुद्रुवुः || २-८१-३५_END
BEGIN_
After killing Seetha in that way, the evil-minded Indrajit became exceedingly glad.
Seeing him exceedingly pleased, the monkeys looked dejected and suddenly ran away._END

B_6_C_82_0
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा तं भीमनिर्ह्रादं शक्राशनिसमस्वनम् |
वीक्षमाणा दिशः सर्वा दुद्रुवुर्वानरर्षभाः || ६-८२-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that terrific roar, similar to the sound of Indra's thunderbolt, the monkeys
looking hither and thither, ran away in all directions._END

B_6_C_82_1
BEGIN_
तानुवाच ततः सर्वान्हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः |
विषण्णवदनान्दीनांस्त्रस्तान्विद्रवतः पृथक् || ६-८२-२_END
BEGIN_
Then, Hanuma the son of wind-god spoke (as follows) to all those monkeys, who were
running away widely apart, looking dejected, miserable and frightened._END

B_6_C_82_2
BEGIN_
कस्माद्विषण्णवदना विद्रवध्वं प्लवङ्गमाः |
त्यक्तयुद्धसमुत्साहाः शूरत्वं क्व नु वो गतम् || ६-८२-३_END
BEGIN_
"O, monkeys! Why are you running away, looking dejected and leaving your zeal to
fight? Where has your valour gone?"_END

B_6_C_82_3
BEGIN_
पृष्ठतोऽनुव्रजध्वं मामग्रतो यान्तमाहवे |
शूरैरभिजनोपेतैरयुक्तं हि निवर्तितुम् || ६-८२-४_END
BEGIN_
"Come along closely behind me, while I am marching ahead in the battle. For the
valiant who are born in a good family, it is not indeed proper to shrink back from the battle."_END

B_6_C_82_4
BEGIN_
एवमुक्ताः सुसङ्क्रुद्धा वायुपुत्रेण धीमता |
शैलशृङ्गान्द्रुमांश्चैव जगृहुर्हृष्टमानसाः || ६-८२-५_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of that wise Hanuma, the monkeys in a cheerful mood, took hold of
mountain-peaks and trees in a great fury._END

B_6_C_82_5
BEGIN_
अभिपेतुश्च गर्जन्तो राक्षसान्वानरर्षभाः |
परिवार्य हनूमन्तमन्वयुश्च महाहवे || ६-८२-६_END
BEGIN_
The foremost of monkeys, while roaring, rushed towards the demons. They followed
him, by surrounding Hanuma on all sides, in that great battle._END

B_6_C_82_6
BEGIN_
स तैर्वानरमुख्यैस्तु हनूमान्सर्वतो वृतः |
हुताशन इवार्चिष्मानदहच्छत्रुवाहिनीम् || ६-८२-७_END
BEGIN_
That Hanuma, being surrounded by those monkey-chiefs on all sides, began to consume
that army of adversaries as a flaming fire._END

B_6_C_82_7
BEGIN_
स राक्षसानां कदनं चकार सुमहाकपिः |
वृतो वानरसैन्येन कालान्तकयमोपमः || ६-८२-८_END
BEGIN_
That Hanuma, accompanied by his army of monkeys, brought about the destruction of
demons, as Yama the lord of death does at the time of universal dissolution._END

B_6_C_82_8
BEGIN_
स तु शोकेन चाविष्टः क्रोधेन च महाकपिः |
हनूमान्रावणि रथे महतीं पातयच्छिलाम् || ६-८२-९_END
BEGIN_
Filled with inordinate grief and rage, that Hanuma the monkey-chief, threw a large
rock on Indrajit's chariot._END

B_6_C_82_9
BEGIN_
तामापतन्तीं दृष्ट्वैव रथः सारथिना तदा |
विधेयाश्व समायुक्तः सुदूरमपवाहितः || ६-८२-१०_END
BEGIN_
On seeing that rock rushing towards them, the obedient horses, yoked to that
chariot, carried the chariot off to a far-distance._END

B_6_C_82_10
BEGIN_
तमिन्द्रजितमप्राप्य रथथं सहसारथिम् |
विवेश धरणीं भित्त्वा सा शिलाव्यर्थमुद्यता || ६-८२-११_END
BEGIN_
That rock employed in vain, without reaching that Indrajit and his charioteer
sitting in the chariot, split itself into fragments and penetrated the ground._END

B_6_C_82_11
BEGIN_
पतितायां शिलायां तु रक्षसां व्यथिता चमूः |
निपतन्त्या च शिलया राक्षसा मथिता भृशम् || ६-८२-१२_END
BEGIN_
The demons were very much bruised by the falling fragments of the rock. That army of
demons was perturbed over the rock thus falling upon them._END

B_6_C_82_12
BEGIN_
तमभ्यधावञ्शतशो नदन्तः काननौकसः |
ते द्रुमांश्च महाकाया गिरिशृङ्गाणि चोद्यताः || ६-८२-१३_END
BEGIN_
Hundreds of monkeys with their colossal bodies, lifting up trees and mountain-peaks,
rushed roaring towards Indrajit._END

B_6_C_82_13
BEGIN_
चिक्षिपुर्द्विषतां मध्ये वानरा भीमविक्रमाः |
पृक्षशैलमहावर्षं विसृजन्तः प्लवङ्गमाः || ६-८२-१४
शत्रूणां कदनं चक्रुर्नेदुश्च विविधैः स्वनैः |_END
BEGIN_
Those monkeys of terrible prowess, threw trees and mountain-peaks towards Indrajit
in battle. While shooting a large deluge of trees and rocks, the monkeys caused destruction of
their enemies. They roared in various high tones._END

B_6_C_82_14
BEGIN_
वानरैर्तैर्महावीर्यैर्घोररूपा निशाचराः || ६-८-१५
वीर्यादभिहता वृक्षैर्व्यवेष्टन्त रणक्षितौ |_END
BEGIN_
Beaten forcibly with trees, by those highly terrible monkeys, those demons of
frightful appearance, rolled about restlessly in the battle-field._END

B_6_C_82_15
BEGIN_
स्वसैन्यमभिवीक्ष्याथ वानरार्दितमिन्द्रजित् || ६-८२-१६
प्रगृहीतायुधः क्रुद्धः परानभिमुखो ययौ |_END
BEGIN_
On seeing his army tormented by the monkeys, that enraged Indrajit, taking hold of
his weapons, sallied forth, facing towards his enemies._END

B_6_C_82_16
BEGIN_
स शरौघानवसृजन्स्वसैन्येनाभिसंवृतः || ६-८२-१७
जघान कपिशार्दूलान्सुबहून्दृष्टविक्रमः |_END
BEGIN_
That Indrajit, of firm fortitude, accompanied by his army, by releasing a multitude
of arrows, killed a very many number of monkeys._END

B_6_C_82_17
BEGIN_
शूलैरशनिभिः खड्गैः पट्टसैः कूटमुद्गरैः || ६-८२-१८
ते चाप्यनुचरांस्तस्य वानरा जघ्नुराहवे |_END
BEGIN_
In the battle, Indrajit's soldiers too killed the monkeys with spikes tips of
missiles, swords, sharp-edged spears and concealed weapons similar to mallets._END

B_6_C_82_18
BEGIN_
सस्कन्धविटपैः सालैः शिलाभिश्च महाबलैः || ६-८२-१९
हनूमान्कदनं चक्रे रक्षसां भीमकर्मणाम् |_END
BEGIN_
The mighty Hanuma played a havoc among demons of terrible deeds, with Shala trees,
distinguished by excellent trunks and branches as with rocks._END

B_6_C_82_19
BEGIN_
स निवार्य परानीकमब्रवीत्तान्वनौकसः || ६-८२-२०
हनूमान्संनिवर्तध्वं न नः साध्यमिदं बलम् |_END
BEGIN_
Keeping the hostile army back, that Hanuma spoke to those monkeys as follows:
"Retreat! This army need not be conquered any more by us."_END

B_6_C_82_20
BEGIN_
त्यक्त्वा प्राणान्विचेष्टन्तो राम प्रियचिकीर्षवः || ६-८२-२१
यन्निमित्तं हि युध्यामो हता सा जनकात्मजा |_END
BEGIN_
"That Seetha for whose sake we have fought so far, with a wish to do what is
pleasing to Rama, making a special effort to win, risking our lives has been killed."_END

B_6_C_82_21
BEGIN_
इममर्थं हि विज्ञाप्य रामं सुग्रीवमेव च || ६-८२-२२
तौ यत्प्रतिविधास्येते तत्करिष्यामहे वयम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Informing Rama and even Sugreeva about this matter, we shall do that which both of
them are prepared to do in return."_END

B_6_C_82_22
BEGIN_
इत्युक्त्वा वानरश्रेष्ठो वारयन्सर्ववानरान् || ६-८२-२३
शनैः शनैरसन्त्रस्तः सबलः स न्यवर्तत |_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking and keeping back all the monkeys, Hanuma the chief of monkeys, with
absence of fear, along with his army, gradually turned back._END

B_6_C_82_23
BEGIN_
ततः प्रेक्ष्य हनूमन्तं व्रजन्तं यत्र राघवः || ६-८२-२४
स होतुकामो दुष्टात्मा गतश्चैतं निकुम्भिलाम् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Hanuma with drawing to the place where Rama was, the evil-minded Indrajit
went to a sanctuary called Nikumbhila, seeking to pour oblations into the sacred fire._END

B_6_C_82_24
BEGIN_
निकुम्भिलामधिष्ठाय पावकं जुहुवे न्द्रजित् || ६-८२-२५
यज्ञभूम्यां तु विधिवत्पावकस्तेन रक्षसा |
हूयमानः प्रजज्वाल होमशोणितभुक्तदा || ६-८२-२६_END
BEGIN_
Arriving at Nikumbhila, Indrajit poured oblations into the sacred fire. Thereupon,
