while being propitiated by that demon on reaching sacrificial ground, the sacrificial fire then
blazed up on consuming the oblations of flesh and blood._END

B_6_C_82_25
BEGIN_
सोऽर्चिः पिनद्धो ददृशे होमशोणिततर्पितः |
सन्ध्यागत इवादित्यः स तीव्राग्निः समुत्थितः || ६-८२-२७_END
BEGIN_
Swollen up when propitiated with oblations of blood, the highly intense fire, like
the evening sun, appeared wrapped in flames._END

B_6_C_82_26
BEGIN_
अथेन्द्रजिद्राक्षसभूतये तु |
जुहाव हव्यं विधिना विधानवत् |
दृष्ट्वा व्यतिष्ठन्त च राक्षसास्ते |
महासमूहेषु नयानयज्ञाः || ६-८२-२८_END
BEGIN_
Then, Indrajit, well-versed with the technique of performance of rites for the
prosperity of the demons, poured oblations according to the scriptural precepts. Seeing this, those
demons, who knew what was prudent and evil in major battles, stood firm in big piles (by Indrajit's
side)._END

B_6_C_83_0
BEGIN_
राघवश्चापि विपुलं तं राक्षसवनौकसाम् |
श्रुत्वा सङ्ग्रामनिर्घोषं जाम्बवन्तमुवाच ह || ६-८३-१_END
BEGIN_
On hearing that great tumult of battle between demons and monkeys, Rama spoke to
Jambavan as follows:_END

B_6_C_83_1
BEGIN_
सौम्य नूनं हनुमता कृतं कर्म सुदुष्करम् |
श्रूयते हि यथा भीमः सुमहानायुधस्वनः || ६-८३-२_END
BEGIN_
"O excellent Jambavan! From the way in which a very great terrible rattling sound of
arms in heard, it seems an exceedingly difficult feat has been performed by Hanuma. It is
certain."_END

B_6_C_83_2
BEGIN_
तद्गच्छ कुरु साहाय्यं स्वबलेनाभिसंवृतः |
क्षिप्रमृष्कपते तस्य कपिश्रेष्ठस्य युध्यतः || ६-८३-३_END
BEGIN_
"O lord of bears! Therefore, accompanied by your own army, go and quickly extend
your help to that Hanuma, who is fighting."_END

B_6_C_83_3
BEGIN_
ऋक्षराजस्तथेत्युक्त्वा स्वेनानीकेन संवृतः |
आगच्छत्पश्चिमद्वारं हनूमान्यत्र वानरः || ६-८३-४_END
BEGIN_
Saying "Yes, so be it" and surrounded by his own army, Jambavan came to the western
gate, where the monkey, Hanuma was._END

B_6_C_83_4
BEGIN_
अथायान्तं हनूमन्तं ददर्शर्क्षपतिः पथि |
वानरैः कृतसङ्ग्रामैः श्वसद्भिरभिसंवृतम् || ६-८३-५_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Jambavan saw Hanuma, coming with monkeys, who had given fight and were
sighing (on account of grief caused by the destruction of Seetha)._END

B_6_C_83_5
BEGIN_
दृष्ट्वा पथि हनूमांश्च तदृष्कबलमुद्यतम् |
नीलमेघनिभं भीमं संनिवार्य न्यवर्तत || ६-८३-६_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that terrible army of bears, looking like a dark cloud on their way, ready
(to perform battle) and effectively intercepting it, Hanuma retreated them all._END

B_6_C_83_6
BEGIN_
स तेन हरिसैन्येन संनिकर्षं महायशाः |
शीघ्रमागम्य रामाय दुःखितो वाक्यमब्रवीत् || ६-८३-७_END
BEGIN_
Quickly seeking the presence of Rama with that army, the highly illustrious Hanuma,
with sorrow, spoke the following words to Rama:_END

B_6_C_83_7
BEGIN_
समरे युध्यमानानामस्माकं प्रेक्षतां च सः |
जघान रुदतीं सीतामिन्द्रजिद्रावणात्मजः || ६-८३-८_END
BEGIN_
"While we, who were carrying on the battle, stood looking on, Indrajit, the son of
Ravana killed Seetha in front of us, even though she continued to weep."_END

B_6_C_83_8
BEGIN_
उद्भ्रान्तचित्तस्तां दृष्ट्वा विषण्णोऽहमरिन्दम |
तदहं भवतो वृत्तं विज्ञापयितुमागतः || ६-८३-९_END
BEGIN_
"O destroyer of enemies! On seeing her with my distressed mind, I felt sad. I came
to report the event to you."_END

B_6_C_83_9
BEGIN_
तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राघवः शोकमूर्छितः |
निपपात तदा भूमौ छिन्नमूल इव द्रुमः || ६-८३-१०_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Hanuma, Rama then was agitated with grief and fell down on
the ground, like a tree with its bottom chopped off._END

B_6_C_83_10
BEGIN_
तं भूमौ देवसङ्काशं पतितं दृश्य राघवम् |
अभिपेतुः समुत्पत्य सर्वतः कपिसत्तमाः || ६-८३-११_END
BEGIN_
On seeing that Rama, who with the semblance of god, falling on the ground, the
chiefs of monkeys came bouncing from all sides and rushed towards him._END

B_6_C_83_11
BEGIN_
असिञ्चन्सलिलैश्चैनं पद्मोत्पलसुगन्धिभिः |
प्रदहन्तमसह्यं च सहसाग्निमिवोत्थितम् || ६-८३-१२_END
BEGIN_
They sprinkled him with water, fragrant with scent of lotuses and lilies, as one
would sprinkle an inextinguishable as one would sprinkle an inextinguishable fire, which has just
flared up suddenly and is burning all._END

B_6_C_83_12
BEGIN_
तं लक्ष्मणोऽथ बाहुभ्यां परिष्वज्य सुदुःखितः |
उवाच राममस्वस्थं वाक्यं हेत्वर्थसंहितम् || ६-८३-१३_END
BEGIN_
Then, the highly lamenting Lakshmana, having embraced that ailing Rama in his arms,
spoke the following meaningful words, endowed with reason:_END

B_6_C_83_13
BEGIN_
शुभे वर्त्मनि तिष्ठन्तं त्वामार्यविजितेन्द्रियम् |
अनर्थेभ्यो न शक्नोति त्रातुं धर्मो निरर्थकः || ६-८३-१४_END
BEGIN_
"O venerable brother! Virtue cannot save you, who are sticking to the noble path and
who have subdued the senses, from adversities and is (hence) useless."_END

B_6_C_83_14
BEGIN_
भूतानां स्थावराणां च जङ्गमानां च दर्शनम् |
यथास्ति न तथा धर्मस्तेन नास्तीति मे मतिः || ६-८३-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Just as inanimate and animate beings are visible, likewise virtue and vice are not
visible. Therefore, my opinion is that virtue is non-existent."_END

B_6_C_83_15
BEGIN_
यथैव स्थावरं व्यक्तं जङ्गमं च तथाविधम् |
नायमर्थस्तथा युक्तस्त्वद्विधो न विपद्यते || ६-८३-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Even as inanimate beings and animate beings are expressly visible, likewise this
form of virtue of vice is not established. For, in that case, a virtuous man like you would not
have this misfortune."_END

B_6_C_83_16
BEGIN_
यद्यधर्मो भवेद्भूतो रावणो नरकं व्रजेत् |
भवांश्च धर्मसंयुक्तो नैवं व्यसनमाप्नुयात् || ६-८३-१७_END
BEGIN_
"If unrighteousness had been effective, Ravana should have obtained the hell. You,
endowed with virtue, would never obtain such troubles."_END

B_6_C_83_17
BEGIN_
तस्य च व्यसनाभावाद्व्यसनं च गते त्वयि |
धर्मेणोपलभेद्धर्ममधर्मं चाप्यधर्मतः || ६-८३-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Since there is absence of calamity for Ravana and misfortune occurred to you, the
result of vice is obtained through virtue and the result of virtue is obtained through vice. The
contraries of each other have changed the roles with each other."_END

B_6_C_83_18
BEGIN_
धर्मेणोपलभेद्धर्ममधर्मं चाप्यधर्मतः |
यदि धर्मेण युज्येरन्नाधर्मः प्रतिष्ठतः || ६-८६-१९
न धर्मेण वियुज्येरन्नधर्मरुचयो जनाः |
धर्मेण चरतां धर्मस्तथा चैषां फलं भवेत् || ६-८३-२०_END
BEGIN_
Will the fruit of virtue be obtained through virtue and fruit of vice through vice?
If that in whom unrighteousness is rooted are enjoined with the fruit of unrighteousness alone,
people showing interest in unrighteousness would be deprived of the fruit of virtue. The fruit of
virtue alone would have accrued to those who administer righteousness through that virtue?_END

B_6_C_83_19
BEGIN_
यस्मादर्था विवर्धन्ते येष्वधर्मः प्रतिष्ठितः |
क्लिश्यन्ते धर्मशीलाश्च तस्मादेतौ निरर्थकौ || ६-८३-२१_END
BEGIN_
Since prosperities of those, in whom unrighteousness is rooted, develop; while those
who have a conduct of virtue suffer, hence these two (virtue and vice) are useless._END

B_6_C_83_20
BEGIN_
वध्यन्ते पापकर्माणो यद्यधर्मेण राघव |
वधकर्महतो धर्मः स हतः कं वधिष्यति || ६-८३-२२_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama! If sinful doers are killed by their own vice, that unrighteousness, as it
does, in the act of killing, will be forthwith destroyed. Whom will that unrighteousness destroy
(which is destroyed in the course of three seconds)?"_END

B_6_C_83_21
BEGIN_
अथ वा विहितेनायं हन्यते हन्ति वा परम् |
विधिरालिप्यते तेन न स पापेन कर्मणा || ६-८३-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Or if a man is killed by a recourse to a ritual prescribed in the scriptures or
kills another (by recourse to such a ritual), that destiny alone, which is engendered by that
ritual, is tainted by that sinful act and not the agent."_END

B_6_C_83_22
BEGIN_
अदृष्टप्रतिकारेण अव्यक्तेनासता सता |
कथं शक्यं परं प्राप्तुं धर्मेणारिविकर्शन || ६-८३-२४_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama, the destroyer of adversaries! It is not clear how prosperity can be reached
by righteousness, which has never known how to retaliate. Hence, righteousness seems to be
non-existent."_END

B_6_C_83_23
BEGIN_
यदि सत्स्यात्सतां मुख्य नासत्स्यात्तव किं चन |
त्वया यदीदृशं प्राप्तं तस्मात्सन्नोपपद्यते || ६-८३-२५_END
BEGIN_
"O chief among the virtuous! If righteousness were really there, no evil whatever
would have accrued to you. As you reaped such a calamity, the hypotheses that the destiny
engendered by virtuous acts is real is not proved."*_END

B_6_C_83_24
BEGIN_
अथ वा दुर्बलः क्लीबो बलं धर्मोऽनुवर्तते |
दुर्बलो हृतमर्यादो न सेव्य इति मे मतिः || ६-८३-२६_END
BEGIN_
"Or else, if righteousness becomes weak and cowardly, as it surrenders to the might,
it is my opinion that the righteousness, which lacks strength and has been deprived of its
capacity, should no longer be pursued."_END

B_6_C_83_25
BEGIN_
बलस्य यदि चेद्धर्मो गुणभूतः पराक्रमे |
धर्ममुत्सृज्य वर्तस्व यथा धर्मे तथा बले || ६-८३-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Depend on might, as you do now on virtue, if the virtue is subordinate to might,
thus giving up predominance of virtue."_END

B_6_C_83_26
BEGIN_
अथ चेत्सत्यवचनं धर्मः किल परन्तप |
अनृतस्त्वय्यकरुणः किं न बद्धस्त्वया पिता || ६-८३-२८_END
BEGIN_
"O tormentator of enemies! Or else, if speaking truth were indeed a virtue, our
lying father, who was merciless to you, was disunited from you. Were you not bound by that
announcement made by our father regarding your installation as the Prince Regent?"_END

B_6_C_83_27
BEGIN_
यदि धर्मो भवेद्भूत अधर्मो वा परन्तप |
न स्म हत्वा मुनिं वज्री कुर्यादिज्यां शतक्रतुः || ६-८३-२९_END
BEGIN_
"O tormentator of your enemies! Had either righteousness or unrighteousness worth
pursuing, Indra the wielder of thunderbolt would not have performed a sacrifice on killing a sage
(viz. Viswarupa, son of Twasta*)_END

B_6_C_83_28
BEGIN_
अधर्मसंश्रितो धर्मो विनाशयति राघव |
सर्वमेतद्यथाकामं काकुत्स्थ कुरुते नरः || ६-८३-३०_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama! Virtue destroys enemies, when united with might (something other than
virtue). O Rama! A man does all this, according to his will."_END

B_6_C_83_29
BEGIN_
मम चेदं मतं तात धर्मोऽयमिति राघव |
धर्ममूलं त्वया छिन्नं राज्यमुत्सृजता तदा || ६-८३-३१_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama in a pitiable condition. My opinion is that righteousness consists in such
recourse to both virtue and strength. The very roots of virtue (in the form of earthly gain) have
been chopped off by you in that you spurned the sovereignty the other day."_END

B_6_C_83_30
BEGIN_
अर्थेभ्यो हि विवृद्धेभ्यः संवृद्धेभ्यस्ततस्ततः |
क्रियाः सर्वाः प्रवर्तन्ते पर्वतेभ्य इवापगाः || ६-८३-३२_END
BEGIN_
"By the treasures brought from place to place and augmented by means of various
strategies, all the tasks are indeed fulfilled, as the rivers flow from the mountains."_END

B_6_C_83_31
BEGIN_
अर्थेन हि वियुक्तस्य पुरुषस्याल्पतेजसः |
व्युच्छिद्यन्ते क्रियाः सर्वा ग्रीष्मे कुसरितो यथा || ६-८३-३३_END
BEGIN_
"All the tasks of a man of small intellect, bereft of his wealth, get a cessation as
small rivers dry up in summer-season."_END

B_6_C_83_32
BEGIN_
सोऽयमर्थं परित्यज्य सुखकामः सुखैधितः |
पापमारभते कर्तुं तथा दोषः प्रवर्तते || ६-८३-३४_END
BEGIN_
"Such a man, brought up by comforts, renouncing wealth (within easy reach) and
seeking comfort, proceeds to commit sinful act and then evil (in the form of punishment) follows
from it."_END

B_6_C_83_33
BEGIN_
यस्यार्थास्तस्य मित्राणि यस्यार्थास्तस्य बान्धवः |
यस्यार्थाः स पुमांल्लोके यस्यार्थाः स च पण्डितः || ६-८३-३५_END
BEGIN_
"Friends gather round him, who has riches. Relatives stand by him, who has riches.
He alone is virile in the world, who has riches. He alone is a learned man, who has riches."_END

B_6_C_83_34
BEGIN_
यस्यार्थाः स च विक्रान्तो यस्यार्थाः स च बुद्धिमान् |
यस्यार्थाः स महाभागो यस्यार्थाः स महागुणः || ६-८३-३६_END
BEGIN_
"He alone is a mighty man, who has riches. He alone is a prudent man, who has
riches. He alone is highly fortunate. He alone is distinguished, who has riches."_END

B_6_C_83_35
BEGIN_
अर्थस्यैते परित्यागे दोषाः प्रव्याहृता मया |
राज्यमुत्सृजता वीर येन बुद्धिस्त्वया कृता || ६-८३-३७_END
BEGIN_
"O resolute one! I told you about these evils attendant on the abjuration of wealth.
The ground on which you made the resolve to sacrifice the kingdom was not known to me."_END

B_6_C_83_36
BEGIN_
यस्यार्था धर्मकामार्थास्तस्य सर्वं प्रदक्षिणम् |
अधनेनार्थकामेन नार्थः शक्यो विचिन्वता || ६-८३-३८_END
BEGIN_
"A man in whom the treasures abide, religious merit and wealth are obtained. All
would be favourable to him. To the penniless man, who has a desire for wealth and even hunting for
wealth, it is not possible to attain wealth."_END

B_6_C_83_37
BEGIN_
हर्षः कामश्च दर्पश्च धर्मः क्रोधः शमो दमः |
अर्थादेतानि सर्वाणि प्रवर्तन्ते नराधिप || ६-८३-३९_END
BEGIN_
"O king! Delight, sensuous pleasure, pride, virtue, anger, peace, control of the
senses all these are attained from wealth."_END

B_6_C_83_38
BEGIN_
येषां नश्यत्ययं लोकश्चरतां धर्मचारिणाम् |
तेऽर्थास्त्वयि न दृश्यन्ते दुर्दिनेषु यथा ग्रहाः || ६-८३-४०_END
BEGIN_
"Those riches, due to renunciation of which, worldly happiness of those practicing
the path of virtue gets lost, are not seen in you, any more than the planets are seen in cloudy
days."_END

B_6_C_83_39
BEGIN_
त्वयि प्रव्रजिते वीर गुरोश् च वचने स्थिते |
रक्षसापहृता भार्या प्राणैः प्रियतरा तव || ६-८३-४१_END
BEGIN_
"O valiant one! While you were in exile, faithful to the command of your father,
your wife who was more beloved than life itself, was stolen away by a demon."_END

B_6_C_83_40
BEGIN_
तदद्य विपुलं वीर दुःखमिन्द्रजिता कृतम् |
कर्मणा व्यपनेष्यामि तस्मादुत्तिष्ठ राघव || ६-८३-४२_END
BEGIN_
"O valiant prince! I shall dispel with my exploits today, that great agony caused by
Indrajit. Therefore, rise O Rama!"_END

B_6_C_83_41
BEGIN_
उत्तिष्ठ नरशार्दूल दीर्घबाहो धृतव्रत |
किमात्मानं महात्मानं कृतात्मानं न बुध्यसे || ६-८३-४३_END
BEGIN_
"O the foremost among men! O the long-armed one! O the firmly resolute one! Arise!
Why are you not knowing about yourself, who is the great-souled and whose spirit is
disciplined?"_END

B_6_C_83_42
BEGIN_
अयमनघ तवोदितः प्रियार्थं |
जनकसुता निधनं निरीक्ष्य रुष्टः |
सहयगजरथां सराक्षसेन्द्रां |
भृशमिषुभिर्विनिपातयामि लङ्काम् || ६-८३-४४_END
BEGIN_
"O faultless one! On seeing the death of Seetha and enraged, rising to do favour for
you, I shall completely destroy with my arrows, Lanka with its chariots, elephants and horses along
with Ravana."_END

B_6_C_84_0
BEGIN_
राममाश्वासयाने तु लक्ष्मणे भ्रातृवत्सले |
निक्षिप्य गुल्मान्स्वस्थाने तत्रागच्छद्विभीषणः || ६-८४-१_END
BEGIN_
While Lakshmana, who was so fond of his brother, was consoling Rama, Vibhishana,
keeping the troops of simian army in their respective positions, arrived there._END

B_6_C_84_1
BEGIN_
नानाप्रहरणैर्वीरैश्चतुर्भिः सचिवैर्वृतः |
नीलाञ्जनचयाकारैर्मातङ्गैरिव यूथपः || ६-८४-२
सोऽभिगम्य महात्मानं राघवं शोकलालसं |
वानरांश्चैव ददृशे बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणान् || ६-८४-३_END
BEGIN_
That Vibhishana, surrounded by four warriors, wielding many types of weapons, and
who were chiefs of troops, looking like heaps of black collyrium and who were appearing like
elephants, approached Lakshmana who was totally engrossed in sorrow and saw the monkeys also, whose
eyes were filled with tears._END

B_6_C_84_2
BEGIN_
राघवं च महात्मानमिक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दनम् |
ददर्श मोहमापन्नं लक्ष्मणस्याङ्कमाश्रितम् || ६-८४-४_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana also saw the great-souled Rama, the delight of Inkshvaku dynasty fallen
into a swoon and resting on the lap of Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_84_3
BEGIN_
व्रीडितं शोकसन्तप्तं दृष्ट्वा रामं विभीषणः |
अन्तर्दुःखेन दीनात्मा किमेतदिति सोऽब्रवीत् || ६-८४-५_END
BEGIN_
On seeing the embarrassed Rama, tormented with grief, that Vibhishana, distressed as
he was in spirits, with agony inside, asked him, "What is this?"_END

B_6_C_84_4
BEGIN_
विभीषण मुखं दृष्ट्वा सुग्रीवं तांश्च वानरान् |
उवाच लक्ष्मणो वाक्यमिदं बाष्पपरिप्लुतः || ६-८४-६_END
BEGIN_
Fixing his gaze on Vibhishana's face and looking at Sugreeva and those monkeys,
Lakshmana with tears pouring down, spoke the following words, with a splendid meaning:_END

B_6_C_84_5
BEGIN_
हतामिन्द्रजिता सीतामिह श्रुत्वैव राघवः |
हनूमद्वचनात्सौम्य ततो मोहमुपागतः || ६-८४-७_END
BEGIN_
"O gentle Sir! Just on hearing through the words of Hanuma, saying that Seetha was
killed by Indrajit, Rama entered into a swoon."_END

B_6_C_84_6
BEGIN_
कथयन्तं तु सौमित्रिं संनिवार्य विभीषणः |
पुष्कलार्थमिदं वाक्यं विसंज्ञं राममब्रवीत् || ६-८४-८_END
BEGIN_
Intercepting the narrating Lakshmana in the middle, Vibhishana spoke the following
amply meaningful words to Rama, who was in an unconscious state._END

B_6_C_84_7
BEGIN_
मनुजेन्द्रार्तरूपेण यदुक्तस्त्वं हनूमता |
तदयुक्तमहं मन्ये सागरस्येव शोषणम् || ६-८४-९_END
BEGIN_
"I hold that which you have been told by Hanuma with a sorrowful temper, O ruler of
men, to be absurd as the drying up of the sea."_END

B_6_C_84_8
BEGIN_
अभिप्रायं तु जानामि रावणस्य दुरात्मनः |
सीतां प्रति महाबाहो न च घातं करिष्यति || ६-८४-१०_END
BEGIN_
"O the long armed! I know the design of the evil-minded Ravana towards Seetha. He
would never do the killing of Seetha."_END

B_6_C_84_9
BEGIN_
याच्यमानः सुबहुशो मया हितचिकीर्षुणा |
वैदेहीमुत्सृजस्वेति न च तत्कृतवान्वचः || ६-८४-११_END
BEGIN_
"Eventhough begged by me, the well-wisher, several times to give up Seetha, he did
not heed that advice."_END

B_6_C_84_10
BEGIN_
नैव साम्ना न भेदेन न दानेन कुतो युधा |
सा द्रष्टुमपि शक्येत नैव चान्येन केन चित् || ६-८४-१२_END
BEGIN_
"It is neither possible even to see her by recourse to conciliation nor by bestowing
gifts nor by sowing dissention. How is it possible then by a war? By any other strategy, it is
impossible."_END

B_6_C_84_11
BEGIN_
वानरान्मोहयित्वा तु प्रतियातः स राक्षसः |
मायामयीं महाबाहो तां विद्धि जनकात्मजाम्| ६-८४-१३_END
BEGIN_
"That Indrajit for his part retracted, by hoodwinking the monkeys. O the long armed!
Know that Seetha (who was seemingly killed by him) as illusory."_END

B_6_C_84_12
BEGIN_
चैत्यं निकुम्भिलां नाम यत्र होमं करिष्यति |
हुतवानुपयातो हि देवैरपि सवासवैः || ६-८४-१४
दुराधर्षो भवत्येष सङ्ग्रामे रावणात्मजः |_END
BEGIN_
"After reaching a sanctuary by name Nikumbhila, this Indrajit will pour oblations
into the sacred fire. On returning after pouring oblations into the sacred fire, Indrajit will
prove difficult to be overcome in battle, even by celestials including Indra."_END

B_6_C_84_13
BEGIN_
तेन मोहयता नूनमेषा माया प्रयोजिता || ६-८४-१५
विघ्नमन्विच्छता तात वानराणां पराक्रमे |_END
BEGIN_
"Certainly, this conjuring trick (in the form of killing an illusory living effigy
of Seetha) was exhibited by him, who was employing his magical art, expecting interruption by the
prowess of the monkeys there."_END

B_6_C_84_14
BEGIN_
ससैन्यास्तत्र गच्छामो यावत्तन्न समाप्यते || ६-८४-१६
त्यजेमं नरशार्दूलमिथ्या सन्तापमागतम् |
सीदते हि बलं सर्वं दृष्ट्वा त्वां शोककर्शितम् || ६-८४-१७_END
BEGIN_
"While the sacrificial performance is not ended, we shall proceed to that place,
along with an army. O the foremost of men! Give up this improper grief, which has come upon you.
Seeing you tormented with grief, the entire army is sinking into despondency."_END

B_6_C_84_15
BEGIN_
इह त्वं स्वस्थ हृदयस्तिष्ठ सत्त्वसमुच्छ्रितः |
लक्ष्मणं प्रेषयास्माभिः सह सैन्यानुकर्षिभिः || ६-८४-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Very exalted as you are in courage, stay you here, confident at heart, and send
Lakshmana with us, who are taking an army along with us."_END

B_6_C_84_16
BEGIN_
एष तं नरशार्दूलो रावणिं निशितैः शरैः |
त्याजयिष्यति तत्कर्म ततो वध्यो भविष्यति || ६-८४-१९_END
BEGIN_
"This Lakshmana, the eminent prince, can make Indrajit abandon that act of
sacrifice, by employing his sharp arrows. Then, he will be susceptible of being killed."_END

B_6_C_84_17
BEGIN_
तस्यैते निशितास्तीक्ष्णाः पत्रिपत्राङ्गवाजिनः |
पतत्रिण इवासौम्याः शराः पास्यन्ति शोणितम् || ६-८४-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Lakshmana's arrows, which are sharp and fiery, with a speed equal to the wings of a
bird, can drink his blood like cruel birds."_END

B_6_C_84_18
BEGIN_
तत्सन्दिश महाबाहो लक्ष्मणं शुभलक्षणम् |
राक्षसस्य विनाशाय वज्रं वज्रधरो यथा || ६-८४-२१_END
BEGIN_
"O the long-armed one! Therefore, dispatch Lakshmana having auspicious body-marks
even as Indra the lord of celestials employed the thunderbolt to kill Indrajit."_END

B_6_C_84_19
BEGIN_
मनुजवर न कालविप्रकर्षो |
रिपुनिधनं प्रति यत्क्षमोऽद्य कर्तुम् |
त्वमतिसृज रिपोर्वधाय बाणीम् |
असुरपुरोन्मथने यथा महेन्द्रः || ६-८४-२२_END
BEGIN_
"O the best of men! It is not appropriate to delay the killing of the enemy any
further now. Therefore, grant permission to Lakshmana to destroy the enemy, as Indra would hurl his
thunderbolt to destroy the enemies of celestials."_END

B_6_C_84_20
BEGIN_
समाप्तकर्मा हि स राक्षसेन्द्रो |
भवत्यदृश्यः समरे सुरासुरैः |
युयुत्सता तेन समाप्तकर्मणा |
भवेत्सुराणामपि संशयो महान् || ६-८४-२३_END
BEGIN_
"If that Indrajit, the foremost of demons completes the sacrifice, he would not be
visible even to the celestials and the demons in battle. If he come with a desire to fight, after
ending that sacrifice, the celestials also will feel a great suspicion on their own lives."_END

B_6_C_85_0
BEGIN_
तत्तस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा राघवः शोककश्मितः |
नोपधारयते व्यक्तं यदुक्तं तेन रक्षसा || ६-८५-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Vibhishana, Rama, agonized as he was with grief, could not
understand clearly what was spoken by that demon._END

B_6_C_85_1
BEGIN_
ततो धैर्यमवष्टभ्य रामः परपुरंजयः |
विभीषणमुपासीनमुवाच कपिसंनिधौ || ६-८५-२_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama the conqueror of the cities of enemies, leaning upon his courage, spoke
to Vibhishana who was sitting nearby and in front of the monkeys (as follows):_END

B_6_C_85_2
BEGIN_
नैरृताधिपते वाक्यं यदुक्तं ते विभीषण |
भूयस्तच्छ्रोतुमिच्छामि ब्रूहि यत्ते विवक्षितम् || ६-८५-३_END
BEGIN_
"O lord of demons! I wish to hear again those of the words spoken by you. I desire
to hear again, whatever you intend to tell me."_END

B_6_C_85_3
BEGIN_
राघवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः |
यत्तत्पुनरिदं वाक्यं बभाषेऽथ विभीषणः || ६-८५-४_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Rama, spoken very sadly, that Vibhishana who was skilled in
expression, again spoke his words gently as follows:_END

B_6_C_85_4
BEGIN_
यथाज्ञप्तं महाबाहो त्वया गुल्मनिवेशनम् |
तत्तथानुष्ठितं वीर त्वद्वाक्यसमनन्तरम् || ६-८५-५_END
BEGIN_
"O the long armed hero! Immediately after your orders, the marshalling of the troops
was done by me in the manner as enjoined by you."_END

B_6_C_85_5
BEGIN_
तान्यनीकानि सर्वाणि विभक्तानि समन्ततः |
विन्यस्ता यूथपाश्चैव यथाअन्यायं विभागशः || ६-८५-६_END
BEGIN_
"All those armies were divided and positioned at all places. Even the commanders of
those divisions were arrayed and distributed according to their ranks."_END

B_6_C_85_6
BEGIN_
भूयस्तु मम विज्ञाप्यं तच्छृणुष्व महाप्रभो |
त्वय्यकारणसम्तप्ते सम्तप्तह्ऱिदया वयम् || ६-८५-७_END
BEGIN_
"O great lord! I have to report to you something further. Listen to it. While you
are lamenting without any cause, we feel painful at our hearts."_END

B_6_C_85_7
BEGIN_
त्यज राजन्निमं शोकं मिथ्यासंतापमागतम् |
तदियं त्यज्यतां चिन्ता शत्रुहर्षविवर्धिनी || ६-८५-८_END
BEGIN_
"O king! Abandon this lamentation and false grief which came to you. Let your worry,
which augments the pleasure of your adversaries be therefore abandoned."_END

B_6_C_85_8
BEGIN_
उद्यमः क्रियतां वीर हर्षः समुपसेव्यताम् |
प्राप्तव्या यदि ते सीता हन्तव्याश्च निशाचराः || ६-८५-९_END
BEGIN_
"O hero! If you want to get back Seetha and if the demons are to be destroyed, raise
up for the occasion. Keep yourself cheerful."_END

B_6_C_85_9
BEGIN_
रघुनन्दन वक्ष्यामि श्रूयतां मे हितं वचः |
साध्वयं यातु सौमित्रिर्बलेन महता वृतः || ६-८५-१०
निकुम्भिलायां संप्राप्तं हन्तुं रावणिमाहवे |
धनुर्मण्डलनिर्मुक्तैराशीविषविषोपमैः || ६-८५-११_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama! Listen to my benign words I tell you. This Lakshmana together with a large
army should go soon to kill Indrajit, who reached Nikumbhila, with arrows as deadly as the
serpentine poison released from his snake-like bow in battle."_END

B_6_C_85_10
BEGIN_
तेन वीरेण तपसा वरदानात्स्वयंभुवः |
अस्त्रं ब्रह्मशिरः प्राप्तं कामगाश्च तुरंगमाः || ६-८५-१२_END
BEGIN_
"By his penance, Indrajit obtained a weapon called Brahmashira, by way of a gift
from Brahma and also horses, which are coursing at his will."_END

B_6_C_85_11
BEGIN_
स एष सह सैन्येन प्राप्तः किल निकुम्भिलाम् |
यद्युत्तिष्ठेत्कृतं कर्म हतान्सर्वांश्च विद्धि नः || ६-८५-१३_END
BEGIN_
"That Indrajit, as such along with his army, is reported to have reached Nikumbhila.
If he comes forth after completing his sacrificial act, know that all of us as killed."_END

B_6_C_85_12
BEGIN_
निकुम्भिलामसंप्राप्तमहुताग्निं च यो रिपुः |
त्वामातायिनं हन्यादिन्द्रशत्रो स ते वधः || ६-८५-१४
वरो दत्तो महाबाहो सर्वलोकेश्वरेण वै |
इत्येवं विहितो राजन्वधस्तस्यैष धीमतः || ६-८५-१५_END
BEGIN_
"A boon was given by Brahma to that intelligent demon as follows: "O Indrajit! That
enemy of yours, who strikes while you are marching with your bow drawn, and while you have not
arrived at Nikumbhila, or even while you have not offered oblations to the sacred fire, will prove
to be the cause of your killing."_END

B_6_C_85_13
BEGIN_
वधायेन्द्रजितो राम संदिशस्व महाबल |
हते तस्मिन् हतं विद्धि रावणम् ससुहृद्गणं || ६-८५-१६_END
BEGIN_
"O mighty Rama! Give your command for killing of Indrajit. When he is killed, know
that Ravana along with his associate troops also as killed."_END

B_6_C_85_14
BEGIN_
विभीषणवचः श्रुत्वा रामो वाक्यमथाब्रवीत् |
जानामि तस्य रौद्रस्य मायां सत्यपराक्रम || ६-८५-१७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Indrajit, Rama then spoke the following words:"O Vibhishana of
true prowess! I know the conjuring trick of that terrific demon."_END

B_6_C_85_15
BEGIN_
स हि ब्रह्मस्त्रवित्प्राज्ञो महामायो महाबलः |
करोत्यसम्ज्ञान् संग्रामे देवान्सवरुणानपि || ६-८५-१८_END
BEGIN_
"That Indrajit is skilled in the use of the mystic missile presided over by Brahma.
He is intelligent. He is a master of several conjuring tricks. He is so mighty that he can render
unconscious in battle even the gods along with Varuna the king of gods."_END

B_6_C_85_16
BEGIN_
तस्यान्तरिक्षे चरतः सरथस्य महायशः |
न गतिर्ज्ञायते वीर सूर्यस्येवाभ्रसंप्लवे || ६-८५-१९_END
BEGIN_
"O highly illustrious hero! While he drifts in the sky, ascending his chariot, his
movement is not known to others, as the sun is not seen beneath a dense mass of clouds."_END

B_6_C_85_17
BEGIN_
राघवस्तु रिपोर्ज्ञत्वा मायावीर्यं दुरात्मनः |
लक्ष्मणं कीर्तिसंपन्नमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् || ६-८५-२०_END
BEGIN_
Having known the toughness of the conjuring tricks of the evil-minded adversary,
Rama spoke to the illustrious Lakshmana as follows:_END

B_6_C_85_18
BEGIN_
यद्वानरेन्द्रस्य बलं तेन सर्वेण संवृतः |
हनूमत्प्रमुखैश्चैव यूथपैः सह लक्ष्मण || ६-८५-२१
जाम्बवेनार्क्षपतिना सहसैन्येन संवृतः |
जहि तं राक्षससुतं मायाबलसमन्वितम् || ६-८५-२२_END
BEGIN_
"O Lakshmana! You, accompanied by that entire army which stands at the disposal of
Sugreeva, along with troop-commanders with Hanuma as their head; and protected by Jambavan the lord
of bears, who will be accompanied by his army, kill that Indrajit the prince of demons, rich in the
power of conjuring tricks."_END

B_6_C_85_19
BEGIN_
अयं त्वां सचिवैः सार्धं महात्मा रजनीचरः |
अभिज्ञस्तस्य मायानां पृष्ठतोऽनुगमिष्यति || ६-८५-२३_END
BEGIN_
"The great souled Vibhishana, who knows all the conjuring tricks of Indrajit, along
with his counsellors, will follow behind you."_END

B_6_C_85_20
BEGIN_
राघवस्य वचं श्रुत्वा लक्ष्मणः सविभीषणः |
जग्राह कार्मुकश्रेष्ठमत्यद्भुतपराक्रमः || ६-८५-२४_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Rama, Lakshmana of highly wonderful prowess, along with
Vibhishana, took hold of his excellent bow._END

B_6_C_85_21
BEGIN_
संनद्धः कवची खड्गी सशरो वामचापभृत् |
रामपादावुपस्पृश्य हृष्टः सौमित्रिरब्रवीत् || ६-८५-२५_END
BEGIN_
The rejoiced Lakshmana who was prepared for the combat, clad in an armour, wielding
a sword and arrows, wearing his bow in his left hand and having touched Rama's feet in salutation,
spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_85_22
BEGIN_
अद्य मत्कार्मुकोन्मुक्ताः शरा निर्भिद्य रावणिम् |
लङ्कामभिपतिष्यन्ति हंसाः पुष्करिणीमिव || ६-८५-२६_END
BEGIN_
"Today, the arrows released from my bow, piercing Indrajit, will drop into the City
of Lanka, as swans descend into a louts-pond._END

B_6_C_85_23
BEGIN_
अद्येव तस्य रौद्रस्य शरीरं मामकाः शराः |
विधमिष्यन्ति भित्त्वा तं महाचापगुणच्युताः || ६-८५-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Now itself, my arrows discharged from the bow-string of this great bow, duly
splitting his terrific body, will blow him away."_END

B_6_C_85_24
BEGIN_
एवमुक्त्वा तु वचनम् द्युतिमान् भ्रातुरग्रतः |
स रावणिवधाकाङ्क्षी लक्ष्मणस्त्वरितं ययौ || ६-८५-२८_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking in front of his brother, that resplendent Lakshmana, quickly marched
forward, with an intent to kill Indrajit._END

B_6_C_85_25
BEGIN_
सोऽभिवाद्य गुरोः पादौ कृत्वा चापि प्रदक्षिणं |
निकुम्भिलामभिययौ चैत्यं रावणिपालितम् || ६-८५-२९_END
BEGIN_
Offering salutation to the feet of his brother and doing circumambulation too, that
Lakshmana went to the sanctuary named Nikumbhila, which was protected by Indrajit._END

B_6_C_85_26
BEGIN_
विभीषणेन सहितो राजपुत्रः प्रतापवान् |
कृतस्वस्त्ययनो भ्रात्रा लक्ष्मणस्त्वरितो ययौ || ६-८५-३०_END
BEGIN_
Having obtained the blessings from his brother, the glorious Lakshmana, the prince,
quickly sallied forth along with Vibhishana._END

B_6_C_85_27
BEGIN_
वानराणाम् सास्रैस्तु हनुमान् बहुभिर्वऋतः |
विभीषणश्च सामात्यो तदा लक्ष्मणमन्वगात् || ६-८५-३१_END
BEGIN_
Then, Hanuma accompanied by many a thousand of monkeys and Vibhishana along with his
counsellors went behind Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_85_28
BEGIN_
महता हरिसैन्येन सवेगमभिसंवृतः |
ऋक्षराजबलं चैव ददर्श पथि विष्ठितम् || ६-८५-३२_END
BEGIN_
That Lakshmana, quickly surrounded by a large army of monkeys, saw the army of
Jambavan also stationed in the way._END

B_6_C_85_29
BEGIN_
स गत्वा दूरमध्वानं सौमित्रिर्मित्रनन्दनः |
राक्षसेन्द्रबलं दूरादपश्यद्व्यूहमाश्रितम् || ६-८५-३३_END
BEGIN_
After covering a long distance, that Lakshmana, the delight to his friends, saw the
army of Ravana, ranged in battle-array, from a distance._END

B_6_C_85_30
BEGIN_
स तं प्राप्य धनुष्पाणिर्मायायोगमरिंदमः |
तस्थौ ब्रह्मविधानेन विजेतुं रघुनन्दनः || ६-८५-३४_END
BEGIN_
Duly arriving at Nikumbhila, that foe-conquering Lakshmana stood, bow in hand, to
conquer that Indrajit, the possessor of conjuring tricks, in conformity with Brahma's
ordinance._END

B_6_C_85_31
BEGIN_
विभीषणेन सहितो राजपुत्रः प्रतापवान् |
अङ्गदेन च वीरेण तथानिलसुतेन च || ६-८५-३५_END
BEGIN_
The valiant Lakshmana stood there along with Vibhishana, the heroic Angada and
Hanuma, the son of wind-god._END

B_6_C_85_32
BEGIN_
विविधममलशस्त्रभास्वरं त |
द्ध्वजगहनं गहनं महारथैश्च |
प्रतिभयतममम्प्रमेयवेगं |
तिमिरमिव द्विषतां बलं विवेश || ६-८५-३६_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana penetrated that heterogeneous army of enemies, resplendent with spotless
weapons, thick with ensigns and abounded with huge chariots, exceedingly impenetrable, very
terrific, with unimaginable swiftness, even as one would enter a thick veil of darkness._END

B_6_C_86_0
BEGIN_
अथ तस्यामवस्थायां लक्ष्मणं रावणानुजः |
परेषामहितं वाक्यमर्थसाधकमब्रवीत् || ६-८६-१_END
BEGIN_
In that situation, Vibhishana then spoke the following words, which were hostile to
the enemies and advantageous to Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_86_1
BEGIN_
यदेतद्राक्षसानीकं मेघश्यामं विलोक्यते |
एतदायोध्यतां शीग्रम्ं कपिभिश्च शिलायुधैः || ६-८६-२_END
BEGIN_
"Let this army of demons which is seen here, dark as a cloud, be quickly engaged in
battle, by the monkeys using rocks as thier weapons."_END

B_6_C_86_2
BEGIN_
अस्यानीकस्य महतो भेदने यतलक्ष्मण |
राक्षसेन्द्रसुतोऽप्यत्र भिन्ने दृश्यो भविष्यति || ६-८६-३_END
BEGIN_
"O Lakshmana! Make an effort to break this mighty army. When this army is destroyed,
Indrajit also will become visible."_END

B_6_C_86_3
BEGIN_
स त्वमिन्द्राशनिप्रख्यैः शरैरवकिरन्परान् |
अभिद्रवाशु यावद्वै नैतत्कर्म समाप्यते || ६-८६-४_END
BEGIN_
"You as such, rush forward quickly, gushing out arrows, equal to Indra's
thunderbolt, on the enemies, so long as this sacrificial act of Indrajit is not actually carried
through."_END

B_6_C_86_4
BEGIN_
जहि वीरदुरात्मानं मायापरमधार्मिकम् |
रावणिं क्रूरकर्माणं सर्वलोकभयावहम् || ६-८६-५_END
BEGIN_
"O hero! Make a short work of Indrajit, the evil minded, who is interested in
performing conjuring tricks, who is unjust, engaged in cruel acts and who brings fear to all the
worlds."_END

B_6_C_86_5
BEGIN_
विभीषणवचः श्रुत्वा लक्ष्मणः शुभलक्षणः |
ववर्ष शरवर्षाणि राक्षसेन्द्रसुतं प्रति || ६-८६-६_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Vibhishana, Lakshmana, having auspicious marks, showered forth
streams of arrows in the direction of Indrajit._END

B_6_C_86_6
BEGIN_
ऋक्षाः शाखामृगाश्चैव द्रुमाद्रिवरयोधिनः |
अभ्यधावन्त सहितास्तदनीकमवस्थितम् || ६-८६-७_END
BEGIN_
Bears and monkeys, who fight was gigantic trees, rushed towards that army of demons,
drawn up in battle-array._END

B_6_C_86_7
BEGIN_
राक्षसाश्च शितैर्बाणैरसिभिः शक्तितोमरैः |
अभ्यवर्तन्त समवरे कपिसैन्यजिघांसवः || ६-८६-८_END
BEGIN_
The demons too, with an intent to kill the monkeys in battle, attacked them with
sharp arrows, sowrds, spears and javelins._END

B_6_C_86_8
BEGIN_
स सम्प्रहारस्तुमुलः सञ्जज्ञे कपिरक्षसाम् |
शब्देन महता लङ्कां नादयन्वै समन्ततः || ६-८६-९_END
BEGIN_
That tumultuous battle between the monkeys and the demons rendered Lanka noisy on
all sides with its great uproar._END

B_6_C_86_9
BEGIN_
शस्त्रैर्बहुविधाकारैः शितैर्बाणैश्च पादपैः |
उद्यतैर्गिरिशृङ्गैश्च घोरैराकाशमावृतम् || ६-८६-१०_END
BEGIN_
The sky was covered with weapons of various shapes, sharp arrows, trees and tossed
mountain tops._END

B_6_C_86_10
BEGIN_
ते राक्षसा वानरेषु विकृताननबाहवः |
निवेशयन्तः शस्त्राणि चक्रुस्ते सुमहद्भयम् || ६-८६-११_END
BEGIN_
Those demons of ugly faces and arms, hurling weapons on the monkeys, created a great
fear._END

B_6_C_86_11
BEGIN_
तथैव सकलैर्वृक्षैर्गिरिशृङ्गैश्च वानराः |
अभिजघ्नुर्निजघ्नुश्च समरे राक्षसर्षभान् || ६-८६-१२_END
BEGIN_
Even the monkeys too struck and killed all the demons in the battle, with various
types of trees and mountain-peaks._END

B_6_C_86_12
BEGIN_
ऋक्षवानरमुख्यैश्च महाकायैर्महाबलैः |
रक्षसां वध्यमानानां महद्भयमजायत || ६-८६-१३_END
BEGIN_
A great fear developed among the demons who were fighting with mighty leaders of
bears and monkeys endowed with colossal bodies._END

B_6_C_86_13
BEGIN_
स्वमनीकं विषण्णं तु श्रुत्वा शत्रुभिरर्दितम् |
उदतिष्ठत दुर्धर्षस्तत्कर्मण्यननुष्ठिते || ६-८६-१४_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that his own army being tormented by the enemies, was dejected; that
unconquerable Indrajit left off, without performing the sacrificial rite._END

B_6_C_86_14
BEGIN_
वृक्षान्धकारान्निष्क्रम्य जातक्रोधः स रावणिः |
आरुरोह रथं सज्जं पूर्वयुक्तं स राक्षसः || ६-८६-१५_END
BEGIN_
That enraged Indrajit, coming out from the gloominess of the trees, ascended his
firmly yoked chariot which had already been united_END

B_6_C_86_15
BEGIN_
स भीमकार्मुकशरः कृष्णाञ्जनचयोपमः |
रक्तास्यनयनः क्रूरो बभौ मृत्युरिवान्तकः || ६-८६-१६_END
BEGIN_
That awful Indrajit, armed with terrific bow and arrows, looking like a mass of
black collyrium with his blood-red eyes, appeared like the destructive Death._END

B_6_C_86_16
BEGIN_
दृष्ट्वैव तु रथस्थं तं पर्यवर्तत तद्बलम् |
रक्षसां भीमवेगानां लक्ष्मणेन युयुत्सताम् || ६-८६-१७_END
BEGIN_
Just on seeing Indrajit being on a chariot, that army of demons with a terrific
speed, turned back, wishing to fight with Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_86_17
BEGIN_
तस्मिन् काले तु हनुमानुद्यम्य सुदुरासदम् |
धरणीधरसङ्काशी महावृक्षमरिन्दमः || ६-८६-१८
स राक्षसानां तत्सैन्यं कालाग्निरिव निर्दहन् |
चकार बहुभिर्वृक्षैर्निःसंज्ञं युधि वानरः || ६-८६-१९_END
BEGIN_
At that time, Hanuma the destroyer of enemies looking like a mountain, uplifted an
absolutely unpaalleled large tree. Consuming that army of demons, as a fire at the time of
universal dissolution, the aforesaid monkey made that army unconscious on the battle field, with
many trees._END

B_6_C_86_18
BEGIN_
विध्वंसयन्तं तरसा दृष्ट्वैव पवनात्मजम् |
राक्षसानां सहस्राणि हनूमन्तमवाकिरन् || ६-८६-२०_END
BEGIN_
Immediately on seeing Hanuma destroying thier army rapidly, thousands of demons
hurled weapons on him._END

B_6_C_86_19
BEGIN_
शितशूलधराः शूलैरसिभिश्चासिपाणयः |
शक्तिभिः शक्तिहस्ताश्च पट्टसैः पट्टसायुधाः || ६-८६-२१
परिघैश्च गदाभिश्च कुन्तैश्च शुभदर्शनैः |
शतशश्च शतघ्नीभिरायसैरपि मुद्गरैः || ६-८६-२२
घोरैः परशुभिश्चैव भिण्डिपालैश्च राक्षसाः |
मुष्टिभिर्वज्रवेगैश्च तलैरशनिसंनिभैः || ६-८६-२३
अभिजघ्नुः समासाद्य समन्तात्पर्वतोपमम् |
तेषामपि च सङ्क्रुद्धश्चकार कदनं महत् || ६-८६-२४_END
BEGIN_
Approaching Hanuma looking like a mountain, the demons bearing pointed pikes struck
him from all sides with pkes, those carrying swords in their hands with swords, those carring
javelins in their hands with jalins, with iron rods with maces; those armed with sharp-edged spears
with spears, as also with bright-looking spears, with hundreds of cylindrical wooden pieces studded
with iron spikes, with steel hammers, ,with awful axes, with slings for the rwing stones, with
their thunderbolt-like fists and slaps which fell like flashes of lighning. Then, the enraged
Hanuma made a colossal destruction of those demons._END

B_6_C_86_20
BEGIN_
स ददर्श कपिश्रेष्ठमचलोपममिन्द्रजित् |
सूदयानममित्रघ्नममित्रान्पवनात्मजम् || ६-८६-२५_END
BEGIN_
That Indrajit saw Hanuma, the foremost of monkeys, looking like a mountain,
fearlessly killing his enemies._END

B_6_C_86_21
BEGIN_
स सारथिमुवाचेदं याहि यत्रैष वानरः |
क्षयमेव हि नः कुर्याद्राक्षसानामुपेक्षितः || ६-८६-२६_END
BEGIN_
He spoke the following words tohis charioteer: "Take the chariot to the place where
that monkey is standing. If we neglect him, he will surely destroy our demons."_END

B_6_C_86_22
BEGIN_
इत्युक्तः सारथिस्तेन ययौ यत्र स मारुतिः |
वहन् परमदुर्धर्षं स्थितमिन्द्रजितं रथे || ६-८६-२७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of that Indrajit, the charioteer went, carrying that very
unconquerable Indrajit sitting in the chariot, to the place where Hanuma was there._END

B_6_C_86_23
BEGIN_
सोऽभ्युपेत्य शरान्खड्गान्पट्टसासिपरश्वधान् |
अभ्यवर्षत दुर्धर्षः कपिमूर्ध्नि स राक्षसः || ६-८६-२८_END
BEGIN_
Coming close to Hanuma, that unconquerable Indrajit hurled swords, sharp-edged
spears and axes on the head of Hanuma._END

B_6_C_86_24
BEGIN_
तानि शस्त्राणि घोराणि प्रतिगृह्य स मारुतिः |
रोषेण महताविषो वाक्यं चेदमुवाच ह || ६-८६-२९_END
BEGIN_
Receiving those terrible weapons, that Hanuma spoke, seized as he was, with great
rage, the following words:_END

B_6_C_86_25
BEGIN_
युध्यस्व यदि शूरोऽसि रावणात्मज दुर्मते |
वायुपुत्रं समासाद्य न जीवन्प्रतियास्यसि || ६-८६-३०_END
BEGIN_
"O evil-minded Indrajit! If you are valiant, fight with me. Coming nearer to Hanuma,
you will not return alive."_END

B_6_C_86_26
BEGIN_
बाहुभ्यां सम्प्रयुध्यस्व यदि मे द्वन्द्वमाहवे |
वेगं सहस्व दुर्बुद्धे ततस्त्वं रक्षसां वरः || ६-८६-३१_END
BEGIN_
"O foolish fellow! If you enter into a duel with me, fight with your arms. Withstand
my force in the battle-field. Then you will be considered as the best among the demons."_END

B_6_C_86_27
BEGIN_
हनूमन्तं जिघांसन्तं समुद्यतशरासनम् |
रावणात्मजमाचष्टे लक्ष्मणाय विभीषणः || ६-८६-३२_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana told Lakshmana in the following words that while with bow upraised,
Indrajit sought to kill Hanuma._END

B_6_C_86_28
BEGIN_
यः स वासवनिर्जेता रावणस्यात्मसम्भवः |
स एष रथमास्थाय हनूमन्तं जिघांसति || ६-८६-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Having seated in a chariot, Indrajit, who conquered Indra, is seeking to kill
Hanuma."_END

B_6_C_86_29
BEGIN_
तमप्रतिमसंस्थानैः शरैः शत्रुविदारणैः |
जीवितान्तकरैर्घोरैः सौमित्रे रावणिं जहि || ६-८६-३४_END
BEGIN_
"O Lakshmana! Kill that Indrajit with your terrific arrows of incomparable
workmanship, which ward off the enemies and putting an end to their lives."_END

B_6_C_86_30
BEGIN_
इत्येवमुक्तस्तु तदा महात्मा |
विभीषणेनारिविभीषणेन |
ददर्श तं पर्वतसंनिकाशं |
रथस्थितं भीमबलं दुरासदम् || ६-८६-३५_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Vibhishana, who was fearful to his adversaries, the
great-souled Lakshmana saw Indrajit, who closely resembled a mountain, seated in a chariot, of
terrific strength and who was difficult to approach._END

B_6_C_87_0
BEGIN_
एवमुक्त्वा तु सौमित्रिं जातहर्षो विभीषणः |
धनुष्पाणिनमादाय त्वरमाणो जगाम सः || ८७-६-१_END
BEGIN_
After speaking to him as aforesaid, Vibhishana taking Lakshmana, who held a bow in
his hand, felt rejoiced and hastened away._END

B_6_C_87_1
BEGIN_
अविदूरं ततो गत्वा प्रविश्य च महद्वनम् |
दर्शयामास तत्कर्म लक्ष्मणाय विभीषणः || ८७-६-२_END
BEGIN_
Moving not very distant from there and entering an extensive thicket, Vibhishana
showed to Lakshmana, the place where Indrajit was going to pour oblations into the sacred fire._END

B_6_C_87_2
BEGIN_
नीलजीमूतसङ्काशं न्यग्रोधं भीमदर्शनम् |
तेजस्वी रावणभ्राता लक्ष्मणाय न्यवेदयत् || ८७-६-३_END
BEGIN_
The glorious Vibhishana showed a terribly looking banyan tree, appearing like a
blace cloud (and spoke as follows)._END

B_6_C_87_3
BEGIN_
इहोपहारं भूतानां बलवान्रावणातजः |
उपहृत्य ततः पश्चात्सङ्ग्राममभिवर्तते || ८७-६-४_END
BEGIN_
"After offering oblations to the spirits at this place, the mighty Indrajit proceeds
to the battle afterwards."_END

B_6_C_87_4
BEGIN_
अदृश्यः सर्वभूतानां ततो भवति राक्षसः |
निहन्ति समरे शत्रून्बध्नाति च शरोत्तमैः || ८७-६-५_END
BEGIN_
"Thereupon, this demon becomes invisible to any one, kills some enemies in battle
and binds some with his excellent arrows."_END

B_6_C_87_5
BEGIN_
तमप्रविष्टं न्यग्रोधं बलिनं रावणात्मजम् |
विध्वंसय शरैस्तीक्ष्णैः सरथं साश्वसारथिम् || ८७-६-६_END
BEGIN_
"Destroy that mighty Indrajit, along with his chariot, horses and charioteer, by
releasing your blazing arrows, even while he has not reached the banyan tree."_END

B_6_C_87_6
BEGIN_
तथेत्युक्त्वा महातेजाः सौमित्रिर्मित्रनन्दनः |
बभूवावस्थितस्तत्र चित्रं विस्फारयन्धनुः || ८७-६-७_END
BEGIN_
That greatly brilliant Lakshmana, a delight of his fiends, saying 'So be it' took
his stand there, twanging his bow at full length._END

B_6_C_87_7
BEGIN_
स रथेनाग्निवर्णेन बलवान्रावणात्मजः |
इन्द्रजित्कवची खड्गी सध्वजः प्रत्यदृश्यत || ८७-६-८_END
BEGIN_
That Indrajit, the son of Ravana, clad in armour, armed with a sword, and
distinguished by his ensign, appeared in a fire-coloured chariot._END

B_6_C_87_8
BEGIN_
तमुवाच महातेजाः पौलस्त्यमपराजितम् |
समाह्वये त्वां समरे सम्यग्युद्धं प्रयच्छ मे || ८७-६-९_END
BEGIN_
That highly splendid Lakshmana spoke to that Indrajit, the scion of Sage Paulastya,
who had never been conquered before (as follows); "I am inviting you for a fight. Give battle to me
in a right manner."_END

B_6_C_87_9
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तो महातेजा मनस्वी रावणात्मजः |
अब्रवीत्परुषं वाक्यं तत्र दृष्ट्वा विभीषणम् || ८७-६-१०_END
BEGIN_
Thus spoken by Lakshmana, Indrajit with a great brilliance and high mindedness,
seeing Vibhishana there, spoke the following harsh words to him:_END

B_6_C_87_10
BEGIN_
इह त्वं जातसंवृद्धः साक्षाद्भ्राता पितुर्मम |
कथं द्रुह्यसि पुत्रस्य पितृव्यो मम राक्षस || ८७-६-११_END
BEGIN_
"O demon! You are born and brought up here. You are a direct brother to my father
and a paternal uncle to me. How can you be hostile to a son?_END

B_6_C_87_11
BEGIN_
न ज्ञातित्वं न सौहार्दं न जातिस्तव दुर्मते |
प्रमाणं न च सोदर्यं न धर्मो धर्मदूषण || ८७-६-१२_END
BEGIN_
"O perverted fellow, an abuser of righteousness! Consanguinity is not a norm for
you, nor friendliness, nor pride of birth, nor a brotherly feeling nor a right conduct."_END

B_6_C_87_12
BEGIN_
शोच्यस्त्वमसि दुर्बुद्धे निन्दनीयश्च साधुभिः |
यस्त्वं स्वजनमुत्सृज्य परभृत्यत्वमागतः || ८७-६-१३_END
BEGIN_
"O evil-minded one! You are pitiable and deserve to be reproached by the virtuous,
in that having abandoned your onw kind, you have entered into the service of our enemy."_END

B_6_C_87_13
BEGIN_
नैतच्छिथिलया बुद्ध्या त्वं वेत्सि महदन्तरम् |
क्व च स्वजनसंवासः क्व च नीचपराश्रयः || ८७-६-१४_END
BEGIN_
"You are not recognizing the great difference because of your feeble mind. Where is
living together with one's own kindred and where is taking refuge with low kind of enemies?_END

B_6_C_87_14
BEGIN_
गुणवान्वा परजनः स्वजनो निर्गुणोऽपि वा |
निर्गुणः स्वजनः श्रेयान्यः परः पर एव सः || ८७-६-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Opponents may be virtuous. One's own kindred may not be virtuous. But, a relation,
though bereft of merit is preferable. An enemy is, indeed, ever an enemy."_END

B_6_C_87_15
BEGIN_
यः स्वपक्षं परित्यज्य परपक्षं निषेवते |
स स्वपक्षे क्षयं प्राप्ते पश्चात्तैरेव हन्यते || ८७-६-१६_END
BEGIN_
"He who, abandoning his own side, takes sides with adversary, is killed, after his
own knsmen are destroyed just by those people of the other side."_END

B_6_C_87_16
BEGIN_
निरनुक्रोशता चेयं यादृशी ते निशाचर |
स्वजनेन त्वया शक्यं परुषं रावणानुज || ८७-६-१७_END
BEGIN_
"O Indrajit, the demon! The ruthlessness thus shown by you and the manliness
exhibited by you (in bringing Lakshmana here) could be possible only by you, our own kindred."_END

B_6_C_87_17
BEGIN_
इत्युक्तो भ्रातृपुत्रेण प्रत्युवाच विभीषणः |
अजानन्निव मच्छीलं किं राक्षस विकत्थसे || ८७-६-१८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Indrajit, his brother's son, Vibhishana replied: "O demon! Why
do you speak perversely, as though you are not aware of my nature."_END

B_6_C_87_18
BEGIN_
राक्षसेन्द्रसुतासाधो पारुष्यं त्यज गौरवात् |
कुले यद्यप्यहं जातो रक्षसां क्रूरकर्मणाम् || ८७-६-१९
गुणोऽयं प्रथमो नृइणां तन्मे शीलमराक्षसं |_END
BEGIN_
"O Indrajit the wicked one! Atleast out of respect for the elders, abandon your
harshness. Even if I am born in a demoniac race, which does cruel acts, my nature is goodness,
which is prime virtue of human beings and it is not demoniacal."_END

B_6_C_87_19
BEGIN_
न रमे दारुणेनाहं न चाधर्मेण वै रमे || ८७-६-२०
भ्रात्रा विषमशीलेन कथं भ्राता निरस्यते |_END
BEGIN_
"I neither delight in cruel acts, nor rejoice in unvirtuous acts. How can a brother
be driven away by his brother, even if the former's nature is different?"_END

B_6_C_87_20
BEGIN_
धर्मात्प्रच्युतशीलं हि पुरुषं पापनिश्चयम् || ८७-६-२१
त्वक्त्वा सुखमवाप्नोति हस्तादाशीविषं यथा |_END
BEGIN_
"Renouncing a man of sinful resolve hose conduct has deviated from righteousness,
one attains happiness, as one shakes off a venomous serpent from his hand."_END

B_6_C_87_21
BEGIN_
परस्वहरणे युक्तं परदाराभिमर्शाम् || ८७-६-२२
त्याज्यमाहुर्दुरात्मानं वेश्म प्रज्वलितं यथा |_END
BEGIN_
"The wise men say that an evil-natured fellow, who is intent on taking away other's
property and lustfully touches another's wife, is worth shunning, as one abandons a house in
flames."_END

B_6_C_87_22
BEGIN_
परस्वानां च हरणं परदाराभिमर्शनम् || ८७-६-२३
सुहृदामतिशङ्कां च त्रयो दोषाः क्षयावहाः |_END
BEGIN_
"Three faults produce destruction. Taking away other's property, lustfully touching
another's wife and excessive distrust with one's friends."_END

B_6_C_87_23
BEGIN_
महर्षीणां वधो घोरः सर्वदेवैश्च विग्रहः || ८७-६-२४
अभिमानश्च कोपश्च वैरित्वं प्रतिकूलता |
एते दोषा मम भ्रातुर्जीवितैश्वर्यनाशनाः || ८७-६-२५
गुणान्प्रच्छादयामासुः पर्वतानिव तोयदाः |_END
BEGIN_
"These faults which destroy one's life and lordship killing great sages terribly,
waging war against all celestials, arrogance, becoming angry very easily, quarrelsomeness, ill-will
have concealed the good qualities of my elder brother, as the clouds conceal the view of
mountains."_END

B_6_C_87_24
BEGIN_
दोषैरेतैः परित्यक्तो मया भ्राता पिता तव || ८७-६-२६
नेयमस्ति पुरी लङ्का न च त्वं न च ते पिता |_END
BEGIN_
"Because of these vices, Ravana, your father and my brother, has been abandoned by
me. Neither will this City of Lanka will exist any longer nor you nor your father."_END

B_6_C_87_25
BEGIN_
अतिमानी च बालश्च दुर्विनीतश्च राक्षस |
बद्धस्त्वं कालपाशेन ब्रूहि मां यद्यदिच्छसि || ८७-६-२७_END
BEGIN_
"O demon! You can talk to me as you like, since you are arrogant, foolish,
indisciplined and caught, as you are, in the noose of Death."_END

B_6_C_87_26
BEGIN_
अद्य ते व्यसनं प्राप्तं किमिह त्वं तु वक्ष्यसि |
प्रवेष्टुं न त्वया शक्यो न्यग्रोधो राक्षसाधम || ८७-६-२८_END
BEGIN_
"O the worst of demons! You got this calamity here because you spoke harsh words to
me today. You cannot reach the banyan-tree any longer."_END

B_6_C_87_27
BEGIN_
धर्षयित्वा तु काकुत्स्थौ न शक्यं जीवितुं त्वया |
युध्यस्व नरदेवेन लक्ष्मणेन रणे सह || ८७-६-२९
हतस्त्वं देवता कार्यं करिष्यसि यमक्षये |_END
BEGIN_
"It is not possible for you to survive, on attacking Lakshmana. You fight with
Lakshmana, the lord of men, in the battle-field. After being killed, you will do sacred work in the
abode of Yama, the god of Death."_END

B_6_C_87_28
BEGIN_
निदर्शयस्वात्मबलं समुद्यतं |
कुरुष्व सर्वायुधसायकव्ययम् |
न लक्ष्मणस्यैत्य हि बाणगोचरं |
त्वमद्य जीवन्सबलो गमिष्यसि || ८७-६-३०_END
BEGIN_
"Do spend away all your weapons and arrows, by showing your own augmented strength.
Reaching the range of Lakshmana's arrows, you will not indeed return alive with your army
today."_END

B_6_C_88_0
BEGIN_
विभीषणवचः श्रुत्वा रावणिः क्रोधमूर्चितः |
अब्रवीत् परुषं वाक्यं वेगेनाभ्युत्पपात च || ८८-६-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Vibhishana, Indrajit was excited with rage, spoke harsh words
and rushed forward in fury._END

B_6_C_88_1
BEGIN_
उद्यतायुधनिस्त्रिंशो रथे सुसमलंकृते |
कालाश्वयुक्ते महति स्थितः कालान्तकोपमः || ८८-६-२
महाप्रमाणमुद्यम्य विपुलं वेगवद्दृढम् |
धनुर्भीमं परामृश्य शरांश्चामित्रशातनान् || ८८-६-३_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit was looking like Yama the lord of Death at the time of dissolution of the
world, sitting in a well-decorated and distinguished chariot yoked with black horses, having
upraised sword and weapons, raising a big terrific enormous strong and swift bow and laying hold of
arrows which can torment the enemies._END

B_6_C_88_2
BEGIN_
तं ददर्श महेष्वासो रथस्थः समलंकृतः |
अलंकृतममित्रघ्नो राघवस्यानुजं बली || ८८-६-४_END
BEGIN_
The mighty the destroyer of adversaries, wielding a large bow, fully adorned, and
seated in a chariot saw that Lakshmana who was embellished with his own splendor._END

B_6_C_88_3
BEGIN_
हनुमत्पृष्ठमारूढमुदयस्थरविप्रभम् |
उवाचैनं सुसंरब्धः सौमित्रिं सविभीषणम् || ८८-६-५
तांश्च वानरशार्दूलान् पश्यध्वं मे पराक्रमम् |_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit hurriedly spoke to those foremost of monkeys and to this Lakshmana, who
ascended Hanuma's back with a splendor of the sun shining on Mount Udaya and also with Vibhishana
as follows: "You behold my prowess now."_END

B_6_C_88_4
BEGIN_
अद्य मत्कारुमुकोत्सृष्टं शरवर्षं दुरासदम् || ८८-६-६
मुक्तं वर्षमिवाकाशे धारयिष्यथ संयुगे |_END
BEGIN_
"Now, you can face an unconquerable stream of arrows, like rain, released in the
sky, as discharged from my bow in the battle-field."_END

B_6_C_88_5
BEGIN_
अद्य वो मामका बाणा महाकार्मुकनिःसृताः || ८८-६-७
विधमिष्यन्ति गात्राणि तूलराशिमिवानलः |_END
BEGIN_
"Today my arrows released from my large bow will destroy your bodies, as fire
consumes a pile of cotton."_END

B_6_C_88_6
BEGIN_
तीक्षणसायकनिर्भिन्नान् शूलशक्त्यृष्टितोमरैः || ८८-६-८
अद्य वो गमयिष्यामि सर्वानेन यमक्षयम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Today, I will send all of you to the world of Yama the lord of Death, by piercing
you with my sharp arrows and hurling the pikes, javelins and lances on you."_END

B_6_C_88_7
BEGIN_
सृजतः शरवर्षाणि क्षिप्रहस्तस्य संयुगे || ८८-६-९
जीमूतस्येव नदतः कः स्थास्यति ममाग्रतः |_END
BEGIN_
"Who can stand before me, while I release streams of arrows with my swift-hand in
battle, thundering like a cloud?"_END

B_6_C_88_8
BEGIN_
रात्रियुद्धे तदा पूर्वं वज्राशनिसमैः शरैः || ८८-६-१०
शायितौ स्थो मया भूमौ विसंज्ञौ सपुरस्सरौ |_END
BEGIN_
"Earlier on that day, in a nocturnal battle, both of you along with Sugreeva and
other followers, were made unconscious by my arrows which were like thunderbolts and tips of
missiles as also you were made to fall down on the floor."_END

B_6_C_88_9
BEGIN_
स्मृतिर्न तेऽस्ति वा मन्ये व्यक्तं यातो यमक्षयम् || ८८-६-११
आशीविषसमं क्रुद्धं यन्माम् योद्धुमुपस्थितः |_END
BEGIN_
"Do you not have that remembrance? I presume clearly that you are on the road to
Yama the lord of Death, since you have come to give battle to me, enraged as I am, like a venomous
serpent."_END

B_6_C_88_10
BEGIN_
तच्छ्रुत्वा राक्षसेन्द्रस्य गर्जितं राघवस्तदा || ८८-६-१२
अभीतवदनः क्रुद्धो रावणिं वाक्यमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Enraged in hearing that roaring of Indrajit, Lakshmana then spoke the following
words, with a courageous countenance._END

B_6_C_88_11
BEGIN_
उक्तश्च दुर्गमः पारः कार्याणां राक्षस त्वया || ८८-६-१३
कार्याणां कर्मणाम् पारं यो गच्छति स बुद्धिमान् |_END
BEGIN_
"O demon! It has been proclaimed by you about the successful conclusion of your
tasks, eventhough it is difficult to achieve them. He alone is clever, whoever carries through his
undertakings in practice."_END

B_6_C_88_12
BEGIN_
स त्वमर्थस्य हीनार्थो दुरवापस्य केनचित् || ८८-६-१४
वाचा व्याहृत्य जानीषे कृतार्थोऽस्मिति दुर्मते |_END
BEGIN_
"O evil-minded one! You are thinking that you have accomplished your end, by
proclaiming through word alone, the achievement of your end, which is difficult to attain for
anyone, though you, as such, lack in capacity to achieve your purpose."_END

B_6_C_88_13
BEGIN_
अंतर्धानगतेनाजौ यस्त्वया चरितस्तदा || ८८-६-१५
तस्कराचरितो मार्गः नैष वीरनिषेवितः |_END
BEGIN_
"The path, which was followed on that day by you, becoming invisible in the
battle-field, is the one trodden by thieves and is not the path followed by valiant ones."_END

B_6_C_88_14
BEGIN_
यथा बाणपथं प्राप्य स्थितोऽस्मि तव राक्षस || ८८-६-१६
दर्शयस्वाद्य तत्तेजो वाचा त्वं किं विकत्थसे |_END
BEGIN_
"O demon! Having reached the range of your arrows, I am standing before you.
Therefore show your prowess today. Why should you brag with your words?_END

B_6_C_88_15
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तो धनुर्भीमं परामृश्य महाबलः || ८८-६-१७
ससर्ज निशितान् बाणानिंद्रजित् समितिञ्जयः |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words, the mighty Indrajit, victorious in battle, reaching his
terrific bow, released sharp arrows from it._END

B_6_C_88_16
BEGIN_
तेन सृष्टा महावेगाः शराः सर्पविषोपमाः || ८८-६-१८
संप्राप्य लक्ष्मणं पेतुः श्वसन्त इव पन्नगाः |_END
BEGIN_
Duly reaching Lakshmana, the arrows released by Indrajit, which rushed with great
speed and were as deadly as the venom of serpents, fell like the hissing of snakes._END

B_6_C_88_17
BEGIN_
शरैरतिमहावेगै र्वेगवान् रावणात्मजः || ८८-६-१९
सौमित्रिमिन्द्रजिद्युद्धे विव्याध शुभलक्षणम् |_END
BEGIN_
The swift Indrajit, the son of Ravana, with his arrows of very great velocity, in
that battle, struck Lakshmana who was endowed with auspicious body-marks._END

B_6_C_88_18
BEGIN_
स शरैरतिविद्धाङ्गो रुधिरेण समुक्षितः || ८८-६-२०
शुशुभे लक्ष्मणः श्रीमान्विधूम इव पावकः |_END
BEGIN_
That glorious Lakshmana, drenched in blood, with his body very much wounded by
arrows, shone like a smokeless flame._END

B_6_C_88_19
BEGIN_
इन्द्रजित्त्वात्मनः कर्म प्रसमीक्ष्याभिगम्य च || ८८-६-२१
निनद्य सुमहानादमितं वचनमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Mulling over his own feat, Indrajit for his part, approaching Lakshmana and emitting
an exceedingly loud roar, spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_88_20
BEGIN_
पत्रिण शितधारास्ते शरा मत्कार्मुकच्युताः || ८८-६-२२
आदास्यन्तेऽद्य सौमित्रे जीवितं जीवितान्तकाः |_END
BEGIN_
"The sharp-edged and deadly arrows, with their wings, released from my bow, will now
take your life, O Lakshmana!"_END

B_6_C_88_21
BEGIN_
अद्य गोमायुसंघाश्च श्येनसंघाश्च लक्ष्मण || ८८-६-२३
गृध्राश्च निपतन्तु त्वां गतासुं निहतं मया |_END
BEGIN_
"O Lakshmana! Let a number of Jackals, multitude of hawks and vultures descend upon
you, when struck down by me, you are dead."_END

B_6_C_88_22
BEGIN_
क्षत्रबन्धुं सदानार्यं रामः परमदुर्मतिः || ८८-६-२४
भक्तं भ्रातरमद्यैव त्वां द्रख्यति हतं मया |_END
BEGIN_
"The exceedingly evil-minded Rama now itself can see you, a mere kshatriya (military
class only for a name sake), ever ignoble and his devoted brother, killed by me."_END

B_6_C_88_23
BEGIN_
विस्रस्तकवचं भूमौ व्यपविद्धशरासनम् || ८८-६-२५
हृतोत्तमाङ्गं सौमित्रे त्वामद्य निहतम् मया |_END
BEGIN_
"O Lakshmana! Rama will see you, struck down by me today, with your armour dropped
down, bow thrown about and head dismantled."_END

B_6_C_88_24
BEGIN_
इति ब्रुवाणम् संक्रुद्धं परुषं रावणात्मजम् || ८८-६-२६
हेतुमद्वाक्यमर्थज्ञो लक्ष्मणः प्रत्युवाच ह |_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana, understanding the sense of the word, replied in the following logical
words to the enraged Indrajit thus speaking harshly._END

B_6_C_88_25
BEGIN_
वाग्बलं त्यज दुर्भद्धे क्रूरकर्मासि राक्षस || ८८-६-२७
अथ कस्माद्वदस्येतत्संपादय सुकर्मणा |_END
BEGIN_
"O evil-minded one! Give up strength of speech in your empty words. O demons! You
are doing cruel acts. Why do you indulge in such idle talk? Make it active with your good
work."_END

B_6_C_88_26
BEGIN_
अकृत्वा कत्थसे कर्म किमर्थमिह राक्षस || ८८-६-२८
कुरु तत्कर्म येनाहं श्रद्दध्यां तव कत्थनम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O demon! Without performing that act, why do you boast yourself here? Perform that
act by which I can believe your brag."_END

B_6_C_88_27
BEGIN_
अनुक्त्वा परुषं वाक्यं किंचिदप्यनवक्षिपन् || ८८-६-२९
अविकत्थन् वधिष्यामि त्वां पश्य पुरुषाधम |_END
BEGIN_
"O the worst of persons! Without speaking even a few harsh words, without abusing
you and without bragging myself, Lo! I will kill you."_END

B_6_C_88_28
BEGIN_
इत्युक्त्वा पञ्च नाराचानाकर्णापूरितान् शरान् || ८८-६-३०
विजघान महावेगाल्लक्ष्मणो राक्षसोरसि |_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking, Lakshmana stretching five steel arrows upto the ear, dug them into
the demon's chest with a great speed._END

B_6_C_88_29
BEGIN_
सुपत्रवाजिता बाणा ज्वलिता इव पन्नगाः || ८८-६-३१
नैरृतोरस्यभासन्त सवितू रश्मयो यथा |_END
BEGIN_
The arrows, blazing like serpents and feathered with fine plumes, shone like
sun-rays in that demon's chest._END

B_6_C_88_30
BEGIN_
स शरैराहतस्तेन सरोषो रावणात्मजः || ८८-६-३२
सुप्रयुक्तैस्त्रिभिर्बाणैः प्रतिविव्याध लक्ष्मणम् |_END
BEGIN_
Struck with arrows by Lakshmana, that enraged Indrajit pierced in return three
arrows well-directed towards Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_88_31
BEGIN_
स बभूव महाभीमो नरराक्षससिंहयोः || ८८-६-३३
विमर्दस्तुमुलो युद्धे परस्परजयैषिणोः |_END
BEGIN_
That fight between Lakshmana, the foremost among men and Indrajit, the formost among
demons, who wished to conquer one over the other in battle, was most terrific and tumultuous._END

B_6_C_88_32
BEGIN_
उभौ हि बलसंपन्नावुभौ विक्रमशालिनौ || ८८-६-३४
उभौ परमदुर्जेयावतुल्यबलतेजसौ |_END
BEGIN_
Both were endowed with strength. Both were distinguished for their prowess. Both
were exceedingly difficult to conquer and peerless in strength and courage._END

B_6_C_88_33
BEGIN_
युयुधाते तदा वीरौ ग्रहाविव नभोगतौ || ८८-६-३५
बलवृत्राविवाभीतौ युधि तौ दुष्पृधर्षणौ |_END
BEGIN_
Those two heroes, who were difficult to overcome in battle, fought at that moment
like two plants figuring in the sky and like Indra and Vritra, the demon._END

B_6_C_88_34
BEGIN_
युयुधाते महात्मानौ तदा केसरिणाविव || ८८-६-३६
बहूनवष्^इजन्तौ हि मार्गणौघानवस्थितौ |
नरराक्षसमुख्यौ तौ प्रहृष्टावभ्ययुध्यताम् || ८८-६-३७_END
BEGIN_
Then, the two warriors, who were engaged in releasing several streams of arrows,
fought like two lions. Lakshmana the foremost among humans and Indrajit the foremost among demons
fought with rejoice._END

B_6_C_88_35
BEGIN_
ततश्श्रान् दाशरथिः संधायामित्रकर्षणः |
ससर्ज राक्षसेन्द्रय कृद्धः सर्प इव श्वसन् || ८८-६-३८_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Lakshmana the tormentator of enemies, fitting his arrows to his bow,
released arrows on Indrajit, hissing like an enraged serpent._END

B_6_C_88_36
BEGIN_
तस्य ज्यातलनिर्घोषं स श्रुत्वा राक्षसाधिपः |
विवर्णवदनो भूत्वा लक्ष्मणं समुदैक्षत || ८८-६-३९_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the twang of the bow-string of Lakshmana, Indrajit the Chief of demons
became pale-faced and fixed his gaze on Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_88_37
BEGIN_
विषण्णवदनं दृष्ट्वा राक्षसं रावणात्मजम् |
सौमित्रिं युद्धसंयुक्तं प्रत्युवाच विभीषणः || ८८-६-४०_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Indrajit (the son of Ravana) pale-faced, Vibhishana spoke as follows to
Lakshmana, who was fully absorbed in the fight._END

B_6_C_88_38
BEGIN_
निमित्तान्युपपश्यामि यान्यस्मिन् रावणात्मजे |
त्वर तेन महाबाहो भग्न एष न संशयः || ८८-६-४१_END
BEGIN_
"O the long-armed Lakshmana! I infer on the strength of the indications which I see
in Indrajit, that he is disappointed. There is no doubt about it. Make haste."_END

B_6_C_88_39
BEGIN_
ततस्संधाय सौमित्रिः शरानाशीविषोपमान् |
मुमोच निशितांस्तस्मिन् सर्पानिव विषोल्बणान् || ८८-६-४२_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, fitting to his bow sharp arrows, resembling poisonous snakes, Lakshmana
discharged those arrows which looked like serpents full of venom to him._END

B_6_C_88_40
BEGIN_
शक्राशनिसमस्पर्शैर्लक्षमणेनाहतः शरैः |
मुहूर्तमभवन्मूढः सर्वसंक्षुभितेन्द्रियः || ८८-६-४३_END
BEGIN_
Hit by Lakshmana with arrows, which invaded all his senses, like the hit of Indra's
thunderbolt, Indrajit became stupefied for a moment._END

B_6_C_88_41
BEGIN_
उपलभ्य मुहूर्तेन संज्ञाम् प्रत्यागतेन्द्रियः |
ददर्शावस्थितं वीरमाजौ दशरथात्मजम् || ८८-६-४४_END
BEGIN_
Regaining his consciousness within a moment, with his senses restored, that Indrajit
saw the valiant Lakshmana engaged in the battle._END

B_6_C_88_42
BEGIN_
सोऽभिचक्राम सौमित्रिं रोषात्संरक्तलोचनः |
अब्रवीछैनमासाद्य पुनः स परुषं वचः || ८८-६-४५_END
BEGIN_
With blood-red eyes in anger, Indrajit walked towards Lakshmana. Approaching
Lakshmana, he again spoke the following harsh words to him:_END

B_6_C_88_43
BEGIN_
किं न स्मरसि तद्युद्धे प्रथमे यत्पराक्रमम् |
निबद्धस्त्वं सह भ्रात्रा यदा भुवि विचेष्टसे || ८८-६-४६_END
BEGIN_
"Don't you remember my prowess in the first encounter, when you along with your
brother, was bound by me and you wriggled on the floor?"_END

B_6_C_88_44
BEGIN_
युवां खलु महायुद्धे शक्रानिसमैः शरैः |
शायितौ प्रथमम् भूमौ विसंज्ञौ सपुरःसरौ || ८८-६-४७_END
BEGIN_
"At first, both of you along with your foremost warriors in a major encounter, were
indeed laid down unconscious on the ground, by my arrows which were equal to Indra's
thunderbolt."_END

B_6_C_88_45
BEGIN_
स्मृतिर्वा नास्ति ते मन्ये व्यक्तं वा यमसादनम् |
गन्तुमिच्छसि यन्मां त्वमाधर्षयितुमिच्छसि || ८८-६-४८_END
BEGIN_
"The fact that you desire to attack me means that either the remembrance of it no
longer exists in you or I presume you desire to go clearly to the abode of Yama the lord of
Death."_END

B_6_C_88_46
BEGIN_
यदि ते प्रथमे युद्धे न दृष्टो मत्पराक्रमः |
अद्य त्वां दर्शयिष्यामि तिषेदानीं व्यवस्थितः || ८८-६-४९_END
BEGIN_
"If my prowess was not witnessed by you in the first encounter, I will show it
today. Stand ready for it now."_END

B_6_C_88_47
BEGIN_
इत्युक्त्वा सप्तभिर्बाणैरभिविव्याध लक्ष्मणम् |
दशभिस्तु हनूमन्तं तीक्षणधारैः शरोत्तमैः || ८८-६-५०_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking, he struck Lakshmana with seven arrows and Hanuma with ten excellent
sharp-edged arrows._END

B_6_C_88_48
BEGIN_
ततः शरशतेनैव सुप्रयुक्तेन वीर्यवान् |
क्रोधाद्द्विगुणसंरब्धो निर्बिभेद विभीषणम् || ८८-६-५१_END
BEGIN_
Then, the valiant Idnrajit with anger and with twice as much vehemence, wounded
Vibhishana with a hundred well-aimed arrows._END

B_6_C_88_49
BEGIN_
तद्दृष्ट्वेन्द्रजिता कर्म कृतं रामानुजस्तदा |
अचिन्तयित्वा प्रहसन्नैतत्किंचिदिति ब्रुवन् || ८८-६-५२
मुमोच च शरान् घोरान् संगृह्य नरपुंगवः |
अभीतवदनः क्रुद्धो रावनिं लक्ष्मणो युधि || ८८-६-५३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that feat accomplished by Indrajit, yet disregarding it, deriding it by
saying "This is noting" and taking up terrific arrows, the fearless and enraged Lakshmana the
younger brother of Rama and foremost among men, then discharged them against Indrajit in
battle._END

B_6_C_88_50
BEGIN_
नैवं रणगताः शूराः प्रहरन्ति निशाचर |
लघुवश्चाल्पवीर्याश्च शरा हीमे सुखास्तव || ८८-६-५४_END
BEGIN_
"O demon! Heroes who come to battle do not strike like this. These arrows of yours
are light, weak and mild indeed."_END

B_6_C_88_51
BEGIN_
नैवं शूरास्तु युध्यन्ते समरे जयकांक्षिणः |
इत्येवं तं ब्रुवन् धन्वी शरैरभिववर्ष ह || ८८-६-५५_END
BEGIN_
"Warriors, who wish to win in battle, do not fight like this." Thus speaking,
Lakshmana the wielder of a bow, streamed forth arrows on him._END

B_6_C_88_52
BEGIN_
तस्य बाणैः सुविध्वस्तं कवचं काञ्चनं महत् |
व्यशीर्यत रथोपस्थे ताराजालमिवाम्बरात् || ८८-६-५६_END
BEGIN_
A large golden armour, broken to pieces by Lakshmana's arrows, slipped down in the
middle of chariot, like a cob-web of stars falling from the sky._END

B_6_C_88_53
BEGIN_
विधूतवर्मा नाराचैर्बभूव स कृतव्रणः |
इन्द्रजित्समरे वीरः प्रत्यूषे भानुमानिव || ८८-६-५७_END
BEGIN_
The valiant Indrajit, with his armour disheveled by the steel arrows, was wounded in
battle and looked like the sun at dawn._END

B_6_C_88_54
BEGIN_
ततः शरसहस्रेण संक्रुद्धो रावणात्मजः |
बिभेद समरे वीरो लक्ष्मणं भीमविद्रमः || ८८-६-५८_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, the valiant Indrajit of terrific prowess was enraged and wounded
Lakshmana with a thousand arrows in battle._END

B_6_C_88_55
BEGIN_
व्यशीर्यत महद्दिव्यं कवचम् लक्ष्मणस्य तु |
कृतप्रतिकृतान्योन्यं बभूवतुरभिद्रुतौ || ८८-६-५९_END
BEGIN_
The large celestial armour of Lakshmana broke into pieces. The two warriors vied
with each other in offence and retaliation in their attack._END

B_6_C_88_56
BEGIN_
अभीक्षणम् निःश्वसन्तौ तौ युध्येतां तुमुलं युधि |
शरसंकृत्तसर्वाङ्गौ सर्वतो रुधिरोक्षितौ || ८८-६-६०_END
BEGIN_
Those two warriors, with their entire bodies lacerated in combat, smeared with blood
all around and breathing heavily, fought the battle tumultuously._END

B_6_C_88_57
BEGIN_
सुदीर्घकालं तौ वीरावन्योन्यं निशितैः शरैः |
ततक्षतुर्महत्मानौ रणकर्मविशारदौ || ८८-६-६१_END
BEGIN_
Thos mighty warriors, skilled in warfare, were cutting through each other, for a
long time, with sharp arrows._END

B_6_C_88_58
BEGIN_
बभूवतुश्चात्मजये यतौ भीमपराक्रमौ |
तौ शरौघै स्तथाकीर्णौ निकृत्तकवचध्वजौ || ८८-६-६२
सृजन्तौ रुधिरं चोष्णं जलं प्रस्रवणाविव |_END
BEGIN_
Those two heroes f terrific prowess stay on strenuously trying to secure their own
victory, covered as they were, all over with a multitude of arrows as also their armour and
standards torn to pieces. They stood emitting hot blood, as two water-falls gushing hot water._END

B_6_C_88_59
BEGIN_
शरवर्षं ततो घोरं मुञ्चतोर्भीमनिःस्वनम् || ८८-६-६३
सासारयोरिवाकाशे नीलयोः कालेमेघयोः |
तयोरथ महान् कालो व्यतीयाद्युध्यमानयोः || ८८-६-६४
न च तौ युद्धवैमुख्यं श्रमं चाप्युपजग्मतुः |_END
BEGIN_
Much of a time lapsed while the two warriors fought loosing terrific stream of
arrows, then with an awful clamour, like two dark destructive clouds raining from the sky. They
neither trned their back from the battle, nor experienced any fatigue._END

B_6_C_88_60
BEGIN_
अस्त्राण्यस्त्रविदां श्रेष्ठौ दर्शयन्त् पुनः पुनः || ८८-६-६५
शरानुच्चावचाकारानन्तरिक्षे बबन्धतुः |_END
BEGIN_
Displaying their missiles again and again, the two warriors, who were excellent
among those skilled in the use missiles, fastened a net work of arrows both large and small, in the
sky._END

B_6_C_88_61
BEGIN_
व्यपेतदोषमस्यन्तौ लघु चित्रं च सुष्ठु च || ८८-६-६६
उभौ तु तुमुलं घोरं चक्रतुर्नरराक्षसौ |_END
BEGIN_
Loosing their arrows faultlessly, gracefully and easily in a wonderful way, both the
man and the demon carried on a tumultuous and terrific war._END

B_6_C_88_62
BEGIN_
तयोः पृथक् पृथग्भीमः शुश्रुवे तुमुलः स्वनः || ८८-६-६७
सुघोरयोर्निःस्वनतोर्गगने मेघयोरिव |_END
BEGIN_
Their terrific and tumultuous sound could be heard one by one repeatedly. That sound
created a tremble in people, like a violent thunder-storm._END

B_6_C_88_63
BEGIN_
तयोः स भ्राजते शब्दस्तथा समरयत्तयोः || ८८-६-६८
सुघोरयोर्निःस्वनतोर्गगने मेघयोरिव |_END
BEGIN_
That clamour of those two warriors, who were engaged thus in that martial act,
resembled the rumbling of two dreadful thundering clouds in the sky._END

B_6_C_88_64
BEGIN_
सुवर्णपुङ्खैर्नाराचैर्बलवन्तौ कृतव्रणौ || ८८-६-६९
प्रसुस्रुवाते रुधिरं कीर्तिमन्तौ जये धृतौ |_END
BEGIN_
Those two mighty and glorious warriors, who were determined to gain victory over one
another, wounded with golden-shafted steel arrows, were profusely giving out blood._END

B_6_C_88_65
BEGIN_
ते गात्रयोर्निपतिता रुक्मपुङ्खाः शरा युधि || ८८-६-७०
असृग्दिग्धा विनिष्पेतुर्विविशुर्धरणीतलम् |_END
BEGIN_
Fallen on their limbs, the golden-shafted arrows, dropped on the battle-field,
smeared with blood and pierced into the surface of the earth._END

B_6_C_88_66
BEGIN_
अन्ये सुनिशितैः शस्त्रैराकाशे संजघट्टिरे || ८८-६-७१
बभञ्जुश्चिच्छिदुश्चैव तयोर्बाणाः सहस्रशः |_END
BEGIN_
Some more arrows released by those two warriors clashed in thousands with sharp
weapons in the sky and shattered and tore them._END

B_6_C_88_67
BEGIN_
स बभूव रणे घोरस्तयोर्बाणमयश्चयः || ८८-६-७२
अग्निभ्यामिव दीप्ताभ्यां सत्रे कुशमयश्चयः |_END
BEGIN_
The terrific pile of arrows in battle appeared like a mass of sacred Kusha grass by
the side of two blazing fires at a sacrifice._END

B_6_C_88_68
BEGIN_
तयोः कृतव्रणौ देहौ शुशुभाते महात्मनोः || ८८-६-७३
सुपुष्पाविव निष्पत्रौ वने किंशुकशाल्मली |_END
BEGIN_
The wounded bodies of those two mighty warriors shone like Kimshuka and Shalmali
(silk-cotton) trees in full blossom, deprived of leaves._END

B_6_C_88_69
BEGIN_
चक्रतुस्तुमुलं घोरं संनिपातं मुहुर्मुहुः || ८८-६-७४
इन्द्रजिल्लक्ष्मणश्चैव परस्परजयैषिणौ |_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit and Lakshmana who were time and again wishing to attain victory one over
the other, carried out tumultuous and terrific battle._END

B_6_C_88_70
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणो रावणिं युद्धे रावणिश्चापि लक्ष्मणम् || ८८-६-७५
अन्योन्यं तावभिघ्नन्तौ न श्रमं प्रतिपद्यताम् |_END
BEGIN_
In the combat, Lakshmana was striking Indrajit and Indrajit too was striking
Lakshmana. Both of them were striking each other and did not experience any weariness._END

B_6_C_88_71
BEGIN_
बाणजालैः शरीरस्थैरवगाढैस्तरस्विनौ || ८८-६-७६
शुशुभाते महाविर्यौ प्ररूढाविव पर्वतौ |_END
BEGIN_
With a multitude of arrows dug deep into their bodies, those two warriors, of great
prowess and swiftness, shone like two mountains shooting forth plants from them._END

B_6_C_88_72
BEGIN_
ततो रुधिरस्तिक्तानि संवृतानि शरैर्भृशम् || ८८-६-७७
बभ्राजुः सर्वगात्राणि ज्वलन्त इव पावकाः |_END
BEGIN_
At that time, all their limbs, dampened with blood and thickly covered with arrows
shone very much like blazing fires._END

B_6_C_88_73
BEGIN_
तयोरथ महान् कालो व्यतीयाद्युध्यमानयोः || ८८-६-७८
न च तौ युद्धवैमुख्यं श्रमं चाप्यभिजग्मतुः |_END
BEGIN_
A lot of time lapsed in the meanwhile past the two warriors. They neither turned
their back from the battle nor experienced any fatigue._END

B_6_C_88_74
BEGIN_
अथ समरपरिश्रमं निहन्तुं |
समरमुखेष्वजितस्य लक्ष्मणस्य |
प्रियहितमुपपादयन्महात्मा |
समरमु पेत्य विभीषणोऽवतस्थे || ८८-६-७९_END
BEGIN_
Then, to relieve martial weariness of Lakshmana, who did not experience defeat in
any facet of war, the great-souled Vibhishana, offering agreeable and salutary words, took up his
position, on reaching the battle-field._END

B_6_C_89_0
BEGIN_
युध्यमानौ ततो दृष्ट्वा प्रसक्तौ नरराक्षसौ |
प्रभिन्नाविव मातङ्गौ परस्परजयैषिणौ || ८९-६-१
तयोर्युद्धं द्रुष्टौकामो वरचापधरो बली |
शूरः स रावणभ्राता तस्थौ संग्राममूर्धनि || ८९-६-२_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Lakshmana and Indrajit, fighting with commitment to gain victory one over the
other, like elephants in rut, that strong and valiant Vibhishana, wielding his excellent bow, stood
there at the battle-front, with an intent to behold their combat._END

B_6_C_89_1
BEGIN_
ततो विस्फारयामास महद्धनुरवस्थितः |
उत्ससर्ज च तीक्षणाग्रान् राक्षसेषु महाशरान् || ८९-६-३_END
BEGIN_
Standing there thus, Vibhishana stretched his great bow and released excellent sharp
pointed arrow son those demons._END

B_6_C_89_2
BEGIN_
ते शराः शिखिसंस्पर्शा निपतन्तस्समाहिताः |
राक्षसान् दारयामासुर्वज्रा इव महागिरीन् || ८९-६-४_END
BEGIN_
Falling in exact spot, those arrows, hitting like fire, tore the demons into peices,
as thunderbolts would cleave large mountains._END

B_6_C_89_3
BEGIN_
विभीषणस्यानुचरास्तेपि शूलासिपट्टिशैः |
चिछिदुः समरे वीरान् राक्षसान् राक्षसोत्तमाः || ८९-६-५_END
BEGIN_
Even the foremost of demons, the attendants of Vibhishana too, rent asunder those
valiant demns in battle, with pikes, sowrds and sharp-edged spears._END

B_6_C_89_4
BEGIN_
राक्षसैस्त्रैः परिवृतः स तदा तु विभीषणः |
बभौ मध्य प्रधृष्टानाम् कलभानामिव द्विपः || ८९-६-६_END
BEGIN_
Surrounded by those demons, Vibhishana shone like an elephant in the midst of proud
young tuskers._END

B_6_C_89_5
BEGIN_
ततप्सं चोदमानो वै हरीन् रक्षोवधप्रियान् |
उवाच वचनं काले कालज्ञो रक्षसां वरः || ८९-६-७_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana, who knew the timing, spoke to the monkeys, who cherished to destroy the
demons, the following opportune words duly inspiring them._END

B_6_C_89_6
BEGIN_
एकोऽयं राक्षसेन्द्रस्य परायणमवस्थितः |
एतच्छेषं बलं तस्य किं तिष्ठित हरीश्वराः || ८९-६-८_END
BEGIN_
"O cheifs of monkeys! Here stands before you, one who is the last support of Ravana.
He is all that is left in his force. Why do you stand idle?"_END

B_6_C_89_7
BEGIN_
अस्मिंश्च निहते पापे राक्षसे रणमूर्धनि |
रावणम् वर्जयित्वा तु शेषमस्य बलं हतम् || ८९-६-९_END
BEGIN_
"At the end of this war, if this sinful demon is killed, the remaining army is as
good as killed, except Ravana."_END

B_6_C_89_8
BEGIN_
प्रहस्तो निहतो वीरो निकुम्भश्च महाबलः |
कुम्भकर्णश्च कुम्भश्च धूम्राक्षश्च निशाचरः || ८९-६-१०
जम्बुमाली महामाली तीक्षणवेगोऽशनिप्रभः |
सुप्तग्नो यज्ञकोपश्च वज्रदंष्ट्रस्च राक्षसः || ८९-६-११
सिम्ह्रादी विकटोऽरिघ्नस्तपनो मंद एव च |
प्रघासः प्रघसश्चैव प्रजङ्घो जङ्घ एव च || ८९-६-१२
अग्निकेतुश्च दुर्धर्षो रश्मिकेतुश्च वीर्यवान् |
विद्युज्जिह्वो द्विजिह्वश्च सूर्यशत्रुश्च राक्षसः || ८९-६-१३
अकम्पनः सुपार्श्वश्च चक्रमाली च राक्षसः |
कम्पनः सत्त्ववनौ तौ देवान्तकनरान्तकौ || ८९-६-१४_END
BEGIN_
Prahasta was killed. The valiant Nikumbha, the mighty Kumbhakarna, Kumbha, the demon
called Dhumraksha, Jambumali, Mahamali, the highly swift Ashaniprabha, Suptaghna, Yajnakopa, a
demon named Vajradamshtra, Samhadri, Vikata the destroyer of enemies, Tapana, Manda, Praghaasa,
Praghasa, PrajaN^gha, JaN^ga, Agniketu who was difficult to be conquered, Agniketu, the valiant
Rashmiketu, vidyujjihva, Dvijihva, Suryashatru, Akampana, Suparshva, Chakramali, Kampana and the
mighty Devantaka were also killed."_END

B_6_C_89_9
BEGIN_
एतान्निहत्यातिबलान् बहून् राक्षससत्तमान् |
बाहुभ्यां सागरं तीर्त्वा लङ्घ्यतां गोष्पदं लघु || ८९-६-१५_END
BEGIN_
Having killed these many mighty and foremost of demons and having swun the ocen, let
the tiny puddle be crossed._END

B_6_C_89_10
BEGIN_
एतावदिह शेषं वो जेतव्यमिह वानराः |
हताः सर्वे समागम्य राक्षसा बलदर्पिताः || ८९-६-१६_END
BEGIN_
"O monkeys! Only this much of army remains yet to be conquered here. All the demons,
who were proud of their strength, having come to the battle-field here, were killed by you."_END

B_6_C_89_11
BEGIN_
अयुक्तं निधनं कर्तुं पुत्रस्य जनितुर्मम |
घृणामपास्य रामार्थे निहन्यां भ्रातुरात्मजम् || ८९-६-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Driving away tenderness, for the sake of Rama, I will kill my own brother's son
though being his uncle (who is as good as a father), it is not appropriate for me to compose his
death."_END

B_6_C_89_12
BEGIN_
हन्तुकामस्य मे बाष्पं चक्षुश् चैव निरुध्यते |
तदेवैष महाबाहुर्लक्ष्मणः शमयिष्यति || ८९-६-१८
वानरा घ्नन्तुं सम्भूय भृत्यानस्य समीपगान् |_END
BEGIN_
"My eyes are getting cluded with tear, even when I think of killing him. This
long-armed Lakshmana alone will finish him. O Monkeys! All of you, together, kill his servents
standing beside him."_END

B_6_C_89_13
BEGIN_
इति तेनातियशसा राक्षसेनाभिचोदिताः || ८९-६-१९
वानरेन्द्रा जहृषिरे लाङ्गलानि च विव्यधुः |_END
BEGIN_
Thus impelled by that illustrious Vibhishana, those monkey-chiefs were rejoiced and
lashed their tails (in a happy mood)._END

B_6_C_89_14
BEGIN_
ततस्ते कपिशार्दूलाः क्ष्वेडन्तश्च मुहुर्मुहुः || ८९-६-२०
मुमुचुर्विविधान्नादान्मेघान्दृष्ट्वेव बर्हिणः |_END
BEGIN_
Then, those monkeys-cheifs, roaring time and again, emitted various kinds of sounds
resembling the sounds of peacocks at the time of seeing the clouds._END

B_6_C_89_15
BEGIN_
जाम्बवानपि तैः सर्वैः स्वयूथैरभिसंवृतः || ८९-६-२१
अश्मभिस्ताडयामास नखैर्दन्तैश्च राक्षसान् |_END
BEGIN_
Even Jambavan and those monkeys, accompanied by all those, who belong to their
identical troops, began to strike the demons with stones, nails and teeth._END

B_6_C_89_16
BEGIN_
निघ्नन्तमृक्षाधिपतिं राक्षसास्ते महाबलाः || ८९-६-२२
परिवव्रुर्भयं त्यक्त्वा तमनेकविधायुधाः |_END
BEGIN_
Those mighty demons, having various kinds of weapons, abandoning their fear,
surrounded that Jambavan, who was playing havoc on them._END

B_6_C_89_17
BEGIN_
शरैः परशुभिस्तीक्ष्णैः पट्टसैर्यष्टितोमरैः || ८९-६-२३
जाम्बवन्तं मृधे जघ्नुर्निघ्नन्तं राक्षसीं चमूम् |_END
BEGIN_
They struck Jambavan, who was killing the army of demons in battle, with sharp axes,
spears with sharp edges, sticks and javelins._END

B_6_C_89_18
BEGIN_
स सम्प्रहारस्तुमुलः सञ्जज्ञे कपिराक्षसाम् || ८९-६-२४
देवासुराणां क्रुद्धानां यथा भीमो महास्वनः |_END
BEGIN_
That tumultuous and terrific battle accompanied by a great noise, occured between
the monkeys and the demons as between enraged celestials and demons._END

B_6_C_89_19
BEGIN_
हनूमानपि सङ्क्रुद्धः सालमुत्पाट्य पर्वतात् || ८९-६-२५
स लक्ष्मणं स्वयं पृष्ठादवरोप्य महामनाः |
रक्षसां कदनं चक्रे समासाद्य सहस्रशः || ८९-६-२६_END
BEGIN_
That haughty Hanuma too who felt enraged, causing Lakshmana to descend from his
back, and tearing up Sala tree from a mountain, approached the demons and himself began to destroy
those demons in their thousands._END

B_6_C_89_20
BEGIN_
स दत्त्वा तुमुलं युद्धं पितृव्यस्येन्द्रजिद्युधि || ८९-६-२७
लक्ष्मणं परवीरघ्नं पुनरेवाभ्यधावत |_END
BEGIN_
That mighty Indrajit, the destroyer valiant enemies, after giving a tumultuous fight
to his uncle, yet again rushed towards Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_89_21
BEGIN_
तौ प्रयुद्धौ तदा वीरौ मृधे लक्ष्मणराक्षसौ |
शरौघानभिवर्षन्तौ जघ्नतुस्तौ परस्परम् || ८९-६-२८_END
BEGIN_
The two valiant celebreties, Lakshmana and Indrajit, the two intense fighters in
battle, then began to strike each other, showering a multitude of arrows on their enemies._END

B_6_C_89_22
BEGIN_
अभीक्ष्णमन्तर्दधतुः शरजालैर्महाबलौ |
चन्द्रादित्याविवोष्णान्ते यथा मेघैस्तरस्विनौ || ८९-६-२९_END
BEGIN_
The mighty and energetic Lakshmana and Indrajit covered each other off exceedingly
by a network of arrows, in the same way as the sun and the moon are veiled by clouds at the end of
summer._END

B_6_C_89_23
BEGIN_
न ह्यादानं न सन्धानं धनुषो वा परिग्रहः |
न विप्रमोक्षो बाणानां न विकर्षो न विग्रहः || ८९-६-३०
न मुष्टिप्रतिसन्धानं न लक्ष्यप्रतिपादनम् |
अदृश्यत तयोस्तत्र युध्यतोः पाणिलाघवात् || ८९-६-३१_END
BEGIN_
Due to lightness of their hands, even as they fight there, neither the holding of
the bow, nor the taking off the arrows, nor fitting them on their bow-string, nor adjusting their
fists, nor drawing the bow-string nor attaining the target was visible._END

B_6_C_89_24
BEGIN_
चापवेगप्रमुक्तैश्च बाणजालैः समन्ततः |
अन्तरिक्षेऽभिसञ्चन्ने न रूपाणि चकाशिरे || ८९-६-३२_END
BEGIN_
The sky, having been covered by a multitude of arrows, on all sides, discharged with
force by them both, was shrouded in darkness._END

B_6_C_89_25
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणो रावणिं प्राप्य रावणिश्चापि लक्ष्मणम् |
अव्यवस्था भवत्युग्रा ताभ्यामन्योन्यविग्रहे || ८९-६-३३_END
BEGIN_
Meeting Indrajit, Lakshmana fought with him. Meeting Lakshmana, Indrajit too took
the offensive. As they clashed with each other, there was terrible confusion (as to who would win
ultimately)._END

B_6_C_89_26
BEGIN_
ताभ्यामुभाभ्यां तरसा प्रसृष्टैर्विशिखैः शितैः |
निरन्तरमिवाकाशं बभूव तमसा वृतम् || ८९-६-३४_END
BEGIN_
By the sharp arrows released almost continuously with the sky was covered with
darkness._END

B_6_C_89_27
BEGIN_
तैः परद्भिश्च बहुभिस्तयोः शरशतैः शितैः |
दिशश्च प्रदिशश्चैव बभूवुः शरसंकुलाः || ८९-६-३५_END
BEGIN_
By the fall of a multitude of their sharp arrows in hundreds, the quarters and
sub-quarters were filled with arrows._END

B_6_C_89_28
BEGIN_
तमसा पिहितं सर्वमासीद्भीमतरं महत् |
न तदानीइ|म् ववौ वायुर्न जज्वाल च पावकः || ८९-६-३६
रुधिरौघ महानद्यः प्रावर्तन्त सहस्रशः |_END
BEGIN_
All the space was covered with darkness, showing up great fear. While the sun was
setting down, encircling darkness all over, large streams of blood in plenty poured out._END

B_6_C_89_29
BEGIN_
क्रव्यादा दारुणा वाग्भिश्चिक्षिपुर्भीमनिःस्वनान् || ८९-६-३७
न तदानीम् ववौ वायुर्न च जज्वाल पावकः |_END
BEGIN_
Cruel and carnivorous animals diffused awful sounds with their roaring noise. Wind
did not blow at that time nor the wind blazed up._END

B_6_C_89_30
BEGIN_
स्वस्त्यस्तु लोकेभ्य इति जजल्पश्च महर्षयः || ८९-६-३८
सम्पेतुश्चात्र सम्प्राप्ता गन्धर्वाः सह चारणैः |_END
BEGIN_
Those great sages proclaimed, "May it be well for the (three) worlds!" The
frightened Gandharvas the celestial musicians along with Charanas, the wandering singers arrived
there to see tha battle-field._END

B_6_C_89_31
BEGIN_
अथ राक्षससिंहस्य कृष्णान्कनकभूषणान् || ८९-६-३९
शरैश्चतुर्भिः सौमित्रिर्विव्याध चतुरो हयान् |_END
BEGIN_
By discharging four arrows, Lakshmana then struck four black gold-adorned horses of
Indrajit._END

B_6_C_89_32
BEGIN_
ततोऽपरेण भल्लेन सूतस्य विचरिष्यतः || ८९-६-४०
संपूर्णायतमुक्तेन सुपत्रेण सुवर्चसा |
महेन्द्राशनिकल्पेन सूतस्य विचरिष्यतः || ८९-६-४१
स तेन बाणाशनिना तलशब्दानुनादिना |
लाघवाद्राघवः श्रीमाञ्शिरः कायादपाहरत् || ८९-६-४२_END
BEGIN_
