Thereupon, with alacrity of his hand, that illustrious Lakshmana, fully stretching
and releasing another sharp thunderbolt-like arrow, named Bhalla, which was yellowish in colour,
with charming plumes, having a good splendour similar to Indra's thunderbolt and echoing a clapping
sound, severed the head of Indrajit's charioteer from his trunk, even as he was circling
around._END

B_6_C_89_33
BEGIN_
स यन्तरि महातेजा हते मन्दोदरीसुतः |
स्वयं सारथ्यमकरोत्पुनश्च धनुर्स्पृशत् || ८९-६-४३_END
BEGIN_
When the charioteer was killed, the greatly splendoured Indrajit did the
charioteering by himself and also took hold of his bow._END

B_6_C_89_34
BEGIN_
तदद्भुतमभूत्तत्र सामर्थ्यं पश्यतां युधि |
हयेषु व्यग्रहस्तं तं विव्याध निशितैः शरैः || ८९-६-४४
धनुष्यथ पुनर्व्यग्रे हयेषु मुमुचे शरान् |_END
BEGIN_
For them, who saw his capability in that battle, it looked wonderful. When he was
driving his horses, Lakshmana struck him with sharp arrows. When he was attending to his bow, he
released arrows on horses._END

B_6_C_89_35
BEGIN_
चिद्रेषु तेषु बाणौघैर्विचरन्तमभीतवत् || ८९-६-४५
अर्दयामास समरे सौमित्रिः शीग्रकृत्तमः |_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana, who was swift in his acts, tormented Indrajit who was ranging the
battle-field fearlessly, with a multitude of arrows on such opportune occasions._END

B_6_C_89_36
BEGIN_
निहतं सारथिं दृष्ट्वा समरे रावणात्मजः || ८९-६-४६
प्रजहौ समरोद्धर्षं विषण्णः स बभूव ह |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing his charioteer killed in battle, Indrajit became dejected and los this
entusiasm in undertaking the combat._END

B_6_C_89_37
BEGIN_
विषण्णवदनं दृष्ट्वा राक्षसं हरियूथपाः || ८९-६-४७
ततः परमसंहृष्टो लक्ष्मणं चाभ्यपूजयन् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Indrajit with a despondent face, the monkey-chiefs were very much dejected
and then acclaimed Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_89_38
BEGIN_
ततः प्रमाथी शरभो रभसो गन्धमादनः || ८९-६-४८
अमृष्यमाणाश्चात्वारश्चक्रुर्वेगं हरीश्वराः |_END
BEGIN_
Then, four monkey-leaders named Pramathi, Rabhasa, Sharabha and Gandhamadana,
getting impatient, acted hastily._END

B_6_C_89_39
BEGIN_
ते चास्य हयमुख्येषु तूर्णमुत्पत्य वानराः || ८९-६-४९
चतुर्षु सुमहावीर्या निपेतुर्भीमविक्रमाः |_END
BEGIN_
Those four mokeys, having a great might and terrible prowess, quickly bounced and
descended on his ecellent horses._END

B_6_C_89_40
BEGIN_
तेषामधिष्ठितानां तैर्वानरैः पर्वतोपमैः || ८९-६-५०
मुखेभ्यो रुधिरं व्यक्तं हयानां समवर्तत |_END
BEGIN_
Blood started flowing from the mouths of those horses pressed under the weight of
those monkeys, as huge as mountains._END

B_6_C_89_41
BEGIN_
ते निहत्य हयांस्तस्य प्रमथ्य च महारथम् || ८९-६-५१
पुनरुत्पत्य वेगेन तस्थुर्लक्ष्मणपार्श्वतः |
स हताश्वादवप्लुत्य रथान्मथितसारथेः || ८९-६-५२_END
BEGIN_
Those crushed orses, with their limbs broken as also moving to and fro, fell down
dead on the ground. After killing his hrses, those monkeys also crushed that great chariot and
jumping up again with speed, they stood by the side of Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_89_42
BEGIN_
स हताश्वादवप्लुत्य रथान्मथितसारथिः |
शरवर्षेण सौमित्रिमभ्यधावत रावणि || ८९-६-५३_END
BEGIN_
That Indrajit; hatasaarathiH= whose charioteer was killed hataashvaat= and whose
horses were destroyed; avaplutya= leaped down; rathaat= from his chariot; abhyadhaavata= and
attacked; saumitrim= Lakshmana; sharavarSheNa= with streams of arrows._END

B_6_C_89_43
BEGIN_
ततो महेन्द्रप्रतिमंह्स लक्ष्मणः |
पदातिनं तं निशितैः शरोत्तमैः |
सृजन्तमादौ निशिताञ्शरोत्तमान्
भृशं तदा बाणगणैर्न्यवारयत् || ८९-६-५४_END
BEGIN_
Then, that Lakshmana like Indra the lord of celestials, restrained those arrows with
many a number of his arrows. That Indrajit was coming on foot, as his excellent ohrses had been
killed and began to release exquisite sharp arrows in battle._END

B_6_C_90_0
BEGIN_
स हताश्वो महातेजा भूमौ तिष्ठन्निशाचरः |
इन्द्रजित्परमक्रुद्धः सम्प्रजज्वाल तेजसा || ९०-६-१_END
BEGIN_
Indrajit, the demon, who was endowed with extraordinary energy, standing on the
ground his horses having been killed; was very much enraged and blazed with spirit._END

B_6_C_90_1
BEGIN_
तौ धन्विनौ जिघांसन्तावन्योन्यमिषुभिर्भृशम् |
विजयेनाभिनिष्क्रान्तौ वने गजवृषाविव || ९०-६-२_END
BEGIN_
Those two warriors, holding their bows, having an extreme intent to kill each other
with their arrows, were like two excellent elephants going out in the forest for the purpose of
conquering one over the other._END

B_6_C_90_2
BEGIN_
निबर्हयन्तश्चान्योन्यं ते राक्षसवनौकसः |
भर्तारं न जहुर्युद्धे सम्पतन्तस्ततस्ततः || ९०-६-३_END
BEGIN_
Those demons and monkeys, rushing from all sides, destroying each other, did not
desert their masters in battle._END

B_6_C_90_3
BEGIN_
ततस्तान् राक्षसान् सर्वान् हर्षयन् रावणात्मजः |
स्तुवानो हर्षमाणश्च इदं वचनमब्रवीत् || ९०-६-४_END
BEGIN_
Applauding and causing rejoice to all the demons and even feeling delighted himself,
Indrajit then spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_90_4
BEGIN_
तमसा बहुलेनेमाः संसक्ताः सर्वतो दिशः |
नेह विज्ञायते स्वो वा परो वा राक्षसोत्तमाः || ९०-६-५_END
BEGIN_
"These quarters are wrapped on all sides with abundant darkness. O foremost of
demons! It can not be identified at this time whether one belongs to one's own army or an
enemy._END

B_6_C_90_5
BEGIN_
धृष्टं भवन्तो युध्यन्तु हरीणां मोहनाय वै |
अहं तु रथमास्थाय आगमिष्यामि संयुगे || ९०-६-६_END
BEGIN_
"You courageously fight, so as to stupefy the monkeys. I, on my part, will return to
the battle-field, ascending another chariot."_END

B_6_C_90_6
BEGIN_
तथा भवन्तः कुर्वन्तु यथेमे हि वनौकसः |
न युध्येयुर्दुरात्मानः प्रविष्टे नगरं मयि || ९०-६-७_END
BEGIN_
"You act in such a way so that these evil-minded monkeys do not carry on their fight
(with me) while enter the city."_END

B_6_C_90_7
BEGIN_
इत्युक्त्वा रावणसुतो वञ्चयित्वा वनौकसः |
प्रविवेश पुरीं लङ्काम् रथहेतोरमित्रह || ९०-६-८_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking, Indrajit the annihilator of enemies, having deceived the monkeys,
entered the City of Lanka for the sake of getting anther chariot._END

B_6_C_90_8
BEGIN_
स रथं भूषयित्वाथ रुचिरं हे मभूषितम् |
प्रासासिशरसंयुक्तं युक्तं परमवाजिभिः || ९०-६-९
अधिष्ठितं हयज्ञेन सूतेनाप्तोपदेशिना |
आरुरोह महातेजा रावणिः समितिंजयः || ९०-६-१०_END
BEGIN_
Arranging for embellishment of a chariot, which was beautiful, decked with gold,
furnished with darts, swords and arrows, yoked with excellent horses, directed by a charioteer who
could understand those horses properly and could give credible instructions to them, that Indrajit,
a conqueror in battle, who was endowed with extraordinary energy, then ascended it._END

B_6_C_90_9
BEGIN_
स राक्षस्गणैर्मुख्यैर्वृतो मन्दोदरीसुतः |
निर्ययौ नगराद्वीरः कृतान्तबलचोदितः || ९०-६-११_END
BEGIN_
That valiant Indrajit, surrounded by troops of principal demons and incited by the
force of destiny, sallied forth from the city._END

B_6_C_90_10
BEGIN_
सोऽभिनिष्क्रम्य नगरादिन्द्रजित्परवीरह |
अभ्ययाज्जवनैरश्वैर्लक्ष्मणं सविभीषणम् || ९०-६-१२_END
BEGIN_
Moving out form the City with his swift horses, that indrajit, the destroyer of
valiant enemies, attacked Lakshmana and Vibhishana._END

B_6_C_90_11
BEGIN_
ततो रथस्थमालोक्य सौमित्री रावणात्मजम् |
नानराश्च महावीर्या राक्षसश्च विभीषणः || ९०-६-१३
विस्मयं परमं जग्मुर्लाघवात्तस्य धीमतः |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Idnrajit seated in the chariot, Lakshmana, the mighty monkeys and Vibhishana
the demon then were very much surprised on recalling the alacrity of the intelligent Indrajit._END

B_6_C_90_12
BEGIN_
रावणिश्चापि संक्रुद्धो रणे वानरयूथपान् || ९०-६-१४
पातयामास बाणौघैः शतशोऽथ् सहस्रशः |_END
BEGIN_
The enraged Indrajit also struck down hundreds and thousands of monkey-chiefs by
using a multitude of arrows in the battle-field._END

B_6_C_90_13
BEGIN_
स मण्डलीकृतधनू रावणिः समितिंजयः || ९०-६-१५
हरीनभ्यहनत्क्रुद्धः परं लाघवमास्थितः |_END
BEGIN_
Stretching his bow to a circle, that enraged Indrajit the conqueror in battle,
exhibiting supreme agility, began to kill the monkeys._END

B_6_C_90_14
BEGIN_
ते वध्यमाना हरयो नाराचैर्भीमविक्रमाः || ९०-६-१६
सौमित्रिं शरणम् प्राप्तः प्रजापतिमिव प्रजाः |_END
BEGIN_
Thus being killed by steel arrows, those monkeys of terrible prowess sought refuge
in Lakshmana, as people would take refuge in Brahma the Lord of Creation._END

B_6_C_90_15
BEGIN_
ततः समरकोपेन ज्वलितो रघुनन्दनः || ९०-६-१७
चिच्छेद कार्मुकं तस्य दर्शयन् पाणिलाघवम् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, blazing with hostile anger, Lakshmana, showing his agility of hand, tore
Indrajit's bow._END

B_6_C_90_16
BEGIN_
सोऽन्य्त्कार्मुकमादाय सज्जं चक्रे त्वरन्निव || ९०-६-१८
तदप्यस्य त्रिभिर्बाणैर्लक्ष्मणो निरकृन्तत |_END
BEGIN_
Hurriedly, he took another bow and made it ready. Lakshmana tore that bow too of
Indrajit with three arrows._END

B_6_C_90_17
BEGIN_
अथनं चिन्नधन्वानमाशीविषविषोपमैः || ९०-६-१९
विव्याधोरसि सौमित्री रावणिं पञ्चभिः शरैः |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Lakshmana struck that Indrajit, whose bow was torn, on his chest with
five arrows which were deadly like a serpentine poison._END

B_6_C_90_18
BEGIN_
ते तस्य कायं इर्भिद्य महाकार्मुकनिःसृताः || ९०-६-२०
निपेतुर्धरणीं बाणा रक्ता इव महोरगाः |_END
BEGIN_
Those arrows, released from that great bow, penetrating through Indrajit's body,
fell to the ground like huge red serpents._END

B_6_C_90_19
BEGIN_
स च्छिन्नधन्वा रुधिरं वमन् वक्त्रेण रावणिः || ९०-६-२१
जग्राह कार्मुकश्रेष्ठं दृढज्यं बलवत्तरम् |_END
BEGIN_
Ejecting blood from his month, that Indrajit, who had his bow torn, took hold of his
excellent bow with the bow-string firmly fastened and which was stronger than the earlier bow._END

B_6_C_90_20
BEGIN_
स लक्ष्मणं समुद्दिश्य परं लाघवमास्थितः |
ववर्ष शरवर्षाणि वर्षाणीव पुरन्दरः || || ९०-६-२२_END
BEGIN_
Employing utmost agility, Indrajit, aiming at Lakshmana, streamed forth a shower of
arrows, as Indra the lord of celestials streaming forth the rain._END

B_6_C_90_21
BEGIN_
मुक्तमिन्द्रजिता तत्तु शरवर्षमरिन्दमः |
अवारयदसम्भ्रान्तो लक्ष्मणः सुदुरासदम् || ९०-६-२३_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana the annihilator of enemies coolly warded off the shower of arrows released
by Indrajit, though it was most difficult to resist._END

B_6_C_90_22
BEGIN_
संदर्शयामास तदा रावणिं रघुनन्दनः || ९०-६-२४
असंभ्रान्तो महातेजास्तदद्भुतमिवाभवत् |_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana with great splendor, remaining unperplexed, then showed his prowess to
Indrajit, which was marvelous indeed._END

B_6_C_90_23
BEGIN_
ततस्तान् राक्षसान् सर्वांस्त्रिभिरेकैक महावे || ९०-६-२५
अविध्यत्परमक्रुद्धः शीघ्रास्त्रं सम्प्रदर्शयन् |
राक्षसेन्द्रसुतं चापि बाणौघैः समताडयत् || ९०-६-२६_END
BEGIN_
Getting extremely enraged, Lakshmana then pierced all those demons who stood in the
battle-field with three arrows each, showing his speed in discharging missiles and also struck
Indrajit with an array of arrows._END

B_6_C_90_24
BEGIN_
सोऽतिविद्धो बलवता शत्रुणा शत्रुघातिना |
असक्तं प्रेषयामास लक्ष्मणाय बहून् शरान् || ९०-६-२७_END
BEGIN_
That Indrajit, who was struck by the enemy, who was mighty destroyer of enemies,
released several arrows unhindered towards Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_90_25
BEGIN_
तानप्राप्तान् शितैर्बाणैश्चिच्छेद परवीरह |
सारथेरस्य च रणे रथिनो रघुसत्तमः || ९०-६-२८
शोरो जहार धर्मात्मा भल्लेनानतपर्वणा |_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana, the destroyer of valiant adversaries, tore those arrows yet unarrived,
with sharp arrows. The virtuous Lakshmana eliminated the head of the charioteer of Indrajit, the
chariot-warrior, in the battle with an arrow called Bhalla which was looking curved at its
nodes._END

B_6_C_90_26
BEGIN_
असूतास्ते हयास्तत्र रथमूहुरविक्लबाः || ९०-६-२९
मण्डलान्यभिधावन्तस्तदद्भुतमिवाभवत् |_END
BEGIN_
Those horses, bereft of a charioteer there, without getting perturbed, ran up in a
circular fashion and continued to draw the chariot. The scene looked wonderful indeed._END

B_6_C_90_27
BEGIN_
अमर्षवशमापन्नः सौमित्रिर्दृढविक्रमः || ९०-६-३०
प्रत्यविद्ध्यद्धयांस्तस्य शरैर्वित्रासयन् रणे |_END
BEGIN_
Getting the power of anger, Lakshmana of unyielding prowess, pierced the horses of
Indrajit with arrows, so as to frighten them thereby._END

B_6_C_90_28
BEGIN_
अमर्षमाणस्तत्कर्म रावणस्य सुतो रणे || ९०-६-३१
विव्याध दशभिर्बाणैः सौमित्रिं तममर्षणम् |_END
BEGIN_
Getting impatient with that act of Lakshmana in battle, Indrajit struck that enraged
Lakshmana with ten arrows._END

B_6_C_90_29
BEGIN_
ते तस्य वज्रप्रतिमाः शराः सर्पविषोपमाः || ९०-६-३२
विलयं जग्मुरागत्य कवचं काञ्चनप्रभम् |_END
BEGIN_
Those arrows of Indrajit, equal to thunderbolts and deadly as serpentine poison,
having reached Lakshmana's armour with a golden hue, got destroyed._END

B_6_C_90_30
BEGIN_
अभेद्यकचनं मत्वा लक्ष्मणं रावणात्मजः || ९०-६-३३
ललाटे लक्ष्मणं बाणैः सुपुङ्खैस्त्रिभिरिन्द्रजित् |
अविध्यत्परमक्रुद्धः शीघ्रमस्त्रं प्रदर्शयन् || ९०-६-३४_END
BEGIN_
Understanding Lakshmana to have been protected by an impenetrable armour and showing
his swiftness in discharging missiles, Indrajit the son of Ravana, who felt very much angered,
pierced Lakshmana in the forehead with three arrows provided with good plumes._END

B_6_C_90_31
BEGIN_
तैः पृषत्कैर्ललाटस्थैः शुशुभे रघुनन्दनः |
रणाग्रे समरश्लाघी त्रिशृङ्ग इव पर्वतः || ९०-६-३५_END
BEGIN_
With those three arrows planted in his forehead, Lakshmana who was fond of fighting,
shone like a mountain with its three peaks, in the battle-field._END

B_6_C_90_32
BEGIN_
स तथाप्यर्दितो बाणै राक्षसेन महामृधे |
तमाशु प्रतिविव्याध लक्ष्मणः पनभिः शरैः || ९०-६-३६
विकृष्येन्द्रजितो युद्धे वदने शुभकुण्डले |_END
BEGIN_
Thus tormented in battle by Indrajit the demon, that Lakshmana then quickly
stretching the bow, pierced him in return with five arrows, in battle, in Indrajit's face holding
beautiful ear-rings._END

B_6_C_90_33
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणेन्द्रजितौ वीरौ महाबलशरासनौ || ९०-६-३७
अन्योन्यं जघ्नतुर्बाणैर्विशिखैर्भीमविक्रमौ |_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana Indrajit, the heroes endowed with extraordinary might and armed with very
strong bows and possessing terrible prowess, struck each other with distinctly pointed arrows._END

B_6_C_90_34
BEGIN_
ततह् शोणितदिग्धाङ्गौ लक्ष्मणेन्द्रजितावुभौ || ९०-६-३८
रणे तौ राजतुर्वीरौ पुष्पिताविव किंशुकौ |_END
BEGIN_
Those two warriors, Lakshmana and Indrajit, with both their bodies stained in blood,
shone in the battle-field at that time, like Kimshuka trees in blossom._END

B_6_C_90_35
BEGIN_
तौ परस्परमभ्येत्य सर्वगात्रेषु धन्विनौ || ९०-६-३९
घोरैर्विव्यधतुर्बाणैः कृतभावावुभौ जये |_END
BEGIN_
Those two archers, with their minds directed towards victory, met each other and
pierced their opponent in all limbs with dreadful arrows._END

B_6_C_90_36
BEGIN_
ततः समरकोपेन संवृतो रावणात्मजः || ९०-६-४०
विभीषणं त्रिभिर्बाणैर्विव्याध वदने शुभे |_END
BEGIN_
Then, Indrajit, filled with martial anger, struck Vibhishana in his auspicious face,
with three arrows._END

B_6_C_90_37
BEGIN_
अयोमुखस्त्रिभिर्विद्ध्वा राक्षसेन्द्रं विभीषणम् || ९०-६-४१
एकैकेनाभिविव्याध तान्सर्वान् हरियूथपान् |_END
BEGIN_
Having struck Vibhishana, the leader of demons, with three arrows, Indrajit struck
all those monkey chiefs with a single arrow each._END

B_6_C_90_38
BEGIN_
तस्मै दृढतरं क्रुद्धो हताश्वाय विभीषणः || ९०-६-४२
विभीषणो महातेजा रावणेः स दुरात्मनः |_END
BEGIN_
Very much enraged with him, that Vibhishana of great splendor killed the horses of
that evil-minded Indrajit with his mace._END

B_6_C_90_39
BEGIN_
स हताश्वात्समाप्लुत्य रथान्मथिरसारथिः || ९०-६-४३
अथ शक्तिं महातेजाः पितृव्याय मुमोच ह |_END
BEGIN_
Just leaping down from the chariot whose charioteer was destroyed earlier and whose
horses were killed, that Indrajit of great splendor employed his javelin towards his maternal
uncle._END

B_6_C_90_40
BEGIN_
तामापतन्तीं संप्रेक्ष्य सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः || ९०-६-४४
चिच्छेद निशितै र्बाणैर्दशधापातयद्भुवि |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that Javelin rushing towards Vibhishana, Lakshmana tore it into ten pieces
with his sharp arrows and felled it on the floor._END

B_6_C_90_41
BEGIN_
तस्मै दृढतनुः क्रुद्धो हताश्वाय विभीषणः || ९०-६-४५
वज्रस्पर्शसमान्पञ्च ससर्जोरसि मार्गणान् |_END
BEGIN_
The strong bodied Vibhishana, in anger, dug five arrows, whose impact was a hard as
that of a thunder-bolt, into the bosom of Indrajit, whose horses were already killed._END

B_6_C_90_42
BEGIN_
ते तस्य कायं निर्भिद्य रुक्मपुङ्खा निमित्तगाः || ९०-६-४६
बभूवुर्लोहितादिग्धा रक्टा इव महोरगाः |_END
BEGIN_
Having penetrated his body, those arrows which were provided with golden feathers,
went straight into their target, got stained with blood and appeared like red large serpents._END

B_6_C_90_43
BEGIN_
स पितृव्यस्य सङ्क्रुद्ध इन्द्रजिच्छरमाददे || ९०-६-४७
उत्तमं रक्षसां मध्ये यमदत्तं महाबलः |_END
BEGIN_
Enraged with his paternal uncle, that Indrajit, standing in the midst of demons,
took hold of an excellent arrow earlier presented by Yama the lord of Death._END

B_6_C_90_44
BEGIN_
तं समीक्ष्य महातेजा महेषुं तेन संहितम् || ९०-६-४८
लक्ष्मणोऽप्याददे बाणमन्यं भीमपराक्रमः |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that great arrow seized by him, Lakshmana also, of great splendor and
terrible prowess, took hold of another arrow._END

B_6_C_90_45
BEGIN_
कुबेरेण स्वयं स्वप्ने यद्दत्तममितात्मना || ९०-६-४९
दुर्जयं दुर्विषह्यं च सेन्द्रैरपि सुरासुरैः |_END
BEGIN_
That arrow had been presented to him, in the course of a dream, by Kubera the god of
riches, of immense glory himself, which was difficult to be conquered and much more difficult to be
tolerated even for gods and demons including Indra the lord of celestials._END

B_6_C_90_46
BEGIN_
तयोस्तु धनुषी श्रेष्ठे बाहुभिः परिघोपमैः || ९०-६-५०
विकृष्यमाणे बलवत् क्रौञ्चविव चुकूजतुः |_END
BEGIN_
Stretched with strength by their arms, which resembled a pair of steel rods, emitted
a piercing sound like that of a pair of curlew-cranes._END

B_6_C_90_47
BEGIN_
ताभ्यां तौ धनुषि श्रेष्ठे संहितौ सायकोत्तमौ || ९०-६-५१
विकृष्यमाणौ वीराभ्यां भृशं जज्वलतुः श्रिया |_END
BEGIN_
The excellent arrows fitted and pulled out from their excellent bow by those heroes,
blazed very much with splendour._END

B_6_C_90_48
BEGIN_
तौ भासयन्तावाकाशं धनुर्भ्यां विशिखौ च्युतौ || ९०-६-५२
मुखेन मुखमाहत्य संनिपेततुरोजसा |_END
BEGIN_
Those arrows, released from the bow, making the sky shine and hitting each other
face to face, collided each other powerfully._END

B_6_C_90_49
BEGIN_
संनिपातस्तयोश्चासीच्छरयोर्घोररूपयोः || ९०-६-५३
सधूमविस्फुलिङ्गश्च तज्जोऽग्निर्दारुणोऽभवत् |_END
BEGIN_
The collision of those arrows of terrible form broke out a fierce fire comprising of
smoke and sparkles._END

B_6_C_90_50
BEGIN_
तौ महाग्रहसङ्काशावन्योन्यं संनिपत्य च || ९०-६-५४
सङ्ग्रामे शतधा यातौ मेदिन्यां विनिपेततुः |_END
BEGIN_
Hitting each other like two major planets, those two arrows in battle burst into a
hundred pieces and fell on the ground._END

B_6_C_90_51
BEGIN_
शरौ प्रतिहतौ दृष्ट्वा तावुभौ रणमूर्धनि || ९०-६-५५
व्रीडितो जातरोषौ च लक्ष्मणेन्द्रजितौ तदा |_END
BEGIN_
On seeing their arrows warded off in the battle-front, those two warriors, Lakshmana
and Indrajit then felt abashed and got provoked._END

B_6_C_90_52
BEGIN_
स संरब्धस्तु सौमित्रिरस्त्रं वारुणमाददे || ९०-६-५६
रौद्रं महेद्रजिद्युद्धे व्यसृजद्युधि विष्ठितः |_END
BEGIN_
Getting excited, Lakshmana took hold of a missile presided over by Varuna (the god
of water). Skilled in warfare, the great Indrajit too discharged a missile presided over by Rudra
(the god of destruction) in battle._END

B_6_C_90_53
BEGIN_
तेन तद्विहतं शस्त्रं वारुणम् परमाद्भुतम् || ९०-६-५७
ततः क्रुद्धो महातेजा इन्द्रजित्समितिंजयः |
अग्नेयं संदधे दीप्तं स लोकं संक्षिपन्निव || ९०-६-५८_END
BEGIN_
By that Rudra missile, that very wonderful Varuna-missile was struck. Then, that
enraged Indrajit of great splendour and the conqueror of battle, looking like the destroyer of the
world, employed a missile presided over by Agni the god of fire which was blazing._END

B_6_C_90_54
BEGIN_
सौरेणास्त्रेण तद्वीरो लक्ष्मणः पर्यवारयत् |
अस्त्रं निवारितं दृष्ट्वा रावणिः क्रोधमूर्चितः || ९०-६-५९
आददे निशितं बाणमासुरं शत्रुदारणम् |_END
BEGIN_
The valiant Lakshmana obstructed Agni-missile, by a missile presided over by the
sun-god. Finding his missile repelled, Indrajit was filled with anger and took hold of a sharp
arrow used by demons and capable of tearing down an enemy._END

B_6_C_90_55
BEGIN_
तस्माच्चापाद्विनिष्पेतुर्भास्वराः कूटमुद्गराः || ९०-६-६०
शूलानि च भुशुण्ड्यश्च गदाः खड्गाः परश्वधाः |_END
BEGIN_
From that bow, blazing weapon similar to a hammer duly hidden, darts, fire arms,
maces, swords and axes rushed forth._END

B_6_C_90_56
BEGIN_
तद्दृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मणः संख्ये घोरमस्त्रं सुदारुणम् || ९०-६-६१
अवार्यं सर्वभूतानां सर्वशस्त्रविदारणम् |
माहेश्वरेण द्युतिमांस्तदस्त्रं प्रत्यवारयत् || ९०-६-६२_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that terrible missile, which was very harsh, unrestrainable for all beings
and which can tear all weapons in battle, the brilliant Lakshmana obstructed that missile by using
Maheswara-missile._END

B_6_C_90_57
BEGIN_
तयोः समभवद्युद्धमद्भुतं रोमहर्षणम् |
गगनस्थानि भूतानि लक्ष्मणं पर्यवारयन् || ९०-६-६३_END
BEGIN_
There was a wonderful battle between both of them, causing hair to stand erect. The
beings in the sky surrounded Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_90_58
BEGIN_
भैरवाभिरुते भीमे युद्धे वानरराक्षसाम् |
भूतैर्बहुभिराकाशं विस्मितैरावृतं बभौ || ९०-६-६४_END
BEGIN_
Surrounded by many surprised beings in that terrible battle taking place between
monkeys and demons, yielding terrific noise, the sky sparkled._END

B_6_C_90_59
BEGIN_
ऋषयः पितरो देवा गन्धर्वा गरुणोरगाः |
शतक्रतुं पुरस्कृत्य ररक्षुर्लक्ष्मणं रणे || ९०-६-६५_END
BEGIN_
Placing Indra the lord of celestials as their head, the sages, manes, gods,
Gandharvas the celestial musicians, eagles and serpents protected Lakshmana in the
battle-field._END

B_6_C_90_60
BEGIN_
अथान्यं मार्गणश्रेष्ठं सन्दधे रावणानुजः |
हुताशनसमस्पर्शं रावणात्मजदारुणम् || ९०-६-६६_END
BEGIN_
Then, Lakshmana fitted another excellent arrow, which had a sensation of ignition
and which can tear down Indrajit._END

B_6_C_90_61
BEGIN_
सुपत्रमनुवृत्ताङ्गं सुपर्वाणं सुसंस्थितम् |
सुवर्णविकृतं वीरः शरीरान्तकरं शरम् || ९०-६-६७
दुरावारं दुर्विषहं राक्षसानां भयावहम् |
आशीविषविषप्रख्यं देवसङ्घैः समर्चितम् || ९०-६-६८_END
BEGIN_
The heroic Lakshmana fitted the arrow, having beautiful plumes, which consisted of
rounded parts, well-jointed, skillfully fashioned, decked with gold, capable of destroying the body
of the enemies, not difficult to keep off but difficult even to tolerate, a source of terror to the
demons as deadly as the venom of poisonous snakes and duly honoured by the host of gods._END

B_6_C_90_62
BEGIN_
येन शक्रो महातेजा दानवानजयत्प्रभुः |
पुरा देवासुरे युद्धे वीर्यवान्हरिवाहनः || ९०-६-६९_END
BEGIN_
With the help of that arrow, the highly powerful and valiant Indra, the lord of
celestials, who had green horses to his chariot, was able to conquer the demons in a combat which
raged between celestials and demons._END

B_6_C_90_63
BEGIN_
तदैन्द्रमस्त्रं सौमित्रिः संयुगेष्वपराजितम् |
शरश्रेष्ठं धनुः श्रेष्ठे विकर्षन्निदमिब्रवीत् || ९०-६-७०
लक्ष्मीवान् लक्ष्मणो वाक्यमर्थसाधकमात्मनः |_END
BEGIN_
Fitting a missile presided over by Indra the lord of celestials, which had never
been defeated in battle, to his excellent bow and drawing it, the glorious Lakshmana addressed the
following prayer, which was intended to achieve his purpose:_END

B_6_C_90_64
BEGIN_
धर्मात्मा सत्यसन्धश्च रामो दाशरथिर्यदि || ९०-६-७१
पौरुषे चाप्रतिद्वन्द्वस्तदेनं जहि रावणिम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O my dear arrow! If Rama the son of Dasaratha has set his mind on virtue, keeps up
his promise and is second to none in his prowess, destroy this Indrajit."_END

B_6_C_90_65
BEGIN_
इत्युक्त्वा बाणमाकर्णं विकृष्य तमजिह्मगम् || ९०-६-७२
लक्ष्मणः समरे वीरः ससर्जेन्द्रजितं प्रति |_END
BEGIN_
Thus saying and drawing up to the ear the arrow, which went straight, the heroic
Lakshmana released it towards Indrajit._END

B_6_C_90_66
BEGIN_
ऐन्द्रास्त्रेण समायुज्य लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा || ९०-६-७३
तच्छिरः सशिरस्त्राणं श्रीमज्ज्वलितकुण्डलम् |
प्रमथ्येन्द्रजितः कायात्पपात धरणीतले || ९०-६-७४_END
BEGIN_
75. tat mahat shiraH= that large head; raakShasatanuujasya= of Indrajit; bhinna
skandham= separated from his trunk; rudhirokShitam= and moistened with blood; dadR^ishe= appeared;
bhuumau= on the ground; tapaniiya nibham= shining like gold._END

B_6_C_90_67
BEGIN_
तद्राक्षसतनूजस्य छिन्नस्कन्धं शिरो महत् |
तपनीयनिभं भूमौ ददृशे रुधिरोक्षितम् || ९०-६-७५_END
BEGIN_
That large head of Indrajit, separated from his trunk and moistened with blood, was
seen on the ground, shining like gold._END

B_6_C_90_68
BEGIN_
हतस्तु निपपाताशु धरण्यां रावणात्मजः |
कवची सशिरस्त्राणो विध्वस्तः सशरासनः || ९०-६-७६_END
BEGIN_
Having been killed, that Indrajit then forthwith fell to the ground, along with his
armour and head-protector, with his bow shattered._END

B_6_C_90_69
BEGIN_
चुक्रुशुस्ते ततः सर्वे वानराः सविभीषणाः |
हृष्यन्तो निहते तस्मिन्देवा वृत्रवधे यथा || ९०-६-७७_END
BEGIN_
As Indrajit was killed, all those monkeys together with Vibhishana roared in
rejoice, as the celestials did, when Vritra the demon was killed._END

B_6_C_90_70
BEGIN_
अथान्तरिक्षे देवानामृषीणां च महात्मनाम् |
जज्ञेऽथ जयसंनादो गन्धर्वाप्सरसाम् अपि || ९०-६-७८_END
BEGIN_
Then, a shout of victory rose in the sky from the mouth of gods, great-souled sages,
Gandharvas the celestial musicians and the celestial nymphs._END

B_6_C_90_71
BEGIN_
पतितं समभिज्ञाय राक्षसी सा महाचमूः |
वध्यमाना दिशो भेजे हरिभिर्जितकाशिभिः || ९०-६-७९_END
BEGIN_
Seeing him fallen, that great army of demons, being struck by monkeys shining with
victory, sought the quarters._END

B_6_C_90_72
BEGIN_
वनरैर्वध्यमानास्ते शस्त्राण्युत्सृज्य राक्षसाः |
लङ्कामभिमुखाः सर्वे नष्टसंज्ञाः प्रधाविताः || ९०-६-८०_END
BEGIN_
Abandoning their weapons, while being struck by the monkeys, those demons went
towards Lanka, running fast stupefied._END

B_6_C_90_73
BEGIN_
दुद्रुवुर्बहुधा भीता राक्षसाः शतशो दिशः |
त्यक्त्वा प्रहरणान्सर्वे पट्टसासिपरश्वधान् || ९०-६-८१_END
BEGIN_
All those frightened demons, abandoning their weapons sharp-edged spears, swords and
axes ran away in hundreds to various directions._END

B_6_C_90_74
BEGIN_
के चिल्लङ्कां परित्रस्ताः प्रविष्टा वानरार्दिताः |
समुद्रे पतिताः के चित्के चित्पर्वतमाश्रिताः || ९०-६-८२_END
BEGIN_
Tormented by the monkeys, some were scared and entered Lanka. Some fell into the
ocean. Some took refuge in the mountain._END

B_6_C_90_75
BEGIN_
हतमिन्द्रजितं दृष्ट्वा शयानं समरक्षितौ |
राक्षसानां सहस्रेषु न कश्चित्प्रत्यदृश्यत || ९०-६-८३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Indrajit killed and lying on the battle-field, not even one among the
thousands of demons was to be seen._END

B_6_C_90_76
BEGIN_
यथास्तं गत आदित्ये नावतिष्ठन्ति रश्मयः |
तथा तस्मिन्निपतिते राक्षसास्ते गता दिशः || ९०-६-८४_END
BEGIN_
As the sun-rays do not exist when the sun has sunk below the horizon, so those
demons left to different directions when Indrajit had fallen._END

B_6_C_90_77
BEGIN_
शान्तरक्ष्मिरिवादित्यो निर्वाण इव पावकः |
स बभूव महातेजा व्यपास्त गतजीवितः || ९०-६-८५_END
BEGIN_
Thrown asunder and dead, that long-armed Indrajit looked like the sun whose rays
have cooled down and like the fire which is extinguished._END

B_6_C_90_78
BEGIN_
प्रशान्तपीडा बहुलो विनष्टारिः प्रहर्षवान् |
बभूव लोकः पतिते राक्षसेन्द्रसुते तदा || ९०-६-८६_END
BEGIN_
When Indrajit was fallen, the world then had its oppressions pacified, now that its
enemy had been destroyed and it experience a rejoice._END

B_6_C_90_79
BEGIN_
हर्षं च शक्रो भगवान्सह सर्वैः सुरर्षभैः |
जगाम निहते तस्मिन्राक्षसे पापकर्मणि || ९०-६-८७_END
BEGIN_
While that demon of sinful deeds is having been killed, the illustrious Indra the
ruler of gods along with all the great sages were rejoiced._END

B_6_C_90_80
BEGIN_
आकाशे चापि देवानां शुश्रुवे दुन्दुभिस्वनः |
नृत्यद्भिरप्सरोभिश्च गन्धर्वैश्च महात्मभिः || ९०-६-८८_END
BEGIN_
In the sky too was heard the sound of large drums played by celestials, the melody
produced by dancing Apsaras the celestial nymphs and the songs of Gandharvas the celestial
musicians._END

B_6_C_90_81
BEGIN_
ववर्षुः पुष्पवर्षाणि तदद्भुतमिवाभवत् |
प्रशशंसुर्हते तस्मिन् राक्षसे क्रूरकर्मणि || ९०-६-८९_END
BEGIN_
While that demon of cruel deeds was killed, a deluge of flowers rained along with
showers of praises. It was a wonderful scene._END

B_6_C_90_82
BEGIN_
शुद्धा आपो नभश्चैव जहृषुर्दैत्यदानवाः |
आजग्मुः पतिते तस्मिन्सर्वलोकभयावहे || ९०-६-९०_END
BEGIN_
While that Indrajit, who was the terror of all the worlds, had fallen, the waters
and the sky became clear. The celestials and demons were rejoiced and arrived on the scene._END

B_6_C_90_83
BEGIN_
ऊचुश्च सहिताः सर्वे देवगन्धर्वदानवाः |
विज्वराः शान्तकलुषा ब्राह्मणा विचरन्त्विति || ९०-६-९१_END
BEGIN_
The gratified celestials, Gandharvas the celestial musicians and the demons said:
"Let the Brahmanas move about cheerfully, now that their trouble has ceased."_END

B_6_C_90_84
BEGIN_
ततोऽभ्यनन्दन्संहृष्टाः समरे हरियुथपाः |
तमप्रतिबलं दृष्ट्वा हतं नैरृतपुङ्गवम् || ९०-६-९२_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that foremost among demons, who was unrivalled in battle, having been killed,
the rejoiced monkey-chiefs applauded Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_90_85
BEGIN_
विभीषणो हनुमांश्च जाम्बवांश्चर्क्षयुथपः |
विजयेनाभिनन्दन्तस्तुष्टुवुश्चापि लक्ष्मणम् || ९०-६-९३_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana, Hanuma and Jambavan the chief of bears were pleased at Lakshmana for his
victor and applauded him too._END

B_6_C_90_86
BEGIN_
क्ष्वेडन्तश्च नदन्तश्च गर्जन्तश्च प्लवङ्गमाः |
लब्धलक्षा रघुसुतं परिवार्योपतस्थिरे || ९०-६-९४_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys, who accomplished their aim, roaring, jumping with joy and emitting
thundering sounds, stood encircling Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_90_87
BEGIN_
लाङ्गुलानि प्रविध्यन्तः स्फोटयन्तश्च वानराः |
लक्ष्मणो जयतीत्येवं वाक्यं व्यश्रावयंस्तदा || ९०-६-९५_END
BEGIN_
Wagging their tails and lashing them, the monkeys then gave forth the slogan,
"Victorious is Lakshmana!"_END

B_6_C_90_88
BEGIN_
अन्योन्यं च समाश्लिष्य कपयो हृष्टमानसाः |
चक्रुरुच्चावचगुणा राघवाश्रयजाः कथाः || ९०-६-९६_END
BEGIN_
Embracing each other with rejoiced minds, the monkeys indulged in good conversations
about Lakshmana and his manifold qualities._END

B_6_C_90_89
BEGIN_
तदसुकरमथाभिवीक्ष्य हृष्टाः |
प्रियसुहृदो युधि लक्ष्मणस्य कर्म |
परममुपलभन्मनःप्रहर्षं |
विनिहतमिन्द्ररिपुं निशम्य देवाः || ९०-६-९७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Indrajit having been killed and witnessing that arduous act of Lakshmana,
their beloved friend in battle, the celestials were gratified and experienced a great rejoice in
their minds._END

B_6_C_91_0
BEGIN_
रुधिरक्लिन्नगात्रस्तु लक्ष्मणः शुभलक्षणः |
बभूव हृष्टस्तं हत्वा शक्रजेतारमाहवे || ९१-६-१_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana, endowed with auspicious bodily marks, whose limbs were drenched in blood,
felt rejoiced on having killed Indrajit in combat._END

B_6_C_91_1
BEGIN_
ततः स जाम्बवन्तं च हनूमन्तं च वीर्यवान् |
संनिवर्त्य महातेजास्तांश्च सर्वान्वनौकसः || ९१-६-२
आजगाम ततः शीघ्रं यत्र सुग्रीवराघवौ |
विभीषणमवष्टभ्य हनूमन्तं च लक्ष्मणः || ९१-६-३_END
BEGIN_
Having offered salutation to Jambavan, Hanuma and all those monkeys, that valiant
Lakshmana of great brilliance then quickly came from there to the place where Sugreeva and Rama
were there, by leaning himself upon vibhishana and Hanuma._END

B_6_C_91_2
BEGIN_
ततो राममभिक्रम्य सौमित्रिरभिवाद्य च |
तस्थौ भ्रातृसमीपस्थः शक्रस्येन्द्रानुजो यथा || ९१-६-४_END
BEGIN_
Having offered his salutation and approached Rama, Lakshmana stood beside his
brother, even as Lord Vamana (the younger brother of Indra) would stand beside Indra the lord of
celestials._END

B_6_C_91_3
BEGIN_
निष्ठनन्निव चागत्य राघवाय महात्मने |
आचचक्षे तदा वीरो घोरमिन्द्रजितो वधम् || ९१-६-५_END
BEGIN_
Then, the valiant Lakshmana, arriving at the great-souled Rama, told him in a
murmering tone (as he was feeling tiresome) about the terrific destroyal of Indrajit._END

B_6_C_91_4
BEGIN_
रावणस्तु शिरश्छिन्नं लक्ष्मणेन महात्मना |
न्यवेदयत रामाय तदा हृष्टो विभीषणः || ९१-६-६_END
BEGIN_
Then, the rejoiced Vibhishana informed (in a clear tone) to Rama that Indrajit's
head had been chopped off by the great-souled Lakshaman._END

B_6_C_91_5
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वैव तु महावीर्यो लक्ष्मणेनेन्द्रजिद्वधम् |
प्रहर्षमतुलं लेभे वाक्यं चेदमुवाच ह || ९१-६-७_END
BEGIN_
Just on hearing the news about the killing of Indrajit by Lakshmana, Rama of great
prowess obtained immesurable joy and spoke the following words_END

B_6_C_91_6
BEGIN_
साधु लक्ष्मण तुष्टोऽस्मि कर्म चासुकरं कृतम् |
रावणेर्हि विनाशेन जितमित्युपधारय || ९१-६-८_END
BEGIN_
"O Lakshmana! Well done! I feel gratified. An ardous act has been done. Consider it
as our victory, through the destroyal of Indrajit._END

B_6_C_91_7
BEGIN_
स तं शिरस्युपाघ्राय लक्ष्मणं कीर्तिवर्धनम् |
लज्जमानं बलात्स्नेहादङ्कमारोप्य वीर्यवान् || ९१-६-९
उपवेश्य तमुत्सङ्गे परिष्वज्यावपीडितम् |
भ्रातरं लक्ष्मणं स्निग्धं पुनः पुनरुदैक्षत || ९१-६-१०_END
BEGIN_
Smelling the head of that Lakshmana, who had augmented his fame and yet who was
feeling abashed (to hear himself being praised), forcibly drawing him to his lap and placing that
Lakshmana his younger brother in his lap with affection, wounded as he was, that valiant Rama,
having embraced him, tenderly gazed upon him affectionately again and again._END

B_6_C_91_8
BEGIN_
शल्यसंपीडितं शस्तं निःश्वसन्तं तु लक्ष्मणम् |
रामस्तु दुःखसंतप्तं तं तु निःश्वासपीडितम् || ९१-६-११
मूर्ध्नि चैनमुपाघ्राय भूयः संस्पृश्य च त्वरन् |
उवाच लक्ष्मणं वाक्यमाश्वास्य पुरुषर्षभः || ९१-६-१२_END
BEGIN_
Smelling once more the head of that Lakshmana, who was feeling tormented by the
arrows that had penetrted into his body, who had been wounded, who was breathing heard, who was
endowed with auspicious characterestics, was afflicted with agony and was feeling paine dat the
time of respiration, and hurriedly stroking him as well as restoring confidence in him, Rama the
foremost among men spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_91_9
BEGIN_
कृतं परमकल्याणं कर्म दुष्करकारिणा |
अद्य मन्ये हते पुत्रे रावणम् निहतं युधि || ९१-६-१३_END
BEGIN_
"An extremely noble act was performed by you, a doer of difficult things. Now, that
his son having been killed, I account Ravana to have been killed in battle."_END

B_6_C_91_10
BEGIN_
अद्याहं विजया शत्रौ हते तस्मिन् दुरात्मनि |
रावणस्य नृशंसस्य दिष्ट्या वीर त्वया रणे || ९१-६-१४
चिन्नो हि दक्षिणो बाहुः स हि तस्य व्यपाश्रयः |
विभीषणहनूमद्भ्यां कृतं कर्म महद्रणे || ९१-६-१५_END
BEGIN_
"As that evil-minded enenmy has been killed, I become victorious. O valiant
Lakshmana! Fortunately, you indeed severed the right hand of the cruel Ravana. Indrajit is indeed
the support for that Ravana. Vibhishana and Hanuma too performed a great feat in the great
battle."_END

B_6_C_91_11
BEGIN_
अहोरात्रैस्त्रिभिर्वीरः कथंचिद्विनिपातितः |
निरमित्रः कृतोऽस्म्यद्य निर्यास्यति हि रावणः || ९१-६-१६
बलव्यूहेन महता श्रुत्वा पुत्रं निपातितम् |_END
BEGIN_
"In the course of three days and nights, the valiant Indrajit was felled down
somehow. Now, I have been made free of enemies. Hearing of his son having been struck down, Ravana
will indeed come forth with a great and powerful battle-array."_END

B_6_C_91_12
BEGIN_
तं पुत्रवधसन्तप्तं निर्यान्तं राक्षसाधिपम् || ९१-६-१७
बलेनावृत्य महता निहनिष्यामि दुर्जयम् |_END
BEGIN_
"By encircling that Ravana, who is difficult to be conquered, with a great army, I
will kill him, who is coming forth with a feeling of distress for the death of his son."_END

B_6_C_91_13
BEGIN_
त्वया लक्ष्मण नाथेन सीता च पृथिवी च मे || ९१-६-१८
न दुष्प्रापा हते त्वद्य शक्रजेतरि चाहवे |_END
BEGIN_
"O Lakshmana! As that Indrajit has been killed in battle by you, who are my
protector, neither Seetha nor this entire earth is hard to attain."_END

B_6_C_91_14
BEGIN_
स तं भ्रातरमाश्वास्य पारिष्वज्य च राघवः || ९१-६-१९
रामः सुषेणं मुदितः समाभाष्येदमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Having thus consoled Lakshmana and having embraced him, that Rama who was born in
Raghu-dynansty, was duly delighted and by calling Sushena, spoke to him the following words:_END

B_6_C_91_15
BEGIN_
सशल्योऽयं महाप्राज्ञः सौमित्रिर्मित्रवत्सलः || ९१-६-२०
यथा भवति सुस्वस्थस्तथा त्वं समुपाचर |_END
BEGIN_
"O highly intelligent one! You attend upon this wounded Lakshmana, who is fond of
frinds, so that he will become perfectly well in health."_END

B_6_C_91_16
BEGIN_
विशल्यः क्रियतां क्षिप्रं सौमित्रिः सविभीषणः || ९१-६-२१
कृष वानरसैन्यानां शूराणां द्रुमयोधिनाम् |
ये चान्येऽत्र च युध्यन्तः सशल्या व्रणिनस्तथा || ९१-६-२२
तेऽपि सर्वे प्रयत्नेन क्रियन्तां सुखिनस्त्वया |_END
BEGIN_
Let Lakshmana along with Vibhishana be quickly made free from pain caused by the
arrows that have penetrated into their body. Let all others too among the gallant bear and
monkey-warriors fighting with trees who have fought on the battle-field here and stand pierced with
arrows and owunded, be healed in the same way with great care."_END

B_6_C_91_17
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तः स रामेण महात्मा हरियूथपः || ९१-६-२३
लक्ष्मणाय ददौ नस्तः सुषेणः परमौषधम् |_END
BEGIN_
As commanded by Rama, the great-souled Sushena, the monkey-cheif gave an excellent
medicine through nose to Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_91_18
BEGIN_
स तस्य गन्धमाघ्राय विशल्यः समपद्यत || ९१-६-२४
तदा निर्वेदनश्चैव संरूढव्रण एव च |_END
BEGIN_
Inhaling the odour of that herb, Lakshmana became healed of the arrow-wounds, free
from pains and his wounds got completely cured._END

B_6_C_91_19
BEGIN_
विभीषण मुखानां च सुहृदां राघवाज्ञया || ९१-६-२५
सर्ववानरमुख्यानां चिकित्सां स तदाकरोत् |_END
BEGIN_
As per the order of Rama, Sushena then treated his companions like Vibhishana and
others including all the monkey-chiefs._END

B_6_C_91_20
BEGIN_
ततः प्रकृतिमापन्नो हृतशल्यो गतव्यथः || ९१-६-२६
सौमित्रिर्मुदितस्तत्र क्षणेन विगतज्वरः |_END
BEGIN_
Then, with his arrow-wounds healed, his fatigue gone and his feverishness cured
within a moment, Lakshmana having restored his original disposition, felt joyful there._END

B_6_C_91_21
BEGIN_
तथैव रामः प्लवगाधिपस्तदा |
विभीषणश्चर्क्षपतिश्च जाम्बवान् |
अवेक्ष्य सौमित्रिमरोगमुत्थितं |
मुदा ससैन्यः सुचिरं जहर्षिरे || ९१-६-२७_END
BEGIN_
Then, on seeing Lakshmana standing up with sound health, Rama, Sugreeva, Vibhishana
and the valiant Jambavan along with the army were rejoiced for a long time._END

B_6_C_91_22
BEGIN_
अपूजयत्कर्म स लक्ष्मणस्य |
सुदुष्करं दाशरथिर्महात्मा |
बभूव हृष्टा युधि वानरेन्द्रो |
निशम्य तं शक्रजितं निपातितम् || ९१-६-२८_END
BEGIN_
That great-souled Rama apllauded the ardous feat of Lakshmana. Hearing of Indrajit
having been kille din battle, Sugreeva became delighted._END

B_6_C_92_0
BEGIN_
ततः पौलस्त्य सचिवाः श्रुत्वा चेन्द्रजितं हतम् |
आचचक्षुरभिज्ञाय दशग्रीवाय सव्यथाः || ९२-६-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing of Indrajit's killing and having ascertained the news, Ravana's counsellors
reported the matter hurriedly to Ravana._END

B_6_C_92_1
BEGIN_
युद्धे हतो महाराज लक्ष्मणेन तवात्मजः |
विभीषणसहायेन मिषतां नो महाद्युते || ९२-६-२_END
BEGIN_
"O monarch! Your great majestic son has been killed by Lakshmana with the help of
Vibhishana, while we were witnessing the event in the battle-field."_END

B_6_C_92_2
BEGIN_
शूरः शूरेण संगम्य संयुगेष्वपराजितः |
लक्ष्णनेन हतः शूरः पुत्रस्ते विबुधेन्द्रजित् || ९२-६-३
गतः स परमान् लोकान् शरैः संताप्य् लक्ष्मणम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Your valiant son, who was unbeatable in combats and that hero who conquered Indra
the lord of celestials, having collided with valiant Lakshmana, has been killed. Having tormented
Lakshmana with his arrows, Indrajit departed to the highest world."_END

B_6_C_92_3
BEGIN_
स तं प्रतिभयं श्रुत्वा वधं पुत्रस्य दारुणम् || ९२-६-४
घोरमिन्द्रजितः सङ्ख्ये कश्मलं प्राविशन्महत् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that news of formidable, harsh and terrific death of Indrajit his son in
battle, Ravana gave way to a protracted swoon._END

B_6_C_92_4
BEGIN_
उपलभ्य चिरात्संज्ञां राजा राक्षसपुङ्गवः || ९२-६-५
पुत्रशोकाकुलो दीनो विललापाकुलेन्द्रियः |_END
BEGIN_
Regaining his consciousness after a long time, the king Ravana, confounded as he was
with sorrow on account of his son's death and with his mind confused, lamented as follows depressed
as he was._END

B_6_C_92_5
BEGIN_
हा राक्षसचमूमुख्य मम वत्स महारथ || ९२-६-६
जित्वेन्द्रं कथमद्य त्वं लक्ष्मणस्य वशं गतः |_END
BEGIN_
"Alas! My child, the chief of the army of demons, having extraordinary might! Having
conquered Indra, how have you been subjected to the power of Lakshmana now?"_END

B_6_C_92_6
BEGIN_
ननु त्वमिषुभिः क्रुद्धो भिन्द्याः कालान्तकावपि || ९२-६-७
मन्दरस्यापि शृङ्गाणि किं पुनर्लक्ष्मणं रणे |_END
BEGIN_
"Certainly, when enraged, you would pierce with your arrows in battle, even the
all-destroying time in the form of Yama the Lord of Death and even the peaks of Mount Mandara. What
to tell about Lakshmana?"_END

B_6_C_92_7
BEGIN_
अद्य वैवस्वतो राजा भूयो बहुमतो मम || ९२-६-८
येनाद्य त्वं महाबाहो संयुक्तः कालधर्मणा |_END
BEGIN_
"O the long armed one! Highly esteemed to me is the king Yama, son of sun-god, by
whom you have been subjected to the ravages of time today."_END

B_6_C_92_8
BEGIN_
एष पन्थाः सुयोधानां सर्वामरगणेष्वपि || ९२-६-९
यः कृते हन्यते भर्तुः स पुमान् स्वर्गमृच्छति |_END
BEGIN_
"This is the path for great warriors even among all the celestial hosts. That male
offspring who is killed for the cause of his lord, obtains heaven."_END

B_6_C_92_9
BEGIN_
अद्य देवगणाः सर्वे लोकपालास्तथर्षयः || ९२-६-१०
हतमिन्द्रजितं दृष्ट्वा सुखं स्वप्स्यन्ति निर्भयाः |_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing Indrajit having been killed, all the hosts of celestials, the guardians of
the world and the great sages now can sleep comfortably and peacefully."_END

B_6_C_92_10
BEGIN_
अद्य लोकास्त्रयः कृत्स्नाः पृथिवी च सकानना || ९२-६-११
एकेनेन्द्रजिता हीना शूण्येव प्रतिभाति मे |_END
BEGIN_
"Bereft of Indrajit alone, the entire earth with its forest appear to be wholly
alone to me. Nay, even the three worlds!"_END

B_6_C_92_11
BEGIN_
अद्य नैरृतकन्यायां श्रोष्याम्यन्तःपुरे रवम् || ९२-६-१२
करेणुसङ्घस्य यथा निनादं गिरिगह्वरे |_END
BEGIN_
"Now, I shall hear the hue and cry of the demon-maidens in the gynaecium, even as
one would hear the roar of a troop of female-elephants in a mountain cave."_END

B_6_C_92_12
BEGIN_
यौवराज्यं च लङ्कां च रक्षांसि च परन्तप || ९२-६-१३
मातरं मां च भार्यां च क्व गतोऽसि विहाय नः |_END
BEGIN_
"O destroyer of enemies! Where did you go leaving the rank of Prince Regent as also
Lanka, the demons, your mother and myself, your wives and all of us."_END

B_6_C_92_13
BEGIN_
मम नाम त्वया वीर गतस्य यमसादनम् || ९२-६-१४
प्रेतकार्याणि कार्याणि विपरीते हि वर्तसे |_END
BEGIN_
"O hero! The obsequies rights in my honour ought to have been done by you,
consequent upon my death in future. You are, however, following a reverse path."_END

B_6_C_92_14
BEGIN_
स त्वं जीवति सुग्रीवे लक्ष्मणे च राघवे || ९२-६-१५
मम शल्यमनुद्धृत्य क्व गतोऽसि विहाय नः |_END
BEGIN_
"Deserting us without taking away my tormentation, while Sugreeva, lakshmana and
Rama are still alive, where have you gone?"_END

B_6_C_92_15
BEGIN_
एवमादिविलापार्तं रावणं राक्षसाधिपम् || ९२-६-१६
आविवेश महान्कोपः पुत्रव्यसनसम्भवः |_END
BEGIN_
A huge rage enveloped Ravana, the king of demons, born of his son's death, while he
was feeling distressed through grief as aforesaid._END

B_6_C_92_16
BEGIN_
प्रकृत्या कोपनं ह्येनं पुत्रस्य पुनराधयः || ९२-६-१७
दीप्तं संदीपयामासुर्घर्मेऽर्कमिव रश्मयः |_END
BEGIN_
The anguishes occasioned by the death of his son, flared up further for him, who by
his very nature, was wrathful, as rays of the sun flare up the blazing sun in summer._END

B_6_C_92_17
BEGIN_
ललाटे भुकुटीभिश्च संगताभिर्व्यरोचत || ९२-६-१८
यगान्ते सहनक्त्रस्तु महोर्मिभिरिवोदधिः |_END
BEGIN_
With his eye brows joined together on his forehead, he shone brightly like an ocean,
at the time of the dissolution of the world, with crocodiles and giant waves._END

B_6_C_92_18
BEGIN_
कोपाद्विजृम्भमाणस्य वक्त्रद्व्यक्तमिव ज्वलन् || ९२-६-१९
उत्पपात सधूमाग्निर्वृत्रस्य वदनादिव |_END
BEGIN_
While he was yawning with anger; a fire with smoke, as though clearly burning, broke
out from his mouth, as it did from the month of Vritra (in the former days)._END

B_6_C_92_19
BEGIN_
स पुत्रवधसंतप्तः शूरः क्रोधवशं गतः || ९२-६-२०
समीक्ष्य रावणो बुद्ध्या वैदेह्या रोचयद्वधम् |_END
BEGIN_
Afflicted with the grief of his son's killing, that valiant Ravana got wrapped up in
wrath and pondering with his mind, craved for the killing of Seetha._END

B_6_C_92_20
BEGIN_
तस्य प्रकृत्या रक्ते च रक्ते क्रोधाग्निनापि च || ९२-६-२१
रावणस्य महाघोरे दीप्ते नेत्रे बभूवतुः |_END
BEGIN_
The dreadful eyes of that Ravana, which were red in colour by their very nature and
were red even by the fire of his wrath, looked glittering._END

B_6_C_92_21
BEGIN_
घोरं प्रकृत्या रूपं तत्तस्य क्रोधाग्निमूर्छितम् || ९२-६-२२
बभूव रूपं रुद्रस्य क्रुद्धस्येव दुरासदम् |_END
BEGIN_
That naturally terrific form of Ravana, filled with the fire of his wrath, became
difficult to be approached, like the form of enraged Rudra the god of destruction._END

B_6_C_92_22
BEGIN_
तस्य क्रुद्धस्य नेत्राभ्यां प्रापतन्नस्रबिन्दवः || ९२-६-२३
दीप्ताभ्यामिव दीपाभ्यां सार्चिषः स्नेहबिन्दवः |_END
BEGIN_
Drops of tears fell down from his enraged eyes, as drops of oil with flames fall
down from blazing lamps._END

B_6_C_92_23
BEGIN_
दन्तान्विदशतस्तस्य श्रूयते दशनस्वनः || ९२-६-२४
यन्त्रस्यावेष्ट्यमानस्य महतो दानवैरिव |_END
BEGIN_
The sound of his teeth, produced from the friction of his teeth as he ground them,
were heard like the noise of a large machine being bragged by the demons._END

B_6_C_92_24
BEGIN_
कालाग्निरिव संक्रुद्धो यां यां दिशमवैक्षत || ९२-६-२५
तस्यां तस्यां भयत्रस्ता राक्षसाः संनिलिल्यिरे |_END
BEGIN_
Trembling with fear, the demons hid themselves, in whichever quarter to which he
directed his look, enraged as he was, like the fire of universal dissolution._END

B_6_C_92_25
BEGIN_
तमन्तकमिव क्रुद्धं चराचरचिखादिषुम् || ९२-६-२६
वीक्षमाणं दिशः सर्वा राक्षसा नोपचक्रमुः |_END
BEGIN_
Demons could not go towards Ravana, who was looking at all the four quarters, like
the enraged Yama the god of Death, who wants to devour both the mobile and the immobile
creatures._END

B_6_C_92_26
BEGIN_
ततः परमसंक्रुद्धो रावणो राक्षसाधिपः || ९२-६-२७
अब्रवीद्रक्षसां मध्ये संस्तम्भयिषुराहवे |_END
BEGIN_
Desirous of posting the demons to the battle-field, Ravana the king of demons, who
was very much enraged, then spoke as follows, in their midst:_END

B_6_C_92_27
BEGIN_
मया वर्षसहस्राणि चरित्वा परमं तपः || ९२-६-२८
तेषु तेष्ववकाशेषु स्वयम्भूः परितोषितः |_END
BEGIN_
"Brahma the lord of creation was gratified by me, by performing a stupendous
austerity for thousands of years, at the conclusion of those austerities."_END

B_6_C_92_28
BEGIN_
तस्यैव तपसो व्युष्ट्या प्रसादाच्च स्वयम्भुवः || ९२-६-२९
नासुरेभ्यो न देवेभ्यो भयं मम कदा चन |_END
BEGIN_
"As a consequence of that austerity alone and by the grace of Brahma the lord of
creation, there was never a fear for me either from the demons or from the celestials."_END

B_6_C_92_29
BEGIN_
कवचं ब्रह्मदत्तं मे यदादित्यसमप्रभम् || ९२-६-३०
देवासुरविमर्देषु न भिन्नं वज्रशक्तिभिः |_END
BEGIN_
"In the course of combats with the gods and demons, the armour gifted to me by
Brahma, the lord of creation, which is as brilliant as the sun, could not be mutilated by those who
held the thunderbolt in their fists."_END

B_6_C_92_30
BEGIN_
तेन मामद्य संयुक्तं रथस्थमिह संयुगे || ९२-६-३१
प्रतीयात्कोऽद्य मामाजौ साक्षादपि पुरन्दरः |_END
BEGIN_
"Who will, be it Indra himself, dare to attack me on the battle-field now, when
mounted on chariot on this field of battle, and duly wearing the aforesaid armour?"_END

B_6_C_92_31
BEGIN_
यत्तदाभिप्रसन्नेन सशरं कार्मुकं महत् || ९२-६-३२
देवासुरविमर्देषु मम दत्तं स्वयम्भुवा |
अद्य तूर्यशतैर्भीमं धनुरुत्थाप्यतां मम || ९२-६-३३
रामलक्ष्मणयोरेव वधाय परमाहवे |_END
BEGIN_
"Let that large bow of mine, which was given at that time to me along with arrows by
the gracious Brahma the lord of creation, on the occasion of my combat between gods and demons, be
taken out today to the accompaniment of a band of musical instruments, for the purpose of killing
Rama and Lakshmana in the great battle."_END

B_6_C_92_32
BEGIN_
स पुत्रवधसन्तप्तः शूरः क्रोधवशं गतः || ९२-६-३४
समीक्ष्य रावणो बुद्ध्या सीतां हन्तुं व्यवस्यत |_END
BEGIN_
That cruel Ravana, afflicted as he was with grief at the killing of his son, was
subjected to anger and deeply pondering with his mind, decided kill Seetha._END

B_6_C_92_33
BEGIN_
प्रत्यवेक्ष्य तु ताम्राक्षः सुघोरो घोरदर्शनान् || ९२-६-३५
दीनो दीनस्वरान्सर्वांस्तानुवाच निशाचरान् |_END
BEGIN_
Looking fixedly with blood-red eyes on all those demons, who were making miserable
sounds, that very awful Ravana for his part, who had assumed a terrible appearance, though feeling
distressed, spoke to them as follows:_END

B_6_C_92_34
BEGIN_
मायया मम वत्सेन वंचनार्थं वनौकसाम् || ९२-६-३६
किं चिदेव हतं तत्र सीतेयमिति दर्शितम् |_END
BEGIN_
"In order to hoodwink the monkeys, something which had been killed there, was shown,
by taking recourse to conjuring tricks, as Seetha, by my child (Indrajit)"_END

B_6_C_92_35
BEGIN_
तदिदं तथ्यमेवाहं करिष्ये प्रियमात्मनः || ९२-६-३७
वैदेहीं नाशयिष्यामि क्षत्रबन्धुमनुव्रताम् |
इत्येवमुक्त्वा सचिवान्खड्गमाशु परामृशत् || ९२-६-३८_END
BEGIN_
"I shall make that hoax into a hard reality, which is pleasing to me. I shall
destroy Seetha, who is devoted to Rama, a bad warrior". Thus speaking to his counsellors, he
swiftly drew his sword._END

B_6_C_92_36
BEGIN_
उत्प्लुत्य गुणसम्पन्नं विमलाम्बरवर्चसं |
निष्पपात स वेगेन सभायाः सचिवैर्वृतः || ९२-६-३९
रावणः पुत्रशोकेन भृशमाकुलचेतनः |
संक्रुद्धः खड्गमादाय सहसा यत्र मैथिली || ९२-६-४०_END
BEGIN_
The enraged Ravana, who was very much agitated in mind because of the grief for his
son's death, springing up suddenly and taking his excellent sword, having the dazzle of a clear
sky, sallied forth from the assembly hall along with his ministers swiftly and quickly to the place
where Seetha was._END

B_6_C_92_37
BEGIN_
व्रजन्तं राक्षसं प्रेक्ष्य सिंहनादं विचुक्रुशुः |
ऊचुश्चान्योन्यमालिङ्ग्य संक्रुद्धं प्रेक्ष्य राक्षसाः || ९२-६-४१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Ravana going, his followers emitted a lion's roar. Seeing the enraged Ravana
and embracing each other, they spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_92_38
BEGIN_
अद्यैनं तावुभौ दृष्ट्वा भ्रातरौ प्रव्यथिष्यतः |
लोकपाला हि चत्वारः क्रुद्धेनानेन तर्जिताः || ९२-६-४२
बहवः शत्रवश्चान्ये संयुगेष्वभिपातिताः |_END
BEGIN_
"Both those brothers (Rama and Lakshmana), on seeing him now in fury, will get
perturbed. Indeed even the four guardians of the world had been frightened by him, who was in fury.
Many other enemies were also frightened by him in various battles."_END

B_6_C_92_39
BEGIN_
त्रिषु लोकेषु रत्नानि भुङ्क्ते चाहृत्य रावणः || ९२-६-४३
विक्रमे च बले चैव नास्त्यस्य सदृशो भुवि |_END
BEGIN_
"Fetching precious things existing in all the three worlds, Ravana enjoys them. No
one on the earth is equal to him in strength and prowess."_END

B_6_C_92_40
BEGIN_
तेषां संजल्पमानानामशोकवनिकां गताम् || ९२-६-४४
अभिदुद्राव वैदेहीं रावणः क्रोधमूर्छितः |_END
BEGIN_
While those demons were thus talking, Ravana who was excited with fury, rushed
towards Seetha, who was present in the Ashoka grove._END

B_6_C_92_41
BEGIN_
वार्यमाणः सुसंक्रुद्धः सुहृद्भिर्हितबुद्धिभिः || ९२-६-४५
अभ्यधावत संक्रुद्धः खे ग्रहो रोहिणीम् इव |_END
BEGIN_
Though being kept back by his companions whose minds were set on his welfare, Ravana
who was very much enraged, rushed like Mars, in the sky, which would rush towards the
constellation, Rohini in fury._END

B_6_C_92_42
BEGIN_
मैथिली रक्ष्यमाणा तु राक्षसीभिरनिन्दिता || ९२-६-४६
ददर्श राक्षसं क्रुद्धं निस्त्रिंशवरधारिणम् |_END
BEGIN_
The faultless Seetha for her part, who was being guarded by female demons, saw the
enraged Ravana who was bearing an excellent sword._END

B_6_C_92_43
BEGIN_
तं निशाम्य सनिस्त्रिंशं व्यथिता जनकात्मजा || ९२-६-४७
निवार्यमाणं बहुशः सुहृद्भिरनिवर्तिनम् |_END
BEGIN_
Seetha was perturbed in seeing him, bearing sword and who was not going back
eventhough being kept back in many ways by his friends._END

B_6_C_92_44
BEGIN_
सीता दुःखसमाविष्टा विलपन्तीदमब्रवीत् || ९२-६-४८
यथायं मामभिक्रुद्धः समभिद्रवति स्वयम् |
वधिष्यति सनाथां मामनाथामिव दुर्मतिः || ९२-६-४९_END
BEGIN_
Filled with sorrow and lamenting, Seetha said to herself as follows: "From the
manner in which this fellow himself is rushing towards me in fury, I fear the evil-minded demon is
going to kill me, to make me husband-less, even though I have a husband"._END

B_6_C_92_45
BEGIN_
बहुशश्चोदयामास भर्तारं मामनुव्रताम् |
भार्या भव रमस्येति प्रत्याख्यातो ध्रुवं मया || ९२-६-५०
सोऽयं मामनुपस्थानाद् व्यक्तं नैराश्यमागतः |
क्रोधमोहसमाविष्टो व्यक्तं मां हन्तुमुद्यतः || ९२-६-५१_END
BEGIN_
"He incited me several times, devoted as I am to my husband, saying 'Be my
consort!'. He was refused firmly by me. Having been evidently afflicted with despair on my refusing
to wait upon him, he is surely intent to kill me, filled as he was with anger and infatuation."_END

B_6_C_92_46
BEGIN_
अथ वा तौ नरव्याघ्रौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ |
मन्निमित्तमनार्येण समरेऽद्य निपातितौ || ९२-६-५२_END
BEGIN_
"Otherwise, that vulgar demon might have killed those brothers, Rama and Lakshmana,
the foremost of men, today in battle, because of me."_END

B_6_C_92_47
BEGIN_
भैरवो हि महान्नादो राक्षसानां श्रुतो मया |
बहूनामिह हृष्टानां तथा विक्रोशतां प्रियम् || ९२-६-५३_END
BEGIN_
"Here, I just heard a terrific great noise of a multitude of demons, who have been
jubilant and roaring about a pleasant happening."_END

B_6_C_92_48
BEGIN_
अहो धिन्मन्निमित्तोऽयं विनाशो राजपुत्रयोः |
अथवा पुत्रशोकेन अहत्वा रामलक्ष्मणौ || ९२-६-५४
विधमिष्यति मां रौद्रो राक्षसः पापनिश्चयः |_END
BEGIN_
"Alas! Woe is me, if that destruction of the two princes was brought about because
of me. Otherwise, the terrific demon of a sinful resolve, having not been able to kill Rama and
Lakshmana, is going to kill, me, because of the grief over his son's death."_END

B_6_C_92_49
BEGIN_
हनूमतो हि तद्वाक्यं न कृतं क्षुद्रया मया || ९२-६-५५
यद्यहं तस्य पृष्ठेन तदायासमनिन्दिता |
नाद्यैवमनुशोचेयं भर्तुरंकगता सती || ९२-६-५६_END
BEGIN_
"Those words of Hanuma were not acted upon by me, having a low mind. If I left on
that day on his back, though not won back by my husband, I would not have grieved like this today,
as I should be resting on the lap of my husband (in that case)."_END

B_6_C_92_50
BEGIN_
मन्ये तु हृदयं तस्याः कौसल्यायाः फलिष्यति |
एकपुत्रा यदा पुत्रं विनष्टं श्रोष्यते युधि || ९२-६-५७_END
BEGIN_
"I think that the heart of that Kausalya will get burst, when the lady, who had only
one son, hears of her son having been killed in battle."_END

B_6_C_92_51
BEGIN_
सा हि जन्म च बाल्यं च यौवनं च महात्मनः |
धर्मकार्याणि रूपं च रुदती संस्रमिष्यति || ९२-६-५८_END
BEGIN_
"While lamenting, Kausalya will vividly recall about the birth, childhood, youth,
the righteous acts and the handsome form of the great-souled Rama."_END

B_6_C_92_52
BEGIN_
निराशा निहते पुत्रे दत्त्वा श्राद्धमचेतना |
अग्निमारोक्ष्यते नूनमपो वापि प्रवेक्ष्यति || ९२-६-५९_END
BEGIN_
"Having observed a ceremony in honour of her deceased son and getting despondent and
unconscious, Kausalya will surely enter the flame or be drowned in water."_END

B_6_C_92_53
BEGIN_
धिगस्तु कुब्जामसतीं मन्थरां पापनिश्चयाम् |
यन्निमित्तमिदं दुःखं कौसल्या प्रतिपत्स्यते || ९२-६-६०_END
BEGIN_
"Woe be to the unfaithful hunch-back Manthara, of sinful resolve, on whose
consequence, Kausalya will get this grief."_END

B_6_C_92_54
BEGIN_
इत्येवं मैथिलीं दृष्ट्वा विलपन्तीं तपस्विनीम् |
रोहिणीमिव चन्द्रेण विना ग्रहवशं गताम् || ९२-६-६१
एतस्मिन्नन्तरे तस्य अमात्यः शीलवान् शुचिः |
सुपार्श्वो नाम मेधावी रावणं राक्षसेश्वरम् || ९२-६-६२
निवार्यमाणं सचिवैरिदं वचनमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Seetha miserably weeping in that manner like Rohini (the deity presiding over
a constellation of this name), fallen under the sway of the planet Mars, when away of the moon-god
(her husband), a minister called Suparshva, a good-natured, upright and highly intelligent demon,
even though restrained by other ministers, spoke the following words Ravana, the foremost of
demons:_END

B_6_C_92_55
BEGIN_
कथं नाम दशग्रीव साक्षाद्वैश्रवणानुज || ९२-६-६३
हन्तुमिच्छसि वैदेहीं क्रोधाद्धर्ममपास्य हि |_END
BEGIN_
"O Ravana, the younger brother of Kubera himself! How do you wish to kill Seetha,
abandoning your righteousness, in a bout of anger?"_END

B_6_C_92_56
BEGIN_
वेद विद्याव्रत स्नातः स्वधर्मनिरतः सदा || ९२-६-६४
स्त्रियाः कस्माद्वधं वीर मन्यसे राक्षसेश्वर |_END
BEGIN_
"O valiant king of demons! Why are you thinking of destroying a lady, ever since you
completed the vow of celibacy essential for a study of the Vedic lore and were devoted to your own
duty?"_END

B_6_C_92_57
BEGIN_
मैथिलीं रूपसम्पन्नां प्रत्यवेक्षस्व पार्थिव || ९२-६-६५
तस्मिन्नेव सहास्माभी राघवे क्रोधमुत्सृज |_END
BEGIN_
"O king! Behold at Seetha, endowed, as she is, with beauty. Together with us,
release your anger, in battle, on Rama alone."_END

B_6_C_92_58
BEGIN_
अभ्युत्थानं त्वमद्यैव कृष्णपक्षचतुर्दशीम् || ९२-६-६६
कृत्वा निर्याह्यमावास्यां विजयाय बलैर्वृतः |_END
BEGIN_
"Making yourself ready today itself, the fourteenth day of the dark half of this
month, you along with the armies, sally forth tomorrow, the moonless day, to victory."_END

B_6_C_92_59
BEGIN_
शूरो धीमान्रथी खड्गी रथप्रवरमास्थितः || ९२-६-६७
हत्वा दाशरथिं रामं भवान्प्राप्स्यति मैथिलीम् |_END
BEGIN_
"As a valiant and shrewd chariot-warrior, fighting with a sword, in the foremost of
your chariots, you can fetch Seetha by killing Rama, the son of Dasaratha."_END

B_6_C_92_60
BEGIN_
स तद्दुरात्मा सुहृदा निवेदितं |
वचः सुधर्म्यं प्रतिगृह्य रावणः |
गृहं जगामाथ ततश्च वीर्यवान् |
पुनः सभां च प्रययौ सुहृद्वृतः || ९२-६-६८_END
BEGIN_
Accepting that advice, endowed with justice, tendered by a friend, the evil-minded
Ravana went to his palace. Thereafter, that valiant Ravana, along with his friends, again went to
his assembly hall from there._END

B_6_C_93_0
BEGIN_
स प्रविश्य सभान् राजा दीनः परमदुःखितः |
निषसादासने मुख्ये सिन्हः क्रुद्ध इव श्वसन् || ९३-६-१_END
BEGIN_
That king, who was dejected and very much distressed, having entered the
ssembly-hall, sat on his pre-eminent seat, snorting like a lion._END

B_6_C_93_1
BEGIN_
अब्रवीच्च तदा सर्वान्बलमुख्यान्महाबलः |
रावणः प्रांजलीन्वाक्यं पुत्रव्यसनकर्शितः || ९३-६-२_END
BEGIN_
That mighty Ravana, who was emaciated for his son's death, having joined both his
palms in salutation, spoke the following words all those chiefs of army:_END

B_6_C_93_2
BEGIN_
सर्वे भवन्तः सर्वेण हस्त्यश्वेन समावृताः |
निर्यान्तु रथसंघैश्च पादातैश्चोपशोभिताः || ९३-६-३_END
BEGIN_
"Surrounded by the entire elephants and horses, as also graced with columns of
chariots and foot-soldiers, all of you march forward."_END

B_6_C_93_3
BEGIN_
एकन् रामं परिक्षिप्य समरे हन्तुमर्हथ |
प्रहृष्टा शरवर्षेण प्रावृट्काल इवाम्बुदाः || ९३-६-४_END
BEGIN_
"Encircling Rama alone, you have to kill him, by showering streams of arrows upon
him, even as clouds pour showers during the rainy season."_END

B_6_C_93_4
BEGIN_
अथ वाहन् शरैर्तीष्क्णैर्भिन्नगात्रं महारणे |
भवद्भिः श्वो निहन्तास्मि रामन् लोकस्य पश्यतः || ९३-६-५_END
BEGIN_
"Or I shall kill Rama, while the world is witnessing it tomorrow, once his limbs are
torn by you with your sharp arrows in the great battle."_END

B_6_C_93_5
BEGIN_
इत्येवन् राक्षसेन्द्रस्य वाक्यमादाय राक्षसाः |
निर्ययुस्ते रथैः शीघ्रं नागानीकैश्च सन्वृताः || ९३-६-६_END
BEGIN_
Having heard those words of Ravana, those demons sallied forth for the battle, along
with various kinds of armies and speedy chariots._END

B_6_C_93_6
BEGIN_
परिघान् पट्टिशांश्चैव शरखड्गपरश्वधान् |
शरीरान्तकरान् सर्वे चिक्षिपुर्वानरान् प्रति || ९३-६-७
वानराश्च द्रुमान् शैलान् राक्षसान् प्रति चिक्षिपुः |_END
BEGIN_
All those demons hurled iron clubs, sharp-edged spikes, arrows, swords and axes
capable of destroying the life. The monkeys too hurled trees and mountains towards the demons._END

B_6_C_93_7
BEGIN_
स संग्रामो महाभीमः सूर्यस्योदयनं प्रति || ९३-६-८
रक्षसान् वानराणान् च तुमुलः समपद्यत |_END
BEGIN_
Towards sun-rise, that very terrific battle became tumultuous between demons and
monkeys._END

B_6_C_93_8
BEGIN_
ते गदाभिर्विचित्राभिः प्रासैः खड्गैः परश्वधैः || ९३-६-९
अन्योन्यन् समरे जघ्नुस्तदा वानरराक्षसाः |_END
BEGIN_
Those monkeys and demons then began to strike each other with multi-coloured maces,
darts, swords and axes in the battle._END

B_6_C_93_9
BEGIN_
एवं प्रवृते संग्रामे ह्यदुभुतं सुमहद्रजः || ९३-६-१०
रक्षसां वानराणां च शान्तं शोणितविस्रवैः |_END
BEGIN_
While the battle was thus in progress, the surprisingly enormous dust was actually
settled down by the streams of blood, proceeding from the demons and mokeys._END

B_6_C_93_10
BEGIN_
मातंगरथकूलस्य वाजिमत्स्या ध्वजद्रुमाः || ९३-६-११
शरीरसंघाटवहाः प्रसस्रुः शोणितापगाः |_END
BEGIN_
With elephants and chariots as their river-banks, with horses as their fish and with
flag-staffs as trees, rivers of blood gushed forth, carrying dead_END

B_6_C_93_11
BEGIN_
ततस्ते वानराः सर्वे शोणितौघपरिप्लुताः || ९३-६-१२
ध्वजवर्मरथानश्वान्नानाप्रहरणानि च |
आप्लुत्याप्लुत्य समरे वानरेन्द्रा बभंजिरे || ९३-६-१३_END
BEGIN_
Then, all those monkeys were drenched in streams of blood. Leaping and bouncing on
the battle-field, the monkey-chiefs broke off flag-staffs, armours, chariots, horses and various
kinds of weapons._END

B_6_C_93_12
BEGIN_
केशान्कर्णललाटांश्च नासिकाश्च प्लवंगमाः |
रक्षसान् दशनैस्तीक्ष्णैर्नखैश्चापि व्यकर्तयन् || ९३-६-१४_END
BEGIN_
With their sharp teeth and nails, the monkeys tore off the hair, ears, eye-brows and
noses of the demons._END

B_6_C_93_13
BEGIN_
एकैकन् राक्षसं संख्ये शतं वानरपुंगवाः |
अभ्यधावन्त फलिनन् वृक्षं शकुनयो यथा || ९३-६-१५_END
BEGIN_
A hundred monkey-chiefs rushed towards each single demon in the battle, even as
birds would rush towards a tree laden with fruits._END

B_6_C_93_14
BEGIN_
तथा गदाभिर्गुर्वीभिः प्रासैः खड्गैः परश्वधैः |
निर्जघ्नुर्वानरान्घोरान्राक्षसाः पर्वतोपमाः || ९३-६-१६_END
BEGIN_
Then, the demons resembling mountain in size, struck down the terrific monkeys with
large maces, darts, swords and axes._END

B_6_C_93_15
BEGIN_
राक्षसैर्वध्यमानानान् वानराणां महाचमूः |
शरण्यन् शरणं याता रामन् दशरथात्मजम् || ९३-६-१७_END
BEGIN_
The huge army of monkeys, being struck down by the demons, sought refuge in Rama,
the son of Dasaratha, who affords protection._END

B_6_C_93_16
BEGIN_
ततो रामो महातेजा धनुरादाय वीर्यवान् |
प्रविश्य राक्षसन् सैन्यं शरवर्षं ववर्ष ह || ९३-६-१८_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Rama of great splendour and prowess, taking up his bow and entering the
army of demons, streamed forth showers of arrows._END

B_6_C_93_17
BEGIN_
प्रविष्टन् तु तदा रामं मेघाः सूर्यमिवाम्बरे |
नाभिजग्मुर्महाघोरं निर्दहन्तन् शराग्निना || ९३-६-१९_END
BEGIN_
Those highly terrific demons dared not approach Rama, having entered their ranks,
was scorching them with the flame of his arrows, even as clouds would not approach the scorching
sun in the sky._END

B_6_C_93_18
BEGIN_
कृतान्येव सुघोराणि रामेण रजनीचराः |
रणे रामस्य ददृशुः कर्माण्यसुकराणि च || ९३-६-२०_END
BEGIN_
Those demons saw the most terrible deeds only of Rama, when they were actually
performed by him in the battle-field, which were difficult to perform for others._END

B_6_C_93_19
BEGIN_
चालयन्तं महानीकन् विधमन्तं महारथान् |
ददृशुस्ते न वै रामन् वातं वनगतं यथा || ९३-६-२१_END
BEGIN_
Those demons could not actually see Rama, whle he was shaking their huge army and
blowing away their great chariots, any more than one could see a gale of wind in a forest._END

B_6_C_93_20
BEGIN_
छिन्नं भिन्नन् शरैर्दग्धं प्रभग्नं शस्त्रपीडितम् |
बलन् रामेण ददृशुर्न रमं शीघ्रकारिणम् || ९३-६-२२_END
BEGIN_
They saw the army torn and pierced with arrows, as also scorched, broken down and
tormented with missiles. They could not see Rama, who was so swift in his martial art._END

B_6_C_93_21
BEGIN_
प्रहरन्तन् शरीरेषु न ते पश्यन्ति राभवम् |
इन्द्रियार्थेषु तिष्ठन्तं भूतात्मानमिव प्रजाः || ९३-६-२३_END
BEGIN_
The demons could not behold Rama hitting their bodies, even as created beings are
not able to see their individual souls resting in their sense-objects._END

B_6_C_93_22
BEGIN_
एष हन्ति गजानीकमेष हन्ति महारथान् |
एष हन्ति शरैस्तीक्ष्णैः पदातीन्वाजिभिः सह || ९३-६-२४
इति ते राक्षसाः सर्वे रामस्य सदृशान्रणे |
अन्योन्यकुपिता जघ्नुः सादृश्याद्राघवस्य तु || ९३-६-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Here is Rama, killing the army of elephants. Here is Rama, destroying great
chariot-warriors. Here is Rama, killing foot-soldiers along with horses with his sharp arrows".
Saying so, all those demons struck one another with rage in the battle-field those who were in
similarity of appearance to Rama._END

B_6_C_93_23
BEGIN_
स ते ददृशिरे रामन् दहन्तमरिवाहिनीम् |
मोहिताः परमास्त्रेण गान्धर्वेण महात्मना || ९३-६-२६_END
BEGIN_
Having been thrown into confusion by the great mystic missile presided over by the
Gandharvas, the celestial musicians; presided over by the Gandharvas, the celestial musicians;
those demons were unable to see Rama, even when he was scorching away their army._END

B_6_C_93_24
BEGIN_
ते तु राम सहस्राणि रणे पश्यन्ति राक्षसाः |
पुनः पश्यन्ति काकुत्स्थमेकमेव महात्मना || ९३-६-२७_END
BEGIN_
Those demons for their part saw thousands of Rama's in the battle-field, while at
other times, they saw only one Rama in that great battle._END

B_6_C_93_25
BEGIN_
भ्रमन्तीन् कांचनीं कोटिं कार्मुकस्य महात्मनः |
अलातचक्रप्रतिमान् ददृशुस्ते न राघवम् || ९३-६-२८_END
BEGIN_
Those demons for their part saw thousands of Ramas in the battle-field; while at
other times, they saw only one Rama in that great battle._END

B_6_C_93_26
BEGIN_
शरीरनाभिसत्त्वार्चिः शरारं नेमिकार्मुकम् |
ज्याघोषतलनिर्घोषन् तेजोबुद्धिगुणप्रभम् || ९३-६-२९
दिव्यास्त्रगुणपर्यन्तं निघ्नन्तन् युधि राक्षसान् |
ददृशू रामचक्रन् तत्कालचक्रमिव प्रजाः || ९३-६-३०_END
BEGIN_
The created beings saw that Rama in the form of a discus, which was killing the
demons on the battle-field, like the "Wheel of Time", for its flame, the arrows for its spokes, his
bow for the felly of the wheel, the twanging of the bow-string and the clanging of the gauntlet for
the sound produced for its revolution, his energy and the virtues for its radiance and the power of
his mystic missiles for its edge._END

B_6_C_93_27
BEGIN_
अनीकन् दशसाहस्रन् रथानां वातरन्हसाम् |
अष्टादशसहस्राणि कुंजराणान् तरस्विनाम् || ९३-६-३१
चतुर्दशसहस्राणि सारोहाणान् च वाजिनाम् |
पूर्णे शतसहस्रे द्वे राक्षसानां पदातिनाम् || ९३-६-३२
दिवसस्याष्टमे भागे शरैरग्निशिखोपमैः |
हतान्येकेन रामेण रक्षसान् कामरूपिणाम् || ९३-६-३३_END
BEGIN_
Within a matter of three hours, with his arrows looking like tongues of flames, Rama
killed an army of demons, capable of changing their form at will, including ten thousands chariots
possessing the swiftness of the wind, eighteen thousand strong elephants, fourteen thousand horses
with their riders and a full two lacs of demons fighting on foot._END

B_6_C_93_28
BEGIN_
ते हताश्वा हतरथाः श्रान्ता विमथितध्वजाः |
अभिपेतुः पुरीन् लंकां हतशेषा निशाचराः || ९३-६-३४_END
BEGIN_
Those surviving demons, with their horses killed, with their chariots destroyed,
with thier flag-staffs broken and with broken spirits, rushed back towards the City of Lanka._END

B_6_C_93_29
BEGIN_
हतैर्गजपदात्यश्वैस्तद्बभूव रणाजिरम् |
आक्रीडभूमी क्रुद्रस्य रुद्रस्येव महात्मनः || ९३-६-३५_END
BEGIN_
That battle-field, with elephants, foot-soldiers and horses killed, looked like a
pleasure-grave of the powerful and the enraged the lord of destruction._END

B_6_C_93_30
BEGIN_
ततो देवाः सगन्धर्वाः सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः |
साधु साध्विति रामस्य तत्कर्म समपूजयन् || ९३-६-३६_END
BEGIN_
Then, the celestials along with Gandharvas the celestial musicians, holy saints and
great sages acclaimed that feat of Rama, saying "well done, well done!"._END

B_6_C_93_31
BEGIN_
अब्रवीच्च तदा रामः सुग्रीवं प्रत्यनन्तरम् |
विभीषणं च धर्मात्मा हनूमन्तं च वानरम् || ९३-६-३७
जाम्बवन्तं हरिश्रेष्ठं मैन्दं द्विविदमेव च |
एतदस्त्रबलन् दिव्यं मम वा त्र्यम्बकस्य वा || ९३-६-३८_END
BEGIN_
Then, the virtuous Rama spoke also to Sugreeva, Vibhishana, Hanuma the monkey,
Jambavan, Mainda the foremost of monkeys and even Dvivida, who were in close proximity to him as
follows "Such wonderful power of this missile exists either with me or with the three-eyed Rudra
the lord of destruction."_END

B_6_C_93_32
BEGIN_
निहत्य तान् राक्षसवाहिनीन् तु |
रामस्तदा शक्रसमो महात्मा |
अस्त्रेषु शस्त्रेषु जितक्लमश् च |
सन्स्तूयते देवगणैः प्रहृष्टैः || ९३-६-३९_END
BEGIN_
Rama, a compeer of Indra the lord of celestials, the great souled, unwearied in the
use of weapons and missiles, having destroyed that army of demons, was applauded by the rejoiced
troops of celestials._END

B_6_C_94_0
BEGIN_
तानि नागसहस्राणि सारोहाणान् च वाजिनाम् |
रथानान् चाग्निवर्णानान् सध्वजानां सहस्रशः || ९४-६-१
राक्षसानान् सहस्राणि गदापरिघयोधिनाम् |
कांचनध्वजचित्राणान् शूराणान् कामरूपिणाम् || ९४-६-२
निहतानि शरैस्तीक्ष्णैस्तप्तकांचनभूषणैः |
रावणेन प्रयुक्तानि रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा || ९४-६-३_END
BEGIN_
Rama, who was unweary in action, with his shining arrows adorned with pure gold,
killed those thousands of elephants dispatched by Ravana, thousands of horses, valiant demons who
can change their form at will mounted on thousands of chariots with their flag-staffs, having the
colour of fire, fighting with maces and iron rods and conspicuous with their golden banners._END

B_6_C_94_1
BEGIN_
दृष्ट्वा श्रुत्वा च सम्भ्रान्ता हतशेषा निशाचराः |
राक्षस्यश्च समागम्य दीनाश्चिन्तापरिप्लुताः || ९४-६-४
विधवा हतपुत्राश्च क्रोशन्त्यो हतबान्धवाः |
राक्षस्यः सह संगम्य दुःखार्ताः पर्यदेवयन् || ९४-६-५_END
BEGIN_
Seeing and hearing about the killing of the demons, the surviving demons well
frightened, looked sad and were overwhelmed with anxiety. They wailed when they met their wives.
All female-demons who lost their husbands, sons and kinsfolk met at one place, stricken as they
were with sorrow, wailed as follows:_END

B_6_C_94_2
BEGIN_
कथन् शूर्पणखा वृद्धा कराला निर्णतोदरी |
आससाद वने रामन् कन्दर्पमिव रूपिणम् || ९४-६-६_END
BEGIN_
"How did the old and ugly Surpanakha, of sunken belly, approach, in the forest, Rama
who is charming like the god of love?"_END

B_6_C_94_3
BEGIN_
सुकुमारं महासत्त्वन् सर्वभूतहिते रतम् |
तन् दृष्ट्वा लोकवध्या सा हीनरूपा प्रकामिता || ९४-६-७_END
BEGIN_
"How strange that on seeing that Rama of tender youth, endowed with extraordinary
strength and devoted to the welfare of all created beings, that ugly woman (Surpanakha) who
deserved to be condemned by the people, was stung with excessive lust?"_END

B_6_C_94_4
BEGIN_
कथन् सर्वगुणैर्हीना गुणवन्तं महौजसं |
सुमुखन् दुर्मुखी रामं कामयामास राक्षसी || ९४-६-८_END
BEGIN_
"How that ugly-faced demoness, who is bereft of all virtues, dared to make love to
Rama, who is full of virtues, endowed with great bodily strength and who possessed a charming
countenance?"_END

B_6_C_94_5
BEGIN_
जनस्यास्याल्पभाग्यत्वात्पलिनी श्वेतमूर्धजा |
अकार्यमपहास्यन् च सर्वलोकविगर्हितम् || ९४-६-९
राक्षसानान् विनाशाय दूषणस्य खरस्य च |
चकाराप्रतिरूपा सा राघवस्य प्रधर्षणम् || ९४-६-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Because of the ill-luck of these people, and to the destruction of demons and of
Dushana and Khara, that grey-haired and disgusting woman, who had developed wrinkles, tried to be
arrogant with Rama, misdeed which was worth ridiculing and condemned by the whole world."_END

B_6_C_94_6
BEGIN_
तन्निमित्तमिदन् वैरं रावणेन कृतं महत् |
वधाय नीता सा सीता दशग्रीवेण रक्षसा || ९४-६-११_END
BEGIN_
"For the sake of that Surpanakha, Ravana built this huge enmity. For his own
destruction, Ravana the demon brought that Seetha."_END

B_6_C_94_7
BEGIN_
न च सीतान् दशग्रीवः प्राप्नोति जनकात्मजाम् |
बद्धं बलवता वैरमक्षयन् राघवेण ह || ९४-६-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Ravana cannot obtain Seetha, the daughter of Janaka, but an endless enmity has been
built with the mighty Rama."_END

B_6_C_94_8
BEGIN_
वैदेहीं प्रार्थयानन् तन् विराधं प्रेक्ष्य राक्षसं |
हतमेकेन रामेण पर्याप्तन् तन्निदर्शनम् || ९४-६-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing that instance of Rama killing single-handedly Viradha the demon, who was
yearning for Seetha, is enough indeed (to convince Ravana of Rama's strength and ability)"_END

B_6_C_94_9
BEGIN_
चतुर्दशसहस्राणि रक्षसां भीमकर्मणाम् |
निहतानि जनस्थाने शरैरग्निशिखोपमैः || ९४-६-१४_END
BEGIN_
"In Janasthana, Rama killed fourteen thousand demons who were doing terrific feats,
with his arrows resembling tongues of fire."_END

B_6_C_94_10
BEGIN_
खरश्च निहतः संख्ये दूषणस्त्रिशिरास्तथा |
शरैरादित्यसंकाशैः पर्याप्तन् तन्निदर्शनम् || ९४-६-१५_END
BEGIN_
"In that battle, Khara, Dushana and Trishira were killed with arrows resembling the
sun. That instance should have been sufficient (to open the eyes of Ravana)."_END

B_6_C_94_11
BEGIN_
हतो योजनबाहुश्च कबन्धो रुधिराशनः |
क्रोधार्तो विनदन्सोअथ पर्याप्तन् तन्निदर्शनम् || ९४-६-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Further, that Kabandha having arms with a length of eight miles each, with blood as
his food and roaring with anger was killed. That instance should have been sufficient."_END

B_6_C_94_12
BEGIN_
जघान बलिनन् रामः सहस्रनयनात्मजम् |
बालिनं मेघसंकाशं पर्याप्तन् तन्निदर्शनम् || ९४-६-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Rama killed the mighty Vali, the son of Indra the lord of celestials, looking like
the black cloud. That instance should have been sufficient. (To open the eyes of Ravana)"_END

B_6_C_94_13
BEGIN_
ऋश्यमूके वसंशैले दीनो भग्नमनोरथः |
सुग्रीवः स्थापितो राज्ये पर्याप्तन् तन्निदर्शनम् || ९४-६-१८_END
BEGIN_
"The kingdom was restored to the miserable Sugreeva, who was residing in Mount
Rishyamuka, living with his wishes disappointed. That instance should prove sufficient. (To open
the eyes of Ravana)."_END

B_6_C_94_14
BEGIN_
धर्मार्थसहितन् वाक्यं सर्वेषां रक्षसां हितम् |
युक्तन् विभीषणेनोक्तं मोहात्तस्य न रोचते || ९४-६-१९_END
BEGIN_
"The appropriate advice tendered by Vibhishana which was conformable to duty and
interest of Ravana as also beneficial to all the demons, was not to the liking to him, due to his
ignorance."_END

B_6_C_94_15
BEGIN_
विभीषणवचः कुर्याद्यदि स्म धनदानुजः |
श्मशानभूता दुःखार्ता नेयन् लंका पुरी भवेत् || ९४-६-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Had Ravana followed Vibhishana's advice, this Lanka would not have become a burial
ground, tormented by sorrow."_END

B_6_C_94_16
BEGIN_
कुम्भकर्णन् हतं श्रुत्वा राघवेण महाबलम् |
अतिकायं च दुर्मर्षं लक्ष्मणेन हतं तदा || ९४-६-२१
प्रियन् चेन्द्रजितं पुत्रन् रावणो नावबुध्यते |_END
BEGIN_
"Ravana is not able to learn a lesson, even after hearing that the mighty
Kumbhakarna was killed by Rama and that unconquerable colossal-bodied Indrajit, his beloved son was
killed by Lakshmana."_END

B_6_C_94_17
BEGIN_
मम पुत्रो मम भ्राता मम भर्ता रणे हतः || ९४-६-२२
इत्येवन् श्रूयते शब्दो राक्षसानान् कुले कुले |_END
BEGIN_
"Ravana is not able to learn a lesson, even after hearing that the mighty
Kumbhakarna was killed by Rama and that the unconquerable colossal-bodied Indrajit, his beloved son
was killed by Lakshmana."_END

B_6_C_94_18
BEGIN_
रथाश्चाश्वाश्च नागाश्च हताः शतसहस्रशः || ९४-६-२३
रणे रामेण शूरेण राक्षसाश्च पदातयः |_END
BEGIN_
"The valiant Rama killed hundreds and thousands of chariots, horses and elephants in
the battle. He killed even the foot soldiers too."_END

B_6_C_94_19
BEGIN_
रुद्रो वा यदि वा विष्णुर्महेन्द्रो वा शतक्रतुः || ९४-६-२४
हन्ति नो रामरूपेण यदि वा स्वयमन्तकः |_END
BEGIN_
"Rama, coming in the form of either Rudra the lord of destruction or Vishnu, the
lord of preservation, or Indra the lord of celestials who performed one hundred ritual sacrifices,
or otherwise Yama, the Lord of Death himself, is killing us."_END

B_6_C_94_20
BEGIN_
हतप्रवीरा रामेण निराशा जीविते वयम् || ९४-६-२५
अपश्यन्त्यो भयस्यान्तमनाथा विलपामहे |_END
BEGIN_
"As Rama killed all our great warriors, we are lamenting with a loss of hope in our
lives, failing to see an end to our fear and having become helpless."_END

B_6_C_94_21
BEGIN_
रामहस्ताद्दशग्रीवः शूरो दत्तवरो युधि || ९४-६-२६
इदं भयं महाघोरमुत्पन्नं नावबुध्यते |_END
BEGIN_
"The valiant Ravana, having been gifted with great boons by Brahma, is not able to
understand this greatly terrific calamity, coming forth from the hand of Rama."_END

B_6_C_94_22
BEGIN_
न देवा न च गन्धर्वा न पिशाचा न राकसाः || ९४-६-२७
उपसृष्टं परित्रातुन् शक्ता रामेण सन्युगे |_END
BEGIN_
"Neither the celestials nor Gandharvas the celestial musicians nor the evil spirits
nor the demons are able to protect Ravana, who is about to attack Rama in battle."_END

B_6_C_94_23
BEGIN_
उत्पाताश्चापि दृश्यन्ते रावणस्य रणे रणे || ९४-६-२८
कथयिष्यन्ति रामेण रावणस्य निबर्हणम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Bad omens are appearing for Ravana, as and when his warriors are setting out for
each combat. They are indeed telling about the prospective annihilation of Ravana by Rama."_END

B_6_C_94_24
BEGIN_
पितामहेन प्रीतेन देवदानवराक्षसैः || ९४-६-२९
रावणस्याभयन् दत्तं मानुषेभ्यो न याचितम् |_END
BEGIN_
Brahma, the lord of creation, gratified by the austerity of Ravana, gave protection
to Ravana from celestials, demons and ogres. But Ravana did not seek protection from human
beings."_END

B_6_C_94_25
BEGIN_
तदिदं मानुषान्मन्ये प्राप्तं निःसंशयं भयम् || ९४-६-३०
जीवितान्तकरन् घोरन् रक्षसां रावणस्य च |_END
BEGIN_
"I think that such a calamity has come from that humanity only dreadfully causing an
end to the lives for the demons and for Ravana too. There is no doubt about it."_END

B_6_C_94_26
BEGIN_
पीड्यमानास्तु बलिना वरदानेन रक्षसा || ९४-६-३१
दीप्तैस्तपोभिर्विबुधाः पितामहमपूजयन् |_END
BEGIN_
"The celestials, tormented by the mighty Ravana, because of the misuse of the boon
bestowed on him, worshipped Brahma the lord of creation with their glowing austerities."_END

B_6_C_94_27
BEGIN_
देवतानान् हितार्थाय महात्मा वै पितामहः || ९४-६-३२
उवाच देवताः सर्वा इदन् तुष्टो महद्वचः |_END
BEGIN_
"The great-souled Brahma, duly gratified, spoke for the benefit of those celestials,
the following words to them:_END

B_6_C_94_28
BEGIN_
अद्य प्रभृति लोकान्स्त्रीन्सर्वे दानवराक्षसाः || ९४-६-३३
भयेन प्रावृता नित्यन् विचरिष्यन्ति शाश्वतम् |_END
BEGIN_
"From today onwards, all the ogres and demons, constantly enveloped with fear, will
be wandering always in the three worlds."_END

B_6_C_94_29
BEGIN_
दैवतैस्तु समागम्य सर्वैश्चेन्द्रपुरोगमैः || ९४-६-३४
वृषध्वजस्त्रिपुरहा महादेवः प्रसादितः |_END
BEGIN_
"All the celestials together with Indra and others, got propitiated by Shiva the
lord of destruction, with the ensign of a bull on his flag-staff and who destroyed the three strong
cities built of gold, silver and iron in the sky, air and earth for demons."_END

B_6_C_94_30
BEGIN_
प्रसन्नस्तु महादेवो देवानेतद्वचोअब्रवीत् || ९४-६-३५
उत्पत्स्यति हितार्थन् वो नारी रक्षःक्षयावहा |_END
BEGIN_
"The gracious Shiva spoke the following words to the celestials: 'For your benefit,
a woman will be born, for causing destruction of the demons.'"_END

B_6_C_94_31
BEGIN_
एषा देवैः प्रयुक्ता तु क्षुद्यथा दानवान्पुरा || ९४-६-३६
भक्षयिष्यति नः सीता राक्षसघ्नी सरावणान् |_END
BEGIN_
"This Seetha, the destroyer of demons, employed by the celestials, will consume us
along with Ravana, as in the past hunger consumed the demons."_END

B_6_C_94_32
BEGIN_
रावणस्यापनीतेन दुर्विनीतस्य दुर्मतेः || ९४-६-३७
अयं निष्टानको घोरः शोकेन समभिप्लुतः |_END
BEGIN_
"As a result of the bad behaviour of Ravana, the wicked demon with an evil
disposition of mind, this terrific havoc with grief occurred."_END

B_6_C_94_33
BEGIN_
तं न पश्यामहे लोके यो नः शरणदो भवेत् || ९४-६-३८
राघवेणोपसृष्टानान् कालेनेव युगक्षये |_END
BEGIN_
"Rama is occupying us, as the Death occupies at the time of dissolution of the
universe. We do not find any one now, who can give protection to us in this world."_END

B_6_C_94_34
BEGIN_
नास्ति नः शरणं कश्चिद्भये महति तिष्ठताम् || ९४-६-३९
दावाग्निवेष्ठितानां हि करेणूनां यथा वने |_END
BEGIN_
"There is no refuge whatsoever for us, who stand in great danger, as indeed there is
no shelter for female-elephants, enveloped by a wild fire in a forest."_END

B_6_C_94_35
BEGIN_
प्राप्तकालं कृतं तेन पौलस्त्येन महात्मना || ९४-६-४०
यत एवं भयं दृष्ठं तमेव शरणं गतः |_END
BEGIN_
"The great-souled Vibhishana did something opportune. He sought refuge in him alone
from whom such a peril is perceived."_END

B_6_C_94_36
BEGIN_
इतीव सर्वा रजनीचरस्त्रियः |
परस्परन् सम्परिरभ्य बाहुभिः |
विषेदुरार्तातिभयाभिपीडिता |
विनेदुरुच्चैश्च तदा सुदारुणम् || ९४-६-४१_END
BEGIN_
Then, all female-demons, embracing each other in their arms, afflicted as they were
with grief and tormented with excessive fear, lamented thus and wept loudly and severely._END

B_6_C_95_0
BEGIN_
आर्तानान् राक्षसीनान् तु लङ्कायां वै कुले कुले
रावणः करुणन् शब्दं शुश्राव परिवेदितम् || ६-९५-१_END
BEGIN_
Ravana for his part heard the mournful and plaintive cry of the afflicted
female-demons in every house at Lanka._END

B_6_C_95_1
BEGIN_
स तु दीर्घन् विनिश्वस्य मुहूर्तन् ध्यानमास्थितः |
बभूव परमक्रुद्धो रावणो भीमदर्शनः || ६-९५-२_END
BEGIN_
Sighing for a long time and remaining engrossed in reflection for a while, that
Ravana was very much enraged and assumed a frightful appearance._END

B_6_C_95_2
BEGIN_
सन्दश्य दशनैरोष्ठन् क्रोधसन्रक्तलोचनः |
राक्षसैरपि दुर्दर्शः कालाग्निरिव मूर्छितः || ६-९५-३_END
BEGIN_
Nipping his lips with his teeth, his eyes becoming blood-red with anger, and his
