sight becoming difficult to endure even for the demons, Ravana looked like the augmented fire of
dissolution._END

B_6_C_95_3
BEGIN_
उवाच च समीपस्थान्राक्षसान्राक्षसेश्वरः |
भयाव्यक्तकथान्स्तत्र निर्दहन्निव चक्षुषा || ६-९५-४
महोदरं महापार्श्वन् विरूपाक्षन् च राक्षसं |
शीघ्रन् वदत सैन्यानि निर्यातेति ममाज्ञया || ६-९५-५_END
BEGIN_
Ravana, in words indistinct with anger as though consuming them with his glance,
ordered the demons, standing there near him, viz. Mahodara, Mahaparshva and Virupaksha, the demon
(as follows): "Tell the armies asking them to start immediately, as per my command."_END

B_6_C_95_4
BEGIN_
तस्य तद्वचनन् श्रुत्वा राक्षसास्ते भयार्दिताः |
चोदयामासुरव्यग्रान्राक्षसान्स्तान्नृपाज्ञया || ६-९५-६_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that command of Ravana, those demons were tormented with fear and enjoined
those armies of demons, who felt unagitated, in accordance with the orders of the king._END

B_6_C_95_5
BEGIN_
ते तु सर्वे तथेत्युक्त्वा राक्षसा भीमदर्शनाः |
कृतस्वस्त्ययनाः सर्वे रावणाभिमुखा ययुः || ६-९५-७_END
BEGIN_
Saying, 'so it be', all those demons of terrible aspect, praying for the blessing of
the Almighty for averting evil, sallied forth, with their faces turned towards the
battle-field._END

B_6_C_95_6
BEGIN_
प्रतिपूज्य यथान्यायन् रावणन् ते महारथाः |
तस्थुः प्रांजलयः सर्वे भर्तुर्विजयकांक्षिणः || ६-९५-८_END
BEGIN_
Paying reverence to Ravana according to the rules of propriety, all those great
car-warriors stood with joined palms, wishing victory to their lord._END

B_6_C_95_7
BEGIN_
अथोवाच प्रहस्यैतान्रावणः क्रोधमूर्छितः |
महोदरमहापार्श्वौ विरूपाक्षन् च राक्षसं || ६-९५-९_END
BEGIN_
Laughing heartily, Ravana then, stupefied as he was with anger, spoke to those
demons viz. Mahodara, Mahaparshva and Virupaksha, the demons as follows:_END

B_6_C_95_8
BEGIN_
अद्य बाणैर्धनुर्मुक्तैर्युगान्तादित्यसंनिभैः |
राघवन् लक्ष्मणन् चैव नेष्यामि यमसाधनम् || ६-९५-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Today, I will send Rama and Lakshmana to the abode of Death, with my arrows looking
similar to the sun at the time of dissolution of the Universe."_END

B_6_C_95_9
BEGIN_
खरस्य कुम्भकर्णस्य प्रहस्तेन्द्रजितोस्तथा |
करिष्यामि प्रतीकारमद्य शत्रुवधादहम् || ६-९५-११_END
BEGIN_
"By killing the enemies now, I will take vengeance for Khara, Kumbhakarna, Prahasta
and Indrajit."_END

B_6_C_95_10
BEGIN_
नैवान्तरिक्षं न दिशो न नद्यो नापि सागरः |
प्रकाशत्वन् गमिष्यामि मद्बाणजलदावृताः || ६-९५-१२_END
BEGIN_
"The sky overcast by my arrows, like clouds, will not be distinctly seen. Neither
the quarters, nor the heaven, nor the seas will come to view."_END

B_6_C_95_11
BEGIN_
अद्य वानरयूथानान् तानि यूथानि भागशः |
धनुःसमुद्रादुद्भूतैर्मथिष्यामि शरोर्मिभिः || ६-९५-१३_END
BEGIN_
"With a multitude of plumed arrows joined with my bow, I will kill, by turns, the
troops of monkey-chiefs today."_END

B_6_C_95_12
BEGIN_
अद्य वानरसैन्यानि रथेन पवनौजसा |
धनुःसमुद्रादुद्भूतैर्मथिष्यामि शरोर्मिभिः || ६-९५-१४_END
BEGIN_
"By mounting on a chariot, having a speed equal to that of wind, I will destroy
today the armies of monkeys, with waves of arrows arising out of the ocean of my bow._END

B_6_C_95_13
BEGIN_
व्याकोशपद्मचक्राणि पद्मकेसरवर्चसाम् |
अद्य यूथतटाकानि गजवत्प्रमथाम्यहम् || ६-९५-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Like an elephant, today I will destroy ponds in the form of troops of monkeys
shining like the filaments of lotus, with their faces resembling full-blown lotuses."_END

B_6_C_95_14
BEGIN_
सशरैरद्य वदनैः संख्ये वानरयूथपाः |
मण्डयिष्यन्ति वसुधान् सनालैरिव पंकलैः || ६-९५-१६_END
BEGIN_
"With their faces transfixed with arrows, the monkey-leaders, lying on the
battle-field today will adorn the earth as with lotuses together with the stalks."_END

B_6_C_95_15
BEGIN_
अद्य युद्धप्रचण्डानान् हरीणान् द्रुमयोधिनाम् |
मुक्तेनैकेषुणा युद्धे भेत्स्यामि च शतंशतम् || ६-९५-१७_END
BEGIN_
"With each arrow released in battle today, I shall tear one hundred full of monkeys,
the most furious of their troop, fighting with trees."_END

B_6_C_95_16
BEGIN_
हतो भर्ता हतो भ्राता यासान् च तनया हताः |
वधेनाद्य रिपोस्तासान् कर्मोम्यस्रप्रमार्जनम् || ६-९५-१८_END
BEGIN_
"By killing the enemy today, I shall wipe off the tears of those demons, who lost
their brothers and sons."_END

B_6_C_95_17
BEGIN_
अद्य मद्बाणनिर्भिन्नैः प्रकीर्णैर्गतचेतनैः |
करोमि वानरैर्युद्धे यत्नावेक्ष्य तलां महीम् || ६-९५-१९_END
BEGIN_
"With the monkeys pierced with my arrows, lying scattered in the battle-field and
bereft of their lives today, I shall cover the earth so fully, that it would be possible to see its
surface only with effort."_END

B_6_C_95_18
BEGIN_
अद्य काकाश्च गृध्रा ये च मान्साशिनोअपरे |
सर्वान्स्तान्स्तर्पयिष्यामि शत्रुमान्सैः शरार्दितैः || ६-९५-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Today, I shall satiate the crows, vultures and all those other creatures which eat
the flesh, with the flesh of enemies, struck by my arrows."_END

B_6_C_95_19
BEGIN_
कल्प्यतां मे रथशीघ्रन् क्षिप्रमानीयतां धनुः |
अनुप्रयान्तु मान् युद्धे येअवशिष्टा निशाचराः || ६-९५-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Arrange my chariot quickly. Bring my bow swiftly. Let all the remaining demons
here, follow me to the combat."_END

B_6_C_95_20
BEGIN_
तस्य तद्वचनन् श्रुत्वा महापार्श्वोअब्रवीद्वचः |
बलाध्यक्षान्स्थितान्स्तत्र बलन् सन्त्वर्यताम् इति || ६-९५-२२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that command of Ravana, Mahaparshva ordered the army-chiefs, standing there,
as follows: "let the army be made ready quickly."_END

B_6_C_95_21
BEGIN_
बलाध्यक्षास्तु सन्रब्धा राक्षसान्स्तान्गृहाद्गृहात् |
चोदयन्तः परिययुर्लङ्कान् लघुपराक्रमाः || ६-९५-२३_END
BEGIN_
Going around the city of Lanka, the army-chiefs for their part, with quick
resolution, joined hand in hand and hastened the demons in every house to set out for the
battle._END

B_6_C_95_22
BEGIN_
ततो मुहूर्तान्निष्पेतू राक्षसा भीमविक्रमाः |
नर्दन्तो भीमवदना नानाप्रहरणैर्भुजैः || ६-९५-२४
असिभिः पट्टसैः शूलैर्गलाभिर्मुसलैर्हलैः |
शक्तिभिस्तीक्ष्णधाराभिर्महद्भिः कूटमुद्गरैः || ६-९५-२५
यष्टिभिर्विमलैश्चक्रैर्निशितैश्च परश्वधैः |
भिण्डिपालैः शतघ्नीभिरन्यैश्चापि वरायुधैः || ६-९५-२६_END
BEGIN_
The demons, of terrible aspect and having awful faces, then roaring, with their arms
equipped with various weapons viz. swords, sharp-edged darts, pikes, maces, clubs, plough-like
weapons, sharp-edged javelins, huge Kutas and Mudgara, staffs, discuses of every kind, sharpened
axes, slings for throwing stones, stones or cylindrical wooden pieces with iron pikes and other
excellent weapons, rushed out within a moment._END

B_6_C_95_23
BEGIN_
अथानयन्बलाध्यक्षाश्चत्वारो रावणाज्ञया |
आरुरोह रथन् दिव्यं दीप्यमानन् स्वतेजसा || ६-९५-२७
द्रुतन् सूतसमायुक्तं युक्ताष्टतुरगं रथम् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, as per the orders of Ravana, the army-commander hurriedly brought a chariot,
moving swiftly, along with a charioteer and yoked with eight horses. Thereupon, the awful Ravana
mounted that chariot, shining with his own splendour._END

B_6_C_95_24
BEGIN_
ततः प्रयातः सहसा राक्षसैर्बहुभिर्वृतः || ६-९५-२८
रावणः सत्त्वगाम्भीर्याद्दारयन्निव मेदिनीम् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, surrounded by several demons, Ravana sallied forth quickly, as though he was
cracking the earth with a profundity of his strength._END

B_6_C_95_25
BEGIN_
ततश्चासीन्महानादस्तूर्याणाम् च ततस्ततः || ६-९५-२९
मृदङ्ग्गैः पटहैः शङ्खैः कलहैः सह रक्षसाम् |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, a great noise emanated on all sides from tabors, drums, Kettle-drums and
counches along with the clamour of the demons._END

B_6_C_95_26
BEGIN_
आगतो रक्षसां राजा चत्रचामरसंयुतः || ६-९५-३०
सीतापहारी दुर्वृत्तो ब्रह्मघ्नो देवकण्टकः |
योद्धुं रघुवरेणेति शुश्रुवे कलहध्वनिः || ६-९५-३१_END
BEGIN_
A clamour was heard, saying "There comes the ruler of demons, the abductor of
Seetha, the destroyer of Brahmanas, the enemy of gods, notorious for his bad conduct, accompanied
by his canopy and pair of whisks, to fight with Rama, the foremost among the Raghu dynasty."_END

B_6_C_95_27
BEGIN_
तेन नादेन महता पृथिवी समकम्पत |
तं शब्दं सहसा श्रुत्वा वानरा दुद्रुवुर्भयात् || ६-९५-३२_END
BEGIN_
By that huge sound, the earth trembled. Hearing that sound suddenly, the monkeys ran
away in fear._END

B_6_C_95_28
BEGIN_
रावणस्तु महाबाहुः सचिवैः परिवारितः |
आजगाम महातेजा जयाय विजयं प्रति || ६-९५-३३_END
BEGIN_
The long-armed Ravana, for his part, with extra-ordinary energy, surrounded by his
ministers, turned up for victory in quest of victory._END

B_6_C_95_29
BEGIN_
रावणेनाभ्यनुज्ञातौ महापार्श्वमहोदरौ |
विरूपाक्षश्च दुर्धर्षो रथानारुरुहुस्तदा || ६-९५-३४_END
BEGIN_
Mahaparshva and Mahodara as also Virupaksha, who was difficult to overpower, as
order by Ravana, then ascended their chariots._END

B_6_C_95_30
BEGIN_
ते तु हृष्टा विनर्दन्तो भिन्दत इव मेदिनीम् |
नादन् घोरन् विमुंचन्तो निर्ययुर्जयकांक्षिणः || ६-९५-३५_END
BEGIN_
Those demons, roaring elatedly, as though cracking the earth, and emitting an awfull
uproar, sallied forth, longing for victory._END

B_6_C_95_31
BEGIN_
ततो युद्धाय तेजस्वी रक्षोगणबलैर्वृतः |
निर्ययावुद्यतधनुः कालान्तकयमोमपः || ६-९५-३६_END
BEGIN_
Then, the powerful Ravana, resembling the all-destroying Time in the form of Yama,
along with his army-troops of demons, set out for the battle with his raised bow._END

B_6_C_95_32
BEGIN_
ततः प्रजवनाश्वेन रथेन स महारथः |
द्वारेण निर्ययौ तेन यत्र तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ || ६-९५-३७_END
BEGIN_
Then, that Ravana, the great chariot-warrior, ascending his chariot driven by swift
horses, sallied forth to the gate, where Rama and Lakshmana were._END

B_6_C_95_33
BEGIN_
ततो नष्टप्रभः सूर्यो दिशश्च तिमिरावृताः |
द्विजाश्च नेदुर्घोराश्च संचचाल च मेदिनी || ६-९५-३८_END
BEGIN_
Then, the sun lost its radiance. The quarters too were enveloped in darkness. The
birds emitted fearful notes. The earth too trembled violently._END

B_6_C_95_34
BEGIN_
ववर्ष रुधिरन् देवश्चस्खलुश्च तुरंगमाः |
ध्वजाग्रे न्यपतद्गृध्रो विनेदुश्चाशिवन् शिवाः || ६-९५-३९_END
BEGIN_
The cloud rained blood. The horses stumbled. A vulture descended on the top of the
ensign. Jackals emitted sinister howls._END

B_6_C_95_35
BEGIN_
नयनन् चास्फुरद्वामन् सव्यो बाहुरकम्पत |
विवर्णवदनश्चासीत्किन् चिदभ्रश्यत स्वनः || ६-९५-४०_END
BEGIN_
His left eye too throbbed. His left arm trembled. He became pale-faced. His voice
was a little lowered._END

B_6_C_95_36
BEGIN_
ततो निष्पततो युद्धे दशग्रीवस्य रक्षसः |
रणे निधनशन्सीनि रूपाण्येतानि जज्ञिरे || ६-९५-४१_END
BEGIN_
When Ravana the demon was sallying forth for the battle, the following evil
phenomena, predicting his death, appeared in the battle-field._END

B_6_C_95_37
BEGIN_
अन्तरिक्षात्पपातोल्का निर्घातसमनिस्वना |
विनेदुरशिवन् गृध्रा वायसैरनुनादिताः || ६-९५-४२_END
BEGIN_
A meteor with a sound similar to a thunder, fell down from the sky. Ill-omened
vultures together with crows cried out aloud._END

B_6_C_95_38
BEGIN_
एतानचिन्तयन्घोरानुत्पातान्समुपस्थितान् |
निर्ययौ रावणो मोहाद्वधार्थी कालचोदितः || ६-९५-४३_END
BEGIN_
Ignoring these dreadful bad omens due to his ignorance, Ravana marched forward for
the purpose of the massacre in battle, driven as he was by fate._END

B_6_C_95_39
BEGIN_
तेषान् तु रथघोषेण राक्षसानां महात्मनाम् |
वानराणामपि चमूर्युद्धायैवाभ्यवर्तत || ६-९५-४४_END
BEGIN_
On hearing the sound of the chariot of those mighty demons, that army of monkeys too
returned for the fight._END

B_6_C_95_40
BEGIN_
तेषान् सुतुमुलं युद्धं बभूव कपिरक्षसाम् |
अन्योन्यमाह्वयानानान् क्रुद्धानां जयमिच्छताम् || ६-९५-४५_END
BEGIN_
A tumultuous battle ensued between those monkeys and demons, who were fond of
victory and summoning each other for combat with rage._END

B_6_C_95_41
BEGIN_
ततः क्रुद्धो दशग्रीवः शरैः कांचनभूषणैः |
वानराणामनीकेषु चकार कदनं महत् || ६-९५-४६_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, the enraged Ravana, with his arrows decked with that army of monkeys._END

B_6_C_95_42
BEGIN_
निकृत्तशिरसः के चिद्रावणेन वलीमुखाः |
केचिद्विच्छिन्नहृदयाः केचिच्छ्रोत्रविवर्जिताः || ६-९५-४७_END
BEGIN_
Some monkeys had their heads chopped off by Ravana. Some had their hearts pierced.
Some were made deprived of their ears._END

B_6_C_95_43
BEGIN_
निरुच्छ्वासा हताः के चित्के चित्पार्श्वेषु दारिताः |
के चिद्विभिन्नशिरसः के चिच्चक्षुर्विवर्जिताः || ६-९५-४८_END
BEGIN_
Some were struck down breathless. Some were torn in their ribs. Some had their
skulls smashed. Some were deprived of their eyes._END

B_6_C_95_44
BEGIN_
दशाननः क्रोधविवृत्तनेत्रो यतो यतोअभ्येति रथेन संख्ये |
ततस्ततस्तस्य शरप्रवेगं सोढुं न शेकुर्हरियूथपास्ते || ६-९५-४९_END
BEGIN_
Whichever side Ravana was coming in his chariot on the battle-field, his eyes
rolling in anger, those monkey-warriors, on that side, could not with stand the rapidity of his
arrows._END

B_6_C_96_0
BEGIN_
तथा तैः कृत्तगात्रैस्तु दशग्रीवेण मार्गणैः |
बभूव वसुधा तत्र प्रकीर्णा हरिभिर्वृता || ६-९६-१_END
BEGIN_
The battle-field there, on its part, was strewn on that occasion with those monkeys
whose bodies had thus been torn asunder by Ravana with his arrows._END

B_6_C_96_1
BEGIN_
रावणस्याप्रसह्यन् तन् शरसम्पातमेकतः |
न शेकुः सहितुन् दीप्तं पतङ्गा इव पावकम् || ६-९६-२_END
BEGIN_
Those monkeys could not bear that irresistible descent of arrows loosed by Ravana,
any more than moths would bear a blazing fire._END

B_6_C_96_2
BEGIN_
तेअर्दिता निशितैर्बाणैः क्रोशन्तो विप्रदुद्रुवुः |
पावकार्चिःसमाविष्टा दह्यमाना यथा गजाः || ६-९६-३_END
BEGIN_
Those monkeys tormented by sharp arrows, fled away roaring, as elephants run away,
when enveloped in flames of fire and getting scorched by them._END

B_6_C_96_3
BEGIN_
प्लवङ्गानामनीकानि महाभ्राणीव मारुतः |
स ययौ समरे तस्मिन्विधमन्रावणः शरैः || ६-९६-४_END
BEGIN_
Ravana was marching forward swiftly in that battle-field, blowing away the army of
monkeys, like the wind blows away large clouds._END

B_6_C_96_4
BEGIN_
कदनन् तरसा कृत्वा राक्षसेन्द्रो वनौकसाम् |
आससाद ततो युद्धे राघवन् त्वरितस्तदा || ६-९६-५_END
BEGIN_
Having brought about with his might the destruction of those monkeys in battle,
Ravana quickly approached Rama on the battle-field._END

B_6_C_96_5
BEGIN_
सुग्रीवस्तान्कपीन्दृष्ट्वा भग्नान्विद्रवतो रणे |
गुल्मे सुषेणं निक्षिप्य चक्रे युद्धे द्रुतं मनः || ६-९६-६_END
BEGIN_
Seeing those monkeys running away in defeat in that battle, Sugreeva kept Sushena in
charge of his army and quickly threw his mind into the fight._END

B_6_C_96_6
BEGIN_
आत्मनः सदृशन् वीरं स तं निक्षिप्य वानरम् |
सुग्रीवोअभिमुखः शत्रुं प्रतस्थे पादपायुधः || ६-९६-७_END
BEGIN_
Keeping that Sushena who was equal to himself, his substitute, that Sugreeva, armed
with the tree as a weapon, marched forward towards the enemy._END

B_6_C_96_7
BEGIN_
पार्श्वतः पृष्ठतश्चास्य सर्वे यूथाधिपाः स्वयम् |
अनुजह्रुर्महाशैलान्विविधांश्च महाद्रुमान् || ६-९६-८_END
BEGIN_
Taking huge rocks and various kinds of trees, all the monkey-warriors followed
Sugreeva at his side and behind._END

B_6_C_96_8
BEGIN_
स नदन्युधि सुग्रीवः स्वरेण महता महान् |
पातयन्विविधांश्चान्याञ्जघानोत्तमराक्षसान् || ६-९६-९_END
BEGIN_
The gigantic Sugreeva roared at a high pitch in the battle-field. Striking with his
blows, he crushed various other chiefs of demons._END

B_6_C_96_9
BEGIN_
ममर्द च महाकायो राक्षसान्वानरेश्वरः |
युगान्तसमये वायुः प्रवृद्धानगमानिव || ६-९६-१०_END
BEGIN_
The colossal bodied Sugreeva smashed the demons, as the grown-up trees are smashed
by the wind at the time of dissolution of the world._END

B_6_C_96_10
BEGIN_
राक्षसानामनीकेषु शैलवर्षन् ववर्ष ह |
अश्ववर्षन् यथा मेघः पक्षिसङ्घेषु कानने || ६-९६-११_END
BEGIN_
Sugreeva rained a hail of rocks on the army of demons, as a cloud rains a shower of
hail-stones on a host of birds in a forest._END

B_6_C_96_11
BEGIN_
कपिराजविमुक्तैस्तैः शैलवर्षैस्तु राक्षसाः |
विकीर्णशिरसः पेतुर्निकृत्ता इव पर्वताः || ६-९६-१२
अथ सङ्क्षीयमाणेषु राक्षसेषु समन्ततः |
सुग्रीवेण प्रभग्नेषु पतत्सु विनदत्सु च || ६-९६-१३
विरूपाक्षः स्वकं नाम धन्वी विश्राव्य राक्षसः |
रथादाप्लुत्य दुर्धर्षो गजस्कन्धमुपारुहत् || ६-९६-१४_END
BEGIN_
While those demons, thus defeated by Sugreeva, falling on the floor and then
roaring, get diminished in number from all sides, the indomitable Virupaksha the demon, holding a
bow, pronouncing his name by himself, descended from his chariot and mounted the back of an
elephant._END

B_6_C_96_12
BEGIN_
स तन् द्विरदमारुह्य विरूपाक्षो महारथः |
विनदन्भीमनिर्ह्रालन् वानरानभ्यधावत || ६-९६-१५_END
BEGIN_
That mighty Virupaksha, mounting that elephant, then roared a terrific noise and
rushed towards the monkeys._END

B_6_C_96_13
BEGIN_
सुग्रीवे स शरान्घोरान्विससर्ज चमूमुखे |
स्थापयामासा चोद्विग्नान्राक्षसान्सम्प्रहर्षयन् || ६-९६-१६_END
BEGIN_
Virupaksha released dreadful arrows on Sugreeva who was at the front-rank of the
army. He strengthened his support to the worried demons, by cheering them up._END

B_6_C_96_14
BEGIN_
सोअतिविद्धः शितैर्बाणैः कपीन्द्रस्तेन रक्षसा |
चुक्रोध च महाक्रोधो वधे चास्य मनो दधे || ६-९६-१७_END
BEGIN_
Sugreeva, the king of monkeys, when he was struck severely with sharp arrows by that
demon, shouted loudly. With profuse anger, he set his mind on killing him._END

B_6_C_96_15
BEGIN_
ततः पादपमुद्धृत्य शूरः सम्प्रधने हरिः |
अभिपत्य जघानास्य प्रमुखे तं महागजम् || ६-९६-१८_END
BEGIN_
Uplifting a tree and coming near that huge elephant, the valiant Sugreeva, a
thorough fighter, struck it on its face._END

B_6_C_96_16
BEGIN_
स तु प्रहाराभिहतः सुग्रीवेण महागजः |
अपासर्पद्धनुर्मात्रं निषसाद ननाद च || ६-९६-१९_END
BEGIN_
That huge elephant, struck with the blow of Sugreeva, receded to a distance of four
yards, sank down and roared too._END

B_6_C_96_17
BEGIN_
गजात्तु मथितात्तूर्णमपक्रम्य स वीर्यवान् |
राक्षसोअभिमुखः शत्रुं प्रत्युद्गम्य ततः कपिम् || ६-९६-२०
आर्षभन् चर्मखड्गं च प्रगृह्य लघुविक्रमः |
भर्त्सयन्निव सुग्रीवमाससाद व्यवस्थितम् || ६-९६-२१_END
BEGIN_
Descending quickly from his wounded elephant, that valiant demon then seizing hold
of his sword from a shield made of a bull's hide and advancing in rapid paces, facing towards
Sugreeva his enemy, approached him, who stood firm, threatening him as it were._END

B_6_C_96_18
BEGIN_
स हि तस्याभिसङ्क्रुद्धः प्रगृह्य महतीन् शिलाम् |
विरूपाक्षाय चिक्षेप सुग्रीवो जलदोपमाम् || ६-९६-२२_END
BEGIN_
Taking a huge rock, which looked like a cloud, that Sugreeva, who felt enraged,
threw it on Virupaksha._END

B_6_C_96_19
BEGIN_
स तान् शिलामापतन्तीन् दृष्ट्वा राक्षसपुङ्गवः |
अपक्रम्य सुविक्रान्तः खड्गेन प्राहरत्तदा || ६-९६-२३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that rock falling, that highly valiant and excellent of demons then receding
away, struck him with a sword._END

B_6_C_96_20
BEGIN_
तेन खड्गेन सङ्क्रुद्धः सुग्रीवस्य चमूमुखे |
कवचं पातयामास स खड्गाभिहतोअपतत् || ६-९६-२४_END
BEGIN_
Wounded by the blow of the sword of that strong demon, Sugreeva became as though
unconscious on the ground, for a moment._END

B_6_C_96_21
BEGIN_
सहसा स तदोत्पत्य राक्षसस्य महाहवे |
मुष्टिं संवर्त्य वेगेन पातयामास वक्षसि || ६-९६-२५_END
BEGIN_
Then, bouncing up suddenly in that great battle, Sugreeva, tightening his fist,
brought it down on the demon's chest violently._END

B_6_C_96_22
BEGIN_
मुष्टिप्रहाराभिहतो विरूपाक्षो निशाचरः |
तेन खड्गेन संक्रुद्धः सुग्रीवस्य चमूमुखे || ६-९६-२६
कवचम् पातयामास पद्भ्यामभिहतोऽपतत् |_END
BEGIN_
Feeling enraged, when struck by the blow of that fist, Virupaksha the demon brought
down the armour of Sugreeva by his sword at the battle-front. Thus struck by him, Sugreeva fell
down from his feet._END

B_6_C_96_23
BEGIN_
स समुत्थाय पतितः कपिस्तस्य व्यसर्जयत् || ६-९६-२७
तलप्रहारमशनेः समानं भीमनिस्वनम् |_END
BEGIN_
Getting up when fallen, Sugreeva gave him a slap, which produced a terrific sound
similar to a thunder._END

B_6_C_96_24
BEGIN_
तलप्रहारन् तद्रक्षः सुग्रीवेण समुद्यतम् || ६-९६-२८
नैपुण्यान्मोचयित्वैनं मुष्टिनोरस्यताडयत् |_END
BEGIN_
Setting himself free from that slap, which was about to be raised by Sugreeva
skillfully, Virupaksha the demon struck Sugreeva on the chest with his fist._END

B_6_C_96_25
BEGIN_
ततस्तु सङ्क्रुद्धतरः सुग्रीवो वानरेश्वरः || ६-९६-२९
मोक्षितन् चात्मनो दृष्ट्वा प्रहारं तेन रक्षसा |_END
BEGIN_
Then, seeing that demon escaping his blow, Sugreeva the monkey-king for his part,
very much enraged._END

B_6_C_96_26
BEGIN_
स ददर्शान्तरन् तस्य विरूपाक्षस्य वानरः || ६-९६-३०
ततो न्यपातयत्क्रोधाच्छङ्खदेशे महातलम् |_END
BEGIN_
That monkey saw an opportunity to strike that Virupaksha. Then, with anger, Sugreeva
brought down another violent slap on his temple-bone._END

B_6_C_96_27
BEGIN_
महेन्द्राशनिकल्पेन तलेनाभिहतः क्षितौ || ६-९६-३१
पपात रुधिरक्लिन्नः शोणितन् स समुद्वमन् |
स्रोतोभ्यस्तु विरूपाक्षो जलं रस्रवणादिव || ६-९६-३२_END
BEGIN_
Virupaksha, struck by the blow of that palm, which was like the thunderbolt to the
ground, oozing blood profusely from the (nine) apertures* of his body, as water flows from the
spring._END

B_6_C_96_28
BEGIN_
विवृत्तनयनन् क्रोधात्सफेन रुधिराप्लुतम् |
ददृशुस्ते विरूपाक्षन् विरूपाक्षतरन् कृतम् || ६-९६-३३_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys saw Virupaksha, bathed in foaming blood, with his eyes rolling through
anger and as such rendered all the more deformed.*_END

B_6_C_96_29
BEGIN_
स्फुरन्तं परिवर्जन्तं पार्श्वेन रुधिरोक्षितम् |
करुणन् च विनर्दान्तं ददृशुः कपयो रिपुम् || ६-९६-३४_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys saw their enemy, bathed in blood, turning to and from as also throbbing
on his sides and roaring piteously._END

B_6_C_96_30
BEGIN_
तथा तु तौ सन्यति सम्प्रयुक्तौ |
तरस्विनौ वानरराक्षसानाम् |
बलार्णवौ सस्वनतुः सभीमं |
महार्णवौ द्वाविव भिन्नवेलौ || ६-९६-३५_END
BEGIN_
Confronting together in the battle-field in that way, those two violent and terrific
armies which were extensive as oceans, of monkeys and demons, roared like two large oceans which
had burst their bounds._END

B_6_C_96_31
BEGIN_
विनाशितं प्रेक्ष्य विरूपनेत्रं |
महाबलन् तन् हरिपार्थिवेन |
बलन् समस्तन् कपिराक्षसानाम् |
उन्मत्तगङ्गाप्रतिमं बभूव || ६-९६-३६_END
BEGIN_
Beholding that mighty Virupaksha killed by Sugreeva, the army of monkeys and demons
together looked like the agitated river of Ganga._END

B_6_C_97_0
BEGIN_
हन्यमाने बले तूर्णमन्योन्यन् ते महामृधे |
सरसीव महाघर्मे सूपक्षीणे बभूवतुः ||६-९७-१_END
BEGIN_
Being killed by each other in that major battle, those two armies were very much
diminished soon, like two lakes in a severe summer._END

B_6_C_97_1
BEGIN_
स्वबलस्य विघातेन विरूपाक्षवधेन च |
बभूव द्विगुणन् क्रुद्धो रावणो राक्षसाधिपः ||६-९७-२_END
BEGIN_
Ravana the lord of demons got doubly enraged because of the destroyal of his own
army and the fall of Virupaksha._END

B_6_C_97_2
BEGIN_
प्रक्षीणन् तु बलं दृष्ट्वा वध्यमानन् वलीमुखैः |
बभूवास्य व्यथा युद्धे प्रेक्ष्य दैवविपर्ययम् ||६-९७-३_END
BEGIN_
He felt restless to find his own army diminished while being killed by the monkeys
and to see the reversal of his fate._END

B_6_C_97_3
BEGIN_
उवाच च समीपस्थं महोदरमरिन्दमम् |
अस्मिन्काले महाबाहो जयाशा त्वयि मे स्थिता ||६-९७-४_END
BEGIN_
He spoke to Mahodara, the annihilator of enemies, standing beside him (as follows):
"O the long-armed! At this juncture, my hope for victory is centered in you."_END

B_6_C_97_4
BEGIN_
जहि शत्रुचमून् वीर दर्शयाद्य पराक्रमम् |
भर्तृपिण्डस्य कालोअयं निर्वेष्टुन् साधु युध्यताम् ||६-९७-५_END
BEGIN_
"O the brave demon! Destroy the army of our enemies. Show your prowess now. This is
the time to repay the debt of your master (received in the form of sustenance from him). Fight
well."_END

B_6_C_97_5
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तस्तथेत्युक्त्वा राक्षसेन्द्रं महोदरः |
प्रविवेशारिसेनान् स पतङ्ग इव पावकम् ||६-९७-६_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Ravana, Mahodara the chief of demons saying "So it be",
penetrated into the army of enemies, as a moth rushed into a flame._END

B_6_C_97_6
BEGIN_
ततः स कदनन् चक्रे वानराणां महाबलः |
भर्तृवाक्येन तेजस्वी स्वेन वीर्येण चोदितः ||६-९७-७_END
BEGIN_
Emboldened by the words of his master, that mighty demon, with full of energy,
destroyed the monkeys by dint of his own valour._END

B_6_C_97_7
BEGIN_
वानराश्च महासत्त्वः प्रगृह्य विपुलाः शिलाः |
प्रविश्यारिबलं भीमं जघ्नस्ते सर्वराक्षसान् ||६-९७-८_END
BEGIN_
Taking hold of huge rocks and penetrating the terrific army of enemies, those highly
strong monkeys too started killing all the demons._END

B_6_C_97_8
BEGIN_
महोदरः सुसंक्रुद्धः शरैः काज्ञ्चनभूषणैः |
चिच्चेद पाणिपादोरु वानराणां महाहवे ||६-९७-९_END
BEGIN_
In that great battle, the highly enraged Mahodara, with his arrows decked in gold,
chopped off the hands, feet and thighs of monkeys._END

B_6_C_97_9
BEGIN_
ततस्ते वानराः सर्वे राक्षसैरर्दिता भृशम् |
दिशो दश द्रुताः केचित्केचित्सुग्रीवमाश्रिताः ||६-९७-१०_END
BEGIN_
Then, among all those monkeys who were tormented by the demons, some ran away into
ten directions. Some others sought refuge with Sugreeva._END

B_6_C_97_10
BEGIN_
प्रभग्नान् समरे दृष्ट्वा वानराणां महाचमूम् |
अभिदुद्राव सुग्रीवो महोदरमनन्तरम् ||६-९७-११_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the large army of monkeys defeated in the battle, Sugreeva rushed towards
Mahodara who was immediately close to him._END

B_6_C_97_11
BEGIN_
प्रगृह्य विपुलान् घोरां महीधर समान् शिलाम् |
चिक्षेप च महातेजास्तद्वधाय हरीश्वरः ||६-९७-१२_END
BEGIN_
Seizing hold of a large and terrific rock, which looked like a mountain, Sugreeva
who was endowed with a great energy, hurled it with an aim to kill the demon._END

B_6_C_97_12
BEGIN_
तामापतन्तीन् सहसा शिलान् दृष्ट्वा महोदरः |
असम्भ्रान्तस्ततो बाणैर्निर्बिभेद दुरासदाम् ||६-९७-१३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that rock falling suddenly, Mahodara, then unagitated, tore it with his
arrows, though it was difficult to approach._END

B_6_C_97_13
BEGIN_
रक्षसा तेन बाणौघैर्निकृत्ता सा सहस्रधा |
निपपात शिलाभूमौ गृध्रचक्रमिवाकुलम् ||६-९७-१४_END
BEGIN_
That rock, broken to a thousand pieces by that demon with a multitude of his arrows,
forthwith fell down on earth, like a flock of frightened vultures._END

B_6_C_97_14
BEGIN_
तान् तु भिन्नान् शिलां दृष्ट्वा सुग्रीवः क्रोधमूर्छितः |
सालमुत्पाट्य चिक्षेप रक्षसे रणमूर्धनि ||६-९७-१५_END
BEGIN_
Filled with rage on seeing that rock broken and uprooting a Sala tree, Sugreeva
hurled it at his enemy and Mahodara chopped it off into many pieces._END

B_6_C_97_15
BEGIN_
शरैश्च विददारैनन् शूरः परपुरञ्जयः |
स ददर्श ततः क्रुद्धः परिघं पतितं भुवि ||६-९७-१६_END
BEGIN_
The valiant Mahodara, who was the tormentator of hostile forces, lacerated Sugreeva
with his arrows. That enraged Sugreeva then saw an iron rod on the ground._END

B_6_C_97_16
BEGIN_
आविध्य तु स तन् दीप्तं परिघं तस्य दर्शयन् |
परिघाग्रेण वेगेन जघानास्य हयोत्तमान् ||६-९७-१७_END
BEGIN_
Swinging that flashing iron rod and showing it to him, Sugreeva killed the excellent
horses of Mahodara with that iron rod of terrible speed._END

B_6_C_97_17
BEGIN_
तस्माद्धतहयाद्वीरः सोअवप्लुत्य महारथात् |
गदान् जग्राह सङ्क्रुद्धो राक्षसोअथ महोदरः ||६-९७-१८_END
BEGIN_
Jumping down from that huge chariot, whose horses had been killed, that valiant
Mahodara the demon, thereupon seized hold of a mace with anger._END

B_6_C_97_18
BEGIN_
गदापरिघहस्तौ तौ युधि वीरौ समीयतुः |
नर्दन्तौ गोवृषप्रख्यौ घनाविव सविद्युतौ ||६-९७-१९_END
BEGIN_
With a mace and an iron road respectively in their hands and roaring like two bulls
and resembling like two clouds charged with lightning, those two heroes closed in for a battle._END

B_6_C_97_19
BEGIN_
ततः क्रुद्धो गदां तस्य चिक्षेप रजनीचरः |
ज्वलन्तीं भास्कराभासां सुग्रीवाय महोदरः ||९७-६-२०_END
BEGIN_
Mahodara the demon was angry with Sgureeva and thereupon hurled his blazing mace,
which shone like the sun, on Sugreeva._END

B_6_C_97_20
BEGIN_
गदां तां सुमहाघोरामापतन्तीं महाबलः |
सुग्रीवो रोषताम्राक्षः समुद्यम्य महाहवे ||६-९७-२१
आजघान गदान् तस्य परिघेण हरीश्वरः |
पपात स गदोद्भिन्नः परिघस्तस्य भूतले ||६-९७-२२_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that highly terrible mace, falling on him in that great battle, the mighty
Sugreeva, the King of monkeys, was enraged with red eyes and struck that mace, by lifting up the
iron rod. That iron rod broke off and fell on the ground._END

B_6_C_97_21
BEGIN_
ततो जग्राह तेजस्वी सुग्रीवो वसुधातलात् |
आयसं मुसलन् घोरन् सर्वतो हेमभूषितम् ||६-९७-२३_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, the spirited Sugreeva took hold of a formidable steel club, entirely
decked with gold, from the earth-surface._END

B_6_C_97_22
BEGIN_
स तमुद्यम्य चिक्षेप सोऽप्यस्य प्राक्षिपद्गदाम् |
भिन्नावन्योन्यमासाद्य पेततुस्तौ महीतले ||६-९७-२४_END
BEGIN_
Lifting that steel club, Sugreeva hurled it. Mahodara too hurled another mace on
him. Those two weapons, clashing each other, broke and fell on the floor._END

B_6_C_97_23
BEGIN_
ततो भिन्नप्रहरणौ मुष्टिभ्यान् तौ समीयतुः |
तेजो बलसमाविष्टौ दीप्ताविव हुताशनौ ||६-९७-२५_END
BEGIN_
As all their weapons were broken, those two warriors, who were endowed with spirit
and strength, resembling two blazing fires, started contending with fists._END

B_6_C_97_24
BEGIN_
जघ्नतुस्तौ तदान्योन्यं नेदतुश्च पुनः पुनः |
तलैश्चान्योन्यमाहत्य पेततुर्धरणीतले ||६-९७-२६_END
BEGIN_
Roaring again and again, those two warriors then banged each other. Slapping each
other with their palms, they rolled on the earth's surface._END

B_6_C_97_25
BEGIN_
उत्पेततुस्ततस्तूर्णन् जघ्नतुश् च परस्परम् |
भुजैश्चिक्षेपतुर्वीरावन्योन्यमपराजितौ ||६-९७-२७_END
BEGIN_
They raised quickly on their feet and then began to strike each other. Remaining
unyielded, the two heroes pushed each other on their shoulders._END

B_6_C_97_26
BEGIN_
जग्मुतुस्तौ श्रमं वीरौ बाहुयुद्धे पांतपौ |
जहार च तदा खग्डमदूरपरिवर्तिनम् ||६-९७-२८
राक्षसश्चर्मणा सार्धं महावेगो महोदरः |_END
BEGIN_
Those two heroes, the annihilators their enemies, felt exhausted in the course of
their wrestling. Then the highly fast Mahodara the demon took hold of a sword and a shield, lying
not very far._END

B_6_C_97_27
BEGIN_
तथैव च महाखड्गन् चर्मणा पतितन् सह ||६-९७-२९
जग्राह वानरश्रेष्ठः सुग्रीवो वेगवत्तरः |_END
BEGIN_
In the same way, the highly swift Sugreeva the foremost of monkeys took hold of a
large sword together with a shield, lying there._END

B_6_C_97_28
BEGIN_
तौ तु रोषपरीताङ्गौ नर्दन्तावभ्यधावताम् ||६-९७-३०
उद्यतासी रणे हृष्टौ युधि शस्त्रविशारदौ |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, those two warriors, who were skilled in the use of weaponry in the
battle-field and whose limbs were seized with anger, galloped forward, roaring with joy, with their
swords upraised._END

B_6_C_97_29
BEGIN_
दक्षिणं मण्डलन् चोभौ तौ तूर्णन् सम्परीयतुः ||६-९७-३१
अन्योन्यमभिसङ्क्रुद्धौ जये प्रणिहितावुभौ |_END
BEGIN_
With their thoughts concentrated on one point of victory, both the warriors were
enraged with each other and performed circumambulations form left to right, very quickly._END

B_6_C_97_30
BEGIN_
स तु शूरो महावेगो वीर्यश्लाघी महोदरः ||६-९७-३२
महाचर्मणि तन् खड्गं पातयामास दुर्मतिः |_END
BEGIN_
That valiant and evil-minded Mahodara, who was boasting of his own prowess, let fall
with very high speed, that sword on the heavy shield of Sugreeva._END

B_6_C_97_31
BEGIN_
लग्नमुत्कर्षतः खड्गन् खड्गेन कपिकुञ्जरः ||६-९७-३३
जहार सशिरस्त्राणन् कुण्डलोपहितन् शिरः |_END
BEGIN_
Even while Mahodara was extracting his sword which had got struck in the shield,
Sugreeva severed with his own sword, Mahodara's head, which was adorned with ear-rings and
helmet._END

B_6_C_97_32
BEGIN_
निकृत्तशिरसस्तस्य पतितस्य महीतले ||६-९७-३४
तद्बलन् राक्षसेन्द्रस्य दृष्ट्वा तत्र न तिष्ठति |_END
BEGIN_
While Mahodara, with his head chopped off, was falling on the ground, Ravana's army,
on seeing it, could no longer be seen on the battle-field._END

B_6_C_97_33
BEGIN_
हत्वा तन् वानरैः सार्धं ननाद मुदितो हरिः ||६-९७-३५
चुक्रोध च दशग्रीवो बभौ हृष्टश्च राघवः |_END
BEGIN_
Having killed Mahodara, Sugreeva made a rejoicing roar with his monkeys. Ravana was
enraged. Rama looked rejoicing._END

B_6_C_97_34
BEGIN_
विषण्णवदनाः सर्वे राक्षसा दीनचेतसः ||६-९७-३६
विद्रवन्ति ततः सर्वे भयवित्रस्तचेतसः |_END
BEGIN_
With their faces looking low-spirited all the demons felt dejected. With their minds
stricken with fear, all of them ran away from the battle-field._END

B_6_C_97_35
BEGIN_
महोदरं तं विनिपात्य भूमौ |
महागिरेः कीर्णमिवैकदेशम् |
सूर्यात्मजस्तत्र रराज लक्ष्म्या |
सूर्यः स्वतेजोभिरिवाप्रधृष्यः ||६-९७-३७_END
BEGIN_
Having thrown down to the ground that Mahodara, looking like a part of a huge
mountain lying shattered the invincible Sugreeva shone in glory in the battle-field like the sun
shines with its rays._END

B_6_C_97_36
BEGIN_
अथ विजयमवाप्य वानरेन्द्रः |
समरमुखे सुरसिद्धयक्षसंघैः |
अवनितलगतैश्च भूतसंघै |
र्हरुषसमाकुलितैर्निरीक्ष्यमाणः ||६-९७-३८_END
BEGIN_
Having attained victory in the battle-front, Sugreeva then continued to be looked at
by the multitude of gods, Siddhas (a class of demigods who are endowed with mystic powers) and
Yakshas (another class of demigods attending on Kubera, the god of riches) as also a host of beings
standing on the earth's surface who were all overwhelmed with joy._END

B_6_C_98_0
BEGIN_
महोदरे तु निहते महापार्श्वो महाबलः |
सुग्रीवेण समीक्ष्याथ क्रोधात्संरक्तलोचनः ||६-९८-१
अङ्गदस्य चमूं भीमान् क्षोभयामास सायकैः |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Mahodara killed by Sugreeva, the mighty Mahaparsva for his part with his
red-blood eyes through anger, forthwith stirred up the terrific army of Angada with his arrows._END

B_6_C_98_1
BEGIN_
स वानराणां मुख्यानामुत्तमाङ्गानि सर्वशः ||६-९८-२
पातयामास कायेभ्यः फलन् वृन्तादिवानिलः |_END
BEGIN_
That demon struck down the heads of monkey-chiefs from their trunks, as wind would
throw down a fruit from its stalk._END

B_6_C_98_2
BEGIN_
केषान् चिदिषुभिर्बाहून्स्कन्धांश्चिछेद राक्षसः ||६-९८-३
वानराणान् सुसङ्क्रुद्धः पार्श्वन् केषां व्यदारयत् |_END
BEGIN_
Moreover, that demon very quickly chopped off the arms of some monkeys with his
arrows and struck down the region of the ribs of others._END

B_6_C_98_3
BEGIN_
तेअर्दिता बाणवर्षेण महापार्श्वेन वानराः ||६-९८-४
विषादविमुखाः सर्वे बभूवुर्गतचेतसः |_END
BEGIN_
Tormented by the flight of arrows of Mahaparshva, all those monkeys were downcast
with despair and lost heart._END

B_6_C_98_4
BEGIN_
निरीक्ष्य बलमुद्विग्नमङ्गदो राक्षसार्दितम् ||६-९८-५
वेगन् चक्रे महाबाहुः समुद्र इव पर्वणि |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing his army depressed on being tormented by the demon, Angada who was endowed
with a great impetuosity, exhibited his tempo like an ocean on full-moon days._END

B_6_C_98_5
BEGIN_
आयसं परिघन् गृह्य सूर्यरश्मिसमप्रभम् ||६-९८-६
समरे वानरश्रेष्ठो महापार्श्वे न्यपातयत् |_END
BEGIN_
Taking hold of a steel rod, with its radiance equal to that of the sun, hurled it on
Mahaparshva in that combat._END

B_6_C_98_6
BEGIN_
स तु तेन प्रहारेण महापार्श्वो विचेतनः ||६-९८-७
ससूतः स्यन्दनात्तस्माद्विसन्ज्ञः प्रापतद्भुवि |_END
BEGIN_
By that blow, that Mahaparsva dropped senseless and unconscious on the ground from
his chariot along with is charioteer_END

B_6_C_98_7
BEGIN_
यस्यर्क्षराजस्तु तेजस्वी नीलाज्ञनचयोपमः ||६-९८-८
निष्पत्य सुमहावीर्यः स्वाद्यूथान्मेघसंनिभात् |
प्रगृह्य गिरिशृङ्गाभान् क्रुद्धः स विपुलान् शिलाम् ||६-९८-९
अश्वाञ्जघान तरसा स्यन्दनन् च बभञ्ज तम् |_END
BEGIN_
The energetic Jambavan, looking like a heap of black collyrium, who was exceedingly
powerful, battalion which resembled a black cloud a mountain-peak, killed his horses with his
strength and broke that chariot too._END

B_6_C_98_8
BEGIN_
मुहूर्ताल्लब्धसन्ज्ञस्तु महापार्श्वो महाबलः ||६-९८-१०
अङ्गदं बहुभिर्बाणैर्भूयस्तं प्रत्यविध्यत |_END
BEGIN_
Regaining his consciousness within a while, the mighty Mahaparshva again struck
Angada with his many arrows._END

B_6_C_98_9
BEGIN_
जाम्बवन्तन् त्रिभिर्बाणैराजघान स्तनान्तरे ||६-९८-११
ऋक्षराजन् गवाक्षं च जघान बहुभिः शरैः |_END
BEGIN_
He struck Jambavan, the king of bears with three arrows in his chest and struck
Gavaksha too with many arrows._END

B_6_C_98_10
BEGIN_
गवाक्षन् जाम्बवन्तं च स दृष्ट्वा शरपीडितौ ||६-९८-१२
जग्राह परिघन् घोरमङ्गदः क्रोधमूर्छितः |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Gavaksha and Jambavan tormented by the arrows, that Angada was infatuated
with anger and seized hold of a terrific iron rod._END

B_6_C_98_11
BEGIN_
तस्याङ्गदः प्रकुपितो राक्षसस्य तमायसं ||६-९८-१३
दूरस्थितस्य परिघन् रविरश्मिसमप्रभम् |
द्वाभ्यां भुजाभ्यान् सङ्गृह्य भ्रामयित्वा च वेगवान् ||६-९८-१४
महापार्श्वाय चिक्षेप वधार्थन् वालिनः सुतः |_END
BEGIN_
Firmly holding that iron rod, which shone like the rays of the sun, with both hands
and turning it around with force, Angada son of Vali, his eyes red with anger, hurled it on that
Mahaparshva the demon, who stood at a distance, with an intention to kill him._END

B_6_C_98_12
BEGIN_
स तु क्षिप्तो बलवता परिघस्तस्य रक्षसः ||६-९८-१५
धनुश्च सशरन् हस्ताच्छिरस्त्रन् चाप्यपातयत् |_END
BEGIN_
Hurled by the mighty Angada, that iron rod for its part, knocked the bow with the
arrow fitted to it, from the demon's hand and also his helmet._END

B_6_C_98_13
BEGIN_
तन् समासाद्य वेगेन वालिपुत्रः प्रतापवान् ||६-९८-१६
तलेनाभ्यहनत्क्रुद्धः कर्णमूले सकुण्डले |_END
BEGIN_
Approaching him with speed and with anger, the valiant Angada slapped him on the
temple (root of the ear), shining with an ear-ring._END

B_6_C_98_14
BEGIN_
स तु क्रुद्धो महावेगो महापार्श्वो महाद्युतिः ||६-९८-१७
करेणैकेन जग्राह सुमहान्तं परश्वधम् |_END
BEGIN_
Enraged as he was, that Mahaparsva for his part, who was endowed with a great
swiftness and enormous splendour, seized hold of a huge axe in one hand._END

B_6_C_98_15
BEGIN_
तन् तैलधौतन् विमलं शैलसारमयं दृढम् ||६-९८-१८
राक्षसः परमक्रुद्धो वालिपुत्रे न्यपातयत् |_END
BEGIN_
Extremely enraged, the demon hurled that stainless and strong axe, which had been
washed in oil and which was made of steel, on Angada._END

B_6_C_98_16
BEGIN_
तेन वामान्सफलके भृशं प्रत्यवपातितम् ||६-९८-१९
अङ्गदो मोक्षयामास सरोषः स परश्वधम् |_END
BEGIN_
Full of anger, that Angada evaded that axe, which had been aimed by him mostly at
his left shoulder-bone._END

B_6_C_98_17
BEGIN_
स वीरो वज्रसङ्काशमङ्गदो मुष्टिमात्मनः ||६-९८-२०
सन्वर्तयन्सुसङ्क्रुद्धः पितुस्तुल्यपराक्रमः |_END
BEGIN_
That valiant Angada, with his prowess equal to that of his father, was quite enraged
and firmly tightened his fist resembling a thunder-bolt._END

B_6_C_98_18
BEGIN_
राक्षसस्य स्तनाभ्याशे मर्मज्ञो हृदयं प्रति ||६-९८-२१
इन्द्राशनिसमस्पर्शन् स मुष्टिं विन्यपातयत् |_END
BEGIN_
Knowing the vital parts of the body, Angada pounced his fist, which invaded like a
thunderbolt, on the boson of the demon, in the vicinity of his breasts._END

B_6_C_98_19
BEGIN_
तेन तस्य निपातेन राक्षसस्य महामृधे ||६-९८-२२
पफाल हृदयन् चाशु स पपात हतो भुवि |_END
BEGIN_
With the blow of that fist in that great combat, the fleshy part of his heart was
blasted and he fell dead on the ground._END

B_6_C_98_20
BEGIN_
तस्मिन्निपतिते भूमौ तत्सैन्यन् सम्प्रचुक्षुभे ||६-९८-२३
अभवच्च महान्क्रोधः समरे रावणस्य तु |_END
BEGIN_
When Mahaparshva fell dead on the ground, his army got confused. A mammoth anger
arose in Ravana._END

B_6_C_98_21
BEGIN_
वानराणां प्रहृष्टानां सिंहनादः सुपुष्कलः ||६-९८-२४
स्फोटयन्निव शब्देन लङ्कां साट्टालगोपुराम् |
सहेन्द्रेणेव देवानां नादः समभवन्महान् ||६-९८-२५_END
BEGIN_
That highly profound lion's roar of the rejoiced monkeys, by its noise, was well
like the loud sound of the gods along with Indra the lord celestials, nay, by its vibrations
breaking asunder as it were the City of Lanka with its attics and town-gates._END

B_6_C_98_22
BEGIN_
अथेन्द्रशत्रुस्त्रिदशालयानां |
वनौकसां चव महाप्रणादम् |
श्रुत्वा सरोषं युद्दि राक्षसेन्द्रः |
पुनश्च युद्धाभिमुखोऽवतस्थे ||६-९८-२६_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the loud noise of monkeys, as also of the celestials in the battle-field,
the enraged Ravana the adversary of Indra, then stood prepared for a battle again._END

B_6_C_99_0
BEGIN_
महोदरमहापार्श्वौ हतौ दृष्ट्वा तु राक्षसौ |
तस्मिंश्च निहते वीरे विरूपाक्षे महाबले || ६-९९-१
आविवेश महान्क्रोधो रावणन् तु महामृधे |
सूतन् सञ्चोदयामास वाक्यन् चेदमुवाच ह || ६-९९-२_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Mahodara and Mahaparshva the demons having been killed, and that valiant and
mighty Virupaksha struck down in that great battle, a tremendous anger took possession of Ravana.
He urged on his charioteer and addressed to him the following words:_END

B_6_C_99_1
BEGIN_
निहतानाममात्यानान् रुद्धस्य नगरस्य च |
दुःखमेषोअपनेष्यामि हत्वा तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ || ६-९९-३_END
BEGIN_
"Killing those two princes, Rama and Lakshmana, I will remove surely the sorrow
caused to me on account of the ministers who have been killed and the city which has been laid
siege to (by the monkeys)."_END

B_6_C_99_2
BEGIN_
रामवृक्षन् रणे हन्मि सीतापुष्पफलप्रदम् |
प्रशाखा यस्य सुग्रीवो जाम्बवान्कुमुदो नलः || ६-९९-४
स दिशो दश घोषेण रथस्यातिरथो महान् |
नादयन्प्रययौ तूर्णन् राघवन् चाभ्यवर्तत || ६-९९-५_END
BEGIN_
"In the battle, I will cut down the tree in the shape of Rama, which is going to
yield fruit through its flower in the form of Seetha, whose principal branches are Sugreeva,
Jambavan, Kumuda, Nala, Dvivida, Mainda, Angada, Gandhamadana, Hanuma, Sushena and all the chiefs
of monkey-warriors."_END

B_6_C_99_3
BEGIN_
पूरिता तेन शब्देन सनदीगिरिकानना |
सञ्चचाल मही सर्वा सवराहमृगद्विपा || ६-९९-६_END
BEGIN_
Ravana, the mighty and the surpassing Chariot-Warrior, went quickly, making a noise
in all the ten directions, with the sound of the chariot, rushing towards Rama._END

B_6_C_99_4
BEGIN_
तामसन् सुमहाघोरन् चकारास्त्रं सुदारुणम् |
निर्ददाह कपीन्सर्वान्स्ते प्रपेतुः समन्ततः || ६-९९-७_END
BEGIN_
Filled with that sound, the entire earth, with its rivers, mountains and forests,
trembled, throwing lions, antelopes and birds, into fright._END

B_6_C_99_5
BEGIN_
तान्यनीकान्यनेकानि रावणस्य शरोत्तमैः |
दृष्ट्वा भग्नानि शतशो राघवः पर्यवस्थितः || ६-९९-८_END
BEGIN_
He employed very highly terrific and exceedingly frightful mystic missile called
Tamasa, which began to consume all the monkeys, who started falling down on all sides._END

B_6_C_99_6
BEGIN_
उत्पपात रजो भूमौ तैर्भग्नै संप्रधावितैः |
न हि तत्सहितुं शेकुर्ब्रह्मणा निर्मितं स्वयम् || ६-९९-९_END
BEGIN_
Dust began to fly up from the earth, while those frustrated monkeys were fleeing
away for they could no longer bear that missile built by Brahma himself._END

B_6_C_99_7
BEGIN_
तान्यनीकान्यनेकानि रावणस्य शरोत्तमैः |
दृषःट्वा भग्नानि शतशो राघवः पर्यवस्थितः || ६-९९-१०_END
BEGIN_
Seeing those hundreds of many of his armies shattered by excellent arrows of Ravana,
Rama took his stand, ready for the battle._END

B_6_C_99_8
BEGIN_
ततो राक्षसशार्दूलो विद्राव्य हरिवाहिनीम् |
स ददर्श ततो रामन् तिष्ठन्तमपराजितम् || ६-९९-११
लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा विष्णुना वासवन् यथा |
आलिखन्तमिवाकाशमवष्टभ्य महद्धनुः || ६-९९-१२
पद्मपत्रविशालाक्षन् दीर्घबाहुमरिन्दमम् |_END
BEGIN_
Having driven away the army of monkeys, Ravana the foremost among the demons then
saw Rama, the annihilator of his enemies, who was endowed with long arms and eyes as wide as lotus
petals standing unconquered with his brother Lakshmana-like Indra the lord of celestials is seen
with Vishnu, the supreme lord of preservation-holding up his great bow as though scraping the
sky._END

B_6_C_99_9
BEGIN_
ततो रामो महातेजाः सौमित्रिसहितो बली || ६-९९-१३
वानरांश्च रणे भग्नानापतन्तन् च रावणम् |
समीक्ष्य राघवो हृष्टो मध्ये जग्राह कार्मुकम् || ६-९९-१४_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the disappointed monkeys and Ravana advancing, the mighty Rama who was
endowed with a great splendour and accompanied by Lakshmana who were born in Raghu dynasty, then
pleasingly seized his bow at the middle._END

B_6_C_99_10
BEGIN_
विस्फारयितुमारेभे ततः स धनुरुत्तमम् |
महावेगं महानादं निर्भिन्दन्निव मेदिनीम् || ६-९९-१५_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Rama began to stretch his excellent bow, which was endowed with great
force and sonorous, as though he was breaking the earth asunder._END

B_6_C_99_11
BEGIN_
रावणस्य च बाणौघै रामविस्फारितेन च |
शब्देन राक्षसास्तेन पेतुश्च शतशस्तदा || ६-९९-१६_END
BEGIN_
Then, due to that buzzing sound produced by the streams of Ravana's arrows as also
by the twang of Rama's bow, those demons fell down in their hundreds._END

B_6_C_99_12
BEGIN_
तयोः शरपथं प्राप्य रावणो राजपुत्रयोः |
स बभूव यथा राहुः समीपे शशिसूर्ययोः || ६-९९-१७_END
BEGIN_
That Ravana, coming within the range of arrow-shots of Rama and Lakshmana, resembled
Rahu (the demon who is supposed to seize the sun and the moon), standing in the vicinity of the
moon and the sun._END

B_6_C_99_13
BEGIN_
तमिच्छन्प्रथमन् योद्धुं लक्ष्मणो निशितैः शरैः |
मुमोच धनुरायम्य शरानग्निशिखोपमान् || ६-९९-१८_END
BEGIN_
Wishing to fight him with his sharp arrows at the earliest, Lakshmana stretching his
bow, released his arrows which were like flames of fire._END

B_6_C_99_14
BEGIN_
तान्मुक्तमात्रानाकाशे लक्ष्मणेन धनुष्मता |
बाणान्बाणैर्महातेजा रावणः प्रत्यवारयत् || ६-९९-१९_END
BEGIN_
Ravana of extra ordinary energy prevented those arrows, the moment they were
released by Lakshmana, with his arrows, in the sky itself._END

B_6_C_99_15
BEGIN_
एकमेकेन बाणेन त्रिभिस्त्रीन्दशभिर्दश |
लक्ष्मणस्य प्रचिच्छेद दर्शयन्पाणिलाघवम् || ६-९९-२०_END
BEGIN_
Showing the dexterity of his hand, Ravana split the arrows of Lakshmana one with
one, three with three and ten with ten arrows._END

B_6_C_99_16
BEGIN_
अभ्यतिक्रम्य सौमित्रिन् रावणः समितिञ्जयः |
आससाद ततो रामन् स्थितं शैलमिवाचलम् || ६-९९-२१_END
BEGIN_
Overpassing Lakshmana, Ravana the victorious in battle, approached Rama, who stood
like another mountain, in the battle-field._END

B_6_C_99_17
BEGIN_
स सङ्ख्ये राममासाद्य क्रोधसन्रक्तलोचनः |
व्यसृजच्छरवर्णानि रावणो राघवोपरि || ६-९९-२२_END
BEGIN_
Having approached Rama, Ravana the lord of demons, having his eyes turning red-blood
through anger, released streams of arrows upon him._END

B_6_C_99_18
BEGIN_
शरधारास्ततो रामो रावणस्य धनुश्च्युताः |
दृष्ट्वैवापतिताः शीघ्रं भल्लाञ्जग्राह सत्वरम् || ६-९९-२३_END
BEGIN_
Just on seeing streams of arrows coming forth, loosed from Ravana's bow, Rama
thereupon quickly seized hold of 'Bhalla'* arrows in haste._END

B_6_C_99_19
BEGIN_
ताञ्शरौघान्स्ततो भल्लैस्तीक्ष्णैश्चिच्छेद राघवः |
दीप्यमानान्महावेगान्क्रुद्धानाशीविषानिव || ६-९९-२४_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama tore off that multitude of arrows, which were blazing and looking very
terrific like enraged serpents, with his sharp Bhalla - arrows._END

B_6_C_99_20
BEGIN_
राघवो रावणन् तूर्णन् रावणो राघवं तथा |
अन्योन्यन् विविधैस्तीक्ष्णैः शरैरभिववर्षतुः || ६-९९-२५_END
BEGIN_
Rama on Ravana and Ravana on Rama, quickly showered each other with streams of
sharp-pointed arrows of various kinds._END

B_6_C_99_21
BEGIN_
चेरतुश्च चिरन् चित्रं मण्डलन् सव्यदक्षिणम् |
बाणवेगान्समुदीक्ष्य समरेष्वपराजितौ || ६-९९-२६_END
BEGIN_
Pushing back each other with the velocity of their arrows and remaining undefeated,
the two warriors described circles of different kinds each moving from left to right, for a long
time._END

B_6_C_99_22
BEGIN_
तयोर्भूतानि वित्रेषुर्युगपत्सम्प्रयुध्यतोः |
रौद्रयोः सायकमुचोर्यमान्तकनिकाशयोः || ६-९९-२७_END
BEGIN_
Created beings were frightened, even as both the terrific warriors were fighting all
at once, releasing their arrows at each other, thus resembling the god of retribution and the god
of Death respectively._END

B_6_C_99_23
BEGIN_
सन्ततन् विविधैर्बाणैर्बभूव गगनन् तदा |
घनैरिवातपापाये विद्युन्मालासमाकुलैः || ६-९९-२८_END
BEGIN_
The sky at that time became dense with arrows of various kinds, even as it is
covered, at the end of the monsoon, with clouds crowded with crowns of lightning._END

B_6_C_99_24
BEGIN_
गवाक्षितमिवाकाशं बभूव शूरवृष्टिभिः |
महावेगैः सुतीक्ष्णाग्रैर्गृध्रपत्रैः सुवाजितैः || ६-९९-२९_END
BEGIN_
The sky was studded as with eye-holes, by showers of arrows of high velocity, which
were extremely sharp-pointed and adorned with plumes of vultures and were loosed with high
speed._END

B_6_C_99_25
BEGIN_
शरान्धकारन् तौ भीमं चक्रतुः परमं तदा |
गतेअस्तन् तपने चापि महामेघाविवोत्थितौ || ६-९९-३०_END
BEGIN_
They initially made the sky dark with arrows. Even after the sun-set, they made it
dark, like two huge clouds risen in it._END

B_6_C_99_26
BEGIN_
तयोरभून्महद्युद्धमन्योन्यवधकाङ्क्षिणोः |
अनासाद्यमचिन्त्यन् च वृत्रवासवयोरिव || ६-९९-३१_END
BEGIN_
A great combat ensued between both of them, who were willing to kill each other.
That battle was unimaginable and unapproachable, like the duel that took place between Vritra the
demon and Indra the lord of celestials._END

B_6_C_99_27
BEGIN_
उभौ हि परमेष्वासावुभौ शस्त्रविशारदौ |
उभौ चास्त्रविदां मुख्यावुभौ युद्धे विचेरतुः || ६-९९-३२_END
BEGIN_
Both the warriors were excellent archers. Both were skilled in war-fare. Both were
eminently skilled in the use of missiles. Both moved unhindered in the battle-field._END

B_6_C_99_28
BEGIN_
उभौ हि येन व्रजतस्तेन तेन शरोर्मयः |
ऊर्मयो वायुना विद्धा जग्मुः सागरयोरिव || ६-९९-३३_END
BEGIN_
In whichever course both of them went, in the same respective direction, streams of
arrows went, like waves in two oceans, whipped by the wind._END

B_6_C_99_29
BEGIN_
ततः सन्सक्तहस्तस्तु रावणो लोकरावणः |
नाराचमालान् रामस्य ललाटे प्रत्यमुञ्चत || ६-९९-३४_END
BEGIN_
Ravana, having skilful hands and a cause for the cry of the world, released a row of
steel arrows on Rama's forehead._END

B_6_C_99_30
BEGIN_
रौद्रचापप्रयुक्तान् तां नीलोत्पलदलप्रभाम् |
शिरसा धारयन्रामो न व्यथां प्रत्यपद्यत || ६-९९-३५_END
BEGIN_
Rama endured on his head, that row of steel arrows, having a lustre of black
lotus-petals, discharged from the terrific bow. He did not get perturbed._END

B_6_C_99_31
BEGIN_
अथ मन्त्रानपि जपन्रौद्रमस्त्रमुदीरयन् |
शरान्भूयः समादाय रामः क्रोधसमन्वितः || ६-९९-३६
मुमोच च महातेजाश्चापमायम्य वीर्यवान् |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, seizing hold of more arrows, reciting sacred incantations and making use
of the missile presided over by Rudra and stretching his bow, the valiant Rama of great splendour
was filled with anger and released those arrows._END

B_6_C_99_32
BEGIN_
ते महामेघसङ्काशे कवचे पतिताः शराः || ६-९९-३७
अवध्ये राक्षसेन्द्रस्य न व्यथान् जनयन्स्तदा |_END
BEGIN_
Fallen on the unbreakable armour of Ravana, which looked like a large cloud, those
arrows could not cause any pain to him at that time._END

B_6_C_99_33
BEGIN_
पुनरेवाथ तन् रामो रथस्थं राक्षसाधिपम् || ६-९९-३८
ललाटे परमास्त्रेण सर्वास्त्रकुशलोअभिनत् |_END
BEGIN_
Rama, who was skilled in the use of all types of mystic missiles, forthwith pierced
in the forehead, yet again by a paramount missile, that Ravana seated in his chariot._END

B_6_C_99_34
BEGIN_
ते भित्त्वा बाणरूपाणि पञ्चशीर्षा इवोरगाः || ६-९९-३९
श्वसन्तो विविशुर्भूमिन् रावणप्रतिकूलताः |_END
BEGIN_
Having pierced the frames of arrows of Ravana, Rama's arrows penetrated like
five-headed hissing serpents into the earth, when rebuffed by Ravana._END

B_6_C_99_35
BEGIN_
निहत्य राघवस्यास्त्रन् रावणः क्रोधमूर्छितः || ६-९९-४०
आसुरन् सुमहाघोरमन्यदस्त्रं समाददे |_END
BEGIN_
Striking down Rama's missile, that Ravana, who was stupefied with anger, employed
another exceedingly terrific missile presided over by demoniac forces._END

B_6_C_99_36
BEGIN_
सिन्हव्याघ्रमुखांश्चान्यान्कङ्ककाक मुखानपि || ६-९९-४१
गृध्रश्येनमुखांश्चापि सृगालवदनान्स्तथा |
ईहामृगमुहांश्चान्यान्व्यादितास्यान्भयावहान् || ६-९९-४२
पञ्चास्याण्ल्लेलिहानांश्च ससर्ज निशिताञ्शरान् |_END
BEGIN_
He released sharp arrows, having the heads of lions and tigers, those of buzzards
and crows, even of vultures and faloons, as well as those of jackals and wolves, arrows with their
mouths wide open, having the heads of venomous snakes with five heads, bringing fear._END

B_6_C_99_37
BEGIN_
शरान्खरमुखांश्चान्यान्वराहमुखसन्स्थितान् || ६-९९-४३
श्वानकुक्कुटवक्त्रांश्च मकराशीविषाननान् |
एतांश्चान्यांश्च मायाभिः ससर्ज निशिताञ्शरान् || ६-९९-४४
रामं प्रति महातेजाः क्रुद्धः सर्प इव श्वसन् |_END
BEGIN_
Hissing like a serpent provoked to anger Ravana who was endowed with extraordinary
energy and conjuring tricks, released towards Rama these and other arrows, having the heads of
donkeys, those of boars, dogs and cocks as also of alligators and venomous snakes._END

B_6_C_99_38
BEGIN_
आसुरेण समाविष्टः सोअस्त्रेण रघुनन्दनः || ६-९९-४५
ससर्जास्त्रं महोत्साहः पावकं पावकोपमः |_END
BEGIN_
Possessed by a missile presided over by demoniac forces, that Rama endowed with a
great strength and resembling the god of fire, released a missile presided over by the god of
fire._END

B_6_C_99_39
BEGIN_
अग्निदीप्तमुखान्बाणान्स्तथा सूर्यमुखानपि || ६-९९-४६
चन्द्रार्धचन्द्रवक्त्रांश्च धूमकेतुमुखानपि |
ग्रहनक्षत्रवर्णांश्च महोल्का मुखसन्स्थितान् || ६-९९-४७
विद्युज्जिह्वोपमांश्चान्यान्ससर्ज निशिताञ्शरान् |_END
BEGIN_
Rama employed there, various kinds of arrows, with heads bright as fire, others with
heads shining like the sun, the moon, the crescent, a comet, others shining like planets, lunar
mansions and a huge meteor and some arrows resembling flashes of lightning._END

B_6_C_99_40
BEGIN_
ते रावणशरा घोरा राघवास्त्रसमाहताः || ६-९९-४८
विलयन् जग्मुराकाशे जग्मुश्चैव सहस्रशः |_END
BEGIN_
Struck by Rama's missile, the terrific arrows of Ravana got destroyed in the sky and
fell down in thousands of pieces._END

B_6_C_99_41
BEGIN_
तदस्त्रं निहतन् दृष्ट्वा रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा || ६-९९-४९
हृष्टा नेदुस्ततः सर्वे कपयः कामरूपिणः |
सुग्रीवाभिमुखा वीराः संपरिक्षिप्य रागवम् || ६-९९-५०_END
BEGIN_
Rejoiced to see that missile struck down by Rama, who was unweary in action, all the
valiant monkeys, who were capable of changing their form at will, then encompassing Rama, raised a
clamour, facing Sugreeva._END

B_6_C_99_42
BEGIN_
ततस्तदस्त्रं विनिहत्य राघवः |
प्रसह्य तद्रावणबाहुनिःसृतम् |
मुदान्वितो दाशरथिर्महात्मा |
विनेदुरुच्चैर्मुदिताः कपीश्वरा || ६-९९-५१_END
BEGIN_
Striking down with force that missile which came forth from Ravana's arms, the
great-souled Rama, then was filled with rejoice while the chiefs of monkeys, full f joy, shouted
loudly._END

B_6_C_100_0
BEGIN_
तस्मिन्प्रतिहतेअस्त्रे तु रावणो राक्षसाधिपः |
क्रोधन् च द्विगुणं चक्रे क्रोधाच्चास्त्रमनन्तरम् || ६-१००-१_END
BEGIN_
When that missile was made defunct, Ravana the king of demons, for his part, doubled
his fury and in his anger, began to employ another missile immediately._END

B_6_C_100_1
BEGIN_
मयेन विहितन् रौद्रमन्यदस्त्रं महाद्युतिः |
उत्स्रष्टुन् रावणो घोरं राघवाय प्रचक्रमे || ६-१००-२_END
BEGIN_
Ravana, who was endowed with extraordinary splendour, started to release another
cruel and terrific missile built by Maya the demon, on Rama._END

B_6_C_100_2
BEGIN_
ततः शूलानि निश्चेरुर्गदाश्च मुसलानि च |
कार्मुकाद्दीप्यमानानि वज्रसाराणि सर्वशः || ६-१००-३_END
BEGIN_
Then, from that bow, came forth, blazing pikes, maces and clubs, which were hard as
adamant, on all sides._END

B_6_C_100_3
BEGIN_
मुद्गरः कूटपाशाश्च दीप्ताश्चाशनयस्तथा |
निष्पेतुर्विविधास्तीक्ष्णा वाता इव युगक्षये || ६-१००-४_END
BEGIN_
Various kinds of furious mallets, deceptive nooses and blazing thunderbolts came
forth, like piercing gales at the time of the destruction of the world._END

B_6_C_100_4
BEGIN_
तदस्त्रन् राघवः श्रीमानुत्तमास्त्रविदां वरः |
जघान परमास्त्रेण गन्धर्वेण महाद्युतिः || ६-१००-५_END
BEGIN_
The glorious Rama, the foremost among the knower in the use of excellent missiles
and who was endowed with extra ordinary splendour, struck down that missile with an excellent
missile presided over by Gandharvas the celestial musicians._END

B_6_C_100_5
BEGIN_
तस्मिन्प्रतिहतेअस्त्रे तु राघवेण महात्मना |
रावणः क्रोधताम्राक्षः सौरमस्त्रमुदीरयत् || ६-१००-६_END
BEGIN_
When that missile was made defunct by the great souled Rama, Ravana with his coppery
eyes in anger, employed a missile presided over by the sun-god._END

B_6_C_100_6
BEGIN_
ततश्चक्राणि निष्पेतुर्भास्वराणि महान्ति च |
कार्मुकाद्भीमवेगस्य दशग्रीवस्य धीमतः || ६-१००-७_END
BEGIN_
Then came forth resplendent and large discuses, from the bow of that intelligent
Ravana, of terrific impetuosity._END

B_6_C_100_7
BEGIN_
तैरासीद्गगनन् दीप्तन् सम्पतद्भिरितस्ततः |
पतद्भिश्च दिशो दीप्तैश्चन्द्रसूर्यग्रहैरिव || ६-१००-८_END
BEGIN_
Even as they came forth and falling on all sides, the sky was blazing and the
quarters illuminated, as by the moon, the sun and other planets._END

B_6_C_100_8
BEGIN_
तानि चिच्छेद बाणौघैश्चक्राणि तु स राघवः |
आयुधानि विचित्राणि रावणस्य चमूमुखे || ६-१००-९_END
BEGIN_
In the forefront of Ravana's army, that Rama split those discuses and other strange
weapons, with a multitude of arrows._END

B_6_C_100_9
BEGIN_
तदस्त्रन् तु हतं दृष्ट्वा रावणो राक्षसाधिपः |
विव्याध दशभिर्बाणै रामन् सर्वेषु मर्मसु || ६-१००-१०_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that missile struck down, Ravana the king of demons, for his part, pierced
Rama with ten arrows in all his vital parts._END

B_6_C_100_10
BEGIN_
स विद्धो दशभिर्बाणैर्महाकार्मुकनिःसृतैः |
रावणेन महातेजा न प्राकम्पत राघवः || ६-१००-११_END
BEGIN_
Eventhough that Ravana struck Rama with those ten arrows released from his great
bow, Rama of extraordinary energy was not shaken._END

B_6_C_100_11
BEGIN_
ततो विव्याध गात्रेषु सर्वेषु समितिञ्जयः |
राघवस्तु सुसङ्क्रुद्धो रावणं बहुभिः शरैः || ६-१००-१२_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama the victorious in battle, was quite enraged and struck Ravana in all his
organs with a multitude of arrows._END

B_6_C_100_12
BEGIN_
एतस्मिन्नन्तरे क्रुद्धो राघवस्यानुजो बली |
लक्ष्मणः सायकान्सप्त जग्राह परवीरहा || ६-१००-१३_END
BEGIN_
In the meantime, the mighty and enraged Lakshmana, Rama's younger brother, the
destroyer of valiant enemies, seized hold of seven arrows._END

B_6_C_100_13
BEGIN_
तैः सायकैर्महावेगै रावणस्य महाद्युतिः |
ध्वजं मनुष्यशीर्षन् तु तस्य चिच्छेद नैकधा || ६-१००-१४_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana of great brilliance, with those arrows of high velocity, tore off into
many pieces, the flag-staff of Ravana, which bore the emblem of a man's head._END

B_6_C_100_14
BEGIN_
सारथेश्चापि बाणेन शिरो ज्वलितकुण्डलम् |
जहार लक्ष्मणः श्रीमान्नैरृतस्य महाबलः || ६-१००-१५_END
BEGIN_
The glorious and mighty Lakshmana, with a single arrow, tore the head of Ravana's
charioteer, which was adorned with blazing ear-rings._END

B_6_C_100_15
BEGIN_
तस्य बाणैश् च चिच्छेद धनुर्गजकरोपमम् |
लक्ष्मणो राक्षसेन्द्रस्य पञ्चभिर्निशितैः शरैः || ६-१००-१६_END
BEGIN_
With five sharp arrows, Lakshmana then chopped off Ravana's bow, which looked like
an elephant's trunk._END

B_6_C_100_16
BEGIN_
नीलमेघनिभांश्चास्य सदश्वान्पर्वतोपमान् |
जघानाप्लुत्य गदया रावणस्य विभीषणः || ६-१००-१७_END
BEGIN_
Bouncing forward, Vibhishana killed, with his mace, the excellent horses of Ravana,
which looked like black clouds and were tall as mountains._END

B_6_C_100_17
BEGIN_
हताश्वाद्वेगवान्वेगादवप्लुत्य महारथात् |
क्रोधमाहारयत्तीव्रं भ्रातरं प्रति रावणः || ६-१००-१८_END
BEGIN_
Leaping down with speed from his large chariot, whose horses had been killed, Ravana
then exhibited a violent anger towards the younger brother of Rama._END

B_6_C_100_18
BEGIN_
ततः शक्तिं महाशक्तिर्दीप्तान् दीप्ताशनीम् इव |
विभीषणाय चिक्षेप राक्षसेन्द्रः प्रतापवान् || ६-१००-१९_END
BEGIN_
Then, Ravana, of great energy and prowess, hurled a spear looking like a blazing
thunderbolt, on Vibhishana._END

B_6_C_100_19
BEGIN_
अप्राप्तामेव तां बाणैस्त्रिभिश्चिच्छेद लक्ष्मणः |
अथोदतिष्ठत्संनादो वानराणान् तदा रणे || ६-१००-२०_END
BEGIN_
Even before the spear reached Vibhishana, Lakshmana tore it with three of his arrows
and a loud cheer then arose from the monkeys in the battle-field._END

B_6_C_100_20
BEGIN_
संपपात त्रिधा छिन्ना शक्तिः काञ्चनमालिनी |
सविस्फुलिङ्गा ज्वलिता महोल्केव दिवश्च्युता || ६-१००-२१_END
BEGIN_
That gold-crowned spear, torn into three pieces, fell like a large meteor with
sparks of fire falling from the sky._END

B_6_C_100_21
BEGIN_
ततः सम्भाविततरान् कालेनापि दुरासदाम् |
जग्राह विपुलान् शक्तिन् दीप्यमानां स्वतेजसा || ६-१००-२२_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Ravana took hold of another large most competent spear, which was
difficult to be approached even by Yama the lord of Death and blazing as it was, with its own
splendour._END

B_6_C_100_22
BEGIN_
सा वेगिना बलवता रावणेन दुरात्मना |
जज्वाल सुमहाघोरा शक्राशनिसमप्रभा || ६-१००-२३_END
BEGIN_
The mighty and the evil-minded Ravana swiftly hurled that very great spear, burning
with a radiance similar to that of a blazing thunder-bolt._END

B_6_C_100_23
BEGIN_
एतस्मिन्नन्तरे वीरो लक्ष्मणस्तन् विभीषणम् |
प्राणसंशयमापन्नन् तूर्णमेवाभ्यपद्यत || ६-१००-२४_END
BEGIN_
In the meanwhile, the valiant Lakshmana quickly rushed towards that Vibhishana, who
got a danger to his life._END

B_6_C_100_24
BEGIN_
तं विमोक्षयितुं वीरश्चापमायम्य लक्ष्मणः |
रावणन् शक्तिहस्तन् तं शरवर्षैरवाकिरत् || ६-१००-२५_END
BEGIN_
To rescue that Vibhishana, the heroic Lakshmana, having stretched his bow, threw out
streams of arrows on Ravana who was holding a spear in his hand._END

B_6_C_100_25
BEGIN_
कीर्यमाणः शरौघेण विसृष्ट्तेन महात्मना |
न प्रहर्तुं मनश्चक्रे विमुखीकृतविक्रमः || ६-१००-२६_END
BEGIN_
Poured in with a multitude of arrows discharged by the great-souled Lakshmana,
Ravana with his attach frustrated, did not make up his mind to attack Vibhishana further._END

B_6_C_100_26
BEGIN_
मोक्षितं भ्रातरन् दृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मणेन स रावणः |
लक्ष्मणाभिमुखस्तिष्ठन्निदन् वचनमब्रवीत् || ६-१००-२७_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Vibhishana his brother rescued by Lakshmana, that Ravana, turning his face
towards Lakshmana spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_100_27
BEGIN_
मोक्षितस्ते बलश्लाघिन्यस्मादेवन् विभीषणः |
विमुच्य राक्षसन् शक्तिस्त्वयीयं विनिपात्यते || ६-१००-२८_END
BEGIN_
"O Lakshmana, exalter of your own strength! As Vibhishana was rescued by you in this
way, this spear, on letting off Vibhishana the demon, is being hurled on you now."_END

B_6_C_100_28
BEGIN_
एषा ते हृदयं भित्त्वा शक्तिर्लोहितलक्षणा |
मद्बाहुपरिघोत्सृष्टा प्राणानादाय यास्यति || ६-१००-२९_END
BEGIN_
"This spear, having blood-marks and hurled by bludgeon-like arm, having pierced your
heart, will depart only after taking your life."_END

B_6_C_100_29
BEGIN_
इत्येवमुक्त्वा तान् शक्तिमष्टघण्टां महास्वनाम् |
मयेन मायाविहिताममोघान् शत्रुघातिनीम् || ६-१००-३०
लक्ष्मणाय समुद्दिश्य ज्वलन्तीमिव तेजसा |
रावणः परमक्रुद्धश्चिक्षेप च ननाद च || ६-१००-३१_END
BEGIN_
Thus saying, the greatly enraged Ravana roared and hurled towards Lakshmana, that
unfailing spear, which was adorned with eight loudly clamouring bells, which had been designed by
Maya the demon by dint of his conjuring trick, capable of destroying adversaries and blazing as it
was with splendour._END

B_6_C_100_30
BEGIN_
सा क्षिप्ता भीमवेगेन शक्राशनिसमस्वना |
शक्तिरभ्यपतद्वेगाल्लक्ष्मणन् रणमूर्धनि || ६-१००-३२_END
BEGIN_
That spear, with a sound equal to Indra's thunder-bolt, hurled by the terribly swift
Ravana, soon fell with speed on Lakshmana in the battle-front._END

B_6_C_100_31
BEGIN_
तामनुव्याहरच्छक्तिमापतन्तीन् स राघवः |
स्वस्त्यस्तु लक्ष्मणायेति मोघा भव हतोद्यमा || ६-१००-३३_END
BEGIN_
Rama repeatedly uttered to that spear even as it was rushing forth (on Lakshmana) as
follows: "May it be well with Lakshmana! May you prove useless! May your effort be frustrated!"_END

B_6_C_100_32
BEGIN_
तावणेन रणे शक्तिः क्रुद्धेनाशीविषोपमा |
मुक्ताशूरस्यभीतस्य लक्ष्मणस्य ममज्ज सा || ६-१००-३४_END
BEGIN_
That spear, which was looking like a venomous serpent, released by the enraged
Ravana in the battle, quickly penetrated the bosom of Lakshmana, who stood fearless._END

B_6_C_100_33
BEGIN_
न्यपतत्सा महावेगा लक्ष्मणस्य महोरसि |
जिह्वेवोरगराजस्य दीप्यमाना महाद्युतिः || ६-१००-३५_END
BEGIN_
That spear, like the tongue of Vasuki (the lord of serpents), blazing with a great
dazzle, fell on the broad chest of Lakshmana, with enormous speed._END

B_6_C_100_34
BEGIN_
ततो रावणवेगेन सुदूरमवगाढया |
शक्त्या निर्भिन्नहृदयः पपात भुवि लक्ष्मणः || ६-१००-३६_END
BEGIN_
Penetrated very deeply and pierced through his heart by the spear due to the force
exerted by Ravana, Lakshmana fell to the ground._END

B_6_C_100_35
BEGIN_
तदवस्थन् समीपस्थो लक्ष्मणं प्रेक्ष्य राघवः |
भ्रातृस्नेहान्महातेजा विषण्णहृदयोअभवत् || ६-१००-३७_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Lakshmana in that state, Rama, of extraordinary splendour, who was stationed
in the vicinity, became sorrowful at heart because of the love towards his brother._END

B_6_C_100_36
BEGIN_
स मुहूर्तमनुध्याय बाष्पव्याकुललोचनः |
बभूव सन्रब्धतरो युगान्त इव पावकः || ६-१००-३८_END
BEGIN_
Rama, whose eyes were filled with tears, reflected just for a while and then was
very much enraged, like fire at the time of dissolution of the world._END

B_6_C_100_37
BEGIN_
न विषादस्य कालोअयमिति सञ्चिन्त्य राघवः |
चक्रे सुतुमुलन् युद्धं रावणस्य वधे धृतः || ६-१००-३९
सर्वयत्नेन महता लक्ष्मणं परिवीक्ष्य च |_END
BEGIN_
Becoming aware that it was not the time for feeling despondent, and looking at
Lakshmana, Rama resumed that highly tumultuous battle with a great and whole-hearted endeavour,
determined as he was to destroy Ravana._END

B_6_C_100_38
BEGIN_
स ददर्श ततो रामः शक्त्या भिन्नं महाहवे || ६-१००-४०
लक्ष्मणन् रुधिरादिग्धं सपन्नगमिवाचलम् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama saw Lakshmana, who was struck by the spear in that Great War, bathed as
he was in blood and looking like a mountain with a snake (entering its centre)._END

B_6_C_100_39
BEGIN_
तामपि प्रहितान् शक्तिं रावणेन बलीयसा || ६-१००-४१
यत्नतस्ते हरिश्रेष्ठा न शेकुरवमर्दितुम् |
अर्दिताश्चैव बाणौघैः क्षिप्रहस्तेन रक्षसा || ६-१००-४२_END
BEGIN_
Even with an exertion to pull out that spear hurled by the mighty Ravana, those
foremost of the monkeys could not those foremost of the monkeys could not do it because they were
being tormented by Ravana the foremost of demons with a stream of his arrows._END

B_6_C_100_40
BEGIN_
सौमित्रिन् सा विनिर्भिद्य प्रविष्टा धरणीतलम् |
तान् कराभ्यां परामृश्य रामः शक्तिं भयावहाम् || ६-१००-४३
बभञ्ज समरे क्रुद्धो बलवद्विचकर्ष च |_END
BEGIN_
Penetrating through Lakshmana's bosom, that spear touched the earth. Seizing hold of
awful spear with his hands, the mighty Rama drew it out and getting enraged, broke it during the
course of the battle._END

B_6_C_100_41
BEGIN_
तस्य निष्कर्षतः शक्तिन् रावणेन बलीयसा || ६-१००-४४
शराः सर्वेषु गात्रेषु पातिता मर्मभेदिनः |_END
BEGIN_
While Rama was drawing the spear out; arrow, which pierced his vital organs, were
sunk by the mighty Ravana on all his limbs._END

B_6_C_100_42
BEGIN_
अचिन्तयित्वा तान्बाणान्समाश्लिष्या च लक्ष्मणम् || ६-१००-४५
अब्रवीच्च हनूमन्तन् सुग्रीवन् चैव राघवः |_END
BEGIN_
Ignoring those arrows and having embraced Lakshmana, Rama spoke to Hanuma and
Sugreeva, the king of monkeys, as follows:_END

B_6_C_100_43
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणं परिवार्येह तिष्ठध्वन् वानरोत्तमाः || ६-१००-४६
पराक्रमस्य कालोअयन् सम्प्राप्तो मे चिरेप्सितः |
पापात्मायन् दशग्रीवो वध्यतां पापनिश्चयः || ६-१००-४७
काङ्क्षितः स्तोककस्येव घर्मान्ते मेघदर्शनम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O the chiefs of monkeys! Remain just encompassing Lakshmana. Let this malicious
Ravana of evil designs be killed. The time to manifest my prowess, which I have been wishing for
long, has come, as for a chataka bird, the site of a cloud would come, as sought by it, at the end
of a hot season."_END

B_6_C_100_44
BEGIN_
अस्मिन्मुहूर्ते नचिरात्सत्यं प्रतिशृणोमि वः || ६-१००-४८
अरावणमरामन् वा जगद्द्रक्ष्यथ वानराः |_END
BEGIN_
"I take this vow in truth before you, at this moment, O monkeys, that without delay,
you will see the world devoid of Ravana or Rama (myself)."_END

B_6_C_100_45
BEGIN_
राज्यनाशन् वने वासन् दण्डके परिधावनम् || ६-१००-४९
वैदेह्याश्च परामर्शन् रक्षोभिश्च समागमम् |_END
BEGIN_
"I encountered with the loss of sovereignity, the dwelling in the forest, the
wandering around in the woods of Dandaka and the rough treatment of Seetha by the demons."_END

B_6_C_100_46
BEGIN_
प्राप्तन् दुःखं महद्घोरं क्लेशं च निरयोपमम् || ६-१००-५०
अद्य सर्वमहन् त्यक्ष्ये हत्वा तन् रावणं रणे |_END
BEGIN_
"A great and terrible suffering has happened to me and an agony equivalent to hell.
Now, by killing Ravana in battle, I will relieve myself of all that agony."_END

B_6_C_100_47
BEGIN_
यदर्थन् वानरं सैन्यं समानीतमिदं मया || ६-१००-५१
सुग्रीवश्च कृतो राज्ये निहत्वा वालिनन् रणे |
सोअयमद्य रणे पापश्चक्षुर्विषयमागतः || ६-१००-५२_END
BEGIN_
"That sinful demon, for whose sake, this army of monkeys has been brought by me,
Sugreeva has been anointed on the throne after killing Vali and for whose sake the ocean has been
crossed and a bridge built on it, has come within the range of my sight in the battle-field
now."_END

B_6_C_100_48
BEGIN_
चक्षुर्विषयमागम्य नायन् जीवितुमर्हति || ६-१००-५३
दृष्टिन् दृष्टिविषस्येव सर्पस्य मम रावणः |
यथा वा वैनतेयस्य दृष्टिं प्राप्तो भुजंगमः || ६-१००-५४_END
BEGIN_
"This Ravana, having come within the range of my vision, cannot survive, any more
than the one who has come within the range of vision of a snake injecting deadly poison with its
very glance or than a serpent who has come within the range of vision of Garuda, the king of birds
and the enemy of serpents."_END

B_6_C_100_49
BEGIN_
स्वस्थाः पश्यत दुर्धर्षा युद्धन् वानरपुङ्गवाः |
आसीनाः पर्वताग्रेषु ममेदन् रावणस्य च || ६-१००-५५_END
BEGIN_
"O the foremost of the monkeys who are so difficult to conquer! Seated on the
mountain-peaks, you witness at ease, this battle between myself and Ravana."_END

B_6_C_100_50
BEGIN_
अद्य रामस्य रामत्वं पश्यन्तु मम सन्युगे |
त्रयो लोकाः सगन्धर्वाः सदेवाः सर्षिचारणाः || ६-१००-५६_END
BEGIN_
"Let the three worlds (viz. the earth, heaven and the intermediate region) including
Gandharvas the celestial musicians, the gods, the sages and the celestial bards see today the
Ramahood of Rama during the course of my battle."_END

B_6_C_100_51
BEGIN_
अद्य कर्म करिष्यामि यल्लोकाः सचराचराः |
सदेवाः कथयिष्यन्ति यावद्भूमिर्धरिष्यति || ६-१००-५७
समागम्य सदा लोके यथा युद्धं प्रवर्तितम् |_END
BEGIN_
"I shall perform today a feat, which people in the world including all living beings
both mobile and immobile, as also gods, will ever narrate together, describing how the battle
proceeded, as long as the earth is able to support those who occupy it."_END

B_6_C_100_52
BEGIN_
एवमुक्त्वा शितैर्बाणैस्तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणैः |
आजघान दशग्रीवन् रणे रामः समाहितः || ६-१००-५८_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking, Rama with an attentive mind in the battle-field, struck Rama with
sharp arrows, decked in pure gold._END

B_6_C_100_53
BEGIN_
अथ प्रदीप्तैर्नाराचैर्मुसलैश्चापि रावणः || ६-१००-५९
अभ्यवर्षत्तदा रामन् धाराभिरिव तोयदः |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Ravana streamed forth blazing steel arrows and then clubs, as clouds
would stream forth the rains._END

B_6_C_100_54
BEGIN_
रामरावणमुक्तानामन्योन्यमभिनिघ्नताम् || ६-१००-६०
शराणान् च शराणां च बभूव तुमुलः स्वनः |_END
BEGIN_
A tumultuous sound arose from the excellent arrows, released by Rama and Ravana, as
they struck each other._END

B_6_C_100_55
BEGIN_
ते भिन्नाश्च विकीर्णाश्च रामरावणयोः शराः || ६-१००-६१
अन्तरिक्षात्प्रदीप्ताग्रा निपेतुर्धरणीतले |_END
BEGIN_
The arrows of Rama and Ravana, split asunder and scattered off, with their blazing
points, fell from the space on to the surface of the earth._END

B_6_C_100_56
BEGIN_
तयोर्ज्यातलनिर्घोषो रामरावणयोर्महान् || ६-१००-६२
त्रासनः सर्वबूतानान् स बभूवाद्भुतोपमः |_END
BEGIN_
The loud sound, produced by the impact of the bow-string on the palms of those two
heroes Rama and Ravana, which struck terror in all the living beings, was felt astonished by the
audience._END

B_6_C_100_57
BEGIN_
विकीर्यमाणः शरजालवृष्टिभिर् |
र्महात्मना दीप्तधनुष्मतार्दितः |
भयात्प्रदुद्राव समेत्य रावणो |
यथानिलेनाभिहतो बलाहकः || ६-१००-६३_END
BEGIN_
Torn asunder by the streams of a multitude of arrows by the great-souled Rama, who
was armed with a blazing bow, while coming in collusion with him, Ravana took to his heels out of
fear, like a cloud when pushed by a tempest._END

B_6_C_101_0
BEGIN_
शक्त्या निपातितं दृष्ट्वा रावणेन बलीयसा |
लक्ष्मणं समर् शूरं शोणितौघपरिप्लुतम् || ६-१०१-१
स दत्त्वा तुमुलन् युद्धं रावणस्य दुरात्मनः |
विसृजनेव बाणौघान्सुषेणन् वाक्यमब्रवीत् || ६-१०१-२_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the valiant Lakshmana bathed in a stream of blood, when struck down in battle
with a spear by the mighty Ravana and having given a tumultuous fight, to the evil-minded Ravana,
Rama spoke as follows to Sushena, even while releasing a multitude of arrows (at Ravana)._END

B_6_C_101_1
BEGIN_
एष रावणवेगेन लक्ष्मणः पतितः क्षितौ |
सर्पवद्वेष्टते वीरो मम शोकमुदीरयन् || ६-१०१-३_END
BEGIN_
"This heroic Lakshmana, falling down on earth yielding to Ravana's prowess, is
wiggling like a serpent, causing an increase in grief to me."_END

B_6_C_101_2
BEGIN_
शोणितार्द्रमिमन् वीरं प्राणैरिष्टतरं मम |
पश्यतो मम का शक्तिर्योद्धुं पर्याकुलात्मनः || ६-१०१-४_END
BEGIN_
"My energy to fight is failing, even as I see this valiant Lakshmana, who is dearer
to me than life, bathed in blood, my mind being greatly disturbed."_END

B_6_C_101_3
BEGIN_
अयन् स समरश्लाघी भ्राता मे शुभलक्षणः |
यदि पञ्चत्वमापन्नः प्राणैर्मे किन् सुखेन वा || ६-१०१-५_END
BEGIN_
"Of what use is life or happiness to me, if this illustrious brother of mine, who is
endowed with auspicious bodily marks and who always speaks highly of war, meets with his
death?"_END

B_6_C_101_4
BEGIN_
लज्जतीव हि मे वीर्यं भ्रश्यतीव कराद्धनुः |
सायका व्यवसीदन्ति दृष्टिर्बाष्पवशन् गता || ६-१०१-६_END
BEGIN_
"My valour is feeling shy, as it were. My bow seems to fall down from any hand. My
arrows are dropping down. My vision has been overcome with tears."_END

B_6_C_101_5
BEGIN_
अवसीदन्ति गात्राणि स्वप्नयाने नृणामिव |
चिन्ता मे वर्धते तीव्रा मुमूर्षापि च जायते || ६-१०१-७_END
BEGIN_
"My limbs seem to sink down, like those of men in sleep. I have a serious tension,
growing in me. I even wish to die."_END

B_6_C_101_6
BEGIN_
भ्रातरं निहतन् दृष्ट्वा रावणेन दुरात्मना |
विष्टन्न्तं तु दुःखार्तं मर्मण्यभिहतं भृशम् || ६-१०१-८_END
BEGIN_
"My brother has been struck down by the evil-minded Ravana, seriously wounded in his
vital parts, afflicted with agony and groaming."_END

B_6_C_101_7
BEGIN_
राघवो भ्रातरं दृष्ट्य प्रियं प्राणं बहिश्चरम् |
दुःखेन महताविष्टो ध्यानशोकपरायणः || ६-१०१-९_END
BEGIN_
Seeing his beloved brother, who was his very life-breath moving outside, Rama was
afflicted with excessive agony and gave himself up to anxiety and grief._END

B_6_C_101_8
BEGIN_
परन् विषादमापन्नो विललापाकुलेन्द्रियः |
न हि युद्धेन मे कार्यं नैव प्राणैर्न सीतया || ६-१०१-१०_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Lakshmana his brother lying wounded in the dust of the battle-field, he got
into extreme despondency and lamented (as follows), confused in mind, as he was:_END

B_6_C_101_9
BEGIN_
विजयोऽपि हि मे शूर न प्रियायोपकल्पते |
अचक्षुर्विषयश्चन्द्रः कां प्रीतिं जनयिष्यति || ६-१०१-११_END
BEGIN_
"O the valiant Lakshmana! Even victory cannot create a pleasure for me. What
pleasure can the moon create for a man who has lost his vision?"_END

B_6_C_101_10
BEGIN_
किं मे युद्धेन किं प्राणैर्युद्धकार्यं न विद्यते |
यत्रायं निहतः शेते रणमूर्धनि लक्ष्मणः || ६-१०१-१२_END
BEGIN_
"What purpose of mine will be served by fighting or eve by life? When this Lakshmana
lies killed in the forefront of battle here, I have no use for the war."_END

B_6_C_101_11
BEGIN_
यथैव मां वनं यान्तमनुयाति महाद्युतिः |
अहमप्युपयास्यामि तथैवैनं यमक्षयम् || ६-१०१-१३_END
BEGIN_
"In the same way as the very glorious Lakshmana followed me When I was going to the
forest, I too will in the same way follow him to the abode of Yama the lord of Death."_END

B_6_C_101_12
BEGIN_
इष्टबन्दुजनो नित्यं मां स नित्यमनुव्रतः |
इमामवस्थां गमितो राक्षसैः कूटयोधिभिः || ६-१०१-१४_END
BEGIN_
"The demons, who fight treacherously, created this condition to Lakshmana, who loved
his relatives and who was ardently devoted forever to me."_END

B_6_C_101_13
BEGIN_
देशे देशे कलत्राणि देशे देशे च बान्धवाः |
तं तु देशं न पश्यामि यत्र भ्राता सहोदरः || ६-१०१-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Wives may be obtained ever where. Relatives can be had every where. However, I do
not find a brother, born of the same womb, at such a place whatesoever."_END

B_6_C_101_14
BEGIN_
इत्येवं विलपन्तं तं शोकविह्वलितेन्द्रियम् |
विवेष्टमानं करुणमुच्छ्वसन्तं पुनः पुनः || ६-१०१-१६_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys saw that Rama, thus lamenting with his mind reeling and distressed in
grief and pitiably sighing his breath repeatedly._END

B_6_C_101_15
BEGIN_
किं नु राज्ये दुर्धर्षलक्ष्मणेन विना मम |
कथं वक्ष्याम्यहं त्वम्बां सुमित्रां पुत्रवत्सलाम् || ६-१०१-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Of what use is the kingdom for me, without Lakshmana, who was difficult to over
power? What can I tell to Sumitra, the mother who was so fond of her son?"_END

B_6_C_101_16
BEGIN_
उपालम्भं न शक्ष्यामि सोढुं दत्तं सुमित्रया |
किं नु वक्ष्यामि कौसल्यां मातरं किं नु कैकयीम् || ६-१०१-१८_END
BEGIN_
"I shall not be able to bear the reproach, which will be levelled by Sumitra. What
shall I pay to kausalya the mother or what shall I say to Kaikeya?"_END

B_6_C_101_17
BEGIN_
भरतं किं नु वक्ष्यामि शत्रुघ्नं च महाबलम् |
सह तेन वनं यातो विना तेनागतः कथम् || ६-१०१-१९_END
BEGIN_
"What shall I say to Bharata or to the mighty Shatrughna, when they ask me, how I
came back without Lakshmana even though I went to the forest along with him?"_END

B_6_C_101_18
BEGIN_
इहैव मरणं श्रेयो न तु बन्धुविगर्हणम् |
किं मया दुष्कृतं कर्म कृतमन्यत्र जन्मनि || ६-१०१-२०
येन मे धार्मिको भ्राता निहतश्चाग्रतः स्थितः |_END
BEGIN_
"It is better to die at this place only, rather than hear the reproaches of one's
own people. What sinful act was done by me in a previous birth due to which my righteous brother
lies killed before me?_END

B_6_C_101_19
BEGIN_
हा भ्रातर्मनुजश्रेष्ठ शूराणाम् प्रवर प्रभो || ६-१०१-२१
एकाकी किं नु मां त्यक्त्वा परलोकाय गच्छसि |_END
BEGIN_
"Alas! O the powerful brother, the best of men! O the foremost among the valiant
men! Why are you going to the other world, deserting me?"_END

B_6_C_101_20
BEGIN_
विलपन्तं च मां भ्रातः किमर्थं नावभाषसे || ६-१०१-२२
उत्तिष्ठ पश्य किं शेषे दीनं मां पश्य चक्षुषा |_END
BEGIN_
"O brother! Why don't you talk to me, even though I am lamenting? Rise and see! Why
are you lying down? See me, by opening your own eyes, miserable as I am."_END

B_6_C_101_21
BEGIN_
शोकार्तस्य प्रमत्तस्य पर्वतेषु वनेषु च || ६-१०१-२३
विषण्णस्य महाबाहो समाश्वासयिता मम |_END
BEGIN_
"O the mighty armed! You have been indeed comforting me, whenever stricken with
grief, I roamed listlessly among mountains and forests or felt low-spirited."_END

B_6_C_101_22
BEGIN_
राममेवं ब्रुवाणं तु शोकव्याकुलितेन्द्रियम् || ६-१०१-२४
आश्वासयन्नुवाचेदं सुषेणः परमं वचः |_END
BEGIN_
Comforting Rama, whose mind was full of grief and who was thus lamenting, Sushena,
for his part, addressed the following excellent words:_END

B_6_C_101_23
BEGIN_
त्यजेमां नरशार्दूल बुद्धिं वैक्लब्यकारिणीम् || ६-१०१-२५
शोकसंजननीं चिन्तां तुल्यां बाणैश्चमूमुखे |_END
BEGIN_
"O the excellent among men! Give up this notion, which causes despondency in you,
this anguish which gives rise to grief and is as piercing as arrows, in the forefront of
battle."_END

B_6_C_101_24
BEGIN_
नैव पञ्चत्वमापन्नो लक्ष्मणो लक्ष्मिवर्धनः || ६-१०१-२६
न ह्य्स्य विकृतं वक्त्रं न च श्यामत्वमागतम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Lakshmana, the augmenter of prosperity, has not got into death. His countenance is
not changed, nor has it become dark."_END

B_6_C_101_25
BEGIN_
सुप्रभन् च प्रसन्नं च मुखमस्याभिलक्ष्यते || ६-१०१-२७
पद्मरक्ततलौ हस्तौ सुप्रसन्ने च लोचने |_END
BEGIN_
"His face may be seen with a good brightness and very much placid. The palms of his
hands are resembling the petals of a lotus. His eyes too are very bright."_END

B_6_C_101_26
BEGIN_
नेदृशं दृश्यते रूपं गतासूनां विशां पते || ६-१०१-२८
विषादं मा कृथा वीर सप्राणोऽयमरिंदम |_END
BEGIN_
"O king! The appearance of the dead does not look like this. O hero, the annihilator
of enemies! He is all with his life. Do not worry."_END

B_6_C_101_27
BEGIN_
आख्याति तु प्रसुप्तस्य स्रस्तगात्रस्य भूतले || ६-१०१-२९
सोच्छ्वासं हृदयं वीर कम्पमानं मुहुर्मुहुः |_END
BEGIN_
"The repeatedly beating heart with the signs of breath of Lakshmana, lying on the
earth's surface, fast asleep, with his limbs relaxed are telling it, O the gallant prince!"_END

B_6_C_101_28
BEGIN_
एवं न विद्यते रूपन् गतासूनान् विशां पते || ६-१०१-३०
समीपस्थमुवाचेदं हनूमन्तं महाकपिम् |_END
BEGIN_
Having addressed the words thus to Rama, the highly learned Sushena spoke the
following words to Hanuma the great monkey, who was standing nearby:_END

B_6_C_101_29
BEGIN_
सौम्य शीघ्रमितो गत्वा शैलमोषधिपर्वतम् || ६-१०१-३१
पूर्वन् हि कथितो योअसौ वीर जाम्बवता शुभः |
दक्षिणे शिखरे तस्य जातामोषधिमानय || ६-१०१-३२
विशल्यकरणी नाम विशल्यकरणीन् शुभाम् |
संजीवकरणीं वीर संधानीं च महौषधीम् || ६-१०१-३३
संजीवनार्थं वीरस्य लक्ष्मणस्य महात्मनः |_END
BEGIN_
"Proceeding from this place with full speed, O gentle one!, to the mountain called
Oushadhi (Mahodaya), which was already described to you previously by Jambavan, O brave one! Bring
here for restoring the great-souled and heroic Lakshmana to consciousness, the precious herb
Vishalyakarani (1) by name which was sprung up on its southern peak, Savarnakarnani (2),
Samjivakarani(3) and the precious herb, Samdhanakarani (4)."_END

B_6_C_101_30
BEGIN_
इत्येवमुक्तो हनुमान्गत्वा चौषदिपर्वतम् || ६-१०१-३४
चिन्तामभ्यगमच्छ्रीमानजानंस्ता महौषधीः |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words, Hanuma, having sprung to Mount Oushadhi, could not identify
those precious herbs and became thoughtful._END

B_6_C_101_31
BEGIN_
तस्य बुद्धिः समुत्पन्ना मारुतेरमितौजसः || ६-१०१-३५
इदमेव गमिष्यामि गृहीत्वा शिखरं गिरेः |_END
BEGIN_
The following thought arose to that Hanuma, whose strength was unlimited: "I will go
back, taking this mountain-peak itself."_END

B_6_C_101_32
BEGIN_
अस्मिंस्तु शिखरे जातामोषधिं तां सुखावहाम् || ६-१०१-३६
प्रतर्केणावगच्छामि सुषेणो ह्येवमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
"By conjecture, I understand that the delightful herb must have sprouted in this
mountain-peak. Sushena indeed has said so."_END

B_6_C_101_33
BEGIN_
अगृह्य यदि गच्छमि विशल्यकरणीमहम् || ६-१०१-३७
