कालात्ययेन दोषः स्याद्वैक्लब्यं च महद्भवेत् |_END
BEGIN_
"If I go without taking Vishalyakarani, harm may come through passage of time and a
great perplexity may arise."_END

B_6_C_101_34
BEGIN_
इति सञ्चिन्त्य हनुमान्गत्वा क्षिप्रं महाबलः || ६-१०१-३८
आसाद्य पर्वतश्रेष्ठं त्रिः प्रक्रम्य गिरेः शिरः |
प्लुल्लनानातरुगणं समुत्पाट्य महाबलः || ६-१०१-३९
गृहीत्वा हरिशार्दूलो हस्ताभ्यां समतोलयत् |_END
BEGIN_
Thinking thus, the mighty Hanuma the excellent of monkeys, having gone quickly and
approaching that excellent mountain, taking that mountain-peak with his arms, shaking it violently
for three times and uprooting the mountain-peak, which was endowed with many trees in bloom, lifted
it up, so mighty as he was._END

B_6_C_101_35
BEGIN_
स नीलमिव जीमूतं तोयपूर्णम् नभस्तलात् || ६-१०१-४०
उत्पपात गृहीत्वा तु हनूमाञ्शिखरन् गिरेः |_END
BEGIN_
Taking that mountain-peak, which looked like a dark rainy cloud, that Hanuman jumped
up into the sky._END

B_6_C_101_36
BEGIN_
समागम्य महावेगः संन्यस्य शिखरं गिरेः || ६-१०१-४१
विश्रम्यकिंचिद्धनुमान् सुषेणमिदमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Arriving with a great speed, Hanuma putting down the mountain-peak and resting for a
while, spoke the following words to Sushena:_END

B_6_C_101_37
BEGIN_
ओषधीर्नावगछामि ता अहन् हरिपुङ्गव || ६-१०१-४२
तदिदन् शिखरन् कृत्स्नं गिरेस्तस्याहृतं मया |_END
BEGIN_
"O the excellent of monkeys! I have brought the entire mountain-peak, as I could not
identify those herbs."_END

B_6_C_101_38
BEGIN_
एवम् कथयमानं तं प्रशस्य पवनात्मजम् || ६-१०१-४३
सुषेणो वानरश्रेष्ठो जग्राहोत्पाट्य चौषधीः |_END
BEGIN_
Eulogizing Hanuma, who was thus narrating his trip, Sushena, the excellent of
monkeys, pulling out the herbs, took hold off them._END

B_6_C_101_39
BEGIN_
विस्मितास्तु बभूवुस्ते सर्वे वानरपुंगवाः || ६-१०१-४४
दृष्ट्वा हनूमतः कर्म सुरैरपि सुदुष्करम् |_END
BEGIN_
All those monkey-chiefs and even the gods were surprised to see that most difficult
feat of Hanuma._END

B_6_C_101_40
BEGIN_
ततः सङ्क्षोदयित्वा तामोषधिन् वानरोत्तमः || ६-१०१-४५
लक्ष्मणस्य ददौ नस्तः सुषेणः सुमहाद्युतिः |_END
BEGIN_
Then, crushign that herb, Sushena the excellent of monkeys, having a great
splendour, administered it through Lakshmana's nose._END

B_6_C_101_41
BEGIN_
सशल्यः स समाघ्राय लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा || ६-१०१-४६
विशल्यो विरुजः शीघ्रमुदतिष्ठन्महीतलात् |_END
BEGIN_
Duly inhaling it well, that Lakshmana, the annihilator of adversaries, having the
spear lodged in his body, raised quickly from the earth's surface rid as he was of the spear and
his pain._END

B_6_C_101_42
BEGIN_
तमुत्थितं तु हरयो भूतलात्प्रेक्ष्य लक्ष्मणम् || ६-१०१-४७
साधु साध्विति सुप्रीताः सुषेणं प्रत्यपूजयन् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that Lakshmana risen from the ground, the mokneys were overjoyed and
applauded Lakshmana, saying, "Excellent, excellent!"._END

B_6_C_101_43
BEGIN_
एह्येहीत्यब्रवीद्रामो लाक्ष्मणं परवीरहा || ६-१०१-४८
सस्वजे स्नेहगाढन् च बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणः |_END
BEGIN_
Rama, the destroyer of enemies, said to Lakshmana, "come, come!" and embraced him
firmly with affection, with his eyes clouded with tears._END

B_6_C_101_44
BEGIN_
अब्रवीच्च परिष्वज्य सौमित्रिन् राघवस्तदा || ६-१०१-४९
दिष्ट्या त्वान् वीर पश्यामि मरणात्पुनरागतम् |_END
BEGIN_
After embracing Lakshmana, Rama then said to him: "Luckily, O valiant one, I see you
here, returned from death."_END

B_6_C_101_45
BEGIN_
न हि मे जीवितेनार्थः सीतया च जयेन वा || ६-१०१-५०
को हि मे जीवितेनार्थस्त्वयि पञ्चत्वमागते |_END
BEGIN_
"There is no purpose of mine, by me own life nor of Seetha nor of victory. If you
have attained demise, tell me what significnace is there for it to me?"_END

B_6_C_101_46
BEGIN_
इत्येवन् वदतस्तस्य राघवस्य महात्मनः || ६-१०१-५१
खिन्नः शिथिलया वाचा लक्ष्मणो वाक्यमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
While the great souled Rama was speaking thus, the exhausted Lakshmana, in a feeble
tone, spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_101_47
BEGIN_
तां प्रतिज्ञां प्रतिज्ञाय पुरा सत्यपराक्रम || ६-१०१-५२
लघुः कश्चिदिवासत्त्वो नैवन् वक्तुमिहार्हसि |_END
BEGIN_
"Having solemnly taken that pledge (of killing Ravana) before, O brother true to
your promise, you ought not to speak as you have done like a weak and courageless man."_END

B_6_C_101_48
BEGIN_
न प्रतिज्ञान् हि कुर्वन्ति वितथां साधवोअनघ || ६-१०१-५३
लक्ष्मणन् हि महत्त्वस्य प्रतिज्ञापरिपालनम् |_END
BEGIN_
"There is no purpose of mine, by me own life nor of Seetha nor of victory. If you
have attained demise, tell me what significance is there for it to me?"_END

B_6_C_101_49
BEGIN_
नैराश्यमुपगन्तुन् ते तदलं मत्कृतेअनघ || ६-१०१-५४
वधेन रावणस्याद्य प्रतिज्ञामनुपालय |_END
BEGIN_
"O the faultless one! Getting into homelessness for my sake is not befitting of you.
Fulfill your promise now, by killing Ravana."_END

B_6_C_101_50
BEGIN_
न जीवन्यास्यते शत्रुस्तव बाणपथन् गतः || ६-१०१-५५
नर्दतस्तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रस्य सिन्हस्येव महागजः |_END
BEGIN_
"An enemy who falls victim to your arrows, cannot turn out alive, as a huge elephant
which gets into the path of a roaring lion possessing terrible tusks."_END

B_6_C_101_51
BEGIN_
अहन् तु वधमिच्छामि शीघ्रमस्य दुरात्मनः || ६-१०१-५६
यावदस्तं न यात्येष कृतकर्मा दिवाकरः |_END
BEGIN_
"I, for my part, wish to see the death of this evil-minded fellow instantly, even
before this sun, having finished his task, does not sink below the horizon."_END

B_6_C_101_52
BEGIN_
यदि वधमिच्छसि रावणस्य संख्ये |
यदि च कृतां हि तवेच्छसि प्रतिज्ञाम् |
यदि तव राजसुताभिलाष आर्य |
कुरु च वचो मम शीग्रमद्य वीर || ६-१०१-५७_END
BEGIN_
"O venerable hero! If you wish to kill Ravana in battle, if you wish to fulfill your
promise and if you feel affectionate towards Seetha, do as I tell you soon and now."_END

B_6_C_102_0
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणेन तु तद्वाक्यमुक्तन् श्रुत्वा स राघवः |
संदधे परवीरघ्नो धनुरादाय वीर्यवान् || ६-१०२-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Lakshmana, that valiant Rama, the annihilator of his enemies,
taking hold of his bow, fixed an arrow on the bow-string._END

B_6_C_102_1
BEGIN_
रावणाय शरान्घोरान्विससर्ज चमूमुखे |
अथान्यं रथमास्थाय रावणो राक्षसाधिपः || ६-१०२-२
अभ्यधावा काकुत्स्थं स्वर्भानुरिव भास्करम् |_END
BEGIN_
In the forefront of battle, Rama released terrific arrows towards Ravana. Then,
occupying another chariot, Ravana the king of demons rushed towards Rama, even as Rahu the
seizer-demon rushes towards the sun._END

B_6_C_102_2
BEGIN_
दशग्रीवो रथस्थस्तु रामन् वज्रोपमैः शरैः || ६-१०२-३
आजघान महाघोरैर्धाराभिरिव तोयदः |_END
BEGIN_
Ravana for his part, standing in his chariot struck Rama with thunderbolt-like
arrows, as a cloud strikes gushes of rain on a huge mountain._END

B_6_C_102_3
BEGIN_
दीप्तपावकसङ्काशैः शरैः काञ्चनभूषणैः || ६-१०२-४
निर्बिभेद रणे रामो दशग्रीवन् समाहितः |_END
BEGIN_
With an attentive mind, Rama showered golden decked arrows, looking like blazing
flames of fire, on Ravana in the battle-field._END

B_6_C_102_4
BEGIN_
भूमिस्थितस्य रामस्य रथस्थस्य च रक्षसः || ६-१०२-५
न समन् युद्धमित्याहुर्देवगन्धर्वदानवाः |_END
BEGIN_
The gods, celestial musicians and kinnaras the mythical beings thought that the
battle was not equal between Rama standing on the ground and Ravana fighting from a chariot._END

B_6_C_102_5
BEGIN_
ततो देववरः श्रीमान् श्रुत्वा तेषां वचोऽमृतम् || ६-१०२-६
आहूय मातलिं शक्रो वचनं चेदमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing their nectar-like words, the illustrious Indra, the chief f celestials then
called Matali and spoke as follows:_END

B_6_C_102_6
BEGIN_
रथेन मम भूमिष्ठं शीघ्रं याहि रघूत्तमम् || ६-१०२-७
आयूय भूतलं यातः कुरु देवहितं महत् |_END
BEGIN_
"Go quickly with my chariot to Rama, who is standing on the earth. After reaching
the earth, invite him to take his seat in the chariot and carry out a great service to the
gods."_END

B_6_C_102_7
BEGIN_
इत्युक्तो देवराजेन मातलिर्द्वसारथिः || ६-१०२-८
प्रणम्य शिरसा देवं ततो वचनमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Indra, Matali, the charioteer of Indra, offering salutation to
him by bowing his head, spoke then the following words:_END

B_6_C_102_8
BEGIN_
शीघ्रं यास्यामि देवेन्द्र सारथ्यं च करोम्यहम् || ६-१०२-९
ततो हयैश्च संयोज्य हरितैः स्यन्दनोत्तमम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O Indra! Providing with green horses the excellent chariot, I will proceed then
immediately and perform the duty of a charioteer to Rama."_END

B_6_C_102_9
BEGIN_
ततः काञ्चनचित्राङ्गः किङ्किणीशतभूषितः || ६-१०२-१०
तरुणादित्यसङ्काशो वैदूर्यमयकूबरः |
सदश्वैः काञ्चनापीडैर्युक्तः श्वेतप्रकीर्णकैः || ६-१०२-११
हरिभिः सूर्यसङ्काशैर्हेमजालविभूषितैः |
रुक्मवेणुध्वजः श्रीमान्देवराजरथो वरः || ६-१०२-१२
देवराजेन संदिष्टो रथमारुह्य मातलिः |
अभ्यवर्तत काकुत्स्थमवतीर्य त्रिविष्टपात् || ६-१०२-१३_END
BEGIN_
Then came the glorious and excellent chariot of Indra, having variegated body decked
in gold, which was fitted with hundreds of tiny bells, with its pole of cat's eye gems shone like
the morning sun, yoked to excellent green horses, having golden chaplets on their heads, having
white whisks, covered with nets of gold, shining like the sun and bearing a flag-staff raised on a
golden bamboo. Ascending the chariot, as enjoined by Indra and descending from paradise, Matali
approached Rama._END

B_6_C_102_10
BEGIN_
अब्रवीच्च तदा रामन् सप्रतोदो रथे स्थितः |
प्राञ्जलिर्मातलिर्वाक्यन् सहस्राक्षस्य सारथिः || ६-१०२-१४_END
BEGIN_
Then Matali, the charioteer of Indra, along with a whip in his hand, stayed in the
chariot itself and joining his palms in salutation, spoke the following words to Rama._END

B_6_C_102_11
BEGIN_
सहस्राक्षेण काकुत्स्थ रथोअयन् विजयाय ते |
दत्तस्तव महासत्त्व श्रीमाञ्शत्रुनिबर्हणः || ६-१०२-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Indra has sent this chariot to you for your victory, O the mighty and the glorious
Rama, the destroyer of adversaries!"_END

B_6_C_102_12
BEGIN_
इदमैन्द्रं महच्चापन् कवचं चाग्निसंनिभम् |
शराश्चादित्यसङ्काशाः शक्तिश्च विमला शिताः || ६-१०२-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Here is the great bow belonging to Indra, an armour shining as fire, some arrows as
bright as sun and a stainless auspicious spear."_END

B_6_C_102_13
BEGIN_
आरुह्येमन् रथं वीर राक्षसन् जहि रावणम् |
मया सारथिना राम महेन्द्र इव दानवान् || ६-१०२-१७_END
BEGIN_
"O heroic king! Mounting this chariot with me as a charioteer, kill Ravana the king,
as earlier Indra the lord of celestials killed the demons."_END

B_6_C_102_14
BEGIN_
इत्युक्तः स परिक्रम्य रथन् तमभिवाद्य च |
आरुरोह तदा रामो लोकाण्ल्लक्ष्म्या विराजयन् || ६-१०२-१८_END
BEGIN_
Duly circumambulating that chariot (as a mark of respect) and offering his
salutation, when thus spoken by Matali, Rama then ascended the chariot, causing the three worlds to
shine forth with his splendour._END

B_6_C_102_15
BEGIN_
बभूव च महायुद्धं तुमुलं रोमहर्षणम् |
रामस्य च महाबाहो रावणस्य च रक्षसः || ६-१०२-१९_END
BEGIN_
Then ensued a tumultuous and thrilling battle, between the great armed Rama and
Ravana, the demon._END

B_6_C_102_16
BEGIN_
स गान्धर्वेण गान्धर्वन् दैवं दैवेन राघवः |
अस्त्रन् राक्षसराजस्य जघान परमास्त्रवित् || ६-१०२-२०_END
BEGIN_
That Rama, who was skilled in the use of great missiles, struck the missile presided
over by Gandharvas and the missile presided over by gods, by means of missiles of the same
type._END

B_6_C_102_17
BEGIN_
अस्त्रन् तु परमं घोरन् राक्षसं राकसाधिप |
ससर्ज परमक्रुद्धः पुनरेव निशाचरः || ६-१०२-२१_END
BEGIN_
Ravana, the king of demons was very much enraged and again released another
extra-ordinarily terrific missile presided over by demons._END

B_6_C_102_18
BEGIN_
ते रावणधनुर्मुक्ताः शराः काञ्चनभूषणाः |
अभ्यवर्तन्त काकुत्स्थन् सर्पा भूत्वा महाविषाः || ६-१०२-२२_END
BEGIN_
Those arrows, decked with gold, discharged from Ravana's bow, turning as they were
into highly poisonous snakes and rolled towards Rama._END

B_6_C_102_19
BEGIN_
ते दीप्तवदना दीप्तन् वमन्तो ज्वलनं मुखैः |
राममेवाभ्यवर्तन्त व्यादितास्या भयानकाः || ६-१०२-२३_END
BEGIN_
With flaming mouths wide open and vomiting blazing fire, those dreadful snake-like
arrows dashed towards Rama alone._END

B_6_C_102_20
BEGIN_
तैर्वासुकिसमस्पर्शैर्दीप्तभोगैर्महाविषैः |
दिशश्च सन्तताः सर्वाः प्रदिशश्च समावृताः || ६-१०२-२४_END
BEGIN_
All the quarters stood covered by highly poisonous serpents, whose impact was as
hard as that of Vasuki (the king of serpents), with the flaming coils. Even the corners between the
quarters stood enveloped by them._END

B_6_C_102_21
BEGIN_
तान्दृष्ट्वा पन्नगान्रामः समापतत आहवे |
अस्त्रन् गारुत्मतं घोरं प्रादुश्चक्रे भयावहम् || ६-१०२-२५_END
BEGIN_
Seeing those serpents rushing towards him in the battle-field, Rama released the
terrific and dangerous missile presided over by Garuda the eagle (an enemy of serpents)._END

B_6_C_102_22
BEGIN_
ते राघवधनुर्मुक्ता रुक्मपुङ्खाः शिखिप्रभाः |
सुपर्णाः काञ्चना भूत्वा विचेरुः सर्पशत्रवः || ६-१०२-२६_END
BEGIN_
With golden shafts which shone like flames, discharged by Rama's bow turning into
golden eagles (the enemies of serpents) those arrows flew all around._END

B_6_C_102_23
BEGIN_
ते तान्सर्वाञ्शराञ्जघ्नुः सर्परूपान्महाजवान् |
सुपर्णरूपा रामस्य विशिखाः कामरूपिणः || ६-१०२-२७_END
BEGIN_
Those arrows of Rama, which can assume any form at will, appeared in the form of
eagles and destroyed all those arrows, which flew with a great speed in the form of snakes._END

B_6_C_102_24
BEGIN_
अस्त्रे प्रतिहते क्रुद्धो रावणो राक्षसाधिपः |
अभ्यवर्षत्तदा रामन् घोराभिः शरवृष्टिभिः || ६-१०२-२८_END
BEGIN_
Enraged on his missile having been frustrated by Rama, Ravana streamed forth
terrific showers of arrows on Rama._END

B_6_C_102_25
BEGIN_
ततः शरसहस्रेण राममक्लिष्टकारिणम् |
अर्दयित्वा शरौघेण मातलिं प्रत्यविध्यत || ६-१०२-२९_END
BEGIN_
Tormenting Rama of unwearied action with thousand arrows, Ravana then pierced Matali
with a multitude of arrows._END

B_6_C_102_26
BEGIN_
चिच्छेद केतुमुद्दिश्य शरेणैकेन रावणः |
पातयित्वा रथोपस्थे रथात्केतुन् च काञ्चनम् || ६-१०२-३०
ऐन्द्रानभिजघानाश्वाञ्शरजालेन रावणः |_END
BEGIN_
Targeting with only one arrow, Ravana tore off the flag-staff. Striking down the
golden flag-staff from the top of the chariot down to the seat of the chariot, Ravana struck even
Indra's horses with a multitude of arrows._END

B_6_C_102_27
BEGIN_
विषेदुर्देवगन्धर्वा दानवाश्चारणैः सह || ६-१०२-३१
राममार्तन् तदा दृष्ट्वा सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः |
व्यथिता वानरेन्द्राश्च बभूवुः सविभीषणाः || ६-१०२-३२
रामचन्द्रमसन् दृष्ट्वा ग्रस्तन् रावणराहुणा |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Rama afflicted, the gods, Gandharvas the celestial musicians, Charanas the
celestials bards along with the demons, as also Siddhas the demi-gods and the great sages felt
dejected. Seeing the moon in the shape of Rama eclipsed by Rahu in the shape of Ravana, the
monkey-chiefs too, along with Vibhishana, felt perturbed._END

B_6_C_102_28
BEGIN_
प्राजापत्यन् च नक्षत्रन् रोहिणीं शशिनः प्रियाम् || ६-१०२-३३
समाक्रम्य बुधस्तस्थौ प्रजानामशुभावहः |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing thus the moon in the shape of Rama eclipsed by the planet Rahu in the shape
of Ravana, the planet Mercury stood, assailing the constellation Rohini presided over by the god
Prajapati (the lord of creation), the beloved of the moon the heavenly body and spelling disaster
to all created beings._END

B_6_C_102_29
BEGIN_
सधूमपरिवृत्तोर्मिः प्रज्वलन्निव सागरः || ६-१०२-३४
उत्पपात तदा क्रुद्धः स्पृशन्निव दिवाकरम् |_END
BEGIN_
Blazing as it were in fury, the ocean rose high at that time, as though it was going
to touch the sun, its mist-wreathed waves moving to-and-fro._END

B_6_C_102_30
BEGIN_
शस्त्रवर्णः सुपरुषो मन्दरश्मिर्दिवाकरः || ६-१०२-३५
अदृश्यत कबन्धाङ्गः सन्सक्तो धूमकेतुना |_END
BEGIN_
The sun, looking ashy in colour assuming a piercing aspect, and its rays grown
exhilarated, appeared in a headless trunk in its lap and united with a comet._END

B_6_C_102_31
BEGIN_
कोसलानान् च नक्षत्रन् व्यक्तमिन्द्राग्निदैवतम् || ६-१०२-३६
आक्रम्याङ्गारकस्तस्थौ विशाखामपि चाम्बरे |_END
BEGIN_
The planet Mars stood assailing in the sky, the constellation Vishakha, presided
over by the gods Indra and Agni (the god of fire), which is adorned by the kings of Kosala._END

B_6_C_102_32
BEGIN_
दशास्यो विंशतिभुजः प्रगृहीतशरासनः || ६-१०२-३७
अदृश्यत दशग्रीवो मैनाक इव पर्वतः |_END
BEGIN_
That Ravana, having ten faces and twenty arms, holding a bow tightly in his hands,
looked like Mount Mainaka._END

B_6_C_102_33
BEGIN_
निरस्यमानो रामस्तु दशग्रीवेण रक्षसा || ६-१०२-३८
नाशकदभिसन्धातुन् सायकान्रणमूर्धनि |_END
BEGIN_
Being overwhelmed by Ravana the demon in the battle-front, Rama could not fit his
arrows to his bow._END

B_6_C_102_34
BEGIN_
स कृत्वा भ्रुकुटीन् क्रुद्धः किं चित्सन्रक्तलोचनः || ६-१०२-३९
जगाम सुमहाक्रोधं निर्दहन्निव रक्षसान् |_END
BEGIN_
The enraged Rama, knitting his eye-brows and with his eyes turned slightly
blood-red, was provoked to fierce anger, as though he would burn out the demons._END

B_6_C_102_35
BEGIN_
तस्य क्रुद्धस्य वदनं दृष्ट्वा रामस्य धीमतः || ६-१०२-४०
सर्वभूतानि वित्रेसुः प्राकम्पत च मेदिनी |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the face of the sagacious Rama getting provoked of anger, all the living
beings got frightened. The earth too began to tremble._END

B_6_C_102_36
BEGIN_
सिंहशार्दूलवान् शैलः संचचाल चलद्द्रुमः |
बभूव चापि क्षुभितः समुद्रः सरितां पतिः || ६-१०२-४१_END
BEGIN_
The mountain, with lions, tigers and swaying trees, was trembled. Even the ocean,
the lord of rivers, became agitated._END

B_6_C_102_37
BEGIN_
खराश्च खरनिर्घोषा गगने परुषा घनाः |
औत्पातिकाश्च नर्दन्तः समन्तात् परिचक्रमुः || ६-१०२-४२_END
BEGIN_
Dense clouds, emitting harsh sounds and assuming a stern aspect, roamed all over in
the sky, thundering._END

B_6_C_102_38
BEGIN_
रामं दृष्ट्वा सुसंक्रुद्धमुत्पातांशैव दारुणान् |
वित्रेसुः सर्वभूतानि रावणस्याभवद्भयम् || ६-१०२-४३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the very much enraged Rama and also the terrific portents, all the living
beings were frightened. Fear seized Ravana too._END

B_6_C_102_39
BEGIN_
विमानस्थास्थदा देवा गन्धर्वाश्च महोरगाः |
ऋषिदानवदैत्याश्च गरुत्मन्तश्च खेचराः || ६-१०२-४४
ददृशुस्ते तदा युद्धं लोकसंवर्तसंस्थितम्
नानाप्रहरणैर्भीमैः शूरयोः संप्रयुध्यतोः || ६-१०२-४५_END
BEGIN_
Seated in their aerial cars, gods, Gandharvas the celestial musicians, great Nagas
(semi divine beings having the face of a man and the tail of a serpent), the sages, demons, giants
and those eagles remaining in the air, saw then the battle of two heroes, fighting steadily with
various dreadful weapons and looking like the final dissolution of the world._END

B_6_C_102_40
BEGIN_
ऊचुः सुरासुराः सर्वे तदा विग्रहमागताः |
प्रेक्षमाणा महद्युद्धं वाक्यं भक्त्या प्रहृष्टवत् || ६-१०२-४६_END
BEGIN_
Getting rejoiced on observing that great battle, all the gods and demons who had
come to witness the conflict at that time, responded:_END

B_6_C_102_41
BEGIN_
दशग्रीवं जयेत्याहुरसुराः समवस्थिताः |
देवा राममवोचंस्ते त्वं जयेति पुनः पुनः || ६-१०२-४७_END
BEGIN_
The demons who reached there cried out to Ravana, "Be victorious!". Those gods
called to Rama saying again and again: "Be you victorious!"._END

B_6_C_102_42
BEGIN_
एतस्मिन्नन्तरे क्रोधाद्राघवस्य स रावणः |
प्रहर्तुकामो दुष्टात्मा स्पृशन् प्रहरणं महत् || ६-१०२-४८
वज्रसारं महानादं सर्वशत्रुनिबर्हणम् |
शैलशृङ्गनिभैः कूटैश्चित्तदृष्टिभयावहम् || ६-१०२-४९
सधूममिव तीक्षणग्रं युगान्ताग्निचयोपमम् |
अतिरौद्रमनासाद्यं कालेनापि दुरासद्म् || ६-१०२-५०
त्रासनं सर्वभूतानां दारणं भेदनं तथा |
प्रदीप्तमिव रोषेण शूलं जग्राह रावणः || ६-१०२-५१_END
BEGIN_
In the meantime, that evil-minded Ravana, who caused enemies to cry, stroking with
anger a great weapon wishing to strike Rama, took hold off with fury, a spike, which was powerful
as a thunderbolt, which made a loud noise (when hurled at a target), capable of exterminating all
enemies, resembling the mountain-peaks, which with its sharp points dreadful to conceive and to
behold, resembling a smoke-crested mass of fire blazing at the end of the world-cycle, exceedingly
furious, which was difficult to approach even for Death, which was unassailable, which was a terror
for all beings, capable as it was of tearing and splitting them and blazing as it was._END

B_6_C_102_43
BEGIN_
तच्छूलं परमक्रुद्धो मध्ये जग्राह वीर्यवान् |
अनीकैः समरे शूरै राक्षसैः परिवारितः || ६-१०२-५२_END
BEGIN_
That valiant Ravana, surrounded by warriors of demons in battle, was very much
enraged and took hold of that spear at its middle._END

B_6_C_102_44
BEGIN_
समुद्यम्य महाकायो ननाद युधि भैरवम् |
संरक्तनयनो रोषात् स्वसैन्यमभिहर्षयन् || ६-१०२-५३_END
BEGIN_
With blood-red eyes in anger, Ravana with his collossal body, duly raising the spear
and bringing rejoice to his own army, roared terribly in battle._END

B_6_C_102_45
BEGIN_
पृथिवीं चान्तरिक्षं च दिशश्च प्रदिशस्तथा |
प्राकम्पयत्तदा शब्दो राक्षसेन्द्रस्य दारुणः || ६-१०२-५४_END
BEGIN_
The terrific noise made by Ravana then trembled the earth, the sky, the four
quarters and the angles of the compass_END

B_6_C_102_46
BEGIN_
अतिकायस्य नादेन तेन तस्य दुरात्मनः |
सर्वभूतानि वित्रेसुः सागरश्च प्रचुक्षुभे || ६-१०२-५५_END
BEGIN_
By that roar of that evil-minded Ravana of a collossal body, all the living beings
were frightened. The ocean too got agitated._END

B_6_C_102_47
BEGIN_
स गृहीत्वा महावीर्यः शूलं तद्रावणो महत् |
विनद्य सुमहानादं रामं परुषमब्रवीत् || ६-१०२-५६_END
BEGIN_
Taking hold of that large spear, that Ravana of great prowess, emitting a very loud
roar, spoke the following harsh words to Rama:_END

B_6_C_102_48
BEGIN_
शूलोऽयं वज्रसारस्ते राम रोषन्मयोद्यतः |
तव भ्रातृसहायस्य सम्यक् प्राणान् हरिष्यति || ६-१०२-५७_END
BEGIN_
"Raised in fury by me, O Rama! This spear with the power of a thunder-bolt, will
take away surely your life along with the life of your bother, your help-mate."_END

B_6_C_102_49
BEGIN_
रक्षसामद्य शूराणां निहतानां चमूमुखे |
त्वां निहत्य रणश्लाघी करोमि तरसा समम् || ६-१०२-५८_END
BEGIN_
"Killing you with my strength now, I, who always commend war-fare, will make you
level with the valiant demons, who have been killed in the battle-front."_END

B_6_C_102_50
BEGIN_
तिष्ठेदानीं निहन्मि त्वामेष शूलेन राघव |
एवमुक्त्वा स चिक्षेप तच्छूलं राक्षसाधिपः || ६-१०२-५९_END
BEGIN_
"Wait, I will kill you with the spear now, O Rama!" Saying so, that demon hurled
that spear._END

B_6_C_102_51
BEGIN_
तद्रावणकरान्मुक्तं विद्युन्मालासमावृतम् |
अष्टघण्टं महानादं वियद्गतमशोभत || ६-१०२-६०_END
BEGIN_
That spear, wreathed as it was in a circle of lightning, provided as it was with
eight bells and making a loud noise, released from Ravana's hand, splashed, as it went into tehs
sky._END

B_6_C_102_52
BEGIN_
तच्छूलां रागवो द्ऱिष्ट्वा ज्वलन्तं घोरदर्शनम् |
ससर्ज विशिखान् रामश्चापमायम्य वीर्यवान् || ६-१०२-६१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that blazing spear of terrible appearance, the valiant Rama who was born in
Raghu dynasty, having stretched his bow, released the arrows._END

B_6_C_102_53
BEGIN_
आपतन्तं शरौघेण वारयामास राघवः |
उत्पतन्तं युगान्ताग्निं जलौघैरिव वासवः || ६-१०२-६२_END
BEGIN_
With streams of arrows, Rama warded off that spear, which was rushing upon him, as
with streams of water, Indra the lord of celestials warded off the fire shooting up at the time of
dissolution of the world._END

B_6_C_102_54
BEGIN_
निर्ददाह स तान् बाणान् रामकार्मुकनिःसृतान् |
रावणस्य महान् शूलः पतङ्गानिव पावकः || ६-१०२-६३_END
BEGIN_
That large spear of Ravana consumed those arrows coming forth from Rama's bow, as
fire would consume the moths._END

B_6_C_102_55
BEGIN_
तान् दृष्ट्वा भस्मसाद्भूतान् शूलसंस्पर्शचूर्णतान् |
सायकानन्तरिक्षस्थान् रागवः क्रोधमाहरत् || ६-१०२-६४_END
BEGIN_
Seeing those arrows smashed by coming into contact with the spear and reduced to
ashes even while positioned in the sky, Rama was seized with fury._END

B_6_C_102_56
BEGIN_
स तां मातलिनानीतां शक्तिं वासवसंमताम् |
जग्राह परमक्रुद्धो राघवो रघवनन्दनः || ६-१०२-६५_END
BEGIN_
That Rama, the delight of Raghus, was quite enraged and took hold of that spear
brought by Matali the charioteer, as desired by Indra the lord of celestials._END

B_6_C_102_57
BEGIN_
सा तोलिता बलवता शक्तिर्घण्टाकृतस्वना |
नभः प्रज्वालयामास युगान्तोल्केव सप्रभा || ६-१०२-६६_END
BEGIN_
That spear, lifted up by the powerful Rama, which was rendered resonated by the
bells, began to blaze like a blazing meteor at the time of the dissolution of the world._END

B_6_C_102_58
BEGIN_
सा क्षिप्ता राक्षसेन्द्रस्य तस्मिन् शूले पपात ह |
भिन्नः शक्त्या महान् शूलो निपपात हतद्युतिः || ६-१०२-६७_END
BEGIN_
That spear, hurled by Rama, fell on that Ravana's spear. Torn down by Rama's spear,
the large spear of Ravana fell on the ground, with its lustre extinguished._END

B_6_C_102_59
BEGIN_
निर्भभेद ततो बाणैर्हयानस्य महाजवान् |
रामस्त्रीक्षणैर्महावेगैर्बाणवद्भिरजिह्मगैः || ६-१०२-६८_END
BEGIN_
With terrific arrows of high speed, with their shafts made of reeds, going straight
to their target, Rama pierced the exceedingly fleet horses of Ravana._END

B_6_C_102_60
BEGIN_
निर्बधेदोरसि तदा रावणं निशितैः शरैः |
राघवः परमायत्तो ललाटे पत्त्रिभिस्त्रिभिः || ६-१०२-६९_END
BEGIN_
With his sharp arrows, Rama then pierced the chest-region of Ravana. He also struck,
quite deliberately, the forehead of Ravana with three arrows._END

B_6_C_102_61
BEGIN_
स शरैर्भिन्नसर्वाङ्गो गात्रप्रसृतशोणितः |
राक्षसेन्द्रः समूहस्थः पुल्लाशोक इवाबभौ || ६-१०२-७०_END
BEGIN_
With all his limbs torn down by arrows and with blood flowing from his limbs, that
Ravana in the midst of demons, shone like a blooming Ashoka tree in the midst of a multitude of
trees._END

B_6_C_102_62
BEGIN_
स रामबाणैरतिविद्धगात्रो |
निशाचरेन्द्रः क्षतजार्द्रगात्रः |
जगाम खेदं च समाजमध्ये |
क्रोधं च चक्रे सुभृशं तदानीम् || ६-१०२-७१_END
BEGIN_
With his limbs severely injured by Rama's arrows and with his body bathed in blood,
that Ravana felt exhausted in the middle of a multitude of demons and gave went to a violent anger
at that time._END

B_6_C_103_0
BEGIN_
स तु तेन तदा क्रोधात्काकुत्स्थेनार्दितो रणे |
रावणः समरश्लाघी महाक्रोधमुपागमत् || ६-१०३-१_END
BEGIN_
Tormented by Rama in fury, that Ravana then for his part, who was boasting of his
fight, flew into a great rage._END

B_6_C_103_1
BEGIN_
स दीप्तनयनो रोषाच्चापमायम्य वीर्यवान् |
अभ्यर्दयत्सुसङ्क्रुद्धो राघवं परमाहवे || ६-१०३-२
बाणधारा सहस्रैस्तु स तोयद इवाम्बरात् |
राघवन् रावणो बाणैस्तटाकमिव पूरयत् || ६-१०३-३_END
BEGIN_
Raising his bow, his eyes blazing with anger, extremely enraged as he was with Rama
in that great battle, the valiant Ravana of prowess continued to oppress, by covering Rama with
thousands of streams of arrows, as a rainy cloud would fill a pond with thousands of arrow-like
torrents from the sky._END

B_6_C_103_2
BEGIN_
पूरितः शरजालेन धनुर्मुक्तेन सन्युगे |
महागिरिरिवाकम्प्यः काकुस्थो न प्रकम्पते || ६-१०३-४_END
BEGIN_
Covered by a multitude of arrows discharged from Ravana's bow in battle, Rama did
not wince, like a large mountain which was unshakable._END

B_6_C_103_3
BEGIN_
स शरैः शरजालानि वारयन्समरे स्थितः |
गभस्तीनिव सूर्यस्य प्रतिजग्राह वीर्यवान् || ६-१०३-५_END
BEGIN_
The valiant Rama stood interrupting the torrents of arrows with his own arrows in
the battle-field and endured them as rays of the sun._END

B_6_C_103_4
BEGIN_
ततः शरसहस्राणि क्षिप्रहस्तो निशाचरः |
निजघानोरसि क्रुद्धो राघवस्य महात्मनः || ६-१०३-६_END
BEGIN_
Then, the enraged Ravana of brisk hand, struck thousands of arrows into the breast
of the great-souled Rama._END

B_6_C_103_5
BEGIN_
स शोणित समादिग्धः समरे लक्ष्मणाग्रजः |
दृष्टः फुल्ल इवारण्ये सुमहान्किंशुकद्रुमः || ६-१०३-७_END
BEGIN_
Rama, bathed in blood in the battle-field, appeared like a very big Kimshuka tree
with bloom in a forest._END

B_6_C_103_6
BEGIN_
शराभिघातसन्रब्धः सोअपि जग्राह सायकान् |
काकुत्स्थः सुमहातेजा युगान्तादित्यवर्चसः || ६-१०३-८_END
BEGIN_
Enraged at the impact of the arrows, that Rama of very great splendour , took hold
of arrows which shone like the sun at the time of dissolution of the world._END

B_6_C_103_7
BEGIN_
ततोअन्योन्यन् सुसन्रब्धावुभौ तौ रामरावणौ |
शरान्धकारे समरे नोपालक्षयतान् तदा || ६-१०३-९_END
BEGIN_
Both Rama and Ravana who were see each other at that time in the battle-field, which
was shrouded in darkness by the arrows._END

B_6_C_103_8
BEGIN_
ततः क्रोधसमाविष्टो रामो दशरथात्मजः |
उवाच रावणन् वीरः प्रहस्य परुषं वचः || ६-१०३-१०_END
BEGIN_
Bursting into laughter, though filled with anger, the valiant Rama, the son of
Dasaratha spoke the following harsh words to Ravana._END

B_6_C_103_9
BEGIN_
मम भार्या जनस्थानादज्ञानाद्राक्षसाधम |
हृता ते विवशा यस्मात्तस्मात्त्वं नासि वीर्यवान् || ६-१०३-११_END
BEGIN_
"O the worst of demons! Since you took away my helpless wife without my notice from
Janasthana, hence you are not a person of prowess."_END

B_6_C_103_10
BEGIN_
मया विरहितान् दीनान् वर्तमानां महावने |
वैदेहीं प्रसभन् हृत्वा शूरोअहमिति मन्यसे || ६-१०३-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Having taken away by force the miserable Seetha while she was staying in the forest
away from me, you think: �I am a champion'."_END

B_6_C_103_11
BEGIN_
स्त्रीषु शूर विनाथासु परदाराभिमर्शके |
कृत्वा कापुरुषन् कर्म शूरोअहमिति मन्यसे || ६-१०३-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Having done an act of cowardly persons of laying your hands on another's wife,
posing as a hero in relation to women without a protector, you think: "I am a champion'."_END

B_6_C_103_12
BEGIN_
भिन्नमर्याद निर्लज्ज चारित्रेष्वनवस्थित |
दर्पान्मृत्युमुपादाय शूरोअहमिति मन्यसे || ६-१०३-१४_END
BEGIN_
"O shameless person, who have broken the bounds of morality and are unstable of
customs, having laid hold through vanity of death (in the form of Seetha) you think �I am a
champion'."_END

B_6_C_103_13
BEGIN_
शूरेण धनदभ्रात्रा बलैः समुदितेन च |
श्लाघनीयन् यशस्यन् च कृतं कर्म महत्त्वया || ६-१०३-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Indeed a praiseworthy, great and glorious act has been performed by you, a valiant
brother of Kubera, the god of wealth, rich in strength!"_END

B_6_C_103_14
BEGIN_
उत्सेकेनाभिपन्नस्य गर्हितस्याहितस्य च |
कर्मणः प्राप्नुहीदानीन् तस्याद्य सुमहत्फलम् || ६-१०३-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Reap now and today the stupendous fruit of that noxious and contemptible act,
perpetrated through sheer vanity."_END

B_6_C_103_15
BEGIN_
शूरोऽहमिति चात्मानमवगच्छसि दुर्मते |
नैव लज्जास्ति ते सीतान् चोरवद्व्यपकर्षतः || ६-१०३-१७_END
BEGIN_
"O evil-minded one! You think: �I am a champion' yourself! Shame did not stand in
your way at all, for having taken away Seetha like a thief."_END

B_6_C_103_16
BEGIN_
यदि मत्संनिधौ सीता धर्षिता स्यात्त्वया बलात् |
भ्रातरन् तु खरं पश्येस्तदा मत्सायकैर्हतः || ६-१०३-१८_END
BEGIN_
"If Seetha were laid hands upon by you in my presence, you would have surely seen
your brother Khara at that very moment when killed with my arrows."_END

B_6_C_103_17
BEGIN_
दिष्ट्यासि मम दुष्टात्मंश्चक्षुर्विषयमागतः |
अद्य त्वान् सायकैस्तीक्ष्णैर्नयामि यमसादनम् || ६-१०३-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Thank heaven, O stupid fellow, you have come within the range of my sight. I will
dispatch you to the world of Death, by my sharp arrows, today."_END

B_6_C_103_18
BEGIN_
अद्य ते मच्छरैश्छिन्नन् शिरो ज्वलितकुण्डलम् |
क्रव्यादा व्यपकर्षन्तु विकीर्णन् रणपान्सुषु || ६-१०३-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Let your head, having blazing ear-rings lying on the dust-laden battle-field, be
carried away by beasts of prey, after being chopped off by my arrows today."_END

B_6_C_103_19
BEGIN_
निपत्योरसि गृध्रास्ते क्षितौ क्षिप्तस्य रावण |
पिबन्तु रुधिरन् तर्षाद्बाणशल्यान्तरोथितम् || ६-१०३-२१_END
BEGIN_
"O Ravana! Let vultures fly down on your wounded breast when you have been thrown
down on the ground and oozing out from the orifices caused by the impact of my pointed
arrow-tips."_END

B_6_C_103_20
BEGIN_
अद्य मद्बाणाभिन्नस्य गतासोः पतितस्य ते |
कर्षन्त्वन्त्राणि पतगा गरुत्मन्त इवोरगान् || ६-१०३-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Let birds (such as crows and vultures) tear out your bowels, as eagles would drag
serpents when you fall down dead when pierced by my arrows today."_END

B_6_C_103_21
BEGIN_
इत्येवन् स वदन्वीरो रामः शत्रुनिबर्हणः |
राक्षसेन्द्रन् समीपस्थं शरवर्षैरवाकिरत् || ६-१०३-२३_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking, the valiant Rama, the annihilator of enemies, poured out streams of
arrows on Ravana, who was in the vicinity._END

B_6_C_103_22
BEGIN_
बभूव द्विगुणन् वीर्यं बलं हर्षश्च सन्युगे |
रामस्यास्त्रबलन् चैव शत्रोर्निधनकाङ्क्षिणः || ६-१०३-२४_END
BEGIN_
The prowess, the strength, the enthusiasm and the stamina of arms of Rama became
two-fold, when he longed for the death of his enemy in battle._END

B_6_C_103_23
BEGIN_
प्रादुर्बभूवुरस्त्राणि सर्वाणि विदितात्मनः |
प्रहर्षाच्च महातेजाः शीघ्रहस्ततरोअभवत् || ६-१०३-२५_END
BEGIN_
All kinds of mystic missiles came to light in the mind of Rama the learned self and
in his excessive enthusiasm, Rama of extra-ordinary energy became all the more swift-handed._END

B_6_C_103_24
BEGIN_
शुभान्येतानि चिह्नानि विज्ञायात्मगतानि सः |
भूय एवार्दयद्रामो रावणन् राक्षसान्तकृत् || ६-१०३-२६_END
BEGIN_
Recognizing those good omens, Rama, the destroyer of demons, tormented Ravana even
more vehemently._END

B_6_C_103_25
BEGIN_
हरीणान् चाश्मनिकरैः शरवर्षैश्च राघवात् |
हन्यमानो दशग्रीवो विघूर्णहृदयोअभवत् || ६-१०३-२७_END
BEGIN_
While being struck by volleys of stones hurled by the monkeys and the showers of
arrows coming from Rama, Ravana felt bewildered at heart._END

B_6_C_103_26
BEGIN_
यदा च शस्त्रं नारेभे न व्यकर्षच्छरासनम् |
नास्य प्रत्यकरोद्वीर्यन् विक्लवेनान्तरात्मना || ६-१०३-२८_END
BEGIN_
Ravana could no longer take up weapons, nor stretch his bow, nor reacted to Rama's
prowess - on account of his mind being confused._END

B_6_C_103_27
BEGIN_
क्षिप्ताश्चापि शरास्तेन शस्त्राणि विविधानि च |
न रणार्थाय वर्तन्ते मृत्युकालेअभिवर्ततः || ६-१०३-२९_END
BEGIN_
As the time of his death approached, the arrows swiftly hurled and the various kinds
of missiles employed by Ravana did not turn to be of any use in battle._END

B_6_C_103_28
BEGIN_
सूतस्तु रथनेतास्य तदवस्थं निरीक्ष्य तम् |
शनैर्युद्धादसम्भान्तो रथन् तस्यापवाहयत् || ६-१०३-३०_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Ravana reduced to such a plight, the charioteer driving the chariot, for his
part, without getting excited, calmly and slowly carried off his chariot away from the
battle-front._END

B_6_C_103_29
BEGIN_
रथं च तस्याथ जवेन सारथि |
र्निवार्य भीमं जलदस्वनं तदा |
जगाम भीत्या समरान्महीपतिं |
निरस्तवीर्यं पतितं समीख्य || ६-१०३-३१_END
BEGIN_
On seeing Ravana, the king sunk down; hopelessly bereft of energy, the charioteer
diverting in haste the chariot of Ravana, which was rumbling like a cloud, thereupon sneaked away
from the battle-field in dismay._END

B_6_C_104_0
BEGIN_
स तु मोहात्सुसङ्क्रुद्धः कृतान्तबलचोदितः |
क्रोधसन्रक्तनयनो रावणो सूतमब्रवीत् ||६-१०४-१_END
BEGIN_
Impelled by force of Destiny and with his red-blood eyes through anger due to
infatuation, that Ravana spoke to his charioteer as follows:_END

B_6_C_104_1
BEGIN_
हीनवीर्यमिवाशक्तं पौरुषेण विवर्जितम् |
भीरुन् लघुमिवासत्त्वं विहीनमिव तेजसा ||६-१०४-२
विमुक्तमिव मायाभिरस्त्रैरिव बहिष्कृतम् |
मामवज्ञाय दुर्बुद्धे स्वया बुद्ध्या विचेष्टसे ||६-१०४-३_END
BEGIN_
"O evil-minded fellow! Despising me as though I were bereft of manliness, incapable,
deficient in prowess, cowardly, petty-minded, devoid of energy, bereft of brilliance, deserted of
conjuring tricks and abandoned by mystic missiles, you are acting as per your discretion!"_END

B_6_C_104_2
BEGIN_
किमर्थं मामवज्ञाय मच्छन्दमनवेक्ष्य च |
त्वया शत्रुसमक्षं मे रथोअयमपवाहितः ||६-१०४-४_END
BEGIN_
"Why have you carried away this chariot of mine, thus humiliating me in the presence
of my enemies and overlooking my will?"_END

B_6_C_104_3
BEGIN_
त्वयाद्य हि ममानार्य चिरकालसमार्जितम् |
यशो वीर्यन् च तेजश्च प्रत्ययश्च विनाशिथ ||६-१०४-५_END
BEGIN_
"O vulgar fellow! You have destroyed my fame which was earned through a long period,
prowess, vital power and the trust of people today."_END

B_6_C_104_4
BEGIN_
शत्रोः प्रख्यातवीर्यस्य रञ्जनीयस्य विक्रमैः |
पश्यतो युद्धलुब्धोअहन् कृतः कापुरुषस्त्वया ||६-१०४-६_END
BEGIN_
"While my adversary, having an illustrious prowess and making others delightful
through feats of his valour, stood looking on, myself, who has an ardent desire for fighting and
who was made contemptible by you!"_END

B_6_C_104_5
BEGIN_
यस्त्वन् रथमिमं मोहान्न चोद्वहसि दुर्मते |
सत्योअयं प्रतितर्को मे परेण त्वमुपस्कृतः ||६-१०४-७_END
BEGIN_
"O evil-minded fellow! In case you do not, by perversity, carry away this chariot at
any event, this expectation of mine that you stand corrupted by the enemy, will be a fact."_END

B_6_C_104_6
BEGIN_
न हीदन् विद्यते कर्म सुहृदो हितकाङ्क्षिणः |
रिपूणान् सदृशन् चैतन्न त्वयैतत्स्वनुष्ठितम् ||६-१०४-८_END
BEGIN_
"This act, which has been done by you, is only befitting of enemies. This is indeed
not the work of a friend, who wishes me well."_END

B_6_C_104_7
BEGIN_
निवर्तय रथन् शीघ्रं यावन्नापैति मे रिपुः |
यदि वाप्युषितोअसि त्वन् स्मर्यन्ते यदि वा गुणाः ||६-१०४-९_END
BEGIN_
"If you inhabited with me in Lanka for a long time and if you remember my merit,
drive back the chariot swiftly till my enemy does not withdraw."_END

B_6_C_104_8
BEGIN_
एवं परुषमुक्तस्तु हितबुद्धिरबुद्धिना |
अब्रवीद्रावणन् सूतो हितं सानुनयं वचः ||६-१०४-१०_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those harsh words of the foolish Ravana, the friendly-minded charioteer
spoke the following conciliatory words of Ravana:_END

B_6_C_104_9
BEGIN_
न भीतोअस्मि न मूढोअस्मि नोपजप्तोअस्मि शत्रुभिः |
न प्रमत्तो न निःस्नेहो विस्मृता न च सत्क्रिया ||६-१०४-११_END
BEGIN_
"I was neither frightened nor I was stupid. I was not bribed by the enemies, nor was
I a blunderer. I was not disloyal to you. I have not forgotten the benefits conferred by you."_END

B_6_C_104_10
BEGIN_
मया तु हितकामेन यशश्च परिरक्षता |
स्नेहप्रस्कन्नमनसा प्रियमित्यप्रियन् कृतम् ||६-१०४-१२_END
BEGIN_
"An act which was not to your taste was done by me as something conducive to your
interest, by wishing well of you, for protecting your honour and with mind affectionately disposed
towards you through attachment."_END

B_6_C_104_11
BEGIN_
नास्मिन्नर्थे महाराज त्वं मां प्रियहिते रतम् |
कश्चिल्लघुरिवानार्यो दोषतो गन्तुमर्हसि ||६-१०४-१३_END
BEGIN_
"O monarch! Like somebody who is petty-minded and unworthy, you ought not to hold
me, devoted as I am to your pleasure and good, quilty in this matter."_END

B_6_C_104_12
BEGIN_
श्रूयतामभिधास्यामि यन्निमित्तं मया रथः |
नदीवेग इवाम्भोभिः सन्युगे विनिवर्तितः ||६-१०४-१४_END
BEGIN_
"O monarch! Like somebody who is petty-minded and unworthy, you ought not to hold
me, devoted as I am to your pleasure and good, guilty in this matter."_END

B_6_C_104_13
BEGIN_
श्रमन् तवावगच्छामि महता रणकर्मणा |
न हि ते वीर सौमुख्यं प्रहर्षन् वोपधारये ||६-१०४-१५_END
BEGIN_
"I understand your exhaustion, due to your strenuous fighting in the great battle. I
am not reflecting on the inclination of your valour or on your superiority over your enemy."_END

B_6_C_104_14
BEGIN_
रथोद्वहनखिन्नाश्च त इमे रथवाजिनः |
दीना घर्मपरिश्रान्ता गावो वर्षहता इव ||६-१०४-१६_END
BEGIN_
"The horses of my chariot were broken down and were exhausted by drawing the
chariot. They became miserable and thoroughly fatigued, like the cows lashed by heavy rain."_END

B_6_C_104_15
BEGIN_
निमित्तानि च भूयिष्ठन् यानि प्रादुर्भवन्ति नः |
तेषु तेष्वभिपन्नेषु लक्षयाम्यप्रदक्षिणम् ||६-१०४-१७_END
BEGIN_
"I am seeing inauspiciousness in all the portents, which appear to us in large
numbers and duly examined by me."_END

B_6_C_104_16
BEGIN_
देशकालौ च विज्ञेयौ लक्ष्मणानीङ्गितानि च |
दैन्यन् हर्षश्च खेदश्च रथिनश्च बलाबलम् ||६-१०४-१८_END
BEGIN_
"(Propitious and unpropitious) time and place, (good and bad) omens, facial as also
the strength and weakness of the warrior occupying the chariot must be ascertained (by a
charioteer)."_END

B_6_C_104_17
BEGIN_
स्थलनिम्नानि भूमेश्च समानि विषमाणि च |
युद्धकालश्च विज्ञेयः परस्यान्तरदर्शनम् ||६-१०४-१९_END
BEGIN_
"The eminences and depressions of the ground as well as the parts which are level
and rugged, the time appropriate for the combat and the visible weak points of the enemy must be
known (by a charioteer)."_END

B_6_C_104_18
BEGIN_
उपयानापयाने च स्थानं प्रत्यपसर्पणम् |
सर्वमेतद्रथस्थेन ज्ञेयन् रथकुटुम्बिना ||६-१०४-२०_END
BEGIN_
"How to arrive and retreat, how to hold one's position and to recede all this must
be known by a charioteer, seated in the chariot."_END

B_6_C_104_19
BEGIN_
तव विश्रामहेतोस्तु तथैषान् रथवाजिनाम् |
रौद्रन् वर्जयता खेदन् क्षमं कृतमिदं मया ||६-१०४-२१_END
BEGIN_
"This action appropriate was taken by me in order to give rest to you and to these
horses of the chariot as also to relieve your terrible fatigue."_END

B_6_C_104_20
BEGIN_
न मया स्वेच्छया वीर रथोअयमपवाहितः |
भर्तृस्नेहपरीतेन मयेदन् यत्कृतं विभो ||६-१०४-२२_END
BEGIN_
"O the valiant lord! This chariot was not removed by me arbitrarily. That which was
done by me was because I was overwhelmed with affection for my master."_END

B_6_C_104_21
BEGIN_
आज्ञापय यथातत्त्वन् वक्ष्यस्यरिनिषूदन |
तत्करिष्याम्यहन् वीरन् गतानृण्येन चेतसा ||६-१०४-२३_END
BEGIN_
"O annihilator of enemies! O hero! Give me a command! I will do that which you will
enjoin me to do, with due attention and with a mind which feels relieved of all that is due."_END

B_6_C_104_22
BEGIN_
सन्तुष्टस्तेन वाक्येन रावणस्तस्य सारथेः |
प्रशस्यैनं बहुविधन् युद्धलुब्धोअब्रवीदिदम् ||६-१०४-२४_END
BEGIN_
Satisfied with the explanation given by his charioteer and applauding him in many
ways, Ravana who was avaricious of fighting, spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_104_23
BEGIN_
रथन् शीघ्रमिमं सूत राघवाभिमुखन् कुरु |
नाहत्वा समरे शत्रून्निवर्तिष्यति रावणः ||६-१०४-२५_END
BEGIN_
"O charioteer! Take this chariot quickly towards Rama. Ravana does not turn back in
battle, without killing his enemies."_END

B_6_C_104_24
BEGIN_
एवमुक्त्वा ततस्तुष्टो रावणो राक्षसेश्वरः |
ददौ तस्य शुभन् ह्येकं हस्ताभरणमुत्तमम् ||६-१०४-२६_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking Ravna the lord of demons was pleased and then presented a beautiful
and excellent ornament for the hand to him. That charioteer, after hearing Ravana's instruction,s
drove the chariot back to the battle-field._END

B_6_C_104_25
BEGIN_
ततो द्रुतन् रावणवाक्यचोदितः |
प्रचोदयामास हयान्स सारथिः |
स राक्षसेन्द्रस्य ततो महारथः |
क्षणेन रामस्य रणाग्रतोअभवत् ||६-१०४-२७_END
BEGIN_
Impelled by Ravana's command, that charioteer thereupon quickly drove the horses
forward. Then, that chariot of Ravana stood within a moment, before Rama's chariot on the
battle-field._END

B_6_C_105_0
BEGIN_
ततो युद्धपरिश्रान्तं समरे चिन्तया स्थितम् |
रावणं चाग्रतो दृष्ट्वा युद्धाय समुपस्थितम् || ६-१०५-१
दैवतैश्च समागम्य द्रष्टुमभ्यागतो रणम् |
उपगम्याब्रवीद्राममगस्त्यो भगवान् ऋषिः || ६-१०५-२_END
BEGIN_
Approaching Rama standing absorbed in fight in the battle-field, exhausted as he was
by the fight, and seeing Ravana who came nearby, facing him duly prepared for the battle, the
glorious sage, Agastya, who had come together with the gods, to perceive the battle, then spoke as
foolows:_END

B_6_C_105_1
BEGIN_
राम राम महाबाहो शृणु गुह्यं सनातनम् |
येन सर्वानरीन्वत्स समरे विजयिष्यसे || ६-१०५-३_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama, the mighty armed! Hear the following eternal secret, by which you can
conquer all the enemies in battle, my child!"_END

B_6_C_105_2
BEGIN_
आदित्यहृदयं पुण्यं सर्वशत्रुविनाशनम् |
जयावहं जपेन्नित्यमक्षय्यं परमं शिवम् || ६-१०५-४
सर्वमङ्गलमङ्गल्यं सर्वपापप्रणाशनम् |
चिन्ताशोकप्रशमनमायुर्वर्धनमुत्तमम् || ६-१०५-५_END


B_6_C_105_3
BEGIN_
रश्मिमन्तं समुद्यन्तं देवासुरनमस्कृतम् |
पूजयस्व विवस्वन्तं भास्करं भुवनेश्वरम् || ६-१०५-६_END
BEGIN_
"Worship the sun-god, the ruler of the worlds, who is crowned with the rays, who
appears at the horizon, who is greeted by the gods and the demons alike, shines forth; covering up
all other lights and brings light to the world."_END

B_6_C_105_4
BEGIN_
सर्वदेवात्मको ह्येष तेजस्वी रश्मिभावनः |
एष देवासुरगणान् लोकान् पाति गभस्तिभिः || ६-१०५-७_END
BEGIN_
"He is the embodiment of all gods, full of glory and the reflector of rays. He
protects the multitude of gods and demons as well as their worlds by his rays."_END

B_6_C_105_5
BEGIN_
एष ब्रह्मा च विष्णुश्च शिवः स्कन्दः प्रजापतिः |
महेन्द्रो धनदः कालो यमः सोमो ह्यपांपतिः || ६-१०५-८_END
BEGIN_
"He is Brahma the creator, Vishnu the protector of the Universe, Lord Shiva the god
of destruction, Skanda (son of Lord Shiva), Prajapati (the ten lords of creted beings), Indra the
ruler of gods, Kubera the bestower of riches, Kala the Time-spirit, Yama the god of retribution,
Soma the moon-god and Varuna the ruler of the waters."_END

B_6_C_105_6
BEGIN_
पितरो वसवः साध्या अश्विनौ मरुतो मनुः |
वायुर्वह्निः प्रजाः प्राण ऋतुकर्ता प्रभाकरः || ६-१०५-९_END
BEGIN_
"The Pitrus (manes), the eight Vasus, the twelve Sadhyas, the two Ashvins the
physicians of gods, the fortymine Maruts (wind-gods), Manu (a progenitor of the human race), Vayu
the wind-god, the fire-god, the created beings, the life-breath of the universe, the source of teh
seasons and the store-house of light."_END

B_6_C_105_7
BEGIN_
आदित्यः सविता सूर्यः खगः पूषा गभस्तिमान् |
सुवर्णसदृशो भानुर्हिरण्यरेता दिवाकरः || ६-१०५-१०_END
BEGIN_
"An off-spring of Aditi, the progenitor of all, Surya the sun-god and the provocator
of acts in people, the courser in the sky, the nourisher of all iwth rain, the possessor of rays
the golden, the brilliant, having golden seed whose energy constitutes the seed of the universe and
the maker of the day."_END

B_6_C_105_8
BEGIN_
हरिदश्वः सहस्रार्चिः सप्तसप्तिर्मरीचिमान् |
तिमिरोन्मधनः शम्भुस्त्वष्टा मार्तण्डकोऽंशुमान् || ६-१०५-११_END
BEGIN_
"He has seven green horses, is thousand-rayed, full of rays, the destroyer of
darkness, the source of happiness, maker of thinness, the infuser of life in the lifeless cosmic
egg and radiant."_END

B_6_C_105_9
BEGIN_
हिरण्यगर्भः शिशिरस्तपनोऽहस्करो रविः |
अग्निगर्भोऽदितेः पुत्रः शङ्खः शिशिरनाशनः || ६-१०५-१२_END
BEGIN_
"He is a golden foetus, maker of coolness, creator of heat, the bringer of a day,
the one who is eulogized by all, pregnant with fire, the son of Aditi, the one who pacifies himself
in the evening and the destroyer of frost."_END

B_6_C_105_10
BEGIN_
व्योमनाथस्तमोभेदी बुग्यजुः सामपारगः |
घनवृष्टिरपां मित्रो विन्ध्यवीथीप्लवंगमः || ६-१०५-१३_END
BEGIN_
"He is the lord of the sky, the disperser of darkness, the master of the three Vedas
(Viz. Rik, Sama and Yajur), the sender of thick rain, the friend of water and the on who courses
swiftly in the path of the sky."_END

B_6_C_105_11
BEGIN_
आतपी मण्डली मृत्युः पिङ्गलः सर्वतापनः |
कविर्विश्वो महातेजा रक्तः सर्वभवोद्भवः || ६-१०५-१४_END
BEGIN_
"He is the radiator of heat and adrned with a circle of rays. He is death himself,
tawny of hue, a giver of warmth to all, omniscent, all-formed, endowed with extra-ordinary
splendour, the one who has an affection in all and the source of all evolutes."_END

B_6_C_105_12
BEGIN_
नक्षत्रग्रहताराणामधिपो विश्वभावनः |
तेजसामपि तेजस्वी द्वादशात्मन्नमो.स्तु ते || ६-१०५-१५_END
BEGIN_
"He is the controller of all lunar mansions, planets and stars, the creator of all
and the resplendent among the splendid. O god, appearing in twelve forms (in the shape of twelve
months in a year), hail to you."_END

B_6_C_105_13
BEGIN_
नमः पूर्वाय गिरये पश्चिमायाद्रये नमः |
ज्योतिर्गणानां पतये दिनाधिपतये नमः || ६-१०५-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Hail to you in the form of eastern mountain and hail to the western mountain. Hail
to the lord of host of luminaries and hail to the lord of the day."_END

B_6_C_105_14
BEGIN_
जयाय जयभद्राय हर्याश्वाय नमो नमः |
नमो नमः सहस्रांशो आदित्याय नमो नमः || ६-१०५-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Hail to you, the giver of victory, hail to you, the joy born of victory! Hail to
you, the god with green horses, hail to you, having thousands of rays! Hail, hail to you the son of
Aditi!_END

B_6_C_105_15
BEGIN_
नम उग्राय वीराय सारङ्गाय नमो नमः |
नमः पद्मप्रबोधाय प्रचण्डाय नमोऽस्तु ते || ६-१०५-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Hail to you, the fierce one, hail to you the valiant one! Hail to you, the one with
variegated colours! Hail to you, the awakener of the louts, hail to you, the furious one!"_END

B_6_C_105_16
BEGIN_
ब्रह्मेशानाच्युतेशाय सूर्यायादित्यवर्चसे |
भास्वते सर्वभक्षाय रौद्राय वपुषे नमः || ६-१०५-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Hail to you, the ruler of Brahma, Lord Shiva and Lord Vishnu the infallible, the
sun-god, the light indwelling the solar orb, the resplendent one, the devourer of all, appearing in
form of Rudra."_END

B_6_C_105_17
BEGIN_
तमोघ्नाय हिमग्नाय शत्रुघ्नायामितात्मने |
कृतघ्नघ्नाय देवाय ज्योतिषां पतये नमः || ६-१०५-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Hail to you, the dispeller of darkness, the destroyer of cold, the exterminator of
foes, the one whose extent in immeasurable, the destroyer of the ungrateful, the god, who is the
ruler of all lights."_END

B_6_C_105_18
BEGIN_
तप्तचामीकराभाय हरये विश्वकर्मणे |
नमस्तमोभिनिघ्नाय रुचये लोकसाक्षिणे || ६-१०५-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Hail to you, possessing the lustre of refined gold, the dispeller of ignorance, the
architect of the universe, the uprooter of darkness, the splendour incarnate, the onlooker of the
world!'"_END

B_6_C_105_19
BEGIN_
नाशयत्येष वै भूतं तदेव सृजति प्रभुः |
पायत्येष तपत्येष वर्षत्येष गभस्तिभिः || ६-१०५-२२_END
BEGIN_
"This sun, the lord alone destroys and brings into existence all the brings. He
radiates heat by his rays. He sends the rain."_END

B_6_C_105_20
BEGIN_
एष सुप्तेषु जागर्ति भूतेषु परिनिष्ठितः |
एष चैवाग्निहोत्रं च फलं चैवाग्निहोत्रिणाम् || ६-१०५-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Planted in all created beings, he remains awake, when they have fallen asleep. He
alone is the oblation to the fire-god and the fruit attained by those who pour such oblations."_END

B_6_C_105_21
BEGIN_
देवाश्च क्रतवश्चैव क्रतूनां फलमेव च |
यानि कृत्यानि लोकेषु सर्वेषु परमप्रभुः || ६-१०५-२४_END
BEGIN_
"He comprises all the gods, as well as the sacrifies as also the fruit of all
sacrifices. He is a supremely competent one of all activities, which are found in all the
worlds."_END

B_6_C_105_22
BEGIN_
एनमापत्सु कृच्छ्रेषु कान्तारेषु भयेषु च |
कीर्तयन् पुरुषः कश्चिन्नावसीदति राघव || ६-१०५-२५_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama! No individual glorifying this sun-god, in distresses in difficulties; in
the woods or in times of peril, comes to grief."_END

B_6_C_105_23
BEGIN_
पूजयस्वैनमेकाग्रो देवदेवं जगत्पतिम् |
एतत्त्रिगुणितं जप्त्वा युद्धेषु विजयिष्यसि || ६-१०५-२६_END
BEGIN_
"Worship this sun-god, the lord of the universe and the god of all gods with
undivided attention. Muttering this praise three times, you will come out victorious in
battles."_END

B_6_C_105_24
BEGIN_
अस्मिन् क्षणे महाबाहो रावणं त्वं वधिष्यसि |
एवमुक्त्वा ततोऽगस्त्यो जगाम स यथागतम् || ६-१०५-२७_END
BEGIN_
"You will be able to kill Ravana at this very moment, O mighty armed one!" Saying
so, the sage, Agastya, thereupon, left as in the same way as he had come._END

B_6_C_105_25
BEGIN_
एतच्छ्रुत्वा महातेजा नष्टशोकोऽभवत्तदा |
धारयामास सुप्रीतो राघवः प्रयतात्मवान् || ६-१०५-२८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing this, Rama of extra ordinary energy, then became bereft of anguish. Feeling
greatly delighted, Rama retained that hymn in his memory with a devoted mind._END

B_6_C_105_26
BEGIN_
आदित्यं प्रेक्ष्य जप्त्वा तु परं हर्षमवाप्तवान् |
त्रिराचम्य शुचिर्भूत्वा धनुरादाय वीर्यवान् || ६-१०५-२९
रावणं प्रेक्ष्य हृष्टात्मा युद्धार्थं समुपागमत् |
सर्वयत्नेन महता वधे तस्य धृतोऽभवत् || ६-१०५-३०_END
BEGIN_
Sipping the water thrice and getting purified looking intently on the orb of the sun
and repeating this prayer, the valiant Rama obtained a great rejoice. Seizing hold of his bow and
seeing Ravana, Rama felt delighted in mind and marched forward for the fight. He stood voed to kill
Ravana, with an intense and all-sided effort._END

B_6_C_105_27
BEGIN_
अथ रविरवदन्निरीक्ष्य रामं |
मुदितमनाः परमं प्रहृष्यमाणः |
निशिचरपतिसंक्षयं विदित्वा |
सुरगणमध्यगतो वचस्त्वरेति || ६-१०५-३१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Rama with a delighted mind, and becoming most exhildrated on foreseeing the
death of Ravana, the sun-god, standing in the middle of a troop of celestials, exclaimed, "Hasten
up."_END

B_6_C_106_0
BEGIN_
सारथिः स रथम् हृष्टं परसैन्यप्रधर्षणम् |
गन्धर्वनगराकारं समुच्छ्रितपाताकिनम् || ६-१०६-१
युक्तं परमसंपन्नैर्वाइभिर्हेममालिभिः |
युद्धोपकरणैः पूर्णं पताकाध्वजमालिनम् || ६-१०६-२
ग्रसन्तमिव चाकाशं नादयन्तं वसुंधराम् |
प्रणाशं परनैन्यानां स्वनैन्यस्य प्रहर्षणम् || ६-१०६-३
रावणस्य रथं क्षिप्रं चोदयामास सारथिः |_END
BEGIN_
Thrilling with rapture, that charioteer, the charioteer of Ravana, drove forward
quickly, his chariot, a chariot, which was capable of attacking the army of enemies, a wonderful
piece of art like Gandharva-city, an imaginary city in the sky, mounted with flags, yoked with
horses of excellent quality adorned with golden necklaces, filled with war-implements, adorned with
rows of flags and banners, which was devouring the sky as it were, making the earth resound, which
was the destroyer of the army of adversaries and caused delight to its own._END

B_6_C_106_1
BEGIN_
तमापतन्तन् सहसा स्वनवन्तं महाध्वजम् || ६-१०६-४
रथन् राक्षसराजस्य नरराजो ददर्श ह |
कृष्णवाजिसमायुक्तन् युक्तं रौद्रेण वर्चसा || ६-१०६-५
दीप्यमानमिवाकाशे विमानं सूर्यवर्चसं |
तडित्पताकागहनन् दर्शितेन्द्रायुधायुधम् || ६-१०६-६_END
BEGIN_
Rama saw that Ravana's chariot, which was coming speedily with a noise, bearing a
large flag-staff, yoked with black horses, endowed with a terrific luster, blazing like an aerial
car in the sky, with a luster of the sun, filled with lightning-like flags and with a beautiful
appearance of a rain-bow._END

B_6_C_106_2
BEGIN_
शरधारा विमुञ्चन्तन् धारासारमिवान्बुदम् |
तन् दृष्ट्वा मेघसङ्काशमापतन्तन् रथं रिपोः || ६-१०६-७
गिरेर्वज्राभिमृष्टस्य दीर्यतः सदृशस्वनम् |
विस्पारयन्वै वेगेन बालचन्द्रानतं धनुः || ६-१०६-८
उवाच मातलिन् रामः सहस्राक्षस्य मातलिम् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that chariot, releasing streams of arrows, like a cloud releasing streams of
rain, with a noise equal to that of a bursting mountain, struck with a diamond, Rama after
stretching his bow in a crescent shape, spoke to Matali, Indra's charioteer as follows:_END

B_6_C_106_3
BEGIN_
मातले पश्य सन्रब्धमापतन्तन् रथं रिपोः || ६-१०६-९
यथापसव्यं पतता वेगेन महता पुनः |
समरे हन्तुमात्मानन् तथानेन कृता मतिः || ६-१०६-१०_END
BEGIN_
"O Matali! From the way in which the enemy is marching forward from left to right
with a great speed in his chariot more, it appears that heart has been set by him upon destroying
himself in the battle."_END

B_6_C_106_4
BEGIN_
तदप्रमादमातिष्ठ प्रत्युद्गच्छ रथन् रिपोः|
विध्वन्सयितुमिच्छामि वायुर्मेघमिवोत्थितम् || ६-१०६-११_END
BEGIN_
"Therefore, take care and march forward, facing the chariot of the enemy I wish to
destroy it, even as the wind would blow a cloud."_END

B_6_C_106_5
BEGIN_
अविक्लवमसम्भ्रान्तमव्यग्रहृदयेक्षणम् |
रश्मिसञ्चारनियतं प्रचोदय रथन् द्रुतम् || ६-१०६-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Without fear and flurry and with a steady heart and vision, and the movement of the
reins fully controlled, drive the chariot swiftly."_END

B_6_C_106_6
BEGIN_
कामं न त्वन् समाधेयः पुरन्दररथोचितः |
युयुत्सुरहमेकाग्रः स्मारये त्वां न शिक्षये || ६-१०६-१३_END
BEGIN_
"You need not be instructed by me, accustomed as you are to drive the chariot of
Indra the lord of celestials. Keen as I am to fight with a close attention, I am just reminding you
and not teaching you."_END

B_6_C_106_7
BEGIN_
परितुष्टः स रामस्य तेन वाक्येन मातलिः |
प्रचोदयामास रथन् सुरसारथिसत्तमः || ६-१०६-१४_END
BEGIN_
Extremely gratified with those words of Rama, that Matali the excellent charioteer
of gods drove on the chariot._END

B_6_C_106_8
BEGIN_
अपसव्यन् ततः कुर्वन्रावणस्य महारथम् |
चक्रोत्क्षिप्तेन रजसा रावणन् व्यवधूनयत् || ६-१०६-१५_END
BEGIN_
Passing the huge chariot of Ravana on the right, the charioteer then set Ravana
shaking, by the dust risen from the wheels of his own chariot._END

B_6_C_106_9
BEGIN_
ततः क्रुद्धो दशग्रीवस्ताम्रविस्फारितेक्षणः |
रथप्रतिमुखन् रामं सायकैरवधूनयत् || ६-१०६-१६_END
BEGIN_
The enraged Ravana then, with his coppery eyes wide open, trembled Rama, who stood
facing his chariot, with arrows._END

B_6_C_106_10
BEGIN_
धर्षणामर्षितो रामो धैर्यन् रोषेण लङ्घयन् |
जग्राह सुमहावेगमैन्द्रन् युधि शरासनम् || ६-१०६-१७_END
BEGIN_
Meeting fortitude with anger, though provoked with assault, Rama took hold of
Indra's bow, which was possessed of extra ordinary impulse in the battle-field._END

B_6_C_106_11
BEGIN_
शरांश्च सुमहातेजाः सूर्यरश्मिसमप्रभान् |
तदुपोढं महद्युद्धमन्योन्यवधकाङ्क्षिणोः || ६-१०६-१८
परस्पराभिमुखयोर्दृप्तयोरिव सिन्हयोः |_END
BEGIN_
He also seized hold of arrows of exceeding swiftness, which were shining like
sun-beams. Then began that great battle between the two warriors (Rama and Ravana) who were
desirous of killing each other, while facing each other like two proud lions._END

B_6_C_106_12
BEGIN_
ततो देवाः सगन्धर्वाः सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः || ६-१०६-१९
समीयुर्द्वैरथन् द्रष्टुन् रावणक्षयकाङ्क्षिणः |_END
BEGIN_
Then, the gods along with the Gandharvas the celestial musicians, Siddhas the
demigods and great sages, desirous of Ravana's ruin, arrived to see the battle of both the
chariot-warrriors._END

B_6_C_106_13
BEGIN_
समुत्पेतुरथोत्पाता दारुणा लोमहर्षणाः || ६-१०६-२०
रावणस्य विनाशाय राघवस्य जयाय च |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, terrific portents that caused one's hair to stand on end, appeared giving
an augury of doom to Ravana and prosperity to Rama._END

B_6_C_106_14
BEGIN_
ववर्ष रुधिरन् देवो रावणस्य रथोपरि || ६-१०६-२१
वाता मण्डलिनस्तीव्रा अपसव्यं प्रचक्रमुः |_END
BEGIN_
The god of rains poured blood on Ravana's chariot. Horrible winds blew from right to
left, forming circles._END

B_6_C_106_15
BEGIN_
महद् गृध्रकुलन् चास्य भ्रममाणं नभस्तले || ६-१०६-२२
येन येन रथो याति तेन तेन प्रधावति |_END
BEGIN_
A large flock of vultures, roaming about in the sky, was flying forward in the same
direction in which Ravana's chariot was going._END

B_6_C_106_16
BEGIN_
सन्ध्यया चावृता लङ्का जपापुष्पनिकाशया || ६-१०६-२३
दृश्यते सम्प्रदीतेव दिवसेअपि वसुन्धरा |_END
BEGIN_
Lanka was overcast with dusk, resembling a (red) Japa flower. The land in Lanka, as
also the day appeared as if they were blazing._END

B_6_C_106_17
BEGIN_
सनिर्घाता महोल्काश्च सम्प्रचेतुर्महास्वनाः || ६-१०६-२४
विषादयन्त्यो रक्षान्सि रावणस्य तदाहिताः |_END
BEGIN_
Large meteors, along with lightnings fell with great noise. Those entities, inimical
to Ravana, made demons to lament._END

B_6_C_106_18
BEGIN_
रावणश्च यतस्तत्र प्रचचाल वसुन्धरा || ६-१०६-२५
रक्षसान् च प्रहरतां गृहीता इव बाहवः |_END
BEGIN_
The earth on which Ravana was there, trembled. The arms of fighting demons looked as
if they were clasped._END

B_6_C_106_19
BEGIN_
ताम्राः पीताः सिताः श्वेताः पतिताः सूर्यरश्मयः || ६-१०६-२६
दृश्यन्ते रावणस्याङ्गे पर्वतस्येव धातवः |_END
BEGIN_
Fallen before Ravana, the rays of the sun appeared coppery, yellow, white and dark,
like mineral ores on a mountain._END

B_6_C_106_20
BEGIN_
गृध्रैरनुगताश्चास्य वमन्त्यो ज्वलनं मुखैः || ६-१०६-२७
प्रणेदुर्मुखमीक्षन्त्यः सन्रब्धमशिवन् शिवाः |_END
BEGIN_
The she-jackals followed by vultures hastily uttered inauspicious howls, on
beholding Ravana's face as also vomiting fire from their mouths._END

B_6_C_106_21
BEGIN_
प्रतिकूलन् ववौ वायू रणे पान्सून् समुत्किरन् || ६-१०६-२८
तस्य राक्षसराजस्य कुर्वन्दृष्टिविलोपनम् |_END
BEGIN_
Scattering the dust upwards over the battle-field and clouding the vision of that
Ravana, the wind blew in a direction inimicable to him._END

B_6_C_106_22
BEGIN_
निपेतुरिन्द्राशनयः सैन्ये चास्य समन्ततः || ६-१०६-२९
दुर्विषह्य स्वना घोरा विना जलधरस्वनम् |_END
BEGIN_
Even without the appearance of clouds, thunderbolts fell on his army on all sides,
with a noise which was hard to endure._END

B_6_C_106_23
BEGIN_
दिशश्च प्रदिशः सर्वा बभूवुस्तिमिरावृताः || ६-१०६-३०
पान्सुवर्षेण महता दुर्दर्शन् च नभोअभवत् |_END
BEGIN_
All the quarters and intermediate points of the compass became covered with darkness
and due to outpourings of dust, the sky became difficult to be seen._END

B_6_C_106_24
BEGIN_
कुर्वन्त्यः कलहन् घोरन् सारिकास्तद्रथं प्रति || ६-१०६-३१
निपेतुः शतशस्तत्र दारुणा दारुणस्वनाः |_END
BEGIN_
Hundreds of dreadful Sarika* birds, with their awful howls, terribly fighting there,
fell down upon Ravana's chariot._END

B_6_C_106_25
BEGIN_
जघनेभ्यः स्फुलिङ्गांश्च नेत्रेभ्योअश्रूणि सन्ततम् || ६-१०६-३२
मुमुचुस्तस्य तुरगास्तुल्यमग्निन् च वारि च |_END
BEGIN_
His horses discharged sparks of fire from their hips and loins as also tears from
their eyes, releasing out fire and water at the same time continuously._END

B_6_C_106_26
BEGIN_
एवं प्रकारा बहवः समुत्पाता भयावहाः || ६-१०६-३३
रावणस्य विनाशाय दारुणाः सम्प्रजजिञिरे |_END
BEGIN_
Frightful portents in multitude thus sprang up, bringing danger and destruction to
Ravana._END

B_6_C_106_27
BEGIN_
रामस्यापि निमित्तानि सौम्यानि च शिवानि च || ६-१०६-३४
बभूवुर्जयशन्सीनि प्रादुर्भूतानि सर्वशः |_END
BEGIN_
Pleasant and auspicious omens, depicting victory of Rama appeared on all sides,
before Rama._END

B_6_C_106_28
BEGIN_
निमित्तानि च सौम्यानि राघवः स्वजयाय वै || ६-१०६-३५
दृष्ट्वा परमसंहृष्टो हतं मेने च रावणम् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the pleasant omens depicting his victory, Rama was very much pleased and
considered Ravana as (already) dead._END

B_6_C_106_29
BEGIN_
ततो निरीक्ष्यात्मगतानि राघवो |
रणे निमित्तानि निमित्तकोविदः |
जगाम हर्षन् च परां च निर्वृतिं |
चकार युद्धेअभ्यधिकन् च विक्रमम् || ६-१०६-३६_END
BEGIN_
Then Rama, with the knowledge of all omens, having seen those portents in his own
way in the battle-field, obtained rejoice as well as extreme happiness and shown enhanced prowess
in combat._END

B_6_C_107_0
BEGIN_
ततः प्रवृत्तं सुक्रूरं रामरावणयोस्तदा |
सुमहद्द्वैरथं युद्धं सर्वलोकभयावहम् ||६-१०७-१_END
BEGIN_
Then ensued a fierce and a prolonged chariot-duel between Rama and Ravana, which was
frightful to all the worlds._END

B_6_C_107_1
BEGIN_
ततो राक्षससैन्यं च हरीणां च महद्बलम् |
प्रगृहीतप्रहरणं निश्चेष्टं समतिष्ठत ||६-१०७-२_END
BEGIN_
Then, the army of demons and the huge army of mokeys, stood motionless with their
weapons held fast in their hands._END

B_6_C_107_2
BEGIN_
सम्प्रयुद्धौ ततो दृष्ट्वा बलवन्नरराक्षसौ |
व्याक्षिप्तहृदयाः सर्वे परं विस्मयमागताः ||६-१०७-३_END
BEGIN_
Having their hearts captivated in seeing those two warriors, a human being and a
demon, both in full strength engaged in a fight, all for their part experienced a great wonder._END

B_6_C_107_3
BEGIN_
नानाप्रहरणैर्व्यग्रैर्भुजैर्विस्मितबुद्धयः |
तस्थुः प्रेक्ष्य च सङ्ग्रामं नाभिजघ्नुः परस्परम् ||६-१०७-४_END
BEGIN_
Having their hands occupied with various kinds of weapons, all those warriors stood
amazed in mind in beholding that duel. They did not go for war on each other._END

B_6_C_107_4
BEGIN_
रक्षसां रावणं चापि वानराणां च राघवम् |
पश्यतां विस्मिताक्षाणां सैन्यं चित्रमिवाबभौ ||६-१०७-५_END
BEGIN_
The demons beholding Ravana and the army of monkeys seeing Rama with their eyes in
amazement appeared as though they were paintings._END

B_6_C_107_5
BEGIN_
ते तु तत्र निमित्तानि दृष्ट्वा राघवरावणौ |
कृतबुद्धी स्थिरामर्षौ युयुधाते अभीतवत् ||६-१०७-६_END
BEGIN_
Having made up their minds and being firm in their anger, those two warriors for
their part, Rama and Ravana fought fearlessly, as it were, on seeing the portents in the
battle._END

B_6_C_107_6
BEGIN_
जेतव्यमिति काकुत्स्थो मर्तव्यमिति रावणः |
धृतौ स्ववीर्यसर्वस्वं युद्धेऽदर्शयतां तदा ||६-१०७-७_END
BEGIN_
Rama, who was convinced that he was going to win and Ravana who was firmly persuaded
that he would die, then demonstrated the entire wealth of their prowess in battle on that
occasion._END

B_6_C_107_7
BEGIN_
ततः क्रोधाद्दशग्रीवः शरान्सन्धाय वीर्यवान् |
मुमोच ध्वजमुद्दिश्य राघवस्य रथे स्थितम् ||६-१०७-८_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, the valiant Ravana, fitting his arrows with anger, released them,
directing them towards the flag-staff fixed on Rama's chariot._END

B_6_C_107_8
BEGIN_
ते शरास्तमनासाद्य पुरन्दररथध्वजम् |
रक्तशक्तिं परामृश्य निपेतुर्धरणीतले ||६-१०७-९_END
BEGIN_
Without even reaching the ensign on Indra's chariot and touching off the staff which
supported the banner of the chariot, the arrows fell on the ground._END

B_6_C_107_9
BEGIN_
ततो रामोऽभिसङ्क्रुद्धश्चापमायम्य वीर्यवान् |
कृतप्रतिकृतं कर्तुं मनसा सम्प्रचक्रमे ||६-१०७-१०_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, the valiant Rama too, in great anger, stretching his bow, proceeded with
his mind, to return blow for blow._END

B_6_C_107_10
BEGIN_
रावणध्वजमुद्दिश्य मुमोच निशितं शरम् |
महासर्पमिवासह्यं ज्वलन्तं स्वेन तेजसा ||६-१०७-११_END
BEGIN_
Rama released a sharp arrow, looking like a huge serpent and which was unbearable,
as though blazing with its own splendour, directing towards Ravana's flag-staff._END

B_6_C_107_11
BEGIN_
रामश्चिक्षेप तेजस्वी केतुमुद्दिश्य सायकम् |
जगाम स महीं भित्त्वा दशग्रीवध्वजं शरः ||६-१०७-१२_END
BEGIN_
As the brilliant Rama released the arrow towards the flag-staff, that arrow, tearing
asunder Ravana's flag-staf, entered the earth._END

B_6_C_107_12
BEGIN_
स निकृत्तोऽपतद्भूमौ रावणस्य रथध्वजः |
ध्वजस्योन्मथनं दृष्ट्वा रावणः सुमहाबलः ||६-१०७-१३
क्रोधजेनाग्निना सङ्ख्ये प्रदीप्त इव चाभवत् |
स रोषवशमापन्नः शरवर्षं महद्वमन् ||६-१०७-१४_END
BEGIN_
That standard, mounted on Ravana's chariot, having been torn off, fell on the
ground. Seeing the thrown-down piece of his flag-staff, that mighty Ravana stood blazing as though
he was laughing with intolerance. Flaming up with anger, he showered a stream of arrows afflicted
as he was, with the power of wrath._END

B_6_C_107_13
BEGIN_
रामस्य तुरगान्दिव्याञ्शरैर्विव्याध रावणः |
ते विद्धा हरयस्तस्य नास्खलन्नापि बभ्रमुः ||६-१०७-१५
बभूवुः स्वस्थहृदयाः पद्मनालैरिवाहताः |_END
BEGIN_
Ravana struck Rama's horses with blazing arrows. Those divine horses were neither
shaken nor stumbled in the battle-field. They were indeed healthy at heart and felt as though they
were just struck with lotus-stalks._END

B_6_C_107_14
BEGIN_
तेषामसम्भ्रमं दृष्ट्वा वाजिनां रावणस्तदा ||६-१०७-१६
भूय एव सुसङ्क्रुद्धः शरवर्षं मुमोच ह |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing those horses unstumbled, Ravana then was very much enraged and released
showers of arrows._END

B_6_C_107_15
BEGIN_
गदाश्च परिघांश्चैव चक्राणि मुसलानि च ||६-१०७-१७
गिरिशृङ्गाणि वृक्षांश्च तथा शूलपरश्वधान् |_END
BEGIN_
He also hurled maces, iron bludgeons, discs, iron clubs, mountain-tops, trees,
spikes and axes._END

B_6_C_107_16
BEGIN_
माया विहितमेतत्तु शस्त्रवर्षमपातयत् ||६-१०७-१८
सहस्रशस्ततो बाणानश्रान्तहृदयोद्यमः |_END
BEGIN_
Unwearied as he was in his heart and in effort, Ravana then employed streams of
missiles as a creation of magic and also thousands of arrows._END

B_6_C_107_17
BEGIN_
तुमुलं त्रासजननं भीमं भीमप्रतिस्वनम् ||६-१०७-१९
दुर्धर्षमभवद्युद्धे नैकशस्त्रमयं महत् |_END
BEGIN_
In that battle, abundant rain of various missiles, which were tumultuous, generating
fear, terrific and attended with a terrible echo, descended._END

B_6_C_107_18
BEGIN_
विमुच्य राघवरथं समन्ताद्वानरे बले ||६-१०७-२०
सायकैरन्तरिक्षं च चकाराशु निरन्तरम् |_END
BEGIN_
Leaving alone Rama's chariot, Ravana released arrows on the army of monkeys on all
sides, thus wholly covering the sky._END

B_6_C_107_19
BEGIN_
मुमोच च दशग्रीवो निःसङ्गेनान्तरात्मना || ६-१०७-२१
व्यायच्छमानं तं दृष्ट्वा तत्परं रावणं रणे |
प्रहसन्निव काकुत्स्थः सन्दधे निशितान् शरान् ||६-१०७-२२
स मुमोच ततो बाणान्रणे शतसहस्रशः |_END
BEGIN_
Ravana released arrows with a mind, which had given up all hope of survival. Seeing
that Ravana, who was interested in the battle, putting forth his great effort, Rama fitted Sharp
arrows to his bow, as though laughing and thereupon he loosed the arrows in hundreds and
thousands._END

B_6_C_107_20
BEGIN_
तान् दृष्ट्वा रावणश्चक्रे स्वशरैः खं निरन्तरम् ||६-१०७-२३
ततस्ताभ्यां प्रयुक्तेन शरवर्षेण भास्वता |
शरबद्धमिवाभाति द्वितीयं भास्वदम्बरम् ||६-१०७-२४_END
BEGIN_
Seeing those arrows, Ravana completely covered the sky with his own arrows. Due to
that dazzling shower of arrows then employed by the two warriors, the shining sky looked like a
second sky built with arrows._END

B_6_C_107_21
BEGIN_
नानिमित्तोऽभवद्बाणो नातिभेत्ता न निष्फलः |
अन्योन्यमभिसंहत्य निपेतुर्धरणीतले ||६-१०७-२५
तथा विसृजतोर्बाणान्रामरावणयोर्मृधे |_END
BEGIN_
While Rama and Ravana were discharging the arrows thus in the battle0field, no arrow
missed the target, no one failed to pierce the target and none had gone in vain. Colliding with
each other, they fell on the ground._END

B_6_C_107_22
BEGIN_
प्रायुध्येतामविच्छिन्नमस्यन्तौ सव्यदक्षिणम् ||६-१०७-२६
चक्रतुस्तौ शरौघैस्तु निरुच्छ्वासमिवाम्बरम् |_END
BEGIN_
Releasing the arrows left and right continually, they fought at each other. With
their terrific arrows, they made the sky, bereft of even a breathing space._END

B_6_C_107_23
BEGIN_
रावणस्य हयान्रामो हयान्रामस्य रावणः ||६-१०७-२७
जघ्नतुस्तौ तदान्योन्यं कृतानुकृतकारिणौ |_END
BEGIN_
Rama struck Ravana's horses. Ravana struck Rama's horses. Both the warriors then
struck at each other, doing anything before and after._END

B_6_C_107_24
BEGIN_
एवं तु तौ सुसंक्रुद्धौ चक्रतुर्युद्धमुत्तमम् ||६-१०७-२८
मुहूर्तमभवद्युद्धं तुमुलं रोमहर्षणम् |_END
BEGIN_
Those two extremely enraged warriors in this way, carried out are excellent combat.
A tumultuous battle ensued for an hour or so, causing the hair to stand erect._END

B_6_C_107_25
BEGIN_
प्रयुध्यमानौ समरे महाबलौ |
शितैः शरै रावणलक्ष्मणाग्रजौ |
ध्वजावपातेन स राक्षसाधिपो |
भृशं प्रचुक्रोध तदा रघूत्तमे ||६-१०७-२९_END
BEGIN_
The mighty Ravana and Rama carried out the fight well with sharp arrows in the
battle-field. That Ravana at that time was very much enraged with Rama, as his flag-staff was
thrown down._END

B_6_C_107_26
BEGIN_
तौ तथा युध्यमानौ तु समरे रामरावणौ |
ददृशुः सर्वभूतान्नि विस्मितेनान्तरात्मना ||६-१०७-३०_END
BEGIN_
All the created beings for their part gazed with an astonished mind on Rama and
Ravana, who thus were fighting at each other in the battle-field._END

B_6_C_107_27
BEGIN_
अर्दयन्तौ तु समरे तयोस्तौ स्यन्दनोत्तमौ |
परस्परमभिक्रुद्धौ परस्परमभिद्रुतौ ||६-१०७-३१_END
BEGIN_
Furiously attacking each other in the battle-field, those excellent chariots of the
two warriors ran towards each other._END

B_6_C_107_28
BEGIN_
परस्परवधे युक्तौ घोररूपौ बभूवतुः |
मण्डलानि च वीथीश्च गतप्रत्यागतानि च ||६-१०७-३२
दर्शयन्तौ बहुविधां सूतसामर्थ्यजां गतिम् |_END
BEGIN_
Intent on destroying each other, those chariots, displaying various types of
movements such as, moving in circles, moving straight and darting forward as also receding
forthwith, originated from the capabilities of those charioteers, assumed a terrible aspect._END

B_6_C_107_29
BEGIN_
अर्दयन् रावणं रामो राघवं चापि रावणः ||६-१०७-३३
गतिवेगं समापन्नौ प्रतिवेगप्रवर्तने |_END
BEGIN_
Rama wounding Ravana and Ravana too wounding Rama, both of them had recourse to
speed in movement in their forward and backward motions._END

B_6_C_107_30
BEGIN_
क्षिपतोः शरजालानि तयोस्तौ स्यन्दनोत्तमौ ||६-१०७-३४
चेरतुह् संयुगमहीं सासारौ जलदाविव |_END
BEGIN_
Those excellent chariots, casting streams of arrows, strolled in the battle-field,
like two clouds pouring showers._END

B_6_C_107_31
BEGIN_
दर्शयित्वा तदा तौ तु गतिं बहुविधां रणे ||६-१०७-३५
परस्परस्याभिमुखौ पुनरेव च तस्थतुः |_END
BEGIN_
Showing various kinds of movement in the battle-field, those chariots then again
stood facing each other._END

B_6_C_107_32
BEGIN_
धुरं धुरेण रथयोर्वक्त्रं वक्त्रेण वाजिनाम् ||६-१०७-३६
पताकाश्च पताकाभिः समीयुः स्थितयोस्तद |_END
BEGIN_
The shaft of the two chariots even as they stood at that moment, met one with the
other shaft the muzzle of the horses met the one with the other and the flags met the one with the
other flags._END

B_6_C_107_33
BEGIN_
रावणस्य ततो रामो धनुर्मुकैः शितैः शरैः ||६-१०७-३७
चतुर्भिश्चतुरो दीप्तान् हयान् प्रत्यपसर्पयत् |_END
BEGIN_
Then Rama, with his four sharp arrows discharged from his bow, drove back the four
splendid horses of Ravana._END

B_6_C_107_34
BEGIN_
स क्रोधवशमापन्नो हयानामपसर्पणे ||६-१०७-३८
मुमोच निशितान् बाणान् राघवाय दशाननः |_END
BEGIN_
That Ravana, falling a prey to anger for retreating his horses, discharged sharp
arrows on Rama._END

B_6_C_107_35
BEGIN_
सोऽतिविद्धो बलवता दशग्रीवेण राघवः ||६-१०७-३९
जगाम न विकारम् च न चापि व्यथितोऽभवत् |_END
BEGIN_
Rama, who was severely struck by the mighty Ravana, did not get upset nor was even
tottered._END

B_6_C_107_36
BEGIN_
चिक्षेप च पुनर्बाणान् वज्रपातसमस्वनान् ||६-१०७-४०
सारथिं वज्रहस्तस्य समुद्दिश्य दशाननः |_END
BEGIN_
Directing towards Matali, Indra's charioteer, Ravana hurled arrows with a sound
similar to that of a thunder-bolt._END

B_6_C_107_37
BEGIN_
मातलेस्तु महावेगाः सरीरे पतिताः शराः ||६-१०७-४१
न सूक्ष्ममपि संमोहं व्यथां वा प्रददुर्युधि |_END
BEGIN_
Arrows of great speed, fallen on Matali's body, did not cause even a pretty little
of bewilderment or hurt on him in that battle._END

B_6_C_107_38
BEGIN_
तया धर्षणया क्रुद्धो मातलेर्न तथात्मनः ||६-१०७-४२
चकार शरजालेन राघवो विमुखं रिपुम् |_END
BEGIN_
Enraged at that daring attack on Matali, Rama who for his part did not feel provoked
by the attack on himself, made his enemy turn away by hurling a net work of arrows on him._END

B_6_C_107_39
BEGIN_
विंशतिं त्रिंशतिं षष्टिं शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः ||६-१०७-४३
मुमोच राघवो वीरः सायकान् स्यन्दने रपोः |_END
BEGIN_
The valiant Rama discharged twenty, thirty, sixty and hundreds and thousands of
arrows on the enemy's chariot._END

B_6_C_107_40
BEGIN_
रावणोऽपि ततः क्रुद्धो रथस्थो राक्षसेश्वरः ||६-१०७-४४
गदामुसलवर्षेण रामं प्रत्यर्दयरणे |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, even Ravana, the enraged king of demons, who was seated in the chariot,
tormented Rama, by showering maces and mallets on him in the battle._END

B_6_C_107_41
BEGIN_
तत्प्रयुक्तं पुनर्युद्धं तु मुलं रोमहर्षणम् ||६-१०७-४५
गदानां मुसलानां च परिघाणां च निःस्वनैः |
शरणां पुङ्खवातैश्च क्षुभिताः सप्त सागराः ||६-१०७-४६_END
BEGIN_
The battle thus started again by then, was tumultuous, causing one's hair to stand
erect. With the sounds of maces, mallets and iron rods and with the gusts raised by the plumes
adorning the flying arrows, the seven agitated oceans felt disquieted._END

B_6_C_107_42
BEGIN_
क्षुब्धानां सागराणां च पातालतलवासिनः |
व्यथिता दानवाः सर्वे पन्नगाश्च सहस्रशः ||६-१०७-४७_END
BEGIN_
Thousands of all the demons and serpents, inhabiting in the nethermost subterranean
region of the agitated oceans, felt disturbed._END

B_6_C_107_43
BEGIN_
चकम्पे मेदिनी कृत्स्ना सशैलवनकानना |
भास्करो निष्प्रभश्चासीन्न ववौ चापि मारुतः ||६-१०७-४८_END
BEGIN_
The entire earth, including mountains, groves and forests trembled. The sun too
became gloomy even the wind did not blow._END

B_6_C_107_44
BEGIN_
ततो देवाः सगन्धर्वाः सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः |
चिन्तामापेदिरे सर्वे सकिंनरमहोरगाः ||६-१०७-४९_END
BEGIN_
Then, the gods along with Gandharvas the celestial musicians, Siddhas the
semi-divine beings, great sages and all including Kinnaras the mythical beings and great serpents
became disquieted._END

B_6_C_107_45
BEGIN_
स्वस्ति गोब्राह्मणेभ्योऽस्तु लोकास्तिष्ठन्तु शाश्वताः |
जयतां राघवः संख्ये रावणं राक्षसेश्वरम् ||६-१०७-५०
एवं जपन्तोऽपश्यंस्ते देवाः सर्षिगणास्तदा |
रामरावणयोर्युद्धं सुघोरं रोमहर्षणम् ||६-१०७-५१_END
BEGIN_
At that time, those gods along with troops of sages, saying "May all be well with
the cows and Brahmanas, May all the worlds endure forever, May Rama conquer Ravana!", saw a
terrific battle between Rama and Ravana, which caused one's hair to stand on end._END

B_6_C_107_46
BEGIN_
गन्धर्वाप्सरसां संघा दृष्ट्वा युद्धमनूपमम् |
गगनं गगनाकारं सागरः सागरोपमः ||६-१०७-५२
रामरावणयोर्युद्धं रामरावणयोरिव |
एवं ब्रुवन्तो ददृशुस्तद्युद्धं रामरावणम् ||६-१०७-५३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that matchless struggle and observing that the sky is its own compeer and the
ocean is its own analogue, the battle between Rama and Ravana can be likened only to the battle
between Rama and Ravana, the hosts of Gandharvas the celestial musicians and Apsaras, the heavenly
lymphs, looked on that battle between Rama and Ravana._END

B_6_C_107_47
BEGIN_
ततः क्रोधान्महाबाहू रघूणां कीर्तिवर्धनः |
संधाय धनुषा रामः शरमाशीविषोपमम् ||६-१०७-५४
रावणस्य शोरोऽच्छिन्दच्छ्रीमज्ज्वलितकुण्डलम् |
तच्छिरः पतितं भूमौ दृष्टं लोकैस्त्रिभिस्तदा ||६-१०७-५५_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, the great-armed Rama who augmented the fame of the kings born in Raghu
dynasty, stretching with anger, the serpent-like arrow with his bow, chopped off the glorious head
of Ravana, which was graced with blazing ear-rings. Then, all the three worlds saw that head,
fallen on the ground._END

B_6_C_107_48
BEGIN_
तस्यैव सदृशं चान्यद्रावणस्योत्थितं शिरः |
तत् क्षिप्तं क्षिप्रहस्तेन रामेण क्षिप्रकारिणा ||६-१०७-५६_END
BEGIN_
Another head, exactly similar to that head, cropped up on the shoulders of Ravana.
That second head was again chopped off by Rama, possessing a swift hand and who was swift in his
act._END

B_6_C_107_49
BEGIN_
द्वितीयं रावणशिरश्चिन्नं संयति सायकैः |
चिन्नमात्रं च तच्छीर्षं पुनरेव प्रद्श्यते ||६-१०७-५७_END
BEGIN_
The second head of Ravana was cut off by arrows in that battle. Soon after that head
was chopped off, it again rose into view._END

B_6_C_107_50
BEGIN_
तदप्यशनिसंकाशैश्छिन्नं रामस्य सायकैः |
एवमेव शतं चिन्नं शिरसां तुल्यवर्चसाम् ||६-१०७-५८_END
BEGIN_
Rama chopped off that head too with his arrows looking like thunderbolts. In the
same manner, a hundred of Ravana's heads of equal splendour were chopped off by Rama._END

B_6_C_107_51
BEGIN_
न चैव रावणस्यान्तो दृश्यते जीवितक्षये |
ततः सर्वास्त्रविद्वीरः करुसल्यानन्दवर्धनः ||६-१०७-५९
मार्गणैर्बहुभिर्युक्तश्चिन्तयामास राघवः |_END
BEGIN_
Yet, no certainty about Ravana's death could be seen. Thought equipped with many
arrows and well-versed with all kinds of missiles, the valiant Rama, the augmentor of Kausalya's
joy, then became thoughtful (said to himself as follows):_END

B_6_C_107_52
BEGIN_
मारीचो निहतो यैस्तु खरो यैस्तु सदूषणः |
क्रौञ्चावने विराधस्तु कबन्दो दण्डके वने |
यैः साला गिरयो भग्ना वाली च क्षुभितोऽम्बुधिः ||६-१०७-६०
त इमे सायकाः सर्वे युद्धे प्रात्ययिका मम |
किं नु तत्कारणं येन रावणे मन्दतेजसः ||६-१०७-६१_END
BEGIN_
"What is the reason, these arrows by which Mareecha, Khara, Dushana, Kabandha in
Kroucha-forest, and Viradha in Dandaka-forest were killed, by which seven Sala trees and the
mountains were burst, by which Vali was killed and the ocean shaken up all these arrows which
provided immediate succour to me in battle, have proved of little efficacy in the case of
Ravana."_END

B_6_C_107_53
BEGIN_
इति चिन्तापरश्चासी दप्रमत्तश्च संयुगे |
ववर्ष शरवर्षाणि राघवो रावणोरसि ||६-१०७-६२_END
BEGIN_
Thus absorbed in thought, Rama remained vigilant in the battle-field. He showered
streams of arrows in Ravana's chest._END

B_6_C_107_54
BEGIN_
रावणोऽपि ततः क्रुद्धो रथस्थो राक्षसेश्वरः |
गदामुसलवर्षेण रामं प्रत्यर्दयद्रणे ||६-१०७-६३_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, even Ravana, the enraged king of demons, who was seated in his chariot,
tormented Rama by showering maces and mallets on him in the combat._END

B_6_C_107_55
BEGIN_
तत्प्रवृत्तं महद्युद्धं तुमुलं रोमहर्षणम् |
अन्तरिक्षे च भूमौ च पुनश्च गिरिमूर्धनि ||६-१०७-६४_END
BEGIN_
That great tumultuous battle, which caused one's hair to stand on end, took place in
the sky, on the ground and furthermore on the mountain._END

B_6_C_107_56
BEGIN_
देवदानवयक्षाणां पिशाचोरगरक्षसाम् |
पश्यतां तन्महायुद्धं सप्तरात्रमवर्तत ||६-१०७-६५_END
BEGIN_
While the gods, the demons, Yakshas the super-natural beings, the devils, the
serpents and the ogres were witnessing, that great battle occurred for seven days._END

B_6_C_107_57
BEGIN_
नैव रात्रिं न दिवसं न मुहूर्तं न च क्षणम् |
रामरावणयोर्युद्धं विराममुपगच्छति ||६-१०७-६६_END
BEGIN_
There was no respite in battle between Rama and Ravana, either in the might or in
the day-time or for an hour or even for a instant._END

B_6_C_107_58
BEGIN_
दशरथसुतराक्षसेन्द्रयो |
र्जयमनवेक्ष्य रणे स राघवस्य |
सुरवररथसारथिर्महात्मा |
रणरतराममुवाच वाक्यमाशु ||६-१०७-६७_END
BEGIN_
Not beholding the victory of Rama in the combat between Rama and Ravana that
great-souled Matali, the charioteer of Indra quickly spoke the following words to Rama, who was
still engaged in fighting._END

B_6_C_108_0
BEGIN_
अथ सस्मारयामास मातली राघवं तदा |
अजानन्निव किं वीर त्वमेनमनुवर्तसे || ६-१०८-१_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Matali refreshed the memory of Rama as follows: "O the valiant one! Why
are you still carrying out the battle with Ravana as though you are unaware (of how to dispose of
him)?_END

B_6_C_108_1
BEGIN_
विसृजास्मै वधाय त्वमस्त्रं पैतामहं प्रभो |
विनाशकालः कथितो यः सुरैः सोऽद्य वर्तते || ६-१०८-२_END
BEGIN_
"O lord! You can employ a mystic missile presided over by Brahma the lord of
creation. The time for his destruction has come now, as expressed by the celestials."_END

B_6_C_108_2
BEGIN_
ततः संस्मारितो रामस्तेन वाक्येन मातलेः |
जग्राह स शरं दीप्तं निःश्वसन्तमिवोरगम् || ६-१०८-३
यं तस्मैन् प्रथमं प्रादादगस्त्यो भगवानृषिः |
ब्रह्मदत्तं महाबाणममोघं युधि वीर्यवान् || ६-१०८-४_END
BEGIN_
Then, the valiant Rama, who was reminded thus by Matali, took hold of a blazing
arrow, which was given by Brahma and which in turn was given to him by the glorious sage, Agastya
earlier in the battle-field and which looked like a hissing serpent._END

B_6_C_108_3
BEGIN_
ब्रह्मणा निर्मितं पूर्वमिन्द्रार्थममितौजसा |
दत्तं सुरपतेः पूर्वं त्रिलोकजयकाङ्क्षिणः || ६-१०८-५_END
BEGIN_
Having been made formerly for Indra, the lord of celestials by Brahma, the lord of
creation of infinite strength, it was bestowed in the past on the ruler of gods, who was desirous
of conquering the three worlds._END

B_6_C_108_4
BEGIN_
यस्य वाजेषु पवनः फले पावकबास्करौ |
शरीरमाकाशमयं गौरवे मेरुमन्दरौ || ६-१०८-६_END
