BEGIN_
In its feathers, wind was established. In its end-point were the fire and the sun.
In its heaviness were Mounts Meru and Mandara. Its shaft was made of ether._END

B_6_C_108_5
BEGIN_
जाज्वल्यमानं वपुषा सुपुङ्खं हेमभूषितम् |
तेजसा सर्वभूतानां कृतं भास्करवर्चसम् || ६-१०८-७_END
BEGIN_
Provided with good shaft decked with gold, the arrow which had its body shining, had
been made up of the efficacy of all the elements and an illuminating power of the sun._END

B_6_C_108_6
BEGIN_
सधूममिव कालाग्निं दीप्तमाशीविषोपमम् |
नरनागाश्ववृन्दानां भेदनं क्षिप्रकारिणम् || ६-१०८-८_END
BEGIN_
Blazing like a fire at the time of universal dissolution enveloped in smoke and
looking like a venomous snake, it was swift in action and capable of bursting hosts of men,
elephants and horses._END

B_6_C_108_7
BEGIN_
द्वाराणां परिघाणां च गिरीणां चापि भेदनम् |
नानारुधिरदिग्धाङ्गं मेदोदिग्धं सुदारुणम् || ६-१०८-९_END
BEGIN_
It broke gate-ways, iron bars, and even mountains. Smeared witht he blood of various
victims and quoted with their marrow, it presented a very terrific appearance._END

B_6_C_108_8
BEGIN_
वज्रसारं महानादं नानासमितिदारणम् |
सर्ववित्रासनं भीमं श्वसन्तमिव पन्नगम् || ६-१०८-१०_END
BEGIN_
That arrow had an efficacy of a thunder bolt, loud-sounding, tearing off armies of
adversaries in many battles and creating fear to all, like a hissing serpent._END

B_6_C_108_9
BEGIN_
कङ्कगृध्रबकानां च गोमायुगणरक्षसाम् |
नित्यं भक्षप्रदं युद्धे यमरूपं भयावहम् || ६-१०८-११_END
BEGIN_
It was giving perennial feed to vultures, eagles, cranes, troops of jackals and
demons in the battle-field, possessing a form of Yama the lord of Death and was fearful._END

B_6_C_108_10
BEGIN_
नन्दनं वानरेन्द्राणां रक्षसामवसादनम् |
वाजितं विविधर्वाजैश्चारुचित्रैर्गरुत्मतः || ६-१०८-१२_END
BEGIN_
That arrow bestowed joy on the monkey-leaders and destroyed the demons. It was made
speedy, by tying various kinds of beautiful coloured feathers of Garuda, the king of eagles, to
it._END

B_6_C_108_11
BEGIN_
तमुत्तमेषुम् लोकानामिक्ष्वाकुभयनाशनम् |
द्विषतां कीर्तिहरणम् प्रहर्षकरमात्मनः || ६-१०८-१३
अभिमन्त्र्य ततो रामस्तं महेषुं महाबलः |
वेदप्रोक्तेन विधिना संदधे कार्मुके बली || ६-१०८-१४_END
BEGIN_
Making it sacred by a special formula as per the procedure specified in scriptures,
Rama who was endowed with an extraordinary strength then fixed that arrow which was the foremost
among the three worlds, capable of removing the fear of Ikshwaku dynasty, taking away the glory of
the enemies and bestowing joy to one's own self on his bow._END

B_6_C_108_12
BEGIN_
तस्मिन् संधीयमाने तु राघवेण शरोत्तमे |
सर्वभूतानि संत्रेसुश्चचाल च वसुंधरा || ६-१०८-१५_END
BEGIN_
While that excellent arrow was being fixed by Rama, all the beings were frightened
and the earth trembled._END

B_6_C_108_13
BEGIN_
स रावणाय संक्रुद्धो भृशमायम्य कार्मुकम् |
चिक्षेप परमायत्तः शरं मर्मविदारणम् || ६-१०८-१६_END
BEGIN_
That enraged Rama, stretching his bow well and with an attentive mind, hurled that
arrow which can tear off the vitals, towards Ravana._END

B_6_C_108_14
BEGIN_
स वज्र इव दुर्धर्षो वज्रिबाहुविसर्जितः |
कृतान्त इव चावार्यो न्यपतद्रावणोरसि || ६-१०८-१७_END
BEGIN_
That arrow, which was inviolable as a thunderbolt hurled by the arms of Indra and
irresistible as Yama the lord of Death, fell upon Ravana's chest._END

B_6_C_108_15
BEGIN_
स विसृष्तो महावेगह् शरीरान्तकरः शरः |
च्छेद हृदयं तस्य रावणस्य दुरात्मनः || ६-१०८-१८_END
BEGIN_
That arrow, released with great speed and which was capable of destroying the body,
tore off the heart of that evil-minded Ravana._END

B_6_C_108_16
BEGIN_
रुधिराक्तह् स वेगेन शरीरान्तकरः शरः |
रावणस्य हरन् प्राणान् विवेश धरणीतलम् || ६-१०८-१९_END
BEGIN_
That arrow, which was capable of causing death to the body, after taking away the
life of Ravana and having been anointed with blood, penetrated the earth._END

B_6_C_108_17
BEGIN_
स शरो रावणं हत्वा रुधिरार्रीकृतच्छविः |
कृतकर्मा निभृतवत्स्वतूणीं पुनराविशत् || ६-१०८-२०_END
BEGIN_
Smeared with blood on having killed Ravana and thereby accomplishing its mission,
that arrow re-entered its own quiver (of Rama) silently._END

B_6_C_108_18
BEGIN_
तस्य हस्तद्धतस्याशु कार्मुकं च ससायकम् |
विपपात सह प्राणैर्भ्रुश्यमानस्य जीवितात् || ६-१०८-२१_END
BEGIN_
From the hands of the slain Ravana, who was being separated from his life, fell his
bow with its arrows (fitted to it), at the same time coinciding indeed with his life-breath._END

B_6_C_108_19
BEGIN_
गतासुर्भीमवेगस्तु नैरृतेन्द्रो महाद्युतिः |
पपात स्यन्दनाद्भूमौ वृत्रो वज्रहतो यथा || ६-१०८-२२_END
BEGIN_
Having lost his life, that king of demons for his part, who was endowed with
terrible swiftness and invested with great splendour, fell down from the chariot to the ground ,
like Vritra the demon when the latter was struck down by the thunderbolt._END

B_6_C_108_20
BEGIN_
तं दृष्ट्वा पतितं भूमौ हतशेषा निशाचराः |
हतनाथा भयत्रस्ताः सर्वतः संप्रदुद्रुवुः || ६-१०८-२३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Ravana fallen down on earth, the surviving demons whose king had been killed,
were panic stricken and ran away to all sides._END

B_6_C_108_21
BEGIN_
सर्वतश्चाभिपेतुस्तान् वानरा द्रुमयोधिनः |
दशग्रीववधं दृष्ट्वा वानरा जितकाशिनः || ६-१०८-२४_END
BEGIN_
The monkeys, who fought with trees, fell upon the demons from all sides. Seeing the
killing of Rvana, the monkeys assumed a triumphant appearance._END

B_6_C_108_22
BEGIN_
अत्दिता वानरैर्भ्रष्टा लङ्कामभ्यपतन् भयात् |
हताश्रयत्वात्करुणैर्बाष्पप्रस्रवणैर्मुखैः || ६-१०८-२५_END
BEGIN_
Tormented by the monkeys, the demons rushed back with panic towards Lanka, with
faces looking miserable and tears flowing down, their supporter having been killed._END

B_6_C_108_23
BEGIN_
ततो विनेदुः संहृष्टा वानरा जितकाशिनः |
वदन्तो राघवजयं रावणस्य च तद्वधम् || ६-१०८-२६_END
BEGIN_
Roaring shouts of joy, quite rejoiced as they were, and proclaiming Rama's victory
and the killing of Ravana in his hands, the monkeys behaved like conquerors._END

B_6_C_108_24
BEGIN_
अथान्तरिक्षे व्यनदत्सौम्य्स्त्रिदशदुन्दुभिः |
दिव्यगन्धवहस्तत्र मारुतः सुसुखो ववौ || ६-१०८-२७_END
BEGIN_
Then the cheerful kettle-drum of the gods reverberated in the sky. Very pleasant
winds, carrying divine odour, blew there._END

B_6_C_108_25
BEGIN_
निपपातान्तरिक्षाच्च पुष्पवृष्टिस्तदा भुवि |
किरन्ती रघवरथं दुरवापा मनोहरा || ६-१०८-२८_END
BEGIN_
Pouring over the chariot of Rama quite fascinating shower of flowers, which was
difficult to be accomplished (elsewhere), fell from the heavens to the earth on that occasion._END

B_6_C_108_26
BEGIN_
राघवस्तवसंयुक्ता गगने च विशुश्रुवे |
साधु साध्विति वागग्य्रा देवतानां महात्मनाम् || ६-१०८-२९_END
BEGIN_
Excellent pronouncements of the great-souled gods saying "well done! Bravo!",
combined with a panegyric in praise of Rama, was distinctly heard in the sky._END

B_6_C_108_27
BEGIN_
आविवेश महान् हर्षो देवानां चारणैः सह |
रावने निहते रौद्रे सर्वलोकभयंकरे || ६-१०८-३०_END
BEGIN_
When Ravana, the cruel demon and the terror of all the worlds, was killed, a great
rejoice filled the hearts of gods and charanas the celestial bards._END

B_6_C_108_28
BEGIN_
ततः सकामं सुग्रीवमङ्गदं च विभीषणम् |
चकार राघवः प्रीतो हत्वा राक्षसपुंगवम् || ६-१०८-३१_END
BEGIN_
Having been pleased with the killing of Ravana, Rama then fulfilled the desire of
Sugreeva, Angada and Vibhishana._END

B_6_C_108_29
BEGIN_
ततः प्रजग्मुः प्रशमं मरुद्गणा |
दिशः प्रसेदुर्विमलं नभोऽभवत् |
मही चकम्पे न च मारुतो ववौ |
स्थिरप्रभश्चाप्यभवद्दिवाकरः || ६-१०८-३२_END
BEGIN_
Then, troops of celestials got their mental peace. All the quarters were brightened
up and the sky became clear. The earth did not tremble. The wind blew gently. The sun too shed a
steady light._END

B_6_C_108_30
BEGIN_
ततस्तु सुग्रीवविभीषणाङ्गदाः |
सुहृद्विशिष्टाः सहलक्ष्मणास्तदा |
समेत्य हृष्टा विजयेन राघवं |
रणेऽभिरामं विधिनाभ्यपूजयन् || ६-१०८-३३_END
BEGIN_
Rejoiced with the victory in battle, Sugreeva, Vibhishana and Angada together with
Lakshmana along with their friends paid their respects with due ceremony to Rama, who looked
charming._END

B_6_C_108_31
BEGIN_
स तु निहररिपुह् स्थिरप्रतिज्ञः |
स्वजनबलाभिवृतो रणे रराज |
रघुकुलनृपनन्दनो महुजा |
स्त्रिदशगणैरभिसंवृतो यथेन्द्रः || ६-१०८-३४_END
BEGIN_
That Rama, the delight of Dasaratha, for his part, who had just killed his enemy and
thus who was steadfast in his vows and who was endowed with a great splendour, who stood surrounded
on the battle-field by his own people and the army shone like Indra the lord of celestials._END

B_6_C_109_0
BEGIN_
भ्रातरं निहतं दृष्ट्वा शयानं निर्जितं रणे |
शोकवेगपरीतात्मा विललाप विभीषणः || ६-१०९-१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing his brother lying down dead after defeat in battle, Vibhishana lamented, with
his mind filled with an outburst of sorrow:_END

B_6_C_109_1
BEGIN_
वीर विक्रान्त विख्यात प्रवीण नयकोविद |
महार्हशयनोपेत किं शेषे निहतो भुवि || ६-१०९-२_END
BEGIN_
"Why are you lying killed on the ground, though you are highly worthy of turning
towards lofty beds, O hero! The valiant one, the celebrated one, prudent in polity?"_END

B_6_C_109_2
BEGIN_
निक्षिप्य दीर्घौ निश्चेष्टौ भुजावङ्गदभूषितौ |
मुकुटेनापवृत्तेन भास्कराकारवर्चसा || ६-१०९-३_END
BEGIN_
"Having thrown about your two long arms which though decked wit armlets, are now
motionless and with your diadem brilliant as the sun, knocked down; why are you lying killed on the
ground/"_END

B_6_C_109_3
BEGIN_
तदिदं वीर संप्राप्तं यन्मया पूर्वमीरितम् |
काममोहपरीतस्य यत्त्न्न रुचितं तव || ६-१०९-४_END
BEGIN_
"O the valiant brother! That which was told by me earlier and that which was not
liked by you, as you were overcome with sensuality and infatuation; that very fate has been
obtained by you."_END

B_6_C_109_4
BEGIN_
यन्न दर्पात् प्रहस्तो वा नेन्द्रजिन्नापरे जनाः |
न कुम्भकर्णोऽतिरथो नातिकायो नरान्तकः || ६-१०९-५
न स्वयं त्वममन्येथास्तस्योदर्कोऽयमागतः |_END
BEGIN_
"For that which, because of arrogance, neither Prahasta nor Indrajit and others, nor
Kumbhakarna nor Atiratha nor Narantaka nor you yourself has agreed to my counsel, the consequence
of it has come now."_END

B_6_C_109_5
BEGIN_
गतः सेतुः सुनीतीनां गतो धर्मस्य विग्रहः || ६-१०९-६
गतः सत्त्वस्य संक्षेपह् प्रस्तावानां गतिर्गता |
आदित्यः पतितो भूमौ मग्नस्तमसि चन्द्रमाः || ६-१०९-७_END
BEGIN_
"As this hero, the foremost of those who wield the weapons, has fallen on the
ground, the established rule of well-conducted persons has gone. The incarnation of virtue has
departed. The epitome of strength has gone. The refuge of enlogies has gone out of sight. The sun
has fallen to the earth. The moon has merged in darkness. Fire has extinguished its flames and a
strennous effort has become inactive."_END

B_6_C_109_6
BEGIN_
चित्रभानुः प्रशान्तार्चिर्व्यवसायो निरुद्यमः |
अस्मिन्निपतिते वीरे भूमौ शस्त्रभृतां वरे || ६-१०९-८_END
BEGIN_
"What is remaining in this world now, while Ravana the foremost of demons, is at
present lying fast asleep in the dust?"_END

B_6_C_109_7
BEGIN_
किं शेषमिह लोकस्य गतस्त्त्वस्य संप्रति |
रणे राक्षसशार्दूले प्रसुप्त इव पांसुषु || ६-१०९-९_END
BEGIN_
"With firmness for its shoot, endurance for its excellent blossom, asceticism for
its strength, and valour for its firm root, the large tree in the shape of Ravana has been crushed
in the battle-field, by the tempest in the shape of Rama."_END

B_6_C_109_8
BEGIN_
धृतिप्रवालः प्रसहाग्र्यपुष्प |
स्तपोबलः शौर्यनिबद्धमूलः |
रणे महान् राक्षसराजवृक्षः |
संमर्दितो राघवमारुतेन || ६-१०९-१०_END
BEGIN_
"With sharpness for its tusks, the line of ancestors for its back-bone, anger for
its lower parts and graciousness for its proboscis, the elephant in rut in the shape of Ravana is
lying asleep on the ground, its body having been overthrown by a lion in the shape of Rama."_END

B_6_C_109_9
BEGIN_
तेजोविषाणः कुलवंशवंशः |
कोपप्रसादापरगात्रहस्तः |
इक्ष्वाकुसिंहावगृहीतदेहः |
सुप्तः क्षितौ रावणगन्धहस्ती || ६-१०९-११_END
BEGIN_
"With prowess and power for its expanded flames, sighs for its smoke and his native
strength for its glowing heat, the blazing fire in the shape of Ravana the demon has been
extingushed in the battle-field by the rainy cloud in the shape of Rama."_END

B_6_C_109_10
BEGIN_
पराक्रमोत्साहविजृम्भितार्चि |
र्निःश्वासधूमः स्वबलप्रतापः |
प्रतापवान् संयति राक्षसाग्नि |
र्निर्वापितो रामपयोधरेण || ६-१०९-१२_END
BEGIN_
"With the demons for its tail; hump and horn and fickleness for its ears and eyes,
the bull in the shape of Ravana the demon, the conqueror of its enemies, which vied with the wind
in energy, is lying dead, struck down by a tiger in the shape of Rama, the ruler of the earth."_END

B_6_C_109_11
BEGIN_
सिंहर्क्षलाङ्गूलककुद्विषाणः |
पराभिजिद्गन्धनगन्धहस्ती |
रक्षोवृषश्चापलकर्णचक्षुः |
क्षितीश्वरव्याग्रहतोऽवसन्नः || ६-१०९-१३_END
BEGIN_
To Vibhishana, who was thus speaking; enveloped in sorrow, Rama spoke the following
words, full of reason and which revealed his determined view of the matter._END

B_6_C_109_12
BEGIN_
वदन्तं हेतुमद्वाक्यं परिदृष्टर्थनिश्चयम् |
रामः शोकसमाविष्टमित्युवाच विभीषणम् || ६-१०९-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Ravana did not die in battle, without making an effort. He has fallen in combat,
eventhough he was endowed with terrible prowess and exhibited extra ordinary enthusiasm of a very
exalted type and remained confident throughout."_END

B_6_C_109_13
BEGIN_
नायं विनष्टो निश्चेष्टः समरे चण्डविक्रमः |
अत्युन्नतमहोत्साहः पतितोऽयमशङ्कितः || ६-१०९-१५_END
BEGIN_
"There is no occasion to grieve for him having fallen into death in the battle-field
and by whom the development of his country was wished for, while remaining steadfast in the duty of
Kshatriya the warrior."_END

B_6_C_109_14
BEGIN_
नैवं विनष्टाः शोच्यन्ते क्षत्रधर्मव्यवस्थिताः |
वृद्धिमाशंसमाना ये निपतन्ति रणाजिरे || ६-१०९-१६_END
BEGIN_
"There is no occasion to grieve for his having been brought under the sway of death
by whom intelligent as he was, all the three worlds including indra were frightened."_END

B_6_C_109_15
BEGIN_
येन सेन्द्रास्त्रयो लोकास्त्रासिता युधि धीमता |
तस्मिन् कालसमायुक्ते न कालः परिशोचितुम् || ६-१०९-१७_END
BEGIN_
"In the past, none has ever been exclusively victorious in a combat. A hero either
has been killed by his adversaries or had killed the enemies in battle."_END

B_6_C_109_16
BEGIN_
नैकान्तविजयो युद्धे भूतपूर्वः कदाचन |
परैर्वा हन्यते वीरः परान्वा हन्ति संयुगे || ६-१०९-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Such is the destiny proclaimed by the ancients, as highly esteemed for a warrior. A
warrior killed in battle, does not deserve to be mourned. Such is the ascertainment of the sacred
scriptures."_END

B_6_C_109_17
BEGIN_
इयं हि पूर्वैः संदिष्टा गतिः क्षत्रियसंमता |
क्षत्रियो निहतः संख्ये न शोच्य इति निश्चयः || ६-१०९-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Therefore, seeing this ascertainment, understanding the true principle, and free
from grief, think here of what duty that deserves to be performed."_END

B_6_C_109_18
BEGIN_
तदेवं निश्चयं दृष्ट्वा तत्त्वमास्थाय विज्वरः |
यदिहानन्तरं कार्यं कल्प्यं तदनुचिन्तय || ६-१०९-२०_END
BEGIN_
To that valiant prince (Rama) by whom the aforesaid words were spoken, Vibhishana,
who was tormented with grief, spoke (as follows) about the suitable action to be done next in
relation to his brother._END

B_6_C_109_19
BEGIN_
योऽयं विमर्देष्वविभग्नपूर्वः |
सुरैः समस्तैरपि वासवेन |
भवन्तमासाद्य रणे विभग्नो |
वेलामिवासाद्य यथा समुद्रः || ६-१०९-२१_END
BEGIN_
"The demon, who had never been conquered before in battles, by even all the gods
combined or by Indra himself, has been conquered, on confronting you in the battle-field, as the
sea breaks up, on reaching the shore."_END

B_6_C_109_20
BEGIN_
अनेन दत्तानि वनीपकेषु |
भुक्ताश्च भोगा निभृताश्च भृत्याः |
धनानि मित्रेषु समर्पितानि |
वैराण्यमित्रेषु निपातितानि || ६-१०९-२२_END
BEGIN_
"By him, gifts were endowed to to mendicents. Pleasures too were enjoyed. The king's
servents were fully maintained. Rches were made over to friends. Grudges against enemiies were
revenged."_END

B_6_C_109_21
BEGIN_
एषोहिताग्निश्च महातपाश्च |
वेदन्तगः कर्मसु चाग्र्यशूरः |
एतस्य यत्प्रेतगतस्य कृत्यं |
तत्कर्तुमिच्छामि तव प्रसादात् || ६-१०९-२३_END
BEGIN_
"He maintained a perpetually sacred fire. he practised great religious austerities.
He completely mastered Vedas, the sacred scriptures. He was highly proficient even in the ritual
acts. I desire to do, with you graciousness, that which is to be performed to him, who has departed
to the other world."_END

B_6_C_109_22
BEGIN_
स तस्य वाक्यैः करुणैर्महात्मा |
संबोधितः साधु विभीषणेन |
आज्ञापयामास नरेन्द्रसूनुः |
स्वर्गीयमाधानमदीनसत्त्वः || ६-१०९-२४_END
BEGIN_
Thus getting the personality of Ravana well-acquainted by vibhishana by his
compassionate words, Rama possessing unimpaired goodness, directed Vibhishana to perfom funeral
rites, which were intended to lead the departed soul to heaven:_END

B_6_C_109_23
BEGIN_
मरणान्तानि वैराणि निर्वृत्तं नः प्रयोजनम् |
क्रियतामस्य संस्कारो ममाप्येष यथा तव || ६-१०९-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Hostilities end with death. Our purpose has been accomplished. Let his funeral
rites be performed. He is even as good mine, as yours."_END

B_6_C_110_0
BEGIN_
रावणम् निहतं दृष्ट्वा राघवेण महात्मना |
अन्तःपुराद्विनिष्पेतू राक्षस्यः शोककर्शिताः || ६-११०-१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Ravana killed by the great-souled Rama, the female-demons were stricken with
grief and rushed out from their gynaecium._END

B_6_C_110_1
BEGIN_
वार्यमाणः सुबहुशो वेष्टन्त्यः क्षितिपांसुषु |
विमुक्तकेश्यः शोकार्ता गावो वत्सहता यथा || ६-११०-२_END
BEGIN_
Even though impeded now and then by their maid servants, they were rolling in the
dust of the streets, with their hair dishevelled, tormented as they were with grief like cows that
had lost their calf._END

B_6_C_110_2
BEGIN_
उत्तरेण विनिष्क्रम्य द्वारेण सह राक्षसैः |
प्रविश्यायोधनं घोरं विचिन्वन्त्यो हतं पतिम् || ६-११०-३
आर्यपुत्रेति वादिन्यो हा नाथेति च सर्वशः |
परिपेतुः कबन्धाङ्कां महीं शोणितकर्दमाम् || ६-११०-४_END
BEGIN_
Issuing out of the northern gate along with demons and penetrating into the terrific
battle-field, searching for their husband, who had been killed and crying out, "Ah my lord! Ah my
husband!" they all ran hither and thither on the ground which was covered with headless trunks and
rendered muddy with blood."_END

B_6_C_110_3
BEGIN_
ता बाष्पपरिपूर्णाक्ष्यो भर्तृशोकपराजिताः |
करेण्व इव नर्दन्त्यो विनेदुर्हतयूथपाः || ६-११०-५_END
BEGIN_
Those women, who were overcome with grief about the death of their husband, having
their eyes filled with tears, loudly lamented like female-elephants who had lost the leader of
their herd._END

B_6_C_110_4
BEGIN_
ददृशुस्ता महाकायं महावीर्यं महद्युतिम् |
रावणं निहतं भूमौ नीलाञ्जनचयोपमम् || ६-११०-६_END
BEGIN_
Those women saw the gigantic Ravana, who was endowed with a great strength and
invested with a great splendour, lying killed on the ground, like a heap of black collyrium._END

B_6_C_110_5
BEGIN_
ताः पतिं सहसा दृष्ट्वा शयानं रणपांसुषु |
निपेतुस्तस्य गात्रेषु छिन्ना वनलता इव || ६-११०-७_END
BEGIN_
Suddenly seeing their husband lying in dust of the battle-field, those women fell
down on his limbs, like uprooted wild creepers._END

B_6_C_110_6
BEGIN_
बहुमानात्परिष्वज्व काचिदेवं रुरोद ह |
चरणौ काचिदालम्ब्य काचित्कण्ठेऽवलम्ब्य च || ६-११०-८_END
BEGIN_
A woman wept, embracing him out of great regard, another woman clinging to his feet
and another, catching hold of his neck._END

B_6_C_110_7
BEGIN_
उत्क्षिप्य च भुजौ काचिद् भूमौ सुपरिवर्तते |
हतस्य वदनं दृष्ट्वा काचिन्मोहमुपागमत् || ६-११०-९_END
BEGIN_
A woman rolled over the ground, with her arms thrown up. On seeing the face of her
deceased husband, another woman fell into a swoon._END

B_6_C_110_8
BEGIN_
काचिदङ्के शिरः कृत्वा रुरोद मुखमीक्षती |
स्नापयन्ती मुखं बाष्पैस्तुषारैरिव पङ्कजम् || ६-११०-१०_END
BEGIN_
Keeping Ravana's head in her lap, a woman, looking at his face, wept moistening that
face with her tears, as dew drops moisten a lotus-flower._END

B_6_C_110_9
BEGIN_
एवमार्ताः पतिं दृष्ट्वा रावणं निहतं भुवि |
चुक्रुशुर्बहुधा शोकाद्भूयस्ताः पर्यदेवयन् || ६-११०-११
येन वित्रासितः शक्रो येन वित्रासितो यमः |
येन वैश्रवणो राजा पुष्पकेण वियोजितः || ६-११०-१२
गन्धर्वाणामृषीणां च सुराणां च महात्मनाम् |
भयं येन रणे दत्तं सोऽयं शेते रणे हतः || ६-११०-१३_END
BEGIN_
"That Ravana, by whom Indra was thrown into fear, Yama was struck with terror, by
whom Kubera the king was deprived of Pushpaka the aerial car, and by whom fear was caused on the
battle-field in the Gandharva the celestial musicians, in the sages and the great-souled gods, lies
killed in the battle-field."_END

B_6_C_110_10
BEGIN_
असुरेभ्यः सुरेभ्यो वा पन्नगेभ्योऽपि वा तथा |
भयं यो न विजानाति तस्येदं मानुषाद् भयम् || ६-११०-१४_END
BEGIN_
"This danger has come from a mortal to him, who did not conceive any fear from the
demons or the gods or even the serpents for that matter!"_END

B_6_C_110_11
BEGIN_
अवध्यो देवतानां यस्तथा दानवरक्षसाम् |
हतः सोऽयं रणे शेते मानुषेण पदातिना || ६-११०-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Here lies killed in battle, by a pedestrian man coming from Ayodhya, that Ravana,
who was incapable of being killed by gods and even so by devils and demons too."_END

B_6_C_110_12
BEGIN_
यो न शक्यः सुरैर्हन्तुं न यक्षैर्नासुरैस्तथा |
सोऽयं कश्चिदिवासत्त्वो मृत्युं मर्येन लम्भितः || ६-११०-१६_END
BEGIN_
"He who could not be killed by gods, Yakshas and demons alike, could be killed by a
mortal like one devoid of strength."_END

B_6_C_110_13
BEGIN_
एवं वदन्त्यो रुरुदस्तस्य ता दुःखिताः स्त्रियः |
भूय एव च दुःखार्ता विलेपुश्च पुनः पुनः || ६-११०-१७_END
BEGIN_
Thus uttering, those women of Ravana, wailing as aforesaid, burst into tears. They
once more and repeatedly lamented, stricken, as they were, with grief (as follows):_END

B_6_C_110_14
BEGIN_
अशृण्वता तु सुहृदां सततं हितवादिनाम् |
मरणायाहृता सीता राक्षसाश्च निपातिताः || ६-११०-१८
एताः सममिदानीं ते वयमात्मा च पातितः |_END
BEGIN_
"For your own death, Seetha was borne away by you, who did not listen to your near
and dear ones, who always offered friendly counsel to you. The demons were struck down. Here, stand
we (your consorts) as well as your own self, struck down now."_END

B_6_C_110_15
BEGIN_
ब्रुवाणोऽपि हितं वाक्यमिष्टो भ्राता विभीषणः || ६-११०-१९
धृष्टं परुषितो मोहात्त्वयात्मवधकाङिक्ष्णा |_END
BEGIN_
"Though tendering salutary advice to you, Vibhishana your beloved brother, was
harshly scolded through ignorance by you, who sought your own destruction."_END

B_6_C_110_16
BEGIN_
यदि निर्यातिता ते स्वात्सीता रामाय मैथिली || ६-११०-२०
न नः स्याद्व्यसनं घोरमिदं मूलहरं महत् |_END
BEGIN_
"If you had restored Seetha a princess of Mithila to Rama, this appallingly terrific
disaster, which has robbed us of every root, would not have befallen us."_END

B_6_C_110_17
BEGIN_
वृत्तकामो भवेद्भ्राता रामो मित्रकुलं भवेत् || ६-११०-२१
वयं चाविधवाः सर्वाः सकामा न च शत्रवः |_END
BEGIN_
"If you had restored Seetha to Rama, Vibhishana your brother would have had his
desire fulfilled. Rama would have been in the company of our allies. All of us would have been
spared the curse of widowhood and our enemies would not have realized their ambition."_END

B_6_C_110_18
BEGIN_
त्वया पुनर्नृशंसेन सीतां संरुन्धता बलात् || ६-११०-२२
राक्षसा वयमात्मा च त्रयं तुल्यं निपातितम् |_END
BEGIN_
"By you, however, who forcefully captivated Seetha cruelly, the demons, we (your
consorts) and your own self all the three have been destroyed all at once."_END

B_6_C_110_19
BEGIN_
न कामकारः कामं वा तव राक्षसपुंगव|
दैवं चेष्टयते सर्वं हतं दैवेन हन्यते || ६-११०-२३_END
BEGIN_
"O the excellent demon! Your act of following your own free will, may not be the
reason for your destruction, either for, all is being run by a divine power, struck and ruined by
the divine power."_END

B_6_C_110_20
BEGIN_
वानराणाम् विनाशोऽयं राक्षसानां च ते रणे |
तव चैव महाबाहो दैवयोगादुपाग्तः || ६-११०-२४_END
BEGIN_
"This destruction of the monkeys, your demons as also yourself, in the battle, has
happened at the juncture of the Providence (alone), O the great armed!"_END

B_6_C_110_21
BEGIN_
नै वार्थेन न कामेन विक्रमेण न चाज्ञया |
शक्या दैवगतिर्लोके निवर्तयितुमुद्यता || ६-११०-२५_END
BEGIN_
"The course of destiny, when ready to bear fruit, cannot be diverted either by
money, or by wish, or by valour or even by command in this world."_END

B_6_C_110_22
BEGIN_
विलेपुरेवं दीनास्ता राक्षसाधिपयोषितः |
कुरर्य इव दुःखार्ता बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणाः || ६-११०-२६_END
BEGIN_
Those consorts of Ravana, depressed as they were and afflicted with grief, with
their eyes full of tears, thus lamented like female ospreys._END

B_6_C_111_0
BEGIN_
तासां विलपमानानां तथा राक्षसयोषिताम् |
ज्येष्ठा पत्नी प्रिया दीना भर्तारं समुदैक्षत || ६-१११-१_END
BEGIN_
While those consorts were weeping on that occasion, Mandodari, the senior most and
beloved wife of Ravana, who was feeling miserable, stared at her husband._END

B_6_C_111_1
BEGIN_
दशग्रीवन् हतं दृष्ट्वा रामेणाचिन्त्यकर्मणा |
पतिं मन्दोदरी तत्र कृपणा पर्यदेवयत् || ६-१११-२_END
BEGIN_
Gazing at Ravana, her husband who was killed by Rama of unimaginable exploits,
Mandodari there, miserably lamented (as follows):_END

B_6_C_111_2
BEGIN_
ननु नाम महाबाहो तव वैश्रवणानुज |
क्रुद्धस्य प्रमुखे स्थातुन् त्रस्यत्यपि पुरन्दरः || ६-१११-३_END
BEGIN_
"O the great armed, the brother of Kubera! Even Indra the destroyer of strongholds,
indeed dares not to stand before you, when you were enraged."_END

B_6_C_111_3
BEGIN_
ऋषयश्च महीदेवा गन्धर्वाश्च यशस्विनः |
ननु नाम तवोद्वेगाच्चारणाश्च दिशो गताः || ६-१११-४_END
BEGIN_
"Because of fear from you, eminent sages, illustrious Gandharvas the celestial
musicians and the wandering bards indeed fled in all directions."_END

B_6_C_111_4
BEGIN_
स त्वं मानुषमात्रेण रामेण युधि निर्जितः |
न व्यपत्रपसे राजन् किमिदं राक्षसर्षभ || ६-१११-५_END
BEGIN_
"O the lord of demons! O king! How is it that you are not ashamed, though you were
conquered in battle, by Rama, a mere mortal?"_END

B_6_C_111_5
BEGIN_
कथन् त्रैलोक्यमाक्रम्य श्रिया वीर्येण चान्वितम् |
अविषह्यन् जघान त्वं मानुषो वनगोचरः || ६-१११-६_END
BEGIN_
"How did a mortal, wandering in a forest, killed you, who having overcome the three
worlds by dint of your prowess, had grown irresistible and were endowed with glory?"_END

B_6_C_111_6
BEGIN_
मानुषाणामविषये चरतः कामरूपिणः |
विनाशस्तव रामेण सन्युगे नोपपद्यते || ६-१११-७_END
BEGIN_
"It is not possible of annihilation of yourself, who lived in a place not accessible
to men and was able to assume any form at your will, by Rama in battle."_END

B_6_C_111_7
BEGIN_
न चैतत्कर्म रामस्य श्रद्दधामि चमूमुखे |
सर्वतः समुपेतस्य तव तेनाभिमर्शनम् || ६-१११-८_END
BEGIN_
"I do not believe this act of Rama in the battle-front, nor do I believe of the
attack by him, on your army, fully equipped with all the implements of war."_END

B_6_C_111_8
BEGIN_
यदैव च जनस्थाने राक्षनैर्बहुभिर्वृतः |
खरस्तव हतो भ्राता तदैवानौ न मानुषः || ६-१११-९_END
BEGIN_
"The moment your brother Khara was killed by Rama in Janasthana, though surrounded
by a multitude of demons, it became evident that Rama was really no mortal."_END

B_6_C_111_9
BEGIN_
यदिअव नगरीं लङ्कां दुष्प्रवेशां सुरैरपि |
प्रविष्टो हनुमान्वीर्यात्तदैव व्यथिता वयम् || ६-१११-१०_END
BEGIN_
"We felt painful, the moment Hanuma penetrated, by dint of his prowess, deep into
the City of Lanka, which was difficult to be entered even for gods."_END

B_6_C_111_10
BEGIN_
यदिअव वानरैर्घोरैर्बद्दः सेतुर्महार्णवे |
तदैव हृदयेनाहं शङ्के रामममानुषम् || ६-१११-११_END
BEGIN_
"The day when the terrific monkeys built a bridge on the great ocean, that day
itself I believed that Rama was not an ordinary mortal."_END

B_6_C_111_11
BEGIN_
अथवा रामरूपेण कृतान्तः स्वयमागतः |
मायां तव विनाशाय विधायाप्रतितर्किताम् || ६-१११-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Otherwise, for your destruction, Yama, the lord of Death came himself assuming the
form of Rama having arranged an unimaginable form of illusion."_END

B_6_C_111_12
BEGIN_
अथवा वासवेन त्वं धर्षितोऽसि महाबल |
वासवस्य तु का शक्तिस्त्वां द्रष्टुमपि संयुगे || ६-१११-१३_END
BEGIN_
"O the mighty lord! Otherwise, you might have been overpowered by Indra the lord of
celestials. But for Indra, where is the capacity even to behold you in battle?_END

B_6_C_111_13
BEGIN_
व्यक्तमेष महायोगी परमात्मा सनातनः |
अनादिमध्यनिधनो महतः परमो महान् || ६-१११-१४
तमसः परमो धाता शङ्खचक्रगदाधरः |
श्रीवत्सवक्षा नित्यश्रीरजय्यः शाश्वतो ध्रुवः || ६-१११-१५
मानुषं रूपमास्थाय विष्णुः सत्यपराक्रमः |
सर्वैः परिवृतो देवैर्वानरत्वमुपागतैः || ६-१११-१६
सर्वलोकेश्वरः श्रीमान् लोकानां हितकाम्यया |
सराक्षस परीवारम् हतवांस्त्वां महाद्युतिः || ६-१११-१७_END
BEGIN_
"This Rama is certainly a great ascetic, an eternal person, having no beginning
middle or end, greater than distinguished universal spirit like Brahma, the one beyond ignorance,
the nourisher, wielding a conch, a disc and a mace, wearing the 'Srivatsa' mark on his chest, of
lasting beauty, incapable of being conquered, a perpetual one, being the constant soul of the
universe, truly mighty, the lord of all the worlds, the prosperous one having a great splendour and
Vishnu, the lord of maintenance of the world with a wish to benefit the worlds, assuming a human
form surrounded by all the gods in the form of monkeys, Rama killed you, surrounded by demons._END

B_6_C_111_14
BEGIN_
इन्द्रियाणि पुरा जित्वा जितन् त्रिभुवणं त्वया |
स्मरद्भिरिव तद्वैरमिन्द्रियैरेव निर्जितः || ६-१११-१८_END
BEGIN_
"In the past, by performing a great penance, you conquered the senses and conquered
the three worlds. Now, as if revenging that enmity, those very senses conquered you."_END

B_6_C_111_15
BEGIN_
यदैव हि जनस्थाने राक्षसैर्बहुभिर्वृतः |
खरस्तव हतो भ्राता तदैवासौ न मानुषः || ६-१११-१९
यदैव नगरीन् लङ्कान् दुष्प्रवेषां सुरैरपि |
प्रविष्टो हनुमान्वीर्यात्तदैव व्यथिता वयम् || ६-१११-२०_END
BEGIN_
"The moment your brother Khara was killed by Rama in Janasthana, though surrounded
by a multitude of demons, it became evident that Rama was really no mortal. We felt perturbed, the
moment Hanuma penetrated, by dint of his prowess, deeply into the City of Lanka, which was
difficult to be entered even for gods."_END

B_6_C_111_16
BEGIN_
क्रियतामविरोधश्च राघवेणेति यन्मया |
उच्यमानो न गृह्णासि तस्येयन् व्युष्टिरागता || ६-१११-२१_END
BEGIN_
"This evil result has come upon you, since you did not heed to my advice, saying
that no hostility should be entered into with Rama."_END

B_6_C_111_17
BEGIN_
अकस्माच्चाभिकामोअसि सीतान् राक्षसपुङ्गव |
ऐश्वर्यस्य विनाशाय देहस्य स्वजनस्य च || ६-१११-२२_END
BEGIN_
"O the foremost of demons! For the annihilation of your power, your body and your
own people, you conceived a desire for Seetha suddenly."_END

B_6_C_111_18
BEGIN_
अरुन्धत्या विशिष्टान् तान् रोहिण्याश्चापि दुर्मते |
सीतान् धर्षयता मान्यां त्वया ह्यसदृशं कृतम् || ६-१११-२३_END
BEGIN_
"O the foolish one! An unworthy act was indeed done by you, in offending Seetha, who
was more distinguished and more respectable than Arundhati (wife of sage Vasishta) and Rohini (the
principal spouse of moon-god)."_END

B_6_C_111_19
BEGIN_
वसुधाया हि वसुधां श्रियः श्रीं भर्तृवत्सलाम् |
सीतां सर्वानवद्याङ्गीमरण्ये विजने शुभाम् || ६-१११-२४
आनयित्वा तु तां दीनां चद्मनात्मस्वदूषण |
अप्राप्य तं चैव कामं मैथिलीसंगमे कृतम् || ६-१११-२५
पतिव्रतायास्तपसा नूनं दग्धोऽसि मे प्रभो |_END
BEGIN_
"O my lord, who annihilated yourself and your people! Seetha is the model of
forbearance even to the Goddess Earth and a model of grace to Lakshmi, the goddess of fortune and
charm. She is extremely fond of her husband. By a recourse to a fraud in bringing that Seetha in a
lonely forest, faultless in every limb as she was, and charming though miserable, and having failed
to fulfill your desire for union with Seetha and due to your own fault you have been surely
consumed by the asceticism of that woman, devoted as she was to her husband."_END

B_6_C_111_20
BEGIN_
तदैव यन्न दग्धस्त्वं धर्षयंस्तनुमध्यमाम् || ६-१११-२६
देवा बिभ्यत ते सर्वे सेन्द्राः साग्निपुरोगमाः |_END
BEGIN_
"It is because, the gods together with Indra the ruler of gods including those
headed by the fire-god fear you, that you were not consumed even while you were laying hands on
Seetha, the slender-waisted woman."_END

B_6_C_111_21
BEGIN_
अवश्यमेव लभते फलं पापस्य कर्मणः |
घोरं पर्यागते काले कर्ता नास्त्यत्र संशयः || ६-१११-२७_END
BEGIN_
"There is no doubt that when the time comes, the doer surely reaps a harsh fruit of
his sinful deed."_END

B_6_C_111_22
BEGIN_
शुभकृच्छुभमाप्नोति पापकृत्पापमश्नुते |
विभीषणः सुखं प्राप्तस्त्वं प्राप्तः पापमीदृशम् || ६-१११-२८_END
BEGIN_
"The doer of an auspicious act obtains happiness, while the doer of a sinful act
reaps misery. While Vibhishana has obtained happiness, you met with such an evil destiny."_END

B_6_C_111_23
BEGIN_
सन्त्यन्याः प्रमदास्तुभ्यं रूपेणाभ्यधिकास्ततः |
अनङ्गवशमापन्नस्त्वं तु मोहान्न बुध्यसे || ६-१११-२९_END
BEGIN_
"There are other women, more excellent in form than Seetha for you in your
gynaecium. Having fallen a prey to the power of passion, you did not know it through
ignorance."_END

B_6_C_111_24
BEGIN_
न कुलेन न रूपेण न दाक्षिण्येन मैथिली |
मयाधिका वा तुल्या वा त्वन् तु मोहान्न बुध्यसे || ६-१११-३०_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha is no match for me either in birth or in beauty or in amiability. You did
not perceive this through infatuation."_END

B_6_C_111_25
BEGIN_
सर्वथा सर्वभूतानां नास्ति मृत्युरलक्षणः |
तव तावदयं मृत्युर्मैथिलीकृतलक्षणः || ६-१११-३१_END
BEGIN_
"At any time, there is no causeless death for any living being. As for you, this
Seetha has become a cause."_END

B_6_C_111_26
BEGIN_
सीतानिमित्तजो मृत्युस्त्वया दूरादुपाहृतः |
मैथिली सह रामेण विशोका विहरिष्यति || ६-१११-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Death which was brought about on account of Seetha was invited by you from a
far-off distance. Free from sorrow, Seetha will now be enjoying herself with Rama."_END

B_6_C_111_27
BEGIN_
अल्पपुण्या त्वहन् घोरे पतिता शोकसागरे |
कैलासे मन्दरे मेरौ तथा चैत्ररथे वने || ६-१११-३३
देवोद्यानेषु सर्वेषु विहृत्य सहिता त्वया |
विमानेनानुरूपेण या याम्यतुलया श्रिया || ६-१११-३४
पश्यन्ती विविधान्देशान्स्तान्स्तांश्चित्रस्रगम्बरा |
भ्रंशिता कामभोगेभ्यः सास्मि वीरवधात्तव || ६-१११-३५_END
BEGIN_
"I, however, whose stock of merit was deficient, have fallen into a terrific ocean
of grief. I, who having enjoyed myself with you in suitable aerial cars in Mount Kailasa, mount
Mandara, Mount Meru and in a grove named Chaitraratha and in all celestial gardens, decked as was
with lovely garlands and clad in colorful robes and invested in matchless splendour, visiting and
seeing various lands of every description have now been deprived of all sense- enjoyments because
of your death. Though the same, I stand transformed into another as it were. Woe be to the
flickering fortunes of kings!"_END

B_6_C_111_28
BEGIN_
हा राजन् सुकुमारं ते सुभ्रु सुत्वक्समुन्नसम् || ६-१११-३६
कान्तिश्रीद्युतिभिस्तुल्यमिन्दुपद्मदिवाकरैः |
किरीटकूटोज्ज्वलितं ताम्रास्यं दीप्तकुण्डलम् || ६-१११-३७
मदव्याकुललोलाक्षं भूत्वा यत्पानभूमिषु |
विविधस्रग्धरं चारु वल्गुस्मितकथं शुभम् || ६-१११-३८
तदेवाद्य तवैवं हि वक्त्रं न भ्राजते प्रभो |
रामसायकनिर्भिन्नं रक्तं रुधिरविस्रवैः || ६-१११-३९
वीशीर्णमेदोमस्तिष्कं रूक्षम् स्यन्दनरेणुभिः |_END
BEGIN_
"Alas, O king! That face of yours which was so tender, O lord, and distinguished by
charming eye-brows, a gloss surface, having an exceptionally prominent nose, coppery lips and
brilliant ear-rings, which vied with the moon the lotus and the sun in loveliness, light and
luster, was illumined by a number of diadems, which shone with its eyes wild and rolling through
inebriety in banqueting places, bore garlands of various kinds, was lovely and charming in every
way, was lit with a captivating smile and indulged in a delightful talk - that face of yours does
not actually shine as before today pierced with Rama's arrows, it lies dyed with streams of blood.
It has its marrow shattered and has got soiled through the dust raised by the chariots."_END

B_6_C_111_29
BEGIN_
हा पश्चिमा मे संप्राप्त दशा वैधव्यदायिनी || ६-१११-४०
या मयासीन्न संबुद्धा कदाचिदपि मन्दया |_END
BEGIN_
"Alas! The last stage of my life, which conferred widow ship on me, has come and
which was never contemplated me at any time; a stupid woman as I am."_END

B_6_C_111_30
BEGIN_
पिता दानवराजो मे भर्ता मे राक्षसेश्वरः || ६-१११-४१
पुत्रो मे शक्रनि र्जेता इत्यहं गर्विता भृशम् |_END
BEGIN_
"I was very much proud that my father was king of demons, my husband a lord of
demons and my son, a conqueror of Indra the lord of celestials."_END

B_6_C_111_31
BEGIN_
दृप्तारिमर्दनाः शूराः प्रख्यातबलपौरुषाः || ६-१११-४२
अकुतश्चिद्भया नाथा ममेत्यासीन्मतिर्दृढा |_END
BEGIN_
"I had a firm conviction that my guardians were capable of crushing their arrogant
adversaries, heroes as they were, renowned for their might and valour, and as such had no fear from
any quarter."_END

B_6_C_111_32
BEGIN_
तेषामेवंप्रभावाणां युष्माकं राक्षसर्षभाः || ६-१११-४३
कथं भयमसंबुद्धं मानुषादिदमागतम् |_END
BEGIN_
"How did this unknown danger come from a mortal to you, who were so powerful?"_END

B_6_C_111_33
BEGIN_
स्निग्देन्द्रनीलनीलं तु प्रांशुशैलोपमं महत् || ६-१११-४४
केयूराङ्गदवैदूर्यमुक्ताहारस्रगुज्ज्वलम् |
कान्तं विहारेष्वधिकं दीप्तं संग्रामभूमिषु || ६-१११-४५
भात्यभरणभाभिर्यद्विद्युद्भिरिव तोयदः |
तदेवाद्य शरीरं ते तीक्ष्णैर्नैकशरैश्चितम् || ६-१११-४६
पुनर्दुर्लभसंस्पर्शं परिष्वक्तुं न शक्यते |
श्वाविधः शलकैर्यद्वद्बाणैर्लग्नैर्निरन्तरम् || ६-१११-४७
स्वर्पितैर्मर्मसु भृशं संचिन्नस्नायुबन्धनम् |
क्षितौ निपतितं राजन् श्यामं वै रुधिरच्छवि || ६-१११-४८
व्ज्रप्रहाराभिहतो विकीर्ण इव पर्वतः |_END
BEGIN_
"O king! The body of yours which was really dark as glossy sapphire, gigantic like a
lofty mountain and resplendent with Keyuras and Angadas (two varieties of armlets) and necklace of
cat's eye-gems and pearls and wreaths of flowers, which body looked more charming during your
pleasure-walks and dazzling in battle-fields, which shone with luster of jewels as a rainy cloud
with flashes of lightning lies transfixed in numerous sharp arrows today. Though it will be
difficult for me to touch it again, it is no longer possible to embrace it. It has tendons cut to
pieces, by arrows of Rama, dug deep into your vital parts and closely transfixed like the spines of
a porcupine. Though dark of complexion, it is now transformed into the colour of blood and lies
fallen on the ground like a mountain broken into pieces when hit by a stroke of thunder-bolt."_END

B_6_C_111_34
BEGIN_
हा स्वप्नः सत्यमेवेदं त्वं रामेण कथं हतः || ६-१११-४९
त्वं मृत्योरपि मृत्युः स्याः कथं मृत्युवशं गतः |_END
BEGIN_
"Alas! Is it a dream? Is it the reality? But, how could you be killed by Rama? You
were the death, even to Death himself. How did you depart from this world, falling under the sway
of Death?_END

B_6_C_111_35
BEGIN_
त्रैलोक्यवसुभोक्तारं त्रैलोक्योद्वेगदं महत् || ६-१११-५०
जेतारं लोकपालानां क्षेप्तारं शंकरस्य च |_END
BEGIN_
"My husband enjoyed the wealth of all the three worlds. He gave tremendous fear to
the three worlds. He conquered the guardians of the worlds and lifted up Lord Shiva (along with his
seat, Mount Kailasa)."_END

B_6_C_111_36
BEGIN_
दृप्तानां निग्रहीतारमाविष्कृतपराक्रमम् || ६-१११-५१
लोकक्षोभयितारं च नादैर्भूतविराविणम् |_END
BEGIN_
"My husband held down those who were arrogant. He manifested his prowess and shook
up the worlds. He caused the living beings to weep, with his roars."_END

B_6_C_111_37
BEGIN_
ओजसा दृप्तवाक्यानां वक्तारं रिपुसंनिधौ || ६-१११-५२
स्वयूथभृत्यगोप्तारं हन्तारंभीमकर्मणाम् |_END
BEGIN_
"He used to utter arrogant words with vigour in the presence of his enemies. He was
the protector for his troop and his servants. He was the killer of those who indulged in terrible
acts."_END

B_6_C_111_38
BEGIN_
हन्तारं दानवेन्द्राणाम् यक्षाणां च सहस्रशः || ६-१११-५३
निवातकवचानां च संग्रहीतारमाहवे |_END
BEGIN_
"He was the killer of the lords of demons and Yakshas the super natural beings in
thousands. He was drawing to himself, the demons called Nivatakavachas, in battles."_END

B_6_C_111_39
BEGIN_
नैकयज्ञविलोप्तारं त्रातारं स्वजनस्य च || ६-१११-५४
धर्मव्यवस्थाभेत्तारं मायास्रष्टारमाहवे |_END
BEGIN_
"My husband ruined several sacrificial performances. He was the protector of his own
people. He violated the moral order. He violated the moral order. He created conjuring tricks on
the battle-field."_END

B_6_C_111_40
BEGIN_
देवासुरनृकन्यानामाहर्तारं ततस्ततः || ६-१११-५५
शत्रुस्त्रीशोकदातारं नेतारं स्वजनस्य च |_END
BEGIN_
"He used to bring the virgin-daughters of gods, demons and human beings from here
and there. He brought mourning to his enemy's wives. He was the leader of his own people."_END

B_6_C_111_41
BEGIN_
लङ्काद्वीपस्य गोप्तारं कर्तारं भीमकर्मणाम् || ६-१११-५६
अस्माकं कामभोगानां दातारं रथिनां वरम् |_END
BEGIN_
"He was the protector of the island of Lanka. He was the doer of terrible deeds. He
was the bestower of desires and sensual gratifications to us. He was excellent among the
chariot-warriors."_END

B_6_C_111_42
BEGIN_
एवंप्रभावं भर्तारं दृष्ट्वा रामेण पातितम् || ६-१११-५७
स्थिरास्मि या देहमिमं धारयामि हतप्रिया |_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing my husband with such power struck down by Rama, I, having my husband killed,
am hard-hearted indeed, still bearing this body."_END

B_6_C_111_43
BEGIN_
शयनेषु महार्हेषु शयित्वा राक्षसेश्वर || ६-१११-५८
इह कस्मात्प्रासुप्तोऽसि धरण्यां रेणुगुण्ठितः |_END
BEGIN_
"Having reposed on very valuable coaches, O the king of demons, why are you lying
buried in sleep slumber on the bare ground and shrouded in dust?"_END

B_6_C_111_44
BEGIN_
यदा ते तनयः शस्तो लक्ष्मणेनेन्द्रजिद्युधि || ६-१११-५९
तदा त्वभिहता तीच्रमद्य त्वस्मि निपातिता |_END
BEGIN_
"When Indrajit, your son was killed in battle by Lakshmana, I was hard-hit then and
today, of course, I am completely beaten down."_END

B_6_C_111_45
BEGIN_
साहं बन्धुजनैर्हीना हीना नाथेन च त्वया || ६-१११-६०
विहीना कामभोगैश्च शोचिष्ये शाश्वतीः समाः |_END
BEGIN_
"Bereft of kinsfolk and forsaken by you, my lord, and deprived of desires and
sensual enjoyments, I shall lament for ever more years."_END

B_6_C_111_46
BEGIN_
प्रपन्नो दीर्घमध्वानं राजन्नद्य सुदुर्गमम् || ६-१११-६१
नय मामपि दुःखार्तां न वर्तिष्ये त्वया विना |_END
BEGIN_
"O king! Having embarked today on a long journey, which is very difficult to be
traversed, take me too with you, tormented as I am with grief. I shall not survive without
you."_END

B_6_C_111_47
BEGIN_
कस्मात्त्वं मां विहायेह कृपणाम् गन्तुमिच्छसि || ६-१११-६२
दीनां विलपतीं मन्दां किं वा मां नाभिभाषसे |_END
BEGIN_
"Why do you intend to go, leaving me here, miserable as I am? Why do you not speak
to me, a sad and lamenting creature, and unfortunate as I am?"_END

B_6_C_111_48
BEGIN_
दृष्ट्वा न खल्वभिक्रुद्धो मामिहानवगुण्ठिताम् || ६-१११-६३
निर्गतां नगरद्वारात्पद्भ्यामेवागतां प्रभो |_END
BEGIN_
"O Lord! Are you not indeed enraged, in seeing me on foot in this way out through
the city-gate, unveiled and come on foot in the way?_END

B_6_C_111_49
BEGIN_
पश्येष्टदार दारांस्ते भ्रष्टलज्जावगुण्ठनान् || ६-१११-६४
बहिर्निष्पतितान् सर्वान् कथं दृष्ट्वा न कुप्यसि |_END
BEGIN_
"O lover of your consorts! Look at all your spouses, who came out, with their veils
dropped off. Why are you not getting enraged in seeing this?"_END

B_6_C_111_50
BEGIN_
अयम् क्रीडासहायस्तेऽनाथो लालप्यते जनः || ६-१११-६५
न चैनमाश्वासयसि किं वा न बहुमन्यसे |_END
BEGIN_
"This Mandodari, who was helping in your sport with you, is weeping with
helplessness. You are not consoling her. Do you not have a high esteem of her?"_END

B_6_C_111_51
BEGIN_
यास्त्वया विधवा राजन् क्ऱिता नैकाः कुलस्त्रियः || ६-१११-६६
पतिव्रता धर्मरता गुरुशुश्रूषणे रताः |
ताभिः शोकाभितप्ताभिः शप्तः परवशं गतः || ६-१११-६७
त्वया विप्रकृताभिर्यत्तदा शप्तं तदागतम् |_END
BEGIN_
"You have fallen under the sway of your enemies in that you were cursed by the
numerous women of noble lineage, who, though devoted to their husband, fond of piety and intent on
the service of their elders, had been widowed by you, O king, and were accordingly tormented with
grief. That curse which was pronounced at that time by those aggrieved women on their having been
wronged by you, has fallen on you."_END

B_6_C_111_52
BEGIN_
प्रवादः सत्य एवायं त्वां प्रति प्रायशो नृप || ६-१११-६८
पतिव्रतानां नाकस्मात्पतन्त्यश्रूनि भूतले |_END
BEGIN_
"The popular saying that the tears of virtuous wives d not generally fall on the
ground in vain' has come out probably true in your case O king!"_END

B_6_C_111_53
BEGIN_
कथं च नाम ते राजन् लोकानाक्रम्य तेजसा || ६-१११-६९
नारीचौर्यमिदं क्षुद्रं कृतं शौण्डीर्यमानिना |_END
BEGIN_
"How was this mean act of abducting a lady, done by you, who having invaded the
three worlds, were proud f your prowess?"_END

B_6_C_111_54
BEGIN_
अपनीयाश्रमाद्रामं यन्मृगच्चद्मना त्वया || ६-१११-७०
आनीता रामपत्नी स तत्ते कातर्यलक्षणम् |_END
BEGIN_
"It was indeed a mark of your cowardice that Rama's consort was borne away by you,
after luring away Rama from his hermitage in the pretext of deer"_END

B_6_C_111_55
BEGIN_
कातर्यं न च ते युद्धे कदाचित्संस्मराम्यहम् || ६-१११-७१
तत्तु भाग्यविपर्यासान्नूनं ते पक्वलक्षणम् |_END
BEGIN_
"I do not recall your faint-heartedness at any time on the battle-field. That case
of abduction of Seetha, however, was due to your ill-luck and certainly as the result of your
sins."_END

B_6_C_111_56
BEGIN_
अतीतानागतार्थज्ञो वर्तमानविचक्षणः || ६-१११-७२
मैथिलीमाहृताम् दृष्ट्वा ध्यात्वा निःश्वस्य चायतम् |
सत्यवाक्स महाबाहो देवरो मे यदब्रवीत् || ६-१११-७३
अयन् राक्षसमुख्यानां विनाशः पर्युपस्थितः |
कामक्रोधसमुत्थेन व्यसनेन प्रसङ्गिना || ६-१११-७४_END
BEGIN_
"O the mighty armed one! Whatever my younger brother-in-law, Vibhishana who knows
matters relating to the pat and of the future and also conversant with the present said after
reflecting and sighing for long, on seeing Seetha abducted by you: 'The destruction of the chiefs
among the demons now is imminent, have become true words. This misfortune had come from the lust,
wrath and addiction to the vice of deep attachment."_END

B_6_C_111_57
BEGIN_
निर्वृत्तस्त्वत्कृतेऽनर्थः सोऽयं मूलहरो महान् |
त्वया कृतमिदन् सर्वमनाथं रक्षसान् कुलम् || ६-१११-७५_END
BEGIN_
"This major disaster occurred, destroying our very root, because of you. This entire
race of demons has been deprived of its protector, by you."_END

B_6_C_111_58
BEGIN_
न हि त्वन् शोचितव्यो मे प्रख्यातबलपौरुषः |
स्त्रीस्वभावात्तु मे बुद्धिः कारुण्ये परिवर्तते || ६-१११-७६_END
BEGIN_
"You, who were far illustrious for your strength and prowess, do not deserve to be
lamented for by me. But, because of feminine nature, my mind is leaning towards melancholy."_END

B_6_C_111_59
BEGIN_
सुकृतन् दुष्कृतं च त्वं गृहीत्वा स्वां गतिं गतः |
आत्मानमनुशोचामि त्वद्वियोगेन दुःखिताम् || ६-१११-७७_END
BEGIN_
"By taking away your merit and sin, you obtained your course of fate. I, however,
mourn for my own self, so afflicted as I am, by your death."_END

B_6_C_111_60
BEGIN_
सुहृदां हितकामानां न श्रुतं वचनं त्वया |
भ्रातृइणां चैव कार्त्स्न्येन हितमुक्तं दशानन || ६-१११-७८_END
BEGIN_
"O Ravana! You did not hear the advice of your friends, who wish for your welfare.
Nor did you hear the words of your brothers completely."_END

B_6_C_111_61
BEGIN_
हेत्वर्थयुक्तं विधिवच्छ्रेयस्करमदारुणम् |
विभीषणेनाभिहितं न कृतं हेतुमत्त्वया || ६-१११-७९_END
BEGIN_
"The counsel offered by Vibhishana, which was endowed with reason, meaning, rule of
conduct, wholesome, gentle and well-founded, was not implemented by you."_END

B_6_C_111_62
BEGIN_
मारीचकुम्भकर्णाभ्यां वाक्यं मम पितुस्तथा |
न श्रुतं वीर्यमत्तेन तस्येदं फलमीदृशम् || ६-१११-८०_END
BEGIN_
"The advices offered by Mareecha, Kumbhakarna, myself and my father have not been
heeded by you, who were arrogant of your prowess. What is followed is a bitter consequence of your
perversity."_END

B_6_C_111_63
BEGIN_
नीलजीमूतसंकाश पीताम्भर शुभाङ्गद |
स्वगात्राणि विनिक्षिप्य किं शेषे रुधिराप्लुतः || ६-१११-८१_END
BEGIN_
"My lord, resembling a dark cloud in hue, clad in yellow and decked with brilliant
armlets, why are you lying with your limbs, cast away on the ground and bathed in blood?"_END

B_6_C_111_64
BEGIN_
प्रसुप्त इव शोकार्तां किं मां न प्रतिभाषसे |
महावीर्यस्य दक्षस्य संयुगेष्वपलायिनः || ६-१११-८२
यातुधानस्य दौहित्र किं मां न प्रतिभाषसे |_END
BEGIN_
"As though fast asleep, why are you not replying to me, the granddaughter of Somali
the demon who was clever, endowed with extraordinary prowess and never retreated in battles,
tormented with grief as I am?"_END

B_6_C_111_65
BEGIN_
उत्तिष्ठोत्तिष्ट किं शेषे नवे परिभवे कृते || ६-१११-८३
अद्य वै निर्भया लङ्कां प्रविष्टाः सूर्यरश्मयः |_END
BEGIN_
"Arise, arise! Why are you lying down, though subjected to a fresh insult? The sun's
rays have penetrated deep into Lanka today, without any fear."_END

B_6_C_111_66
BEGIN_
येन सूदयसे शत्रून् समरे सूर्यवर्चसा || ६-१११-८४
वज्रं वज्रधरस्येव सोऽयं ते सततार्चितः |
रणे बहुप्रहरणो हेमजालपरिष्कृतः || ६-१११-८५
परिघो व्यवकीर्णस्ते बाणैश्छिन्नः सहस्रधा |_END
BEGIN_
"Torn into thousand pieces, that iron bludgeon of yours, which was brilliant as the
sun, like a thunderbolt of Indra, with which you killed your enemies in the battle-field, which was
constantly honoured by you, which had struck many in battle and which was decked with gold, lies
scattered."_END

B_6_C_111_67
BEGIN_
प्रियामिवोपसंगृह्य किम् शेषे रणमेदिनीम् || ६-१११-८६
अप्रियामिव कस्माच्च मां नेच्छस्यभिभाषितुम् |_END
BEGIN_
Why are you lying down, embracing the battle-ground, as one would embrace a loved
one? Why do you not feel inclined to reply to me, as though I were abhorrent to you?"_END

B_6_C_111_68
BEGIN_
धिगस्तु हृदयन् यस्या ममेदं न सहस्रधा || ६-१११-८७
त्वयि पञ्चत्वमापन्ने फलते शोकपीडितम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Woe be to me, that my heart is not bursting into pieces, tormented as I am with
grief, now that you have returned to the five elements."_END

B_6_C_111_69
BEGIN_
इत्येवं विलपन्ती सा बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणा || ६-१११-८८
स्नेहोपस्कन्नहृदया तदा मोहमुपागमत् |_END
BEGIN_
Lamenting thus, with her eyes filled with tears and her heart moistened with love,
Mandodari, at that time, fell into a swoon._END

B_6_C_111_70
BEGIN_
कश्मलाभिहता सन्ना बभौ सा रावणोरसि || ६-१११-८९
संध्यानुरक्ते जलदे दीप्ता विद्युदिवोज्ज्वला |_END
BEGIN_
Fallen on the breast of Ravana, that dispirited Mandodari, stricken as she was with
grief, shone like a vivid flash of lightning across a rainy cloud, reddened by the flow of
twilight._END

B_6_C_111_71
BEGIN_
तथागतां समुत्थाप्य सपत्न्यस्तां भृशातुराः || ६-१११-९०
पर्यवस्थापयामासू रुदन्त्यो रुदतीं भृशम् |_END
BEGIN_
Raising up Mandodari, who was in that condition bitterly weeping, her co-wives who
were also weeping, very much distressed as they were, began to console her (as follows):_END

B_6_C_111_72
BEGIN_
किं ते न विदिता देवि लोकानां स्थितिरध्रुवा || ६-१११-९१
दशाविभागपर्याये राज्ञां वै चञ्चलाः श्रियः |_END
BEGIN_
"Don't you know the uncertain state of the worlds, O queen, that the wealth of kings
is unsteady, when there is a change in the tide of their fate?"_END

B_6_C_111_73
BEGIN_
इत्येवमुच्यमाना सा सशब्दं प्ररुदोद ह || ६-१११-९२
स्नापयन्ती तदास्रेण स्तनौ वक्त्रं सुनिर्मलम् |_END
BEGIN_
While they were consoling thus, Mandodari, moistening her breasts and her spotless
face in tears, wept aloud at that moment._END

B_6_C_111_74
BEGIN_
एतस्मिन्नन्तरे रामो विभीषणमुवाच ह || ६-१११-९३
सन्स्कारः क्रियतां भ्रातुः स्त्रियश्चैता निवर्तय |_END
BEGIN_
In the meanwhile, Rama spoke to Vibhishana as follows: "Let the obsequies of your
brother be performed and let these crews of women be consoled."_END

B_6_C_111_75
BEGIN_
तमुवाच ततो धीमान् विभीषण इदं वचः || ६-१११-९४
विमृश्य बुद्ध्या धर्मज्ञो धर्मार्थसहितं हितम् |_END
BEGIN_
Reflecting with his intellect, the intelligent Vibhishana, the knower of virtue,
thereupon, spoke to Rama, the following words, which were in conformity with righteousness and
self-interest._END

B_6_C_111_76
BEGIN_
त्यक्तधर्मव्रतन् क्रूरं नृशन्समनृतं तथा || ६-१११-९५
नाहमर्होअस्मि सन्स्कर्तुं परदाराभिमर्शकम् |_END
BEGIN_
"I am not obliged to perform the obsequies to him, who had abandoned the vow of
virtue, who was cruel, who killed human beings, who was a cheater and who had longed for others'
wives."_END

B_6_C_111_77
BEGIN_
भ्रातृरूपो हि मे शत्रुरेष सर्वाहिते रतः || ६-१११-९६
रावणो नार्हते पूजां पूज्योअपि गुरुगौरवात् |_END
BEGIN_
"This Ravana, who was interested in wishing evil to all, though venerable as a
respectable elder, is not fit for honour. He is my enemy, in the guise of a brother."_END

B_6_C_111_78
BEGIN_
नृशन्स इति मान् राम वक्ष्यन्ति मनुजा भुवि || ६-१११-९७
श्रुत्वा तस्य गुणान्सर्वे वक्ष्यन्ति सुकृतं पुनः |_END
BEGIN_
"If I do not perform obsequies, O Rama, the human beings on earth will speak about
me as ruthless. But, on hearing about his bad qualities all of them will speak of it as a good
act."_END

B_6_C_111_79
BEGIN_
तच्छ्रुत्वा परमप्रीतो रामो धर्मभृतान् वरः || ६-१११-९८
विभीषणमुवाचेदन् वाक्यज्ञो वाक्यकोविदम् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words, Rama the best among the supporters of virtue and skilled in
speech, was very much pleased and spoke the following words to Vibhishana, the intelligent one in
his speech._END

B_6_C_111_80
BEGIN_
तवापि मे प्रियन् कार्यं त्वत्प्रभवाच्च मे जितम् || ६-१११-९९
अवश्यन् तु क्षमन् वाच्यो मया त्वं राक्षसेश्वर |_END
BEGIN_
"O king of demons! I too have to do a favour to you. I won the battle because of
you. Certainly I have to give you an appropriate advice."_END

B_6_C_111_81
BEGIN_
अधर्मानृतसन्युक्तः काममेष निशाचरः || ६-१११-१००
तेजस्वी बलवाञ्शूरः सङ्ग्रामेषु च नित्यशः |_END
BEGIN_
"This demon may be full of unrighteousness and falsehood. But, he was brilliant,
strong and ever a brave warrior in battles."_END

B_6_C_111_82
BEGIN_
शतक्रतुमुखैर्देवैः श्रूयते न पराजितः || ६-१११-१०१
महात्मा बलसम्पन्नो रावणो लोकरावणः |_END
BEGIN_
"It is heard that Ravana who was mighty, endowed with strength and who was causing
people to cry, was not conquered by the chiefs like Indra and others."_END

B_6_C_111_83
BEGIN_
मरणान्तानि वैराणि निर्वृत्तं नः प्रयोजनम् || ६-१११-१०२
क्रियतामस्य सन्स्कारो ममाप्येष यथा तव |_END
BEGIN_
"Hostilities end with death. Our purpose has been accomplished. Let his funeral
rites be performed. He is even as good mine also, as yours."_END

B_6_C_111_84
BEGIN_
त्वत्सकाशान्महाबाहो सन्स्कारन् विधिपूर्वकम् || ६-१११-१०३
पाप्तु मर्हति धर्मेण त्वं यशोभाग्भविष्यसि |_END
BEGIN_
"According to rule, Ravana is eligible to get the last rites on his dead body from
you, by usage. You will also become fit for glory."_END

B_6_C_111_85
BEGIN_
राघवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा त्वरमाणो विभीषणः || ६-१११-१०४
सन्स्कारेणानुरूपेण भ्रातरं रावणम् हतम् |_END
BEGIN_
Having heard the words of Rama, Vibhishana in haste began to do obsequies to Ravana,
his dead brother._END

B_6_C_111_86
BEGIN_
स प्रविश्य पुरीं लङ्कां राक्षसेन्द्रो विभीषणः || ६-१११-१०५
रावनस्याग्निहोत्रं तु निर्यापयति सत्वरम् |_END
BEGIN_
Entering the City of Lanka, that Vibhishana, the lord of demons, quickly concluded
the Agnihotra (the act of pouring oblations into the sacred fire) carried on by Ravana._END

B_6_C_111_87
BEGIN_
शकटान् दारुरूपाणि अग्नीन् वै याजकांस्तथा || ६-१११-१०६
तथा चन्दनकाष्ठानि काष्ठानि विविधानि च |
अगरूणि सुगन्धीनि गन्धांश्च सुरभींस्तथा || ६-१११-१०७
मणिमुक्ताप्रवाळानि निर्यापयति राक्षसः |_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana actually caused to be brought together, carts, excellent varieties of
firewood, the three sacred fires and the priests required to officiate at the obsequies, logs of
sandalwood, various types of firewood, pieces of fragrant aloe-wood, odorous perfumes, as well as
gems, pearls and corals._END

B_6_C_111_88
BEGIN_
आ जगाम मुहूर्तेन राक्षसैः परिवारितः || ६-१११-१०८
ततो माल्यवता सार्धं क्रियामेव चकार सः |_END
BEGIN_
Surrounded with demons, he came back for a while and thereupon, Vibhishana along
with malyavan (the father of his own mother) initiated the obsequies._END

B_6_C_111_89
BEGIN_
सौवर्णीं शिबिकां दिव्यामारोप्य क्षौमवाससम् || ६-१११-१०९
रावणं राक्षसाधिशमश्रुपूर्णमुखा द्विजाः |
तूर्यघोषैश्च विविधैः स्तुवद्भिश्चाभिनन्दितम् || ६-१११-११०
पताकाभिश्च चित्राभिः सुमनोभिश्च चित्रिताम् |
उत्क्षिप्य शिबिकां तां तु विभीषणपुरोगमाः || ६-१११-१११
दक्षिणाभिमुखाः सर्वे गृह्य काष्ठानि भेजिरे |_END
BEGIN_
Placing Ravana, the lord of demons, who was covered with linen, accompanied by
blasts of various musical instruments as well as panegyrists singing his the Brahmanas (forming
part of the demon's race, which was apparently divided into four classes, like human beings) stood
around him with their faces filled in tears. Lifting up that palanquin, which had been decorated
with colorful flags and flowers and taking up blocks of wood, all the demons for their part, with
Vibhishana in front, proceeded with their face turned towards the south._END

B_6_C_111_90
BEGIN_
अग्नयो दीप्यमानास्ते तदाध्वर्युसमीरिताः || ६-१११-११२
शरणाभिगताह् सर्वे पुरस्तत्तस्य ते ययुः |_END
BEGIN_
Those sacrificial fires were ignited and re-animated, as they were, by Adhvaryu
priests, the performers of the sacrificial act, at that time. Those sacrificial fires were
contained in earthen pots and went in front of Ravana's body._END

B_6_C_111_91
BEGIN_
अन्तःपुराणि सर्वाणि रुदमानानि सत्वरम् || ६-१११-११३
पृष्ठतोऽनुययुस्तानि प्लवमानानि सर्वतः |_END
BEGIN_
All those women of the gynaecium, while weeping, followed at his heels with quick
paces, stumbling, as they were, on all sides._END

B_6_C_111_92
BEGIN_
रावणम् प्रयते देशे स्थाप्य ते भृशदुःखिताः || ६-१११-११४
चितां चन्दनकाष्ठैश्च पद्मकोशीरसंवृताम् |
ब्राह्म्या संवर्तयामासू राङ्कवास्तरणावृताम् || ६-१११-११५
वर्तते वेदविहितो राज्ञो वै पश्चिमः क्रतुः |_END
BEGIN_
Keeping the body of Ravana on a consecrated spot, Vibhishana and others, who were
very much afflicted with grief, piled up a sacred pyre, with logs of sandalwood, moistened with
perfumes called Padmaka and Koshira and covered with the skin of black antelopes, turned about to
perform the obsequies in accordance with Vedic rites in honour of the king._END

B_6_C_111_93
BEGIN_
प्रचक्रू राक्षसेन्द्रस्य पित्ऱ्^मेधमनुत्तमम् || ६-१११-११६
वेदिं च दक्षिणप्राच्यां यथास्थानं च पावकम् |_END
BEGIN_
They performed the ancestral oblations to Ravana in a superb way. They constructed
an altar in the south-east the funeral pile) and placed the sacred fire in its proper place._END

B_6_C_111_94
BEGIN_
पृषदाज्येन संपूर्णं स्रुवं स्कन्धे प्रचिक्षिपुः || ६-१११-११७
पादयोः शकटं प्रादुरूर्वोश्चोलूखलं तदा |_END
BEGIN_
They poured a ladle-full of ghee mixed with curds on his shoulders, placed a cart at
his feet and then a wooden mortar at his thighs._END

B_6_C_111_95
BEGIN_
दारुपात्रानि सर्वाणि अरणिं चोत्तरारणिम् || ६-१११-११८
दत्त्वा तु मुसलं चान्यं यथास्थानं विचक्रमुः |_END
BEGIN_
Having set at their proper place, all the wooden vessels (used in Agnihotra), the
lower piece of wood used for kindling fire at a sacrifice and the upper piece of wood (which is
rotated at great speed on to lower one, to produce fire by friction), the wooden pestle and other
things used in the sacrifice, they circled around the funeral pyre._END

B_6_C_111_96
BEGIN_
शास्त्रदृष्टेन विधिना महर्षिविहितेन च || ६-१११-११९
तत्र मेध्यं पशुं हत्वा राक्षसेन्द्रस्य राक्षसाः |
परिस्तरणीकां राज्ञोघृताक्तां समवेशयन् || ६-१११-१२०_END
BEGIN_
According to ordinance laid down by eminent sages and according to the rules viewed
in Vedas, having sacrificed a goat fit for sacrifice at that spot, the demons dampened with ghee on
Ravana the King of demons._END

B_6_C_111_97
BEGIN_
गन्धैर्माल्यैरलंकृत्य रावणं दीनामानसाः || ६-१११-१२१
विभीषणसहायास्ते वस्त्त्रैश्च विविधैरपि |
लाजैरवकिरन्ति स्म बाष्पपूर्णमुखास्तथा || ६-१११-१२२_END
BEGIN_
Having decorated the body of Ravana with perfumes, garlands and various kinds of
clothes; those demons accompanied by Vibhishana, distressed as they were in their minds, poured
parched grains of rice, with their faces bathed in tears._END

B_6_C_111_98
BEGIN_
स ददौ पावकन् तस्य विधियुक्तन् विभीषणः |
स्नात्वा चैवार्द्रवस्त्रेण तिलान् दर्भविमिश्रितान् || ६-१११-१२३
उदकेन च संमिश्रान् प्रदाय विधिपूर्वकम् |
प्रदाय चोदकं तस्मै मूर्ध्ना चैनं नमस्य च || ६-१११-१२४
ताः स्त्रियोअनुनयामास सान्त्वमुक्त्वा पुनः पुनः |
गम्यतामिति ताः सर्वा विविशुर्नगरं ततः || ६-१११-१२५_END
BEGIN_
That Vibhishana set fire to Ravana, according to the rules in the scriptures.
Washing himself and offering in his wet clothes, according to scriptural ordinance, sesame seeds
mixed with water, as well as blades of Kusha grass and offering obeisance to Ravana by bowing his
head, Vibhishana entreated those women to return, consoling them again and again. Then, all of the
returned to the City._END

B_6_C_111_99
BEGIN_
प्रविष्टासु च सर्वासु राक्षसीषु विभीषणः |
रामपार्श्वमुपागम्य तदातिष्ठद्विनीतवत् || ६-१११-१२६_END
BEGIN_
When those women were re-entering the City, Vibhishana the lord of demons on
approaching Rama's vicinity then remained standing there with humility._END

B_6_C_111_100
BEGIN_
रामोअपि सह सैन्येन ससुग्रीवः सलक्ष्मणः |
हर्षन् लेभे रिपुं हत्वा यथा वृत्रं वज्रधरो यथा || ६-१११-१२७_END
BEGIN_
Having destroyed the enemy, Rama too experienced happiness, along with his army as
well as with Sugreeva and Lakshmana, even as Indra the wielder of thunderbolt did on destroying
Vritra the demon._END

B_6_C_111_101
BEGIN_
ततो विमुक्त्वा सशरं शरासनं |
महेन्द्रदत्तं कवचं च तन्महत् |
विमुच्य रोषं रिपुनिग्रहात्ततो |
रामः सुसौम्यत्वमुपागतोऽरिह || ६-१११-१२८_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, taking off his bow and arrows as also that great armour endowed to him by
Indra, Rama the annihilator of his enemies, taking off his anger too, because of the enemy's
defeat, then obtained a charming benevolence._END

B_6_C_112_0
BEGIN_
ते रावणवधं दृष्ट्वा देवगन्धर्वदानवाः |
जग्मुः स्वैः स्वै र्विमानैस्ते कथयन्तः शुभाः कथाः || ६-११२-१_END
BEGIN_
Having seen the destruction of Ravana, those gods, celestial musicians and demons,
while chatting about the auspicious narrative, went away in their respective aerial cars._END

B_6_C_112_1
BEGIN_
रावणस्य वधं घोरं राघवस्य पराक्रमम् |
सुयुद्धं वानराणां च सुग्रीवस्य च मन्त्रितम् || ६-११२-२
अनुरागं च वीर्यं च सौमित्रे र्लक्ष्मणस्य च |
पतिव्रतात्वम् सीताया हनूमति पराक्रमम् || ६-११२-३
कथयन्तो महाभागा जग्मुर्हृष्ट यथागतम् |_END
BEGIN_
Chatting themselves about the awful destruction of Ravana, the terrific prowess of
Rama, the admirable combat of the monkeys, the counsel tendered by Sugreeva, the affection and
valour of Lakshmana; the son of Sumitra; the loyaltyof Seetha to her husband and about the strength
of Hanuma, the illustrious celestials and others rejoicingly returned as they had come._END

B_6_C_112_2
BEGIN_
राघवस्तु रथं दिव्यमिन्द्रदत्तं शिखिप्रभम् || ६-११२-४
अनुज्ञाय महाबाहुर्मातलिं प्रत्यपूजयत् |_END
BEGIN_
Taking leave of the celestial chariot, which had been given by Indra the lord of
celestials and which shone like fire, the mighty armed Rama respectfully saluted Matali._END

B_6_C_112_3
BEGIN_
राघवेणाभ्यनुज्ञातो मातलिः शक्रसारथिः || ६-११२-५
दिव्यं तं तथमास्थाय दिवमेवोत्पपात ह |_END
BEGIN_
As assented by Rama, Matali Indra's charioteer, mounting that celestial chariot,
ascended to the heaven itself._END

B_6_C_112_4
BEGIN_
तस्मिंस्तु दिवमारुढे सरथे रथिनां वरः || ६-११२-६
राघवः परमप्रीतः सुग्रीवं परिषस्वजे |_END
BEGIN_
When Matali ascended to heaven along with his chariot, Rama, the foremost one among
the chariot-warriors was highly rejoiced and embraced Sugreeva._END

B_6_C_112_5
BEGIN_
पर्ष्वज्य च सुग्रीवं लक्ष्मणेनाभिवादितः || ६-११२-७
पूज्यमानो हरिगणैराजगाम बलालयम् |_END
BEGIN_
Having embraced Sugreeva greeted by Lakshmana and having been honoured by the
monkey-troops. Rama came to the camp where the army had been stationed._END

B_6_C_112_6
BEGIN_
अथोवाच स काकुत्स्थः समीपपरिवर्तिनम् || ६-११२-८
सौमित्रिं सत्त्वसंपन्नं लक्ष्मणं शुभलक्षणम् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama spoke (as follows) to Lakshmana, son of Sumitra, who was endowed with
strength and having auspicious marks, who stayed nearby._END

B_6_C_112_7
BEGIN_
विभीषणमिमं सौम्य लङ्कायामभिषेचय || ६-११२-९
अनुरक्तं च भक्तं च तथा पूर्वोपकारिणम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O the benevolent Lakshmana! Consecrate on the throne of Lanka, this Vibhishana to
whom everyone is attached, a loyal person as he is and the one who has formerly done a service to
us."_END

B_6_C_112_8
BEGIN_
एष मे परमः कामो यदिमं रावणानुजम् || ६-११२-१०
लङ्कायां सौम्य पश्येयमभिषिक्तं विभीषणम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O gentle one! This s my paramount desire that I should see this Vibhishana, the
brother of Ravana being consecrated for throne in Lanka."_END

B_6_C_112_9
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तस्तु सौमित्री राघवेण महात्मना || ६-११२-११
तथेत्युक्त्वा सुसंहृष्टः सौवर्णम् घटमाददे |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of the great soled Rama, Lakshmana replied, 'so it be' and
rejoicingly procured a golden pot._END

B_6_C_112_10
BEGIN_
तं घटं वानरेन्द्राणाम् हस्ते दत्त्वा मनोजवान् || ६-११२-१२
व्यादिदेश महासत्त्वः समुद्रसलिलं तदा |_END
BEGIN_
That mighty Lakshmana, then placing that pot in the hands of the monkey-chiefs,
instructed them, who were as swift as thought, to bring sea-water._END

B_6_C_112_11
BEGIN_
अतिशीघ्रम् ततो गत्वा वानरास्ते मनोजवाः || ६-११२-१३
आगतास्तु जलं गृह्य समुद्राद्वानरोत्तमाः |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, those excellent monkeys, with the swiftness of thought, moving very
quickly from that place, returned, having obtained the water from the sea._END

B_6_C_112_12
BEGIN_
ततस्त्वेकं घटं गृह्य संस्थाप्य परमासने || ६-११२-१४
घटेन तेन सौमित्रिरभ्यषिञ्चद्विभीषणम् |
लङ्कायां रक्षसां मध्ये राजानं रामशासनात् || ६-११२-१५
विधिना मन्त्रदृष्टेन सुहृद्गणसमावृतः |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Lakshmana together with his friends, taking one pot and making Vibhishana
to sit on the throne, sprinkled him with sea-water from that pot in accordance with the rule
prescribed in Vedic scriptures, while the demons were witnessing the ceremony, to make him the king
for Lanka, as directed by Rama._END

B_6_C_112_13
BEGIN_
अभ्यषिञ्चंस्तदा सर्वे राक्षसा वानरास्तथा || ६-११२-१६
प्रहर्षमतुलं गत्वा तुष्टुवू राममेव ह |_END
BEGIN_
Then, all the demons as well as the monkeys consecrated Vibhishana. Having gained
extra ordinary delight, they indeed eulogized Rama._END

B_6_C_112_14
BEGIN_
तस्यामात्या जहृषिरे भक्ता ये चास्य राक्षसाः || ६-११२-१७
दृष्ट्वाभिष्क्तं लङ्कायां राक्षसेन्द्रं विभीषणम् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Vibhishana the lord of demons consecrated for the throne of Lanka, his four
counsellors who were always together with him and such of those demons who were devoted to him,
were rejoiced._END

B_6_C_112_15
BEGIN_
राघवः प्रमां प्रीतिं जगाम सहलक्ष्मणः || ६-११२-१८
स तद्राज्यं महत्प्राप्य रामदत्तं विभीषणः |_END
BEGIN_
Rama together with Lakshmana were greatly delighted. That Vibhishana, having gained
that great kingdom bestowed on him by Rama, was also greatly delighted._END

B_6_C_112_16
BEGIN_
प्रकृतीः सान्त्ययित्वा च ततो राममुपागमत् || ६-११२-१९
दध्यक्षतान् मोदकांश्च लाजाः सुमनसस्तथा |
आजह्रुरथ संतुष्टाः पौरास्तस्मै निशाचराः || ६-११२-२०_END
BEGIN_
After consoling his people, Vibhishana then sought to presence of Rama. Now, the
demons who were residing in the city were quite delighted and brought to him (by way of presents)
curds, unbroken grains of rice, sweets shaped like balls, parched grains of unhusked rice and
flowers too._END

B_6_C_112_17
BEGIN_
स तान् गृहीत्वा दुर्धर्षो राघवाय न्यवेदयत् || ६-११२-२१
माङ्गल्यं मङ्गलं सर्वं लक्ष्मणाय च वीर्यवान् |_END
BEGIN_
Accepting them, the valiant and unconquerable Vibhishana happily offered all those
auspicious objects to Rama and Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_112_18
BEGIN_
कृतकार्यं समृद्धार्थं दृष्ट्वा रामो विभीषणम् || ६-११२-२२
प्रतिजग्राह तत्सर्वं तस्यैव प्रियकाम्यया |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Vibhishana, who had accomplished his act and increased his resources, Rama
accepted it all, with a sole desire to show gratefulness to him._END

B_6_C_112_19
BEGIN_
ततह् शैलोपमं वीरं प्राञ्जलिं प्रणतं स्थितम् || ६-११२-२३
उवाचेदं वचो रामो हनूमन्तं प्लवङ्गमम् |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Rama spoke the following words to the valiant Hanuma the monkey who was
equal in size to a mountain and who was standing in humility, with his hands joined in
salutation._END

B_6_C_112_20
BEGIN_
अनुज्ज़्नाप्य महाराजमिमं सौम्य विभीषणम् || ६-११२-२४
प्रविश्य नगरीं लङ्कां कौशलं ब्रूहिमैथिलीम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O the benevolent one! Taking permission from this Vibhishana, the great king and
entering into the City of Lanka, inform about our welfare to Seetha."_END

B_6_C_112_21
BEGIN_
वैदेह्यै मां कुशलिनं सुग्रीवं च सलक्ष्मणम् || ६-११२-२५
अचक्ष्व वदतां श्रेष्ठ रावणं च हतं रणे |_END
BEGIN_
"O Hanuma, the proficient one in speech! Inform Seetha that myself together with
Lakshmana and Sugreeva are well and that Ravana had been killed in battle."_END

B_6_C_112_22
BEGIN_
प्रियमेतदुदाहृत्य वैदेह्यस्त्वं हरीश्वर || ६-११२-२६
प्रतिगृह्य च संदेशमुपावर्तितुमर्हसि |_END
BEGIN_
"O Hanuma the master of monkeys! Making clear this favourite news to Seetha, you
ought to return, taking back her message."_END

B_6_C_113_0
BEGIN_
इति प्रतिसमादिष्टो हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः |
प्रविवेश पुरीं लङ्कां पूज्यमानो निशाचरैः ||६-११३-१_END
BEGIN_
Thus directed by Rama, Hanuma the son of wind-god, entered deeply into the City of
Lanka, being respectfully received by the demons._END

B_6_C_113_1
BEGIN_
प्रविश्य च पुरीं लङ्कामनुङ्ञ्प्य विभीषणम् |
ततस्तेनाभ्यनुज्ञातो हनूमान् वृक्षवाटिकाम् ||६-११३-२
संप्रविश्य यथान्यायम् सीताया विदितो हरिः |
ददर्श शशिना हीनां सातङ्कामिव रोहिणीम् ||६-११३-३
वृक्षमूले निरानन्दां राक्षसीभिः परीवृताम् |
निभृतः प्रणतः प्रह्वः सोंअभिगम्याभिवाद्य च ||६-११३-४_END
BEGIN_
That Hanuma, the monkey, known to Seetha, having entered the City of Lanka, seeking
permission from Vibhishana, getting approval from him and entering Ashoka grove as per the
prevailing regulation, saw at the foot of a tree, Seetha, who was bereft of freshness, looking
joylessly like a frightened cow and surrounded with female-demons. Approaching her humbly by
offering salutation to her in bending his head, he stood there silently._END

B_6_C_113_2
BEGIN_
दृष्ट्वा समागतं देवी हनूमन्तं महाबलम् |
तूष्णीमास्त तदा दृष्ट्वा स्मृत्वा हृष्टाभवत्तदा ||६-११३-५_END
BEGIN_
Even after seeing the mighty Hanuma who came there, Seetha kept herself silent.
Then, seeing and recollecting him, she became rejoiced._END

B_6_C_113_3
BEGIN_
सौम्यं तस्या मुखं दृष्ट्वा हनूमान् प्लवगोत्तमः |
रामस्य वचनं सर्वमाख्यातुमुपचक्रमे ||६-११३-६_END
BEGIN_
Seeing her cool face, Hanuma the excellent monkey began to narrate the entire
message of Rama._END

B_6_C_113_4
BEGIN_
वैदेहि कुशली रामः ससुग्रीवः सलक्ष्मणः |
विभीषणसहायश्च हरीणां सहितो बलैः ||६-११३-७_END
BEGIN_
"O Seetha! Rama is well, together with Sugreeva and Lakshmana, along with Vibhishana
as his supporter and collectively with the army of monkeys."_END

B_6_C_113_5
BEGIN_
कुशलं चाह सिद्धार्थो हतशत्रुररिन्दमः |
विभीषणसहायेन रामेण हरिभिः सह ||६-११३-८
निहतो रावणो देवि लक्ष्मणस्य नयेन च वीर्यवान् |_END
BEGIN_
"O the divine lady! Having destroyed his enemy, Rama the annihilator of his
adversaries, having accomplished his object, is informing you about his welfare. Rama and
Lakshmana, with the support of Vibhishana and the monkeys, killed the valiant Ravana."_END

B_6_C_113_6
BEGIN_
प्रियमाख्यामि ते देवि भूयश्च त्वां सभाजये ||६-११३-९
तव प्रभावाद्धर्मज्ञे महान् रामेण संयुगे |
लब्धोऽयं विजयः सीते स्वस्था भव गतज्वरा ||६-११३-१०_END
BEGIN_
"O the divine lady! I am telling a pleasant news and again eulogizing you. O Seetha,
the knower of righteousness! Rama accomplished this great victory in the battle, because of your
power. Be free from your grief and be comfortable."_END

B_6_C_113_7
BEGIN_
रावणश्च हतः शत्रुर्लङ्का चैव वशीकृता |
मया ह्यलब्धनिद्रेण धृतेन तव निर्जये ||६-११३-११
प्रतिज्ज़्नैषा विनिस्तीर्णा बद्ध्वा सेतुं महोदधौ |_END
BEGIN_
"Ravana, the enemy was killed. Even the Lanka has been subdued. With a firm
determination to win you back, by me who have had no sleep, a bridge has been constructed across
the great ocean and this vow (of winning you back) has been fulfilled."_END

B_6_C_113_8
BEGIN_
संभ्रमश्च न कर्तव्यो वर्तन्त्या रावणालये ||६-११३-१२
विभीषणविधेयं हि लङ्कैश्वर्यमिदं कृतम् |_END
BEGIN_
"You ought not to have any fear, living as you do in Ravana's abode. This kingdom of
Lanka has now been placed indeed under the dominion ship of Vibhishana."_END

B_6_C_113_9
BEGIN_
तदाश्वसिहि विस्रब्धं स्वगृहे परिवर्तसे ||६-११३-१३
अयं चाभ्येति संहृष्टस्त्वद्दर्शनसमुत्सुकः |_END
BEGIN_
"That is why, console yourself complacently. You are staying in your own house. This
Vibhishana too is coming to you with a rejoice, as he is so eager to see you."_END

B_6_C_113_10
BEGIN_
एवमुक्ता तु सा देवी सीता शशिनिभानना ||६-११३-१४
प्रहर्षेणावरुद्धा सा व्यहर्तुं न शशाक ह |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing these words, that Seetha the divine lady, whose face resembled the moon,
could not speak, tongue-tied as she was with a thrill of delight._END

B_6_C_113_11
BEGIN_
ततोऽब्रवीद्धरिवरः सीतामप्रतिजल्पतीम् ||६-११३-१५
किं त्वं चिन्तयसे देवि किं च मां नाभिभाषसे |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Hanuma spoke to Seetha, who was not making any answer (as follows): "O
divine lady! What are you reflecting upon? Why don't you speak to me?"_END

B_6_C_113_12
BEGIN_
एवमुक्ता हनुमता सीता धर्मपथे स्थिता ||६-११३-१६
अब्रवीत्परमप्रीता बाष्पगद्गदया गिरा |_END
BEGIN_
Thus asked by Hanuma, Seetha, who was ever established in a righteous path, was very
much delighted and spoke (as follows) in a voice choked with tears._END

B_6_C_113_13
BEGIN_
प्रियमेतदुपश्रुत्य भर्तुर्विजयसंश्रयम् ||६-११३-१७
प्रहर्षवशमापन्ना निर्वाक्यास्मि क्षणान्तरम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Hearing these pleasant tidings about the victory of my husband, I became speechless
for a while, overpowered as I was, by extreme joy."_END

B_6_C_113_14
BEGIN_
न हि पश्यामि सदृशं चिन्तयन्ती प्लवङ्गम ||६-११३-१८
मत्प्रियाख्यानकस्येह तव प्रत्यभिनन्दनम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Hanuman! I indeed do not see any appropriate thing here, which pleases you in
return, to offer you, who have announced these tidings pleasant to me, even after enervating my
brain."_END

B_6_C_113_15
BEGIN_
न च पश्यामि तत्सौम्य पृथिव्यामपि वानर ||६-११३-१९
सदृशं मत्प्रियाख्याने तव दातुं भवेत्समम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Nor, do I perceive anything worthy for you on this earth for you act of conveying
this agreeable news to me and on bestowing which on you, happiness may come to me."_END

B_6_C_113_16
BEGIN_
हिरण्यं वा सुवर्णं वा रत्नानि विविधानि च ||६-११३-२०
राज्यं वा त्रिषु लोकेषु नैतदर्हति भाषितुम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Neither silver, nor gold nor even diamonds nor the sovereignty of the three worlds,
can be worthy of this message."_END

B_6_C_113_17
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तस्तु वैदेह्या प्रत्युवाच प्लवङ्गमः ||६-११३-२१
प्रगृहीताञ्जलिर्वाक्यं सीतायाः प्रमुखे स्थितः |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Seetha, Hanuma standing with his face turned towards Seetha and
with his hands joined in salutation, joyfully replied as follows:_END

B_6_C_113_18
BEGIN_
भर्तुः प्रियहिते युक्ते भर्तुर्विजयकाङ्क्षिणि ||६-११३-२२
स्निग्धमेवंविधं वाक्यं त्वमेवार्हसि भाषितुम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O faultless lady, interested in things agreeable and beneficial to husband and
wishing for his victory! You alone deserve to speak such words filled with affection."_END

B_6_C_113_19
BEGIN_
तवैतद्वचनं सौम्ये सारवत्स्निग्धमेव च ||६-११३-२३
रत्नौघाद्विविधाच्चापि देवराज्याद्विशिष्यते |_END
BEGIN_
"O gentle lady! These words of yours, endowed with preciousness and affection, are
better than various kinds of collection of diamonds or the sovereignty over the celestials."_END

B_6_C_113_20
BEGIN_
अर्थतश्च मया प्राप्ता देवराज्यादयो गुणाः ||६-११३-२४
हतशत्रुं विजयिनं रामं पश्यामि यत्स्थितम् |_END
BEGIN_
"I see Rama victorious and happy, he having killed the enemies and having obtained
victory. That is to say, I have attained the blessing like the sovereignty over the celestials and
other good qualities."_END

B_6_C_113_21
BEGIN_
तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा मैथिली जनकात्मजा ||६-११३-२५
ततः शुभतरं वाक्यमुवाच पवनात्मजम् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Hanuma, Seetha the daughter of Janaka thereupon spoke the
following auspicious words to Hanuma._END

B_6_C_113_22
BEGIN_
अतिलक्षणसंपन्नं माधुर्यगुणभूषितम् ||६-११३-२६
बुद्ध्या ह्यष्टाङ्गया युक्तं त्वमेवार्हसि भाषितुम् |_END
BEGIN_
"You alone can utter these words, endowed with exceedingly good attributes,
embellished with a grace of style and filled with an intelligence, consisting of eight
excellences.*"_END

B_6_C_113_23
BEGIN_
श्लाघनीयोऽनिलस्य त्वं सुतः परमधार्मिकः ||६-११३-२७
ब्लं शौर्यं श्रुतं सत्त्वं विक्रमो दाक्ष्यमुत्तमम् |
तेजः क्षमा धृतिः स्थैर्यं विनीतत्वं न संशयः ||६-११३-२८_END
BEGIN_
"You are a praiseworthy and supremely virtuous son of the wind-god. Numerous good
qualities are there in you along (as follows, along with others): strength, valour, knowledge of
scriptures, vigour, prowess, superlative skill (in action), spirit, forbearance, firmness,
stability and re is no humility. There is no doubt about it."_END

B_6_C_113_24
BEGIN_
अथोवाच पुनः सीतामसंभ्रातो विनीतवत् ||६-११३-२९
प्रगृहीताञ्जलिर्हर्षात् सीतायाः प्रमुखे स्थितः |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, having joined his hands together in salutation, standing in front of
Seetha in humility and free from flurry, Hanuma again spoke to Seetha (as follows):_END

B_6_C_113_25
BEGIN_
इमास्तु खलु राक्षस्यो यदि त्वमनुमन्यसे ||६-११३-३०
हन्तुमिच्छामि ताः सर्वा याभिस्त्वं तर्जिता पुरा |_END
BEGIN_
"If you permit me, I wish to kill of all these notorious female-demons, by whom you
have been frightened earlier."_END

B_6_C_113_26
BEGIN_
क्लिश्यन्तीं पतिदेवां त्वामशोकवनिकां गताम् ||६-११३-३१
घोररूपसमाचाराः क्रूराः क्रूरतरेक्षणाः |
इह श्रुता मया देवि राक्षस्यो विकृताननाः ||६-११३-३२
असकृत्परुषैर्वाक्यैर्वदन्त्यो रावणाज्ञया |_END
BEGIN_
"These cruel female-demons of terrific form and behavior, with still more cruel
eyes, having ugly faces, were heard by me here speaking again and again harsh words to you, who are
so devoted to your husband, at Ravana's command, when you were suffering hardships in the Ashoka
grove, O divine lady!"_END

B_6_C_113_27
BEGIN_
विकृता विकृताकाराः क्रूताः क्रूरकचेक्षणाः||६-११३-३३
इच्छामि विविधैर्घातैर्हन्तुमेताः सुदारुणाः |
राक्षस्यो दारुणकथा वरमेतं प्रयच्छ मे ||६-११३-३४_END
BEGIN_
"I wish to kill with various kinds of strokes, these cruel, extremely rough and
deformed female-demons, with distorted features and terrific hairs and eyes, talking together
roughly. (Pray) grant this boon to me."_END

B_6_C_113_28
BEGIN_
मुष्टिभिः पाणिभिश्चैव चरणैश्चैव शोभने |
जङ्घाजानुप्रहारैश्च दन्तानां चैव पीडनैः ||६-११३-३५
भक्षणैः कर्णनासानां केशानां लुञ्चनैस्तथा |
भृशं शुष्कमुखीभिश्च दारुणैर्लङ्घनैर्हतैः ||६-११३-३६
विभिन्नशङ्कुग्रीवांशपार्श्वकैश्च कलेवरैः |
निपात्य हन्तुमिच्छमि तव विप्रियकारिणीः ||६-११३-३७_END
BEGIN_
"I wish to kill the female-demons, who have spoken harsh words to you and wronged
you, striking them down with my fists, hand-blows, long arms, blows of my shanks and knees, by
causing pain to their teeth, biting off their ears and nose and pulling out their hair, making them
severely dry-mouthed, tearing them off, leaping over them, encountering them and throwing down
their bodies, with their burst cheeks, necks, shoulders and ribs."_END

B_6_C_113_29
BEGIN_
एवम्प्रकारैर्बहुभिर्विप्रकारैर्यशस्विनि |
घातये तीव्ररूपाभिर्याभिस्त्वं तर्जिता पुरा ||६-११३-३८_END
BEGIN_
"O illustrious lady! Striking them with several blows in this way, I would destroy
the female-demons of terrible form, by whom you have been threatened in the past."_END

B_6_C_113_30
BEGIN_
इत्युक्ता सा हनुमता कृपणा दीनवत्सला |
हनुमन्तमुवाचेदं चिन्तयित्वा मिमृश्य च ||६-११३-३९_END
BEGIN_
Reflecting as pondering for a while, when spoke thus by Hanuma, the compassionate
Seetha, who was kind to the miserable, spoke to Hanuma as follows:_END

B_6_C_113_31
BEGIN_
राजसंश्रयवश्यानां कुर्वतीनां पराज्ञया |
विधेयानां च दासीनां कः कुप्येद्वानरोत्तम ||६-११३-४०_END
BEGIN_
"O the foremost of monkey! Who will be angry with servant-maids, who are dependent
on their king's command and work in obedience to the orders of others?"_END

B_6_C_113_32
BEGIN_
भाग्यवैषम्य योगेन पुरा दुश्चरितेन च |
मयैतेत्प्राप्यते सर्वं स्वकृतं ह्युपभुज्यते ||६-११३-४१_END
BEGIN_
"All this is reaped by me, as a consequence of my bad fortune or an account of a
misdeed committed by me in the past. The fruit of one's own making is indeed experienced (in one's
life)."_END

B_6_C_113_33
BEGIN_
मैवं वद महाबाहो दैवी ह्येषा परा गतिः |
प्राप्तव्यं तु दशा योगान्मयैतदिति निश्चितम् ||६-११३-४२
दासीनां रावणस्याहं मर्षयामीह दुर्बला |_END
BEGIN_
"O the great-armed Hanuma! Do not speak like this. This is indeed a great divine
strategy. It was ordained that this type of situation is to be obtained by me, due to the
application of fate. Feeble as I am in these matters, I am forgiving the servant-maids of Ravana
here."_END

B_6_C_113_34
BEGIN_
आज्ञप्ता रावणेनैता राक्षस्यो माम् अतर्जयन् ||६-११३-४३
हते तस्मिन्न कुर्युर्हि तर्जनं वानरोत्तम |_END
BEGIN_
"O Hanuma! As commanded by Ravana the threatened me. As he is dead now, they will
not do the threatening."_END

B_6_C_113_35
BEGIN_
अयं व्याघ्रसमीपे तु पुराणो धर्मसंहितः ||६-११३-४४
ऋक्षेण गीतः श्लोको मे तं निबोध प्लवङ्गम |_END
BEGIN_
