"O Hanuma! There is an old axim possessed of merit, actually uttered by a bear in
the presence of a tiger. Hear it from me."_END

B_6_C_113_36
BEGIN_
न परः पापमादत्ते परेषां पापकर्मणाम् ||६-११३-४५
समयो रक्षितव्यस्तु सन्तश्चारित्रभूषणाः |_END
BEGIN_
"A superior person does not take into account the sin of those who have committed an
offence evil for evil must be carried out at all costs virtuous persons account good conduct as an
ornament."_END

B_6_C_113_37
BEGIN_
पापानां वा शुभानां वा वधार्हाणां प्लवङ्गम ||६-११३-४६
कार्यं कारुण्यमार्येण न कश्चिन्नापराध्यति |_END
BEGIN_
"Kindness is to be shown by a noble person either towards a sinner or to a virtuous
person or even to a person who deserves death, for, there is none who never commits a wrong."_END

B_6_C_113_38
BEGIN_
लोकहिंसाविहाराणां रक्षसां कामरूपिणम् ||६-११३-४७
कुर्वतामपि पापानि नैव कार्यमशोभनम् |_END
BEGIN_
"No evil is to be done, even to those cruel persons of sinful deeds, who take
pleasure to harm the life of others and continue to perpetrate their sinful acts."_END

B_6_C_113_39
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तस्तु हनुमान्सीतया वाक्यकोविदः ||६-११३-४८
प्रत्युवाच ततः सीतां रामपत्नीं यशस्विनीम् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Seetha, Hanuma who was skilled in speech, then replied to the
faultless Seetha, Rama's consort (as follows):_END

B_6_C_113_40
BEGIN_
युक्ता रामस्य भवती धर्मपत्नी यशस्विनी ||६-११३-४९
प्रतिसन्दिश मां देवि गमिष्ये यत्र राघवः |_END
BEGIN_
"O divine lady! You are the apt wife of Rama, full of virtue. Give me a message in
return. I will go to the place where Rama is."_END

B_6_C_113_41
BEGIN_
एवमुक्ता हनुमता वैदेही जनकात्मजा ||६-११३-५०
अब्रवीद्द्रष्टुमिच्छामि भर्तारं वानरोत्तम |_END
BEGIN_
Thus spoken by Hanuma, that Seetha the daughter of Janaka spoke as follows: "O the
foremost of monkeys! I long to see my husband."_END

B_6_C_113_42
BEGIN_
तस्यास्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा हनुमान्पवनात्मजः ||६-११३-५१
हर्षयन्मैथिलीं वाक्यमुवाचेदं महाद्युतिः |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Seetha, the highly intelligent Hanuma, the son of wind-god,
bringing delight to Seetha, spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_113_43
BEGIN_
पूर्णचन्द्राननं रामं द्रक्ष्यस्यार्ये सलक्ष्मणम् ||६-११३-५२
स्थिरमित्रं हतामित्रं शचीव त्रिदशेश्वरम् |_END
BEGIN_
"You shall see today, Rama whose countenance is like a full moon, whose friends
(like Sugreeva and Vibhishana) are alive, whose enemies have been killed along with Lakshmana, as
Shachi (the consort of Indra) would see Indra the lord of gods."_END

B_6_C_113_44
BEGIN_
तामेवमुक्त्वा राजन्तीं सीतां साक्षादिव श्रियम् ||६-११३-५३
आजगाम महावेगो हनूमान्यत्र राघवः |_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking to that Seetha, who appeared radiant before his eyes as Lakshmi the
goddess of prosperity, Hanuma of great splendor, came to the place where Rama was._END

B_6_C_113_45
BEGIN_
सपदि हरिवरस्ततो हनूमान् |
प्रतिवचनं जनकेश्वरात्मजायाः |
कथितमकथयद्यथाक्रमेण |
त्रिदशवरप्रतिमाय राघवाय ||६-११३-५४_END
BEGIN_
Then, Hanuma the excellent of monkeys speedily narrated, in order of sequence, the
message given by Seetha, to Rama who was equal to Indra the chief of celestials._END

B_6_C_114_0
BEGIN_
तमुवाच महाप्रज्ञमभिगम्य प्लवङ्गमः |
रामं वचनमर्थज्ञो वरं सर्वधनुष्मताम् || ६-११४-१_END
BEGIN_
Having offered his salutation to that Rama, who was excellent among all the wielders
of the bow and whose eyes resembled the lotus-petals, that highly intelligent Hanuma spoke to him
as follows:_END

B_6_C_114_1
BEGIN_
यन्निमित्तोऽयमारम्भः कर्मणां च फलोदयः |
तां देवीं शोकसन्तप्तां मैथिलीं द्रष्टुमर्हसि || ६-११४-२_END
BEGIN_
"You ought to see Seetha that divine lady who is consumed by grief, for whose sake
this course of actions was undertaken and which has (now) borne fruit."_END

B_6_C_114_2
BEGIN_
सा हि शोकसमाविष्टा बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणा |
मैथिली विजयं श्रुत्वा तव हर्षमुपागमत् || ६-११४-३_END
BEGIN_
"Hearing the news of your victory, that Seetha, stricken as she was with grief, is
now longing to see you, her eyes filled with tears of joy."_END

B_6_C_114_3
BEGIN_
पूर्वकात्प्रत्ययाच्चाहमुक्तो विश्वस्तया तया |
भर्तारं द्रष्टुमिच्छामि कृतार्थं सहलक्ष्मणम् || ६-११४-४_END
BEGIN_
"By her, who has trust in me because of confidence which has trust in me because of
confidence which had been inspired me on a former occasion, I was spoken as follows: 'I desire to
see my husband, who has accomplished his purpose, together with Lakshmana.'"_END

B_6_C_114_4
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तो हनुमता रामो धर्मभृतां वरः |
अगच्छत्सहसा ध्यानमासीद्बाष्पपरिप्लुतः || ६-११४-५_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Hanuma's words, Rama who was the foremost among the supporters of
righteousness, was a little over whelmed with tears and suddenly became a bit thoughtful._END

B_6_C_114_5
BEGIN_
दीर्घमुष्णं च निश्वस्य मेदिनीम् अवलोकयन् |
उवाच मेघसङ्काशं विभीषणमुपस्थितम् || ६-११४-६_END
BEGIN_
Drawing a deep and warm breath and casting his looks on the ground, he spoke (as
follows) to Vibhishana, who closely resembled a cloud in hue and who was standing nearby._END

B_6_C_114_6
BEGIN_
दिव्याङ्गरागां वैदेहीं दिव्याभरणभूषिताम् |
इह सीतां शिरःस्नातामुपस्थापय माचिरम् || ६-११४-७_END
BEGIN_
"Bring here Seetha, after she has bathed her head, has been anointed with charming
cosmetics and adorned with beautiful jewels. Let there be no delay."_END

B_6_C_114_7
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण त्वरमाणो विभीषणः |
प्रविश्यान्तःपुरं सीतां स्त्रीभिः स्वाभिरचोदयत् || ६-११४-८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Rama, Vibhishana, after entering the gynaecium in haste,
communicated his presence to Seetha, through his own women._END

B_6_C_114_8
BEGIN_
ततः सीतां महाभागां दृष्ट्वोवाच विभीषणः |
मूर्ध्नि बद्धाञ्जलिः श्रीमान्विनीतो राक्षसेश्वरः || ६-११४-९_END
BEGIN_
Then, the glorious Vibhishana the king of demons, after seeing the highly fortunate
Seetha, with his palms joined over his head, humbly spoke to her as follows:_END

B_6_C_114_9
BEGIN_
दिव्याङ्गरागा वैदेही दिव्याभरणभूषिता |
यानमारोह भद्रं ते भर्ता त्वां द्रष्टुमिच्छति || ६-११४-१०_END
BEGIN_
"O Seetha! Anointed with charming cosmetics and adorned with beautiful jewels if you
please, mount on the vehicle. Your husband wants to see you."_END

B_6_C_114_10
BEGIN_
एवमुक्ता तु वैदेही प्रत्युवाच विभीषणम् |
अस्नाता द्रष्टुमिच्छामि भर्तारं राक्षसाधिप || ६-११४-११_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Vibhishana, replied as follows: "O king of demons! I wish to
see my husband, even without taking my bath."_END

B_6_C_114_11
BEGIN_
तस्यास्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा प्रत्युवाच विभीषणः |
यथाहं रामो भर्ता ते तत्तथा कर्तुमर्हसि || ६-११४-१२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Seetha, Vibhishana replied as follows: "You ought to do the
bidding of Rama, your husband, as he has enjoined you to do."_END

B_6_C_114_12
BEGIN_
तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा मैथिली भ्रातृदेवता |
भर्तृभक्तिव्रता साध्वी तथेति प्रत्यभाषत || ६-११४-१३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Vibhishana, the virtuous Seetha, regarding her husband as a
divinity, endowed as she was with a devotion to her husband, said in reply, "So t be!"_END

B_6_C_114_13
BEGIN_
ततः सीतां शिरःस्नातां युवतीभिरलङ्कृताम् |
महार्हाभरणोपेतां महार्हाम्बरधारिणीम् || ६-११४-१४
आरोप्य शिबिकां दीप्तां परार्ध्याम्बरसंवृताम् |
रक्षोभिर्बहुभिर्गुप्तामाजहार विभीषणः || ६-११४-१५_END
BEGIN_
Prevailing upon Seetha to ascend a shining palanquin, covered with an exceedingly
valuable cloth and guarded by numerous demons, after she had bathed her head and cleansed her body,
had put on costly robes and had been adorned with exceedingly valuable jewels, Vibhishana then
brought her to the presence of Rama._END

B_6_C_114_14
BEGIN_
सोऽभिगम्य महात्मानं ज्ञात्वाभिध्यानमास्थितम् |
प्रणतश्च प्रहृष्टश्च प्राप्तां सीतां न्यवेदयत् || ६-११४-१६_END
BEGIN_
Approaching the great-souled Rama, who was absorbed in thought, even after coming to
know that Seetha had arrived, Vibhishana offered his obeisance and with full of great joy,
announced to him that Seetha had arrived._END

B_6_C_114_15
BEGIN_
तामागतामुपश्रुत्य रक्षोगृहचिरोषिताम् |
हर्षो दैन्यं च रोषश्च त्रयं राघवमाविशत् || ६-११४-१७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that Seetha had arrived after living long in the abode of a demon, Rama was
filled with joy, indignation and felt miserable too all the three emotions at the same time._END

B_6_C_114_16
BEGIN_
ततः पार्श्वगतं दृष्ट्वा सविमर्शं विचारयन् |
विभीषणमिदं वाक्यमहृष्टो राघवोऽब्रवीत् || ६-११४-१८_END
BEGIN_
Feeling unhappy on considering with deep thought, the question of Seetha having come
in a palanquin, all the way, Rama then spoke the following words, looking at Vibhishana who was
beside him._END

B_6_C_114_17
BEGIN_
राक्षसाधिपते सौम्य नित्यं मद्विजये रत |
वैदेही संनिकर्षं मे शीघ्रं समुपगच्छतु || ६-११४-१९_END
BEGIN_
"O the gently king of demons, who is forever intent on my victory! Let Seetha duly
seek my presence quickly."_END

B_6_C_114_18
BEGIN_
स तद्वचनमाज्ञाय राघवस्य विभीषणः |
तूर्णमुत्सारणे यत्नं कारयामास सर्वतः || ६-११४-२०_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of that Rama, Vibhishana, who knew what was right, began to
disperse the crowd there quickly._END

B_6_C_114_19
BEGIN_
कञ्चुकोष्णीषिणस्तत्र वेत्रझर्झरपाणयः |
उत्सारयन्तः पुरुषाः समन्तात्परिचक्रमुः || ६-११४-२१_END
BEGIN_
Demons wearing jackets and turbans, their hands carrying staffs which made a
jingling sound, walked there all round, dispersing those warriors._END

B_6_C_114_20
BEGIN_
ऋक्षाणां वानराणां च राक्षसानां च सर्वतः |
वृन्दान्युत्सार्यमाणानि दूरमुत्ससृजुस्ततः || ६-११४-२२_END
BEGIN_
Crowds of bears, monkeys and demons, dispersed on all sides, bounced for a distance,
from their nearness to the palanquin._END

B_6_C_114_21
BEGIN_
तेषामुत्सार्यमाणानां सर्वेषां ध्वनिरुत्थितः |
वायुनोद्वर्तमानस्य सागरस्येव निस्वनः || ६-११४-२३_END
BEGIN_
While those warriors were being driven away, there was a very great sound,
resembling the roar of a sea, lashed by a storm._END

B_6_C_114_22
BEGIN_
उत्सार्यमाणांस्तान्दृष्ट्वा समन्ताज्जातसम्भ्रमान् |
दाक्षिण्यात्तदमर्षाच्च वारयामास राघवः || ६-११४-२४_END
BEGIN_
Seeing them being dispersed on all sides excited, Rama then stopped that operation
of those who were dispersing them, out of kindness (for those who were being driven away) and
resentment (at the behaviour of the demons who were dispersing them)._END

B_6_C_114_23
BEGIN_
संरब्धश्चाब्रवीद्रामश्चक्षुषा प्रदहन्निव |
विभीषणं महाप्राज्ञं सोपालम्भमिदं वचः || ६-११४-२५_END
BEGIN_
The enraged Rama, consuming the demons with his looks as it were, Rama spoke the
following reproaching words to the highly intelligent Vibhishana_END

B_6_C_114_24
BEGIN_
किमर्थं मामनादृत्य कृश्यतेऽयं त्वया जनः |
निवर्तयैनमुद्योगं जनोऽयं स्वजनो मम || ६-११४-२६_END
BEGIN_
"Why disregarding me, are these people harassed by you? Stop this exertion. They are
my own people."_END

B_6_C_114_25
BEGIN_
न गृहाणि न वस्त्राणि न प्राकारास्तिरस्क्रियाः |
नेदृशा राजसत्कारा वृत्तमावरणं स्त्रियः || ६-११४-२७_END
BEGIN_
"An apartment is not a thing that protects a woman, nor robes, nor compound-walls,
nor concealments nor such royal honours. Her character is her shield."_END

B_6_C_114_26
BEGIN_
व्यसनेषु न कृच्छ्रेषु न युद्धे न स्वयं वरे |
न क्रतौ नो विवाहे च दर्शनं दुष्यते स्त्रियः || ६-११४-२८_END
BEGIN_
"A woman becoming visible to public in times of a calamity is not condemned in
difficult situations, nor in battles, nor in self-choosing of a husband by a princess at a public
assembly of suitors, nor in sacrificial ceremonies nor in marriage-functions."_END

B_6_C_114_27
BEGIN_
सैषा युद्धगता चैव कृच्छ्रे महति च स्थिता |
दर्शनेऽस्या न दोषः स्यान्मत्समीपे विशेषतः || ६-११४-२९_END
BEGIN_
"The younder Seetha is in distress and beset with a great difficulty. There is no
fault in her appearance in public, particularly in my presence."_END

B_6_C_114_28
BEGIN_
विसृज्य शिबिकां तस्मात्पद्भ्यामेवोपसर्पतु |
समीपे मम वैदेहीं पश्यन्त्वेते वनौकसः || ६-११४-३०_END
BEGIN_
"That is why, let her come on foot alone, leaving the palanquin there. Let these
monkeys see Seetha in my presence."_END

B_6_C_114_29
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण सविमर्शो विभीषणः |
रामस्योपानयत्सीतां संनिकर्षं विनीतवत् || ६-११४-३१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Rama the intelligent Vibhishana, with decency, brought Seetha
to Rama's vicinity._END

B_6_C_114_30
BEGIN_
ततो लक्ष्मणसुग्रीवौ हनूमांश्च प्लवङ्गमः |
निशम्य वाक्यं रामस्य बभूवुर्व्यथिता भृशम् || ६-११४-३२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Rama, Lakshmana Sugreeva and Hanuma the monkey then felt very
much perturbed._END

B_6_C_114_31
BEGIN_
कलत्रनिरपेक्षैश्च इङ्गितैरस्य दारुणैः |
अप्रीतमिव सीतायां तर्कयन्ति स्म राघवम् || ६-११४-३३_END
BEGIN_
From the pitiless facial features of Rama, showing indifference to his consort, they
conjectured as if Rama had some displeasure towards Seetha._END

B_6_C_114_32
BEGIN_
लज्जया त्ववलीयन्ती स्वेषु गात्रेषु मैथिली |
विभीषणेनानुगता भर्तारं साभ्यवर्तत || ६-११४-३४_END
BEGIN_
Seetha, for her part, shrinking into her limbs with modesty, approached her husband,
duly followed by Vibhishana._END

B_6_C_114_33
BEGIN_
विस्मयाच्च प्रहर्षाच्च स्नेहाच्च परिदेवता |
उदैक्षत मुखं भर्तुः सौम्यं सौम्यतरानना || ६-११४-३५_END
BEGIN_
The pleasant-faced Seetha, who considered her husband as the divinity, saw the
charming face of her husband, with a surprise, rejoice and affection._END

B_6_C_114_34
BEGIN_
अथ समपनुदन्मनःक्लमं सा |
सुचिरमदृष्टमुदीक्ष्य वै प्रियस्य |
वदनमुदितपूर्णचन्द्रकान्तं |
विमलशशाङ्कनिभानना तदासीत् || ६-११४-३६_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the face of her beloved husband, which had not been seen for a long time and
which was charming like the rising full moon, she forth dispelled her mental fatigue._END

B_6_C_115_0
BEGIN_
तां तु पार्श्वे स्थितां प्रह्वां रामः संप्रेक्ष्ये मैथिलीम् |
हृदयान्तर्गतं भावं व्याहर्तुमुपचक्रमे || ६-११५-१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that Seetha, who stood at his vicinity bowing low, Rama began to tell his
feeling hidden in his heart (as follows):_END

B_6_C_115_1
BEGIN_
एषासि निर्जिता भद्रे शत्रुं जित्वा रणाजिरे |
पौरुषाद्यदनुष्ठेयं मयैतदुपपादितम् || ६-११५-२_END
BEGIN_
"You are won back by me, after conquering the enemy in the battle-field, my dear
lady! That which is to be done through human effort, has been accomplished by me."_END

B_6_C_115_2
BEGIN_
गतोऽस्म्यन्तममर्षस्य धर्षणा संप्रमार्जिता |
अवमानश्च शत्रश्च युगपन्निहतौ मया || ६-११५-३_END
BEGIN_
"I have come to the end of my indignation and my outrage has been completely
requited as also the contempt against the enemy have been wiped out, all at once, by me."_END

B_6_C_115_3
BEGIN_
अद्य मे पौरुषं दृष्टमद्य मे सफलः श्रमः |
अद्य तीर्णप्रतिज्ञोऽहं प्रभवाम्यद्य चात्मनः || ६-११५-४_END
BEGIN_
"Now, my manly strength has been seen by all. Today, my toil has borne fruit. Now, I
have fulfilled my promise. Today, I am the master of myself."_END

B_6_C_115_4
BEGIN_
या त्वं विरहिता नीता चलचित्तेन रक्षसा |
दैवसंपादितो दोषो मानुषेण मया जितः || ६-११५-५_END
BEGIN_
"The wrong done to you, when you were deserted from me, in that you were taken away
by a fickle-minded demon, which was ordained by the destiny, has been corrected by me as a human
being."_END

B_6_C_115_5
BEGIN_
संप्राप्तमवमानं यस्तेजसा न प्रमार्जति |
कस्तस्य पौरुषेणार्थो महताप्यल्पचेतसः || ६-११५-६_END
BEGIN_
"What is the use of a prowess, however great, of that weak-minded man who does not
wipe out, by his energy, the insult fallen to his lot?"_END

B_6_C_115_6
BEGIN_
लङ्घुनं समुद्रस्य लङ्कायाश्चापि मर्दनम् |
सफलं तस्य च श्लाघ्यमद्य कर्म हनूमतः || ६-११५-७_END
BEGIN_
"The praise-worthy act of Hanuma in the form of crossing of the ocean and the
destroying of Lanka, has borne fruit today."_END

B_6_C_115_7
BEGIN_
युद्धे विक्रमतश्चैव हितं मन्त्रयतस्तथा |
सुग्रीवस्य ससैन्यस्य सफलोऽद्य परिश्रमः || ६-११५-८_END
BEGIN_
"The endeavour of Sugreeva, who exhibited his prowess on the battle-field with his
army and tendered a good advice, is fruitful today."_END

B_6_C_115_8
BEGIN_
विभीषणस्य च तथा सफलोऽद्य परिश्रमः |
विगुणं भ्रातरं त्वक्त्वा यो मां स्वयमुपस्थितः || ६-११५-९_END
BEGIN_
"Furthermore, the exertion of Vibhishana, who after deserting his brother who was
void of good qualities, sought my presence, is fruitful today._END

B_6_C_115_9
BEGIN_
इत्येवं वदतः श्रुत्वा सीता रामस्य तद्वचः |
मृगीवोत्फुल्लनयना बभूवाश्रुपरिप्लुता || ६-११५-१०_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words spoken thus by Rama, Seetha with her eyes wide open like those
of a female-deer, was bathed in tears._END

B_6_C_115_10
BEGIN_
पश्यतस्तां तु रामस्य समीपे हृदयप्रियाम् |
जनवादभयाद्राज्ञो बभूव हृदयं द्विधा || ६-११५-११_END
BEGIN_
The heart of King Rama, as he saw Seetha, (the beloved of his heart) near him, was
torn for fear of public scandal._END

B_6_C_115_11
BEGIN_
सीतामुत्पलपत्राक्षीं नीलकुञ्चितमूर्धजाम् |
अवदद्वै वरारोहां मध्ये वानररक्षसाम् || ६-११५-१२_END
BEGIN_
In the midst of monkeys and demons, Rama spoke (as follows) to Seetha, whose eyes
resembled the petals of a lotus, who wore dark curly hair and was endowed with fine hips._END

B_6_C_115_12
BEGIN_
यत्कर्तव्यं मनुष्येण धर्षणां प्रतिमार्जता |
तत्कृतं रावणं हत्वा मयेदं मानकाङ्क्क्षिणा || ६-११५-१३_END
BEGIN_
"I, wanting for an honour, have done this particular act, which ought to be done by
a man, in killing Ravana and thus wiping away the insult meted out to me."_END

B_6_C_115_13
BEGIN_
निर्जिता जीवलोकस्य तपसा भावितात्मना |
अगस्त्येन दुराधर्षा मुनिना दक्षिणेव दिक् || ६-११५-१४_END
BEGIN_
"You have been won by me, whose mind stands purified by asceticism as the southern
quarter, which was difficult to be approached by the world of mortals, was conquered by the Sage
Agastya."_END

B_6_C_115_14
BEGIN_
विदितश्चास्तु भद्रं ते योऽयं रणपरिश्रमः |
सुतीर्णः सुहृदां वीर्यान्न त्वदर्थं मया कृतः || ६-११५-१५
रक्षता तु मया वृत्तमपवादम् च सर्वतः |
प्रख्यातस्यात्मवंशस्य न्यङ्गं च परिमार्जता || ६-११५-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Let it be known to you that this endeavor in the shape of war, which has been
successful carried through, due to the strength of my friends was not undertaken for your sake. Let
there be prosperity to you! This was done by me in order to keep up my good conduct and to wipe off
the evil-speaking from all sides as well as the insinuation on my own illustrious dynasty."_END

B_6_C_115_15
BEGIN_
प्राप्तचारित्रसंदेह मम प्रतिमुखे स्थिता |
दीपो नेत्रातुरस्येव प्रतिकूलासि मे दृढम् || ६-११५-१७_END
BEGIN_
"You, with a suspicion arisen on your character, standing in front of me, are
extremely disagreeable to me, even as a light to one, who is suffering from a poor eye-sight."_END

B_6_C_115_16
BEGIN_
तद्गच्छ त्वानुजानेऽद्य यथेष्टं जनकात्मजे |
एता दश दिशो भद्रे कार्यमस्ति न मे त्वया || ६-११५-१८_END
BEGIN_
"O Seetha! That is why, I am permitting you now. Go wherever you like. All these ten
directions are open to you, my dear lady! There is no work to be done to me, by you."_END

B_6_C_115_17
BEGIN_
कः पुमांस्तु कुले जातह् स्त्रियं परगृहोषिताम् |
तेजस्वी पुनरादद्यात् सुहृल्लेख्येन चेतसा || ६-११५-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Which noble man, born in an illustrious race, will take back a woman who lived in
another's abode, with an eager mind?"_END

B_6_C_115_18
BEGIN_
रावणाङ्कपरिक्लिष्टां दृष्टां दुष्टेन चक्षुषा |
कथं त्वां पुनरादद्यां कुलं व्यपदिशन् महत् || ६-११५-२०_END
BEGIN_
"While mentioning greatly about my lineage, how can I accept again, you who were
harassed in Ravana's lap (while being borne away by him) and who were seen (by him) with evil
looks?"_END

B_6_C_115_19
BEGIN_
तदर्थं निर्जिता मे त्वं यशः प्रत्याहृतं मया |
नास्थ् मे त्वय्यभिष्वङ्गो यथेष्टं गम्यतामितः || ६-११५-२१_END
BEGIN_
"You were won by me with that end in view (viz. the retrieval of my lost honour).
The honour has been restored by me. For me, there is no intense attachment in you. You may go
wherever you like from here."_END

B_6_C_115_20
BEGIN_
तदद्य व्याहृतं भद्रे मयैतत् कृतबुद्धिना |
लक्ष्मणे वाथ भरते कुरु बुद्धिं यथासुखम् || ६-११५-२२_END
BEGIN_
"O gracious lady! Therefore, this has been spoken by me today, with a resolved mind.
Set you mind on Lakshmana or Bharata, as per your ease."_END

B_6_C_115_21
BEGIN_
शत्रुघ्ने वाथ सुग्रीवे राक्षसे वा विभीषणे |
निवेशय मनः सीते यथा वा सुखमात्मनः || ६-११५-२३_END
BEGIN_
"O Seetha! Otherwise, set your mind either on Shatrughna or on Sugreeva or on
Vibhishana the demon; or according to your own comfort."_END

B_6_C_115_22
BEGIN_
न हि त्वां रावणो दृष्ट्वो दिव्यरूपां मनोरमाम् |
मर्षयेत चिरं सीते स्वगृहे पर्यवस्थिताम् || ६-११५-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing you, who are endowed with a beautiful form and attractive to the sense,
detained for long in his abode, Ravana could not have endured your separation."_END

B_6_C_115_23
BEGIN_
ततः प्रियार्हश्रवणा तदप्रियं |
प्रियादुपश्रुत्य चिरस्य मैथिली |
मुमोच बाष्पं सुभृशं प्रवेपिता |
गजेन्द्रहस्ताभिहतेव वल्लरी || ६-११५-२५_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that unpalatable speech of her beloved husband, Seetha who used to hear
pleasing words alone, was very much trembled for long, like a creeper attacked by the proboscis of
an elephant and thereupon shed tears._END

B_6_C_116_0
BEGIN_
एवमुक्ता तु वैदेही परुषं लोमहर्षणम् |
राघवेण सरोषेण भृशं प्रव्यथिताभवत् || ६-११६-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the harsh words with indignation, spoken by Rama, which caused her hair to
stand on end, Seetha became very much perturbed._END

B_6_C_116_1
BEGIN_
सा तदश्रुतपूर्वं हि जने महति मैथिली |
श्रुत्वा भर्तृवचो रूक्षं लज्जया व्रीडिताभवत् || ६-११६-२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the terrific words of her husband, which were never actually heard by her
before, amidst a large gathering of people, Seetha stood bent low with shame._END

B_6_C_116_2
BEGIN_
प्रविशन्तीव गात्राणि स्वान्येव जनकात्मजा |
वाक्षल्यैस्तैः सशल्येव भृशमश्रूण्यवर्तयत् || ६-११६-३_END
BEGIN_
As though her own limbs were pierced by those words, which were arrow-like with
pointed splinters, Seetha shed profuse tears._END

B_6_C_116_3
BEGIN_
ततो बाष्पपरिक्लिष्टं प्रमार्जन्ती स्वमाननम् |
शनैर्गद्गदया वाचा भर्तारमिदमब्रवीत् || ६-११६-४_END
BEGIN_
Then, wiping clean her face, which was bathed in tears, she spoke the following
words slowly, in a stammering voice to her husband._END

B_6_C_116_4
BEGIN_
किं मामसदृशं वाक्यमीदृशं श्रोत्रदारुणम् |
रूक्षं श्रावयसे वीर प्राकृतः प्राकृताम् इव || ६-११६-५_END
BEGIN_
"O valiant Rama! Why are you speaking such harsh words, which are violent to hear
for me, like a common man speaking to a common woman?"_END

B_6_C_116_5
BEGIN_
न तथास्मि महाबाहो यथा त्वमवगच्छसि |
प्रत्ययं गच्छ मे स्वेन चारित्रेणैव ते शपे || ६-११६-६_END
BEGIN_
"O the long-armed one! I am not the one in the way you understand me. Have a faith
in me. I swear to you by my own character."_END

B_6_C_116_6
BEGIN_
पृथक्स्त्रीणां प्रचारेण जातिं त्वं परिशङ्कसे |
परित्यजेमां शङ्कां तु यदि तेऽहं परीक्षिता || ६-११६-७_END
BEGIN_
"By the conduct of vulgar woman you distrust the entire race of women. Give up this
doubt, if I have been actually tested (and found trustworthy) by you."_END

B_6_C_116_7
BEGIN_
यद्यहं गात्रसंस्पर्शं गतास्मि विवशा प्रभो |
कामकारो न मे तत्र दैवं तत्रापराध्यति || ६-११६-८_END
BEGIN_
"O lord! It was not my willfulness, when I came into contact with the person of
Ravana. I was helpless. My adverse fate was to blame on that score."_END

B_6_C_116_8
BEGIN_
मदधीनं तु यत्तन्मे हृदयं त्वयि वर्तते |
पराधीनेषु गात्रेषु किं करिष्याम्यनीश्वरा || ६-११६-९_END
BEGIN_
"My heart, which was subservient to me, was abiding in you. What could I do,
helpless as I was, with regard to my limbs which had fallen under the sway of another?"_END

B_6_C_116_9
BEGIN_
सहसंवृद्धभावाच्च संसर्गेण च मानद |
यद्यहं ते न विज्ञाता हता तेनास्मि शाश्वतम् || ६-११६-१०_END
BEGIN_
"O bestower of honour! If I could not be fully known to you, in spite of our love
having simultaneously grown and despite of our having lived together, I am ruined permanently by
such ignorance."_END

B_6_C_116_10
BEGIN_
प्रेषितस्ते यदा वीरो हनूमानवलोककः |
लङ्कास्थाहं त्वया वीर किं तदा न विसर्जिता || ६-११६-११_END
BEGIN_
"O king! Hanuma, the great hero, was sent by you as your search-agent. Why I, who
was still in Lanka, was not abandoned then itself?"_END

B_6_C_116_11
BEGIN_
प्रत्यक्षं वानरेन्द्रस्य त्वद्वाक्यसमनन्तरम् |
त्वया सन्त्यक्तया वीर त्यक्तं स्याज्जीवितं मया || ६-११६-१२_END
BEGIN_
"O hero! Life would have been given up by me, when deserted by you; immediately on
hearing the message (conveying your desertion) before the eyes of the monkey."_END

B_6_C_116_12
BEGIN_
न वृथा ते श्रमोऽयं स्यात्संशये न्यस्य जीवितम् |
सुहृज्जनपरिक्लेशो न चायं निष्फलस्तव || ६-११६-१३_END
BEGIN_
"This wasteful endeavour (in the form of crossing over to Lanka and waging war
against the mighty Ravana, keeping your life in jeopardy), would not have been there, nor would
have your friends been put to such fruitless hardship."_END

B_6_C_116_13
BEGIN_
त्वया तु नरशार्दूल क्रोधमेवानुवर्तता |
लघुनेव मनुष्येण स्त्रीत्वमेव पुरस्कृतम् || ६-११६-१४_END
BEGIN_
"O excellent king! You, however, like a feeble man, gave priority to womanliness,
conforming yourself to just an emotion of anger."_END

B_6_C_116_14
BEGIN_
अपदेशेन जनकान्नोत्पत्तिर्वसुधातलात् |
मम वृत्तं च वृत्तज्ञ बहु ते न पुरस्कृतम् || ६-११६-१५_END
BEGIN_
"O knower of virtuous conduct! My birth was from Janaka in disguise; but was
actually from the earth. My sacred birth of such a high degree, was not honoured by you."_END

B_6_C_116_15
BEGIN_
न प्रमाणीकृतः पाणिर्बाल्ये बालेन पीडितः |
मम भक्तिश्च शीलं च सर्वं ते पृष्ठतः कृतम् || ६-११६-१६_END
BEGIN_
"My hand taken (by you as a bride) in our childhood was not duly recognized by you.
My devotion, my chastity and all have been ignored by you."_END

B_6_C_116_16
BEGIN_
इति ब्रुवन्ती रुदती बाष्पगद्गदभाषिणी |
उवाच लक्ष्मणं सीता दीनं ध्यानपरायणम् || ६-११६-१७_END
BEGIN_
Seetha, thus speaking, weeping and stammering with tears, said to Lakshmana, who was
sad and engaged in thoughtfulness (as follows):_END

B_6_C_116_17
BEGIN_
चितां मे कुरु सौमित्रे व्यसनस्यास्य भेषजम् |
मिथ्यापवादोपहता नाहं जीवितुमुत्सहे || ६-११६-१८_END
BEGIN_
"O Lakshmana! Create a pile of fire, for me, which is a remedy for this disaster. I
no longer wish to survive, smitten as am with false blames."_END

B_6_C_116_18
BEGIN_
अप्रीतेन गुणैर्भर्त्रा त्यक्ता या जनसंसदि |
या क्षमा मे गतिर्गन्तुं प्रवेक्ष्ये हव्यवाहनम् || ६-११६-१९_END
BEGIN_
"I will enter a fire, to obtain the only course appropriate for me, who has been
abandoned amidst an assembly of men, by my husband who was not satisfied with my traits."_END

B_6_C_116_19
BEGIN_
एवं ब्रुवाणा रुदती बाष्पगद्गदभाषिणी |
अब्रवील्लक्ष्मणं सीता दीनं ध्यानपरं स्थितम् || ६-११६-२०_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Seetha, Lakshmana, the destroyer of enemy warriors, giving way
to wrath, looked towards Rama._END

B_6_C_116_20
BEGIN_
स विज्ञाय मनश्छन्दं रामस्याकारसूचितम् |
चितां चकार सौमित्रिर्मते रामस्य वीर्यवान् || ६-११६-२१_END
BEGIN_
Understanding the inclination of the mind of Rama, hinted by the expression in his
face, that valiant Lakshmana prepared a pyre, in deference to the wishes of Rama._END

B_6_C_116_21
BEGIN_
न हि रामं तदा कश्चित्कालान्तकयमोपमम् |
अनुनेतुमथो वक्तुं द्रष्टुं वा प्यशकत्सुहृत् || ६-११६-२२_END
BEGIN_
No one near and dear was indeed able to cajole on that occasion or to speak or even
to look upon Rama, who appeared like Yama the lord of death at the time of dissolution of the
world._END

B_6_C_116_22
BEGIN_
अधोमुखं ततो रामं शनैः कृत्वा प्रदक्षिणम् |
उपासर्पत वैदेही दीप्यमानं हुताशनम् || ६-११६-२३_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Seetha, after doing circumambulation to Rama, who was standing with his
head bent low, proceeded towards the blazing fire._END

B_6_C_116_23
BEGIN_
प्रणम्य देवताभ्यश्च ब्राह्मणेभ्यश्च मैथिली |
बद्धाञ्जलिपुटा चेदमुवाचाग्निसमीपतः || ६-११६-२४_END
BEGIN_
Having offered salutation to gods and brahmins as also having joined her palms in
the vicinity of the fire, Seetha spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_116_24
BEGIN_
यथा मे हृदयं नित्यं नापसर्पति राघवात् |
तथा लोकस्य साक्षी मां सर्वतः पातु पावकः || ६-११६-२५_END
BEGIN_
"As my heart never moves off from Rama, so let the fire-god, the witness of the
world, protect me from all sides."_END

B_6_C_116_25
BEGIN_
यथा मां शुद्धचरितां दुष्टां जानाति राघवः |
तथा लोकस्य साक्षी मां सर्वतः पातु पावकः || ६-११६-२६_END
BEGIN_
"As Rama apprehends me, though of unimpeachable conduct, to be spoilt, let the
fire-god the witness of the world protect me from all sides."_END

B_6_C_116_26
BEGIN_
कर्मणा मनसा वाचा यथा नातिचराम्यहम् |
राघवं सर्वधर्मज्ञं तथा मां पातु पावकः || ६-११६-२७_END
BEGIN_
"As I have never been unfaithful in act, thought and speech to Rama, who knows all
the virtues, so let the fire-god protect me."_END

B_6_C_116_27
BEGIN_
आदित्योभवान् वायुर्दिशश्चन्द्रस्तथैव च |
अहश्चापि तथा सन्ध्ये रात्रिश्च पृथिवी तथा || ६-११६-२८
यथान्येऽपि विजानन्ति तथा चारित्रसंयुताम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Since the adorable sun-god, wind-god, the four quarters and even so the moon-god,
as also the deity presiding over the day-time and the twilights and the night and the earth and
even others know me to be endowed with good conduct, so let the fire-god protect me."_END

B_6_C_116_28
BEGIN_
एवमुक्त्वा तु वैदेही परिक्रम्य हुताशनम् || ६-११६-२९
विवेश ज्वलनं दीप्तं निःसङ्गेनान्तरात्मना |_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking, Seetha walking around the fire-god, with her mind free from
hesitation, entered the blazing fire._END

B_6_C_116_29
BEGIN_
जनः स सुमहांस्तत्र बालवृद्धसमाकुलः || ६-११६-३०
ददर्श मैथिलीं तत्र प्रविशन्तीं हुताशनम् |_END
BEGIN_
A large gathering of men including children and elders, saw the shining Seetha
having entered the fire there._END

B_6_C_116_30
BEGIN_
सा तप्तनवहेमाभा तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणा || ६-११६-३१
पपात ज्वलनं दीप्तं सर्वलोकस्य संनिधौ |_END
BEGIN_
That Seetha, with the shining of fresh refined gold and decked with ornaments of
refined gold, plunged into the blazing fire, in the presence of all people._END

B_6_C_116_31
BEGIN_
ददृशुस्तां विशालाक्षीं पतन्तीं हव्यवाहनम् || ६-११६-३२
सीतां सर्वाणि रूपाणि रुक्मवेदिनिभां तदा |_END
BEGIN_
All the living beings saw then that wide-eyed Seetha, who looked like a golden
altar, plunging into the fire._END

B_6_C_116_32
BEGIN_
ददृशुस्तां महाभागां प्रविशन्तीं हुताशनम् || ६-११६-३३
सीतां कृत्स्नास्त्रयो लोकाः पुण्यामाज्याहुतीमिव |_END
BEGIN_
The sages, gods, and the Gandharvas saw that illustrious Seetha entering deep into
the fire as a sacred oblation of clarified butter._END

B_6_C_116_33
BEGIN_
प्रचुक्रुशुः स्त्रियः सर्वास्तां दृष्ट्वा हव्यवाहने || ६-११६-३४
पतन्तीं संस्कृतां मन्रैर्वसोर्धारामिवाध्वरे |_END
BEGIN_
All the women (who were present there) screamed on seeing her, rushing into the
fire, like a gush of clarified butter plunging into the sacrificial fire, duly consecrated by Vedic
hymns._END

B_6_C_116_34
BEGIN_
ददृशुस्तां त्रयो लोका देवगन्धर्वदाननाः || ६-११६-३५
शप्तां पतन्तीं निरये त्रिदिवाद्देवतामिव |_END
BEGIN_
The denizens of the entire three worlds including the gods, Gandharvas and demons,
beheld her falling into the fire, like a goddess, subjected to a curse, falling from heaven to
hell._END

B_6_C_116_35
BEGIN_
तस्यामग्निं विशन्त्यां तु हाहेति विपुलः स्वनः || ६-११६-३६
रक्षसां वानराणां च सम्बभूवाद्भुतोपमः |_END
BEGIN_
While she was entering deeply into the fire, a loud sound, which appeared strange,
uttering 'Alas, Alas' rose both from the demons and the monkeys alike._END

B_6_C_117_0
BEGIN_
ततो हि दुर्मना रामः श्रुत्वैवम् वदतां गिरः |
दध्यौ मुहूर्तं धर्मात्मा बाष्पव्याकुललोचनः || ६-११७-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the cries of these who were thus wailing, the virtuous minded Rama then
became thoughtful for a while, afflicted as he was with melancholy, his eyes filled with tears._END

B_6_C_117_1
BEGIN_
ततो वैश्रवणो राजा यमश्च पृभिः सह |
सहस्राक्षश्च देवेशो वरुणश्च जलेश्वरः || ६-११७-२
षड्र्धनयनः श्रीमान् महादेवो वृषध्वजः |
कर्ता सर्वस्य लोकस्य ब्रह्मा ब्रह्मविदां वरः || ६-११७-३
एते सर्वे समागम्य विमानैः सूर्यसंनिभैः |
आगम्य नगरीं लङ्कामभिजग्मुश्च राघवम् || ६-११७-४_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Kubera the King of Yakshas, Yama the lord of death together with the
deceased ancestors, Indra the lord of celestials Varuna the lord of waters, the illustrious Shiva
the great deity who bears the device of a bull as his banner and having three eyes, Brahma the
creator of all the worlds and the best among the knowers of sacred knowledge all these together
reaching the City of Lanka in aerial cars, shining like the sun approached Rama._END

B_6_C_117_2
BEGIN_
ततः सहस्ताभरणान् प्रगृह्य विपुलान् भुजान् |
अब्रुवंस्त्रिदशश्रेष्ठा राघवं प्राञ्जलिं स्थितम् || ६-११७-५_END
BEGIN_
Lifting their long arms, their hands decked with ornaments, those excellent gods
thereupon, spoke (as follows) to Rama who stood there, making a respectful salutation to them with
his folded hands._END

B_6_C_117_3
BEGIN_
कर्ता सर्वस्य लोकस्य श्रेष्ठो ज्ञानवतां प्रभुः |
उपेक्षसे कथं सीतां पतन्तीं हव्यवाहने || ६-११७-६
कथं देवगणश्रेष्ठमात्मानं नावबुद्ध्यसे |_END
BEGIN_
"How do you, the maker of the entire cosmos, the foremost among those endowed with
knowledge and an all-capable person, ignore Seetha who is falling into the fire? How do you not
recognize yourself to be the foremost of the troop of gods?"_END

B_6_C_117_4
BEGIN_
ऋतधामा वसुः पूर्वं वसूनां च प्रजापतिः || ६-११७-७
त्रयाणामपि लोकानामादिकर्ता स्वयं प्रभुः |_END
BEGIN_
"Among the Vasus (a class of gods, eight in number), you are the Vasu, named
R^itadhama (one whose abode is Truth or the Divine Law) who was formerly the self-constituted
ruler, the first creator of all the three worlds and the lord of creatures."_END

B_6_C_117_5
BEGIN_
रुद्राणामष्टमो रुद्रः साध्यानामपि पञ्चमः || ६-११७-८
अश्विनौ चापि कर्णौ ते सूर्याचन्द्रामसौ दृशौ |_END
BEGIN_
"You are the eighth Rudra among (eleven) Rudras and the fifth (Viryavan by name)
among the Sadhyas (a particular class of celestials belonging to Gana Devata). The twin Aswinis are
your ears. The sun and the moon constitute your eyes."_END

B_6_C_117_6
BEGIN_
अन्ते चादौ च लोकानां दृश्यसे च परंतप || ६-११७-९
उपेक्षसे च वैदेहीं मानुषः प्राकृतो यथा |_END
BEGIN_
"O the destroyer of the adversaries. You are seen (to exist) at the beginning and at
the end of creation. Yet, you ignore Seetha, just like a common man."_END

B_6_C_117_7
BEGIN_
इत्युक्तो लोकपालैस्तैः स्वामी लोकस्य राघवः || ६-११७-१०
अब्रवित्त्रिदशश्रेष्ठान् रामो धर्मभृतां वरः |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of those guardians of the world, Rama, the lord of creation, who
was born in Raghu dynasty and the foremost one among protectors of righteousness, spoke to those
god-chiefs as follows:_END

B_6_C_117_8
BEGIN_
आत्मानं मानुषं मन्ये रामं दशरथात्मजम् || ६-११७-११
सोऽहं यस्य यतश्चाहं भगवंस्तद्ब्रवीतु मे |_END
BEGIN_
"I think of myself to be a human being, by name Rama, the son of Dasaratha. You, as
a gracious Divinity, tell me that which I as such really am like this."_END

B_6_C_117_9
BEGIN_
इति ब्रुवाणं काकुत्थ्सं ब्रह्मा ब्रह्मविदां वरः || ६-११७-१२
अब्रवीच्छृणु मे वाक्यं सत्यं सत्यपराक्रम |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Rama, Brahma (the creator), the foremost among the knowers of
Brahma the Absolute, spoke as follows: "Listen to my true word, O the truly brave lord!"_END

B_6_C_117_10
BEGIN_
भवान्नारायणो देवः श्रीमांश्चक्रायुधः प्रभुः || ६-११७-१३
एकशृङ्गो वराहस्त्वं भूतभव्यसपत्नजित् |_END
BEGIN_
"You are the Lord Narayana himself the glorious god, who wields the discus. You are
the Divine Boar with a single tusk, the conqueror of your past and future enemies."_END

B_6_C_117_11
BEGIN_
अक्षरं ब्रह्म सत्यं च मध्ये चान्ते च राघव || ६-११७-१४
लोकानां त्वं परो धर्मो विष्वक्सेनश्चतुर्भजः |_END
BEGIN_
"You are Brahma, the imperishable, the Truth abiding in the middle as well as at the
end of the universe. You are the supreme righteousness of people, whose powers go everywhere. You
are the four-armed."_END

B_6_C_117_12
BEGIN_
शार्ङ्गधन्वा हृषीकेशः पुरुषः पुरुषोत्तमः || ६-११७-१५
अजितः खड्गधृग्विष्णुः कृष्णश्चैव महाबलः |_END
BEGIN_
"You are the wielder of a bow called Sarnga, the lord of the senses, the supreme
soul of the universe, the best of men, the invincible, the wielder of a sword named Nandaka, the
all-pervader, the bestower of happiness to the earth and endowed with great might."_END

B_6_C_117_13
BEGIN_
सेनानीर्ग्रामणीश्च त्वं त्वं बुद्धि स्त्वं क्षमा दमः || ६-११७-१६
प्रभवश्चाप्ययश्च त्वमुपेन्द्रो मधुसूदनः |_END
BEGIN_
"You are the leader of the army and the village headman. You are the intellect. You
are the endurance and the subduer of the senses. You are the origin and the dissolution of all,
Upendra the Divine Dwarf and (the younger brother of Indra) as also the destroyer Madhu, the
demon."_END

B_6_C_117_14
BEGIN_
इन्द्रकर्मा महेन्द्रस्त्वं पद्मनाभो रणान्तकृत् || ६-११७-१७
शरण्यं शरणम् च त्वामहुर्दिव्या महर्षयः |_END
BEGIN_
"You perform action for Indra the lord of celestials, the Supreme Ruler, the one
having a lotus in one's navel and who puts an end to all in battle. The divine sages pronounce you
to be fit to afford protection to all and the refuge for all."_END

B_6_C_117_15
BEGIN_
सहस्रशृङ्गो वेदात्मा शतशीर्षो महर्षभः || ६-११७-१८
त्वं त्रयाणां हि लोकानामादिकर्ता स्वयंप्रभुः |
सिद्धानामपि साध्यानामाश्रयश्चासि पूर्वजः || ६-११७-१९_END
BEGIN_
"In the form of the Vedas, you are the great Bull with hundred heads (rules) and
thousand horns (precepts). You are the first creator of all, the three worlds, and the self
constituted Lord of all. You are the refuge and the forbear of Siddhas (a class of demi-gods
endowed with mystic powers by virtue of their very birth) and Sadhyas (a class of celestial
beings.)"_END

B_6_C_117_16
BEGIN_
त्वं यज्ञ्स्त्वं वषट्कारस्त्वमोंकारः परात्परः || ६-११७-२०
प्रभवं निधनं वा ते नो विदुः को भवानिति |_END
BEGIN_
"You are the sacrificial performance. You are the sacred syllable 'Vashat' (on
hearing which the Adhvaryu priest casts the oblation to a deity into the sacrificial fire). You are
the mystic syllable 'OM'. You are higher than the highest. People neither know your end nor your
origin nor who you are in reality."_END

B_6_C_117_17
BEGIN_
दृश्यसे सर्वभूतेषु गोषु च ब्राह्मणेषु च || ६-११७-२१
दिक्षु सर्वासु गगने पर्वतेषु नदीषु च |_END
BEGIN_
"You appear in all created beings in the cattle and in brahmanas. You exist in all
quarters, in the sky, in mountains and in rivers."_END

B_6_C_117_18
BEGIN_
सहस्रचरणः श्रीमान् शतशीर्षः सहस्रदृक् || ६-११७-२२
त्वं धारयसि भूतानि पृथिवीं च सपर्वताम् |_END
BEGIN_
"With thousand feet, with hundred heads and with thousand eyes along with Lakshmi
the goddess of wealth, you bear the earth with all its created beings along with its
mountains."_END

B_6_C_117_19
BEGIN_
अन्ते पृथिव्याः सलिले दृश्यसे त्वं महोरगः || ६-११७-२३
त्रीन् लोकान् धारयन् राम देवगन्धर्वदानवान् |_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama! You appear as Sesha, a large serpent in water, at the earth's bottom,
bearing the three worlds, gods, Gandharvas, the celestial musicians and the demons."_END

B_6_C_117_20
BEGIN_
अहं ते हृदयं राम जिह्वा देवी सरस्वती || ६-११७-२४
देवा रोमाणि गात्रेषु ब्रह्मणा निर्मिताः प्रभो |_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama! I (brahma) am your heart. Saraswathi, the goddess (of learning) is your
tongue. O lord! The gods created by Brahma are the hair on all your limbs."_END

B_6_C_117_21
BEGIN_
निमेषस्ते स्मृता रात्रिरुन्मेषो दिवसस्तथा || ६-११७-२५
संस्कारास्त्वभवन्वेदा नैतदस्ति त्वया विना |_END
BEGIN_
"Night has been recognized as the closing of your eye-lids and the day, as the
opening of eye-lids. The correct usages of your words are the Vedas. Bereft of you, this visible
universe does not exist."_END

B_6_C_117_22
BEGIN_
जगत्सर्वं शरीरं ते स्थैर्यं ते वसुधातलम् || ६-११७-२६
अग्निः कोपः प्रसादस्ते सोमः श्रीवत्सलक्षणः |_END
BEGIN_
"The entire cosmos is your body. The earth constitutes your firmness. Fire is your
anger. The moon constitutes your placidity. You are Lord Vishnu (who bears the mark Srivatsa - a
curl of white hair on his breast)."_END

B_6_C_117_23
BEGIN_
त्वया लोकास्त्रयः क्रान्ताः पुरा स्वैर्विक्रमैस्त्रिभिः || ६-११७-२७
महेन्द्रश्च कृतो राजा बलिं बद्ध्वा सुदारुणम् |_END
BEGIN_
"In the past, the three worlds were occupied by you in your three strides, after
binding the exceptionally formidable Bali (the ruler of the three worlds) and Indra was made the
king (by you)."_END

B_6_C_117_24
BEGIN_
सीता लक्ष्मीर्भवान् विष्णुर्देवः कृष्णः प्रजापतिः || ६-११७-२८
वधार्थं रावणस्येह प्रविष्टो मानुषीं तनुम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha is no other than Goddess Lakshmi (the divine consort of Lord Vishnu), while
you are Lord Vishnu. You are having a shining dark-blue hue. You are the Lord of created beings.
For the destruction of Ravana, you entered a human body here, on this earth."_END

B_6_C_117_25
BEGIN_
तदिदं नस्त्वया कार्यं कृतं धर्मभृतां वर || ६-११७-२९
निहतो रावणो राम प्रहृष्टो दिवमाक्रम |_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama, the foremost among the supporters of righteousness! The aforesaid purpose
of ours has been fulfilled. Ravana has been killed. Return to your divine abode, with a
rejoice."_END

B_6_C_117_26
BEGIN_
अमोघं देव वीर्यं ते न ते मोघाः पराक्रमाः || ६-११७-३०
अमोघं दर्शनं राम अमोघस्तव संस्तवः |_END
BEGIN_
"O Lord! Unerring is your valour. Your exploits are never in vain. O Rama! Your
blessed sight is powerful. The songs in praise of you never go in vain."_END

B_6_C_117_27
BEGIN_
अमोघास्ते भविष्यन्ति भक्तिमन्तो नरा भुवि || ६-११७-३१
ये त्वां देवम् ध्रुवं भक्ताः पुराणं पुरुषोत्तमम् |
प्राप्नुवन्ति सदा कामानिह लोके पात्र च || ६-११७-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Those humans who are full of devotion to you will never be unsuccessful on this
earth. Those who are devoted to you, the primeval and the eternal lord, belonging to ancient times
and the Supreme Person, will forever attain their desired objects here as well as hereafter."_END

B_6_C_117_28
BEGIN_
इममार्षम् स्तवं दिव्यमितिहासं पुरातनम् || ६-११७-३३
ये नराः कीर्तयिष्यन्ति नास्ति तेषां पराभवः |_END
BEGIN_
"Humiliation will never be the plight of those humans who will recite this hymn in a
divine ancient history, sung by Brahma, the foremost seer."_END

B_6_C_118_0
BEGIN_
एतच्छ्रुत्वा शुभं वाक्यं पितामहसमीरितम् |
अङ्केनादाय वैदेहीमुत्पपात विभावसुः || ६-११८-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the foregoing auspicious words of Brahma (the creator), the fire-god came
up, taking Seetha in his arms._END

B_6_C_118_1
BEGIN_
विधूयाथ चितां तां तु विअदेहीं हव्यवाहनः |
उत्तस्थौ मूर्तिमानाशु गृहीत्वा जनकात्मजाम् || ६-११८-२_END
BEGIN_
Shaking off that funeral pile and taking that Seetha, the daughter of Janaka in his
arms, the fire-god forthwith sprang up at once in a personified form._END

B_6_C_118_2
BEGIN_
तरुणादित्यसंकाशां तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणाम् |
रक्ताम्बरधरां बालां नीलकुञ्चितमूर्धजाम् || ६-११८-३
अक्लिष्टमाल्याभरणां तथारूपामनिन्दिताम् |
ददौ रामाय वैदेहीमङ्के कृत्वा विभावसुः || ६-११८-४_END
BEGIN_
Bearing in his arms the youthful Seetha, who was shining brightly as the rising sun,
was decked in ornaments of refined gold, attired in a red robe and wore dark curly hair, who was
further adorned with ornaments of flowers, which had not abraded (on her entering the fire and
coming out of it), who was absolutely beyond reproach and looked just the same (as she did while
entering the fire and coming out of it), who was absolutely beyond reproach and looked just the
same (as she did while entering the flames), the fire-god restored her to Rama._END

B_6_C_118_3
BEGIN_
अब्रवीत्तु तदा रामं साक्षी लोकस्य पावकः |
एषा ते राम वैदेही पापमस्यां न विद्यते || ६-११८-५_END
BEGIN_
Then, the fire-god, the witness of the whole world, spoke to Rama as follows "Here
is your Seetha. No sin exists in her."_END

B_6_C_118_4
BEGIN_
नैव वाचा न मनसा नैव बुद्ध्या न चक्षुषा |
सुवृत्ता वृत्तशौण्डीर्यं न त्वामत्यचरच्छुभा || ६-११८-६_END
BEGIN_
"This auspicious lady, whose character has been good, has never been unfaithful to
you who are endowed with strength of character either by word or by mind or even by intellect or by
her glances."_END

B_6_C_118_5
BEGIN_
रावणेनापनीतैषा वीर्योत्सिक्तेन रक्षसा |
त्वया विरहिता दीना विवशा निर्जनाद्वनात् || ६-११८-७_END
BEGIN_
"Separated from you, this miserable and helpless lady, was taken away by Ravana the
demon, who was arrogant of his valour, from a lonely hermitage."_END

B_6_C_118_6
BEGIN_
रुद्ध चान्तःपुरे गुप्ता त्वच्चित्ता त्वत्परायणा |
रक्षिता राक्षसीभिश्च घोराभिर्घोरबुद्धिभिः || ६-११८-८_END
BEGIN_
"This Seetha, who was fixing her mind upon you ad looking on you as her final
attainment, was detained in the gynaecium and hidden there. She was guarded by rightful
female-demons with horrible intellect."_END

B_6_C_118_7
BEGIN_
प्रलोभ्यमाना विविधं तर्ज्यमाना च मैथिली |
नाचिन्तयत तद्रक्षस्त्वद्गतेनान्तरात्मना || ६-११८-९_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha, whose mind was directed towards you, ignored that demon even though allured
and frightened through various means."_END

B_6_C_118_8
BEGIN_
विशुद्धभावां निष्पापां प्रतिगृह्णीष्व मैथिलीम् |
न किंचिरभिधातव्या अहमाज्ञापयामि ते || ६-११८-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Take back Seetha, who is sinless, with a pure character. She should not be told
anything harsh. I hereby command you."_END

B_6_C_118_9
BEGIN_
ततः प्रीतमना रामः श्रुत्वैवं वदतां वरः |
दध्यौ मुहूर्तं धर्मात्मा बाष्पव्याकुललोचनः || ६-११८-११_END
BEGIN_
Rama, the excellent among the eloquent, whose mind was set on virtue, with a
pleasant mind to hear the aforesaid speech, reflected for a while, his eyes, entirely filed with
tears of joy._END

B_6_C_118_10
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तो महातेजा धृमानुरुविक्रमः |
उवाच त्रिदशश्रेष्ठं रामो धर्मभृतां वरः || ६-११८-१२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words, the courageous Rama of great prowess and the foremost of those
upholding the virtue, replied to the fire-god, the best of gods._END

B_6_C_118_11
BEGIN_
अवश्यं चापि लोकेषु सीता पावनमर्हति |
दीर्घकालोषिता हीयं रावणान्तःपुरे शुभा || ६-११८-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha certainly deserves this pure factory ordeal in the eyes of the people in as
much as this blessed woman had resided for a long time indeed in the gynaecium of Ravana._END

B_6_C_118_12
BEGIN_
बालिशो बत कामात्म रामो दशरथात्मजः |
इति वक्ष्यति मां लोको जानकीमविशोध्य हि || ६-११८-१४_END
BEGIN_
"The world would chatter against me, saying that Rama, the son of Dasaratha, was
really foolish and that his mind was dominated by lust, if I accept Seetha without examining her
with regard to her chastity."_END

B_6_C_118_13
BEGIN_
अनन्यहृदयां भक्तां मचत्तपरिवर्तिनीम् |
अहमप्यवगच्छामि मैथिलीं जनकात्मजाम् || ६-११८-१५_END
BEGIN_
"I also know that Seetha, the daughter of Janaka, who ever revolves in my mind, is
undivided in her affection to me."_END

B_6_C_118_14
BEGIN_
इमामपि विशालाक्षीं रक्षितां स्वेन तेजसा |
रावणो नातिवर्तेत वेल मिव महोदधिः || ६-११८-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Ravana could not violate this wide-eyed woman, protected as she was by her own
splendour, any more than an ocean would transgress its bounds."_END

B_6_C_118_15
BEGIN_
प्रत्ययार्थं तु लोकानां त्रयाणाम् सत्यसंश्रयः |
उपेक्षे चापि वैदेहीं प्रविशन्तीं हुताशनम् || ६-११८-१७_END
BEGIN_
"In order to convince the three worlds, I, whose refugee is truth, ignored Seetha
while she was entering the fire."_END

B_6_C_118_16
BEGIN_
न च शक्तः सुदुष्टत्मा मनसापि हि मैथिलीम् |
प्रधर्षयितुमप्राप्यां दीप्तामग्निशिखामिव || ६-११८-१८_END
BEGIN_
"The evil-minded Ravana was not able to lay his violent hands, even in thought, o
the unobtainable Seetha, who was blazing like a flaming tongue of fire."_END

B_6_C_118_17
BEGIN_
नेय मर्हति चैश्वर्यं रावणान्तःपुरे शुभा |
अनन्या हि मया सीता भास्करेण प्रभा यथा || ६-११८-१९_END
BEGIN_
"This auspicious woman could not give way to the sovereignty, existing in the
gynaecium of Ravana, in as much as Seetha is not different from me, even as sunlight is not
different from the sun."_END

B_6_C_118_18
BEGIN_
विशुद्धा त्रिषु लोकेषु मैथिली जनकात्मजा |
न विहातुं मया शक्या कीर्तिरात्मवता यथा || ६-११८-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha, the daughter of Janaka, is completely pure in her character, in all the
three worlds and can no longer be renounced by me, as a good name cannot be cast aside by a prudent
man."_END

B_6_C_118_19
BEGIN_
अवश्यं च मया कार्यं सर्वेषां वो वचो हितम् |
स्निग्धानां लोकनाथानामेवं च वदतां हितम् || ६-११८-२१_END
BEGIN_
The salutary advice of you all, the affectionate guardians of the world, who are
saying what is conducive to our good, must be certainly carried out by me."_END

B_6_C_118_20
BEGIN_
इत्येवमुक्त्वा विजयी महाबलः |
प्रशस्यमानह् स्वकृतेन कर्मणा |
समेत्य रामः प्रियया महायशाः |
सुखं सुखार्होऽनुबभूव राघवः || ६-११८-२२_END
BEGIN_
Saying thus and getting reunited with her beloved Seetha, the victorious and highly
illustrious Rama, a scion of Raghu dynasty, who was endowed with a great strength and deserved
happiness and was being glorified by his exploits, performed by his own self, experienced joy._END

B_6_C_119_0
BEGIN_
एतच्छ्रुत्वा शुभं वाक्यं राघवेण सुभाषितम् |
इदं शुभतरं वाक्यं व्याजहार महेश्वरः || ६-११९-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the auspicious words thus spoken by Rama, Lord Shiva the Supreme Lord
thereupon delivered the following still more beautiful speech:_END

B_6_C_119_1
BEGIN_
पुष्कराक्ष महाबाहो महावक्षः परन्तप |
दिष्ट्या कृतमिदं कर्म त्वया शस्त्रभृतां वर || ६-११९-२_END
BEGIN_
"O lotus-eyed, long-armed, broad-chested, annihilator of enemies and excellent among
those upholding the cause of virtue! Thank heaven! You accomplished this task."_END

B_6_C_119_2
BEGIN_
दिष्ट्या सर्वस्य लोकस्य प्रवृद्धं दारुणं तमः |
अपावृत्तं त्वया सङ्ख्ये राम रावणजं भयम् || ६-११९-३_END
BEGIN_
"Fortunately has the fear born of Ravana - which increased the severe darkness on
the entire world has been removed by you, on the battle-field, O Rama!"_END

B_6_C_119_3
BEGIN_
आश्वास्य भरतं दीनं कौसल्यां च यशस्विनीम् |
कैकेयीं च सुमित्रां च दृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मणमातरम् || ६-११९-४
प्राप्य राज्यमयोध्यायां नन्दयित्वा सुहृज्जनम् |
इक्ष्वाकूणां कुले वंशं स्थापयित्वा महाबल || ६-११९-५
इष्ट्वा तुरगमेधेन प्राप्य चानुत्तमं यशः |
ब्राह्मणेभ्यो धनं दत्त्वा त्रिदिवं गन्तुमर्हसि || ६-११९-६_END
BEGIN_
"You are fit to go to the heaven, by comforting the depressed Bharata and the
illustrious Kausalya as well as seeing Kaikeyi and Sumitra, the mother of Lakshmana having got the
sovereignty of Ayodhya, bringing delight to your friends, stabilizing the back-bone in the race of
Ikshvaku, getting excellent glory by performing a horse-sacrifice and by granting riches to
Brahmanas."_END

B_6_C_119_4
BEGIN_
एष राजा विमानस्थः पिता दशरथस्तव |
काकुत्स्थ मानुषे लोके गुरुस्तव महायशाः || ६-११९-७_END
BEGIN_
"This king Dasaratha, your father in this mortal world and the highly glorious as
well as the venerable person, is seated in an aerial car, O Rama!"_END

B_6_C_119_5
BEGIN_
इन्द्रलोकं गतः श्रीमांस्त्वया पुत्रेण तारितः |
लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा त्वमेनमभिवादय || ६-११९-८_END
BEGIN_
"Having been delivered by you, his (godly) son, the glorious king obtained the abode
of Indra the lord of celestials. you offer your respectful salutation to him, along with Lakshmana,
your brother."_END

B_6_C_119_6
BEGIN_
महादेववचः श्रुत्वा काकुत्स्थः सहलक्ष्मणः |
विमानशिखरस्थस्य प्रणाममकरोत्पितुः || ६-११९-९_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Shiva, Rama along with Lakshmana his brother, offered their
salutation to their father, seated on the topmost part of an aerial car._END

B_6_C_119_7
BEGIN_
दीप्यमानं स्वयां लक्ष्म्या विरजोअम्बरधारिणम् |
लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा ददर्श पितरं प्रभुः || ६-११९-१०_END
BEGIN_
The lord Rama along with Lakshmana his brother saw their father, who was blazing
with his own splendour and clad in brilliant garments._END

B_6_C_119_8
BEGIN_
हर्षेण महताविष्टो विमानस्थो महीपतिः |
प्राणैः प्रियतरं दृष्ट्वा पुत्रं दशरथस्तदा || ६-११९-११
आरोप्याङ्कं महाबाहुर्वरासनगतः प्रभुः |
बाहुभ्यां सम्परिष्वज्य ततो वाक्यं समाददे || ६-११९-१२_END
BEGIN_
Then the king Dasaratha the lord who was sitting in the aerial car, in an excellent
seat, was filled with excessive delight to see his son (Rama), who was dearer to him than life.
Placing him in his lap and embracing him in his arms, he thereupon commenced his speech as
follows:_END

B_6_C_119_9
BEGIN_
न मे स्वर्गो बहुमतः संमानश्च सुरर्षिभिः |
त्वया राम विहीनस्य सत्यं प्रतिशृणोमि ते || ६-११९-१३_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama! Separated from you, the heaven is not a liking to me, nor the respect given
to me by the foremost of celestials. I am telling you the truth."_END

B_6_C_119_10
BEGIN_
अद्य त्वां निहतामित्रं दृष्ट्वा संपूर्णमानसम् |
निस्तीर्णवनवासं च प्रीतिरासीत्परा मम| ६-११९-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Today, there is a great joy for me, for having seen you, fully satisfied in your
mind, now that your enemies have been destroyed and you have fully gone through the period of
exile."_END

B_6_C_119_11
BEGIN_
कैकेय्या यानि चोक्तानि वाक्यानि वदतां वर |
तव प्रव्राजनार्थानि स्थितानि हृदये मम || ६-११९-१५_END
BEGIN_
"O excellent among the eloquent! The words, which were uttered by Kaikeyi, with an
aim to send you into exile, are still imprinted in my heart."_END

B_6_C_119_12
BEGIN_
त्वां तु दृष्ट्वा कुशलिनं परिष्वज्य सलक्ष्मणम् |
अद्य दुःखाद्विमुक्तोअस्मि नीहारादिव भास्करः || ६-११९-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing you in a fine fettle with Lakshmana and hugging you today, I stand
completely rid of sorrow - even as the sun is freed from mist."_END

B_6_C_119_13
BEGIN_
तारितोअहं त्वया पुत्र सुपुत्रेण महात्मना |
अष्टावक्रेण धर्मात्मा तारितो ब्राह्मणो यथा || ६-११९-१७_END
BEGIN_
"O great-souled son! I have been redeemed by you, my worthy son, even as Kahola a
brahmana was redeemed by Ashtavakra."_END

B_6_C_119_14
BEGIN_
इदानीं च विजानामि यथा सौम्य सुरेश्वरैः |
वधार्थं रावणस्येह विहितं पुरुषोत्तमम् || ६-११९-१८_END
BEGIN_
"O gently one! I recognize you now to be the Supreme person, duly enjoined here by
the rulers of gods, for the destruction of Ravana."_END

B_6_C_119_15
BEGIN_
सिद्धार्था खलु कौसल्या या त्वां राम गृहं गतम् |
वनान्निवृत्तं संहृष्टा द्रक्ष्यते शत्रुसूदन || ६-११९-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Blessed indeed is Kausalya, who will see you, the destroyer of your enemies,
returned home from the forest."_END

B_6_C_119_16
BEGIN_
सिद्धार्थाः खलु ते राम नरा ये त्वां पुरीं गतम् |
राज्ये चैवाभिषिक्तं च द्रक्ष्यन्ति वसुधाधिपम् || ६-११९-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Blessed indeed are those men, who will see you returned to the City of Ayodhya and
consecrated on the throne as a lord of the earth."_END

B_6_C_119_17
BEGIN_
अनुरक्तेन बलिना शुचिना धर्मचारिणा |
इच्छेयं त्वामहं द्रष्टुं भरतेन समागतम् || ६-११९-२१_END
BEGIN_
"I desire to see you, re-united with the mighty Bharata, who is affectionate towards
you, honest and virtuous."_END

B_6_C_119_18
BEGIN_
चतुर्दशसमाः सौम्य वने निर्यापितास्त्वया |
वसता सीतया सार्धं लक्ष्मणेन च धीमता || ६-११९-२२_END
BEGIN_
"O gentle one! You spent fourteen years, residing in the forest with Lakshmana and
Seetha."_END

B_6_C_119_19
BEGIN_
निवृत्तवनवासोअसि प्रतिज्ञा सफला कृता |
रावणं च रणे हत्वा देवास्ते परितोषिताः || ६-११९-२३_END
BEGIN_
"You completed the term of your exile. My pledge was implemented by you. The
celestials too have been fully gratified, by your killing of Ravana in battle."_END

B_6_C_119_20
BEGIN_
कृतं कर्म यशः श्लाघ्यं प्राप्तं ते शत्रुसूदन |
भ्रातृभिः सह राज्यस्थो दीर्घमायुरवाप्नुहि || ६-११९-२४_END
BEGIN_
"O the destroyer of enemies! A laudable act has been done and glory has been earned
by you. Getting consecrated on the throne, may you attain a long life, along with your
brothers."_END

B_6_C_119_21
BEGIN_
इति ब्रुवाणं राजानं रामः प्राञ्जलिरब्रवीत् |
कुरु प्रसादं धर्मज्ञ कैकेय्या भरतस्य च || ६-११९-२५_END
BEGIN_
To Dasaratha, who was thus speaking, Rama with joined palms in salutation, submitted
(as follows): "Be gracious to Kaikeyi and Bharata, O the knower of virtues!"_END

B_6_C_119_22
BEGIN_
सपुत्रां त्वां त्यजामीति यदुक्ता कैकयी त्वया |
स शापः कैकयीं घोरः सपुत्रां न स्पृशेत्प्रभो || ६-११९-२६_END
BEGIN_
You will remember those words spoken by you saying, I disown you, with your son
(Bharata)'. May that terrific curse not touch Kaikeyi and her son, O Lord!"_END

B_6_C_119_23
BEGIN_
तथेति महाराजो राममुक्त्वा कृताञ्जलिम् |
लक्ष्मणं च परिष्वज्य पुनर्वाक्यमुवाच ह || ६-११९-२७_END
BEGIN_
Saying 'May it be" to Rama who stood with joined palms embraced Lakshmana. Dasaratha
again uttered the following words to Lakshmana:_END

B_6_C_119_24
BEGIN_
रामं शुश्रूषता भक्त्या वैदेह्या सह सीतया |
कृता मम महाप्रीतिः प्राप्तं धर्मफलं च ते || ६-११९-२८_END
BEGIN_
"A great gratification has been rendered to me and reward in the form of religious
merit earned by you in that you served Rama and Seetha, the princess of Videha kingdom, with
devotion."_END

B_6_C_119_25
BEGIN_
धर्मं प्राप्स्यसि धर्मज्ञ यशश्च विपुलं भुवि |
रामे प्रसन्ने स्वर्गं च महिमानं तथैव च || ६-११९-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Rama, being pleased with you, you will attain religious merit and extensive glory
on earth, as also heaven and excellent power O knower of righteousness!"_END

B_6_C_119_26
BEGIN_
रामं शुश्रूष भद्रं ते सुमित्रानन्दवर्धन |
रामः सर्वस्य लोकस्य शुभेष्वभिरतः सदा || ६-११९-३०_END
BEGIN_
"Happiness to you, O the augmentor of the joy of Sumitra, your mother! Serve Rama
well. Rama forever is intent on advancing the interests of the entire world."_END

B_6_C_119_27
BEGIN_
एते सेन्द्रास्त्रयो लोकाः सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः |
अभिगम्य महात्मानमर्चन्ति पुरुषोत्तमम् || ६-११९-३१_END
BEGIN_
"These three worlds, including Indra Siddhas (a class of demi-gods) and great sages
pay homage to the great-souled Rama as a Supreme person, on approaching him."_END

B_6_C_119_28
BEGIN_
एतत्तदुक्तमव्यक्तमक्षरं ब्रह्मनिर्मितम् |
देवानां हृदयं सौम्य गुह्यं रामः परन्तपः || ६-११९-३२_END
BEGIN_
"O great one! O the destroyer of adversaries! Rama has been spoken of as the
unmanifest and the imperishable Brahama (the absolute), established by the Vedas, the heart of gods
and the secret of all gods."_END

B_6_C_119_29
BEGIN_
अवाप्तं धर्मचरणं यशश्च विपुलं त्वया |
एनं शुश्रूषता भक्त्या वैदेह्या सह सीतया || ६-११९-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Having served him, along with Seetha with devotion, you obtained the reward of the
practice of all virtues as also celebrity, abundantly."_END

B_6_C_119_30
BEGIN_
इत्युक्त्वा लक्ष्मणं राजा स्नुषां बद्धाञ्जलिं स्थिताम् |
पुत्रीत्याभाष्य मधुरं शनैरेनामुवाच ह || ६-११९-३४_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking to Lakshmana, the (former) king, addressing his daughter-in-law
standing before him with joined palms as "My daughter", slowly and affectionately advised her as
follows:_END

B_6_C_119_31
BEGIN_
कर्तव्यो न तु वैदेहि मन्युस्त्यागमिमं प्रति |
रामेण त्वद्विशुद्ध्यर्थं कृतमेतद्धितैषिणा || ६-११९-३५_END
BEGIN_
"No wrath indeed should be rendered by you towards Rama, for having repudiated you.
This has been done by him, wishing for your welfare and in order to demostrate your purity."_END

B_6_C_119_32
BEGIN_
सुदुष्करमिदं पुत्रि तव चारित्रलक्षणम् |
कृतं यत्तेऽन्यनारीणां यशो ह्यभिभविष्यति| ६-११९-३६_END
BEGIN_
"This act (of entering into fire) which has been done by you and which reveals your
true character, my daughter, is the most difficult task to perform for other ladies and will
overshadow their illustriousness."_END

B_6_C_119_33
BEGIN_
न त्वं सुभ्रु समाधेया पतिशुश्रूवणं प्रति |
अवश्यं तु मया वाच्यमेष ते दैवतं परम् || ६-११९-३७_END
BEGIN_
"You need not be instructed about the matter of rendering service to your husband.
But, it is to be told certainly by me. He is your supreme deity."_END

B_6_C_119_34
BEGIN_
इति प्रतिसमादिश्य पुत्रौ सीतां तथा स्नुषाम् |
इन्द्रलोकं विमानेन ययौ दशरथो ज्वलन् || ६-११९-३८_END
BEGIN_
Having instructed thus to his sons and Seetha, the King Dasaratha who was born in
Raghu dynasty went to the abode of Indra, the lord of celestials, by an aerial car._END

B_6_C_119_35
BEGIN_
विमानमास्थाय महानुभावः |
श्रिया च संहृष्टतनुर्नृपोत्तमः |
आमन्त्य्र पुत्रौ सह सीतया च |
जगाम देवप्रवरस्य लोकम्| ६-११९-३९_END
BEGIN_
With a satisfied self, Dasaratha the excellent king of noble-mindedness endowed with
splendour, taking leave of his sons and Seetha and mounting the aerial car, went to the abode of
Indra, the chief of gods._END

B_6_C_120_0
BEGIN_
प्रतिप्रयाते काकुत्थ्से महेन्द्रः पाकशासनः |
अब्रवीत् परमप्रीतो राघवं प्राञ्जलिं स्थितम् || ६-१२०-१_END
BEGIN_
When Dasaratha returned, the Lord Indra, the destroyer of Paka the demon, was very
much pleased and spoke to Rama, who stood there with his oined palms._END

B_6_C_120_1
BEGIN_
अमोघं दर्शनं राम तवास्माकं नरर्षभ |
प्रीतियुक्ताः स्म तेन त्वं ब्रूहि यन्मनसेप्सितम् || ६-१२०-२_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama, the foremost among men! Your sight of us, should not go in vain. Therefore,
tell us whatever is desired by you."_END

B_6_C_120_2
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तो महेन्द्रेण प्रसन्नेन महात्मना |
सुप्रसन्नमना हृष्टो वचनम् प्राह राघवः || ६-१२०-३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of the great souled Indra the lord of celestials, after having
been pleased, Rama with the most placid mind spoke the following words with rejoice:_END

B_6_C_120_3
BEGIN_
यदि प्रीतिः समुत्पन्ना मयि ते विबुधेश्वर |
वक्ष्यामि कुरु मे सत्यम् वचनं वदतां वर || ६-१२०-४_END
BEGIN_
"O the foremst among the eloquent! O Indra! If you have affection in me, I shall
speak out my words. Make my words real."_END

B_6_C_120_4
BEGIN_
मम हेतोः पराक्रान्ता ये गता यमसादनम् |
ते सर्वे जीवितं प्राप्य समुत्तिष्ठन्तु वानराः || ६-१२०-५_END
BEGIN_
"Let all the monkeys, who reached the abode of death, after displaying their
energyfor_END

B_6_C_120_5
BEGIN_
मत्कृते विप्रयुक्ता ये पुत्रैर्दारैश्च वानराः |
तान् प्रीतमनसः सर्वान् द्रष्टुमिच्छामि मानद || ६-१२०-६_END
BEGIN_
"O the bestower of honour! I wish to see all those monkeys, who for my sake, were
removed from their sons and wives, be delighted at heart."_END

B_6_C_120_6
BEGIN_
विक्रान्ताश्चापि शूराश्च न मृत्युं गणयन्ति च |
कृतयत्ना विपन्नाश्च जीवयैनान् पुरंदर || ६-१२०-७_END
BEGIN_
"They were all valiant, proving their energies and did not take their death into
account. They made their strenuous efforts and died. O Indra! Restore their lives to them."_END

B_6_C_120_7
BEGIN_
मत्प्रियेष्वभिरक्ताश्च न मृत्युं गणयन्ति ये |
त्वत्प्रसादात्समेयुस्ते वरमेतमहं वृणे || ६-१२०-८_END
BEGIN_
"Those mokeys - who coutned death as nothing and who were fond of doing favour to me
- let them get re-united with their near and dear ones by your grace. I seek this boon of you."_END

B_6_C_120_8
BEGIN_
नीरुजो निर्व्रणांश्चैव संपन्नबलपौरुषान् |
गोलाङ्गूलांस्तथर्क्षांश्च द्रष्टुमिच्छामि मानद || ६-१२०-९_END
BEGIN_
"O bestower of honour! I wish to see the monkeys and bears, free from wounds and
pains, with augmented strength and valour."_END

B_6_C_120_9
BEGIN_
अकाले चापि पुष्पाणि मूलानि च फलानि च |
नद्यश्च विमलास्तत्र तिष्ठेयुर्यत्र वानराः || ६-१२०-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Wherever the aforesaid monkeys live, let there be rivers with crystal-clear water,
flowers, roots and fruits even in an off-season."_END

B_6_C_120_10
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा तु वचनं तस्य राघवस्य महात्मनः |
महेन्द्रह् प्रत्युवाचेदं वचनं प्रीतिसंयुतम् || ६-१२०-११_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of that great-souled Rama, Indra the lord of celestials endowed as
he was with delight, again spoke the following words:_END

B_6_C_120_11
BEGIN_
महानयं वरस्तात यस्त्वयोक्तो रघुत्तम |
द्विर्मया नोक्तपुर्वं च तस्मादेवद्भविष्यति || ६-१२०-१२_END
BEGIN_
"O beloved Rama! This boon, which has been sought by you is hard to grant. No offer
has, however, been revised by me in the past. Therefore this will come to be."_END

B_6_C_120_12
BEGIN_
समुत्तिष्ठन्तु ते सर्वे हता ये युधि राक्षसैः |
ऋक्षाश्च सह गोपुच्छैर्निकृत्ताननबाहवः || ६-१२०-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Let all those monkeys and bears along with long-tailed monkeys, who have been
killed in battle, by the demons and whose heads and arms have been severed, be alive and active
again."_END

B_6_C_120_13
BEGIN_
नीरुजो निर्व्रिणाश्चव संपन्नबलपौरुषाः |
समुत्थास्यन्ति हरयः सुप्ता निद्राक्षये यथा || ६-१२०-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Without any ill-health andwounds and with boosted strength and valour, the monkeys
will srise again, as those fallen asleep would do at the end of their sleep."_END

B_6_C_120_14
BEGIN_
सुहृद्भिर्बान्धवैश्चव ज्ञातिभिः स्वजनेन च |
सर्व एव समेष्यन्ति संयुक्ताः परया मुदा || ६-१२०-१५_END
BEGIN_
"All of them, full of delight, will get re-united with their friends, relatives,
kinsmen and family members."_END

B_6_C_120_15
BEGIN_
अकाले पुष्पशबलाः फलवन्तश्च पादपाः |
भविष्यन्ति महेष्वास नद्यश्च नलिलायुताः || ६-१२०-१६_END
BEGIN_
"O the wielder of a great bow! The trees will look colourful with flowers and fruits
even in the off-season. Rivers too will remain constantly with water."_END

B_6_C_120_16
BEGIN_
सव्रणैः प्रथमं गात्रैरिदानीं निर्व्रणैः समैः |
ततः समुत्थिताः सर्वे सुप्त्वेव हरियूथपाः || ६-१२०-१७
बभूवुर्वानराः सर्वे किं न्वेतदिति विस्मिताः |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, all those monkey-warriors got up, as if from a sleep, with all their
limbs completely healed of wounds. All the monkeys felt surprised, saying to one another "What
miracle is this?"_END

B_6_C_120_17
BEGIN_
काकुत्थ्सं परिपूर्णार्थं दृष्ट्वा सर्वे सुरोत्तमाः || ६-१२०-१८
अब्रुवन् परमप्रीताः स्तुत्वा रामं सलक्ष्मणम् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Rama, whose wish has been fully realised, all the foremost of celestials,
with a great delight, spoke praisingly to Rama and Lakshmana:_END

B_6_C_120_18
BEGIN_
गच्छायोध्यामितो राजन् विसर्जय च वानरान् || ६-१२०-१९
मैथिलीं सान्त्वयस्वैनामनुरक्तां यशस्विनीम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O monarch! Proceed to Ayodhya from here and disband the monkeys. Reassure this
illustrious and devoted Seetha."_END

B_6_C_120_19
BEGIN_
भ्रातरं भरतं पश्य त्वच्छोकाद्व्रतचारिणम् || ६-१२०-२०
शत्रुघ्नं च महात्मानं मातृइः सर्वाः परंतप |
अभिषेचय चात्मानम् पौरान्गत्वा प्रहर्षय || ६-१२०-२१_END
BEGIN_
"O destroyer of adversaries! See Bharata, your brother, who is practising
austerities through grief caused by separation from you, the great-souled Shatrughna and all your
mohters. Get yourself consecrated on the throne. Bring rejoice to the citizens, by going
there."_END

B_6_C_120_20
BEGIN_
एवमुक्त्वा सहस्राक्षो रामं सौमित्रिणा सह |
विमानैः सूर्यसंकाशैर्ययौ हृष्टः सुरैह् सह || ६-१२०-२२_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking to Rama and Lakshmana, Idnra the thousand-eyed god of celestials,
having beenpleased, returned to heaven with other gods in their aerial cars, shining liek the
sun._END

B_6_C_120_21
BEGIN_
अभिवाद्य च काकुत्थ्सः सर्वांस्तांस्त्रिदशोत्तमान् |
लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा वासमाज्ञापयत्तदा || ६-१२०-२३_END
BEGIN_
having respectfully saluted all those celestials, Rama along with Lakshmana his
brother, then instructed all the monkeys to take rest in their respective places._END

B_6_C_120_22
BEGIN_
ततस्तु सा लक्ष्मणरानुपालिता |
महाचमूर्हृष्टजना यशस्विनी |
श्रिया ज्वलन्तीविरराज सर्वतो |
निशा प्रणीतेव हि शीतरश्मिना || ६-१२०-२४_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, that illustrious and mighty army of rejoiced troops, for its part, whichw
as protected by Lakshmana and Rama, and was blazing with splendour on all sides, shone brightly
like the might, illumined by the moon._END

B_6_C_121_0
BEGIN_
तां रात्रिमुषितं रामं सुखोदितमरिंदमम् |
अब्रवीत् प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं जयम् पृष्ट्वा विभीषणः || ६-१२१-१_END
BEGIN_
Vibhishana, wishing victory to Rama, (the destroyer of adversaries) who having
reposed during the previous night and had risen fresh, spoke to him with joined palms, the
following words:_END

B_6_C_121_1
BEGIN_
स्नानानि चाङ्गारागाणि वस्त्राण्याभरणानि च |
चन्दनानि च माल्यानि दिव्यानि विविधानि च || ६-१२१-२
अलंकारविदश्चैता नार्यः पद्मनिभेक्षणाः |
उपस्थितास्त्वां विधिवत् स्नापयिष्यन्ति राघव || ६-१२१-३_END
BEGIN_
"These women with lotus-like eyes, who are skilled in the art of decoration, came
with bathing accessories like garments, ornaments, sandal-pastes and beautiful garlands of various
kinds. They will assist you in bathing O Rama!"_END

B_6_C_121_2
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तस्तु काकुत्स्थः प्रत्युवाच विभीषणम् |
हरीन् सुग्रीवमुख्यांस्त्वं स्नानेनोपनिमन्त्रय || ६-१२१-४_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Vibhishana, Rama replied as follows: "You invite the monkeys
headed by Sugreeva for the bath."_END

B_6_C_121_3
BEGIN_
सत् उ ताम्यति धर्मात्मा मम हेतोः सुखोचितः |
सुकुमारो महाबाहुर्भरतः सत्यसंस्रयः || ६-१२१-५_END
BEGIN_
"That Bharata, the virtuous man, who was accustomed to comfort, a delicate youth,
the great-armed and the one consistent with the truth is suffering on my account."_END

B_6_C_121_4
BEGIN_
तं विना कैकयीपुत्रम् भरतं धर्मचारिणम् |
न मे स्नानं बहुमतं वस्त्राण्यानि च || ६-१२१-६_END
BEGIN_
In the absence of Bharata, the son of Kaikeyi, who is practicing virtue, ritual
bathing, garments and jewels are not to my liking."_END

B_6_C_121_5
BEGIN_
एतत् पश्य यथा क्षिप्रं प्रतिगच्छाम ताम् पुरीम् |
अयोध्याम् गच्छतो ह्येष पन्थाह् परमदुर्गमः || ६-१२१-७_END
BEGIN_
"See how we may return to that City of Ayodhya soon. It is indeed very difficult to
travel over this path to reach Ayodhya City, so soon."_END

B_6_C_121_6
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तस्तु काकुत्स्थं प्रत्युवाच विभीषणः |
अह्ना त्वां प्रापयिष्यामि ताम् पुरीं पार्थिवात्मज || ६-१२१-८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Rama, Vibhishana replied : "O prince! I will get you t that
City in a day."_END

B_6_C_121_7
BEGIN_
पुष्पकं नाम भद्रं ते विमानं सूर्यसम्निभम् |
मम भ्रातुः कुबेरस्य रावणेन बलीयसा || ६-१२१-९
हृतं निर्जित्य सम्ग्रामे कामगं दिव्यमुत्तमम् |
त्वदर्थं पालितं चेदं तिष्ठत्यतुलविक्रम || ६-१२१-१०_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama of unequalled prowess! The aerial car shining like the sun, which moves as
one pleases, wonderful and excellent, named Pushpaka of Kubera my brother was robbed by the mighty
Ravana after conquering Kubera in battle. May prosperity attend you! It is retained there for your
sake."_END

B_6_C_121_8
BEGIN_
तदिदं मेघसंकाशं विमानमिह तिष्ठति |
येन यास्यसि यानेन त्वमयोध्यां गतज्वरः || ६-१२१-११_END
BEGIN_
"The yonder aerial car, looking like a cloud, stands here and by which transport,
you can reach Ayodhya without any trouble."_END

B_6_C_121_9
BEGIN_
अहम् ते यद्यनुग्राह्यो यदि स्मरसि मे गुणान् |
वस तावदिह प्राज्ञ यद्यस्ति मयि सौहृदम् || ६-१२१-१२_END
BEGIN_
"O sagacious prince! If I deserve to be treated with kindness by you, if you think
of any virtue in me and if you think of any virtue in me and if you have any affection in me, stay
here for some more time."_END

B_6_C_121_10
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा वैदेह्या भार्यया सह |
अर्चितह् सर्वकामैस्त्वं ततो राम गमिष्यसि || ६-१२१-१३_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama! When you have been offered with reference all the entertainments, you along
with Lakshmana, your brother and Seetha your consort, shall then depart."_END

B_6_C_121_11
BEGIN_
प्रीतियुक्तस्य विहितां ससैन्यः ससुहृद्गणः |
सत्क्रियां राम मे तावद्गृहाण त्वं मयोद्यताम् || ६-१२१-१४_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama! In the meantime, accept you, with your entire army and assemblage of
friends, my hospitality which has been fixed and arranged by me, full of affection as I am."_END

B_6_C_121_12
BEGIN_
प्रणयाद्बहुमानाच्च सौहार्देन च राघव |
प्रसादयामि प्रेष्योऽहं न खल्वाज्ञापयामि ते || ६-१२१-१५_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama! I entreat you with affection, respect and friendship I am your servant. I
am not in any way commanding you to do so."_END

B_6_C_121_13
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तस्ततो रामह् प्रत्युवाच विभीषणम् |
रक्षसां वानराणां च सर्वेषमेव शृण्वताम् || ६-१२१-१६_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words, Rama replied to Vibhishana as follows, while all the demons and
the monkeys present there, listened:_END

B_6_C_121_14
BEGIN_
पूजितोऽस्मि त्वया वीर साचिव्येन परंतप |
सर्वत्मना च चेष्टाभिः सौहार्देन परेण च || ६-१२१-१७_END
BEGIN_
"O destroyer of enemies! O hero! I stand honoured by you by your valued counsel,
your efforts put forth with your whole soul and more so by your friendship._END

B_6_C_121_15
BEGIN_
न खल्वेतन्न कुर्याम् ते वचनं राक्षसेश्वर |
तं तु मे भ्रातरं द्रष्टुम् भरतं त्वरते मनः || ६-१२१-१८_END
BEGIN_
"O king of demons! It is not that I am not carrying out your words. But, my heart is
hastening to see that Bharata, my brother."_END

B_6_C_121_16
BEGIN_
मां निवर्तयितुं योऽसौ चित्रकूटमुपागतः |
शिरसा याचतो यस्य वचनम् न कृतं मया || ६-१२१-१९
कौसल्यां च सुमित्राम् च कैकेयीं च यशस्विनीम् |
गुहम् च सुहृदं चैव पौरान् जनपदैः सह || ६-१२१-२०_END
BEGIN_
"My heart is hastening to see that Bharata, who came all the way to Mount Chitrakuta
to take me back to Ayodhya, yet whose appeal was not executed by me, even though he requested me
with his head bent low and Kausalya my mother as also Sumitra and the illustrious Kaikeyi (my
step-mothers) as also Guha my friend, as well as the citizens of Ayodhya and the inhabitants of the
country-side."_END

B_6_C_121_17
BEGIN_
अनुजानीहि मां सौम्य पूजितोऽस्मि विभीषण |
मन्युर्न खलु कर्तव्यः सखे त्वां चानुमानये || ६-१२१-२१_END
BEGIN_
"O gentle Vibhishana! Allow me to go. I am honoured. O friend! You need not be
disappointed, I entreat you."_END

B_6_C_121_18
BEGIN_
उपस्थापय मे शीघ्रं विमानं राक्षसेश्वर |
कृतकार्यस्य मे वासह् कथम् स्यादिह संमतः || ६-१२१-२२_END
BEGIN_
"O the king of demons! Fetch the aerial car immediately. How is it advisable for my
continued stay here, now that my task has been accomplished?"_END

B_6_C_121_19
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण राक्षसेन्द्रो विभीषनः |
विमानं सूर्यसम्काशमाजुहाव त्वरान्वितः || ६-१२१-२३
ततः काञ्चत्राङ्गं वैदूर्यमणिवेदिकम् |
काञ्चनं काञ्चनैर्हर्म्यैर्हेमपद्मविभूषितैः || ६-१२१-२४
पाण्डुराभिह् पताकाभिर्ध्वजैश्च समलंकृतम् |
काञ्चनं काञ्चनैर्हर्म्यैर्हेमपद्मविब्बूषितैः || ६-१२१-२५
प्रकीर्णं किङ्किणीजालैर्मुक्तामणिगवाक्षकम् |
घण्टाजालैः परिक्षिप्तम् सर्वतो मधुरस्वनम् || ६-१२१-२६
तं मेरुशिखराकारं निर्मितम् विश्वकर्मणा |
बृहद्बिर्भूषितं हर्म्योर्मुक्तारजतशोभितैः || ६-१२१-२७
तलैह् स्फटिकचित्राङ्गर्वैदूर्यैश्च वरासनैः |
महार्हस्तरणोपेतैरुपपन्नं महाधनैः || ६-१२१-२८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Rama, Vibhishana the king of demons then hastily invoked the
presence of that aerial car shining like the sun, with colourful parts made of gold, with the
platform made of cat's-eye gems, which was full of attics, shone like silver on all sides,
decorated well with white flags and flag-staff, decked with gold and golden lotuses, graced with
golden mansions, hung all over with networks of tiny bells, giving forth a melodious sound on all
sides, resembling a summit of Mount Meru, built by Vishvakarma, which was graced with stately
palaces decked with pearls and silver, provided with pavements inlaid with crystal, furnished with
excellent seats of cat's eye gems of great value and upholstered with highly valuable
coverings._END

B_6_C_121_20
BEGIN_
उपस्थितमनाधृष्यं तद्विमानं मनोजवम् |
निवेदयित्वा रामायतस्थौ तत्र विभीषणः || ६-१२१-२९_END
BEGIN_
Informing Rama that the said aerial car which could not be assailed and was as swift
as though- had arrived, Vibhishana stood there._END

B_6_C_121_21
BEGIN_
तत्पुष्पकम् कामगमं विमान |
मुपस्थितम् भूधरसंनिकाशम् |
दृष्ट्वा तदा विस्मयमाजगाम |
रामः ससौमित्रिरुदारस्त्त्वः || ६-१२१-३०_END
BEGIN_
The generous minded Rama along with Lakshmana felt amazed to see the aforesaid
aerial car, Pushpaka, which resembled a mountain and which could travel everywhere at will, arrived
on that occasion._END

B_6_C_122_0
BEGIN_
उपस्थितम् तु तं कृत्वा पुष्पकं पुष्पभूषितम् |
अविदूरे स्थितो राममित्युवाच विभीषणः || ६-१२२-१_END
BEGIN_
Keeping ready Pushpaka the aerial car decorated with flowers, Vibhishana, for his
part, standing not very far, spoke to Rama (as follows):_END

B_6_C_122_1
BEGIN_
स तु बद्धाञ्जलिपुटो विनीतो राक्षसेश्वरः |
अब्रवीत्त्वरयोपेतः किं करोमीति राघवम् || ६-१२२-२_END
BEGIN_
"What more can I do?" thus spoke with haste, Vibhishana endowed as he was with
modesty and with joined palms, to Rama._END

B_6_C_122_2
BEGIN_
तमब्रवीन्महातेजा लक्ष्मणस्योपशृण्वतः |
विमृश्य राघवो वाचमिदं स्नेहपुरस्कृतम् || ६-१२२-३_END
BEGIN_
After some circumspection, Rama of great splendor, affectionately spoke the
following words to him, while Lakshmana was listening:_END

B_6_C_122_3
BEGIN_
कृतप्रयत्नकर्माणः सर्व एव वनेचराः |
रत्नैरर्थैश्च विविधैः संपूज्यन्तां विभीषण || ६-१२२-४_END
BEGIN_
"Let all these monkeys and bears (ie. Denizens of forests), who performed tasks of
exertion, be honoured with tasks of exertion, be honoured with precious stones and riches of
various kinds, O Vibhishana!"_END

B_6_C_122_4
BEGIN_
सहामीभिस्त्वया लङ्का निर्जिता राक्षसेश्वर |
हृष्टैः प्राणभयं त्यक्त्वा संग्रामेष्वनिवर्तिभिः || ६-१२२-५_END
BEGIN_
"O Vibhishana the king of demons! Lanka has conquered by you, in collaboration with
these monkeys, who never turned their backs in battles and fought joyfully, ignoring all risk to
their lives."_END

B_6_C_122_5
BEGIN_
त इमे कृतकर्माणः सर्व एव वनौकसः |
धनरत्नप्रदानेन कर्मैषां सफलं कुरु || ६-१२२-६_END
BEGIN_
"All these monkeys, without exceptions, have accomplished their task. Reward their
achievement with gifts of gold and precious stones."_END

B_6_C_122_6
BEGIN_
एवम् संमानिताश्चैते नन्द्यमाना यथा त्वया |
भविष्यन्ति कृतज्ञेन निर्विऋता हरियूथपाः || ६-१२२-७_END
BEGIN_
"Highly honoured in this way any duly cheered by you, acknowledging their services,
the chiefs of monkey-troops, will feel happy."_END

B_6_C_122_7
BEGIN_
त्यागिनं संग्रहीतारं सानुक्रोशं जितेन्द्रियम् |
सर्वे त्वामभिगच्छन्ति ततः संबोधयामि ते || ६-१२२-८_END
BEGIN_
"All will come nearer to you, for having possessed this quality of generosity, for
propitiating them, for showing compassion to them and for having subjugated your senses. Hence, I
am reminding you."_END

B_6_C_122_8
BEGIN_
हीनं रतिगुणैः सर्वैरभिहन्तारमाहवे |
सेना त्यजति संविग्ना नृपतिं तं नरेश्वर || ६-१२२-९_END
BEGIN_
"O king! Feeling agitated, the army deserts that king, who is bereft of all loving
qualities and who merely orders them to kill people in battle."_END

B_6_C_122_9
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण वानरांस्तान्विभीषणः |
रत्नार्थसंविभागेन सर्वानेवाभ्यपूजयत् || ६-१२२-१०_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Rama, Vibhishana honoured all those monkeys, by dispersing
precious stones and gold to them._END

B_6_C_122_10
BEGIN_
ततस्तान् पूजितान् दृष्ट्वा रत्नार्थैर्हरियूथपान् |
आरुरोह तदा रामस्तद्विमानमनुत्तमम् || ६-१२२-११_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, having seen on that occasion all those commanders of monkey-troops
honoured with precious stones and gold, Rama then mounted that excellent aerial car._END

B_6_C_122_11
BEGIN_
अङ्केनादाय वैदेहीं लज्जमानां यशस्विनीम् |
लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा विक्रान्तेन धनुष्मता || ६-१२२-१२_END
BEGIN_
He mounted the aerial car along with Lakshmana, his valiant brother wielding a bow
and taking the illustrious Seetha, who was feeling abashed, in his arms._END

B_6_C_122_12
BEGIN_
अब्रवीत्स विमानस्थः पूजयन् सर्ववानरान् |
सुग्रीवं च महावीर्यम् काकुत्स्तः सविभीषणम् || ६-१२२-१३_END
BEGIN_
Bestowing attention on all the monkeys as well as Vibhishana and the mighty
Sugreeva, Rama remaining in the aerial car, spoke (as follows):_END

B_6_C_122_13
BEGIN_
मित्रकार्यम् कृतमिदं भवद्भिद्वानरर्षभाः |
अनुज्ञाता मया सर्वे यथेष्टम् प्रतिगच्छत || ६-१२२-१४_END
BEGIN_
"O the foremost of monkeys! This work of a friend has been accomplished by you.
Permitted by me, all of you can go, where you will."_END

B_6_C_122_14
BEGIN_
यत्तु कार्यं वयस्येन स्निग्धेन च हितेन च |
कृतं सुग्रीव तत्सर्वं भवता धर्मभीरुणा || ६-१२२-१५
किष्किन्धां प्रतियाह्यशु स्वसैन्येनाभिसंवृतः |_END
BEGIN_
"O Sugreeva! All that which ought to be done by an affectionate and service-minded
friend, has been done for your part by you, trembling alive as you are to righteousness.
Accompanied by your army, proceed to Kishkindha at once."_END

B_6_C_122_15
BEGIN_
स्वराज्ये वस लङ्कायां मया दत्ते विभीषण || ६-१२२-१६
न त्वां धर्षयितुं शक्ताः सेन्द्रा अपि दिवौकसः |_END
BEGIN_
"O Vibhishana! Settle down in your kingdom at Lanka, conferred by me. Even the
celestials including Indra shall not be able to attack you."_END

B_6_C_122_16
BEGIN_
अयोध्यां प्रतियास्यामि राजधानीं पितुर्मम || ६-१२२-१७
अभ्यनुज्ञातुमिच्छमि सर्वानामन्त्रयामि वः |_END
BEGIN_
" I am going to Ayodhya, the seat of government of my father. I bid adieu to you and
wish to take leave of you all."_END

B_6_C_122_17
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तास्तु रामेण हरीन्द्रा हरयस्तथा || ६-१२२-१८
ऊचुः प्राञ्जलयः सर्वे राक्षसश्च विभीषणः |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Rama, the monkey-chiefs, the monkeys, Vibhishana the demon and
all of them there, with their joined palms, spoke (as follows):_END

B_6_C_122_18
BEGIN_
अयोध्यां गन्तुमिच्छामः सर्वान् नयतु नो भवान् || ६-१२२-१९
मुद्युक्ता विचरिष्यामो वनान्युपननानि च |_END
BEGIN_
"We also wish to proceed to Ayodhya. You take all of us there we shall range the
gardens and groves there with rejoice."_END

B_6_C_122_19
BEGIN_
दृष्ट्वा त्वामभिषेकार्द्रं कौसल्यामभिवाद्य च || ६-१२२-२०
अचिरादागमिष्यामः स्वगृहान्नृपसत्तम |_END
BEGIN_
"O the excellent king! Seeing you, drench with ablution (in the coronation ceremony)
and offering our salutations to Kausalya, we shall return to our homes."_END

B_6_C_122_20
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तः स धर्मात्मा वानरैः सविभीषणैः || ६-१२२-२१
अब्रवीद्वानरान्रामः ससुग्रीवविभीषणान् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of the monkeys and Vibhishana, that pious-minded Rama spoke to
those monkeys, Sugreeva and Vibhishana as follows:_END

B_6_C_122_21
BEGIN_
प्रियाअत्प्रियतरं लब्धं यदहं ससुहृज्जनः || ६-१२२-२२
सर्वैर्भवद्भिः सहितः प्रीतिं लप्स्ये पुरीं गतः |_END
BEGIN_
"Something more dearer than everything dear will be achieved by me, if I reach
Ayodhya with the host of my friends along with all of you, for, I shall feel delighted."_END

B_6_C_122_22
BEGIN_
क्षिप्रमारोह सुग्रीव विमानं वानरैः सह || ६-१२२-२३
त्वमप्यारोह सामात्यो राक्षसेन्द्र विभीषण |_END
BEGIN_
"O Sugreeva! Mount the aerial cars quickly, along with the monkeys. O Vibhishana,
