the king of demons! You also ascend it, along with your counsellors."_END

B_6_C_122_23
BEGIN_
ततह् स पुष्पकं दिव्यं सुग्रीवः सह वानरैः || ६-१२२-२४
आरुरोह मुदा युक्तः समात्यश्च विभीषणः |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, that Sugreeva along with the monkeys gladly ascended that wonderful
Pushpaka, the aerial car. Vibhishana together with his counselors also ascended it._END

B_6_C_122_24
BEGIN_
तेष्वारूढेषु सर्वेषु कौबेरम् परमासनम् || ६-१२२-२५
राघवेणाभ्यनुज्ञातमुत्पपात विहायसम् |_END
BEGIN_
When all of them ascended, that excellent aerial car, belonging to Kubera, flew into
the sky, after having been duly authorized by Rama._END

B_6_C_122_25
BEGIN_
खगतेन मिवानेन हंसयुक्तेन भास्वता || ६-१२२-२६
प्रहृष्टश्चप्रतीतश्च बभौ रामः कुबेरवत् |_END
BEGIN_
Feeling greatly rejoiced and satisfied while travelling in that splendid aerial car,
which was now in the air and was provided with the image of a swan, Rama shone like Kubera._END

B_6_C_122_26
BEGIN_
ते सर्वे वानरर्क्षश्च राक्षसाश्च महाबलाः || ६-१२२-२७
यथासुखमसंबाधं दिव्ये तस्मिन्नुपाविशन् |_END
BEGIN_
All those mighty monkeys, bears and demons sat comfortably and spaciously in that
wonderful aerial car._END

B_6_C_123_0
BEGIN_
अनुज्ञातन् तु रामेण तद्विमानमनुत्तमम् |
उत्पपात महामेघः श्वसनेनोद्धतो यथा || ६-१२३-१_END
BEGIN_
As approved by Rama, that excellent aerial car, with images of swan painted on it,
flew into the sky, with a great sound._END

B_6_C_123_1
BEGIN_
पातयित्वा ततश्चक्षुः सर्वतो रघुनन्दनः |
अब्रवीन्मैथिलीन् सीतां रामः शशिनिभाननाम् || ६-१२३-२_END
BEGIN_
Casting his look on all sides, Rama, the delight of Raghu dynasty, then spoke to
Seetha, who had a moon-like face (as follows):_END

B_6_C_123_2
BEGIN_
कैलासशिखराकारे त्रिकूटशिखरे स्थिताम् |
लङ्कामीक्षस्व वैदेहि निर्मितान् विश्वकर्मणा || ६-१२३-३_END
BEGIN_
"O Seetha! Look at the City of Lanka, resting firmly on the mount of Trikuta,
looking like a peak of Mount Kailasa and built by Viswarakarma, the universal architect."_END

B_6_C_123_3
BEGIN_
एतदायोधनं पश्य मान्सशोणितकर्दमम् |
हरीणान् राक्षसानान् च सीते विशसनं महत् || ६-१२३-४_END
BEGIN_
"O Seetha! Look at this great battle-field, covered with a mud of flesh and blood as
also a cause for the death of monkeys and demons."_END

B_6_C_123_4
BEGIN_
अत्र दत्तवरः शेते प्रमाथी राक्षसेश्वरः |
तव हेतोर्विशालाक्षि रावणो निहतो मया || ६-१२३-५_END
BEGIN_
"O the large-eyed Seetha! Here lies Ravana, the king of demons, the tormentator of
people, on whom boons were conferred by Brahma and who was killed by me for your sake."_END

B_6_C_123_5
BEGIN_
कुम्भकर्णोअत्र निहतः प्रहस्तश्च निशाचरः |
धूम्राक्षश्चात्र निहतो वानरेण हनूमता || ६-१२३-६_END
BEGIN_
"Here, Kumbhakarna and Prahasta the demon were killed. Here, Dhumraksha was killed
by Hanuma, the monkey."_END

B_6_C_123_6
BEGIN_
विद्युन्माली हतश्चात्र सुषेणेन महात्मना |
लक्ष्मणेनेन्द्रजिच्चात्र रावणिर्निहतो रणे || ६-१२३-७_END
BEGIN_
"Here was Vidyunmali killed by the great-souled Sushena and here was Indrajit, the
son of Ravana, killed by Lakshmana in a combat."_END

B_6_C_123_7
BEGIN_
अङ्गदेनात्र निहतो विकटो नाम राक्षसः |
विरूपाक्षश्च दुष्प्रेक्ष्यो महापार्श्वमहोदरौ || ६-१२३-८
अकम्पनश्च निहतो बलिनोअन्ये च राक्षसाः |
त्रिशिराश्चातिकायश्च देवान्तकनरान्तकौ || ६-१२३-९_END
BEGIN_
"Here was killed a demon called Vikata by Angada. Virupaksha, who was disagreeable
to the sight, Mahaparsva, Mahodara, Akampana, Trishiras, Atikaya Devantaka, Narantaka and other
mighty demons were also killed here."_END

B_6_C_123_8
BEGIN_
युद्धोन्मत्तश्च मत्तश्च राक्षसप्रवरावुभौ |
निकुम्भश्चैव कुम्भश्च कुम्भकर्णात्मजौ बली || ६-१२३-१०
वज्रदंष्ट्रश्च दंष्ट्रश्च बहवो राक्षसा हताः |
मकराक्ष्च दुर्धर्षो मया युधि निपातितः || ६-१२३-११_END
BEGIN_
"Both Yuddonmatta and Matta, the foremost of demons, as also Nikumbha and Kumbha the
sons of Kumbhakarna, as also the strong Vajradamshtra, Damshtra and many demons were killed.
Makaraksha, the most difficult demon to be attacked, was struck down by me in this
battle-field."_END

B_6_C_123_9
BEGIN_
अकम्पनश्च निहतः शोणिताक्षश्च वीर्यवान् |
यूपाक्षश्च प्रजङ्घश्च निहतौ तु म्हाहवे || ६-१२३-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Akampana was killed in the great battle. The valiant Shonitaksha was also killed.
Yupaksa and Prajangha were killed."_END

B_6_C_123_10
BEGIN_
विद्युज्जिह्वोऽत्र निहतो राक्षसो भीमदर्शनः |
यज्ञशत्रुश्च निहतः सुप्तघ्नश्च महाबलः || ६-१२३-१३
सूर्यशत्रुश्च निहतो ब्रह्मशत्रुस्तथापरः |_END
BEGIN_
"Here, Vidyujjihva, the demon was a terrific appearance, was killed. Yajnashatru
also was killed. The mighty Suptaghna was killed. Surya shatru was killed and another demon called
Brahma shatru was too killed."_END

B_6_C_123_11
BEGIN_
अत्र मन्दोदरी नाम भार्या तं पर्यदेवयत् || ६-१२३-१४
सपत्नीनान् सहस्रेण सास्रेण परिवारिता |_END
BEGIN_
"Here, surrounded by more than a thousand fellow-wives, Ravana's wife named
Mandodari lamented for Ravana."_END

B_6_C_123_12
BEGIN_
एतत्तु दृश्यते तीर्थन् समुद्रस्य वरानने || ६-१२३-१५
यत्र सागरमुत्तीर्य तान् रात्रिमुषिता वयम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O Seetha, the lovely-faced one! Here is seen a water-descent of the ocean on the
sea-shore, where having crossed the ocean, we spent that night."_END

B_6_C_123_13
BEGIN_
एष सेतुर्मया बद्धः सागरे सलिलार्णवे || ६-१२३-१६
तवहेतोर्विशालाक्षि नलसेतुः सुदुष्करः |_END
BEGIN_
"O the large-eyed Seetha! Here is the bridge called Nala Setu, which was so
difficult to execute for others, got built by me over the salt-sea for your sake."_END

B_6_C_123_14
BEGIN_
पश्य सागरमक्षोभ्यन् वैदेहि वरुणालयम् || ६-१२३-१७
अपारमभिगर्जन्तन् शङ्खशुक्तिनिषेवितम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O Seetha! See this roaring imperturbable and seemingly boundless ocean, the
habitation of Varuna (the god of waters), which is teeming well with couches and
oyster-shells."_END

B_6_C_123_15
BEGIN_
हिरण्यनाभन् शैलेन्द्रन् काञ्चनं पश्य मैथिलि || ६-१२३-१८
विश्रमार्थन् हनुमतो भित्त्वा सागरमुत्थितम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O Seetha! See the golden mountain, Mainaka (the ruler of mountains) which rose
passing through the ocean, in order to provide rest and relaxation to Hanuma."_END

B_6_C_123_16
BEGIN_
एतत् कुक्षौ समुद्रस्य स्कन्धावारनिवेशनम् || ६-१२३-१९
अत्र पूर्वं महादेवः प्रसादमकरोत्प्रभुः |_END
BEGIN_
"See this island, located in the middle of the ocean, where my troops were
stationed. At this place, the lord Shiva (the supreme deity) formerly bestowed his grace on
me."_END

B_6_C_123_17
BEGIN_
एतत्तु दृश्यते तीर्थं सागरस्य महात्मनः || ६-१२३-२०
सेतुबन्ध इति ख्यातं त्रैलोक्येन च पूजितम् |
एतत्पवित्रं परमं महापातकनाशनम् || ६-१२३-२१
अत्र राक्षसराजोऽयमाजगाम विभीषणः |_END
BEGIN_
"Here is seen the water-descent of the gigantic ocean, called a Setubandha, adored
in all the three worlds. This is very much a sacred spot, capable of washing away major sins. At
this very place, Vibhishana the king of demons first came."_END

B_6_C_123_18
BEGIN_
एषा सा दृश्यते सीते किष्किन्धा चित्रकानना || ६-१२३-२२
सुग्रीवस्य पुरी रम्या यत्र वाली मया हतः |_END
BEGIN_
"O Seetha! Here is seen the beautiful City of Sugreeva, Kishkindha, which is full of
colourful groves, where Vali was killed by me."_END

B_6_C_123_19
BEGIN_
अथ दृष्ट्वा पुरीं सीता किष्किन्धां वालिपालिताम् || ६-१२३-२३
अब्रवीत्प्रश्रितं वाक्यं रामं प्रणयसाध्वसा |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the City of Kishkindha, which was earlier ruled by Vali, Seetha, who was
feeling timid through love, then spoke the following courteous words to Rama._END

B_6_C_123_20
BEGIN_
सुग्रीवप्रियभार्याभिस्ताराप्रमुखातो नृप || ६-१२३-२४
अन्येषां वानरेन्द्राणां स्त्रीभिः परिवृता ह्यहम् |
गन्तुमिच्छे सहायोध्यां राजधानीं त्वया सह || ६-१२३-२५_END
BEGIN_
"O king! I wish to reach the capital City of Ayodhya along with you, accompanied by
the wives of other monkey-chiefs with Tara and other beloved wives of Sugreeva."_END

B_6_C_123_21
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तोऽथ वैदेह्या राघवः प्रत्युवाच ताम् |
एवमस्त्विति किष्किन्धां प्राप्य संस्थाप्य राघवः || ६-१२३-२६
विमानं प्रेक्ष्य सुग्रीवं काक्यमेतदुवाच ह |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Seetha, Rama then said to her in reply "let it be". Reaching
Kishkindha, causing the aerial car to halt, and looking at Sugreeva, Rama spoke to him the
following words:_END

B_6_C_123_22
BEGIN_
ब्रूहि वानरशार्दूल सरान् वानरपुङ्गवान् || ६-१२३-२७
स्त्रीभिः परिवृताह् सर्वे ह्ययोध्यां यान्तु सीतया |_END
BEGIN_
"O the king of monkeys! Instruct all the monkey-chiefs to come to Ayodhya in the
company of their wives."_END

B_6_C_123_23
BEGIN_
तथा त्वमपि सर्वाभिः स्त्रीभिः सह महाबल || ६-१२३-२८
अभित्वरस्व सुग्रीव गच्छामः प्लवगाधिप |_END
BEGIN_
"O the mighty Sugreeva, the King of monkeys! You too hasten to depart, taking the
wives of all the monkeys "we shall proceed."_END

B_6_C_123_24
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवो रामेणामिततेजसा || ६-१२३-२९
वानराधिपतिः श्रीमांस्तैश्च सर्वैः समावृतः |
प्रविश्यान्तःपुरं शीघ्रम् तारामुद्वीक्ष्य सोऽब्रवीत् || ६-१२३-३०_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Rama of great splendour, that illustrious Sugreeva, the lord of
monkeys accompanied by all those monkeys, quickly entering his gynaecium, spoke to Tara as
follows:_END

B_6_C_123_25
BEGIN_
प्रिये त्वं सहनारीभिर्वानराणां महात्मनाम् |
राघवेणाभ्यनुज्ञाता मैथिलीप्रियकाम्यया || ६-१२३-३१_END
BEGIN_
"O the beloved lady! You have been permitted by Rama to proceed to Ayodhya, in the
company of the wives of the great-souled monkeys, with an intent to gratify Seetha."_END

B_6_C_123_26
BEGIN_
त्वर त्वमभिगच्छामो गृह्य वानरयोषितः |
अयोध्यां दर्शयिष्यामः सर्वा दशरथस्त्रियः || ६-१२३-३२_END
BEGIN_
"You hurry up, to proceed to Ayodhya, with the wives of the monkeys. We shall show
Ayodhya and all the widows of Dasaratha to them."_END

B_6_C_123_27
BEGIN_
सुग्रीवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा तारा सर्वाङ्गशोभना |
आहूय चाब्रवीत्सर्वा वानराणां तु योषितः || ६-१२३-३३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Sugreeva, Tara, who was charming of every limb, called all the
spouses of the monkeys and spoke to them as follows:_END

B_6_C_123_28
BEGIN_
सुग्रीवेणाभ्यनुज्ञाता गन्तुं सर्वैश्च वानरैः |
मम चापि प्रियं कार्यमयोध्यादर्शनेन च || ६-१२३-३४_END
BEGIN_
"Duly permitted by Sugreeva and all the monkeys, hurry up to proceed to Ayodhya. A
kindly act will be done to me too, through the sight of Ayodhya (which is so dear to me)."_END

B_6_C_123_29
BEGIN_
प्रवेशम् चैव रामस्य पौरजानपदैः सह |
विभूतिं चैव सर्वासां स्त्रीणां दशरथस्य च || ६-१२३-३५_END
BEGIN_
"We shall also see the entry of Rama into Ayodhya, along with the people of that
city as well as the inhabitants of the country-side, as also the affluence of the widows of
Dasaratha."_END

B_6_C_123_30
BEGIN_
तारया चाभ्यनुज्ञाताः सर्वा वानरयोषितः |
नेपथ्यविधिपूर्वं तु कृत्वा चापि प्रदक्षिणम् || ६-१२३-३६
अध्यारोहन्विमानं तत्सीतादर्शनकाङ्क्षया |_END
BEGIN_
Duly permitted by Tara, all the wives of the monkeys, wearing their costumes as per
rule and going round the aerial car clockwise, ascended it with an intent to see Seetha._END

B_6_C_123_31
BEGIN_
ताभिः सहोत्थितं शीघ्रं विमानं प्रेक्ष्य राघवः || ६-१२३-३७
ऋष्यमूकसमीपे तु वैदेहीं पुनरब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the aerial car having risen quickly, after having taken the wives of monkeys
too, Rama again spoke to Seetha at the vicinity of Mount Rishyamuka (as follows):_END

B_6_C_123_32
BEGIN_
दृश्यतेअसौ महान्सीते सविद्युदिव तोयदः || ६-१२३-३८
ऋश्यमूको गिरिश्रेष्ठः काञ्चनैर्धातुभिर्वृतः |_END
BEGIN_
"O Seetha! Here is seen Rishyamuka, the excellent mountain, endowed with layers of
gold and looking like a cloud with lightning."_END

B_6_C_123_33
BEGIN_
अत्राहन् वानरेन्द्रेण सुग्रीवेण समागतः || ६-१२३-३९
समयश्च कृतः सीते वधार्थन् वालिनो मया |_END
BEGIN_
"O Seetha! Here did I meet Sugreeva, the king of monkeys and an agreement too was
made by me for the killing of Vali."_END

B_6_C_123_34
BEGIN_
एषा सा दृश्यते पम्पा नलिनी चित्रकानना || ६-१२३-४०
त्वया विहीनो यत्राहन् विललाप सुदुःखितः |_END
BEGIN_
"Here is seen Pampa-river, abounding in lotuses and edged with colourful groves,
where I lamented with great pain, having been separated from you."_END

B_6_C_123_35
BEGIN_
अस्यास्तीरे मया दृष्टा शबरी धर्मचारिणी || ६-१२३-४१
अत्र योजनबाहुश्च कबन्धो निहतो मया |_END
BEGIN_
"The virtuous Shabari was seen by me at the bank of this river. Here was killed,
Kabandha, having arms, a Yojana (eight miles) long."_END

B_6_C_123_36
BEGIN_
दृश्यतेअसौ जनस्थाने सीते श्रीमान्वनस्पतिः || ६-१२३-४२
यत्र युद्धं महद्वृत्तन् तवहेतोर्विलासिनि |
रावणेन हतो यत्र पक्षिणां प्रवरो बली || ६-१२३-४३_END
BEGIN_
"And over there is seen in the forest of Janasthana, O Seetha, that illustrious tree
under which the highly brilliant and mighty Jatayu, the foremost among the birds, was killed by
Ravana, for your sake, O sporting lady!."_END

B_6_C_123_37
BEGIN_
खरश्च निहतश्सङ्ख्ये दूषणश्च निपातितः |
त्रिशिराश्च महावीर्यो मया बाणैरजिह्मगैः || ६-१२३-४४
पर्णशाला तथा चित्रा दृश्यते शुभदर्शना |
यत्र त्वं राक्षसेन्द्रेण रावणेन हृता बलात् || ६-१२३-४५_END
BEGIN_
"O lady of beautiful complexion! Here is the region, (known as Panchavati, so called
because it consists of five banyan trees) where Khara the demon was killed by me with
straight-going arrows, as also his brothers, Dushana and the mighty Trishiras. And over there is
seen our enchanting leaf-hut, where you were forcibly taken away by Ravana the king of demons, O
charming lady!"_END

B_6_C_123_38
BEGIN_
एषा गोदावरी रम्या प्रसन्नसलिला शिवा || ६-१२३-४६
अगस्त्यस्याश्रमो ह्येष दृश्यते कदलीवृतः |_END
BEGIN_
"Here is the shining hermitage of Sutikshna, the great-souled sage. And over there
is seen the great hermitage of Sharabhanga, where the thousand-eyed Indra, the destroyer of
Citadels, came."_END

B_6_C_123_39
BEGIN_
दीप्तश्चैवाश्रमो ह्येष सुतीक्ष्णस्य महात्मनः || ६-१२३-४७
दृश्यते चैव शरभङ्गाश्रमो महान् |
उपयातः सहस्राक्षो यत्र शक्रः पुरन्दरः || ६-१२३-४८_END
BEGIN_
"Here is the shining hermitage of Sutikshna, the great-souled sage. And over there
is seen the great hermitage of Sharabhanga, where the thousand-eed Indra, the destroyer of
Citadels, came."_END

B_6_C_123_40
BEGIN_
एते ते तापसावासा दृश्यन्ते तनुमध्यमे |
अत्रिः कुलपतिर्यत्र सूर्यवैश्वानरप्रभः || ६-१२३-४९_END
BEGIN_
"O slender-waisted lady! Here are seen those sages, where, Atri the head of the
hermitage, was equal in splendour to the sun and the fire."_END

B_6_C_123_41
BEGIN_
अस्मिन्देशे महाकायो विराधो निहतो मया |
अत्र सीते त्वया दृष्टा तापसी धर्मचारिणी || ६-१२३-५०_END
BEGIN_
"At this place, the gigantic Viradha was killed by me. O Seetha! Here was seen by
you, the virtuous Anasuya, the ascetic lady (the wife of sage, Atri)."_END

B_6_C_123_42
BEGIN_
असौ सुतनुशैलेन्द्रश्चित्रकूटः प्रकाशते |
यत्र मान् कैकयीपुत्रः प्रसादयितुमागतः || ६-१२३-५१_END
BEGIN_
"O Seetha, having a beautiful body! Here is Chitrakuta, the excellent mountain,
shining. Bharata came here to seek my favour (in the form of my consent to return to Ayodhya)."_END

B_6_C_123_43
BEGIN_
एषा सा यमुना दूराद्दृश्यते चित्रकानना |
भरद्वाजाश्रमो श्रीमानेष दृश्यते चैष मैथिलि || ६-१२३-५२_END
BEGIN_
"O Seetha! Here is seen the beautiful river of Yamuna, surrounded by colourful
groves. Here is seen the illustrious hermitage of Sage Bharadwaja."_END

B_6_C_123_44
BEGIN_
इयं च दृश्यते गङ्गा पुण्या त्रिपथगा नदी |
नानाद्विजगणाकीर्णा संप्रपुष्पितकानना || ६-१२३-५३_END
BEGIN_
"Here is seen the holy River Ganga, which wends its way through the three worlds
(viz. heaven, the earth and the subterranean world), whose banks are crowded with flocks of birds
and which is lined with trees in full-flowering."_END

B_6_C_123_45
BEGIN_
शृङ्गवेरपुरन् चैतद्गुहो यत्र समागतः |
एषा त्रिपथगा गङ्गा दृश्यते वरवर्णिनि || ६-१२३-५४
नानातरुशताकीर्णा संप्रपुष्पितकानना |_END
BEGIN_
"Here is the town of Shringaberapura, where Guha my friend stays. Here is seen that
river, Sarayu, lined with rows of sacrificial posts (the relics of sacrifices performed from time
to time by Ikshvaku dynasty), bordered with hundreds of trees and with groves in full blossom."_END

B_6_C_123_46
BEGIN_
एषा सा दृश्यतेअयोध्या राजधानी पितुर्मम || ६-१२३-५५
अयोध्यान् कुरु वैदेहि प्रणामं पुनरागता |_END
BEGIN_
"O Seetha! Here is seen that Capital City of my father. O the princess of Videha
territory! Having duly returned, offer your salutation to Ayodhya."_END

B_6_C_123_47
BEGIN_
ततस्ते वानराः सर्वे राक्षसश्च विभीषणः || ६-१२३-५६
उत्पत्योत्पत्य ददृशुस्तां पुरीन् शुभदर्शनाम् |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, all those monkeys and the rejoiced demons along with Vibhishana, at that
time, bounding again and again (to have a glimpse of it) saw that City._END

B_6_C_123_48
BEGIN_
ततस्तु तां पाण्डुरहर्म्यमालिनीं |
विशालकक्ष्यान् गजवाजिसङ्कुलाम् |
पुरीमयोध्यान् ददृशुः प्लवङ्गमाः |
पुरीं महेन्द्रस्य यथामरावतीम् || ६-१२३-५७_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, the monkeys along with the demons beheld that Ayodhya, having rows of
white palaces, intersected with wide roads, and crowded with elephants and horses, looking like
Amaravathi, the City of Indra the lord of Celestials._END

B_6_C_124_0
BEGIN_
पूर्णे चतुर्दशे वर्षे पञ्चम्यां लक्ष्मणाग्रजः |
भरद्वाजाश्रमं प्राप्य ववन्दे नियतो मुनिम् || ६-१२४-१_END
BEGIN_
After completion of fourteen years of his exile and on the fifth day of the bright
half of the lunar month of Ashvayuja (roughly corresponding to the month of September), Rama, who
was disciplined even now, reaching the hermitage of the sage Bharadwaja, offered his salutation to
the sage._END

B_6_C_124_1
BEGIN_
सोऽपृच्छदभिवाद्यैनं भरद्वाजं तपोधनम् |
शृणोषि कच्चिद्भगवन् सुभिक्षानामयं पुरे || ६-१२४-२
कच्चित्स युक्तो भरतो जीवन्त्यपि च मातरः |_END
BEGIN_
Having offered his obeisance to Bharadwaja, who was rich in asceticism, Rama
enquired (of him): "Have you heard, O venerable one, of Ayodhya City having an abundance of food
and free from disease? Is that Bharata attentive in his rule? I hope my mothers are still
alive."_END

B_6_C_124_2
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण भरद्वाजो महामुनिः || ६-१२४-३
प्रत्युवाच रघुश्रेष्ठं स्मितपूर्वं प्रहृष्टवत् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Rama, Bharadwaja the great sage, quite rejoiced as he was,
smilingly replied to Rama (as follows):_END

B_6_C_124_3
BEGIN_
पङ्कदिग्धस्तु भरतो जटिलस्त्वां प्रतीक्षते || ६-१२४-४
पादुके ते पुरस्कृत्य सर्वं च कुशलं गृहे |_END
BEGIN_
"Bharata, with his mud-smeared limbs 9throwing the burden and blame ie. mud and with
matted locks, as also placing your wooden-sandals before him, is looking forward for your arrival.
All are safe at your home and in the city."_END

B_6_C_124_4
BEGIN_
त्वां पुरा चीरवसनं प्रविशन्तं महावनम् || ६-१२४-५
स्त्रीतृतीयं च्युतं राज्याद्धर्मकामं च केवलम् |
पदातिं त्यक्तसर्वस्वं पितृनिर्देशकारिणम् || ६-१२४-६
सर्वभोगैः परित्यक्तं स्वर्गच्युतम्वामरम् |
दृष्ट्वा तु करुणा पूर्वं ममासीत्समितिंजय || ६-१२४-७
कैकेयीवचने युक्तं वन्यमूलफलाशिनम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama, the victorious in battles! Formerly, on seeing you penetrating deeply into
the great forest on foot, with the sole intention of practicing virtue, clad in pieces of bark,
going away from sovereignty, deprived of all enjoyments, like an immortal fallen from heaven,
having renounced all your possession, with your spouse (Seetha) as the third (of your party besides
Lakshmana and yourself), resolved in carrying out the behest of your father and intent on
implementing the pledge given (by your father) to Kaikeyi and living on wild roots and fruits, pity
arose in me earlier."_END

B_6_C_124_5
BEGIN_
सांप्रतम् तु समृद्धार्थं समित्रगणबान्धवम् || ६-१२४-८
समीक्ष्य विजितारिं च ममाभूत्प्रीतिरुत्तमा |_END
BEGIN_
"But now, a great delight occurred to me, on seeing you, having fulfilled your
purpose, that you have conquered your enemies and are accompanied by your host of friends and
relatives."_END

B_6_C_124_6
BEGIN_
सर्वं च सुखकुःखं ते विदितं ममम् राघव |
यत्त्वया विपुलं प्राप्तं जनस्थाननिवासिना || ६-१२४-९_END
BEGIN_
"That joy and sorrow experienced by you in abundance while residing in
Janasthana-forest in completely known to me, O Rama!"_END

B_6_C_124_7
BEGIN_
ब्राह्मणार्थे नियुक्तस्य रक्षतः सर्वतापसान् |
रावणेन हृता भार्या बभूवेयमनिन्दिता || ६-१२४-१०_END
BEGIN_
"While you were busy in protecting all the ascetics who prayed you for safeguarding
the interests of Brahmanas, this irreproachable wife of yours was taken away by Ravana."_END

B_6_C_124_8
BEGIN_
मारीचदर्शनं चैव सीतोन्मथनमेव च |
कबन्धदर्शनं चैव पम्पाभिगमनं तथा || ६-१२४-११
सुग्रीवेण च ते सख्यं यथा वाली हतस्त्वया |
मार्गणं चैव वैदेह्याः कर्म वातात्मजस्य च || ६-१२४-१२
विदितायां च सीतायां नलसेतुर्यथा कृतः |
यथा चादीपिता लङ्का प्रहृष्टूररियूथपैः || ६-१२४-१३
सपुत्रबान्दवामात्यः सबलः सहावाहनः |
यथा च निहतः संख्ये रावणो बलदर्पितः || ६-१२४-१४
यथा च निहते तस्मिन् रावणे देवकण्टके |
समागमश्च त्रिदशैर्यथा दत्तश्च ते वरः || ६-१२४-१५
सर्वम् ममैतद्विदितं तपसा धर्मवत्सल |
संपतन्ति च मे शिष्याः प्रवृत्त्याख्याः पुरीमितः || ६-१२४-१६_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama, devoted to virtue! Even the appearance of Mareecha, the abduction of Seetha
by Ravana, the sight of Kabandha, your arrival at the Pampa lake, your alliance with Sugreeva, how
Vali was killed by you, the search-operation for Seetha, the exploit of Hanuma, the tracing of
Seetha, how the bridge, Nalasetu was constructed (over the sea), how the City of Lanka was set fire
by the rejoiced monkey-chiefs, how that Ravana who was the thorn in the side of gods and how was
arrogant of his might, was killed in battle, with his sons kinsfolk and his ministers as the gods
happened, how a boon was conferred by them on you- all this is known to me by virtue of my
asceticism. My disciples, who were accustomed to report to me the news, used to go to Ayodhya-City
from here."_END

B_6_C_124_9
BEGIN_
मित्राणि धन धान्यानि प्रजानां सम्मतानिव |
जननी नन्म भूमिश्च स्वर्गादपि गरीयसी || ६-१२४-१७_END
BEGIN_
"The friends, the riches and the grains are highly honoured in this world. Mother
and mother-land are far superior to even the heaven."_END

B_6_C_124_10
BEGIN_
तस्य तच्छिरसा वाक्यं प्रतिगृह्य नृपात्मजः |
बाढमित्येव संहृष्टः श्रीमान्वरमयाचत || ६-१२४-१८_END
BEGIN_
Bowing to the aforesaid statement of the sage with his head bent low, highly pleased
as he was and saying, "By all means" the glorious prince (Rama) asked of him the following
boon:_END

B_6_C_124_11
BEGIN_
अकालफलिनो वृक्षाः सर्वे चापि मधुस्रवाः |
फलान्यमृतगन्धीनि बहूनि विविधानि च || ६-१२४-१९
भवन्तु मार्गे भवन्नयोध्यां प्रति गच्छतः |_END
BEGIN_
"O venerable sir! Let all the trees on the way, even as I fly to Ayodhya, bear fruit
even in the off-season and flow with honey. Let abundant fruits of various kinds, emitting the
fragrance of nectar, appear on them."_END

B_6_C_124_12
BEGIN_
तथेति च प्रतिज्ञाते वचनात्समनन्तरम् || ६-१२४-२०
अभवन्पादपास्तत्र स्वर्गपादपसंनिभाः |_END
BEGIN_
Once the consent of the sage was given in the words "be it so", the trees there grew
to be closely like the heavenly trees._END

B_6_C_124_13
BEGIN_
निष्फलाः फलिनश्चासन्विपुष्पाः पुष्पशालिनः || ६-१२४-२१
शुष्काः समग्रपत्रास्ते नगाश्चैव मधुस्रवाः |
सर्वतो योजनास्त्रिस्रो गच्छतामभवंस्तदा || ६-१२४-२२_END
BEGIN_
Then, for an extent of three Yojanas (twenty four miles) on all sides, in the
direction of their travel, the trees that no longer bore fruit, were laden with fruit and those
which had ceased to blossom looked charming with blossom. The withered trees were fully clothed
with foliage and further began to flow with honey._END

B_6_C_124_14
BEGIN_
ततः प्रहृष्टाः प्लवगर्षभास्ते |
बहूनि दिव्यानि फलानि चैव |
कामादुपाश्नन्ति सहस्रशस्ते |
मुदान्विताः स्वर्गजितो मुदेव || ६-१२४-२३_END
BEGIN_
Highly rejoiced who had conquered the heaven, those monkey-chiefs thereupon consumed
at will, thousands of many of those wonderful fruits._END

B_6_C_125_0
BEGIN_
अयोध्यां तु समालोक्य चिन्तयामास राघवः |
प्रियकामः प्रियं रामस्ततस्त्वरितविक्रमम्
अयोध्यां तु समालोक्य चिन्तयामास राघवः |
प्रियकामः प्रियं रामस्ततस्त्वरितविक्रमः || ६-१२५-१_END
BEGIN_
Looking at Ayodhya, Rama, a scion of Raghu dynasty, for his part, who wished to do a
kindly act and who was quick in exhibiting prowess, contemplated thereupon to do a kindly act._END

B_6_C_125_1
BEGIN_
चिन्तयित्वा ततो दृष्टिं वानरेषु न्यपातयत् |
उवाच धीमांस्तेजस्वी हनूमन्तं प्लवङ्गमम् || ६-१२५-२_END
BEGIN_
Having thus contemplated, the sagacious and the glorious Rama then cast his glimpse
on the monkeys and spoke to Hanuma, the monkey (as follows):_END

B_6_C_125_2
BEGIN_
अयोध्यां त्वरितो गच्छ क्षिप्रं त्वं प्लवगोत्तम |
जानीहि कच्चित्कुशली जनो नृपतिमन्दिरे || ६-१२५-३_END
BEGIN_
"O the foremost of the monkeys! Going with all speed to Ayodhya, find out whether
the people there, are safe in the royal palace._END

B_6_C_125_3
BEGIN_
शृङ्गवेरपुरं प्राप्य गुहं गहनगोचरम् |
निषादाधिपतिं ब्रूहि कुशलं वचनान्मम || ६-१२५-४_END
BEGIN_
"Reaching then to Shrigaberapura, communicate in my name, about my welfare to Guha,
the king of Nishadas, a wild tribe living in the forest."_END

B_6_C_125_4
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा तु मां कुशलिनमरोगं विगतज्वरम् |
अविष्यति गुहः प्रीतः स ममात्मसमः सखा || ६-१२५-५_END
BEGIN_
"Guha will be pleased to hear about me, as being safe, healthy and free from
trouble. He is my friend, as well as my own self."_END

B_6_C_125_5
BEGIN_
अयोध्यायाश्च ते मार्गं प्रवृत्तिं भरतस्य च |
निवेदयिष्यति प्रीतो निषादाधिपतिर्गुहः || ६-१२५-६_END
BEGIN_
Feeling pleased, Guha, the lord of Nishadas, the wild tribe, will tell the path to
Ayodhya and the news about Bharata."_END

B_6_C_125_6
BEGIN_
भरतस्तु त्वया वाच्यः कुशलं वचनान्मम |
सिद्धार्थं शंस मां तस्मै सभार्यं सहलक्ष्मणम् || ६-१२५-७_END
BEGIN_
"Bharata too is to be asked by you, the news about his welfare, in my name. Tell him
of me as having returned, accomplished of our object, with my consort and Lakshmana."_END

B_6_C_125_7
BEGIN_
हरणं चापि वैदेह्या रावणेन बलीयसा |
सुग्रीवेण च संवादं वालिनश्च वधं रणे || ६-१२५-८_END
BEGIN_
"Tell him about the abduction of Seetha by the mighty Ravana, my conversation with
Sugreeva and the killing of Vali in combat."_END

B_6_C_125_8
BEGIN_
मैथिल्यन्वेषणं चैव यथा चाधिगता त्वया |
लङ्घयित्वा महातोयमापगापतिमव्ययम् || ६-१२५-९_END
BEGIN_
"Tell him also about the search for Seetha and how she was traced out by you, after
crossing the never-diminishing ocean, having extensive waters."_END

B_6_C_125_9
BEGIN_
उपयानं समुद्रस्य सागरस्य च दर्शनम् |
यथा च कारितः सेतू रावणश्च यथा हतः || ६-१२५-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Tell him about our going near the ocean, the appearance of the ocean, how the
bridge was constructed there and how Ravana was killed."_END

B_6_C_125_10
BEGIN_
वरदानं महेन्द्रेण ब्रह्मणा वरुणेन च |
महादेवप्रसादाच्च पित्रा मम समागमम् || ६-१२५-११_END
BEGIN_
"Tell him about the bestower of boons by Indra the lord of celestials, by brahma the
lord of creation, and by Varuna the lord of waters, my meeting with my (deceased) father, through
the grace of Shiva the Supreme Deity."_END

B_6_C_125_11
BEGIN_
उपयातं च मां सौम्य भरताय निवेदय |
सह राक्षसराजेन हरीणामीश्वरेण च || ६-१२५-१२_END
BEGIN_
"O gentle Hanuma! Inform to Bharata, of me as having come near Ayodhya, along with
Vibhishana and Sugreeva the lord of monkeys."_END

B_6_C_125_12
BEGIN_
जित्वा शत्रुगणान्रामः प्राप्य चानुत्तमं यशः |
उपयाति समृद्धार्थः सह मित्रैर्महाबलः || ६-१२५-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Tell him, that having conquered hosts of enemies and obtained an excellent fame, is
purpose having been accomplished, Rama is coming near, with is mighty friends."_END

B_6_C_125_13
BEGIN_
एतच्छ्रुत्वा यमाकारं भजते भरतस्ततः |
स च ते वेदितव्यः स्यात्सर्वं यच्चापि मां प्रति || ६-१२५-१४_END
BEGIN_
"It is also to be observed by you, about the facial expression which Bharata wears,
after hearing all this and also all that he intends to do in relation to me."_END

B_6_C_125_14
BEGIN_
ज्ञेयाः सर्वे च वृत्तान्ता भरतस्येङ्गितानि च |
तत्त्वेन मुखवर्णेन दृष्ट्या व्याभाषणेन च || ६-१२५-१५_END
BEGIN_
"All the occurrences there are to be known. All the gestures of Bharata are to be
ascertained through the colour of his face, glances and the speech."_END

B_6_C_125_15
BEGIN_
सर्वकामसमृद्धं हि हस्त्यश्वरथसङ्कुलम् |
पितृपैतामहं राज्यं कस्य नावर्तयेन्मनः || ६-१२५-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Whose mind does not turn round, with a kingdom abundantly rich in all coveted
enjoyments, teeming with elephants horses and chariots and which is in herited from one's
father?"_END

B_6_C_125_16
BEGIN_
संगत्या भरतः श्रीमान्राज्येनार्थी स्वयं भवेत् |
प्रशास्तु वसुधां सर्वामखिलां रघुनन्दनः || ६-१२५-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Having been associated with the kingdom for long, if the illustrious Bharata is
longing for it himself, let Bharata rule the entire kingdom in one piece."_END

B_6_C_125_17
BEGIN_
तस्य बुद्धिं च विज्ञाय व्यवसायं च वानर |
यावन्न दूरं याताः स्मः क्षिप्रमागन्तुमर्हसि || ६-१२५-१८_END
BEGIN_
"O Hanuma! Understanding his mind and perception, you ought to return quickly,
before we are not gone for a long distance towards Ayodhya."_END

B_6_C_125_18
BEGIN_
इति प्रतिसमादिष्टो हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः |
मानुषं धारयन्रूपमयोध्यां त्वरितो ययौ || ६-१२५-१९_END
BEGIN_
Assuming a human form, when thus commanded by Rama, Hanuma the son of wind-god,
swiftly left for Ayodhya._END

B_6_C_125_19
BEGIN_
अथोत्पपात वेगेन हनूमान् मारुतात्मजः |
गरुत्मानिव वेगेन जिघृक्षन् पन्नगोत्तमम् || ६-१२५-२०_END
BEGIN_
Hanuma, the son of wind-god then flew up with speed towards Ayodhya, as Garuda the
eagle would fly with speed, while seeking to catch a large snake._END

B_6_C_125_20
BEGIN_
लङ्घयित्वा पितृपथं भुजगेन्द्रालयं शुभम् |
गङ्गायमुनयोर्भीमं संनिपातमतीत्य च || ६-१२५-२१
शृङ्गवेरपुरं प्राप्य गुहमासाद्य वीर्यवान् |
स वाचा शुभया हृष्टो हनूमानिदमब्रवीत् || ६-१२५-२२_END
BEGIN_
Leaping into the auspicious sky, the dwelling place of birds, duly crossing over the
terrific conjunction of Ganga and Yamuna rivers, reaching Shringaverapura and approaching Guha (the
chief of Nishadas), that valiant Hanuma spoke the following words in a charming voice:_END

B_6_C_125_21
BEGIN_
सखा तु तव काकुत्स्थो रामः सत्यपराक्रमः |
ससीतः सह सौमित्रिः स त्वां कुशलमब्रवीत् || ६-१२५-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Along with Seetha and Lakshmana, Rama, your friend, that scion of Kakutthsa, of
true prowess, has for his part enquired of your welfare."_END

B_6_C_125_22
BEGIN_
पञ्चमीमद्य रजनीमुषित्वा वचनान्मुनेः |
भरद्वाजाभ्यनुज्ञातं द्रक्ष्यस्यद्यैव राघवम् || ६-१२५-२४_END
BEGIN_
"You can see Rama here itself today, when he has been duly permitted by Bharadwaja
the sage, after spending, at the instance of the sage, for a night of the fifth lunar day (of the
bright half of the month of Ashvayuja)."_END

B_6_C_125_23
BEGIN_
एवमुक्त्वा महातेजाः सम्प्रहृष्टतनूरुहः |
उत्पपात महावेगो वेगवानविचारयन् || ६-१२५-२५_END
BEGIN_
That swift-moving Hanuma, with his rejoicingly feather-like body and with a great
splendor, not thinking of his fatigue, sprang up with a great speed._END

B_6_C_125_24
BEGIN_
सोऽपश्यद्रामतीर्थं च नदीं वालुकिनीं तथा |
वरूथीं गोमतीं चैव भीमं सालवनं तथा || ६-१२५-२६
प्रजाश्च बहुसाहस्रीः स्फीतान् जनपदानपि |_END
BEGIN_
Hanuma saw, on the way, Ramatirtha, a place of descent into the river (hallowed by
the association of Lord Parashurama), as well as the rivers Valukini, Varuthini and Gomati as also
the formidable forest of Sala trees, many thousands of people and numerous communities._END

B_6_C_125_25
BEGIN_
स गत्वा दूरमध्वानं त्वरितः कपिकुञ्जरः || ६-१२५-२७
आससाद द्रुमान्फुल्लान्नन्दिग्रामसमीपजान् |
सुराधिपस्योपवने यथा चैत्ररथे द्रुमान् || ६-१२५-२८
स्त्रीभिः सपुत्रैर्वृद्धैश्च रममाणैः स्वलंकृतैः |_END
BEGIN_
Going quickly for a long distance, that foremost of the monkeys reached trees in
flowering, near Nandigrama and looking like those comprised in the garden of Kubera (known by the
name, Chitraratha) and frequented by women along with their sons and elders, charmingly adorned as
they were._END

B_6_C_125_26
BEGIN_
क्रोशमात्रे त्वयोध्यायाश्चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरम् || ६-१२५-२९
ददर्श भरतं दीनं कृशमाश्रमवासिनम् |
जटिलं मलदिग्धाङ्गं भ्रातृव्यसनकर्शितम् || ६-१२५-३०
फलमूलाशिनं दान्तं तापसं धर्मचारिणम् |
समुन्नतजटाभारं वल्कलाजिनवाससं || ६-१२५-३१
नियतं भावितात्मानं ब्रह्मर्षिसमतेजसं |
पादुके ते पुरस्कृत्य शासन्तं वै वसुन्धराम् || ६-१२५-३२
चतुर्वर्ण्यस्य लोकस्य त्रातारं सर्वतो भयात् |
उपस्थितममात्यैश्च शुचिभिश्च पुरोहितैः || ६-१२५-३३
बलमुख्यैश्च युक्तैश्च काषायाम्बरधारिभिः |_END
BEGIN_
At a distance of two miles from Ayodhya Hanuama saw Bharata, living in a hermitage,
with the bark trees and the skin of a black antelope wrapped round his waist, looking miserable and
emaciated, wearing matted locks on his head, his limbs coated with dirt, afflicted through
separation from Rama his elder brother, subsisting on roots and fruits, with his senses subdued,
engaged in austerities, protecting virtue, with a very high head of matted hair, covering his body
with the bark of trees and a deer skin, disciplined, whose thoughts were fixed on the Supreme
Spirit, with a splendour equalling that of a Brahmanical sage, ruling the earth after placing the
wooden sandals before him, protecting the people belonging to all the four grades (viz. Brahmans
Kshatriyas, Vaisyas and Shudras) from all peril and attended by the upright ministers, priests and
by clever troop-commanders, all clad in saffron robes._END

B_6_C_125_27
BEGIN_
न हि ते राजपुत्रं तं चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरम् || ६-१२५-३४
परिमोक्तुं व्यवस्यन्ति पौरा वै धर्मवत्सलाः |_END
BEGIN_
Those citizens, who were all fond of righteousness, were not willing to enjoy
pleasures, ignoring that prince clad in the bark of trees and the skin of a black antelope._END

B_6_C_125_28
BEGIN_
तं धर्ममिव धर्मज्ञं देववन्तमिवापरम् || ६-१२५-३५
उवाच प्राञ्जलिर्वाकय्ं हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः |_END
BEGIN_
With joined palms in salutation, Hanuma the son of wind-god spoke as follows to that
Bharata, who knew what is right and seemed to be a second Dharma (the god of virtue) clothed with a
body of virtue:_END

B_6_C_125_29
BEGIN_
वसन्तं दण्डकारण्ये यं त्वं चीरजटाधरम् || ६-१२५-३६
अनुशोचसि काकुत्स्थं स त्वा कुशलमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
"Rama, for whom you are repenting residing as he was in the forest of Dandaka
wearing the bark of trees and matted locks, has enquired about your welfare."_END

B_6_C_125_30
BEGIN_
प्रियमाख्यामि ते देव शोकं त्यक्ष्यसि दारुणम् || ६-१२५-३७
अस्मिन्मुहूर्ते भ्रात्रा त्वं रामेण सह सङ्गतः |_END
BEGIN_
"O Lord! I am telling you a pleasant news. Give up this dreadful anguish. Within a
while, you will be meeting Rama, your elder brother."_END

B_6_C_125_31
BEGIN_
निहत्य रावणं रामः प्रतिलभ्य च मैथिलीम् || ६-१२५-३८
उपयाति समृद्धार्थः सह मित्रैर्महाबलैः |_END
BEGIN_
"Having killed Ravana and got back Seetha, Rama is returning with his mighty
friends, his purpose duly accomplished."_END

B_6_C_125_32
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणश्च महातेजा वैदेही च यशस्विनी || ६-१२५-३९
सीता समग्रा रामेण महेन्द्रेण शची यथा |_END
BEGIN_
"Lakshmana too, who is endowed with extraordinary energy, is coming intact with
Seetha, the illustrious princess of Videha territory and with Rama as Sachi (the wife of Indra)
would with the mighty Indra the lord of celestials."_END

B_6_C_125_33
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तो हनुमता भरतः कैकयीसुतः || ६-१२५-४०
पपात सहसा हृष्टो हर्षान्मोहमुपागमत् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Hanuma, Bharata the son of Kaikeyi, felt delighted and sank all
at once to the ground as also fainted through joy._END

B_6_C_125_34
BEGIN_
ततो मुहूर्तादुत्थाय प्रत्याश्वस्य च राघवः || ६-१२५-४१
हनुमन्तमुवाचेदं भरतः प्रियवादिनम् |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Bharata who was born in Raghu dynasty, got up from the swoon within a
while and regaining his consciousness, spoke the following words to Hanuma, who spoke pleasant
tidings to him._END

B_6_C_125_35
BEGIN_
अशोकजैः प्रीतिमयैः कपिमालिङ्ग्य सम्भ्रमात् || ६-१२५-४२
सिषेच भरतः श्रीमान् विपुलैरश्रुबिन्दुभिः |_END
BEGIN_
Embracing Hanuma with eagerness, the illustrious Bharata bathed him with copious
tear-drops born of delight and as such, other than those born of anguish._END

B_6_C_125_36
BEGIN_
देवो वा मानुषो वा त्वमनुक्रोशादिहागतः || ६-१२५-४३
प्रियाख्यानस्य ते सौम्य ददामि ब्रुवतः प्रियम् |
गवां शतसहस्रं च ग्रामाणां च शतं परम् || ६-१२५-४४
सकुण्डलाः शुभाचारा भार्याः कन्याश्च षोडश |
हेमवर्णाः सुनासोरूः शशिसौम्याननाः स्त्रियः || ६-१२५-४५
सर्वाभरणसम्पन्ना सम्पन्नाः कुलजातिभिः |_END
BEGIN_
"O the gentle one! Are you a divine being or a human being, who have come here out
of compassion? To you, who have given this agreeable news to me, I shall give in return, for the
pleasant tidings, a hundred thousand cows, a hundred best villages, and for wives, sixteen golden
complexioned virgin girls of a good conduct, decked with ear-rings, having beautiful noses and
thighs, adorned with all kinds of jewels, with charming countenances as delightful as the moon and
born in a noble family."_END

B_6_C_125_37
BEGIN_
निशम्य रामागमनं नृपात्मजः |
कपिप्रवीरस्य तदाद्भुतोपमम् |
प्रहर्षितो रामदिदृक्षयाभवत् |
पुनश्च हर्षादिदमब्रवीद्वचः || ६-१२५-४६_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the news of Rama's arrival resembling a womnder, from Hanuma, Bharata the
prince felt overjoyed by a desire to see Rama and spoke the following words again with delight:_END

B_6_C_126_0
BEGIN_
बहूनि नाम वर्षाणि गतस्य सुमहद्वनम् |
शृणोम्यहं प्रीतिकरं मम नाथस्य कीर्तनम् || ६-१२६-१_END
BEGIN_
"I am indeed hearing a delight mention of my lord, who proceeded to the vast forest
so many years ago._END

B_6_C_126_1
BEGIN_
कल्याणी बत गाथेयं लौकिकी प्रतिभाति मे |
एति जीवन्तमानन्दो नरं वर्षशतादपि || ६-१२६-२_END
BEGIN_
"This common saying sounds to me good, that bliss comes to a surviving man, even if
it be after a hundred years!"_END

B_6_C_126_2
BEGIN_
राघवस्य हरीणां च कथमासीत्समागमः |
कस्मिन्देशे किमाश्रित्य तत्त्वमाख्याहि पृच्छतः || ६-१२६-३_END
BEGIN_
"How and on what ground, an alliance has been concluded between Rama and the monkeys
and at what place? Tell the truth to me, enquiring as I am."_END

B_6_C_126_3
BEGIN_
स पृष्टो राजपुत्रेण बृस्यां समुपवेशितः |
आचचक्षे ततः सर्वं रामस्य चरितं वने || ६-१२६-४_END
BEGIN_
Seated comfortably on a cushion and interrogated by Bharata, Hanuma thereupon began
to narrate the entire exploits of Rama in the forest._END

B_6_C_126_4
BEGIN_
यथा प्रव्रजितो रामो मातुर्दत्ते वरे तव |
यथा च पुत्रशोकेन राजा दशरथो मृतः || ६-१२६-५
यथा दूतैस्त्वमानीतस्तूर्णं राजगृहात्प्रभो |
त्वयायोध्यां प्रविष्टेन यथा राज्यं न चेप्सितम् || ६-१२६-६
चित्रकूटं गिरिं गत्वा राज्येनामित्रकर्शनः |
निमन्त्रितस्त्वया भ्राता धर्ममाचरिता सताम् || ६-१२६-७
स्थितेन राज्ञो वचने यथा राज्यं विसर्जितम् |
आर्यस्य पादुके गृह्य यथासि पुनरागतः || ६-१२६-८
सर्वमेतन्महाबाहो यथावद्विदितं तव |
त्वयि प्रतिप्रयाते तु यद्वृत्तं तन्निबोध मे || ६-१२६-९_END
BEGIN_
"O Lord, the long-armed! How your mother was conferred with two boons by your
father, how Rama was sent to exile, how Dasaratha the king died, with a shocking sorrow for his
son's exile, how you were brought quickly from Rajagriha (the seat of government of Kekaya kings)
by the envoys, how sovereignty was not coveted by you when you returned to Ayodhya, how on your
going to mount Chitrakuta, your, elder brother the tormentator of enemies was invited by you who
followed righteousness to take back the kingdom, how Rama who stood by his father's words,
renounced the kingdom and stood by his father's words, renounced the kingdom and how your returned
to Ayodhya, taking with you the wooden sandals all this is known accurately to you. Hear from me
now, that which occurred after you had returned to Ayodhya."_END

B_6_C_126_5
BEGIN_
अपयाते त्वयि तदा समुद्भ्रान्तमृगद्विजम् |
प्रविवेशाथ विजनं सुमहद्दण्डकावनम् || ६-१२६-१०_END
BEGIN_
"When you had gone away, that forest (of Chitrakuta) then assumed a very miserable
appearance, with the frightened animals and birds (on seeing strange people there)."_END

B_6_C_126_6
BEGIN_
तद्धस्तिमृदितं घोरं सिंहवाग्रमृगाकुलम् |
प्रविवेशाथ विजनं स महद्दण्डकावनम् || ६-१२६-११_END
BEGIN_
"Rama, thereupon, entered that large, terrific and solitary forest of Dandaka, which
had been trampled by elephants and extensive with lions, tigers and deers."_END

B_6_C_126_7
BEGIN_
तेषां पुरस्ताद्बलवान्गच्छतां गहने वने |
विनदन्सुमहानादं विराधः प्रत्यदृश्यत || ६-१२६-१२_END
BEGIN_
"In front of them, even as they were going in that dense forest, there appeared
Viradha, a demon, uttering forth a very loud roar._END

B_6_C_126_8
BEGIN_
तमुत्क्षिप्य महानादमूर्ध्वबाहुमधोमुखम् |
निखाते प्रक्षिपन्ति स्म नदन्तमिव कुञ्जरम् || ६-१२६-१३_END
BEGIN_
"They cast him, who rushed with uplifted arms towards them, into a pit, turning his
head bent low, and who was emitting a loud cry, like an elephant."_END

B_6_C_126_9
BEGIN_
तत्कृत्वा दुष्करं कर्म भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ |
सायाह्ने शरभङ्गस्य रम्यमाश्रममीयतुः || ६-१२६-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Carrying out that ardous task, Rama and Lakshmana, both the brothers, went to the
beautiful hermitage of Sharbhanga, in that evening._END

B_6_C_126_10
BEGIN_
शरभङ्गे दिवं प्राप्ते रामः सत्यपराक्रमः |
अभिवाद्य मुनीन्सर्वाञ्जनस्थानमुपागमत् || ६-१२६-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Offering salutation to all the hermits when Sharabhanga ascended to heaven, Rama
who truly mighty, reached the region of Janasthana."_END

B_6_C_126_11
BEGIN_
पश्चाच्चूर्पणखा नाम रामपार्श्वमुपागता |
ततो रामेण संदिष्टो लक्ष्मणः सहसोत्थितः || ६-१२६-१६
प्रगृह्य खड्गं चिच्छेद कर्णनासे महाबलः |_END
BEGIN_
"Thereafter, a female-demon called Surpanakha sought the presence of Rama. As
ordered by Rama, the mighty Lakshmana thereupon rose quickly and seizing a sword, chopped off her
ears and nose."_END

B_6_C_126_12
BEGIN_
चतुर्दशसहस्राणि रक्षसां भीमकर्मणाम् |
हतानि वसता तत्र राघवेण महात्मना || ६-१२६-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Fourteen thousand demons, inhabiting Janasthana-region, were killed by the
great-souled Rama, while sojourning that region."_END

B_6_C_126_13
BEGIN_
एकेन सह संगम्य रामेण रणमूर्धनि |
अह्नश्चतुर्थभागेन निःशेषा राक्षसाः कृताः || ६-१२६-१८_END
BEGIN_
"The demons, who came together at the battle-front, were wholly finished by Rama
alone, in a fraction of a quarter of a day."_END

B_6_C_126_14
BEGIN_
महाबला महावीर्यास्तपसो विघ्नकारिणः || ६-१२६-१९
निहता राघवेणाजौ दण्डकारण्यवासिनः |_END
BEGIN_
"The demons who were the mighty inhabitants of Dandaka-forest, who were causing
obstacles to the austerity of the ascetics, were killed by Rama."_END

B_6_C_126_15
BEGIN_
राक्षसाश्च विनिष्पिष्टाः खरश्च निहतो रणे || ६-१२६-२०
दूषणं चाग्रतो हत्वा त्रिशिरास्तदनन्तम् |_END
BEGIN_
"The demons were smashed in the battle. Khara (their leader) also was killed. After
killing Dushana (his brother) first, Trishira (the other brother) was killed thereafter."_END

B_6_C_126_16
BEGIN_
ततस्तेनार्दिता बाला रावणं समुपागता || ६-१२६-२१
रावणानुचरो घोरो मारीचो नाम राक्षसः |
लोभयामास वैदेहीं भूत्वा रत्नमयो मृगः || ६-१२६-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Tormented by the incident of destruction of demons, the foolish Surpanakha sought
refuge with Ravana. Disguised in the form of a deer studded with precious stones, a terrific demon
by name, Maricha, a follower of Ravana, allured Seetha."_END

B_6_C_126_17
BEGIN_
सा राममब्रवीद्दृष्ट्वा वैदेही गृह्यतामिति |
अयं मनोहरह् कान्त आश्रमो नो भविष्यति || ६-१२६-२३_END
BEGIN_
"That Seetha, on seeing it, told Rama, 'Let this deer be caught. Our hermitage will
turn out to be charming and pleasing to the eye'."_END

B_6_C_126_18
BEGIN_
ततो रामो धनुष्पाणिर्धावन्तमनुधावति |
स तं जघान धावन्तं शरेणानतपर्वणा || ६-१२६-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Thereupon, Rama wielding a bow in his arm, chased that deer and killed that running
one, with an arrow of curved knots."_END

B_6_C_126_19
BEGIN_
अथ सौम्या दशग्रीवो मृगं याते तु राघवे |
लक्ष्मणे चापि निष्क्रान्ते प्रविवेशाश्रमं तदा || ६-१२६-२५_END
BEGIN_
"O good sir! While Rama was chasing the deer and even when Lakshmana had gone out,
Ravana forthwith entered their hermitage during that interval."_END

B_6_C_126_20
BEGIN_
जग्राह तरसा सीतां ग्रहः खे रोहिणीम् इव |
त्रातुकामं ततो युद्धे हत्वा गृध्रं जटायुषम् || ६-१२६-२६
प्रगृह्य सहसा सीतां जगामाशु स राक्षसः |_END
BEGIN_
"Ravana, the demon, seized Seetha, even as a planet like Mars would obscure the
constellation, Rohini. Having killed a vulture named Jatayu, who sought to deliver her, Ravana then
went quickly in haste, taking Seetha with him"_END

B_6_C_126_21
BEGIN_
ततस्त्वद्भुतसङ्काशाः स्थिताः पर्वतमूर्धनि || ६-१२६-२७
सीतां गृहीत्वा गच्छन्तं वानराः पर्वतोपमाः |
ददृशुर्विस्मितास्तत्र रावणं राक्षसाधिपम् || ६-१२६-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Then, in surprise, some monkeys who was staying on a mountain-peak, looking like
mountain, saw, with astonishment writ large in their faces, Ravana the king of demons, passing that
way, taking away Seetha."_END

B_6_C_126_22
BEGIN_
ततः शीघ्रतरं गत्वा तद्विमानं मनोजवम् |
आरुह्य सह वैदेह्या पुष्पकं स महाबलः || ६-१२६-२९
प्रविवेर्श तदा लङ्कां रावणो लोकरावणः |_END
BEGIN_
"Going still faster and ascending along with Seetha, the aerial car, Pushpaka, which
was as swift as thought, the mighty Ravana the king of demons thereupon entered the City of
Lanka."_END

B_6_C_126_23
BEGIN_
तां सुवर्णपरिक्रान्ते शुभे महति वेश्मनि || ६-१२६-३०
प्रवेश्य मैथिलीं वाक्यैः सान्त्वयामास रावणः |_END
BEGIN_
"Conducting that Seetha into a large beautiful mansion, embellished with gold, that
Ravana sought to cajole her gently with his words."_END

B_6_C_126_24
BEGIN_
तृणवद्भाषितं तस्य तं च नैरृतपुंगवम् || ६-१२६-३१
अचिन्तयन्ती वैदेही ह्यशोकवनिकां गता |_END
BEGIN_
"Caring a straw for that Ravana and his talk, Seetha, later, actually remained in
Ashoka-grove."_END

B_6_C_126_25
BEGIN_
न्यवर्तत तदा रामो मृगं हत्वा तदा वने || ६-१२६-३२
निवर्तमानः काकुत्स्थो दृष्ट्वा गृध्रं प्रविव्यथे |
गृध्रं हतं तदा दग्ध्वा रामः प्रियसखं पितुः || ६-१२६-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Having killed that deer, Rama while returning to the hermitage, saw the vulture
(Jatayu) in the forest. Rama was greatly disturbed. Seeing the vulture (Jatayu) who was dearer to
him than his own father killed, Rama was disturbed."_END

B_6_C_126_26
BEGIN_
मार्गमाणस्तु वैदेहीं राघवः सहलक्ष्मणः |
गोदावरीमनुचरन्वनोद्देशांश्च पुष्पितान् || ६-१२६-३४_END
BEGIN_
"While searching for Seetha, RAma along with Lakshmana strolled after blossomed
woodlands along the bank of Godavari-river."_END

B_6_C_126_27
BEGIN_
आसेदतुर्महारण्ये कबन्धं नाम राक्षसं |
ततः कबन्धवचनाद्रामः सत्यपराक्रमः || ६-१२६-३५
ऋश्यमूकं गिरिं गत्वा सुग्रीवेण समागतः |_END
BEGIN_
"They met, in that great forest, a demon by name Kabandha. Then according to the
advice of Kabandha, Rama of true prowess met Sugreeva, after heading for Mount Rishyamuka."_END

B_6_C_126_28
BEGIN_
तयोः समागमः पूर्वं प्रीत्या हार्दो व्यजायत || ६-१२६-३६
इतरेतर संवादात्प्रगाढः प्रणयस्तयोः |
इतरेतरसंवादात्प्रगाढः प्रणयस्तयोः || ६-१२६-३७_END
BEGIN_
"Even before they met, a meeting of hearts through affinity, had taken place between
them. Sugreeva had been banished in the past by the enraged Vali, his elder brother and as a result
of mutual talks, affection deeply arose between Rama and Sugreeva."_END

B_6_C_126_29
BEGIN_
रामः स्वबाहुवीर्येण स्वराज्यं प्रत्यपादयत् |
वालिनं समरे हत्वा महाकायं महाबलम् || ६-१२६-३८_END
BEGIN_
"Having killed with the strength of his arms in combat, the mighty Vali with a
colossal body, Rama caused the kingdom of Sugreeva restored._END

B_6_C_126_30
BEGIN_
सुग्रीवः स्थापितो राज्ये सहितः सर्ववानरैः |
रामाय प्रतिजानीते राजपुत्र्यास्तु मार्गणम् || ६-१२६-३९_END
BEGIN_
"Sugreeva, who was established in his kingdom with all, his monkeys, had given his
pledge to Rama, to commence a search for Seetha the princess."_END

B_6_C_126_31
BEGIN_
आदिष्टा वानरेन्द्रेण सुग्रीवेण महात्मना |
दशकोट्यः प्लवङ्गानां सर्वाः प्रस्थापिता दिशः || ६-१२६-४०_END
BEGIN_
"Ten crores of monkeys were accordingly commanded by the great-souled Sugreeva and
sent to all the four quarters."_END

B_6_C_126_32
BEGIN_
तेषां नो विप्रनष्टानां विन्ध्ये पर्वतसत्तमे |
भृशं शोकाभितप्तानां महान्कालोअत्यवर्तत || ६-१२६-४१_END
BEGIN_
"Having lost our way in Vindhya, the foremost of mountain-ranges, a long time
slipped past us and we felt sore-stricken with sorrow."_END

B_6_C_126_33
BEGIN_
भ्राता तु गृध्रराजस्य सम्पातिर्नाम वीर्यवान् |
समाख्याति स्म वसतिं सीताया रावणालये || ६-१२६-४२_END
BEGIN_
"Meanwhile, the brother of Jatayu (the king of vultures), Sampati by name, precisely
communicated to us that Seetha was dwelling in the habitation of Ravana."_END

B_6_C_126_34
BEGIN_
सोअहं दुःखपरीतानां दुःखं तज्ज्ञातिनां नुदन् |
आत्मवीर्यं समास्थाय योजनानां शतं प्लुतः || ६-१२६-४३_END
BEGIN_
"Removing the grief of my kinsfolk, who were seized with sorrow, I, as such, crossed
one hundred yojanas (eight hundred miles of the ocean), resorting to my own strength."_END

B_6_C_126_35
BEGIN_
तत्राहमेकामद्राक्षमशोकवनिकां गताम् |
कौशेयवस्त्रां मलिनां निरानन्दां दृढव्रताम् || ६-१२६-४४_END
BEGIN_
"There, I saw Seetha, living alone in a grove of Ashoka trees, clad in a soiled
silk-saree, looking cheerless, but unflinching in her vow."_END

B_6_C_126_36
BEGIN_
तया समेत्य विधिवत्पृष्ट्वा सर्वमनिन्दिताम् |
अभिज्ञानं मया दत्तं रामनामाङ्गुलीयकम् || ६-१२६-४५_END
BEGIN_
"After meeting her and duly enquiring that faultless Seetha, everything of her, a
ring with the name, Rama engraved on it, was handed-over to her by me as a token."_END

B_6_C_126_37
BEGIN_
अभिज्ञानं मणिं लब्ध्वा चरितार्थोअहमागतः |
मया च पुनरागम्य रामस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः || ६-१२६-४६
अभिज्ञानं मया दत्तमर्चिष्मान्स महामणिः |_END
BEGIN_
"Receiving in return from her, a jewel (from her head), I came back to the northern
shore, successful as I was in my undertaking. On my return, that brilliant and valuable jewel was
given by me as a token to Rama who was unweary in action."_END

B_6_C_126_38
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा तां मैथिलीं हृष्टस्त्वाशशंसे स जीवितम् || ६-१२६-४७
जीवितान्तमनुप्राप्तः पीत्वामृतमिवातुरः |_END
BEGIN_
"On hearing the news of Seetha, Rama for his part regained the hope to survive, as a
dying patient would, on drinking the ambrosia."_END

B_6_C_126_39
BEGIN_
उद्योजयिष्यन्नुद्योगं दध्रे लङ्कावधे मनः || ६-१२६-४८
जिघांसुरिव लोकांस्ते सर्वांल्लोकान्विभावसुः |_END
BEGIN_
"Excited as he was to put forth a war-effort, he set his mind on the destruction of
Lanka, as the fire-god intending to destroy all the three worlds, would, at the end of the
universe."_END

B_6_C_126_40
BEGIN_
ततः समुद्रमासाद्य नलं सेतुमकारयत् || ६-१२६-४९
अतरत्कपिवीराणां वाहिनी तेन सेतुना |_END
BEGIN_
"Then, on reaching the ocean, he got a bridge constructed by Nala and through that
bridge, the army of the valiant monkeys crossed the ocean."_END

B_6_C_126_41
BEGIN_
प्रहस्तमवधीन्नीलः कुम्भकर्णं तु राघवः || ६-१२६-५०
लक्ष्मणो रावणसुतं स्वयं रामस्तु रावणम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Neela killed Prahasta. Rama, the scion of Raghu dynasty, personally killed
Kumbhakarna and Ravana. Lakshmana killed Indrajit, the son of Ravana."_END

B_6_C_126_42
BEGIN_
स शक्रेण समागम्य यमेन वरुणेन च || ६-१२६-५१
महेश्वरस्वयम्भूभ्यां तथा दशरथेन च |
तैश्च काकुत्थ्सो वरान् लेभे परंतपः || ६-१२६-५२
सुरर्षिभिश्च काकुत्स्थो वरांल्लेभे परन्तपः |_END
BEGIN_
"The illustrious Rama, the destroyer of enemies, happened to meet Indra the lord of
celestials, Yama the lord of dissolution, Varuna the lord of waters, Maheshvara, the great lord
(Shiva), Brahma the lord of creation as also Dasaratha (his deceased father) and was bestowed boons
by them. Sages and celestial masters who came there, too gave boons."_END

B_6_C_126_43
BEGIN_
स तु दत्तवरः प्रीत्या वानरैश्च समागतः || ६-१२६-५३
पुष्पकेण विमानेन किष्किन्धामभ्युपागमत् |_END
BEGIN_
"Having been granted boons, Rama for his part flew to Kishkindha in an aerial car
called Pushpaka, along with the monkeys who gathered there."_END

B_6_C_126_44
BEGIN_
तं गङ्गां पुनरासाद्य वसन्तं मुनिसंनिधौ || ६-१२६-५४
अविघ्नं पुष्ययोगेन श्वो रामं द्रष्टुमर्हसि |_END
BEGIN_
"Reaching the coast-line of Ganga-river again, Rama is staying in the presence of
the sage, Bharadwaja. Tomorrow, when the moon will be in conjunction with the asteroid, Pushya you
will be able to see Rama, without any obstacle."_END

B_6_C_126_45
BEGIN_
ततः स सत्यं हनुमद्वचो महन् |
निशम्य हृष्टो भरतः कृताञ्जलिः |
उवाच वाणीं मनसः प्रहर्षिणी |
चिरस्य पूर्णः खलु मे मनोरथः || ६-१२६-५५_END
BEGIN_
"Gladdened to hear Rama's impending return to Ayodhya in the sweet words of Hanuma,
Bharata offered his salutation by joining his palms together and spoke the following words, which
enraptured his mind: 'My desire has been fulfilled indeed after a long time'."_END

B_6_C_127_0
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा तु परमानन्दं भरतः सत्यविक्रमः |
हृष्टमाज्ञापयामास शत्रुघ्नं परवीरहा || ६-१२७-१_END
BEGIN_
"Hearing the news of a great happiness from Hanuma, Bharata the truly brave ruler
and the destroyer of enemies, commanded (as follows) to Shatrughna, who too felt delighted at the
news."_END

B_6_C_127_1
BEGIN_
दैवतानि च सर्वाणि चैत्यानि नगरस्य च |
सुगन्धमाल्यैर्वादित्रैरर्चन्तु शुचयो नराः || ६-१२७-२_END
BEGIN_
"Let men of good conduct, offer worship to their family-deities, sanctuaries in the
city with sweet-smelling flowers and to the accompaniment of musical instruments."_END

B_6_C_127_2
BEGIN_
सूताः स्तुतिपुराणज्ञाह् सर्वे वैतालिकास्तथा |
सर्वे वादित्रकुशला गणिकाश्चैव संघशः || ६-१२७-३
राजदारास्तथामात्याः सैन्याः सेनागणाङ्गनाः |
ब्राह्मणाश्च सराजन्याः श्रेणिमुख्यास्तथा गणाः || ६-१२७-४
अभिनिर्यान्तु रामस्य द्रष्टुं शशिनिभं मुखम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Let bards well-versed in singing praises and Puranas (containing ancient legends,
cosmogony etc.) as also all panegyrists, all those proficient in the use of musical instruments,
courtesans all collected together, the queen-mothers, ministers, army-men and their wives,
brahmanas accompanied by Kshatriyas (members of fighting class), leaders of guilds of traders and
artisans, as also their members, come out to see the moon-like countenance of Rama."_END

B_6_C_127_3
BEGIN_
भरतस्य वचः श्रुत्वा शत्रुघ्नः परवीरहा || ६-१२७-५
विष्टीरनेकसाहस्रीश्चोदयामास भागशः |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Bharata, Shatrughna the destroyer of valiant adversaries called
together, laborers working on wages, numbering many thousands and dividing them into gangs, ordered
them (as follows):_END

B_6_C_127_4
BEGIN_
समीकुरुत निम्नानि विषमाणि समानि च || ६-१२७-६
स्थानानि च निरस्यन्तां नन्दिग्रामादितः परम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Let the cavities on the path from Nandigrama to Ayodhya be levelled. Let the rough
and the even places be made flat."_END

B_6_C_127_5
BEGIN_
सिञ्चन्तु पृथिवीं कृत्स्नां हिमशीतेन वारिणा || ६-१२७-७
ततो&अम्प्;&अम्प्;अभ्यवकिरंस्त्वन्ये लाजैः पुष्पैश्च सर्वतः |_END
BEGIN_
"Let the entire ground be sprinkled with ice-gold water. Let some others strew it
all over with parched grains and flowers."_END

B_6_C_127_6
BEGIN_
समुच्छ्रितपताकास्तु रथ्याः पुरवरोत्तमे || ६-१२७-८
शोभयन्तु च वेश्मानि सूर्यस्योदयनं प्रति |_END
BEGIN_
"Let the streets in Ayodhya, the excellent City, be lined with flags. Let the
dwellings (on the road-side) be decorated, till the time of rising of the sun."_END

B_6_C_127_7
BEGIN_
स्रग्दाममुक्तपुष्पैश्च सुगन्धैः पञ्चवर्णकैः || ६-१२७-९
राजमार्गमसम्बाधं किरन्तु शतशो नराः |_END
BEGIN_
"Let hundreds of men sprinkle, on the main royal highway, with five fragrant colours
and with rows of garlands as well as lose flowers."_END

B_6_C_127_8
BEGIN_
ततस्तच्छासनं श्रुत्वा शत्रुघ्नस्य मुदान्विताः || ६-१२७-१०
धृष्टिर्जयन्तो विजयः सिद्धार्थश्चार्थसाधकः |
अशोको मन्त्रपालश्च सुमन्त्रश्चापि निर्ययुः || ६-१२७-११_END
BEGIN_
On hearing that command of Shatrughna, Dhrushti, Jayanta, Vijaya, Siddhartha,
Arthasadhaka, Ashoka, Mantrapala and Sumantra proceeded with joy._END

B_6_C_127_9
BEGIN_
मत्तैर्नागसहस्रैश्च शातकुम्भविभूषितः |
अपरे हेमकक्ष्याभिः सगजाभिः करेणुभिः || ६-१२७-१२
निर्ययुस्त्वरया युक्ता रथैश्च सुमहारथाः |_END
BEGIN_
Some rode on thousands of well-adorned elephants in rut and bearing banners. Some
others rode on female-elephants provided with golden girths, along with those elephants. Excellent
chariot-warriors issued forth in their chariots, with speed._END

B_6_C_127_10
BEGIN_
शक्त्यष्टिपाशहस्तानां सध्वजानां पताकिनाम् || ६-१२७-१३
तुरगाणां सहस्त्रैश्च मुख्यैर्मुख्यतरान्वितैः |
पदातीनां सहस्त्रैश्च वीराः परिवृता ययुः || ६-१२७-१४_END
BEGIN_
Warriors on selected horses even still superior ones in thousands, bearing banners
and pennants, carrying javelins, spears and nooses, as also surrounded by thousands of
foot-soldiers, sallied forth._END

B_6_C_127_11
BEGIN_
ततो यानान्युपारूढाः सर्वा दशरथस्त्रियः |
कौसल्यां प्रमुखे कृत्वा सुमित्रां चापि निर्ययुः || ६-१२७-१५
कैकेय्या सहिताः सर्वा नन्दिग्राममुपागमन् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, all the wives of the deceased Dasaratha, placing Kausalya and Sumitra in front
of them, mounting their vehicles, issued forth. All of them, including Kaikeyi, reached
Nandigrama._END

B_6_C_127_12
BEGIN_
द्विजातिमुख्यैर्धर्मात्मा श्रेणीमुख्यैः सनैगमैः || ६-१२७-१६
माल्यमोदक हस्तैश्च मन्त्रिभिर्भरतो वृतः |
शङ्खभेरीनिनादैश्च बन्दिभिश्चाभिवन्दितः || ६-१२७-१७
आर्यपादौ गृहीत्वा तु शिरसा धर्मकोविदः |
पाण्डुरं छत्रमादाय शुक्लमाल्योपशोभितम् || ६-१२७-१८
शुक्ले च वालव्यजने राजार्हे हेमभूषिते |
उपवासकृशो दीनश्चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरः || ६-१२७-१९
भ्रातुरागमनं श्रुत्वा तत्पूर्वं हर्षमागतः |
प्रत्युद्ययौ तदा रामं महात्मा सचिवैः सह || ६-१२७-२०_END
BEGIN_
Placing the wooden sandals of his brother (Rama) on his head and taking the white
parasol (intended for Rama) which was adorned with white garlands and two white whisks decorated
with gold, eminently worthy of kings, accompanied by the foremost of Brahmanas, leaders of the
guilds of traders and artisans, including the mercantile class, surrounded by the counselors with
garlands and bell-shaped sweets in their hands, cheered by the blass of conches and kettle-drums,
duly praised by panegyrists, the great-souled Bharata, for his part, whose mind was set on
righteousness, who was well-versed with the secret of virtue, who was emaciated through fasting,
who felt miserable, was clad in the bark of trees and the sking of a black antelope, who
experienced joy for the first time in hearing the news of the arrival of his brother then went in
advance, along with his ministers, to meet Rama."_END

B_6_C_127_13
BEGIN_
अश्वानां खरशब्दैश्च रथनेमिस्वनेन च |
शङ्खदुन्दुभिनादेन संचचालेव मेदिनी || ६-१२७-२१_END
BEGIN_
The earth seemed, as it were, shaking with the sound of horse-hoofs the rattling of
rims of chariot-wheels and by the tumults of couches and kettle-drums._END

B_6_C_127_14
BEGIN_
कृत्स्नं तु नगरं ततु नन्दिग्राममुपागमत् |
समीक्ष्य भरतो वाक्यमुवाच पवनात्मजम् || ६-१२७-२२_END
BEGIN_
The entire City of Ayodhya literally reached Nandigrama. Glancing round, Bharata
spoke as follows to Hanuma._END

B_6_C_127_15
BEGIN_
कच्चिन्न खलु कापेयी सेव्यते चलचित्तता |
न हि पश्यामि काकुत्स्थं राममार्यं परन्तपम् || ६-१२७-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Indeed, I hope the fickle-mindedness which constitutes the peculiarity of monkeys,
has not been resorted to by you. For I do not indeed see Rama, a worthy scion of Kakutthsa and the
destroyer of adversaries."_END

B_6_C_127_16
BEGIN_
अथैवमुक्ते वचने हनूमानिदमब्रवीत् |
अर्थं विज्ञापयन्नेव भरतं सत्यविक्रमम् || ६-१२७-२४_END
BEGIN_
When these remarks were uttered by Bharata, Hanuma forthwith replied, as follows to
Bharata of unfailing prowess, by his meaningful words which were, as if they were apprising the
situation._END

B_6_C_127_17
BEGIN_
सदा फलान्कुसुमितान्वृक्षान्प्राप्य मधुस्रवान् |
भरद्वाजप्रसादेन मत्तभ्रमरनादितान् || ६-१२७-२५
तस्य चैष वरो दत्तो वासवेन परन्तप |
ससैन्यस्य तदातिथ्यं कृतं सर्वगुणान्वितम् || ६-१२७-२६
निस्वनः श्रूयते भीमः प्रहृष्टानां वनौकसाम् |
मन्ये वानरसेना सा नदीं तरति गोमतीम् || ६-१२७-२७_END
BEGIN_
"A formidable roar of rejoiced monkeys is being heard, for, they are seeing on the
way, trees which continually, yield fruit, adorned with blossom, flowing with honey which is drunk
by bees, making reverberant humming sounds - all due to the grace of Sage Bharadwaja O Bharata, the
destroyer of adversaries! A boon was conferred by Indra, the lord of celestials, by virtue of which
a hospitality rich with all excellences was earlier extended by Bharadwaja to you, with your entire
army. I presume that the aforesaid army of monkeys is crossing the rivers, Gomati."_END

B_6_C_127_18
BEGIN_
रजोवर्षं समुद्भूतं पश्य वालुकिनीं प्रति |
मन्ये सालवनं रम्यं लोलयन्ति प्लवङ्गमाः || ६-१२७-२८_END
BEGIN_
"See the cloud of dust, shooting froths towards the grove of Sala trees. I presume
that the monkeys are shaking the beautiful grove of Sala trees."_END

B_6_C_127_19
BEGIN_
तदेतद्दृश्यते दूराद्विमलं चन्द्रसंनिभम् |
विमानं पुष्पकं दिव्यं मनसा ब्रह्मनिर्मितम् || ६-१२७-२९_END
BEGIN_
"There is seen, in distance, that very famous aerial car, shining brightly like the
moon. The wonderful aerial car called Pushpaka was built with his intelligence by Viswakarma (an
architect of gods, who has been referred to here as Brahma by virtue of his creative talent.)."_END

B_6_C_127_20
BEGIN_
रावणं बान्धवैः सार्धं हत्वा लब्धं महात्मना |
तरुणादित्यसंकाशं विमानं रामवाहनम् || ६-१२७-३०
धनदस्य प्रसादेन दिव्यमेतन्मनोजवम् |_END
BEGIN_
"This wonderful aerial car, with a speed of thought, which is carrying the great
souled Rama, and shines brightly like the rising sun, belongs to Kubera, the lord of riches, by the
grace of brahma, the lord of creation. (Who bestowed it on him)"_END

B_6_C_127_21
BEGIN_
एतस्मिन्भ्रातरौ वीरौ वैदेह्या सह राघवौ || ६-१२७-३१
सुग्रीवश्च महातेजा राक्षसेन्द्रो विभीषणः |_END
BEGIN_
"In the same aerial car are the valiant Rama and Lakshmana, the brothers, along with
Seetha, the immensely brilliant Sugreeva and Vibhishana the demon."_END

B_6_C_127_22
BEGIN_
ततो हर्षसमुद्भूतो निस्वनो दिवमस्पृशत् || ६-१२७-३२
स्त्रीबालयुववृद्धानां रामो&अम्प्;&अम्प्;अयमिति कीर्तितः |_END
BEGIN_
Meanwhile, the words 'Here comes Rama' were loudly said and a clamour born of joy
from the mouth of women, children, youth and elders touched the sky._END

B_6_C_127_23
BEGIN_
रथकुञ्जरवाजिभ्यस्ते&अम्प्;&अम्प्;अवतीर्य महीं गताः || ६-१२७-३३
ददृशुस्तं विमानस्थं नराः सोममिवाम्बरे |_END
BEGIN_
Descending from their chariots, elephants as also horses and standing on the ground,
all those people saw, like the moon in the sky, that Rama seated in the aerial car._END

B_6_C_127_24
BEGIN_
प्राञ्जलिर्भरतो भूत्वा प्रहृष्टो राघवोन्मुखः || ६-१२७-३४
स्वागतेन यथार्थेन ततो राममपूजयत् |_END
BEGIN_
The over-joyed Bharata with his joined palms, his face turned towards Rama,
worshipped and welcomed him in a befitting way._END

B_6_C_127_25
BEGIN_
मनसा ब्रह्मणा सृष्टे विमाने लक्ष्मणाग्रजः || ६-१२७-३५
रराज पृथुदीर्घाक्षो वज्रपाणिरिवापरः |_END
BEGIN_
Rama, with his long and large eyes, seated in the aerial car, created by Viswakarma
the divine architect with his intelligence, shone like another Indra who carries the thunderbolt in
his hand._END

B_6_C_127_26
BEGIN_
ततो विमानाग्रगतं भरतो भ्रातरं तदा || ६-१२७-३६
ववन्दे प्रणतो रामं मेरुस्थमिव भास्करम् |_END
BEGIN_
Bent low in reverence, Bharata then saluted Rama, who stood in the forepart of the
aerial car and shining like the sun appearing on Mount Meru._END

B_6_C_127_27
BEGIN_
ततो रामाभ्यनुज्ञातं तद्विमानमनुत्तमम् || ६-१२७-३७
हंसयुक्तं महावेगम् निपपात महीतले |_END
BEGIN_
As authorized by Rama, that excellent aerial car, having a great speed and endowed
with the images of swans, landed on the ground._END

B_6_C_127_28
BEGIN_
आरोपितो विमानं तद्भरतः सत्यविक्रमः || ६-१२७-३८
राममासाद्य मुदितः पुनरेवाभ्यवादयत् |_END
BEGIN_
Feeling glad, when lifted on that aerial car and approaching Rama, Bharata of true
valour, greeted him yet again._END

B_6_C_127_29
BEGIN_
तं समुत्थाप्य काकुत्स्थश्चिरस्याक्षिपथं गतम् || ६-१२७-३९
अङ्के भरतमारोप्य मुदितः परिषष्वजे |_END
BEGIN_
Fully rising from his seat and placing that Bharata, who was seen after a long time,
on his lap, Rama delightfully embraced him._END

B_6_C_127_30
BEGIN_
ततो लक्ष्मणमासाद्य वैदेहीं च परन्तपः || ६-१२७-४०
अभ्यवादयत प्रीतो भरतो नाम चाब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, the jubilant Bharata, the destroyer of adversaries, approaching
Lakshmana and Seetha, then saluted them in reverence and also announced his name._END

B_6_C_127_31
BEGIN_
सुग्रीवं कैकयी पुत्रो जाम्बवन्तं तथाङ्गदम् || ६-१२७-४१
मैन्दं च द्विविदं नीलमृषभं चैव सस्वजे |_END
BEGIN_
Then, Bharata embraced Sugreeva, Jambavan, Angada, Mainda, Dvivida, Neela and
Rishabha._END

B_6_C_127_32
BEGIN_
सुषेणं च नलं चैव गवाक्षम् गन्धमादनम् || ६-१२७-४२
शरभं पनसं चैव परितह् परिष्स्वजे |_END
BEGIN_
He also embraced Sushena, Nala, Gavaksha, Gandhamadana, Sharabha, Panasa and the
surrounding monkeys._END

B_6_C_127_33
BEGIN_
ते कृत्वा मानुषं रूपं वानराः कामरूपिणः || ६-१२७-४३
कुशलं पर्यपृषन्त प्रहृष्टा भरतं तदा |_END
BEGIN_
Then, those monkeys, who can change their form at will, assumed the form of humans
and rejoicingly asked about the welfare of Bharata._END

B_6_C_127_34
BEGIN_
अथाब्रवीद्राजपुत्रः सुग्रीवं वानरर्षभम् || ६-१२७-४४
परिष्वज्य महातेजा भरतो धर्मिणां वरः |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, the immensely brilliant Bharata, the son of Dasaratha and the foremost
among the virtuous, after embracing Sugreeva the excellent monkey, spoke to him (as follows):_END

B_6_C_127_35
BEGIN_
त्वमस्माकं चतुर्णां वैभ्राता सुग्रीव पञ्चमः || ६-१२७-४५
सौहार्दाज्जायते मित्रमपकारोऽरिलक्षणम् |_END
BEGIN_
"You are a fifth brother, for all the four of us, O Sugreeva! A friend is born of
affection, while malifience is the attribute of an adversary."_END

B_6_C_127_36
BEGIN_
विभीषणं च भरतः सान्त्वयन्वाक्यमब्रवीत् || ६-१२७-४६
दिष्ट्या त्वया सहायेन कृतं कर्म सुदुष्करम् |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, Bharata spoke the following kind words to Vibhishan: "Thank heaven! A
very difficult task was accomplished by you, as a companion of Rama."_END

B_6_C_127_37
BEGIN_
शत्रुघ्नश्च तदा राममभिवाद्य सलक्ष्मणम् || ६-१२७-४७
सीतायाश्चरणौ पश्चाद्ववन्दे विनयान्वितः |_END
BEGIN_
Then, the valiant Shatrughna offered his salutation to Rama, along with Lakshmana
and offered his reverential salutation to Seetha's feet, by bowing in humility._END

B_6_C_127_38
BEGIN_
रामो मातरमासाद्य विषण्णं शोककर्शिताम् || ६-१२७-४८
जग्राह प्रणतः पादौ मनो मातुः प्रसादयन् |_END
BEGIN_
By going to his mother, who became pale and emaciated due to her grief, Rama, by
bowing, seized her feet in salutation, making his mother's heart delighted._END

B_6_C_127_39
BEGIN_
अभिवाद्य सुमित्रां च कैकेयीं च यशस्विनीम् || ६-१२७-४९
स मातॄश्च तदा सर्वाः पुरोहितमुपागमत् |_END
BEGIN_
Offering salutation to Sumatra, the illustrious Kaikeyi and all his mothers, Rama
then went to Vasishta the priest and offered his salutation in reverence._END

B_6_C_127_40
BEGIN_
स्वागतं ते महाबाहो कौसल्यानन्दवर्धन || ६-१२७-५०
इति प्राञ्जलयः सर्वे नागरा राममब्रुवन् |_END
BEGIN_
With joined palms, all the citizens of Ayodhya said to Rama: "Welcome to you, O the
great-armed! O the enhancer of Kausala's delight!"_END

B_6_C_127_41
BEGIN_
तन्यञ्जलिसहस्राणि प्रगृहीतानि नागरैः || ६-१२७-५१
व्याकोशानीव पद्मानि ददर्श भरताग्रजः |_END
BEGIN_
Rama saw those thousands of joined palms held by the citizens, appearing as
lotus-flowers in bloom._END

B_6_C_127_42
BEGIN_
पादुके ते तु रामस्य गृहीत्वा भरतः स्वयम् || ६-१२७-५२
चरणाभ्यां नरेन्द्रस्य योजयामास धर्मवित् |_END
BEGIN_
Taking those wooden sandals of Rama, Bharata, the knower of virtue, personally
placed them below the feet of Rama, the lord of men._END

B_6_C_127_43
BEGIN_
अब्रवीच्च तदा रामं भरतः स कृताञ्जलिः || ६-१२७-५३
एतत्ते रक्षितं राजन्राज्यं निर्यातितं मया |_END
BEGIN_
Having offered his salutation with joined palms, Bharata spoke to Rama as follows:
"This entire sovereignty of yours, kept with me as a deposit, is being returned to you, by me."_END

B_6_C_127_44
BEGIN_
अद्य जन्म कृतार्थं मे संवृत्तश्च मनोरथः || ६-१२७-५४
यस्त्वां पश्यामि राजानमयोध्यां पुनरागतम् |_END
BEGIN_
"My life has accomplished its purpose today and my wish too stands fulfilled, in
that I see you, its king, come back to Ayodhya."_END

B_6_C_127_45
BEGIN_
अवेक्षतां भवान्कोशं कोष्ठागारं पुरं बलम् || ६-१२७-५५
भवतस्तेजसा सर्वं कृतं दशगुणं मया |_END
BEGIN_
"You review your treasury, granary, palace of your spirit, everything has been
enhanced tenfold by me."_END

B_6_C_127_46
BEGIN_
तथा ब्रुवाणं भरतं दृष्ट्वा तं भ्रातृवत्सलम् || ६-१२७-५६
मुमुचुर्वानरा बाष्पं राक्षसश्च विभीषणः |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that Bharata, speaking thus with affection with his brother, Vibhishana the
demon and the monkeys shed their tears._END

B_6_C_127_47
BEGIN_
ततः प्रहर्षाद्भरतमङ्कमारोप्य राघवः || ६-१२७-५७
ययौ तेन विमानेन ससैन्यो भरताश्रमम् |_END
BEGIN_
Placing Bharata on his lap with delight, Rama thereupon flew with his army (of
monkeys and bears) in that aerial car to the hermitage of Bharata._END

B_6_C_127_48
BEGIN_
भरताश्रममासाद्य ससैन्यो राघवस्तदा || ६-१२७-५८
अवतीर्य विमानाग्रादवतस्थे महीतले |_END
BEGIN_
Reaching the hermitage of Bharata along with his army Rama then descended from the
anterior of the aerial car and stood, for the time-being, on the ground._END

B_6_C_127_49
BEGIN_
अब्रवीच्च तदा रामस्तद्विमानमनुत्तमम् || ६-१२७-५९
वह वैश्रवणं देवमनुजानामि गम्यताम् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama, for his part, spoke to that excellent aerial car, "Serve as a transport
to Kubera, the lord. I permit you to leave."_END

B_6_C_127_50
BEGIN_
ततो रामाभ्यनुज्ञातं तद्विमानमनुत्तमम् || ६-१२७-६०
उत्तरां दिशमुद्दिश्य जगाम धनदालयम् |_END
BEGIN_
Thus permitted by Rama, that excellent aerial car, thereupon proceeded towards the
northern direction, so as t reach the abode of Kubera the lord of riches._END

B_6_C_127_51
BEGIN_
विमानं पुष्पकं दिव्यं सम्गृहीतं तु रक्षसा || ६-१२७-६१
अगमद्धनदं वेगाद्रामवाक्यप्रचोदितम् |_END
BEGIN_
That wonderful aerial car, Pushpaka which was seized by Ravana once, went in speed
to Kubera, as impelled by Rama's advice._END

B_6_C_127_52
BEGIN_
पुरोहितस्यात्मसमस्य राघवो |
बृहस्पतेः शक्र इवामराधीअपः |
निपीड्य पादौ पृथगासने शुभे |
सहैव तेनोपविवेश वीर्यवान् || ६-१२७-६२_END
BEGIN_
Affectionately pressing the feet of Vasishta, his well-wisher and family-priest,
even as Indra the lord of celestials would press the feet of Brihaspati (the preceptor of gods),
the valiant Rama sat by his side, on a separate seat._END

B_6_C_128_0
BEGIN_
शिरस्यञ्जलिमादाय कैकेयीनन्दिवर्धनः |
बभाषे भरतो ज्येष्ठन् रामं सत्यपराक्रमम् || ६-१२८-१_END
BEGIN_
Placing his hallowed hands together on his head (as a mark of salutation), Bharata
the enhancer of Kaikeyi's happiness, spoke to the truly brave Rama, his elder brother (as
follows):_END

B_6_C_128_1
BEGIN_
पूजिता मामिका माता दत्तन् राज्यमिदं मम |
तद्ददामि पुनस्तुभ्यन् यथा त्वमददा मम || ६-१२८-२_END
BEGIN_
"You gave this kingdom to me and treated my mother's words respectfully. As you gave
it to me then, in the same way I am giving it to you again._END

B_6_C_128_2
BEGIN_
धुरमेकाकिना न्यस्तामृषभेण बलीयसा |
किशोरवद्गुरुं भारं न वोढुमहमुत्सहे || ६-१२८-३_END
BEGIN_
I cannot carry this heavy burden anymore than a young ox would sustain a load,
carried forward by a strong bull all alone."_END

B_6_C_128_3
BEGIN_
वारिवेगेन महता भिन्नः सेतुरिव क्षरन् |
दुर्बन्धनमिदं मन्ये राज्यच्छिद्रमसन्वृतम् || ६-१२८-४_END
BEGIN_
"I think this venerable point in the form of administration of the kingdom is
difficult to be controlled, as a broken dam, seeping from its cracks when breached mammoth stream
of water._END

B_6_C_128_4
BEGIN_
गतिं खर इवाश्वस्य हन्सस्येव च वायसः |
नान्वेतुमुत्सहे देव तव मार्गमरिन्दम || ६-१२८-५_END
BEGIN_
O hero, the annihilator of enemies! I am not able to follow your path, any more than
a donkey would follow the gallop of a horse or a crow would take up the chase of a wild goose."_END

B_6_C_128_5
BEGIN_
यथा च रोपितो वृक्षो जातश्चान्तर्निवेशने |
महांश्च सुदुरारोहो महास्कन्धः प्रशाखवान् || ६-१२८-६
शीर्येत पुष्पितो भूत्वा न फलानि प्रदर्शयेत् |
तस्य नानुभवेदर्थन् यस्य हेतोः स रोप्यते || ६-१२८-७
एषोपमा महाबाहो त्वमर्थन् वेत्तुमर्हसि |
यद्यस्मान्मनुजेन्द्र त्वं भक्तान्भृत्यान्न शाधि हि || ६-१२८-८_END
BEGIN_
"O mighty armed king! How a tree planted in the back yard of one's own house, even
though grown big and difficult to climb with a huge trunk and large branches, does not yield fruits
but dries up after flowering, he who planted it would not enjoy the fruit for which it was planted.
This is the analogy applied to you, if you, as a Master, would not indeed rule over us, your
servants. You can understand the meaning."_END

B_6_C_128_6
BEGIN_
जगदद्याभिषिक्तन् त्वामनुपश्यतु सर्वतः |
प्रतपन्तमिवादित्यं मध्याह्ने दीप्ततेजसं || ६-१२८-९_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama! Today, let the world see you when crowned, like the sun with its glowing
splendour, shining brilliantly at noon._END

B_6_C_128_7
BEGIN_
तूर्यसङ्घातनिर्घोषैः काञ्चीनूपुरनिस्वनैः |
मधुरैर्गीतशब्दैश्च प्रतिबुध्यस्व शेष्व च || ६-१२८-१०_END
BEGIN_
May you relax and wake-up too, to the sounds of an ensemble of musical instruments,
the tinkling of ornaments strung with tiny bells and worn around the waist and anklets as well as
sweet invocation of songs._END

B_6_C_128_8
BEGIN_
यावदावर्तते चक्रन् यावती च वसुन्धरा |
तावत्त्वमिह सर्वस्य स्वामित्वमभिवर्तय || ६-१२८-११_END
BEGIN_
Look after, you, lordship of world here, as long as the stellar sphere revolves and
so far as the earth is spread out."_END

B_6_C_128_9
BEGIN_
भरतस्य वचः श्रुत्वा रामः परपुरञ्जयः |
तथेति प्रतिजग्राह निषसादासने शुभे || ६-१२८-१२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Bharata, Rama who conquered the cities of adversaries, accepted
his words saying "Be it so" and sat on an auspicious seat._END

B_6_C_128_10
BEGIN_
ततः शत्रुघ्नवचनान्निपुणाः श्मश्रुवर्धकाः |
सुखहस्ताः सुशीघ्राश्च राघवं पर्युपासत || ६-१२८-१३_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, on instructions from Shatrughna, skilled barbers with gentle hands who
can do their work with a good speed, encircled Rama all round._END

B_6_C_128_11
BEGIN_
पूर्वन् तु भरते स्नाते लक्ष्मणे च महाबले |
सुग्रीवे वानरेन्द्रे च राक्षसेन्द्रे विभीषणे || ६-१२८-१४
विशोधितजटः स्नातश्चित्रमाल्यानुलेपनः |
महार्हवसनोपेतस्तस्थौ तत्र श्रिया ज्वलन् || ६-१२८-१५_END
BEGIN_
Bharata, having bathed first, the mighty Lakshmana, Sugreeva the lord of monkeys and
Vibhishana the king of demons took bath. Rama had his matted locks disentangled and bathed. He
stood there, shining with splendour, adorned with picturesque garlands, smeared with sandal pastes
of various colours and clothed in costly raiment._END

B_6_C_128_12
BEGIN_
प्रतिकर्म च रामस्य कारयामास वीर्यवान् |
लक्ष्मणस्य च लक्ष्मीवानिक्ष्वाकुकुलवर्धनः || ६-१२८-१६_END
BEGIN_
Shatrughna, the valiant and charming man, the promoter of Ikshvaku dynasty made
arrangements for personal adornment of Rama and Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_128_13
BEGIN_
प्रतिकर्म च सीतायाः सर्वा दशरथस्त्रियः |
आत्मनैव तदा चक्रुर्मनस्विन्यो मनोहरम् || ६-१२८-१७_END
BEGIN_
Then, all the noble-minded widows of Dasaratha indeed themselves personally adorned
Seetha beautifully._END

B_6_C_128_14
BEGIN_
ततो राघवपत्नीनान् सर्वासामेव शोभनम् |
चकार यत्नात्कौसल्या प्रहृष्टा पुत्रवत्सला || ६-१२८-१८_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, the delightful Kausalya, who was affectionate of her sons, adorned with
zeal all the wives of monkeys._END

B_6_C_128_15
BEGIN_
ततः शत्रुघ्नवचनात्सुमन्त्रो नाम सारथिः |
योजयित्वाभिचक्राम रथन् सर्वाङ्गशोभनम् || ६-१२८-१९_END
BEGIN_
Later, on the orders of Shatrughna, the charioteer by name Sumantra made his
appearance, yoking chariot to horses which were completely beautiful in all respects._END

B_6_C_128_16
BEGIN_
अर्कमण्डलसङ्काशन् दिव्यं दृष्ट्वा रथन् स्थितम् |
आरुरोह महाबाहू रामः सत्यपराक्रमः || ६-१२८-२०_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the charming chariot, which emitted immaculate splendour like that of the
sun, standing before him, the mighty armed Rama, the conqueror of hostile cities, ascended it._END

B_6_C_128_17
BEGIN_
सुग्रीवो हनुमांश्चैव महेन्द्रसदृशद्युती |
स्नातौ दिव्यनिभैर्वस्त्रैर्जग्मतुः शुभकुण्डलौ || ६-१२८-२१_END
BEGIN_
Sugreeva and Hanuma, having splendour similar to that of Indra the lord of
celestials, after taking their bat, wore beautiful raiment as well as sparkling ear rings and
started._END

B_6_C_128_18
BEGIN_
सर्वाभरणजुष्टाश्च ययुस्ताः शुभकुण्डलाः |
सुग्रीवपत्न्याः सीता च द्रष्टुं नगरमुत्सुकाः || ६-१२८-२२_END
BEGIN_
Endowed with all types of ornaments as well as charming ear-rings, those wives of
Sugreeva together with Seetha moved out, longing as they were, to see the city._END

B_6_C_128_19
BEGIN_
अयोध्यायान् तु सचिवा राज्ञो दशरथस्य च |
पुरोहितं पुरस्कृत्य मन्त्रयामासुरर्थवत् || ६-१२८-२३_END
BEGIN_
In Ayodhya, the ministers of king Dasaratha, having placed the priest in their
front, planned everything meaningfully._END

B_6_C_128_20
BEGIN_
अशोको विजयश्चैव सिद्धार्थश्च समाहिताः |
मन्त्रयन्रामवृद्ध्यर्थन् वृत्त्यर्थं नगरस्य च || ६-१२८-२४_END
BEGIN_
Ashoka, Vijaya and Siddhartha, with a great concern, discussed about Rama's
advancement and the prosperity of the City._END

B_6_C_128_21
BEGIN_
सर्वमेवाभिषेकार्थन् जयार्हस्य महात्मनः |
कर्तुमर्हथ रामस्य यद्यन्मङ्गलपूर्वकम् || ६-१२८-२५_END
BEGIN_
"You ought to do auspiciously whatever is required for the coronation of the
great-souled Rama, worthy of victory."_END

B_6_C_128_22
BEGIN_
इति ते मन्त्रिणः सर्वे सन्दिश्य तु पुरोहितम्
नगरान्निर्ययुस्तूर्णन् रामदर्शनबुद्धयः || ६-१२८-२६_END
BEGIN_
Advising the priest in this way, all those ministers quickly started from the city,
with an intention to see Rama._END

B_6_C_128_23
BEGIN_
हरियुक्तन् सहस्राक्षो रथमिन्द्र इवानघः |
प्रययौ रथमास्थाय रामो नगरमुत्तमम् || ६-१२८-२७_END
BEGIN_
The faultless Rama, mounting the excellent chariot, as Indra ascended the chariot
yoked to green-coloured horses, sallied forth to the city._END

B_6_C_128_24
BEGIN_
जग्राह भरतो रश्मीञ्शत्रुघ्नश्छत्रमाददे |
लक्ष्मणो व्यजनन् तस्य मूर्ध्नि सम्पर्यवीजयत् || ६-१२८-२८
श्वेतन् च वालव्यजनन् सुग्रीवो वानरेश्वरः |
अपरन् चन्द्रसङ्काशन् राक्षसेन्द्रो विभीषणः || ६-१२८-२९_END
BEGIN_
Bharata took up the reins. Shatrughna held the parasol on Rama's head. Lakshmana
winnowed a fan. Vibhishana, the king of demons standing nearby, held a white fan, shining
brilliantly like the moon._END

B_6_C_128_25
BEGIN_
ऋषिसङ्घैर्तदाकाशे देवैश्च समरुद्गणैः |
स्तूयमानस्य रामस्य शुश्रुवे मधुरध्वनिः || ६-१२८-३०_END
BEGIN_
Then, in the sky, groups of sages, celestials along with troop of the Maruts, the
host of the gods, praised Rama and sweet reverberation was heard._END

B_6_C_128_26
BEGIN_
ततः शत्रुञ्जयं नाम कुञ्जरं पर्वतोपमम् |
आरुरोह महातेजाः सुग्रीवो वानरेश्वरः || ६-१२८-३१_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Sugreeva, the foremost of monkeys, possessing a great splendor, mounted
an elephant named Shatrunjaya, looking like a mountain._END

B_6_C_128_27
BEGIN_
नवनागसहस्राणि ययुरास्थाय वानराः |
मानुषन् विग्रहन् कृत्वा सर्वाभरणभूषिताः || ६-१२८-३२_END
BEGIN_
Assuming human forms and adorned with all types of ornaments, monkeys sallied forth,
mounting on mine thousand elephants._END

B_6_C_128_28
BEGIN_
शङ्खशब्दप्रणादैश्च दुन्दुभीनान् च निस्वनैः |
प्रययू पुरुषव्याघ्रस्तां पुरीन् हर्म्यमालिनीम् || ६-१२८-३३_END
BEGIN_
Rama, the foremost among men, accompanied by sounds of conches buzzing in the ears
and sounds of kettle-drums, proceeded to the city of Ayodhya, having a series of palaces._END

B_6_C_128_29
BEGIN_
ददृशुस्ते समायान्तन् राघवं सपुरःसरम् |
विराजमानन् वपुषा रथेनातिरथन् तदा || ६-१२८-३४_END
BEGIN_
Then, the people of Ayodhya saw Rama, the chariot warrior, having a beautiful form,
arriving on a chariot, with attendants walking in front._END

B_6_C_128_30
BEGIN_
ते वर्धयित्वा काकुत्स्थन् रामेण प्रतिनन्दिताः |
अनुजग्मुर्महात्मानं भ्रातृभिः परिवारितम् || ६-१२८-३५_END
BEGIN_
Felicitating Rama and greeted in reciprocation by Rama, they followed the great
souled Rama, who was surrounded by his brothers._END

B_6_C_128_31
BEGIN_
अमात्यैर्ब्राह्मणैश्चैव तथा प्रकृतिभिर्वृतः |
श्रिया विरुरुचे रामो नक्षत्रैरिव चन्द्रमाः || ६-१२८-३६_END
BEGIN_
Surrounded by ministers, brahamanas and other citizens, Rama shone with his own
brilliance, like the moon among the stars._END

B_6_C_128_32
BEGIN_
स पुरोगामिभिस्तूर्यैस्तालस्वस्तिकपाणिभिः |
प्रव्याहरद्भिर्मुदितैर्मङ्गलानि ययौ वृतः || ६-१२८-३७_END
BEGIN_
That Rama drove, surrounded by musicians having musical instruments cymbals and
Swastika-musical instruments in their hands walking in front and uttering auspicious songs._END

B_6_C_128_33
BEGIN_
अक्षतन् जातरूपं च गावः कन्यास्तथा द्विजाः |
नरा मोदकहस्ताश्च रामस्य पुरतो ययुः || ६-१२८-३८_END
BEGIN_
Men with grains of rice mixed with turmeric and thereby appearing gold in colour,
cows, maidens along with brahmanas having balls of sweets in their hands, walked in front of
Rama._END

B_6_C_128_34
BEGIN_
सख्यन् च रामः सुग्रीवे प्रभावं चानिलात्मजे |
वानराणान् च तत्कर्म व्याचचक्षेअथ मन्त्रिणाम् || ६-१२८-३९_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama narrated about his friendship established with Sugreeva, the power of
Hanuma and the great act of monkeys to his ministers._END

B_6_C_128_35
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा च विस्मयन् जग्मुरयोध्यापुरवासिनः |
वानराणां च तत्कर्म राक्षसानां च तद्बलम् || ६-१२८-४०_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the well-known achievement monkeys and the commonly known strength of the
demons, the citizens of Ayodhya were astonished._END

B_6_C_128_36
BEGIN_
विभीषणस्य संयोगमाचचक्षेऽथ मन्त्रिणाम् |
द्युतिमानेतदाख्याय रामो वानरसन्वृतः || ६-१२८-४१
हृष्टपुष्टजनाकीर्णामयोध्यां प्रविवेश ह |_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama spoke to his counselors about his meeting with Vibhishana. After
recounting it, the resplendent Rama entered Ayodhya crowded with happy and rejoiced people,
together with the monkeys._END

B_6_C_128_37
BEGIN_
ततो ह्यभ्युच्छ्रयन्पौराः पताकास्ते गृहे गृहे || ६-१२८-४२
ऐक्ष्वाकाध्युषितन् रम्यमाससाद पितुर्गृहम् |_END
BEGIN_
