Then, the citizens hoisted flags on every house. Rama reached the beautiful palace,
paternal occupied by Ikshvaku kings._END

B_6_C_128_38
BEGIN_
अथाब्रवीद्राजपुत्रो भरतं धर्मिणां वरम् || ६-१२८-४३
अर्थोपहितया वाचा मधुरं रघुनन्दनः |
पितुर्भवनमासाद्य प्रविश्य च महात्मनः || ६-१२८-४४
कौसल्यान् च सुमित्रां च कैकेयीं चाभ्यवादयत् |_END
BEGIN_
Approaching and entering the palace of the great-souled father, Rama the prince
offered salutation to Kausalya, Sumitra and Kaikeyi and spoke the following sweet and meaningful
words to Bharata, the foremost among the righteous:_END

B_6_C_128_39
BEGIN_
तच्च मद्भवनन् श्रेष्ठं साशोकवनिकं महत् || ६-१२८-४५
मुक्तावैदूर्यसङ्कीर्णन् सुग्रीवस्य निवेदय |_END
BEGIN_
"Give this great palace of mine which looks excellent with Ashoka garden and
consisting of pearls and cat's eye-gems to Sugreeva for his stay."_END

B_6_C_128_40
BEGIN_
तस्य तद्वचनन् श्रुत्वा भरतः सत्यविक्रमः || ६-१२८-४६
हस्ते गृहीत्वा सुग्रीवं प्रविवेश तमालयम् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Rama, Bharata having a true prowess, holding Sugreeva by his
hand, entered that house._END

B_6_C_128_41
BEGIN_
ततस्तैलप्रदीपांश्च पर्यङ्कास्तरणानि च || ६-१२८-४७
गृहीत्वा विविशुः क्षिप्रं शत्रुघ्नेन प्रचोदिताः |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, some men as ordered by Shatrughna, quickly brought oil lamps, beds as
also mats and entered the house._END

B_6_C_128_42
BEGIN_
उवाच च महातेजाः सुग्रीवन् राघवानुजः || ६-१२८-४८
अभिषेकाय रामस्य दूतानाज्ञापय प्रभो |_END
BEGIN_
Bharata of great splendour spoke to Sugreeva as follows: "O capable person! Order
the messengers to make arrangements for Rama's coronation."_END

B_6_C_128_43
BEGIN_
सौवर्णान्वानरेन्द्राणान् चतुर्णां चतुरो घटान् || ६-१२८-४९
ददौ क्षिप्रन् स सुग्रीवः सर्वरत्नविभूषितान् |_END
BEGIN_
Sugreeva then gave four golden jars encrusted with jewels, to four leaders of
monkeys._END

B_6_C_128_44
BEGIN_
यथा प्रत्यूषसमये चतुर्णान् सागराम्भसाम् || ६-१२८-५०
पूर्णैर्घटैः प्रतीक्षध्वन् तथा कुरुत वानराः |_END
BEGIN_
"O monkeys! Get ready in such a way that you await my orders tomorrow at dawn, with
your water-jars filled with water from the four oceans respectively."_END

B_6_C_128_45
BEGIN_
एवमुक्ता महात्मानो वानरा वारणोपमाः || ६-१२८-५१
उत्पेतुर्गगनन् शीघ्रन् गरुडा इव शीघ्रगाः |_END
BEGIN_
The great souled monkeys, resembling elephants and going speedily like eagles, thus
ordered by Sugreeva, leapt quickly into the sky._END

B_6_C_128_46
BEGIN_
जाम्बवांश्च हनूमांश्च वेगदर्शी च वानरः || ६-१२८-५२
ऋषभश्चैव कलशाञ्जलपूर्णानथानयन् |
नदीशतानां पञ्चानान् जले कुम्भैरुपाहरन् || ६-१२८-५३_END
BEGIN_
Jambavan, Hanuma, a monkey called Vegadarshi and Rishabha brought water-jars filled
with water. They brought water from five hundred rivers with those jars._END

B_6_C_128_47
BEGIN_
पूर्वात्समुद्रात्कलशन् जलपूर्णमथानयत् |
सुषेणः सत्त्वसम्पन्नः सर्वरत्नविभूषितम् || ६-१२८-५४_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, the energetic SusheNa brought a jar, adorned with all types of precious
stones, filled with water from the eastern sea._END

B_6_C_128_48
BEGIN_
ऋषभो दक्षिणात्तूर्णन् समुद्राज्जलमाहरत् |
रक्तचन्दनकर्पूरैः सन्वृतन् काञ्चनं घटम् || ६-१२८-५५_END
BEGIN_
Rishabha brought water quickly from the southern sea in a golden jar, covered with
some stems of red sandal-wood tree._END

B_6_C_128_49
BEGIN_
गवयः पश्चिमात्तोयमाजहार महार्णवात् |
रत्नकुम्भेन महता शीतं मारुतविक्रमः || ६-१२८-५६_END
BEGIN_
Gavaya, having a pace as rapid as wind, brought cool water from the western ocean,
in a large jar set with jewels._END

B_6_C_128_50
BEGIN_
उत्तराच्च जलन् शीघ्रन् गरुडानिलविक्रमः |
आजहार स धर्मात्मा नलः सर्वगुणान्वितः || ६-१२८-५७_END
BEGIN_
That virtuous Nala, who vied with Garuda (the king of birds) and the wind-god in
prowess, and who was endowed with all good qualities, swiftly brought water form the northern
sea._END

B_6_C_128_51
BEGIN_
ततसैर्वानरश्रेष्ठैरानीतं प्रेक्ष्य तज्जलम् |
अभिषेकाय रामस्य शत्रुघ्नः सचिवैः सह || ६-१२८-५८
पुरोहिताय श्रेष्ठाय सुहृद्भ्यश् च न्यवेदयत् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, Shatrughna, accompanied by the counsellors, reported to Vasishta, their chief
priest and his friends, about that water intended for Rama's coronation brought by those foremost
of monkeys._END

B_6_C_128_52
BEGIN_
ततः स प्रयतो वृद्धो वसिष्ठो ब्राह्मणैः सह || ६-१२८-५९
रामन् रत्नमयो पीठे सहसीतं न्यवेशयत् |_END
BEGIN_
The elderly Vasistha, with diligence, along with other brahmins on his side,
prevailed upon Rama duly to occupy along with Seetha, on a seat made of precious stones._END

B_6_C_128_53
BEGIN_
वसिष्ठो वामदेवश्च जाबालिरथ काश्यपः || ६-१२८-६०
कात्यायनः सुयज्ञश्च गौतमो विजयस्तथा |
अभ्यषिञ्चन्नरव्याघ्रं प्रसन्नेन सुगन्धिना || ६-१२८-६१
सलिलेन सहस्राक्षन् वसवो वासवं यथा |_END
BEGIN_
Vasishta, Vamadeva, Kashyapa, Katyayana, Suyajna, Gautama and Vijaya consecrated
Rama the tiger among men, with clear and fragrant water, as the eight Vasus*_END

B_6_C_128_54
BEGIN_
ऋत्विग्भिर्ब्राह्मणैः पूर्वन् कन्याभिर्मन्त्रिभिस्तथा || ६-१२८-६२
योधैश्चैवाभ्यषिञ्चन्स्ते सम्प्रहृष्टाः सनैगमैः |
सर्वौषधिरसैश्चापि दैवतैर्नभसि स्थितैः || ६-१२८-६३
चतुर्हिर्लोकपालैश्च सर्वैर्देवैश्च सङ्गतैः |_END
BEGIN_
Vasishta and others, with much delight got him consecrated first, with brahmanas
officiating as priests and by virgins, ministers, warriors, as well as merchants sprinkling the sap
of all kinds of medicinal herbs, with the four gods the guardians of the worlds, standing in the
air and with all the gods assembled there, sprinkling the sap on Rama._END

B_6_C_128_55
BEGIN_
ब्रह्मणा निर्मितं पूर्वं किरीटं रत्नशोभितम् || ६-१२८-६४
अभिषिक्तः पुरा येन मनुस्तं दीप्ततेजसम् |
तस्यान्ववाये राजानः क्रमाद्येनाभिषेचिताः || ६-१२८-६५
सभायां हेमक्लुप्तायां शोभितायां महाधनैः |
रत्नैर्नानाविधैश्चैव चित्रितायां सुशोभनैः || ६-१२८-६६
नानारत्नमये पीठे कल्पयित्वा यथाविधि |
किरीटेन ततः पश्चाद्वसिष्ठेन महात्मना || ६-१२८-६७
ऋत्विग्भिर्भूषणैश्चैव समयोक्ष्यत राघवः |_END
BEGIN_
With which crown, long ago, Manu the emperor was adorned while he was consecrated
and with which, the kings followed in his line were successively adorned while they were coronated,
that crown studded with precious jewels, fashioned by Brahma at the beginning of creation and
dazzling with splendour, being kept according to practice on a throne adorned with many kinds of
precious stones in the council-hall, studded with gold, graced with abundant riches, decorated and
shiningly made with most charming jewels of various kinds, and thereafter Rama duly adorned by that
crown as well as jewels by the great-souled Vasishta and other priests officiating at the
coronation-ceremony._END

B_6_C_128_56
BEGIN_
छत्रं तस्य च जग्राह शत्रुघ्नः पाण्डुरन् शुभम् || ६-१२८-६८
श्वेतन् च वालव्यजनन् सुग्रीवो वानरेश्वरः |
अपरन् चन्द्रसङ्काशन् राक्षसेन्द्रो विभीषणः || ६-१२८-६९_END
BEGIN_
Shatrughna held over him, a white and charming parasol; Sugreeva the king of
monkeys, a white whisk and vibhishana the lord of demons, another whisk shining like the moon._END

B_6_C_128_57
BEGIN_
मालान् ज्वलन्तीन् वपुषा काञ्चनीं शतपुष्कराम् |
राघवाय ददौ वायुर्वासवेन प्रचोदितः || ६-१२८-७०_END
BEGIN_
Encouraged by Indra, the lord of celestials, the wind-god presented to Rama, a
golden garland consisting of a hundred lotuses and which looked shining brilliantly._END

B_6_C_128_58
BEGIN_
सर्वरत्नसमायुक्तं मणिरत्नविभूषितम् |
मुक्ताहारं नरेन्द्राय ददौ शक्रप्रचोदितः || ६-१२८-७१_END
BEGIN_
Induced by Indra, the wind-god presented to Rama the king, a chain of pearls,
adorned with gems and endowed with several types of precious stones._END

B_6_C_128_59
BEGIN_
प्रजगुर्देवगन्धर्वा ननृतुश्चाप्सरो गणाः |
अभिषेके तदर्हस्य तदा रामस्य धीमतः || ६-१२८-७२_END
BEGIN_
On that occasion of the coronation-ceremony of the intelligent Rama, who was
well-deserving it, the celestial-musicians among the celestials gracefully sang and troupes of
Apsaras (celestial nymphs) danced._END

B_6_C_128_60
BEGIN_
भूमिः सस्यवती चैव फलवन्तश्च पादपाः |
गन्धवन्ति च पुष्पाणि बभूवू राघवोत्सवे || ६-१२८-७३_END
BEGIN_
On the occasion of that merriment of coronation to Rama, the earth was bearing a
rich crop, the trees were laden with fruits and fragrant flowers._END

B_6_C_128_61
BEGIN_
सहस्रशतमश्वानान् धेनूनां च गवां तथा |
ददौ शतन् वृषान्पूर्वन् द्विजेभ्यो मनुजर्षभः || ६-१२८-७४_END
BEGIN_
Rama the foremost among men, first gave away to Brahmanas, a hundred thousand horses
and cows that have lately calved as well as a hundred bulls._END

B_6_C_128_62
BEGIN_
त्रिंशत्कोटीर्हिरण्यस्य ब्राह्मणेभ्यो ददौ पुनः |
नानाभरणवस्त्राणि महार्हाणि च राघवः || ६-१२८-७५_END
BEGIN_
Rama again gave to Brahmanas, thirty crores of gold coins, all kinds of very costly
jewels and raiment._END

B_6_C_128_63
BEGIN_
अर्करश्मिप्रतीकाशान् काञ्चनीं मणिविग्रहाम् |
सुग्रीवाय स्रजन् दिव्यां प्रायच्छन्मनुजर्षभः || ६-१२८-७६_END
BEGIN_
Rama gave to Sugreeva, a beautiful chaplet, studded with plenty of gems, looking
like a beam of sun-light._END

B_6_C_128_64
BEGIN_
वैदूर्यमणिचित्रे च वज्ररत्नविभूषिते |
वालिपुत्राय धृतिमानङ्गदायाङ्गदे ददौ || ६-१२८-७७_END
BEGIN_
The joyful Rama presented to Angada, the son of Vali, a bracelet worn on upper arm,
conspicuously studded with cat's eye gems and adorned with jewels and gems._END

B_6_C_128_65
BEGIN_
मणिप्रवरजुष्टन् च मुक्ताहारमनुत्तमम् |
सीतायै प्रददौ रामश्चन्द्ररश्मिसमप्रभम् || ६-१२८-७८
अरजे वाससी दिव्ये शुभान्याभरणानि च |_END
BEGIN_
Rama presented to Seetha, an excellent string of pearls, furnished with superior
gems, shining like a beam of moon-light; two clean and beautiful raiment and lovely ornaments._END

B_6_C_128_66
BEGIN_
अवेक्षमाणा वैदेही प्रददौ वायुसूनवे || ६-१२८-७९
अवमुच्यात्मनः कण्ठाद्धारन् जनकनन्दिनी |
अवैक्षत हरीन्सर्वान्भर्तारन् च मुहुर्मुहुः || ६-१२८-८०_END
BEGIN_
Looking towards Hanuma the monkey, Seetha, daughter of Janaka, having taken off the
pearl-string from her neck, repeatedly caught the glimpse of all the monkeys and her husband._END

B_6_C_128_67
BEGIN_
तामिङ्गितज्ञः सम्प्रेक्ष्य बभाषे जनकात्मजाम् |
प्रदेहि सुभगे हारन् यस्य तुष्टासि भामिनि || ६-१२८-८१
तेजो धृतिर्यशो दाक्ष्यं सामर्थ्यं विनयो नयः |
पौरुषन् विक्रमो बुद्धिर्यस्मिन्नेतानि नित्यदा || ६-१२८-८२_END
BEGIN_
Looking at her, Rama who was acquainted with the gesture of another spoke to Seetha
as follows: "Dear Seetha! Give the pearl-necklace to a person, with whom you are pleased and in
whom the following viz. sharpness, firmness, renown, dexterity, competence, modesty, prudence,
virility, prowess and intelligence are ever present."_END

B_6_C_128_68
BEGIN_
ददौ सा वायुपुत्राय तन् हारमसितेक्षणा |
हनूमान्स्तेन हारेण शुशुभे वानरर्षभः || ६-१२८-८३
चन्द्रांशुचयगौरेण श्वेताभ्रेण यथाचलः |_END
BEGIN_
The black-eyed Seetha gave that pearl necklace to Hanuma. Hanuma, the foremost among
the monkeys, by wearing that necklace, which was as white as a heap of moonlight-beams, shone
brilliantly as a mountain silvered by a white cloud._END

B_6_C_128_69
BEGIN_
सर्वे वानरवृद्धाश्च ये चान्ये वानरोत्तमाः || ६-१२८-८४
वासोभिर्भूषणैश्चैव यथार्हं प्रतिपूजिताः |_END
BEGIN_
All the elder ones among the monkeys and others, who were foremost among the moneys,
were honoured suitably with raiment and ornaments._END

B_6_C_128_70
BEGIN_
ततो द्विविद मैन्दाभ्यां नीलाय च परन्तपः || ६-१२८-८५
सर्वान्कामगुणान्वीक्ष्य प्रददौ वसुधाधिपः |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, Rama the tormentator of enemies, having thought over, presented articles
according to their inclinations, to Mainada, Dvivida and Nila._END

B_6_C_128_71
BEGIN_
विभीषणोऽथ सुग्रीवो हनुमान् जाम्बवांस्तथा || ६-१२८-८६
सर्ववानरवृद्धाश्च रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा |
यथार्हं पूजिताः सर्वे कामै रत्नैश्च पुष्कलैर् || ६-१२८-८७
प्रहृष्टमनसः सर्वे जग्मुरेव यथागतम् |_END
BEGIN_
Rama, who was unwearied in action, then suitably honoured Vibhishana, Sugreeva,
Hanuma, Jamabavan and all other eminent monkeys with desired objects and abundant gifts. All of
them went back, delighted in mind even as they had come._END

B_6_C_128_72
BEGIN_
नत्वा सर्वे महात्मानस्ततस्ते वानरर्षभाः || ६-१२८-८८
विसृष्टाः पार्थिवेन्द्रेण किष्किन्धां समुपागमन् |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, all those excellent great souled monkeys, offering their salutation to
Rama and getting permission from him, returned to Kishkindha._END

B_6_C_128_73
BEGIN_
सुग्रीवो वानरश्रेष्ठो दृष्ट्वा रामाभिषेचनम् || ६-१२८-८९
पूजितश्चैव रामेण किष्किन्धां प्राविशत्पुरीम् |_END
BEGIN_
Having seen Rama's coronation-ceremony, Sugreeva the chief of monkeys, after getting
honoured by Rama, entered the city of Kishkindha._END

B_6_C_128_74
BEGIN_
विभीषणोऽपि ध्र्मात्मा सह रैर्नैरृतर्षभैः || ६-१२८-९०
लब्ध्वा कुलधनं राजा लङ्कां प्रायान् महायशाः |_END
BEGIN_
The righteous and the renowned king Vibhishana too, after obtaining the treasure of
his race (kingdom of demons), followed by those foremost of demons, returned to Lanka._END

B_6_C_128_75
BEGIN_
स राज्यमखिलं शासन्निहतारिर्महायशाः || ६-१२८-९१
राघवः परमोदारः शशास परया मुदा |
उवाच लक्ष्मणं रामो धर्मज्ञं धर्मवत्सलः || ६-१२८-९२_END
BEGIN_
That renowned Rama, of a very generous nature, having destroyed his enemies and
ruling the entire kingdom, enjoyed it with a great delight. Rama, affectionate of righteousness,
spoke to Lakshmana, the knower of righteousness (as followers):_END

B_6_C_128_76
BEGIN_
आतिष्ठ धर्मज्ञ मया सहेमां |
गां पूर्वराजाध्युषितां बलेन |
तुल्यं मया त्वं पितृभिर्धृता या |
तां यौवराज्ये धुरमुद्वहस्व || ६-१२८-९३_END
BEGIN_
"O Lakshmana, the knower of what is right! Rule with me, this earth, as ruled by the
earlier kings, with the help of an army. Installed in the office of Prince Regent, bear like me,
the burden (of sovereignty), which was borne by our forefathers."_END

B_6_C_128_77
BEGIN_
सर्वात्मना पर्यनुनीयमानो |
यदा न सौमित्रिरुपैति योगम् |
नियुज्यमानोऽ पि च यावराज्ये
ततोऽभ्यषिञ्चद्भरतं महात्मा || ६-१२८-९४_END
BEGIN_
When Lakshmana did not give his consent, even though being repeatedly entreated in
all ways, nay even being appointed to the office of Prince Regent, the great-souled Rama thereupon
consecrated Bharata._END

B_6_C_128_78
BEGIN_
पौण्डरीकाश्वमेधाभ्यान् वाजपेयेन चासकृत् |
अन्यैश्च विविधैर्यज्ञैरयजत्पार्थिवर्षभः || ६-१२८-९५_END
BEGIN_
Rama propitiated the gods by performing Paundarika, Ashvamedha, Vajapeya and other
sacrifices many times._END

B_6_C_128_79
BEGIN_
राज्यन् दशसहस्राणि प्राप्य वर्षाणि राघवः |
शताश्वमेधानाजह्रे सदश्वान्भूरिदक्षिणान् || ६-१२८-९६_END
BEGIN_
Having enjoyed the kingship for ten thousand years, Rama performed a hundred
horse-sacrifices, in which good horses were sacrificed and numerous gifts bestowed._END

B_6_C_128_80
BEGIN_
आजानुलम्बिबाहुश्च महास्कन्धः प्रतापवान् |
लक्ष्मणानुचरो रामः पृथिवीमन्वपालयत् || ६-१२८-९७_END
BEGIN_
That Rama, having his long arms reaching down his knees, having a broad chest and
glorious, ruled this earth with Lakshmana as his companion._END

B_6_C_128_81
BEGIN_
राघवश्चापि धर्मात्मा प्राप्य राज्यमनुत्तमम् |
ईजे बहुविधैर्यज्ञैः ससुतभ्रातृबान्धवः || ६-१२८-९८_END
BEGIN_
Obtaining a very great kingdom the righteous Rama propitiated the almighty with many
kinds of sacrifices, with the team-work of his sons, brothers and relatives._END

B_6_C_128_82
BEGIN_
न पर्यदेवन्विधवा न च व्यालकृतं भयम् |
न व्याधिजं भयन् वापि रामे राज्यं प्रशासति || ६-१२८-९९_END
BEGIN_
While Rama was ruling the kingdom, there were no widows to lament, nor there was no
danger from wild animals, nor any fear born of diseases._END

B_6_C_128_83
BEGIN_
निर्दस्युरभवल्लोको नानर्थः कन् चिदस्पृशत् |
न च स्म वृद्धा बालानां प्रेतकार्याणि कुर्वते || ६-१२८-१००_END
BEGIN_
The world was bereft of thieves and robberies. No one felt worthless nor did old
people perform obsequies concerning youngsters._END

B_6_C_128_84
BEGIN_
सर्वं मुदितमेवासीत्सर्वो धर्मपरोअभवत् |
राममेवानुपश्यन्तो नाभ्यहिन्सन्परस्परम् || ६-१२८-१०१_END
BEGIN_
Every creature felt pleased. Every one was intent on virtue. Turning their eyes
towards Rama alone, creatures did not kill one another._END

B_6_C_128_85
BEGIN_
आसन्वर्षसहस्राणि तथा पुत्रसहस्रिणः |
निरामया विशोकाश्च रामे राज्यं प्रशासति || ६-१२८-१०२_END
BEGIN_
While Rama was ruling the kingdom, people survived for thousands of years, with
thousands of their progeny, all free of illness and grief._END

B_6_C_128_86
BEGIN_
रामो रामो राम इति प्रजानामभवन् कथाः |
रामभूतं जगाभूद्रामे राज्यं प्रशासति || ६-१२८-१०३_END
BEGIN_
While Rama ruled the kingdom, the talks of the people centered round Rama, Rama and
Rama. The world became Rama's world._END

B_6_C_128_87
BEGIN_
नित्यपुष्पा नित्यफलास्तरवः स्कन्धविस्तृताः |
कालवर्षी च पर्जन्यः सुखस्पर्शश्च मारुतः || ६-१२८-१०४_END
BEGIN_
The trees there were bearing flowers and fruits regularly, without any injury by
pests and insects. The clouds were raining in time and the wind was delightful to the touch._END

B_6_C_128_88
BEGIN_
ब्राह्मणाः क्षत्रिया वैश्याः शूद्रा लोभविवर्जिताः |
स्वकर्मसु प्रवर्तन्ते तुष्ठाः स्वैरेव कर्मभिः || ६-१२८-१०५
आसन् प्रजा धर्मपरा रामे शासति नानृताः |_END
BEGIN_
Brahmins (the priest-class), Kshatriyas (the warrior-class), Vaishyas (the class of
merchants and agriculturists), Shudras (the servant-class) were performing their own duties,
satisfied with their own work and bereft of any greed. While Rama was ruling, the people were
intent on virtue and lived without telling lies._END

B_6_C_128_89
BEGIN_
सर्वे लक्षणसम्पन्नाः सर्वे धर्मपरायणाः || ६-१२८-१०६
दशवर्षसहस्राणि रामो राज्यमकारयत् |_END
BEGIN_
All the people were endowed with excellent characteristics. All were engaged in
virtue. Rama was engaged in the kingship thus for one thousand years._END

B_6_C_128_90
BEGIN_
धर्मयं यशस्यमायुष्यं राज्ञां च विजाअवहम् || ६-१२८-१०७
आदिकाव्यमिदं चार्षं पुरा वाल्मीकिना कृतम् |
पठेद्यः शृणुयाल्लोके नरः पापात्प्रमुच्यते || ६-१२८-१०८_END
BEGIN_
In this world, whoever person reads and listens to this foremost lyric derived from
the speech of a sage, which is endowed with righteousness, conferring fame and longevity, fetching
victory to kings and as written at first by Valmiki, that person is delivered from all
misfortune._END

B_6_C_128_91
BEGIN_
पुत्रकामश्च पुत्रान्वै धनकामो धनानि च |
लभते मनुजो लोके श्रुत्वा रामाभिषेचनम् || ६-१२८-१०९
महीं विजयते राजा रिपूंश्चाप्यधितिष्ठति |_END
BEGIN_
On hearing the narrative of his coronation in this world, a person seeking for sons
gets sons. A person looking for wealth, gets the riches. A king conquers the earth and overcomes
his enemies._END

B_6_C_128_92
BEGIN_
राघवेण यथा माता सुमित्रा लक्ष्मणेन च || ६-१२८-११०
भरतेन च कैकेयी जिवपुत्रास्तथा स्त्रियः |
भविष्यन्ति सदानन्दाः पुत्रपौत्रसमन्विताः || ६-१२८-१११_END
BEGIN_
Even as Kausalya, the mother has Rama as her living son, or as Sumitra has Lakshmana
or as Kaikeyi has Bharata, the women likewise can become mothers of living sons, endowed with
children as well as grand children and thus become happy forever._END

B_6_C_128_93
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा रामायणमिदं दीर्घमायिश्च विन्दति |
रामस्य विजयं चैव सर्वमक्लिष्ठकर्मणः || ६-१२८-११२_END
BEGIN_
On hearing this epic of Ramayana and all the episode of victory of Rama, who was
unweary in his actions, a person gets longevity to life._END

B_6_C_128_94
BEGIN_
शृणोति य इत्दं काव्यं पुरा वाल्मीकिना कृतम् |
श्रद्दधानो जितक्रोधो दुर्गाण्यतितरत्यसौ || ६-१२८-११३_END
BEGIN_
He or she, who hears with attention and with a subdued anger, this poetic
composition done by Valmiki long ago, that person overcomes the difficulties._END

B_6_C_128_95
BEGIN_
समागम्य प्रवासान्ते रमन्ते सह बान्धवैः |
शृण्वन्ति य इदं काव्यं पुरा वाल्मीकिना कृतम् || ६-१२८-११४_END
BEGIN_
Whoever hears this poetical composition written by Valmiki long ago, they at the
conclusion of their absence from home, meet their relatives and get rejoiced._END

B_6_C_128_96
BEGIN_
ते प्रार्थितान् वरान् सर्वान् प्राप्नुवन्तीह राघवात् |
श्रवणेन सुराः सर्वे प्रीयन्ते संप्रशृण्वताम् || ६-१२८-११५_END
BEGIN_
They get all the boons, entreated from Rama. All the gods get pleased with those who
carefully listen to it._END

B_6_C_128_97
BEGIN_
विनायकाश्च शाम्यन्ति गृहे तिष्ठन्ति यस्य वै |
विजयेत महीं राजा प्रवासि स्वस्तिमान् भवेत् || ६-१२८-११६_END
BEGIN_
Whoever carefully listens to the epic in his house, all obstacles come to an end. A
king conquers the earth. A person staying away from home, fares well._END

B_6_C_128_98
BEGIN_
स्त्रियो रजस्वलाः श्रुत्वा पुत्रान् सूयुरनुत्तमान् |
पूजयंश्च पठंश्चनमितिहासं पुरातनम् || ६-१२८-११७_END
BEGIN_
On hearing the epic, the menstruating women give birth to excellent sons. The adorer
and the reader of this ancient epic gets relieved of all sins and obtains longer life._END

B_6_C_128_99
BEGIN_
प्रणम्य शिरसा नित्यं श्रोतव्यं क्षत्रियैर्द्विजात् || ६-१२८-११८
ऐश्वर्यं पुत्रलाभश्च भविष्यति न संशयः |
रामायणमिदं कृत्स्नं शृण्वतः पठतः सदा || ६-१२८-११९_END
BEGIN_
The epic is to be listened by warrior-class, after offering their salutation with
their heads bent low, from brahmins every day regularly. There is no doubt that the listener and
the reader of this entire Ramayana will get lordship and the birth of a son._END

B_6_C_128_100
BEGIN_
प्रीयते सततं रामः सहि मिष्णुः सनातनः |
आदिदेवो महाबाहुर्हरिर्नारायणः प्रभुः || ६-१२८-१२०
साक्षाद्रामो रघुश्रेष्ठः शेषो लक्ष्मण उच्यते |_END
BEGIN_
Rama gets forever pleased with him who listens to or reads Ramayana daily. He is
indeed the eternal Vishnu, the Lord of preservation. Rama is the primordial Lord, clearly placed
before the eyes the powerful Lord removing the sins and the great-armed, who has abode on waters
(of the ocean of milk) Sesha (the serpent-god forming his couch is said to be Lakshmana._END

B_6_C_128_101
BEGIN_
एवमेतत्पुरावृत्तमाख्यानं भद्रमस्तु वः || ६-१२८-१२१
प्रव्याहरत विस्रब्धं बलं विष्णोः प्रवर्धताम् |_END
BEGIN_
Tell this epic which occurred long ago in this manner, to those who ask for it,
fearlessly. Let there be happiness to you! Let the strength of Vishnu increase!_END

B_6_C_128_102
BEGIN_
देवाश्च सर्वे तुष्यन्ति ग्रहणाच्छ्रवणात्तथा || ६-१२८-१२२
रामायणस्य श्रवणे तुष्यन्ति पितरः सदा |_END
BEGIN_
By studying and listening to this epic, all the gods get appeased. By listening to
this Ramayana, the forefathers forever get pleased._END

B_6_C_128_103
BEGIN_
भक्त्या रामस्य ये चेमां संहितामृषिणा कृताम् || ६-१२८-१२३
ये लिखन्तीह च नरास्तेषां वासस्त्रिविष्टपे |_END
BEGIN_
To those persons who transcribe with devotion this collection of poems depicting the
story of Rama residence in heaven is assured._END

B_6_C_128_104
BEGIN_
कुटुम्बवृद्धिं धनधान्यवृद्धिं |
स्त्रियश्च मुख्याह् सुखमुत्तमं च |
श्रुत्वा शुभं काव्यमिदं महार्थं |
प्राप्नोति सर्वां भुवि चार्थसिद्धिम् || ६-१२८-१२४_END
BEGIN_
By listening to this highly meaningful and auspicious poetical composition, a person
gets family-prosperity, augmentation in money and grain, superior women, exquisite happiness and
all the acquisition of wealth on this earth._END

B_6_C_128_105
BEGIN_
आयुष्यमारोग्यकरं यशस्यं |
सौभ्रातृकं बुद्धिकरं शुभं च |
श्रोतव्यमेतन्नियमेन सद्भि |
राख्यानमोजस्करमृद्धिकामैः || ६-१२८-१२५_END
BEGIN_
This narrative is to be listened invariably by good people, seeking for wisdom,
longevity, health, fame, fraternity, intelligence, welfare and brilliance._END
